review_body: My stay at the Park Central hotel was great except for one incident. Cheryl at the front desk was amazing. She’s an asset to the hotel. The room was clean and efficient. Ten minutes after checking out I called the hotel because I left a brand new necklace that was a birthday gift on the desk in the room. I was connected to housekeeping and security who located my necklace. Trudy from housekeeping took my credit card number and address to send me my necklace and that’s the last trace of my necklace. Numerous phone calls and emails failed to produce any answers. If the necklace wasn’t found I’d understand but to get to that point and the ball to be dropped certainly tainted my opinion of the hotel.

The staff at Park Central Hotel were amazing here are few that I would like to recognize. Nick, Angela and David thanks for taking care of me during my visit. The staff was very friendly and attentive to all the guest needs.

Arrived on March 29th to Park Central Hotel, myself & five of my coworkers from Krucial Staffing preparing for a large intake of Doctors and Nurses to support the COVID-19 outbreak in New York. Upon arrival we were greeted with opened arms by the management staff Eric Palmer, Quimby Hightower, Linda Foster, Sokha Puth, and a host of hotel employees. This establishment has supplied myself and our Krucial Staff with more than your average hospitality especially given the current circumstances, we’ve been granted access to everything we need here to support the mission during this crisis. On behalf of myself and the other 800plus staff members you’ve opened your doors to here @Park Central & West House Hotel WE THANK YOU ALL...GOD BLESS

The rooms were very comfortable, well equipped and clean. And the maid, Maritza, is amazing. She made us feel really good during our visit.The hotel is very well located in the city. But maybe they should add the possibility to have lunch or dinner there. That was our bigger struggle during our New York trip.On the other hand, there are only two elevators available for all the guests, so you have to wait a lot to go to your room or outside. Also we booked a double room, with two beds specifically, but when we arrived they gave us a one bed room and to get another room we must pay almost the double that we already did.Except for those details, it's a good place to stay. We were there during Christmas 2019 for a week.

I am here for a few weeks with my job helping out during the nursing shortage and my experience has been nothing short of amazing! The staff are wonderful and caring and just all around awesome! Q has gone above and beyond for all of us and he's an immaculate dresser lol. 10 out of 10 will be back in the future!

Mr Hightower and his entire staff have gone over and above to help us at every turn while we are here for the Nursing shortage. Cant wait to come stay here when the World is right again. We are here to support the 900 Nurses in the Hotel and I am sure that we have created some challenges for them. Whenever I have a request, his staff does everything they can to make it happen. We are working our Head Quarters 24/7 and there is no drop off in service no matter what time of day.

The Company I am with has deployed over 800 Nurses and Staff Members to Park Central Hotel to support New York City's local Hospitals as they are currently overwhelmed with COVID-19 Patients. First I want to say that even with the many, many unique challenges that Quimby Hightower and his staff are faced with on a daily basis (receiving over 1000 packages daily, working in a potential hazardous environment, and making arrangements for us to create a command center in the ballroom) their unwavering support, service and willingness to provide anything and everything that has been asked of them has never wavered. Mr. Hightower and his Essential Staff are always so friendly! They treat each one of us like Royalty and ALWAYS greet you with a smile. I am constantly in awe of how clean the Hotel is and how often and thorough it is cleaned. I am excited to visit my new first choice for a Hotel when the world returns to a sense of normalcy. Park Central should be your first choice when you need a Hotel in NY.

I am staying here for a few weeks and this place has really been the highlight of my trip. Quimby, Eric, and all their staff have been more than gracious and accommodating. I would truly recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a luxury room near Times Square AND Central Park!

Park Central may have the most accommodating staff to date spear headed by Hotel Staff Quimby. During the toughest of times of the current virus, Park Central has done everything they can to keep the facility safe and clean for everyone.

During these troubling times, the staff of Park Central asked "How can we help?". In preparation to receive several hundred nurses coming to help those in need Park Central accommadated us with no hesitation. There willingness to help and provide went beyond my expectations. Never have I've seen a leadership so willing to open the doors and help to do the right thing. I strongly encourage all those who visit New York to stay there. If they were willing to go the extra mile during an emergency, I can only imagine how far they would be willing to go when things get back to normal. I want to thank Erik, Quimby and Linda. Also the rest of the staff that were working behind the scenes. Thank you

Well, I always told my husband that I want to go back to Manhattan and if at all possible be a short walk from Times Square. I honestly never thought we'd be able to afford it due to crazy prices. Well for our 19th wedding anniversary, he completely surprised me with a week at Park Central Hotel. I thought for sure he broke the bank for this trip but I finally got the pricing out of him. All I can say is WOW, for the price, I don't think it can be beat. The hotel itself is really nice, the staff is wonderful and very helpful and did I mention the location? It's probably a 3 to 5 minute walk to Times Square and about, if I remember correctly, a 5 to 8 minute walk to Central Park. There are great places to eat and even get midnight cheesecake right around the corner. I usually stay in the East Village area, Alphabet City and the like, or Queens. You can get a lot for your money in the East Village. All that being said, this was the best week of my life. You really can't go wrong with Park Central Hotel. When searching for lodging the price may scare you because it is really low compared to others in the vicinity. Don't let that happen, it will exceed your expectations. I can't wait to go back, and if it's up to me, we'll be at Park Central Hotel.

Well located, walking distance from times square and most theaters. Also, short walk to central park. The room was clean and safe - so for the essentials, not bad. Check is horrendous - waited for about 45 minutes to be checked in, which felt like a waste of valuable time. The elevator was so slow that we would deliberately pack extra supplies to avoid having to return to the room any more than absolutely necessary. If you want to avoid ridiculously high prices, and don't mind being inconvenienced waiting for check-in and elevators, this place isn't all bad.

After staying in at the Park Central 10 years ago, my partner and I returned to the same hotel to celebrate an anniversary.  Apart from being modernised, the hotel was the same as we remembered, clean, modern and friendly staff.  Michalyn from customer services at the hotel was fantastic and helped make our stay and anniversary perfect. Michalyn kindly organised a room upgrade and treats in our room. Michalyn was enthusiastic, kind and a real credit to this hotel.  The hotel location was perfect as we were 5 minute walk away from Central Park, and 10 minute walk away from Times Square.  A subway isn’t far either. The bar service is great and open till late, but sadly the hotel no longer has a restaurant. The WiFi was also fast and reliable.Look forward to another stay when the current events have passed.

I had a great experience with Mishalin. She was very assertive when I needed help contacting transportation to arrive earlier rather then the time it was scheduled. Transportation came 30 minutes earlier because of her. We were traveling on an international flight and needed to guarantee we did not miss our flight. She saved the day. We are hoping to travel back to your hotel in the near future just because of her. Thanks a bunch!

We’ve just returned home five days early from our trip to NYC and wanted to write a quick review/ thank you to the hotels guest relation staff especially Michalyn who went above & beyond helping us on our unexpectedly early check out. She made the whole process extremely easy and stress free for us both. She is a credit to the hotel and her manner could not have been more pleasant and reassuring. Thank you to everyone and we will be back ASAP.

Stayed at Park Central for 4 nights. Hotel was clean, well maintained, and central to everything in lower Manhattan. Right next subway for easy access to metro. Had an billing issue that we talked to Elizabeth about, she was very helpful and took care of us. I highly recommend staying at Park Central! Will stay again!

For the money and location, this is not a bad place to stay. The elevators are small and if you’re staying during “peak seasons” you could find yourself waiting a while to catch a ride up to your room. There aren’t any refrigerators, though you can request one, or microwaves which is inconvenient. The staff is extremely helpful, nice, and professional. I would stay here again!

Good service at the hotel. Had a problem with a charge, and Elizabeth at the front desk was more than happy to help. The hotel was very clean and seemed to be well taken care of. I was impressed and will definitely stay here again.

When I first entered the property and lobby, Carolyn was the first desk clerk to welcome me with an infectious smile and delightful personality. Throughout my stay, she was on-hand for any questions or needs I might have. I enjoyed staying at this hotel, but Carolyn's assistance and pleasant greetings and attitude, not to mention her impeccable professionalism, is the reason I would choose to stay here again. Thanks again!!

I came to NYC for a few days with the hubster. The check-in was seamless, which is always a plus . Mishalin (I know I botched her name) was very helpful. I realized I had forgotten some essentials home and she was very helpful in pointing me in the right direction to get them. She also suggested some fun things for us to do. Very intuitive and funny. Great stay! thank you from the lady with the funky hair.

The location is perfect, just a couple of blocks from big attractions and the subway. The rooms are absolutely huge, we had two double beds and the room was so big that it was almost like having two separate rooms. We had arrived to New York early and were able to do an early check in. Both check in and valet for our car were quick, smooth, and efficient, despite how busy the staff was! The little marketplace in the lobby is super convenient for busy mornings. I was overwhelmingly impressed by the hotel overall. Unfortunately, there was one issue regarding my room which wasn’t dealt with in a timely manner which was absolutely inexcusable for what a quick fix it could’ve been, BUT that being said- I recommend not responding to any texts sent from the hotel if you have a complaint or trying to communicate issues with them that way. Even guest relations were overwhelmed and had to be asked a couple times to deal with my issue. Instead, if you have a big/consistent problem, ask for Darren who was beyond wonderful. He’s the hotel manager and it’s very obvious how much he cares about the quality of your stay. He was quick to fix the problem I had been dealing with and communicated with me every step of the way. I could not say enough good things about him, or Rosa, if I might add even more praise. She’s one of the housekeepers at Park Central and she is fast, thorough, and genuinely kind!Although I had a slight hiccup with my stay, I would still recommend this hotel to just about anyone! You can’t get this much space for such a low price anywhere else.

Great hotel in a great location. Hotel lobby was attractive and check-in was pleasant. Hotel room was updated, large by NYC standards, and very clean. Centrally located and steps from the subway stop, walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, and great restaurants. Hotel lobby bar was attractive and bartenders were very friendly. Room was quiet at night with minimal street noise. Nice touch to allow guests to use computers, printer at no charge. Gym had everything we needed. Amazingly comfortable beds and pillows. The outside of building is being worked on so the street entrance was blocked for transportation, just had to get out cab on the corner and walk a very short distance - but wasn't an issue for us. The view was obstructed by scaffolding, but we were told this at check-in. Only complaint was how very slow the elevators were - wait time was sometimes very long. Overall a very pleasant, safe, family friendly retreat at the end of the day.

JP from diamond resorts helped us both on arrival and departure. We watched the rockets game at the bar, and the staff were absolutely great. Location is perfect. Central Park 5 min to the north and Times Square to the south. Can’t buy a better experience

Pillows and beds like clouds! Smiling, helpful and knowledgeable employees!! Easy access to Times Square and so many other landmarks!! Not so much walking it takes the joy out! Starbucks right next door! This is the place to stay!!!

Room was very nice.Lifts - long waits.Staff - Some are fine some have attitude problems, especially on guest relations which is somewhere good attitude is needed.Bar - Nice bar area, some of the furniture has seen better days.

First, the good. Our room was clean and nice. The hotel in general is clean and nice, and is within walking distance from Times Square and Central Park. It is not directly by Central Park though. The bar is beautiful, and the cafe next door is really good.That said, we experienced a number of issues with this hotel:-The staff: Aside from the room service staff, everyone else in this hotel seemed angry or like they were doing you a favor to help you. Basically, they were rude. -Expect to wait for a very long time for an elevator. We were on the 8th floor, and people were waiting so long for the elevator to arrive, they chose to take the stairs. Us included. In fact, this is the worst wait for an elevator I've ever experienced, hotel or otherwise.-Our room key deactivated itself at least 5 times over our 2-day stay. One time, after numerous attempts at reseting a card, they ended up sending security up with us to let us in our room. Just like the elevator, this was the worst experience I've had with a room key.-Even though our room looked nice, there were issues. The hardware holding the shampoo and soap bottles in the shower kept falling apart. Very frustrating when you're taking a shower. Also, the shower curtain was too small for the shower, meaning that the floor was soaking wet when you get out of the shower, and it took multiple towels to soak the water up.-Speaking of towels, we called the front desk to get towels delivered one morning, and 20 minutes later we still had no towels. Called again. Fifteen minutes later, no towels. We finally went down to the front to retrieve our towels. This hotel definitely looks the part, but it did not deliver on the little things for us.

I had a great stay this month at the Park Central. In particular I would like to call out Elizabeth who bent of backwards to make my stay great! She is amazing and I would ask directly for her when you are checking in. She truly gets the word hospitality!

Awesome location! Great room and GYM! The hotel staff is great and really nice! Especially Elizabeth which was really helpful with questions during check in and check out! Also gave us really nice tips from Ny!

Made a rookie mistake by tipping too much that almost cost me my taxi fare to the airport. Jamie and Nick made sure that didn’t happen and call me while I was on the taxi. Once again thank you so much Jamie and Nick!

During my stay here I had the pleasure to be assisted by a lovey lady name Michelline. I needed directions to different places as I needed to know how to move around using public transportation. She offered me a map, printed the directions (Highlighted Info) and was very detailed on how to get around. You guys are lucky to have such a helpful person on your side. We need more Michelline’s in this Industry.

Spent 5 nights at the Park Central Hotel and had a great time ! Service was amazing and the team at the concierge was very helpful. Elizabeth, from the team, kindly offered an upgrade on my second night due to disturbance from constructions outside. I highly recommend the hotel !

This trip marks my third time in NYC and also at Park Central and it gets better with every visit! I travel a sometimes tiring amount for work and the last thing you want upon arrival at your Hotel is to have to deal with inconvenience and or other issues. Not at Park Central! Elizabeth and Michalyn from Guest Relations have taken care of me like only my Mother would and for that I thank them eternally! Jokes, laughs and help with anything I needed - Michalyn’s got me!I have plenty of reasons to return to NYC and the Park Central will definitely stay one of them! Thanks Ladies! LOVE

Spent extra money to stay in a 2 x premier King rooms. I phoned in advance to make sure I could get connecting rooms and have the most upper floor avail. Turns out both rooms (not connecting) are on the 9th floor and we are starting into an office block. I thought I was paying for a view. There isn’t one. Room is in need of repairs (will add photos), the check in was so so and there is construction going on directly outside the hotel so you cannot get in and out easily. The hotel is also seemingly under construction as it’s covered with netting. If I could check out tonight and spend my remaining 4 elsewhere, I would. Already disappointed and I’ve been here 15 mins

The staff are especially welcoming and hospitable, contributing to an all-round amazing atmosphere.With a special shout out to Front Desk managers Elizabeth and Emaunal, it has been a fun trip and we are excited to return :)Tau (London, UK)

Lovely hotel, very clean and staff are very friendly and professional.....Thanks a mil to Emanuel and Elizabeth..... very helpful and always smiling We will be back xxRunya, Tau, Ant & Mon(Birmingham, UK)

It was a pleasure staying in this hotel felt appreciated and respected by all stop me and my family will be coming back to stay at the hotel thank you park Central Hotel . Me and my family would like to say it was a pleasure

My daughter and I stayed at the hotel for her bday. Upon arrival everything looks amazing, clean and well put together. During check in I did have a minor issue. I don’t know if the person that was checking me in was having a bad day but it wasn’t the greatest service you’d expect with paying close to $200 a night at beautiful hotel. The associate had stepped away momentarily and this pleasant lady I believe her name was Ellie or Elisa had greeted me. I mentioned the service and although I didn’t expect anything she took it upon herself to get the manager. She was attentive, friendly, full of energy and apologized for the behavior of the other employee. She gracefully took the time to ensure the rest of my check in and stay went well. Ms Senia didn’t have to go out of her way, I honestly wasn’t going to make a big deal about the other employee. She was incredible. As I told her before I left, its people like her that make a huge difference on whether people decide to go back to a hotel. I will definitely return. I can only imagine the amazing work her and her staff accomplish under her leadership. Wonderful service at the front desk staff. Thank you.

We had several requests coming into the hotel and Michalyn at the front desk was kind, polite and solved each of them for us. I would highly recommend Park Central to any NYC travelers both new and old.

I wanted a central location and took a chance on the Park Central Hotel The Lobby at check in is not very welcoming, its spacious with not much seating. We were welcomed at the front desk with a warm and friendly smile. We went to the room, surprised to find it so well appointed! nice large bed, big TV and nice design. Bathroom was small but designed well with nice tile and sink area was very functional.I would love to see a coffee maker in the roomWe were offered a coupon for a coffee juice or tea, fruit and pastry. Perfect.The staff everywhere in the hotel were great! I will return.

Requested early check in and instead of setting realistic expectations, led us to believe that our room would be ready soon. We waited from 7 am to 4 pm (check in time). Upon check in, was told our room was upgraded, was not. Entered room to find invite to pick up welcome gift at front desk (time share sales pitch). Left to check out a few days later and was invited to a departure gift (same sales pitch). I understand that this is a limited service hotel but there is no reason to add to the lack of personality and hospitality that this hotel offers by trying to sell me twice in one trip. On the upside, nice room and comfy bed. Hotel was under construction so expected higher level of hospitality to make up for construction.

Excellent location, just 2 mins to Times square and Carnegie Hall across the road. Central Park also 2 Mins walk away. The hotel however is a different story. We found the reception staff to be rude and the room 1433 hadn't been cleaned properly, there was a dirty wet flannel on the hook on the bathroom door. Dust across the tile trim in the bathroom, a broken toilet roll holder. The floor lamp flickered so couldn't be used. There was a bedside table missing ( this was a king room). The drawers fell out if pulled out more than 6-8 inches.The deadlock wasn't working on the main door to the room, so we didnt feel safe at night and had to push a chair up against the door.I complained several times while there and was informed it would all be sorted. It wasn't. The bathroom was indeed cleaned, but not the tile trims, they still had a lot of dust on them and the tiles had streaks on them.I paid extra for the location and the security for my daughter and I, but I'm afraid I couldn't recommend this hotel due to the lack of response to my complaint both whilst there and now we are back home. I have emailed them and only got a "Thankyou for your comments" and due to the inadequate state of the hotel room.

I found this hotel through a quick online search and was expecting a 3 star experience that would have sufficed our quick Manhattan trip. We were pleasantly surprised at this hotel. Beautiful lobby, clean entry way and quick friendly staff got us checked in rapidly. We had a two queen bed room and it was huge. The bathroom was large and full of nice fluffy towels and the most amazingly scented soaps, body washes and lotion. The TV had tons of options and you can checkout directly from the account screen. This was a great choice for a nightly stay under $100 and we will certainly be back on our next trip!

Michalyn was an absolute pleasure to deal with. She made our check in experience a breeze . Hotel is centrally located and very clean and modern with a classic twist . Beds were super comfy and clean. Only down fall is the elevators and the hotel fee. I don’t understand the hotel fee as there were no facilities such as pools etc .

We just checked in a little while ago and had a weird interaction with another patron on our floor. The customer service team especially Senia, were absolutely incredible!!! Such great service at the bar as well. Truffle fries were to die for! :)

Michalyn & Sena went out of their way to make sure I had everything I needed. They answered all of my questions without any complaints. From giving my directions and recommending great food spots. Everything was done with a smile.

Michelline at the front desk went out of her way to take care of my wife and her mother for their birthday trip to NY! I asked to have something nice done for her birthday, and she not only took care of me but she asked me how to personalize it. Thank you!

First things first I want to tell everyone about the greatest employee in the big Apple her name is JET She was very polite and understanding she made me and my friend feel at home we arrived early so are room was not ready but she stayed on top of them until they got our room cleaned and ready for us she made sure are stay was fabulous she gave us great recommendations for restaurants transportation and night life.Now about the hotel VERY VERY CLEAN both hotel and rooms also rooms are roomy I’ve been to other hotels in NYC and they are really SMALL from check in to check out I did not have any problems this hotel makes sure customers are always there first priority I highly recommend this hotel definitely recommend it all around thank you all again for the amazing hospitality I’ll see u next time.

Elizabeth, a representative of the Guest Relations Desk, was so helpful to me! She was so kind and personable. She made sure to help me with my concern and it made my night at the Park Central even greater. Elizabeth is a great example of someone who goes above and beyond to make sure guests and others are always taken care of. Thank you again!

My mother and I had the pleasure of staying at the Park Central Hotel in New York, to celebrate my mother's birthday. From the moment we checked in, the staff provided exemplary service. Specifically, Alicia Nunez, went out of her way to make sure our experience in the bar was terrific,(which it was!). Great location, comfortable and clean rooms, and an amazing staff!

I was visiting NYC from Florida and I wasn't top fimilar with the area and I was trying to get something good to eat and and Michalyn was very polite and helpful. She was able to recommend excellent food places. We actually went to one of the places she recommended.The food was on point. Thank you again Michalyn!

Stayed for a week at park central hotel .. the service was excellent .. we received extremely good service from khianna as she went above and beyond to help us . she was always ready to help us with a smile and ensure we had a great time and service through the week and even helped us when she was not on duty

It was an amazing experience! The staff were loveley, the place is gorgeous and the room was all I could of hoped for. Khianna, the advisor of hotel, made the trip much smoother with her tips and guidance. Without her help, our stay on NYC wouldn't have been as organized, fun and stress free, so if you come to this hotel you know who to ask when thinking of having a good tourist experience. Lastly, the hotel had an amazing location to be at, what I mean with this is that everything was close to hotel. Some examples are central park, the metro station, time square, rockefeller center, etc. In summary, if you want to experience a thorough search into the city of NY, Hotel Park Central is a perfect option for you

I checked in late evening and Daphne at the front desk helped me. She was very on top of her game and a good listener as I was very stressed as I was checking in after having a very horrible day. Alex, the general manager was very helpful and made my stay as pleasant as he could with some add on perks as I was having a very horrible day and some issues. Thanks guys for all the help, I know you did what you could. Noel brought my bags up to the room and he made sure I knew where the stairs were just in case, what number to call just in case I need anything, and all you need to know to feel safe and sound. He was very nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to visit NYC. Great service and staff

I’m all about the service! Elizabeth the guest relations manager just made a client for life! After a long day she went above and beyond! Oh, the location, rooms and overall value...you can’t beat it. Thumbs up!!

Hands down Emanuel and Jet were amazing. Never had a front desk experience like that in any of the places I’ve visited. Came here on business and I felt as if I was on vacation. Snuck in some work at the lobby Lounge. Drinks were great.

I have been staying at the Park Central Hotel in New York for business at least one a month. It is an excellent hotel with a great staff. My favorite is Carol at the front desk. She has a amazing memory and it is very nice that she remembers my name each time I visit. Her smile and warm personality sets the tone for my visit each time. The rooms are of the higest quality and every thing is always in place. The desks in the rooms are sufficiently large to allow one to work very productvely. I also enjoy my time there and that is the reason I come back and back again.

We chose this over a few places closer to Times Square because it was significantly less expensive. It turned out that the rooms were very nice (we appreciated that the beds in our room were queen rather than double, which worked better for our family of four). The location, while not in the middle of Times Square, was a short walk from there, and was right on top of a subway entrance that gave us easy access to the rest of Manhattan. The gym was very nice. The elevators are a bit slow, and crowded at check out time. But for the amount this place was cheaper than some of the similar alternatives, it was well worth it.

Loved this hotel the first time we stayed so re-booked it for our wedding anniversary. The rooms are a good size, clean and modern. The reception area is busy but the staff are efficient and attentive and really do try and help. The restaurant, lounge area behind reception is great if you want to charge your phone or eat your order in pizza. Have recommended this place to a few people as the location is just amazing - you're not far from anywhere.

The hotel has an excellent location, rooms are really clean and spacious and the service is excellent, we received great recommendations by guest relations (Elizabeth) she really helped us with everything on our stay. There are a lot of restaurants and bars near the hotel and its so close to central park. I would love to stay here on mi next visit.

The Park Central has a fantastic location, clean and cozy rooms, a nice modern lobby and lounge to relax and socialize in, and wonderful and attentive staff. The fitness center was clean and offered a nice variety of workout options, the lobby coffee shop was convenient, and the location can't be beat with so many great places to explore just outside the front door. We felt welcomed and comfortable upon arrival and throughout our 5 day stay. The front desk, Guest Services, housekeepers, and lounge staff were all friendly, fun, and helpful. We plan to make Park Central our NYC home base on future trips. Thank you Park Central for the great place to relax, sleep, and enjoy.....It was a spanking good time! :)

After staying at the Park Central Hotel 2.5 years ago, it is the ONLY Hotel I frequent in NYC! This month marks my 12th Stay at the Park Central hotel. Their staff is courteous and professional. Their rooms are clean, cozy, and accommodating to my family and friends. The lounge is lively in the evenings and the modern decor is pleasing to the eye! Despite the construction on the outside of the building the views are priceless and exactly what this Orange County mama desires when in the Big City. As Arnold said, I’ll Be Back!!!

I haven’t been back in New York for about 10yrs and first time staying at the park central hotel(NYC) upon arriving I was greeted by a young lady by the name Michalyn. She has been amazing while staying here and help me with amazing restaurants and bars. I wish there were more people like her in the hotelIndustry. I look forward to staying here more when I visit New York.

I have stayed in this hotel many times. The lobby is lovely. The rooms are nice. During my most recent stay this weekend I downgraded my rating and will not stay again unless I find some ridiculous deal. Here is what I found less than OK:$38 nightly fee with no real benefits and a sign on the reception desk that tells you you’re welcome to take advantage of the 10% discounts but that the fee is non-negotiable. I felt like I was paying for luggage under the seat in front of me. Just include this fee in the price. Note: many people who reviewed and didn’t mention this may have taken advantage of $99/night Travelzoo deal where nightly fee was included at 50%, so their nightly rate was ~$130 including room, fee, and taxes. Major construction in front of hotel - no where to load or unload car or taxi.Major construction outside of your room if you’re in the courtyard. I stood for 5 minutes in front of 2 receptionists who talked to eachother and never bothered letting me know that they weren’t working and to go to the other reception desk. No blanket on the bed in mid February. No vanity kit in the bathroom. It is what it is but $65 valet.

The Park Central has been my family’s Manhattan hotel of choice for my entire life (40 yrs). We’ve seen it undergo some renovations and the most recent are impressive to say the least. The thing I love about this hotel is that it feels closer to Central Park South and the upper east side/5th Avenue than the more touristy Times Square hotels, and this is one of its most positive attributes. For the price/value/location alone I think it’ll always be my go to. Highly recommended.

Everytime I come to New York City I stayat the Park Central hotel which I've been doing since 2002. The hotel is beautiful, the staff is helpful and the rooms are clean and well kept. This time I had a bit of an issue with security and Darren went FAR OUT OF HIS WAY to help and that has guaranteed that we'll continue to be customers forever. With employees like Darren your hotel will continue to be a top choice for years to come. I'm not sure what he gets paid, but id I were you I do WHATEVER it took to keep him on staff.

The Hotel staff was excellent. Great experience with Guest Services - Michalyn and Eliza were awesome!!! Also received excellent help from the Concierge! Always friendly, helpful and willing to do anything to assist!

Park Central is in a great location!!! Quiet but still walking distance to everything including the Theater district and Times Square! We have stayed here multiple times and are never disappointed. The staff are always friendly and accomodating. Special thanks to Jason McGrath Assistant Director of the front desk who graciously extended a late check out to us as we had Jimmy Fallon tickets for the day of our check out!!! They also held our bags till after the show! We will definitely return!

While staying at the Park central Hotel in NY this past week, we had a package shipped to the hotel which we urgently needed for a demonstration. We met with Alvin at the Baggage Storage room which conducted a search for more than 30 min to find our package, which was mislabeled by the shipping agent. Excellent Service - thank you Alvin

Even though it doesn’t serve breakfast but only has a grab and go shop and a bar, this hotel really is a satisfying choice. A very nice classic hotel room with good service, a beautiful lobby and bar area, and an amazing location within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway but not close enough to be really pricey. Also has a door that is 20 feet from a subway entrance which is convenient. While we were here there was some construction so we couldn’t really see the building from the outside but we are happy that we chose this hotel!

I had the pleasure of staying at this mid-town hotel multiple times in Jan/Feb. Special thanks to Angela and Salaam at the front desk who were so helpful in making sure our stays were successful. They helped with early check in where possible and made sure they could accommodate our special requests, two beds, extra pillows, etc. They greeted us every morning and checked to make sure we were comfortable. Hotels can be so impersonal, not so with this one. They work hard to make you feel at home. At the end of the last stay, we knew we'd be back to this great hotel with it's welcoming staff! You can't beat the convenience of he location in this mid-town hotel. Steps to the subway, great coffee shop next store, amazing restaurants (don't miss Trattoria D'Arte, delicious!) Walk to 5th Avenue, take a stroll around the park. So many great restaurants, shopping and of course the theatre!Great Bodega adjacent to the subway stop.

Couldn’t ask for a better welcome on my birthday night after long travelling-2 free cocktails! Such a friendly service and made you feel like home straight away. Nothing was hassle and everything was taken care within minutes after request! Vito will get my vote any day for best customer service I’ve had in a hotel! Thank you from me and my mum from the bottom of my heart! Oh and also best location you could ask for first time visit! I’ll be back for sure!

Everyone I encounter at this hotel was amazing and extremely accommodating. Elizabeth and Micheline at guest relations helped me through an unexpected emergency and I couldn’t be more amazed and their compassion, expertise, professionalism and hospitality. I don’t know what I would have done without them. Also, Miguel at guest services was an absolute doll and knew absolutely everything you need to know about all the Broadway shows playing. Since he’s seen most all of them he was able to make excellent recommendations based on the mood we were in. I was in the city on a business trip, so I didn’t have any say in where we stayed but I would definitely consider coming back to this hotel for personal travel.

Our stay at Park Central was absolutely amazing! We loved the location as it was two blocks from Central Park. Emanual at the front desk took care of us when we arrived two hours before check-in. He was very accommodating and understanding. Thank you Emanual and thank you Park Central! We will be back!

Emanuel went above and beyond to make our stay very enjoyable. He was friendly, attentive, and very professional. He gave us a very pricey upgrade for no extra charge, which we really appreciated. I would recommend this hotel for many different reasons, but the staff being a big part of that!

Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 3 nights & loved it! The hotel has a welcoming atmosphere, very clean & nit. It has a specious lounge area with a bar and life music in the evenings. Location is gold, right next to Central Park, minutes to 5th ave shopping mile, Rockefeller center, Time Square and many other attractions, that saved us money & time on taxis ! Friendly staff, Quimby was very helpful ! Also Hotel provides lot’s of perks, like 1h free bike rental at the shop next door and discounts at neighboring businesses.

From the rooms to the service you will not be let down. Though booking accommodation complications may occur, Elizabeth and Senia are the super women of the night! This is one of the few hotels, let alone in NYC, that do everything they can to earn your business and put the customer first! Thank you again to Elizabeth and Senia for going above and beyond to make sure I could rest easy. Highly recommended to anyone looking to see the sights, enjoy the atmosphere, and stay in a quality establishment! 10/5 stars

The hotel is conveniently located in Midtown close to Central Park. It’s my fifth time here. I aways have a very pleasant check-in specially when Vito is working at the front desk. He is very nice and super professional. I frequently get upgraded to a nicer room and get free drinks at the bar. The margarita is really good! Jet at the front desk is really sweet too! I will definitely come back to this hotel. Highly recommended.

Every time I travel to New York for work I stay at this hotel. I refer all my most important clients here too — not only is it inexpensive compared to the other hotels around here, but the service and professionalism are unmatched. It’s safe, clean, and truly a home away from home. During my most recent stay, Elizabeth, Senia and Micheline went literally above and beyond accommodating my tough last minute requests — no questions asked. If I could hire them to work for me I would (I tried!!) they were seriously so, so, so sweet and accommodating and definitely gave me an even better impression of this place. 10/10 would recommend coming to this hotel and I will definitely be back. Ask for the girls — they will take care of you!!

From the point of arrival to the moment we left the staff were amazing. Had an issue with the heating in our room so the maintenance guy came and spent at least half an hour trying to put it right but to no avail. At this point we were immediately moved to another room. Fantastic service. We would like to say a special thank you to Mr Ken Holden who worked on the diamond desk for answering any questions we had and nothing was ever a problem and always had a smile on his face. So thanks again.. would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay again on our next visit to New York.

If your thinking of staying at park central hotel, right on Central Park. I would avoid at this time of months. The hotel is very nice don’t get me wrong. However I stay in the 36th floor and from 7am in the morning all you can hear is building work sending load bangs waking you up maki it in easy to sleep. Other than that the hotel is clean and alround good. Just shame about the building work at this moment in time. I would say check with them first.

Had a wonderful stay here , booked on Expedia . Clean rooms, great location, wonderful staff! Will definitely return! We enjoined the helpfulness of the staff, they helped with subway directions, dinner reservations and you can leave your luggage before and after checking out .

By now you would have read about how this is a nice hotel in a superb location etc. Only reasons I am not awarding 5 stars is because of three niggling issues:1) the shower water pressure is too low. 2) the WiFi doesn’t work in all the rooms (lacks range) so you will need to get a special code in some areas. 3) at busy times you can wait upwards of 5 minutes to get a lift down from your room which can start to grind when you are staying for 4 days and are going up and down.

Clean hôtel with good and very polite personel Elizabeth at reception counter was very efficient, friendly and welcoming.Ventilation is noisy but it covers for the noise coming up from the street!The location is perfect, 5 minutes walk to central park and Broadway.

Great hotel this location is great because its only a short walk to times square Central Park etc, JP on reception was great and so was all the other staff, no problems at all, we got the hop on hop off pass from one of the guys outside the hotel was very cheap we got 5 day pass for 2 which was only about 100 dollars. Shops cafes etc literally on your door step which is perfect. Definitely worth it would recommend and would return.

Jet from the front desk did a excellent job both in checkin and recommending a great restaurant.Carmello valet our car on the way in and out with a great attitudeThis hotel was great however it did not have a restaurant or coffee in the room

This hotel is centrally located to everything in Manhattan. 1 block from Broadway, 3 blocks from Time Square, 2 blocks from Central Park. We walked most places as it was 10 minutes or less to get there. We used the metro for longer trips such as Battery Park, 9/11 memorial, and Herald Square.The hotel staff was easy to work with. We didn't have any issues at the hotel.

We started off our stay with the room not being ready when we arrived, however we checked our bags and went for a walk around the city. When we returned, we found out that the elevators were out of service and had to carry our bags up to our room via the stairs. When we arrived, we had been given a room with two small beds, even through our reservation was for a king, and the air conditioning did not work. Reception was not helpful at all and refused to give us another room. Will never stay here again.

What an incredible hotel! The staff was so kind and friendly. The manager JP was unbelievably kind and welcoming. He truly cares about his place of work and the people staying at the hotel. Also, it was so clean! I only stayed one night and I wish I could have stayed longer! Definitely going back for another mini get away!

Hotel was very nice, Smooth check in. Alicia Nunez made my birthday special. She remember my special day. Room was clean and comfortable. Location was good, close to Times Square and Rockefeller. We had a great stay. Looking forward to come back shortly.

We stayed here in October, 2019.They put us in a room opposite one of the many lifts which was loud and pinged every five minutes so we had to move rooms. But then they located us next to the Service Users lift! The next day, the Car Valet asked us "Are you the guys with the car that has the scratch on it?". We most certainly were not but they had smashed up our car, blamed us and we had to pay additional in insurance. Quite frankly, this is appalling.  I would never stay here again or trust the Valet Parking. They were clearly out for themselves.

I stayed here for 3 weeks. It is located right in the middle of the Manhattan. A hell lot of restaurants nearby and a lot of sight-seeing places are at a walking distance. Rooms are clean; housekeeping staff was really nice. I asked for extra hangers; extra lamp; even a humidifier, they got me all.I would like to especially appreciate Adriana from the front desk. She helped me check-in. When she saw, I was to stay here for 3 weeks, she offered me the biggest room in the category I had booked. And that too without even asking for the same. And that helped me a lot. A bigger room made my stay really comfortable. @Adriana: One need to be both kind as well as smart to do so. You are both. I would like to thank you. Really appreciated.

It is in fact a very nice hotel and very well located, the issue was that at this time the hotel was in construction, therefore at 8am there were people working outside my window and making noise. The lady in the reception was also quite arrogant towards myself and my colleague, however the manager was very kind and solved our issue.I would also like to make a special thank you to Marisa who cleaned our room every day and was extremely nice.

2nd visit to Park Central Hotel. Good value for money, very good transport connections, hotel staff very friendly, answered all our requests, the rooms are clean, linen changed every day, free fast internet, close to theaters, Central Park, 5th avenue, MOMA, good choice of restaurants for all budgets. Our favourite place to stay in NYC.

I had an amazing stay! The front desk clerks/ receptionists were always willing to help. I stayed here for a week and enjoyed every second. Ken H. was very professional and amazing at what he does! Would definitely recommend staying here.

We've just returned from a lovely NYC weekend, where we stayed at the Park Central Hotel. We can't say enough about the staff who worked with us during the stay. At one point my husband lost a bag. The staff went above all expectations to resolve the problem. The hotel is in an excellent location. We walked everywhere--to the museum, the theater, the park, and shopping. This was a real treat for us as we live in an area where walking is downright dangerous. We want to give a shout-out to Merissa who took care of us on the 10th floor!

OMG, this was such an amazing experience. Hotel was beautiful, staff was excellent and the location was perfect!!! We were right between Park Central and Time Square which was only steps away. I loved that we could just walk there!

2ND year of the Park Central hosting our 14 Managers for our annual business meeting. Once again perfect stay for all! Riley Allen was more than accommodating the over all service we recieved was impeccable.

Oh my gosh I can't say enough good things about this hotel!!! Upgraded room for our honeymoon! Q at the front desk was amazing! The bartender I can't remember his name he is from Dublin was amazing and so was Nancy! Perfect location, excellent amenities and wonderful staff. The BEST hotel!!

The hotel is located in very central location, very close to the Times square. The room compare to NYC was lovely, big and comfortable. The staff were very friendly especially Elizabeth who made sure we get the best experience while our stay. We had a very positive experience, we definitely would recommend and return next time in NYC.

We have stayed at this hotel about 8 times over the last 15 yrs.Both the location and customer service are great.Angela at reception has been at the hotel for a long time and has always been wonderful to deal with, moreover she still prides herself in welcoming guest to the hotel.I had received an email after booking on line from the new manager of the hotel Erik Palmer, he wanted to personally welcome us and told me to reach out to him if we needed anything during our stay.I did ask Erik if we could possibly have a certain room that my wife and I like in the hotel, he responded that he would make sure that would happen, sure enough it was noted on our reservation at check in.Angela was wonderful once again in expediting an early check in for us.We were also fortunate enough to meet Q in the lobby greeting guest, this guy can turn your grey sky blue in two seconds.What a personality, great addition to the hotel!The customer service at the Park Central Hotel is outstanding.Erik is going to make sure his goal of exemplary guest services exude through all of his staff. He has staff text you during your stay to make sure your stay is the best possible and to address any issue or concern a guest may have.Want to mention how wonderful John the bartender is in the lounge too.Great place to relax and unwind with great conversation.This 5 star service at its best.Thanks again for such a wonderful stay at your property.Richie & Marie Montemarano

We booked this hotel through Expedia and probably the best thing was the bed. We needed somewhere close to Carnegie Hall for a night with a bed and some where to change. On checking out we were hit with a facility fee for such things as us of the gym, a tour of some sort, use of the business center etc. no of which we used but we still had to pay. Water pressure in the shower could not be changed and it was to low. There was no tea or coffee in the room and away from the foyer it was looking a bit old. The bed was comfortable and we got a good night sleep.

Our school, The University of Tennessee, had a FANTASTIC stay at Park Central Hotel. We had no problems with the service and catered to every need we had. I highly encourage anyone to stay here. Also, shout out to Ken H!! Go talk to him and get your free gift. He’s the man.

I was here earlier in the week as they used a downstairs area for “holding” for background talent on the Law & Order SVU set and had an amazing experience. The staff was so friendly, kind and eager to offer help and smiles — especially the manager J.P. who helped me out with accessing the lobby bathroom. They made a long day of filming more enjoyable and if they treated me this nicely, I can only imagine how much hospitality they show their overnight guests. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family visiting NY!

I have reviewed quite a few hotels on Tripadvisor and this is the first time I am reviewing to let people know what a disappointment this hotel was.Stayed here for 5 nights, upon arrival there was scaffolding up at the front of the hotel and nowhere for the cab to park, we ended up being dropped on a corner and finding our way in, no doorman or concierge to be seen. Check-in the staff were offhand and not particularly friendly. Room and bed were large but the aircon unit was the noisiest I have experienced so was turned off immediately. No proper bedding on the bed only a sheet and thin blanket (we went in January whilst it snowed). The next morning we asked at reception for a blanket to be sent up as we had been cold the night before, to be told the aircon would also heat the room, I informed her that it was too noisy and could we have a blanket. The blanket was dumped on the bed still on a hanger when we arrived back. When we checked out we were charged the facility fee, I am at a loss as to what this fee was actually for. There are no facilities in the hotel, a gym on the third which is pointless as you are unlikely to use it after sightseeing all day, other than that nothing.As the title says, the only reason to stay is the location of the hotel, mind you there are other hotels a little further down 7th.

The hotel is very beautiful and the room was spacious and very clean. Personnel were very nice and friendly.  Main reason for the 4 rating was the forced facility fee of $38/night. It is for getting a percentage off if you use extras like site seeing bus tour, renting a bike, etc. I would have liked getting a lower rate for using the garage for parking! Also the coffee shop was way overpriced. I spent over $7 for a water and a banana. There wasn’t a coffee pot in the room either. I recommend this hotel, just be aware of the fees.

Darren M, the hotel manager literally saved my night! I had huge technical problems using 3 different credit cards (one wasn't mine and I didn't have the owner's I'd, other was just by number, and the third one was not valid) so basically I had no place to stay for the night! That's what all the workers (very nice ppl btw) have told me, but than Darren came and did beyond and above what he should have done and got me some really nice room...The hotel is great and on a prime location btw...enjoy

The Park Central is an ideal hotel to stay in the city. Its location and price are perfect for any visitor. The staff are helpful, friendly, and courteous. They clearly want to ensure their guests are comfortable and satisfied with their accommodations and service, especially because of the inconvenience of the subway work directly in front of the hotel. David, the doorman, was incredibly helpful navigating this construction. He made a challenging situation easy and stress free. His happy and professional manner was the perfect start and end to a wonderful weekend. The room was clean and comfortable. The corner room offers a great view of 7th Ave. I recommend staying here.

The hotel is ideally situated to take in many attractions. The room were very comfortable albeit there was construction workers on the scaffolding outside our window which wasn't a nice wake up call!!.The only downside to this hotel is the cost that's put on your bill for stuff that we didn't use ( gymnasium, bicycles, can't remember the other items) USE THEM OR NOT YOU STILL GET CHARGED $36 p/day.unfortunately because of this we wouldn't use this hotel again & we go to NY every december.

Room was great comfortable bed, clean bathroom and no noise at night. Friendly staff and manager J.P was very helpful. I definitely recommend this hotel AWESOME location to everything!!! If you need anything talk to J.P he will take care of you!!!

Had a great stay at park central hotel. Friendly staff . Great accommodations. Had fun in the city . Lot of things to do here.Manager J.P. Was super friendly and even gave us a free gift when asked about the airport shuttles!

We had the good fortune to sing at Carnegie hall and stay at the Park Central Hotel for our rehearsals and performance. The hotel exceeded our expectations and by far one of the best highlights for us was the evenings we spent in the lounge after dinner - relaxing in large clumps of us - in the ample, comfortable booths and waited on by the very awesome waitress Nancy! This was a wonderful way to cap an exciting day. Nancy made us feel at home - she was also really helpful guiding us to better choices. Overall the drinks were great, and service stellar!

I was in town for work and found myself in a bit of a bind before needing to leave the hotel one morning. Alex Claudio, the Overnight Manager on Duty was in the lobby and assisted me. He was so helpful and promised to follow up with me within the next 24 hours ..... and true to his word he did. I have stayed a the Park Central before and have had no complaints, but he went above and beyond to help me and made this stay even better. Thank you, Alex.

As soon as you walked in the door you felt welcome! Service was exceptional, location was great and therefore we had a wonderful stay! Emanuel was very friendly and instantly recommended dinner options and even made reservations for us on the spot! And as far as the restaurant chosen, he did not disappoint!

We have been to the Park Central before and love its location as we never had to take public transportation for what interested us. We walked to the Theatre District, to Lincoln Center and to the Metropolitan Museum and the new Museum of Modern Art ( three short blocks away.) The hotel itself had everything we could want. We had the basic room which was plenty large, and were given a refrigerator for our stay. Went to the Fitness Center in the hotel every day, and it has modern equipment in an attractive facility. Finally, the staff could not have been nicer and more helpful. For example, we received wonderful assistance from a manager, JP, when we were in the midst of checking out.

We had a perfect stay at the Park Central Hotel from the moment we checked in and for 9 nights. Hotel staff was very welcoming and accommodating. The rooms are large, clean and the beds and pillows are super comfortable. Rooms are also tastefully decorated and there are numerous electrical outlets throughout the room as will as some USB outlets. The bathroom is a very nice size and the lighting is good! All of the housekeeping staff I encountered were also kind and courteous. I’ve stayed in the big chain hotels in NYC but the Park Central is my favorite place to stay! The location is perfect as you are a few blocks from Times Square, Central Park and Rockefeller Center. You are also steps from a bus stop and the subway. The lobby is beautifully decorated and the fragrance which fills it is wonderful. There are many, many places to stay in NYC, but I will return to the Park Central for all the reasons I’ve listed above. It’s a lovely place and everything one would want in a great stay!

This hotel was recommended to me by my daughter who had stayed there more than once. It's a reasonably priced hotel, with the ambience of a basic Luxury Hotel, in a sea of overpriced accommodations near Central Park South and Rockefeller Center. Before my trip, I contacted the manager to inquire about several tax and other fees tacked onto the Room Charges, mostly mandated by the city. I immediately received an email from Tony Cunaj, the Complex Director of Reservations, that was welcoming and informative. Tony offered to upgrade my room and provide a senior discount, although I only just qualify for the latter. Although I opted not to use my credit card rewards, he was also willing to make an exception in my booking to allow me to use them towards my bill. Tony certainly earned my loyalty and deserves a commendation from whomever he reports to as an asset to the hotel.The hotel bellman, Jaime, met me upon my early arrival and stored my baggage without delay. The hotel is nicely appointed and has a large bar and meeting area behind the lobby desks that was ideal for spending time with family. I found the room very clean, quiet and comfortable with a nice view. Although there isn't a restaurant on premises, there's a Starbucks for morning coffee adjacent to the hotel and plentiful dining options nearby within a block or two. Jett, who I met at the Concierge Desk, was especially helpful in locating a Chinese restaurant for a large party with my special request for a dish I hadn't been able to find.I highly recommend Park Central for its location, price and warm hospitality.

This weekend we stayed at the Park Central Hotel. Our experience was unmatched; from the location, to the lobby design & the room sizes. I have stayed at many hotels in NYC & nothing compared. The staff was highly accommodating but in particular the manager, Darren McLeod, was calm and welcoming. He was able to assist us with all the navigation questions that we had & consistently made sure that we were beyond satisfied with our experience. Thank you again!

We stayed recently for the third time at Park Central, the first time with our child and the experience was very family friendly. The service is second to none and staff are very amenable and friendly. Compared with other hotels I’ve tried, Park Central is by far the best and most accommodating!! They are great at problem solving as oppose to saying no to requests like other hotels have, and don’t charge for essentially like a kettle and fridge which another large chain of hotels did with us. The service makes the experience at Park Central very enjoyable and our pick amongst all other hotels in NYC. The service and experience feels boutique and personalised. The rooms are clean and modern looking. Convenient location. A special thanks to Eric Palmer, the General Manager for his generosity and for his great leadership. From guest services, thank you Salim and Elizabeth. Thank you to Ivan from the bell desk for always having a pleasant greeting. Thank you to the main lady at concierge for the helpful and honest tips and finally, thank you Charles Safo from housekeeping for going out of his way for us. All staff were wonderful and made this trip very enjoyable. See you again Park Central and Westhouse, the sister hotel which offers all the bells and whistles.

Hotel refused to check me in because the system hadn't synced with Hotels.com (after more than 30 minutes from the time of booking). Sometimes it takes hotels time before the system updates but they are usually able to do this manually. Attendant at hotel was both unhelpful and rude - I had an email confirmation and he refused to look at this.

We usually stay at the Park Central, but weren't able to get a reservation the last time and so it's been a while. So happy we were able to stay there again this time! The rooms and bathrooms are always clean, the beds comfortable, and the staff so helpful and friendly. The location is great, right next to one set of train lines and a short walk to two others, so it's easy to get around. Plus being so close to Central Park, it's easy to get out and walk around, shop, or just run to Duane Reade or TJ Maxx to get those things you always need last minute. We usually book when they have special rates, and when we do, the value cannot be beat!

Stayed for 2 nights Jan 8-9. Large room, very comfortable bed and pillows (4) Did the Valet package and got a great deal. Helpful and friendly staff. Good location for walking to everything. Were in our late 60's but had no problem walking to Rock Center, Winter Garden Theater to see Beetlejuice, And Ed Sullivan Theater for the Colbert Show. No surprises on the bill. Will go back. Depending on your room you might have to deal with some on and off construction noise. We just closed the curtain and it wasn't a problem.

Courteous and efficient staff. Large and very clean room overlooking Carnegie Hall. perfect location, a block away from Central Park. Later checkout and complimentary baggage hold made out last day in NYC easily manageable. Very satisfied!

We have stayed at this hotel many times; however, I quit staying here for awhile because there was always another problem that had to be resolved. But, I was headed to NYC and so I thought I would give them another try. I requested a refrigerator as we are in town for several days, and waited, and waited. I finally just went to bed when it hadn’t arrived in 1-1/2 hours. The room was cold and the beds don’t have a real blanket on them, so I requested some extras. Housekeeping called the room and told us the hotel turned off the heat as it is warm outside? Really, it was 30 degrees last night. Warmer today, but the room is cold. Why would you turn off the heat in January when you live in NYC? Their solution, bring us a space heater. It's really too bad because this is a nice hotel and clean, but it takes too much effort to fix all of the issues on arrival. Every time we stay here, I have to spend the time and effort to fix problems. No heat, no blankets, bathtub doesn't hold water, etc. I just want to book a hotel, arrive, get to my room and find everything working. It doesn't have to be fancy or perfect. It just needs to be clean and work. And, if I request something, just tell me if you can or can't supply it and when. I don't even want them to clean while I'm here. I'll tell you if I need something like fresh towels. Just don't waste my time.

I chanced upon this hotel on a website that had a very good deal for a night and immediately made a reservation. Location is EXCELLENT - 5 to 6 (10-15mins easy walk) blocks south of hotel is immediate vicinity of Times Square. 2-3 blocks north is Central Park / Columbus Circle. Adjacent to hotel is the world famous Carnegie Hall. Property is SUBERB - 2 separate properties situated in the same building. Huge bar right behind Park Central lobby/front desk. We also had drinks at the other bar in the lobby of West House (classic, beautiful interior - reminds of the old movies that were filmed in NYC). Staff is WORLD CLASS - although C/I was at 4, we arrived a little early in hopes of getting a room before standard checkin time. ELSA at the FD welcomed us like we were long lost friends coming for a reunion. She took her time to explain thoroughly what the hotel offered and our accommodations. There was a line and maybe 5-10mins wait to check in but ELSA and her other team mate (maybe european blonde), handled the line effectively and efficiently, taking their time to converse and relay all the information guests needed. Good job ladies! Rooms - Sleek modern and ideal. We had a King bed lots of space in the room, bathroom with tub and very strong water pressure(u dont need a masseuse). Very clean, alot of closet space. Excellent Bed mattress and pillows. We requested extra pillows and towels from Gst Services - in less than 5mins, they were delivered. Conclusion: Book this hotel! You cant go wrong! Just do it.

I’ve been in this hotel 3 times, and others members of my family too, the location is perfect, the rooms are very clean and comfortable, the personal always attent and with great treat! In this occation the wifi doesn’t work in my room, but sopouse that things happen. No doubt I will be back!!!

Most egregious was returning to my room after a full day of sightseeing on January 1 at 6 pm, only to discover that my room had not yet been cleaned. Reaching Housekeeping on the room telephone, I was told they would send someone ‘right away’ to clean my room. I vacated the room so as not to hinder the staff and returned an hour later, only to discover the room was not ready. Calling Housekeeping again, I was told they had had a busy day but my room was ‘next’. Again, I left the room, this time taking a short nap in the lounge, since my family had intended to try another venture out before we left the next day. This time, however, before going upstairs to my room - since my knees were painful - I asked Guest Services to call Housekeeping. Again, I was assured I was ‘next’. Close to tears, I called my family to regretfully inform them I could not go with them. ANOTHER HOUR, yup. This time Head of Housekeeping explained that due to the number of checkouts they had been overwhelmed but that also my room had been flagged ‘do not disturb’. I did NOT display the DND sign, nor was there one hanging on my door when I returned. I was then told that there was an email stating that. I did not send an email with that notice. I finally returned to a cleaned room at 11:30 pm, with a complimentary bottle of water Fr the inconvenience, just in time to pack and be ready for my 9:00 am pickup for the airport. There were other families also waiting for their rooms to be cleaned when I left the lounge at 11:30 pm.

JET THE FRONT OFFICE LADY WAS TRULY AMAZING! The room was very clean and same with the bathroom. They had a deal with a $75 amex gift card which was very cool and I am very happy with this experience, and JET needs a raise ASAP! She’s the best.

Upon approaching g the hotel I wasnt too happy about the construction. Emanuele personality and smile changed that thought instantly. Great deal and a free upgrade couldn't get any better. First time I NYC and all went well.

Great hotel and our room was spacious and very stylish and luxurious. A great refuge after trekking around the city. 5 minutes from Central Park and 10 minutes from time square so a perfect oasis in the city.

Another excellent stay at Park Central. Greeted by Carmelo as usualwith a smile, welcome back good to see you also a hug.The 1 thing you need to do on this and the hotel's sites be up front and mention the construction out front.I was on 18th floor and it was loud felt sorry for those on lowwe floors.Look forward to returning next year.

If you want a great location to see the top sites in the city,this is it! Close to the subway, Central Park and great food! The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Definitely a place we will return to.

I needed one night in NYC and this was a bargain, even with the silly $43 "facilities fee". I can't really say much they are all doing it and will continue to do so until the FTC tells them to stop.But I wasn't expecting much. I was ensconced in 939 with a nice view of the street (that is about all you can tet on the 9th floor). The room was spacious enough, actually large for an older NYC property. It appeared that the room had been renovated and redecorated - everything was in pristine condition.Wifi worked great. The only negatives are the construction on 7th Ave. which is a minor hassle when you are checking in or out with luggage (it's on the street itself, not the hotel's fault), only two smaller elevators, no coffee pot nor kettle in the room. It had a nice big (55" I would estimate" tv. A tremendous bargain for midtown!

The maids to an excellent job of keeping the rooms clean and the common areas of the hotel are also clean. The hotel is situated a few blocks and walking distance from Central Park. Our room was on the 16th floor which was fine except there were only two lifts which meant waiting quite a while. It has a bar but we didn’t use that and a small cafe (no seating) to buy coffee, tea and pastries etc.

While visiting New York for New Year’s Eve, a very busy time of year, and the biggest challenge was organizing a group of ten people. Khianna, The Park Central hotel concierge, made it easy and was a life saver. She took on the task of calling the restaurants on our must eat list, to find any that would accommodate 10 people on short notice so would could go out and enjoy the city.She always greated us with a smile, was patient and helpful with what ever we inquired about.She made our stay in New York a memorable one.Thank You to much Khianna!

Once again a brilliant stay at the Park Central, always my no 1 choice when visiting NYC. 7th stay here and still excellent service from check in to check out. Clean, friendly hotel. Great room and great hotel amenities Hope to be back soon to my fave hotel in my fave city

This hotel is not what you expect from a 4 star hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted with smokers outside the front lobby and a major construction site. Checking in was simple and quick. Then we were off to the 1...yes the 1 small elevator that serviced the property the full 4 days we were in town. My mom is unable to climb stairs so we had to wait up to 10 mins each time to use the elevators. We asked several times about service on the other elevator and were told " We aren't sure when service will get here"....really? Lines were lonnnng to the elevator! When you'd leave your room, again would have to wait 10 mins or longer for the 1 elevator to stop on your floor and have room for you. WIFI didn't work the whole time we were there as well. The rooms are completely outdated and dirty. We laid towels out on the carpet for a walk path because the carpet was so dirty. The sheets had holes in them and pillows are completely flat. We had 2 towels in our room and no wash cloths. So weird! I will say the cleaning ladies are extremely nice. I'm not sure if this hotel needs a new manager or what the issue is but definitely not a 4 star NYC hotel. After all of this at check out we were charged $174 fee....fee for what? No WIFI? Long wait lines at the elevator?? Holes in sheets?? Flat pillows?? I have reached out to the manager to have this fee refunded to me but no luck as of yet and we checked out Sunday. I try to find the positives in hotels but this one needs a lot of restructure and work.

Had a great time in New York & fortunately most out & about.Check in, credit card required for 40 dollars per night, more than tui had on booking so taking it up with them.Lobby shows what a grand place this was when built as it must be just the same, everywhere clean just refurbishment is essential. Carpet in the breakfast lounge is much like your parents in 70’s just theirs has been replaced several times & this had lots of use & everywhere is the same. To eat here is extremely expensive maybe no more than comparable hotels but quality has to reflect that, $80 for breakfast is just too much. We were on the 24th floor & it was noisy if your a light sleeper try & get a higher room.When you check in they tell you that you’ve got $40 to spend in the hotel, two coffees & muffins costs @20 so it’s just a ploy to get you to spend more than your $40 trying to get it back.Make sure the $40 comes off your bill when you check out as they’ve already got your credit card & want to charge it to that.Excellent position for what we wanted to do, staff pleasant & everywhere was clean.Never a 4* in our opinion maybe we’ve been lucky elsewhere, suggest the hotels stop saying services are included when clearly they’re not otherwise there would be no need for mandatory charges. Just charge it to the tour operator then we’d all know at the beginning.

This hotel is 100% worth the stay, I’ve been with my mum in August and my girlfriend over new year, the staff go above and beyond, the rooms are fantastic. Elizabeth the manager couldn’t of been more helpful and understanding when we needed her, polite kind and above the call of duty. If you’re staying in New York and want a central hotel right between time square and Central Park with luxury accommodation and outstanding lobby then this is the place for you. 5 star from us both visits!

Clean and quiet hotel located between Central Park and Times Square. We walked everywhere like Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Columbus Circle, Times Square and even 911 Memorial and then took subway back. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

A last minute booking through Hotwire did not show up in the hotel’s system, necessitating calls to Hotwire and a wait that seemed very long at a late hour of the night. The front desk manager, Elizabeth Cacovic, greeted me so warmly and handled this situation so gracefully. I was eventually settled into my room, a clean, elegant space that offered a weary traveller a peaceful night of rest. In the morning all the details of my booking were fully resolved with Kemi and I was on my way. Everyone at the Park Central was kind. I highly recommend staying there for its location and lovely atmosphere which really gives one a feeling of the beauty of the city, but also the warmth of all the people working there— a true New York experience.

Centrally located hotel with a lively bar & convenient store located in the lobby. Spacious-clean guest rooms & Very helpful staff! Thank you Senia! For being attentive, resourceful & taking the time to make sure my stay exceeded expectations!

We stayed at Park Central for four nights, our first time to this hotel and New York, it is in a great position and walking distance to all the land marks. We had a king room on the sixth floor it was a little run down but a great size and the bed was large and very comfy which we much prefer than immaculate paintwork or a slight frayed carpet. We never issued any problems with the lifts as many other reviews have stated apart from New Year’s Eve just after midnight but everyone was coming back in from celebrating so understandable but they where staffed and the wait wasn’t that long. Would like to mention Carmelo the doorman who made sure our checkout was quick and simple, he had our bags ready and a taxi waiting outside at the time we asked for, go see him when you want to check out 5 stars Carmelo. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely return, thanks Park Central we had a great time and great new year..

we enjoy the stay at the hotel!the hotel is located in a great place near the Central Park.we ‏receive a great atention from the personal of the hotel.we receive special help from guest service .‏Elizabeth and jason help us a lot!they was excelent

Once a lovely spot to stay for our trips of the city, this hotel is now suffering not just from age but from pure neglect: 1) only one elevator operating for the 4th floor leaving us standing, waiting endlessly as every five minutes or so a car would stop, only to be full. Eventually we took the up elevator to the top in order to get down to the lobby (this happened more than once). 2) Torn seats in the banquets in the lounge. 3) Only one face cloth, no bathmat and a total of two towels in the bathroom; 4) No doormen at all...Thankfully, still a competent and friendly staff who seemed to be at their wits ends about the sad fall of a once lovely hotel. We do not plan to stay there ever again.

Great customer service here at this luxury hotel. Staff are super helpful and very courteous. Room was new and very clean, sitting area was a great retreat after touring around the city. location was also convenient to Broadway and 5th Ave. Will definitely be coming back again.

Vito received us at the check in and his services was amazing!! Vito made sure we felt like home and offer us different alternatives to have in NYC. Vito is the Best!! Will definitly return ti The Park Central thanks to Vito!!

Just returned from 6 nights stay at Park Central. The hotel was lovely and clean, staff were mostly friendly and the room was a good size. Would definitely stay again! The hotel is about a 10 minute walk away from Central Park in one direction and a 15 minute walk to Times Squara. Close to the subways too. Be aware that they charge $38 a day fee to cover services like gym etc and it isn't optional. It wasnt advertised anywhere on the holiday booking and was a bit of a surprise when we arrived.

Park Central Hotel provided a perfect spot for our stay in the city that never sleeps, during an immensely busy week. The staff was consistently courteous, a ticketed luggage closet was available for early arrival and checking it out prior to needing to leave for the airport.
