I really enjoyed my stay at the Park Central Hotel. It's one of those beautiful old hotels, a little past its prime but still really nice. The staff was pretty wonderful, and the location could hardly have been better: a block away from Carnegie Hall, not far from MOMA, within walking distance of Central Park, the Frick, Lincoln Center (well, I do like to walk!). Also, very easy access to subways. The hotel has no restaurants, but that is not a problem, since there are plenty of places to eat with a short walking distance.

That there was a strong, almost unbearable, moldy smell in the bathroom and the a towel had a lipstick stain that had not washed out completely from previous use. The room was warm and they ran out of fans and offered to open a window-in NYC on the third floor-where the noise from the street would make it impossible to sleep leaving you no choice but to sleep in heat or in noise.Rooms are outdated ,Service wise had to ask and go to front desk and concierge multiple times to get my room change or upgrade it but no affect or follow up .

Staying a night at what I thought was a decent business hotel in mid-town NYC hotel. Decent room. Good location. But when I was ready for bed there was no bottled water in the room! You have to wonder down the hallway and buy it from a vending machine for $4.50!! Are you kidding me! I travel every week for work and EVERY hotel has a courtesy bottled water in the room. Even sometimes you have to pay, it’s in the room. I know this sounds like a stupid thing but I want to register this complaint with their management. So short sighted and NOT customer friendly.

This hotel is in very a good location, ideal for Time sq and must see attractions. Found some of the female reception staff unhelpful, the gentleman concierge was really good. Rooms were clean and spacious, Sadly we were at the corner back so view was restricted. As you would expect drinks expensive. Waitress was miserable and slow. There are plenty of places around to get tea, coffee meals etc. Hotel has a small area to buy tea coffee snacks, it closes at. Lunch. No facilities in room for hot drink.

I couldn’t wait to write this review. Emanuel at the check in desk was great. Got our room expedited as fast as he could. He promised us a great stay and from the looks of it with his help it will turn out for the better.

Quick & easy check in no problems & text message to mobile asking was everything ok. We stayed in room 752 which was airy & bright enough as was on the corner of the building a double queen room so extra window. Beds comfortable and clean & excellent powerful shower but there was a very odd smell not an unclean smell but ??? what it was ? Damp ? Air conditioning? I would have moved but my daughter said it was ok for her so we didn’t bother reporting it we only slept there. No tea or coffee facilities asked for these and was delivered 45 mins later but never replenished & not to my taste so left that.Fabulous location turn right out of hotel 7 mins walk to Times Square and turn left 10 mins walk Central Park. Would overall recommend & we loved NY.

This is my third business stay since the beginning of 2019. I am very satisfied with the location, spacious rooms and accommodating staff. Kudos to all of you and especially Elizabeth the manager! I would suggesting adding more amenities to the room.

We moved hotels at short notice because we had a bad experience with our previous hotel. We were so pleased we chose to move to Park Central! The room was spacious and quiet and the staff were friendly and helpful. Location is perfect - walking distance to all major attractions. High speed wifi made it easy to download our pictures at the end of each day. Price was very reasonable too. The only downside was that some guests obviously flouted the “no smoking” rule so the hallways smelt of smoke on occasion. I’d stay here again next time I’m in New York. Thanks for the great stay!

I have tried calling the hotel 3 times due to fraudulent transactions that occurred on my credit card-my card got hacked. The account services/customer services team have yet to return my 4 phone calls. I received a sketchy email asking for my card number. I had asked for a phone number so I could actually talk to someone. Well, the phone number was a disconnected number.Just because you are a 4+star hotel doesn't mean you are not subject to fraud, but at least have some customer service and call back opposed to emailing.

Rooms were nice, clean generous for NYC std. and all employees were very pleasant and accommodating. Special shout out to Elizabeth (at the Mgrs. desk) for helping us with a couple special requests. Great location, couple blocks from Central Park and tons of great restaurants in walking distance. Would definitely stay there again on business or with family.

I brought my high school choir to perform in Carnegie Hall and had previously stayed at the Park Central Hotel, so I knew it was the perfect location. Upon arrival, I was confused by the rooming list and (even though there was a line behind me) they made me feel like I was the ONLY one there. Answered every question, helped me understand what to do - all with a smile on their face!! I was SOOOOOOO impressed with Quimby!! WOW. I think I asked him five or six additional questions after I was finished with Guest Services and he was pleased to assist EVERY time. I am a teacher.....after a while I get tired of student questions. : - ) I felt like one of "those" students asking too many questions, but Quimby was ultra polite and answered my questions without hesitation and with a big smile on his face.Elizabeth was extremely helpful upon check-in and also throughout our stay (April 25-29). At one point, I asked if she lived there! It seemed every time I walked by at all hours, she was there. I know customer service is a challenge to do well and not sound robotic with fake smiles, etc. But, whatever they are doing at Park Central with their Guest Services employees is working beautifully. I did interact with a couple more employees, but do not remember their names. Always kind. I love a good sense of humor and they had no problem laughing and chatting with me at times and cared about how our stay was going. I love clear, concise communication and they did it with a smile on their face. Way to go, Quimby and Elizabeth!! : )

It isn’t 4 star at all I just want to put that out there immediately.Pro’s:>Comfy beds>Great location>Great WiFi Cons:>Stains all over the wallpaper>Dingy room, very dark and with the city having such tall buildings limiting light having the walls a dark grey colour does not maximise the light you do get>Room stank of damp because of the bathroom. It has no extraction in there and if we left the shower curtain pulled to dry it out to help prevent the smell the maids will pull it back again. Just keep the door shut and hold your nose when you go for a pee in room 912. >Shower is awful, yes it’s hot but it comes out of the head like a snail slithering up a wall. I was there forever. >Hair dryer randomly dips in power every 15 seconds or so and comes back to full power after about 10 seconds. It’s annoying when you have thick hair. I’d rather they had those ones you have to constantly keep holding the button on. >Lift was CONSTANTLY busy and only fits about 5 people in there. Theres queues that go into the lobby just to get into the lift. >Phone in the room didn’t even work.Tips: they only put a sheet and thin blanket on the bed and the first night I was freezing. I asked the guest relations person for a duvet and it was on the bed by the time we got back so they do have duvets. It reminded me of the hotel from American Horror Story in all honesty so it could have been worse. When you pay so much money for a hotel and then you have to pay a facility fee for literally nothing of any use to 97% of guests there we feel quite short changed. We walked over 50 miles around the city in the 5 nights we were there so we were rarely in the room thankfully. It’s a good base location and they’re building another metro stop directly outside the hotel on the other side of the road which will be perfect once done. With so many other hotels in NYC definitely explore other options.

First, location is great and room prices are pretty decent. Be very careful about the ‘facility fees’ and taxes. They will add a few hundred onto your room. So, that was the good stuff. This was my second time at the hotel but will book elsewhere next time. Bar staff was friendly. Maid service personnel was friendly BUT THAT WAS IT. Front desk less than nice and the same for the ‘grab and go.’ I also did not have a hairdryer in the room. I phoned down for one and 40 minutes later, one was still not delivered. I had to go find maid service and ask for one. I also saw something on my receipt about getting 10 percent off at the bar but nobody mentioned anything about that or how to do it. Honestly, when you are spending over 1300 bucks for a hotel for a few days, you would like to actually have someone friendly to help you. Oh, elevator is also slow and fills quickly. Just wasn’t impressed overall. To the manager – a little (just a little) friendliness and hospitality goes a long way. You are in the hospitality industry, right??

Amazing location, super cute housekeeping, amazing guest relation service with Quim. Nice size room, had requested for a fridge and got it, only problem was the noise one night with drunk kids running on the corridor until 2am and security hasn’t done nothing!

We just got back from a very exciting, action packed 4 nights at The Park Central Hotel on 7th Avenue and 56th. You cannot beat this hotels location! You are literally across from Carnegie Hall and steps away from amazing restaurants, the subway and a short walk to Broadway Theatres, Central Park and great shops. The hotel is spotless and the rooms a generous size for Manhattan. The beds are super comfy and sheets nice and soft. Everyone you encounter at the hotel is friendly with a smile on their face.A special mention and Thank You to Angela at the front desk who insured that our 3 rooms were ready for an earlier check in. We also have to Thank You for the great suggestion to try The Brooklyn Diner (just around the corner on 57th) for a fantastic 80th Birthday lunch. Special mention and thanks go out to Josie Miguel at the Concierge Desk. Your recommendations were spot on! We all adored Azalea for dinner - it was absolutely delicious! Thank you for helping to make the reservation and for getting our part of 6 in at the last minute like you did!Also a shout out to John in the lobby lounge - it was so great to meet you and chat with you. When in NYC this is our families hotel of choice, it truly is a special place - thanks again Park Central Hotel!

Upon arrival we had the pleasure of meeting Emanuel. Not even in the hotel yet and his service was as if he knew us forever. He just knew what we wanted to do outlet first time in the city and we had a blast. Emanuel needs a raise!!!

The loc of the hotel is amazing. 3min walking toCentral park. Our room was good but there was no refrigerator. We didnot need and asked for it though.Elizabeth from the guest relations was so helpful, she was so passionate with her work. She helped us alot. I want to personally thank her as well.

This hotel is very nice! The bed is huge and has the most comfortable bedding. Very nice and helpful staff. Very spacious rooms and bathroom. Awesome location! We had a very good experience staying at this hotel. You get a lot for your money here.Would definitely come again!

This "independent" modernist style hotel has a great location and is well priced. Minutes from Carnegie Hall and a few blocks from Central Park and Rockefeller Center. Although there is no restaurant there is an abundance of dining choices minutes from the hotel. There is a central bar that had some great affordable beers and wines on offer. In addition, there is a small cafe which serves up Nespresso (yay!) and pastry snacks plus empanadas and pizza. The staff was super friendly and attentive to needs. The room I had was a well priced non-smoking King. It was large and the bed was comfortable. Well stocked bathroom. Sadly my room had a brick wall view. I was there for business so it didn't bother me at all. The property and rooms are clean and professionally maintained. I found this hotel to be great value in a very expensive city. It did charge a "resort fee" which is a model used in Las Vegas and other resort areas. It gave me access to the fitness center, free WiFi. and 10% off the bar. I am not a big lover of Resort Fees in non-resort destinations. However, I would definitely return.

Great spot for anyone who loves the city, Central Park, Times Square, and the broadway scene. We met some of the staff and they were purely delightful! Chantal Lewis and Monique Brown in the housekeeping department are the bomb. They take great care of their guests and take a personal interest in them. Ask for the floors where they are!

I can’t say enough about how wonderful we were treated at this hotel from the moment we entered. We were greeted by a professional and friendly agent named Vito! He took care of us and explained everything about our stay and even went above and beyond to answer all our questions! We loved the hotel, the room was beautiful and enjoyed a few days away as a couple! We will definitely stay there again!

Staying at Park Central New York for a week in March was my first time. I was a bit skeptical because I normally stay at another hotel when I’m in Manhattan but work booked my hotel for me to maximum my time. PCNY was close to the NY office.I spent most of my time away from the room, but when I WAS there, the 10th floor housekeeper was amazing. Her name’s Marisa (Marissa). She was, by far, the best part of both my/my co-worker’s stay. She cleaned thoroughly, tediously efficient, & had great conversation while I worked from my laptop.People like her & Quimby are the pinnacle of customer service. I’d definitely stay again. And the “cherry on top” was Quincy Hightower. I was actually waiting to speak w/Don Fraser (about Marisa) but he was brow deep in hotel affairs. Quimby, too, was awesome. I informed him of my experience & he told me that Marisa is, indeed, a true asset to the PCNY brand. She’s been with the hotel for decades. But little did Quimby realize, during our talk, that he, too, is an asset to the PCNY brand, as well.I greatly appreciate the first time experience. It was phenomenal. Have a blessed day, PCNY! Until next time...

First time staying at the hotel and picked it based on location. Entering the hotel, service was great, from the bell hops to concierge, who really helped out out booking our tours and shows. The lobby area is really nice and their are tons of options for food around the hotel. We were only 5 blocks from Time Square which was really nice. Based on what we spend per night including what they charge to park the car each night, I did expect a little more. The hotel room was small, which I guess is typical of NY, we had 2 double beds in the room and not much more room than that. The beds were not comfortable at all and the room was very loud because you could hear everything from outside the window, you could hear all the construction, the car noise, the traffic, everything. Check out was a breeze, but no one really asked how my stay was. They had to bring the car from the parking garage and they told me 15 minutes but I felt more like 30. If your looking for location then a great place to stay

They have a sign that says “your experience starts here”, and it certainly does, with a passive aggressive, frustrated-with-his-job disheveled and unkempt check-in clerk named Vito. He starts with a “hello” to which I reply softly as I was searching my bag for my papers. He - under his breath because that’s the kind of passive aggressive guy he is - replies “noooo answer....”. Maybe because I work in the five star hospitality industry this makes me laugh at how unthinkable it would be if one of the people I work with answer a client like this, but I can’t help but be baffled. I then tell him, “I said hello to you” and he goes “well then maybe I didn’t hear you”. To the managers at this hotel: I don’t know if you pay your staff too little or there is not enough training but this is NOT the place for your staff to get their frustrations out. I wish I had it on camera it was such a poor display of professionalism and hospitality. This guy needs to be working in an all together different industry if a presumed “missed hello” sets him off like this. Hotel room was pretty dated. No mini bar. No front desk or concierge after 6:30pm. Bathroom a disgrace. Pretty disgusting. I really couldn’t wait to check out I’m going to be honest. No restaurant for breakfast, only a grab and go bar. Would never stay in again. Comparable to a crappy airport hotel.

I booked this trip last year to celebrate a big birthday. Imagine my surprise when we were shown to our room only to find almost the whole hotel covered in scaffolding, completely spoiling our view. The lovely Darren M moved us to another room higher up but still covered in scaffolding. He did give us champagne and choccies. The hotel was beautiful and clean but why did they not inform their guests of the scaffolding issue? This almost ruined my trip.

This was our second stay at the hotel. The location is Great and is one of the reasons we chose to stay here a second time. The lobby is lovely although there is a strong fragrance always present that I found unpleasant. The front desk representatives are always very pleasant and helpful. The option to have your bags stored until your room is ready so you can venture out is really nice. The rooms are very comfortable. We were on the fourth floor both times facing the street and I would suggest a sheer curtain to cover the window so guests have the option of leaving the shade up and still have some privacy from the office building directly across the street. The beds are super comfy. We like the large television screen. The bathroom had some sort of stain on the walls but it wasn't terrible. We would recommend this hotel and would stay again. It's a bit on the expensive side but the location probably justifies the price in New York City,

My husband and I just returned home after 10 nights at the Park Central Hotel. The beds were super comfortable and the rooms were modern and clean. The staff were professional and friendly. The drinks at the bar are a bit pricey, but no more so than any other hotel bar in the area, and the bartenders were fun to chat with over cocktails. It was a fantastic stay overall, in particular, the location can't be beat. It's really in a prime location, with the park a few blocks in one direction, Times Square several blocks in the other direction, and some REALLY fun bars and restaurants right around the corner. The ONLY thing that I found inconvenient (and it really isn't the fault of the hotel) is that while we were staying there, there was some sort of musical competition at Carnegie Hall, and the lobby was always JAM PACKED with hundreds of kids and their parents. They were gone for our last few days, and that was a very refreshing change! That being said, I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, and it will definitely on my list of hotels to price check when I plan our next trip.

Stayed here for the 2nd time, I think it’s a great hotel in a great location. I wanted to walk to Central Park, literally a few minutes and I was there. Times Square is right there as well. Very clean, very friendly and accommodating staff, my room was ready early, by a few hours. Rooms are modern, bed and pillows very comfortable. Bathrooms are a good size as well. I honestly have no complains about either one of my stays at Park Central, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who asks.

This hotel was in a great location, easy walking distance to lots of popular tourist sites and very near the subway on 57th street. Unlike previous reviews we found the beds very comfortable.However the room was quite dark, we were on a lower floor facing the central ‘courtyard’ and was difficult to cool down - was ok when we eventually managed to open the window but the air conditioning was pants!But this wouldn’t put me off staying there again

I stayed with my family for three nights. The shower curtain was dirty and smelly. I had to ask them to remove it (they did and they were quick). The carpet is old and very dirty. Especially around the corners and under the tables. It feels as though the cleaning crew are not efficient and there is no supervision. The beds are not comfortable at all and the ventilation system is very loud. Beyond that, the parking is very expensive ($75 per night) and the amenities in the room are non existent. The water pressure in the shower is on the very low end. If you like showers with strong water pressure then you would be very disappointed. On a positive note, the location of the hotel is great but all in all, the room and the overall experience was quite negative. I will never recommend this hotel to anyone.

It’s about 10 mins walk up from time square. Very touristy area. 5 mins to Central Park. Get the breakfast offer when booking if you can- $1 per person gets you a drink a pastry and a fruit each morning, great offer considering the cost of eating out in Manhattan. Very nice hotel, room had two queen size beds and was more spacious than I was expecting, I’d heard that NY hotel rooms were small. Special mention to staff member Orlando. He found my daughters precious teddy bear. He had already searched the laundry room and he eventually found it by taking the draws in the room apart and found it. If he hadn’t gently insisted on coming in to search the room we’d never have found it. So greatful, thank you Orlando. You’re a gentleman.

This hotel is in a great location but the problem is that the a/c only works when the outside temperature reaches a certain point. Our room was hot & humid. We were told by the staff to “open our window” and they offered to bring us a fan. For the amount of money we paid for our room, I would expect to have good temperature control in our room. We couldn’t sleep well in that warm room. While it is a nice hotel in a good location and the staff are very nice, I will not stay at again for my next visit.

This is hotel is beautiful and is hotel in nice area . I like this one hotel campus . I Know this hotel in food provide services is very fast and testy food . Like a Indian food, south Indian ,veg or non veg. Thank you .Read and like

This was my first time booking a hotel in New York City and I am glad I booked here. Carolyn made my check in a quick, easy, and gracious experience. The hotel is well kept and beautiful. I’ll be back!

Great stay. Staff was nice. I stayed for 1 night. My room was ready one hour earlier than it was scheduled for. The room was a nice size for a single. Ice machine was located close to my room so I didn’t have to walk

Nice hotel. Historic building. Good location. A/C doesn’t work. Staff brought a fan to the room. I was told the building’s a/c doesn’t come on until the outside air gets to a certain temp. Trouble is our room was hot and humid. Tried opening windows which didn’t cool down room. I wouldn’t choose a hotel for my family to stay at for four days with no a/c. Wish I had known.

Facilities are fantastic, perfect location for all the sightseeing tours etc. However, the staff are second to none. John Cavanagh looked after us when in the bar and was the perfect gentleman. Quemby!!!!!! Wow this guy epitomises service!! The only regret is that i cant take him home in my suitcase. The perfect engagement to my fiance in the perfect hotel. 11/10. John and Quemby thank you for making our stay the best experience we have had. We love NY!! X

We stayed at the Park Central Hotel in March and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is perfectly located, rooms were clean and the service excellent! Alicia Nunez helped us out and set the tone for a pleasant hotel stay. She was knowledgeable, personable and professional. Highly recommended

Stayed at Park Central Hotel for three nights in April 2019. The location was perfect for us - about 3 blocks south of Central Park and 6 blocks or so north of Times Square. There was an initial mix-up with the room. I had reserved/paid for a corner room with 2 queen beds. Initially they put us in a handicapped room with a King bed and a pullout couch (and tried to convince us that this was just as good as two queens). This was remedied fairly quickly when I said I wanted the room that I had reserved. The beds were really comfortable and the bathroom was clean, but there was an odd smell in the room (like old socks) and the bathroom definitely smelled like mildew. The rooms were quiet, and overall we were satisfied. I have seen the reviews about "surprise charges," but that wasn't our experience. I was advised at the time of the reservation, and by email on two different occasions thereafter (and before our arrival) about the "facility fees." I can't complain because I knew about them in advance, but they were annoying nonetheless. Complaints in prior reviews about the staff's attitude were pretty accurate. The gentleman that helped correct the room mix-up was helpful - but everyone else seemed annoyed to be working. In any event, average hotel all around in a really convenient location.

I traveled Dec 2016 but I am sure the same applies for now. Excellent location! Walking distance to times square, rockerfeller center, central park, and so much more! Clean rooms, would definitely recommend!

Beds were so comfortable and clean, perfect location with fair pricing. My friend and I were in a time crunch to check out, so they gave us an hour extension no problem. I highly recommend this place!

The hotel location is great. The staff were very helpful especially the concierge. I'm sure that's why all the tour groups use this hotel. Getting an elevator was a challenge with all the groups staying there. The room needed more light and the bathroom was only usable with the door shut. It has been renovated but looks worn. Expect no frills. The biggest disappointment was the $281 "facility fee" attached to our bill. We never used their gym, bike rental or phones but got charged $36 a day anyway. We had prepaid the hotel on Travelocity and this was a large expense we hadn't planned on. I'm told they are one of the few hotels who assess this fee. My emails asking about the fee went unanswered and I feel the hotel should have informed us when we prepaid that this would be added on to our bill.

I stayed for a couple of days in the hotel. I was positively surprised by the outstanding level of service provided by the hotel manager Elizabeth. She went out of her way to solve a problem with my booking and managed to turn a situation that could be displeasing. i left completely satisfied thanks to her. I had stayed at the hotel more than 5 times before on business trips, but this time i thought Elizabeth really deserved a good review

The room was comfortable, staff accommodating, and response to our needs prompt..My request for a mini refrigerator was met. Upon arrival no coffee makers were available, but the next day one was delivered to our room.

I booked this hotel given its central locality as well as the room description published on the agent’s site. My fiancé trusted my choice as the experience of us staying at the first hotel near Wall Street prior to this was a fantastic one. Looking forward to Park Central Hotel, it didn’t last any longer when we were ‘welcomed’ by a ‘not very welcomed’ face of a front desk lady. Throughout the whole checking process, there’s no smile on her face at all, neither did she look at us while checking us in. She’s simply hostile! When we were in the room, to our surprise, there’s no bottled water provided, no minibar and also no slippers. We were told there’s a water dispenser in the gym, however, it’s not working when we tried to get some hot water! Moreover, the bathroom was extremely small and we didn’t feel that the room was clean. Anyway, we didn’t enjoy the stay as we felt all the basics were not in place in this so called 4-star rated hotel. If we ever go back to NYC again, I’m sorry that it will not be the hotel in our list, according to my fiancé.

The location was great the room was huge compared to other rooms I’ve stayed in NY. There was no view and the bathroom had like mildew smell I think it was the shower curtain. I did love the big TV in the room and light up room in the bathroom.

I just arrived at the Park Central Hotel in NY and was greeted by the very friendly and knowledgeable Carolyn. I got here three hours prior to check in, but Carolyn had a room ready for me, which was great since I had been travelling since 5:00 am and I was exhausted. I have stayed at this property many times before and the staff is always awesome, including John the bartender; this is why the title of my review is "Great Service As Usual".

Our hotel was amazing ! The staff was very nice and helpful , and it was in walking distance from a lot of great food and sites. Would definitely come back ! Thank you . P.s Carolyn is great and made our check out process a breeze !

This was my second stay within a 2-year period. The hotel is very conveniently located across the street from Carnegie Hall, just south of Columbus Circle and Central Park South, and about 10 blocks north of Times Square. The hotel (as are numerous hotels in the City) has undergone considerable renovations, and on both of my stays I’ve had a nicely renovated and well-appointed room. The staff at the hotel has been excellent, and I especially want to acknowledge the expert assistance from front desk personnel Nancy and Darren, and the cheerful housekeeper named Kim. I also wanted to give an honorable mention to another housekeeper who turned in a set of Lincoln Center tickets that I had mistakenly left behind during a room change (complimentary upgrade)! What an unexpected relief it was to get those tickets back in time! This would be a 5-star rating but for the often poor elevator service. The hotel is host to many tour groups and large choruses visiting Carnegie Hall, and the elevators can get very backed up. One additional tip, get the $1.00/day breakfast option if it’s offered. For a buck you can get a beverage (excellent coffee), a piece of fruit and a pastry!

Our first time in NYC and it was a pleasure dealing with Emanuel at the front desk. His attention was as if we were family staying in his home. He directed us to the best places to visit snd eat and everything was memorable. Thank you Emanuel!

Me and my girlfriend took a one week vacation to NYC from San Jose California and believe me when I say this I was very skeptical of staying at Park Central Hotel based on reviews on yelp but after staying there and my experience I am glad we choose to stay there. First of the location is a few blocks from Times Square and Central Park and the Subway entrance is literally 20-30 feet from the front door. Upon arrival we were able to checkin fairly quick ( less then 5 mins ) My room was upgraded one level up and we took our luggage upstairs. The room was king size bed. Very neat and contemporary style. Loved it!! The bathroom was a bit small but that kinda given when it comes to majority of NYC hotels. After staying there for a couple of nights we wanted to change the room because we were facing the 56th St with a office building across from us, I went down to get some bandaids from the front desk coz my girlfriend new shoes gave her blisters (Walking about 20,000 steps) I see a guy by the name Darren at the front desk, after getting the bandaids I brought up my request to him thinking he probably will tell me that he can't do anything blah blah and to my surprise he turned out to be manager and an awesome dude. Very professional yet very helpful. He said he can't guarantee anything but he did make all the necessary notes and suggested that I call the front desk in the AM. Which I precisely did that and than I was transferred to Guest Services, at this point I find myself speaking to another gentleman by the Quimby T. who's in charge of BRAND INTEGRATION AND GUEST EXPERIENCE ( BTW I grabbed his business card don't know what all that really means lol) He was very polite, professional and helpful as well. I was still skeptical until the point he said, I see all the notes made by the manager Darren. He said no worries. we want you to have a pleasant stay and put a room from us with a King size bed for tomorrow ( couldn't do anything for that day because all King Size bedrooms were booked ) on the 16th floor with partial views of Times Square. I was so impressed with the genuine urge to help a guest staying at their hotel. Also when I walked into my new room I can't help to notice a bottle of Champagne and couple of champagne glasses and some chocolate. They really didn't need to do that but the fact that went out of their way specially Quimby to make our stay even more pleasant I can't be appreciative enough. Bottom line is the location is just one of the best traits of staying at this hotel but they have truly exceeded my expectations and I would definitely stay here on my next visit to NYC and recommend this hotel if any of you ever stay in NYC because I for sure am. Again thank you Darren and Quimby for all the help and professionalism. Also LOVE the gym.. Worked out everyday

We were taking a cruise out of New York and decided to arrive a day early to see some of the sites of the city. We chose Park Central due to its proximity to the cruise terminal. This hotel did not disappoint . Excellent hotel for a stay in Manhattan. Centrally located within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park and many restaurants.Reception staff were friendly. We met Alicia Nunez who was kind and gracious and offered us tips and advice on things to see and do. She ensured that all was satisfactory.Our rooms were spacious, clean and beds very comfortable.We would certainly stay here again.

This hotel is a fab choice if it's your first time in New York. It was our virgin visit to the city and it's perfectly located for the main attractions and subway - so easy to get around. Lovely clean, comfy, large room with nice bathroom and good Wi-Fi. Door staff were always friendly and smiley which was nice! If I had one gripe it's that we were hit with a bill when we left for 'facilities' or something - none of which we'd used. I feel that could have been more transparent at the time of booking (we used booking.com).

Let’s start with the positives. The hotel has the name and the location and that is where it stops...Staff in general was very rude and unhelpful apart from the ladies cleaning the room and the gentleman at the concierge. All other staff was extremely rude. I am not sure how this hotel got the rating it has. We were so impressed with the 4/4.5 star hotels in Vegas,LA and SF but NYC was totally on a different scale. The room was not clean. The shower specifically was dirty with the dirt falling from the grout while showering. The size of the shower head does not fit the small shower. You can only stand on one spot. Very uncomfortable.When I booked the room I asked for a view of time square but got a brick wall in return.The walls ARE very thin and the people in the room next to us was singing and talking and swearing at three and four in the morning and it sounded like they were standing in our room. Very expensive for what it is. There is no restaurant in the hotel for breakfast...the best place for that is the diner across the street.

Years ago I spent a single night here when in NYC to see a play. When my son and I booked a 5-night Spring Break trip this year, I opted to return to the Park Central, and was not disappointed. I spent a little extra for a corner room, giving us nice views of 7th Avenue out two windows and up the Avenue toward Central Park (about 3 blocks away only) from another window. When you step out of the hotel--and had we had a room on the other side--you can see clear down to Times Square. The location cannot be beat. Our room was the largest hotel room I have ever had in NYC with 2 queen beds and a nice bathroom. Some work is being done on the building right now so the two sets of windows looking over 7th Ave. had scaffolding in front of them but that was not too bad. The hotel does not have a restaurant, though it has a shop selling snacks and sandwiches and beverages, etc. It also has a full bar which is nice in the evenings and with generous cocktail pours at reasonable prices. Being on 7th Ave, it is easy to find breakfast or lunch spots within a block or two in any direction and the requisite Starbucks is right next door. The hotel was clean, staff was friendly, and our room was very quiet for good sleeping every night.

Park Central is in a good location walkable to many popular venues. Is directly across from Carnegie Hall. The hotel does not have any food service, except for a small take out kiosk. There is a large lounge that is not exciting, but pleasant. The room was clean and very quiet. Not all the washcloths provided were clean and on check out we were surprised with higher rate for our second night stay due to "high occupancy". With so many choices, we will not return to this hotel.

We have been staying for 19 years at Park Central Hotel and we hosted here all the artists of Flamenco Festival. Always great service, Alicia Nuñez and her team really takes care that evwrything is perfect and that we have the best experience at the hotel.Highly recomended

Lovely hotel. Excellent service. Tastefully appointed. Quiet rooms. Beautiful washroom with a wonderful shower and water pressure. Loved it all. Near Central Park, near Carnegie Hall, near subway stop, short walk to Times Square (10-15 min). Lots of restaurants and convenience stores nearby.

Loved my stay. Great location steps from the subway. The park is 2 blocks north, and Times Square was jus a few blocks south. There’s a great breakfast / dessert place around the corner too. The room is well laid out, beds comfy, and the bathrooms roomy and well appointed. But what makes this place is the staff...like Gloria who’s been a housekeeper there for 30+ years, and Benny who helped return my grandsons lost phone to me!

This would have been my 3rd visit to PC and westhouse and as always it was a pleasant stay!Had drinks at the bar which was such a good experience. The bar man made us two off the menu cocktails which were delicious! Special mention to Elisabeth & Quimby who sorted us out with a later check out when we expressed how late our flight was.The only thing that seems to be a recurring issue here is the communication between reception and housekeeping. It was great to have been given a late check out however I was probably disturbed by housekeeping - even with the DND sign on the door - at least 5 times asking me what time I’m checking out. The first one was at 8am!!I work In the hotel industry and I would have thought it is common and best practice around the world that you do not start cleaning occupied rooms at 7:30/8am let alone have Hsk asking guests what time they’re checking out. That conversation should be had with reception and not the guest.In any case I’ll be back, however I thought some constructive feedback to management was due.

I stayed at the hotel last week and Quimby really helped me out. It was a great location, beautiful hotel and wonderful room! I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The quick grab and go is perfect when getting something light on the way out to enjoy the city.

The Park Central is my "Go To Hotel All The Time" when planning a stay in NYC.I've stayed at other hotels but this particular hotel I most enjoy and will only stay here now ! (its been 3 years) Why? The accommodations? Location? Bedding? Cleanliness? Yes, all those are very important to me but what I most treasure is how i'm treated during my stay. The staff here in NYC is by far the Best! No matter when I visit the first man I see when pulling up is Carmello with his smiling face followed by a hug and a warm greeting. (the staff here speaks highly of him to). My car is always parked with care! What a wonderful happy man. Then I see Melania at the front desk. We always laugh for a bit and the happiness she exudes while checking me in is contagious! She is a pure Joy as well! And of course you have Quimby : Guest Relations Executive. I had a problem one time with my car key missing from my key fob when I got home and I had to communicate from home with him to have my key returned. He was just like everyone else...so joyful, happy and accommodating as well. I got my key in 2 days! I usually grab a coffee before going up to my room. Carolyn works at the Coffee Market in the hotel. We always talk, laugh and share a little to. She makes me feel right at home. Each time I pass her she asks if i'm having fun in the City and a good day! Such a wonderful woman. And lastly? Betty. She's in Housekeeping. What another Joyful person to converse with. She is a wonderful listener, happy and inspirational to me as well. What more can I say? I don't mind what the rooms cost, ever! When you come in contact with such joyful people like I do here, WHY would I want to stay anywhere else? All I have to say is Thank You ALL for being who you are!

The company I work for has several of its employees staying here at different times. Today one of my coworkers landed in NY from California after flying on the red eye and his room was not ready as check in is at 4pm. I have established a relationship with Quimby since I often have to put down the company credit card that is in my name to extend or for reservations. My co worker and I went to see if there was anyway he could check in early as we have so many rooms with Park Central. Quimby he works at Cuatomer Relations was most understanding and accommodating. Thank you for having such a wonderful employee who understands what customer relations is all about!! I would recommend staying at Park Central Hotel as it’s clean, comfortable and well priced. Most important is location and Quimby!!!

First time in NYC with my wife and we absolutely enjoyed it. Emanuel at the front desk checked us out and recommended us our last minute tour of the day. The system Isla d ferry ride to catch a glimpse of the Statue of Liberty went well with the beautiful weather.

When I first arrived at the hotel I honestly that it was absolutely gorgeous, even our room was incredible... until we found a cockroach in our room. I was absolutely disgusted, and after speaking to front desk got moved to another room which was great. However my issue is that I’m not too pleased about the level of customer service provided. I think the hotel staff hide behind the exterior of “I work at this fancy hotel and you should appreciate being able to stay here” type of attitude. On the night of being moved to another room we had spoken to one of the managers at front desk, I believe his name is Darren and I told him that I was not happy about the cockroach, especially because I’d found it in the bathroom I felt that I couldn’t use any of my toiletries and replaced my toothbrush amongst other things. I explained to him that I felt it fair to have our room fees waived for the duration of our stay. He agreed almost instantly, told us it would be absolutely no problem and to me that was the end of that. Fast forward to the next morning, and I have an email from another manager summarising the events of the night before. The only difference is this new manager claimed that Darren only offered to waive room fees for 2 nights and not the remainder of our stay. When I replied to correct him he disagreed and stated that this was not the case. Even after going down to speak to him at the lobby it was as if he was explaining the conversation I had with Darren as if I had not been there. I even explained that as a business focused on customer services and hospitality they should honour the agreement originally made. However instead we had a manager speak to us in nothing but jargon and try to find a way to okay finding a cockroach in our room. I have to say I’m not happy with this. Especially as I felt that I was made out to look like a liar. What shocked me the most is how kind and helpful Darren was when I had spoken to him, only for him to tell the AM manager a completely different story. Aesthetically the hotel is gorgeous, however their customer service, and ability to keep to their word has a lot of improvement to be made.

Upon arrival, we encountered a nasty front desk person that would not honor the advertised 3pm check in. When I went back and showed her the 3pm on our confirmation, she dismissed me by taking me to another desk where someone else had to help us. Upon doing this, he too initially challenged the 3pm check in time only to make us wait in the lobby while they rushed to get a room together that was not the one I paid extra for. This was a birthday weekend and the hotel didn’t make it enjoyable. Will not stay here or recommend again.

Our room was a double and looked internally in to the hotel. We were told it was quieter and would be better for our longer stay (8 nights). Not sure it the reason was true, but it was quiet, away from any stair wells and lifts and though our view was uninspiring (just looking in to a 'well' of other bedroom windows) we were not in the hotel much at all. So quiet...suited us very well. When there we just wanted to rest and sleep. Room was very comfortable and perfect for our need. The breakfast is from a small shop in the foyer if you choose. You can prepay for breakfast and collect from here but we did not include breakfast in our reservation and were glad. We were able to catch breakfast on the fly, depending where we were going and what we fancied. The shop had a good variety but when buying adhoc, it was expensive. So buying a croissant and tea outside the hotel from a little cafe was much cheaper than the shop in the foyer. I think they had the most expensive banana's anywhere!Hotel was great for us, we slept very well and the couple of occasions we used the hotel bar it was pleasant. Though we did encounter a waitress, who seemed to think an apathetic attitude still justified a 20% service tip.....having ignored us for over half an hour and not just once, I disagreed and she was not happy, but it did not taint our stay. I would recommend this hotel as it is in a great location and ultimately well run and comfortable.

This is my first time in New York City and I would like to comment I had a small issue with my room when I checked in, but Elizabeth from guest relations helped me to solve it immediately, but I also want to mention that she was very kind and friendly in helping me with my situation. I definitely give a "10" in customer service!. Without hesitation I would stay at Park Central Hotel again.Thank you for an excellent service!

This hotel has the best customer service of any hotel I've ever stayed in. Every person from Quimby, the amazing manager, down to bell hops and the cleaning staff were polite and interested in making sure the stay was awesome! Also, the hotel bar has an awesome Irishman named John who makes one heck of a sazerac and dry, dirty martinis. They have live jazz in the bar as well. There are many tables to enjoy a quick bite you've brought in, or have a quick business meeting. My travel agent found this hotel and I couldn't have been happier. I took my choir here and I had 43 people in my party, they had a rooming list and keys all set to hand me when I arrived. The showers are awesome and the beds are comfy.

Used to stay here all the time with my family, now is the first time after the renovation and the hotel looks amazing! Front desk guys all very kind, specially Carolyn, they really make you feel welcome. Happy to be here again and glad to get an early check in after a long flight :)

Elizabeth, the hotel manager, was extremely gracious and accommodating. She was very helpful with our checkout and made sure everything went smoothly. The hotel is a great choice with its proximity to Central Park, Times Square, and Carnegie Hall. We stayed here multiple times and plan to come back again,

My husband and I just spent 11 days staying at Park Lane .Very freindly and helpful staff.we stayed on the 38th floor in a Jnr suite looking over Central Park,amazing.Only downfall of this motel no coffee or tea facilities in your room,had to go down stairs every morning to buy a morning coffee.Great position to walk everywhere,.Timothy our doorman was fantastic nothing a problem went above and beyond to help us.Also Betty in the dinning lounge was another who was a lovely smiley face .

Stayed here on a company visit and loved it! I paid for an extra night so I could explore and Elsa made sure the transaction went smoothly and that I was in the same room for my next day. Nice staff and great location!

Quimby was very accommodating, he made sure our group got rooms next to each other. He’s very friendly and a real sweetheart! The room is wonderful and has everything we need. I’m sure our stay will be wonderful!

The manager Quimby went out of his way to accomadate our needs. We were celebrating a dear friends 50th bday and he made sure that our rooms were near each other. Sincerely,A school teacher from Brooklyn

Everyone was friendly and helpful. Quimby helped us a lot and was super understanding/flexible when we had to suddenly change our plans. Rooms are spacious for NYC. Great location. Will definitely be back.

Centre hotel is superb. The infrastructures are correct and fully meet our expectations we are delighted. The rooms are clean and the blue is relatively quiet. We recommend this perfect hotel to visit New York.

The rooms are clean the staff is amazing . Quimby goes above and beyond . This is my 9th night here in March and i wouldn’t go anywhere else . Best bang for your buck in all of New York City and amazing location !

On this visit I stayed on the 4th floor. I took a room with two beds because they said I would have a better view and could check in earlier than 4pm- I took it. there were tons of kids the lobby. I asked what was happening and the lady said it was the season for kids groups. The not so great part of this visit was the amount of people and the constant waiting for the elevator. Every inch of the hotel was crowded! On my second night I complained to the desk and they seemed a bit overwhelmed and sent me to the managers desk. There was a well dressed gentleman there and he listened to my complaint and saw that I had been here before. He assured me that the students had adults with them and asked if he could provide me with ear plugs to help drown out the noise. He said that he would make sure that the parents were notified of my complaint and he would have his security people monitor the hallway. He said he’d be there again the next morning and he actually called my room to check on me!All in all you can’t beat the location and the people working here seem to really care. I’ll be back and hopefully no kids group!

Lovely hotel with bigger rooms than many NYC hotels. The location was great and the staff very friendly. I liked the bar area where you could sit and chill during the day if you were waiting for someone.

My daughter and I had a very enjoyable stay! Spacious room, good location in mid-town, and we felt welcome by the 10th floor cleaning lady, Maritza. She got to know us right away. When my daughter wasn’t feeling well, she directed us to a nearby soup place and gave suggestions for remedies. Maritza made us feel right at home.

This was my second stay in a year or so, so I knew several secrets about the room facility. You need to ask them a coffee maker or a medical refrigerator on your own.Depends on the direction your room facing with, it is generally noisy because its NY.Large drawers are very useful as well as the closet. The bed was king size and bit too soft.No cafeteria or restaurant for breakfast, but there’s a Starbax at the corner just next to the hotel and many cafes and restaurants around, so you don’t have to worry.Bathtub was available but no hand shower and not strong enough.

Our experience was out of this world, thanks to the kindness and warmth displayed by Shdresa. She treated us with the utmost respect and assisted us with all our questions regarding tourist information and overall city recommendations. She connected with us, specifically because this was a father-daughter trip for us! She was sweet, kind, hospitable, and informative! Outside of the awesomeness that was Shdresa, the hotel is in a great location with lots to see and amazing places to eat! Love!

We stayed here for a week. The stay was great. Carolyn was great to work with. She made checking in/out very easy and was very friendly asking us about our stay and making sure we were well taken care of

One of the best hotels I’ve stayed in! Most friendly and helpful receptionist ever, so lovely and great first impression of hotel. The front desk staff were just lovely and the food was amazing I was very pleased with my stay, and although short and sweet this time, I hope to be back for a longer visit in the future!!! I would recommend this hotel to family and friends! Comfy rooms and great people. Over all one of the best trips!!!! Darren was very helpful when we were checking in. Mrs.Carolyn made the checkout process very easy. Hoping to come back in the summer!

Stayed here with one of my best friends, our first time in NYC. The our experience was amazing from the moment we walked in and checked in with Elsa and Anna. They were so fun, rememberable and helpful. Our experience only got better when we met Q. These people are without a doubt the main reason we will only stay at this hotel in the future. Thank you guys!Angel and Amanda :)

Despite the AC not working for one night all went well when we addressed it with Emanuel. He made sure that we were compensated for the inconvenience. We look foward to coming back and staying again in the future.

Stayed for one night to enjoy an evening out with my boyfriend. Read reviews ahead of time and sure enough we looked for the most talked about person on trip advisor Emanuel. He lead us on an adventure with his advice. This was my boyfriends first night sleeping in a hotel with no worries. The beds and pillows were so comfortable.

Came down for the weekend with my husband to enjoy the city for his birthday. Enjoyed it every single bit. Emanuel provided us with the hippest place to celebrate. Vandal lounge in Manhattan was excellent. See Emanuel for any advice around the town.

Excellent 4 night stay. Enjoyed every bit of it. Came here from Scotland expecting it to be like the movies. Fortunately we came across Emanuel at the desk and he proved otherwise. Looking forward to our return next year.

My family always stays at the Park Central. We love it there. We love to walk the city, so to find a hotel that centrally located and so reasonably priced is a big reason why we keep coming back. We started coming to the hotel before it’s renovations and every time we come back there are always amazing upgrades. The moment you walk into the hotel there is this incredible aroma in the air that helps you to transform from the busy streets of NYC into a spa like environment. The people at the front desk greet you like you live there, as park central also has a section of permanent residents, similar to other well known hotels like the plaza. But the gem of this place, hidden discreetly behind the front desk, is the bar and lounge area. Be it for a night cap, dinner or listening to music, the effort of service with a smile and the posh details gives you the feeling that you are their focus. I had the chance to be there many times and see several events that took place while staying with in the hotel and who ever is the event planner or lounge manager has turned an already beautiful space into an opulent experience. The rooms are larger than others I’ve been in while staying in New York for business. The beds are soft and the pillows form around you. Needless to say we will be Back. And by the way NYC at Christmas is awesome!

Two gals out for their 30th birthdays never ever coming to the city and this hotel gave us the best experience we could have ever asked for. Q was an absolute gem and so helpful. Elsa and Anna were so helpful for the check in process and made every single thing about our stay perfect! When we come back because we certainly are we will always stay at Park Central so wonderful, friendly and caring. Thank you for making us feel at home! Amanda and Angel

We stayed at the Park Central Hotel for three nights. The hotel's exterior is currently being renovated, but that didn't cause any issues with our stay. We actually never heard any work being done while we were in our room. We stayed on the 15 floor which was very quiet. Overall, we had a nice experience. The only issues we had were the limited lighting in the room, especially in the bathroom. Definitely needed to be brighter. Also, our room was extremely warm. We basically had it turned off the entire time - set the thermostat at 65, but the room was consistently registering at 75. Didn't feel that warm, but it was hard to cool it down. Bathroom was clean, but I think they could have made sure the walls around the sink were wiped down.Some positives to note were:- Very comfortable beds! - Big area with seating and tables on the first floor.- Fast check-in.- Good security. You need your room key to access the elevator.- Starbucks next door if you're into coffee or want a quick breakfast.- Easily walkable distance to Broadway shows. - R and W Subway lines only a block north.- Taxis always available.Lastly, I'd like to send a shout out to the concierge. I left my wallet in a taxi (found it later), and I was pretty upset. She was wonderful and calm. Thanks for you understanding!

This was a third time staying at Park Central Hotel. It is clean and the staff is friendly. In addition, it is conveniently located including only two blocks from Central Park. I highly recommend anyone whether traveling with or without kids to stay at Park Central Hotel.

What a great stay at this property this week. From check in to check out, all I can say is that this property has great people and clean, modern, spacious rooms. Upon check in, the hotel staff were friendly and accommodating (as I couldn't go up to my room and had to leave my bags downstairs). I needed directions to just about everywhere I went, and the hotel staff were patient. I really like the layout of the hotel, especially the lobby area. I also found the property quite good in terms of being able to move safely around the city and enjoy the experience. This was a work trip, but I plan to take my family back to the city and stay at this property. Great rate as well.

Perfect location if you’re looking to be in thick of the hustle bustle near all transportation and 100% walkability.Spacious and inviting lobby & bar area that consistently played upbeat background music that added to overall ambience.All staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms & baths were well designed, and very comfortable, with good reading lites on BOTH sides of bed!Didn’t miss the coffee maker, as there were so many great coffee, delis & bakeries just outside the door.Only complaint was incompetent elevator on our check out day. Only one appeared to be functioning.Will stay here again & again even tho we are Hilton Rewards members! So much more charm!

We selected this hotel because of its proximity to Carnegie Hall. Location is obviously the reason why this hotel is so expensive, although it was even pricier than what I’ve paid for hotels in the heart of Times Square. Exterior & lobby/bar are attractive, but the rooms are standard, small NY fare. Rooms were also lacking what I’d consider basic amenities - coffee maker & fridge(extremely frustrating, as we were in NY for an event, and often needed to eat on the fly, in our room). Rooms a bit tired (stains on carpets, walls), and didn’t feel completely clean - the bathroom, for example, felt like it could use an extensive wipe down. I found bed very hard. Wifi was complimentary, although the website indicates that it is a daily fee- this was a pleasant surprise. The coupons for free coffee/breakfast pasty at in-house breakfast area were much appreciated. Cleaning staff were very friendly. We were “upgraded” to a deluxe room (ie., 2 queen beds), but I’m pretty sure the extra bedroom space cut into our bathroom square footage - our bathroom was a similar size to a cruise ship bathroom, and much smaller than other NY bathrooms I’ve had (I was touching the walls every time I got a shower...)

I don’t like to write reviews but felt inclined to do so after receiving such exceptional service from a staff member here (Elizabeth). She worked hard to get us an early check-in since we had just gotten off of a red eye flight and she even comped two drinks for us! It was greatly appreciated! Hotel was great and clean.

We stayed at the Park Central with our 16 yearly daughter for a spring break getaway. So, we had never stayed at this hotel before, but we wanted something near Central Park. We found the hotel online, so even with pics on the website, you still never know, right? We were pleased to walk in to a beautiful lobby. Check in was fast and friendly. I wish I could remember the front desk associates name; she was so helpful and friendly! We needed two beds so we chose the Premium Corner Two Queen Room as it advertises higher floors 8th-18th, and would be an exterior room, with some kind of view. Initially during check in, we were informed that there was no guaranteed minimum 8th floor, but she would try and accommodate us. No problem as we were placed on the 11th floor, but this is a disconnect from what is advertised. The room was very nice; windows on two sides (corner room) with a decent view, bright and airy. The room wasn't wide but longer than a traditional room, with an easy chair and desk/chair, and was clean and comfortable! Just like the website photo. This hotel, located on 7th at 57th, is a couple of blocks from Central Park and a short walk to Times Square, Broadway theaters and many restaurants! When looking for hotels in Manhattan, just remember that the Avenues; 5th, 6th, 7th, Broadway, 8th, for example are very long blocks. The Streets; 59thSt, down to 42nd.,are much shorter and a quicker walk! Our friendly concierge was very helpful for restaurants and subway directions, however, be aware the concierge is only available until around 6pm, so help with dinner has to be done beforehand! Upon departure, the doormen were helpful securing a cab, and helped us with our luggage. Additionally, you can store your luggage before check in and get started having fun and leave it there after checkout before you depart! Overall, this was a very nice hotel. Really, everything we hoped it would be! Hints: Use your mobile device for reservations to get the best rate! Be aware there is an approx. $30 facility fee per day. Sign up for The Guestbook and you will get the option of getting "cash back". Our credit card was credited in just two days after our stay! Great stay!!!

This is my first stay with park central and while I was very excited after seeing the hotel lobby, I must say I’m pretty disappointed after checking into our room. The air conditioning doesn’t work and the room temperature is stuck at 74 degrees no matter how low we set the control to. The bathroom shower curtain smells terrible like it hasn’t been cleaned in years and needs to cleaned/replaced. I was really looking forward to a romantic getaway since I was planning to propose to my gf in the room, possibly with some champagne and breakfast in bed. I had even called the hotel a couple of times in advance to let them know and was assured that we would be given a good room. I have since decided to propose outside the hotel but look forward to seeing if anything is done regarding my concerns. Will update shortly

Salem and Angels were at front desk. Salem checked my daughter and me in and he was gracious, accommodating, communicative, and all with a lovely sense of humor. Both were a great team and a tremendous asset to the hotel and its guests! The hotel is very nice and clean, in a great location. I’d recommend to anyone!

We stayed at the park central in February, the hotel is in an excellent location, very clean and comfortable. The only problem was on arrival at book in I did ask the receptionist would there be any other charges, her reply was no , so on our last night we were surprised to find a bill left under our door for $200.85!!! On checkout I did ask why were we not told that there would be a further charge at the end of our stay, her reply was that this is separate thing??We were surprised at how much extra we had to pay for our stay and park central and would of budgeted better if we’d of known of this charge upon arrival .

We were few nights at the Park central hotel. We got really good service and help from Angela when we checked In, thank you. The location of the hotel is very good and our room was really clean and comfortable.

The hotel is really nice, perfect location and perfect room sizes compared with most of NY hotels. I´d recommend to build a loyalty program or guest recognition system for those who stays frequently so can be awarded with some additional consideration.Finally, want to mentioned that Quimby has been a great supporting us during our stay!

I have stayed at this hotel four times, most of them being in charged of big groups, and I only have good words for them. The location are room features are just perfect. The dedication and professionality of the staff is wonderful. I would like to thank Alicia Nuñez and Riley Allen for making us feel like home, helping us with everything we needed. I will come back for sure.

This hotel is so nice. Is so near the Central Park, time square and other nice things to do in New York.The bedroom is really good, whit amazing bed. the people make up is so good as well, all in the room is so good.My wife stayed in the weekend and she loves as well.

I stay at the Park Central about 5 times a year and it never disappoints. We have become great friends with the bartender, John Cavanaugh. He’s one of our favorite people EVER. He now stocks the beer we like in the bar. They go above and beyond to make us happy. Love love love them!!

Hotel is OK, no kettle in room or fridge which is a first, every hotel i have stayed in before offers these basics, you get told at check in you have to pay a facilties fee, approx $50 dollars per night, what this is for I had no idea as no explanation was given, it is just a scam to fleece guests out of even more money which is very poor.

My girlfriend and I were staying here for one night and the stay was okay. Don’t expect the bell boys to help you take your luggage out of the taxi or load it in. The check in was fast, as well as the check out. The hotel has a check out box near the elevators where you could place your room keys in and be on your way.The room was clean, but the water pressure in the shower could be better. The hotel is in a great location for shopping, tours, eating and clubbing.

First time in this hotel after many visits from the UK to NYC , amazing hotel with very Freind my staff Not the cheapest but a very good quality stay . Very quiet at night , great lifts and felt very safe Only slight niggle is tv selection poor and rooms slightly dark , we would stay again though Mike and Paula UK

We came back to stay at Park Central, yes, because of the great location and the clean, comfortable rooms, but mainly because of our favorite cocktail waitress, Nancy. During our last visit, Nancy gave us great recommendations for restaurants and things to do. And she was just so kind and attentive that she made our whole experience better. That kind of service is rare these days so the question of where to stay on this trip was a no-brainer. Nancy’s dedication to her clientele has not wavered in the slightest, and she has continued to provide us with top-notch service on this trip. Every hotel should be so lucky as to have a Nancy to take care of their customers! Thanks, Nancy and thanks Park Central!
Don't waste your time or money staying hereWent for a special birthday only to be told we had been booked for the previous year and would have to pay again, really horrible receptionist no help given

Well located, clean and affordable. What more could you want? Service - that's good as well. Easy check in and close to the theater district and museums. No full service restaurant but being located in Manhattan, you are surrounded by great restaurants. I will definitely be back.

Stayed at this hotel from March 7-12 and it was great. The location is fantastic, being a short walk from Central Park, Times Square and two subway stops, not to mention being basically across the street from Carnegie Hall. The lobby and bar are lovely to look at, and the beds in our room were extremely comfortable. However, even if all that weren't the case I would still give this hotel an Excellent based on the interaction I had with one employee alone. Her name is Carolyn and she checked us in. After travelling for over 12 hours my friend and I were exhausted and Carolyn was the perfect person for us to encounter. Not only was she funny, personable, and charming, but she also went above and beyond for us and moved our room to a higher floor, found a room we could check in to right away as opposed to waiting hours until the official check in time, and even gave us two free drink tickets for the bar. On top of that, over the course of the next few days when she'd see us in the lobby on our way in or out of the hotel she'd make a point to chat and laugh with us (when she wasn't busy) and she really made it seem like we had a personal connection with the hotel. Cannot say enough good things about her!

I had to travel for business and was asked to pick a cheaper hotel than the host hotel we were exhibiting that I was not happy about it but reviews look decent on here and it was very close and walkable even in the cold weather I got there and the place was packed with what look like a big tour group from overseas hundreds of people in the lobby and baggage everywhere I thought oh no this is going to be terrible but as I was checking and I met Elizabeth and she was absolutely wonderful got me a room quick and The room was huge compared to a lot I’ve seen in the city great experience very clean very nice great service....Thank you Elizabeth

This hotel is a complete scam and will do anything to take your money. By far the worst experience I've had as a traveler. Three things: the place smells like weed, hotel staff is rude and hostile, and there's absolutely nothing in the room - yes even water. I checked into the hotel around 11:30 pm. The entire 11th floor smelled like weed. I thought the smell would get better in my room but the smell was no different. In fact, the smell of marijuana worsened throughout the night. Within 2 hours into my stay, at 2 am, I started having a really bad headache due to the smell and went to the front desk about this matter. The front desk gave me two options: clean the room or go to a different room. I requested housekeeping to clean the room because it was 2 am in the morning and I've had a long day due to flights/meetings. The housekeeper spoke to me in a very hostile and threatening manner as she entered the room. She said, "The room doesn't smell. What are you talking about? Where do you want me to spray?" Further, she sprayed the odorizer DIRECTLY on my pants as I was standing right next to it. It was an extremely unpleasant experience. I didn't expect this from a 4-Star hotel. I talked to Darren, the manager of Park Central hotel, about this incident. While he provided a waiver of the facility fees, this was NOT a 4-Star experience. The guest should NEVER feel threatened by the hotel staff and should NEVER sleep in a room clouded with marijuana smell.

close to central park, times square, carnegie hall, the subway, and cheap I love new york stores. About 20 min uber or cab ride from Laguardia airport (about $40-$50 fare). Rooms were tight but very clean.

We had the perfect bachelorette weekend thanks to the Park Central Hotel. It was centrally located to everything we planned and was super clean. Right when we walked in the front desk staff was extremely attentive and made sure we got our rooms next to each other. But, what made the experience truly magical was the Guest Services employee, Quimby Hightower. He helped us get into our rooms early so we could decorate for the bride. He also went above and beyond reserving a space for us inside the lounge area where we hosted a calligraphy and champagne gathering. He made a super cute photo for our event and framed it. It made the whole thing truly special. We cannot thank Park Central enough for everything. Truly and unforgettable experience.

Slept with this fly during my stay. Makes me believe that this room wasn't properly cleaned prior to my arrival. The lady working the front desk on Friday March 8 at approx 11:40am was quite rude as well after I was locked out of my room. There was several people waiting in line to check in and she made me wait behind all of them in order to reset my room key. I had originally left my luggage in my room to come down and get a coffee. When I went back up to get my luggage, my key didn't work. So I had to go back down to reset the key. I think it was ridiculous that she wouldn't take 15 seconds to reset the key and made me wait behind several people waiting to check in.I will not be staying here ever again.

Had an amazing experience with Nancy from the bar. She has a great attitude and makes everyone feel welcomed. She gave my coworkers and I the best recommendations for food spots around the city. Definitely will be back on my next work trip!

We didn't think it was possible to be that comfortable (at that price!) in the middle of Manhattan. NYC made easy and wonderful with a great stay smack between Central Park and Times Square, right on the subway, and surrounded by incredible restaurants. We'll be back.

We loved our 4-day stay at this hotel; in fact we plan to make it our go-to whenever we are visiting NYC. Pleasant atmosphere, comfortable rooms and a prime location. We have stayed at plenty of nice hotels in different cities; what really set this one apart was the care and attention that the housekeeping staff took in cleaning our room. Ms. Batista on the 17th floor went above and beyond the call of duty to ensure that we were well cared for and that our room was ready for us at the end of a busy day of exploring the city. We are so grateful for the excellence that she displayed. It truly made all the difference in our stay. While we give the hotel 4 stars, we’d give her 5.

Aside from the location and decent bar off the lobby, I can’t say much for the rest of the hotel experience. I have stayed here numerous times for meetings, and this hotel has gradually gone downhill over the past year(s). We (personally and our company) will not be back. Rooms extremely dated and very small, bathroom amenities feel like you are at a YMCA (shower curtain so short water leaks all over floor, hardware loose and falling off, ect). Our guests for the meeting were extremely upset at this hotel despite the meeting space being acceptable. Couple that with long lines and extended time spent waiting in the lobby just to get a key redone since it had been turned off too soon... and it was just too much. There are better options to consider.

First time here from Toronto and we absolutely loved the hotel. NYC was a blast and because of Emanuel at the front desk we would have memories that last a lifetime. We are already planning our next trip for the summertime.

Close to the Park and Times Square i like this hotel. I have chronic Lyme Disease and now have bad arthritis where it actually hurts to sleep. I stay here because these beds are great. I have stayed here many times and recommend.

We just love Nancy She treats us like one of the family. She is an asset, She knows us by name. We've be going to the Park Central for 8 or more years We love her and John also.Dont know much about other employees. We've just had such good experiences with them. we give them a 10. also add Carmelo. He is a great outside person..

The Park Central is well located south of Central Park within walking distance of Times Square.The rooms are large and well appointed.There is no breakfast available but there are a number of places to eat or get a take way nearby. There is also a place to buy food in the lobby.

Stayed here for Kids Night on Broadway. It was a great find! Just a few blocks away from most theaters made it an easy walk - even on a cold, windy night after the show. Beautiful entrance/lobby with welcoming staff. Rooms were clean and spacious for a midtown hotel. Staff was helpful with recommendations. Walls are a bit thin, so if you’re a light sleeper bring noise blockers. The beds are comfortable, you should have no trouble sleeping!Would absolutely stay here again.

We’ve stayed at this hotel multiple times. Great location. Nicely designed and appointed. Staff is responsive and professional. I will definitely return to this location. Walking distance from the theater district, Central Park and Columbus Circle.

This was my first trip to New York and really wasn't sure what to expect. The location was very convenience with multiple subways lines around the corner. 3 blocks from Central Park, 4 blocks from Times Square and tasty locations VERY close by for good eats! Beds were comfy, liked that the windows actually opened for ventilation. Not a view to speak of but no problem. Staff was helpful. The only down sides at all were the threshold between the room and the bathroom was a bit dangerous in the dark (beware!) and the toilet paper holder was broken the whole time but no big deal. John at the bar was very friendly. Always doormen ready to help with bags or get transportation for you.

I stay at this hotel about a dozen times a year since my workplace is nearby so when I need to stay in the city due to a late meeting, I book a room here. It is very clean and the beds are comfortable - though the wallpaper in the bathroom needed repair in a few of the room I stayed in. But on my last visit I have to say there was a distinct improvement in the service of the staff. The doorman helped take my bags out of my taxi and then helped to carry it to the check in desk. This has never happened in the past. Then he set my bags down on the counter of the desk and went back to the street - which again was a pleasant surprise since at this point I usually get asked if they can bring my bags up or they wait for a tip. Then when I left my room the next day, I ran into the most cheerful housekeeping attendant, Marissa, who was so very pleasant, asked me about my stay and thanks me for coming.
