This again, never happened before. And when I walked out of the hotel, the doorman wished me a good day and told me to keep warm - and thanks me for staying here. This has always been a solid hotel, but I will say the service is improving. The only thing left is to re-train the front desk staff to be more personable and cheerful. Not a word from any of them otherwise it would have been a 5 star experience.

Park Central Hotel is the best quality hotel for the price, I’ve ever found in NYC. It is centrally located a block from Columbus Circle close to Central Park and Times Square. The customer service staff is outstanding and Quimby went out of his way to help us twice! We’ve been here for a week and will come back as the rooms are spacious, great location with nice view out both windows.

This past weekend was probably my 6th stay at the Park Central. As always, it is clean, conveniently located, well-priced and the service is wonderful. For me, it feels like my home away from home in New York City. The lobby and bar area have been wonderfully upgraded the past few years and the feeling is of a happening place in the City. I was graciously afforded an early check-in after a red-eye flight from the West coast which afforded me the chance to get some much needed sleep. I will of course return in August for my next stay in NYC.

Pros: Great location, located right next to Carnegie Hall. The front desk staff was helpful and kind. The hotel's common areas, for the most part, were clean. The gym is well-equipped (minor some issues they were having with treadmills on our first day). The staff outside will ensure you get where you need to be an assist with transportation recommendations, etc. Cons: Every day we had to ask for towels or washcloths that were missing. The common areas on our floor were not clean, as they had vacuum cleaners consistently in the hallways that were not being used. There is no restaurant in the hotel (but there are plenty of places to eat within walking distance). The sheets were the loudest sheets in which I'd ever slept. We slept poorly. Overall, it was a good stay and I wouldn’t allow those few hiccups to cause me to avoid staying again.

Our two night stay was a gift from our daughters through GroupOn. Upon arrival the reservation had been cancelled with no reason given by GroupOn. Anna at the front desk took the time to get us a great room at an even better price than the original GroupOn price. The location is excellent for Central Park and Times Square. The room was spacious for New York with a very comfortable bed. Particularly enjoyed the lounge.Thanks to Anna for going the extra mile for us.

Advertisements are supposed to be reality, not in the case of this hotel. Reception staff rude, not willing to assist in anyway at all, all round lack of professionalism towards its guest. Booked a premier room at this property and the final outcome was a standard room, good start, and the continuous attitude from reception just made everything worse. Air-condition and heating system is non-existent in this property. Made a complaint about the cold and the hotel just provide me with a portable heater in the room, a heater that is from the 60s. Another complaint and again no response what so ever. "This is what we have" was the response. Again we go back to the professionalism of the property, just does not exist.Various amenities mentioned on the booking were not available in the room. Event the simplest of requirements in a floor towel in the bathroom. The various contacts with reception just pointless. Surprised that this property is still in existence and the star rating is well up for a review.Not sure it is worth discussing any other aspect of the room as it is well below the rating. Dated, in need of an update and requires a complete change in staff.Concierge, water of time. The concierge usually within the hotel chains is one of the most knowledgeable members of the team. This property offers concierges who know very little about the tourist sites and whether or not they are open or not. Was sent to an attraction, only to be informed it was closed based on the time of year and weather, is such not something a concierge should know.Give up. Will not visit this property again, simple. Would avoid as an opinion.

First off, the pictures do not depict the true hotel appearance. Very dated and the rooms are in need of major updating. Carpet was beyond filthy, rusted water dripped from the ceiling and ruined my coat. The cleaning carts and vacuum cleaners sat out in the hallways, not something I wanted to look at for sure. Our room was not cleaned the first night even after the cleaning lady saw us leave our room. We didn't get back to our room until late so we had no clean towels, etc. They did bring up towels but that was really all they could do, it being so late. At check in I had requested a coffee maker for the room. The coffee maker was not brought to the room and I had to request it at midnight. There are so many options when you visit NY, so make your choice carefully. I know this information would have helped me in making mine.

I had a problem when i checked in. I booked the wrong room type and Emanuel at the front desk eventually upgraded us at no charge. We appreciated this kind gesture and look forward to our future return because of this great service.

Park Central met all our criteria for a memorable family weekend in Manhattan: central location, spacious rooms, superb service with smile and always accommodating with requests. This hotel focuses on your stay without competing on providing eating options which there are so many within short walks of the hotel. Hence it remains very affordable. Our special thanks to Elizabeth - Guest Relation Manager, who accommodated us with every request and on top of it she ensured that our stay was memorable. Yes it was! You can never go wrong by focusing on your clients!

When I first walked into the Park Central Hotel, I thought that I was in the wrong hotel. The lobby and check-in experience were reminiscent of a Four Seasons, and seeing the flashing lights of Time Square down the street seemed almost too good to be true. Little did I know, however, that my first impressions of the hotel were not characteristic of my stay. Here is a list of things I felt took away from my New York vacation. Housekeeping: By far the worst housekeeping I've ever had in any hotel, ever! The rooms were clean enough--my person forgot to clean my restroom several times, but I can look past that. What I can't look past is having housekeeping staff outside my door every morning and every night loudly talking on their cell phones. My first morning, I was awoken by someone screaming "SISTER, SISTER!" Curious to what was going on, I peaked out my door only to discover a member of the housekeeping staff shouting on their phone. This happened on more than one occasion, with a different staff member each time. Other members of my party, who were staying in completely separate parts of the hotel also experienced this. This is an easy fix, and I hope this review changes that. Construction / Lack of Soundproofing: Be warned, the hotel is undergoing construction and is wrapped in scaffolding. The noise can be inconvenient to guests, especially considering that the windows of the hotel are nothing near soundproof. The walls are also paper thin, and I could often hear the conversations of my neighbors (and the hotel staff!) late into the night. Worst of all, the lack of soundproofing meant the rock band from the nearby club often made its way into my room--even at 1 am.Lack of Food: For a hotel that advertises itself as 4 Star, the universal expectation is that it has some sort of restaurant option for its guests, especially for breakfast; the Park Central, however, has none. Even Holiday Inns and other 3 star hotels have some sort of breakfast spread for their guests--it's not that hard! The only thing the Park Central has is its overly priced Central Market, where you can buy $12 mediocre grab-and-go sandwiches and $6 bottles of water. As a side note, a staff member informed me that I would be FINED if I brought in outside food to eat in their vast, empty seating area. Another staff member told me it was fine to being in outside food. Regardless of whoever was right, this is of evidence of a clear lack of communication between management and staff.The Elevators: This is the first time I've ever found fault with the elevators of a hotel. The Park Central's elevators are bizarre, inconvenient, and in need of repair. Namely, pressed-buttons don't light up, causing a sense of momentary anxiety as you wonder if your elevator will really stop at your floor. Additionally, the layout of the elevators is so confusing, that it really needs a map--somehow, the elevator directly outside my room took me the lobby of a different hotel? Most inconveniently, there is not nearly enough elevators for the size of the hotel. I would often wait 5 minutes for an elevator, only for it to be full. The moral of my stay: take the stairs! But this shouldn't have to be the case for handicapped people who don't have the option to take the stairs (or the time to wait 10 minutes for an elevator!) Overall, the Park Central Hotel has a great location and is affordable when compared to its competitors in the area. But considering that a night's sleep is nearly impossible, I wouldn't risk staying here.

We arrived several hours before check-in. The staff was friendly and gave me a temporary room key so that I could use the restroom off of the lobby. We checked in our luggage and went about our day. We didn't return for hours. We had originally wanted two Queen beds but could only get a King Size. We asked about Queens but were told they were sold out. As we were standing there, one became available. The desk clerk seemed almost as happy about it as we were.If you need to get any work done, the lobby bar area is comfortable. The store downstairs has better prices on their coffee then the Starbucks next door. Remember to have your room key out in the elevator - you need it before pushing your floor number.Overall, a pleasant stay. Look for Groupon to save money!

Not an outstanding hotel but clean, not too expensive, not tired-looking (as so many are) and in an excellent location. We walked to museums, stores, Lincoln Center, Central Park. Quality bath and bed linen. Luggage checking was friendly and efficient. No complaints!A great base for exploring Manhattan.

My partner surprised me the week before Christmas, that he was taking me to New York.Neither of us have been before and it was exciting! He had booked everything prior and when I found out where we were staying I Immediately looked at the website. Wow- Park Central looks amazing.Upon arriving we were very tired but again, excited.When we entered the ‘lobby’ it smelt incredible.. reminded me and of mother’s perfume. It was clean, gorgeous and very impressive. Reception are a little frosty- not mean, just not very smiley and we were told ‘stand in between the ropes’ (where you wait to be seen) check in was quick and we were on the 7th floor. Only two small lifts to our floor but no wait- quick and up to our room in no time. The room itself was next to the ice machine and behind the elevators - I’m a light sleeper, so instantly I said ‘ohhh, I hope this isn’t noisy’ :/..The room was big, had a comfortable bed, huge tv, small bathroom (but well lit and all you need- bath shower sink etc). We were very happy!We came back later that evening to relax after being out all day and we were tired! I had ear plugs from the flight and because the windows were not double glazing- you could hear the streets. It’s New York! However, we kept hearing this god awful sound that I thought was someone dragging a big table above us- turns out it was the lift whenever it went past our floor .. this was loud and did annoy me. Overall the stay was lovely. A few things like noise and the bath plug didn’t work- I did let reception know for future guests of that room.We loved our trip and the room was great- but it was a little dusty on the carpet. That was all!

We have just returned from a five day break in New York staying at the park Central Hotel, I must say what a fantastic hotel in all aspects, the staff were very friendly and always willing to help, the hotels positioning is perfect as you can walk to pretty much everything, the rooms were great and very clean.Keep up the good work park Central As my family and I will definitely be returning.Regards Jonathan Hussey

I came to New York to visit some friends and stayed at the Park Central Hotel. Because I am from New Jersey, and having worked in Manhattan, I know that New York is very pricey. I was so very happy to see that Park Central Hotel had an amazing nightly rate. I also knew that because of the rate charged, that the hotel would more than likely be less than stellar. This was absolutely NOT the case. I felt safe the minute I walked into the hotel each night - there is security at the door of the hotel and they take the time to discreetly recognize you. The staff (in all areas of the hotel: front desk, bar and lounge area, convenience store downstairs, maintenance and all those on the phone that I didn't have the pleasure to meet) were pleasant, professional and genuinely happy. The room was modern, clean, quiet - just everything I needed. The first night I wanted an additional blanket (I'm always cold) and I called the service number to ask for a blanket. Immediately, not one - but two warm blankets were delivered. I then received a call from someone in maintenance confirming that my blankets arrived. What???? Who does THAT anymore? The attention to detail is wonderful, especially the lovely lights which adorn the entrance to the hotel - this helped me recognize my hotel when I was returning in the evening. This hotel is a 10 insofar as customer service is concerned - especially since customer service seems to be less evident in these times. I will most definitely return to this hotel.

I was here almost exactly two years ago to perform with a group at Carnegie Hall, and once again, I wasn't disappointed by my actual stay Park Central. First of all, this time the room had more synthetic pillows! Yay! I also felt that the elevator situation wasn't as bad as before, but maybe that's because I was on a top floor, so the elevator was always empty when it got to me. It appears they had just re-grouted the bathroom tile from the room I was staying in, because some of the stain from the black grout ran down the side of the shower when water was splashed on it. The bathroom door could use replacing for sure. In fact, in a small bathroom like that, it would be smart if the hotel went to using pocket doors! Now, in terms of complaints, I will say that the only reason I didn't rate this hotel higher has to do with their front desk. We encountered a few issues with our check in and reservation, and the attitude that the front desk took with me didn't help. They claimed that we didn't pay ahead of time for our group rooms, which we had proof of otherwise. On check out, we requested a late checkout for one member of our group who was sick, which they gave us, but again, there was definitely some attitude. Overall, I think it's a great place to stay, however.

We had good time in there.Very clean facilities including the gym.Carolyn and Yana were very frendly and kind during all my stay.Great staff.Very well located in 7th street.Very close to Central Park and Times Square.

Quimby (who looks amazing) sorted us out, got us in early, comp’d our drinks, and this place is great. Could not have asked for better service! Everybody has been wonderful, I’m very picky and after a long flight, they’re welcoming and friendly.

Our flight was landing at 5 am so we had to check-in earlier than normal. The receptionist at the check-in desk was very understanding of our situation and found us a room so we wouldn't have to wait in the present snowstorm. However, the room was not the one we expected since they did not have one with a king bed available at that time. Elizabeth at the concierge desk was very professional and she truly understands customer service! She switch us to a king bed room the day after in an upper level. Since it was my friend's birthday, she also gave us some coupons for complimentary drinks and continental breakfast. So, I really want to thank her for all her help and understanding.I'd stay here again for sure!

My flight got canceled so I had to check-in a little earlier than normal. Carolyn at the check-in desk was very understanding of my situation and found me a room so I wouldn't have to wait in the present snowstorm. She was very professional and she truly understands customer service! I'd stay here again in a heartbeat! Also, I want to thank the wonderful ladies in the concierge area. They helped me plan a few things for my day since I arrived early!

The hotel looks amazing from the lobby and check in! Rooms was quite dated bathroom quite shabby. The noise from the generator at night was awful and smells from cooking early in the morning came through into the room. Too noisy though and when I enquired about why it was so noisy I was told I could enquire about a room change at 1pm but couldn’t guarantee anything. I explained we would be out all day as we were in New York to explore. With that was told it wouldn’t be possible then as they check in too. I understand it’s a busy hotel but feel that I couldn’t cut our day short to come back and change rooms. The room view was rubbish anyway so no need to have a window which would stop the nose and smells from coming through!! Wasn’t in the hotel at all so the resort fee is rubbish and should be including in the price during booking not added after. I only met one helpful member of staff the whole trip and that was the day I was leaving.

So we arrived at the hotel on first appearance from the outside the hotel doesnt have any appeal. We went to the reception desk where the receptionist was less than welcoming on arrival. Anyone booking this hotel be aware that initially the price of the hotel looks good. However you will have to pay a charge which isnt cheap upon arrival. We went to our room and this is where the hotel starts to look tired and worn. The rooms are big and well equiped but doors were badly damaged, door handles were hanging off, there was alot of dust and dirt on the carpets, the windows allow to much noise in, the AC unit is also verg noisy. When leaving the hotel we waiting over 15 minutes to collect our luggage from the luggage collect are where i witnessed shocking attitude from a memeber of staff to customers. Once i also received my luggage the employee of the hotel also had the cheek to ask me for a tip. My tip is that his service was far to slow and ask the hotel for the tip from the large sum of money i have paid to stay in the hotel. On a plus note the hotel is in a geat location and there is WIFI throughout the hotel.

Upon arrival I noticed how quickly the hotel receptionist greet you and come toward you to assist. I felt as if I was in a hotel that catered to you as if you lived there. Emanuel was great. His personality was one that you look for when in need of service. This will be my home away from home.

To say that this is the best Hotel in New York City is an understatement. My mother was put in the hospital and never being in the City before, Mr. Hightower went above and beyond for me. I stay there every month and it's never a let down.

I stayed in this hotel 20 years ago. The service then was excellent and Emanuel at the front desk made it memorable with his service.looking forward to my return next year. Housekeeping service was great as well.

From start to finish, Park Central was a lovely experience. The front desk was quick, helpful and polite, the room was beautiful, and the bar service was impeccable. I’ll come back time and time again knowing Nancy is going to be there. Awesome!

This was my first time in New York and got a great deal for this hotel. Fantastic location, great rooms, very very friendly and accommodating staff. Literally couldn’t have asked for better! A stones throw from Central Park, Columbus and another great shopping mall. Carnegie Hall across the street, and 4 mins walk to broadway and Times Square. Loads of subway stations, shops,cafes and restaurants all within 1-2 blocks.

To start with our flight was cancelled, not the hotels problem but they didn’t make any adjustments even after calling and exchanging text messages, there was no courtesy call from the hotel, when we did not arrive on our original date, to enquire if or when we would be arriving. Upon arrival at the hotel, there was no warm welcome or smile from the staff checking us in. They couldn’t find our booking because they hadn’t made a note on the system of our late arrival. There was no direction or run through of the hotel, nor was there a generic ‘we hope you enjoy your stay’. They took my card and charged us $340 which we later found out was a deposit as we were never told while checking in, on the final day we received a bill under the door of $281 for ‘Facilities fee’ which we were told by our travel agents was the only thing we actually had to pay for. We asked another miserable member of staff that ill informed us costs of everything.  Really big shame to be honest as the hotel is in a prime location but seems the hotel is more concerned about revenue than customer service

Had a wonderful stay. Nancy went above and beyond by answering all our questions about the city and about the hotel She was extremely helpful and so kind. Room was great. Comfortable bed. Will definitely stay there again

Both Nancy and John the bartender were the bomb!!! Very helpful with recommending restaurants and other sites to see. Can't say enough good things about them. Very customer friendly. Will recommend hotel to orhers.

Came here on a friend’s recommendation and was not disappointed. Spent 4 nights here and enjoyed my stay. Rooms are average size, but very clean. Staff were very friendly during our stay. Love the location as everywhere we wanted to go was easy to get too. Love walking to the park. There is a Starbucks and deli close by. We will be back.

We stayed for 5 days last week and the hotel is very clean. We spoke to many people on the street that were some of the friendliest people I’ve met. When we arrived back to our hotel the staff was not helpful. We felt as if we were bothering them when we needed directions or questions about the city. I called the auto recording before we went down stairs to get something from the store and the auto recording said they were open for a few hours more. Once downstairs we were told the employee decided to close down early. The store carries drinks, candy and some small sandwich items. There is also no restaurant or food available at this hotel( partly my fault for not checking before booking). I don’t think I would stay at this hotel again unless it was free. We were totally disappointed in how the staff acted as if they didn’t care. We wanted to change hotels immediately after checking in. We met a man who was staying at the hotel who said he worked for the company and I saw staff members speaking to him. So we know they are capable of speaking when approached. Pros: location is close to Central Park/Times SquareVery Clean Great curb appeal Negatives:No food/restaurant Most staff was not accommodating or friendlyOur trip to the hotel reminded me of crocodile dundee when he arrives and says “so many people here, must be the friendliest place in the world.” Sarcasm

Excellent hotelnthat can combine tão different environments in the same place: Business and family. Perfect localization (very close do the subway station and the main turistic points like Central Park, 5th avenue, Broadway and Times Square. I cannot let to talk about their very cordially staff, always supporting and providing attention. I would like to give a special mention to Elizabeth (guest information) and her assistance and cordiality with my Family. With totally sure I'll stay at the hotel for the next time in NYC.

By far my favorite hotel in New York City because of Saleem. He made the check in so easy for us and had great customer service. Everyday we see Saleem he has a smile on his face. He made our stay in Park Central hotel so pleasant and nice. The hotel is gorgeous and smells amazing. The rooms are spacious and roomy. This is the only hotel for me in New York City.

This hotel was clean and the beds were comfortable. The location was great - close to Central Park, restaurants, Subway, Carnegie Hall. I would stay there again if the price was right. Room was a little dark, could of used a few more towels. This hotel is perfect if all you need is a clean, comfortabe place to sleep and don't plan on spending too much time in your room.

Everything is always perfect. Centrally located. Walked to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Radio City, Broadway shows, best restaurants in town. Don't forget to ask about the $1 breakfast! Yes, $1.

Hotel is nice, comfortable, central, but was hit with a hidden $36 dollars per night, per room mandatory “facilities fee” to pay for the free internet. It was so deeply hidden when I booked through Agoda. Totally disingenuous, scummy, and cheap.Be warned.

We had a wonderful 4 day stay here. Fantastic location, close to Time square, Carnegie Hall and lits of food and shopping places. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Lots of amenities fridge, coffee machine, ironing board etc.

We are a family of four (2 adults and 2 kids) and stayed in this hotel for 3 nights whilst visiting New York.Hotel is very conveniently located in the middle of midtown Manhattan. Its 10-15mins walk from Times Square and the shopping areas along Fifth Ave.The room was clean, and room/bathroom had reasonably modern décor and amenities, however there was a couple of things that dropped the experience a bit.First there was no luggage service that we were aware of – we hauled our luggage to our room ourselves and upon checking out brought the luggage down ourselves as well. There is a concierge so not sure if they offer this service or not.Second the lifts at this hotel area absysmally slow and inefficient. There’s no other way to put it. From what I understand, this is a large hotel (around 600-700 rooms) but there were only 2 lifts servicing the floors. Each day we’d have to pass up multiple lifts to get one that is suitably empty. (going down to lobby). This was only an issue in the mornings. In the evenings we got an empty lift first time each time, but they were still slow…Finally heating/cooling unit in the room was quite loud when it was on, it sounded like the motor was installed somewhere nearby which is what was audible rather than just loud passage of air.Other than that, this hotel wins on location and convenience and if you’re intending to be out and about the whole day and using the hotel just to sleep, it’s a suitable place to do just that.

This was our tenth time to stay in Park Central and it was as comfortable as ever. The rooms are clean and it is a great location. Our issue was in the bar, my husband had seen a hotel signature cocktail on the hotels Instagram page prior to our stay. And he really wanted to try it. So we stopped by the bar, showed the server Nancy the picture and asked if the cocktail was available. Nancy then told us it must be a different hotel because were in the Park Kitchen and the Instagram picture said Park Lounge, the drinks menu in the bar had the words Park Lounge written on it. So either she just didn’t want to ask the guy behind the bar or clearly wanted to push something else on the menu. We found this quite rude and to be honest found Nancy quite pushy and aggressive we didn’t return to the bar during our stay.

It’s very nice hotel very clean and in great location walking distance to almost every thing you may need but the only problem they don’t provide parking so you have to park I. The garage next block on your work other wise it’s great

Let’s start with the check in and out service we received from Emanuel at the front desk. He has great recommendations and consistently checked in with us to make sure we were doing well and were enjoying our stay. It’s felt like a home away from home. Looking forward to our return next year.

I stayed here with my family and it was a great location. Very centrally located for many activities plus the subway access was close. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Alas it happened to be the coldest week in January when we visited NY. As a smoker I am used to having to go outside. However, in such a large hotel it sometimes became a nightmare because only 2 lifts were working for the entire building. In the 8 nights my sister and I stayed we had to replace our digital door key card 3 times. Thank goodness there were two of us! I'd have expected a room like this to at least provide tea and coffee and a kettle. Eventually a kettle was sent up. That said, the staff were always courteous.

the hotel is in the central area, closed to Central park, time square and many good restaurants/bar/lounges, nice area, there are some constructions going on on the street (which is a normal thing in NYC), the hotel doesn't have food/kitchen (this is the only downside, but I guess people don't eat the hotel often), there are plenty of restaurants across the street/next to the hotel.Oh, elevator is the part I dislike, I think they need to innovate the elevator system. Service is the part I love the most, I got there kind of early and and got an amazing helpful services from Elizabeth, I was able to check in early plus get some complementary for water, coffee and some snacks. I would definitely come back and recommend this hotel to everyone, if you want the best service, go look for the front desk lady Elizabeth.

Me and my fiancé came to New York for the first time in our lives from Maryland and not only did Elizabeth give us amazing service. We agree that she went far beyond her duties in making our stay at Park Central Hotel and fun and relaxing one as well as a memorable one. We will always come to Park Central Hotel every visit thanks to her.

Our room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. All of the staff we met (front desk, house keeping, cafe, bar waitress, baggage, front door) where very friendly and helpful. We'll definitely stay at Park Central the next time we're in New York.

The hotel was very clean and in a fantastic spot of New York City.One of the main reasons we chose this hotel was its location - right outside Central Park, quick walk to Times Square, lots of good places to eat and close to the subway. Also, from looking online, one of the few hotels with king beds.The staff was super friendly and accommodating.My only criticism would be the added resort fee charged per night - seems common for hotels in New York and you don’t really get anything beneficial for it - the gym is quite small and free internet?Overall, a fantastic stay and I would definitely stay here again!Good luck and good travelling

We came to stay here for my birthday and although i Wasn’t happy at the start of my stay. Emanuel at the front desk was great and turned our ways of thinking around. Hence the 5 star review. Can’t wait to come back again.

Me and my wife enjoyed our 3 night stay. We look fowsrd to comi g back and stayi v again. Emanuel at the front desk is great at what he does. Recommendations were excellent and on point. Housekeeping was impeccsble.

I've been staying here for years. I have come here because of the 5 star service that Emanuel provides me and my family. Although rates are sometimes cheaper else where I come here because its like a home away from home.

I stayed at the Park Central Hotel twice in February 2019 and had great experiences both times. The hotel is located in a great area, and it's very easy to get a cab/Lyft/Uber right outside of the hotel. It's slightly away from all of the Times Square traffic, so you can more easily get to other areas in Manhattan from the hotel. The rooms are clean and spacious (I did both the Deluxe 2-Queen and the Standard 2-Double - both were perfect). There are plenty of places to get food/beverages right around the hotel - I highly recommend "99 Cent Pizza" right around the corner if you're in the mood for a good, New York Pizza (*only $8 for an 18" pie!).

I usually don’t do reviews but the gentleman who goes by the name Emanuel at the front office was the best I’ve come across. He literally planned our 2 night stay for us. He went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed ourselves and answered every question we had.

Stayed here for two nights snd the service was good. Widh i could of stayed longer. Emanuel at check out was great. He offered to keep my luggage and gave me recommendations for breakfast at the BROOKLYN DINER.

One night stay in the city with my wife. Wanted to treat her to a nyc trip and it could t of turned out better. Ate at Tuscany steakhouse recommended by The great Emanuel at the front desk. He also recommended the Iridium jazz club for entertainment. Thanks again!!

My husband and I planned a trip to New York for the first time and decided to book this place since it was a close location to Central Park. When we arrived at the hotel, Elizabeth checked us in and she was amazing! She made our trip even better with everything she did for us. The hotel room was clean and spacious as well.I am pleased with our decision staying here since we were able to walk to Times Square, Central Park, Bryant Park and the majority of other places. I would definitely book my stay with Park Central again.Definitely recommend.

Angela at the Park Central made my impromptu NY girl's trip 100 times better in just minutes. Post room booking, I started noticing ads for cool & cost effective room upgrades and began clicking away (sidenote - not the wisest you push can reposition lower re: room availability), only to receive a message that these upgrades were pending and could be confirmed at front desk so my attempt to secure "extras" in advance was futile. At check-in, Angela patiently analyzed the multiple change requests, let me know they had an immediate availability fitting most of my wants for no additional reservation fees. And threw in info about a free sight seeing for same value as the occupancy fee; I'll take two for the price of 1 anytime.All in all she made the experience of staying the the park beneficial inside and outside of the hotel and for that I'll surely look them up first whenever I want to playdate in the Big Apple.

At the end of our stay, Park Central Hotel charged us 36 $US per night extra for «amenities fees». So the price we paid and booked online was not the final price (in our case 120$ extra fees on a 280$ reservation). Be aware. Staff looked depressed, not friendly. Other than that, the Hotel was very confortable, rooms very spacious, great location.

I was surprised how large our room was especially for the price. My wife is handicapped in a wheelchair and the there was plenty of room to get her around comfortably in our room and in the bathroom. Everything looked new and stylish, but not over done. We were very comfortable there. The doormen we great for getting us cabs and helping with the doors. The bar was large and relaxing. The location was just great. A couple of blocks from Central Park and a couple from Times Square.

Great location. Clean rooms. We arrived at 9am, jet lagged and wanting to check in early but our room wasn’t ready yet. As we were resting in the lobby one of the lovely hotel staff, Elizabeth, could see how tired we were and was kind enough to look into it further and offer us an alternative room with early check in free of charge.

I loved this hotel! It was convenient for walking to all of the attractions.The staff was wonderful! Specifically, Ivan, Jermain and John. They helped us with how to take the subway. Helped us with cabs. Always had a smile for us. I will definately be stayin there again!

I have stayed here 10x. Normally a terrific value. Not this time. No heat, phone dead and remote did not work right. No blankets in room. They did check me in early which helped but no heat on 2nd night was painful and no phone to call down when in bed. Too tired to go down stairs.

Nice hotel in an excellent location; Central Park, restaurants, theaters are all in easy walking distance nice big rooms, very clean, friendly and efficient service - elevators could be improved - will come back.

We stay at Park Central whenever we are in NYC, about once a year. It’s close to Time Square, Broadway shows, good restaurants, shopping, Central Park & subway access. The hotel rooms are well appointed, clean, have modern bathrooms and a great, well equiped gym facility.

Overall we had an excellent stay . Few minor issues that Emanuel at the front desk rectified. He was of great help. Poking coward to our return again soon. Housekeeping was great in the morning. Be back soon.

First time in this hotel but numerous times in NYC. I guess this will be our go to hotel from now on. EMANUEL AT THE FRONT DESK WAS GREAT! Excellent information and had answers to all of our question and concerns. We will be back soon.

When booking online, they don't mention the extra $40/night in "facilities fees" and taxes they're going to charge you, so beware. It drives me nuts when places get away with this kind of stuff. I do most of my booking online, and generally balance location and price when making my decision. Additional, undisclosed fees tacked on at the check-in desk are omission and dishonest, in my opinion.Hotel in general was on par with a typical chain hotel (Marriott, Hyatt, etc) in terms of appearance, room size and furnishings. Front desk staff was efficient, but not particularly warm or welcoming. The gentleman this morning was mildly rude when we asked him if we needed to pay him for the additional fees or if it would be charged to the account. Probably would not consider staying here again, since there are plenty of other options in the city.

I always stay at Park Central when I go to NYC. I like everything about it- great price, great location, great rooms, great service! I highly recommend it to anyone who is interested in seeing as much of NY as possible in a short time period. You can walk to Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Trump Tower, Astoria and so many other notable sites, or jump on the subway and go. Book here. You won't regret it.

I didn't expect a hotel across from Carnegie Hall to be reasonably priced, yet it was. The room was a nice size, the decor well appointed and the window actually opened (always a plus for me as I treasure fresh air). I will stay here again, as you simply cannot get accommodations of this quality in New York for this price. Bravo to Park Central Hotel!

Location is great, particularly if you’ve got an event at Carnegie Hall. However, recognize that you’ll be treated as little more than a number. Concierge is the definition of smug customer care with a less than sincere smile. Luggage check is an ongoing waiting line with no care for urgency. If you can tolerate the subpar customer service, I say go for it.P.S. No A/C in the winter. Doesn’t sound like a big deal but it’s problematic as the natural room temp probably hovers around 75. You can crack the window to cool the room down but ,if so, plan to sleep with noise canceling headphones.

After a long flight we were welcomed with champagne and chocolates and an upgrade! The room was beautiful, big and very clean, we were also given complimentary breakfast vouchers it has an excellent location, the confirm beds and I'd love to go back again! Highly recommended.

I always stay at Park Central Hotel in my trips to NY and it is a fantastic experience. The rooms are great, the location is superb and the staff is friendly. I would like to give my special thanks to Quimby who made my stay even more special. I definitely recommend this hotel and will always come back.

We were on a holiday travelling with family to NYC. On the last day of our trip Monday the 17th of September, my wife unfortunately took a heart attack. The night in question I went to reception and I would like to thank the night security guard Broderick who called emergency services & kindly attended to my wife in the room while waiting on emergency services. This was obviously a difficult situation being away from home & Elvir Dervisevic (Complex director of housekeeping) was an amazing support to us, nothing was a problem. I would like to thank him for everything he did for us- we will never forget it. They looked after my wife & I on her return from hospital while we waited for the ok to travel back to Ireland. Patrick Dempsey

Stayed here for the first time and loved it. Visiting here from Puerto Rico and felt at home with the service received from Emanuel at the front desk. His hospitality is impeccable. Looking forward to our return next year.

This hotel is in a perfect location to attend Broadway shows. There are also plenty of diners and small eating places and is close to the subway.The hotel is clean and the rooms are a good size. The staff is friendly and efficient. My only complaint is that you can hear the street noise and it's rather loud. We were on the 5th floor and I had to wear my earplugs to sleep. But all in all this is a perfect place to stay when visiting NYC.

I typically spend 30-45 nights a year at this hotel The staff is great, Vito is exceptional. He makes you feel like family. The prices are always in line with everybody else so there is no need to shop around. It does not have a party atmosphere and I really like that. It is business and family friendly.

Stayed at Park Central last Thursday thru Sunday. We secured an early check in no problem. Check in took only took a few mins and the staff was very friendly and helpful the entire weekend. We grabbed a couple drinks in the lounge after bringing our things to the room. The 2 bartenders were awesome. Very friendly. But not cheap. But hey. It’s a NYC hotel near Times Square. Lol. The room was very nice. Looked line it had all been upgraded recently. Very clean except we did see some hairs in the shower that were not ours. Not a game changer since it was our only complaint. Great location. It was loud at night because of the construction going on all night across the street But the convenience of the location made up for it. A couple great bars right across the street. Would definitely stay there again.

We got a great price on this hotel on MLK weekend. I knew the location was great but was slightly skeptical about what we would find when we arrived. The hotel lobby was beautiful and staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms we booked had two double beds each which is not easy to find in NYC. Concierge led us to a cool restaurant/bar right around the corner in an old building with a jazz band playing. We were able to walk to ice skating in Central Park and a show on Broadway. Great trip. I recommend this hotel.

I love the location of this hotel! You can walk to Central Park within minutes, Carnegie Hall is practically across the street. It only takes 15 minutes to walk to Lincoln Center. There are many good restaurants nearby too. The rooms are larger than most with lots of counter space in the bathroom which is becoming rare. I also loved that there was a soap dish. Most hotels have gotten rid of the soap dish so the soap falls into the sink repeatedly.

Excellent service! After have a small issue claiming a coupon deal the agent went above and beyond to verify the discounted price and make sure it applied correctly to the final bill.Thanks so much! Have a great stay!

This hotel is brilliant in its location. It’s central to just about everything in Manhattan. It’s foyer is sweet. The bellhops are wonderful and friendly. The concierge was happy to help us in any way possible..... however..... they had 2 lifts and at times 1 lift servicing the whole place. We did wait up to 7 minutes to get on an elevator. There were just so many of us waiting and only 5 or 6 people fit at a time. Then we have the problem with the room not having heating. We spoke to guest services who told us the previous occupant didn’t want heating on and therefore they turned it off. Well I’m not the previous occupant. They supposedly turned the heating on but the room was still freezing so we slept with hand warmers in the bed so our teeth would stop shattering. There is no fridge, no mini bar, and the amenities fee is ridiculous. What in God’s name are they charging for? Get rid of this charge and allow people to decide if they want to use a gym or make phone calls. Over all I wouldn’t stay there again. For the price I paid I’d go to something more classy.

Held up a bit at checkout because of an posting error but overall it was a great stay. Emanuel at checkout was great at making sure the error was taken care of. Looking forward to a return soon. NYC was exactly what I thought.

The hotel was in a great location, and was very accommodating to our travel plans. We got in at 6am and they were able to give us an early check in (rather than 4pm) and also an extra hour to check out. There was a noise issue with door repairs across the hall one morning, but Emmanuel was able to help us resolve the issue. We were very happy with our stay.

we got to the Park Central, checked in, went to our room and lo and behold we received a phone call from the front desk telling us we were at the wrong hotel. someone with the same last name had checked in after us and he was the Schlossberg that was expected. Alex was so helpful and kind to us when we came downstairs. both he and the manager agreed to let us stay the night, gave us a reduced rate for the night and helped us contact the right hotel (which was across the street). he made us feel very welcome and helped us laugh it off as one of lifes little fo pahs. we would absolutely want to stay at the Park Central again.

Really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was clean, well-maintained and our room was very nice and appeared to be recently renovated. We will definitely be back.Also want to say that the staff was very friendly and accommodating. In particular the check-in process at the front desk was effortless and Angela was extremely helpful and friendly and made us feel right at home. She is a true asset to the hotel team.

Great location, close to Times Square and Central Park, excellent service, especially Angela, who welcome us so greatly. If you are planning to visit ny, the best hotel is definitely the park central hotel!!

I stayed at this hotel. Excellent location. The staff ratio at the hotel is excellent. Especially Mrs. Elizabeth (GUEST RELATION MANAGER) gave a different and special attitude that solved many matters in the moment. And after the solutions, make sure everything is in order. Extraordinary ratio. The rooms are comfortable, clean, the shower is comfortable, the lobby is peaceful, a quality hotel

The hotel is nice enough, especially if you get a room with a view. Elevators are a pain - take a long time to arrive and always full. The Resort Fee is may be mentioned in the fine print, but it's still ridiculous - I won't stay there again.

Very lovely hotel, clean, great location!Great service , special Elizabeth from the customer services.Looking forward to come again.The room is big and clean. Very close to the great central park.Thank to the great team

I love the hotel not only of its excellent location and the renovation they did to the hotel, but because of the marvelous and warm treatment you get from the staff, from the great manager to the front desk, the store, from everyone. For me the best place to stay in New York,

A couple of years ago we were fortunate to hook into this hotel. We were very impressed. For a very long time we had experienced expensive hotels with limited room and bathrooms not much larger than airplane WCs. The cost was always up there as well. No matter where you stay in New York City, a hotel can boast about their location. Park Central doesn't have to boast. It's a wonderful location. If you need theater district, it's only a short walk. If you need Carnegie Hall, it's right there or the Metropolitan Opera is also walking distance. Rooms and bathrooms are huge, clean and modern

We stayed at the Park Central Hotel for 4 nights in December. The room was really clean and with a lovely comfortable bed. Although we did have a view(which we paid extra for)it was on the side of the building. Nevertheless we had two windows and could see Carnegie Hall. The bathroom was excellent and very clean. The only downfall is that there are only two elevators but it didn't really cause us a problem apart from a little wait at peak times. Would definitely stay there again.

Bought this on Groupon and reviews were good. I’m a hotel snob-preferring Marriott properties but the rate and location were too good to pass. Angela and Espressa greeted us, provided a free upgrade, and helped me with parking and other questions. They made me feel like i was important and worth spending time with. Truly above and beyond care! Overall hotel was great, location was walking accessible to 5th ave shopping and Times Square shopping. Room was clean and modern and spacious enough for our group of three. Bathroom was clean and pleasant. Overall awesome and I will definitely seek it out in the future.

My previous travels to New York had anchored me with the expectations of hotels with a small room and crammed lobbies: to my delight, my three week stay in Park Central was the exact opposite. The lobby was beautifully decorated with Christmas ornaments, and the room was large - given its location in Manhattan - with extremely comfortable beds garnered with soft duvets. I was grateful for its strategic location next to Central Park because it allowed me to run there every morning, but equally as important, I had the pleasure of having Elizabeth help me with the many packages I had delivered from Amazon. Although the hotel had additional charges for the package fees, Elizabeth had graciously waived them for me due to our longer then average stay.I could only say that my stay at the hotel was pleasant, looking forward to another holiday at New York.

A beautiful, clean hotel with the best customer service I’ve had to date. Vito at the front desk went above and beyond for me, and it was greatly appreciated. The staff was friendly, nice and really showed me what customer service is meant to be. I highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed at this hotel 2 nights and the location couldn’t be any better, right outside the hotel looking to your right you see Times Square, walking distance to everywhere. My only 2 issues would be parking which is almost 3 blocks away and quite pricey but I guess that’s a little price to pay for what you get location wise. The bathroom although nice, was way too small even for a short person like me, can’t close the door or open it without hitting your own knees or anyone who is inside. 1.5 thumbs up

This hotel was nice enough, rooms dusty around the edges but warm and comfortable. The lifts are an issue in the morning, but thankfully being only on the fourth floor, we could use the stairs. The hotel has a well-complained about stealth charge, the "resort fee". We knew about it in advance but didn't know what it included, we only going this out on the last day at the luggage desk, where there was a small sign explaining it. At check in we have a credit card to authorise incidentals, but I asked if I could pay on a different debit card at check out instead. The hotel receptionist said this isn't a problem and off we went.The last day, we awoke to invoice of having charged $325 USD before we'd checked out. I asked them to reverse it and charge the debit card, as agreed and requested, which they did. On my return home I have discovered they have charged the debit card the right amount but charged me $400 USD on my credit card. No response to emails or phonecalls. I have had my neck reverse the charge but I am still out of pocket for a foreign transaction fee and the multiple phonecalls that don't resolved.This has marred an otherwise good stay. Apart from avoiding the extortionate cafe bar shop ($6.25 for a small bottle of water when a street vendor outside sells the same for $1) it's a nice hotel. But having had $400 USD stolen and having been ignored for a week, it's just put a bad taste in my mouth. I won't return.
user_location: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here for our Christmas trip to New York. From the 23-26th the service was great and our standard room was lovely. They come and clean regularly and everything personal of ours was left exactly as it was. Check in at Park Central isn’t until 4pm, However they have a luggage check in where you can drop everything off for the time being. This hotel location is great because it’s steps away from the subway stations, and Central Park is right down the street. If you are looking for something to eat but not wanting to travel far, there is a Premier Cafe right by the hotel (walking distance) they have amazing drinks and food. You have to try their macaroons they are amazing.We honestly enjoyed our stay at Park Central, and the bed was extremely comfortable which was great after going sight seeing all day.

We loved our stay at park central. Be prepared the queues for reception and bag check can be brutal!The room was spacious and clean but we had no view. Our window looked out into a weird inner section and it was hard in the room to gauge what time of day it was, especially with the jet lag!The beds are comfortable, the shower was good and having a little coffee/snack shop in the lobby is very useful when you need it although there are also some good coffee shops and a subway right outside.You book this hotel for the location and it doesn’t disappoint! A short walk to Central Park and also to Times Square. Perfect location.

I can’t say enough about our wonderful stays at Park Central. I have been going through medical procedures 1600 miles from home. We have stayed at Park Central three times in the last 8 months. The staff does their very best to make sure I am comfortable after surgery. They treat us like family. Riley Allen is one the most compassionate and considerate people I have ever had the pleasure to work with. He makes our reservation process seamless. The rooms are always spotless, very quiet, comfortable, and spacious. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else!!

Our 18th year and another excellent stay. Greeted by Carmelo the doorman with a warm and good to see you again. He is also great at suggesting a good restaurant to dine at, Nocello a hit. The housekeeping ladies always friendly and do a excellent job. Perfect location one reason we chose it 18 yrs. ago and Carmelo gets a taxi fast. Central Park up the street, MOMA within walking distance as is 30 Rock, RadioCity, NBC studios and Top of the Rock, Times Square down 7th. Patsys also a few blocks away and can recommend Rosie O'Gradys down 7th Ave.Look forward to our 19th year next January.

I can highly recommend this place! The hotel is amazingly located and very easy to reach via public transport. It’s a short walk from Central Park and you can easily walk to Times Square as well. After we lost our phone in the cab right after arrival, we the guest relation manager was supporting us right away on calling the driver etc. She followed up until we found it. We enjoyed a very warm welcome and the rooms were nice with big beds as well as very clean. We will definitely come back as soon as we can! Best,Jenna

My husband and I stayed here a coulple times before but our last visit will keep us coming back. Quimby helped us get a room immediately upon early arrival and upgraded our room. It made my birthday visit even more special. Because of him I’ll definitely make this hotel my go to when visiting NYC. Its 10 min walking distance of a lot of NYC hot spots. It’s always clean (the rooms look exactly like the photos online), the staff is always great and even the bell man is so nice and helpful. I appreciate staying at a hotel with ginuwine kind people and Quimby definitely made our visit memorable.

I travel to New York quite frequently and thought I would try and stay at a new hotel- huge mistake. The ONLY good thing I can say about this hotel is the location.... and thats literally it. My mom and I just visited New York from Jan 4-8 as a celebratory trip, and this hotel ruined our experience. We had been in touch with the hotel prior to our arrival, and we were ensured that the staff would do everything in their power to ensure a special visit. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a rude woman who each time we saw her she would hide her name tag so we never got her name despite speaking with her on several occasions (was working Jan 4 at 230pm). She had an attitude each time we saw her and seemed as though she despised her job.Upon reaching our room, we were immediately disappointed. The room itself was tiny, despite upgrading to the King room (I forget the specific name of the room), but for some reason had a long, strange hallway. The hotel faces itself, so everytime we looked outside we could only see other people in their rooms, including a couple that made us very uncomfortable as they would be intimate by the window. This resulted in us having to keep the window shut. Additionally, the thermostat needed a new battery, so we had to call down because the room was way too hot. We had to wait a long time for someone to come upstairs to replace the battery, despite being told he would be up, "immediately". He ended up opening our window to which it became way too cold, but whenever we would shut the window it was way too hot. Additionally, the sounds of New York (i.e., sirens, music, honking, etc) would keep us up.Additionally, we had requested extra towels, a coffee machine and fridge upon avail... none of which was presented. Two days in a row (Jan 6 & 7), we were woken up at 6:00am on the dot by the alarm on the end table despite us never touching it. We suspect that when it was cleaned something was hit by mistake. Both days we were up late the night before, and after it went off we were unable to fall back asleep. Completely exhausted us. When room service came they did not replace the soap or hand towels. We asked for hand towels and were told, "there were no more" and that, "once the next load of laundry was complete, we would receive them" (we were on the 16th floor and this was at 9am....?). So, we went out for the day and returned in the early evening and still did not have towels or soap. The little cafe or whatever it's officially classified as in the hotel lobby is extremely overpriced, and the staff there are extremely rude as well. The woman working there (again, didn't catch her name but she works the morning shift and has should length strawberry blonde hair), just like the woman at the front desk, makes it extremely evident that she hates her job. She literally rolled her eyes at people and maintained an extremely rude attitude. There were two groups of children who were running around the lobby and each floor (they would take the elevator down one floor at a time) who were screaming and laughing late at night, holding up the elevators and waking people up. The lobby also had many people who were not staying at the hotel, some of which creeped my mom and I out. For a contrasting point of reference, I have stayed at the Sheraton one block down who always have staff and security members in the lobby. On multiple occasions I have walked past them politely, maturely, professionally and respectfully asking people to leave. It always made me feel much safer staying there. The bathrooms in the lobby are also always filled with people who are not staying at the hotel waiting to use the bathroom. I have never witnessed this being an issue at any other hotel in New York. For another point of reference, the Millennium at Times Square will not even let you approach the elevators unless you present your room key (or they recognize you). This hotel did not present adequate procedures as such. Anyone can walk in at any time in the lobby and hang out for as long as they wish. As if this wasn't enough, the elevators are also ridiculous. There are only two in the lobby, and the wait time for one to come would sometimes be up to 10 minutes long. They are also so tiny that once an elevator finally came, you couldn't squeeze in. Not only that, but the elevator would stop at every single floor despite there being no room for someone to fit on. So, you wait ten minutes for an elevator to come, and once it comes you most likely can't fit on. If you can, it takes another 5-10 minutes to finally reach the lobby because it stops at every single floor with disappointed people. Each time we were in the elevator (10+ times a day), people were ALWAYS complaining. I've never seen such tiny, poorly operated elevators in a hotel in my entire life.... and we were only on the 16th floor... I can only image how much more frustrating it was for people higher up.There are many more reasons, but this review is long enough. Do NOT stay at this hotel- you will just be frustrated and disappointed. There are countless hotel options in New York in every area, choose another.
The usual standard package is offered efficiently. Elizabeth excelled by lending a European adaptor which I forgot and offered me a late checkout of 3pm on a last day full of appointments. Thank you

We stayed at the hotel for 5 days in December. The room was large and the bed was massive and very comfortable! It’s situated perfectly for getting round the city, close to Central Park and close to Times Square. The staff were very polite and helpful. If we visit the city again would 100% stay here again!

The hotel price for the room we had and the location its at, is v convenient. Ana at the concierge was so nice to help us get a city view room that we wanted! Great staff the hotel has a late check out at 1 pm which is very convenient for us young adults or those who have late flight/bus

Terrible start to out stay at Park Central Hotel. Hotel itself is lovely and at a great location however the hotel staff, in particular the man who checked us in couldn’t be more unpleasant in his manner and demeanour. Didnt get so much as a hello or a smile or welcome to Park Central just ID and credit card without any introduction. Came across as very rude and not welcoming at all. There was some confusion with one of the guests in our party in regards to the service fees etc, however when explaining it he had an attitude and was just unpleasant in general. Considering he’s supposed to have good hospitality skills he was seriously lacking them on this occasion. Disgusting service.

Great group stay! The hotel staff were a pleasure to work with as we set up a room block (and kept adding/changing rooms). Our guests were pleased with the location and the accommodations. We'd come back again!

We were heading into NYC from Philly for one night to celebrate my sister’s birthday. I called the day before for early check-in. I was told that it is first come first serve, but if I was there around 2pm I should have no problem getting into a room. So, we arrived at 2pm and waiting in a crazy line to check in. Only to be told to come back at 4 and leave our luggage. Well, the luggage like was also very long so my husband and I went to the bar. About an hour or so into our wait someone told us to give the front desk our phone number and they’ll call when our room is ready. I wish they had told us that when we first checked in, but I went back up and did it again. About 15 minutes later I noticed people getting keys and heading for the elevators. So I went back to the front desk just to check. Turns out our room was ready...but we did not get a call or text. We went to the room to drop our stuff and meet up with the family. The problem with the staff telling everyone to come back at 4 means there are now lines for the elevators...Other than that debacle the room was fine and clean just for one night. However, they do really nickel and dime you for the facilities fee. I purchased a groupon for the hotel stay. But then ended up having to pay $41 just for whatever a facilities fee is. With tax and fees in total, I could probably have gotten a better deal at another hotel with better customer service...

My wife, 2 sisters in law and a niece and a nephew had a three day short trip to NYC and stayed at the Park Central Hotel. Never driven in NYC but easy to get to and fairly easy to get around from with many things in walking distance or the subway which is across the street. Hotel was very clean and very convenient, and while the room is on the small side, beds were very comfortable and would stay here again. Would rate as excellent, but hate the concept of having to ask for a coffee maker in the room, should just be there.

My family and I just completed a five night stay at the Park Central Hotel. Great value, great location. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Very close to Central Park and the theater district. The rooms are small but that’s because in this city you don’t spend much time in the room anyway. We had a premier king and a premier queen room for our family of six. One of my daughters was sick for a day or two and they were kind enough, at no charge, to put a rollaway bed in our room for her. You cannot go wrong staying at this hotel.

First of all the hotel looks nice. Some employees are nice, some employees are cranky. The place of the hotel is good. It is 5-10 minutes away from Times Square and Central Park. The room is also nice, but not very clean. The last morning we woke up and found a letter under our door. It was a bill with a weird description. We went to the reception and asked what is was. They told us we broke a lamp and they charged $250 dollar for it. They showed us the picture of the broken lamp but we didn’t do anything. We think this is a weird way to communicate with each order. We are honest people and when we break something we will pay for it. We recommend the place, but not the way how they treat us.

I usually don't like older hotels which have been updated. But the Park Central was the exception. The location is perfect. The rooms are well appointed. The bathroom was nice. The front desk staff was friendly. For a large hotel with large groups in and out, there was never excess noise in the room or in the halls on the upper floors. And, the gym here is excellent.

When we arrived at our room with a 4.5 month old baby, the housekeeper, Mary Paul gave us a brand new hot water kettle to use so we could sterilize our baby bottles. She and all the housekeeping staff were so accommodating to us. Front desk clerk Emmanuel was also very hospitable ensuring we could have a room with 2 beds instead of one King. Great location and clean modern rooms.

I stayed in the Park Central Hotel over Christmas with my daughter. The hotel is situated five minutes walk away from Times Square and five minutes from Central Park, so great location. You can get to a lot of the sites on foot. The rooms are modern and clean, very comfortable bed, huge tv. We were on the sixth floor and did hear a lot of noise during the night from the street behind the hotel, the windows don’t seem to be double glazed. Don’t take your GHD hair straighteners as they won’t work, not enough power in the plug sockets, I had to pay $70 for some that would work. They also don’t have a fridge.The hotel does not provide breakfast although there is a Grab & Go place in the foyer where you can pay for tea coffee & croissants etc. The staff were all polite and friendly. We were upset to receive a bill at the end of our five night stay for $200, this we were told was because we booked through Expedia, I won’t be booking with them ever again. Overall we had an enjoyable stay but felt the hotel was quite expensive to stay in a had nothing much in the way of facilities.

I was recently in Gotham on business and need to stay with staff at a central location for meeting and appointments. We could not have made a better decision than to say at Park Central. It was incredibly convenient to just about everything in Gotham and the staff was incredibly helpful and warm. If you want to feel like you are in the heart of the City, without feeling overwhelmed, there are very few places like this.

I am currently staying at this hotel. We arrived Monday for New Years Eve. Total disaster. I reserved two premium rooms paying $600+ for the first night. Wasn't able to see the ball drop. Couldn't even stand out in front of the hotel and couldn't stand in the lobby. Told to go to our rooms and try to watch from there but even the corner rooms do not offer a view of Times Square. No planned activities for NYE planned for guests. Staff was rude at the bar and in the lobby. Amenities were minimal at best. No refrigerator inside the room. No room service. Will have to find other restaurants close by for food and snacks. Anytime we wanted to go anywhere, we found ourselves having to wait on elevators. Only two running elevators and both very small. For the amount of floors and guests staying in this hotel, the number of elevators is inadequate. My total bill for 2 rooms for four nights is $3,200. I paid way too much for a hotel that offers so little and poor service. There are so many other options in the city to stay. Do your research and don't get caught in the same predicament.

I have hosted quite a few groups at Park Central and that job has been made easier because of my work with Riley. He takes care of all the details, which makes my job easier. My customers love the location, rooms, and the service at the desk. THank you to Park Central and Riley for a job done well.

We stayed here with our 2 kids for a couple of nights in Jan. The location is pretty good - just enough outside of Times Square, but able to walk over for a show. Walking distance to Central Park. However, we usually stay closer to the upper east side and I personally prefer that as I find it to be less congested. The lobby and staff were nice and helpful. I do wish they had valet parking - we had to pull up and unload and then my husband drove around the corner to valet at another hotel’s garage. The room looks nice, but it had a funky smell - probably because they keep the rooms so warm and without any circulation. The air felt really stale. We turned on the AC, but it doesn’t let you turn the temp down very much and it’s so loud when it’s on that’s it’s hard to talk or watch TV. I don’t think we’d stay again.

My boyfriend lost his pijamas the first morning they cleaned up the room. I lost a memory card and a MAC lipstick ( that I left on the drawer of the side table) during the 9 days we stayed in the hotel. I feel that for the price we paid, and the time we spent, we should at least have had the right to keep our things intact, specially as they mean something only to us...(Who would ever steal some pijamas, a lipstick that has been used and a memory card? We wouldn't put those things under key either, that's honestly a bit paranoid!)... I wrote to the hotel in a desperate trial to recover my sd memory card, but after asking for my booking reservation, they totally ignored me (and I could never tell if they just lost my stuff, threw them to the trash can, stole them, put them on the lost and found pile, or what). Bad management and bad stories to tell. I loved New York, and the location was really good, but that's it. I wouldn't come back as my belongings were never safe.

We arrived at the hotel and already in the first day we received an amazing reception.Elizabeth, the concierge was wonderful! She helped us in everything we needed. I recommend the hotel specially for the service and the staff.

Just wanted to thank Park Central team for their hospitality. Especially Mme Shpressa. She was and is just outstanding! This our fifth stay in five years! Just fantastic! You made our dream came true «  a perfect holidays, in a perfect hotel with an outstanding services! »I highly recommend this hotel! 10/10!

This is my first ever review ,so please bear with me .I wright this because I feel the service me & my family received was appallingWe arrived at the hotel a little early and our room was not ready.NOT a promblem for us, we droped our bags of and went out for a couple of hours when we returned our room was still not ready ,so we went and waited in the lounge for awhile , my 4 year old son needed the toilet so i took him, only to find out you need a key card to get into the toilet Had to que up at recpition to get a card so we could us the toilet great fun when you have a four year old bursting to go to the toilet,by the time we got to be seen the lady on recpition said she could change our room to one that was ready now and we could go straight up, we rushed to the lifts only to find a bloody long que quick rush back to the toilets and our 4 year old is a little lighter and a lot happier ,back to the lifts we go and join the que,Room was nice and clean ,but very dark, & not what we had paid /asked for when booking. We want room with a veiw of 7th ave ( got room with a side street veiw )On one occasion our room key would not work. So of i go to join the que for the lifts to go down to reception to ask them to sort it out Speak to a lady who is doing nothing on the edge of the reception desk only to be told i need to join the que of people waiting to check in i explain me wife and 2 kids are waiting outside our room door only to be told i need to join the que ,45 mins later i get seen and it takes less than 1 min to sort the key out Of i go to join the que for the lifts to let my family into the room have i mentioned there is always a bloody que for the lifts Two lifts on each side of the hotelon a hotel this size is a joke.Great location and could have been so much better .staff very unhelpfull .Hotel over priced ,compared to Roosevelt were we normally stay when visting new york WILL NOT BE STAYING HERE AGAIN ON OUR NEXT VIST

Our group of 20 had a wonderful time at Park Central. The Midtown location is convenient to Carnegie Hall, Central Park, Times Square, and much more. The service was courteous and professional and the rooms were clean and relatively spacious. This is the third time I have stayed at Park Central and it has been consistently excellent. I was originally directed to Park Central by our travel planner, Paula Zackeru, with Sapphire Tours & Travel, and we have been ably assisted at the hotel by Alicia Davila (Sales Manager), Riley Allen (Sales Coordinator) and Quinby Hightower (Guest Relations).There are plenty of restaurants, coffee shops, and cafes of all types and price ranges within a short walk of the hotel. Internet service/WiFi was quite good (and included with our group package).

Great place to stay, near Central Park and Times Square. Metro station, theatre district, MoMa and so many other attractions are walking distance from the hotel. Quimby from guest services went out of his way to make our stay unforgettable. We will be back here for sure on our next visit!!!

We arrived early, our room was not ready but we were able to store our luggage immediately. We went for a walk and came back around check in time and everything went smoothly. The staff was extremely friendly, the room was nice and clean the beds were super comfy. Location is great you are close to everything, but far away enough from everything to enjoy a little peace and quiet in the city that never sleeps. Will definitely stay again and will highly recommend.

Arrived early at the hotel, expecting to drop off luggage and check-in at a later point, however staff were very friendly and managed to accommodate us and check us in straight away. Hotel was clean and the room a nice size, we had a 2 double beds due to having my young daughter with us (family room) Central Park was only a 5 minute walk as was times sq however the hotel was quiet; close enough to all the key places but far enough to be away from the lights, noise and bustle of times sq Would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would use this hotel again on out next visit

I chose the Park Central Hotel for my first trip to NYC and was very impressed! The location was fantastic, the staff was efficient and friendly, and there were many dining options around the hotel. I didn’t have interactions with the staff after checking in but the housekeeping staff kept my room very clean and comfortable. Very close to subway.

First off, let’s start off by saying that the rooms were extremely dark there was only two small lamps that did not reflect much light in the actual bedroom. The only light that projected the most light was the light inside the bathroom which was not enough for the actual bedroom area the only light that projected the most light was the light inside the bathroom which was not enough for the actual bedroom area. Second, the remote control in the room never worked so we were never able to change the channels in our bedroom and had to deal with not being able to watch the TV. Thrid, the hotel only had one working elevator at one point throughout my 6 day stay at the hotel which with the amount of guests at the hotel you can imagine how long the wait for an elevator during any time of the day would be. Coming down 8 flights of stairs with an injured knee is not the most ideal thing to do. Which at one point is exactly what I had to do after waiting 15 minutes for an elevator! Incredibly inconvenient. And lastly, I also had to deal with opening my own double doors in and out of the hotel because the handicaped automatic door button was not functioning. Had I not had a hurt knee during the time perhaps I would of not been bothered by this last thing but I am not only mentioning it for myself but for any future guests with disabilities.

This is the first time we've stayed at this hotel, despite being to NYC several times a year. We usually stay with (and have been disappointed with) chains such as Hilton and Marriott. Since this recent stay, I plan to make arrangements exclusively at this hotel in the future. It was in a great location, had helpful staff, and was very clean. The lobby felt luxurious. Since staying here, I have actually talked to many people who have been guests over the years, and they, too have had nothing but positive things to say about it. I wish I had found this gem sooner. It's far enough from Times Square that the neighborhood is clean and quiet, but close enough to walk over for a show and the Columbus Circle Subway station is close by! Highly recommend!

Although my overall stay at Park Central was a good one, it could have been better. My stay could have been better if I actually had control of the thermostat in my room to run the aircondition and heat and not just the heat becuse it was winter time. This was an issue for me because my room was hot. I was given a fan to help cool my room. The other issue was the noise outside which caused problems at times getting to sleep. The hotel was nice, clean, and the staff was very courteous.
