Great location for the price, convenient for Broadway theatres and Central Park, room was tight with 2 queen beds, but any problems and questions were promptly solved and answered. Heating was not initially working in the room but was fixed within 30 minutes, concierge inquiries were well received with good restaurant recommendations. Would consider again on our next nyc trip

Recently returned to the Park Central Hotel during the first week of December...a REALLY challenging time to get a hotel room at a good price. I can't say enough about the assistance provided by Angela and Saleem (front desk staff) to help me secure a room on very short notice! Their customer service and efforts to meet our needs really went above and beyond. We will be returning to the Park Central Hotel the next time we travel to NYC.

This was my first time staying here in the Park Central Hotel. Since day one nothing but everyone’s undivided attention. Emanuel at the front desk gave us so much information and made sure we had it all to enjoy our time here. Look for him when checking in.

I booked the hotel through a third party and paid for a room with two queen beds. I can't tell you how many people I needed to argue with in order to get that room. I called the hotel a week before to confirm when I received an email stating that I reserved a king room. The customer service rep could not help me, Hotels.com could not help me, the registration desk would not accomodate me at pre-registration. Finally, someone found me a room with double beds (on the 4th floor) when I officially checked in, however, the customer next to me was told she was being upgraded to a double queen room at the exact same time! I can not believe that a hotel with this kind of customer service would ever really have 4 stars. Couple the bad customer service with an additional daily fee of $35.00 to use the internet and the gym?? I was also charged an upgrade fee for a room on the 4th floor. I have attached a photo of our view. The hotel did remove it when I emailed them from home. I will not be returning. I have stayed at many hotels in NYC that are actually friendly to their guests and have the services they advertise.

The front staff was not really kind and I had some cleaning issue with the room but the housekeeping staff was very kind.(maybe they should switch place)I had the king size bed with city view and the bathroom is very small,you can't even open the door because it hits the toilet.

With few amenities and rooms on the smaller side the location makes up for its shortfalls. The hotel had some construction occurring on the street side façade. It is equal distance to Times Square and Central Park. It did have a nice size bar downstairs as well as a small shop for snacks and drinks. Our family had a great time and the beds were comfortable. With so much to do in the area we didn’t spend much time in the room. For the price point we had no complaints.

Great location. Super convenient to most major mid town sites and close to subway for ease of transportation. Stayed here with my daughters. It was a lovely stay and the staff was really great. Rooms were nice.

Wow! is all I can say from the time we step into the lobby... We were early on a red eye flight from Canada with little sleep and Saleem greeted us at reception. This guy bent over backwards to ensure we got a great room on a higher floor (Yes a free upgrade) and early check in with a box of chocolates! This just doesn't happen any more in our busy world. His manager Quimby was supported of his staff member too! These guys worked as a team to make sure my daughter and I were taken care of. Yes I would certainly recommend this hotel to family and friends. Good location, clean and exceptional staff!

I'll start at the beginning to describe this hotel. My girlfriends and I decided we wanted to do a girls trip to NYC, and we decided to look at Groupon and found this hotel. Researching reviews, it seemed like an ok deal. We read the small print and knew about the $20/person fee above 2 people in a room and the $35/night amenities fee. We booked it. Getting to the hotel was easy. Location was great. Check in - awful. The man who helped us check in, couldn't be more awful. He was so rude and dismissive. We were there at 3:30. He said your room won't be ready until 4. He was still able to check us in, and took the credit card info. But once that was done, he just stopped talking to us. We observed others coming in and going to a desk to get door keys so we figured that is what we would need to do at 4pm.We opted to store our bags so we could get coffee after a day of traveling. This is an amenity that you pay $35/night plus tax for. A man standing at a different desk literally takes your bag and throws it into a room 2 steps behind a door. When we came back a little after 4 to get our room keys we picked up our bags. The attendant literally said "I would like a tip". I wasn't happy with that as $35/night is excessive and the only 'amenity ' we would even use would be the bag store service. Not the attendant's fault for the hotel policy. However, the attendant didn't do anything to get the tip. If I could get my own bag from behind the door, I would have. Its not like they put them on carts or carried them for us. Nothing to me that was 'tippable'. And I'm typically a generous tipper. Elevators always seemed congested. We often had to wait more than 5 minutes, mostly less than 10 minutes for an elevator. We were on the 10th floor. Our housekeeper/maid Mariska or Marisha was the nicest person we met from NYC. She was so welcoming and helpful, and so positively happy with each encounter. We left a tip the first day and requested some extra towels. She delivered wonderfully. Talking about tipping, I do feel bad we didn't leave a tip the 2nd night. Our Lyft came a lot quicker than expected - within a minute and we knew the elevator situation so we grabbed our bags and flew down 10 flights of stairs to catch the Lyft. In the shuffle we forgot to leave money for her.The restrooms on the ground floor are clean. The lobby shop has a good selection but closes early. It is a great location to Rockefeller Center and Times Square. Small rooms. I was in a room with 2 queen beds. Overlooked an alley. Could hear the garbage trucks, horns, etc all night. Even 10 floors up. If we were to go back, I think I would try to find a nicer hotel. Again, the housekeeper was great, and the nicest person.

The Park Central Hotel is a first class establishment, the rooms are clean, nice bar, beautiful view and most important the service is above and beyond! Elizabeth at the Service desk was wonderful. She took the extra time to help us get into the room we wanted. She was very hospitable and made us feel very welcomed! Her extra effort put a more than can ask for first impression of the hotel and New York city!

After arriving early in the morning after a red eye flight and enquiring about our room, my mom and I were greeted in a very friendly and helpful manner. Saleem at the front desk made us feel like we were welcomed with warm arms as well as the manager on duty, Quimby. They even suprised us with getting our room ready early and even upgrading us to two queen beds for our week long Christmas vacation. So glad to have chosen a hotel that still values its guests and treats them like part of the family. Excellent location as well, and were able to store our luggage before checking in and after departing the hotel. Strongly recommend this choice, subway from JFK is only 2 blocks away!

I'm staying at Park Central Hotel for a work trip for a week, the reception team exceeds my expectation by solving me any issue, I sent some packages without my name on it and Quimby (that works here) help me out to solve this with no problem. Also, this hotel is well-located, just a few blocks from Columbus Circle, Central Park, 5th Ave, Bryant Park. If you are coming for pleasure or work, you should stay here.

My bf and I had a 5 night stay in Park Central Hotel. It was really easy to get to from JFK using the AirTrain and subway.Check in was swift and easy. You’ll need your keycard to use the elevators. We had a room on the third floor, and despite other reviews complaining of noise from the street, we slept soundly. If anything, the beds are a bit too soft....but that’s all personal preference. Spacious and roomy, and the shower is great. Our only gripe was that the hotel seemed a bit busy and there was always a queue for the elevator. Luckily being on the third floor we just took the stairs. It’s a great central base close to the subway and within walking distance of Times Square and Central Park, very close to Broadway also. It was a great trip for me and I’ll have fond memories of Park Central hotel, as I came with a boyfriend and left with a fiancé

The hotel is in a great location for first time visitors to NYC. majority of tourist attractions are in walking distance or can be accessed by subway. Very polite and helpful staff. Rooms very clean and comfortable. Cons: poor room lighting to check your makeup and outfits, but hey what does that matter in the grand scheme of it all

Came down to the city to enjoy the evening with two friends. Usually stay at a relatives house but decided on staying here instead. The service here is in impeccable starting with Emanuel at the fron desk. He sent us to times Square and recommended Tonic sports bar for the games.

Me and my boyfriend came down to NYC to enjoy the holiday rush. First time for me and I was in Awe. Emanuel st the front desk told us where to go to enjoy the tree and some ice skating. Couldn’t go wrong asking him where to get dinner as well. Tusacany steakhouse was great!! So great we booked an additional 2 whole nights.

Location was great. Right between Central Park and Times Square/Rockefeller Center. Room was a good size for NYC. No problems checking in or out and the concierge was very helpful. Would stay here again after shopping costs for other good hotels in the area.

Went there on my vac with my family, took an early flight and arrived at 5am. One staff member(Elizabeth) saw us waiting in the lobby with my kids falling asleep, she quickly helped us get an earlier check in! Thank you!

Exceeded expectations, the staff in particular Elizabeth where generously helpful and courteous which also reflected amongst her peers. Great service from the beautiful and detailed hotel. Comfortable room and the Park Central Hotel is perfectly located.

We checked in as part of a tour group singing in Carnegie Hall the week of Thanksgiving. My family and some friends checked in several days early to enjoy the city before the rest of the tour came in even though there were several large groups check-in was painless we didn't have adjacent rooms like we agree quested but when we got to our room and had some issues with the view asI had an elderly person who was going to be staying in the room most of the week so she could have a better View and we were accommodated immediately. Staff at the front desk also made arrangements so that we would not need to change rooms when our tour group arrived. Due to health issues we were accommodated with a fan, a mini fridge, and coffee maker we even got a call making sure we got let me ask for and if we were satisfied. We cannot say more about the staff from the minute we checked in we were able to leave our bags and had a recommendation for a place to eat nearby from the Bellman and also a great recommendation as to where to stand for the Thanksgiving Day Parade viewing. I cannot give enough praise to Quimby in customer service he always greeted me everyday and inquired about my day activities when we came back from the Thanksgiving Day Parade Frozen he greeted us with offers of hot coffee or a bottle of water. Such a very kind man representing that property amazingly well he also told me the history of the hotel and what famous people used to stay there it was very interesting. Carmelo (I have misplaced his card) the doorman was wonderful. We became friendly also and I looked forward to seeing him and visiting with him even though I generally used Uber he still helped me watch for my car He did give us help and tips regarding the cabs as we did Dean ever use them a few times also. Several days I traveled solo he would always say make sure if I'm working you check back in with me so I know you're okay. They both made me feel like I was almost family for them. I would pick this hotel again just because of the level of service that they displayed. It's an excellent location very walkable to many of the areas people want to do in New York City. Have a wonderful Premier Deli across the street with excellent food and a block and a half down Applejack Diner and McGee's Pub were wonderful recommendations all by the staff. I feel I left friends at this hotel I hope to return to the city. Our room was large the bed was extremely comfortable. The only issue we had is it could use some brighter lighting. We did request an additional floor lamp and it was brought in so my elderly friend could read. if you're looking for locations close to Central Park it's very close and Time Squares about a ten-minute walk very safe area to explore and enjoy the neighborhood. I hope Quimby and Carmillo are well recognized for their quality Ambassador services at this hotel. Pardon that hat hair with Quimby, we just walked in from being frozen at the coldest Thanksgiving Day Parade in New York City history LOL. Thanks from Fans from Kansas!

The location of the hotel is amazing, the staff was super nice and very helpful, specially Mr Quimby and Elizabeth in guest relations. The hotel was clean and tidy, WE wanted to stay longer but unfortunately rates when up due to NYC marathon.Only negative is the hotel doesn not have in dining service.

This hotel is close or in easy reach of all the attractions. Less than a 10 minute walk to Times Square. Clean rooms with comfy beds and plenty of storage. The staff were extremely helpful. Would stay here again

Amazing hotel, clean and rooms large and perfect for us.Man that checked us in was very rude and did not make any eye contact which was disappointing. However all other staff were great. Room cleaned everyday. Excellent location, 5 min walk to Central Park one way and 10 mins to Times Square the other way.

Very nice hotel. I have stayed at this hotel several times. Love the location. Easy to walk to Times Square, Central Park, and Rockefeller Center. Also, the Red Eye Grill is next door. Had a great dinner there. Thank

Hubby and I just got back from our little vacation in NYC yesterday. This hotel is near EVERYTHING! The rooms were modern and gorgeous. Staff was very accommodating and pleasant. Walk out of the hotel and look to the right and you see times square. Look to your left and you see Central Park. Everything was Within walking distance. We cannot wait for our next visit to the Park Central Hotel. Here is a pic of hubby paring the bar tab, please try the chocolate martinis

The location is great. The room is very old and could use some updating. Perhaps this is the case with most NY hotels, but there was no valet service here. Parking was 2 blocks away at least. The tub did not drain well and the TV remote did not work. Much of the bathroom hardware was mounted crooked and the bottom of the bathroom door looked water damaged. The staff were friendly, but the hotel rooms are not worth the price. This is an average hotel.

We were very excited to stay here but ended up being rather disappointed. First we request adjoining room they were noted on reservations 3 children ages 9-13. Rooms were 2 rooms apart they did find adjoining rooms after considerable time. They were rude at front desk when I questioned about my bill and would not explain a charge. The room maids were very nice and helpful. The elevators are a disaster especially if you are on a lower floor you have to Waite thru 4-5 times to get down stairs

Great place! Friendly staff and great location! When we arrived, they held our luggage until our room was ready so we could go exploring. The rooms were clean amd had everything we needed. I would definitely stay here again!

I haven't been to NYC in awhile and checked into the Park Central NY this morning and was treated like royalty. Literally, from the bellman who wouldn't let me lift a finger to the AMAZING Saleem and Angela at the Front Desk, who were so warm, helpful that I felt like I was "coming home" again! Q in Customer Service was exceptional as well....ALL of them deserve to know that weary travelers SO appreciate professionals like them.

Absolutely fantastic location, right up the street from times square. Staff in hotel friendly and helpful except the man who checked us in. No eye contact at all! Room spacious and cleaned everyday. Downside no Kettle or fridge in room. Very luxurious hotel and excellent location.

Perfectly located a block south of Central Park and walking distance to everything in midtown. Also close to the subway station on 7th. We had a corner room on the 8th floor. Nice view, but probably would get a higher floor next time, as the traffic noise was noticeable (but not horrible). Rooms were nice and beds comfortable. They felt smaller than the photos suggest, but it is NYC and was plenty big enough for us. Staff was incredibly nice, and we enjoyed the bar/lounge. Only real knock was the elevators, which are small, few and often crowded. Wish they had coffee makers. Book online and in advance to save some dough.

We had a group of international scholars who attended our Syracuse University conference and stayed at the hotel for two nights. Park Central Hotel has always been our first choice hotel in NYC. The hotel has the best location and excellent service! All the staff from front desk to sales department exceeded our expectations every time! Riley Allen and Alicia Nunez in the sales department are both very helpful and flexible in our group bookings. Our special thanks to Riley who paid personal attention to our group during our stay. Thank you for the extremely professional service, patience, flexibility and responsiveness to any of our requests. It is very clear why we highly recommend this hotel. We could not do what we’ve done programmatically and within budget without the Park Central and absolutely plan on more group stays and workshops in NYC in the future!

Location was perfect-- a couple of blocks south of Central Park and a short walk to the theater district. The beds were super comfortable and we had a spacious, modern double queen, but no coffee makers or mini-fridge. The staff was hit or miss; most were friendly and helpful, but a few were the opposite. I spent 30 minutes on the phone requesting a late checkout, yet they still deactivated our room keys anyway. We liked the large, modern lobby and bar. Overall we would recommend to others. Note that check-in is 4 pm. High floor if possible.

Went with others who were performing at Carnegie Hall (almost across the street) and thoroughly enjoyed our 5 night stay. Close to fabulous restaurants, delis and things to see, Out 6th floor room overlooked 7th. Ave., and was a very nice room for both of us. Would stay here again and was very close to the south end of Central Park.

Hotel was clean, comfortable and a good location. Could have used brighter lighting and more elevators, but the staff was friendly and accommodating. Can cross off seeing New York at Christmas off my bucket list. Very enjoyable trip.

We stayed at park central for two nights.. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The location is fantastic, within walking distance to Times square and Central park. The only negative I have, is there's no parking offered here, you're pretty much on your own to find a place, We would def stay here again.

This was our first time to NYC, and our stay could not have been better. The staff was excellent and extremely accomodating the entire time! This was one of the best hotel experiences my wife and I have ever had while on vacation! Every request was met with a smile and every question answered quickly and thoroughly. We will definitely be back to stay at this hotel and will recommend everyone we know.

My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights. We were lucky enough that our room was ready on arrival and we were able to check in early. We had issues with the bathroom light flickering and reception sent the maintenance guy to sort it within a hour. We were impressed that they phoned our room later to check it had been done. All reception staff, bar staff, maintenance and housekeeping friendly and polite. Room was clean and tidy but the carpet by the skirting and the skirting is filthy also the wall by bathroom sink had toothpaste splashes every where. We had a room on the front corner and it was noisy but hey this is New York and you get used to it and we did sleep well. Beds are really comfy. You can feel the draft from the window but we kept the heating on so it was fine. We stayed here last year and it was as good this year. We would stay here again when next in New York as it is a a great location with a selection of good restaurants close by.

Rooms are very clean, and spacious. Furniture, shower, appliances all feel high end, new and shiny.Elevators could be crowded at peak times...The staff is extremely nice but not pushy. Anytime I needed anything, it was a matter of minutes until it was provided.Special thanks to Elizabeth, who was so kind, and helped me with extending my check out time, after my flight was delayed.. Location is perfect, and also close to many subway lines.Overall an outstanding stay!

Stayed in this hotel with my two teenagers. Fantastic location, close to central park and Times Square. We had a room to the rear so no street noise so that was great. Only down side: three people in the room should mean 3 towels. Nope, one day we had none and where questioned as to why we wanted 3?The second day we were given only 2 so had to share. If there are 3 people in a hotel room, there should be 3 towels. Not much tip was left based on that poor service from housekeeping.

The front desk clerk, Ana, was amazing. She was very caring and helpful. We could not have asked for better customer service. Ana fulfilled all of our requests. We will definitely be recommending this hotel to our family and friends.Regards,Amy

I really wish to thank Elizabeth of the customer relationship desk: she was so supportive in providing me help! i needed to check out a little bit late than the usual schedule (12:00) and nothwithstanding a fully booked hotel rooms for the following day she gave me the opportunity to stay untill 16:00!

My aunt and I stayed here for a long weekend in November for my birthday. It was in a great location. There was a diner we went to every day for at least one meal. I did try to keep in mind that it was a busy weekend since it was marathon weekend. The hotel was definitely full. Since the hotel was full, we had to wait at least 5 or more minutes for the elevator to go up or down. There was always a line to get on the elevator to go up to our room. Elevators were quite small for such a big hotel. Our room was nice. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. However, we did not have a refrigerator or mini bar in our room. The bar in the hotel was nice - nice bartenders but did not serve any food. Overall, our stay was ok.

Fantastic views, hotel was close to central park and shopping. Great service from Elsa at the front desk. I would defiantly stay again. Great overall experience. Thank you Park Central Hotel and Elsa.

I have stayed I can´t remember how many times at the PC, I call it home in NYC, the friends I have made there , that make my stay time after time are great, Nancy , Elizabeth, Angela, etc all so helpfull always, the rooms I get are so comfortable and the hotel is located just where one would want it to be , ALL THE BEST TO ALL AT MY DEAR PARK CENTRAL HOTEL

We just finished our 3 night stay and was very impressed. Great location blocls from central park, rockefeller center, times square. Was able to walk to everything. Ana at the front desk was extremely helpful and vary sincere. She was able to get us checked in early without me even asking. As a large family, this was a pleasant surprise. Great experiebce and would definitely come back.

We have just returned today after a 4 night stay in this hotel and were left disappointed. Arriving to a less than warm greeting where we were told we had already checked in at 10:30am (we were at 41,000 feet and over the Atlantic at this time so check in would have been difficult) this confusion took 20 minutes to sort and was largely the colleague at the desk frowning at the screen in complete silence with a couple of “Card Please” and “Name Please” thrown in for good measure. The room itself was great, a nice big bed, really clean and a lovely view of the Xmas shop on the street below. A little bit noisy but you don’t book New York for a quiet getaway. The bar was also a great chill out spot for us too.Back to the staff at the hotel though.....I spoke to a guest relations about how I was planning to propose to my girlfriend and could she recommend any nice restaurants to celebrate. “No, you’ll have to speak to concierge was what I had as a reply and we actually counted in passing how many times this lady actually smiled when passing (It was zero) In comparison the concierge shook my hand, congratulated me and took the time to tell me about all of his favourite spots.We also went to ask about the hotel facilities but noticed the person at the counter was actually shopping for dresses on our way out of the bar which must have been why she didn’t make eye contact or acknowledge us to the point where we walked away.On checkout we had our bill posted under the door at 6am with some lovely additional charges from the person who had been checked in under our name in error. These were removed after we proved we weren’t even at the hotel at the time.So the common theme was the service here. The hotel is really nice and in a great location. A handful of the staff clearly love their jobs and work hard to reflect well on the hotel. The rest of the people we encountered didn’t represent the hotel well at all and left me feeling annoyed on more than one occasion.

We stayed at the Park Central Hotel during the New York City Marathon. It was a great atmosphere with all the runners. Loved the location, so close to everything, especially Central Park. The staff were so accomodating and friendly. We had a great experience with Carolyn on reception, who helped us out with a room change. A great stay.

Enjoyed our visit at hotel. It is centrally located with a very personable housekeeping staff (especially Martza) and a beautiful young woman who helped in the lobby at check-in. The lobby cafe was perfect for AM cappuccino or snacks.

The Room is great! Clean, Pretty, Roomy.No Room service, in fact...not much service at all. If you're an Independent traveler that doesn't need ANY help, stay here. If you want ANY ammenties, keep looking.The only way a Midtown hotel provides these rates is by denying service. I. I'm fine with that, but if you need help, you'll be disappointed.

This hotel was recommended by 2 friends of mine who stayed in February and then April. Great location! The hotel overall was very clean however there are only 4 elevators for this big hotel and there was always a line! We ended up walking the steps the majority of the time which is not pleasant when you’ve walked 10 miles touring the city. There were 4 staying in our room and I indicated that on our reservation, however, not enough towels for everyone in the room! My family left at different times on check out day and my brother and his wife waited 30 minutes to check their luggage at the luggage hold! Not enough staffing or elevators for holiday traffic was our experience.

Stayed at this hotel for a one night girls trip. The check in guy Emanuel was such a charm. He gave us all the highlights of the city and we couldn’t wait. Recommended Vida Verde for drinks and they were great. Can’t wait for our return this summer.

When I arrived to the hotel there was a long line. As soon as one guy came in he moved the line fast. I ended up getting him to check me in and he was just great. I believe his name was Emanuel. Later that day I was looking for some night life and he knew it all. Sent me to Iguanas and I enjoyed salsa night.

So upon arrival I noticed that everyone was friendly. The one guy Emanuel at the front desk checked us in and gave us all the information we needed to get around. I’m hoping to come back soon just because of this kind of service. Couldn’t ask for anything more.

I have never written a review before however the service provided by Elizabeth (guest relations) warrants one. Elizabeth was superb with us and ensured that our comfort was a priority of hers, which helped make our stay at Park Central a much better stay. Moreover she was very friendly and provided great recommendations for us. Thanks very much Elizabeth for helping to make our first visit to NYC an unforgettable one. Joe & Sonia

Loved the hotel and the location. Room was clean, bathroom was nice, beds were very comfortable. Four of us stayed in a room with two queen sized beds. Hotel is a short walk from Radio City Music Hall and 5th Ave. Try the Souvlaki Grill near by for delectable and fresh Greek food. So good. Only negative to hotel is a daily $80 facilities fee. They will hold your luggage if you arrive early or have to leave after checking out, but want to spend the afternoon in the city before heading home.

My friends and I stayed at the Park Central this October. Over 1000 dollars worth of clothing was stolen out of my friend’s bag. The hotel has done nothing to rectify this and it’s been beyond frustrating. The bathroom also smelled like Mildew. Perhaps the housecleaning staff is too busy stealing from guests to clean properly? Don’t stay here!

We chose this hotel for location and thought it would be great place for our girls weekend. Unfortunately, we found the cleanliness of the room and bathroom to be sub par, to say the least. That was not the worst part though. My friend had a significant amount of personal belongings stolen and the hotel said there was nothing they could do about it. I definitely DO NOT recommend this hotel to anyone!!

The hotel is located at the center of Manhattan and walking distance from all the main attractions. We only interacted one time with the customer service and Elizabeth was super helpful and friendly!!

First time In new York city and staying here has given us the best experience. EMANUEL AT THE FRONT DESK GREETED us upon arrival and told us the history of the hotel and afterwards made sure that we knew all The best restaurants and places to visit.

This hotel really suits our needs every time we visit New York. You can not beat the location. It is in walking distance for most everything you want to see and subways station close to everything. The rooms were redone a few years ago and are very comfortable. Ours did show a bit of wear this time. The staff for the most part is very accommodating but the front desk seem a little disinterested. The maids are some of the friendliest and polite we have encountered. The access and parking at the hotel has changed and there is no longer valet parking due to construction around the hotel. There was confusion about where the self park was located when we arrived which caused a bit of frustration. However, over all this is still the best reasonably priced option for convenience and comfort in NYC!

Our choir stayed here while practicing to sing "The Messiah" at Carnegie Hall over Thanksgiving. DCINY who produces the concert took care of the reservations. As we were practicing in the lower area of the hotel, this made for the perfect spot. Our accommodations were very good and there is a great bar in the lobby; however, on our first night which was Thanksgiving night, they ran out of any kind of hors'douvres - no meat for the charcuterie tray and no olives for the cheese tray (the cheese that they did bring was a bit stale) but as we were quite a big group, it gave us a great place to meet and mingle. There is no restaurant in the hotel, just a place to get coffee, snacks and pastries. It is an ideal location as it was just across the street from Carnegie Hall where we were performing and located on 7th Ave. at 56 and 57 streets makes getting downtown or to Central Park really convenient.

This hotel is in a good location and facilities are perfect. However dont expect a warm reception checking in. As you walk in don’t go to right hand desk .... go left. We made mistake and two ladies didn’t want to check in our group of 4. But we were using one credit card for four rooms. This put them both in grumpy mood. It seemed that they didn’t get along with one another. They said I Was in 956 and they wrote this number on key cars holder. Went here and couldn’t get in had to go back to reception ...which. I was dreading. So went to staff at left hand side. She was very friendly and apologetic as lady had written down wrong room number. I was in 656 instead of 956. Not good when all you want to do is get to your room. The two ladies had very poor attitude. Otherwise everyone else we spoke to in hotel couldn’t help enough

Do not stay at the Park Central! My friend had clothing stolen and the hotel refused to reimburse he for the stolen items. They made he jump through hoops for 6 weeks before telling her that there was nothing they could do. So disappointing! The hotel was also filthy! Find a better hotel if you visit New York

Do not stay in this hotel!!! I can’t caution you enough. I went to New York for a fun weekend with my girlfriends and left disappointed and completely violated. While we were in New York we decided to stay at Park Central, we believed it was good hotel and liked it’s location. While staying at the hotel, someone riffeled through my belongings and stole items from my room and directly out of my suitcase. I notified the hotel immediately about the incident. After months of jumping through hoops and dealing with their insurance, I was told there is nothing they can do and I am sorry. What a joke!!! I’m the loser here, not only did I pay to stay there but I had stuff stolen. Double whammy!!! They clearly have a thief amongst their staff and do not have the proper security measures in place to handle it. Shocked to find out the hallways do not have cameras! Again, beyond upset and left disappointed with what was supposed to be a fun getaway.

Very good hotel, look for Quimby in gest relations, he’s so nice and helped me with everything that I needed! The room is very good, confortable, and the hotel is near to Central Park and Time Square.

This hotel is central and walking distance to everything. Very clean and the staff are amazing. There are 25 floors and you want to be as high as you can as you can really hear everything outside. I was on the 14th floor. I will stay there again on my next trip.

it is our first family vacation in NY city and we had a very good experience with this hotel. we got a good deal with a package of $10 parking for 24 hrs. They had an excellent costumer service, especially Ms Carolyn, very kind, polite, friendly... name it! so awesome!

We've been visiting our son in NYC for 7 years and every year we stay at the Park Central Hotel. We've rarely had any issues and if we do, the staff is very helpful and swift to resolve. By far our favorite part of our yearly stay is the Bar/Lounge behind the lobby. Nancy (the server) and John (the bartender) have always been kind, professional and really make us feel special. Nancy always remembers our drink order without us saying a word and John makes the best vodka martini in town! The hotel itself is within walking distance of Central Park, Columbus Circle and the shops of 5th Ave! If you're looking for an upscale-like hotel for a great price and in a great part of town the Park Central is your place!

Totally enjoyed my stay here. Room a little noisy but pretty much excellent service from staff. Emanuel was great. We couldn’t ask for more. Looking forward to our return next year. Holidays are the best in NYC.

Chose this hotel due to our group’s choral rehearsals being held here, as well as very close proximity to Carnegie Hall (diagonally across 7th Avenue from hotel). Very convenient for what I was in NYC to do. Friendly, professional staff at registration desk and concierge was helpful. The hotel lobby area and bar are very nice. Conveniently located to Central Park, subway stops, about 10 block walk to Times Square. Nearby restaurants - Applejack Diner which is good for breakfast, and Serafina - good Italian, both about 2 blocks from hotel. (Hotel does not have a restaurant. There is a place to purchase coffee, muffins, pastry, fruit, small snack items, but we found it expensive. (2 medium lattes and 2 muffins were almost $20. You then can then take it to the bar area to eat.)Our initial room was a king room (1408) and the light in the bathroom mirror was so dim, you could really not see well. There was no chair in the room and it was tight between end of bed and dresser. We called for maintenance concerning the dim light, and they said this particular room had “different bulbs” in the bathroom mirror than most of the other rooms and nothing could be done. After speaking to guest relations, we were able to move to another room 3 doors down. This room was larger, had a chair, a well-lit bathroom BUT, was very hot and stuffy, even though we turned the temp down. Maintenance was called to this room and they explained due to age of building, they either had to have air conditioning or heat on, but could not switch back and forth; and since it was now winter, heat had been turned on, so only way to cool the room was to open a window. (A little noisy, but we did this to cool off the room.) Totally understand that this is because of age of the building, but just something to keep in mind. Room price changes for weekend and weekdays may be a little less. A facilities fee applies automatically. Hair dryer, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, lotion, soap supplied.

The people are so exceptional, especially Quimby Hightower. They were so helpful and considerate. We were there on a business trip with our company, and they helped us out with multiple requests that we had.

This hotel is perfectly situated for a sightseeing trip to NYC. A few minutes up to Central Park and a short walk straight down into Times Square. Really reasonably priced with big rooms, comfy beds and clean bathrooms. They are my criteria for a good hotel. Staff are helpful if needed.I have been here two years running and will use again, which probably tells you more than my ramblings! Highly recommend.

The hotel is located very close to Central Park. Very convenient. We stayed in the deluxe room w 2 queens and found it perfect for our family. The lobby and lounge are beautiful. The room is comfortable. Would definitely stay again.

This is my second stay at the hotel and I will certainly come again. Its perfect location was accompanied by a comfortable and clean room and most important - the hotel staff is always welcoming and helpful. Special thanks to Quimby, from guest relations, who was super kind and warm on a cold November day. Happy Thanks Giving!

We were celebrating our little man's third birthday with a non-rushed outing and stay in New York and I am so glad that we chose to stay at the Park Central Hotel! Upon arrival, we were greeted promptly and friendly in a manner that made me feel less rushed (on a busy city street, yes!)and instantly relaxed. Doing anything with a three year old can be tough but there was nothing but smiles to be found. Making our way to the desk to check in, the decor is modern yet familiar with bright tones and clean lines, classically modern would be a decent term. The ladies at the desk were delightful, informative, and genuine as well as quick which was very much appreciated! Making our way up to the room, the halls seem a little narrow, but then you open the door to a large room which, compared to other places we have stayed, was a pleasant and welcome surprise! Comfortable and clean it lends to an air of quiet ambiance (of course if you listen closely you will remember what a busy area of a major city you are in)but that can'tbe helped. There are so many choices to get a bite to eat, and as for an adult beverage...I suggest the lounge! Perfectly mixed cocktails and a relaxed yet sophisticated feel! The next day sealed our Platinum stamp of approval. Check out was simple and easy, however, we needed to have our bags held for a couple of hours while we took an early afternoon stroll to the Central Park Zoo and surrounding park. Not only was it not an issue, Quimby Hightower made it a delight! He gave us his card for our bags stating that it isn't an issue at all and when we returned had a Park Central Hotel tote full of goodies for the ride home and a balloon, and presented it to our little guy for his birthday! Those little things, attention to detail, genuine kindness, personable while remaining professional...they add up to create unforgettable experiences and a top choice when returning to the area! Highly suggest staying here.

As most savvy travelers, we spent “ hours” searching for our special NY trip with our Mom. We are from Vegas and San Francisco , CA ( we have our standards ) One of the reasons we booked almost a year in advance, was to have connecting rooms, with our Elderly Mother. I personally called the hotel 3-4 times to confirm details. Well...when we arrived ( separately) the check in was a nightmare ! No connecting rooms, room rate was changing , we are now located in separate buildings and the attitude was awful. You could only imagine our disappointment. The Managers on duty. tried to patch us up, but it wasn’t good. So the next morning we reached out to Quimby Hightower. He sat down with us, addressed every little concern and literally listened ( like a therapist ) we needed one for sure ! This amazing Gentleman is the glue to Park Central! He made sure we were in the same building, our rooms were satisfactory, would check in on us and even called to say goodbye! Traveling can be stressful no matter how smooth all goes! But he saved us from serious frustration! Because of his attention to detail and incredible professionalism our trip was flawless. Give that man a raise !

I always stay at park central hotel because of the special treatment they give to their loyal guests, and also because Ms Elizabeth Cacovic makes sure that I will get the best service ever! The location is the best in town and the room is clean, beautiful And comfortable. My family and I have been loyalClients since the 80’s and we consider the park central our home in New York City! Thank you for the outstanding services and the kindness always provided by all employees até the front desk and housekeeping. I just love this hotel and I strongly recommend it.Miriam Magalhães from São Paulo Brazil

We’ve stayed here a few times over the last couple of years and love the location. I reserved a King room but as it was not available for an early check in, took a queen double and was able to check in three hours earlier making us very happy. The bathroom was very nice and immaculately clean, beds were comfortable. I was surprised at no coffee machine or fridge in the room but there was a safe. Once we realized we’d lost our parking garage ticket, Quimby came to the rescue by first offering us complimentary coffee and croissants, then solving our parking garage problem without blinking an eye. (Hotel offers a package with $10 nearby parking) Housekeeping for our room was also very friendly.

Alicia and Riley were very helpful as well as a pleasure to work with on the planning of our annual New York trip. The hotel is very nicely done with a terrific location near the park! Our group of 50 gave it all high remarks! I would definitely recommend the Park Central Hotel! Mary M

I greatly appreciate the help we received from Elizabeth. She works at guest services and was extremely kind and great help. She examplified great customer service. The stay was good and the room was nice and clean with no complaints! Definitely recommend!

As soon as my husband and I walked in, we were astonished. Elizabeth took amazing care of us and made the process quick, easy, & painless ! We sat in the sofas while she finished with another guest and came right to us to assist us. This was the best customer service I have ever experienced hands down because of Elizabeth! We’ve stayed at many hotels in the past, but this is definitely somewhere we will return due to our amazing experience. If you come to New York I would definitely recommend booking with Park Central Hotel & recommending Elizabeth to help you.

We had great time in Park Central Hotel New York. Special thanks for Mrs Alicia Nunez she gave us a lot of help. Durring our stay in the hotel everything was convenient, the location was perfect for us. I would recommend this hotel for shorter or longer stay.

This is my 5th stay and another enjoyable stay at the hotel. Our room was clean & comfortable with a great view of the city. Our stay was made even more enjoyable by Miguel, the concierge. He was able to get us tickets to the play Chicago with great seats. He is friendly and knowledgeable about the city and what it has to offer. The location of this hotel is very convenient. Walking distance to Time Square, Central Park & 5th Avenue stores.

Our stay was delightful. The rooms were ready and clean. Our second stay here and we were treated very well. Concierge is knowledgeable of area and restaurants. Carolyn always had a smile on her face. Thanks so much Park Central!

huge hotel and nonstop busy.....with continuous flow of international tourists, business visitors and due to the UN week when I was here NYPD armed to the teeth as apparently foreign VIP on 2 floors;front desk staff friendly and helpful, floor staff too, very nice and welcoming, this isn't always the case in US hotelsroom is well enough equipped

Great location close to Central Park and the theater district. Amazing staff. Could t be more helpful and any glitches were handled with ease. Rooms were clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend staying here.

The hotel was really clean the hospitality of all staff was amazing. Can't wait to stay really soon. Staying on 42 st was amazing and the rate for a night was super reasonable. When i return i will have a longer stay.❤

The two defining words that easily come to my mind when reflecting back on my recent stay at the “Park Central Hotel” are “genuine” and “enjoyable”! Moreover, throughout my entire stay at this terrific hotel, I was always in such a very good mood and I attribute this at least in part to a most welcoming hotel staff. Obviously, this hotel is located in one of the best New York City zip codes, which undeniably is the main attraction for booking a reservation. However, there are other good reasons as well to stay at the “Park Central Hotel”, which include: the hotel is extremely well run, immaculately clean and the daily room rates generally do not fluctuate much in comparison to other NYC hotels’ daily room charges. Although this hotel is very busy with over 900 guest hotel rooms, not once did I ever encounter a problem with hotel management when requesting to extend my stay and I did this at least several times while I was a guest. The hotel lobby is quite grand and has a lounge area that includes a huge bar with lots of banquet seating and where seasoned bartenders make excellent mixed drinks. However, there is no restaurant at this hotel but it is easy to order in food from several nearby restaurants. Also in the hotel lobby is an excellent coffee/pastry shop with very fresh daily selections. The coffees offered are all excellent and Gina who works there has to be one of the nicest people you will ever encounter. In addition to this, the hotel reception staff all are completely organized and sincerely friendly. I did want to specifically mention Angela as she made certain that my check in went smoothly and that any special requests I had were met. She was as perfectly pleasing as possible and this is an employee who obviously excels at customer service. In summation: The Park Central Hotel is an excellent yet less expensive hotel in comparison to other nearby hotels that are all in a prime NYC location and is an ideal choice to stay at. Many of the guests staying there that I spoke with indicated to me that they felt the same sentiments as I did and absolutely enjoyed the overall experience of being a patron at a hotel that knows exactly how to treat all their guests in a most special way. I highly recommend this hotel inasmuch as staying there made me feel as if I had escaped the busy outside city life in exchange for the serenity that awaited me inside at the very special “Park Central Hotel”! Thanks again to the entire hotel staff for making my stay most enjoyable. Jeff M.

I would like to commend the staff of the hotel as well as the room service, in particular, Mrs. Nancy V., guest assistant, who always greets us very promptly and sympathetically! I highly recommend the hotel and look for Mrs. Nancy V.!

We stayed at the Park Central Hotel for a recent business trip. I worked with Nicole Kottmann ahead of time for all the online reservations. her service was excellent and always took care of any changes i had. Then, once I arrived, Saleem was on site and became our contact. his service was above and beyond and always done with a smile. he was an excellent contact and there to help in any way needed. Saleem was the best! Thank you for your excellent service and excellent staff! Karen

This hotel is very trendy. I love the atmosphere and special gratitude to men that work at entrance opening doors, taking care of luggage and hailing cabs.What I did not like is the fact that all facilities are pretty dark, including rooms. Also, my room was freezing cold. Yes, I called for help, no, they did not fix it. That’s why they get one star down.

The hotel is very well located if you need to be in the midtown area (either East Side or West Side, or down to the Broadway area as well), and was quite efficient in terms of check-in and check-out (express checkout option available with just a key drop).The rooms were fairly large, well-appointed and comfortable. Wifi was free and fairly quick despite I'm sure many people using it. Only minor observation is that the lighting in the rooms were a bit dim, but other than that it was a good choice for myself on a one-day business trip, but would say it would be pretty suitable for a family visit as well.

We received an exelent service from Elizabeth, Sokha and Nancy ! You should take this hotel in your next visit to NY!!!!! They give us a late check out when we need it so, we can do our baggs without hurry!!!!! Thank you girls!!!!!

Besides being very kind, they helped me with my late check out ... they allowed me to come back from the forum and finish my bags calmly.Thank you very much .. they are the best.. excellent service !!! You have to come and visit this hotel very soon.

Just wanted to say this is my 1st time staying at the Park Central in NYC. After attempting to check in early and trying to upgrade our room I was originally told there were no upgrades available and I would have to wait in the lobby until my original room was ready. Elizabeth stepped in and with amazing efficiency and kindness worked her magic! She located an available upgraded room and within 10 minute she issued me a key and put a smile on my face!Thank for your professionalism and kindness!HAlston

Park Central Hotel NY is THE location FOR EVERYTHING New York as to offer.the rooms are great with a view looking down to Times Square. The cleanliness of the hotel is top notch. The staff is so hospitable and friendly. we arrived the day of the NY Marathon and the hotel had a full occupancy, but with a lobby filled with the runners the front desk warmly welcomed us.Walking out the front door allowed us steps to 5th Avenue & all the shopping and restaurants The big apple offers. Getting a cab or Uber was a breeze too.in the morning the lobby cafe offers great coffee & healthy items & pastries.we were 100% pleased.

This is my third visit. Other than the location, the best thing about this hotel is the staff they were very helpful especially Mr.Quimby. The bell services were also very friendly .I highly recommend this hotel.Regard,

Only stay in this hotel if your prepared for the facilities charge at the end. Completely ruined our trip when a bill for $200.00 was pushed under the door on our last night. Yes, in the fine print local charges were spoken of but in no way was this communicated to us by the hotel at check in nor was the amount. The room itself was spacious, clean and the bed was comfy but very noisy at night.

Just checked into this gem in Manhattan, and had a warm and efficient check in experience with Sumeel (apologies if spelling is wrong). Great smile, warm greeting, and I was in my room within about 5 minutes. The room itself is terrific and large by New York standards. Clean, quiet (interior room), comfortable temp, quick elevator up. This may my new place to stay when I’m in New York!

NYC...and just a few blocks walk to Times Square and a lovely hotel. Our desk check in guy Emanuel was Superb! The bar closed a bit earlier than they said they were going to...so we came in after a long day and they would not let us gather in there at 9:30pm...they closed at 10pm

From the moment me and my mother checked in we were greeted by the most accommodating and plesant staff members Elizabeth and Sokha. They both were Absolutely Wonderful! This hotel far exceeded my expectations-it is contemporary and sheek. Despite purchasing my room through Groupon I wasnt given a subpar room which has been my experience in the past with other Groupon hotel purchases. My room was clean, smelt wonderful and everything worked as it should. The hotel was also located about a block away from the metro station. I would definitely stay at Park Central hotel again when visiting NY.

I stayed for 8 nightsThe location is great, big rooms,the stuff is so nice and helpful.Specially Elizabeth that was so nice and did her best to make our stay so great and fun .I will definitely come back

Very happy with the attention from ANGELA, he was great! 5 stars.The hotel is very nice, nice rooms, 2 blocks from Central Park and in the same street of Times Square al the best of the best! Thanks for the service!

Spent 5 nights here November 5 to 10 2018 ,excellent hotel wanted to bring the bed home with me ,front desk were really friendly as well as cleaning ladies and maintenance guy.stayed on fifth floor didn’t find it too noisy it’s New York so you are going to hear traffic

This is a great location – far enough from Times Square that its not too messy and close to both subway, central park, 5th avenue to make it very practical. It’s a nice hotel – with a strange setup. There’s no restaurant and consequently no room service either. This I have no problem with – generally speaking Id rather go out anyway and for some reason or another, hotel breakfasts in the USA are notoriously bad. Never quite figured out why – but rarely is it worth the money or the bother. The room we had was large with two double beds – in New York hotels rooms are not large in general. This was perfect. Either you could face inwards – with 5 meters to the next building/window – or outwards towards Carnegie hall, with the noise from the street as an added bonus. Again – this is New York, so it should come to no surprise to anyone. Only two elevators served our floor – and since the hotel was pretty full – at times you could expect to queue up for elevators. All in all I liked the hotel – there’s always a but, there were a few things I did not like. Some of the staff was great – in particular the concierge, the doorman getting taxis was absolutely great (didn’t catch his name) and the assistant manager who assisted me when we had a check out problem with the credit card charges. But the check-in and check-out staff were at best not interested, at worst rude. And not New York arrogant – I mean rude. Strange that the front desk from left to right can be so different. Our wedding anniversary was during our visit, so I picked up flowers – but the hotel could not offer up a vase – not in any shape or form. For what is supposedly a first class hotel - that’s a first for me. And the final part that I did not appreciate – although I liked the room size – it was far from clean. Im not particularly sensitive, but when I see the sense in going to buy a box of Clorox to wipe down the surfaces you get the picture. Picked up old bottle tops from the floor underneath the desk, etc. You get the picture – it just generally did not feel clean and wasn’t either from the look of the used Clorox wipes. That is certainly not acceptable. Will we be back – perhaps. At the right price … sure. At the price we paid this time around, no.

First time to NYC and I read so many reviews on so many different hotels before deciding to stay at the Park Central Hotel even though there were some negative reviews and I am so glad we didn’t listen to those reviews. We stayed Nov 5-10 and the hotel was super nice, clean and well maintained. Yes there is no coffee maker, microwave or fridge but I think u can get that if requested but why would you want to since everything is so close to the hotel you can get coffee downstairs, across the street, next door or two doors down (Starbucks). And yes there is no restaurant but once again, so many great choices so close to you. Go out and explore. The hotels location is perfect, far enough out of Times Square to get away from the crowd but close enough you can be there in a few mins. Central Park, broadway and 5th ave are only a few mins away, and also subway stations super close (and super easy to use). The beds are so comfortable and the rooms are much more spacious than lots of other hotels we looked at that were more expensive than the Park Central. Even though a lot of reviews say upgrade to get a room on a higher level to get a quieter room and a view, you don’t need to, my husband and I booked the classic king room and we ended up on the 6th floor and it was perfect, you could hear a bit of noise outside but we had the fan on our heating/cooling system on and it was perfect. My parents booked a classic king room as well and ended up on the 5th floor and they had no complaints either. And if you book higher for a view I don’t think you would get much a view cause you are surrounded by taller buildings. Don’t trust a lot of those negative reviews, I am a very picky person when it comes to where I stay and this hotel met my high standards. We all loved the hotel and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to the city. The Park Central helped make our family trip to NYC perfect.

Wonderful stay! Clean and close to everything! Carolyn was amazing and helpful. Room wasnt too small close to time square and central park. Great walk to breakfast places and restaurants. My husband and I had a blast!

due to our itinerary we selected a midtown location, which the park central fulfilled. generally hotels in NYC are more expensive than we are used to paying, so it came as a bit of a disappointment that our basic room did not include a refrigerator, microwave, or coffee maker. in addition, we did not have a working clock, and there was no fan in the bathroom. the shampoo and soaps were a brand that we did not care for, so we bought some we preferred at a nearby drug store. the best thing about the park central was the terrific service we received from the guest relations manager, elizabeth cacovic, who upgraded our room and provided an extra bed for my son, who visited with us for 1 night, at no extra charge. she also upgraded friends who stayed over the weekend, providing them with a suite at no extra charge. she went out of her way to be sure we enjoyed our say at the hotel. jamal, one of the bartenders at the hotel, was a very skilled mixologist who provided delicious drinks, and the concierge arranged a very reasonably priced limo ride to newark airport for us.

I checked in today (8th Nov) and found that the room was extremely cold. This was due to a gap in one of the windows. I called housekeeping / maintenance 5 times but nobody turned up for >1 hour. The maintenance engineer came eventually and fixed the air conditioning to heat up a little, but said in quite a flat tone that he cannot do anything about the faulty window! And the heating "should compensate for the cold draft"I thought i can expect a little more courtesy than this and a concrete resolution. I am horribly late for my dinner appointment now as i hope that this temporary solution has worked before I leave my mother alone in the room. I cant wait to imagine what kind of experience is in store with this property.

My family and I are traveling across America and have been here for a month and stayed at numerous resorts and hotels.We paid in full to stay at The Park Central almost 6 months prior to our stay, upon arrival and check in the reception staff did not mention the additional charge of the facility fee and it wasn’t until we looked at the website after checking in that we seen this fee mentions on their site.The hotel lobby is nice as is the bar area but the hotel is let down by not having a hotel restaurant or even room service.The rooms are small but that’s ok given we were out and about most of the time. Housekeeping did a good job, they cleaned daily. However upon arrival when inspecting the bathroom there is some sort of something on the walls that doesn’t look like there has ever been any attempt to clean it off. We stayed for 8 nights, on night 2 we reported that our room phone wasn’t working and nothing was done about it. On day 3 we reported the phone again and nothing was done about it. The night before the Marathon my husband tried to call reception to request a wake up call and AGAIN the phone still wasn’t working. Numerous times we had to go looking for housekeeping to advise them they could make up our room because the phone wasn’t working and we couldn’t call them.Finally my husband for a 4th time went and requested for someone to fix the phone and it was suggested by the guest relations staff that we didn’t know how to use a phone and that it wasn’t broken and it was user error. This time they sent a lovely gentleman to come to the room to look at the phone, he was lovely, we’ll mannered and took a lot of pride in his work. This man is the kind of person they are luck to have working for them. He ascertain that the phone was unplugged at the back and that the handset needed a new battery. He fixed it quickly and but it would have been nice if it was fixed when it was first reported, it was a big inconvenience in our stay.Would I stay here again, no and my suggestion to others is factor in the “facility fees” to your budget as the faculty fee plus costs to stay at this hotel you might be able to find somewhere that doesn’t have the fee for the same price.Please note that all issues were raised with Guest Relations who committed to responding however at the time of writing this review upon checking out no response has been provided. Very disappointing.

We stayed here for 3 nights the weekend of the NYC marathon. We actually didn't know this was marathon weekend when we booked. Oops. Anyway, my husband and 10 year old daughter and I had a very good experience at Park Central. We arrived super early Saturday and didn't expect our room to be ready that early. We checked in and stored our baggage with the bellman. That process was the worst thing during our stay. We were in line for at least 15 min while the bellman went into the back room to track down a package for someone in front of us. Frustrating. Our room was good. We had a premier double queen room on the 14th floor. We overlooked the backside of the hotel, which was actually great because I think it was quieter. The room was clean and decent size. We had 3 suitcases and no issue storing things in drawers or even just in suitcases on the floor/bench. Decent closet space and there is a safe for securing valuables. One issue was AC. It was really hot in our room. We took to opening the window while we were out so it would cool down and we set the thermostat really low. It wasn't a huge deal because it's November, but I can imagine that being an issue in hotter months. Excellent location! We were a couple blocks from Central Park and about a 10 min walk to Times Square. I was not pleased about the $35 "resort fee", but it's not uncommon among the NYC hotels. We just didn't use many of the services that this supposedly paid for.

Just like a bad road hotel where you prefer to keep your shoes on rather than bare foot on the carpet, or a stuck bathtub where water fills your feet, or maybe neighbors like if they where in your room?. Go somewhere else

Park central is pretty much "you get what you pay for." I stay here when I'm cost sensitive since the rooms are relatively cheap for NYC and it's not terrible. Beds are not uncomfortable but nothing to write home about. Good location right next to Columbus Circle and a decent hotel bar.

Hotel clean however had to ask for a kettle for our room no tea or coffee making facilities no restaurant in hotel but advertised as having one. Beds very comfortable right in the heart of city good for subway and transport links quiet at night time so got a good night's sleep

They advertise AC. Yes it is Nov 6 but it is unusually warm. We are in a high rise hotel so the room is very warm and uncomfortable. Extremely disappointed. Will never stay here again!! Also room is so small there is only 10 inches between the foot of the bed and the cabinetry for the TV.

Loved the location as we could walk to all the major areas we wanted to see. Very clean and the staff was super friendly. Only issue we ran into is we had a large bill at the bar yet they charged my pregnant family member $4.25 for a soda water.

I stayed here with my family and we had 2 rooms. 1 double room and 1 room with 2 double beds. Both rooms were very clean and the bathrooms were spotless. The towels were changed everyday and I could not fault the hotel on cleanliness. The decor of the rooms was also nice. The only fault with the rooms is that the lighting wasn't great. The bathroom was very bright but the room itself was very dim at night. Space was ok in the double room but in the room with the 2 double beds it could have done to have another bedside locker as table space was limited but this wasn't a big issue.Overall rooms the rooms were good and I really liked the decor and the beds were very comfy and we had no trouble sleeping.The lobby and bar arra of the hotel was very nicely decorated and the staff were friendly. The price of the drinks I thought was very expensive in the bar. I know it's New York but $21 for a pint of beer and a glass of wine is a bit excessive.Location wise the hotel is a few blocks up from time square on one side and a few blocks from central park on the other side. There is also a subway station very near which was great.Overall I would stay here again and I would recommend this hotel.

My staynig was perfect, I really liked the Hotel because The location is very good close all the touristic places inside Manhattan and The room are so confortable Carolyn is very friendly!! This hotel is amazing

Excelent hotel and employees, specialy Carolyn from the front desk, she wasvery kindly with us in our check.I have been more than once in this hotel and this was the first time they receive me so good, thans Carolyn, after 10 hours flight we really aprreciate your effort and kindly with us

I stayed here with my girlfriend in October 2018. We are 2 young adults (late 20s, early 30s). The hotel was reasonably priced by New York standards. The location is the best thing about this hotel. Central Park, Times Square and Top of the Rock are a short walk away. There are also multiple subway stations within a 5 mins walk of the hotel. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The room and bathroom were very comfortable. The TV with multiple channels was also good. I used the complimentary gym. The gym was small but this is normal for hotel gyms from what I have seen. We did not check out the hotel bar or restaurant. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this to anyone. We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay here.

I have been coming to New York for years, and have stayed in many hotels, this was my 1st time in Park Central and I will be coming back. Location is amazing, the concierge was fantastic, the beds SO comfortable and TV was also amazing we were then very lucky to get a free late checkout at 5pm due to having a late evening flight by the very friendly ELIZABETH in guest services! Highly recommend hotel! Thank you

I travel to NYC ~4 time each year for work, and this is one of my favorite places to stay. The hotel is overall well done with great decor and ambiance through the lobby to the bar. Rooms are decent sized compared to most hotels in NYC, which often cost more $.The staff was pleasant and attentive especially Quimby! The location is awesome. You're an easy walking distance (south) to Times Square and 30 Rock. There are plenty of places to eat near by, including McGee's Pub (inspiration for How I Met Your Mother). Central Park is just a few blocks north.There are only a few drawbacks - There's only 2 small elevators, and though they do run quickly, you may end up a bit smooshed with all the people trying to get on. There's no full service restaurant on site, though there is a small cafe / coffee bar inside and a Starbucks on the corner of the same building. There's plenty of places nearby to eat though.For the price, you can't really beat Park Central, and we plan on staying again on our next trip to town.

Everything was fine.Service perfect. Not noising. Good clener service.The place is perfect web you finish thé marathon and also the location full of shops and locals.Caroline in consergerie was so pretty!!!!

Love the location. Love that it's clean. When booking, we had requested a refrigerator for my medications, but it wasn't there. We had to request again on arrival and it was quickly provided. Our closet door was hanging off when we first went in. It soon fell off when we were unpacking. We let the maintenance guy know when he brought the fridge. He took the door...but never came back. That being said, the front staff are friendly & helpful. The housekeeping staff are excellent...and that will keep the Park Central high on our list.

Very nice hotel, I will back here. Caroline take care of Us, and she’s so nice:) hotel is close to so muchdaw many sights, central park. Did lota of shopping.Family haf a great time. Thank you Park Central for a wonderful time.

Great time at the hotel! The staff was very kind, specially Elizabeth at guest relations, she took time to explain us many things and was very kind every time we needed something . We really appreciate our time here !

We stayed here for six nights and it was clean/in a good location, but this review is mainly for the cocktail class we signed up for on a whim. The class took place in the hotel bar and was hosted by their mixologist Jason, who was very professional and personable. We learned to make three delicious whiskey cocktails. I usually prefer gin or vodka cocktails, but the drinks definitely wowed me - our group agreed that the sage blood-orange one was hands down the best one. As someone who's never tried making cocktails beyond simple mixers, it was really satisfying making drinks that tasted like something I'd pay $20 for at a bar. More than that, it was such a fun way to spend an afternoon with friends (even our NYC native friend was impressed). We were shocked that the class was only $45, considering all the drinks and the charcuterie plates they brought out for us as well. A class like this could easily go for $100+ in LA. Anyway, thanks again to Jason, who was the best teacher - we had a ton of fun!

The service was great, everyone was kind and helpful; especially the concierge, Khianna., she was very knowledgeable, professional and friendly. The facility was very clean. Great location, in the center of Time Square and Central Park, both within walking distance.

My daughter & I stayed in room 553. It is a corner room facing 7th Ave. Windows are not well insulated against street noise. The door was not locked upon our arrival. One pillow had a horrible urine odor. The distance between the end of both beds & the television screen is @ 9 inches. IF that meets code I would be amazed. We are both small women and needed to turn sideways in order to pass through the space. One spare blanket was in the closet. It had a very funky odor. It was needed because the HVAC wasn't working properly. The electric heater did not do an adequate job. I had a drink at the hotel bar. The bartender told me he was out of both brands of gin that I requested - Tanqueray and Hendrix - both of which are commonly stocked. At check out I spoke to guest relations about the room and they kindly removed the facilities fee.

Top of the list - location. Absolutely excellent. Come out the main door and you have central park couple of blocks to your left and Time Square couple blocks to right. Booking process great and staff really helpful (we were group booking from Ireland). Rooms small (but that's to be expected for NY - however not the smallest room I've stayed in in NY) and cleaned daily. They just need to be more aware of the # of people booked into a room V the number of towels they leave in! Also, bed clothing scarce so couple nights sleep uncomfortable as we were cold. Asked for extra towels a number of times (4 times) before getting them and had to ask for bed clothing too.Staff in the bar really friendly and helpful. Reception desk staff the same.

Perfect location, close to subway, Central Park, Times Square !No breakfast but a Starbucks is down the street.Nice room, comfortable beds , quiet with a nice view!Thank you Elizabeth for the late check-out !

This is not the first time I’ve stayed in this hotel and definitely won’t be my last. The staff are always friendly and welcoming, the hotel is clean and the location is fantastic. The whole experience is flawless every time and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a central New York hotel. 10/10.

stayed in this hotel for 4 nights from the 1st October along with 6 other family members. the hotel is 'ok' but expensive, especially when figuring in the exorbitant facility fees that none of our party and I'd suggest the majority of their guests ever use. rooms are comfortable and clean, but noisy, tired and in need of updating as is most of the hotel. The lift access is dreadfully slow and insufficient in comparison to room and guest members.My big issue with the hotel is that despite them issuing a final invoice for the agreed value for my stay I'm still yet to receive a refund of my $200 deposit for incidentals. Be very aware of this. it's not particularly clear at booking that this is required, but you get stumped for it when you check in. also consider that this may be a reasonably sized chunk of your spend budget if you go with X amount of USD to spend. also if you're visiting from outside the US be aware that they advise in their small print it can take up to 30 days to get this back. this in my view is complete rubbish as after speaking with both my card provider and MasterCard they suggest a refund should be much quicker. I've written several times, and have just been fobbed of with '30 days'. I'm now at 27 days and nothing, and I hold no hope for it turning up, so the inconvenience of having to persue a chargeback seems likely. all in all not fussed on this place and feel we could have done better for the money. can't recommend.

My family and I stayed at the Park Central Hotel for a week on vacation. Mr. Fraser and Mr. Hightower run a first-rate hotel; the staff is exceptionally friendly and accommodating. The room suited us perfectly: our son slept on the sofa bed, which had a mattress nearly as comfortable as a regular bed. No lumps, no springs, nothing but soft mattress. The cleaning staff made sure we had enough towels each day.Mr. Fraser and Mr. Hightower greet their guests warmly and professionally, and they go the extra mile to exceed their guests expectations by recommending sites to visit (keeping in mind that kids and adults may enjoy different activities), and the best restaurants - which the concierge was happy to book on our behalf.Thank you, Mr. Fraser and Mr. Hightower, for making our visit a happy and memorable one!

I stayed in the Park Central while attending a conference the end of October. The positives: The room was nice -- clean and well appointed. The staff were pleasant enough. The location is great.The negatives: The elevators are small and slow leading at times to lines. (I used the stairs to access my fifth floor room.) There is construction in the area and it can be noisy even during the night. Most disappointing is the $35/night "facilities fee". This fee is designed to cover the cost of services such as phone calls, internet, fitness center, etc. These items are usually included in the rate or applied via user fees at most hotels. This fee was not listed on my travel agency confirmation nor was it mentioned at check in. I was not aware of it until checkout. These "fees" should be included in the rate, allowing for price comparison. To do otherwise is dishonest.

Check-in today after a long flight from Hong Kong, this is the first time I stay in this hotel. Location is excellent, check-in was fast, however, when I got into the room, I was disappointed as my room is dark even New York has sunshine. Worst case the window is facing the big wall, feeling very bad, so I went to check-in counter ask for room upgrade even I have to pay more money. The receptionist at counter guide me to their customers relationships counter(sorry I forgot the correct name) the lady called ELIZABETH is so friendly and very kind, listen my request and spent time looking for better room for me, she even called the phone in the room to make sure I am satisfied with the new room. Thanks to Elizabeth with her hospitality to make my life in New York feel much better. But be honest, highly recommend everyone should choose the room not face to the street as the window didn't isolate noisy at all, thank god I have my earplugs otherwise I don't think I can sleep.

I noticed Carmelo before because he has that personality that really cannot be matched. He is amazing, his personality, his thoughtfulness. PC is very lucky to have him working for them. I wish I could put him in my pocket!

Room was a bit shabby, small, cold, poorly lit, curtain in bad shape, bathroom door would not close, windows sound proofing very poor, shower curtain was short. I complained to the hotel Manager.
