Very professional approach. Hotel full-up so he tried to fix as much as possible. As sign of good will credited back to me one full nights stay (out of three).

Superb location!! Nice rooms, clean and tidy. You can ask for a complementary coffee machine for your room. Great staff specially Mrs. Elizabeth from Guest Relations, friendly and very helpful. Will be back!

Park Central Hotel is at a perfect location, right in the middle of Manhattan where all the sights are just a walk away. The hotel itself is great! But what really set it apart was the friendly staff. EVERYONE was always smiling and willing to go the extra mile to help out - especially Carolyn at the front desk. She welcomed my husband and I with some drinks at their bar (where the bartender was exceptional!) and that just set our trip off perfectly! Thank you for making our first trip to NY so awesome!

My absolute favorite hotel located minutes from Times Square. Beautiful accommodations and fantastic and helpful staff. I love the ambiance and the rooms are spotless. Very affordable prices for this awe-inspiring city.

My husband and I were recommended the Park Central Hotel and let me tell you it was excellent! Great location, clean rooms, fantastic service and friendly staff. This was our very first visit to New York and the concierge Miguel helped us with tickets to see Wicked. I will definitely be staying here again. Thank you Park Central you guys are the best!

It was very wonderful experience staying at the hotel and lady Carolyn at the front desk was very helpful and kind. I will defend will come back and stay at the hotel. The location of the hotel was really awesome. It was just 10 min away from the Times Square and 5 min from the Central Park. What more to ask. Loved it my son loved it too.

This was my first time staying at the Park Central (I have stayed at the Manhattan which is just down the road a few times) - I prefer staying in this area as it is in a great location for all of the sights and there are many different subway stations nearby depending on what line you need. It is also far enough away from Times Sq if you want to bypass it when going back to the hotel.The room size was fine for the two of us and there was enough storage space for us and our cases. We used the safe in the wardrobe with no issues.The bed was extremely comfortable and very large! We chose to stay in a inward facing room on the 8th floor which worked well, the lifts went up to the 9th floor so we had no problem in getting in one in the morning or when going back at night (you need your room key when pressing the floor to go up to the room). Although the wait time was sometimes a little long, this was not surprising for a large hotel and have had this issues in most other NY hotels I have stayed in. For some reason the cleaning staff kept replacing the towels when they came in even though we didn't put them in the bath (the last day they didn't replace them at all so had to go ask for some - just make sure this doesn't happen to you before you take a shower!).Would definitely recommend staying at this hotel, the facilities and staff were all great and the location is perfect for tourists.We also used the boat tour that was included in the room so only had to pay $35 for the two of us which worked out well.

I've stayed at the Park Central a number of times and have always been happy. The location is great and the check in staff is always super nice. My room was spacious for NYC and I had a great view of the city. It was clean and quiet with a very comfortable bed, top of the line linens and pillows. Bathroom was great with a new tub that I took full advantage of soaking in. The little store downstairs had great juices, small meals and snacks and the bar is a great place to have a drink with a friend or colleague.

The hotel is in Avery strategic area right nxt to Central Park , few blocks away from time square n broadway , everything was in reach ,Elizabeth is such agr8 host she was there when we needed a late check out n helped us deal with it smoothly , I would definitely have the same spot for my next stay in newyork amazing city.

I stayed at Park Central while in town for work and when I reached the hotel I learned that my pre-payment had not gone through. They were very patient with me in getting it all straightened out (which took a while). Elizabeth with Guest Relations has taken extraordinary care of me- gave me meal vouchers for their news stand, has called to check on how my stay has been, and when my flight was rescheduled due to weather and I had to extend my stay, she took care of everything for me so that I could stay in the same room. Every staff member I have interacted with has been welcoming, friendly, and helpful. This is the best experience I've had at a hotel in NYC thus far and I will absolutely be staying here again!

I have been in NY for the first time, and 3 first days stayed in another hotel and was very disappointed! Then I moved to Park Central! Omg! So happy! They antecipated my check in, the room and bathroom super clean, the location amazing and the staff at bar and at reception super friendly!! Had busy days at work, but slept like a princess at their quite and comfortable room! Very satisfied!Thank you for your professional attention and looking forward to come back!

My husband and I have stayed at the Park Central NY MANY TIMES !We love staying there. Always clean Always quiet rest. Great location !Efficient and friendly staff. Some rooms have fabulous views of the city ! We will never miss staying there every time we go to NYC !

The Hotel is super cute and clean. Great sound, great location, great smell and specially great room. But best of all was Elizabeth from the Guest Relations! So kind and helpful when we needed! Thank you! :)

Hotel was very nice, location was perfect for the reason we were there. There is a beautiful lounge, but they did not serve food in the lounge. There is a little café (which is really like a little store) and the food there was very limited. Would have been nice to grab a bite or breakfast in the lounge. Want to give a special shout out to Ana, who assisted us at check in. She was very sweet and kind!

Just checked in today. Have never stayed in a room as noisy as this. There is constant hammering sound from the road below. There is no coffee maker in the room more room service. So if you are looking for a coffee or tea in your room, just forget it. Wanted to take a cough syrup but they don’t provide you with a spoon also.Am here till Saturday. Let’s see what other surprises await.

We enjoyed our stay at Park Central as it was clean and comfortable. I was quite surprised how comfortable the beds were as we stayed an extra unexpected day -- just to sleep in. The staff were very helpful when extending our stay so we did not have to move out the hotel room. We were exhausted after working NYFW and it was quite rainy that day. I love how close it is to Central Park and we took advantage of the location. It was good to get some fresh air after a stressful fashion week. The hotel was quite stylish and cute! Great staff!

We were very pleased with the location and our overall stay. We walked everywhere and rarely found the need to hire a taxi. We arrived at 7:00 AM and the kind staff provided us with a room which was very welcome as we were tired from a red-eye flight. We found the room a bit tired and there were marks on the walls of the bathroom which unfortunately appeared red against the wallpaper. We asked the maid service to clean the walls but they either couldn't or didn't. We understand there is a renovated section to the hotel and would recommend asking for one of these rooms at check-in.

Brilliantly located hotel facing Seventh Ave, close to Central Park in one direction and Times Square in the other. VERY comfortable bed and great linens, plenty of space to work either in the room or down in the bar area. Small bathroom but has everything you need - most importantly a good shower! Would definitely use again when travelling for business.

We stay in this hotel every year. They never disappoint us. The staff is friendly and professional. The hotel has a very modern and clean look and feel. The bar looks and feels like you're at a swanky NYC lounge. Requests are promptly filled. The location is the best. You're just steps away from literally everything New York has to offer. 2 blocks to Central Park, a short 15 minute walk to Times Square and just a block to the subway that will take you to any connection you need. We highly recommend this place!!! I have to give special thanks to Chris Pazmino and Sokha who gave us special attention and made our trip all that more memorable. Park Central ROCKS!!!

The Park Central hotel is definitely centrally located for all midtown sights and the rooms are super modern and comfortable. But the greatest aspect of the Park Central Hotel is their employees. Every person with whom we came in contact was kind, helpful and truly dedicated to making sure that our stay and that of our guests was the most excellent experience in New York City. Special note has to go to Quimby Hightower, who literally made every request a reality and went above and beyond to make sure our stay, and that of our guests for whom this was their first visit to the Big Apple, was a perfect one. I couldn't recommend this hotel more highly.

For the money - NOT SO MUCH..... We had to change rooms once due to ueber noisy neighbors, the new room was 2 floors down and 2 floors louder, although we requested accomodations NOT facing the front, that's where we were put under the headline of an 'upgrade'. In the new room, the safe deposit box did not work, the bathroom drain only worked without the stopper, the first day we did not get any towels at all and although I called housekeeping they never were delivered. On the 3rd day we got no room service at all. By then we were so frustrated, could not wait to leave the next morning. The music in the lobby is so loud that conversations are prohibitive, there is a huge construction site out on 7th Ave, where our window was facing, nobody with a conscience should have put guests there who explicidly requested a quiet room. All this we brought to the attention of the concierge upon check-out, but were made to feel we were hustling for a discount. You guys need some training in customer service!

I was a little concerned about the Park Central because of many reviews that gave it a less that stellar review. Well I think those reviews were wrong. The hotel is in a great location and the room was large. The bathroom was very large and everything was outstanding. Check in was quick and easy. The only low point would be the elevators were slow. While there is no parking connected to the hotel there are a lot of parking garages half a block around the corner. I used a Groupon and the rate was excellent. Be aware however the hotel does have a $35 “resort” fee. However even with everything my room a king was under $200. For NYC that was a real bargain. Great room, great staff all add up to a great stay. I will be back to the Park Central Hotel

I would give this place one star if I could. This place is old and crappy and way too overpriced. Has two working elevators for the whole damn building. Don’t ever expect to get anywhere on time. The customer service sucks and nobody is there to help. I’ve tried reaching the accounting and billing line and nobody ever picks up, just sends you to voice mail and claims to call you back in 24 hrs but never do. NEVER STAY HERE. DONT GIVE THIS PLACE YOUR MONEY. They will literally rob you of your money

Superb location, very nice place to stay, highly recommended! I frequently passing by for business in New York and prefer this hotel to spend my time. Hotel is located in the heart of Manhattan near my favorite places as Central park Carnegie Hall, Milos restaurant. Always excellent service specially by Saleem and Angela!!!

Visiting NY for more that 40 years. Staying at Park Central at least once or twice yearly. Always a pleasure to stay. Warm and correct attention. Highly responsive and effectively group of employees at all levels.My particular thanks to Elizabeth Cacovic who is ALWAYS available to help me and work on any issue that may arise.Six Stars !!!!Thanks a lot and keep going up !!KInd regards.

20 years ago I was fortunate to discover this hotel. It was been the only hotel I would ever consider in New York. Superb people, superb management, elegant and beautiful hotel. Looking forward to returning soon. From the doormen, to the ladies who cleaned my room, everyone bent over backwards to help me. I have some medical challenges. In this hotel, no worries. The management sent a coffee brewer to my room to save me some unnecessary walking. They brought a compact fridge for me.Emails almost a year later are answered immediately. Don’t hesitate to stay at the Park Central Hotel. It is truly beautiful.

I came to new york for a very special trip with my sister and the hotel customer attention made it better. The location is perfect and we look forward to come back any pther time that we visit NYC. THANK YOU ELIZABETH!!!

we are just arrived from Italy in this beautiful hotel...we are very happy to find ELIZABETH at the concierge desk...she helped us with the check-in and she was able to find a room without waiting...she really was a nice and professional person...our stay started very well thanks to her!!

I loved my stay at Park Central Hotel. The room was cozy and had a great view of the city. Carolyn, the conceirge, was quite helpful with informing us about the hotel and any other questions we had during our stay. My friend and I will definitely be staying at the Park Central Hotel again!

Here for my birthday had a great stay at the hotel. The hotel was great and the staff was amazing especially Carolyn. I would definitely return again. The hotel is. CLose to everything within walking distance. Great hotel! We will be back!!

First visit to NYC and wanted a hotel located near Midtown. We selected the Park Central Hotel and we are so glad we did.Clean room, great service and the location turned out to be walking distance to Central Park, Times Square and several subway stations. We will def stay here again. At checkout. Carolyn was so helpful and friendly. She explained the surcharges in a way that was helpful and easy to understand. Great hotel, staff and location.

Enjoyed ourselves in this city. Couldn’t of asked for anything else. Hotel was clean and comfortable. Space compared to other hotels in the area is impeccable. Emanuel checked us in and his smile and service is to die for. We will be back soon.

Was in town to take engagement photos and couldn’t figure out where to start. Our photographer started us out in Times Square but we wanted more. He asked Emanuel for help and he guided us to a spot in Central Park that was just beautiful. Thanks a lot!

I was looking for something to do while in town. Had one night to spare for leisure and I was told to see Emanuel. He knows this city from top to bottom. He recommended Tuscany restaurant for food and drinks then we hit 230 fifth rooftop bar for fun. On our way back to hotel we couldn’t stop talking about the memories we will have because of him.

All the way from Texas with mom and couldn’t believe the service in this hotel. Emanuel at the front desk showed us the ropes and even recommended restaurants and places to visit. He is an asset in this hotel. If you visit here look for him. You won’t be steered wrong!!

First experience on New York was awesome, hotel was 2min from time square, and around 5min from Central Park, which was ideal. Very nice and clean hotel, staff was nice and polite, as most Americans are. Room was excellent and big, clean and comfortable bed, bathroom was also big and clean. There was a gym there, but didn’t use it, as New York is for the sight seen, would highly recommend it.

I went with a friend to celebrate my birthday. Althought we requested two double beds and it was what was on my reservation confirmation, we were charged and extra 40$ per night to have two beds. The bed were very comfortable, lots of pillows and warm down comforters. I tried emailing them 3 times prior to our arrival, but never got any answer. The lobby has a very pungent perfumy scent which lingers on you for a while, way too strong and hits you like a wall when you enter the lobby. Staff were friendly and helpful when information was requested. This hotel is old but has the basics.

This hotel is a must! The staff is fantastic, the room was a great size and clean! A five minute walk to most of the famous landmarks around town. I'll DEFINITELY be back to the Park Central. I would recommend the hotel :)

Excelent service at the front desk, rooms very comfortable, clean and quiet.Elisabeth was perfect helping us at the convierge desk. I will return my nest trip in NYC. The location is fantastic. Close to Central Park , walking distance to middle town, Lincoln center and 5fh Ave.

Great hotel and a great stay. I haven’t been here since the renovations and Wow! Elizabeth at the front desk was very helpful and a joy to deal with! If you’re coming to New York City, check this hotel out.

I’ve stayed in NYC at the Park Central Hotel in October 2018. The place was great, everything was on point, especially the staff! They treated us like friends and we couldn’t be happier! Especially Elizabeth (the girl at the front desk) was super nice and really helped us in anyway, she was just great!

Good hotel. Clean, modern, friendly staff. Elizabeth was very helpful and friendly with my requests and group booking. Would recommend and will stay again and recommend to friends and business colleagues.

I am a tough guest I admit it. But all of my requests was fulfilled in a matter of minutes , thanks to the great service of Carolyn and Saleem the receptionists.The hotel was clean . Comfy beds . Clean every day . Amazing stay would deffently be back.

hotel has excellent location, nearby central park. Carolyn was very helpful at the front desk - assisting us in changing room effeciently and without any problem.We suggest to take a room that does not look into the central part, but faces outside.

Having stayed at the park central 6 years ago, I wanted to stay again for my recent trip to NYC. The hotel had been renovated since my last visit with a very modern reception and rooms. The downside to this is the USD35 ‘resort fee’ per night, which is ridiculous and should just be incorporated in the cost of the rooms. The hotel is very conveniently located a 5-10min walk to Times Square and to to Central Park. Also wasn’t happy with the maid service in the hotel, they were always very eager to enter the room at around 9am and we felt kicked out of the room. On the one day day we had a lie in, we got a call from reception at 11am basically asking if we could get out of the room or it wouldn’t been cleaned that day. Not the service I expect for the price paid!

The location is excellent, close to Central Park, a short walk from Times Square and lots of attractions. However, I felt it was a very expensive hotel for the size of the room. The staff at check in and at the baggage room were rude - brusque and peremptory which did not make a good first impression for this New York visitor, especially as the desks were not busy. No help was great freed with our cases which would have been appreciated as we were a long way from home for an extended trip.The room had insufficient lighting - no overhead lighting - just one standard light and one bedside lamp both of which you had to get out of bed to turn off. The tv was not plugged in and we couldn't reach behind the heavy bench to plug it in. The plug in the bath wouldn't seal. These things ( except the lighting) were fixed when we brought them to the hotel's attention but it was a pretty disappointing room.

Very nice experience with customer service. There was a problem with our reservation upon arrival. The front desk could not help so we were sent to customer services. The young man working there, who's name I can't remember, took the time to listen to us until he understood what the problem was. He then attempted to resolve the problem. upon realizing he couldn't fix it on his own, he got the manager involved. The manager was remarkably gracious and helpful. He not only solved our problem, but he gave us drink vouchers so we could sit in the lounge while he did so. He then walked us to the front desk and personally saw to it that we were checked in. as this was happening, Jett, also on his staff, found us a room with a king size bed. Really great service.Don't want to forget Nancy in the lounge. She took care of us three nights in a row and was helpful and friendly while giving us excellent service.

Always LOVE the Park central.Best location in NYC for theatres , shopping (5th avenue is close) and Central Park 2 blocks away! Hell’s Kitchen also very close for amazing restos! Elisabeth was very accommodating and an outstanding person ! She took great care of our needs and made our stay even more memorable.Thank you Elisabeth!!!!! We will be back soon ! The Salvatores Montréal

Following a mix-up with our tour operator, we have had our original accommodation cancelled & have been booked into this hotel for a pre-Christmas break so I have come on here to learn more about the hotel, Reading the reviews, a recurring theme seems to be the issue of the 'facilities fee' & the fact that this has come as a surprise to some people who have been landed with a bill at the end of their stay. I visited the hotel website & struggled to find any mention of this charge, but eventually found the information in the FAQ section, which reads: 'WHAT IS THE FACILITIES FEE?The mandatory Facilities Fee of $35 plus tax per room per night provides guests with the following amenities: - Unlimited Local and Domestic Long Distance Calls - Unlimited use of the 24-hour state-of-the-art Fitness Center - Luggage storage on arrival and/or departure up until 9:00 PM - Apple workstations with printing, faxing and scanning offered through our Guest Relations Team - 10% off your experience at our lobby bar Park Lounge - 1 hour free bike rental with 1 hour purchase from our partner Fancy Apple, showing your room key.**Please note, the facilities fee is not inclusive of service gratuities.'So there you go, We are now preparing to pay an additional sum of $140 (plus tax) at the end of our stay for facilities which we will not be using (apart from possibly having to store our luggage before our departure - $140 (plus tax) for that seems a bit steep!) Quite why establishments insist on doing this is beyond me, as there is clear evidence from previous reviews that all it does is create 'a bad taste' and deter guests from making a return visit. If you must charge people for facilities they don't use, then bury it in the room rate - ignorance is bliss, as they say. Better still, charge guests for what they use, when they use it.Anyway, let's see how the visit goes in December & I'll return with an update on our stay. Perhaps the hotel will redeem itself - it will have to do well to convince me that I haven't been ripped off.

Last week of your trip across America. We stayed 6 nights at park central hotel. Very nice. No restaurant in hotel. Khianna the conceige was excellent helping us to plan our week in New York City. Good position to Central Park and shows.Good on u Mate!!!!

I come to New York few times a year for business and always stay at Park Central Hotel.The reasons i choose this hotel is of its Modern amenities, amazing location, which allows me easily to navigate through the city, countless nearby great restaurants, entertainment and Central Park which i adore. Special thanks to Elizabeth Cacovic - Guest relation Manager, who helps me with all my needs and makes me feel home away from home.Thank you Elizabeth, Thank you Park Central Hotel!!!

This is my third time in NYC and my second time in Park Central Hotel, and I have to say the city is incredible as always and more, I love its museums, coffee shops, streets and all. We went to Broadway to Lion King, ir was wonderful!And I really am surprised because my first time in Park Central was in 1995 and now I find it very different, beautiful and modern with the best service! Thank you so much for everything!Regards, Karina Blanco

Hotel was in a fantastic radius from city center. Room was spacious and clean. Super pretty views from The 18th floor. Room service promptly delivered everything needed. And dear Carolyn helped with any questions asked upon checkout the next morning. 10/10!!!!! For the price you get 5 star service.

Carolyn at the front desk was amazing! Totally would come stay here again! Rooms are super clean and the hotels location in amazing! Close to absolutely everything! Thank you Carolyn for helping me out!

We’re meant to stay in the wellington hotel which is across the road but they had overbooked and so put us in park central, hotel was lovely, room spacious and free WiFi, though this is usually paid for but as we were moved from Wellington we got it for free. I would highly recommend this hotel due to its location and rooms. Upon check out we were confronted with a bill for the WiFi’s and we had to to and fro between the two hotels for this to be sorted which it eventually was by Jeanette Miller who was of great assistance. Thanks for the great stay.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. The hotel is well situated in NYC, close to everywhere I wanted to visit. The room is very clean and I found the staff exceptionally helpful. I particularly would like to call out Sonia Wright : the Room Attendant : Very warm, kind and super helpful lady! I will definitely come back to the hotel.

I had a great room, the staff were very helpful and they solve all my problems. I will always return to this hotel. This is my forth stay at the Park Central.The only thing is they should put some lighting in the closets so i could see my clothing.Pedro S México

The Park Central is definitely a mixed experience. If you’re not familiar with NYC, it’s a fabulous location - easy walk to Broadway, Central Park, west side, east side, etc. the lobby is lovely - bright and inviting. Contrary to a few negative reviews, I found all of the staff helpful and friendly. I had booked in advance for the rate that included the possibility of cancelling. 3 days before, when I knew I wouldn’t need to cancel, I changed to a non-refundable rate for a significant savings and got a larger room. In fact, a nice sized room for NY, street view and higher level. Street noise and hallway noise were all acceptable.Now the negative and why I won’t return. As stated on other reviews, the room doesn’t feel clean. While the bed was clean and comfortable, the room felt musty and the bathroom had an odor. At first I thought maybe it was the plumbing, but I think it might have been dirty rags. Management needs to have the carpets cleaned well. There is what looks like dust on the floor by all of the walls. Also, it is strange that there is only one heavy, opaque window shade. With office buildings directly across the street, that means that the shade must be kept completely closed for privacy if you’re light is on Most hotels have an additional curtain or shade that allows light to come in, but can be closed so people can’t look in.It was also surprising that the lovely, large bar off of the lobby doesn’t serve any food at all. However, there is a small take out cafe, but closes early.The elevator security is misleading. As long as one person uses a key to make the elevator work, you can go to any floor. At most hotels with an elevator key slot, a key is needed to get to each specific floor.Location - perfectStaff - responsive Noise level - good for NYRoom size - good for NYRoom cleanliness - needs improvement

My wife and I chose Park Central Hotel to stay during our vacation in NYC because every time we have stayed at this hotel it was extremely pleasant. And this time it wasn’t different. We had the opportunity to meet manager Elizabeth when checking in and her friendliness made us feel at home again. The hotel is well located, with easy access to the main sights of the city and subway is at the corner. Definitely we will be staying at Park Central Hotel again next time in NYC.

So I stopped by the other day and informed the front desk that I was gonna stay later on during the week and needed a place to store my luggage in the meantime. Emanuel at the front desk was excellent and informed me that there was a luggage storage place next oír who will accommodate me and it worked out great. Upon my arrival he also was great at making sure me and my boyfriend were well taken care of.

So many issues with this hotel from the moment we arrived. We came here last month and it still sticks out as a sore thumb in my memory. It is a lie to call this a 4 star hotel.Issue 1: Facilities FeeThis ridiculous policy they have of $35 plus tax PER DAY "facilities fee" which covers the gym and concierge and newspapers - all the things that should come as part of a decent hotel anyway without extra charges. I don't understand why it's not already part of the room rate. We definitely didn't know about this prior to checking in. Is it so they can keep a lower rate on search engines and then spring the fee on unsuspecting guests? We took up issue with this and spoke to the manager, who was very rude and said that it's a standard practice in all New York hotels. Having stayed in New York hotels many times before, we knew this was a complete lie. Her rudeness and dishonesty, coupled with this unreasonable policy, were an awful way to start our stay.Issue 2: HousekeepingThe housekeeping is abysmal. Every single day we had a different standard of housekeeping. Once our towels were taken and not replaced. I had to call and ask for new towels. Another time, the housekeeper knocked the door and actually asked me to bring our garbage to the door for her. What kind of housekeeping standard is this? Ridiculous.Also they do not have any slippers and bathrobes at all. I have never been even in a 3 star hotel that refuses to provide these basic comfort items for guests.Issue 3: FacilitiesThis is an old hotel and even though attempts have been made to modernise it, you can still see the upkeep is poor. The window shades in our room were blackened and tattered on one side. There are stains all over the walls, especially in the bathroom. The hallway carpeting looks old and tired and there are even glasses left all over the floor by housekeeping I presume. It is not a pretty sight. The walls are extremely thin and you can hear everything your neighbours are saying and doing. The elevators take forever, be prepared to spend 10 minutes waiting each time you need to go up or down. There are also no mini fridges or coffee machines in the rooms. What are the facilities fees paying for if these guests still have all these inconveniences?Issue 4: Staff AttitudeAs mentioned above, the manager's response to us was unacceptably unprofessional and housekeeping is pretty bad too (see the staff asking me to carry garbage to her for her own convenience). We also needed to pick up a package and we were told that we could pick up from the concierge 24/7. So we got back around 11pm and asked for our package and then we were told the package room had already closed and we had to wait til the next day. Why were we being told different things by different staff?The only thing I liked about this hotel was the seating in the lobby. It's a nice place to sit and have breakfast or meet with people. However this one aspect is not enough to redeem all of the others that went wrong.The location is also rather undesirable, it's located in what feels like tourist central with food carts immediately outside the door and homeless people on the corners. Some might like this environment because it's close to other tourist hotspots but I did not.In conclusion, do not waste your money on this hotel. There are much better experiences to be had at many other NYC hotels and there's no reason why guests should put up with all of the issues I listed above.

Was in New York for business - never thought I’d speak of business and relaxation in the same sentence. (Without evading one for the other). The gym was great and made for an easy, enjoyable workout. There were definitely spaces in the hotel to work and the bar offered a great selection of cocktails. The hotel is in an ideal location in the heart of the city and from the looks of the reception desks this is the place to be. The staff is excellent and pays keen attention to detail - the leadership must be awesome ! I will definitely be back !

Location ! Pros - amazing & attentive staff ! This hotel is buzzing and spacious. You’ll likely never repeat contact with the same person. If you need to get work done, this is the perfect space and the bar is definitely worth your time ! Cons - you would think they’re giving away gold or something. The line at reception can be a bit long but if anything that’s a sign that this is the place to be while in the city !

The hotel is fine, average. The elevators were way too small which was a pain. You can tell the hotel was older and the cosmetics have been updated but not the bones. Location is good. Rooms were clean. The bed sagged in the middle. Worst part was the extra $35 a night charge for things like use of the gym and computers in the lobby, things that other hotels price into their rooms. It’s ridiculous to charge a non-optional extra fee for this. I was only notified about the extra fee 2 days before my arrival. What a rip off! My advice - there are plenty of average hotels in the area, pick one that doesn’t try to sneak in fees.

Stay here! You won’t have any complaints. The location and quality is fabulous. The rooms are spotless and so is the service. I messed up the safe and had to call security and a gentleman came to the room within 10 minutes. No restaurant but there is a large beautiful bar. No in room coffee but there is a coffee stand in the lobby. 2 blocks from Central Park one direction and 2 blocks from Time Square the opposite direction. 57th st subway is right outside the door. About a 30 minute taxi from JFK but there was no traffic as we arrived 6 a.m. on a Saturday morning. Thank goodness we got to check in early! Great neighborhood. We felt safe walking everywhere.

Arrived late from Los Angeles. The hotel offers no food service and has no restaurant. When asked where they recommended to dine close by, I wa told “you’ll find lots eat if you walk out”. I wanted to have water in the middle of the night and nothing is supplied. Housekeeping carts are stored right next to my room door which is noisy in the early morning hours. A refrigerator is plugged in and left on the floor at the entrance to my room. I am certainly not impressed!

My wife and I stayed at the Park Central Hotel in December 2016 and had a one of a kind experience so when we planned a trip back to New York in October 2018, we knew where we were going to stay. This time we traveled with another couple, Richard & Daisy who had never been to the Big Apple. The hotel is centrally located next to the subway, one block away from Broadway and within a couple of blocks to Central Park, Fifth Ave and Times Square. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are spacious. The best part of the experience is the staff. From the time you check in, they make you feel at home. I reconnected with Quimby Hightower, Complex Director and he extended a very warm welcome to our friends and my wife and I. When you are operating a busy hotel like this one, the way hotel staff treats their guests is a reflection of their General Manager. Don Fraser is the GM for Park Central and I want to commend him for making our stay possible and making memories with friends and family members that will stay with us for a lifetime. WE look forward to coming back and telling others about the wonderful experience we had.God Bless,Fred & Linda Fernandez

A stay at Park Central comes at a decent price for its location and competitors. Worth a night or two to be walkable to major metro and train hubs, as well as the Park. This review is mainly intended to give kudos to Dafne, at the front desk. Her professionalism, knowledge, and customer service is the main reason I'll go back. She handled many irrational and weary travelers before me, but still maintained her composure and was nothing but kind when I checked in. She also upgraded me since I was on business and needed some rest. Such a class act!

In town for a few days for a concert at Carnegie Hall. Hotel was very nice, clean, top-notch. We walked to Central Park, restaurants, bars, shopping at Columbus Circle and 5th Avenue. Centrally located to all the best places - Rockefeller Center, Broadway, Theater, etc. There is a nice bar, but no restaurant. Breakfast and snack bar in lobby with coffee. We walked next door to Starbucks. Plenty of restaurants around, so not a problem. Check out PJ Carney Irish Bar for food and drink!

The hotel was fully booked when we were there. Some suggestions to management.1. Have enough people for checking bags. One guy doesn't cut it. There was a line of 6 parties (pretty noticeable, I thought) which took about 20 minutes. How about a second person?2. Ditto on answering phones. The automated system for connecting to guest rooms -- well, if you're going for a common last name, it doesn't really work. To be more specific: common four letters starting the last name. How about having someone who might actually pick up the phone, instead of minutes of numbers to push to try to do do it yourself?3. Something not easily fixed: the incredibly narrow elevators!4. Maybe if you can get this hotel at $200, it's a good deal, but we paid $300+, and then, we get hit with this ridiculous $40 or so "facility fee" which did nothing for us. (Yes, they disclose it, but they should be honest about the cost of their hotel). I'm sure some people take advantage of the facilities, but not us.The room was small but clean; there is a good coffee shop/bakery nearby, as well as other options a bit further away. It's close to Central Park, etc.. I just think they should staff up more; congrats on being full, now please make it easier to get basic "tasks" done.

The hotel was beautiful to stay in and very centralised to everything, time square, Central Park and broadway.Elizabeth on the front desk was amazing at sorting out our transfer back to Newark for our return home and answered al of our questions with knowledge and a wonderful big smile. Thank you Elizabeth Nothing was too much trouble for her, will definitely stay here again

The hotel was very clean and pretty. The room was big and the beds very comfortable. We slept fantastic. The Service was fantastic - we booked tickets for some attractions via the concierge Service -from Germany- this worked out very well! The concierge was very friendly. Our flight was late so the very friendly Elizabeth at guest relations gave us the possibility to keep our room till we needed to go to the Airport A perfect place to stay in New York

What a great choice for a 4 night break in NYThe location means you are in the thick of it without it being overwhelming.Near Central Park and dangerously close to 5th Ave for the retailStaff are lovelyThe bar in the evening is lovely.Special thanks to the service of Nancy (Cocktail Waitress) in the evening. She couldnt be nicer.My partner is going back to NY to take his girls on a Xmas Shopping trip - think he will re book.Thank you for a wonderful stayJane Eagle

Stayed here for 6 nights and was in a perfect location. Walking distance from time square and also Central Park, star bucks down stairs and subway station across the road. Rooms were the largest we had found in all of NYC and why we chose it. Bathroom was large too. We booked a standard room and the view was unfortunately the only down fall - just looked across to other hotel windows so definitely consider the upgrade!

Stayed here in April and wasn’t the best service,so thought i would give it one more chance ...what a mistake.Arrived Just before 3pm which is the check in time listed to be told if we accepted different beds to the ones we had chosen and payed for we could check in,if not we would need to wait till 4pm.I proceeded to tell them I wasn’t happy with this to be told the check in is 4pm (well not on Hotels.com)where it was booked it’s not.Anyway same as last time staff not interested and just basically rude.Will be my last time staying here.AVOID THIS HOTEL.

The Park Central has become my hotel of choice when visiting New York City. The rooms are adequately sized and the accommodations are A+. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The hotel is nicely located for shopping and attending Broadway and Off Broadway shows. Subway stations for the various lines are only a block or two away which is ideal for getting around the city as well as to and from the airports.

We stayed here as a family of three - the location was perfect and we were upgraded on arrival to a corner room which had a wonderful view of the city. Very kind and friendly staff. ProsGreat locationLovely lounge downstairs for drinks after 5pmView from room and location is amazingFriendly staffComfy roomsGood coffee from the market downstairs (opens at 6am)ConsWe found it very strange that for the price you pay there is no fridge in the room unless you specifically request one (??) and no kettle or food/drink room service = we got in at 2am off our long haul flight and unexpectedly had no fridge with water or any mini bar/ room service, so my husband had to walk the streets trying to find food for our 3 year old with jet lag.Warning - the hotel also charges extra fees each day for “services” which I think is the gym and other things even if you don’t use them. I understand from the hotel that this is flagged on booking, but I didn’t see it (or the amount).I would stay again, but not with a family as you really need room service and a fridge / tea & coffee in the room.

If you are into music in general, you will love this location as Broadway theaters, Carnegie Hall and Lincoln Center are in walking distance. Buzzing Hells kitchen is nearby as well. The rooms are fairly large, clean and a decent coffee shop in the lobby area. Very helpful and supportive staff when it comes to extra requests.

My husband and I have stayed at Park Central Hotel for years, usually 2 or 3 times annually. Always pleased with the room and Front Desk, Maintenance and Housekeeping staff. Today, however, I had difficulty making a reservation. The off-site Reservationist mentioned a rate stipulation that was not referenced anywhere on the website. Repeated attempts to explain my point got me nowhere. I decided to contact the hotel directly and had the pleasure of speaking with Tony Cunaj, Complex Director of Reservations. He actively listened to my comments, graciously took time to straighten things out and made the reservation for me. I so appreciate Tony's assistance. He's an asset to Park Central.

$500 per night (after all the taxes etc.) seems steep for a room (#1810) that clearly needs to be refurbished: peeling wall paper, bathroom door that cannot be fully opened (as it clashes with the toilet), no sit down restaurant. On the positive side the room itself is relatively large and clean and the staff is eager to help.

Rooms comfortable, great staff willing to help, and awesome location. A little noisy in the halls so could use more sound proofing. A wonderful place to stay and next time I'm in New York I would like to stay here.

Very nice hotel, centrally located, clean and very friendly staff. Within walking distance to Central Park and great restaurants and Time Square. Service was excellent. Taxi available right outside hotel

The location was in close distance to all of the spots I wanted to visit. I can’t say enough about the location. They don’t offer valet parking but that was not a deal breaker because they suggested a self parking garage around the corner.The room was big and clean but faced a brick wall and it was quite. The people were nice but it’s a busy hotel and they seemed to rush a lot. I liked being able to have snacks from the store in the lobby. New York this time of year is amazing I can’t wait to come back, but maybe try something closer to Times Square.

Loved everything about this hotel.... from the check in to the check out... everything is a 10/10. The location is perfect and the rooms are spacious and clean. When I come back to New York... wont even bother looking at other accomodation. Thank you to Don Fraser and to all his staff for a great stay and for the personal touch.

Whenever we visit New York, we stay here. The rooms have been redecorated, which is a plus. The location can't be beat. It's located just a few blocks from Central Park and mid-town attractions. Good restaurants are also nearby.

It was my third time in the city and this time staying at the park central was the best time. No other hotel was as spacious and courteous as this one. Emanuel at the front desk was the best. He never said no to any of our requests and always had an answer to our questions. Looking to our return next year.

Flew in for 8 nights from swiss snd loved new york city so much. The man Emanuel gave us all the information on the city and area. Looking foward to return here next year. All the people were great snd helped.

I found this hotel on Groupon and not only was it a very nice and clean hotel it was in a great location. It is very close to Central Park and Times Square. Carolyn was a huge help, answered any and all questions we had. I will be staying here again. Andrea Recker

We found this hotel on Expedia. We got a good deal. There is a 35$ resort fee in addition that is ok if you use the gym. Angela at the front desk went above and beyond to get us a much needed early check in. With the help of her boss we were offered a room upgrade! The room was spacious under NY standards. All was ok bed was comfortable. There was noise from the street on Sat nite. Also our tv was not working, and we asked for help. Someone came but then the next day it wasn’t working again. I told the front desk before we left so hopefully they fixed it this time. Hotel is located walking distance from Times Square. Many nice places to eat too. You will enjoynthe time here!

I liked this hotel mainly because of its location, three short blocks from Central Park and about 6 blocks from Time Square. Alot of restaurant options for all budgets. I found the room to be a good size for NY. Most hotels I’ve stayed in there were very small. The room was clean and housekeeping did a good job servicing the room daily. The price, well very high but in all NY its the same. The only reason I did not give a 5 is due to the unfriendliness off the front desk staff. Had an issue with An overcharge and they were not very willing to resolve the issue. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Great location, great bed, very clean. Ideal for sleep over ONLY. No concierge service after working hours.No utensils in the room.Asked for a fruit knife and reception actually asked me to go to the restaurant and get it myself.Room lights not enough, very dim in the room. Overall, if you are looking just for a place to sleep and shower, it's alright.

We booked the meeting room for three days and stayed two nights. The Hotel hospitality staff of Nancy, Alex and Frankie too great care of us and our guests from all over the US. The service was excellent and they exceeded all of our expectations. We look forward to booking again.

After reading the reviews I hesitated whether to book this hotel. The deal was tempting that day so I decided to book and I’m happy I did! Check in was fast, service was excellent ( we asked for refrigerator and coffee machine and got them few minutes later flowing a phone call from the costumer service desk checking we got them and everything is ok), room was clean and spacious with two double beds and big bathroom, perfect location and the noise of the city wasn’t an issue the minute we closed the window ( considering it is midtown nyc...)During our stay we were assisted by Elizabeth from guest relations and Elza at the front desk who provided personal and thoughtful assistance! Traveling with two toddlers can be very challenging sometimes and I’m sure that our stay in park central hotel contributed a lot to the success of our trip!

I stayed here for the first time and can't believe how much service I received. Emanuel was great and reached out to make sure all was well. Excellent location close to all that's needed. Central market was great for breakfast.

Good room. Vey good hotel have Nice location. Very nice lobby comfortable.it was a perfect experience have a lot of things to do fitness. computer room, for you Work.I recomend you chose this hotel to stay on new york

Wonderful help from manager Elizabeth. Great costumer services. Awesome management and cleaning crew. Also great security services. Great location and very convenient to all your needs and desires. Just amazing

The location is essentially my reason for booking. I visited for one night during the United Nations- last minute and it was VERY EXPENSIVE but the most reasonable out of other hotels in the area. The staff were nice and the rooms were clean and a good size. Park Central to be a more streamlined experience. There is a bar downstairs but not overly crowded. My check out was quick thanks to Ana at reception. I would visit again but not at the same price.

We stayed here for our honeymoon and checked out earlier today. The staff were fantastic and couldn’t do enough to help us! The room was great, brilliant view of time square!! Absolutely ideal location for a stay in New York with staff to make the experience really pleasant

The location was certainly my reason for reserving here. I visited for one night during the United Nations and it was VERY EXPENSIVE but the most reasonable out of other hotels in the area. The staff was ver nice and the rooms were clean. Park Central provided me with a great NYC experience. There is a bar downstairs that is not overly crowded. They provided all of the basics. I probably visit again but not too excited about the price. Lisa

Stayed over for a long week as group leader of a business trip and had a wonderful stay. The venue is comfortable and the location is just amazing: you can reach anywhere within a short time.What made our stay the best is the guest relations desk: Elizabeth has taken care of us the entire time, helping us out with any need, fixing small issues of our NY experience and always being reactive and very professional. She has def been the added value of our stay. Highly recommended for any kind of travelers.

Very beautiful hotel, the staff and the concierge are very friendly y and specially Elizabeth from guest service , excellent host. The hotel is close to everything, shops, bars and good restaurants Very recommended!

Park Central is my East Coast home. It is the perfect home base no matter where I need to be in the city. On this trip I went from business meeting, to Broadway show, to Yankee stadium all with in minutes. The staff always seems to know what I need or where I need to go before I even know it. Special thanks to Quimby! From the minute I arrived he welcomed me by name and had my keys ready to go. More importantly, he genuinely was interested in (and delivered!) what I wanted and needed to make my stay perfect. His service and personality was larger than life and made me want to never leave. Thank you so much! I will be back.

From the moment we arrived we were taken care of! Our room wasn’t yet ready as we arrived very early BUT the staff was quick to accomodate our luggage while we took in the city! Emmanuel and Q were so attentive and helpful! They even recognized my sister who stayed here about 3 weeks ago and they even took the time to congratulate my mother on her belated birthday which is the reason for this visit to begin with. We did not hint them either they just picked it up on their own:) DETAILED...DETAILED...DETAILED!!!! Excellent!

Upon arrival the attention to detail and customer service was excellent! From the bellboys to the front desk! We were treated like royalty by Emmanuel and Q! The hotel is beautiful and clean. All the staff go above and beyond and this is just day 1 of our stay! Can it wait to get to our room and enjoy the rest of our stay!

Excellent service and attention from Carlyn and Quimby, who helped us when we needed.They were very considerate. The hotel is very well located and the rooms also ok. Good expirience.Ana, María and Matilde

I love The Park Central hotel. I always look for Ángela ay reception because she is always helpful and nice. She truly takes care of my daughter and her manager Que is also friendly , i like the location and the staff. I will return.

I was very interested in the hotel for a stay with my husband right before Thanksgiving. I just tried to call and get information about the construction that I read about through other reviews. The very unfriendly receptionist stated that she couldn't give me any information at the time and that if I would wait to be put on hold while she gets the info. I had a feeling she was hoping I would just hang up. Which I did not. The girl never picked back up and eventually I was hung up on!!!

Location, location, location. My secretary found this hotel and it was not clear if it was a business hotel. Check in was efficient but I did wait a couple of minutes. Room was standard but did not have a view. I typically stay at Hilton but they had no availability. It suited my needs. Typical NYC big hotel with a lot of activity. I would return again.

This hotel is merely a room with no mod cons except for television. The room I had which was a premier room with two large beds was shabby and the carpet was stained. No mini bar or fridge in the room. The fridge on request was extra. I cannot state how dismayingly dismal the room was. Quite large, after all it had the 2 beds but so shabby and unloved. A bit of hanging space and 4 drawers were all the space for personal items clothes etc. No slippers were on offer and the bathroom although clean had on offer soap and bath items in the tub. No bidet no hand held shower. No breakfast room we had to go out for breakfast. There was a shop where one could purchase breakfast items but there was nowhere to sit. This hotel was booked for us by friends with little experience. Nowadays you really have to read between the lines and understand that the photos are always far better than the reality. Next time I will book myself. I know I could have done far better with the money spent

I left my wallet in the safe in my room; I never use a safe and this is why, because I always seem to forget my belongings. I didn't realize I left my wallet until I was at my connection in Minneapolis. I phoned the hotel and spoke with Benny Fong, who oversees security and Mr. Fong was amazing! He returned my wallet to me with 100% of the belongings inside, including two $1 bills. I am so grateful and highly recommend this property or WestHouse as not only are they amazing to stay in, but they have professionals there who really care about their guests!

Hotel room I stayed it had 2 queen beds, perfect for a family of 4 in a city where getting 2 rooms would have been prohibitively expensive. Service provided by front desk staff was especially good, despite being an extremely busy period with the UN in session. Quimby from guest relations was particularly helpful in fulfilling needs and making our stay as comfortable as possible.

amazing hotel clean the stuff is realy friendly specialy quimby nice guy and very helpfull and nice... the location amzing and verry close to times square and to the subway... it was a great experise ever

I came into the city to surprise my brother. I can’t express how much I enjoyed staying here. Emanuel at the front desk gave me the best room possible and recommended a great place for dinner. I look forward to coming back!

Fiancé and I spent 3 nights in New York City at the Park Central Hotel. Amazing hotel, prime location, definitely coming back! Great service, friendly staff and the price was very good. All in all, we had an amazing time in NYC.

Nothing necessarily bad about the hotel but it's pretty average. It's nice. It's clean. It's actually quiet - at least on the 11th floor. It's as tourist central as it gets. A place to lay your head and then get out and go. Next to zero amenities for most. Example, no coffee in rooms (must request a pot), no 'real' housekeeping, no room service, no food, and for me, no real concierge service. My room had a faulty bathtub and a missing closet door (I would've never noticed the door - but the maintenance folks noticed when they fixed the bath - no complaints there. Tom was great).None of this is a deal breaker, but when my rate to stay longer due to an extension of meetings went from 400 per night to 1,000 per night, I skipped on out to a new location. It was mainly just odd. Never saw a bellman - just a doorman to hail a cab, never had a cleaned room - meaning, they make the bed and empty trash. NOTHING ELSE. Not a wipe down, not a straighten up, nothing. I never even had food I'd had delivered (no food in the hotel) removed. It was always just left on the desk (no trashcans big enough to place containers in)... I'm no slob, but I think stacked disposable dishware and empty water bottles/juice/ in room glasses would be an obvious thing to remove? Maybe not. I asked the concierge about recommendations to book me for a massage. He informed me he could 'google some places in the area" - no thanks, I have the googles on my own phone. They do allow delivery of food. You can go down to the lobby to meet the delivery driver. I had no use for 10% off of a hotel bar (it's like the heart of the city right here), and I had no need for a gym, There's no pool or 'amenities' other than a 'business center' - but that 40.00 'resort fee' they charged was still front and center. Trust me, if you can buy in the same price range elsewhere, I would. You are only paying for location, not another thing. And 400 plus a night is a LOT for a bed. It's a 3 star hotel - but pretty - hence the rating. I requested a room with a view - and I got it - as I was told - of the building across the street. Fun watching people work! The photos show rooms with views - but I don't know that is the truth... I prob won't be back, but I guess my expectations of paying premium for premium services are too high. Pretty disappointing, but nothing to remove stars about. Simply having a few things that make visitors stay a bit pleasant and not 'work' to do anything hotel related would change it up a lot!

I must say I’ve been here for three days now and every day I feel more comfortable and more welcome. In part this is due to the wonderful room staff that have met every need courteously enthusiastically. I want to highlight my experience with Carolyn at the front desk. She is wonderfully accommodating for my idiosyncrasies, very quiet room, near quick elevators. Whenever she is not too busy with checking in and out people she takes time to tell me great stories about NYC and wonderful beautiful places to visit.I think I have found a second home here at the Park Central. I would be remiss not to mention the location so near the theater district Lincoln center and Carnegie Hall,and to get away from the hubbub , really close to Central Park.

Darren exemplified excellent customer service. Expertly helping me and my friends navigate nyc. An assest to your company and further more alleviated new traveler anxiety. My trip was awesome! Idk what I would have done without the staff at Central Park honestly specifically darren!!!!

The hotel is excellent! Great location.The crew is very helpful and kind especially Elizabeth and Skoha.I will recommend on this hotel to all my friends.It was a great trip and a great stay.Suitable for 2 or 4 People

We had such a nice time in New York and at the hotel that we wanted to extend our stay an extra day. I tried doing so by calling from the room and was unsuccessful so decided to head down to the lobby where I spoke with Elizabeth, the hotel manager. She was able to help me out really quick and was very efficient at doing so. She made our stay that much better.

Had a lovely night out and Carolyn was so nice in making sure we had everything we needed. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Great location. Great accommodation and awesome view of the city.

The hotel was great, the staff was really friendly and attentive specially Nancy at the front desk. She took care of everything I needed and handled perfectly online orders I had delivered to the Hotel. Will definitely come back and recommend this hotel.

Don't bother!! Stayed here for 30th wedding anniversary. Hotel made no effort to recognise this milestone. Family emailed them in advance to make arrangements but no recognition of this! Paid extra for premium room. Nothinging premium about this. No view. No tea/ coffee facilities! Even asked for this at reception. Nothing provided!! No fridge either! No in house restaurant! Only night bar. Only good thing. Close to Time square. Dont bother to book via Expedia

When I go to NY, I prefer to stay at Park Central because it really has a great vibe to it! Not only is it perfectly located, the staff is friendly and attentive. I wanted to say thank you to Peter in Guest Services, Juan in Security and most importantly, Quimby the manager. They all ensured that my lost laptop was found, secured and personally delivered to my colleague to bring back for me. I travel a lot and I’ve stayed in many beautiful hotels. The difference between Park Central and the rest is that the other hotels lack energy and exciting vibe. Quimby embodies that infectious personality and a “let’s make it happen” type of leadership! Personally, I think Quimby needs his own reality show! Thank you Park Central!Robin Noma’aea

I stayed here before, and as always, this has been a great stay. The hotel has an incredible location and the rooms are very spacious, clean and conformable. This is becoming my preferred location when I'm in NYC for pleasure or business. The staff is always very helpful and welcoming. My special thanks for Quimby Hightower, customer relations manager, for taking care of us during our stay. My business partner forgot her laptop and he retrieved it and personally delivered to me, as he had already left the hotel. That's what I call excellent personal service, which you don't see it often these days. I'm coming back here for sure!

This is a tastefully modern, well maintained hotel located between Times Square and Central Park, across from Carnegie Hall. Alicia Nunez made our reservation process easy as can be and the rest of the staff was friendly and helpful. The concierge staff offered some great local nightlife suggestions and housekeeping kept our room in tip-top shape and well stocked with fresh towels. If you're looking for a hotel within walking distance of metro, Central Park south, Theater District and Times Square, Park Central Hotel is a solid choice!

Really nice place, 10min walk from Times Square and just a couple blocks away from Central Park The room was clean and really spaciousThe staff was very welcoming, special thanks to Elisabeth for her kindness and her precious help.

our recent stay at park central hotel, was terrific from beginning to end!Carmello our favorite doorman was courteous, professional,kind and just a GREAT all around guy!!! he always met us with a huge smile, handshake and great city information. it made our stay, a stay of a lifetime... we will be back!!!

My husband and I decided to book a last minute "mini-honeymoon" before we can take our big one in 2019. I found a pretty decent deal through expedia.ca and booked with Park Central based on the location and pretty good reviews regarding their customer service. It was just okay overall. The room was cleaned daily and replenished with fresh towels, which was nice but I wouldnt say they were deep cleaned, even upon arrival. Dust in the corners, left over hair in the shower, etc. The cards for the rooms are frustrating and do not often work properly...I had made it clear we were celebrating our recent wedding and were told we would be "taken care of" in terms of a nice room but that didnt happen...we ended up with a room with two double beds :S so confusing. Nothing else was done, not even a congratulations at check in.They also have a VERY steep daily fee, so expect a large bill at the end of your stay. I had been aware of this but for the dated nature of the hotel, the issues with the room keys, etc. 10% off at the hotel bar isn't exactly worth it. They charge resort fees in vegas but that is because they all have pools, etc. That being said the location is excellent, a few blocks from Central Park and Times Square. Would I recommend it? maybe, for location if you get a good deal.Would I book again? probably not, would rather pay a bit more for an initial cost at a more modern place with no hidden fees.

I enjoyed my stay here with a few friends. James and Kemi, were really helpful. I like that the hotel was centrally located to everything we did. Great place. I would stay again. Price was okay. Thanks.

We visited here as a second stop in New York. The rooms were of a good size, in a good condition. The hotel has a nice luxury feel to it, with a welcoming lobby and bar set just behind it.The location is great, close to Central Park, and close to Times Square without being in the bustle and bustle it brings!It’s also close to two subway stations so getting further afield was no problem.Overall, great hotel and would consider staying here again if returning to NYC.

What a great place to spend time while visiting nyc.Thanks to kemi and James you guys made our stay much better. My husband and I were very happy for choosing this place. Next time we go to NYC we will stay here again.

Thank you Carolyn for helping me to book our room. You are so special. And is so quick. I didn't pass past a lot of time there. Thats why you have to Keep doing good. Godd job. I think i will comw back. Love this hotel.

After our original accommodations were no longer available to us, we were booked at the park Central Hotel. To our surprise, the accommodations were wonderful but better yet the service was outstanding !!! After, explaining our dilemma regarding our accommodations and the loss of over $2000 the hotel manager, Elvir was very sympathetic and made our stay comfortable. it was a pleasant surprise. Elvir, the hotel manager and Angela, the checkin staff are an asset to the property.

We arrived a day met Emanuel who made sure we were accommodated and threw in a room upgrade. The level of happiness from the first hello is super heightened! Perfect location #loveparkcentralhotelnewyork

I always come in this Hotel when I travel for work. The staff, in particular Carolyn, is very careful helpful and nice. She made me feel comfortable like at home. I did appreciate so much the big standard room, always clean and well furnished and the central position is a very plus, close to everything. Erika Pittarello

The Park Central Hotel is a clean, modern hotel. The staff is friendly, helpful, and welcoming. My room was a very nice size with two very comfortable queen beds, modern furnishings, art on the walls. The bathroom had nice modern fixtures and was quite roomy. I got a good weekend price that made this updated hotel a genuine bargain. Also its location is very convenient, with a subway stop a block away.Highly recommended!!

It was my first time staying here at the Park Central and I must say that everyone at reception service skills are immaculate. Emanuel was outstanding upon check in. Looking forward to staying there from now on.

This is a very nice and cozy hotel at a great location, all of the staff was very friendly and helpful with everything, especially Quimby that helped us with guest relations. Overall a very plesant stay!

I had a fantastic stay at the Park Central! The room was beautiful and quiet, the bed was incredibly comfortable and the staff were incredible. I had the loveliest chat with Carolyn at the front desk. I can’t wait to come back!

Thank you Angela for your kindness :) I really recommend this place, it’s rare to find a place where people are so careful. You have all the good spots close to you and the Central Park of course! Enjoy!

clean , spacious , i am a repeat client for many years and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great location , service etc... the people are nice , the bar is great , new modern looking and they make great drinks and offer you like appetizers !!!!

The room was clean and staff made my wife feel real comfortable because she was uneasy about staying in the city. We celebrated our 33rd wedding anniversary and her 66th birthday. Staff was great with us. We planned to visit again very soon.

The main advantages of the hotel are the location, the renovated rooms, and the great service.The rooms are always clean, and you can get anything you need.At the beginning i was disappointed by the lack of some basic items in the room, but after contacting the service manager, they made the effort to make sure we get everything needed.

I absolutely loved this hotel! We got a great welcome from Quimby and a 5-star service from him! He accommodated us really fast and made sure we had everything we needed. In addition, our room was spacious, clean and really modern. We would go back at the Park Central Hotel anytime we’re in New York again.

It was my first time ever staying at this hotel and it was absolutely amazing. The service there is excellent. Angela and Saleem both greeted and welcomed me. Their level of service was above and beyond. I will go back just because how well they treated me. I am all about service and they both made me feel like home. I will always go back and stay there. Such a great experience overall. Excellent service, great location, great room!!!!. Thank you Angel and Saleem for a wonderful experience!!! You guys are awesome!

Elizabeth and Ana were great. Very friendly and helpful. Favorite place to come stay. Highly recommend it. Rooms are always clean and smell fresh. Location is ideal always able to grab a cab and the subway is right on the corner.

Excellent stay here at PC. Very quiet and all employees were great with service. Emanuel was very helpful. I look forward to staying here in the future. If there was a pool on grounds it would of been even better.

After arriving at the hotel I realized I forgot to book reservations for my night out with family and friends. Emanuel at the reception area fixed that issue right away. We ate and enjoyed the rest of the night around town with his concierge skills. Great Job Emanuel!!

I stayed here for two nights and to my amazement Emanuel at the front desk went above and beyond our expectations. He continuously guided us to the best restaurants and made sure we had everything we needed throughout our stay. Service was impeccable.

Very nice hotel and excellently located. Near all the must see New York spots. Been here many times before, always a pleasure. Modern, clean and big rooms, helpfull personel, specially Carolyn from the reception.

My visit to Park Central was amazing,we were celebrating my anniversary and all of the staff truly made it a homey experience. I was warmly greated by Carol, who really made the trip worth while. She let me know some sites I can visit and restaurants that were to die for, all while providing exquisite service on a daily basis. Im forever grateful to those who have assisted during my stay!

had an amazing and great service at the front desk, with a wonderful lady named Angela Her beautiful smile and warm greeting as we get to the front desk. Welcoming us and having a pleasant conversation while she check us in Angela, found out it was our anniversary and she did wonders for us she upgrade our room for us" oh my beautiful room", what a way to start our anniversary with God Grace and Angela putting a touch to it..We had an amazing time and a great experience at the hotel, highly recommend! specially with great front desk personnel like Angela..

Had an amazing experience at this hotel. View was bonkers. Local spots were endless. And guest services were OUTSTANDING. Especially a young man by the name of Darrien. He was super accommodating and answered all my questions. Definitely staying here again in the future.

After a morning of Sunday travel, Quimby at the front desk made sure everything went as smooth as possible! The lobby is thoughtfully laid out with great areas to rest and/or meet with a guest. Great hotel and great service.

Quimby - really was helpful we were tired from a long trip and he sorted out an early check in!!! really appreciate it. The hotel is in an ideal location - close to subway and times square, really nice for a quick pop into central park for an early morning run before work

We arrived early from our 16 hour flight and Quimby the guest relations manager made a highly concerted effort to ensure that we could gain early check in to freshen up even though our check in was only at 2, really appreciate it!!

I came in well before check-in and Carolyn worked very well and fast to get me a room, all while being very kind. Great service and help right from the start, which continued throughout my short stay.

Amazing staff , Carolyn at the front was so helpful and friendly ! I will be back to this place just cause of that experience with her. Highly recommend! Awesome lobby and easy to check in! Great location .

I love this hotel. It is a great location for both my work when Im in town and social time. It has a beautiful classy feel to it and on top I have to say the staff are so professional and lovely.A personal shout out to Carolyn . I just came off a lot of long flights for work from Paris, to Australia, to LA and then NY where i came in very early in the morning just exhausted. Carolyn was such a star and made sure I got a room and was comfortable. She went beyond and that's what is great at this hotel - They are professional and classy but also have a family feel. So I highly recommend and come on ....its New York! ;) It is always a great idea !

Gorgeous office building views :) Good size and beautiful room. Exquisite Art. TO DIE FOR PILLOWS. Super comfy beds. Accommodating Staff. MY girls love the bath products. Did I mention these pillows. Props for the blackout curtain. Will return when we come back to NYC!

Big shout-out to Park Central Hotel, NYC after our recent vacation in August '19...Such a great, convenient location with friendly and accommodating staff... After numerous previous stays, the first of which was in Winter 2004/5 my family and I were happy to return to what we consider to be our home away from home... We're never disappointed and our expectations are always exceeded. From the minute we stepped in to the reception area and were met by Carolyn @ Check-Inn, we immediately felt right at home. Thank-you so much for making our vacation memorable, we'll definitely be back (hopefully real soon!) and we'll always recommend that our friends & family stay at our home away from home...

I've stayed here many times. The hotel is conveniently located for Central Park, Broadway, and 5th Avenue attractions. It's large, not personal. The elevators are a bottleneck - not enough as they allocated 1/2 of them to their high end property on the higher floors. Be aware that the price that shows up in the online price searches is incorrect. They add $35/day "service charge" that others e.g. Marriott do not. There is no special service. In fact they're pretty skimpy and don't even provide water - which is pretty common in 4 star hotels

We stayed at Park Central Hotel for New York Fashion week. Very comfortable beds & pillows. Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, MOMA, and many Broadway shows. I want to thank a very nice lady from guest service (originally from Montenegro) for all you help. Will stay here again

This was my first time staying at the Park Central Hotel. For comparison only, I usually stay in places like the Lotte NY Palace or one of the Kimpton branded hotels. I chose this hotel as it was close to a conference site and NYC was incredibly booked up that night so there wasn't much available. I booked and paid for the room in advance to save a little since the rooms were so expensive ($550/night plus taxes which took it to over $625). That being said, the hotel was a lovely surprise. Large, modern-decor lobby and swift check-in. I liked that you needed your room key to access the elevator. I asked for a quiet room and got just that. Yes, it did face an interior courtyard area and all I saw was a brick wall in the distance but hey, it was only for one night. It was blissfully quiet which is always a plus in NYC. The room was modern and clean and the bed was incredibly comfy. Large TV, enough conveniently placed plugs for charging and well lit. Was it worth that large sum of money? Not sure but I think I caught NYC on a particularly bad Wednesday night so I was grateful to get a room. It is convenient if you want to hang in that part of town and there was a Starbucks just steps from the front door. Yay. Would I consider it again? You bet.

Had a great stay at the park central hotel, I was helped by a manager who was in training named Darren who did a phenomenal job and made sure me and my family left with smiles on our faces. Although he was new he was confident and friendly along with other staff. I will be returning to New York and staying here. Thank you !

We arrived from our red eye flight early in NY and our rooms were not ready (as expected, totally normal). Quimby was beyond nice and the most helpful person and he was able to get us into rooms earlier than expected. Truly amazed at his graciousness and we will totally stay here again because of it.

Quimby went above and beyond in accommodating my coworker and I in getting checked in early. He gave us exceptional hospitality and was friendly and professional. He even gave us upgraded conjoining rooms. We will definitely be back for future business trips because of his hospitality.

Just stayed in this hotel with my wife and three friends to celebrate a friends 50th birthday for 3 nights.We were happy with 2 out of the 3 rooms we booked and we're disappointed that we had to wait until the second day of our stay to have our issue's resolved and a new room allocated. We were also very disappointed that we were charged 35 dollars a night per room to use extra facilities and we're then told on the final night of our stay we couldn't use the hotel bar as it was closed for a private function. We all enjoyed our stay in New York but am afraid to say that the hotel was a bit of a let down we did pay quite a considerable amount of money for our stay .

Park Central is a great hotel, with great localization and renovated rooms.
