I think it's the fourth time I've been there...Had some problems with the wifi and the cleaning, although the second of them was completely resolved by Elizabeth, part of the guest relations staff. She was extremely helpful in resolving my issues and even got me a free late check out. I am planning on staying there again.

I have visited New York numerous times and stayed in many different hotels, this hotel Park Central has exceeded my expectations. It is located in between Times Square and Central Park so it’s convenient to all of the hot spots in New York. The hotel is beautiful & definitely a 5 star hotel, they have a sexy upscale bar/lounge and the rooms are beautiful and larger than most hotel rooms in New York (space is limited). I originally booked my stay for only two nights knowing that I was going to be New York for 10 days. I went to guest services to upgrade my room and was immediately greeted by Elizabeth, she made me feel welcomed & helped me with my room. She went above and beyond to make sure that I was accommodated & enjoying my time there. Elizabeth was engaging and charismatic. Working in sales, I was impressed with her customer service, so I extended my stay for another 7 nights!!! when I went down to guest services a second time to extend my stay Elizabeth help me and make sure that I was satisfied with my room, While extending my stay with Elizabeth; another gentleman named Darren M was working with her, he was friendly and funny and also made me feel welcomed. My stay here was amazing. Honestly it’s the friendly staff that make this place a five-star hotel keep up the good work with your customer service and thank you Park Central! ~TZ

Our party checked into 3 rooms, reception staff were not particularly friendly, very slow & offered no advice on the hotel facilities or places to visit, maps etcWe'd booked allocation on arrival & although 2 rooms were ok ours was simply awful, small, dark & looked grubby, toilet seat was cracked & it had a view out onto a brick wall plus an interconnecting door through which you could hear everything the occupants of that room were saying. Certainly not what we expected for the price we paid. I immediately called reception & asked if we could move to a room without an interconnecting door, I was told the concierge would come up & take us to another room.We sat there for 45 minutes & no one came so I called again, this time they said that they would get the manger to call me "right back" Meanwhile our friends were waiting downstairs so we could go out as we'd had nothing to eat since we'd landed. Another 20 minutes go by so I called again, this time I was eventually put through to the 'manager' I explained that this was the third call to reception with regards the room & she said she knew nothing about it ? I tried to explain the issues but she butted in to say there was nothing she could do as they had no other rooms available. When I asked why I had been told on the first call that the concierge would come up to move us she said they couldn't have done that as they were finished for the night ! She said the best she could do was move us to a 'deluxe' room the following day so we couldn't unpack & eventually left to find a restaurant 1 1/2 hours later than we could have done had we been told this in the first place.We did get moved the folllowing day & this room (652) was far better but not really what I expected for the price. Oh & the toilet seat was cracked in this room & the heaters in all 3 rooms did not seem to work. We then found on the second night the bar closed at 11.30pm, the 4th night it was closed completely for a private function & the day we left it was not open while we waited for our airport transfer ( between 1pm & 3pm) There is a little shop that sells very limited food, drink & coffee but that's it. No idea how they get 4 stars. No kettles in the rooms, no fridge ( unless you ask for one ) not even a bottle of water. As other guests have said the facilities fee of $35 / night is ridiculous & should be included in the price as it is compulsory. We had no use for anything it offered ( apart from luggage storage which most hotels offer for free ) & it didn't even include the wifi ? To recap, we found the staff on reception unfriendly & unhelpful, rooms with interconnecting doors could be very noisy, poor facilities for the price, a bar that's not open very late or not at all, standard room very poor, deluxe room just ok, nothing special or deluxe about it.The location was the only thing really going for it, 3 blocks from Central Park & 10 mins walk to Times Square. Would I stay again, no. Would I recommend it, not really, I've stayed in much nicer places for a lot less money.

The Park Central Hotel is centrally located and convenient for travelers. The best part of my stay was my interaction with Quimby (the guest relations staff). When I got locked out of my room he was extremely helpful and helped me get back into my room to get my things. His energy and professionalism were "top notch"!

We got the Best service from Angela at the front disk. She was so nice and helpfull, wich was so needed after beeing at another hotel, that where conpletely dirty and bad. The hotel itself was beatiful

This is my 3rd times here. This hotel always on top of my lost everytime I am in NYC (except sometime they fully booked). Carolyn at the front desk very friendly and helpful. I arrived at 12:00am and could get my room right away with her help.

The Hotel was very good and the personal very friendly and helpful. Quimby talked to us when we checked out.He is a very friendly and funny guy! We're sure we'll come back to the Park Central Hotel! Two little negative points: It hasn't a minibar in the rooms to cool down the drinks and the air conditioner didn't work so well. We wanted to cool down our room but it wasn't very successful. Sadly I don't remember our room number.Thank you very much.

The room we first got was on the front side of the hotel, the noice of the machinery outside was crazy and it started at 7 am, so we asked to be moved to a different floor and on the other side of the street. They gave me the room at 4:00 pm so we didn't have a room all day, I'm pregnant in my first trimester and I need a bed to rest for a little bit. After they moved us they gave us a king size bed room, even though we had a 2 double bed room with more space. But I was to tired to argue and didn't want to wait longer to rest. The bathroom was very tiny and you couldn't fit on the toilet and close the door at the same time. Also I don't like that it doesn't have a glass door on the shower and has a curtain. And overall the cleanliness of the room was poor. the The staff wasn't very helpful and had bad mood every time we talked to the lady. On the second night we had the loudest neighboors, we could hear their conversations, the laughs, the stayed up all night, it was torture. We tried to contact the front desk but you don't have the option. You don't put bottled water, even though you charge a 40 use fee extra nightly.

I stayed here for one week. The experience was outstanding because of the extended effort of Elizabeth. She was my guardian angel during the stay and she goes way out of her way to make anyone feel welcomed and at home even in the heart of a hotel. My experience here started after a 14 hours flight from Dubai to New York and I was very disappointed when I found out that because of the full occupancy, the check in could be from 2-4 in the afternoon and as I reached the hotel at 10 in the morning I was just tired and jet lagged. After having a discussion with her she manage to convince me with a coffee and a pastry to wait for a bit and she will tru to accomodate me as soon as possible and she did. When I reached the room, as it was cold, she sent me a heater immediately. The room did not have a fridge or a beverage maker upon but she anticipated my needs and send it to me . She also gave me a spacious room, as I was here for one week for the fashion week and two suitcase can create a whole mess in a tiny room. I cannot express my gratitude towards this beautiful amazing woman that knows exactly what hospitality industry means and she indeed reflects her managerial skills and her focus is on offering the best customer service. Thank you, Elizabeth, you made Park Central a warm house from me, far from my home and I do recommend this hotel, for the location and the facilities they offer!

I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting NYC; the location is excellent, is nearby most attractions, only two blocks from Central Park, Columbus Circle, Rockefeller center, Times Square, and the Theater District. The rooms are bright and spacious, rare for NYC, super clean and most importantly the staff is amazing, super friendly and helpful they go above and beyond to ensure your stay is memorable. From the front line Angela, Isabel, Quinby, everyone was great! Great value for your dollar, great customer service, all around a great hotel

We stayed here for 4 nights in August, we'd previously stayed in the same hotel about 10 years ago.Since our last stay there's been a large amount of renovation done to the place, as you'd expect in that time, and it really is a very nice hotel now.The room was spacious, the air con effective, given the heat while we were there that was an essential, and very quiet, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom more than adequate. All of the staff we encountered at the hotel were helpful, special mention must be made to the housekeeping staff who very kindly offered to warm my young daughters pain au chocolat in their staff room, we declined but it was still a lovely offer all the same.By NYC standards this hotel is relatively affordable, I've certainly stayed in other hotels and paid more and got less. The only gripes I have are minor but big enough for me to still remember. The hotel really does require more lifts to service floor 0 - 9. this was especially a problem on the morning of departure with bags to carry and the lifts absolutely full to bursting upon landing on our floor for a good 20 minutes. The TV channel choice in the room is limited, our hotel in Boston had Netflix facility so we could sign-in and let our daughter watch while we got ready for the day ahead and finally our room looked out onto 7th Avenue but we were only just above the level of the hotel foyer and to say the flat room we looked out onto looked like a post apocalyptic waste land would be no exaggeration. Despite these minor gripes I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

I got a surprisingly good deal for this hotel and it was an even more pleasant surprise when I arrived. Modern clean rooms with quiet air con and all the extras you need (hairdryer, heater etc). Very comfy bed. I had an internal facing room which was totally silent at night. Concierge were nice and helpful. It’s also just a stones throw away from at least 2 subway stations so easy to get around. Only downsides were that there was no basic coffee of tea facilities in the room so there’s no morning tea in bed option (no doubt to encourage you to go downstairs and buy a coffee). Also the ‘mandatory facilities fee’ of $35 ($40 incl tax) is a bit of a rip off if you don’t actually use those facilities. Two of the three main facilities - the bag deposit and WiFi - in a hotel of this quality should really be included in the price.

Hotel is in a perfect spot to take in the sites, visit Lincoln center, Carnegie hall, Central Park and Lincoln center. Close to fifth avenue, Columbus circle, Times Square and all the major subway and bus routes. From the 3x we stayed there, the rooms were always clean and the beds are very comfortable. This is not a luxury hotel but it is a really nice property and has a good bar/lounge with a good vibe. What makes it really nice is the staff. They are always so friendly and helpful. On our recent trip, we had to leave early due to a weather catastrophe where our home is. We were prepaid, the hotel didn’t hesitate to refund our money and wish us a safe return home. It made everything so much easier with less stress. So where it may lack in other luxuries, you can be sure they want you to have a good experience and they care. A very easy hotel to have kids in, so a better choice than the surrounding luxury hotels.

Location, service, everything was awsome! Specially Ana, in the front desk. We got there early and tired, there were no rooms avaiable for an early check-in. I don't know how, but she came up with a better room right away. That kind of treatment that makes the difference! We'll be back for sure.

The Hotel is very nice located. It is near At Central Park and There is a metro Station around.The service is excelent.It was wonderful to stay here for a week.The room is very confortableWe will recomend this hotel for all our friends.

We stayed here for a week in September and we had a lovely room on the 11th floor. The bed was huge and very comfy!! We had a nice view onto Carnegie hall which was a bonus, and the room wasn’t too noisy being higher up. The staff were very attentative and we had a great check out experience Quimby was great help! Would definitely recommend staying here and would stay again :)

Stayed for a week in September with absolutely no problems at all, was very relaxing and the hotel was very accommodating. Excellent subway system very local which is a huge bonus. Would 100% recommend. Carolyn and Quimby were excellent hosts and couldn’t have done enough!

Just booked a second night because of the excellent service I received. Downside is that there’s no restaurant but Emanuel and Carol at the front desk were great. Positive attitudes all the time. Look forward to my return.

Came from Argentina to NYC for the first time and it was amazing. Young gentleman in reception by the name of Emanuel was excellent. Read his reviews online and everything added up. What an asset he is to this hotel. Keep up the good work guys!!

Great people and super comfortable room. Emanuel took amazing care during my stay! Check in was incredibly easy. I slept like a baby on their mattresses. Very comfortable lobby bar and lounge. 100 percent recommend!

I stayed in nyc for 2 nights and enjoyed every bit of it. Bartenders are great. Nice gentleman at the front desk Emanuel took care of us and recommended s few places in the local area. Concierge was busy so he took over. Clean rooms and smiles everywhere.

Se vas the opportunity yo be assisred by Anna and Quimby at recesión, the are the best! Se loved the loción and ir a próximo to times asusté and oír fin esa crean and the Bobby os ver oferta.i si lo recommed the Park Central hotel and i can esto yo come black.

I spent a 3 days weekend with my boys here. First of all the hotel has an excellent location, close to the subway, to Central Park, to shops and restaurants. The rooms are clean and neat even if I found a little dark inside. The best was Elizabeth at the guest services, she helped us with everything, gave us good advice with so much kindness, she is absolutely fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely come back whenever we come back to NY.

From the moment we walked into this fantastic hotel it was a great experience. From the Bell Man who was super friendly to our check-in person Ana, to the effusively happy, helpful, and friendly Quimby (I wish I had as much life energy as he does), we loved our stay. The hotel is stylish with great decor. The rooms (we had two) were immaculately clean, fresh, and beautiful. Also great value for the money. The location is stunning - two short blocks from Central Park South, Columbus Circle, and the biggest Whole Foods Market I have ever seen. We will be back for sure and plan to make this our regular NYC hotel destination.

I usually stay in the area but never in this hotel. Front desk agents are great. Emanuel is the agent to see. He has so much information in all aspects. Looking forward to my last night here. Rooms are huge compared to neighboring hotels.

I’m staying Park Central Hotel for 2nights while I’m traveling NYC and I came to the hotel much earlier than chech-in time but Carolyn helped me cheched-in early. It’s so kind of her. I was frustrated about the weather but she make my day. Thank you so much for helping me and I like this hotel so much! Location is perfect, hotel is perfect, everything is perfect.

We stayed at the Park Central Hotel in New York a week. It was all perfect. Professionalism of each division. Great availability and excellent room cleaning. All perfect!! The hotel is centrally located (5 min. to Central Park and 10 min. to Times Square) and very well connected by subway. Many thanks at all and Mrs. Elizabeth (Guest Relation Manager). Mauro Befo

We had an amazing stay at Park Central. Perfect situated, very closed to Broadway and Time Square. Very nice staff. Many thanks to Elizabeth, who was very kind and helpfull to us. We‘ll come back ... thank you! Luminita

After a really bad experience with another hotel (they cancelled my reservation minutes prior to my arrival) we found Central Hotel NYC, last minute. I was nervous because it was mid-summer, and all other well-known chain hotels were fully booked. However, I was completely wrong. Hotel staff were absolutely amazing (bonus for Vito, the front desk concierge who went above and beyond to save my trip, after a bad start). Hotel was great, clean, great location (close enough to Time Square, and close to the central park). They have a coffee shop in the lobby where you could get a decent coffee before venturing outside. Totally recommended!

The hotel was what I had expected. Very touristy and close to the park, the latter was very convenient for running. Check in was not a short process and for a few minutes there were 10 groups in line with nobody behind the desk. My room was spartan but generally clean. The chain/flip lock looked as though somebody had kicked in the door and the metal was broken - it had not been fixed. There was no water or snacks in the room so if you needed anything in the evening, you'd have to go to the corner store to buy something.The bar seemed busy during the day but empty at night. The convenience shop in the hotel was good and had sandwiches, coffee and a good selection of drinks.The best part about the hotel was after I checked out I realized that I had left some items in the room. I emailed the manager and they were able to quickly locate the items and have them ready for me when I returned the week after, The hotel staff has integrity and that is important when you travel a lot for business.

The moment I stepped into the beautiful lobby after a long flight I was greeted and assisted by Carolyn at the front desk. She had a beautiful, kind and genuine smile on her face. I knew I was early and check in was at 4 pm. Carolyn acknowledged that and was honest about the situation. She told me they were booked and she will give me the first room that comes available. within the first hour she provided me with the room...... Carlyn’s Kind gesture set the tone for my trip. I love NY and people like Carolyn who work hard and go out of their own way to provide personalized care to their customers. I would definitely return to this hotel. Thank you

I've stayed at many hotels in New York, and I can say with much sincerity that this was the best experience I've had. The staff, Nancy V and Elsa, accommodated my requests and made sure I was comfortable. I will stay here again in the future without a doubt. Thank you!

I stayed here in April and loved it. But upon returning in September Emanuel helped me again, and helped me so much. This hotel is so clean and central to all of Manhattan. I won’t stay anywhere else.

My stay was great the room and clean and staff was excellent. Went to the bar and the drinks were great and stayed open late. Emanuel at the desk was a great help and very polite. The staff was welcoming and approachable.

Me and my friends came to celebrate my birthday here from Florida and it was a great experience overall! Check in had a long line but they were so efficient and helpful. One of the employees Quinby was even more amazing! You could tell he had a long day and yet still managed a smile on his face and was super sweet. Would definitely recommend this place to friends/family !!

We stayed at Park Central for three nights. It was ideal because it was very centrally located with plenty of good restaurants and delis close by and just a few minutes from Times Square. It was our first time in New York and we were very pleased with the room, clean and comfortable. We had a view of central park which was amazing. We were given breakfast vouchers for the lobby cafe which we didn't expect. The doormen were very helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel, it was good value for money.

Newly renovated Park Central Hotel is well situated. It is blocks away from Central Park in one direction and Broadway from another direction. The staff at the Front Desk is welcoming and efficient, but not overly staffed. The rooms are modern, and very clean – Housekeeping and Customer Service is friendly and eager to please. I highly recommend the Lobby Bar; the main bartender is awesome, and prepares the best drinks and cocktails, ever. I recommend the famed Negronis! The night servers are great, especially the principle lady who has the best disposition ever! The hotel does not offer room service but there are many eateries surrounding the hotel. Price versus accommodation/location: very good!

Worth every penny. Modern, chic, inviting. Super friendly and helpful staff. Fantastic location a stone's throw from Central Park and Whole Foods. Tons of cafes and restaurants in the area. Rooms are as nice as the staff. And the restaurant and bar within the hotel are convenient. We will definitely be staying again soon!

The rooms were a good size & comfortable & clean. The location is ideal, halfway between Central Park and Time Square with Metro station very close by. The staff were attentive, polite and professional.

Fantastic time in Central Park,Hired rickshaws, had to get 2 because we are a family of 4,Started at $200 being $100 per rickshaw, but haggled and got both for $120,Best $120 spent, saw lots of sights,Strawberry fields, Dakota building, homes of famous people,fountain and bridge from friends, hotel from home alone movie, carousel, zoo and many many more, with stops for photos, just over 1 hour tour,A must for New York,Nobody knows New York better than them.

Thank you so much to Elvir and Nancy V for helping me check in this morning. They were very helpful and nice employees. I will definitely be coming back thanks to these two. Provided some of the best customer service I have ever experienced. I 100% recommend this hotel solely because of them.

The hotel is perfectly located do discover the city. Nice and clean rooms, friendly staff and a large, comfortable bed. Nancy and Quimby were helping us during rhe checkput time. We will definitely come back

The hotel is perfectly located near central park and midtown. So it‘s a great balance between the opportunity of seeking a rest in the green, but also for shopping, going out and great restaurants. There is also a metro station near by. The bed was very comfy. The staff is incredible friendly!

I have spent 10 nights at the hotel. Very well located, walking distance from Central Park and other major attractions like theatres, MoMa, the Met, Time Square. Personel is very friendly and always ready to help. Special mention to Miss Elizabeth Sokha. From minute one she was very helpful in expediting y check in and handling reception of some packages and in general advice as to the best things to do when... All of the guys at front desk, concierge, luggage etc are always ready to give a helping hand. Definitely recommend a stay at this place!

Everything was perfect from the welcoming atmosphere to the check-in process. We were very well taken care of by the front office manager Ms. Sokha Puth. She could tell how tired and we were and wasted no time making sure we had a great room with a view of Time Square. She even went the extra mile by giving us bottled waters and calling us in our room within 15 minutes of us getting to it to make sure we were comfortable and to see if we needed anything else. Ms. Puth is an example of what great customer service is. We will definitely come back and stay here again! It is well located within walking distance to Central Park and time square. Thank you Ms. Puth for taking care of my family.

Stayed at the park central New York hotel over Labor Day weekend and had a great time. Angela checked us in and was very accommodating especially given it was our first time in NY. Great location, great customer service, and spacious rooms

We have spent 2 stays in this magnificent hotel. On our arrival we were welcomed and made to feel at home before reaching our rooms. The staff are exceptionally friendly and really go above and beyond to make their guests feel comfortable and meet all requests. The rooms are modern and spotless with fantastic AC. I would highly recommend this hotel for a fabulous stay and minutes away from the heart of New York. A special mention must be made to Don Fraser and Elizabeth who could not do enough to ensure that our ever need was meet. Thank you for memorable experience.

This hotel ended up being perfect for our 4 night stay in New York. Excellent location, right next to central park, just across the street from the subway and there is a great little coffee shop next door. Rooms were clean and pretty good size for a NYC hotel. There was only 1 bar of soap so we called housekeeping for more and they immediately brought some up. Guest services even called to follow up 20 minutes later just to make sure we got them. I would definitely recommend staying here for your next trip to the city!

A great location with an even better team, with a special thanks to Angela, Nancy & Quimby for making the experience so seamless — and also finding us a room before their official check in! Thanks again :)

I first stayed at Park Central in 2006 when I came to NYC for the very first time. The rooms are suitable and clean and the views of the city are pretty enjoyable! This location is very central to all things New York!

We choose this hotel because it was near Central park and Times square. it's just one of the best locations to have if you want to explore nyc. The hotel is also near a good subway station. Groccery shop, Starbucks, 99cents pizza and lots of nice restaurants are around the corner.Staff was very helpfull, polite and professional. From the moment you walk in, you feel right at home.Rooms are very spatious (deluxe queensize room) with excellent comfy beds, airco, a safe and a very large tv. We had a nice view at carnegie hall from our window on the 4th floor. Bathroom is very clean and large enough. The reception staff is very helpfull at any moment of the day.We couldn't really find anything bad about this hotel. Maybe the elevators are a bit small and the facilities fee is a bid odd to charge, but overall those are minor details. Booking directly from their site gives you a beter deal and additional perks which is always nice.If you're looking for a quality hotel with an excellent location, look no further. If we ever return to nyc, we 'll probably book this hotel again!

If your looking for a great place to stay this place is it. All staff are very friendly and welcoming. You are very close to Central Park and great restaurants all around. Times Square is only a few minute walk one way and Central Park is the same going the other way which are both visible from the entrance to the hotel. Thanks Park Central Hotel in making our stay one to remember.Rick Henderson

I stayed at the Park Central Hotel in July of this year with my 10 year old son and we had a great time. Great location, warm welcome from Daphne who checked us in and out, friendly staff and a great concierge service who organized our 3 day sight seeing agendaWould definitely go again and would recommend as a great base in New York.

I recently had a pleasure to stay at park central hotel new York with my two kids,I found the hotel staff extremely friendly and helpful,I specially like to mention Saleem at the front desk,he was amazing and the assistant manager front desk Nancy , she went above and beyond to help me when my flight got canceled and I wanted to rebook in the same hotel at a very busy time and short notice .As for the hotel I found my room both times very clean and immaculate , bathrooms very clean and stylish and the cleaning staff were friendly and courteous. I definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends who wants great location and awesome accommodation,I will be choosing park central hotel on my next trip to new York.

We stayed at Park Central Hotel for eight days and we enjoyed the location and Nnew York City. We met Quimby and Nancy at Guest Relations and they were very helpful in helping us with questions and our bill. We will return!

Me. Hightower at thé hôtel is gréât - if you havé challenge or nées help hé will help you. We will certains return and are happy with pur visit and looks forward to coming to New York City. Or is pur new hôtel

Great hotel with very welcoming. Please see Quimby Hightower and Nancy at the Guest Relations desk if you need help with any information or questions about your visit, they take ça of any questions and help you ! Will come back.

I had a great time staying here!I loved the location and enjoyed places near here!Carolyn helped me out checking out. Thanks!Bars, great restaurants, central park, and so many different metro lines near hotel was very helpful.

Well located hotel, near Central Park, subway stations, iconic buildings and shopping area. Rooms were well kept, clean and large. If you have an issue of any type you would like to discuss with any of the people working there, do not hesitate to look for Quimby Hightower over at Guest Relations front desk. He is definitely an asset to this hotel and will go out of his way to help you out in any way he can, always classy.We will definitely go back in future trips.

We immensely enjoyed our stay at Park Central. Emanuel Z and the entire staff was so kind and helpful at all times, They were always there and eager to help with anything we needed. The room was spacious and clean. It was very quiet and secure. It was a great location, easy to access Central Park, Time Square and the transit.

My visit was excellent. Carolyn Smith at the front desk made it all too easy to check-in and get settled. We enjoyed our room and the prompt service we received. We will definitely stay again on our next visit. Thanks Park Central!

Their customer service is great. If you do encounter an issue, or have a request, their guest relations will do their best to accommodate you. Elizabeth (guest relations manager) was understanding, accommodating and very hospitable. The rooms have been refurbished. My recommendation is simple, upgrade to the Premium Room, and you wont regret it. Definitely going back.

We were very pleased with the location and decor of this hotel for our first trip to New York . A few blocks in one direction you are in the tranquility of Central Park , a few blocks in the other direction sees you in the hustle and bustle of Times Square . The decor is very sophisticated , lots of beautiful art in rooms and communal areas . The staff are very helpful and accommodating . Couldn’t fault this hotel and would def visit again .

I usually do not write reviews however, I really enjoy my time at Park Central Hotel - the location was great,and the staff was so patience and showed excellent customer service. I was having a difficult time when I first arrived to New York. my travel to New York was hard, thank you to the bartender Kenny and customer relation team, especially James, yall are awesome and really turned my NY experience around .

We have been staying at the Park Central Hotel for last 6 years every time we visit New York - - - And we love it here:) it's excellent location, great rooms and friendly service are some of the reasons why we return every year. Beautiful lounge and bar in the lobby is a great place to relax and have a drink. We will be back again next year for sure.

I travel every month for work and try to take trips to NYC with my family when there is a long weekend. This is the 4th time I have stayed at this hotel and it never disappoints. Whether trips with my wife or traveling for business, the location is perfect for getting anywhere in the city and away from the overpopulated areas. Short walk to Time Square, 5th Ave. and Central Park. The staff has always treated me exceptionally well and they are very attentive to your needs and requests. Quimby- Director of Guest Experience could not be more helpful and thorough. I receive emails from him prior to my arrival and see him often throughout my stay. He's always positive, on point and friendly. This is my favorite hotel in NYC and is Top 3 in any city I have traveled to.

Everything was excellent about this hotel. No complaints all smiles. The people was great and the service was wonderful. I’m definitely staying at this location when I visit again. Thank you so much for the experience

The service at this hotel has been fantastic and I just got here. Although we were early for our check-in they took our luggage and information to text when our room was ready. Upon check-in at 4pm, I met Elizabeth and Manuel who went above and beyond to make my vacation even better! They provided me with information and maps for the area and told me to come to them if I needed anything else during my stay. I'm very excited for my stay and have also enjoyed the wonderful staff behind the bar as we waited for our room.

We had an amazing time at Park Central, from start to finish. Mesina (Mezina) did a wonderful job servicing our rooms. She is a wonderful person, hard working, and kind. She was very accommodating to us, as some times we had to sleep in after a long day exploring the city the day before. She was so sweet, and came back at another time to service the room. When we returned to our room at night, the beds were always made to perfection, with clean fresh sheets, and we never had to use the same towel twice. So a big Thank you to Mesina for looking after us. Also to Ally, Don, Quimbl for treating us with such kindness, it was our first time in NYC and you all made it one of the best holiday ever. So thank you to all. I cannot fault the staff, the hotel, and the location. We were close to everything. The hotel is located minutes from Central park, its also close to times Square - we could see it partially from out hotel room. There are pubs, diners, grocery stores, coffee shops and all within walking distance. This hotel really is a Gem in the heart of NYC.
Excellent service I received from Nomay v.The hotel is close to Times Square and Central ParkThe hotel have a very good standard and the rooms are cleanWi-Fi is available in the hotelThank you Yossi

We stayed here for a week of sightseeing the city. We were so pleased with the location, just 2 blocks from central park, couple of blocks from times square. The staff are really friendly and helpful. if you want to buy tickets for attractions you can do this through the hotel and saves queuing up at different venues. are room was the classic king size, it was spacious and clean, we had a great view of Carnegie hall. You can still hear the traffic through the windows so if your a light sleeper invest in ear plugs.The bed was so comfortable, we slept-well. There is a small shop in the lobby for hot drinks, sandwiches, cakes and sweets, convenient but we thought a little pricey.

Had a good stay.. great staff! Our kind receptionist was carolyn and she was friendly. Did lots of shopping. Love the location close to times square and central park. Will return again ans bring my family.

I was very well attended by the staff of the hotel, specially by Nancy who was very polite and helped me with a couple of questions about my packages and room keys!!Located just near the times square, the hotel is clean and provides great hospitality.
Great location when staying in New York.Staff are very friendly and very accomodating.Rooms are lovely and very clean and contain everything you need for the short time you stay in them.Will be back

We were welcomed warmly by Elsa at check-in who acknowledged my mom’s birthday. Then we had drinks in the bar served by Nancy who was very personable and made us feel welcome. The hotel is in a great location in that it is centrally located (walking distance to Central Park and Theatre District, and sandwiches between East Side and West Side). Hotel room is quite dark, but clean and comfy beds and decent towels and good shower. Best for tourists who want a good location and clean and comfortable place to rest.

Stayed 2 nights in 2 x queen room, a/c noisey, and no fridge no tea/coffee making facilities. But great location for Central Park and short walk to Time square. Beware of extra charge ( approx usd$40) on check out for hotel fee for use of wifi,gym etc , even if you don’t use it!

We always stay at The Park Central Hotel when staying in New York City. The location is so convenient near Central Park and Times Square. It is just a short walk to the great restaurants in Hell's Kitchen or Restaurant Row near the theater district. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. We are usually lucky enough to find a good deal whenever we go. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. We visit annually and are never disappointed. The only complaint we have is the elevator situation. We request a low floor and use the stairs and the elevators on one side of the building always has a long line.

We have been on a tour of Americaand stayed in many wonderful hotels .. this was not one of them. We were charged an extra 40 dollars per night each, apparently for use of gym and business centre, which we did not use. When we queried it, it is of course in the small print and I received a curt, vaguely rude email to this effect. This feels like such a scam as I’d rather pay an upfront room rate, as was our experience elsewhereThe 4O dollars was further annoying given that this hotel has nothing to offer apart from location. No breakfast, place for a drink.. the welcome is a queue and your key. The lifts can’t manage the volume of people .We stayed in the viceroy around the corner last year, next to Carnegie Hall.. much better value and no charges outside of room rate.

Amazing service especially by Quimby and hotel also ideal location and of a very high standard. Beds extremely comfortable and spacious. Bathroom also very spacious. Will definitely be back here and will definitely recommend to a friend. Much enjoyed stay!

Spent a thoroughly enjoyable night in the park central hotel! Received amazing help and assistance from staff, especially quimby at the front desk! Who made our stay simple and enjoyable! I found the beds to be extremely comfortable and don't want to get up

Good sized rooms, very clean and modern, 6 blocks from time square and 3 blocks from Central Park, great service from concierge Khianna to find help us find available broadway tickets, unfortunately no mini fridge

The position of this hotel is wonderful since it is between Times Square and Central Park, with 2 subway stations and bus stops within 2 minutes on foot. I booked a standard room: the floor is carpeted, but the borders are full of dust and the furniture sometimes damaged. No mini-bar available in the room. Very good bed and good bathroom. The hotel does not offer neither breakfast nor dinner, but there is Starbucks and other similar ones just next door. The fare is worth of the position, but the quality of the room could be improved. Moreover, two elevators for 26 floors are definitely not enough (you have to wait too long for the elevator).

We were delighted with the service, especially from James Beaubrun, the front desk manager. We are French people and can’t speak very well in English, and we were very lucky to meet James, who was very concilient with us. He gave us very good advices about the city. We enjoyed our trip even more because of him. We highly recommend the hotel.

The hotel has only rooms and fitness center. No other service. They don't have a restaurant to provide breakfast but only a lounge which opens in afternoon till night. They have no email to communicate before checking in and contacting thru website has no response. This place runs like a Bed and Breakfast. Sorry, no breakfast so only a Bed & Fitness center. The walls are so thin that talking little loud would disturb neighbours.

Very friendly customer service, very helpful people. Great central location. When you walk out look to your left to see Central Park and to your right to see Times Square. The rooms were very nice and clean.

We had a great experience with Caroline and Emanuel. She gave us a great room and he was great with local things to do. Best hotel to stay in Manhattan. The location is near everything. Central Park Times Square and Lincoln center.

I stayed here for a few days this past week and it has been great. The staff is very accomadatimg and it’s only 2 blocks from the edge of Central park which was great! Emanuel at the front desk was extremely helpful and I definitely recommend this place.

It always nice to be welcomed by friendly front desk especially Carolyn which was huge help!!Location prefect close to everything Rooms are very spacious Nice lobby Nice ambiance at bar lobby See you next Time NYC

Stayed here 3 nights and today we leave. Unbelievable service at this hotel. Love that they are going above and beyond for the guest. No time I was ever given a No when I was in need. Everyone at the desk was excellent. Emanuel and Jetmira were outstanding to speak to.

I cane into town for an interview and enjoyed my stay. The stacc here are very accommodating and helpful. EMANUEL AT THE FRONT DESK IS VERY INFORMATIVE. Very clean and location is great. Times square is near by.

We had a very good welcoming from Ms. Nancy V.She helps us getting earlier to our room and in getting our Broadway show tickets. She was amazing, smiley and mostly helpful. And we’ll of course remember her as one of the good ones in our tour to NYC!

Nice Hotel convenient to Central Park and Theatre District. Reasonably priced for mid town Manhattan with nice bar in hotel. Room was spacious and clean. It would have been nice if the hotel had a nice restaurant. Convenience store did not offer breakfast, other than donuts and coffee.

Amazing stay, everything was cleans and new. The location is perfect being very Central. The staff was great help with everything I needed. This hotel is a great deal for the price. Carolyn was great help with the checkout !

First time in NYC. My wife and I picked the Park Central due to its location and price. We arrived around at 1200 and was expecting to just store bags and begin to explore Manhattan, but to our pleasant surprise they had our room ready. We had a king bed which was very comfortable and there were plenty of space in the room for the both of us. Room was well appointed with modern décor, clean and comfortable. There was a bar/lounge on first floor as well as a coffee place. Its very walkable to Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park, and Times Square. We were able to store our bags there until 9 pm on check out day, which was very convenient. We arrive to NYC via Penn Station and was only a 15 minute taxi ride,

Alvethia (Ally) was very helpful and patient with us when we checked in at the hotel. She was very professional when assisting us after a long day of travelling, which my family and I really appreciated. She made extra efforts to accommodate our room requests, which helped to keep our family in close proximity.

Hotel room and bathroom was very clean. My mistake because I didn’t read everything when I booked, we didn’t have a refrigerator in the room, you can get one if requested I believe. Elevators are way too small and slow. Bar doesn’t open til 5, a bit of a bummer when you get in hours before check-in time. Overall a fabulous time for a very spontaneous trip!

This hotel lives up to the hype. I would recommend this hotel highly to anyone visiting New York. After a day touring the city, there is nothing better than stepping into this luxurious hotel with friendly helpful staff and spacious, comfortable beds. In particular I want to mention a member of staff, Elizabeth who was working at the guest relations desk. She was so kind and helpful and really made our stay so enjoyable. If I was staying in New York I would not look anywhere else but here.

Excellent location and services. Just a few blocks from Central Park and Time Squares.We had a problem with our Expedia reservation and Elizabeth from Guest services, helped us and solved it right away! We highly recommended it.

It was our first time in New York and we had booked 7 nights here through Hotels.com. The hotel staff were very helpful and courteous, and helped us to get 10% online discounts for a variety of sightseeing things to do during our stay. The location of this hotel is a big plus as you can easily walk to Central Park, Times Square etc. The room we had was air conditioned, a good size, had a BIG comfy bed and a large tv. If you want to see the sights in a short space of time, this hotel is a perfect place to stay.

After long flight you just want to relax. Walked into a busy Lobby at Noon thinking it was going to be more waiting but was very smoothe and fast. Nice lady named Elizabeth greeted me and helped me right away. I asked for an early check in and didn’t expect much due to the amount of people but she Made it Happen. Nice lounge area to meet and great staff .

Elizabeth Cacovic and Nancy V are excellent in helping me to find my card that got stuck in the machine. They saved the card for me and contact me. It is a big relieve for me that I don’t have to get a new card from the bank. They also gave me a late check out. It means a lot to me.Thank

Thank you Elizabeth for a warm welcome. It gave me a great first impression of the hotel. Elizabeth was very kind, attentious and fast on my reception, thanks again. The hotel is very well located, few steps from times square

The hotel was wonderful. Very well located and easy to get around to ALL major places. Even the subway to Brooklyn was steps from the front door. We loved being so close to restaurants, attractions, and yet slightly away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. The room was clean and comfortable. We did wish there was access to a mini-fridge so we could keep food and drinks cold. The portions are huge in NYC so we often had leftovers packed up. The staff at the hotel was very professional and friendly and they were always available to help. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would happily stay there again.

The lobby offers a nice ambiance and meeting tables for quick or all day meetings. It is elegant and modern...Best and friendliest staff Ever: my family came at the end of my business trip and Ana at the reception was amaizing, by the time they arrived, she had put chocolate little boxes in the room as a welcoming touch and a bottle of courtesy bubbly for the wife. It makes such a big difference to have people that take seriously their hospitality job.

We had a lovely stay at the Park Central Hotel in NY during the last week in July with my daughter and 2 of her friends. It was an ideal location to base our sightseeing and activities throughout the city. The girls were able to visit all 5 boroughs easily as the hotel was centrally located from many subway lines.Our room was spacious enough for 4 girls to share. The beds was lush and comfortable. The hotel also has a lovely lobby bar area where we could gather in the evening after a long day of touring the city. The staff are friendly and efficient - we checked in and out without any problems or a long wait time.I highly recommend this hotel, as it's centrally located in a safe area in the city and is reasonably priced.

Park Central hosted two of Manhattan’s most notorious mob hits. On November 4th, 1928, Arnold Rothstein walked into the Park Central’s front door and few hours later he spilled out of the service entrance with a bullet in his gut. 29 years later, the Park Central would see blood again, but this time in its barbershop. October 25, 1957, Albert Anastasia strutted into Grasso’s Barber shop in The Park Central Hotel. The mobster took a barber chair with his back facing the door. The attack was a classic mob hit. Two identically dressed gunmen hidden beneath aviator sunglasses, fedoras, and scarves wrapped around their faces walked into the hotel lobby. A wheelman and lookout in the lobby were waiting for them outside. Five bullets tore into the mafia chieftain. The police never apprehended the mob hitmen and the crime remains unsolved. The barbershop is now, like everything else, a StarBucks.The rooms are nice. The old bathroom means the door doesn't open all the way, instead hits the toilet before even halfway open. The seat has a big crack in it after everybody hits it with the door over and over. Every day when I returned to the room at 4:30, the maid had not cleaned yet. Rather than have to leave for an hour while she cleaned, I called the front desk and told them no need for towels and making the bed, etc. This continued 3 days in a row. Then I got a message that I must allow cleaning or the management will be forced to open the door to inspect. I guess I understand, after all. the Vegas bomber refused service for days, but it was the late cleaning every day that upset me. All in all, the location can't be better for everything Manhattan, and I would definitely return, and I plan to. Check prices carefully, as the daily charge fluctuates wildly from day to day.

Stayed 5 days in NYC visiting family. Know the city pretty well. This hotel is best located for us on the Upper Westside. Staff is great and helpful for anything. Loved listening to all the languages from around the world. Nothing like New York Dinning. Will be retuning for all the Holiday decorations in December. Have fun and just take it all in. The magic city of the world.

So when we first arrived and got up to our room the view was far from satisfying we asked to be moved...Shortly after The amazing Quimby explained to us the situation not only was he helpful but so entergetic he immediately made the situation alright we want to come back just to talk to him !!! QUIMBY HIMSELF IS A NEW YORK EXPERIENCE !!!

When I travel to nyc I stay at this hotel and I love it. Clean large rooms and easy access to everything. Tonight James and Elizabeth really came through and set me up perfectly for the weekend!! They are the best!!

Hotel was good and clean.nice people at the desk.very helpfull and thanks to salvador for the good tips about new york city!nearby times square and central park.close to the subway 57 street.we will come back

We have been at Park Central on our NY stay in Aug and it was great. I booked knowing already the place from previous visits and it confirmed the expectations ... better, it went beyond !Good rooms, sophisticated furnitures and design details, quiete and comfort, perfect position make this hotel a guarantee for a super stay in NYC.The personnel is also very friendly, effective and makes you feel truly good. I want to mention in particular one person, Quimby, that is at Customer Relations: he is incredibly nice, always available, super helpful... the kind of person you wish to find in an hotel to make you feel like at home. Thanks for all Quimby.

This is a great hotel located very close to Time Square and the Central Park. I have a nice room with a very reasonable rate. I did not expect this rate for a hotel in this location. There are many restaurants around, all in a walking distance. I found the staff at the Guest Relation desk are very helpful. Thanks to James and Elizabeth, I now can late check-out tomorrow at 3 pm. If you are here in NY for fun or business, this can be a place for you!

Excellent service and great location! Reception, concierge, and guest desk is super friendly and professional. Special shout out to Elizabeth and James at the guest desk. Location is great as well. Highly recommend!

Just got here and I’m already enjoying my stay. Hotel has been renovated but needs new locks on doors. Otherwise Emanuel Z. at the front desk was amazing. He knows all the hot spots. If ever in need of information look for him. Bell staff are also great couldn’t remember any names but as a whole they were excellent.

Excellent accommodation! Upon our arrival the front desk reception was friendly and helpful. They made us feel very welcome. The lounge behind reception has a very comfortable atmosphere. The bar tender was more than willing to help us map out all the places to visit during our stay. Emanuel Z. At the front desk was great. Our room was clean and comfortable and very inviting. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Hotel was in a great location, close to Central Park, Times Square, and shopping. Staff at check-in and check-out were very friendly. The concierge was very helpful and housekeeping were very good. If you want a room with street or city views make sure you book one otherwise the room we had with view of other rooms was ok, especially when most of our time was not spent in the room. But as our room did not have a street view the room got very little natural sunlight and the lighting in the room was not adequate which made the room very dark. A major problem we had was that we had to pay a $35 facilities fee per day. We stayed 6 nights and were required to pay the fee with taxes per night even though we did not use any of the facilities. This was a major down fall with our stay.

Enjoyed the rooms and staff during my one night stay. Customer service was great and location is ideal. Definitely a good value hotel. Located perfectly in midtown close to great restaurants and the park

Excelent rooms and service for any visit to NY. I came for a business trip and could not ask for a better location near all the shops and Central Park. The prices are also great for NY standards. Looking forward to my next stay.

Absolutely fantastic service! I had a late meeting and my wife and son needed a later checkout for scheduling and Elizabeth was amazing and managed to get a late checkout without charge! This type of service in NYC is rare (for free). Great service and great location!

We booked this hotel for our honeymoon. We knew that it would be nice and had a great location, but were blown away by the staff, most notably Elizabeth. When she greeted us as we waited to check in we mentioned we were here for our honeymoon and she went out of her way to ensure we had an amazing stay. The location was perfect. The main lobby is beautiful, and the room was very clean. Parking was seamless. Couldn’t have asked for a better experience! Thank you Elizabeth!

I’ve been there maybe 4 or 5 time in different situations: business, alone and last time on a family trip. The staff delivered Always a great service and the hotel couldn’t be better: location is great and everything looks gorgeous! If you are planning your next trip to nyc don’t hesitate and go to park central hotel! Thanks guys you did it again!

We had a great time at Park Central Hotel in NYC. From top to bottom this is a beautiful place, and the staff is great. Emanuel in particular went above and beyond to ensure that we had a great experience and were fully taken care of. Highly recommend!

We enjoyed our stay here. Everyone was delightful and service was immaculate. Emanuel Z. and Carol at the front desk were great. Excellent recommendations from them both. Looking forward to our return back to NYC.

Visiting NYC a lot for work, needed a change of venue this time - found Park Hotel.Loved it, clean and quiet hotel located near central park and Coulombs Circle.Best of all were the hotel staff always with a smile AND if you ever need anything when you visit Park Central ask for Elizabeth - she is the best!

Visited from Orlando, FL to show my S.O. the greatest city on earth after years of hyping how great the pizza is to her [I was born and raised in Queens]. The hotel was in a perfect location: merely a 15 minute walk to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, the MoMA, and Times Square. Our room was very comfortable, from the soft bed you can sink right into to the constant A.C. keeping the place cool. Our housekeeper, PJ Kaur was amazing; she kindly greeted us every morning before we ventured out into the concrete jungle. The location was well worth it alone, but the added bonus of welcoming staff, well-kept rooms, comfy beds, and a great breakfast deal has all contributed to the best vacation yet. We will undoubtedly be returning to Park Central in the future.

I firstly booked the hotel by booking and then happily found a better deal on the hotel website saving roughly $200.Location is great, few walking minutes from Times Square and close to all main attractions. We found the cleanness a bit poor for the price you pay, with a bad smell coming from the room’s carpet and the shower’s tent not very clean.We also had issues with our key rooms overnight as it could not unlock the door properly. Despite this, I do recommend the hotel overall for no more than three/four days in the city for the great location, the room’s size and the lobby which is very welcoming!

I always stay at this hotel and Emanuel Z. Always assists me when I stay. He recommends the go to places and always has something new for us to visit. Very clean and friendly environment. If your looking for a great burger place visit Blacktap on 55 street between 6th and 7th Avenue.

Had an amazing stay at the Park Central New York. Stayed for 5 nights with a friend and got great service from Emanuel Z at the front desk during the whole stay. This is a hotel I would defiantly recemend to people on their first stay in Manhattan.

I reserved this hotel for my NYC trip with my bestfriend. I was helped by Emanuel Z. at the front desk, and he was super friendly and recommended different places to visit! I would highly recommended this hotel if you are visiting New York

It was our first time in this hotel and We loved everything especially Quimby, who was very nice with us. The rooms are great and the location is the best! I will recommend the hotel to all! Thank you very much

We stayed for one night, but it was in a very good location. Close to Times Square and much of the big theatres, but out enough to be less busy and more peaceful.The hotel is professional and nice, the rooms are clean, spacious, and you are provided with a number of essential amenities. The beds are also very comfortable.Quimby was also a great help, very personable and friendly!

We checked in for one night at the Park Central Hotel and were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location; just off the hustle and bustle of Times Square but extremely close to the sights. Check in was quick with the staff all very friendly. The room was spacious, clean and the beds very comfortable which made for a good night's sleep. Perfect for what we needed. The hotel itself is of a very high standard, which lead for a very enjoyable experience overall. Quimby helped us to check out; he was friendly and helpful, and made us feel very welcome at the hotel.

What a nice place to stay at ! Close to everything we did ! Staff was friendly ! Greete since the moment we got there and overall a nice stay. Check in was quick and pleasant and our bell man Salvador was very helpful and corteous ! Great place to stay with kids as well ! Spacious and clean ! I recomemded it for sure !

Emanuel did a great job checking in and was really kind to us throughout our stay. Really appreciate all the kind gestures. The rooms are also really clean and updated really well. I’m happy with my stay and will stay again!

I am astonished how lovely everything is! Emanuel was very welcoming and kind .. frankly I feel honored and excited to begin my vacation in such lovely accommodations. The door man was expectionally friendly and attentive. If you’re goig to do NY do it here.

New York is complicated But Park central hotel New York rocks! We are having problems with our moving in to apartment. But park central hotel New York gave us free breakfast and cocktail just to ease our stress. We love them!

I was at the Park Central for a week and found the staff helpful and friendly. The room was spacious and cleaned well, except for one day when I left my "Do Not Disturb" sign on after noon--they called to see if i wanted service but didn't come in.The check-in staff could be a bit more welcoming, but, overall, it was a comfortable, clean and efficient place.

This is our 4th stay at the Park Central hotel and it never disappoints. This time, I had some challenges booking online but when I spoke to Tahmina K in reservations she went above and beyond to help me with my booking. She was polite, professional and most importantly followed through on everything she promised including calling back and emailing me to make sure we satisfied with everything. She checked in on us before our stay and also during. I highly recommend this hotel as the experience has been second to none. Thank you Tahmina for the exceptional customer service you provided us with. We will definitely be back again. Great hotel, excellent location and exceptional staff like Tahmina who make this hotel a 5 star experience. Thank you again!!! Suzanna N

We were greeted incredibly by the lovely Quimby immediately upon arrival which made for a great first experience. Excited to be in New York! Nice first experience for sure and happy we got the scoop on this hotel

Quimby helped us as soon as we got into the hotel! Greeted us and helped direct us to the right area. Great staff who didnt hesitate to grab the things we needed. I even forgot to grab our luggage tag and they ran to give it to us

We stayed 9 nights in this hotel on August 18 and got so many disppointments that we won't come back and don't recommend it to future visitors. First, it started at the check in with a very cold and unfriendly staff....that proved quickly helpless: when we asked for a bathroom scale, the answer was "we don't do that"... and when we asked for brunch addresses, the feedback was "you have plenty of restaurants around"...! When we we asked to benefit from the "Bloomingdale package" that they advertise on their website...they refused to let us participate even though there were no restrictions.As regards the room, it was a good size BUT with a poor quality bed, a view on a wall of bricks and no curtain to allow minimum privacy... And on 1 day the room was not fully cleaned with dirty glasses and ice bucket left on the table...: (Not to mention on top that this hotel has NO restaurant or breakfast place except for a sandwich counter... and has too few elevators to manage the traffic (10 minutes wait minimum when you have a high floor). Last but not least there is a 35$ extra fee per day that is not justified and hurts even more the overall value for money. Clearly too many problems in terms of customer service and hotel management !

My wife and I had a great time visiting New York. So much so that we left a few items in our hotel room. The head of security was a huge help locating these items and getting them shipped to me within a couple of days. His response time and communication was fantastic and I really appreciated his efforts.

I highly recommend Park Central Hotel. Great location, close to Subway stations, Tines Square, Broadway theaters, Central Park and all kind of restaurants. Room was very clean and comfortable; Service was excellent.

The location is great! Close to Time Square, Central Park, lots of restaurants, and everything you want to see in Manhattan. People were great! The staff have been really great! The counter staff, the gentleman at the bar always smiling when you arrive. The lady at the morning coffee shop was so nice and remember our order by the 3rd day lol. The OK is the room... the hotel is clean but the rooms are small. I’m told that’s normal here. I have a 2 queen bed room. It’s 2 beds and a small tv stand/dresser and barley room to get around it. The bathroom is very small. Single shower. If you’re not planning to be in your room much and just need a comfy bed to sleep after a long day then this is a good choice.

Great room, nice, modern, clean, staff very friendly. Would definitely come back. Affordable too and close to main attractions . And we have to write 200 characters but I did enjoy my stay here .......

Great location great service! We are so happy with our stay. Can’t stop smiling. We love New York City!Super Clean. We got toothpaste when we didn’t pack it. Able to print our boarding passes. Everything super conevenient. Great stay!Thank you!

The pictures on their website look much better than the real thing. My upgraded Superior King was way too small for two. If your luggage is larger than carry-ons, you won't find a convenient place to set and open. My room was very dark. They have an issue with proper lighting. The closet has no lighting. There are no clothes hooks to hang anything on - only the closet hangars, which are useless if you are trying to match a tie with a jacket or shirt, or just simply hang a robe. Small inconveniences like these are reason enough to go for a better place. The entrance door are is dark. So dark I couldn't see the umbrella I left near the door. With luggage opened, there wasn't enough room to walk around the bed, which by the way, wasn't great, either. No pillow choices, just huge way-too-soft worn out feather pillows. The desk lamp was absolutely disgusting, as it had not been cleaned since the day it was put on the tiny (TINY) desk area. No restaurant (or room service) at this hotel. Only two SMALL elevators out of four working. And each stops at every floor. If you're on a high floor, forget getting on - six or seven adults will fill it up. A completely unmovable 4pm check-in time. And a luggage line of at least a dozen guests pretty much all the time. One attendant. They really need to update and clean house and get with travelers' needs, not their own.

I travel weekly for work, so I've caught plenty of zzz's on hotel beds. Hands down, the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on is the one I had in my room at the Park Central. Words can hardly describe what a heavenly experience it was, but suffice to say that I did NOT want to get out of that bed in the morning. The mattress was just the right firmness, and the pillows were perfect. I would go back just to sleep there again! The room was clean and contemporary. The hotel has a GREAT location just a couple blocks (walking distance) from Times Square. The fitness center was well-equipped and spacious and I had a great treadmill workout overlooking 7th Avenue. I would have given the hotel 5 stars, but the lack of a restaurant, breakfast buffet, and in-room coffee maker were a few of the negatives.

I had the opportunity to visit my brother Fred Colon who asked me to meet him at Park Central Hotel in the bar lounge area. We met an excellent bartender named Alex who welcomed us; offered suggestions from the menu, was attentive and professional. He made our visit comfortable and enjoyable. We had a great time along with tasty drinks in a very open inviting atmosphere. I would definitely return and recommended to others to visit.

Fantastic hotel. Incredible location. Steps away from Central Park and Times Square. Right at 59th subway going downtown to China Town, Soho etc. Staff are great and friendly. Shout out to Nancy in Client Relations. Excellent value. Big rooms (for NY). Better spot than Hyatt Times Square and less $.

Nice hotel, clean and big rooms, wi-fi really fast, great staff and a great location close to everything, especially Central Park and Times Square and all the stores. Close to really everything and the metro stations. I’ll probably come back.

We do not want to say good bye to this wonderful town without mentioning Carolyn at the frontdesk of the Park Central Hotel in New York who stands for a lot we met during the past days: Always with a smile in her face seeking solutions to the best of the guest and furthermore with a pleasent professional attitude! Thank you New York, thank you Carolyn, hope to see you soon again - definitely again in Park Central Hotel.Thomas

Cannot complain in terms of the location! The hotel is surrounded by places to eat/bars/shops. It is right in the heart of New York. You can see Times Square when you step out the door and Central Park is a 5 minute walk in the other direction. On arrival, our bags were taken to the room by staff and they told us if we needed anything, to call to reception. I found that this was very slow and we ended up spending the first night without a cot for our baby, even though I had sent an email in advance to confirm that this would be in the room, as were arriving late. Our room didn’t have enough towels for the family and we had to call to reception again! The beds were comfortable but the duvets had no covers and were instead put between two sheets. The room was extremely muggy and unpleasant, as the air conditioning was incredibly weak and made a loud noise when turned on. The bathroom has absolutely no ventilation so the mirror gets all steamed up and this contributes the humidity in the room.In general, the hotel is perfectly located but the hotel itself could be better!

Elizabeth went out of her to make sure our stay at the hotel was great. She even gave us a free room upgrade when she found out it was our honeymoon. Throughout the stay she checked in with us to make sure everything was going well. I would highly recommend this place for their great personalized service and central location. It’s Near both the park and Times Square and the room was very spacious, clean and quiet. Thanks again Elizabeth for making our stay memorable!!!

I have been staying at the Park Central for years for business travel. I used to stay at another hotel but it was so big it was hard to get around. Now that I have been staying here for some time, I have developed a relationship with hotel staff. I now direct all my business through Alicia Nuñez, who handles group bookins and events and I could not ask for it to go any smoother. Since I have been staying here, it is just what you need to get some rest and is also centrally located. If you travel for business like I do; you can easily access the subway, restaurants and Central Park is only a few blocks away. Hallways are quiet, room clean up staff is kind and bathrooms are kept clean. I will continue to stay here for my upcoming trips and have also recommended to a few friends.

Rooms are run down with very few working parts. Elevators take forever and are too small for the amount of guests. Service fine but again, nothing super notable so I think 4 star rating a stretch. Maybe a 3 at best ... only good thing is location is central to most activities. No extras at all - lucky to get enough towels. Higher expectations for a Manhattan hotel. Will try another one next time.

Great location with access to subways close by, taxi service is front door available, walking distance to Central park, Columbus circle, Times square, great restaurants and shopping. Hotel service is excellent, catering to the guests,room was very nice, up to date design and amenities, best bed and pillows we ever slept on in an hotel!

Great hotel, we liked it very much. Right at the Carnegie Hall and only a couple of blocks from the Central park. Building is amazing, the only minus is there is no hotel restaurant, just the bar and breakfast kiosk/

Two things: the room service is just terrible. Called 4 times within 3hrs to get a mini fridge in the room, after my ice cream has completely melted (of course) nobody showed up and nobody knew where the fridge was. If this one is annoying for the mind, the second issue would be harmful for the body. In my room, a classic King room, there’s no such thing as cold or even mild water. All it has is hot hot hot water that can boil you into a cooked meal under minute. I’m booked for 8 nights in this hotel, I don’t know what to do seriously.

I knew beforehand about the Westhouse Hotel's (located on top of the Park Central Hotel ) excellent reputation prior to our stay. Amazingly, the Westhouse exceeded my already high expectations. Upon being dropped off at the main entrance, my wife and I were promptly greeted by a team of doormen. What I immediately noticed, and then what I discovered to be a theme throughout our stay, was how genuinely friendly the staff is. Not the "I'm friendly because it's my job" friendly, but the "genuinely happy to see you" friendly. Doormen, front desk, housekeeping, terrace staff: every single person we encountered was super friendly and accommodating. The hotel manager, Petr, checked in with us throughout . After learning our tastes and preferences, Petr made spot-on restaurant recommendations. Not the touristy ones the everyone already knows about, but the small hidden gem restaurants that could otherwise go unnoticed except for a dedicated local following. Clearly, Petr genuinely listened to us. One of the many amenities that comes with staying at the Westhouse is the morning breakfast and the late afternoon "hours of indulgence". Going in, I thought wrongly - oh so very wrongly- that this would be a generic continental breakfast and a little meat and cheese spread in the afternoon. The breakfast always had freshly made eggs, meat and lots of other goodies. The coup de grace was the afternoon hours of indulgence. In addition to a wide selection of cheese, Italian meats and very delicious wines was a daily, freshly made hot item worthy of New York's best restaurants. Once, manicotti was offered, and on another day, the best seafood paella that I ever had the privilege to savor. I have been to NYC dozens of times in my life. I have stayed at quite a few very fine hotels. Without a doubt, my most enjoyable and most memorable visit was our stay at the Westhouse. Because of the kind, caring staff, their outgoing manager Petr, the great food and wine, and the luxurious rooms, I have absolutely no reason to ever stay anywhere else.

This was a lovely hotel. We stayed there for a week, the rooms were pretty basic but there are certain things like mini refrigerators and coffee makers that you can add if they are available an no additional charge. The front desk was absolutely amazing. Caroline went above and beyond to accommodate our requests and needs. Guest Services was wonderful in helping us get around the city and helping us when we needed assistance with the wifi so that we could work in the lobby area. Beds are comfy, housekeeping staff on the 3rd floor, outstanding! So kind and courteous. The reason why I could not give this 5 stars was because of the valet/bellman staff. I arrived and left the hotel with luggage 2 times during our week there. Not once when I arrived was I asked if I needed help and when we left in the pouring rain, we waited for so long that we finally just ordered an uber. The guys were not busy, they were talking to eachother and not paying attention to the people around them. They lost money in tips and since they are the first people customers come in contact with it gives a bad impression. However, get past them and you will be good to go! There is a cute cafe with yummy sandwiches in the lobby as well as a Starbucks right next door. Enjoy your stay, we are looking forward to staying there again soon!

This was my second stay at the Park Central and I was treated to wonderful, friendly and helpful service from front desk staff to porters to the concierge staff, the bar staff, the cleaners. everyone seems happy to be working for this hotel and their happiness shines through in everything they do. such a pleasure to come back to this clean, elegant and well-located property, when i have business and pleasure in new york. as return guests, we were treated like friends and made to feel very welcome. i recommend park central completely. you'll be in the heart of everything, but behind the hotel's doors, you have a quiet and civilized escape from the hustle.

such a great location and hotel. everyone so helpful and great, bed was so comfortable and room and hotel is spotless. will be returning again and again. asked for more pillows and they came so fast. tv perfect size for room. shower was nice and strong. loved the coffee at the café in the hotel

We were very happy with our stay over the weekend at Park Central Hotel. Beds were comfy and so close to Central Park. Hotel was quiet and loved the shower after walking around the hot streets all day. Very close to lots of restaurants, Starbucks, Coffee shop which serves my favorite Stumptown coffee, and close to Time Square too. Loved our stay. My only complaint would be having to wait in line to get an elevator like 10 minuets sometimes. I’ve never in a Hotel had to wait for an elevator. Not sure why but there were literally lines of sometimes 15-20 people waiting to get an elevator each time we wanted to get to our room. Not sure if it’s like that all the time or just on the Sunday night we stayed but thought it was odd. I do highly recommend though. The staff was very friendly and rooms were clean and spacious in our double queen room.

My sister and I surprised our mom for her 60th birthday and took her to New York! We stayed at Park Central and I'm so glad we booked here. We arrived early so expected to just drop off our bags, but they allowed us to checkin early as there was a room ready/available. Upon arrival, we were greeted with exceptional hospitality and asked if we needed any recommendations on places to eat/things to do, and given a city map. Once we went up to our room, we noticed a smell (like a musty/wet mop smell). It was quite strong, but we figured that room was just cleaned and that the smell would go away. Approximately 10mins after checking in, someone knocked on the door to inspect the room and make sure we were happy with it. We noted the smell and she figured out that it was the shower curtain and said they would replace that ASAP for us. We left for the afternoon and when we got back the smell was completely gone and the curtain had been changed (we were more than impressed with this service). Despite some comments, I did not find the room AS small as most people stated. The A/C worked amazing, the beds/pillows were extremely comfortable, and to top it off, free wifi was given (which appears quite hard to find in NY). Hotel staff were always friendly and the room was always cleaned well!Overall, we had an amazing stay and would absolutely stay here again! It is in a very central location - hence the name - (5min walk to Central Park, less than 10min walk to Times Square, and many other great restaurants and attractions not far from the hotel)! Well done Park Central Hotel, and thanks for an amazing stay!

Okay so this was worth the price for sure. I will advise that I noticed a few different prices while I shopped so make sure you do you homework.
