The room was clean spacious (for a city hotel) and very well located. The staff was always helpful and polite. Really you couldn't ask for better service based on my experience. Over all just a great experience. Highly recommmend.

I had such a great experience from the booking process until the day I checked in. Brooke made my reservation and she was very nice and responded quickly! I was there to celebrate my wedding anniversary and it was perfect. The room was very clean, good view and everyone was pretty friendly. The bartenders were great and make awesome drinks! Thank you for making my stay great!! I will see you guys soon :)

We booked this trip as a last minute sister’s getaway. The Park Central is in a great location, close to Central Park and Times Square and the hop on hop off bus. The room was very clean and the beds comfortable. We had one problem. We purchased the Downton Abbey package and on check-in our tickets were not at the desk. We were told they’d be at the customer service desk the next morning. When we went the next morning we were told the person in charge of the package was off and hadn’t left our tickets. We were told to buy tickets at the exhibition and to show our receipt at check out so that the price of the package could be refunded. We didn’t understand why we had to show a receipt when they knew we hadn’t received our package but they did refund that part of our stay. Even though we had this glitch, we would stay at the Park Central again.

Our room cleaner Maritza was fantastic 10th floor of Park Central. Friendly, helpful, efficient. Made this day much better. Nice to have friendly people when you’re in another city. Will come back for Maritza.

Hotel was superb in every way - location / staff / rooms Great location for tourists - we considered staying in TriBeCa and glad we stayed at park central Would def go back to this hotel - the staff gave us good advice on going to a New York mets game

The Park Central was a great location for our family of four to stay and explore all the sites in NYC. We had an unfortunate mishap of our own doing and left behind a ton of clothing on accident - including our kids new Aaron Judge Yankee jerseys! Kizzi with the front desk helped us navigate this after the fact and fedexed everything back to us - great customer service!

I escorted a large group on a cruise out of NYC. The group sales team at Park Central was easy to work with. The location of this hotel is perfect - very close to subway and buses, right by a Hop On Hop Off Bus stop, close to Times Square without being in the crowds and close to Central Park. The staff at the front desk and at the bar were friendly, professional and made our stay very pleasant. I would not hesitate to book here again.

We stayed for 4 nights. It is a lovely hotel. Spotlessly clean. A very central location not far from times square or central park. With lots of cafes and restrauants to choose from very near. Will definately stay again and would recommend

Nancy V was excellent to help out. I highly recommend this hotel in a perfect location! We had an issue with our WiFi and she quickly resolved our issue. I can’t wait to come back to New York City!!!!

Stayed here for 5 nights in August. Initially was in a standard Room which was nice and a good size (esp for NY) . Was then upgraded to a suite which was very nice and had an excellent view of Times Square. It had a bar fridge and no coffee/ tea facilities but you can request it. ThStaff were very helpful and friendly.Location Location Location. Close to Times Square and Central Park and there is a Subway just outside the hotel (57th and 7th).There is no restaurant or breakfast in the hotel but there are excellent options just outside. I enjoyed the Metro Cafe. There is a Starbucks right next door and many places to eat. RAys Pizza is good! Please note there is a facilities fee of $35 excl tax per night which is a bummer, so make sure to budget for it. Great experience at this hotel overall

My husband and I stayed here just after 9-11, before we were married. We loved it then and love it now. This time, we came with our two teenaged kids. The whole place has been redecorated. The room was small but impeccable. The bathroom invited us to take baths. Everyone was super friendly, and the price wasn't too high. The location is perfect, situated between Central Park and Times Square. It is a fabulous place to stay! That said, we couldn't find a good place to eat nearby, though the pubs on 7th Street aren't bad.

Firstly, I would love to thank Annette for making my reservation process go so easy and at the same time get me so excited to stay at the Park Central Hotel. It was just as you said, in a great location, clean, comfortable bed & pillows and so accommodating to my needs. Everyone was so friendly and I can't wait to visit again.

This hotel has a great location 7th ave and 56th st. Three blocks from Central Park and five blocks from Times Square. It sits in a location that you are short walks to all of the major spots. Hotel underwent a renovation that provided the hotel with a contemporary style.

If you are looking for a great location in New York City, Park Central Hotel is the right place. They have fantastic service and great rooms at a reasonable price. The employees go above and beyond the call of duty.

Stayed seven days at the hotel and was very happy with all aspects of my visit. The location so close to Times Square and Central Park and the subwY was a great bonus. The staff friendly and courteous and efficient. The room was large for a single occupant. The bathroom had all the amenities but could have been a little larger. I will definitely stay there again next year when I go on my annual visit.

Park Central hotel was perfect for us. We had plans to watch a broadway show and watch a TV taping. We practically walked everywhere since everything was so close. There’s a Starbucks downstairs as well as another great coffee/pastry place called Tissirie. The hotel is located a couple of blocks from the south end of Central Park, there’s multiple subway stations that are very close too. I’m always weary about the size of the hotel rooms in New York as well as how old the rooms can be but this hotel was great! The room was large and the bathroom was big too and the hotel felt new.

Great location. Spacious room.The check in experience was the best.The lady who helped me out of her way to make my experience the best!Great market at the lobby.Looks like the rooms were fully remodeled.

This hotel is fantastic considering the amount of hotels there are in the city you are spoilt for choice but so glad I choose this one. Hotel itself is well decored upon arrival and all the way up to leaving the customer service was superb. The room was ideal for what we needed. We never really used much of the hotel facilities apart from the coffee shop but the gym looked good and the bar also shame we never had enough time to have a drink there. The location of the hotel is amazing step out the front look left there is central park, look right there is times Square and a subway station just around the corner. If I ever visit the city again I will sure stay here again.

I had never been to this hotel, but a last minute trip to NYC had us rushing for a reasonably priced room not far from Times Square. The front desk staff was extremely courteous and friendly. The room was clean and decor was up to date. I would have expected to pay alot more for the room based on the room and service. A great bargain and will be booking there again.

Nancy V and Sokha helped me to book another room. My travel agency booked the wrong room type for us. We have 5 people but they booked us for one room only. I was lucky to be able to book another room here.

Elizabeth the manager and sokha: they Àre an example and they know atend very well at the Guest and the room was very clean , Nice view to the street, the relation price and comfort its very nice. I will back again

Enjoyed our stay! Place was very strategic and comfy. The room we had was spacious, clean and service was fast. We had some issues and our guest relations manager, Elizabeth, helped us resolve it. Thank you Elizabeth! Will definitely come back here!

i m on a business trip and like the location. Service from Vito who check me in is very good and the manager Nancy V is helping me on the future booking is great too. i ll recommend the reward program and refreshing room after guest check out

The service was perfect,the employees were attentive,including the sweet Maritza and the location is amazing,because is near from central park and times square,but the negative point, you have to pay plus 50 dolars per day, besides this everything worth it.

My family and I are visiting New York for the first time. We had booked a room at the Park Central Hotel with two double beds through one of the travel websites. After the first night, we realized we needed to upgrade to a room with larger beds. Nancy V., the front desk manager, was so helpful!! And upgraded us to a room with two queens, and didn’t even charge us. Thanks to her exceptional service, we are thoroughly enjoying our visit. This is now our go to hotel when we stay in NYC!!

As a family we really enjoy our stay in this nice hotel! The room was pretty comfortable and always clean. The best thing of Park Central is the unique and perfect location. Walking distance to CentralPark , Fifth Avenue, Times Square. Excellent meeting point with friends!

I have not only stayed at the Park Central many times, I have booked many meetings there with Alicia Nunez, the Senior Sales Manager. She is personable, professional, and very quick to respond to any inquiry. Would highly recommend this hotel for both business and personal travel.

Hey I have been visiting New York for the last ten days with my wife from England. Overall, my family enjoyed the trip to New York. However, it was overbearing to leave our hotel.1. Each day, the workers in the bike shop would persistently ask my wife about renting bikes and follow us up the street (So annoying).2. Certain elevators were not operational.3. The room was dark and dirty.But locations is great.

Nancy V helps us to change the room and also recommended places to go and to eat. I like this hotel and we will come back and recommend to our friend. We are just married and very happy with the treatment we get here.

Oh, there's a substantial extra fee for, you know, actually using the hotel? For using hotel services? Pardon me! I thought that was called, uh, your cost of doing business as a hotel. It's not like paying the fee is optional. Grow a pair, and put this in the cost of the room. Anything else is just sleazy and dishonest. Oh wow, but it does let you list the cost of your "room" for a much lower price on all the travel websites.Gross and offensive.

The staff goes out of their way to make you feel at home. I stay in NYC 20 to 25 nights a year. I can stay anywhere and I always choose Park Central. The rooms are spacious compared to others I have stayed.

When I checked in Carolyn went above and beyond to help me with directions for a meeting and she schecked me right into my room. Alvin assisted me with my work bag to hold while I had meetings. Excellent service. This is the second time I am staying here for work and plan to always stay here if there is vacancy. Rooms are always clean and comfortable. Great location.. highly recommend

Very Good location and we were able to walk everywhere. We felt safe and the area was clean. For the visitors that want to get to know New York, this is the place to stay. The staff was friendly and we will surely visit again.

My family has an emergency and has to leave early. Nancy V the manager helps me on the reservatiion. She underdtand the situation and adjust the date on the booking for us. We will come Back to this hotel.

This is my first time staying at Park Central Hotel and I have to say that I am very impressed! From Carolyn at the front desk upgrading my room to a suite to the breathtaking view of Times Square from my window, this was certainly a great way to kick off my birthday! Customer service is amazing and the lobby and hotel rooms are absolutely gorgeous. I will definitely be back for my next visit.

I have been coming back to the Park Central Hotel for 5+ years; mainly for an overnight business stay when in Manhattan. This place has not changed and it is a good thing. Always friendly service, clean and well decorated rooms ], and a great night sleep. When my wife and I do come to the city for leisure, we stay here. Close to Central Park and the subway but quiet enough compared to other parts of the city.

I had a very good experience at the Park Central, it was pretty much everything that I expected when booking. The location is excellent, the building relatively recently renovated (about 2013/14) and the staff pleasant and responsive. I liked the room and bathroom, specifically the cleanliness and thoroughness of the daily tidy up. Then only thing I can say on the negative side is that the noise levels from the street were high. This is midtown Manhattan so you are not expecting peace and quiet, but my feeling was that the sound isolation should have been better given the recent renovation.Overall - I'd go back and would recommend it to friends as a base for exploring NYC.

Hotel is very well located. Close to great shopping, museums, restaurants, central park and public transportation. Rooms are well appointed and clean and reasonably priced for new york city. Free wifi and staff who are amenable to providing extra services. Quick check in and out. Have stayed here for many years and service keeps getting better and better.

Front desk staff were all quite miserable, the conceriege gave us incorrect information about tours, certain elevators were not operational, the lounge was very dirty, no umbrellas available for loan to guests. Certainly will not return to this hotel nor will i recommend it.,

I booked this hotel because of its vicinity to the ‘touristy’ places around Manhattan. I was over for a family birthday party but knew I’d be spending a good amount of time solo in Manhattan so wanted to be in the middle of everything as it were. Hotel staff were excellent. Specifically Carolyn at reception and John at the bar. Both made me feel very welcome during my stay and were willing and able to help answer any questions I had. Accidentally found the cocktail class that’s on every second Saturday. Even though I wasn’t booked for it I was accommodated and able to join what turned out to be a wonderful treat the day before I left. I won’t review New York as most people know/will soon find out about it already but the hotel is a nice place to stay and was always clean and tidy. All their publications mention the amenities fee of around $40 per night for the duration of your stay but it could easily be overlooked. Especially if booking through a third party site. This fee is nonnegotiable and, even though I didn’t use many of the facilities that it included, I knew it was there and had budgeted accordingly. To sum up a nice, centrally located hotel with friendly staff and a good atmosphere.

This was my second time staying at Park Central Hotel. The management and front desk personnel were amazing, very helpful,professional and ready to answer your questions and guide you through the your visit to New York. James, the manager, Vito and Anitea were amazing. For sure I will come back to stay at PARK CENTRAL HOTEL!

Had a great time. Checking out was a breeze with Carolyn. Great location within walking distance to Times Square. Good food options nearby as well. Couldn't have had a better trip, will definitely stay again Highly recommended

Had a great time at this hotel..People were very friendly. We arrived around 2 pm we thought we would have to leave our luggage and go out until 4pm , but our room was ready. Check out was easy and Carolyn was very helpful to get us on our way. Very clean , great service. Would stay again when visiting NY....

awesome hotel always stay here best location Carolyn at the front desk is a Amazing and so is Nancy at the hotel lobby bar which by the way has fantastic drinks and great atmosphere the location is very convenient to all of New York City's greatest sights highly recommend this hotel

This is a great hotel, clean, nice rooms, comfortable beds. Great location nice and close to the Central Park, subways and great restaurants with in a block.. Spent 4 days here and can’t wait to go back and do more exploring

As we arrived, Dafney at the front desk greeted us and welcomed my family. And then she offer best customer service a staff can offer. Hotel is awesome. It has nice cozy bar with limited drinks. Location over all is fantastic.

Got to say, this hotel was spotless and the staff were amazing from door staff to reception to the cleaning personnel. Especially Alvin at the luggage check in. What a great guy!Great atmosphere, only critique was that coffee and croissant pretty expensive from the cafe, but there is a Starbucks right next door. Coffee approx $3 and croissant pretty much the same.The hotel is pretty central to everything, go right and you hit the formidable Times Square, go left and a you see the beautiful Central Park.Park central hotel will be my first choice when I return to New York.

Stayed one night with friends.Very busy hotel.Warning , they add a resort fee. daily to bill ? not sure why.We got a great summer rate on their web site, included parking. When we drove up, there was no valet, and the bellmen never new anything about this option, and told me to park the car myself in a nearby lot. After some discussion with the front desk, this was corrected and the car was parked.The room was clean and comfortable, bed was good.The lobby of the hotel is bustling and busy, but there is a beautiful bar/lounge being the reception area, that is great for hanging out and relaxing after a hard days touring. We had drinks there at night.The hotel is close to times square, but you don't feel like you're in the very hectic mess of times square, its about 10-15 min walk, about 10 blocks.Only 2 blocks to central park, which is lovely to visit.Great option for visiting NYC

Very well located, the room is normal clean good bed no wow factor, be sure to anticipate if you are living your bag checked in to go some place because the line is crazy and they ask you to make the line for checking in your luggage or to pick it up so beware of time if you have to go to the airport in a rush.Expect a 35 dollar charge per day for amenities that is mandatory even if you don’t use them.

excellent location , great rooms, great service , amenities , rooms ares are as photos , lobby very nice and clean rate very good for this quality and location I definitively recommend this hotel to stay

I travel weekly for work and have stayed at the Park Central many times. It is my hotel of choice in New York City. This is why:Manhattan boasts hundreds of hotels to choose from with all the amenities you could imagine, but what makes a hotel REALLY special? THE PEOPLE! That is what the Park Central on 7th Avenue has. I could tell you about the great location right between Central Park and Times Square or the actual human size rooms (which anyone who has stayed in a New York hotel can appreciate) that are clean and stylish, but what truly sets it apart is the staff. Carolyn and Manny are at the front desk offering top notch check-in service and a friendly word when you come in from dinner or the theater. Gina is in the café ready with a cup of coffee or a pastry. Even the facilities staff are friendly and helpful at every turn. At the Park Central, the people make the place! Staying somewhere that folks are friendly and responsive is what I call luxury!

Just got back from NYC and had a great stay at the Park Central Hotel! Loved the location, steps to central park and the theater. Valet parking and a great front desk staff made for a quick check-in. The rooms are big (by NY standards) completely updated and well appointed. It was nice to jump into a comfortable bed after a day on the town! Highly recommend!

You can walk to Times Square and other areas, day or night. The hotel is also located with easy access to all metro lines. We enjoyed the large bar, the room was spacious with all the amenities and the staff was helpful. I will go back to this hotel, can't go wrong.

Exceptional service, great room and attentive management. I use this hotel for business travel and have always found it to consistently provide excellent service. I would recommend it for business and personal use.

Easy check in, gorgeous hotel! Great rooms! Nice location . This is our second visit. Highly recommend! Go check it out! Emanuell was excellent. Great room for price for amount of time we stayed. John at the bar serves great drinks.

Great check in and wonderful hotel. Second visit and will be back again! Spacious and very great service from Emanuel at the front desk. Excellent location near all metro stations. Sue at the concierge was excellent with reservations as well.

Snagged this room on Hotel tonight- super glad we did! VERY nice and clean room, and a more than generous size for NYC. Emanuel at the front desk even got us checked in and the keys at 11am- we’ll before the listed check in time. Would definitely recommend!

Room was lovely, service was outstanding. Super comfortable bed, extremely accessible to times square! Concierge checked us in early which was amazing! Emanuel took great care of us upon check out! 5/5

Stayed here 3 times and it loved it every single time. Awesome locations d wonderful staff. I would highly recommend anyone and everyone to stay here when I NYC. Honestly you can walk anywhere from here.

Fantastic staff, very clean, and slept very well throughout the night. Carol especially was very nice and helpful. I believe the hotel was perfectly located in Manhattan. Allowing my son and I to travel throughout the area to visit many places and eateries.

When you visit the hotel bar ask for Nancy, she is the absolute definition of hospitality! Such a lovely lady who is always willing to help and have a nice talk! Thanks to her our stay was extra special!

Most amazing hotel in the city, next to central park, Columbus circle and starbucks. It is my second time here and all my familly also comes here every year. We love this place that we can trust and enjoy.

Our family traveled to NYC for the first time and had a wonderful stay at Park Central Hotel. Angela at reception went above and beyond to help us and I cannot thank her enough!! I highly recommend this hotel and their staff was wonderful. The hotel is centrally located and just a short walking distance to Central Park, Time Square, and many other sights. There is also a subway station very close to the hotel. The gym was great and the take and go breakfast was delicious. I am so glad we choose this hotel for our trip and highly recommend it for anyone wanting to visit NYC. Thanks again Angela!!!

Alvir was the best hotel worker we could have asked for. We will definitely be back, he was brilliant and did whatever we wanted. He advised us on places to go and was bery helpful in everhthing we wanted

Stay was amazing. Staff was exceptional Carolyn. Everything close to hotel. Here for business but had a wonderful time. Will come back again and stay at the park central.Great looking building, entrance foyer very accessible, all concierge staff very helpful also.

Standard hotel. Nothing wrong, nothing special. Room was comfortable and service fine. Some towels were stained and air con quite noisy. Location is very good, close to central park and easy to reach by subway

Sonya our house keeping was awesome , very very nice ,carrying lady , does her job very well and aways welcome us when she's around . Bar and Lounge Nancy is also amazing along with Alex at the bar. Appreciate people that like their jobs and try to make our better days .

Park central hotel is located in a very prime location. The price of the nightly fair is very reasonable. Hotels interior is modern and the staffs are very kind. Carolyn at the front desk was very helpful and professional.

The Park Central is a great hotel in the best area in NYC right near Central Park. I am a meeting planner and always book and recommend my company and clients to stay here. Alicia Nunez is a huge help as well!

So disappointedI was a tourist in New York over the last week and I stayed in a hotel on 7th avenue and 55th street. After paying a lot of money with my family, room were so dark. The employees of a bike rental place that was nearby were consistently asking me and my sons to go into the shop and rent bikes. This was something that we were not interested in participating in. However, these people working for the bike rental company were outside the hotel with their bikes blocking the footpaths and asking us to pay for the renting of bikes.

Stayed here for my moms birthday , staff was excellent and such a great help , Emmanuel was an amazing help and so nice . Would recommend this hotel to anybody , perfect area to stay in . Would come back again !

Park Central is perfectly located and the rooms are beautiful! The staff is incredibly helpful and Emanuel went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. If you're looking to stay in NYC, Park Central is the best around.

The service of the hotel it was great, and a beautiful place to stay, I would like to come back one day, I really recommend it. In New York there is a lot of activities and attractions to do it, so you need a nice place to rest on it

We enjoyed a lot New York City. We Will back soon. Empires States Building. Liberty Statue. Justiça Museun it das awesome. No Park Central Hotel possui um excelente serviço e uma localização perto do Central Park da Time Square. AMAZING!

Arrival time was earlier than Expected and Front Desk Agent Emanuel went above and beyond to make Sure we got in earlier than Expected. Subways were all close by and it was very easy getting around. We love NYC!!

Hotel was great, not to close to Times Square but not to far away either. Close to Central Park and great lil delis. Easy access to many things. Suzie in guest services was fantastic with helping with anything you need!

We stayed at Park Central in NYC for four nights on our family vacation. It is in an excellent location near Central Park. Our room had two double beds. The wifi at this hotel is excellent. We requested a refrigerator and they brought us one. I would have liked to have a microwave in our room but there was none and a coffee maker would have been nice too. It was expensive but what hotel isn't expensive in New York? Go here is you want to be close to alot of attractions. We were able to walk to lots of different fun activities. My kids loved riding bikes in Central Park.

By not offering a host of amenities and services (example: good restaurant), the hotel forces you out to enjoy the the city. The room were clean and housekeeping did their part by jumping to every request (extra blankets, pillows and towels). Front desk was on their toes by giving top attention to every question (they actually had an interest in making your stay as pleasant as possible. They made you feel as if you were the only quest in the hotel. You were their GUEST, and not a paying commodity ). The entire hotel staff worked as team to do their part to serve each and every GUEST, and make their same a "home, away from home". I have now found my New Your "HOME".

Had an awesome stay here this weekend. Super close to subway, Central Park and Times Square. Rooms are nice and staff is super friendly, will def be back. Highly recommend :) Q and Emanuel at the front desks were also very helpful!

Had some of my best experiences in this hotel. The staff helped me with literally everything! A staff named Emanuel pulled all his strings to help me get the best experiences. Absolutely awesome hotel.

Perfect attention from staff. Nice Manager! Also thanks for Vito help and service :)Good WiFi, big room and comfortable. Bar with good atmosphere and small but good central market. Not restaurant in hotel.

Amazing service! Concierge goes above and beyond to ensure a great stay. Ask for Emanuel, he will be glad to help with anything. The hotel is in the perfect area, minutes to Central Park, broadway and time square

We initially booked a room at the Park Lane on Central Park South. We were on the 20th floor with an amazing view and a large room. But the A/C was broken and it was 90+ outside. (tried switching rooms but that one was broken too) We were not fans of sleeping in sweat so we moved hotels to the Park Central and booked it through Hotel Tonight. Daphne at the front desk was awesome. Pros: Easy check in, friendly staff, huge lobby, nice people working lobby bar, plenty of space in lobby bar to relax and mingle. A/C in room was cold and worked well. Great location. 4 subway stops virtually on every corner leaving the hotel. 1-2 blocks north was Central Park. 5-6 blocks south was Time Square. When you walk out of the hotel and look right you see the main lights of time square and the new years eve ball. Close to Premiere Deli. Awesome inexpensive food and if you order on grubhub they will bring it to your lobby. Cons: They are doing construction at Carnegie Hall and we were on the 4th floor. It was kind of loud during the day with jack hammers. We only really noticed it on check out day because we were out of the room most of the time. Room size is small. Bathroom is small. View is average. You may want to request a higher floor for less noise and a city or park view if they have it. There are very tall buildings around so I'm not sure how much of a view of the park you will get.

The service here is phenomenal. The staff is very accomadating and polite. It’s such an ideal location to be able to quickly navigate through the city. We would definitely recommend this place and come back again. We love this place and we’ve stayed in a lot of different places in New York!

Great attention from staff. Close to numerous attractions and metro stations. The bar downstairs has a good atmosphere and the market has all necessary items. The privacy in the rooms are questionable since all sounds from the neighbors and hallways can be heard.

Terrific location, but I didn't like the smell of the corridor at the 5th floor, and most important, I didn't pay attention when I booked it for the fact that the resort fee of us35 is per night, and I'm staying 11 nights, so it's gonna cost me almost 400, that's really too much! Employees at the reception were very atencious, especially Mr. Quimby.

This hotel is beautiful. Really cool murals and digital art. Great location and huge rooms for the city. The staff also went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed for a great stay. Quimby was the best.Thanks! - N

Perfect location great hotel with nice employees.Location is great between Times Square and Central Park.We’ll stay here again on our next family trip to New York City. Renovated rooms and comfortable beds.

First time in the hotel and enjoyed it so much. we are from Brazil and we look foward to coming and staying here again soon. Front Desk Emanuel and Carolyn were great. Rooms were large and clean. Concierge was very informative as well.

Very disappointed in Park Central Hotel and would not recommend staying here. Although location was great, the service and accommodations are lacking. Our AC would not cool and had to have maintenance to our room 3 times. We asked about changing rooms and were basically told to “suck it up” and that they had no other rooms available. Dirty glassware was never replaced during our 3 night stay. Only 3 towels were left daily for our family of four, therefore we had to call daily for an extra towel. For the price paid for our stay, I would certainly expect much better.

So disappointed and would never recommend it. We feel the only thing it had was the location!Room was so dark, only 2 nite stand lights. Couldn’t see sky, ground, but lots of brick wall! Paid $277, for this?...Had to stack furniture to have room for our luggage! Asked for nonsmoking and near the elevator, got nonsmoking and end of the hall. Talked with a woman who told me to be happy, I didn’t ask for the best. I didn’t know we had to do that to have room for our luggage and all the other normal amenities you’d expect.

I loved this hotel. We visited for my parents anniversary, Dafne was extremely nice and gave my parents a small food gift along with a card to get 3 free drinks at the bar. This hotel was super clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. The only thing that was weird is there was no refrigerator. I've never been in a hotel room without a fridge and that was a little bit of a disappointment! Other than that, everything was perfect.

Highly recommend this Hotel if you want to stay in NYC. Close to Central Park which is such a beautiful place to walk and explore. Also only a few blocks from Times Square. John and Nancy in the lounge are very knowledgeable of the area and are very warming people to talk to and make you feel welcome. The cleaning staff do a great job each day and the room was very comfortable and modern. Thank you Park Central Hotel for making our first stay in NYC a memorable one. We hope to be back soon... room 552.

We checked in on the July 17th, we have been traveling for 10 hours and were pretty tired, the frontdesk are not so helpful but but but..... Nancy the waitress from the bar is absolutely perfect she help out with directions, dinner, breakfast and so on nice and kind to my children just perfect

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Park Central, it really was centrally located, great room service, a special shout out to our housekeeping/room maid Julie Grenade for such great service, so pleasant to speak to and great to come back to a thoroughly spotless room every night. The guest services and conceriege were also very pleasant, very helpful and also extremely resourceful!! Great valet for taxi especially at the last minute and in the pouring rain!!!

My family and me arrived early i the morning and decided to go to the MoMA. After spending all day on planes and in the musuem, it is safe to say we were spent. And as we arrived to the hotel we where greeted by Elsa, whom was all cheers and great attitude, making our tired attitude change from "I really need to sleep" to something more akin to "Know what? She's right the day was absolutely great." Great service and attention from part of Elsa, thabk you so much.

Excellent work and attention! is aware of the needs of the guest!!! Excellent housekeeper!!! She is friendly with the guests!!! The room is always clean!!! She ask the guest about that they need it!! She is great housekeeper!!!

Had a wonderful stay at the Park Central. The hotel is very conveniently located and has very friendly. Pleasure to sse their staff actualy have fun at their job. They made me smile at several inetractions. Forgot my iPhone when I left the hotel and KIZZI SHILLINGFORD, the hotel property management coordinator went the extra mile to have it shipped back to me in the Netherlands. All and all a great experience! Defenitely going back to the Park Central my next visit to NY.

I have been returning to this hotel for a few years now, and it is superior. Always welcomed with a smile and the staff always ready to greet me. The very first time I stay I returned a year later and they remembered me, that is called great customer service. Excellent condition, never had a problem with the rooms or with house keepingand I must say, I am a tough critic. I travel often for business and never have I found a hotel that I look forward to going back to as much as I do Park Central. Highly recommended!

If I could give this place a zero, I would. Checked in on 7/13 and then on 7/15, I realized that two pair of very expensive glasses were missing from our room. One pair of Ray Ban sunglasses and one pair of prescription Tom Ford glasses that were tucked away in our suitcase were missing when we went to pack our stuff. We searched the room up and down, all over the place and nothing was found. These glasses were both tucked away in bags and did not leave the room. Saturday morning before leaving, we locked our valuables in the safe and left the glasses tucked away in our bag and suitcase. On Sunday, we filed a report with security, who was completely unaware of protocol and the appropriate procedures in this situation. He advised us to ask Customer Service about the next steps (because he was unaware of them himself). When we checked out, we stopped at Customer Service before leaving and they were of no help either. Quite frankly, they were condescending and patronizing towards us saying that they would "check the footage on security cameras" and the "card access history." Then when I asked up front what would happen next, they said their "head of security" would not be working until the next day, leaving us with no further information. Out of all the hotels I have stayed in, I have never thought twice about having my glasses STOLEN. In addition to this very disappointing event, every time we would come back to the room in the evening, the entire third floor reeked of marijuana both nights. My only hope is that there is some sort of resolution/recovery when/if I hear back from the security director. We will NOT be coming back to this hotel. I am simply writing this review to warn future guests about our very sad and disappointing experience at the Park Central Hotel.

Great hotel with a great location! About a minute's walk to Central Park, and about 10 minutes to Times Square. We were able to see and do more than expected during our short stay thanks to the hotel's proximity to everything, including subway stations. We would definitely stay here again when returning to NYC.

Loved this hotel and would definitely go back. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms a good size and clean. Great location close to Central Park and Times Square. I know where we will be staying when we go back to New York.

Salvador was the one that treat us in the hotel, he work in the hotel.excellent service!!! The hotel is great with a good attendance and good people working out there is in a excellent place near of everything

Check in was fast and counter staff helpful. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The shower/bath products very nice. We were on the 17th floor with 2 double beds. Beds were comfy and we had 4 pillows on each bed. The only problems I had was that I had to get the key cards re done as they didn’t work. I was very happy with the room and the location was perfect! Between Central Park and Times Square. There is a great coffee shop next door.

Kudos to Messina in housekeeping. She was enormously helpful and kind. She is a great asset to the Hotel.Many thanks to Mr. Hightower, who effectively and consistently resolved several challenges (both ours and the hotel’s).

Had a amazing Stay and Would give credit to all the staff & Employee who are the best in their department,Thanks Emanuel/ Carolyn/Defanny/- Front deskrestaurant /Bar- JOHN/ALEX/MARIAM/NANCY/ALI.Door area- JOHN /David/ carmello

Park Central Hotel is just as beautiful as advertised online and in the photos. My lady friend and I went here in April of this year as we were looking for a nice hotel that was close to the Metropolitan Opera House and other major attractions and this perfectly met our expectations. From this hotel, Central Park is about a 10-minute walk, Times Square about 15-20 minutes, the Lincoln Center, a 5-minute taxi ride. There is also an entrance to the subway conveniently located outside the hotel for those of you who would like to use public transit to explore other parts of the city like Brooklyn or Lower Manhattan. Customer service at this hotel was friendly. When making inquiries about buying tickets to the MET Museum and Circle Line Sightseeing Cruises, the staff were always willing to answer our questions and help us out. They also have a printing station conveniently located in the lobby that is free of charge if you need to print any personal stuff. The man who served us our drinks at the lounge area also made us feel very welcome there. On our last day, they also had a desk where we dropped off our luggage for safe-keeping, since check-out was in the morning and our flight home was not until the evening, so that we were able to continue with some last-minute adventures in the city.Our room was clean and had a nice view of the city from our window. I loved the wall divider that separated both of our beds, which gave each of us that extra privacy. Wifi signal was fast and easy to set-up as well. The furniture, decor, and the hallways also had a nice New Yorker vibe to it. We paid a lot of money for this hotel but it was well worth it. Overall, I would definitely stay here again the next time we need a hotel in the city.

Recently stayed at the Park Central and was extremely happy with the stay and specially the location of the hotel. A few blocks from Central Park, Rockefeller Center and a short walk to Times Square. Had a little problem with my original room that smelled a little like a wet basement. We went down to let them know and the gentleman at the desk seemed a bit unwilling to help; after we got annoyed another lady helped us out and we were able to change our room and get our vacation back on track. The hotel is surround by numerous options of great places for breakfast or lunch and close to great restaurants for dinner (all price levels.) Very close to a few subway stations, even though Uber was our preferred transportation. Our room had no view whatsoever, but honestly we didn’t mind; the convenience of being close to everything made up for it. I would definitely stay here again. 2

I stayed here for two weeks and by far the best hotel I have been too the staff member are all amazing and welcoming especially Emanuel because of him we had the best views to see the fireworks on the 4th of July. Wonderful area same street as Times Square close to most asttractons it has just been great. If you want a good hotel to stay at for your visit to New York City, come to Park Central it feels like home. It’s has become my home ❤️❤️❤️I promise you

This hotel is walking distance from Central Park, Times Square, and numerous other attractions. Expensive unless you go off peak or get a special. For the money you would expect coffee maker, fridge, and microwave but there are none. We paid for a room upgrade and were very disappointed. The only upgraded thing was a view of the street. I wish there were more for your money. The room is very average!

Hotel was really nice friendly staff.We were early getting to the hotel so we went to register with our passports. Our rooms were ready early and we were allowed to go to it. The rooms are large and clean TV if you want it a large bathroom with plenty of towels. It is a bit of an expensive hotel a glass of wine was over 10 dollars and a half beer over 8 dollar's.No coffee or tea making facilities in the room you can ask for coffee machine. Also the hotel as a city tax ours was an extra 80 dollars for 2 days.Close to everything you may need and nice and central.

We are 4 ppl and staying here for 6 nights. When we checked in, the room given to us was stinky/smelly, unclean and dusty. Even the housekeeping staff came with room freshener suggested to change the room immediately. We had to manage a night to get another room.New room given to us appeared all good. When we moved-in there (premium room), realised it is also dusty. My wife caught allergy due to dust, there is lint all over the curtains, corners un-cleaned. Please do not stay here if you have dust allergy. When we came back in the evening, we found no housekeeping done in the room. We have to keep requesting stuff all the time.$35 paid as service fee at the top of booking fee is useless. Not getting any worth of it. 4 star rating is totally misleading. Just waiting to finish our stay now. I hope i don't have to return to this place in future.

This Hotel was amazing, a central location to everything. Great for business travel. Excellent wifi and meeting area's. The staff was super nice & very accommodating. This hotel staff know's how to make you feel special, old school Las Vegas special. I would not recommend staying at any other hotel in New York, stay there! Park Central on 7th

Me with my family stay for 24 night every things was perfect. But the elevator was crowded so the elevator lifts it and is somewhat small. Good staff especially Mariem She was very helpful and fluent in Arabic and she helped us a lot.

Check in was a bit slow and without any help. The staff at checkin seemed to have a chip on her shoulder. The rest of the staff was very helpful. The room was nice, a little tight with 2 queen beds in the room. However, it was very nice and the bed itself was perfect.

The location is incredible, between Central Park and Times Square; near to MoMa, Top of the Rock, Empire State, LOVE & HOPE sign, broadway, etc. You have 4 metro lines, so you can easily go anywhere in Manhattan. The room was really spacious, super clean and with an amazing view. All the staff was really kind. I was really impressed by the hotel!! I definitely would stay at the Park Central again!. I previously read about the elevators, it's true they have few elevators but this was never a problem, you don't have to wait too much. I was seriously amazed with the Park Central Hotel.

Very nice hotel - Can't beat the location.Pro - Location, location, location. Once you strip out the confiscatory tax rates, not a bad price for a roomFriendly helpful staff, clean rooms, well runCon - No restaurantNo pool, (but it's Manhattan so, what do I expect?)We really enjoyed our stay. You're close to Central Park, in a great part of town, can catch a subway anywhere. You could do a LOT worse. I'd stay here again for sure!

The good: Location is convenient to transportation, Times Square, Central Park, Museums etc. Very good base. The rooms are a good size for New York and tastefully done. Bathrooms too, with nice Bigelow products. And the lobby smells amazing!The needs improvement: They have nerve charging for that Wi-Fi service which is about the worst I have ever encountered. Almost unusable. The cell service wasn't much better I was almost cut off from communication except when in the lobby. Despite being on the lowest temp the A/C was not great and the room never really got cool which would have been nice given the hot temps outside. The room was dark due to one small window that faced the interior (good for sleeping tho). Housekeeping was no great about replacing/replenishing (never had a bathmat after the first day, took the lotion that wasn't empty and didn't give another, took four dirty towels and replaced with one). Was never told what the resort fee was for or what it included.Overall, I wouldn't let the negatives deter me from staying here because they are all fixable things with some focus.

My partner and I stayed 5nights in a king room ( king size bed).Room was absolutely fine. Bathroom was spacious .Free internet . Air con works well and can be adjusted.Location is fantastic. Three blocks from Central Park. Easy walk to Times Square and all theatres and clubs. Eateries and bars everywhere.Highly recommend

Kuddos to “Mariem” the intelligent and articulate bartender who waited on me during my recent stay at the Park Central. In town on business, I was alone and tired after a long workday. Mariem went out of her way to make me feel welcome and not quite so “alone” in the Big Apple :))

The Park Central, renovated not long ago, is a very comfortable hotel in a perfect location for visitors to New York. The rooms are small but adequate and clean with very good bathrooms, A/C that can stand up to 97-degree days,and the service is very helpful and courteous. There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are several in the area; if you have breakfast at the "usual" time though, expect waits at the nearby restaurants. The hotel is practically on top of a subway line with elevator access, very important for travelers. Compared with the prices of national-chain hotels in the area, this is an excellent value.

Nice hotel close to popular attractions yet close the quietness of Central Park. Delicious restaurants around the hotel that were not packed with tourists. Clean room, comfortable bed and pillows. Abundance of toiletries and towels no need to call for more. Friendly and helpful staff. Will be staying here again it was perfect!!

A modern interior greets us when we enter. The room was very comfortable with excellent bedding and ability to control the air temperature easily. The only negative in our experience was how the framed art in the bathroom made my wife and kids uncomfortable.Steps from the subway and Carnegie Hall, and only a few blocks from Central Park or Times Square. Easy to get around and we were so pleased to have selected this hotel as our base to explore the city. Coming back at the end of a busy day was relaxing and a great environment to recharge.We would certainly consider using them again on future trips.

Room was very comfortable with a wonderful view of Times Square!. Staff was very kind and friendly. The location was great and using the Hop on Hop off bus was a good way of getting around. The hotel was an easy walk to Central Park and shopping areas. The bar was very relaxing after a long day of shopping. Say “Hello” to Mariem...a beautiful lady and the sweetest bartender ever!

Postage stamp size elevator but very fast. Needed new mattress. Lighting in bathroom very dim. Room was large with loveseat and chair. Location and staff were great. Don't know if I'd stay there again.

They charge USD 75.00 for valet parking and I had to walk 4 blocks to return my car because there were no drivers available. At checkout I waited 75 minutes at the sidewalk for my car. They charge USD 33,00 as facility fee as an extra to use the gym, have 10% discount at the bar and 1 hour bike. It’s not true.

There is nothing Restaurant in this hotel. There are no coffee makers in rooms, unless requested. But, the rooms are nicely updated (but no fridge) so for the price, it should have these amenities. Staff very friendly on check in. Good location to shops, theatre and restaurants.Just not a full service hotel which I believe would rate 4 stars.

This is a very nice, very clean hotel with very nice, contemporary decor. The rooms are a decent size and the location can’t be beat! This was my first time in New York and I decided that I wanted to extent my trip because one day just was not enough and the staff was extremely accommodating and tried their very best to keep me in the same room, which I really appreciated. I stayed in a room with a view overlooking 7th Avenue and loved every minute of it! Yes, you get noise from the street, but it’s New York... what do you expect? It helps lend to the experience of being in the city and I kind of liked being woken in the morning by the buzz of the city coming to life. The hotel bar is a nice place for a drink and has a lot of great work space. The location can’t be beat...in any direction you are a mere minutes walk from Central Park, MoMA, Times Square and subway stations to get you where ever else you may want to go. Friendly staff, great room and great location. Can’t be beat... will be back again.

When I made the booking thru Expedia I was quoted a rate which seemed OK so I went ahead The total including taxes was US$753.02.However later I was informed that I had to pay an extra US$40.16 per night as resort or amenity charges, which would give me access to facilities which I had no interest in.At the Hotel I found out this is a mandatory fee and lost $120 to this deceiving and cheating hotel, they told me that this included a free i hour bike rental and I could read newspapers in the lobby for US$40 per night.I later read on google that this is illegal and some hotels are being investigated by the New York authorities for deceiving the public.Any straight forward hotel would give the full rate why does Park Central resort to deceiving and cheating.It's desigusting

Great location, nice rooms, but watch out for these 35$/day facilities fee. Midtown isn’t the best place to stay if you don’t want to hear sirens all night. The rooms are super clean. But expect some delays at check-ins and check-outs. Moreover, staff disappear without notice and give you the wrong information (with a smile). Our TV remote did not work. When we told the concierge, he told us it would be fixed by the end of day. 3 days later, we’ll, the remote did not work.

We were not going to bother to write a review until we got an email from the hotel telling us how great they are. This really annoyed us as they did not live up to their claims. The noise from the street was excessive and we were unable to sleep. The elevators are too small and too few. The lack of food options was a surprise as they had a very small market which was overpriced. The response to complaints was by text and follow up was slow. This is an old building which has been renovated but the windows are not soundproofed enough. We were so looking forward to our trip and enjoyed the city but the hotel stay was very poor and won't be repeated. They gave us complimentary breakfast to make up for the inconveniences, we thought that was a nice gesture until we saw what was included. One Muffin, one drink and one fruit. We have stayed in a lot of hotels over many years some good some not so good, but this one left a bad taste. The hotels response was so defensive, just telling us how great they are.......well not for us!!!

My husband and I always stay at the Park Central when we visit Manhattan. Our room was luxurious. It is clean and comfortable. We love the location. You can walk to Central Park or Times Square. We take the subway from the airport on the blue line and get off at 53rd and 7th and walk up 7th for 2 blocks to the hotel. It's so easy.

At first getting to the hotel takes about an hour with taxi and costs $42 from the airport, the route is very busy.On arrival you must give them a credit/ debit card for any extras even if you don't intend to have any, this was a bit annoying.Reception was friendly and quick with little fuss, we was given our room cards for a deluxe king room which in itself was just a normal hotel room with a slightly bigger bed but in all it was ok apart from out one window was on-looked by an office block and the other window had very noisy air conditioning units just below us, so you had to keep the curtains closed for privacy and no view what so ever of NY.The hotel maids were friendly and efficient as were all the staff and especially when I asked if they could put up some balloons and banners in my room for my wife's birthday they excelled. Thank you for that.The bar downstairs is not 24hr but that was ok but it is expensive and just like every one else in NY they DO EXPECT A TIP !This was a big bone of contention as tipes should be given depending on service quality, all bars restaurants taxis in fact everyone expects about a 20% tip. some are added automatically to your bill others you have a "choice" (I say that lightly) off 20 % 18% or 15 % you tick the one applicable. And it is not cheep to eat out to start with.All in all the hotel was over priced but of good standards and very good location between Times sq and Central Park.Now the main thing that a lot of people do not like is the $1,889.79 facilities tax WHICH IS NOT OPTIONAL. This comes of your card when you leave or you have to pay before you check out. This is for any WFI you might use (most people can use there data in the USA now any way, and for a discount and priority booking in the restaurant next door which was shut and for the Hotel gym which was not used so all in all expensive back door tax.Oh regarding TAX when ever you see something you want to buy it does not always have TAX on it so when you go to pay... yup the price has gone up " be careful of this"I would give this hotel 9/10 if it had not charged me the facilities tax, but with that Im afraid its a 7/10 sorry Park Central but a lot of people are angry with the stealth tax, yes I know you state it in your T&C but when you book through a third party you think you have paid in full and that's what you stated on my e mail to you when I questioned this as per below. Thank you for reaching out to Park Central Hotel NY!Your reservation was charged for the hotel amount of $1,889.79 (INCLUDING ALL TAXES AND FEES )

Very nice people and rooms are more than clean. Room maids are smiling all day long and they do a very good job. This hotel is also very well located, near central park and Times square. I just can recommand this hotel

Stayed at this hotel with my wife for six nights while attending a conference. Like others state the location is perfect with easy access to multiple subway lines and lots of attractions. Staff were wonderful but do note that the lobby bar has limited hours and there is no on-site full service restaurant, but many close by. Staff made excellent recommendations for reasonably (for NYC) priced bars and places to eat.We started out in room 1533, which is small and located directly behind a four-elevator shaft. It was VERY noisy, like a subway train every minute. Staff worked with us to relocate to room 902, which was roomy and simply AWESOME. Quiet, not much street noise, clean, and with two suitcase stands which we used. Note that you will not want to stay here for a view. We looked across to the other wing but that helped with reduced street noise.When we moved out of the first room my wife left a mirror in the bathroom. While it took a little time to locate it, we discovered the housekeeper for that room had removed and saved it on her cart for deposit in the lost and found. Let me say my wife and I were appreciative for this kind of honesty. We hope she received the praise we asked to be passed on.

The Park Central is located within walking distance of many great sight seeing places - Central Park, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Plaza, Empire State Building, High Line, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Times Square, shopping, and much more. It is also close to the subway for a quick ride to the 9/11 Memorial. The hotel is very clean, quiet and has a friendly staff. I would definitely stay here again.

Fantastic hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. The location is perfect: Central Park and Times Square are nearby and enough places to have a good breakfast are at walking distance. As my wife uses a wheelchair for longer distances we were kindly offered the disabled room which was absolutely fantastic.

I don'd know about the staff but I like the hotel, our room was spacious. Quick check in, Good price, near to almost everything. The facilities were clean and pleasant to look at. I will surely stay here when I visit NYC next.

The room was so small that I have to close my luggage to get to the  toilet. No air conditioning temperature control in the room. I could hear the people talking and laughing in the next room. Terrible

my wife and i were statying in New jersey on vacation and decided to spend a couple of nights in NYC. I made a reservation and paid in advance. when I checked in I showed the same credit card I used to pre-pay the hotel and presented and international driver licence. I was requested to show my Passport. I explained the Clerk that I was not carrying around my Passport unnecesarily and he replied to me that it would make an exception, BUT I was told that it was a requisite. I do not believe such thing and if so, it would be very convenient to say: if you are statying in this hotel, our policie is that if you are an alien you must show a Passport.as far as the room, it was decent -even though NYC is expensive still paying almot 500 USD per night is way too expensive and I did not get what I paid for.Air conditioning unit - it makes a very loud noise...View - I got the 3rd floor, so I manage to see and ugly view of the hotel´s roof.all in all - bad expereince.

The hotel is located at the corner of 55th street and 7th avenue, just a block away from Times Square. We got the room for a little over $300 which is very reasonable for this time of year and the size of the room. We had requested for two double beds but since we flew in at midnight, we only got the one with a king-size bed. The room was pretty spacious and complete, my only complaint is that they didn't have complimentary bottled water and bathrobes. The room also smelled like mothballs when we came in but disappeared after the AC came on after a few minutes. Excellent location with two diners across the street. They also have a little market where you could get breakfast and other essentials.

The hotel is very central for walking almost anywhere in midtown. Only a few blocks from Central Park. Only 8 blocks from Times Square, shows and lots of shopping.There is not a restaurant but there are lots of choices just outside the door. Rooms are spacious and updated. The windows actually open. The only thing I would suggest is for the cleaning staff run a vacuum around the edges of the carpet in the rooms. They are a little dusty. This was my second stay this year at the Park Central and compared to other hotels and its location I found it pretty good value for my money.

Be warned they do not always honor reservations. You will get a room but not the one you reserved. On the plus side the staff is very accommodating. Location, location, location. Centrally located in the heart of midtown.

This was my least favorite hotel that I have ever stayed in. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and was appalled by their service and rooms. I had just had surgery and booked a room to stay in at the hotel and the front desk workers yelled at me. Everything was already paid for it should have been an easy 5 minute Pleasant talk. I was appalled at how I was treated. I have never experienced such poor service. This is a Walmart hotel. The toilet paper holder was broken and the shower was stained.

We visited NYC three weeks ago. The hotel is located on the 7th avenue, just a 7min walk away from Time square. Everybody were very polite and helpful. Gave us information and tips for our stay the city. The room was very clean and well kept.

Horrible customer service!! I’m a frequent traveler and I’ve never seen such hostile support staff and filthy common areas. Hidden fees for no benefit are imposed on all guests. Have to leave the hotel for a full meal of any kind. Look elsewhere. There are better values in New York.

We enjoyed our brief stay at this hotel. It was our first time to stay here and everyone seemed pleasant. I wish I could remember the names of the people who helped us. The facilities were clean and pleasant to look at. During our stay the restaurant was closed for renovations. Thank you.

We didn’t like it at all. We stayed for 8 days. They didn’t make our room twice. Too much apologies but it happened again. 3 ours to get the room ready. No minibar, no restaurant no room service. They charge you for the gym even if you don’t use it. US35 per night. I will never come back to this hotel ever.

Fast checkin and checkout. The room we had was very clean and wellkept and clean although planned a bit strange but good beds. Bathroom large and with all the necessary amenities. Close to Central Park and just about everything else with subway a stonethrow away.

Great stay, with great service! Everybody we encountered there from doorman to concierge were super helpful and attentive to all our needs. Room was clean, bed was comfy and location was amazing! We walked everywhere we went!

Park Central is a perfect location for visiting NYC! Located near theatres, Times Square, Central Park, & subway stations. We walked to all threatre shows & to Madison Square Gardens. I found the hotel clean, comfortable, & affordable. The room itself is small but what NYC hotel has a spacious room! The bathroom was very small but worked fine for me. Hotel staff was friendly & very helpful with subway routes & dining recommendations. There is a small coffee shop in the hotel. However, is closes early & opens late! Next door is a Starbucks. I would definitely stay at Park Central Hotel on my next NYC trip!

I stayed in this hotel in March during big winter storm and still was able to get everywhere I needed to go.Hotel staff was very helpful and provided assistance needed because of the storm. Rooms were nice and clean and mine had a wonderful view. Highly recommend.

Fantastic bar with attentive service. Miriam took wonderful care of us after Melissa’s performance at Carnegie Hall. Nice wine selection and inventive cocktails. Steps away fro Carnegie for non natives. :-)

Would highly recommend this hotel. Helpful staff. Lovely room. Great location for times square, central park, MOMA, Ellens Stardust Diner, Ambassador theatre, Bloomingdales, Rockefeller and subways. No long wait for lifts as previous reviews have stated and the service elevator is also sign posted if required. Nice lobby bar.

It was a great experience from booking to checking out. I booked the hotel on their website with ease. The location is fantastic. I love the hotel room itself. Super comfortable bed and pillows, nice space, modern style and nice bathroom. I liked that the bathroom was away from the bed. The previous hotel we were at the bathroom was right next to the bed and didn’t have a legit door. I really like the welcome text when I checked in, and had the option to text any questions or needs, for example extra towels or the WiFi user and password. The bar area look really cool, but we didn’t stop by for drinks since we had a full itinerary. Overall, great experience. I definitely would recommend this place, and I would return to this hotel on my next trip.

When my group of 9 arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a friendly African American woman that checked us in at 11 a.m. During the check in process she realized my travel agents payment had not been received and took my credit card for the 4 rooms to secure the deposit, which I completely understood. Because we checked in early, she was only able to provide us with 1 of the 3 rooms to secure our luggage, but assured us we’d be fine when we returned from our conference that night.When we got back to the hotel at 10:30 p.m. that night 1 of the 3 additional rooms had been cancelled. The desk attendant called over the manager on duty, Nahn. From the beginning he was combative. He rudely asked me what the problem was. I explained the woman at the front desk told me my male students room had been cancelled. As a female educator traveling with students, this was alarming being so far away from home with no other options. Than went on to rudely say the room name was not in the system. I kindly explained our morning situations as well as the fact that the front desk attendant had just told me the room had been zeroed out when I gave them Justin’s name.Than became even more condescending explaining to me that Park Central is a luxury hotel. He never once stopped to assure me he’d get the situation resolved. Instead he kept rudely asking me questions for another 20 minutes only to later find Justin a room on the ninth floor.When I got back up to the room I called the front desk to ask who was the manager on duty. They refused to share his name. I got in my pajamas relieved we were all in our rooms after an 18 hour day and crawled into bed. My phone rang and a condescending voice asked me to come back down to the lobby to run my credit card on the room. I explained I was in my pajamas after an 18 hour day at which time he got more combative trying to explain to me that he was doing me a favor. I’m not sure what the flavor was. I asked him for his name and your name, at which time he told me you’d be available on Friday.On Friday when I came down to speak to the general manager, he was on the phone. Our paths never crossed because of the extensive amount of conferences we had to attend while in NYC.Each year I bring students to New York for the Columbia Scholastic Press Association National Conference. I have always stayed at the Park Central. I have also referred other faculty members that attend this conference to stay at this location. After this terrible treatment I will never stay at the Park Central again. Nahn’s lack of customer service and arrogance did not exclude the luxury brand he tried to proclaim about the Park Central. I’ve stayed at many hotels and been treated much kinder. In this industry, customer service is key. Nahn clearly are not ready for the position he has. Perhaps they should attend sensitivity training where they learns the value of customer service. As an educator I too am in the people business. I understand that kindness is a choice, it is one I choose to take. Perhaps the Park Central would be better served with someone that treats others the way they wants to be treated.

We didn’t know what to expect, but WOW we were surprised. Right in the middle of mid-town it’s equal distance to anywhere you want to go. The subway is a 1/2 block away and Central Park just a little further. The hotel is demure, but friendly. Our room (Premium King) was clean, quiet and had a nice view. The staff was courteous and professional. Speaking of staff....here’s a shout out to Miriam and Irish John...The two of you made our trip! Visit them in the the hotel lounge. Park Central...we will see you soon.Paul & Karen

We had a wonderful 2 nights staying at the Park Central Hotel New York. The hotel is well positioned and close to all that we wanted to do. The room was very clean and big. But best of all was the heater in the room was amazing as it was very cold and it heated the room very good. We would stay here again next year.

It was difficult deciding what to eat among all these great restaurants in the underground market ,we decided to go with pasta and end our dinner with a delightful ice cream,and then after sharing all the good ambience we went for coffee !!!

We just got back from NYC and stayed in the Park Central for 4 nights. I was concerned about the negative reviews about this hotel. I booked 2 rooms and brought 3 granddaughters, a son and his wife who were there on business. When we checked in, people were so kind. We got there about noon and we were able to go directly into out room. My son and family hadn't arrived and I requested a crib, a refridgerator and a coffee maker for them. They all arrived within 30 minutes. Impressive! The rooms each had 2 double beds and we were on the 4th floor, so we weren't high payers. We got a great package that included parking, which was important for my son. The rooms were really nice, with great bathrooms. Nothing was peeling, or broken. The beds were SO comfortable. The pillows were great! The housekeeps were some of the best we have ever met. If you stay on the 4th floor, you will have a housekeeper named Bebe, who will take care of you. She is the kindest soul there is....and so all of the housekeepers are kind because she guides them. I cannot say enough about the kindness about everyone in the hotel. There might be lines at the elevator, but they move quickly and the lines aren't all the time. Don't let it bother you. There are all sorts of restaurats within a block or 2 of the hotel. You are a couple of blocks from the park and the great playground if you have little ones. I've stayed in over 10 hotels int he area and really recommend the Park Central.

This hotel has a great location, close to the subway line just within easy walking distance of Central Park and Times Square. I can’t say much good about the service however. We arrived with 6 pieces of luggage and there didn’t seem to be anyone in sight offering to help. I know they have bellman there. Front desk didn’t offer to call a bellman to help our family of 6 and 6 pieces of luggage. We managed. Our room was clean and housekeeping service was so so. Guest services desk was helpful on the 2 occasions I asked for something. I asked the concierge about tickets to various things, she basically told me to use the computers and go to the website myself. I asked the front desk about arranging transportation to the airport before leaving. She said the concierge usually handled that and they weren’t there. So she also basically told me to look on the internet myself. The following morning I asked the bellman and he said if I wanted anything other than standard taxi I could look for a number and call. I am a seasoned world traveler and I managed all these things by myself. Maybe these things are NYC standard now, but I doubt it. This was not my first, or last, trip to NYC. I would imagine foreigners, or English second language, or no English visitors will not appreciate these attitudes.

I met Mariyam at the lounge and she was so friendly that I forgot that I was in NYC. RECEPTION STAFF WAS NOT AS WELCOMING THOUGH. room was decent but small as most in NYC. The lounge is a nice area to hang out. Not too loud not too boring

Excellent location, steps away from hop on hop off bus, Uber was very excellent and quick, the hotel was clean , staff were excellent , overall experience a good one. Their are so many choices and you never know where to book, we are glad we booked here, excellent hotel for anyone, and good pricing.

My company booked a 2-day meeting. While the hotel is conveniently located there's no breakfast, no restaurant, no room service which is a deal breaker when you travel for business.The hotel is full of families with children and I understand why. You can eat outside and just sleep there.The room was ok, relatively quiet. Hasn't been redone for decades so nothing fancy.Conclusion, good for families visiting NYC but avoid if you're traveling for business.

Nicely renovated rooms. Contemporary design I liked. Special request were taking care of immediately. Hotel management follow up, after check out. Overall I can recommended the hotel. Watch out for special deals.

Stayed here with my wife for 5 nights. Our 3rd visit to this amazing city. Park Central was a 5 minute walk to Central Park and 10 minutes to Times Square. Room was spacious with 2 Queen beds and spotlessly clean. Towels changed every day. A great hotel for our holiday. Concierge was really helpful and booked attractions for us. Only downside was no restaurant in the hotel, but we found a great little restaurant at 910 7th Avenue opposite Carnegie Hall for a great breakfast. We happily recommend Park Central as a great place to stay.

Stayed here for my birthday this year, the location was perfect 5 min to Central Park and 10 minute walk to Time Square. The subway is also located close to so you can catch it to downtown Manhattan and Brooklyn. The lobby is really nice and smells really good as well, it has a classy elegant feel to it and wasn't crowded. Staff at the front are friendly and polite and ensured a fast and hassle free check in which made the stay that much better.The rooms were super clean and tidy and the air-con was always super cold ahah, The beds had to be one of the best ever super comfy and warm as well as an ample amount of pillows. Bathroom was always super clean and had fresh towels daily which was good the mirror had a ring light effect which was nice as well. Beside the bed it had 2 charging ports for your phone which was good meaning you could just plug in your cord instead of using an adapter. Only thing would have been nice if there was a few more amenities as there was only really a bar of soap and some body lotion water in the room would have been good as well even though just drank from the bathroom tap and the water tasted fine. One annoying thing was the lifts, to begin with they were fine but throughout my stay they became increasingly worse and on multiple occasions had to take the stairs, at one point the lift got trapped and you could hear the other gusts inside calling for help and assistance. Apart from that the hotel is perfect really well situated has good sized rooms and tastefully decorated, definitely will be coming back

A great place to stay. Warm friendly staff. Great service. Centrally located in midtown. Close to everything I need. Keep coming back over last 3 years. Strongly recommend to either business travelers or vacationing families.

Great location walking distance to central park, columbus circle, lots of restaurants as well as times square and broadway shows. Safe, clean, esp updated nice bathroom, ask for street view though, guest service very helpful. Reasonable price for this location. If alone or friends andfamily very good to stay at. Highly recommended.

Stayed here recently and location of the hotel is great however it has its negatives.1 - after checking in one of the two hotel keys was not working. Went to the lobby and asked to have the key that I had at the time to have it reset or issue a new one. The person behind the desk asked for an ID which I did not have at the time and was refused service because of hotel policy. I was not offered any alternative solutions nor asked for additional information. I felt very dismissed and the experience left a sour note. So I had to wait until for the other half to return to have access to the room.2 - the room smelled musty so I had to opened up all the windows to let some fresh air in. The room my in-laws were in had the same must odor. They had to request for a new shower curtain because the smell was soo bad.3 - the windows of this hotel are not sound proof meaning get ready for some restless nights. Sound from the street carries and you can hear it from you room. If you plan on a quiet night and this hotel, don't count on it.4 - the hotel does not come with its own refrigerator. So if you need one, you have to ask for it and count on a couple of hours or more to have it delivered to your room.5 - walls not insulated. You can hear people from the other room very clearly.As I mentioned, the location of this hotel is ideal. It is within walking distance from Central Park and Times Square. Other than this plus, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

We stayed here for six nights with our two children in a premier twin queen room which are located on the corners of the building. The room was perfectly located and looked out over Carnegie Hall. When we arrived there weren’t enough bath towels for us all so we used their text service to request more and they were delivered to the room within 5 minutes. We requested a fridge and coffee maker and there were none available on our arrival (Memorial Day weekend) but the following day they became available and were delivered to the room. For a family of four staying for six nights I was disappointed at the lack of storage space. There wasn’t sufficient drawers or storage space so we effectively lived out of cases for the week. And as some reviewers have mentioned the $35 nightly fee for “free” WiFi and gym (which we didn’t use) seemed expensive particularly if there for almost a week. That said, everything else was fine. The staff were friendly, prompt and helpful, the room clean and the location fantastic being two blocks from a subway, five minutes from Central Park and Times Square.
