For instance there is a nice diner across the road, Park Cafe. When you enter the hotel, you feel the new york kind of vibe just like everywhere in new york: very busy and non stop. It is not a very relaxing atmosphere, but that is normal in New York i guess, especially in big hotels such as these. The staff did their job, but not much more. They werent very devoted to their job i believe.

Good clean hotel which is very well situated to every thing in Manhattan. Could not help but think there might be a little but of penny ,pinching with services and amenities provided. Staff were very pleasant and helpful

We moved to a corner room (double queen) for a last minute deal. Our room was huge for NYC standards and would easily accommodate a family of 4. We were supposed to have a "view" of central park which basically meant that if you leaned out the window you might see a bit of green. We didn't care though because the beds were nice, bathroom roomy and lots of windows with black out curtains. The lounge was a great place to sit before and after going out. The negatives were: no fridge or microwave in room (although there is plenty of room if they wanted to add them), and no restaurant, no room service. There is a small "to-go" cafe in lobby which has limited items like cereal, sandwiches and salads. Also, our room was facing 7th Street and there was quite a bit of street noise all night (it didn't bother us, it's NYC and we expected some of that).

Perfectly located in the heart of New York City- 10 minutes away from Times Square, the 5th Avenue and Central Park- the Park Central offers, besides its most valuable asset, small but comfortable rooms (which when travelling to NYC is ideal, since a hotel room should only be necessary to sleep), neatly decorated with pictures and artworks (sadly, without a minibar :/), a café that offers basic foods and beverages in the lobby, a bar and a fitness center. But the overall experience in the hotel gets sunken down by the lack of service. When we arrived to the entrance (with 3 large bags!), the bellboy, who is supposed to help unload the luggage from the car and take it to the lobby, did not do anything besides opening the door, or offering a carriage for taking said luggage upstairs to our room. The girl in the reception wasn't anything out of the ordinary when referring to her hospitality and welcome, and when our A/C stopped working, we had to call 3 times so that someone would come fix it. They staff definitely did not make sure that we feel as guests, instead of people who just sleep in a room inside a building. If necessary, we would be fine with coming back to the hotel, but it certainly wouldn't be the first choice. There are other hotels in the zone which seem worth trying out.

Hotel is lovely, great position for seeing almost everything in NY without needing to use the subway, and our room was large, clean, modern, and very comfortable. However... the NOISE! The rooms seriously need white noise generators which I've seen in other NY hotels to drown out the outside noise. The hotel is in a very busy area, right next to central park and the Carnegie hall, 5-10 minute walk from Times square. 7th Avenue is a gridlock of traffic 24/7, so outside, day and night is honking horns, shouting and general city noise which is frequently loud enough to disturb sleep. The walls are super thin too so you can have a chat to your next door neighbour should you wish to. This is especially delightful when someone arrives from a different time zone at 3am and has a little welcome party in their room with their friends. (yes, this IS British sarcasm)For such a lovely hotel I was surprised by the lack of mini bar, fridge and coffee maker in the room, also by the lack of white noise option and very limited lifts for such a large hotel. A small single cup coffee machine was supplied on request though.The bed was seriously THE most comfortable bed I've ever slept in, and as someone who suffers with back pain and almost never finds a comfortable bed this is really saying something. I booked a twin room for my son and I, and we were given a good sized double queen room which looked out over the side street.Overall - It has its faults, but for location versus price I think this hotel is unbeatable. No serious complaints other than the noise and the long wait for lifts, which is tiresome, but I would stay there again.

Perfect location close to Central Park and Broadway. On a well travelled street so felt very safe at night. Rooms and bathrooms were a generous size for New York City. Guest services were very accommodating when my daughter and her friend both forgot their room keys. Proper verification was required but it was quick and easy and they were on their way to the room with little delay, Only downside I experienced was long delays for the elevators (there were only 2 operating elevators for a fairly large hotel). Notwithstanding that, I give this hotel a thumbs up,

We booked park central hotel from Travelzoo and when we arrived, they told us we were upgraded to the hotel next door. We were leaded thru private door next to the lobby and entered westhouse hotel. At the beginning, we were a bit nervous about this 'upgrade', but it turned out to be pretty nice hotel and with breakfast included, in addition with happy hours free with alcohol on the terrace floor. This was for our anniversary getaway weekend, so we are really happy with this surprise upgrade. Also good location, walking distance to a lot of nice restaurants and broadway shows.

Nice place, but we were in an emergency (weather canceled our flight) and had to pay 700$ at booking.com for just one night ! This is the definition of being "taken advantage of". Another surprise was that there was no breakfast area an had to cross the road and find a restaurant ! They charge extra for a package of usual amenities, wi-fi, luggage storage, etc.

This hotel was in a very central fabulous location. The only annoyance was that the room didn't come with a fridge and they didn't tell us that this was going to be charged to us each day. Overall pleasant stay and would stay again for location.

Got a good deal via the Hotel Tonight app. Rooms were small like most NYC hotels. Hotel has over 700 rooms but a limited number of elevators and at times you can wait 5 - 10 mins to get to your room. The gym was shockingly small considering the size of the hotel. Hotel Needs an upgrade. Area is next to Central Park and not the side of the city I would stay at if I didn't have my meetings in the area

Great location for a first visit . My partner and I visited NYC with my parents in April. We chose this hotel for the location. It didn't disappoint. It's easy to access everything from . The hotel was great , the rooms a good size ( for New York standards) . They could have been cleaner but by no means were they dirty . Reception staff amazing. Lifts easy to operate and clean . There is no restaurant in the hotel . The only fault and it's not a big one is the bar ( which is fabulous) closed far to early. 23.15 !! Had a great time .

Location great as not too close to busy Times Square. Disappointed in some staffs behaviour. Lifts are terrible and baggage staff person Noel, went up the lift so he could come down to avoid the wait. Extremely rude and selfish. Management had no empathy. Also no room service or mini bar. Room did not get cleaned until 3rd day!!! Would not recommend Hotel, only the area.

Located on 7th Avenue midway between Central Park and Times Square - you really can't get a better location! There is a subway stop right outside so it's very easy to get around. The room was very nice and clean and the windows even opened which I always appreciate. The washroom didn't have a fan which was a bit weird but we managed with the air conditioning. The small elevators were very busy and each trip ended up being shared with as many other people who could be comfortably squeezed in. The hotel doesn't include a pool or a restaurant but there is a bar and a market in the lobby where you can get pricey drinks, muffins and sandwiches. I recommend going to the market which is about 5 mins away for supplies (they also carry wine and beer), but note that the rooms don't have a minifridge, kettle, microwave, etc. Very nice staff. Note that there is a $30/day 'resort fee' which will be added to your bill at checkout. The resort fee includes internet.

Stayed here for 6 nights for wedding anniversary , was a good clean hotel fabulous size room only downfall was the elevators, two for the whole place and was often left for long periods of time waiting but overall I loved it . Favourite place in the world new york city . Rooms kept clean and friendly staff .

My brother recommended this hotel. The location was perfect. Staff was very helpful. I really look foward to staying again. It was my first trip to NYC and I couldn't have asked for a better hotel....

Nice rooms. Clean hotel. Great location. Elevators frustrating. Slow and security card didn't always work. We had a problem 3-4 times getting it to stop at our floor. Would stay here again even with elevators. Oh..stairs don't take you to the lobby. Booked online and fees not listed. Taxes and fees addEd up. Check your bill. One under our door was fine. My husband is old school and checked out. That bill had parking on it. We did not have a car.

At a good location close to the central park.big hotel with spacious rooms.many places near by for breakfast.reasonable rate.car parking.top floors are better.busy elevators.you can have coffee at the lobby.good service.

I stay here when I visit the city. Always get a great room. One issue this last time was the wait time to check in. We were in line for over 30 minutes and only two people working the desk. This is unacceptable. Other than that, I still love the hotel and will be back. Clean, large rooms make it worth it!

We booked a standard double room; the room was very small.But on request, we get a slightly larger room the next day. We unfortunately had to bring our bags ourselves, since they were still standing in the old room after 5 hours. But the reception at the front desk and the staff in general were very friendly.The breakfast was very manageable and unilateral. The design of the lobby and the bar is very innovative and hip with an antique touch. The rooftopbar and the courtyard are also very nice. In the evening often very crowded. Also seems to be a popular meeting place for locals. The location of the hotel was fantastic and the room service was also great. We will be back!

For those who enjoy Central Park, many of the museums, shopping, and Time Square, this property is in a great location. Near the Subway/metro system. Beautifully appointed rooms. Make sure to ask for a room with a window, as some rooms are interior with no view.

Delicious selection of gourmet canapes & sandwiches, fresh scones + condiments & mini tarts & fine macaroons. Well aged loose tea. Beautiful classic lounge. Great service. A la carte choices available. Highly recommend.

Reception was very good. Valet parking attendant was friendly and always had time to assist. The concierge service was excellent and money saver when purchasing event tickets. Look for specials on line for valuable savings at the hotel including parking. But be aware car size is a factor when using valet parking there are extra cost not mentioned for an SUV for example. Rooms are small but comfortable, clean with basic appointments. No bar fridge, no coffee pot, no wine glasses, no shower cap......Elevator service can be quite slow leave time for possible delays.

We have special praise for Tony Cunaj, Reservation Director and Elizabeth Cacovic, Guest Relations Manager, who gave us outstanding service, paying particular concern to our needs. We also were impressed with the friendly attitude of others working at the hotel. Moreover, the location of the hotel is excellent.

First to last, this hotel is first class. Steps from the major sites and convenient to most places, the Park Central does not disappoint. The rooms are clean and quiet; the staff jump to help. I love this place. The price is reasonable. The elevators are tiny and slow; otherwise, PC is the best. This is my home base in NYC. I am seriously crushing on this hotel!

Love this hotel! Amazing location around 7 min walk to times square. Close to central park Lots of food options surrounding the hotel. Rooms are clean and spacious. Would highly recommend this hotel. Great for tourists.

What an amazing stay we had. We could not have asked for a better hotel. Location was perfect, the bed was the best I've ever slept in and the staff on a whole were nothing but helpful. A couple of niggles were the air conditioning was sooo cold and elevators were slow. But if we ever visited NYC again we would definitely consider Park Central!

Very classy hotel between central Park and Time Square. Beautiful and clean room. There is a small market inside to have breakfast in (or a Quick Lynch) . A special thanks to our housekeeper, Marissa: she was very Kind to us!

We have stayed at this location several times and have always had a decent room but not this time. We had never had a room under the 10th floor, which use a separate elevator. Despite reserving in advance and paying full price we got placed in low level room (606). These room are not even on the road; they are overlooking the hotel roof. Also, I don't know if there is a separate housekeeping staff; we have always had very clean rooms but this room had some trash left there from previous occupants and my pillow case smelled used. On an up note, our check in was quicker than usual. The $1 breakfast is very worth it - muffin, coffee/tea/juice, fruit. And, as always, the location is great. Special note to the bell and door staff - they are awesome and so helpful! Don't ever get rid of those guys!

There are so many wonderful hotels in NYC but we really haven't found one that is more perfectly located which provides the accomodations and services of the Park Central. We always say let's try a different hotel but this hotel has really become our place when in New York. The staff is always pleasant and helpful. The hotel is so convenient and we can walk to Times Square, Central Park or Lincoln Center in minutes. There are also several subway stations within a few blocks that will get you anywhere in the city. The rooms are well kept, modern and comfortable. Rates are reasonable and we can usually take advantage of special deals to include parking and breakfast. The elevators can be slow and inadequate when busy but small price to pay.

For your next gig, book a room at Park Central Hotel as Carnegie Hall is kitty corner to the hotel. Staff are very friendly. The rooms are spic n span, comfy and up to date. I heard music loud enough to be concerning in the hall two doors down from me. When I was in my room all I heard were slightly muffled New York Street sounds. The price per night was very good. You may want to get a package with daily parking if you have a car as it is $65 a day otherwise.I'll return.

e recently spent several days at Park Central. They know us from many stays over the years. Check in is quick and the rooms are generally larger than most rooms in NYC. Great central location for food and Times Square. Enjoyed

Hotel was excellent, I couldn't fault it. The location was so central and easy access to all attractions. The hotel was decorated lovely, and the room was an decent size. We had two double bedded room, it was very spacious. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay near times square.

My family of 5 stayed for 6 nights in total and we occupied 2 rooms. The size of the room is good enough for 3-4 persons and at most 1 extra large luggage & 1 carry-on luggage. Needless to say, the room is too small if you're travelling with more persons or bags other than what I've mentioned. Although the size of the bed is large enough to fit two persons comfortably, there just isn't enough space in the room to move around in and place more bags in the room. However, the size of the hotel room is typical for a hotel in Manhattan so it was all right.The bed was particularly comfortable and made for a good night's sleep after walking the whole day. The water pressure in the shower and sink was also excellent, and there were no issues with the water heater. The shampoo, conditioner, and body wash provided by the hotel were likewise wonderful to use. The hotel's location couldn't be better as it is right in the middle of Manhattan and just a couple of blocks away from Central Park, Times Square, etc.Just one other thing to note aside from the tiny room is the fact that only 2 elevators service the whole hotel so expect to wait 5-10 minutes to get an elevator at peak times. For some reason, the other two elevators are not in service. Also, the mandatory $30 facilities fee per day includes fast wifi in the room and lobby, unlimited use of the gym, unlimited telephone calls, and bag storage until 9 PM.Overall, it was a great stay and I would definitely choose to stay here again!

I read a lot of differing reviews of this hotel. I booked it and I have to say, I was a bit scared! I even brought my own towels because one review said they didn't have enough. However, my experience was really great. The hotel rooms were large for NYC standard. I had a room with a King Size bed. I had a ton of towels in the room. I also read that the maid service was lacking. I was on the 8th floor and my cleaning team did a great job on my room. The shower was powerful with lots of hot water. So, let me just call out a few things that are just realizes of the hotel. No coffee maker in the room but there is a Starbucks like ten feet from the front door of the hotel. Also, the elevators are historic, meaning they are not large and it doesn't make much to fill them, and there is a short wait during peak times. I would say my excellent hotel rate and all the pro's outweigh the cons. You have to decide for yourself if coffee makers and the elevator warrant you wanting to pay $$$ more. The location, again is wonderful to Central Park. I found the staff to be nice. The front desk experience i had was efficient, meaning not a lot of casual chat but who wants that, I just wanted to get my room keys and move along. lolI would gladly go back and I would encourage those who want a great bed, clean rooms, great location to try the Park Central Hotel.

I stayed here with my wife and 2 sons for 5 nights in June , although l can't faulter the hotel in regards to service l was more than a bit dismayed at checkout when l was asked to pay $338 for a facilities fee for 2 rooms when l enquired about this l was told that it was for use of leisure facilities and wi fi etc seen as l did not use either it was a bitter pill, if that was hard to take when l returned home l found out that my card had been charged £202 twice for a reason l am still trying obtain ( l have sent 2 e mails and not heard anything yet ) given the reasons l have outlined l will not be returning to the Park Central any time soon .

The location is literally in Times Square, you are right in the middle of the action. Very centrally located. Madison Square Garden is a few blocks away as well. Also, the rooms are very clean, albeit a tad small for two queen beds.

Excellent hotel, clean, friendly staff. Location is superb! Only 3 blocks from Central Park. Very close to fifth avenue and then Mrs square as well. Great neighborhood with lots of good eating places!

I had a room on the 10th floor, which was exactly as shown on their website. Very modern and large. The bathroom was also large with a rain shower shower head. The bar area was great for meeting people and their cocktails were delicious. The location of the hotel is two streets from Central Park and perfect walking distance to subway stations and bars and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

As what people would tell you, service ain't a given in Big Apple. It took me 3 attempts to get an answer for extended late check out. It eventually earned back 1 star from me on the day of my departure as I finally met the 2 friendliest front desk assistants - Saleem & Angeln. Saleem in particular was great - jovial and helpful at the same time.

The hotel is nice. At the end, it is supposed to be, right? I've stayed in many hotels in NYC. At very busy times. But they've all handled the crowd much better. At the reception you get the feeling that you're at a supermarket checkout counter. We asked for a cot way ahead of arriving. It wasnt there. It took 3 hours to get it. The window was open, not unlocked, open... now with kids booked in the room that is simply unsafe. The AC is not working and the manager was supposed to call this morning at 9 but decided not to. You have to wait in line for the elevator. If the hotel doesn't have capacity to welcome guests, then it shouldn't. Very disappointed.

My room was on the 10th floor. While I did not have a view per say, the room faced the street which was nice for natural light. The hotel has been remodeled. The front lobby is great for meeting for drinks. The rooms are tastefully decorated. The bathrooms have awesome lighting and a rain shower shower head. The location is mid-town and convenient to many restaurants within walking distance. It is about 2 blocks away from famed central park.

We came to NYC on a red eye on June 24th. I had booked a hotel room for Friday the 23rd so we had a room ready when we touched down in the city. I had specifically asked to notate my account saying we were coming in at 6am. We arrived to the hotel only to receive a somewhat cold Good Morning. I chalked it up to being in the city and it was early. I gave the desk clerk my information and she asked us to give her a minute. She walked away and got the manager. The manager proceeded to tell me that my hotel room wasn't ready because I was a "no show" on Friday for checkin and that there were no notes stating that I would arrive on Saturday at 6am. I told the manager that this was totally unacceptable!! Why would I purchase a hotel Friday then???!!! Duh! The manager said she could put us in a temporary King room until my double queen room was ready and comp us for 3 days of breakfasts. Mind you there were three of us traveling. We went to the king room this is what we saw:-small doorway to bring in luggage- king bed took up the entire room barely could walk around it-no wash cloths -room was very warmThe desk clerk told us someone would call my cellphone when the room was ready. I didn't receive a call however someone called and left a vm on the hotel room that I couldn't even check. I tried calling the front desk and it went to their sister hotel. At this point I was very upset. We finally got our double room and was upgraded to a "premier" floor. Don't let the name premier fool you there is nothing premier about it. We were assigned a room on the 12th floor right off the elevator facing the brick buildings behind us! Wow what an upgrade! Here are the pros and cons of this place:Pros:- 2 blocks west of the Central Park- 4 blocks from the heart of time square- tons of souvenir shops- 2 blocks west of the famous Brooklyn diner- 3 blocks from the big bus city tour stop- next door to two coffee shops including Starbucks Cons- rooms are extremely small even premier upgrades- service is poor- no hotel restaurant bar only- market is tiny and very expensive- rooms are hot and uncomfortable - elevators are super slow- restrooms on main floor need a room key only- room keys lose magnetic strip easily had to get new keys multiple times - facilities fees are $31 a day on top of your room rate and triple tax you payAll in all I probably would get a hotel that is in the same vicinity as this one but would spring for something comparable in price to get more service and a better experience.

What a find! Located diagonally across from Carnegie Hall this hotel was outstanding. The room was stylish and clean. There was helpful staff all over the lobby ready to assist. Located 2 blocks south of Central Park and an easy walk into Times Square this was a great mid town location. At $159.00 a night (through Travelzoo.) it was a steal and a half. I could not recommend this hotel more. I'm sure the price won't stay so low, so grab it now if you can.

I was put in charge of booking 22 rooms in NYC for a company event. I knew nothing of the Park Central. I did some research, spoke with an amazing sales person Dreena who couldn't have made my decision to pick this hotel any easier.We all arrived at scattered times throughout the day, we were seamlessly checked in but a fantastic woman, Angela. I can not say enough great things about this hotel. The rooms were nice size and nicely decorated. The lobby/bar was warm and inviting! The hotel is so close to everything. And very quiet! I highly recommend it!!I am booking a night in August for my husband and I can't wait to go back!!

What a great hotel. They stored our car which was very convenient. Ideal location as it is easy walking distance to all theaters!! Room was very spacious, bigger than we expected. Staff checking us in we're very kind and helpful.We would absolutely stay here again!!!Highly recommended for families and theater goers!!

This hotel was the perfect fit for my 20 year old daughter and I! Super friendly staff, remodeled, modern feel with large rooms for NYC standards. It was nice, clean and even quiet. We felt welcome and safe! The elevators were small and always busy but didn't mind as we were on vacation! This hotel is very near Time Square, Central Park, and Carnegie Hall. The door men were super helpful, smiley and polite! Plenty of restaurants nearby and within walking distance. We pretty much walked everywhere or took the subway. We LOVE NYC and the Park Central Hotel!!

Lovely hotel and great design. The reception staff might have been busy but I expected a slightly warmer welcome. Booked here as a last minute booking after another hotel fell through. Its a wonderful location with great room design and lots of space for the price. Hotel is a great design but check out was difficult as had to really break down the bill after a lot of hidden charges. Some 5 star hotels near by dont offer what this hotel does for half the price

The Park Central is a great location near Central Park and is walking distance to the the theatre district, Lincoln Center, 30 Rock and more. Service was great. Hotel was clean. Rooms were very nice. Could not ask for more. Park Central will not disappoint.

We stayed here recently to see a high school orchestra concert at Carnegie Hall since a family member was playing there. Park Central was a great location for us. Close enough to walk to Times Square but not right in the middle of it. The subway is just on the corner and easy to get anywhere if you prefer. We enjoyed walking everywhere to see the city. MoMa is close by as well as many good Delis. One note, if you ask for a corner room with a view, know the bathroom is quite small for 3 people. Not much counter space either. Our other family members stayed in a regular double room and had a bigger bathroom. Rooms have a cool, hip NYC vibe and beds are really comfortable after a long day of walking. Overall, a great experience and I would definitely stay there again.

This was my fifth stay at the Park Central Hotel & by far my best. The hotel has been beautifully renovated and the rooms are spacious, clean & comfortable. The main reason for my return to the hotel is the fabulous location - an easy walk to the Theatre District whilst at the same time being close to Central Park and in a position where you can easily walk up to the Upper West Side or to the East. It also has subway & bus stops literally on its doorstep. The only thing I missed on this visit was not being able to have a sit-down breakfast at the hotel but there are so many places nearby that one can go to. I highly recommend this hotel & look forward to returning.

Only stayed one night but it was great! Room was a good size, impeccably clear and well kept. Bed wonderfully comfortable and the pillows I think the best hotel pillows ever! Stag very friendly and location is excellent. There is a tune station a block away and Central Park is very close. Only downside, few elevators and rather slow. Would certainly like to return.

Hotel is in an excellent location, the rooms and the lobby are very nice. My only complaint (and it is relatively minor one) is that I had to wait in line for about 15 minutes to check in. There should be more staff on a Friday night IMO. Would recommend and stay again!

If you are driving, just getting here is a chore. the lobby is really nice, but long lines and crowds at check in. and don't even try to check in early! the room was nice and clean, not too small, but very noisy at night from the street. parking overnight is insane, but i guess you expect that for the area. It doesn't have nearly enough elevators and only a few people can fit, which can make for a long wait to get in and out of your room. The location is excellent for the midtown manhattan area. it is surrounded by great diners and a block from central park.

We recently spent several days at Park Central. They know us from many stays over the years. Check in is quick and the rooms are generally larger than most rooms in NYC. Great central location for food and Times Square. When prices are good will always stay here. Enjoy!

My boyfriend and I stayed here right before Christmas and before our family cruise that was leaving out of New Jersey so that we could see the city a bit. The location of this hotel is fantastic!! It is close (literally like 3 blocks North) to Times Square but without the hubbub and noise. It's also walking distance to just about all the tourist spots in the city (with the exception of Lower Manhattan). Proximity to the subway (to reach Brooklyn and lower Manhattan) was also fantastic. We had no problem getting around.We had stayed in a different NYC chain hotel on a previous trip and this hotel far exceeded my expectations.Our room was large. Like, not "large for NYC," but actually large. There was a sitting area by the window that had plenty of room for both of us and all our copious luggage. We had a full closet and a bathroom with more than enough space for both of us.Our view was alright. We didn't pay for a view upgrade and I was still satisfied with the view we had outside our window. We were facing Carnegie Hall.Everything was very clean and we appreciated all the space. I was not expecting our room to be so lavish for the price we paid. The sheets and pillows were modern and cozy.My only complaint is that the elevators are slow and small. I don't believe we waited for too long to catch an elevator but if I had any complaints at all it would be the elevators. Pretty minor if you ask me. I would definitely stay here again and have been recommending this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

First time staying here at this hotel a dozen blocks uptown from Time Square. Nice location close to midtown as well as central park, which is just a couple of blocks away. Easy access to subway and also cabs,Uber etc due to 7th avenue location. Premier corner room with two queens was tight but not unexpected for NYC hotels in this price range. Beds were comfortable. Everything was clean and hotel staff was very accommodating. Our bathroom had a mildew smell on arrival, but when we mentioned to Guest Services, it was thoroughly cleaned and the problem was solved.Nice lounge area behind check in area. Coffee & grab-n-go items at the market area are good yet expensive, but there are plenty of options nearby. Great diner across the street - we ate breakfast there every morning.Overall we would give this 4.5 stars as this is a great value in the midtown area, and we would definitely stay here again!

We stayed 2 nights at this hotel and it was perfect. We were ushered in by the doorman, early check-in was granted and was a breeze (Emmanuel even gave us tips on the best hotdog and pizza). The rooms were clean, bathrooms as well. They are on the small side but who spends time in the room in NYC anyway. Beds were very comfortable. Elevators were quick! I would definitely book here again.

We booked a corner room for a family trip. We have two children (10 and 9). We were able to easily walk to shopping, Central Park, Broadway and Times Square. Steps away from the Subway.The room is eerily quiet for NYC. The people next to us were playing their music quite loudly but when we entered the room we couldn't hear them at all. Con: There were only 2 working elevators that were very slow. There was additional elevator banks so I am not sure if there was maintenance.

I spent one night at the Park Central Hotel I found the location to be ideal. It is close to the E train. Our room was wonderful...completely updated. I would recommend staying here during a visit to NYC!

Stayed here with a friend for 5 nights celebrating her birthday in New York. Check in was fast and straight forward. Room was at the back of the hotel and although we had no view it was nice and quite and clean. Hotel is in a great location for exploring. All staff from reception to house keeping are polite and helpful. Nice bar area that we used every night, really friendly barman. We would stay here again if ever in New York.

This was easily the worst New York hotel experience I have ever had. Poor management. Terribly understaffed. Long line-ups for everything. Checking luggage , waiting for the rooms to be ready (4 pm check-in). On check-out Day we had Taps on the door to get the room cleaned from 9:30 am onwards. The one good kiosk is overpriced and closes over night. No bottles of water in the room. Very unhappy staff. I don't blame them.Do not go to this hotel! You will regret it.

Stayed here 12-17 June. Upon reading some of the previous reviews I did wonder if I was in the same hotel! I found it clean with helpful staff when needed, saying that we did only use the hotel as a base as we were out from late morning to evening doing things all over this amazing city. One downfall we did encounter was the darkness of the rooms, especially the lack of light in the closet space, I had to use the torch button on my mobile phone to see which numbers I was pressing on the safe! We had a room on the 18th floor at the rear, away from the street noise which was ideal. We did ask for the use of a coffee machine on our second day, which duly arrived ten minutes later with a supply of coffee, which wasn't too bad either. We purchased our breakfast from the coffee and snack bar in the lobby most mornings, ideal for a very tasty muffin, fruit and coffee before heading out to do battle on the busy streets, not cheap though, about twice as much for the same at the Starbucks two doors down the avenue, but a much nicer place than the cramped Starbucks if you ate it in the lounge area!We only used the bar once, let's just say it wasn't the cheapest two beers we had in the city, but you're in New York, so it was no surprise to be honest.The luggage storage facility in the lobby on our last day was a godsend as we weren't flying till 10pm, so we were able to check out then go out for the day and come back to use the toilets and change before being picked up by our shuttle driver at 5.30pm, beware..the shuttle drivers we had came from the loony school of driving!Overall, I'd happily come back here, ideally located for all the midtown sights, a five minute stroll up to Central Park, a ten minute walk across to Fifth Avenue and another ten minutes walk down to Times Square. Staff were always amiable whenever we spoke to them, the staff on the 18th always said a friendly good morning as we headed out every morning.

Small rooms, comfortable beds. Good location. Lobby very crowded. Our tiny room cost about $300 with all the taxes. Room was clean. Bathroom has poor lighting. Checking in was slow. I wouldn't avoid it, but I wouldn't seek it out again.

I went here for a work trip and have to say I'm glad I didn't pay for it. The hotel looks very nice when first walking in, but...-There was a light flickering in the bar area-The shower pressure is incredibly weak and the bath takes over half an hour to get just half full- The door handles weren't put on straight on some of the doors- It is SOOOOO noisy at night. I had to buy earplugsIt's just not a place I would want to stay at again.

Our tour guide Dan was super awesome! He was very knowledgeable and told us great places to visit while in New York City. This tour is a must. A great way to really see Central Park and get some exercise

I decided to take a spontaneous trip to the city with my wife and kids. We booked our stay at the park central hotel and it was perfect! The room was clean, the location was perfect! Few minute walk to Central Park and time square. My kids had a blast in the hotel. It was overall great!

The rooms were clean. The beds were wonderfully comfortable. Plenty of pillows and towels. Housekeeping and the bellhop were all friendly and helpful. Even the desk clerk was friendly. That being said, the rooms were rather small. There was no refrigerator or supplies for making coffee. I feel like those are basic amenities, and should always be included in any room rental, especially for the amount I paid for the room.

The hotel was good and the (free drinks and buffet) was most welcome but if you have prepaid your bill just before you check out they hit you with a facilities fee of $36 per night. This is for the use of the gym, phone service and wi fi even if you don,t use them.won,t be using this hotel again so beware

We were pleased when they held our bags for us the days we checked in or out. Unfortunately we realized when we got our room that they hadn't return one of our bags. When my husband went back to retrieve it, they argued with him about it. Finally convinced them to check and there it was. The three nights we stayed there were fully booked. The elevators were a nightmare: Absolutely unable to handle the volume of guests and too small to fit many peoplewith their bags. Not to mention that they only have two of their four elevators dedicated to their guests. Plus you have to use your key to get the elevator to work, which is an added aggravation. The room itself is small. It has two full beds and just enough room to walk around them but no more. There's no view. The window looks out on a central opening in the building, basically four brick walls with AC units. It's not a place you would want to spend any length of time. I haven't mentioned all the frustrations we experienced staying there. I do not recommend it and would never stay there again.

This is a case of buyer beware. I booked it and pre paid through Qantas hotels. Not super cheap and rated 4 stars. This is probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. At check in they present you with a form to sign that you will pay their compulsory facility fee. For use of their gym luggage storage and telephone. I didn't need any of these but inspire of my objections was just ignored. If I hadn't prepaid and just done a 24 hour flight I wouldn't have stayed. Then this hotel had NO food facility and lifts that don't work. It's a dormitory for unsuspecting tour groups and prepaid fools like me. Don't stay here.

Location is good, no doubt about it. I also appreciated that it was quiet. And that's about it.My room & bathroom were very small. I barely had 3-4' between the bed and the walls.If you want more details the TV remote did not work well, couldn't go up and down the channels and the image was grainy. I only had 2 bed lights so the room was quite dark. Shower curtain was too short by an inch or two so a lot of water went out despite all the my care.No room service, no restaurant so you'll have to eat outside all the time. Staff was quite friendly I must say and happy to help.All in all it seems a good choice for tourists and families. I was traveling for business so my experience/perspective was quite different.

This place has a great location but the hotel is just ok. The staff is not necessarily the friendliest or accommodating. The lobby is nicely decorated. Check in was stressful and long. The service was not to my liking so I actually switched to a different hotel the following night.

My only complaint is the cost to valet park overnight. $195 with no ins and outs for a 3 day stay is extreme. But the staff was really nice and the location is everything. The room was clean and housekeeping was great.

We booked 6 nights, but, we stayed only one night as we could not bare with the dirty room. Obviously, see dust all around the edge&corner plus the room had some nasty smell. No breakfast and wifi was so slow. Check out time was 11am, but, by 10.30, cleaning supervisor staffs knocked on the door 3 times, urged us to be out of the room, not a very nice polite service.

For years we stayed at this hotel and once again a great stay !!!Very well located, near the central park and next to the subway..Once again we were very well attended by Mrs Elizabeth Cacovic,very helpful and kind.A pleasant stay in NY!!!!

Our room had been updated in the recent past and was kept clean by the staff. We only slept there so we did not need a super size room. The concierge lady helped us with the New York City pass and is real money saver. Plus the location was perfect for us as we could walk to Central Park, Times Square, and the theater where we saw Ground Hog Day, a very entertaining play. The double decker bus stop and the subway are nearby. You will not be disappointed with this hotel.

Housekeeping staff was excellent. Took care of everything I requested and very pleasant. Bell captain arranged for valet parking of the car in the offsite parking garage and he was a professional!Really knew his business

So many good things - good price with 30% off - great staff - beautifully redecorated room - free good WiFi - SUPERB location.Distinguished Concerts International New York chose the ballroom for the reheasrsals for their concert at Geffen Hall Lincoln Centre on June 4. As a result, I chose to stay in the rehearsal hotel. It was an excellent choice!

i was part of the planning committee for our 30th high school reunion and some of us stayed at the hotel. Drew who was our point person, was very accommodating and helpful. The hotel itself was gorgeous. Bed was comfortable. Decently sized, guest services helpful. Bigelow bath and body products! a small market downstairs.  it was near a subway. close to central park, Times Square, Hell's Kitchen which has so many restaurants and Columbus Circle. We had a great time at the hotel.

We had stayed here once before 7 years ago and were hoping the value and freshness was still the same. We weren't disappointed. Even though the website was higher, our corporate travel agency (Travel Discounters in MD) had a cheaper rate by $56 for the same night. The decor was very nice for an older property and updated modern rooms. For an extra $1 per person you can include juice or coffee, a muffin or croussant, and a fruit. Very comfortable beds and we stayed away from elevators to avoid any noises. There was a safe in room, but no refrigerator. Available on request for a bit extra. Walking distance to Times Square is 14 blocks, which takes literally 15 minutes. You are 6 minute walk to Central Park and 1 block from subway. I would definitely stay here again.

Great central location. Great views from the room. Comfortable beds. Short walk to Times Square, the Empire State Building and right opposite Carnegie Hall. The cocktails are a must! Friendly, attentive staff.

Step out of hotel and turn right you hit Times Square- step out of hotel and turn left you hit Central Park.....all midtown landmarks- st Patrick's cathedral, Rockefeller center, trump tower, the plaza, broadway and on and on are short walks- the bartenders were great but no restaurant in hotel which would've been nice. Only complaints: the concierge was not helpful at all she was bothered by us asking simple questions and elevator slow and room hot bc sensor turn air off when not in room so have to wait for room to cool when return from outing. Other than that very friendly staff and at check-in the young man was nice enough to give party of 4 free drink vouchers at the bar bc of birthday

The Park Central is one of NY classic hotels, and has ben remodeled recently to my surprise.The location es perfect, right in front of Carnegie Hall and a block away from the subway.The rooms are big, clean and comfortable.free wi fi is included, and you also have some imacs in the business center if you need to print something.you don't have any minibar in the rooms though.

We only spend one night at the Hotel, but we are in Love with it!We arrived at night, so we didnt have a view. When we woke up, we thought that we are dreaming. The room was on the 42. Floor and we were able to see the whole central park (look at the picture)We would love to come back there!

Very big hotel in excellent position. Can go on foot to Central Park in a few minutes. Rooms have been updated and are comfortable and affordable. Not tried the breakfast. Broadway theatres are just a few blocks away.

Got this at a deal on Hotels Tonight, but neglected to notice the $31 "facilities fee." This practice is similar to the Park Lane, but with theirs you get free pre- show appetizers and drinks in a lovely room overlooking Central Park.So this fee pays for the "free" wifi. Check-in was pleasant and quick -- was told I would have a "double" bed, and have learned to ask for a queen, which was easily accommodated. Bottom line, ask for what you want. We have a view of the air- conditioning hardware and brick interior of buildings. I'm sure if you asked for a city view, you could get one.This hotel is very convenient-- we are going to Jazz at Lincoln Center, near Central Park. Only about 2 blocks from the park, 8 short blocks to Times Square and the Broadway shows. In the lobby there's a spot to get coffee and baked goods in the morning, but I am biased--really hate no coffee maker in the room! Wifi and a nice open work area off the lobby looks convenient if you are here for work. Beds are comfy. Bathroom is new and up--to-date. Nice shower. Beautiful art in the room, too.

We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. It was clean and the room we had (571) was good enough for our needs and overall the bar was fine for the times we used it. The staff , particularly Nancy were very professional and helpful with any questions we had during the stay. It is in a great location close to Central Park , The Rockefeller center and has the subway station on the corner, although it is within walking distance to Times Square and Broadway. The Hotel has no restaurant but there are plenty of places around for meals - Names and Faces and the Park Diner being very good.We were billed for the "facilities fee" that is charged for using things like the phone service, wifi and the gym, whether we used them or not. We were aware of this at the time of booking but a communication problem with our travel agent meant we were a little confused when presented with the bill at the end of our stay.Overall the stay there was perfect for what we were looking for , central to the attractions and having a good variety of places to eat and drink nearby. We would stay here again ..

We stayed for the 8th time at park central and really never disappoints, my go to hotel when staying New York. The location and accessibility to everything whether it is shopping, sightseeing m, broadway or otherwise.

There was a bit of a wait at check in and we had 4 people staying and only 3 sets of towels, but those are my only complaints. Lovely hotel, great location and friendly staff. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Outstanding hotel!! The staff was kind, and professional. The Concierge (all of them) were very specific and knowledgeable. The location is perfect most everything is quite easy to find. Be advised: This is quite a hotel!!!! Jesse M

I stayed here with my family for 2 nights to explore Manhattan. Not only is the location perfect - close to so many of the best things NY has to offer, but the staff were so friendly and courteous. Elisabeth on the client service desk provided such a warm and friendly welcome and was always available to assist with our needs during our stay. Her amazing focus on customer service made our stay so pleasant and we will certainly be recommending this hotel to our friends! Thank you Elisabeth!

We have stayed here before and liked not only the location, but also were impressed by the nice rooms and decent size, given the typical small NYC hotel room. Was pleased to get an interior looking room (who needs a view unless you are spending a lot of time in your room). The interior room gives you a quiet respite from the street noise that you get with an exterior view. Didn't hear one siren or horn the whole time we stayed there (2 nights). The hotel concierge was very helpful and check-in was easy. Liked the fact it is close to the E train to JFK airport and other subways as well as the 57th Street cross-town bus. Times Square is just blocks away. Plenty of food options all around.

We arrived and were told that out rooms (2 couples) booked via Travelbag had been cancelled!! Quite a shock which we've still not got to the bottom of. We had two rooms allocated to us within 20 minutes that were fine. Good size - not like some of the apparently pokey little rooms that some New York hotels offer. It was pretty clean although some more attention was needed as dust was visible such as at skirting/carper junctions. Tthe rooms we had (17th floor) looked onto an enclosed space so we were clear of the NYC traffic and other noise. Not the best view but it really didn't matter as we were not in the Big Apple to spend time in the rooms to look at the view!!Bar prices were ok given that it was NYC and we had a good deal on the coffee/cake shop in the foyer.The hotel is well located for Mid-town attractions and Central Park, Diamond district etc.Would we stay there again? Yes, no problem but I would want to check my room availability a day or so before we traveled. The room issue was probably not the hotel's fault but more down to the agents involved.

My girls and I wanted a convenient location to Times Square and also a good place to walk around. The room was wonderful! The staff greeted us with such courtesy. We were able to place our bags with the concierge until our room was ready. We walked to the deli near by. Times Square is about 10 minute walk.

My daughter, husband and I stayed at your wonderful hotel four days when we came to watch the HS kids play at Carnegie Hall. It was a special treat for me celebrating a milestone birthday. I had wanted a great city view. Although our original room view was good, my daughter talked with management and we were able to move to a corner room with a magnificent view. The rooms were clean, nicely decorated and the beds were a cloud. Close to EVERYTHING. Hope I can stay here my next trip to NYC!!

Wonderful hotel. Large room with separate seating area, spotlessly clean, great helpful staff throughout the hotel. What a pleasure to return to this hotel. Good position near Central Park, Lincoln Centre, Times Square. There aren't enough words to praise this hotel.

Park Central exceeded our expectations for a 1920's property in Manhattan. The hotel was fresh and the finishes were new from the lobby to our room and it is evident that a great deal of attention has been paid to detail. The staff was very friendly and genuinely interested in our well-being. Shortly before our stay, the hotel offered and, although I was reluctant, we purchased a higher-floor view upgrade. Management came through with a 17th floor view of the crystal ball in Times Square! Our corner room had two very comfortable queen beds and the bath was new, fresh and roomy. Our party included mom, dad and our two late-teen aged girls. We had plenty of room and didn't get in each other's way. We slept well and easily through the city sounds. There's no restaurant but there is a huge, fully-tended bar and a little take-out breakfast nook. But Park Central is within easy walking distance from restaurants, delis, tours, shopping, Central Park and other attractions.

Just spent 4 nights at this hotel while using a Groupon. Fantastic deal. When I checked in they told me they had no more King rooms available, which is what I booked. The lady at check in said she'd upgrade me to a better room, and comp the $31 resort daily fee for internet/gym/etc. Fine by me. I was given room 426 (I think) and when I got there the A/C wasn't working despite being set to 67 degrees. It was hot. The room also had one window that faced the interior brick corridor, and the bathroom was the size of an airplane toilet. Seriously, if you stood in the shower you would bump into the walls. I asked for another room and was promptly given 1628. Same interior corridor view, but the bath was 3x the size and most importantly - the A/C worked great. Had small issue where the sliding "barn" door to the closet was only hanging on with one wheel (the other was in the closet on the safe) and also the conditioner pump in the bath was not working. I called maintenance and they fixed the door while I was at work, and left me 3 bottles (shower gel, shampoo, conditioner) for the bath. I didn't need all that, just wanted the broken pump replaced on the conditioner, but ok. Minor complaint... no small fridge in the room. I just kept filling up my teeny-tiny ice bucket for water/soda. Also couldn't connect to internet for some reason. Kept saying room # wasn't correct, despite double checking with front desk that my room 1628 was the one listed. They connected me to their IT people off-site and they ended up linking my IP address so I would automatically sign in without even having to log in. Bed was very comfortable. Room was pretty much 2x the size I'm used to in NYC. Loved it. 15 min walk to Times Square/Broadway shows. Easily accessible to subway, cabs were always right outside too, even in rush hour. Clean rooms. Big flat panel TV, shower/bath has 3 large pumps of shampoo/conditioner/body wash. The only tiny bottle is the body lotion. Elevators were fast in comparison to other hotels in the area. There's also an adorable cafe kiosk in the lobby, as well as an Apple station where you can print boarding passes and such. 15 min free. Employees were all a joy to interact with. I'll definitely try to return here as I'm in NYC a few times a year on business.

We stayed at The Park Central for 4 nights. The location is quite good with close accessibility to Times Square, Central park etc. Nice places to hang out too just around the block. The food at the place was delightful. We had a great time.

THis is a nice hotel with a good work out room and reasonably friendly staff. No problems. Well located. Not memorable. Eat breakfast nearby, skip the included grab and go continental breakfast. Room is reasonably sized and reasonably clean. Great for walking to Lincoln Center and Central Park.

Our room looked in to another room so needed to keep the blinds closed.Needed a cork screw to open a bottle of wine and we had to take it downstairs to the bar to get it opened. The beds were super comfortable.

Great location few minor things looked like a view of generators from my room on 9th floor could hear them as well not what I expected for price we paid if you opened bathroom door it nearly hits off tiolet bowl had to ask for bath towels when I arrived as only gave hand towels but was sorted quickly only other gripe I had was my swipe key wouldn't work after first nite I had to keep going down to reception only to be asked for my passport which I replied is in the safe and I can't get in my son was asleep in bed the hotel take a Copy of your passport when you arrive so they should be able to look at it on computer and look at you 3 times I had to do this staff were nice except for barman found him bit rude take away breakfast was great loved the muffins in the morn nice quiet hotel great location would stay again

Great hotel, perfect location. Easy to book and responded to all queries quickly. Recommend highly. Bar area very nice and also within easy walking distance of Times Square, many bars & restaurants and the Trains.

Good location, 2 blocks from Central Park and not far from from Times Square. Only minor thing I would say is the rooms aren't overly spacious (but it is New York) and the elevators are very small, but overall very good comfortable hotel. Check-in and Check-out process easy and fast.

Good location, friendly staff, clean and comfy room. Our only quibbles relate to the details. For instance the bathroom door couldn't be opened fully because it smacked into the toilet bowl, so you had to sorta sidle in to get in to use the shower. Also, the hotel offers upgrade to room on higher floor with views of midtown. We plunked down for the upgrade but the view was interior. Save the money on the upgrade. The way the hotel is positioned, no rooms would have sweeping vistas of the skyline.

We arrived at Park Central about noon and checked in (room avail at 4) ... informed of luggage storage and were quickly on our way to do "touristy things". Arrived back at 6:30 after seeing WTC and Radio City and Chelsea Market and walking the length of the Highline. Got our room from a very accommodating (pun intended) desk clerk. Room was 1st class. Nearby restaurants were plentiful and varied. 1st rate treatment throughout our stay

On April 07-04-2017 To The 9th I Was In New York For A Little Vacation I Was Invited On The 7th For A Pop Opero Sensual Concert Called Deja Vu With Michael Peer The Opera Singer WOW He Was Fantastic..!!! I was Vary well Served At The Hotel Park Central Hotel New York By Elizabeth Cavovic And Sanday Dixon Front Office Manager. Great Services...!!!!. my Room Was Great And super Clean Comfortable Bed.. WOW WOW Room Number 1824.Great Location...!!!! I Would Go Back Again. Thank You So Much. From Michael Ponari From Montreal L'oreal Canada Ambassadeur Armani / Prive.

It's a nice and clean hotel right in the Times Square and just 3 blocks from Central Park.The rooms are small but clean and well maintained.I was not happy after finding out that the rooms have no fridge !We stayed for 2 nights in a 2 double bed room.

This hotel exceeded all expectations., the staff are all very helpful and house keeping the best in a very long time .. my only criticism was the bar ., it was really comfy and welcoming ., that was until Nancy came on shift ., To be fair when we was spending a lot of money in the bar she was fairly friendly . As soon as we checked out and the reception staff very gracefully said it would be ok to wait in the bar area for our taxi .. (my daughter who is 5 months pregnant ) needed to be comfortable? Nancy was very rude totally un professional and didn't like the fact we weren't spending more money and made us feel most un welcome ., we had planned to return in August as we are attending a family wedding near by (there is 16 of us ) but feel that this treatment has put us off .. Nancy is a very mature lady and maybe the job is a little too much for a lady of her years .. the rest of the bar staff were more than helpful .,

When you check into this hotel forget onw thing : SERVICE. The room smell terribly die to the stinky carpet.I asked to change the room and been waiting 45 minutes for luggage pick up. I've decided to go by myself carring back the luggage after a tiring international flight Worst 4?stars in Manhattan and wort experience for me ever

Main advantage of this hotel is its location to Central Park and Times Square. Also there are some subway stations nearby and a good choice of restaurants. When you consider to book this hotel take in account that there is quite a lot of noise from the 7th Avenue during all day and night. Overall the service was basic. I booked this hotel via TravelZoo and is was a good deal and value for money.

No breakfast restaurant no minibar assistance at reception null. Room key locker not working took one hour to break it and another hour to have another room assigned. First and last time nere. People working here seems to make you a favour to attend customer

Really pleased with this hotel. It was clean, room was spacious, lovely bar and staff were very helpful. Great location close to Central Park and short walk to Times Square and Broadway. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

The location can't be beat -- two blocks uptown to Central Park, head downtown to the theatre dictrict -- easy walk. Our room was clean and comfortable (that bed is amazing!) and the lobby a welcoming place to wait for others. All staff we interacted with were kind and helpful. For the location, this price could not be beat.

After we were dropped off by bus in lower Manhattan at 8:00 a.m. on a blustery, rainy Saturday, we arrived at the hotel much later that afternoon somewhat waterlogged and exhausted.Our check-in process was fast and our bags were kept in convenient baggage storage just across from the check-in desk. Everyone was super-friendly. We had read about the long lines for the elevators (yes, they are tiny) but we were able to hop on the second available elevator. We had also been told to expect tiny hotel rooms in New York. Not even close. The room was spacious, clean and inviting. The bed was fantastic. My eighteen-year old daughter changed straight into dry clothes and was asleep within five minutes of stretching out on the bed. With the nor'easter raging outside, we were perfectly happy to get take out and remain in the room until the next day. The next morning, which was beautiful, we took an easy walk over to Central Park and then did some additional sight-seeing before check-out at noon. Everthing we wanted to do was within convenient walking distance. We would definitely stay here again.

Stayed at Park Central for a week visit to NYC. Perfect location for walking and using the subway to get around to all the sights. staff was friendly and helpful. Doorman Carmello was a kick ! Room was as expected. Close to quick meals or dining. Would stay there again.

I've lived in NYC for 20 years and have had family/friends stay at many different hotels all around Manhattan. I was recently impressed by the quality of the experience at park central on 7th Ave btw 55-56 streets, particularly the large size of the rooms. NYC hotels are notoriously tiny (lobby, bar, rooms, bathrooms) especially for visitors who are used to larger room sizes. The rooms at park central (at least on the 10th floor) were generously sized, modernly furnished, and very comfortable. The lobby and bar were also spacious with lots of room to spread out. Location is excellent- close to Central Park, Times Square, rock center, and many other key attractions. While it is not really that cool or trendy, I would definitely recommend it as a very comfortable, reliable, and good go-to hotel for a midtown stay in the big apple.

The hotel was fine - the room was large and had a nice writing/work area, The bathroom was very clean. But the bed! Oh the bed! It was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. It was unbelievably comfortable. There is also a small coffee shop in the lobby, and a Starbucks next to the hotel if you want coffee or tea. The hotel is one block away from 57th Street with easy access to public transportation. There are many eateries nearby, so getting a meal is easy. Molyvos, an upscale Greek restaurant, is across the street and it is excellent.

I and 12 adults, 100 students, and about 70 additional families stayed at Park Central in February over a long weekend (4 nights). The hotel was great. Location perfect. But being charged $200 for bellman gratuity was over the top. The bellman offered to help us with bringing pizzas for 100 kids (admittedly a lot!) to one of our rooms. We declined as there were plenty of us to carry them. The bellman insisted. We finally said ok, never suspecting we would be charged a "gratuity". My colleague tipped him to boot. They tried to pass a $200 "handling" charge from room to room. I disputed the charge with guest services. I found out the outcome when I received my credit card statement. ARGH. When our business office requested the folio the charge was listed as 'bellman gratuity'. That's not my idea of a gratuity!! Since then I've contacted the hotel and the ONLY response is to complete a form to have another credit card charged. I find this extremely unethical. Yes, I agree to pay hotel charges, but 1. There was no indication we would be charged for the bellman's offer of assistance. 2. When I disputed the charges their only response was to charge my credit card without notifying me. 3. The hotel has been unwilling to have a conversation. 4. Charging for a "gratuity" (their words, not mine). A gratuity is a gift. 5. We gave them considerable business. I don't have the total numbers of adults and families that stayed at the hotel, but it was easily over 100 rooms. Some thanks. Never, ever, staying there again.

This is a lovely hotel steps from Columbus Circle, Carnegie Hall, Times Square. It's nice and centrally located. The rooms are clean, modern and spacious. The one kicker is that there is a facilities fee that is charged for using things like phone service, wifi/internet, the gym, etc whether you use them or not. It's clearly written in their terms but it just seems this should already be included in the hotel rate rather than an additional charge on top.

This hotel was AMAZING. Perfect location, beautiful reception and bar area, coffee/sandwich shop inside. Staff were friendly. Room was beautiful and spacious and modern and we had a great view down to Times Square (15th floor). Cleaner came every day and did a great job. Right next to Central Park. Lots of restaurants near by. It was just great. Highly recommend staying here on a trip to New York. Hotel also really good as we came for mums birthday and they gave us prosecco on arrival which was a lovely touch. Can't wait to visit New York again. Only complaint would be there is no fridge in the room or coffee facilities. This would make it 5 star as New York is pretty pricey.

4 nights , location is excellent without being too central. value for money. staff friendly enough - hotel is clean. I'd stay here again. didn't eat in the hotel so no idea if food is good value - too many choices on the doorstep. great trip all round

Some travelers don't think this place is in their price range, but that's not necessarily true. BUT it is in walking distance of many, many of Manhattan's most popular attractions such as Times Square, Broadway, Lincoln Center, Central Park, Carnegie Hall is a block away.You will save money on taxis and subway fare. You will save valuable time. You can walk out the door left or right and in 10 blocks, you're somewhere you want eat or seeing things you came to NYC to see.AND you can pay an extra dollar per person per day and get breakfast--a piece of fruit and muffin or croissant and tea or juice or coffee. This is great for when you want to get going to see the sites early. Don't worry if you're used to a big breakfast. There's also lots of food on the way to wherever you're off to. The hotel will hold your luggage until you're room is ready or when it's check out time but your flight isn't until later. Then you can make the most of your time in NYC.Nice lounge to wait or for a drink. Clean lobby, hallways and rooms. Pleasant staff. No problems. Would stay again.

Found hotel through TripAdvisor for a 6 day getaway to NYC. Very satisfied. Paid $195 per night (plus a $31 per night "Resort Fee" which was kind of announced at the end of our reservation process). Hotel, an older one built in 1927, was completely renovated about four years ago, is very sleek, modern, with good service.Great location (7th Ave and 56th Street), convenient to anything in NYC, and to Brooklyn and NJ.Hotel has a long and interesting history. Albert Anastasia was assassinated in their barber shop in 1957 (it was the Park Sheraton then). Jackie Gleason lived there when performing in NY. It also at times housed Mae West and Eleanor Roosevelt.Will definitely use again if price is right.

I visit NYC at least 2-3 times a year, whether it be with my husband or a girl's weekend. I've been staying at the Park Central Hotel since 2001. They run specials on off times. The location is perfect. I feel safe coming back late at night and going to my room. It's close to the park, great restaurants, and of course, the theater. Emanuel checked us in the last 2 times. He is professional and very engaging. He has a great smile, very helpful and courteous. Lots of customer service has declined, but, Emanuel is what customer service in the hospitality industry is all about. He is an asset to this hotel. .   My only gripe with the hotel, is that the bar is not open in the late afternoon. The bar opens at 5:00 p.m. it should open at 3:00 or earlier, so guests can get a drink and socialize in the beautiful lobby that was just renovated. Before the renovation, the small bar to the right when entering the hotel was opened in the afternoon. Most of the hotels in this area, the lobby bar opens at 11:30 a.m.  That being said, all in all we had a great stay and I give this hotel five (5) stars. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to the Big Apple.

Location is excellent, right near Central Park, a block from the F train, close to Times Square without being too close, etc. I was upgraded to a suite, which was amazing and huge by Manhattan standards. Bathroom was EXCELLENT, it was seriously bigger than some entire rooms I've had in Manhatan. Great gym with a lot of free weights including a nice selection of kettlebells, even a few heavy ones, this is not something you usually see. Nice bar where I got a free (and delicious) cocktail. The whole place feels very classic, but updated. I would definitely stay here again.My only complaints are related to communication/organization. I had to email them a few days later to receive a .pdf of my receipt. I feel like in 2017 this is something hotels just do automatically. Also, when making my reservation I was promised a bunch of perks including a $10 Uber credit, no one has answered my inquiries on how I am supposed to receive this. Not really a huge deal to me, but I'd be very cautious of booking one of the packages that includes more expensive perks like parking or meal plans. There seems to be a disconnect between the add-ons customers are offered on the website and what one can actually obtain from hotel staff. You might end up paying for something you cannot collect.Minor communication issues aside, I think I have my new hotel for when I have business in midtown.

We stayed at the hotel for 2 days before continuing to Norway. All in all the hotel was not bad, but I do have one big issue. We payed for a higher floor upgrade, but our room faced a wall, so no view at all. Make sure you let future guests know in advance.

We stayed at Park Central for our honey moon. We really appreciate that our room was upgraded for the special occasion and the hotel offered two bottles of Champagne when we arrived in the room. It was very clean and the location is perfect for a stay in New York!

When we got to our room I noticed we didn't have enough soap or towels and no hair dryer.....I called and they said they would bring them up and we could go out in the meantime...when we got back I had all towels no washcloths or soap and three shower caps...so I called again and told them and again they said they would be sent up,,,and in about 15-20 minutes they were brought up to our room...We had a long narrow room which was ok but it only had one long mirror outside the bathroom so it made it hard for my daughter and I to get ready sharing just one long mirror...my husband had to use the one in the bathroom....But what really upset me is I booked the parking package which was 15.00 for the first night...I thought this sounded good as we were staying just overnight...We checked our bags and went out for the day...when we went to get our car they said we went over the 24 ours and would have the pay the full 65.00 for parking. We were about an hour or so over the 24 hr mark so I think it was a total rip-off the be charged the full price.., This was never explained to us...I could see pro rating the amount like other hotels we've stayed have done..but I thought the total amount was totally unfair...I talked to customer service but they weren't willing to do anything even after I explained no one mentioned this at check-in...There are so many nicer hotels to stay at while in New York and after this incident I'll make sure we do.

This hotel was in good location, very clean and rooms very good maybe a little small but beds were very comfortable...did not use gym or restaurant in hotel. I would recommend this hotel it is near subway, and restaurants for any meal.

72 degrees. SEVENTY TWO DEGREES. Heat sensitive? Don't stay here. You have zero control over the thermostat. I didn't want to wake my family up by calling maintenance in the middle of the night. So I suffered. And now I'm miserable. Worst hotel stay ever. Also, there are no perks to this hotel. Not even a refrigerator.

We found this hotel a delight and will be glad to use it again. We were in NYC for a play and a quick overnight. I chose this hotel as I had reward points that could be used here and the location was ideal. It's right between Times Square, Broadway and Central Park. We found the rooms to be a decent size for NYC standards. The staff were helpful, especially Ana Pina with our check out. We knew about the facility fee as it had been clearly communicated. When we checked out, we told her how pleased we were and she waived the fee for us. A nice surprise after a nice stay. The rooms and bathroom were clean and updated. The bed was comfortable. Everything worked as it should. No complaints from us.

I have been staying at the Park Central Hotel off and on for the last two years while my daughter has been in college at Fordham University. As a patron with special needs I have always had the best of service. They are eager to help me with my mobility scooter. They always help me with my baggage and truthfully anything else I need help with ranging from getting a handicap accessible cab to accessing the subway system. The rooms are a little bit bigger by New York standards. This will not be my last day at the Park Central Hotel!

My sisters and I went to New York to celebrate the youngest's birthday. The hotel is situated not far from Central Park and Carnegie hall. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was lovely and the beds were very comfortable! I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.
user_location: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom

review_body: I stayed at Park Central for 9 nights on a recent business trip to NYC.The hotel is outstanding for a few reasons:- staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. In particular Elizabeth Cacovic, the Guest Relations Manager. Elizabeth helped to book my extra two nights at a great rate.- rooms are clean and well sized. Most comfortable bed and pillows!- business centre and lounge downstairs is awesome.- well-equipped gym on 3rd floor.- extremely good location - short 2 min walk to Central Park, 5th Ave, Times Square- subway station literally outside the hotel door.

This is central to everything. Rooms are a pretty decent size for NYC standard. The room and bed are comfortable. Great dining options around the hotel. You have the benefit of being in the center of things, but you don't have to deal with the noise like you do in many NYC hotel rooms.

I had not stayed at the Park Central Hotel New York since 2001. Last week I returned to a renovated, modern looking Park Central Hotel. The rooms are spacious. The beds are confortable and the room has all the amenities of a modern boutique hotel. The staff was accessible and very friendly. Getting around the city from the hotel is very easy since it is located in the heart of midtown Manhattan. Glad I was able to get reacquainted with an old friend.

My boyfriend and I regularly stay at the Park Central. We always book with them because we enjoy the friendliness of the staff, the room cleanliness and the perfect location!! Every stay has been great and they keep getting better! This recent trip we had a minor setback with our room not being ready by check in time. We received vouchers for free drinks to pass time until our room was ready. After two hours of waiting and our room still not being ready Sanday, (who I believe is a manager), took the liberty of accommodating us and our needs. This was our first time coming across any type of inconvenience, but that still does not change that we will continue to stay at the Park Central!

This is a large and very busy hotel in the heart of bustling NYC. The location is fantastic, just south of Central Park, only two or three blocks from Broadway theatres, right across the street from Carnegie Hall, walking distance to MOMA, and there are many restaurants and cafes close by. Our room was very nicely appointed and was a quiet oasis at the end of each day. Our King sized bed was very comfortable. Lighting was quite dim in the room and I would have appreciated the option to have brighter lighting at times. We did also have an issue with our A/C, but we called for service one morning and when we came back at the end of the day, it had been fixed. Ashley at the concierge desk was very helpful and the luggage storage service (which we used when we arrived before check-in time) was very well run. We can't comment on the bar or other facilities as we didn't make use of them.

Stayed at park for a weekend getaway with family. The hotel is in a perfect location right in between Times Square and Central Park. The hotel is clean but I wasn't too happy with sheets on the bed that were wrinkled like they had already been slept on. I don't even think they were fitted sheets. The rooms are good size but there is no refrigerator or even a pen or pad of paper to write on. I would recommend this hotel but I can't because of the extra fee per night. The price is great but then you get charged an extra 30 dollars a night for amenities that should be free. They say you are paying for free phone calls in your room but I think they forget everyone has a celllphone. Your also paying to have your bags stored if you need them before your room is ready and after check out. Other hotels that I have been to that is for free - lastly they say it also pays for the use of their computers to print - really? What would I need to print? Also, there are only two very small elevators to get everyone to their rooms so just give yourself extra time during peek times to get places.

We stayed here for a long weekend to attend a wedding. First impressions were good , the lobby was nice and the lady on reception gave our group a drink voucher for the bar. Our room was very disappointing - dark and gloomy looking out at an office block. There was no coffee maker in the room.
