The toiletries were miserable 1 bar of soap & 1 bottle of body lotion - no shower cap - things I would expect in a hotel of this supped Cali restaurant. From the night we arrived there was a problem with the lock in our bedroom. We spent a ot of time getting the key reprogrammed . Eventually the day of the wedding the door jammed completely and when we got back that night , we were effectively locked out of the room. The hotel security and maintenance staff couldn't get it open . I had to ask for a new room at 2.00am in the morning . We were upgrade to a suite for the rest of that nighr and our next and last night but we didn't have our bags until about 9.30 am on Saturday morning. However, it should have been apparent to the staff on reception & the security and maintenance staff once we had to get the key reprogrammed three times within 10 minutes on the 2nd night of our stay that the problem was the lock. Instead , we were made feel that we were unable to understand how the key worked. It is a pity because the location of the hotel is perfect but in light of our experiences I'm not sure whether I'd stay there again .

Although I only stayed for one night which was unbelievable! I would stay a hundreds nights. It's a jewel in the city and I cannot express how much I was wrapped in luxury and style. Huge soft bed, beautiful bathroom, great tv and channels like...it left me speechless and kept me sound a sleep. Look forward to going back real real soon.

I stayed at this facility in June 1971 back when it was The Park Sheraton Hotel. The mix of the modernization of the now Central Park Hotel and the legacy surrounding it makes this a great value for anyone visiting NYC, be it business or pleasure. Walking distance to anything Midtown (Central Park, Columbus Circle, 5th Ave, Times Square, etc.) plus easy Subway transportation south in Manhattan to reach Lower East, SoHo, etc.is just outside the front door. Well done rooms, great lounge, clean and with a friendly staff. A must stay!

We stayed @ the Park Central Hotel based on the rec of friends who had stayed on a previous trip. It's a large, older hotel, but one can tell that it has been thoughtfully updated & remodeled. We stayed 4-nites on the 11th floor, & then due to a flight cancellation after ✔️-out, stayed one more nite in the 10th floor. The rooms are modern & clean, the beds were fairly comfortable with plenty of pillows, soft sheets & duvet. The bathrooms were sparkling & well-lit with fluffy white towels (not too thick, not too thin...just right :) The shower heads were fun* with plenty of water pressure. (*a shiny rectangular "rain-shower") Not being a morning-person, I totally appreciated having the extra ceiling light in the bath&shower area. That, + the shower head made for a happy-start to my day! The rooms also had PLENTY of outlets...We had 2-ipads, 2-cellphones, my personal hairdryer & flatiron, (along with the room-provided hair-dryer), etc. We were able to charge several devices @ the same time, while simultaneously using the hair-appliances. I didn't give 5-stars because there were a few minor annoyances. Even tho the rooms had been updated, the edges of the wall2wall carpeting was frayed, & didn't quite fit flush with the wall. (providing a visual of lint & dirt that conveniently fell into those open-spaces....not so cool) Also, the large "floating" mirror in one of our bathrooms probably needed 2b replaced....several chipped areas around the edges.. I lived all if the outlets, altho in one of the 2-rooms we stayed in, most of the outlets didn't work....(they ALL worked fine in the other room)Other than those small gripes, the location was perfectly placed between Tumes Sq, Central Park, the theatres, Rockefeller Ctr, and....a very big plus for me (as a sometimes solo female-traveler) several "very-close-2-the-Hotel" subway stations. One more thing: I cannot say ENOUGH good about the PCH-staff. Every single employee we interacted with was EXTREMELY friendly & more than helpful (luggage storage/front desk/room attendants/lobby bar/bell-men etc) We didn't have time2call re our small complaints, tho I believe if we had, the PCH would have made those issues better4us. In summary: moderately-priced, $250+/night/Standard K & standard dbl, nice clean rooms, & extremely well-trained & accommodating staff. If we were looking for a hotel in the same Midtown nghbrhd, we would have no problem choosing the Park Central Hotel again!

We did not have much time in the city and wanted to have a great location for easy walking to Times Square and Central Park. This hotel is perfect for that. The room was fine and the service good with an excellent price point. We would come back here if the opportunity arises.

I find the Park Central to be an outstanding hotel with courteous and professional staff. My 5th stay at the Park Central, and I will be booking again in June. Clean, modern rooms and a perfect location. I question the negative reviews, specifically the service fee. It is clearly stated and not unreasonable at all. As for the elevators, this is a landmark building with a rich history. Appreciate it.I highly recommend the Park Central for both value and location.

I was very disappointed in this "4 Star" hotel. I was told by several friends that the concierge would happily assist with getting tickets to shows or tours, so after checking in, we went to speak with her. The only thing she was willing or able to assist with was selling us a NY Pass and sending us to an obscure place to purchase "left over" cheap Broadway show tickets. After getting up to the room and pulling back the sheets to the bed, we were shocked to see stains on the bed sheets! The first phone call to housekeeping said it would take 45 minutes to change them. I then called the front desk and told them this was unacceptable and I wanted it done now. After an hour the sheets where still not changed and I asked to speak with a manager and was denied because they were in the process of taking care of my problem and doing their best. The next day I noticed something gross on the inside of the shower curtain and asked for that to be changed as well...3 days later, it was changed for a shower curtain that wasn't long enough and it barely grazed the top of the bath tub allowing water to fall into the floor when you showered. Again I was denied when asking to speak with a manager. When I booked the room and a phone call made the day before our arrival, I notified them that our anniversary was at the end of the week and I wanted something special in our room to surprise my husband. I was assured they would "take care of it". As you can guess by now, there was NOTHING special...AT ALL! The LEAST they could have done was to leave some mints on the pillow with a special note like "Happy Anniversary!"...Again, disappointed.This hotel is not worth the money they charge. There are too many hotels in the city to waste time with this "4 Star" hotel that only deserves 2 stars at best.Good things about this hotel are that it's close to Times Square, Central Park and the Subway and it's a place to lay your head at night. The elevators are slow and small, barely room to get your luggage on. Do NOT recommend.

Great location and unusually large rooms for NYC at affordable rates. Easy to walk to great restaurants, the park, and top retail. The concierge Diana went out of her way to take care of me and it was much appreciated.

Pros:* walking distance to many places including Times Square, Central Park, many restaurants, and Broadway theaters* friendly staffCons:* Long wait to check in. Only one person was working the front desk* hotel has old creaky elevators which took a long time to move* hotel bar closed earlier than what we are used to, even on the weekends* took a while to get fresh towels when we called the front deskOverall our stay was fine since we mainly used the room fro sleeping. The room was slightly smaller than we expected especially for 3 people but the location is great since we were able to walk to many places.

Good location, service is poor. Expected more for a $400/night hotel. Beds are comfortable and clean. Interiors are new. Wifi internet is good and fast. BUT Many additional hidden charges. No answer when calling Concierge and front desk. The card reader inside the elevator are hard to use and so are the buttons for the floors. Not easy to operate and an inconvenience when you are holding a lot of things going up to your room.

This hotel is in perfect location for everything around Times Square/Central Park. The rooms are good for the price point, the fitness center good and the hotel bar quite nice with great bar staff. However, there are 2 small, older elevators servicing each side of the hotel. 2 elevators is completely inadequate. I think that the morning I was coming in and out, only one elevator was working. There were people waiting on every floor. My suggestion - hop in an elevator going up and take the slow ride down. Once you get to the street level, you'll be starting from a great location

Great location but with many negative issues. The elevators are small, insufficient in number for the size of the hotel and long waits are the norm. Coffee makers are not in the room but can be requested from room service. They do not automatically replenish the coffee packs so another call to room service is needed. The additional $30 plus "facility fee" is a ripoff. It allows you to use the internet, use a small workout facility and check luggage: all free services at a Motel 6. And don't expect a lot of happy faces from the employees. Clearly the hotel manager is trying to maximize profit at the expense of the guests.

One of the best locations in the city. Close to everything and it's conveniently next to all the hot spots people want to access when in the city. I would have given the hotel 5 stars, but the first room I was offered was way too small to house the king sized bed there (I wacked my shin on the bureau knob due to lack of walking space between the bed and bureau) and it appeared a little dirty. When I went back to the front desk, the person there put me in an upgraded room without any hassles; it was a very nice room and it appeared cleaner. I plan to stay here again and would recommend it to others.

First the good things: an excellent position, very close to Central Park, lots of restaurants in the area, convenient for the subway, and easy to find a taxi when you need one; and within walking distance of Broadway, Times Square, the Lincoln Center and the Rockefeller Plaza.In our room, the beds were very comfortable and the shower worked well.BUT - the room itself overlooked the well, and had almost no natural light. To make matters worse, the room lighting was inadequate - a floor standing lamp in one corner and a single bedside light between the two beds. Reading in bed was difficult. There was only a single mirror, in the bathroom, with no real facilities for things like make-up etc. There was only one chair.The level of service was patchy; the room staff were generally very friendly and helpful; the reception staff were efficient if not exactly effusive; the staff at the concierge desk varied from brusque to barely polite (my only questions to them were purely factual and I got the answers I needed, but I wouldn't have liked to enter into a discussion about where to go or what to see).Then there is the "facility fee" - at $31 plus tax per night this was extortionate; for us, all it covered was WiFi and luggage storage on our last day, both of which in my view should be free (at least for basic WiFi, which is all I used). On balance - if/when we go back to New York, we won't be staying here again. I'm sure that there must be better hotels at a similar price.

Excellent room with fantastic Manhattan view!!!The receptionist was very kind and helpful . He made me feel very welcomed !!!The luggage man at my departure was not so kind! I had to carry my bags to the exit !But thanks to my first impression of the staff and the nice room i had ,it made all the difference!! Thank you !!

This marks the second time I've experienced indifferent/rude service after booking a hotel with Hotel Tonight. I've booked through other and similar sites but have never been treated like a second class citizen, or worse, like I was here.The hotel room was so-so, with rather cheap bathroom fixtures. The lobby was nice.

I dont like to write bad reviews, prefer the positive ones but last night i was so disappointed I checked out this morning - I was meant to stay 5 nights.It began with a 20 flight from NZ arriving in New York expecting a transfer organised by the hotel, it didnt arrive. Arriving at the hotel at 1am, reception was very luke warm from the staff. No welcome, how was your flight, where have you travelled from but thats minor. They mentioned that there is no restaurant and the lounge was closed but failed to mention that the rooms dont have any amenities, even water! When I went down to ask about an adaptor, they said they had none but it is a short block to the DR 24hr drug store nearby - so I walked there at 1.30 in the morning to get water etc. The rooms at first glance are nice but on closer inspection dingy, dirty and there are stains everywhere....shower hopeless, only 4 coat hangers. As I write this my comments seema little trivial but I travel a lot as we all do and I just know, this wasnt 4star. When I told them I was checking out early this morning, there were no questions at all. I was just given my bill and the staff went back to chatting to each other. I guess in a busy city, a hotel like this keeps getting new patrons and they dont really have to rely on service or customer experience.

Listen, this is a large NYC Hotel, right near the heartbeat of the city. The rooms are small, but they are clean. I was surprised by how quiet it was, but I had an inside room (which means no view, but who cares). This is all about the location, cleanliness, recently renovated, and large - and those are hard to come by when you then factor in the prices that were crazy low for NYC. Spend a little money here, because you get what you need, then spend all the rest of your money doing tours or eating out, because that will be money well spent!!

The hotel is centrally located, once block south of Carnegie Hall. It is a busy hotel, with waits for the elevator at times, and sometimes a long checkin line. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and well decorated, but a little dark. I was on the 8th floor, and even though I had a good window, I received little natural light as I looked at a blank wall. This hotel does not have views of Central Park, and is not that close to Central Park. The price was very good.

I stayed here with 5 friends for a girls' weekend to celebrate a milestone birthday, the weekend of April 21-23, 2017.The hotel is well-situated, close to Times Square and many interesting NYC attractions. Our room was adequate, with comfortable beds, and adequate storage and closet space for 2 people. The 1$ continental breakfast consisting of a choice of beverage (water, juice, or coffee), fresh fruit (banana, orange, or apple), and a muffin or pastry, was adequate for getting us started for the day, before we headed off for a substantial brunch later in the morning.I really appreciated having access to the hotel gym, which was well-outfitted with treadmills, free weights, and other cardio equipment.Front desk staff member Elsa was extremely friendly, and gracious. When she heard we were in town to celebrate our milestone birthdays, she gave us complimentary vouchers for a free drink in the hotel lounge. Another male staff member was very helpful whenever we needed help hailing taxi rides. He stepped out into the street -- in the rain, no less!-- to flag taxis down for our party of 6. Very kind of him!The lounge is a very beautiful, inviting space, with ample hard and soft seating. Very nice area to hang out.The price was reasonable for a hotel in NYC that is so conveniently located!I would definitely stay here again on a return trip!A special shout-out to Elsa at the front desk, for the very warm reception we received when we checked in on Friday evening;-)

The hotel was great. If I have the opportunity to visit New York again, this is where I will stay. My room was quiet. The furnishings were beautiful. Rooms are narrow but you understand that in a city like this space is limited. Shower was wonderful. The elevator service offers added security.

Close to pretty much everywhere, an amazing location. Room size was adequate for a city like New York, but the service was great. Guest relations could not have been more accommodating. Also, the bar was just the right atmosphere to unwind.

We stayed here last year for one night and loved it so much we stayed again this time for two nights. Our experience was amazing again. We loved the location which is an easy walk to Central Park, Broadway shows, Time Square and lots of great restaurants. The room is a great size for a family visiting NYC and it was clean. We would definitely stay here again.

We were in New York to perform at Carnegie Hall. Thanks to the proximity of the hotel, rehearsal and sound check were very convenient. The room was clean and maintained well. Elevators were a problem; very slow and difficult to get during peak times. There was no sitting space in the room and only 1 chair so more than one guest would need to sit on the bed. There is no restaurant, which is fine since there are plenty of quality places nearby, however the "Grab and Go" breakfast is an option for a quick breakfast.

My family and I had a wonderful stay at the Park Central. This was our first trip to New York City. I was referred to the Park Central by a friend. We will like to extend our Gratitude to Ms. Alicia Nunez and Mr. Tony Cunaj who were extremely helpful in assuring we had a gracious stay. Our room was comfortable, spacious, nice, and clean. Our room overlooked Carnegie Hall. We like to mention, housekeepers who were very helpful and friendly. We recommend Park Central to Everyone who will be traveling to Beautiful New York City. . Sincerely, Carrie and Alejandro Morejon

A basic hotel. For the price, I was expecting a bit more. I've stayed in midtown several times, and played much less. I thought I was treating my family to a nicer place, but no, it was just a typical hotel room (nothing "premier" about it except the price).Add in the fact their advertised "free WiFi" actually costs $22 per day in a surprise "facilities fee," and I will never recommend this hotel to anyone. Too many other great hotels in the area.

Theatre, dinner, a run in Central Park, and a nice breakfast. All while staying one night at Park Central. An enjoyable hotel that is comfortable, quiet, clean, accommodating, and walkable. Great stay.

We booked this hotel on the hotel's website and chose the $50 Delta reward upon arrival. This is NOT a Delta voucher--when you activate it you can only use it if you book your flight through the specific "'agency" and an 1800 number. Starbucks reward was great, worked right away.Hotel is in a fantastic location and we had a specious room. People, this is NYC, no need to have water and coffee and fridge in your room! Great experience, they need to upgrade the heating system, though. Otherwise, excellent choice.

this is not 4 star hotel. there are no water, no coffee in the room also no frige the service girl are not nice and very rod. we book the hotel for one night and had two more night we need to do check out and check in from being i never see this kind of service the told me that i have to book from the website they cant do it from the service. the price not worth it

We had a great stay @ the Park Central hotel. Clean room and bathroom, perfectly situated between Time Square & Central Park, close to several Subway lines. The room and bathroom were small, but as we really only slept there, worked out perfectly!

It is a very nice hotel with spacious rooms, and very clean, close to everything, broadway and its theaters, central park, columbus circle, shopping, 5th avenue, etc. When I arrived at the hotel I was greeted very kindly and with a smile from Elizabeth Cacovic guest relations manager who treated me at all times cordially. I would recommend this hotel to all who come to visit this beautiful city

When we pulled up it was very busy inside the hotel and the lobby was filled and extremely loud due to a group who just played at Carnegie but that was understandable. The valet that spoke to us was not very friendly seemed because he was so busy. Waited at least 10 minutes to check in. Staff was not over friendly at all. The room was small clean but the air conditioning was not on (which we found out at check out) Our phone hand set did not work and neither did the alarm clock. The location was GREAT. Price was very reasonable , location great room was clean.

I recently stayed 1 night at Park Central Hotel, and overall I liked my stay. Our room was nice (we booked a room with 2 queen beds), and I'd say it's actually larger than your average NYC hotel room, which are typically quite small. Beds were really comfortable, and our room was very clean.The lobby was somewhat chaotic when we arrived late morning to store our luggage (apparently there were several busloads of tour groups waiting there), when we returned later in the afternoon to check in, and when we checked out the following morning. I will say they seemed to have all available front desk staff assisting with check-ins, but the line still snaked through the lobby. There was also a bit of a line to check luggage. I understand this can happen with a large quantity of guests checking in and out, but it might not be something guests will think to budget extra time for, so be aware you might wait a little.The hotel is just steps from the 57th St subway station (N, Q, R, W), which was very convenient.Park Central Hotel will be on my list of options when I return to NYC, not at the top of my list, but not a bad option.

The hotel is perfectly located in Manhattan. After arriving to NY we had a family decease, we requested a late check out to be able to accommodate my family with the funeral and burial services, we ask James, the Front Desk Manager a four hours late checkout on Monday April 17,2017. He totally refuse to accommodate us in anyway staying that the hotel was sold out. After few phone calls to reservations and customer care I ended speaking to James again. At this time he offered us a late checkout up to 7:00 PM for an extra fee charge. He didn't offer us the option of paying extra at the initial request, instead he lied to us claiming the hotel was sold out and there was nothing he can do. If you receive an offer like this one:High FloorEnjoy stunning city and skyline views of New York City.This offer can be awarded in conjunction with any of the premium rooms on this page, if selected.Do not accept it, the hotel is surrounded by buildings and even the front desk tell us there was no skyline view. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY.

This hotel has gone through major renovations over the past ten years. It is now a very comfortable clean and reasonably priced hotel in Manhattan. Directly across the street from Carnegie Hall and Red Eye Grill! This is a great hotel for large groups. Bravo! Customer service was right on! Appreciate the security and accommodating attitude.

I picked this hotel because of its location close to the subway and within walking distance of a number of other areas of interest, including central park. The lobby was beautiful but that's where it ended. Upon checking in they told me they had upgraded me. I ended up with two beds instead of the one King which was fine but the room was small for the beds and I found myself questioning if it really was an upgrade. The room was kept very clean and neat. I found the air conditioning unit, which was one of the old school unit, very loud and difficult to get the temperature right. The other disappointment for me was the lack of customer service. In general it felt more like a factory with a "get them in and get them out" sort of feeling. The only time I got some help was when I asked a bellman for a recommendation for a restaurant since the concierge desk was always too busy or not staffed. The bellman was very helpful and friendly. I also needed to store my luggage since I was unable to get my room for the hour and a half longer past checkout time that I needed. When I returned to get the luggage I ended up having to wait almost twenty minutes to retrieve it. All in all if you are looking for a good location but service and comforts are not as important this hotel is a good choice as it is clean and easily accessible.

The best thing about this hotel is the location. We had a great stay here tho it was a busy Easter weekend. The elevators were always crowded. There are only two that work for the Park Central guests. Looks like there are atleast 5 or 6 others that must go to the Manhattan Club or some other section. We like our room, it was clean, quiet and no bedbugs. The amenities in the room were very good, big TV, nice modern bathroom fixtures, safe in the closet. The maids were always working. All employees were friendly.

We stayed her for 9 nights. Overall the hotel is pretty average and this is reflected in the rooms - although I found them to be clean and presented nicely. The shop in reception is terrifically overpriced - so be aware. The staff make this hotel though - very helpful and when they found out we were here to get married they fell over themselves to give us free drinks and free chocolates. We were looked after well though, just don't expect luxury.

Good location and a nice looking place but the service SUCKS and it's an absolute rip off. Aside from the high prices they sneak in a $33.50/night "facility fee" in the small print AND then they ask you to leave gratuities. This was all after housekeeping failed to make the beds in our room and left us 2 towels for 4 people. When we asked why they staff told us it was because they didn't have enough towels to go around. They're also apparently running low on soap. All that in a place that charges more than $300 per night. First and last time here.

After an exhausting trip from Europe, the staff attempted aggressively to persuade us that we booked a room with a king size bed. Not true. They were arrogant, did not apologize and would not even discuss that matter until we showed them our voucher specifying that we booked a twin size bed. They claimed that they did not commit any mistake. Instead of finding a suitable solution, they ordered us to leave our room the very next day in order to give us a twin size bed room. The normal behaviour in this situation would be to let us stay in the room until the proper room is ready and take our suitcases the that room which is not case, we have check out and wait until the room is ready. It is like we are leaving this hotel. There is not anyone to help us with the luggages. Terrific. That was just the beginning. Our room has no curtains and it is not possible to regulate the temperature of the tap of the shower. Not to mention the mess under the bed. It is noisy (because of the lift) and the air conditioning sounds like a bulldozer. It is really disappointing, because the location is truly amazing and the design is nice. In addition, the lobby is always crowded. It is nearly impossible get to the reception because there is always a lot of people waiting and there is not enough staff to assist them all. It is surprising that in such a big hotel there is not enough staff for everyone. All this does not correspond to a four star level hotel and not to the the price of approximately 280$ a night.

Considering the rate per night you would expect friendly service and a clean room. That is not the case with the Park Central Hotel. Upon entering my room there were two bloody q tips on the bathroom floor. I call the front desk to have them send someone to remove them and clean the bathroom but nobody came. All the trash cans were full of the previous guests trash, the remote for the tv was sticky, it was just a disgusting experience.  With so many choices in NYC I highly recommend avoiding this hotel. They also charge a facilities fee per night on top of your room rate.

This was my first overnight visit to NYC. I was expecting to be in a room the size of a walk in closet and was surprised to find the room incredibly spacious and comfortable. Check in was quick and the staff were friendly and helpful. I asked to be placed in a higher room away from noise as I expected the city noise to keep me awake. I was well accommodated and running the fan from the AC unit did a great job drowning out the city noise allowing me to sleep better than expected. The room was clean (other than the odd odor from the room deodorizer), the bed and linens were comfortable, and the seating area was a nice convenience. I did wish there were amenities that allowed me to make coffee or tea and ended up running the tap to warm up water for tea that I fortunately bring with me when I travel. It got the job done. There is a bar in the hotel, which I did not take advantage of, there is no room service or restaurant, however there is a small market with pre-made salads, sandwiches, drinks/coffee, and wine - open from early morning until 8 pm. I did visit the market to grab breakfast of fruit and yogurt. The cashier in the market was friendly and patient. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to Times Square and the theater district, but far enough to miss the busy crowds and foot traffic. I would choose this hotel again and recommend it to others.

Stayed at this hotel in April 2017 & received top notch service. Due to weather delays & flight cancellations/rebookings, the process of getting to the Park Central was delayed and stressful--but the helpful phone calls with hotel staff during flight delays and the warm welcome upon arrival were much appreciated. Room was very clean, corner views of city, perfect for 3 adults, and hotel location is ideal for exploring NYC, whether by foot/subway/car service. This was the second stay at this hotel and we will absolutely stay here again!

I stayed 4 nights. My overall experience was that this hotel is super overpriced. There are soo many more hotels with a lot better service than this. We were treated poorly by the front desk, that seemed very unwilling to give good customer service. No information about the hotel in the rooms or at the front desk informing us anything. The wifi wasnt working and no one gave us info. The bartender tried to serve us 15 dollar wine (per glass) in drinking glasses. I just assumed that the service would come along with the price but it did not at all in Park Central. during our stay they sent our a textmessage asking for our feedback but when i gave it, hoping for them to turn our experience around, they didnt reply at all. I would strongly recommend to stay away and chose another hotel instead. Not at all worth the money!//Sandra

Hotel did exactly what is says on their website and also tour operators (Thomson). Ours was a package city break and no extra charges at allincurred as this was already factored in to our cost paid at booking in Scotland. Excellent location for all attractions with transport links if needed. We were able to walk to all the main attractions Central Park/Times Square/Empire State and Rocckelfellar/Bloomingdales/Macy's & Broadway. and use the Hop on Off Big Bus for other like Battery Park/Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island. No real issues experienced with lifts for us and hotel was busy with school visits too when we were there week from 26th March 2017. Would return to this hotel. Staff were friendly at all times and we used hotel as a base for our city visit.

This was my 4th trip to NYC and the first time I had stayed at Park Central. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would without doubt stay here again. The room was large, modern, exceptionally clean and had a great view. I found the staff friendly and helpful, especially the concierge team who assisted in sorting theatre tickets and restaurant bookings out for my group prior to our stay. Park Central is in a fantastic location too, close to Times Square, Central Park with lots of great bars and restaurants close by.

My partner and surprise me with a trip to NYC for our anniversary.the hotel was lovely and easy enough to find. it was also good walking distance to Central Park and other places. Housekeeping staff were extremely friendly and our room was always freshen, even when we only went out for an hour. Staff on the desk were ok, however a couple of time I would be stood waiting to speak to someone and staff were clearly more interested in their own conversations. My only other pet hate was there had clearly been a lot of money put into the hotel however it was the small detail items that had been forgotten. for example the wall paper was stating to peel off the wall in our room. Door lock system seem dated and door themselves needed painting. One tip- Make sure you don't get a room next to the housekeeping room as you will be awake early with them banging about. Lucky we were up and out most dates by 7am

This hotel is in a fantastic location and has the feeling of a grandeur establishment despite being affordable. Central Park and Times Square are easily walkable and we used the subway station which was a two minute walk, basically perfect for wherever you want to explore.The room was good, always clean and had very comfortable beds. Unfortunately there were no hot drink making facilities and the shower wasn't adjustable or particularly powerful, however overall it made for a decent stay.The biggest downfall was that the staff who greeted us were far less than approachable. It was 21:00 when we arrived so I understand that they may have been working for a while but we had been travelling for a significant amount of time and were expecting a friendly welcome. Whenever we approached staff on the front desk we were met with cold and unfriendly faces, not what I have experienced anywhere else in America where the customer service can usually polish the most unattractive of you know what.I would advise people to stay here but to avoid the front desk and get information from the chaps outside who were always happy to help.

This hotel is in a great location especially for music and dance fans few steps from City Center and the Carnegie Hall. Close to Central Park on 7th Ave, you can see Time Square and get there on foot. Another advantage is the bus stop just a few meters away, which makes it possible to visit the Madison Square Garden for sports fans. The metro is around the corner with the Q-N-R lines with which I was going directly to Union Square ...The hotel staff is very friendly and attentive to guests. I had a room problem which was too cramped and they allowed me to visit 2 or 3 rooms and choose the one I liked the most ... The men in charge of the suitcases and the reception of the guests are nice, especially Jermaine, not only good looking but also always ready to help and make your stay better.I was also lucky to meet a very nice housekeeper, Agenia who was particularly devoted, very kind and always ready to give the best of herself to make you feel good.This is definitely a hotel that I would recommend and of course I will definitely go back there again ! It was my 2nd time ;-)

Ideally located with comfortable room and wonderful , helpful, friendly staff. Pretty basic rooms but clean and Extremely good value. Walking distance to great restaurants, shopping and minutes from Central Park

Not a good place to stay if you are a business traveller. I travel to New York 5-6 times a year for work and I definitely will not return here again. Lobby is constantly packed - the place was overrun by huge groups of children on school trips when I was there. Long lines to check in/out. Staff at front desk not very friendly. Very long queues to use the lifts.There were just two of them servicing several floors. Additionally, you need a key card to choose your floor and the cards often didn't work meaning people would ride up and down in the lift until they were able to pick their floor. Room was very, very dark. It had one window facing a wall and just two bedside lamps with very dim bulbs. Housekeeping was also poor. Sheets not changed once during a six night stay. Randoms strands of hair were on the bathroom walls when I checked in and they were still there when I checked out. Gross. Only positive thing was the location and free wifi, but there are so many other hotels in the area which are much better.

The hotel is very nicely located, walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. However, there is very little servce at the hotel. The reception acts if it is only there for check in and check out. There is no restaurant but only a small and expensive snack bar/shop. If you want a room for a business meeting, you will have to pay. Our superior room was ok, but small and ordinary standard. Nothing special. A main problem was that it seems that all high shools of US are visting. This makes the lobby extremely noicy and the entrance area look as a summer camp.

Hotel staff were very niceLate evening manager/ gave me 2 water bottles rather than send me across the streetHousekeeping was friendly and helpful 10 floor/1023No view from room at $400 + / but it is NYCand walking distance Central ParkCan pay for upgraded viewConveniently locatedOverall excellent

Good location but beware. This hotel hits you up the end of your stay for a "facilities fee", a nightly charge for slow wifi, the gym, the business centre even if you don't use it. In our case over $250, outrageous and dishonest. If they were being honest they should increase the room rate so you know in advance but they make it look like it's a good price unless you check the conditions. Also not enough lifts, no food apart from an expensive coffee shop and rude front desk staff.Facilities fee is just a way to gouge you on the way out. Total rip off. Would not stay again.

My family and I stayed here for an impromptu mini Spring Break. We had a corner deluxe queen. It was large for NYC and had great natural light. The location is wonderful - a quick walk to central park and Time Square. I'm not a fan of boutique hotels and was nervous the Park Central would be kitschy, but the lobby and decor were well done with a nice bar and atrium. We had a great stay.

Do not go to one of the higher floors. The elevator capacity is not sufficient. Going down it stops at every floor, even when full.When you want Wi-Fi, do not follow the procedure in the room, go to reception to get a special code to log in.No decent breakfast I this hotel.Strange, that such an expensive hotel does not provide better service

Great location, near time square. Staff very friendly. Our room was located at the 4th floor. Was everything perfect, but a negative thing is the insulation of the windows. Truly catastrophic. it was like sleeping without window! Perhaps it would be better to find a solution, because this problem is surely for all rooms

The service is very good.Unfortunately they have already took away the car service for JFK, that was a great service that make the difference with the other hotel.Emanuel from front desk is one of the best e more profession guy I have ever met.

Really lovely, central hotel. Close to all the main attractions and a stones throw from Central Park. To be honest we weren't in the hotel very much over the five nights but it was a really good size room which was really comfortable. The bed was fantastic and the cleaning service was superb. All the staff we came in to contact with were really friendly and helpful. My only criticism would be that the shower wasn't very powerful but I could live with that, it's not exactly a deal breaker! Would not hesitate to recommend this place.

We stayed for 5 nights and thought the location was fantastic - super close to central park and the metro. The room was a good size for a city hotel although very dark, it really needed at least 2 more lights. The thing that was very disappointing was the service fee - over $30 per night! I think this is a sneaky way of making people think they've got a good deal.

Excellent hotel staff friendly really well placed hotel away from the hustle and bustle of time square but can see time square from front of hotel only 5min walk in one direction and 3 min walk to central park. Rooms big enough 4 of us stayed there but found we had plenty of space. Good eateries around practically on the door step. Child friendly. Would definitely stay there again.

Stayed for 5 nights visiting NYC for the first time. Location wise, I thought this hotel was excellent! Park Central, Times Square, Rockafeller, 5th Avenue, Grand Central all within walking distance.I thought the rooms were clean, spacious, beds comfortable and good facilities such as TV and in room safe. I also found the staff helpful and polite. The only two things which stop this hotel from being top marks are the overpriced resort fees they charge. I was aware of these when I booked so it's not like they are hidden charges, but I don't really know what benefit I got from paying them. Makes more sense to just add it to the room rate.The other thing which they could do with improving is the elevators. They only have 2 elevators serving a number of floors so on weekends and busier times, you have to wait for a while and queue for an elevator.Overall, great hotel!

Luxurious hotel near Central Park and within walking distance of most attractions including Times Square. Bedrooms spacious and comfortable. Nice bar area. Just watch out for compulsory extra charges for Internet and leisure centre. Otherwise I would really recommend this hotel.

Quiet, beautifully appointed rooms that we have stayed in often! Also, nice consideration for early checknin and late check outs! Located across from Carnegie Hall and near tons of shopping and excellent restaurants.

Everything was right with my visit and with the room except that they did not honor what they said they would: instead of early check in when we arrived at 2, we had to wait to 4, and they did not give us the adjourning rooms as promised. It was very disappointing. Otherwise, the room was nice.

I was delighted to stay the Park Central Hotel in NYC last week. It was very centrally located to everything we wanted to do. Time squares was right down the road but not too close to be bothered by the "hub'bub" and the subway entrances were very close if desired. Central park is a very short walk. The hotel was clean and friendly. There was a bit of a wait for the elevators but it wasn't too horrendous. I've waited longer at larger places. The doorman was delightful and check in and out was good. The only draw back was no coffee makers in the room but there was a nice coffee place downstairs. The concierge was helpful when sought. We will stay here again.

Check in presented total for my stay. Payed, went to bed. Woke up to a bill slid under my door in the middle of the night. A utilities fee $31 +tax. Grimy..! Extra 33 bucks, I could of stayed in a nicer hotel. Bovine waste

Horrible service by hotel staff. Extra long lines for elevators. Unnecessary resort fees. Upgraded premium rooms don't even have coffee machines. Not sure about basic room premium upgrades rooms did not have basic amenities. Lobby jammed and staff was unwilling to help. To call hotel front desk from room it took us 30 min every time. Have to go through prompts and then nobody answers at the desk. Lobby felt very cold. Over priced. I travel to nyc every week and have stayed in many hotels in Manhattan.*Few things positive, the beds were comfortable, atleast in the premium rooms, and had a big screen tv. That's about it.

Very disappointed in their service. Staff is not polite and not willing to help. There was one cleaning person who was mopping and vacuuming the floors this morning at and yesterday evening and got mad at us for walking through. I checked out this morning at 5am and had stepped out for a coffee and as I walked in the hotel the guy looks at us and says what is wrong with you people!!!!!! He expected us to use a different entrance as he is vacuuming. If this is the case the. The hotel should put a sign in front of that door. It was freezing outside and I am going to walk into the first door I get. On top of that I wished him good morning and then his comments proceeded. They don't have coffee in the room so goodly I getting any of its outside of normal business hours. They also charge a facility fee which is absolutely not required for the kind of service and amenities they offer. Staying here was a mistake that I will not repeat.

Actually booked in 2014 April. Arrived midnight from Vegas and had advised them of delayed flight. Upon arrival was told that we were to be transferred to brooklyn to a sister hotel as our room had been given to someone else. Also advise that there were no other rooms available In New York. Right. Found a hotel nearby and transferred onour own. Horrible experience. Would NOT ever stay here again. Took us a whole to get our refund. Front desk not helpful at all. NEVER again.

I stayed in the hotel for about 4 or 5 nights. All of the staff are very rude, not welcoming, stand off attitude, and not helpful at all!! The only helpful lady was a Chinese lady in the gust relations, other than that All were rude!!When we firs checked in our room was very noisy, you can hear people talking from down the street, cars and busses passing by, even people in their rooms next to you!!I asked to move to another room and the guest relation told me to wait for the next day and bring all my luggage down to the storage before noon and they will arrange another room for me at around 4pm! The next day we were shifted to another room, is was somewhat better, but still had this noise as if you were located next to a metro station! The room was not a 4 star hotel room! The furniture could use some 4 star hotel upgrade, wardrobes and cabinets could use some fixing!One of the electricity sockets in the toilet was very dangerous! There was a metal thing hanging out of it, i think if someone touches it he might be electrocuted (see picture below)!!!There was no mini bar in the room and no coffee or tee or any of the complimentary utilities other 4 star hotels offer. if you want a fridge you will have to sign your name and wait! The same exact words by the front disk lady!The room was not acceptable for a 4 star hotel in time square and for what i have paid!I went to the concierge to ask some questions, the lady was very rude and unfriendly, gave me a bunch of papers, and when i asked about direction she gave me this look as if it was not her job, and told me 2 words and that was it!Never recommending this hotel to a friend "or enemy"!DO NOT GO THERE

I've stayed at Park Central for a number of times over the past 15 years or so and it still remains one of my favorite hotels to stay at while in NYC. It's close enough to do a leisure walk to Times Square and there is a subway station right next to the hotel, making this a very convenient location. Our party of seven recently stayed at Park Central for four nights during February, and I am so glad we picked Park Central. A few days during the trip, weather was turning really ugly with snowstorm and rain. It was so easy to just go out the door and down into the subway and keep going to our destination. Our rooms were good sized (especially in NYC) and the beds were comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Park Central.

Impeccably clean rooms, basic amenities, top notch facility and location are required to survive in NYC hotel midtown market. But Park Central knows how to extend above and beyond with guest services and personal attentiveness that are rare and much appreciated. Park Central continues to be our go to destination in Manhattan wherever in the city we need to be and we count on the consistency and excellence that always greets us.

This beautiful hotel is just about across the street from Carnegie Hall and about two blocks from Central Park. It's also any easy walk to Times Square. Subway is right across the street. Rooms are comfortable -- lots of pillows! Restaurants all around and completely safe. I would stay there again on my next visit!

We had a very nice stay in this hotel, great location. The extra tax of $33 dollars a night is a bit much. When booking a hotel you would normally pay the fixed fee for the duration, not an additional fee when checking out.I also rang the hotel a couple of weeks beforehand because it was my boyfriend's special birthday and requested a bottle of bubbly in the room. There was no bubbly, and on arrival only then found out that the hotel did not actually have room service. So a bit disappointing on a couple of points.

The Park Central has a convenient location and the rooms are comfortable and clean. My bathroom is also very well-lite and spacious, which is not always the case in NYC! Front desk staff were very responsive and courteous, too. My one complaint is that the walls are thin and I had some trouble sleeping due to noise in hallways and a neighbor who had his TV on loudly.

I took my daughter to new York as a 21st bday present. I selected this hotel very randomly. we were very pleased. the location is so super convenient to everything we did. I plan to visit new York once a year and plan to stay here every time. also, the mattresses and pillows were the most comfortable of any hotel we have ever stayed at. so much so that I reached out to customer relations after we returned home to find out the exact type of mattress and pillows they sue.

Excellent location, spacious and clean rooms, friendly staff although no so much at reception. One big showstopper; STAFF STEALS MONEY FROM BAGS and management does not care. We left our bags for a couple of hours at deposit after check-out. Before dropping off my bags I checked my wallet and I had €200 in separate section. When we arrived back in Holland money was missing from my bag as well as my son's. I immediately called and left message on voicemail of Security Manager. No response. I called again and again no reaction. I emailed that management and again no reaction. Conclusion; watch your valuable belonings even when you leave them in the "secured" deposit. And don't expect too much from the management when things go wrong. Other than that, again, good value for money!

I purchased use of the room through Groupon, so the price was excellent vs the accommodations. Extremely clean and comfortable King sized bed, roomy and stylish bathroom with delicious-smelling lavender peppermint soaps and lotions.

My partner and I visited this hotel for 5 days in march. On arrival the woman on the desk was very rude not welcoming at all had a very stand off attitude. There was nobody there to help assist with the bags to the room. We were meant to be staying in a premier room- it was incredibly basic. There was no mini bar in the room, the air conditioning was useless and the cleanliness was not acceptable for a hotel in the middle of New York rated 4 stars. I went to the concierge one day to ask for advice on the subway the woman barely uttered 2 words at me and handed me a bit of paper with instructions on. There was no restaurant in the hotel either just a very basic grab and go service. I lost my key one night and went to the desk to ask for another the woman on the desk did not try in help in the slightest her words were " no ID no key" overall a very very disappointing hotel we 100% won't be back.

As four women exploring New York City for a week,the location of this hotel was simply perfect. Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, restuarants, tourist spots and shops, shops, shops!! Rooms were very comfortable and serviced daily. An elevator to our room at the end of the day, was a welcome relief! Highly recommended!

Good room sizes, comfortable bed, updated bathrooms, and clean. What else could you ask for? Seems to be an older property but well cared for. Elevators were a bit slow otherwise a pleasant stay. Would recommend.

Great location, just over the road of a subway station, close to Central Park, Rockefeller Centre and Time Square. Nice, clean hotel with generous rooms and good city views when you're on a higher up floor. Shame there wasn't a minibar in the room. Good value for money and the option of having Coffee & Muffin for an extra $1 a night as a great addition.

We went as a family to NYC, and stayed at the Park Central. Beautiful décor, great atmosphere, and the rooms were clean, well appointed, and high quality. The value for money was very reasonable, and the overall property was situated very close to the Park, and also Times Square. A good starting point if you like to walk and explore.The service was very good, the little "breakfast" vouchers were a nice touch, and I recommend this place to anyone I know going to the City. As with other reviewers, the only issue can be wait times at the elevators, so if at all possible - try to stagger the timing of your trips earlier than most (or later than most). It would be frustrating waiting for the small elevators if you were in a hurry to leave.

This hotel has a great location to Central Park, museums, Time Square, Broadway , subways and restaurants. We got a good room rate and we added a parking package on which was $10.00 a day to park your car. The hotel has been updated, so the room had great beds and a nice bathroom. The room was cleaned in a timely fashion. The common areas of the hotel were very nice. Staff was informative and answered all our questions. The internet service was great. There is a hotel service fee that is added to your bill that includes internet along with other services.  That being said, when my daughter arrived home, she found clothing items missing from her bag. I called the next day and spoke to the head of security. He was very polite and said he would speak with the staff. I realize my daughter will not get back her clothing items , but I wanted the hotel to be aware of the actions that took place. My recommendation would be to not only use the safe for valuables , which is provide by the hotel in your room, but to also lock your suitcases when you leave.  To conclude, I would stay here again. It was a great hotel , with a great location ! And we had a great time in NYC!

The receptionist was really helpful from the very beginning and added special touches once she learned we were celebrating a 30th and 60th father/son birthday. The bed is the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! The location is great, near the park and a subway as well as plenty of the main attractions. Thanks!

Large clean apartment with good central heating. Always very obliging with responding to requests.In saying this there is no room service, no restaurant facilities just a little shop selling limited take away food items, no simple items such as an umbrella, no mini bar or tea and coffee making facilities.

I visit the Big Apple several times each year...always try to stay at Park Central. Love the location for theatre, park visits, museums...just about everything. Starbucks at the corner...who could go wrong. Most recent visit...room 1619 seemed to recently redone, they should have dealt with the EXTRA SMALL bathroom...definitely a negative. Will stay again...no reason not to.

I recently had the pleasure to stay at the Park Central Hotel. We were planning a surprise trip for a family member and I was lucky enough to work with Quimby. The service and attention to detail provided by Quimby and everyone else at the Park Central hotel was exceptional. I have read other reviews complaining about the team at the hotel and I would disagree 100%. Quimby was a pure joy and a pleasure to work with. I was honestly blown away by the steps he personally took to ensure our trip was amazing. Thank you to Quimby and the Park Central hotel. It was a trip that we will be talking about for years to come!!!

I joined my daughter's choral group on their trip to NYC to perform at Carnegie Hall. The Park Central was right across the street, and it was also extremely convenient to all of the sites that we were planning to visit. Between walking and reaching a subway, it was a perfect location. The staff were quite professional and courteous. It's not always easy to host large groups, but they managed us without an issue. When I arrived, my suitcase vanished and they were quick to help me track it down; I knew it came in with the rest, and it turned out that a person in our group had taken it by mistake. I made sure to buy a green bandanna to ID it faster in the future! The rooms themselves were spotless, the beds were very comfortable, and there was an ample supply of towels so that we didn't have to call for more. I appreciated the sleep timer on the tv remote control, something that sounds minor but these days is absent from most hotel rooms. The security to get to the other floors was excellent, and though we were a little slow to find out that our key was required for the use of the elevator, it all worked out and this was great! One thing that would have helped was a microwave/fridge in the room. Not sure if it's because it's an older hotel, but with all of the ample portions and treats we could access on our trip, we had to leave the leftovers behind due to a lack of storage. With prices a bit higher than at home, any special help with this would have been a budget-bonus. A fridge could be requested but being put on a waiting list didn't get it to us before the end of our stay. While we didn't use the bar services nor the small deli-type area, the waiting areas by both the bar as well as the lobby was very spacious, with many seating opportunities and outlets to recharge electronics (bar area). I'm not sure when I'll be able to return to NYC, but I would definitely look into the Park Central Hotel as my first choice of a place to call home for the time that I am there!

We arrived mid day and were able to check in quickly at that time. Friendly staff, clean room, comfortable bed, great location 10 minute walk from Times Square. The little coffee shop in the lobby was great in the morning for good coffee, muffins and fruit to get you started. I'd recommend it.

The front desk staff was personable and knowledgeable. The room was a good size with a super comfy bed. Great experience! The proximity to theaters, restaurants, and Times Square makes this hotel a win/win! Kate T.

This hotel is in the perfect location to stop in during the day to drop off shopping bags and such. The room was clean and we happened to have a large room because it was a ADA room. It is also decorated like a high end hotel, but came with with a really great price! I will stay again when I'm back in the city!

The best part of this hotel is the location. You can't beat it. It's close to the subway, and it's walking distance to Times Square, Central Park and other major tourist attractions.One negative thing about my stay was the air conditioning did not cool enough on our first day, despite the thermostat being set to 65 degrees (and it was about 40 degrees outside). I am notorious for being cold all the time, but I was so uncomfortable with the temperature in the room that I barely got any sleep. I also didn't want to keep the window wide open during the whole night since there was no screen, but I was so desperate for cool air that I ended up doing it anyway.The room was very clean, although I did find a stain on one of the blankets which looked like blood.The staff was great, professional and friendly. I got a huge discounted rate thanks to Travelzoo for $89 per night and they even waived the $30 nightly facility fee, so you should check their website to see if there is any deals available.

This hotel is in a great location. Many attractions are in walking distance (such as Carnegie Hall, Times Square, Radio City, Central Park, Rockefeller Center) and the subway stop is 1 block away. Hotel facilities are fine. Staff was okay but not particularly friendly.

It's the facility fee and the taxes (five lines) that are kinda annoying. The hotel can't help the taxes, of course, it is NYC. The king room on the 17th floor was clean and well appointed, modern design. Staff was professional and courteous.

Conveniently located right on the subway line. Walking distance to Central Park, Columbus Circle, Time Square. Front desk extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms were spotless. The only thing I wished we had was a coffee maker in our room, but there is coffee on the main floor. Just nicer to have that first cup without leaving your room.

I was pleasantly surprised when staying at the Park Central Hotel this week. The room was a great size, the room was clean and decorated very stylishly, we were able to get a late check-out, and the staff was very kind. I was surprised at the low rate. I will definitely stay again while in New York.

Good location... clean rooms... Staff is friendly... The only negative as of yet is the exhaust fan doesn't work in the bathroom . The noise level is minimum and the beds are surprisingly comfortable.

Came up for the weekend to celebrate my friends birthday. The hotel is very modern and the decor is amazing. Great check in staff and hospitality from guest services! The texting concierge was so cool and made me feel welcomed and valued making sure we had everything we needed. Convenient! Definitely would stay again.

I spent more time than usual in this hotel because I was in New York for business meetings and events for over a week. For me, that meant I was holding very long working hours and in the hotel room emailing/working for a lot of my time. That also meant I needed full use of the amenities available to me. The big one missing was room service when I didn't have time to go get food. They weren't super helpful with any unique requests and didn't even try to accommodate.I don't expect a doorman for a mid-range hotel, but I do expect that a hotel with so many frequent travelers to try and go the extra mile. Other than the awesome bellhop and good housekeeping, service was just so-so.This hotel is great if you are not planning on spending time here. The rooms are a decent size, the showers are hot, the blowdryer isn't a flimsy travel size, and the bed is comfortable (though the pillows weren't my favorite). However, If you were like me and needed service, it wasn't the best experience.

The hotel is lovely, and the location is excellent. However our first time experience was severely marred by the fact that we hold money stolen from our flight bag. Our luggage was "safely" stored in the luggage check in. I had 800 dollars in the bag when it was checked in and NOTHING when I retrieved it. This was reported to the Hotel Management and nothing has been done!!! We loved our trip to New York and would have hoped the Hotel would live up to their responsibility. Really disappointed.

This is the best hotel I've ever stayed. The price is very reasonable and the room is spacious. You can let your hair down after long jurney. I strongly recommend this hotel to you because I am pretty sure you will love it!

We took a group of high school kids to New York and our stay was amazing. Nothing but the utmost respect received from the staff even though we were among 122 kids. The Concierge folks went out of their way to take us to the street and provide directions to the nearest drug store!!! What a great staff and obviously that does start from the top and how people are treated. Rooms were amazing and the location was perfect for our plans!THANK YOU PARK CENTRAL!!!!!

Room 724 - Beautifully appointed, clean and well cared for property. Staff were kind and helpful at all times. Parking was simple and we enjoyed every aspect of our visit. Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, restaurants/bars and Broadway. King bed was very comfortable and fridge was brought to our room at no expense. Would have loved to have a coffee maker in the room but Starbucks is right next door and McDonalds right around the corner. Would recommend this hotel highly.

I stayed here for a couple of days with my 16 year old son.The location is great, just a 5 minute walk to Central Park and 10 minutes to Times Square.Our room was lovely and clean, 2 double beds with a dividing wall between them which gave us both a bit more privacy.We were on the 10th floor and it was really quiet. We had a grab n go breakfast included in our stay, this was either a tea/coffee/orange juice, muffin or pastry and a piece of fruit - enough to keep us going till we got going in the morning.

This hotel is not given enough credit IMO. Excellant location, close to subway stations, central park, restaurants, time square, broadway. Beautiful room, bathroom. Decent view because who is really in a hotel for the view unless you are on a beach in Mexico?!! Staff was awesome our maid service out of this world. Courtesy and friendly. One of the cleanest rooms I have been in, in awhile.AND let me tell you Nancy down in the bar was amazing! and the COSMO's best I've had to date.If you are looking for a great deal and a great hotel, this one is it!

We stayed here during a cold winter weekend at a highly discounted rate. We were a bit nervous thinking they would give a room in the basement with a small window into the alley, but were pleasantly surprised that we had a lovely room on the 15th floor. The room was clean with a super comfy bed. The hotel is in a prime location near broadway, Central Park, Carnegie Hall and Times Square. Only negative was the super tiny bathroom, but that's to be expected in NY.

Great hotel and good location. Very clean and friendly staff. House keeping were very good. Comfortable nights sleep. You need to use your key card for libby toilets and also for the lifts to gain access to the floor your staying on. Sometimes it didn't work in the lift but no issues getting into the room. Only downfall was the noise from traffic outside the hotel but unfortunately you get it anywhere you go in manhattan.

Park Central is the only hotel we have ever stayed when visiting NYC. The location can't be beat, and the comfort of the rooms is superior! All of the staff from the doorman to the front desk to the cleaning staff is above par. Everyone greets you with a smile and does everything they can to make your stay smooth. I have recommended this hotel to several friends and they all have enjoyed their stay at Park Central. I never even look at other hotels anymore. We are already looking forward to our next stay.

Thanks God, there's this site for travelers! Big thanks to all of you, contributors. This is where you start your trip from eagerly reading reviews of the hotel you are about to book. First, you sift through the latest reviews (Is there something happening recently you should be aware of? Construction? Bed bugs? Mystery murder? Kidding!). Then you enjoy those good reviews - nice location, rooms of decent size, good service, Wi-Fi in the room! And finally carefully check the bad ones - noise outside, rooms small, service inattentive, Wi-Fi too expensive... So why would the same size room be considered small by some and of decent size by the others? Why some people rave about the service in the same hotel while the others find it unacceptable? May I suggest that so often this is our perception of reality conditioned by the expectations? The human factor.I was fortunate to have stayed at many top five-star hotels, among them a few in NYC. I also knew that Park Central wouldn't offer some of those top hotel perks - this is a four-star one. My expectations were realistic - I knew there wouldn't be a Nescafe machine in the room or fridge with minibar, no bathrobes or sleepers, and no turn-down service, we needed a place for a good night sleep, no frills, and yet - a decent place deserving those four stars. I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby was spacious, the room design modern and stylish, gray and white colors dominating, clean lines. Two double beds with comfy mattresses and down comforters, four pillows to your taste, nice linen. TV set with good quality of picture, we were able to connect our iPad to the HDMI input and watch some YouTube movies via the channel 38 using the hotel Wi-Fi. Nice bathroom of acceptable size, satisfying shower, modern fixtures. On our next day stay the room was cleaned diligently, shower parts wiped dry, and the maid even left a thank you note for her tip - very classy gesture. The gym in the hotel was modern, of decent size, good machines.Hotel is just steps away from the central park. Starbucks at the corner of the building, our favorite breakfast place Le Pain Quotidien just a block away toward the park, Subway sandwiches across the street, and the subway station right in the corner. Yet, not too close to the Time Square and its craziness. Perfect location!Overall, the hotel fully met our expectations, and we had good two-night sleep stay. Oh, and did I mention we had it as an unbeatable deal on Travelzoo that set me on a happy note from the beginning?! Human factor, I told you!As for the wishes to make it a better place, I'd say the cheapest and the quickest addition would be a bottle of drinking water in the room, or just make it as a one time complimentary feature, handed out during the check-in. Minimum expenses, good impression.

Easy access to Central Park, Theater district among many other places. Hotel was clean, comfortable and services were very good. The parking fees are high and there is no in/out. There are plenty of parking options for you to do yourself within close proximity. I liked the texting concierge feature they have with Ivy.

I've spend there half month and everything​ was well done:- First of all they upgrade my room from a king one to another better due to lack of the reserved omes. So one point to them!- After fridge was provided to my room, great too!!- Wi-Fi was good, np for working and it has gym also, but no idea about it!- Service really useful and nice by the waySo it was a really good choice!!

This trip was to celebrate my partners 40th Birthday. We stayed in one of their premier king rooms which was lovely. Quite roomy for a New York hotel. Bathroom was small but perfect and you don't need anything bigger really. Decor was really smart and everywhere was very clean. All the staff we had dealings with were very helpful, friendly and approachable.The hotel is perfectly located. Only a short walk to Times Square and Central Park.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and will definitely be back. In fact, we can't wait to come back!!

I spent a week at this hotel and loved every minute. The location is ideal for anyone who wants to be close to Central Park, Times Square, and a quick walk to the upper east side. The rooms are updated and spacious for New York. Overall I feel you get the best bang for your buck here. Staff is friendly too.I will make this my regular hotel when I travel to New York!

The hotel has been totally refurbished and was quite nice. The location is wonderful. The rooms were clean and a pretty good size for NYC standards. There is a very nice bar that we never wasn't open around 5. The staff was extremely nice although there were some issues with the front desk. No complimentary coffee or ability to make it in the room. Two big "bewares": There is a facilities charge that is pretty hefty. We're told that it was for wifi, the gym, and for keeping your luggage for before or after you have your room (something I've never paid for other than a tip to the porter). $70 in addition to other another services charge. Also, we arrived about an hour before check-in. The room wasn't ready but we did all the paperwork. We were told to just come back, show your ID and get the key. When we arrived back there were 15 people in line and two people behind the desk both of whom were helping one person. We waited 20 minutes in line. There was a lot of grumbling in line because of the wait, so we found out that about half the people in line had already checked in and just needed a key. Finally, my husband asked for a manager who wasn't very helpful and also not very quick to arrive. After she spoke to my husband several other people did appear to check people in and hand out keys. It was very frustrating, and obviously a huge flaw in the system. Just put someone behind the desk who is there at 4 pm to hand out keys to people. Not that complicated. To add insult to injury we received a text telling us that the early check-in fee (???) was being waived for us. Good thing because even though we may have checked in early, we didn't receive a key until a good 30 minutes after check-in. We are frequent overnight visitors to NYC as we don't live that far away. Not sure we would go back. I'm sure we'll try a few of the other hotels in the area first.

I have visited New York around this time of year several times and the experience this last time staying at the Park Central was the best so far! The hotel's location is absolutely fantastic and the staff treated us very well. I came with three friends and we arrived early, fully expecting to just see if we could drop off our luggage and come back for check in, but they let us check in right away and upgraded our room without us even asking (no charge!). The room was more spacious then any room I've stayed in and the cleaning services were really good. It was so nice to return to super comfortable beds in a nice clean room after a long day of walking in the city. I was also struck by the lack of noise-- I couldn't hear anything on our floor (the 8th floor) from outside or even from neighboring rooms, despite being in such a central location. It made for some very restful nights! Also, I was pleased with how quickly the staff helped with requests. I sprained my ankle right before arriving and had to soak it every night so the staff brought a bucket and a bath bench to our room for my use as soon as I explained the situation to them. I didn't even ask for the bench so I thought that was a nice touch. Additionally, they gladly held our bags for us on the last day as we had a late flight out of the city and allowed us to wait in the lounge to rest and charge our phones even after check out. Overall, I was very impressed with every detail and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit NYC. Bonus: be sure to try the cafe right next door for breakfast (Tisserie). It was our favorite breakfast place and had the best quiche I've ever tasted! :)

This hotel was the cheapest i could find in Manhattan & it has a brilliant location situated between times square & central park. It is also close to other famous spots including carnegie hall & awesome deli.I did not eat there, as there are just so many choices in new york.The rooms were spacious with brilliant facilities including an ice machine an each floor.Staff were willing to help.Would highly recommend to anyone visiting this ace city

Booked the hotel through Expedia and purposely chose it as it was reasonably priced for the location. I've previously stayed at The Paramount and Hotel Edison so I had high expectations for a Midtown hotel. Check in was quick and easy although the member of staff spoke far too quickly for me to understand and asked me to sign a waiver the sole purpose of which was to agree to the Resort Fee (more to come on that). The lobby was spacious and the bar area was well presented although the bar isn't manned all the time so we couldn't get a drink in the afternoon. The room we stayed in was one of the biggest I have stayed in in the city. It was clean and well presented. The slight criticism I had with the room itself, which I tried to feedback upon checking out, was that both the shower and hot tap in the bathroom took about 10 mins of running to properly heat up. Housekeeping team did a fantastic job with the room every day. The elevator situation was the most annoying aspect of the hotel (more annoying than the Resort Fee). It only served 3 floors (different elevators for different floors) but 2 were not enough. We regularly waited as they were full and they were unreliable and didn't stop on the floor we were staying. Now the resort fee. We were honestly 100% aware we had to pay it so it didn't come as a surprise but unless you go to the gym, you are paying to use wifi. There was not an option to turn it down. I think it is an added charge so they can appear cheaper on price comparison hotel sites which makes me feel it's a dis-honest act. Wi-if was patchy at best. No streaming for Netflix though. In 2017 should wi-if be a chargeable extra?Overall although clean, spacious and in a good location I have been left with an overwhelming gut-feeling that we wouldn't stay here again.

This is a long one. I will preface it by saying that we were very pleased with the rooms we were eventually given. BUT...Checked in after an early flight. We had booked two king rooms at the Premier Level and requested they be on the same floor. Were told we could be side by side if we gave up our king beds. We declined.Upon returning to the hotel, we were told to wait in the long check-in line again. After reaching the counter, our keys were issued. It was then we discovered that one of our premier king bed rooms had been swapped for a double. We explained that we had already discussed this at morning check-in and had declined.After consulting with the manager, the counter attendant gave us keys to rooms on the eighth floor, the lowest floor considered "Premium". We went in, spent a few seconds staring through the windows of the office building 25ft away and called the front desk to arrange alternate rooms.On the third try the manager met us in the lobby, we were given rooms on the 16th floor with a decent view of the city. One was ready, so we dropped our luggage there and made a run to the store. Upon return, we inquired as to the other room and were told that it was ready, on the EIGHTH floor. The manager eventually straightened things out, but wow, what a ridiculous struggle.To top everything off, when we arrived home we discovered they had put a $200 hold on our credit card for "incidentals" which no one had ever mentioned. When we questioned the hotel, they told us the money would take up to seven days to be returned to our account. This was on top of the $135 "resort fee we paid at check out.Bottom Line - Nice Hotel - Poorly Organized

I booked a room for a one night birthday celebration/engagement for my fiancee. I think I was sent to Heaven & back and treated like royalty. It was old school courtesy and elegance all the way. This stay totally surpassed all my hopes & expectations for a special evening. I owe it all to the marvelous, one & only Ms. Elizabeth Cacovic, Guest Relations Mgr. I reached out to her after I read in a Trip Advisor Review how wonderful she was. I asked her to give us a great room if she could w/a King bed and told her it was a special birthday/engagement surprise. She gave me the best room in the building, with 2 bathrooms and a lovely elegant suite, looking out beyond the city scape! My fiancee was beyond thrilled that he could have his own bathroom!
