He didn't have to look at my toiletries and could take as long as he wanted in the shower. And he did! She also gave us each a drink voucher for the lounge and the bartenders were outstanding! These were long term professionals 20 yrs plus, who knew how to mix a drink! WOW! It was sublime, and we patronized this bar/lounge more than several times. Ms. Elizabeth even gave us the courtesy of calling up to the room to ask if all was satisfactory. I went to many upscale Historic hotels through our visit to NYC, Boston, & DC, and no one treated us so special and important as this lovely lady, a gracious epitome of what customer service & guest relations mean. The stay was the best we had in 3 cities and 10 days, and we continued to talk about how we missed this fabulous hotel and personal treatment. Very clean, and quiet, huge suite, attentive, and wonderful space in the lounge to hook up your computer and relax. A tremendous value especially if you book with a Groupon. The only thing missing was a coffee machine in the room. Check this hotel & request Ms. Liz to help you make your stay a phenomenal celebration. I am still tickled with all the goodies and tremendous value we received & have found a true home in NYC when I travel. Thank you Ms Elizabeth Cacovic for working your magic and making this a memory I will always remember!

Stayed here for 7 nights at the beginning of February and cannot fault it at all. The absolute biggest plus point to this hotel is its location. We walked pretty much everywhere we wanted to go, and the few times we needed a subway, they were within a block or two.Staff were very helpful - we arrived two hours before check in time, just wanting to leave our bags whilst we went and explored a bit before checking in, and they allowed us to get in to our room earlier with no extra fee. Also had no issues with leaving our bags for an extra 9 hours after we checked out as we had a late flight home.The room was large, very clean (maid service very good, cleaned every day). Only down side for me was not an overly powerful shower, but that's pretty standard for hotels to be honest!We had booked through a site that paid our facilities fee for us, so we didn't have that extra cost at the end which made it even better value. As others have said, the lifts were a bit annoying - having to put your key card in just to get to your floor, which when you have squeezed several of you in, isn't great! Used the computers/printers in reception a couple of times with no issues, wifi worked perfectly everything, and used the in room phone to call an NY number once, and again no problem.Overall we had a brilliant stay and would be more than happy to stay here again.

Beautiful rooms with lots of space. Beds were very comfortable. Lounge is large and relaxing but closes at 11:30 pm on a Saturday which was disappointing. Staff was friendly from our valet service to check in. I would highly recommend this hotel. We found an amazing deal on TravelZoo and paid only 105.00 with tax. They even waived the ridiculous 30.00 per night facilities fee. This was a spectacular deal especially for NYC!!!!

Hotel is in an excellent location a couple of blocks form Central Park, across from Carnegie Hall, a few blocks to Times Square and theater district.Rooms, clean comfortable, friendly helpful staff. Great place to stay

We got a great price on the room. Very nice value, great location and good amenities. Would stay again. Staff was accommodating, helpful. Good location, walk to theaters, other landmarks. Subway entrances close, Starbucks nearby.

I booked Park Central as a surprise trip for my finance for his 30th birthday, we flew from Mexico to stay here for 3 nights. Check in was quick and simple, staff were very helpful when we had questions regarding the subway and directions etc. Location was perfect, within easy walking distance to Central Park, Times Sq, 5th Ave etc. Subway station was right outside (on the corner). Room was a decent size and very clean. The bar was nice and Nancy (table server) was very attentive. Overall, I would happily stay here again and recommend to friends and family.

I booked a room here for 3 nights-in midtown for a conference-at a rate of 139.00 per night. I thought it was a great value. It was convenient, quiet and clean. The housekeeping staff was especially kind and friendly and the room was super well-kept. The beds comfortable and linens soft-Along with having high-quality shop for take-out food items right in the lobby, there are both an upscale coffee shop and a Starbucks just out the front door of the hotel.

Lovely New York Hotel.Best location, staff, concierge,where five stars.Room was large, comfortable nice bedding, bathroom modern , and emmacuatly clean throughout the hotel.Corridors are wide with beautiful carpeting. Housekeeping friendly.The lobby was was very enique, high ceilings,modern comfy seating to have a drink, or work on your computer.Had a wonderful stay, enjoyed walking out of the hotel, to the Park, Fifth Ave, and all the shows.We will be back⭐

We spent five nights here in town for a conference. The desk staff and concierge were very helpful. The room was larger than many NYC rooms and nicely outfitted. We were disappointed by the $30-something per night facilities fee, which is not tagged into the price but rather added in taxes and fees to the total cost--especially since we had no need for the amenities it was to cover. I'd rather have had that be just a part of the regular price. We realized after it was kind of cold for a few nights that our window was crooked in its frame, leaving a crack for cold air and noise to get in. A facilities person, who was very nice, did his best to wrestle it in line but it was still off. I had a package delivered to myself at the hotel; the communication over that was not the best. All said, it's a nice hotel...just keep in mind that you have to add $30-something per night onto the price quotes.

The hotel is a perfect location and within walking distance of most things. My daughter and I had a double/double room, beds were very comfortable with plenty of pillows. Nice size room, very happy with that. The bathroom was pretty useless, had to use my sons bathroom who was staying in his own room two rooms down. I had a bath and fixed shower, there was no lower shower for hair washing and plugs would not go down in the bath or basin. The maid service was of high standard, staff members extremely polite and hard working. The lifts in the building were dreadful - small and having to use an entry card to press your room number to go up in a crowded lift was often problematic. Reception staff were average in customer service, not overly friendly but ok. The luggage store man was polite and helpful. And the man who helped us get out suitcases into the taxi. The hotel shop was extremely expensive, nothing price tagged so you get a shock at the till, $5 for a small bottle of water. Pastries and cakes also expensive. I am not sure I would stay at this hotel again, mainly because of the lift situation but also as a hard of hearing lady I need to have a more friendly, clearer and gentle customer service at a front desk (that's a personal thing)

My husband and I have stayed at the Park Central 3 times over the past 5 years and we've always had a good experience. The beds are comfortable and the linens are crisp and clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful (especially Carmelo, the doorman--need a tip on where to get a good pizza? Ask Carmelo.). The rates are very good, especially considering it's centrally located in Midtown Manhattan. All in all, the next time we go to NYC, we'll be staying at the Park Central.

The hotel charges a separate fee of $30 per day (not optional) to cover "hotel facilities" - this is ridiculous, they do it this way so trivago and other apps don't catch it when they compare the rates (looks cheaper). They claim that you agree to it when you sign all the check in papers. But what are you going to do? Go on the streets full of bags in search for a new hotel in the freezing cold?Definitely not worth the total all-in price.

Hotel's location is excellent. 2 blocks away from Central Park, 2 blocks away from subway and a right at the hart of Theather district. Their concierge service is very friendly amnd the little coffee shop downstarirs is very well stocked.

I had an event come up that was unable to be rescheduled - and the hotel staff did something nice for me when they could have said "sorry out of luck."For that I give them 5 stars as it says a lot about the character of the management/policies and I will most certainly be back there soon!

Park Central is a great place to stay if you will be seeing any Broadway shows. It is a short walk to any of the theaters, as well as Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and many great restaurants. The hotel is very nice, with beautiful rooms and amazing staff. We will definitively return there.

I was travelling from HK to New York on business trip. It was very long way from HK to New York. The room is old and it is dark. No lamp on the desk. The lamp was bad in bathing room aa well. I requested to change room in the guest relation counter. The staff declined my request. And told me to request engineering to fix it the lamp. So I went out for dinner. When I went back to room, it was still not yet done. The reception reply also told me that they cannot let me know when engineering staff can come. Guest relation service is bad. I can use computer in my room as it was very dark at my room on fifth floor. The room is located at the end of corridor , room 553. I will not recommend anyone to stay in this hotel due to poor service, poor facilities.

I found this hotel on travelzoo for $89 + taxes = $105 and it was a GREAT bargain. I traveled with a friend, and we had two double beds in a larger-than-typical-for-NYC size room. Newly renovated, fresh feel, our only concern was that the heating system required a hotel staff person to explain why we had to set it to 85 degrees to get it to warm up to 67 degrees.

It's our second stay at Park central hotel. The location is as good as it gets. The rooms are all nicely renovated. Staff wants to please you. Only side I'd say could be improved is their Market Central coffee shop which has limited and expensive choices and the elevators are really slow...

We booked for two nights and we loved so much we stayed an extra night. It was a good location only wished they had a microwave and a refrigerator in the rooms also access to vending machines. If we come back to New York i would stay there again.

Great hotel and staff especially Elizabeth Cacovic in guest relations. She was so helpful and nice. I took many of her suggestions and my New York City dream came true. My room was amazing. The bar was friendly and everything you could want to do is right there. Times Square at night,Central Park walk and coffee in the morning(my favorite), to pizza or a lovely French restaurant. Shopping or just walking. I would highly recommend Park Central for a great stay,with no worries.

My partner and I spent three days at Park Central. We got a package that included tax, title, amenity fees, parking, and a complementary cocktail for $517, or about $172 a day. If you can get this hotel for a significant discount, go for it. It is clean, comfortable, stylish, and conveniently located. The rudeness and indifference of staff other reviewers reported seems a thing of the past. We always received prompt and courteous treatment.

Best locations for walking the city, plus subway is 1 a block away. I'm a 15 year return visitor to this hotel and they have always had a very friendly and helpful staff. Actually I met many staff members 10-15 years ago and they still seem very happy to be part of The Park Central team. With all the bed bug scares in the past, I always found this hotel very clean and always updated, never the tired small rooms at many other hotels in the city that left you wondering.... if ????I think in the last couple of years, Park Central finally started to appreciate their return guest and I thank you!Looking forward to many more visits.

We got our hotel with a Groupon coupon. What a wonderful Hotel, from the moment you walk in to the moment you walk out this is a great Hotel.Beds are a big deal for me because of some medical issues. These beds were wonderful. We had an extremely restful night, we were on an inside room , we heard no and I mean no traffic. No Sirens, no garbage man, no horns honking, I've never stayed in New York and not heard some type of street noise.I was also pleasantly surprised at how big the room is. Generally in New York the rooms tend to run a little smaller than average.I would give them 5 stars except they need to clean the corners and edges of the carpets. Everything was immaculate.If you want a hotel that is close to Broadway and the museums, I would suggest this one. Plus it is only two blocks from Central Park.

We recently spent two nights at this centrally located hotel in NYC. It is a huge hotel, with friendly staff who are very willing to help. The building feels safe and is secure. Check in and check out was easy. Room was very clean, large enough and comfortable. Noise level was perfect.

This is a very nice hotel. We had one night left on our trip and received a very good rate for this hotel. Beautiful setting with wonderful room. Not disappointing, to say the least!! The location was central for us. Walking distance to Central Park and the subway. We recommend it without hesitation.

Perfect location, clean and spacious rooms! Courteous staff. We will definitely stay there again. Car valet very reasonable. Only draw back was no vending machine for bottled water after coffee shop was closed. However, 24 hour deli with great cheesecake right across the street.

Great central hotel. Close to Central Park and the subway. The hotel is a great location and the staff are friendly. Great size rooms and very clean. The rooms are spacious and the bedding is crisp. They clean your room daily

I stayed at the Park Central Hotel recently; my room was on the corner of the 6th floor. With huge windows across two walls, the view of 7th Avenue was one of the best things about my stay here. The room is very nice; comfortable beds and pillows, well decorated and clean. The bathroom was also nice with a frosted glass window and plenty of mirrors. My only suggestion would be for the bathroom to have a fan. It got pretty steamy during my shower. Also, there is no coffee maker. This was't so bad though because the little place right next door on the corner has amazing coffee and breakfast.Every staff person I encountered was friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here again!

Hubbie and I stayed here for 1 week. We booked this hotel based on the excellent location - there is a subway station a few mins walk away, you are walking distance to both Central Park and Times Square and there are lots of breakfast/brunch places on your doorstep. Room was not the biggest and the view wasn't particularly great, but neither of these issues bothered us we were out for most of the day. Beds were comfortable and bathroom was clean. Highly recommend this hotel as we found it to be very good value based on the location.

We stayed at the Park Central Hotel last weekend. It was a delightful experience. The rooms were clean and decorated well. There is a large hotel bar that is very pretty. This is a nice place for a nightcap or just to hang out. The location of the hotel was perfect. It is located a few blocks from Midtown and the theater district and is a very quick walk to Central Park . If I had one complaint it is that the elevators are very slow. This would not keep me from staying at this hotel again, loved it.

We booked this hotel on a special promotion with free wifi, the location is amazing, the rooms have been renovated and the service was top notch. Great value for this hotel and will stay there again when in NYC

We found a great deal for Park Central Hotel (and also a recommendation from a friend). We enjoyed our stay there; the room had two double beds, wi-fi, very clean bathroom, etc. It was very close (2 blocks away) to Central Park, across the street from Carnegie Hall, and a short walk to Museum of Modern Art. There is also a good size gym which is available 24-hours a day. Looking forward to staying there again.

We enjoyed our stay, the hotel was clean, quiet and centrally located to many attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only things I would like to have had were a small fridge, I wasn't aware that we didn't have one. Also, acess to a vending machine. It was rather cold outside and we had to bundle up to get a soda at the store next to the hotel once the store in the hotel closed around 8pm. Other than that it was a nice sized room for new york.

Took advantage of a Travel Zoo special and booked one night at the Park Central for $89 per night plus taxes. Resort fee was waived for special. Room was clean and good sized. Bathroom was small but everything was clean and tidy. It was a great location. Only downside was the elevators. Small and slow. Waits were always long.

Staff were professional, friendly & accommodating & clearly cared about creating a pleasant guest experience. Room was comfortable & immaculate & public spaces were inviting as well. Highly recommend this hotel.

Great location near but not too near Times Square. Subway just outside. Rooms clean & spacious. Nice bar. Only disappointing thing is that the hotel has no restaurant but the likelihood of you eating in it is slim anyway so no big deal really. Would recommend.

We stayed here for 5 nights in February 2017.We chose this hotel due to it's location, 5 mins walk to Central Park, 10 mins walk to Times Square, close to Empire State & Rockefeller, with Subway Station across the road. Our room was very spacious, more like a suite than a standard hotel room. Clean towels, bed made everyday. Although agree with previous reviewers about elevators, we didn't find this too much of a problem. HOWEVER, please be aware of mandatory charges. Although we paid for our stay prior to arrival, we were faced with $32 per night additional "mandatory" charges. We now understand these charges to be for the use of the Gym & Wifi. Had we been aware of the above charges at the time of booking, we would have considered other hotel options. When we paid our fee in full, we did not expect any further charges! Unfortunately, The extra $160 bill has overshadowed the good points of the hotel!

We had a great time. Room clean, bright and welcoming. All staff were friendly and professional. Love location. Valet parking a big plus. Cleaning staff, so nice and professional. Thank you looking forward to next visit.

My wife and I planned on going to a Saturday afternoon show and decided to book a room and make a night of it. Can't say enough about how helpful the staff was and how nice the accommodation were. Very pleasant lounge, great bar staff, very friendly place
user_location: Little Falls, New Jersey, United States

review_body: I have to admit that when I was going to New York recently, I was nervous about staying at a hotel that wasn't my "usual" place. This hotel was booked for me as a member of a performing group at Carnegie Hall. Normally, when visiting the city, I stay at a hotel down in the heart of Time Square. I was worried about being away from my "normal" surroundings, but I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It wasn't really that far of a walk into the theater district, and there plenty of amenities around the hotel in terms of restaurants, coffee, etc. The hotel room itself was very comfortable and was more than adequate for our stay. Unfortunately, every hotel on the face of the planet now uses down pillows, which I (along with my mom) am allergic too. I did request synthetic pillows, and they delivered 2 synthetic pillows to our room. The bathroom seems to have been recently updated, but I never understand why hotels don't have vent fans in the bathrooms! My biggest complaint about this place would be the elevators. During my visit, there were at least two performing groups with concerts at Carnegie Hall staying at this hotel. With a limited number of elevators that were both small, plan on allowing extra time to get down to the lobby during busy times.

Good hotel in a great location. My problem with this hotel is the mandatory fees 33 dollars per night per room ( we had 2) for storage of our luggage at the end of our stay. For this price we also had use of the gym! Who wants to use a gym when your on holiday in NY. Extortion with no choice. Please be aware when booking.

The Park Central is a hotel that never disappoints me. Beginning at check in I am always greeted with a smile. The staff is always willing to help accommodate with my request. The room is always clean upon arrival and kept that way each day of my stay. Great location!

We went for a weekend getaway in mid January. The hotel seemed to be re-launching after a renovation. Arriving on Friday afternoon, we found the lobby was hopping. The front desk staff did a great job of handling the rush quickly and smoothly. Standing in line gave me a little time to appreciate the beautifully decorated lobby. It's a bright airy space with a large front desk that allows for several staff to serve customers. You can see the large bar area behind panels behind the desk staff. The lobby also features a small shop offering snacks, drinks, salads, sandwiches, etc. Our room was a good size with two beds, a small desk and a dresser. There was plenty of space to walk around and didn't feel crowded at all. The bathroom was modern and simple. Both spaces were very clean and tidy.The location is just down the street from Carnegie Hall. We found it very easy to find restaraunts and shops within a couple of blocks.

Stayed here with my husband for 6 nights. We were visiting NYC for the first time and picked this hotel because of its location and access to gym facilities. We did not have breakfast included in our stay which was fine as there were so many nearby options to choose from. Facility fees appeared as an extra unforeseen bill at the end of our stay as we thought we had paid everything upfront which was disappointing. Staff were helpful and there were luggage storage facilities and printing facilities available for use (you pay for these in the facilities fees). We were very happy with the location of the hotel. It was close to Time Square but far enough away to escape to hustle and bustle. It is within walking distance of many of the main sights, Rockafellar Centre, Empire State, Maddison Square Garden, Time Square and many of the theatres to name a few.

The Park Central was a great hotel experience for our time in New York. The location was wonderful just three blocks from Central Park one direction and 5 blocks to Times Square the other. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful from the concierge to the gentlemen out front helping us get taxis. I highly recommend this hotel.

February 21 and February 22, 2017 - We took advantage of a Travelzoo special a couple of months ago and booked two nights at the Park Central for only $89 per night plus taxes and city fees. Normally, the hotel charges a $30 to $31 per night wifi, etc. resort fee but his was waived under the Travelzoo Special deal. We had never stayed north of Times Square so we did not know exactly what to expect. However, the hotel is within walking distance of Times Square at 42nd-44th Street and to Central Park and Lincoln Center. Plus, there is a subway stop right around the corner.Our check-in was fast and easy; they had a room for us at 2pm, ahead of regular check in at 4pm. Our room was on the third floor, room 323, and it faced the center courtyard room top that housed all of the heating and air conditioning fans, etc. We were not concerned at not having a view of NYC but were happy to have a quiet inner room. Also, one nice thing about being on the 3rd floor is that the fitness center was just down the hall.Bathroom. As we entered the room, the bathroom was to the immediate right. It was bright, had a large lighted mirror, a modern sink with plenty of counter space. The shower had a modern shower head by Kholer and the tub was sparkling. The shower was easy to adjust. The body wash, shampoo and conditioner are in containers on the wall over the tub and there was a nice large shelf in the shower for other toiletries. One thing we noticed and mentioned to our room attendant was that a lot of lint and hair had lodged into the back of the hairdryer. It need to be cleaned or replaced. We only used the hair dryer once and it worked OK but seemed to generate less heat than expected, possibly because of the extra lint clogged into the back of the hairdryer.The room had a king bed with a fantastic mattress. We had one of the best night's sleep we have had in a long time. The sheets were bright white and crisp; and the pillows were just right. We were pleased that the room had adequate lighting with a desk lamp, two night table lamps, and a hall light. We had to have a couple of items adjusted when we first arrived. First, there was no coffee pot or coffee. We called the housekeeping and a coffee pot, paper cups, coffee, and condiment packs were delivered fairly quickly. We were told that since the hotel has so many rooms, the coffee pots are only included in the room upon the request of the guest. Good to know. The second thing we noticed upon checking into our room was that only one of the night tables had a lamp. Again, we called housekeeping and a lamp was brought to our room that matched the other night table lamp. The hotel seems to solve problems quickly to please the guests and we were impressed.The fitness center on the 3rd floor was large and well equipped. It had several treadmills, elliptical and bicycle machines. Plus, it had two yoga mats, a full set of free weights, three benches, and other work out equipment.The lobby was clean, bright, and efficient. Behind the registration desk is a large lounge with a bar. You don't need to buy a drink to enjoy the lounge.The wifi was fast and was included free for us because of our Travelzoo special rate. Normally, the wifi is included with the $30-$31 resort fee.We would stay at the Park Central again. However, it is unlikely we would stay if we could not find a special deal that waived the resort fee because we feel that it is rather high. For us, we feel our stay was excellent but, I am rating the hotel only as very good because the resort fee is excessive for other guests that may not have been fortunate enough to have it waived.

First time in New York great hotel central to everything. And amazing concierge made our life so easy I would highly recommend! The room with two queens clean freshly renovated and was a very comfortable bed and pillows. Then only has the service been great but everybody goes above and beyond and is very very friendly.

We stayed here for our two week honeymoon in September 2016. The hotel was very well located with only a 10 minute walk down 7th Avenue to Times Square and across the road from Carnegie Hall. However, the concierge behind the desk when we first arrived were INCREDIBLY rude. I had forgotten to tell my bank that we were going away and when we I tried to pay for the room it was declined. The receptionist was incredibly rude and was not understanding in the slightest. She asked whether I had that in cash. Who carries $5,000 in cash??!! I had to plead with them to put a $1,000 deposit down for the room and the woman shouted at me saying ‘You have to pay by 3pm tomorrow otherwise we will kick you out of the room’. Our 8 month old baby crying his eyes out at this stage but none of the staff seemed to care on bit about this, they were completely heartless and the hotel needs to properly train their staff to be far more considerate and understanding, really really rude!!! The room is basic but ok, what you would expect from a hotel really. There was a dead bug in our babies cot but they did change it, but again it needs to be looked at as they should not be giving out cots like this. I must say the conceigre when we left was very helpful organising a taxi for us and some of the staff were helpful, but the whole experience at the start of the trip put a slight dampener on the whole thing and put us off coming back here again. And NEVER GET ANYTHING FROM THE SHOP IN THE RECEPTION, THEY CHANGRED ME $8 FOR TWO CANS OF COKE AND EVEN TRIED TO CHARGE ME FOR HOT WATER TO WARM BABY MILK FOR OUR BABY WHICH WAS AN ABSOLUTE JOKE DESPITE BEING A HOTEL GUEST

My wife and I drove down from Westchester to make a weekend of it in Manhattan. We had stayed here once before and we decided to go again when we found a Groupon deal. My sister and her husband did the same. Although my room was quite small and the bathroom so small that the door would not open all the way because it banged into the toilet. In a addition the only seating in the room was the desk chair. My sister, on the other hand, had a more spacious room with ample seating, as one would expect, and a bathroom door that actually opened all the way. That said, the room and bathroom were clean and the location of the hotel itself very convenient. For the right price I would stay here again but view the room before unpacking!

My husband and I Stayed a night back in January 2017 along with 2 other couples, our rooms and service were great. We Decided to return with some of our family for a quick overnight stay in February. Once again, very pleased with our room- clean and modern with great beds. Great service all around, from the front desk to the bell men. All very pleasant and friendly. Special shout out to our texting contact, Ivy! She was very attentive and responded immediately on the 2 occasions we requested service, while accommodating us. Used the gym on my first visit and gave myself a great work out. Second stay, took advantage of the amazing spring-like weather and the close proximity to Central Park and ran its runners path with the entire family! Plenty to do and plenty of places to eat with it's awesome location. Thanks for a pleasant stay and hope to be back for another stay soon:)

The location of this hotel is hard to beat, close to Central Park and Times Square, easy access to the subway. Great rooms and staff, no issues. I have stayed here many times and will definitely return again.

Checked in on the 9th Feb 2017 late evening due to the snow and had no problems at all!!! Friendly staff at all times (check-in & check-out). We was on the 7th Floor and the room was fantastic. Bed very comfy, bathroom very clean only slight quibble there was only 1 mirror and that was in the bathroom, really need another one in the bedroom! Asked for a kettle, no problem it arrived in minutes! Overall the hotel was in an excellent location, was friendly, clean & tidy and we both had a wonderful time. Would recommend anybody going to New York to stay here!

First, the good stuff: great location. Convenient to Carnegie Hall, Central Park, great dining. Room was clean, service great.Three annoying things: $30 up-charge to every room, every night. We arranged this room through a group, paid in advance. No warning and no chance to decline. No use for me, as I had brought no workout clothing.2. Elevators. This building has been subdivided, so two elevators do work that was shared by four. Elevators are small by today's standards, so waits were long and several times, elevators were full when they came. Elevators were operated by key cards, which frequently did not work. Elevators shuddered all the time.3. Noise & light. We faced 56th St up 9 floors. Could hear every horn honk, including the truck (garbage?) that backed up (with horn honking) for 45 seconds at about 3 in the morning. Shades when fully drawn still admitted a lot of light. Could not tell if it was day or night outside when drawn.

I recently was on business in NYC a couple of weeks ago.Even though it was a short trip I would like to call out 2 individuals who left a marked impression and made my trip memorable .NYC is a busy place and this hotel is extremely busy the day I arrived was on the red eye at 6 am they accommodated me and I was checked in early. After having a quick nap I went to explore ny to find out it was pouring rain and the hotel did not provide umbrellas.In my previous hotel there was always an extra one in the room I asked the door man for a taxi and jokingly mentioned I wish I had his umbrella where he surprised me and pulled a small umbrella from his coat pocket and gave it to me.This was amazing I then found out that my flight had been cancelled due to bad weather and I was in the hotel for an extra night . Quimby Hightower at guest services organized my extra night and a late checkout so I didn't have to panic. But I have to get back to that amazing doorman his name is Carmelo I returned his umbrella to him and then asked him if he could arrange transportation to the airport the following evening .He told me not to worry even though it was his day off he took my phone # arranged a taxi cab and texted me to let me know it was all done .I am one of thousands of people who stay at this hotel but these 2 individuals made it feel like home.I go to NYC twice a year and I look forward to seeing their friendly faces in the springtime .Sofia Ladhari

Positives were decent rooms if a bit small, clean hotel and great location, free computers/printing for boarding passes. Concierge were lovely, always happy to help and happy for a chat. Negatives were the reception staff were touch and go, some really nice and others very sharp. We had to wait hours to get a key to one of our rooms, when we did it didn't work - we went forwards and backwards with reception and the security team seeing someone different every time, then the room key kept breaking throughout our trip. I understand the extra charges for an NYC location, but it's not cheap! There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, you can ask reception/housekeeping however. Very few lifts for the size of hotel, can wait a while. So yes, undecided if I'll return, wasn't made to feel welcome but then it was just a place to rest our heads...

If you are searching for a hotel that has services, like food, refrigerator and/or microwave in your room, this is not the hotel for you. If you are looking for a hotel that is clean, nice rooms with good beds at an affordable price, in a great location close to Carnegie Hall and Central Park, it is a hotel to consider.My wife had a concert at Carnegie Hall. We checked into our room that was provided to us by the production company on a Wednesday. She brought with her another 140+ people who were part of her group that stayed at the hotel.On Thursday and Friday the group my wife lead had 3-4 hour rehearsals at the hotel. The hotel could not provide water for her performers because they have no services at the hotel. This was not ideal and was an issue we had to solve without the hotels help.On Saturday the day of the performance at Carnegie Hall my wife and I were locked out of our room the production company provided us. I came back to the room in the afternoon and the key did not work. I went downstairs and got another key. It did not work. I went back downstairs and the manager met me to say she had purposely given me a key that did not work because she wanted to talk with me. The issue was she stated she did not have enough contact information for us listed on her record. Now, the production company reserved our room and paid for it. We had been guests at the hotel now for 4 days. There are ways to communicate to hotel guests other than making their key not work. Leave a message at the desk or on our room phone is a suggestion. When I voiced my disapproval on how she was working with me. She turn around and left me. Please hotel, get your management education on how to deal with guests. After standing there for a few minutes not believing what just happen I went back to the front desk and ask for key that would work. Now, I never gave the manager any updated information on our room because she never stayed long enough to talk with me or ask me again. The person at the front desk told me security had now unlocked our door and she could now issue me a key.On Saturday night after the concert, many of our performers keys would not work when they got back to their room at 2 AM in the morning. It seems the keys that were given to us on Wednesday were programed to not work through our stay on Sunday. Again, this is a management issue.To review if you want a fair priced room, good location, that is clean and has a good bed, but no refrig. or microwave, it is good place to stay. If you must deal with the management, good luck. For this reason I cannot recommend this hotel, nor will I ever stay there again.

We stayed at the Park Central Hotel in Feb '17. All was fine during the week. Room and bathroom were good, nice bar, decent staff. No restaurant - but you're in New York...so not the end of the world. Close to Central Park (obviously) and in a great position to see a lot of Manhattan Island. So what's the problem????When I paid up front for my trip I paid what they called the 'total cost'. Unfortunately they have a very different understanding to the meaning of the word 'total'. When we left they also charged us an additional (and obligatory) $224. This is for Wi-fi and Gym...regardless of whether you want to use that. They put this charge deep in the small print, far below the 'total cost'. What was even worse is that when we questioned this upon check-in we were told this was already included in what we had paid...but at the end they had changed their mind. So liars as well as thieves. We had to queue with various other unhappy customers to complain about the issue. It's just extremely underhand - which leaves a really bitter taste in the mouth. No one likes to be conned, and I hope this review helps others avoid this too.

Good rooms tho not at all roomy. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Nicely located just south of Central Park. Lots of groups over the weekend because of its proximity to Carnegie Hall. But hotel works well with this.

Amazing location, rooms were very spacious and bathroom very cleaned. Myself and a friend stayed for 10nights and it was always lovely to come back to a clean room. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants ease!Only downside is there is not many elevators and sometimes had to wait a while but not too long.Also after a long flight to New York it was nice to relax and just unwind, until the fire alarm went off telling us a bomb had been activated which sent us into panic at 6:00pm at night. VERY scary! Thank-fully it was a malfunction in the system.

Hotel was booked by production company for my wife and her School group for a performance at Carnegie Hall. Basic rooms in hotel. Good bed and clean. No services at the hotel other than a bar. When the group practicred at hotel before concert hotel could not provide water for performers 3 hour rehearsal. Big negative. On 4th day of stay the hotel manager on Saturday afternoon locked my wife and I out of our room. I returned to hotel and found my key would not work. Went downstairs and got another key. That key did not work. Went back downstairs and the hotel manager told me she purposely gave me a bad key because she needed to talk with us. When I questioned her motives for doing that and not contacting us another way she did not like the tone of my voice and walked away. Now we had been in that room for four days and the production company was paying for the room. I had to wait for security to unlock our door and get a third key. If you want a clean basic room at a fair price in a good location it is ok. If you have to deal with the manager it is a very poor place to stay. Until they learn there are other ways to communicate with your guests than locking them out of their room. I will never book a room there. If the production company does for my wife in the future we will ask them to book a different hotel. WHAT A POOR WAY TO COMMUNICATE AND TREAT YOUR GUEST!

Staff at reception on arrival were at best frosty. There are no facilities for food or drinks except a very overpriced kiosk in lobby. Dust all over skirting boards, a socket hanging out the wall and dirty carpets greeted us in our room. The staff, in fairness, tried to help by moving us but the other rooms were equally as poor. They sent housekeeping up to clean but carpet still grotty around the edges. Dressing table drawer fell on my foot. Expensive resort fee of $32 per night added at end of stay. Better places to stay near by.

The hotel was friendly all around, from the moment we entered, and until the moment we left. We truly were treated with a friendly and courteous staff, cleanliness, and outspoken finesse! Thank you ... until we meet again ...

Amazing location, 5 minute walk to Central Park and 10 minute walk to Times Square. Rooms were actually spacious for downtown Manhattan, clean as well and the luggage checking before and after check in/out is very handy. Only downside to the hotel is there is very few elevators and they are slow but other then that I would highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed for 13 nights in January/Feb 2017. We had a low rise corner room which is more expensive but worth it. The hotel appears to have been extensively renovated since our last visit in 2011 and looks great. The location opposite Carnegie Hall and near to Central Park and walking distance to Times Square MOMA and Broadway shows is great for Aussie tourists looking for the NYC experience. Foyer has a small kiosk for snacks on the go. Guest relations staff are professional and helpful. Low rise floors have easy elevator access. Subway nearby a bonus.

On october 10th 2016, we left our room at 10:00am, when we got back at 10:00pm the Engagement and Wedding Rings were missing. Inmediatly we called for security and made the claim, they asked some questions and checked the door lock to see who had entered the room between those hours.They were supposed to contact us on the next day but that did not happen, I tried to contact the Complex Security Director but i didn't succeed on contact him, so we went to NYPD to make a complaint.We had to leave NY and i tried to speak to somebody who could inform me but nobody could give me information about the incident.After sending many emails and making calls to the hotel, 1 month later i recieved an email from the insurance company asking for my statement. 4 months later, I received the outcome of the investigation: Claim Denied because "they are not legally liable for the incident".I'm never staying again in this hotel or any other Lasalle Hotel Properties.

Location is excellent ! Clean, great beds and room as expected. A little pricey for what U get. They have only two elevators and sometimes U find yourself waiting like for an eternity. Service is good, just good, nothing special.

My wife and I visited New York from the 8th-13th Feb 2017 for my 30th Bday! Originally booked up in October last year for a classic double king room. A few days before we were due to leave I received a welcoming email giving me a discounted rate to an upgrade option if available when we check in. I had arranged for a high floor room and the option to upgrade to a premier double king room. Check in was smooth, we arrived early before check in so dropped our suitcases in the luggage hold and made most of the beautiful day in the city. We returned around 7ish, picked up our room key with no issues and got sorted in the room. Room was an adequate size, had a king size bed, 40 plus inch TV and a sofa chair by the window which looked out onto 7th Ave and Times Square. Decor in room was good. However the bathroom was another story. The main door to the bathroom would not open fully due to the incorrect position of the WC, the door was hitting the wc and restricting the swing of the door. As you can see form the pictures.So a bad install of the wc ruined the bathroom layout and access.Showering faculties were ok, had only a fixed head, no freehand head for the close up washes! I soon realises that there was not a fridge in the room,so before setting out I spoke with concierge who were not the most helpful team in the hotel, they told me to speak with Guest relations, they arranged for a fridge to be placed in my room whilst we went out for dinner. Overall customer relations by the check in and concierge staff could be improved, I understand your a very busy hotel with over 700 rooms to look after, but to keep up with other 4 star hotels around the world, you have a long way to go to meet UK/European standards. Other than the above our 4 night stay at the hotel was adequate as we only slept and showered there, being on the go most of day and night.John, one of the Irish bar man is an asset to the hotel, has great customer service and city experience and knowledge.

Park central was In a great location, close to all the essentials in NYC. Customer service could have been better, we requested items ahead of time but none were delivered to our room prior to our arrival so had to wait a day to receive.

Great location for a weekend in Manhattan. Walking distance to the theatre, shopping and Central Park. Several restaurants in the area. Hotel has a friendly bar. Prices are reasonable. I upgraded my room and found it very spacious.

More and more, I'm becoming weary of hotels and their star rating. This is supposedly a 4 star hotel but unlike other 4/5 star hotels I've stayed at it doesn't have the following - room service - pressing/dry cleaning service - in house dining ( aside from lounge) and I travel for business and the above items are actually important to me. I can make do without but I feel this is a misrepresentation.I'm also very irritated that this hotel - which has no in-room dining did not allow my delivery guy bringing food to bring it all the way to my door. Instead even after confirming with me that I asked for the delivery - I had to come downstairs. Furthermore the hotel's "luggage/mail room" is not manned certain hours so if you arrived back at the hotel at 1 am and wanted to pick up packages that were messengered to you - well good luck. The convenience cafe ( they gave no other breakfast/dining options are open for also limited hours. Craving a late night snack in the cold winter? Be prepared to head outdoors. The windows are not double paned and if you're facing the street you will get that whole NYC experience. This is not a problem for me as I'm a sound sleeper but my colleague who stayed next door had the most terrible time falling asleep and needed earplugs. The rooms are basic, clean and well-kept. My hotel experience with the staff was pleasant - my housekeeper was always warm and friendly and the staff was efficient. I just feel that this is definitely a 3 or 3.5 star hotel at most and should declare itself as such.

I was in town for the weekend for a girls' trip with my mom, mother in law, and sister in law. We had a great stay at the Park Central! For the prime location, we were all quite impressed with the value, the relative spaciousness of the rooms, friendly staff, and up-to-date amenities and fixtures. Would definitely recommend to anyone traveling to NYC who wants to be centrally located without having to pay the hefty price tag!

From checking in to checking out the staff were very professional and polite. The room was very clean. The bathroom was immaculate and very modern. My wife and myself will definitely say there again. The location is central in New York City.

Rooms are comfortable, beginning to show some wear after remodel, maid service is excellent. Doormen are extremely friendly and helpful. Miss the car service previously available. Excellent value in NYC

This hotel is centrally located -- very close to Central Park, Time Square, MOMA, Museum of Arts & Design, and restaurants. The best part, though, is that a subway entrance is right on the corner, so it was a breeze getting to Brooklyn, MET, and theaters. WIFI in the rooms was great. We will definitely return.

We were there 4 nights. 1st night the (interior-facing) room had no AT&T cell service, so were without access to family & kids; nowhere to move us that night. Next night, 2nd room, was located at far end of hallway; wife has broken foot & has on a surgical boot. 3rd room was good. Hotel staff tried to be helpful. At checkout we had been charged for bar tab we didn't make; it was the people who got our Room #1. Took front desk 30 minutes to fix, as we were trying to depart.

I love the texting services, room was always clean once I would arrrve... I look forward to coming back.. LIz was a great help, the Doorman were Pleasant and available to help at all times with a question was asked.

I was there on a business trip, and its one of the worst hotels I've stayed in. The room was okay, but there was absolutely no service from the staff. I had a package sent to the hotel, it took them 1 hour to find it. Not a single person smiling, making you feel welcome. Rude and ignorant was the general feeling..

Love this hotel! rooms are bigger than most in New York. Location is amazing, 2 short blocks from Central Park and only a few more the other way to Times Square. No coffee makers in the room. Room was clean and bathroom updated. Bed was soooo comfy! had to wait for elevators quite a while sometimes but it was super busy being New Years. Staff was helpful and friendly. Would def stay there again!

Got a good deal through Travelzoo. Central location, friendly, helpful staff that allowed us to check in early. Modern decor with clean rooms, bathrooms and common areas. No mini bar or coffee maker in room if that's important to you. There's a spot to get coffee and muffins and fruit in the lobby, otherwise great corner deli just steps away. The room we were in on the 10th floor was quiet + comfy beds = good sleep! Strong wifi. Would definitely visit again.

This hotel is in a great spot. Well situated near Central Park and just a short stroll down to Times Square. The rooms are spacious and the beds big. There is a subway station located just on the corner at 55th street, so there is no trouble getting around. If you are looking for a quiet drink would highly recommend the bar, very friendly staff and very happy to greet you. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Park Central New York is our home away from home. Reasons being #1: Quimby Hightower, #2 great accommodations, #3 great views, #4 Quimby Hightower! Quimby was and is still the reason we return. He is such a warm and friendly young man. He takes his job very seriously and makes sure everyone else does too. The rooms are comfortable, clean and spacious for New York. Why would you stay anywhere else. Off season rates are great. But, we stay at the Holidays as well because it is the best. If there is ever a problem, you know it will be addressed.

Got a good price on this hotel through TravelZoo. Centrally located near Time Square, Central Park, Museums. Convenient to subway, too. Room was fine. However, be careful about using the Central Market on site. A bottle of wine ran $38, and it wasn't anything fancy!

The Park Central Hotel is conveniently located near Central Park, Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall, Rockefeller Center, Times Square and Broadway. The hotel staff were friendly, helpful and completely customer service oriented. Our room was spotless.We will definitely return to this hotel.

My wife and I stayed for the night after taking in an event at Madison Square Garden. This hotel is in the perfect location you are in walking distance of Times Square and Broadway shows. A lot of nice restaurants are near the hotel. We asked for early Check in which was no problem with the front desk. Rooms appear to have been updated and they are very clean. When booking on line take the $ 10.00 valet parking if you are driving as it would be $ 40.00 to park on your own. The only issue we had was the garbage trucks out side which were pretty loud in the morning. I think the trucks are from some construction in the area. All in all a great hotel with a great location. Just for your information this hotel offers no restaurant or room service.

Took my mom to nyc for a show! The Park Central staff was wonderful from their prompt response to my inquiries prior to check in to getting us in a car upon check out. I would absolutely stay here again.

All of the staff from doormen to managers were fantastic and professional. The hotel was clean and inviting. The only issue I had was the bathroom doors seem to be a bit worn due to water from the showers. I informed the front desk about it and the manager, Elizabeth, went above and beyond what you could ask someone to do. I told her I was on a family trip and it wasn't a big deal. She took care our of family and made our stay incredible. A must stay if you're planning a trip to NYC.

Great location. Across the street from Carnegie Hall and can easily walk to Times Square, Central Park and other landmarks/neighborhoods. Rooms are spacious and clean with modern decor. Hospitable staff. Would definitely stay here again.

I had family visiting NYC during the Thanksgiving holiday and this hotel worked out great. It's centrally located in Midtown Manhattan. Central park is just three blocks north, Rockefeller Center and Times Square just a few blocks south. It's also conveniently located to many subway lines, making this hotel an excellent choice for getting around the city. The room was small, but clean and manageable for 4 people. Would recommend upgrading to a corner or large room with a mini fridge. The hotel lobby is large and has a nice bar area. The staff were all very nice, friendly and accommodating. Emanuel was especially great and went out of his way to make my family feel welcome. Would recommend this hotel for a Midtown stay.

Great visit. Convenient location to the park, restaurants and bars. Can walk to most areas but cabs are readily available. Would recommend to anyone looking to visit the city for the first time. About a 30 min ride to LaGuradia airport.

Booked a couple of rooms for a family visit to NYC and staff accommodated our location requests. Rooms are modern, immaculately clean and exceptionally quiet. Lobby lounge is perfect for relaxing. The price and location make this hotel one I'll not only recommend to others, but will book for myself again on my next trip to the city.

The Hotel is very nice and the location is key. We were able to walk to Central Park, and walk to Times Square so this was very convenient. We were also really close to a subway station and Columbus Circle.Service could be better since my shampoo wasn't restocked for two days, and when I called Housekeeping one morning to ask for new shampoo, they took almost one hour (and three phone calls) to bring it up to the room. In addition, staff at the Front Desk and Customer Service desk were not very friendly when I asked them for the online packages I ordered online. In two opportunites I had to have them check for my packages because they said they hadn't recieve them, but they had.

I stayed at the Park Central Hotel for 3 nights for work. The hotel was nice, great location a few blocks from Central Park and a couple blocks the other way from Times Square. The gym is nice as well.The best part about the hotel is the people. I ended up needing to extend my stay by merging two reservations which I anticipated would be a pain. I went to the front desk this morning to try to consolidate those bookings to avoid having to change rooms. Shpressa greeted me immediately when I approached and was very friendly. In a matter of a few moments, she had me taken care of without any issues.Most any hotel has people who can accomplish merging a reservation, however it was the manner in which Shpressa did it that impressed me. She truly made me feel like a valued and important guest. Her smile and great attitude are infectious, and I couldn't help but to be in a better mood after interacting with her.The next time I am in NYC, I will be staying at the Park Central Hotel largely in part due to the excellent service and caring demeanor of Shpressa. You can find a bed in any of several thousand hotels around this city, but people like Spressa are one in a million.

We arrived earlier than expected and had hoped to just be able to drop off our luggage at the hotel. We were greeted warmly and efficiently at the front desk where they were happy to take care of our needs.

We had an excellent experience at this hotel, arriving for a family party, and then extending our stay due to an emergency situation. Angela at the front desk went above and beyond to assist us, and we are grateful. The staff at this hotel are five star all the way!Staying in the month of January, we found the prices to be very reasonable for NY, although we do object to an automatic $31 additional "facilities fee", since there was nothing special about the facilities it includes, and it is always an unpleasant surprise to think you know the price per night, only to find out is $31 higher. Make sure to look for this fee when pricing your stay.That being said, this is a very convenient and super clean hotel in a great location for getting around Manhattan. It is definitely not a hotel for a special, romantic occasion, but it is great for tourism and business.The lobby of the hotel is gorgeous, with ample seating to consume light fare from the grab and go "market" that takes the place of a restaurant. It is convenient if you are in a rush, and the coffee is fabulous. The lobby has the aura of a five star hotel, while the rooms are more like a four star hotel. They are extremely clean and comfortable, but lack the super comfy mattresses and bathroom amenities, like shower caps, that other hotels provide. In theory you can ask for them, but calling and waiting for a shower cap when you are in a hurry to get out is not very practical.The first room we had was on the fifth floor, overlooking Seventh Avenue, and at that level you could hear all the street noises of the city. The second room was on the seventh floor, with the dreariest view of an ugly courtyard with machinery, and rooms on all sides around you. So we closed the shade for privacy and enjoyed the peace and quiet.The room itself was very pleasant and spotlessly clean, which is the most important criteria for us. The location was amazing, near Carnegie Hall and lots of transportation. Far enough away from Broadway that you aren't submerged in a sea of tourists, but accessible to lots of restaurants and shops. If Times Square is too frenetic for you, this may be your happy place.

From the very first friendly greeting at the curb by the doorman (who later smilingly tucked us into a cab to Penn Station on our way home), this was an A+ experience. The staff couldn't have been friendlier, from the front desk to the maids. Our train arrived before noon, and there was no problem checking in early. Our rooms (I was traveling with my sister) were spacious by New York standards and spotless. Loved the stylish bathroom and its amenities! A Travelzoo deal brought me here by chance, and I'd stay here again in a hot second.

I stay at the Park Central when I have to go to NYC for a quick business trip. I generally drive into the city so with many hotels the valet service can be a nightmare. The Park Central has a lot of space in front of the hotel to pull a car up for valet along the curb without causing any traffic issues. This is a huge headache relief. The rooms are nothing extraordinary and tend to be small but clean.

The place is gorgeous, clean, it is full of people consistently. It has a nice touch of "I'm an expensive place but not really." We arrived at 12, check-in is at 4. We went due to our friend getting married, they completely were amazing at accommodating our need of a room that had the best view, they are not known for this so if you really want a great view of times square do not think this will be it. However we were given a room on the 16th floor, they have 24 levels. The view was still great! We could see a tinge of times sqaure hahaha. We waited up until 3:40 to check on the status of our room, it wasn't ready and we needed to get another room because that one (the original room) has an "incident". They told us to wait in the lobby or bar. As we waited we were just a bit confused to what we were going to do so my friend and i went to the customer relations. Elizabeth Cacovic, she was just amazing! She moved us to a higher level room (16th floor) and also gave us 4 complimentary drinks at the bar for our wait. It was an incredible night thanks to her! She was super super helpful. Honestly all the staff was AMAZING! One of them even told us she'd love to hook us up with a drink or two for Sunday but sadly our time ran short. The luggage claim gentlemen, for Saturday was GREAT super patient with me and my friend because we were a hot mess going in and out of that suitcase. The room was super clean and beautiful. The have a TUB! I was slightly disappointed i couldn't take a bubble bath because i think the plug was broken but it was fine i got over it. Best place to go for a great stay!

This was a great hotel. I couldn't have asked for a cleaner, more centrally located hotel. The hotel was 2 minutes from Times Square and 2 minutes from Central Park. Lots of restaurants in the area. The staff was excellent and very accommodating. Highly recommend!! I'll be back!!! Also very close to shows.

All the receptionist were not welcoming at all, not helpful and mean!Even when I call the standard to help me to book additional nights, they were not concerned.It is the worst service I had in a long time...To avoid at all time.The even charge 31$ + taxes per night on top of the booking to provide extra services we can not even use (printing 2 documents was impossible for them).The argue back at us when we said they don't even provide the service we pay extra for.

There are nice things to say about the Park Central- cordial front desk staff, clean, comfortable, quiet room and good location. The cons are the odd cleaning smell when entering the front lobby... less than desirable. The other is the barely visible Service Charge in the agreement details at a surprising add'l $33 per night. I'm not a fan of these tactics... I may return. But, I'll be sure to check the fine print....

Friendly and helpful staff. Easy check-in/check-out. I got a deal online and the price was great considering good location walking distance from everything tourist-Manhattan and metro station 1 block away to get to other locations. Tons of great restaurants, but keep in mind it’s a prime location and prices are higher than other areas. Very clean and modern room. I was a solo traveler and the room was spacious for me, but I think it would be a tight fit for a family – again, this is prime real estate. Loved the room, only missed not having a coffee maker. One thing, this was simply a place to stay for me, I didn’t try to use any of the amenities, and my interaction with staff was minimal and to the point. But I really enjoyed my stay there and wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again.

Absolutely recommend park central for your stay in NY, clean, friendly staff, and not far from anywhere really just a few blocks. king size bed quite comfortable and room is spacious Nicest bathroom ive seen for long time, Australia, NZ & USA.

Really happy I stayed there. It was my first time in New York and I was worried about choosing a hotel. Park Central was more than I could wish for. It was right across the street from Carnegie Hall, around the corner from the best Indian restaurant I've ever eaten in (Benares at 240 West 56th St.), a couple blocks from Central Park, Broadway, Times Sq. Only thing I wish they had was a friendlier looking more cozy lounge/bar. After a day walking my feet off it would have been nice to relax but I found the space too business like. It's ultra modern but not my style. I found one a few blocks away that was incredible - it was at the hotel - Le Parker Meridien (the Knave) at 119 W. 56th St. It was the most beautiful elegant lounge I've ever had a drink in. I ordered a martini and relaxed in the luxurious old world atmosphere, the music was sublime and the complimentary tray of nuts etc was a real surprise. But getting back to Park Central Hotel - it was great.

The hotel is immaculate and location great. The hotel bar area is pretty but boring- they have a huge screen which just shows repetitive pictures of NYC. I left and walked s few blocks to a nearby bar to watch the Ranger Game that was on. Was so disappointed that I couldn't have a drink and watch it at the hotel Z

We spend 5 nights with family in 4 diferente bedrooms and all rooms was nice and clean, no complaints at all. Friendly staff and so helpful lady on concierge help us to buy a good and cheap tour services. I will come back next month again to new york this time for work purposes and i go to stay again at the same hotel, Excellent Location !!!

the park central hotel is good looking in every respect. our room with 2 queen beds was very comfortable, very clean, in a quiet location on the 3rd floor, facing the back, and quite big by NYC standards. staff was accommodating, but some front desk employees were neither knowledgable about the city nor as courteous as expected. i can recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Trendy hotel in the heart of the city. Perfect location for shoppers & show-goer's ! Subway located right outside the doors of the hotel makes for easy access to the downtown area ! Hotel staff were extremely helpful and accommodating. We stayed in a "Classic King Suite" it was a bit small, but REMEMBER you're in NYC, this is very typical!!! Room was clean and very comfortable! Will definitely be returning to this hotel in the near future :)

We stayed here 1/2017, we were in town for a play and decided to spend the night.The room was very clean, and slightly bigger than your average NYC hotel (which is still pretty small, but not unbearably so).We used an app to book the room, so we got a really good rate. Unfortunately, because we used the app, I was not aware of the $31 facility fee until it was too late. Additionally, I was unable to choose my room options and could not get a king bed, we had to settle for 2 queens. Still, all in it came to about 150 .. which is pretty darned good considering the location. The other pitfall of the app was I missed out on the 'breakfast voucher'. Which apparently cost $1 and gets you a pastry and a coffee in the lobby snack counter. I did not book through TripAdvisor, so maybe they have these options listed. They had no restaurant, but there are plenty of options locally. The night of the show, we ate and drank at 'Characters' which is only a few blocks away to the south. The food was reasonably priced, and we really enjoyed it. Before leaving, the next day, we 'lunched' at PJ Carney's pub and they were also a very good deal. Both had great atmosphere. I will try and get to review them separately. There was no view from my room, which was a drag, but other than that its a great place to stay.

I stayed at the Park Central Hotel recently and can not tell you how happy I was with the staff, the room and the whole experience from being able to check in and have a room ready right away so that I could get settled in and start enjoying the Big Apple!! The room had lots of space and was very clean!!!! We were very close to Times Square and lots of great restaurants!!! Will definitely recommend to friends and family!!! I'll be back!!!!Ken Kerner

Rooms were very nice and clean and pretty big for New York City. Nice decor and a great location. A few blocks from Times Square and a few blocks from Central Park. Big problem is no food. The crappy little cafe fills a small void but nothing on the property. Good thing there are dozens of places around the hotel. Obviously no room service either. But great price for the quality and location.

Cannot beat the location. Centrally located between the theater district and Lincoln Center. 2 blocks from Central Park In walking distance of the great museums. On top of convenient subway station. If you can snag an offseason rate grab it.

Park Central is a great hotel for easy access to Central Park (about 2 blocks), Carnegie Hall (across the street) and, if it was still open, the Carnegie Deli (across the street). You're a stone's throw from Broadway if you're in NYC for a show and a block from the subway if you want to go elsewhere (14 minute ride to the Flatiron district, for example).They have good room deals on their own site, including a rate w/ parking included for an extra $10. So there are no surprises, there is a $33.75 resort fee that is separate from the rate. (The website does note this.) A two-night Thursday-Saturday stay with the parking deal was under $400. Overall, given location, prices aren't bad normally and parking is $65/night without the package, which is comparable to other hotels in the area.The staff is accommodating and friendly but this is not a 4- or 5-Diamond hotel, so expecting that type of service may cause disappointment. (I work in a 4-Diamond.) It did not disappoint us -- the Bell Captain was prompt on arrival; Front Desk staff was quick and competent; baggage check was easy; the room was clean and well appointed. Valet at the end of our stay was very fast.Two quick notes -- you need your room key to use the elevator at all times, so don't leave without it, and the shop in the lobby is open until 8:30PM. (It sells wine/champagne if you want a bottle.)We'd definitely stay again.

so I got some packages delivered from Amazon. Service is really poor. No accountability. They point each other including the Manager. No one smiles, no one offers you any extra service. Associates in the coat check and packages received look at you as if you are not welcomed there. the worst service in any place in the States I have been to.

arrived 25th November-2nd December. Well where do I start first of all this was suppose to be a honeymoon we got greeted by a not very welcome receptionist. we then had to take our bags to the room even though other people were being offered a porter. I'm guessing paying £2.700 is still not enough to get a porter. I had emailed ahead and said this was our honeymoon to which I was told we had been upgraded to on of the preferred rooms. Then we arrive in the room just a standard room nothing special at all about it so I wouldn't like to know what the standard rooms are if this was a preferred room. it started off with no welcome pack at all not even phone numbers to ring or anything what hotel doesn't have a welcome pack. Then we notice know tea or coffee making facilities again who has ever been to a hotel and not had that I mean that's pretty standard surely for every hotel. I paid £20 a day each extra for breakfast well if I had know what it was gonna be I woulda saved my money. so we get given these cards for breakfast, we go down our breakfast choice was one of the following;plain croissantplain muffin chocolate muffinblueberry muffina piece of fruit applebanana orangeteawaterorange juicecoffeeThat's it. I'm sorry but that is not worth £20 where is the eggs, bacon, toast. plus if you wanted anything extra like apple juice or a pan au chocolate that was about $5 extra per item.Another issue we had with this hotel is that on our 3rd day it was raining very hard allday so we have come back to our hotel room wet and cold so we turned the heating on to dry our clothes and warm us up but after 20 mins I realised the heater unit was just blowing air not hot at all just normal air. I went down to reception to be told that they don't turn the heating on through the building unless it was below 50 degrees. well what if I was an old couple that were shivering to death nope cant help you can get as much aircon as you want but no heat at all.Then to top it all off you get charged $30 a day for stuff that 90% of people will never use apart from the bag drop.these include unlimited local and domestic phone calls within the usa not internationalunlimited use of the fitness centreluggage storage upon arrival and/or departureapple workstations with printing faxing and scanning.There is no way of getting out of this charge either.The bed sheets weren't changed the whole week we were there which I think is disgusting they should at least change them once in the week. We took our own but the shower gel and shampoo were empty when we arrived so had to ask twice for these to be filled. yes we took our own but they should be provided.The location of the hotel was great right near central park a short walk from times square but that was the only plus we got out of the hotel

Stayed as per a Hotwire booking, called ahead for a quiet room but upon arrival was told I had been reserved into a 4th floor room facing the street. After much hassle, was transferred to a 10th floor room which was still extremely noisy. Soundproofing is pretty awful. Bathroom reeked of cigarette smoke, got so bad I ended up waking up coughing in the middle of the night. Called the manager to request a refund, but the manager, Sandy, copped an attitude and said she'd have to send up an engineer. Ended up staying up another half-hour, only for the engineer to come, feign innocence, and for Sandy to deny that there was any smell at all. Though refusing to admit any issue with the room at all, management refunded the small resort fee and refused to refund the room. I don't know how you could call this place a resort. Absolutely awful, worst hotel of its class in years, and so I urge you to go elsewhere, like the Hilton Garden Inn, where I went the night after. Atrocious!

The gym was nice. The bed comfortable. Everything was clean. I had a nice view of 7th Ave and the location is great! I am happy I checked on the website so I could ask for a coffee maker and refrigerator be brought to my room as they don't automatically come with them. Make sure you ask in advance! The coffee downstairs is quite good.

The hotel is in an excellent location opposite Carnegie Hall and just a few minutes from Central Park. It is modern and busy with clean rooms and lots of seating space to meet friends downstairs.Some other reviewers mention the staff being unfriendly but I had no problems with any of them and never had to wait long for assistance at the desk.It is a pity that there is only a limited range of food and drink available at the hotel and no kettles or coffee makers in the room, but with a Starbucks next door and lots of cheap cafes very close it isn't really a problem - we had breakfast in a selection of these over our stay.

From the check-in with charming staff to the fast elevators to the upgraded room. After one restful sleep - I'm sold. I am going focus this review on the bathroom. For women - the mirror is everything ! No lighting Bad lighting Uo then nose lighting. Not here. The mirror has lights surrounding it a full face illumination. Also the counter top has enough room for Women's stuff. Truly some hotel bathrooms designed thinking you wouldn't be brining a toothbrush let alone some makeup. Plus the shower is delightful. I really like a gently rain shower to wake me up. Photos of the toiletries in shower / bath are curious. Likely a little error that no shampoo provided. Only criticism is that their workspace is minimal. Photo illustrates more space given to a TV than a space to do some work as I am here in business with a laptop. Otherwise. I'd return here again!

Stayed here years ago and loved the location....great deals available for one night stay. I was pleasantly surprised with the renovated lobby and rooms. My friends were impressed with the accommodations too.

Overall this hotel was modern and very busy/popular. The location right between midtown and central park was great. Lots of good restaurants near by and Broadway is right around the corner. Only drawback was no restaurant located in the hotel.

Good location....large and clean rooms.....able to check in early..... accommodating when we needed a later checkout....very affordable room rates....plenty of places to eat that will fit your budget..always a pleasant stay!

This hotel has improved greatly since I was last here (5 years ago) in that they have renovated the rooms to be more modern. The location is good, too; very close to the subway & Central Park. However, the hotel is so overcrowded and the elevators are so slow that getting anywhere takes a very long time. I stay in a lot of hotels, and the other problem is the lack of any sort of soundproofing from the outside noise (or next door, for that matter).

Clean, modern, relatively spacious. Very good lounge downstairs. There is a Starbucks right outside, but americsno/espresso I've had inside a little coffee shop was even better. Location is priceless.

The price is very good as well as the location (very close to time square) and that is why you have to accept some of the challenges. It is a very touristy hotel for the masses.The pros about this hotel are: - rates/central location/ overall OK rooms, nice big TV's. I have been there often and hotel improves yearly especially the cleaningness has improved. The cons are: some rooms are loud (lower levels) and have a bad view (brick wall), my worse issue is the ancient heating system/air condition which is way to loud. I needed to turn it off daily otherwise the noise did not let me sleep or was totally annoying. This time I got bitten by ... we do not know. The staff is either GREAT or BAD with attitude, nothing in between. It was really annoying to book the hotel for a very special rate and than (in small letters easy to over read) you get charges USD 30 per day for internet and other facilities. Not cool the way they add this but my fault to over look this phrase.Generally I would recommend this hotel if you do not look for a fancy, personal high class hotel. This is a good and improving middle class hotel which is generally clean and the rates are great!

This hotel is in a great location easy walking distance to the theaters, great restaurants, and central park. Also easy access to metro line to Battery Park and areas in between. Did not have a lot of interaction with staff but it was easy to check-in and staff even accommodated my friend and I by changing our room from a king to two queens. Room size was adequate (bathroom was very spacious) didn't have a great view but we were not in the room very much. Bed was very comfortable and even thou our room was right across from the elevators the room was fairly quite (except sirens from the street).

We had a wonderful experience staying at the Park Central Hotel. Upon check-in, the front desk staff accommodated our request to have 2 rooms near each other and she included breakfast vouchers that were not originally included with our room (we booked through a 3rd party). The rooms were beautiful, clean, and comfortable. The staff at the Central Market (where you get your free breakfast) was rude, but everything else about our stay was so great I still give it 5 stars.
