The location of the hotel is perfect for sight seeing. So many of the things we wanted to see and do were a 5-15 minute walk from the hotel.

My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon for the weekend of 5th Jan to the 9th.The hotel decor was great, rooms were comfortable and spacious enough. All staff we encountered were very good and friendly. Check in was seamless.I would've liked tea/coffee making facilities in the room but due to the fact there is a coffee shop within the hotel it would take trade away from that....! Some people were complaining about the lifts in the hotel but we never waited very long for one a few minutes at most and didn't have a problem with them.Only a few minor points the bar in the hotel wasn't open on the Sunday afternoon/early evening while we were there which was a shame as we had to go next door. The decor even though stylish needed to be sharpened up a bit more but then I probably notice it more as it's my trade.Overall I would definitely recommend staying here and wouldn't hesitate to return.

I stayed here over a snowy, winter weekend with some girlfriends. We didn't spend much time inside the hotel, but it was conveniently located, clean and well kept. The valet parking and Starbucks attached to the building provided convenience to us as well. The rooms were a good size and the staff was accommodating to our needs - sending up extra towels and a sewing kit upon request. Would definitely stay here again!

I found this hotel in a TravelZoo email. They offered a great deal for one night. I arranged the second night on my own; more expensive but still worth it. Great location. Comfortable room. Friendly, efficient staff. Spacious lobby which we are using right now before our Broadway matinee and then the bus ride home. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone with reasonable NYC expectations and needs.

The hotel is located within walking distance of all Midtown sights as well as Central Park. The rooms are large, clean and are reasonably quiet! There is no restaurant in the hotel, only a small outlet for breakfast and coffee. All the more reason to go out early and have breakfast in one of the amazing little coffee places in the vicinity. Only downside would be the waiting time for the elevators...

Stayed 5 days for business recently. There's no restaurant, but that's a bonus as it keeps the hotel nice and quiet - a welcome respite. However there's a great bar. Very close to Central Park (obviously) and Times Square. Will stay there next time I'm in town.

Great deal to stay near central park and the 5th avenue stores, the rooms are very comfortable and clean, staff was helpfull and the wi-fi service is ok. The best here is the location and the comfortable room!

Arriving at Park central the reception Said we where upgraded to their neighbor hotel and that all amenities where included and it's five star. We where led thru some back door to the other hotel. Well there they didn't have the type of room we had booked. Had to wait thirty minutes and at the end we had to take a smaller room and then change after one night. Bad. At check out they charged something like 150 dollars for amenities. Which of course was wrong. Didn't have time to fight because I had a plane to catch. So instead I advise everyone here DONT BOOK THIS HOTEL. More: how can a five star hotel not serve a drink before 5 pm? I find that quite Amazing. Breakfast was worse then a 90 dollar motel. Stay away.

Loved staying at this hotel, the location to everything was perfect! Short 8 blocks to Time Square, and 3 blocks to Central Park! We booked a room through travelzoo with included the "facility fee" so there were no extra charges when we arrived, and booked 2 queen beds but the beds were doubles not queen size. Room was made up every day by the time we came back to the room from exploring. Clean towels daily, beds were comfortable, decent size room... Nothing to complain about! :) If I had to say one negative, it was the fan/heater, was quite loud and if you are a light sleeper you may want to bring ear plugs.

I stayed three times here and it is getting worse. First of all, front desk staffs are ridiculously unfriendly, talking to fast with a poker face, asking me to repeat my words when I checked in (I am experienced business traveler), like mocking my non-native English (I got the staff name but not proper to reveal that here). Rooms are not clean, especially bathtub. Most of all, I really hate the scary toilet picture which makes me surprised everytime. And you need to cross the street to have sit down breakfast.

We checked in on New Years Day 2017. The guy at the front desk was helpful enough but a little abrupt. But the hotel itself was great. The amenities were fantastic and the location of the hotel is perfect. Would definitely recommend.

It's our third visit at Park Central Hotel and once again, we had a great time.This place is amazingly well located (between Central Park and Time Square). Our room was really clean and comfortable. The hotel was quiet and we were able to have 2 great nights of sleep.The only thing that prevent me from giving 5 stars was the time we had to wait for the valet parking when we arrived at the hotel. I can understand there is less people working at the hotel when you arrive later (10:30pm), but waiting more than 20 minutes in our car before deciding to unload our luggages ourselves to check-in, was way too long.I will still book this hotel on my next trip to NYC.

This was our first trip to New York! A friend recommended this hotel. It was great! Way better then I expected! Clean, service was great, & the location was excellent! Definitely will stay here again!

The Hotel has a great location in easy walking distance of many of the top attractions in New York which was a big bonus. The staff were helpful and friendly particularly at the check in desk and the barman who served us who turned out to be originally from Dublin a place where my wife lived for a couple of years. Before travelling I read a few reviews that said that the service was not particularly good and I was concerned, however this was not my experience with the exception of a slightly grumpy lady from housekeeping who was unhappy that we were still in our room a few minutes prior to the check out time. The room was newly renovated with a comfortable king size bed and decent views. The only draw backs were the elevators of which there were too few causing quite a waiting time and led to them being cramped. I do however understand that increasing their number would be difficult and costly.Overall a good hotel at a good price.

Staying in Nyc for 3weeks in different hotels can be a challenge Look no more Park Central has beautiful cozy rooms, great maids, guest services are 100% there to please you Everything is in the neighborhood from theatre to restaurants, shopping I hope u get to enjoy it as I am

We have stayed at the Park Central Hotel New York several times now. Four to be exact, we have been impressed with the facility throughout every stay. The rates, location and rooms were fantastic. From the Bellman to the concierge, to the front desk to the maid service everything was top notch. The rooms are modern, clean and updated and again as indicated the location is fantastic. We look forward to returning to Manhattan and staying at the Park Central again.

From the moment I arrived until the afternoon I left my stay at Park Central was perfect! The staff at check in/checkout great and the hotel was wonderful! Lot's of awesome history behind this hotel through the years. My room was much bigger than expected and the bed so comfortable. The room I had gave me a very cool view of the Water towers and street below and the sudden snow storm added to the beauty. The location of this hotel can't be any better! I was able to walk to Central Park in minutes as well as Times Square and Rockefeller Plaza. The doorman was so great as I was waiting for my shuttle and made me feel as if I was a celebrity with his attention to making sure I was sent off to the airport. Do yourself a favor and book a room here!

When we first entered the room, we found under one bed a dirty men´s sock, a lipstick, a chewing gum, wrapping debris and a 5 days old pharmacy ticket. Also there was a lack of lights in the room, just the bed lamp between the two queen beds and nothing more... except the bathroom lights of course. We scarcely saw each other, less the luggage contents. Even though when contacting the front desk we obtained an acceptable response, we didn´t get any manager apologize of any kind. When checking out I had to complain for a 31 dollar extra charge in my bill. Again they solve that immediuately but.... The good part is that the hotel is very well located and employees are very nice.

Excellent location and excellent price for a clean and roomy double. Would highly recommend this hotel. We had an unexpected snowstorm and were still able to navigate on foot to theater and an excellent restaurant because there are so many fine options within walking distance.

I've stayed at the Park Central so many times that it feels like home. The mid-town location, price, room size and amenities make it a welcome place to stay. I highly recommend it. You can walk to Central Park or Times Square and still get a quiet night's sleep.

This hotel has such a feeling of grandeur when you walk in. The lobby is very spacious and open. But i felt it wasn't cozy or welcoming. It has a fancy don't touch kind of feel. The staff though are so pleasant and kind and willing to make your stay exceptional that it really makes up for the distant feeling the hotel itself gives off. The room was a decent size. King size bed. The closet was a good size. And it had a few convenient furniture like a bench, a chaise, night tables, desk etc. The bathroom was clean and big. The mirror in the bathroom was my favorite. It was the perfect mirror for applying makeup. And their toiletries are one of my favorites. They have full size installed bottles of C.O. Bigelow Chemist shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. Giving your stay a spa like feel. Close to all Central Park, Times Square and other great lamdmarks. Public transport close as well. Lots of good places to eat nearby.

We've stayed at the Park Central now for several years. We like to visit NYC right after New Year's -- the city still is decorated for the holidays (until 6 January), and Park Central is perfectly located. It's a few blocks from the Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree, just a 10-minute walk to Times Square (passing lots of decorated store windows along the way), and Central Park. If you're lucky, it'll even snow!

We got a great deal from Travelzoo first week in January one night stay just over $100. Didn't plan on spending any time in the room other than sleep but we were happily surprised with a very comfortable, clean, modern room. The king-size bed felt great after much walking. The bathroom a bit small, not a problem except a hook on the inside of the door would be most helpful. No mini frig or coffee maker. There is a Starbucks right on the corner. Agree that the elevator wait can be long. Agree that the $30+ facilities fee is ridiculous. (Ours was covered, the Travelzoo Top 20 deal really was great!)

Really nice stay. The man working yesterday around noon at the guest relations desk was very nice and accommodating when me and my boyfriend decided to stay an extra night. He helped us get into a room earlier which was very convenient. House keepers were nice and respectful. Will likely return thanks to the kind staff.

Right price for the location. Quick check in, spacious room, clean bed, large TV with cable channels. Also provides luggage storage after checking out. Less than 10 mins walk to Times Sq and Central Park. Nothing to complain about really.

We stayed in the room next to the elevator, convenient but noisy, especially in the mornings. Beds are just okay. Clean rooms. The phone was not hooked up, couldn't find the phone jack. Reported it when checked out, the agent did not seem very concerned about it. Free Wi fi worked great both in the lobby and our room. The elevators are a little slow, had to wait every time we took it. The hotel offers free 15 min. max usage of their mini business center for internet use and printing. No limit on how many times you can use it per day. No restaurant in the hotel.

Stayed at the Park Central for 5 nights during the New Years Eve, Staff were very helpful especially the Guest Relations team, Breakfast was pastry, drink and fruit for a dollar. Rooms lovely and clean with fresh linen everyday. Great location for all the attractions Only criticism there was not enough elevators for a busy period during New Year.

We always stay in this boutique hotel. Very clean and rooms the right size. It is close to Central Park and Fifth Ave. We love the location. The only glitch I find is the dim lighting in the rooms. I have shared with administration and they have offered extra lamps. I recommend it.

I've stayed here many times and I'm happy each time. It's a quiet hotel in a perfect location. Close to everything and the subway. I do not like the $36/night that they charge you for the "Facilities fees" to use their lousy treadmill and computer room, but that seems to be the only part I don't like. The bag check is nice, but to make that a part of the facility fee is absurd. You still tip the guys....

Spent a week in NYC celebrating my parents anniversary. We used VRBO but the reservation fell through last minute. We decided to spend our last couple days here. It was a great hotel, located close to the Broadway shows we were seeing and very close to Central Park. It made for a nice run to the park in the morning, before we started our day!

Hotel is clean, modern, nicely appointed. It's walking distance to Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center, Times Square and the theater district. There's a subway station for the NRW line on the same block. A CVS two blocks away, Wells Fargo ATM a block away and plenty of restaurants within steps. The bad: This is a non-smoking hotel, yet a room near us with a do not disturb sign on the handle emitted cigarette smoke and marijuana smoke night and day for days. The hallway reeked of pot smoke and cigarette and got into our rooms. Calls to the front desk and they're saying they'd send security as well as approaching the manager at Guest Relations did nothing to abate it. We were told they couldn't knock on the door to address it as that would be "harassment." They could only address it if they saw it. Never mind the stench of smoke in the common hallway. Meanwhile we suffered with headaches and the smoke. We were told the room was unoccupied, which was a joke as we saw people going in and out. When we complained again for the 3rd day, the manager told us, "the occupants are checking out today." Our two room party of 4 won't stay here again because the smoking and the lingering smoke that affected us all wasn't addressed. There are plenty of other hotels near here. There is no coffee maker. One must go down to the lobby market for coffee and breakfast snacks. However, there were LONG waits for the very small two elevators. We'd go up in the elevator just to be able to be ON the elevator in order to go down. Get the $1 breakfast deal as this is a huge cost saver. It includes coffee or tea, bottle of water or orange juice. apple, orange or banana, a muffin or croissant. Again, if you don't care if someone smokes next to you and the hotel doesn't care, or you want to smoke -- you won't be tossed out, and you want to be close to Central Park, this is for you. Not for us next time.

Hotel is priced right for Time Square. Great location very clean, friendly staff quick check in. Very comfortable bed large TV, fantastic value. 2 blocks from Central Park, Carnegie Hall is across the street.

This was my first time staying at the Park Central Hotel and I can say without a doubt that I'll be back. Not only were the rates reasonable, the location of this hotel is just about perfect! We could see Time Square, but weren't too close and Central Park was a mere 3 blocks away. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms were average in size and nicely decorated as were the halls and lobby.

We loved our stay at Park Central Hotel! We were so close to Times Square that on New Year's Eve (our last night) we were able to watch the Times Square count down and ball drop from right outside our hotel entrance. The only thing that would have made it better would have been a room with a Times Square view but there was none available when we made the reservations (which was on the very night we arrived at NYC because Expedia messed up the reservations we had already had at another hotel). The only caution with that would be that since the rooms can be a little warm during the winter months just open one of the three windows just a crack and therefore be careful with little ones just in case. Although there is no restaurant right on the property, you can enjoy the many other restaurants right around the hotel or the rest of the city or you have a convenient "grab-and-go Central Market" and also a bar in the lobby. Anyway we are just grateful for Park Central having availability on the very day we arrived and we were very pleased with the accommodations and the location.

This hotel has such potential. Near Central Park, a short walk to 5th ave. and Times Square and price. Reserved two rooms – both city view queen. The lay outs were totally different. Room 462 had two queen beds and a full good sized bathroom and the city view did face 7th ave., but the view was of the roof. There are no amenities such as a coffee make, microwave or fridge. Room 426 also 2 queen room had a view of a brick wall and the bathroom was very small with small shower and no tub. Housekeeping didn’t do a good job – it looked as though they left mid-job. One bed was half made, the towels were still on bathroom floor and they left the duster. The rooms were also short of towels on arrival. The beds were very comfortable, clean and quiet. The fact that we wanted adjoining or connecting rooms never made it to the reservation, but they would try and get us on the same floor.The lobby is nicely decorated with lots of seating. It is located behind the check in desk. We had our breakfast there. You can add breakfast when you make a reservation for only $1 per person. We were told that you could have 1 beverage, 1 fruit and 1 pastry. The choices for the beverage were water, coffee, juice and fruits were orange, apple or banana. The pastry choices were limited to muffin or croissant, not much of a choice considering they were out of croissants. The problem with the hotel is hidden charges. Tried to make reservation on line-rooms at $261, but the website wasn’t working so I had to call the hotel and central reservation said they would give me the same room for $290. I told them it was $261 on line he told me then book on line I had told him site was down. After a discussion he connected me to hotel directly. The first person I spoke to couldn’t help, so I was connected to a second person. They said they would match the price but I had to pay in advance. I upgraded room so the price became $272 per night. I requested adjoining or connecting rooms because we had children with us. He gave me the total I gave him the credit card and the reservation was made. Later I went to print up the confirmations and when I read them the prices were totally different. They were $268.50 for the first night and $295.00 for second night plus $32.66 per night per room for a Facility fee. The Facility fee cover things that even the most basic hotels give for free – Wi-Fi and gym. There was no mention of this fee when I made reservation and no mention of a $30 jump in price for second night. I called hotel about discrepancies and they said I paid in advance so tough luck. I asked to speak to manager – not any more help. They said they would do a refund, which I couldn’t do because I had paid for 6 airline tickets based on the reservation and we were leaving the next day. I decided to speak to management when I arrived, but wasn’t able to do so until I was leaving. She wasn’t the friendliest of people. She called (or pretended to call) the agent I spoke with and asked him if he told me about the $32.66 and the higher rate. She told me he said he had, really? He remembered me and the call, I’m sure. I told her that was a bold face lie. She finally said she wouldn’t charge me the $32.66 per room per night, but she wasn’t going to do anything about the room rate. If you stay here be specific in your reservation and remember the $32.66 a night fee.

Hotel rooms are spacious and clean. Pillows aren't firm but beds are comfortable. Bathroom is roomy and shower is great. Hotel staff was fun and friendly if you're fun and friendly - we enjoyed speaking and joking with them.

We stayed here for Thanksgiving. We were at their best suite. Terrible stay. The hotel claims they have renovated their suites, There was mold, carpet was dirty,elevators not working properly and staff was clueless including the managers. What a waste aof money. Do not recommend this hotel at all.

I've stayed at this hotel several times and booked through Travelzoo each time to get a great rate. I like that it's just a few blocks away from Central Park and 5th Avenue shopping. Also, the market within the hotel is great for a quick snack, and the Tisserie coffee shop just outside the front door has fantastic scones, egg dishes and coffee. The rooms are consistently clean and modern, and I'd say this hotel seems quieter than many midtown Manhattan hotels.

When you book a room, first I caution you as they charge a "mandatory" service fee for random calls, internet access, Seventh St gym access, and one other item for almost $33 per day. The room booking does not guarantee you a king bed if that is your request. We learned this upon arriving from a European trip and extremely long flight for this 6'5" man. I arrived at the hotel about 10:00 pm although called them the night before making them aware of this and requesting a definitive king size bed. I was assured I would receive a king size as my feet hang over any other size. This did not turn out to be the case. My first night after my long flight was spent sleepless as my legs were cramping. They moved me the next day to room 1734 that had cockroaches! Additionally, the front desk gave my room key to another guest who entered at 10:30 pm. I was sleeping and my wife was in the bathroom! I was furious on all counts. Later that same night, at 1:30 am, a maid accessed my room stating that a request for a towel had been called in, however, she had no towel with her. Hmmmmmm. Security?????? We moved again. This hotel did little to compensate for all my room moves, the lack of security and privacy, etc. While the location is good, customer service is an oxymoron! Would recommend the Sheraton just two blocks closer to Times Square!!!!

The room with two single beds was pretty small but warm and well functioning and I experienced no problems whatsoever during my stay. The view to a side street ok. The style of decorating was modern, the lobby area was both fancy and somehow too big to make me feel at home and guests were not quite seen by the staff unless you asked about something, then they were quick and helpful. For you who appreciate location it is excellent, next to Carnegie Hall and the iconic Carnegie Deli Restaurant and surrounded by lot's of nice places to eat and hang out.

Nice and friendly place in perfect location. Free wifi in the whole place. The rooms are nice and clean. The only annoying thing about the place is the limited number of rather small elevators. It can easily take up to 5 minutes to go up or down during rush hours.

I booked my stay hoping to show my daughters what a nice New York hotel was like, when we stayed overnight for a concert at Carnegie Hall. The room was clean if a bit cramped, and the beds reasonably comfortable. We had a view of Carnegie Hall from our room, and were directly across the street--perfect to walk to and from the event. However the hotel experience was distinctly lacking. The lobby behind the desk was blocked off for a private party the entire afternoon/evening of the day we checked in, and from 7am to noon the next day. So much for ambiance. There was no place to sit except a few hard, overcrowded benches while waiting for a taxi. In the morning while others slept in, I read on those hard benches, with frigid outside air blowing by, as the only chair in the room is an uncomfortable desk chair, wedged between the bed and a desk. Happy with the location, but totally disappointed by what I hoped would be an elegant experience for my girls.

I chose this hotel for its location. When I arrived at 3pm the room was not ready. (Check-in time was 4pm!) So I asked if there was a public restroom so I could get ready for a meeting. The only one available had a queue of 10 people and no other choices. The desk was totally unhelpful when I asked if there was another restroom. I wound up going to a nearby hotel to freshen up.But the story gets worse. When I returned later that night and finally got a room it was late. I discovered that there were no bath towels, no one picking up a phone, and it was late. So hand towels were all I had. For the price of the room I would expect a decent towel, or some supervisor to check on a room. Or at least someone picking up the phone.Rooms are dark. They have beside lamps but no reading lamps. I found the staff unhelpful expect for a guest relations manager who apologized for my troubles. This hotel is not a chain, does not offer anything except a good location. I would not recommend it given that there are other hotels in the area that are part of more professional chains. It was clearly the lack of interest in treating guests with any respect that would make me steer clear of this venue!

My lady and I stayed here on the 24th & 25th and we definitely enjoyed our stay. Our room looked just like it did on Groupon. It was small and cozy with a nice view of Manhattan. I see folks in other reviews mentioning the thermostat. I found no problems and it was cold as hell outside and our room was nice and toasty.We had a slight issue with a fee and manager took care of it with no problem and no hassle.My only complaint would be the expense of the parking. $75 for a mini-van is wayyyyy too much. It would have been nice to park at the hotel but I don't have $75 to just throw away so we parked around the corner because it was $25 cheaper.

The hotel is fancy and the service at the front desk and guest services was very welcoming and helpful. The room and hotel was decorated in modern New York style. The room is small don't expect to walk in front of the bed. See included picture. The worst part of the entire experience was the thermostat and the heating system. It would not allow me to lower it below 65°. I turned the thermostat off and still the room remained a balmy 72°. If you like a firm mattress you can forget about it. If you like summertime Florida temperatures and high humidity, you will enjoy your stay at the park Central Hotel. Very disappointed.

We have spent 10 days before and over Christmas break found the room to be a bit small . bathroom a good size, bed very comfortable would be nicer if refrigerator was in rooms especially for longer stays . a bit dissapointed that there was no tea or coffee facilities in the room they do have a small cafe in the hotel lobby . We found the house keeping for most of our stay to be good except for 2 days which we had to complain about the way our room had been cleaned but as soon as the normal lady came back from days off we went back to no problems and a clean room again .Could have more elevators across the hotel you are often waiting in a line at certain times . Apart from the above the hotel is in a great location for walking to most places and time square.

We selected Park Central primarily for its location and were not disappointed. The Hotel is fine, comfortable, accommodating, and offers a great place from which to see New York and all it has to offer. We walked everywhere from this spot. I especially like its proximity to Central Park, but my kids loved its proximity to Times Square. Our eating, entertainment and shopping were all accomplished by foot with a wonderful selection at our disposal.

This is not a hotel you want to stay at. There is no privacy and the noise from others rooms is easily heard because of the paper thin walls. The rooms are outdated. There is no restaurant or bar, although there are plenty of options around. Overall, the quality of the hotel is extremely poor.

My teenage daughter and I stayed at the Park Central for two nights last week. The hotel was a quick cab ride from Penn Station, and once we were there we were able to walk everywhere and didn't need to take a cab until it was time to go. We got there well before the 4:00 check in, but they were able to take us if we changed room styles (2 queens instead of a king, which was actually better). There are only two elevators, so that was a bit of an issue at times because there would be a line. On our way to check out, we had to wait for 3 elevators because they were all full, so just know to leave ample time to get down when it's time. There's also a line for luggage holding, but it's a great service they offer. The location was so convenient, and the room was surprisingly quiet and dark -- we slept like babies. I would definitely recommend the Park Central.

Arrived Xmas Eve, got a free upgrade, not sure what the upgrade meant as the room looked normal to me. Great location in Manhattan, everywhere can be walked in a short time. Rooms comfortable, clean, everyone polite.

It was close to time square and Central Park. Very close to the tourist places. The hotel room we stay in dressers was mess up. The only view we got was a view of someone else room across from us. The staff was jaded and unhelpful. And the cafe overpriced but the bartender was nice.This hotel isn't family friendly. Elevators are small and it's only 2 of them.

My friend and I love the Park Central because of the wonderful location, friendly staff and spacious rooms. The management staff are particularly helpful especially Elizabeth and Nancy. We will continue to make this our destination hotel when we come to New York.

We stayed here for Christmas weekend for one night. We were a group of 3 families in 4 rooms. We checked in early on saturday and Vito at the front desk was great! Vito was very helpful and was able to get us one room early so we could leave our luggage and freshen up. Later when we returned to get the rest of the rooms, the other front desk staff was rude and not very accommodating. At 6pm, some of the rooms had still not been made up. I had asked to be next to the room that my teenage sons were in but they told me that it was still being cleaned at 6pm. Check-in was supposed to be 4pm! I ended up taking another room down the hall from them that was ready. Overall, the rooms were nice and the location was great. We were able to walk to all the locations easily. We usually don't stay at hotels with "additional fees" or "facility fees" but we had booked last minute. I want to add that Vito was at the front desk the next day and was very helpful with the check-out process and where to leave our luggage. He even helped us with navigating the subway system! Thanks Vito!

I'm not really sure where the other recent reviewers stayed in NYC, but it can't be the same hotel we were in! We stayed in the deluxe room with 2 queens and found the rooms spacious and very clean! The bathroom was large, clean and I was impressed with the upgrades. The staff was very friendly and helpful! The elevators were a bit slow, but stairs give you a greater chance to experience great NYC food! All in all a great stay! We paid approx $280 a night and found it well worth the price!

If you congratulate yourself on finding a hotel in a top-notch location in Manhattan for just $118 a night, you should not have great expectations for service and quality. (Note: there's also a $32 "facilities fee" that is not included in the rate, so it is really $150 before taxes.) That's the attitude you need for the Park Central. If you are not planning to hang out in the room, it's fine. The rooms are relatively small, with tiny bathrooms, and the elevators are slow and cumbersome to use. The sheets one night were dreadful, but improved the next three nights. The lobby is a madhouse, with long lines for check-in and for the luggage depot.Housekeeping is also very slow; we were shocked to come back to the rooms at 5 pm and discovered our two rooms had not been made up! I complained to a manager, who indicated that sometimes rooms are not made up until after 6 pm. However, she agreed to waive the $32 facilities fee for all four nights for both rooms, which was pretty generous. The housekeeping improved after that. But like I said, the location is wonderful, just steps from Broadway and all of the major subway lines. And the price is quite good. So if you are not looking for the Ritz, you probably will be happy with what you get for the price.

Stayed here with mates of mine on a trip to New York the staff were rude. Every night we would have to ask for towels in our room. Children running wild in corridors. With additional fees you have to pay on arrival it's a joke not worth the stay

Items went missing from my room during my stay 12/12/16-12/15/16. I'm still waiting to hear from your insurance team to "reach out". I'm holding back on the bad reviews on trip advisor, Expedia and the rest of social media. I'm furious!!!This experience ruined my wedding day, no apology from hotel and nonchalant attitude of staff. Still charged service fee by hotel despite alleged stolen items. Corridors cluttered with carts from room attendants, even in the evening, wrong luggage given to me by security after trusting staff with my bags after check out and a coded system ... which clearly doesn't work, lifts/elevators do not require room keys to access all floors despite this being a reassurance at check in (this makes you question who has access to the floor or even your room). X3 emails sent to hotel and manager prior to arrival regarding upgrade and champagne provision to room (on arrival and wedding day, to be completely ignored). #PoorCustomerServiceNo fridge, tea or coffee making facilities or bottled water in rooms ... you get a superior service in a $50 a night budget hotel here in the UK. Avoid this hotel and book anywhere else!

It's isn't a bad hotel, it's in a great location, you can either walk to most attractions or the subway to get to the others.There are over 20 floors but only 2 lifts working, we were on 10 and generally walked down the stairs instead of waiting. There are 8 lift shafts.The staff are no ruder than some you can be in New York, and no politer, It's a hotel designed to shift tourists and ballroom guests in and out, night after night, a production line hotel, don't expect more.As regards the extra $30 per night fee, hidden in the small print. It technically there and in reality, we saw it but we expected lots of extras for the cost but we ended up being charged for stuff that all other hotels normally give for free. In reality we paid $300 to print 3 boarding passes, which the computer only allowed 15 minutes on line to do, before cancelling my time on it.So in reality add €30 per night per room to the rate for the same as every where else. On all other reviews the hotel have vigorously defended the extra charge, which is In the terms and is fine if every member of your party need to use the gym every day, print stuff, leave bags and make lots of US phone calls; things tourists just don't do.Don't forget the tax on €30 as well.Rupert

Do not stay at this hotel if you don't want to be disappointed. Awful gimmick they play with their customers with the room arrangement/assignment. Parking fee $60 for car and $70 SUV/van. We got there at 2pm and were told to come back at 4pm which we did but the room was still not ready. Very very bad......

The staff was friendly upon arrival and we were promptly given keys to our rooms, which was spacious, attractive and more importantly, clean. The location is great and within walking distance to Fifth Avenue shops and Time Square.

Nice hotel, though the rooms are small, and the washrooms are a bit dated. The rooms in general are nice. Defiantly a better choice in the way of cost. Telephone customer service is terrible.On-site customer service is good. The bar is nice, has cell phone charging stations for those waiting or meeting people.

The hotel itself was bright and very well situated. It is on the corner of 57 & 7, across from Carneige Hall. Our room request when we made our reservations (adjoining) was not granted. ( although our room did have an adjoining door to another room). The taller lady with the tight ponytail behind the counter was not accommodating to anyone. It was almost as if she were playing a control game with the customers. ( " oh you are requesting a room with two beds? Haha , sorry, we have two rooms on two different floors.) that was an actual conversation I heard her have with the father and son checking in before us. We had to put our foot down to have our children's room close to ours! Bellmen were just standing around with their carts, waiting for people to ask them for assistance. No one was opening the doors for anyone who had their hands full. It is true about the only 2 working elevators, it is a 10 minute wait. We actually got used to taking the 5 flights of stairs. The rooms were simple and clean. No frills. Two queen bed, plenty of outlets,a safe, blow dryer. Charging ports. Tv, our window opened a few inches which we did keep open at night. The trash trucks at 6 am did not bother us. Check out is noon. On our last day, we left for an early breakfast and came back to a room with a deactivated room key!? When I called from my room to ask them to bring up an activated room key for our children's room, they sent up an obnoxious security man who unlocked the door and told me I needed to go get my new key myself, that he was just there to unlock the door?! He really acted bothered and winded. Like it took a lot out of him to take the quick service elevator across from our room. So, I called again and asked them to bring me a new activated key since they deactivated it with all of our luggage still inside and several more hours left. She could not seem to understand why she should have to bring us the key? She never brought us a new key. We took Futurelimo from Newark for $200, which included tax, tips, and tolls. The ride was a Luxury Cadillac SUV. Definitely recommend. The subway entry was at the corner of the building. The Manhattan Club and Westhouse hotel was also attached to the building. We were within a few blocks walk to Columbus Circle, Time Square, Broadway. The subways were not as scary as we thought they would be? It does get expensive but it really gets you there quickly. We just wish we would have figured it all out earlier in our trip. We ate at the Redeye Grill across the hotel which was definitely NOT worth $350.00 for French fries and a fajita skirt steak ( family of 5 without ordering anything fancy). I would not recommend this restaurant unless you are sharing a plate like we saw several young people doing. Park Cafe across from the hotel is perfect for breakfast. It does get crowded but the atmosphere is fun. We really enjoyed our New York trip tremendously. In my opinion, only the workers were obnoxious . The people we spoke with on the subway or on the streets were very nice and so willing to offer their help with directions.I was surprised by the laziness of the employees at Newark Airport. To me, if you are in a position that makes you that unhappy, leave and give it to someone who really needs a job. Yes, there is someone out there who would take it and give it their best. They behaved as if they were doing the airlines a favor by standing there rolling their eyes as they checked people in?

Quick Corporate Meeting for 30+ People..Initially I was skeptical at Rack Rate Above $500 but Function planner at Hotel got us a much more reasonable rate..and for City Meeting location Meals snacks and support was GREAT.Reminder-Its NYC so you want to keep your Room key handy at all times since all Public areas bathrooms require a Guest Key for access.While to rooms are compact, by other city standards, a recent renovation has made them soundproof and luxurious in this location that cannot be beat.!

I visited NYC with my niece at the beginning of December. We had booked and paid extra for two double beds. We were amazed and delighted when we arrived to find that we had virtually two double rooms adjoining. We were on the 15th floor with a great view. The room was modern and tastefully furnished. The beds extremely comfortable with huge pillows. The bathroom was spacious. A coffee machine was provided on request. The small coffee shop provided a useful place to get food and although expensive was really no more expensive than other places in New York. The hotel is in a great position and we walked to many of the places we visited. The map provided by the Concierge became my constant companion and really helped us find our way around. I would recommend this hotel and if lucky enough to return to New York would have no hesitation in staying here again.

A fantastically set hotel with a bit of chic on the surface that is let down by the rather arrogant and lazy attitude of the staff. Spent three nights and not once did the hotel staff 'set' my room each day for the number of occupants. A little scruffy, and whilst not a prude did not appreciate the cannabis smoker whoever you were living on the same floor as us. Staff were pretty unapproachable and treated you more as a hindrance rather than a customer. All that said room was reasonable great location for a Central Park and Times Square.

I've just returned from a week at this hotel having stayed there for a business trip. On arrival I was aware that the check in time was 4pm and joined the long reception queue at 3.50pm. This is later than most hotels around the world and not a welcome start to long distance travellers, especially those travelling from east to west.Once at the reception desk I was told that they could check-in, but I would have to return after 4pm when they could allocate me a room (if one was available). Really? "Come back in ten minutes and we'll allocate you a room" was the suggestion. This meant rejoining the long queue and waiting a further fifteen minutes to then be allocated a room. Talk about inflexibility and sticking rigidly to a 4pm check in! Ridiculous.Anyway, room allocated and to be fair it didn't seem that bad with all the facilities one would need. However first observation was the use of the heating system, necessary at this time of the year, was very noisy. My first night was awful. The noise from the street was constant and loud, from sirens to dustcarts deliveries and car horns plus many other distractions. It's certainly time to replace the double glazing and improve the awful noise pollution. I had to ask to move rooms as I didn't sleep all night and judging from the reaction of the staff its a common complaint if your room is on the south side of the hotel.After trying another room which was again noisy, I finally settled for the third room offered which was satisfactory for the rest of my stay.Previous reviews have also mentioned the poor elevator service which is entirely accurate, meaning long waits at the lift entrances both going up and coming down.The hotel has the advantage of a great position for all of Manhattans attractions but my advice would be to choose a hotel away from the heart of the city. Public transportation is so good that reaching the same attractions is only a short subway ride away with the benefit of a calmer and more peaceful night's sleep. (Consider Jersey City on the other side of the Hudson - four metro stops out of the city)Finally the well guarded and not to be mentioned issue (until you check out) of the 'Resort fee', a charge of $32.00 per day which you aren't told about on arrival. I and my colleague specifically asked at check-in if there were any other charges that we would be liable for during our stay. 'No' was the reply. So it's a bit sly and underhand to have an invoice slid under your room door on the morning of departure requesting payment. (In my case over $163.00) Another guest checking out in front of me queried the payment and was rudely pointed out a small notice at the far end of the reception desk with the hotels T&C's including the chargeable resort fee. I'm sure its the hotel's way of advertising lower rates but clawing it back through, in my opinion, an underhand way.I probably wouldn't stay at this hotel again and certainly not at the inflated Christmas prices. There are better options available.

Location is great. Right in Times Square but not the chaos of Rockefeller center. Rooms are large and clean and friendly, helpful staff. Bar on premises but no restaurant. Not a big deal as plenty of places to eat. Starbucks right outside front door. Does have a small food mart which is convenient.

Very nice hotel! Only 3 issues: They were very understaffed checking in and out. Took way too much time. The vent didn't work in the bathroom. They charge you a fee for their gym and pool whether you use it or not, be prepared. Other than that, no complaints, very nice and comfortable! You must use your room key to operate the elevators as well.

We went to NYC witha group of 28 tennagers and stayed at the hotel. It was a very pleasent stay and the staff treated us with a lot of respect and kindness.The maintance team was also very quick and helped us.The room has a good size and is very comfortable, I found the location excelent, near to Times Square and also to the Central Park.It has a Subway in front and a Starbucks on the corner of the hotel.

Stayed here for my partners birthday for 5 nights. We had been looking forward to this trip for a long time only to be disappointed by the experience at PARK CENTRAL HOTEL. Here is a list of disappointments. On the first night the bar area was closed to customers, which after 9 hours of flying is a massive let down. There are not enough lifts for the amount of rooms, often spend a long time waiting only for the lift to be crammed full. So if you're in a rush to be somewhere in a morning, expect to be late. Wifi is extraordinarily slow, so despite the fact that you get charged $30 PER NIGHT EXTRA it is better in McDonalds. Television choice is poor, if you're looking for anything other than a news channel, then you will struggle. Insects in the rooms - my partner had a nasty reaction to a bite. I expect insects in my room when I'm in a hostel or a motel, not a "4*" NYC hotel. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room (surely this would be in the $30pn facilities fee?) Instead you can pay $20 for a tea, coffee, sandwich and a donut downstairs.. (!?!?!?)Finally, the hidden cost. At roughly 7am on our final morning, a hotel staff member very kindly slid a bill under our door for $163 as what I expect to be this hotel's way of saying thank you for choosing them, over the other thousands of probably more deserving NY hotels. After scratching our heads wondering where this 'facility charge' had come from we decided to do some research. So... despite the Park Central staff making "every effort to make this known to guests upon check in and throughout our stay" not a single staff member said a word. It is not the fact that I have been billed an extra $163 that is the most annoying, it's the manner in which it was slipped under our door on the morning of our last day in NYC which is the most outrageous, as if the hotel were trying to keep it on the down low, and expecting us to just keep quiet and accept it. Great way to wake up on the final day of your long awaited Christmas trip to New York. Thanks to all staff at this fine establishment for a less than ordinary stay, especially the one that pushed the bill under our door. I can't wait to book our next trip. At the Sheraton across the street.

Elizabeth, the costumer relation manager fixed my problem professionally and quickly. I booked a king size bed room and at checkin i got a double queen beds room. When I talked with Elizabeth she gave me an upgraded king size bed room and she was very nice and helpful.

Me and my partner stayed at the Park Central hotel for 7 Nights! On arrival we were met with appalled service! The lady was very rude and said we have an upgrade in room which yes sounds great BUT we went to the room and there were two double beds which we didn't even need and the room was very small considering we had paid for a large king size deluxe room we wasn't given this! On our invoice it was said our room was on level 8! Well the first room we were given was on level 3 and my other half didn't even fit in the beds they were that small, as well as we just didn't want two beds we wanted one as we booked! So we then went downstairs and asked for the room we originally asked for as this was a downgrade not an upgrade! So she then gave us a room on the 4th floor. She also ASKED FOR A DEPOSIT OF $500! We said we don't have this so she downed it to $300 which is far enough, we were great full for this, would of been nice to have known about this charge though! - We were aware of the facility fee but not for the deposit we had to pay as well!We then got this back at the end of the holiday and got out of paying the facility fee as we complained about the rudeness of staff on arrival. There were some very lovely people on the desks at reception it was only 2 lady's that we found a problem which let the other team members down! Which was disappointed as it led to a poor start to our trip! We thought the room was clean but after looking around properly there was mess around the back of desks all on the floor, the handles of doors were wonky! A very good TV though I must say and very powerful FREE Wireless internet which was great! The side tables were very dusty also, I managed to put my elbow in all the dust when trying to turn the side lamp on! The air con/ heating was a bit confusing to use! The hotel it self was way to hot! and the elevators (lifts) are ridiculously slow considering how big the hotel is they only have 2 very small lifts!! they should install more! On the last day me and my partner were having a lay-in as we had a very long day ahead of us flying back to UK as a night flight then driving 3 hours home then going to work the following day! We basically needed sleep. We were disturbed up 4 maybe 5 times by the house keeping staff wanting to clean our room even though we had a do not disturb sign on our door and check out wasn't till 12 we were a bit upset when we got woken up at 8am and again at 8:30 and again at 9! After that we just didn't bother going back to sleep!The location of the hotel was very good and in walking distance to central park and times square also walking distance to Rockefeller Centre where my boyfriend proposed to me! Which was a lovely most exciting part of the trip!! There are metro subways all over! and two within a 30 second walk from the hotel! Yellow line pretty much takes you everywhere! I would advice to get a 7 day pass if you are going for around that many days and your thinking of using it as its cheaper than paying $3 a time! For food I would recommend Black Tap which is just across the road and do amazing burgers and milkshakes, Rays Pizza which was amazing pizza I would recommend going there! For drink and snacks around times square they are very expensive I would recommend going to a corner shop near Macys Shopping Centre as there is a cheap one around that area! Just also want to add there was another couple we spoke to who have the same room type but there family came with them for 4 days and they stayed for 7! They had 3 different rooms in total and the lady had to pay a fee of $2500 at the beginning of her holiday! She was in her 20`s too! Which was awful! Lucky she had all the money on her Credit/Debit card!When visiting New York again I wouldn't stay at this hotel due to some staff members! Also the cleanliness of the hotel wasn't great! I do wish to say Thank You to the Helpful staff though! :)

Overall this is a great place, but I'll break it down a little bit. Pros:LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATIONFriendly staffDecent sized roomsVery clean Surprisingly updated for an older buildingCons:No restaurant on site"Bar" /lounge only open certain hoursSomewhat slow elevatorsTIPS:Refrigerator is on request, so ask if you need one! They will keep your luggage stored before and after your reservation (luggage check). Utilize the concierge for restaurant recommendations and reservations, as they are quite helpful. Check out Premier Deli on the corner for great food and decent prices. None of the cons were deal breakers, just a side note for someone who places more importance on those things. I would definitely recommend this place to family and friends!

Very good,hotel. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Room was large, airy and. Very clean. We were on the 6 th floor. We did ask for coffe in the room and was brought a coffe making machine and supplies were topped up daily. We stayed for 5 nights. Hotel,is in an excellent position not far from Times Square and Central Park all within 5-10 mins walk away. Also broadway so close. Need to be aware of the charges from hotel daily that do add up at the end of your stay.We were sold a hotel recommendation excursion attractions ticket. Unfortunately these tickets were not recognised by the attractions themselves. We did waste one day going down to Statue of Liberty to be refused entry. We complained to the hotel who changed our tickets for the city pass. They refunded our money with no problems. The city pass was so much easier to use and no rejections from any of the attractions. Would highly recommend this.Try the subway to get around much easier than you think and very safe. Central,park has various singers under the archway bridge that changed daily, worth a look as they are all very good. Would recommend the shuttle bus back to the airport. A lot cheaper than a yellow taxi, hotel will book for you. Hotel,is in an ideal location to see all the sights. A very lovely hotel we enjoyed our stay very much. Would also recommend apple jacks a fantastic diner behind the hotel for the most amazing breakfasts.

I spent 5 days staying at this hotel (room only) and absolutely loved it! The hotel itself is very large and beautifully decorated, our room was very modern with a large flatscreen tv, stylish bathroom, free wifi, and large double bed. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. The hotel boasts a very trendy bar with attentive bar staff and tasty cocktails. The location of the hotel really couldn't be better- Times Square is a 10 minute walk in one direction and Central Park a 10 minute walk in the other. I can be very fussy when it comes to hotels so I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed my stay here. The only thing that could be improved was the friendliness of the concierge. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends and I would certainly stay here again.

I've stayed in numerous NYC hotels and would definitely return to this one. The staff was the best!! Super friendly and helpful... Especially Elizabeth at guest relations and John the doorman. Made our stay so pleasant and hassle free! Great corner room with view of Times Square... Very clean, and the room seemed newly done. We were able to extend our stay due to bad weather, thanks to Elizabeth...one of the best hotel employees I've ever encountered. The location is perfect, especially around the holidays!!

This was our first trip to NYC and our travel agent had found it for us. We had a HUGE suite type room on the 11th floor (1157) and it was very comfortable and modern. A large TV, a comfortable bed and sofa, the bathroom was lovely, it was really spacious for the two of us. You could hear the noise (sirens and arms mainly) from the city below but thats part of being in NYC right? There wasn't much of a view from our room and it was dark so we had the lights on most of the time but who cares, we were in NYC!In the States, the Hotels are a little different to the UK in that there was no coffee making facilities in the room, but there are so many coffee outlets in the street this wasn't an issue (Starbucks right next door for one). The hotel staff were so courteous and friendly, check in was quick, the concierge were great and Carmelo was a huge help with giving us advice on getting downtown,as well as getting us to the airport in plenty of time, and he always had aa really lovely smiley face too.There is a is a little shop in the lobby which opens most of the day and sells coffees, healthy drinks (herbal teas etc), waters, yogurts, granola, cakes and fruit etc so you could grab a snack.I would 100% go back to this hotel not if but WHEN I visit NYC again.

When they say "The heart on town" This is it. Across the street from and one block from Carnegey Hall. Two blocks from Cenrtal park and a subway station right on the corner, That's convient. Walking distance from, Brodway theater. Maceys and Tiffinys. We thoroughly rnjoied the trip!

Though the hotel is situated directly at 7ave, you have a silent room with nice furniture. The price is good for the location but too high for the offers. The location is just one street beside top broadway and 10min by feet away of Rockefeller Center, a subway station is located two streets away and Central Park is also nicely near.

Park Central is, as the title states, close to Central Park. Very walkable to almost everywhere. For an extra $1, excellent value, we got a coffee, fruit and choice of croissant or muffin, for breakfast. It's across the street from Carnegie Hall and just down a block from the Carnegie Deli (which closes December 31 of this year). The room was spacious by NY standards. Three things though - the windows let in a fair amount of noise; the rooms could use more lighting; the front desk staff on our first night were not helpful. The bathroom and fixtures were new and nice with a rain shower faucet. The cleaning staff couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating. Great service that way. However, upon check in, we asked to be placed away from the elevator. When we opened the elevator door, the room was right in front of us, two steps away. We went down to change the room to a quieter location, away from the elevator, they said it wasn't near the elevator and were snooty about the change. Nevertheless, everything else was quite nice for a few days in NYC to see the lights, store windows, and The Rockettes. We would stay there again.

Stayed here for three nights on a recent trip to New York.The room we had was lovely with 2 beds. A really big TV and a good bathroom. Wifi in the room as well. There is a bar behind reception which opens in the evening and a small shop selling coffee and cakes and snacks.Less than 5 minutes to Central Park and about 10 minutes to a Time Square. Ideal for shopping and sightseeing.

Overall we enjoyed our stay due to the location of this hotel being really good, sadly the cheaper rooms suffer from what can only be described as a terrible view and we found the service to be poor, Unhelpful and borderline rude at times. Please note you will be charged a MANDATORY $30 a day for additional services like 'gym use' which we had absolutely no need for but had to pay for, so the prices are not really as advertised, it's not clear when booking that you must pay for this.Regarding the service - When simply wanting to ask about taxis we were told to queue up and wait behind guests checking in, then sent back to the queue to the other side which we had already been to to find out that the concierge is closed... total clown act! The room itself and facilities were good and the cleaning staff did a great job!Overall will probably Try somewhere else next time.

We originally were planning on using a VRBO for our group of 10 ( kids ages 3-9 years old) but that fell through a week before our trip. My husband looked into hotels that were in the area we wanted and found this hotel. It was perfect! We loved having our family next door ( hotel set us up so we had rooms next to/across from each other) and the $1 per person breakfast deal ended up providing a great meal plus snacks. Staff was friendly and helpful ( ex quickly giving us toothbrushes and toothpaste when we found out the left that bag at home). We arrived early on Friday but the ability to check bags at the hotel was great so we didn't have to drag our luggage around NYC. We also took advantage of bag check when we checked out on Monday so we didn't have to worry about luggage before our late flight. Given security concerns / bag restrictions at every place we went , the bag check was very helpful!This location was close to Central Park, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, American Girl Doll store etc. Subway access is around the corner and we used that to go to Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Museum.

This was a pretty good stay. Convenient to the theater district , within walking distance. Nice appointed rooms and comfortable beds. Try to check in just before 4 will save you a line. We booked thru the airlines and was not aware of the facility fee of $30 per night. No coffee maker.

Arrived early but weren't able to check in until 4pm, justified as that is check in time online. Very busy at reception, could have had more staff on maybe. Didn't realise we could have booked the $1 Breakfast pre arriving to the hotel. Staff very nice and room was lovely, especially the bed - good size and good tv with enough channels. Great views from our room and excellent location.

I recently visited New York for the first time with my 16 year old daughter. I picked Park Central Hotel for its location and reasonable price. I was not disappointed. We had a fabulous time! We were able to easily walk to Central Park. A subway stop was just steps away and we took full advantage of using it to explore the city with a 7 day unlimited Metro pass! The concierge recommended Roberts for dinner and Sarabeth's for breakfast. Both were easy walks from the hotel and excellent choices! We were also just a short walk from Times Square, but found it was only one subway stop away, which we preferred to walking since it was a very cold December weekend during our stay. The room & bathroom were small for our Midwestern standard, but I hear that is what you should expect in New York. The hotel looked updated recently, and was very clean, but is showing a few small signs of use. All the staff were very nice and helpful, however, they could use a few more hands during peak times to minimize wait time.

First time visiting NYC 11/23/2016. Our group sang at Carnegie Hall. Loved the hotel. Everyone was nice. We were so close to the things we wanted to do and just a few blocks from Time Square. Carnegie Hall was right across the street. Many restaurants so close. Will stay hear again in the summer. Needed more time in Central Park.

The additional "facilities fee" and tax are bogus and leave a bad taste in my mouth. If you need the money, include it in the room rate and be upfront about it. Other gripe: housekeeping had not thoroughly cleaned the room when I checked in. Trash bins were not emptied from the previous guest (who was on a Gatorade kick apparently), and the bar of soap was not new. I thought housekeeping put out a washcloth for me before realizing it was used. In the bath area, they have a dispenser rack for shampoo and body wash (which I used extensively due to the used soap mentioned above), which was broken and did not hold the bottles well.This hotel has no restaurant facilities or room service. I will not return.

Our stay at Central Park was very nice. There is no coffee pots but you can ask for one. We did and they brought one to us. There is not a restaurant here, and I didn't know about any breakfast~but we usually ate out. GREAT LOCATION....central to everything and can see Times Square from the sidewalk in front of hotel. Room was nicely cleaned every day. Had to get room key made a couple times~once wouldn't work...other time we lost it. They were very accommodating. BRING TENNIS SHOES !!

Perfect location.Staff on reception were horrible whilst checking in and out.Amazing room - Queen Beds times two. Under 21 - but they let us stay regardless.Beautiful inside hotel.Business do in the hotel one night so restricted of facilities.

My wife and I stayed here for our first visit to NYC and the hotel did not disappoint. Before booking our trip, I was looking for more of an economical option because let's be serious, nothing in NYC is cheap. The hotel is in a great spot and close to a lot of things like: bars, food, central park, subway, times square, other hotels, shopping etc. It was a bit more north of Times Square so perhaps I could say it was less congested? The rooms weren't huge but they weren't small either. The bed was extremely comfortable as were the pillows. The shower was nice, and the air conditioning worked well. Guest services were very friendly.One huge perk to staying here was the ride to LaGuardia. A normal taxi is like $45-$55 dollars. They have a private shuttle for $50 flat rate. It was excellent.When we return to NYC we will most likely stay here again. It was everything we needed.

I recently stayed at the Park Central Hotel in New York City.When I got home and checked my Visa statement, I saw I had been charged $134. Since I was told I had paid my bill in full. I was very surprised and made enquiries. I was told this was a holding fee and would be reversed in a few days. I am most upset as nowhere was I told about this "holding fee".Surely, if the hotel finds something broken or missing, they can charge the client for the item?Why's holding fee and why was I not informed about it?

Great location. But disappointed with the $33 a day charge for services I didn't use. Very clean and friendly staff. Did $1 a day breakfast which suited. Didn't think much of happy hour, white wine was not included!

This is a very modern style Hotel, it is very clean and well maintained. The room was nice but the view we had was of wall so that wasn't too good but the bed was really comfortable. The hotel was close to Central Park, radio city, Rockefeller center and time square, all walking distance.

This is among the worst hotels of it's type to stay in. While well located for Broadway, the room is like the lesser ones you stay in overnight at an airport. A key to the men's room in the lobby did not work. There were no paper towels to dry your hands. Staff is courteous but spare. You need radar to detect the presence of one except behind the front desk where there is one and sometimes two people. The corridors to the rooms are lengthy. The heating/air conditioning system is loud. Were this hotel located anywhere else it would have closed. You can get better accommodations for less or the same elsewhere in the city.

I will start with the positives: the lobby is beautiful and the front desk people polite . Rooms are clean; however very small. We paid over 400 per night for 2 beds , no coffee maker, no radio, and no view. I will not stay here again.

My friend and I stayed overnite on Dec.4,2016. We were both impressed with the decor of our room on the 14th floor and the spaciousness of the bathroom. We had a nice view of Seventh Avenue. The staff of the Park Central were very friendly from check-in to check-out. At the end of our stay a smiling doorman hailed us a taxi. We look forward to our next visit.

The Park Central was recommended to us by a friend and we were not disappointed , the hotel is in a great place to explore the city , the rooms were very clean and comfortable and the reception staff very helpful and attentive , I would definitely stay here again .

This was our second time in staying at park central, and previously loved it! We had requested to stay in the same room as emailed 2 weeks before however when we arrived we were given a different room on a different floor. Very noisy from room, as right near elevators on the first night we asked if we could be located to another room and the lady was very unhelpful and stated there wasn't another room even hence explaining it was noisy due to elevators. Other staff appeared quite miserable and not very friendly. On a daily occasion waiting for lifts could take up to 10 minutes in which we had to wait in a line as that many people had been waiting for a long period of time. For my next trip in New York I will be considering another hotel, otherwise in a very good location just not as good of experience as first time.

Arrived on Thanksgiving day at 2pm. The lobby was busy but no line up to check in. The lady who checked us in was not in the least bit helpful or nice. She wasn't able to check us in early, which was expected but was unnecessary rude about it. They do have a great secure area to store your luggage and the guys there were busy but very nice. Came back at 5 and the next lady says to us "oh you're already checked in, she didn't give you keys?" Which reaffirmed the fact she was just being rude. Got our bags and went to the elevator only to encounter a line up of approx 20 disgruntled people. Waiting and waiting. This went on for about 24hrs. We had to take the service elevator at one point and always had to walk down the stairs. We were on the 8th floor and had a friend with us whom has lung cancer (not smoking related) she could not walk up 8 flights of stairs nor could I! It was a major inconvenience and yes they had it fixed by Saturday but it had already put a bad spot on our vacation. So bad in fact that the lady in charge took our room numbers the Thursday night as she walked us to the service elevators. I realize these things can happen but then open up.the other elevators for us to use. They would not even credit us the facility fee stating that they resolved the problem and it was also for the fitness area. It was really very inconvenient and I can assure you that over the 3 nights I spent there I wasted more than $30 of my (our) valuable time waiting for your elevators based on hourly wages. The room was as expected, 2 queen beds which were comfortable. The dust clumps between the wall and carpet beside the desk were honestly gross. Running a vacuum and pushing the dirt up against the wall is not cleaning it. Bathroom had blow dryer, shampoo, conditioner & body wash both of which were empty and never filled or replaced during our stay. We paid top.dollar for a holiday weekend and expected top dollar service that did not happen. The area was great, subway stop right there, walking distance to major attractions and queen beds which is rare in NYC but the rude check in, elevators not working and lack of empathy of any sort towards this fact by the person in charge on Sunday, I would not stay here again.

My husband and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary in NYC, and we stayed at the Park Central Hotel. The hotel is at a very central location. We were able to walk to all of our desired destinations. The room was very large and extremely clean. The hotel was very easy to get to from the airport, and they provided a very reasonably-priced shuttle back to La Guardia. We were able to store our luggage on the day we checked out of the hotel. The hotel's staff was extremely helpful and took great care of us!We definitely plan on returning to this beautiful hotel soon. It was an amazing and very memorable stay!

Well, let's start from the only good things... The location is good, the lobby looks great but that's it.Extremely expensive. $300 per night for a fair hotel is too much. Sheets were not changed for a week. Bathtub is old, dirty and inconvenient, TV is locked and the remote is not genuine, you can wait for elevators for ages. The room is very small. The window is very close to windows of other building so forget about privacy. Terrible hotel.The hotel also charges $33 per night for unneeded services and you can't avoid this charge. The price the hotel shows you doesn't reflect the actual price paid. For me the order was $1700 for 7 night but the actual charge was $2200 due to these services and taxes that are not mentioned anywhere till the actual credit card charge.I wouldn't ever return to this hotel and will not recommend it to anyone.

Really good location and very nice staff. They allowed me a slightly early checkin which was appreciated. However there were very small things I would suggest that they fix. Locking the elevator is just plain annoying, especially with hands full. Would love to see coffee shop open earlier. The room doesn't have a small fridge or any other benefits for a business traveler. The carpet had lumps in it (#1004) but the window fully opening was nice for a breeze. Being next to the park is really good location and very centrally located right off of Broadway and Columbus Circle. It was an inexpensive option booked thru Hotel Tonight. Had I paid full price I would not have been as pleased but I would consider staying again given location and low price. Can't emphasize enough how good the location is for any activities or business meetings in midtown.

If you are going to Carnegie Hall this is a great choice for a hotel. Reasonably priced, convenient, clean and with a helpful staff. We searched for a convenient hotel near Carnegie and this one came up on Trip Advisor.

My daughter and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. We were there from 11/29 to 12/2. The staff was very nice to us and Angela helped us when we arrived and let us check into our room when we arrived. We could not have been at a nicer place. Our room was clean and very convenient to shopping and in walking distance to the plays, Central Park and Rockefeller center and Times Square. Very comfortable beds and very quite room. The maid service was very nice. We had a great stay at this Hotel and hope to come back soon Sarah Drayton

Stayed here 2 times over the years -- both times for 5 days (annual conference). Good location. Nice diner across the street. Too bad they don't really have breakfast here (coffee bar with small shop). Rooms are clean and quiet (rare in NYC).

Very convenient location 2 minutes from Carnegie Hall. Great proximity to several subway lines. Perfect midtown location. Special commendation to Elizabeth Cacovic for resolving an issue - the top half of my white cotton pyjamas (which were almost identical to the hotel linen) were collected up with the sheets! When reported, she immediately acknowledged the error, got me a temporary t-shirt at 10pm and generously compensated me for the loss. First class service.

I reserved through expedia.com. 2 nights in a 2x double bed room. Two adults and one toddler. Room 511.Arrival and check-in was no problem. The hotel's layout means that certain rooms are very far from the elevator. It can be somewhat maze-like.The room was tastefully designed to match the rest of the hotel's decor theme. Aside from that it was underwhelming and smallish. We had three large suitcases, one needed to be open for access to clothing. We had to walk over/around it on the floor constantly.Most noticeable is that there is NO IN-ROOM REFRIGERATOR or bottled water provided. Also no microwave anywhere in the hotel (we even asked the front desk). So you are pretty much forced to eat out, or eat from the hotel food market.About the food market - if you reserve directly with the hotel they give you an optional $1 voucher that can be traded for limited breakfast offerings from the market. Indirect bookings do not get this voucher offer, and full price at the market is VERY expensive. 1 banana, 1 blueberry muffin, 1 plain croissant, 1 CLIFF meal bar, 2 plain coffees, 1 small orange juice, 2 boiled eggs - $47!!!!!! These are baseball stadium prices. Avoid if possible.The beds were very soft; perhaps too much so - unless you were sleeping in the dead center of the mattress is felt as if you were about to be rolled off the side.Pillows were plentiful soft too.The window curtain was a simple roll screen that did not block all light. Windows blocked most road noise, but not all.The in-room safe is standard fare and worked fine. Most problematic was the air-conditioning. It was noisy and ran the fan constantly despite us setting it on "low speed". It overheated and then overcooled the room in 30-minute cycles. We had just come from a 2.5-star hotel in rural Missouri, which had the exact same thermostat/control panel. Disappointing to see a 4-star Manhattan property using such a system.Bathroom was typical, clean, but nothing special aside from the surround-lighting on the mirror, and separately provided zoom-mirror. Some metal fixtures were falling apart in the shower, and the bathroom doorknob fixture was attached at a weird angle.Staff were helpful with some issues we had and generally well mannered and polite.

This was my second time staying at Park Central Hotel. The rooms were very quiet and comfortable. This hotel is in the perfect location to visit Central Park, Times Square and shopping. The staff was very helpful to all of us.

We choose Park Central Hotel due to its location close to Central Park, Time Square, Broadway and 5th avenue and all the other places nearby. We were most pleased with the hotel and its staff. Our room was clean and comfortable. The only negative is that the hotel does not have a breakfast room, but this is compensated with the nice coffee house next door "Tisserie"

Spent 5 nights at this hotel room was nice, but that's all you get is a room,the reception staff need an Injections of personality,I booked this hotel with thomascook which was fine but when we arrived the hotel tried to put on a $30.00 a night service charge,this is a con don't pay it take your recipts from thomascook cook with you

Very nice room, nice workout facility, pleasant staff and the location is excellent. Secured a nice rate and very much enjoyed my stay in this property. I would recommend this hotel for anyone staying in this part of New York City.

Great location. Besides the Vagrant sleeping in the hall, the cleaning carts strewn throughout the halls, the barking dog next door, the bar not being open according to hours and the rude people working at night, it was an ok place.

Stayed here a whole week. Room was located on the corner so had more windows to look out on the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, Two double beds very comfortable. Very nice bathroom with lots of natural light. Surprisingly quiet at night with little street noise. Easy walk to Central Park and lots of museums. No coffee machine in room, but it was easy to go downstairs to the lobby coffee bar.

I reserved a room at the Park Central through Trip Advisor at a great rate. What I ended up with was a room behind the elevator shafts and next to the ice machine.
