No matter the rate, a room where you hear the grinding of the elevators is not a great deal. It's annoying. Disappointing experience and I will never stay here again.

This is the quietest hotel I can remember, ever! And, I would recommend it just for the location near national museums, shopping, theaters, restaurants, metro, etc.We were upgraded to a suite and enjoyed having a sitting room with a kitchenette, along with a nice bedroom and bathroom. The bed was luxurious. We would definitely try to stay here next trip.

Superb staff... superb facilities... for us magnificent location... BUT!The hotel will not be happy with my giving out a secret to help "cure" the one issue the hotel has: elevators are horrendous. If you do not use these secrets, wait times for one could be 5-10 minutes! UGH. So here are the secrets for defeating the elevator gremlins and get up or down as you need to do. First, there are two banks of elevators, North andSouth, both have 2 elevators... North are ostensibly floors 3-9 and South for 10 and above... Almost always a wait at North bank sop here is first secret: if you are on floor 8 (I proved) and probably 9, take the South elevators and hit the 8th or 9th floor - even though the South bank is ostensibly for 10+ ... If the South only first stops at 10, it is still far quicker to go to ten and walk down 1 or two flights. Now the reverse I have not found to be true... going to South Bank on 8th and hitting button for down has never resulted in an elevator opening on 8 ... I did not try this next secret though, so perhaps someone wishes to further experiment. Now, on to the North bank of elevators. If like we, e.g. you are on 8th floor hit BOTH up and down button, and regardless of the elevator showing up or down GET ON - do not ever pass a chance to get on the elevator. If someone is still going up to 9th that will still be far better and quicker for your "detour" ... we have had the same elevator go up and never open for us on its way down several times therefore ALWAYS get on any elevator that opens for you... then hit lobby and you will be on your way. Long I know, but you needed all the arrows in the quiver we had to discover to defeat the PC elevator gremlins. Would we stay here again if this was convenient for our needs? HECK YES... the elevator issue was the only drawback to an excellent hotel (well, except for a loose cable connection to back of TV which stymied my wife in discerning the problem but I cured.) AGAIN great staff, great facilities, a bathroom that was awesome, most noise from city that never sleeps was diminished beng up 8 stories.

We came here for thanksgiving with family and friends no real welcome on arrival told them when i booked it was my 1st wedding Anniversary so on the day to not get as much as a congratulations was a bit poor. The rooms are nice and comfy but just so loud i think they use single glaze glass the bath you couldnt run as plug hole was broken. Now the lifts were awful on many occasions had to climb 9 flights of stairs which was a joke and the facility fee is way to much considering half the things you get dont work. Guest services were nice though as when i checked out they credited me $100 back on to my card which was nice. Overall Hotel is in a great location the lack of breakfast and restuarant is a killer especially after a long flight the rooms are nice, the miserable staff and lack of facilities is the reason i give this a 3 star which is a shame in 2011 this was a great hotel so wouldnt be returning in the future!!

Nice hotel. Centrally located. The thermostat didn't adjust in our room which made for a more than toasty sleep but the room was clean and beds comfortable. The concierge was not always present behind the desk but we already had our plans.

Lots of problems with this place. Yes it's a good location, but the lack of a restaurant is a kicker, no breakfast is a downer. And there's nothing to make tea in the room. The room was clean but incredibly noisy, the generator sounded like a plane. The decor is dated, shabby and not chic and there aren't enough elevators and the key system is unreliable. It felt like staying in a cobwebby old hotel in the late eighties. Unfortunately it costs a lot more than that. The London Hotel is just down the street, it's better all round. And they even do room service.

In general I really like this hotel. For NYC the room we got is large enough for a family of 3. The rooms are nice and you cannot buy the links location. But something has to be done regarding the elevator. The hotel is big and there are only two elevators. Most of the weekend only one elevator was working. In the afternoons and evenings a long line was forming next to the elevator. We stayed on the 7s floor, and had to go up and down the stairs most of the time. I can manage that, but next time I'm in the city with my parents this will not be hotel of my choice. We tried talking to the front desk about it, but I'm still waiting for the manager to call me back.

I stayed at Park Central over Thanksgiving holiday and I was very impressed at how clean and secure this hotel is. The check-in lines were a little long but moved along very quickly as they have 4-5 persons checking people in. My room was on the 11th floor, premier room with awesome views and double queen beds, very clean carpets and modern well maintained furniture plus decor. Excellent clean bathroom tiles, tub and toilet. Beds were very comfy with plenty of plush pillows and warm cozy linens, large flat screen TV, updated doc station for the cell phones and plenty of jacks throughout for plugin stuff. Housekeeping cleaned daily and they were very accommodating to go in the room when we were ready to have it cleaned. Double Elevators on each floor but there could be a little wait considering the building has 17 floors I never waited longer than 2-min's for it. On the main floor there is a Nice huge lounge with bar and plenty of seating, gigantic flat screen TV. The only thing that was a dent in our stay was the over priced parking as we drove our car, hotel has garage in separate bldg that stores cars but if you book on any other site besides the hotel website you will be charged $70. per 24-hr period No Ins/Outs. If you book through the hotel they have special $10 per day for pkg. We made a deal at another garage 1-block away for $50. Also they have a store market on the main floor that is over priced with wine and snacks. You are better off walking to the the Liquor store a block away that has better wine choices at reasonable prices. Also their is Primer Cafe on the corner to the right as you walk out the hotel that serves delicious food opens 6am-2am and to the Left 1-block away there is a fresh fruit grocery store. Hotel Location is 2-blocks away from Central Park, Columbus Square, and Times Square.

I booked this hotel for a three day overnight for three I booked a Deluxe Two Queen room. I had a bad feeling upon arrival as I stood in the check in line with no one at the front desk attending to guests. When I did get up to the desk there was no welcome, no smile, or greeting whatsoever. We arrived a bit prior to 2:00 pm and were told that no rooms were available and that we'd have to wait for a phone call at 4:00 pm. This did not matter since we were hungry and needed to get food. I confirmed that it was going to be a call and not a text and she said it would be a call ( ended up being a text). The pictures of the room showed much better online than reality. We received a room with two DOUBLE beds and not queens. The reason I emphasize is that the room description speaks to accommodating more than 2. - we have 3 and sleeping has been less than ideal. I spoke to guest services the first night and the woman told me that these were queen size and I firmly said No they were not. Then she said well they are New York queen size ?!? The elevator rarely stops on our floor which is the 5th so we have been climbing the stairwell each time we return from the city. Going down obviously is not as grueling. First night we requested some extra bath towels that were never delivered and last night ( night 2) we received an aggressive knock from housekeeping that woke us up a few minutes ahead of 1:00 am that were supposed to be for the neighbor across the hall I'm spending $1,000 or slightly more for these three nights and the service here is horrible. There is one doorman and he's in the lobby more than he is outside and no one representing this hotel is the least bit friendly. It's been three years since I've been in NYC but given this experience it seems like since they have an influx of tourists they don't care about creating a positive impression. I like the location but this hotel is not one I'm coming back to. Very thin walls as others have noted. You can definitely hear your neighbors in the rooms if they are loud as well As in the halls. There's also no room in the bathroom to put much other than a tooth brush and toothpaste. The only rack for towels is under the sink. No amenities in the room - no coffee maker or frig. Not a high end hotel for what you can get elsewhere. I would overlook some of the downsides if the beds were actually Queen -

Staff was so friendly and nice! We arrived after a long travel delay and they were so gracious! Even offered us breakfast at their terrace room which was fantastic. Rooms small but clean with everything you need. Location was right near a subway and could walk to the park or Times Square, Hell's Kitchen etc. would stay again.

I recently booked a two nights stay through Booking.com. Having a job that keeps me in hotels nearly 85% of the time, and having my own background in hospitality (Starwood,Four Seasons), I'm very laid back and as most people who travel for work have rewards memberships.I should have cut my losses on Day 1 when Angela greeted me!! Or, should I rephrase and say didn't greet me! I step to the front desk, say "good afternoon, I'm checking.....and at no time have any of the two clerks raised their heads. And I don't think they are even typing?? I put my identification and pre-paid card on the ledge and Angela is half crazed telling me "oh, you don't want to use this card"! My reply! "Okay, why not?" Well, because it doesn't work and we will take $50 and you won't get it back!" I've never heard this before!! So, I ask.."Angela, why don't I pay cash for the facility fee, and you can pay me at check out"!? She says again "you don't want to use this card!, not responding at all to my statement and her energy is just angry and aggressive!!I tell her I received an email from your General Manager "Dan" (and I was mistaken it was Don). Now Angela is upset about the email and has to get her manager, because she needs "backup". Okay!! What!! I'm 5'3, and 100 pounds soaking wet!! This is bananas!! Who filed the lawsuit that made these guys so jumpy!!The manager comes over and finally I can use my "tainted" card! I apologize for getting the managers name wrong. They are still treating me in an odd manner though. I am able to check in and my room is okay, when balanced with the attitude that will come the next day from a new round of front desk staff. The room had two broken drawers, but other than that it was fine!! Housekeeping staff was phenomenal, bartenders were gracious and on point, and the housekeeping supervisors were very professional and supportive of their team.A change in schedule had me book a second night through Booking.com. On the morning of my second day, I thought I would go down to the front desk and make sure my key was okay ( since I hadn't originally been slated to stay a second night) and make sure my facilities fee was paid! What a terrible idea!! And by the reception I received, you would have thought it was the strangest idea a guest has ever had!! I approached, with my ID, room key, and cc. I don't if this kid had a bad night but essentially I was told that he needed nothing from me, my key was fine (guess what at 10:30 I had to go downstairs again and get new keys)! I asked if there was a reason for his tone!? And he is now arguing with me, as is his female co-worker! I say, "at this point, I think I'd rather just check out!! Because you don't seem to need my money! He says, "if that's what you want to do, we can do that for you!" This changes once he gets "a witness" as he calls it!!Long and short of it.........Booking.com was horrified, my old boss at the Westin was horrified and I'll keep telling people.So, this is the lesson!! There was no reason on Gods green earth to attack a guest on 2 separate occasions!! I had no issues with other outlets and clearly something is amiss at the front desk!! If you don't like being heart of house......don't do it!!! I don't care about the money.....but I literally cried in my room. How does that work?????

This hotel has a serious elevator problem. There is always a long wait, so if you stay here get on a low floor and plan to take the stairs. If you have problems walking, select a different hotel. This hotel is close to many of the best theaters in New York and very convenient to Central Park.

We were in NY for my spouses 40th birthday and had a wonderful stay at the Park Central. The location is perfect and close to the subway line. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Highly recommend. The little café is great for grabbing a quick breakfast or snack.

Recently renovated with comfortable beds and very clean. Staff is helpful and a very pleasant stay. We walked to the Metropolitan Opera House at Lincoln center, and the next morning walked to time Square and Grand Central Station. We have traveled to NY for pleasure many times and this hotel is perfect for experiences on this side of town.

Well located but our room was small for the 4 people we were and was far too dark, only two bed lights for the whole room !! Looking for a black t shirt turned into a nightmare! Only 2 lifts serving 9 floors and often one was out of service... lets queu baby !!

My mother and I took our first trip to NYC and wanted a hotel that had a good location to Times Square, Central Park and some great shopping! This landed us at Park Central Hotel and overall we were very pleased with our stay. Our flight arrived a few hours before check-in, yet we were greeted warmly by staff and were admitted early to a room that was very nice -- two double beds, large tv, nice overlook to the main street of 7th Ave. and a spacious bathroom and storage closet. The room was kept very clean by hotel staff during our stay. The hotel itself looked very nice and always smelled very refreshing :) There is a classy looking bar and lounge in the lobby, although we never used it, it looked very pleasant. There is a small market place in the lobby as well that serves beverages, baked goods, etc. that was convenient. However, there is no restaurant within the hotel, which we did not realize until we attempted to order room service. Wasn't a big deal as there are many great food places within walking distance -- recommend Ray's Pizza! The only mishap we had with this hotel was with the concierge. We asked them what was the quickest way to get to the Statue of Liberty Cruises by subway. Their directions were to take the R train which was located right outside the hotel and to get off at White Hall Street. This is exactly what we did, yet we soon realized while on the train that there was not going to be a stop at White Hall. We got off and soon realized we were in Jackson Heights, which is in New Jersey! We eventually found our way back and noted it to the concierge what had happened. Their remark was that we needed to take the R train to Downtown instead of Uptown and they assumed we knew that. With hotel guests 90% of the time being from out of town and not knowing the area, it was probably not wise for them to assume we knew that. Other than that, I would highly recommend staying at Park Central Hotel and I would definitely stay here again :)

Great place to stay near central park and time square . hotel rooms were clean although bathroom ceiling was stained but overall cleanliness was good . reception and bar overall good but go net door for coffee as its cheaper and far nicer . the hotel is in a great location for the theatres and excellent choice of eatrys.Would definately stay there again.

very nice hotel ambience is moder and clean wifi perfectly working with nice rooms quite spaces altough not very silent as road rumors are not properly isulated ...and perfect location very close to best stores area

I travel for a living and here because Park Central is across from Carnegie Hall and it came so highly recommended. I can say this is the best hotel, the most courteous staff and the most helpful manager-Elizabeth - in all my travel. They have been proven to be responsive to every need with an "over the top" courtesy which is consistent and positive. I'm here for a Great New York experience and they're providing just that. We chose the best so that Friday's performance at Carnegie Hall will be the best. I am assured it will!

The hotel is very well located for walking anywhere in midtown. The room was very good, and all the extra needs we had were quickly and perfectly fulfilled by the housekeeping service and the front desk personnel. Everybody was very kind to us.We plan to come back to this hotel.

Very friendly staff from the valet to check-in/out to Housekeeping.The room was nice and clean, and the bar was pleasant with sitting areas. They give you a coffee maker if you ask, and there is a grab-n-go food stand onsite. No restaurant in the hotel, but there's plenty of places close by, like the Redeye Grill down the block. Perfect place and location for my event at Carnegie Hall. I highly recommend it.

No kitchen for room service. No coffee pots in the room for morning coffee. The little café in the hotel did not have a good selection and staff were rude. The room was hot in temperature with no way of cooling it down. The elevators are small and take forever.

An overall positive experience began with a greeting at the curb by the valet.Check-in was quick and pleasant, the desk clerk smiling and polite.Room and bath were clean, comfortable, and quiet.Room was what I'd call a "normal"-size American hotel room, not a small New York room.Friends had slightly larger room next to mine with larger bath and all the same finishes.

Had a standard king room and it was fine, Although we requested and upgrade they did not provide us ne and did not give me e reason why. I asked but they didn't know why? The hotel was good for the price as most of the hotels in this part of the city at in the $400 to $500 a night range. Great location!!!

This is our second stay in the hotel and my review is identical to that of 2 years ago.The location is fantastic. Midtown 3 blocks south of Central Park. There is lots to do nearby, and it is two blocks away from the madness on 5th ave.The rooms are comfortable, clean and decent. The service is good. Now the bad stuff: Elevators. Once you stay here, you will never forget. The building was built for 8 shafts. There are two working. It takes forever to get an elevator during the busy hours.There is no restaurant. There is no room service. They charge $30 per day for a Resort Fee - what a laugh. This should be more regulated. The resort fee is simply a hidden hotel price increase.

Ok facility and location but the whole experience got overshadowed by the "facility fee" scam. The fee is not communicated during the booking and you will not be informed until you have booked the room. It's communicated prior to your arrival, by then it's to late. So what is included in the fee (32.66$ /per night)? • Unlimited local & domestic long distance phone calls (within the USA).• Unlimited use of 7th Avenue 24 hour Fitness Center• Luggage storage upon arrival and/or departure no later than 9:00 PM • Use of the Apple workstations with printing, faxing and scanning through the Guest Relations DeskGiven that it is 2016, soon 2017, and almost everybody have a smartphone. So... who need to pay a fee for "Unlimited local & domestic long distance phone calls" and access to workstations, faxing (?) etc. This cannot be something that majority of guests are asking for that they need to automaticly include as fee?And access to 24h Fitness Center... that's actualty a good thing if the Fitness Center was something more than couple of treadmills in a small room.

The 1st pic was taken on my birthday this past September. The 2nd was my 13th wedding annivsary. This shows how much I love this hotel! As a native New Yorker myself, it's always good to come back home and stay where everything and everywhere is convenient. The room spells ELEGANT. The bed and pillows feel like heaven. My wife loves the lighted mirror in the bathroom! Keri, Sanday, Ivy and the rest of the staff were professional...in style! If any of my colleagues are planning on visiting NYC in the future, I will consider, suggest, and even BRAG about staying at Park Central!

I started staying here probably 20 years ago. Because of its location, I stuck with the place through several renovations, but this last stay, Nov. 16-19, 2016, ended it for me. The rooms are bat cave dark and there are no lights in the closets. I asked for a desk lamp (ther are none) and they brough me one with a short in it it -- it flickered. You are charged $90 PLUS TAX on top of your room bill for the business center whether you use it or not. The business center is 3 stand up computer screens in the lobby to print boarding passes and check email--that is it. Thre is no other business center. When I wanted to sit down and prepare a document, they sent me to Staples 4 blocks away which charges $35 an hour. The shampoo and conditioner are bolted to the wall and you have to squirt it out in miniscue pumps. The in room safe was broken. No shower caps; no robes, no extra blanket. WORST OF ALL IS THE ELEVATOR SITUATION--IT CAN TAKE 15 MINIUTES TO GET AN ELEVATOR. THERE ARE 8 ELEVATORS IN THE PLACE BUT ALL EXCEPT TWO ARE PREMANENTLY SHUT OFF--EVEN WALLPAPER OVER THE DOORS TO MAKE YOU TRY OT FORGET YOU WAITED 15 MINUTES ON AN ELEVATOR. WORST OF ALL, IT WAS $389 A NIGHT--THE WALDORF WAS HAVING A SALE FOR $199 A NIGHT. RUN AWAY AND DON'T GO BACK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This was our first visit to The Park Central and we were not disappointed. In town for a wedding, the hotel was one of the choices for out-of-town guests. The location was spectacular, within waling distance to everywhere we wanted to-Times Square, theater, restaurants, Fifth Avenue, Central Park. We checked in around 8 p.m. and were greeted by Elsa, a front-desk employee who proved a wonderful representation of the entire hotel staff. From Elsa, to the bellman, housekeeping and concierge, this staff doesn't miss a beat in providing service to guests in a friendly, knowledgeable way.When we were escorted to our room, our bellman asked if it was satisfactory. It was next to the ice machine. Within minutes, he had our room changed to a better location. Quiet, a bit larger and just what we were hoping for.We wanted dinner after settling in-nothing fancy as we were in traveling clothes. The concierge recommended The Redeye Grill across the street. Perfect suggestion! Excellent food, great service, and a glass of champagne on the house to boot (guests from the hotel receive that little perk!). On another day, we asked for a pizza place for lunch. The concierge recommended a little hole-in-the wall place that was out-of-this world.Looking forward to our next trip to NYC, where our base will definitely be The Park Central Hotel. Thanks for a fabulous stay!!

Wonderful Atmosphere as soon as you arrive !!! Elise was very helpful and friendly !! A must stay with its location and very well kept rooms. The views from the rooms puts a personal touch in the New York feel .

This was the second time I had stayed at the Park Central hotel. The location is excellent with great subway access to boot. The service was superb from the moment I checked in to needing to find a cab in the rain. My room was of a generous size, very clean, and all of the normal amenities.

My fifth stay in 5 months. Once again terrific room, excellent service at a reasonable price. Love the Park Central for its great location and exceptional professional care. Remains my go to hotel in NYC.

Great location, and the hotel and rooms are serviceable BUT...apart from Elsa (who was warm, kind and wonderful), the front desk/reception staff was cool and aloof at best. It was as if they would have ALL liked to be doing something else - so disengaged!Then there were the NIGHTLY elevator debacles. The elevators are small as it is, and while they are on both sides of the lobby, every single night we witnessed a manager or maintenance man trying to get one of the two to work, to no avail. For God's sake, FIX THEM! We were there for a week, so it's not like this was a one-off. The only other shining star we encountered was Carmelo, the man out front who hails your taxi for you. A fun, friendly guy who loves what he's doing and always has a smile on his face. Very professional, too!

The location is great. Very expensive, with a big facilities fee for things that should be free,does not have a restaurant or room service. The front desk staff is not very helpful. The common areas do not have places to sit. The concierge sent us to a restaurant named Guantanamera. The food was awful. All in all posh hotel, good location, needs more friendly staff and less facilities (resort) fee with no resort amenities at all.

I have stayed at Park Central for many years. At one time it was just ok, but since the renovation of all of the rooms I can say it is now a great place to stay. The rooms are large enough, and as quiet as most NY City hotels. An excellent bar for entertaining clients or family, and a great location. Within walking distance to Central Park or Time Square This was a business trip but returning with other couples in a few weeks for a weekend get-away in the city. I would highly recommend this hotel.

The location is great.The room was quiet, which matches our needs. We did not ask for a view, and had none. It was comfortable enough, the bed was quite good in fact.Sheets and towels are changed every day (what a waste !) but the cleaning is not thorough.There are no real seats or armchairs or cosy corners in the lobby, it is not a place to meet people and chat.Then there is this issue of the "facilities fee" already mentioned by others...

The stay was fantastic! My 13 yr old daughter and her friend were with us and loved ever minute. The room was spacious and very clean. Beds were comfy and service was spot on. The location.....couldn't be better. 3 blocks to Central Park, 4 blocks from Time Square and 6 blocks to Rockefeller with shopping and restaurants in between. Starbucks was right next door to girl or energy meters. All in all a great hotel.

Great location for family to meet for the NYC Marathon. within walking distance to Central Park and TImes Square. Great meeting area in bar for family to gather. Staff was great. Hotel updated and clean. Would definitely stay there again!

Great location. Terrible cost. We were charger $30 per day for a "facilities fee" that was not advertised. Facilities fee??? Rooms didn't even have refrigerators or coffee makers. Also parking costs far exceed comparable hotels... $70 per day. We have stayed in several NYC hotels, and we will avoid the Park Central in the future. Not worth the money. Keep looking, there are much better hotels available for the money.

I used this hotel for business and pleasure for years but a few years ago had a bad experience. I gave it a bad review. I thought I would give it a second chance since we love the location. They did a great job remodeling beds are comfortable , bathrooms areTastefully decorated. The employees need work except the maintanence man who came to fix my remote. He was there in a minute pleasant and solved the problem. Bar wasn't open until 5:00 on Sunday. Did not like 30 fee for nothing that I used

Great location - centrally and conveniently located equally distant (about 6 blocks) between Central Park and Times Square plus the subway is about 40 steps from the Park Central Hotel entrance. It is a safe haven for a solo traveler and elevators now require your room key for floor access offering additional security. The newly reopened bar and lounge is a lovely place to relax after a hectic day. Any request of Park Central Guest Services has always exceeded my expectations. And, my bed was so comfortable this last stay that it inspired me to come home and purchase a new mattress set!

Great hotel in central location. Handy for access to Central Park, theatre district - everywhere really! Rooms were good sized and quiet and beds were super super comfy. The hotel was booked as part of a package which seemed good value. We didn't spend much time there but as a base to explore the city, it was perfect.

Having read some of the reviews I was a bit hesitant about what to expect. However the accommodation was beautiful and our room was very comfortable with amazing views out to Carnegie hall and 7th Avenue. The bed was so comfortable and facilities were sufficient for our needs. Rooms were cleaned each day with clean towels provided. We did miss not having coffee/tea making facilities - however I have just noted you can request this on arrival.The coffee shop within the hotel was somewhat expensive ($23 for 2 coffees, a filled roll and 1 croissant). however there are a cafes close by. We found a great place called Frames - just Time Square on 7th Avenue - buffet style breakfast with an amazing choice.The location was spot on for us and central to a lot of the attractions and subways.We had a positive experience with staff (especially Ashley Lindner). She was very helpful and made our stay all the more enjoyable

$33.00 per day for wifi and fitness center use. We are in our late 70,s and could not use the fitness center.The wifi kept going out (room # 565) by the ice machine. We had no choice but to pay the facility fee. The room was clean the beds were comfortable.Location was very good.

First class! You won't be disappointed, Great value if booked as package with airline travel. Elevators require room key for added security. Ideal NYC location with park and theatre attractions and fine dining.

My wife and I have stayed many times at the Park Central Hotel, located kitty-corner to Carnegie Hall and close to Times Square and many subway stops. That's most important in NYC in order to visit some of the many, many points of interest spread among the many neighborhoods and burroughs of the city. We've always appreciated the friendly, helpful staff. The doormen are most capable of getting you a taxi or car within minutes. The small coffee shop located in the lobby provides some very good pastries and coffees, plus the usual necessities. If that's not sufficient, next door are two other coffee shops, one being a Starbucks. Since the original large hotel was divided into smaller hotels one must be prepared to wait for an elevator. The rooms in the Park Central have been updated, with comfortable furnishings, excellent beds, good TV's with many TV channels available. There are many reasons this is a very popular hotel, we've certainly enjoyed our stays at the Park Central.

We love NY and visit many times, however this was our first stay at the Park Central hotel. We will not make that mistake again. The room was simply average. Nothing more. The staff was very put out and sometimes just rude. Their attitude was one in which they know your just passing through and they probably won't see you again, so no big deal. It's rather insulting to deal with people who have a real attitude like the people at Park Central hotel.

This hotel exceeded our expectations. I was nervous after reading some of the reviews. Although the room was a bit small, everything was clean. The location was ideal for getting to all points of interest. There are lots of dining options nearby. I would have expected a coffee maker, fridge, etc. as an amenities based on the room rate and level of accommodation. We had one issue with air conditioning that was addressed promptly.

Beautiful hotel. Staff was very friendly and provided great advice. Rooms were very clean, quiet and kept maintained well! Location is awesome if you are looking to visit sites - between Central Park and Times Square. Near subway. Definitely would be my first choice when visiting NYC again.

Met by a surly doormen only really after a tip!Front desk werent overly friendly but its Manhattan the week of the Marathon so maybe they dont need to be. Rooms are well appointed however the lifts that service 3-9 were very slow at times as one was broken for two days and the que of ten people was to much for me so i went into the adjacent hotel and used there stairs to get to the fifth floor. great position

This hotel sits a short walk from Columbus Circle and Central Park. It was a convenient place to stay for New York Marathon runners. It is also a short walk to Broadway and Times Square. Subway stops are close by on the corners enabling guests to head in any direction. Carnegie Hall is across the street and the popular Carnegie Deli is two doors down. We were told that the hotel went through extensive remodeling a couple of years ago. This is reflected in up-to-date decor and a pleasing aesthetic. The hotel is well kept and clean except along baseboards in halls and rooms. That can be off putting upon arrival. The valance in our room was broken and hanging down one side making the first impression rather questionable. The staff at PC is very good. Everyone was helpful. We especially liked the housekeeper for our room, Marissa. She was friendly, helpful and did a great job. Security was efficient in opening our room safe when it malfunctioned and the front desk staff was always pleasant even though they never seemed to have down time. Suggestions for improvement would be to install some hooks or towel bars in the bath in reach of the shower but not in it, longer shower curtains so water does not splash out of the shower, refrigerators available for other than medical reasons, and more seating in the lobby. The tour ticket sellers outside we constant and annoying. The good outweighed the bad and overall we enjoyed our stay.

The Park Central is a great hotel! Nice room, clean, loved the bed...slept great!Hotel is conveniently located to Time Square and the theater district.The staff was exceptionally great, especially Ashley, the concierge.Asked her to do a couple of things for us and she went above and beyond. Was very impressed! Will definitely stay here again.

I must say Park Central Hotel was a pleasant stay. Was only in New York for one night for a gathering. Park Central hotel location was perfect. The room was a nice size....for New York :) The bathroom was also a nice size & clean. I would visit this hotel again.

We spent four days in the Park Central Hotel and were very happy with our choice! The location is excellent, as the hotel is close to Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Fifth Avenue, Times Square, the 57th St subway stop, and many good restaurants. The staff were very professional and helpful during our entire stay. We were able to check our bags and wander around the city while we waited for the 4:00 pm check-in. Our bed was comfy, the bathroom was well appointed, the Wifi worked well, and the flat-screen TV was clear and sharp. Our room was in a quiet corner so we avoided the street noise. The “Central Market” is a convenient grab-and-go place for coffee, pastries, and sandwiches, located right inside the front door. And there’s a large lobby area *behind* the front desk with comfortable chairs, sofas, and tables where guests can eat, read, relax, talk, or patronize the bar during the evening. The hotel isn't cheap, but hey--it's in New York City! We'll probably stay here again!

I stayed here whilst a ran the NYC Marathon so the location was fantastic, being so close to Central Park. However the only plus was the room was to a high standard; the hotel fell short in every other aspect. For example there are no water machines on the floors (ice yes, water no) and asking for water at the bar - we were told to buy some. This was only bettered by my partner being locked out of the room and asking the maid to let her in, to be screamed at to go to downstairs (down the hallway witnessed by other people). Although I could understand this, reception would not give her a key as she had no ID to the room despite saying the room number, our name and our stay length. You just got the impression that they did not care about you or your stay. This was not the attitude of security (who kindly helped me to my room once I had collapsed from the run) or the porter who was frozen but smiled all day to get taxis for you. These two were out shone by the rudeness of their colleagues. In addition the "breakfast market" had expensive coffee and no real options for breakfast bar dry muffins. Great location and rooms, just be expected to pay for everything and don't expect to be treated well. Whereas two blocks down you could have free water, free coffee and staff that actually want to help you and be polite. Really sad as I booked here as a thank you to my gf for coming to the marathon with me. For the price - I wanted something special, sadly it was special in a bad way.

Despite some pretty concerning reports (mainly whinging yanks) my wife and I stayed here for a seven night stay just over a week ago and were pleasantly surprised. Booked from UK before departing we were not subject to the hidden facilities charges some reviews speak of.The hotel reception was very good with a swift check in by very polite staff. Despite our room not being ready our luggage was securely kept for us at no extra charge and when we returned an hour later our room was ready.We did not experience any difficulties with the lifts as reported and the room was more than adequate in size with an extremely large and comfy king size bed. Word of advice, best pack a few extra hangers as there were only 6 which if like my wife yours packs for a month then a few brought with you will ease the situation.Some people complain about traffic noise, well we were on the 6th floor and for an inner city hotel the noise was tolerable so don't worry unless you are a very light sleeper.We only used the hotel for sleeping as there are so many places to wine, dine and get breakfast close by.In short would I stay here again. Absolutely.Great stay, clean and tidy, comfy room/bed and helpful and pleasant staff.Thanks.

My husband, adult daughter, and I made our first trip to the Big Apple to celebrate our daughter's birthday. We selected this hotel because of its overall location to most popular New York City attractions and because we were looking for a larger room to accommodate 3 adults. We had a double room with 2 queen beds. The room was large compared to big city hotel rooms. This hotel fit our criteria well. We loved the location and walked to most things we wanted to see. It's location on 7th Avenue was great and offered a variety of restaurants with a variety of price points. We selected the "cheap seats" as we called it and ended up on the 3rd floor of the hotel, no view of the city, but that was okay for us. The room was quiet and we didn't hear street noise. The hotel offered options to spend more per night to have a city view room. The staff was courteous, and the room clean and orderly. The bathroom was spacious, but we wished there was more counter space to set our toiletries. The shower was modern and comfortable. The hotel sent text messages checking on how the stay was going. There was only one small annoyance, we didn't have wash cloths for the first two days of our stay and needed to request them. The staff responded positively and promptly. On the third day, I left a note on the sink and that resolved the problem for the remainder of the stay. What would have made this stay better? We decided it would have been a complimentary cup of coffee. We get it; it's New York and everything has a cost. Coffee in the hotel cafe was nearly $4.00 a cup. C'est la vie! All in all, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and would also stay here again. Looking forward to a return trip!

Very pleasant stay at this hotel. Will certainly return to stay here in my next trip back to NYC. Location is great, it is all within walking distance to Time Square, Central Park and Fifth Avenue. Room is reasonable size for 2 persons. Staffs are helpful. Overall energy is fantastic.

We like this place very much as we got a free upgrade to our room with 2 queen beds. Also the people at the front desk are very friendly and professional. The elevators are just fine for which we had some concerns after reading other reviews.

My twin sister and I celebrated our big Birthday in NY. at this hotel. At first, we had some room issues but everything got resolved ASAP. OUR BIGGEST PLEASURE, was the concierge named Ashley. VERY HELPFUL with the days plans, birthday dinner plans, the One World Observatory and the Standard for 360 views of the city. And the pictures Ashley took time to take for us! Always a smile and always positive. Thank you for professional attitude.

We have just returned from our second trip to the park central hotel. We were very impressed by the hotels renovations since our last trip four years ago. The new bar is very nice and modern with a chic feel to it. The staff were very friendly upon check in and later offered us a complementary drink in the bar and coffee from the coffee shop because on our last visit to the hotel we got engaged! Overall the hotel location is great, right next to Central Park, easy walk to 5th Ave, Times Square and the 57th st. Subway stop is literally right outside the door! Room was clean with large flat screen tv, only negative about the room was the noise from the street outside but it is New York after all. We will definitely return to the park central hotel on our next visit to New York.

The room, staff and location are all excellent. The room was clean and the comfortable. We did have an issue where our room was missing a desk lamp when we arrived and it took a couple of days to get one put in and the chair to the desk seemed to be broken a little (if you leaned back you felt you were going to fall backwards). But the beds were extremely comfortable! The housecleaning staff took care of the missing desk lamp as soon as they were aware of it. (I had called the front desk the first night but I don't think he understood what I was telling him). The bathrooms were clean and we had plenty of towels. The location is just a couple blocks from Central Park and a quick taxi ride to shows (or a walk!) I stayed here with my 2 children (ages 20 and 23) and we were all very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Stayed there 2 nights (Thursday and Friday) in a room booked through Hotwire - paid 255/night.Room had to be one of the worst in hotel. Certainly not what you would expect at such a nice place? Room overlooked rear courtyard. Faced other rooms and air conditioning units.Safe was non functioning. This was mentioned multiple times and the issue went unaddressed. We spoke Elvir at the Guest Relations counter. He offered assurances to move us to a better / different room or to get the safe operating. Neither happened. In addition the hotel was overbooked - short 7 rooms.Calls to Guest Relations were not responded to during and after our stay.Avoid this place. Too many other choices. I'm letting Hotwire know too.

This was our first visit to New York and was a surprise birthday gift from wife. We could not have not have been happier with the choice of Hotel. I know that there was a lot of research involved prior to booking to get the right Hotel and we found it! There are many highlights to our stay but location and room size exceeded our expectation. Once you come out of the lobby and on to the street, Central Park is a few minutes to your left and Times Square is in full view to your right and only a few minutes walk away, most major attractions are achievable on foot and at worst the Metro is under the Hotel, easy travel if you want to go downtown or out to visit the other boroughs. The Hotel staff are incredibly helpful with special thanks to Elizabeth who went out of her way to ensure an extra comfortable stay. We intend on returning to New York for a summer visit and Park Central will be our first choice!

The hotel has an excellent location. You can walk or take Metro for going all across Manhattan. It was renewed lately, so beds are new and comfortable. The only issue is with elevator, it just has two and sometimes they take so many minutes to go and back.

Mrs Elsa at check in was adorable, the doormen were very nice and helpful! Service for the room not good!!! Had to go get towels very day! Check out very unfriendly lady! Coffeeshop in the hotel not customer friendly at all! No little fridge in the room. Rooms for 4 people way too small! The hotel location is very good!!!

As an old customer of this hotel I was glad to be back to a simply but elegantly furnished room, a quiet floor, a nicely appointed bathroom without minuscule bottles, and helpful staff at this great location. It remains pricey, especially when extra and unnecessary charges are added to the daily cost (e.g. long distance calling in the era of cell phones) together with the steep NYC taxes. But it does offer better prices during other months of the year and it's worth the stay.

Stayed there for 4 nights. Room was clean and very good. Elevators are too few and too small for the hotel, so be ready for long waits at rush hours. Gym is OK, but lacks some basic and cheap features. I bought a reservation package that included an "express breakfast" where you can get some things at the hotel cafe. I recommend you don't buy this breakfast - not worth the price. Service in the hotel was generally aloof and impersonal. A few days after arriving home, I get a charge on my credit card for "holding packages". Tried to get some explanation from the hotel, but got no detailed response and have been therefore unable to determine whether it is a proper charge or not. All in all, excellent location but mediocre service.

I stayed here for a business trip and I don't believe anywhere else could have been more perfect. Location was excellent for seeing as much as possible in very few hours and the attentive service wa over the . I will be back

Room was very clean up to date and modern. Warm and shower excellent Staff were friendly and helpful. My granddaughter left her bag in the taxi from the airport to the hotel . Emmanuel went above and beyond the call of duty to track down the taxi driver and the bag was returned back to us intact. Thankyou Emmanuel

Bringing my adult children to my childhood home was a wonderful time to see the city and stay in a comfortable, convienent location. This hotel hit the mark, close to Central Park, not too far from the theater district and across the street from Carnegie Hall. My daughters had a wonderful time and a comfortable clean room to retreat to when needed.

I highly recommend this hotel due to its great staff, it's location, pretty rooms, and excellent disability accessibility. It is a little pricey, however, for how well you are taken care of, it is well worth it! This was my third stay at this hotel and I have never been disappointed.

We had a great stay at the Park Central Hotel. Right across from Carnegie Hall and many great restaurants. We went to Trattoria Del'arte for Brunch and Quality Italian Steakhouse for dinner, both are really great. We also went right across the street to the Red Eye for Drinks and appetizers and it also was quite good. The hotel has an adjoining door with the Manhattan Club an upscale time share hotel. Our room was clean and updated the bathroom was bright and spotless. The bar was upscale and the bartender John was very nice, enjoyed our time talking with him. We go to the city a couple times a year and usually stay closer to the theaters, however this was a great location and a nice walk to the shows. It's really close to Central Park and its nice to walk in the park in the morning. Will definitely be going back to Park Central!

My husband and I stayed here two nights when his company had an event in Times Square and were disappointed with the accommodations. This hotel has seen better days. The furnishings, decor and hallways are worn out and look bedraggled. It just feels dirty and used. The location is great, but there are definitely better places to spend the night than here. We chose to spend as little time in the hotel as possible. There are no dining options in the hotel, but there is a Starbuck's two doors down! If you don't care where you lay your head, you'll be fine. If you're a bit more picky about your room, pass on this one (at least until they do a renovation).

I stay at the Park Central for business 5-7 times per year. It has a great mid-town location, suitable for business or leisure travel. Always easy to check in and the service is fantastic. I get a great room, always clean and at a great rate. Highly recommended

I booked this hotel through points so wasn't sure what to expect. But the room was just fine. Quiet, clean, well appointed. The location was quite convenient, easy to get wherever we needed to go via subway.However, my complaints: long lines at the front desk. Always. And the insulting $30/day resort fee, for get this: Unlimited telephone calling. (Who doesn't have his own cell phone these days?) Check your bags with the bellhop. Use our computers in the business center. All stuff that comes with every other hotel room at no additional charge. What's baffling is that they do provide wifi with the room at no charge. Now this would be something to include in that resort fee, but no. Ridiculous.

The hotel is in a great spot! Close to the Central Park and. Times Square , no need to uber at all! The room is beautiful, spacey and clean! It s one of the most affordable hotels in the area as well! I highly recommend it to everyone, especially if this is the first visit to Big Apple!!

Best hotel I've stayed inFriendly staff, great hygiene of entire hotel, location is brilliant, value for money hard to beat. I've stayed in more expensive hotels which were not worth the money. This place is worth every penny. The rooms are lovely and the beds are like heaven.The bar and restaurant are up market fair New York prices. The great location means your not far from Starbucks or a Dunkin Donut

Perfectly placed for most attractions.Subway a few steps away.Central location means easy access to most major attractions/sights.The only thing to be careful about is making sure the room you book is the room you get, especially if you have upgraded.

The hotel is conveniently located in front of Central Park and literally 3 minutes walk from 5 th Avenue. Rooms are spacious and clean. Rooms not new but well maintained. Loads of free drinks and water between 5 pm and 7 pm

Lovely experience in the heart of NYC. It took us only a minute to walk to Time Square and all major city attractions like the Rockefeller Plaza/ City library/Lincoln Center were only minutes away. Rooms were nice and spacious but it was hard to get a nice view.

Park Central Hotel New York is located very close to Times Square, Broadway Theatres, MoMA and Central Park. Large and quiet rooms with very comfortable beds and free Wi-Fi connection. We enjoyed breakfast at Central Market and the Fitness Room. The hotel provides free luggage storage after (before) check out (check in). All the staff was very professional and friendly. We would definitely stay here again.

We spent 3 nights at Park Central. We found the hotel to be suitable for our stay. The front desk, concierge, and bell staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, but it did not have a coffee maker, mini-refrig, or seating (which I would expect for the price). The hotel does not have a restaurant or room service. It didn't matter to us because there are plenty of wonderful dining options within a block of the hotel. Although there were only two elevators to our floor, we did not find it to be a problem. The best feature of the hotel is the location. It is close to the park, Carnegie Hall, Times Square, theaters, and the subway. Overall, average hotel with excellent location.

I spent a comfortable few nights at this hotel, and it could not be more convenient for Carnegie Hall which is just across the road. The room was fine, but I felt as though the layout could have been better. There is a long, slim desk, but this is taken up with a very large TV and several drawers, which is great but leaves little useful desk space. There are no tea/coffee-making facilities in the room (though they did kindly provide a kettle on request) and no fridge, which is a nuisance when you could otherwise store some supplies for breakfast in this very expensive city. The beds are very comfortable but my partner and I swapped rooms twice before we found one quiet enough to sleep. The windows of the hotel seem rather old and, though they are double-glazed, you can easily hear the street outside or the AC fans in the courtyard. I noticed every day that there were not enough staff on the desk at check-in and people in line were looking quite frustrated. Otherwise, staff were very quick and helpful to provide extra clothes hangers etc. So I have mixed feelings about this place. Perhaps it is particularly good value? I hope so, but I'm afraid I can't comment on that because I was in NY on business and the room was provided for me.

The hotel lobby and bar are cool, updated and well-appointed. The elevators are very small, and a bit slow. There is no actual restaurant and no room service which was a big disappointment, especially for the property price range. The King room was nice sized, not cramped with an average sized bathroom. The toiletries were devent, but the room overall needed some attention to detail (eg. llack of good artificial lighting and the paint/walpaper around the window were peeling and obviously had water damage).

Generally enjoyed my stay at Park Central which is in a very nice spot.A big THANK YOU to the Guest Relation Manager Elizabeth Cacovic which helped me check in my room very early in the morning . Whenever I needed something she was there to help me with a big smile.Helped me also to make a fast check out.Thank you Elizabeth for making my stay at Park Central wonderful !!!!!!!!!!George

Park Central was the perfect hotel for our girls trip to NYC. The location is great, close to Central Park and 5th Avenue shopping. Plus, walking distance to Times Square. It is beautiful and definitely worth your money!

Selected this hotel for location to my HS reunion and Broadway. It was a perfect location to local transportation as well as being able to walk to Broadway shows and Central Park. The hotel room was modern and very clean. The bed was so comfortable, you really had a good rest and excellent night sleep. The maids, concierge, front desk and door man were friendly and helpful. Even though the hotel did not have a restaurant, there were so many restaurants near by from coffee shops to expensive ones. I would go back to this hotel again.

When we checked in, they explained that there was a resort fee. I told them that we were unaware of this resort fee at the time of our booking, and that they kindly waive this fee. They waived the fee without any issues, it was great. The rooms are nice, it's a 4-star hotel, the rooms are very large for NYC. I wish they had room service/restaurant but other than that I really have nothing to complain about. The gym was good, the wifi was good. The beds are very comfortable. My favorite part about this hotel was the location, you really can't beat it if your doing the tourist thing.

I've been coming here since 2007. When the conference I was attending at another hotel was booked, this was the overflow hotel and I must say, I was very fortunate. My husband and I have family in NJ and always stay here a few days during our visit for the holidays...or my favorite, the Fall. The location is a dream. 3 block walk to Central Park for morning walk/jog. Subway entries all around to get down to the Village, Little Italy or China town in a flash. Wandering through to Columbus Ave or over to 5th is a breeze. The staff are always great and generally if we reserve there for the next time we get a discount. Cab ride from JFK or Laguardia is quick and not to costly. We even take the train in to Grand Central and cab from there. Wonderful place!

The location of this hotel is great but the hotel itself is just ok. The room was stuffy and you can't open a window. There is no breakfast aside from a little shop in the lobby. Watch for the "facilities fee" in the fine print. $33 per day for the gym and business center facilities that we didn't use felt like a rip off and left a bad taste in our mouth.

Very nice hotel in the perfect area. You are about 2-3 blocks from Central Park and three blocks from Times Square - you are right on 7th Ave. Very nice and safe area - so close to everything, including the subway system (which is a breeze and a great way to get to lower Manhattan in a short amount of time.

Excellent location. Friendly staff (uncommon for New York). Will definitely stay here again. in the past I have stayed at the waldorf and Marriott east side. This was a far better location. Our room was lovely, very clean, no complaints. The hotel staff helped us plan routes, food venues etc. Only complaint but it's minor is there is a surcharge of $30 per night which we weren't expecting,Can really recommend

I could sometimes understand why some hotels complain about the unfair competition of airbnb but when you experience Park central, you just think that you would prefer to be somewhere else ! It is not really an hotel but more a place to sleep .The people at reception are just so rude . They don't help you. They just want you to pay and these are excessive prices compared to the services you get . The rooms are very noisy; You hear a lot outside noise . There is no breakfast and dinner rooms .Well a very expensive and bad experience in NYC in a place I cannot define ! But for sure not an hotel !

We stayed for 6 nights .Check in was friendly and efficient. Concierge were friendly and organised . Booked a show through them . Room was nice with bath and big TV . Ironing board and iron in each room . Location was excellent ! We stayed on 10th floor . Rooms are very quiet there .However only 2 lifts working for whole hotel which meant a lot of waiting to get in and out the hotel .no kettle on your rooms so you have to buy every cup of tea : coffee .Cafe in hotel is a complete rip off . Had to go a block down the road each am for breakfast to save $12 on identical items at park central cafe The hotel has no kitchen , room service etc which was disappointing for what you pay .Business centre consists of 3 pc's . No printers , photo copiers etc . Overall not bad for NYC

The location was great. 2 blocks from Central Park, Broadway and just minutes from Times Square. Rooms were a good size and very clean. Beds were comfortable. We didn't have a view but didn't spend enough time in our room for it to matter. The front desk was very pleasant and efficient. It's not a cheap hotel but average for a place in such a great location.

This is our second stay at the PCNY. Fantastic location, clean and modern rooms and friendly staff. Only down side is the amenities fee for which you don't get much. No room service. Highly recommend. Will stay again for sure.

We've stayed twice at Park Central. It is a great location for sightseeing and a very nice hotel with many amenities. It is across the street from Central Park and an easy walk to Time Square and many other attractions. We stayed there prior to a cruise both times and it is close to the cruise port.

It was my 6th stay in Park Central, I always choose it mainly because of the staff, appart from excellent location, service and nice building. Reccomend rooms with view to street. Also the mini market is usefull.I am very grateful to the extremelly kind staff, Tony Cunaj from reservations, Elvir from guest relations, Saleem, Emanuel and Shpresa from reception, Alfredo and Félix the porters, and nice and caring people from security. Sorry for other names I do not remember! Gabriela. Argentina

I stayed here for a business trip, but extended my trip for a couple of days to enjoy the city. The location of the hotel is great- mid way between Central Park and Times Square (6 blocks to either destination). There is a greta little bakery right outside the front door, and a Starbucks next door to that! Convenience? Yes! The rooms are larger than standard for Manhattan, and the beds were confortable.Downside: Housekeeping was terrible. They missed our room completely the first day (and we NEVER had the do not disturb sign up) and when they did come for the remainder of the week, they did only the basics: made the bed, replaced the towels. We never got fresh glasses or even replacement liners for the ice bucket. The elevators are terrible, (slow, despite there being 4 of them) and there was ALWAYS a line to go up or DOWN! Staff didn't seem to particularly care much when these things were pointed out to them.Finally, a "facilities" charge of $60 x2 (for a 6-night stay) essentially meant I paid $20/night for internet. I'd rather just have those charges in the room rate please...what facilities exactly do you offer...and why was I charged twice while co-workers there for the same days weren't? Not sure I can recommend this place...it looks nice, and the pictures are great- but it just felt shady.

Loved our stay at Park Central. Centrally located, professionally staff and beautiful room. Very comfortable beds for rest after a long day of sightseeing and walking. Will most definitely stay here again.

Great location, a couple of blocks from Central Park, close to Broadway and to the MOMA. Hotel was renovated. Elizabeth from Customer Service helped us to extend our stay - thank you. An area for improvement is the number of elevators. They basically split the hotel into 2 brands, with the Westhouse taking the higher floors and with separate elevators. Thus there are long waits for the elevators :-(

I was pleasantly surprised how spacious the rooms were. We were two mother and daughter teams, four of us sharing one room and I figured we would be climbing over one another. Not at all! Room was clean, comfortable and attractive. The location could not be better, two blocks from the subway, walking distance to Central Park and plenty of nice places to dine in the area. Convenient deli on the corner. Would definitely recommend to friends.

Sixteenth floor. Lobby personnel were typical for New York. One of the advertised amenities was a daily dollar boxed lunch when "reservations were made through the internet" which I had done. When I twice asked for it they came out with different excuses as to why I didn't qualify. These qualifications were not listed in their web-site. There was no room microwave available and I was one of the lucky ones to have an available micro-fridge. For the price I paid for this hotel, I've had rooms elsewhere that were much better for less than half the price paid. But then again this is New York. On the plus side, this hotel is located in the heart of Manhattan.

With the help of Elisabeth Cacovic, at Guest relations, she was able to extend my stay during a very busy week, she is a very dedicated professional, able to go the extra mile to help loyal client like myself, also, without her help, my Business meetings would have not been the same, I really like this hotel very convenient for my Business meetings, very good location near Central Park. I strongly recommend this Hotel. a very good value for the price, and the staff is very dedicated to customers.

You cannot beat the Park Central for location, price and service. Very clean and nice size room for NYC, the parking deal is amazing; $10 per night and the service is attentive. I've stayed there 3 times and will again this december. Walking distance to Columbus Circle and Central park to the North and Mid-town restaurants and theatre to the south. Perfect.

This hotel is ideally situated for Times Square & Central Park. The hotel itself was lovely & the rooms spacious & decorated to a good standard. However, we had to have our key card replaced 9 times during a week stay because they stopped working. The staff were rude & unhelpful stating that it was our fault as we must have had the cards near our mobile phone. The staff could have done with going on a customer service course as the majority of them looked as if they didn't want to be there.

We loved the location of this hotel! they were located a few blocks south of Central Park which was fantastic, took some great runs around the park each morning! The location is perfect if you are going to Carnegie Hall. They are located very close to Times Square, can gaze straight down 7th to the center of NYC. The room seemed super fresh and updated ! definitely modern theme and beautifully decorated. The bed was fantastic, had the best nights of sleep on our vacation!The only downside to the room is the shower curtain was too short so the bathroom floor would end up very very wet! This is kind of silly design flaw, maybe they will eventually switch out those curtains. This wasn't too big of a deal overall. We had a very easy check in, check out process and had a great coffee from the little shop in the lobby. They have a nice big bar as well! We would definitely stay here again, great central location and clean, updated rooms.

Nice spacious rooms for NYC Lifts far too small for purpose Often queues for small lifts at busy times  Concierge helpful with bookings Check in and out very efficient Hotel well located for Central Park and all main attractions Air con so noisy had to be turned off Bathroom had very low bath and fixed shower but Ok No porter service offered Overall nice hotel in good position but at premium price

The hotel is in a great location right in the heart of the city. I found the hotel to be clean with a friendly and accommodating staff. In particular, Elizabeth, a manager at the hotel, was really helpful when I moved in and checked out. I knew I was going to arrive a little late to check out so she provided me with the opportunity to extend my check out time. If you want great service, you need to have a strong management team and the Park Central Hotel in New York has just that.

We stayed 7 nights and must say all was very good. just a few comments:The front desk staff is not very professional or inviting.They are very curt and not worthy of a 4 star hotel but with all else taken into consideration we overlooked.The housekeeping is very goodThe wifi is. terrible in the roomThe lighting is almost non existentOther then the front desk the staff was very accommodatingwe would return.

This hotel was such a nice surprise...great location, clean, all staff was friendly, we were immediately upgraded to a larger room without having to ask, market in the hotel offers a great selection, will definitely recommend to others and stay here again.

If you are looking to experience the best of what New York offers, this hotel is ideally located. Just a stone's throw away from Central Park and Times Square, anything -or anywhere- you want to experience is really very accessible from the hotel. The hotel itself is was a highlight of your holiday. Both the outside and inside provide a constant reminder that you are in one of the greatest cities in the world and the staff are fantastic. We found their friendly, professional and easy going manner very welcoming and made it easy for us to relax and feel at home from home. The service and coffee from the foyer is particularly good and the 24hr gym access is handy if your jet lag kicks in. Beds and rooms very comfortable and the wash products get a special mention - they smell amazing!

awesome place to stay in NYC , close to Central Park, Timesqusre and Rockefeller Ctr! Lots of good food around. The rooms were bigger than expected comparing to other hotels in the city, clean bathrooms, comfy beds and pillows, worth the $$$ we paid for per nite for a July 4th wkn. Front desk pips were friendly and offered help each time, even printed out directions and trains for us to use while in the city.

Took a trip to NYC with my wife to vacation and to visit our son. Stayed at Park Central Hotel and it was wonderful...perfect location...clean comfortable rooms...nice view of the city...and most important it felt like we were close to everything.

Park Central is a great place to stay in New York! Nice rooms, good bar, and reasonably priced. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and quiet. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Centrally located and lots of things are in walking distance.

I loved the locatio which is really close to Central Park. Easy to get to all the NY attractions. The hotel is big, and makes you feel like you could exist almost unnoticed. Big rooms for NYC. I had a room where I overlooked other rooms, so it didn't feel very private (no walking around without dressing after showering). The hotel has no restaurant, but that's not really an issue in middle of NY. The big negative for the hotel is the time lost waiting on elevators (they only seem to use 2). Often there were large queues and people losing patience and opting for the stairs (which are only really a fire exit).

Another great stay at the Park Central Hotel. Great service, friendly people & beautiful rooms. Hotel is located on 7th Ave & W57th. Short walking distance to Central Park & Times Square. New cocktail lounge very comfortable & open seating inviting.

The Park Central is in an ideal midtown Manhattan location. Close to Central Park (3 easy blocks), Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall (across the street), and Times Square in the other direction (about 6-7 blocks). There is a subway stop right at the corner making for easy access to anywhere else you want to go in the city. Starbucks is also on the corner for the quick morning coffee run. You are also close to any number of restaurants, delis, etc., so food choices are plentiful. The hotel rooms were nice sized for NYC - we choose Park Central as it had 2 queen beds (as opposed to doubles). Our room was clean, refreshed daily. There was no mini-fridge or coffee maker in the room, which is a slight negative. The bathroom was fine, equipped with plenty of towels, soap, hair dryer - but no exhaust fan which led to a stuffy post-shower experience. The hotel staff we encountered were very friendly and efficient. We arrived early and were unable to check-in early (the hotel was hopping!), but we did check our bags and get out to experience NYC. When we returned later in the day check in was easy and quick. The elevator system is a bit lacking - only two smaller sized elevators leads to delays at the typical busy times of the day.

We had just a few quick days in New York. The main reason for the trip was to see my son perform at Carnegie Hall. We also had plans to see a couple of broadway shows. This hotel was the perfect location. Directly across the street from the hall. Just a block from a subway station that gave quick access to downtown. Just blocks away from Central Park. Easy walking distance to the Broadway shows. It wasn't cheap but what is in New York ? If you are looking for convenience this is it. The only things that I would give it a down rating for was their bar. I thought that the bar tender was rude. The bar closed at 11:30 and was not open during the afternoon at all. They did not serve any type of food. With all of the options close a to the hotel none of these were a big factor for us.

Stayed for four nights at this Hotel, mainly for a sight seeing trip - and we were not disappointed! Great location for easy access to Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Times Square, Broadway, Empire State and much more. Staff were friendly, especially those who helped with hailing cabs. Room was clean and adequate.

We disembarked our cruise in New York and were delighted with the location of Park Central Hotel as a base to explore the high lites of the "Big Apple". The close proximity to Central Park and various transportation modes made for easy exploring.Hotel staff were gracious and helpful, the room was modern and comfortable. We would certainly recommend this excellent hotel to our best friends.

I typically stay somewhere else where. I visit NYC but due to it being sold out I had to try someplace new. I chose this hotel based on reviews and pictures and was very disappointed. The bathroom was dirty when we checked in. The towels were dirty and the room I booked (double queen) had a closed between the beds creating a divider in our room and making it very cumbersome.

The hotel is on a very nice spot on 7th Av and only 5 minutes from Central Park. The service is very good. Friendly staff. Nice and clean rooms, not too largee, but efficient to stay a week. You can buy breakfast in "Central Market" in the lobby. Not a succes. Cheap food and very high prices, and no service.

Park Central Hotel is in a great position with most of the iconic attractions writhing walking distance. Central Park just a few streets away and in the other direction is Times Square, a bit further on but well within walking distance.We did not find a warm or friendly welcome upon arrival and found the concierge quite off hand. Lobby staff and cleaners all friendly. Our room was very comfortable, modern, spacious and cleaned daily.There was a wait for the elevator as only 2 servicing 24 floors, on our side of the hotel, there may have been others elsewhere. This happened most mornings when every one is starting out for the day. A key card is needed for the lift and needs explaining what to do. Key card for lift and room doors needed to be reset as failed to work.There are no tea making facilities but there is a Starbucks almost next door.

Great central location as the name suggests, with Times Square just down the road one way and Central Park just up the road in the opposite direction. Far enough away from Times Square so not too noisy, although you can't escape the 24 hour NYC noise - all part of the experience and we were so tired each night, the noise did not stop us sleeping!We booked a premier king room with city view via Expedia. THE BEST HOTEL BED/MATRESS we have EVER slept in. Nice linen and good pillows. Good shower. Plenty of hot water. Huge mirror in the bathroom and a full view mirror just outside the bathroom. Safe in the room. Lots of plug points. Nice decor. Ice machine in the corridor. No fridge or drink making facilities.Our bedroom and bathroom were small but you get what you pay for and it was worth the money. And it is worth having less space in the room on account of a fantastic, huge, comfy bed! We did peep into a bedroom on the opposite side of the corridor to ours and it was much larger, with a seating area and much more room around the bed, but the one we saw did not have a city view. I would recommend a city view for the all round experience.The reason for only giving the hotel 4 out of 5 is that although the bedroom was clean, it was not 100%, ie. shower gel mark on the tiles, a few hairs on the bathroom floor, shampoo/conditioner/body wash holder was broken, shower tap came off in husbands hand, but worst of all, we found something very 'unsavoury' behind the bed when we moved it to look for my phone case!!! We informed reception and the 'matter' was dealt with immediately.Am sure this was a one-off oversight by housekeeping and if it wasn't for that, I would have no hesitation in giving the hotel 5 out of 5 and despite this incident, I would definitely recommend the hotel to anybody travelling to NYC.The Hotel will store your bags on departure for free if your flight is late in the day. Did not use any facilities in the Hotel. All staff were pleasant.Made it a great holiday - thank you Park Central.(ps. we stayed from 7th October but now wish we had booked our visit for another couple of weeks time, as I particularly wanted to catch the fall in Central Park but we were too early!)

My wife and I stayed at the PCH for a week during our first wedding anniversary, the rooms are larger than typical NYC hotels, very clean and modern, the service was spot on, exactly what you would expect from such a beautiful and luxurious looking hotel, your wonderful experience starts when you walk into the lobby and your eyes feast and such chic decor, Carmelo will great you at the door every day and even hails cab for you when you head out, beds are ultra comfy and the rooms are super quiet, needless to say my wife and I had an amazing experience at the PCH, we will definitely come back and recommend it to all our friends planning to a trip to NYC. The only thing that makes us sad is not being able to have the fragrance of the lobby stay with us, we have look high and low for the scent since, smelled every candle we get our hands on, yet no luck, it would be awesome if someone who has stayed or is currently staying could shed some light, IT SMELLS SOO GOOD

Great location great value!! Not impressed with the rooms bathrooms are tiny but for a great Nyc get away is perfect has an Starbucks right at the door and very friendly workers parking is 60 us x day 32 us Dlls taxes

- in our room wall there was a locked door connecting us with the room next to us and as a result we could hear everything they said!- they charge you every day 32$ for computers even if you dont want them-only 2 elevators for 9 floors so you wait a lot every time you want to use them!-no refrigerator in room-room cards fail to work all the time-very rude concierse lady

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights while sightseeing in NYC and attending the US Open. The location was ideal for hopping on the subway and getting where we needed. The staff were very accommodating and courteous. The hotel was modern with a great vibe. The rooms were clean, well maintained, and well appointed. I would definately recommend.

We left this hotel on 10/11 9:30 AM NY time, when we just opened hotel door, the door man approached to us saying you can use our hotel taxi, include everything pay cash only $65, I looked at that taxi, not regular yellow taxi, it is black SUV, I guess no business lic., I mentioned to this guy and the driver that we need went to 2 terminals, he said yes only $65. But when the driver dropped off us, he asked $75 with very mean face and in patience, I need to catch flight, and forced to gave him $75. I would never go back to this hotel again.

Hi!!We loved our experience in Park Central NY!!Our evaluation is 5 = the best!!I would like to thank the understanding of the Hotel when we need to advance our return to Brazil by reason risk pregnancy our daughter who was also staying in Park Central Hotel...Sincerely

This was my second stay in this wonderful hotel. The location is fantastic. Easy access to most major subway lines.
