I never had to take a taxi during my time in the city and the concierge helped to arrange a very reasonable shuttle to Newark Airport. It is close to everything and in a very safe neighborhood. I never felt uncomfortable or nervous about returning home late or walking around the neighborhood at all hours. The room was very large for a New York City hotel, and it was always kept spotlessly clean. The beds were very comfortable, which is important to me as I was staying for five nights. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Everyone greeted me and asked if they could help in any way. My only complaint (and it is minor) is that there were only two small elevators to reach my room on the 8th floor, and sometimes we had to wait as they were full with people and luggage. Also, my room did not have a fridge, which would have been nice. However, when I commented about this on an after-stay survey, I got a prompt reply from Quimby Hightower, assuring me that I would be provided with a fridge if I requested it during a future stay. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends staying in NYC, and I would be happy to return and stay there again. Because the rooms are big, it is an ideal hotel for larger families. This hotel is fairly expensive, but I felt like my money was well spent, and the location allowed me to use only public transportation which ultimately saved me time and money.

Stayed 2 nights. Excellent room for non-NY prices! Only downside was AC in room wasn't as cold as I like it, but livable!!Would stay here again for sure!!Great location! Room size larger than most NY hotels! Free wifi and more!

This was my first time at the PCH. The location is excellent so are the rooms. I must praise the housekeeping dept. for their work and brilliant attitude everyday. Our room was always cleaned to perfection and always in perfect timing. Ashley at concierge is amazing, i would recommend anyone to ask for her when needing any kind of information about NY and restaurants. Her personal dining recommendations where superb :) Carmelo at the door charming and helpful. The reception desk could definitely do with a more friendlier front especially the night team, however overall it was a great stay and would definitely recommend The Park Central to anyone.

I've stayed at this hotel four or so times over the last few years, with mixed results. I like the location a lot, but the service has been spotty. It was particularly poor this weekend so it will likely be my last stay there. The front desk staff person was particularly rude and unhelpful. Our room was right next to the elevator and since the walls are thin, we could hear the beeping and other guests waiting for it quite clearly. When I requested a change, the woman at the desk first lied about it being the only one left in the entire hotel (despite the fact that I'd just gotten an email suggesting I upgrade). Instead of taking care of a repeat customer, she said there wasn't anything else available. When I asked the customer service staff, they were able to move me to another room (lesser quality and interior facing over the HVAC units or some ugly bunch of equipment, but not near the elevator). The next day, they offered to waive the facility fee ($30 for internet access and bag check - something that just comes with most other hotels, especially when the room was over $400/night). While I appreciated the gesture, it didn't erase how disinterested they initially were in making sure a repeat guest had a decent experience. There are plenty of other hotels in NY, including ones around the corner like Manhattan Club and Salisbury, both of which are fine and less expensive and more helpful. We'll likely stay at one of them next time.

I love this hotel! It is in a perfect location and convenient to the subway and walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, etc. The elevators are small and slow and the lines can back up - this would be my only main issue. Some other little things would be that a lot of the rooms do not have views and can be slightly on the darker side because of this. The rooms are amazing and super clean. It is on the modern side so it has some fun decor. The bathrooms are large and clean as well. The breakfast shop in the lobby can get a little pricey so I would suggest taking a stroll around the neighborhood - there are plenty of other options. I wish it was a little less expensive - I don't see why the nightly rate needs to be so high (but the location is hard to beat). The service is great and I would highly recommend staying here again.

Park Central was a great spot for enjoying Central Park and the Theatre District. Close to subway stations--really easy to get around all the great things to do in Manhattan. Rooms were very quiet, beds and pillows super comfy--all in all, a great place to land during my 4 day visit to NYC enjoying all the wonderful things there are to do!

The hotel was very nice, everything was new and clean . The service was very good and the hotel addressed every issue or question. Ashley the concierge in the front desk was very very nice and helpful, also socca and her manager who helped us in some issue were very nice. I would definitely come back and recommend everyone to stay there ! Very close to Central Park , Times Square and always lighted up , easy to access since the subway is just in the corner .

Park Central Hotel is a very well located hotel in Manhattan.Rooms are big and clean.Concierge are greatClose to MOMA, to 5th Avenue, to the subway...it's great to shop and to visit museums.Right next to Central Park south entry and to Colombus Circle

The hotel is centrally located to Times Square, Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue, Broadway shows and across the street from Carnegie Hall, near everything we wanted except Battle Park; however, subways were very close and easy to manage.The staff was wonderful. The transportation staff went out of their way to help, arrange transportation and even upgraded us for same price. Had everything we could ask for including a safe in the room. Big closet.Only negative I have is the lighting in the room is very dim.

This was not our first stay. The last time we stayed here was 6yrs ago. It was nice to see the hotel has been renovated. We had no complaints except for the elevator but that wasn't new. It would be nice if they let guests use the 3rd elevator rather than leaving it for hotel staff. It looks like there are 4 in total. That would make a huge difference. We love the location in midtown. Close to CP, great restaurants, & it's on the subway line which is convenient. Important to note this hotel does not have a restaurant. It made no difference to us but important to consider when booking for some. We will definitely return.

We have just returned from NYC and 5 nights at this Great Hotel. The location is superb, touching distance from Central Park, and total escape of the busyness of New York. Within 15 mins walking or so from the madness of Times Square. This review is based on a couple from England U.K, who have previous travel experience to NY and the reason I explain is the potential differing levels of expectancy based on previous reviews read. The hotel has tasteful decor. The room (7th floor) was sizeable and of great standard. Large flat screen TV, tidy spotless bathroom, and a humongous size bed. It was a fantastic haven to relax after 12 hours a day exploring the city. Some rooms are stop overs, this room welcomed you back to refresh and recharge. If your heading off early, the complimentary Coffee, Pastry, and Fruit, grabbed from the Market Place is sufficient to kick start the day. Either catch up on the news in your room or enjoy it al fresco in Central Park either or, you decide. We had a slipshod pick up from JFK to NYC using what we thought was a reputable shuttle service (which was two buses in the end and the first drop off in the wrong location). The point is when this was explained to the concierge it was no problem. They sorted our return which in the end was door to door service, with a smile and 'it's no problem' and all for 46 dollars.This is the best option, taxis are 60 to 80 dollars, we used Go Air and didn't have to do a thing.We had good speedy wi fi, no hidden bills or things charged to the room. No real wait for the lift, we did however go out early doors, and return in the main mid evening. We did call back one afternoon early and again the rooms are such that you can just relax. There are no complimentary beverages, and limited toiletries, other than shampoo, conditioner, body wash and clean towels so I don't know what more you need. There is no restriction on taking drinks or food back to you room, but we left it as we found it......with little evidence of the late snack pizza.So depending on what you expect as a couple we needed a safe haven to recharge, with a high level of comfort, central to the main areas, but with that chill factor to relax. Helpful staff, and room cleanliness. This scored in all levels. Great place, make sure you look it up.I would recommend you make this hotel central to your visit to the big apple, a great cornerstone to your stay.

The room was rather small, but clean and nicely decorated. You're close to the park where you may grab a cocktail at Rue 57 or at Faces and Names which has the most unique collection of celebrity caricature paintings adorning the walls (Christopher Walken, David Bowie, etc.). The location makes it an easy walk to MOMA or Central Park. Hotels and tourist sites are linked. Your room will be comfortable; the lobby is beautiful. Breakfast at Ben Ash is wonderful; try the bagel with lox; it's fantastic.

I stayed in this hotel for one week during UN General Assembly in New York. The rooms are a good size with modern facilities, but there is no sound proofing. I heard every conversation that the couple next door had. Also they do not provide breakfast and have no room service.

This hotel is in a great location. The bed is very comfortable. There is a bar and lounge area.That is it unfortunately. This is not a 4 star hotel. There is no kettle in the bedroom. There is no room service. There is no guest book in the bedroom giving information about the hotel or city.How can it have 4 stars?There are hidden charges going through sites as they do not tell you there is a $32 dollar surcharge per night for use of the gym(highly unlikely to be used) and wifi. You will get the bill under your door the night before you leave.There is no option of booking breakfast however there is a small shop area for coffee,cereal fruit and pastries which you will pay a lot for. There is a Starbucks right next door outside. New York is a fabulous city and I will be back but not in this hotel.

Great location of the hotel between Central Park and Times Square, close on lot of objectives. A little to pricy and room conditions need to be improved (wall painting destroyed, floor carpet to be changed, doors to be refurbished, etc)

This hotel is located about .25 miles from Central Park which makes the location great for the price we paid. Check in wasnt too bad given the line of people who were wating to do so. Rooms are decent size for NY and are modernized. Biggest complaint was the room was very dark and the bathroom was espeically dark. It could have used a little more brightness to it. Cant imagine how dar it would be in the winter months,There is coffee shop downstairs in the lobby and a Strabucks next door. The bar is open until 11 or 11:30 pm. It was just off the main lobby and was a desent size. There were very few people in it the night we were there. It would have been nice to have some TV's in the bar to watch some football.Overall it was a good place to stay for business as the location and price were good.

I stayed 2 nights at this well-located hotel and got my booking through Priceline. Having done that seemed to be a mistake, at least to the person who checked us in. I've lived in NY for over 25 years so I am familiar with the term "New York rude." He was that and there was no legitimate reason for it. How about being welcoming and having a smile? I did ask if we could have 2 beds, even 2 twins instead of a king (I was visiting with my 26-yr old son). Response: No. So the room we received was fine. Clean sheets and rug; bathroom was spotless, good towels and there was a nice shower. It was on a par in terms of size and amenities with the Hyatts and Hiltons in NYC. It was quiet at night too. Most appreciated. I did notice that the elevator chimed at the stop so it might make sense to request a room away from those. Maybe the receptionist will say yes!

I really like this hotel. The location, room, and amenities are hard to beat. I wanted to give it a 4 instead of a 3 but just could not. That said, there is definitely room for improvement. The toilet seat in my room was crooked(imagine that). The dispensers for shampoo, conditioner, and body wash was loose and difficult to use and was falling apart. While taking a shower one morning, the overflow cover in the tub just fell off. The desk light did not function and there was no evidence that anyone cared. But there was evidence that someone must have known. I had to wait 5 minutes or more for an elevator, more than a couple of times and consequently there were often too many people waiting to fit on the elevator once it did come. The baggage check was quite handy (and appreciated), but I had to wait over 15 minutes once just to leave my bag. This actually made me late for one of my appointments. Only 2 elevators going to each floor even though there are 4 on your floor. In addition the elevator indicators on my floor did not light, waiting long periods made you wonder if the elevator was even going to come. I am sure I would have taken the stairs had I not been on the 14th floor. Otherwise, the room and especially the beds are very comfortable, clean and inviting at the end of a long day.

I travel a good bit for work, i would not stay at this hotel again. Great area, rooms are ok not great, missing the conveniences that most hotels offer. Staff was pleasant. My first room i was sent to had about a 3/4 inch gap in the door, i could see into the hallway. They kindly changed my room when i complained... but why had the door not been fixed? Creepy! Elevators were not working well and were a bit of a nuisance. Not the best hotel for business travel.

Park Central was a very convenient location. Great Service.We appreciated the Concierge assistance we received from Ashley & Diana before we arrived. They offered us every package going. Ashley recommend the Comedy "Something Rotten". It was so alive and so much fun. We enjoyed meeting Ashley with her bubbly personality. We arrived in a rain & wind storm. It was cold& I wanted heat but were told Sept.30th is too early to turn on the heat in NYC. The extra blankets helped.Jeannine & Brian

Beautiful hotel lobby and the rooms are exactly what they looked liked in the website pictures. Cute, chic and clean. The people were extremely helpful and very welcoming. I highly recommend this hotel.

I've stayed at this hotel a few times. It's in a good location and the room was clean and comfortable. Close to subway and Central Park. This time I stayed on the 3rd floor and my room was very dark even with the lights on(there's no overhead lighting in the bedroom and the lamp and hall light were not enough) . There was no coffee maker and no refrigerator. Also, the windows are old and therefore staying on the 3rd floor was a bit noisy. They advertise that internet is included but charge you a daily $30 fee per day which I thought to be excessive.

Location was great - short walk to Times Square. Had a very good dinner the first night just up the block at Rosie O'Grady's. Check in desk personnel, housekeeping, valet service and baggage people were exceptionally courteous and helpful. Room wasn't huge, but everything worked the way it should, and the beds/pillows/bedclothes were all extremely comfortable! Great to have the Central Cafe in the lobby to grab a very inexpensive breakfast so we could start our day's plans without delay. Room was acceptably quiet. One issue was the cost of the valet service to park our car. $70/night plus city & state taxes seemed rather expensive, but I don't know how it compares to other hotel's parking services, so I'm not sure if it would be considered excessive. Facilities fee and taxes add up very quickly, which makes a $275./night room for a hotel near Times Square not really like much of a deal.

The staff at this hotel (particularly the incredible management) Elvir and Saleem saved my vacation!! I made a terrible mistake in my dates when booking my room. Inadvertently booking for 8/29 as opposed to 9/29, almost in tears because it was a prepaid reservation that most other hotels would have just given a "too bad for you" answer to. The staff here went out of their way to help me and move the reservation. They went so far above and beyond that I'm speechless. The room was beautiful, the beds amazing and I think Saleem has a pillow under the front desk because he's always there lol thank goodness. I also have to give a shout out to James that was totally willing to snag the beautiful orchids at the front desk and let me abscond with them... (I'm kidding). Thank you a million times Park Central Hotel and especially Elvir and Saleem! You have a loyal guest forever because you never forgot how to be both professional and human, something the hospitality industry has lost sight of yet you haven't.

My second time here. Very friendly staff and good value for money if you're looking for a hotel with a convenient location (midtown, south of Central Park) on a business trip. Not much amenities but I think is a good trade off given the location, price and comfortable rooms.

This was my second stay at the Park Central Hotel in New York City. The location is perfect for accessing every attraction, tour bus lines, restaurants and coffee shops. Since our last visit the hotel has been beautifully renovated and updated. The staff was helpful, the beds were comfortable, and our stay at the Park Central was perfect.

This is a very convenient, clean and attractive hotel. I loved being within walking distance do Central Park, Times Square, theaters and many restaurants and cafes. It was also convenient to the subway.

While the hotel is well-located, the service was a total fail, as was management’s ability to remedy very basic service problems.After our first night we went out for the day. When we returned at 5:00pm our room had not been cleaned and there were no towels. We wanted to take showers before the opera, but the hotel was unable to give us that service.I called Guest Services, who could not comprehend the problem and were of no help. So I called the hotel General Manager and was told that the GM’s office would take care of the problem, and going forward the GM would personally supervise services to my room. When I asked to speak with Don Fraser, the GM I was told that was not possible.The next day we arrived back in the room after being out all day and once again, the room was not fully made up and there were no pillowcases. So the GM was apparently unable once again, to find a way to supervise his own staff! I talked with GM’s office and was told that he was happy I provided feedback regarding his lack of management after my call the day before. But he clearly could not offer basic room services.Management had absolutely no idea of what they were doing, and could not figure out how to clean our room unless I called the GM’s office each day! So much for having the GM promise to supervise the housekeeping in my room. It became my job. So much for service…shameful!There was no coffee maker in the room. There was no water in the room. Not only was service terrible but there was obviously a lack of procedures to remedy guest concerns. So when Guest Services fails at the Park Central Hotel, the hotel management seems to have no procedure for quality assurance or guest escalation!There are eight elevators in the hotel. As other guest reviews have also commented, only two were apparently available during my stay. And both were periodically unavailable due to the inability of the security system to read guest room keys. Throughout my stay full elevators had to be continually evacuated because of the failures of the security technology. So there were very long waits for the one operational elevator for all 935 rooms. Many people were complaining, but the problem persisted for three days. Totally unacceptable!When we could not get the elevator to work we had to go to the bar area to wait. When we went to the bar bathroom, the doors did not open, the toilets did not flush and there was no soap. Disgusting!Clearly the Park Central Hotel has service considerably below the level of a $30 country motel in every way possible. Most disturbing was the refusal of the General Manager to even constructively talk with me about these problems and discuss why he was not able to manage the property to provide even basic levels of service to his guests, such as flushing toilets, bathroom soap, pillow cases, towels, coffee makers, water, and working elevators.There are many fine choices for hotels in New York City. In spite of the patronizing comments being made by the General Manager of the Park Central, the service problems that have been going on for years at the hotel continue to be of major consequence and continue to not be remedied by the General Manager. The time for a change of hotel management is very long overdue. Until then, I can see no reason to ever consider staying at the Park Central Hotel.

While this was a beautiful hotel and great location, we had to use a Groupon to afford it, and then were whopped with $200 in TAX! And, then, they charge a $30/day facilities fee. We didn't use their facilities, why are we charged for it. Just another way of them ripping off tourists for the pleasure of their location.Most of us scrape together money to go on vacation, and with all the other crazy expenses that NYC brings, to find some savings with a Groupon was supposed to help. Not so much, and the hotel is just being greedy with that stupid fee.

Once again, we loved our stay! Room was clean and well-maintained. The guys at the baggage check (Alvin, Jordan and all the others) were always helpful. Great team run by Don Fraser! We will be return.

apart from having great location, the room size are really decent. Missed that the hotel did not serve breakfast. Shift check-in and the staff are really helpful. It shall be better if the hotel can start offering room service.

Where do I start - location is brilliant, Value for Money - the jury is out, Resort Tax - a disgraceful shame on NYC/Hotel although to be fair it was in the small-print and reception mentioned it straightaway not that you say no at that point. It didn't start well due to what I have been told was my mistake of booking a room for three and stupidly I expected beds for three people but apparently not you had to order them at extra cost so another £237 added to the bill but that is not a gripe with hotel but booking company. If I put a request for a quote for 3 people I expect a price for 3 but no added was an extra bed and resort tax and yes it was all in the small print so I took the hit but it sourced the experience. The room was okay the lifts a disgrace breaking down taking ages to come and I even walked the 13 floors up once as I got fed up waiting and did not trust them. Refrigerator on request - never arrived despite asking twice. Some eateries nearby were expensive but others really good so be careful. Staff were okay but like others have said you get the feel they are trying to be something they are not, a good 3 star hotel due to location and probably when you add the cost up bordering on value for money, Some nights were noisy from other guests but other nights quiet but the lifts were the big negative

love the room theme and their modern touch. Room we stayed are too small. Lacking with work space and place to eat the food we bring in. No fridge. Basically our bottled water is warm all the time and the stuff we brought that needed to be chilled (meds) have gotten bad. Location is remarkable. Walking distance to central park and world trade center. Lots of restaurant and cofeeshop nearby.

We stayed at this hotel for a few days and it was wonderful. I was a little worried after reading just a couple of bad reviews but i have no complaints. The location is great, the hotel was very clean, and the staff was nice. In other reviews some people complain about the prices at the central market....its NYC people! You pay more for the location and the convenience. I was thrilled to be able to run downstairs in the morning and grab juice, fruit, and granola after a long night in the city. I will definitely stay at The Park Central the next time i come to NYC.

This hotel is a great location if you are going to be a tourist in New York. Easy walk for subway and good eating places. Close to Central Park and Times Square. Very quite and staff is very helpful. Great place to crash after a full day of touring.

Our first time to New York to celebrate my 40th birthday. Great hotel in a central location. Our room was very comfortable overlooking Carnegie Hall. All of the staff were very friendly and welcoming. What made this holiday extra special was a marriage proposal at the top of the Empire State building. We intend on visiting New York again and will definitely stay at the Park Central and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Great hotel in New York. Very convenient to Times Square and Central Park. Staff were great from the Doorman to Housekeeping. Always a happy smile and willing to help and give directions. Rooms were large with 2 x QB very comfortable, bathroom large and clean. Had an ironing board, iron, hairdryer and safe.

Very nice hotel and very convenient location! Walking distance to Central Park, 5th Ave, Time Square, Theater District. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room and bathroom were very clean and spacious. Would definitely stay here again!

It's the third time we go to this hotel because it's amazing location... but what made special this stay was getting to know Elizabeth Cacovic, Guest Relations Manager. She managed to help us with everything we needed during our 8 night stay. She was helpful, good humored, making our stay a total delight! And for the first time, we got a room in the new part of the hotel, which was really spacious and clean. I hope we will be returning soon!

I was attending a meeting at the Sheraton Times Square but wanted something smaller and less pricey. I debated about three or four hotels nearby and landed on Park Central. The room is comfortable, roomy, and stylish. Only thing missing was a coffee maker. Location was great, close to MOMA, Central Park, 5th Ave and of course subway stops. Highly recommend Rue 57 bistro at 6th Ave and 57th. Charming, great service, lively but not overly loud. Breakfast, lunch, dinner. Also Il Corso a few blocks away for quiet, intimate, and innovative Italian. The diner across the street was also fun for breakfast. Carnegie Deli two blocks away but lines are long.,

Park Central Hotel is an older property, recently updated, located near Central Park, Times Square, and several subway lines. The lobby was large and elegant. The front desk staff were friendly enough, and when I arrived out front, I was greeted curbside by a doorman holding an umbrella who escorted me with my luggage to check-in. I found the overall check-in experience very warm and welcoming. They offer a luggage check if you arrive before your room is ready and you want to leave and come back.My room was nicely appointed with a modern look. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom featured a nice rain-style shower head in the tub. The main room had a large flat-screen TV, ice bucket with glasses, and a desk area and chair with convenient outlets for things that need to be recharged. The desk lamp, I discovered, had a USB jack on it. I plugged my phone into it each night. Basically, the room had everything I needed without stuff like a minibar or refrigerator or coffeemaker that I typically don’t need, or want to pay extra for. My room was on a lower floor, and there was maybe one night that I noticed a little bit of street noise, but generally it was quiet. Air conditioner worked fine and was not too noisy.The elevators are small and can feel a little cramped when there are several guests on it with luggage, but I think that’s understandable in a building dating back to the mid-1920s. There is a mandatory per-night facilities fee (~$30+tax) that covers some amenities that I would have expected to just be part of the room rate. There may be laws in NYC governing what services hotels can and cannot include in their room rates, hence the extra fee. You can find more on this on their website in the FAQ. Overall, I found very little to complain about during my stay.Behind the front desk is a lounge area with sofas, tables, and workspace to plug in a laptop and check your email. There is no restaurant but there is room service, and the hotel has partnered with nearby Redeye Grille. The bar opens evenings 5pm to Midnight. I found the drink prices a little steep but I suppose that’s just NYC. The Central Market cafe in the lobby is convenient for grabbing something quick on your way out, but I found if you just go out the front door and down to Tisserie in the same building, you'll find better coffee, cappuccino and food selections. Starbucks is also located in the building on the corner at W 55th St. Plenty of food options can be had within a block or two of the hotel.Overall I was very satisfied with my stay at Park Central. I prefer the quiet elegance of hotels in Midtown over other parts of the city. I would consider a stay here again upon my return to New York.

The elevators take forever to work, the ac is loud, the rooms aren't clean. They charge you a resort fee lol which is for a small gym that is disgusting anyway. Can we please talk to the person who is giving out 4 stars? It's a 2 star at best just in a great location

This is a very nice hotel, great location. Within walking distance to most areas including Central Park and MOMA. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are modern and very clean. They also have a great parking package, if you are thinking of driving to the city.

Stayed here in a double Queen room. This is unusual to find in the city, so that's a huge plus. Room was decent size for New York, clean, great beds. Rooms can get stuffy but AC is good.Had a couple issues with housekeeping , but when we called for coffee maker and more hangers they were great.Location is awesome. Close to transportation and walkable to great restaurants, theatre Central park and jazz at Lincoln center!Getting a cab or Lyft was easy with the hotels locations and great bell staff. Price was high in the whole city when we stayed but I would stay here again.

We recently stayed at Park Central Hotel over a weekend. We needed a room with 2 beds and found their prices to best for a quality hotel in that area. Upon arrival they allowed us to check-in early (around 1PM) which was a life saver. It allowed us to drop our bags and enjoy the afternoon. I travel to and stay in NYC hotels often and found the room and bathroom to be incredibly spacious - I'd stay here again for the space alone! Housekeeping was attentive and prompt throughout our stay. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again!The best part of my stay was the top notch customer service and attention I received following my stay. Upon checkout, we were offered the hotel limo to take to the airport for the same price as a cab. We of course accepted and had a highly comfortable ride. Upon exiting the limo I left my cell phone in the back. After contacting the hotel about an hour after realizing what I had done, they contacted their driver who brought my iPhone back to the hotel. The following day, the hotel shipped my phone back to me via FedEx (at my expense but rightfully so). They followed up with the tracking number immediately. For the hotel to take care of solving my mistake so promptly is much appreciated - as you can imagine, going without a cell phone is not something one can do easily!

Lovely elegant hotel in a prime location. Walking distance from Times Square and Central Park. Staff are nice and friendly. They upgraded my room since my booked room was not available. Rooms are simple and functional. Could do with a set of speakers to plug your phone into tho.

Spent 3 days and nights at this centrally located hotel. Everyone we encountered of the hotel staff was friendly and kind. I specially want to speak about Diana the concierge, she made our trip!!!! Very very helpful with great suggestions and made getting everything we wanted a reality. Thank Diana so very much.

This is a beautiful property. The rooms are well appointed, clean and very comfortable. Check in was a breeze and I used the express check-out when I departed. Stayed for two evenings for a business meeting. Would definitely stay again next time I'm in town.

The only thing I liked about it was the location. I booked the hotel through Hotel Tonight at $250 per night and thought it would be a great deal. It wasn't:1. On check out date, I got a note under my door with a $90 extra "Amenities" fee. When I asked the front desk, they very rudely told me "my third party" (Hotel Tonight) told me about it. I saw it nowhere, it must have been in a very small print, which honestly is not honest business practice. The amenities were for "the fitness center, the room telephone" and other B.S. like that which you are usually NEVER charged for in other hotels, or you are charged for in advance through transparent business practices.2. The room was subpar for the price. The AC is super noisy, the carpet was dirty, particularly around the corner areas of the room, I found a roach on my duvet one evening (stayed 3 nights), the room has no coffee maker or fridge, there is only one garbage bin (in the bathroom), so you have to throw all your disposables there. Basically, it includes NONE of the amenities of regular hotels, let alone a 4 star hotel as this claims to be. Plus, the room I got was all interior, overlooking a patio. I had to check my phone to find out what kind of day it was as the natural light was so poor.3. The common areas in the lobby (dining room, for example) were chaotic. Some remained closed for "private events", and the line at the baggage check was super long first thing in the morning.Will never book this hotel again.

After a 6 hours drive you expect checking into a 4 stars hotel will be smooth, but that wasn't the case.We pulled in front of the hotel expecting a bellman waiting as other hotels, but we had to get inside the hotel to look for one and I wish we did't. He was the rudest person I have ever met. He was dragging his feet and then he stood by our car and asked me to open the trunk for him, and then he stood still waiting for me to unload the luggage!!! I asked him then what is your role, he said this is new york if i unload your luggage and something broke you will hold me responsible,,,,,,REALLy??? And he kept on grumbling that he shouldn't unload.Then we went inside to check in and there was only one on employee behind the desk and waited behind the guest just to find out that there is a different line away from the reception without any sign.Once I reached the reception i immediately reported the bellman, the lady was shocked from His behavior, then I asked to the manager and I reported him too not sure if they will take action !!!But really that wasn't a pleasant start for out trip, hope things gets better.

Expensive, but it is New York, so they can charge those prices. No coffee maker in the room or refrigerator. AC in room is terrible. I had to turn it all the way to 65 to cool the room. Fitness center was horrible. AC doesn't work. Smelled like an old gym. Elevators are ridiculous. They take forever.

Check in is at 4pm. It is 4pm. One person checking people in. There is a line of 20 people. The concierge has advised there are actually 2 people checking people in, but that second person is on a break. To me, 2 -1=1And why would you go on a break at check in time?This does not bode well.

Hotel charged us over $30.00 a day calling it an amenities fee. I would trade up a local call for having an ice machine that worked on our floor (11 th floor). Machine looked like it had'nt been touched in years. Elevator also in need of repair had to play with it every time we were going up. Room was decent and bed was really comfortable and clean.

Your four star experience starts with a nice wait in line at the front desk. Then, because your room won't be ready until at least 4pm, you are instructed to store your luggage. Here, you will encounter yet another line waiting for the bellman to move at a snails pace at waiting on all the other people there before 4pm as well. But you devide to use the restroom in the lobby while your waiting, only to find out you need a card key to use the bathroom - in a four star hotel. Don't bother to wait for your room with a meal, there's no Resturant in the four start hotel. Finally, once 4pm rolls around, wait in line again and get your room key. Head towards the elevators, the area where it is ten people deep waiting on the two closet sized elevators for this giant side of the hotel. You wait for "the next one" only to soon realize it's a waste as every time you wait,more people que up. You get into your elevator, cramped and smelling the lunch of the nice gentleman who's practically hugging you because of the tight squeeze. You make it to your floor, noting to yourself how happy you are to get out of the elevator. Your four star hotel hallway has the nice ambiance of cleaning and linen carts sored in the hall, with a lovely blue looking plastic cover over them, don't worry, I didn't notice. You make it to your room. Ahh, the dimly lit room with a four star view of the inner courtyard of the hotel and its impressive mechanical systems to admire. It's romantic in an industrial type of way. The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom have nice kohler hardware. The pump dispensers are unlike any others I have seen in a four star hotel bathroom. Well maybe, the spa of a four star locker room hotel. You wake up the next morning, unable to see your outfit because your four star room lacks a full length mirror. Maybe you can wave to some of the other hotel guests you can see across the courtyard and look for a thumbs up or thumbs down as your practically rooming with them. You notice your bill that was placed under your door. Your parting gift, a $30 per day "facilities fee."

This hotel sits close to Central Park, with a subway on the corner of the block. We loved here, two rooms, 4 adult. It did the things right that we like done right. Friendly, clean, good decor. The rooms are spacious, with a good shower and comfy beds.Would recommend.

The hotel is in a perfect location for walking and sightseeing. Room was clean and neat. Great view of Carnegie Hall. Staff was very nice and accommodating. Will definitely stay here again. The price was very reasonable compared to other options in the area. Taxis were readily available right outside the front door.

This "hotel" is an absolute joke. No fridge.No coffee/tea facilities in room.No room service.No restaurant.Don't even think about getting laundry done! I was told it would be done by 4pm. 5 hours past the due time and numerous phone calls later, I've been given my laundry - half of it missing. Another 3 calls and a visit to guest services and I've received more items but still one missing! One would assume that if the laundry list says 15 items, you wouldn't deliver only 7. Sheer incompetence at its best. Rooms are dark and dingy and our room wasn't cleaned on one occasion. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. Stay somewhere else.

Great location, friendly staff, clean and updated rooms and super fast wifi! The price is so reasonable and you feel like you received a great deal at the end. Convenient stop & shop coffee/bakery market inside the hotel. You can have your luggages kept locked in the storage room during early check-ins and late check-outs.

You cannot fault the location of this hotel. Being on 7th Ave you are really in the thick of it and everything is on your doorstep. The receptionists are miserable and do not make you feel welcome in any way. Since we were staying there for our honeymoon this wasn't the best welcome to the Big Apple. Our room was lovely aside from the paper thin adjoining door next to the noisiest neighbour known to mankind. We didn't bother with the breakfast place in reception because it looked rubbish and there are so many choices nearby. Probably wouldn't stay again.

Our expectation was higher. The room was too dark. The window looked to inside not outside. Limited lights. There was no light at The wardrope it was broken. Although We told them to repair, They did not. Could not fix The elevators for 2 days. But The housekeeping was good. No refregirator also in the room.

Things I would like to have known before I stayed here:There is no restaurant hence there is no breakfast (despite having booked a bed and breakfast rate)There is no room serviceThere is no information in the room about the hotelThere is no bottled water in the roomThere is no hot drink-making facility in the roomThere is a bakery shop in the foyer for breakfast pastries, but it doesn't open until 8amAll the staff I spoke to were offhand and uninterested. The room was clean and reasonably sized and the bed is very comfortable, but that's it. You can do so much better nearby for the price.

I will be honest....I was so nervous of my stay because of all the reviews I had read after I booked my stay! I'm lucky to say....my stay was awesome!!! The front Desk gentleman who helped us check-in was absolutely wonderful! He was helpful and so polite and nice to answer all the questions we had being first timers in NYC! We got a great room! Super Comfortable beds! The elevators were never full like I had read! The ladies at the coffee shop were so nice and joyful as well! Park Central is so modern and clean...I requested clean towels from another wonderful lady in the front desk and she was Fabulous!!! I really liked her...she provided us with info on visiting Central Park and we had a short beautiful conversation about 9/11.....after returning later that day we meet another employee in the elevator. He also was polite and started a conversation with us, he works night shifts and is from Venezuela! They all made us feel welcomed and with the confidence of addressing any issues or concerns with them! Park central is within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, Everything!!! The location is just great! I'm so glad I decided to book my stay here and definitely will recommend to all my friends & family!! Please Park Central....Thank those employees I mentioned! I was not able to get their names! You have great valuable people as employees! Thank you for making my stay wonderful!

On paper this hotel is great: good location, fabulously designed bar and lounge, impressive looking lobby and attractive rooms. The reality flies at odds with the skill of the official marketing photographer. First tip: Never get a classic room unless you are a troglodyte. I ended up with a room on the 5th floor facing the inner well of the building so the net effect is that the room is in a permanent state of semi darkness even on the brightest summer day. The room's lighting does nothing to ameliorate this either as there are only three woefully dim table/wall lamps. Don't expect to get much work done. The room is small, and the grey decor works synergistically with the overall gloom to hide a multitude of dirt and stains. There's no tea or coffee maker or fridge/minibar. There isn't even free water. Appalling for a hotel of this star rating. The 2 lifts are small and painfully slow and the corridors look a lot more tired than their 3 year age would suggest, In fact, the overall hotel just seems tired, gloomy, badly and inadequately lit. The bar and lounge are spectacular but bizarrely, does not serve drinks until 5pm so if you want a mid afternoon cocktail, you're out of luck. I have stayed in much better in the USA for a lot less. I felt I had been had especially when I was slapped with a 'facilities charge' of about $40 per night on top of what I had already paid for facilities I did not use. I would certainly never stay here again as the place was quite depressing and unsatisfying

This is one of the nicest places I have stayed in NYC. Very good location. The hotel was recently renovated and the lobby and rooms were great. Overall the location couldn't be beat. I've been to NYC many times so I tend to shy away from staying in Times Square. This location was perfect as it was just a few blocks to Times Square or about a block to Central Park. You are right next to a subway line so you can go anywhere very easily and there are lots of restaurants and retail in the area. Not to mention a little cafe in the lobby that was reasonably priced and the coffee was great.

I went for our honeymoon to Park Central Hotel, is well located, near the best attractions and subway but in the two nights that we were there the bathroom was dirty and with hair all over. I don't like it.

Two blocks from Central Park;across the street Carnegie Hall,five to ten minutes toBest restaurants,5th Avenue & Madison Avenue best shops etc...The hotel had a good face lift I guess six years ago,so the rooms,bed,furniture has still some good look... The workout facility has a complete number of equipment in very good conditions..In my opinion the back office is excellent ( they are aware that the guest receive whatthey are expecting for) and the front office..recepcionist,bell boys are just ok..Don't be afraid if something is below your expectations to let them know.Periodically they run some promotions and you can get very good rates,that make yourstay worth...As I said in the beginning ,being close to the places that you frequently go during yourstay in Manhattan makes all the difference .I will continue coming back...

Since our trip was pre-payed we had to stay at Paramount Times Square.. NIGHTMARE... Small tiny rooms with AC of Stone Age.. We spent last night at park central .. All the disappointment was gone and I wish we had more days to stay at this lovely hotel.. Staff amazing .. Gave us check in at 12:30 bcz of my 3 month baby.. Very clean rooms and bath.. A 100% yes to it

The hotel was in a fantastic location for a visit to the city. A 2 minute walk from a subway entrance and good proximity to the park and also Times Square. We will be staying with you again. Thank you!

The location is great for family vacation. Close to great restaurants, close enough to Times Square but with a little less of the crowd, and very close to Central Park. Rooms are nice and staff is great.

Great location for shopping & theater. Wonderful restaurants close by. Decent workout facility, could use some new mats. Comfy bed but room is dark, needs better lighting. Bathroom a bit tight but manageable. I would stay there again if pricing is good.

My name is Ronnie. My sisters and I stayed at the Park Central hotel for 7 days Aug 31-Sept 7, 2016. Making the reservation online was easy, making changes to the reservation online not so easy. The check in upon arrival was smooth. The front desk people especially Emmanuel Z. were friendly and willing to help. The hotel and rooms are clean. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, Columbus Circle and the trains. This is my second stay at Park Central and I plan to stay again on my next visit to NEW YORK.

This is my 6th or 7th visit now - This is such a fantastic hotel , checking is so smooth Love the bellman, the front desk staffMy business associate and I Came last spring with a large group 8 rooms 18 guests My room was great , though the bathroom was small, I think 458 was the room number it was very close to the elevator which was great I am somewhat surprised they can get away with the fact that the door hits the toiletThe amenities are lovely the bedding is excellent the maid staff is very efficient and extremely conscientiousI try to always check on their rates before I consider any other hotel stay in New York it's right at a subway line close to Central Park and Lincoln Center and Carnegie Hall and only wish I had more time to stay and they had some other specials as they did this last time when I went up this weekendI will be returning in the spring with another large group and I'm sure that their rate will continue to be The most competitive

I had a nice room on the 12th floor but the handle of the door of the bathroom was loose so I was locked in the bathroom for one hour and a half with my cell phone outside next to my bed being charged. I banged on the wall and on the door for 30 minutes with no luck. Knowing that the cleaning lady had been in earlier to fix the bed and that she would not be returning until the next morning was a scary thought. I looked in my toiletries for any sharp object that could help me break the lock but I couldn't . For the last 20 minutes , I just used force and my bare hands and broke the door handle to open the door. AAs a result , I missed my morning meeting. When I complained to the guests services, I was surprised at their nonchalant response and a dry apology. I wrote an email to Elizabeth Cacovic and never got a response. This is a hotel where customer service and client comfort are not priorities.

The location is perfect for exploring top sights, and for shopping. Suite was wonderful with luxurious home away from home feel. Fabulous pool and well equipped gym with great views. Restaurant and bar have a lively buzz. Breakfast was delicious with good options for kids and adults. Service was flawless. One of the best hotels I've stayed in.

Hotel is central to everything. Clean in every way. Bed very comfortable. Restaurant , bar were very good. Bartenders were very professional and attentive to our needs. Small coffee shop on first floor. coffee was great, and muffins were fresh.

You can walk here from the train station, it is about a mile, but we wouldn't recommend that you do so as crossing each block along the way with all the crowds and traffic was challenging to say the least. Park Central is near to Central Park, and only a short distance from Times Square.It is a very comfortable hotel, the beds were particularly so. It is clean and staffed by helpful people. It has free wifi.There are many places to eat nearby in each direction.

We really like this hotel because it's in a great location for the quiet of Central Park to the north or head south and you're right in the thick of the action. There's a very handy subway station as well so getting slightly further afield is easy. The hotel itself is very clean, modern and comfortable. Our room was quite spacious compared to NY standards. Our bathroom was more like a wetroom design and our shower curtain was a little too short and as such the floor got quite wet rendering the bath mat towel a little useless. Still it didn't detract from our stay. Just gives housekeeping a little more work lifting saturated mats every day rather than damp ones every other day. Special mention has to go to John and Jamal at the bar. Very good bartenders who make friends with everyone who come for an aperitif or nightcap. As a result everyone at the bar chats with each other and it creates a nice relaxing atmosphere to end the day.

Just returned from a great stay at this hotel.Ideally situated for metro to Flushing Meadows and down time away from the tennis .Large clean room.Breakfast To Go deal a bonus to find and excellent value to kick start the day.Staff more than helpful and patient in organising a third party delivery for me which required payment .I hope to return for the tennis again and would not hesitate in booking this hotel again.

I was charged twice for a charge that should be included anyway. That being said, the staff was the most discourteous, aggressive, condescending, and mean staff I have encountered. This is our fourth trip to NYC this year. WE also visited Dallas, Santa Fe, Scotland, Venice, Paris this year and no where did we encounter such poor attitude and check in and out service. It was absolutely terrible.

Room size was what you would expect for NYC. Room were clean and bed was comfortable. Amenities were very basic. No vending machines located on the floor. Location was excellent!! Close to Hell's Kitchen bars and restaurants, which was key for the select night life we were looking for. Walking distance to Broadway shows and some of the best shopping. We had a subway entrance right on the corner of the hotel, which made it easy to take the N to Queensboro Plaza to cross over to the 7 train to go to the US OPEN. This was a HUGE benefit since the entire trip was booked to go to the US OPEN.We had a trip advisor rate, which made it affordable for a Sun-Fri stay. When trying to extend the stay the price for the value was OUTRAGEOUS.

This hotel does not deserve any rating above a 2 or maybe a 3. I can't IMAGINE what they use to justify a $32 "Resort Fee" other than to finance an underwhelming "renovation". The whole "Resort Fee" thing is a scam, and this hotel certainly isn't a "resort", unless I missed the pool and tennis courts somehow. If they want to charge more, just charge more and let people decide. The pricing "switcheroo" is insulting. I also noted on here that the manager only replies to positive feedback. That should be a clue.

Beautiful and clean rooms!! The staff was very helpful and met our needs! Everyone on the staff was very friendly too! A great hotel that allowed a girls night out to be exactly what we needed! Especially the coffee shop in the morning!

We highly recommend this hotel. Our family spent 3 nights there and loved it. The location is a short walking distance from Central Park. Times Square and the Theater area were also very close. The staff was friendly, the hotel lobby was classy, and the rooms were a nice size. This hotel also has double beds which was hard to find in NYC.

Overall you do not get your money's worth.Pros: -location (very touristy though, with all the trappings outside your front door)Cons: -Very overpriced, even for nyc. three nights cost over $1,000 ($1,300 cad)-hotel is more of 3 Star than 4 Star (rooms are basic, no mini fridge or coffee maker)-rooms were in poor shape (safe was broken, peeling wallpaper, cigarette burn in shower curtain, stain on bed sheet, etc , etc.)-service very inconsistent...some people are great, others treat you like a nuisance (e.g. they promised to fix the safe on the first of day but no one showed. Next day I went back to guest services, this time pissed, and they fixed it right away)Verdict: you can get much better for your money elsewhere.

Hotel staff was extremely accommodating and helpful. Concierge personnel went above and beyond to provide us with useful information about Times Square. Room was very clean and well-appointed. Accessible to subway half block away and three blocks to Central Park. Highly recommended.

We came back to Park Central because we had such a great experience last year and this year was the same! This hotel is centrally located and you can walk to almost everything. The staff are all very nice, the rooms are clean and the housekeeping staff very friendly and accommodating. We were a little unhappy with our room at first, but it was immediately corrected by Emmanuel at the front desk, who did what he could to make sure our stay was perfect - and it was. We would definitely stay again!

From the handoff of our car keys to the valet till the moment we pulled away from the curb at the end, everything about the Park Central was excellent - professional, courteous staff, clean rooms with super comfortable beds. I would have preferred a room with more of a view (we were in an interior room that looked out on three brick walls). The location was convenient to everything we wanted to do in NYC - Park, Subway, Museums. The room was ample sized for two adults and two teenagers - and really, you are only there to sleep. There was ample storage for all four of us to unpack a few days worth of clothing.There are so many delis/bistros/restaurants within a two-block radius no one will go hungry. We discovered the corner store 2 blocks up that sold all kinds of fresh and prepared food where it seems the locals pick up breakfast on the way to work and where the prices are much more reasonable. The only downside to the room was the tight shower stall, the hook on the back of the bathroom door was broken off so nowhere to hang towels. People often complain about elevators in NYC hotels - there certainly always seemed to be a bit of a wait but really not bad considering the size of the hotel and the amount of constant traffic - every wait and ride was an opportunity to meet someone new from someplace else.

I booked a last minute trip and decided to try a new hotel. So glad I did because I will now add Park Central to my favs list. Great staff that made you feel welcome and treasured. Room was spacious and beds were very comfortable. This hotel is close to the Park and everywhere you need to be so definitely give it a shot. 4 star hotel and great value!

We chose this hotel for the location and weren't disappointed with Central Park only 5 minutes away. The room was clean and serviced daily. Our room, 417 overlooked the side street and we found the near constant noise difficult during the early hours but, that said, it is New York so we knew it wouldn't be quiet.Generally the staff were polite and helpful. There are only two lifts in the hotel but to be honest we did not encounter the queues whilst waiting for them that other reviewers have mentioned. If I was to visit the city again I would happily stay at this hotel.

New York hotels, generally, rooms are very small and expensive, however this one has a fair size, good space, and wonderful location..few steps far from the Central Park is a plus...Reception staffs are very polite and helpful..it was a good experience.

On the upside:Location is great, Maids and Bell boys are very nice and patient, rooms are clean and there are free services like printing and WiFi.Downside:We arrived after a 13 hour flight. The receptionist at the main desk was very rude, and did not hesitate to express it. We knew that check-in is at 16:00, but asked if it is possible to chek-in a little earlier. in addition, we reminded her that in the online booking we asked for adjecent rooms and a tea pot in our rooms. she said "we wiil do our best".Unfortenetaly when i called to ask we if the rooms are ready, i was told that we could not check-in before 16:00 and thats it [it is the policy so no harm done, it was fine by me].We arrived back at the hotel in 17:00, the rooms were not adjecent, no tea pots, AC NOT WORKING, dreawers are broke and the room smelled very bad.we called the reception and after 45 minuates someone came, fixed the ac, but had no solution for the drawers. In conclusion:If you are willing to pay over 300$ per night just for location, a clean bad and a shower -then this hotel is for you.

A great 4 day mini vacation hotel wast great and perfect location from time square the theater district and central park. Lots of restaurants and shopping, as we like to walk only took cabs to ground zero

The Park Central leads the trend to add costs to its rates. First, I admit I got a good rate on line and was informed my credit card was charged for 3/4 the cost. Upon arrival I was charged 100% PLUS an extra $200. All this was "place holder" charges which I had to challenge to find out why I was being double billed. This hotel charges a $30 "amenities" fee (PLUS ADDS TAX TO THIS AMOUNT). The amenities include luggage storage before check-in and after check-out, use of one of the 4 computers (that service a 28 floor hotel with thousands of guests), an exercise room that I have no need for and room wifi which I did use. This was the most expensive wifi I have ever used; and I did not actually need it since I have data on my smart phone service. NOT EVEN A FREE CUP OF COFFEE in the lobby. No breakfast facilities or cafe except for a robber-baron Central Market in the lobby. I paid more for a diet coke and a small bag of granola snacks than I had earlier that first evening for a souvlaki dinner at the nearby Greek restaurant. Then the room. The last guest's trash on the floor. Hair in the sink. A maid who would not acknowledge my greeting in the hallway on the first day, but on the last when she wanted to clean my room for the next guest stammered on about which was my room and when was I leaving, "Mama"; this is polite in Francophone Africa, but we are in NYC. In the middle of the night a loud alarm went off with no warning, no explanation, no instructions. I tried to call Guest Relations, but as below all I got was the general hotel phone number with options. In fact ...No guest book in the room identifying the functioning of the TV or the telephone or where to find the ice machine. Call "0" to find out how to find the ice machine and was directed to the hotel main number automated hell. Went out to wander and bumped into other guests who found it only because they had to pass it to get to their room. No signs in the hall way identifying directions to the machine. Filled up the plastic bag provided with the ice bucket and went back to my room. The piece de resistance: In the morning the ice had melted, the bag had leaked, the ice bucket was not sealed or water proof and the tray it sits on had a lip on three sides only. Water had dripped out of the bucket, into the tray and out the back onto the floor very close to the electric plugs AND into the drawer where I had put my clothes. I have been coming to this hotel for about 5 years. This will be my last visit. Every visit the service drops. I shudder to think how much farther down it could go.

Clean. Good beds and ample room in bathroom. We like the midtown location--good to be away from the lights and noise of Times Square. AC works a bit too well. Check in process was backed up, so bring your patience with you when you arrive. NOTE: rate is actually $30 MORE than what you'll see online. It is tacked on as a facilities fee. We knew about this before hand, but still felt like the hotel was a good value.

Frayed towel in the bathroom. Hair in the tub. No point on the pencil. The fire alarm went off at 3:45am, but the two announcements that followed were garbled and unintelligible. The hotel charges a facility fee of $30/night, for which guests get nothing of any value. I stayed here years ago, and it's supposedly been refreshed and refinished, but there's no attention to detail.

Double room was of a decent size, the bathroom spotless, bed linen changed daily. Have not heard street noise, neither neighbours. One block away from small Fresh&co branch - perfect for breakfast!I stayed with my 10years old daughter and since the location is ideal for sightseeing, we mostly walked to the main attractions (5min from Central Park, 25 min from The Met Museum, 35 from Gugenheim, 20min from Empire State).

This hotel and their staff was fantastic and courteous! Location is close to everywhere you would want to be close too. I will definitely be back with the family and friends. The only thing I did not like is the bar only opens at 5pm so you need to head out to grab a cocktail and lunch.

Elizabeth and staff went the extra mile to be sure we felt at home and had everything we needed. How nice when people care and connect with their guests. The hotel is clean, offers a lobby bar and coffee shop and is located next to excellent shopping at 5th Ave, 57th street and Columbus circle. This is a clean, safe area and we have stayed here twice and are sure to be back soon!

Have just come back from a fantastic suprise birthday trip from my boyfriend... we stayed here for four nights, it was amazing! The hotel is so clean, staff are friendly and our room was big with plenty of hot water. When we checked in we got given complimentary cocktails as it was my birthday :)The hotel is in a good location if you turn left and walk your right near central park and if you come out of the hotel and turn right your looking down at times square. The only down side was in the hotel shop it was 6 dollars for a small bottle of water but we didnt pay that again!

Centrally located between Central Park and Times Square. It's also within walking distance to rockafeller center and Columbus circle. There's z Duane read around the corner and a dunk in donuts on the same block. Rooms are solid. Elevators can be problematic because a key must be inserted. The second day our key didn't work someone finAlly told us to keep it away from the phone. The room is plenty big.

Room was great, quite and very comfortable. The two things that I did not like that there was only 2 elevators to serve this foor and the ice machine on this floor was broken the entire 3 days we were there.

This hotel is centrally located and close to Central Park, Broadway, Times Square and within walking distance to museums and great restaurants. Our room was quiet and most of all the bed was very comfortable to rest our tired bones from walking around the city. The staff was friendly and very accommodating.

We checked into the Park Central on Sunday August 27, we were checked in by a very charming young lady called Nancy, she was very friendly and gave us a lovely welcome, as did every other member of staff.Our room was very nice and very clean and the hotel itself was in a perfect location only 2 minutes from the heart of Times Square and 2 minutes in the other direction to Central Park, and most of the other major attractions are close by also.there are lots of bars, restaurant's and shops on the doorstep.We spent five fantastic nights here and loved every minute of it.The reason for the four rating and not five was the charge for using basic Wi-Fi was I think unnecessary, apart from that it's a great friendly well located hotel in which I would use again if went to New York again

Bad hotel, dirty and terrible service!I was sleeping in a 5th level and the only light in my room was the electrical. No light, noisy and with air conditioner view!No more here! One picture of one corridor with the thousand room around let you know the type of hotel with 4 stars!

Arrived at 2:30. Was told fairly rudely by front desk that check in was at 4pm and no rooms were available yet. She told us we could store our luggage and then pointed to this really long line! Also really long line to us the hotel lobby bathroom. Haven't been to the room yet but far I do not see me returning to this hotel in the future.

This hotel lacks the basic amenities expected for a four star hotel!!! The rooms look good online but in my experience the room was very dark. The sheets on one day were a double sheet for a queen sized bed and the next day the sheet had pills and was quite scratchy. There is no room service because there is no restaurant. There is no pool. The exercise room is small and coffee shop is a small corner in the lobby. The elevators are the smallest elevators I have ever seen!!On arrival - I was asked if I needed to use WIFI - I said no - she said 'Well you are going to have to pay for it anyway", as it is part of the $32/night hotel fee. Unless her goal was to irritate me from the start, a smarter approach would be to avoid offering options for mandatory charges.I purchased a premium queen room through a 3rd party. I was given a strange non standard room with the closet projecting out between the two queen beds such that only one of the beds could fully see the TV. When I called to ask about what floor did premium start on - I was given a complete run around; initially they said it started on 15 but when they found out my room was on 8 - they changed it to 8.Yes - I feel flimflammed and bamboozled - my fault - I should read all the reviews!!!

Our room was lovely and the bed was big and really comfortable. Everything was clean and the housekeeping staff was nice. The location is great for travellers! The price for this hotel is also very reasonable, would recommend :)

First we were given a room with a big closet protruding out between the queen beds ...only one person could watch the tv . We changed rooms and were given a broken coffee pot..it took one hour to get a new one. The people at the front desk don't show any consideration at all. There are only a few small elevators for the entire hotelThe final straw was a 30 fee for NOTHING at all....just added to the bill and they insisted that this was standard. NEVER Will I stay there again!!!

After a horrible experience in Brooklyn, Park central Hotel was a Heaven. I stayed here 2 nights on Feb 18 - 20 on a business trip. The location was very close to central park. A few blocks from Columbus circle and Columbus Circle Mall. There is an awesome Whole Foods grocery store in Columbus Circle mall where I walked to to eat organic meals every during my stay. Hotel has a cafe inside for morning coffee and brunch but there is also a cafe adjacent to the hotel on 7th avenue. Breakfast restaurants are plenty within walking distance from the hotel. Hotel bar was very fashionable and sophisticated. I could not have asked for a better room seriously. It was large and high grade. Beds were exceptionally comfortable and deluxe. Hotel staff was very courteous and very helpful, there were multi lingual guest service agents which is a plus for a hotel that glamours. There are plenty attendants inside to help and NY tour guides outside the hotel to assist during morning hours. 7th Avenue fitness center is unlimited for the guests which was rewarding. As in every hotel within this capacity I could store my luggage until 9pm after I checked out. Hotels in NY does have an additional $30+ tax facility charges per night.

This has been by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.1) employees were rude- do not ask for help or assistants because they are useless and treat you horribly2) we booked through a third party (Expedia) which means they wouldn't do anything to make our visit easier- one instants we asked for a cork screw and they told us they wouldn't bring one up we had to come down to the bar3) valet- awful such a scam, if you go over an hour they charge you a full 60 dollars4) THEY MESSED UP CHARGING AND CHARGED US FOR TWO NIGHTS WHEN WE STAYED ONCE, YET WONT ANSWER THE PHONE TO FIX THIS5) overall the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, it was clean but I HIGHLY do not suggest this hotel not worth a penny

Room location, size of rooms, clean, friendly service. Location of hotel is tops. You are a few blocks from Central Park, you are right above the subway line, a block and a bit from time square, down the street from 5th Ave. Just a few blocks from Rockafellar square and everything else you could imagine. Would not complain about anything. We were there once with another couple and once with our kids. We found it kid friendly when we had our kids and never noticed kids when with the other couple. We travelled in January and in July not in the year picked because it wasn't allowed and didn't give an option.

Most og the staff were unfriendly, and NOT helpful at all. The phone did NOT work, etiker from the room nor the guest phone in lobby. I belive there is a bad management, WHO treat their employees Real bad. The cleaning ladies were nice, but Way too stressed. Will NOT stay there again.

No tea or coffee facilities in room. When I requested a machine, they left it in the room with no instruction, milk or sugar, so it wasn't used.The room was so noisy as the windows were not suffice to keep out the outside noise; of which there is a lot - due to its great location in the city. Not one night of full sleep was achieved.There was a basic Cafe in the hotel, but be sure you have at least $9 dollars for two cups of coffee!There was barely any light in the room. Merely the bathroom light and a small insufficient lamp.Not all the lifts worked, so we had to walk quite a bit to get to the available lift.Our keys stopped working on a few occasions, and it was a pain to have to wait for so long on the lift, to go downstairs to get a new key.We left the hotel a week early to move to another hotel. Much happier now and looking forward to a nights sleep!Staff were lovely.

The hotel is close to Central Park, which is nice! Also easy access to subway downtown or uptown! Rooms are nice, not to big, and modern.But the "facility fee" of 33 USD for every night?! It wasnt THAT great.Thank you and ill never see you again.

Hi my last review a few months ago gave park central three stars, but on reflection I'm changing that to four stars.Elvirus dealt with my issue promptly and kindly, the reception staff lady was fine,Elvirus helped her to check us in, because we had a change of hotels.And mostly thank you again to Alvin, he took care of of me and my daughter, he was very helpful, and kind. He always greeted us with a smile, that made our stay even more enjoyable at this hotel. The new bar seating area is lovely and our room was good.Did not mind that there was no coffee tea making machine in room, as there was a Starbucks right next door and the little market in lobby.Stayed in April this year.

The Park Central Hotel is located in the fantastic location near Time Square and Central Park, rooms are clean and spacious, staff are helpful and nice, also the famous Time Square shows are walking distance, restaurants are within few minutes walking

Overall it was a nice hotel but I'm very disappointed with the $30 a day fee that was charged for the facilities. I was unaware of this so on top of the hotel charge I was hit with a $160.00 bill at checkout. I think this is unacceptable and I won't be using this hotel again. Also first 2 days the one elevator was broken so there was so much traffic waiting for the other elevator. Stairs yes but with my disability this was hard. The fridge in my room that was for my medication was not working so we requested a new one, come to find out I figured out it was the plug that was not working so I had to move the fridge myself. My medication was without fridge for 1 day until I figured this out. I should have got a free night for being a maintenance man lolI emailed my concerned and heard back but with a response of they can not credit the fee back. No more park central for me.

Be careful when booking here. Ask to see the room before checking in. Traveling with 3 friends we booked 2 rooms for 2 nights with a special History Hunters package. First the good points: the beds were comfortable and the location excellent for anything mid town or uptown.Now the rest:1. The rooms looked nothing like what was posted on their website. We must have been in an area not yet renovated. The room was dark, floors filthy.2. The bathroom smelled sour as there was not proper ventilation. There appeared to be some sort of vent over the shower, but we never heard a fan. I tracked the smell to the shower curtain liner - never could dry properly without ventilation. Bathroom was clean.3. There was no mini refrigerator in the room and no way to heat water for coffee or tea let alone a coffee pot.4. When my roommate called the desk around 10 or 11 p.m. to request a bottle of water she was told she'd have to go "across the street" - leave the hotel to get water for over night.5. On registering we inquired about a restaurant and were told they had none, but if we identified ourselves as staying at the hotel at the Red Eye Grill across the street we would get a 10% reduction on our bill. We were horribly embarrassed when we went to pay at the restaurant to find out that was not true. The maitre'd had never heard of such a discount.6. Part of our package was to include free admission to the New York Historical Society Museum. We were given vouchers for entrance there. The ticket sellers were baffled by the vouchers as they had never seen such before and knew nothing about them. They were most kind and accepted the vouchers anyway. Oh, and the 4th floor and half of the 3rd were closed for renovations so we saw very little - the film was good.

My wife and daughter stayed at the Park Central in March and again in August. Both stays were quite enjoyable. The staff is very friendly, accommodating, and professional. The rooms are furnished nicely and the bathroom is very nice. We enjoyed the use of the fitness facility and the wifi. Would definitely recommend this on your next visit!

This is my second trip to New York & this is by far my favourite hotel I've stayed at. It was so beautiful & clean. Wifi was very good which I feel is very important when you're so far away from home. The staff were very helpful & friendly, other guests were also very friendly. There is a small shop in the hotel which has light snacks to grab which is easy when you're on the go in NYC. I will 100% be going back for another stay.

The rooms are up-to-date and very clean. The staff was absolutely great, professional, friendly, and caring. I had an issue with noise from a neighbouring room and this was resolved without problem. The overall state of the hotel is very good with a nice lobby and bar region. And the location is great of course. The bill was completely as expected when booked.

A nice, clean, comfortable hotel in the heart of Midtown. Convenient to subways, great restaurants, shopping, Carnegie Hall and lots of other great attractions. I would stay here again and recommend it to others. Molyvos, a delicious Greek restaurant is right across the street. Trattoria Del'Arte next door and the Red Eye Grill next door to that with nightly live music. Don't miss any of those!

Perfectly located on 7th Ave just a couple of blocks from Central Park in one direction and several from Times Sq in the other. Room was clean and functional. Air conditioner in room was very noisy but given the high temperatures and humidity outside just put up with it. Bed was comfortable. Reasonably priced for New York in this location although the 'resort fee' is a bit of a take. I knew the cost and inclusions before I got there though. I would return here.

The hotel is a great location in midtown. The rooms were decent size. Bathroom was large. One complaint about the hotel was small elevators and lines to them. There were other elevators but even with key card they did not work. I never asked why. Room service for extra towels was very prompt. We were in our room a lot so they just gave the room a lick and a promise when turning it. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others. It's recently remodeled and modern looking.

For a visit in NYC it is a great choice.You can walk to most of the locations and it is plenty of restaurants around.The rooms are nice, modern and large enough.
