Nice bar in the back of the hall and a small service bar at the entrance.If staff was a little more hospital and nice it would have been a 5 stars, but this part of the hospitality business is missing by far...

We have stayed in about a half dozen or so different hotels over the years and I can say this is the best so far. We will definitely stay here again. It is beautiful, spacious and clean. It was centrally located to most of what we wanted to see in our short trip. The staff is very warm and courteous. We never got to visit the lounge, look forward to it next time!

Hotel was located so close to central park. Everything was walking distance. The rooms weren't as small as they looked in the pictures. Very clean hotel. Front desk was very nice and helpful. It was easy to get a taxi right outside hotel. Enjoyed my stay here.

I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms, as many New York City hotel rooms are generally pretty tiny. The room was also clean and the beds were very comfortable. Management was extremely responsive when we asked to change our room because the original room we were given had a door connecting with another room, and the sound carried right through. We were immediately and graciously given a non-connecting room. The only down-side is that there is no coffee maker in the room. At the prices charged, it would be a nice touch to allow guests to have complementary coffee in the morning.

Booked this hotel but was a bit apprehensive at first due to some negative reviews.Arrived there 2hrs before we were supposed to check in and was given a room straight away. First impressions were great. A very nice lobby nice smell and cool from the A/C.With the room we were really pleasantly suprised as it was very spacious had good A/C, newly refurbished with a big LED TV and a very nice bathroom. Most important the BED was big and really comfortable which is a really important aspect of a stay.The wifi is superb throughout the hotel and the room was well serviced daily with new towels.The prices at the shop (Central Market) are pretty expesive especially the water so I would suggest the places next door to the hotel.All in all a good experience, well located and very decent.

Good large room, good cable tv right price. Clean, nice staff. No complaints. Ground floor food shop costly, but as expected. Location very good for subway, easy walk to Central Park and Times Square without being on top of the crowds

Hotel with good location but I was very disappointed with the customer care. I left important documents at the hotel room and at the same day I checked out they through the documents to garbage, they did not put into the lost & found, just directly to the garbage. Any person could see the documents were important because they had a country stamp on them. Documents like marriage and birth certificates, they just do not care...I don't know why they have the lost & found!

This place was to die for. The location is perfect. It was about a 5 minute walk to Central Park, where i could spend all day every day. This place is very clean, the service is superb, and the aesthetic is very modern and updated. The rooms were on the smaller side, but it's New York! There is a bar right around the corner called Tanner Smith's, which is a really cool spot for a cocktail and small bite! I would stay here again in a heart beat!

Location is great. Close to Central Park and close to Times Square. The room was nice and clean!! Staff was very nice and helpful. It was nice to have free access to computer and printer in the lobby . Would stay again! Picture of Times Square is taken from front of hotel.

I would stay at the hotel again, knowing upfront what to expect, like long lines on check-in and check-out; not to use the valet service as it would have been more convenient to park and pickup than waiting in line and almost missing my flight home.Also, maid picked up towels and did not replace - including floor towel needed after bathing. Green does not mean going without towels! And the shower curtain was too short to keep water off the floor so the towels were needed to soak up the puddles - definitely not green.All that being said . . . the hotel is quite lovely, the key required elevator is a wonderful safety feature, the lobby and rooms are beautiful, and the beds are triple sheeted (very important to me)!!! and the towels are 100% cotton, not polyester blends as so many hotels are now doing including Marriott, Sheraton and others.My family was very pleased with my hotel selection, and so was I.

Me and my girlfriend stayed at the hotel for four nights. It's a clean, modern and well appointed hotel and the room was great. The reason I've given it one star is because: a) we weren't told that there was a 200usd "holding charge" upon arrival.b) the elevators/lifts were the most annoying lifts I've ever experienced.c) worst of all, we got a 130usd bill through the door on the last day for "facility services"! Apparently this includes the use the phone for long distance calls (none were made), use of the fitness centre (didn't use), Apple workstations (didn't use) and the luggage storage facility (which we only used because the room wasn't ready)! It's 30usd a day + tax. A terrible end to the holiday.

It's my second stay at Park Central Hotel.Positives:Room clean and spacious Lobby great Close to central park and time square Negatives :1) Brian [the manager] was extremely rude and argumentative while checking in. There was only one staff member checking clients in. The que was 20 minutes long. Brian eventually arrived to assist and argued that he had just stepped out to close off some documents in his office. He definitely should not be managing people. They other staff member was very helpful.2) the facility fee charge of $30 per night is not optional and when booking though hotel.com we were not informed. Surely we should decide whether or not we wish to use this facility [gym]3) Waited 25 minutes for the lift on 14th floor. When it arrived it was full. We decided to walk down the 14 flights of stairs hence the reason for not needing the gym!

This is the first and last time I will use this hotel. I booked 1 day before attracted by the price and location. When I arrived (on a hot August night,) it took 20 minutes to check in as there was on one person at a desk which was located at the far end of the check in line thus causing further confusion as newly arrived guests went to stand behind the people at the desk as opposed to the line. A supervisor eventually arrived to help.Room "ok" though no light by the desk making it difficult to use the desk where reading was required.My perception is that this was one hotel now split into 3 and this was problematic. Most obviously the building has 8 elevators at least 4 of which are "walled off" from the Park central. It appears floors 10 - 20 were thus served by only 2 elevators which were not big and chaos the next morning as most people sought to go down to the lobby between 8 and 9am. It took at least 10 minutes as each elevator was chock full with people and I gave up and used the stairs. This was made worse when later one of the elevators went out of commission.On the positive side most of the staff were friendly and it is near the park which I use to go for a run,My take was you get what you pay for and not withstanding the good price (and to be fair the staff gave me back the circa $30 "resort fee",) and I will not stay again.

The pricing at Park Central is as incomprehensible as airline tickets. We were there 4 nights and the price was different every night. Same room - go figure. When we checked in, we asked for a room with a view and they did move us from a courtyard room to a streetview room on the 4th floor. We couldn't see far, but it was nice to be able to look out and see something. (A higher floor would have cost $18 per night more, so with tax an extra $100+) Our room, though it was on the street, was very quiet and we slept well The windows must be super sound-insulated. The bed was a dream-inducer. The room and the bathroom were both large enough and clean. It was a long, winding walk from the elevators (only 2 for 30 floors). The elevators are small and slow, so we were caught several times having to spend a lot of time waiting for one we could get on to go up or down. The hotel doesn't offer breakfast, but it is next door to a coffee shop/bakery and across the street from a nice breakfast/lunch cafe and from a quick-order cafe (Premier Cafe) that has very good breakfasts made to order. Starbucks is also 2 doors down. One of the concierge ladies was rude and very disinterested in helping us. She was impatient with our inexperience with subways and she really needs to look for a job where she is not interacting with tourists. The other concierge (Angela, I think) was so cheerful and helpful. She really went above and beyond in assisting us to get around and to do the things we wanted to do without wasting time. Angela deserves a raise or promotion! (Especially if she has to spend time with the grouchy concierge every day.) Located on 7th Ave. at 55/56th Streets, we could easily walk to Central Park, Times Square, the theaters, and lots of other interesting and fun places.

This hotel was very beautiful and had a nice, central location. The service was good and the room was comfortable, but there are a few fairly standard things that seemed to be missing. First, the only window treatment was a light-blocking pull-down shade. There were no light curtains to provide privacy while also allowing light. Second, the rooms were not good at blocking sound. It was particularly easy to hear other guests opening and closing their doors, and this was a bit of a sleep disturbance. The set-up of the room was awkward, with the closet jutting out in the middle of the room. This may just be a result of old architecture, but it was a bit of a nuisance.

Wonderful stay at the Park Central. Been there before and wasn't disappointed by the previous good experience. Great location, friendly staff and roomy comfortable rooms. Loved the lobby seating area for meeting up with travel mates.

I loved my stay at the Central Park. Lovely staff, from cleaning ladies, to luggage people, reception, engineers, everybody was great and willing to help. Hat off for you guys. Room (double) was great, big beds and very clean; we even had an ice bucket, but no fridge. that was hilarious, still we managed it.

Loved this hotel, we stayed here for Christmas it was amazing. I would advise not to have Xmas dinner at the hotel and go find a proper English roast some where else. Very modern and our room was massive. It's so close to time square and Central Park too. Great location

Weekend getaway for a friends birthday. The rooms were clean, and very comfortable. The hotel was modern and beautiful. The hotels location was perfect!! We were 10 min walk to Time Square and a 10 minute walk to Central Park. Right across the street from Carnegie Hall and a 15 min walk to our play Chicago!! I would recommend this hotel if you want to be in the thick of it!! I would stay here again!

I have stayed in roughly 15 different NYC hotels over the years and I absolutely loved this one - it's a top 3. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a bit small in the king size room but since I was by myself I didn't mind. Everything from the front desk service to the maid service was fantastic. Not much else to say other than I will definitely be booking again soon. For those traveling, the hotel is family friendly and close to every but not in the middle of Times Square which is even better. Just try not take their recommended car service into airports because Uber is much cheaper.

We spent two nights here. The best feature was the exceptionally comfortable beds (we had two rooms with two double beds each); we rested very well. The rooms we had were a little tight, but we weren't spending much time in them, so that was not an issue. The rooms and bathrooms - toiletries courtesy of C. O. Bigelow - were clean, and while there was noise in the hallway and outside (it's NYC and one would expect a certain level of city noise), we slept well. Other than that, the rooms were bare bones without mini fridges and coffee makers, nor were there vending machines in the halls (at least on our floor). Staff courtesy was a mixed bag. The bell men were terrific - helpful and on the ball. The front desk staff were a little surly and not particularly oriented toward customer service. We had arrived at the hotel prior to the check-in time of 4 p.m. and requested adjoining rooms, as we were a family of six. We had asked one gentleman to add our request to the reservation, and he said he would. When we came back at 4 to check in, we were told that no such note was added to our reservation. Although we did have rooms next to each other, we would've appreciated a less dismissive attitude from the second front desk staffer. We were told that we could 'try again tomorrow', but to move rooms during a two-night stay is more trouble than it's worth. All in all, we would be willing to stay at Park Central again. Our rooms were a good value, even with the facilities fee, though I agree with other reviewers that this is not a four star hotel - three at best. Its location is excellent, and it's good for families on holiday.

Don't let the gorgeous marble entry way fool you. the staff were friendly but this hotel is a dump. The first room they put me in smelled so bad they had to move me. Floors littered with stuff. Tiny rooms. No restaurant on premise, even though website says food. So don't check in late and hungry. Bar closes at kiddie hour

Park central is an ok hotel with all the facilities you need, staff are ok but some a bit grumpy. Only 2 small lifts and the stairs a bit confusing as ended up in a different hotel! Saying that I would stay here again as beds really comfy and a great location.

Dear all ,I wish to say that I spent the holiday with my wife in NY from July 24 to July 31, dwelling in particular on the hotel that hosted us .The Park Central New York (870 Seventh Avenue at 56 Street) is first of all strategically located in Manhattan, between Central Park and Times Square, lying just in front of Carnegie Hall, the doyenne of NY concert halls .Broadway, with its famous theaters, is just around the corner, the Rockefeller Centre, Radio City Music Hall, the Cathedral of St.Patrick, the Modern Art Museum, the Lincoln Centre with the Metropolitan Opera House are within walking distance in a short time .Several metro stations surrounding the hotel .The atmosphere at the Park Central expresses pleasantness and familiarity, the environment is soberly elegant, and in the hotel's common areas you spend much time happily, thanks to a fully stocked bar and cozy seating areas .Excellent WiFi connection throughout the hotel .The staff at the concierge is very professional and ready to listen, the rooms are more than spacious enough and diligently clean .Excellent the presence of a market-corner in the lobby, which dispenses everything necessary for a good breakfast: really good desserts !In short, I think I can say that the Park Central offers a truly complete hospitality in all its aspects, not so easy finding somewhere else !Yours sincerely Alexander Z.

Plus points - Awesome location, friendly staff, clean room.Drawbacks - no mini fridge to save edible items, no coffee machine in the room.We had a comfortable stay - walked all over Manhattan during the day and each evening when we returned to the room, it was clean and refreshing and easy to relax.Would easily go back, especially if they would have coffee machines in the room!

First of all, keep in mind. There are no slippers, bathrobe and proper breakfast in this hotel.Unfortunately, I am really upset with this hotel.First of all, there are no slippers and a bathrobe. When we called on a reception and asked them to bring it to us they told that hotel does not provide such service.And also - don't wait much from a breakfast. I am a big fan of tasty breakfasts and I welcome a wide choice. In booking it is written that the breakfast is included, but by breakfast they mean only one drink (either coffee or orange juice, only one option), 1 croissant or muffin (but it is only possible to choose one!) and one fruit (here choice is not big: apple, banana, orange). Staff of the company and that place where "breakfast" is given are not really pleasant too.Besides under a door they constantly enclosed me someone's bills though I watched nothing at all and I didn't ordered any movies on the TV.And my full impression was spoiled finally when they took the sum from my deposit, for the fact that I called to international numbers from my room telephone. I argued longly and I proved that it is a mistake. And When they checked call time, at this time I was on business meeting, only this way it was succeeded to prove that I didn't do this international call from my room. As I understood this call was made by someone from staff who clean the room.I am very dissatisfied and upset. And there are dirty carpets in the rooms.

Stayed here for a week and got back yesterday. I was sceptical about this hotel as noticed a few negative reviews lately. We had no problems with reception staff, elevators or street noise. Check in was quick and receptionist was very polite and helpful. We had room upgrade and room was spacious for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. Had problem with safe access but member of staff came up immediately. Plenty of fresh towels every day. The cleanliness could have been better. Carpet only vacuumed once in a week and bedding only changed once. Glasses only changed a couple of times. But overall we were very impressed with the room. One moan would be the noise from adjoining room due to inter-connecting doors. You would swear the guests were in our room. Didn't have to wait more than a minute for a lift. Reception area was very nice and relaxing. Snack shop was very expensive. Used once for breakfast and thought we would look for alternative. It was well stocked though. Would definitely stay here again. Amazing holiday.

We found their ospitality very confortable and with a good level of room and hall services. Room was always clean and in very good condition. Excellent for family and position. Services respected booking and payment details.

Good location, cleaners do a great job, but then there is no tea or coffee provided in the room...we asked for some, were told we would get it free of charge...it never arrived, so we spent a fortune each day on this. Then we were also stung with a 32 dollar a day surprise "amenities" bill....for WiFi and the use of a tiny gym, which obviously we were way too busy sightseeing to use. Over priced, very sneaky. Not impressed. New York is fantastic though, but don't stay here. I found some of the staff on reception quite curt too.

What a lovely hotel. It's all about location!! You stand outside the reception and you literally have Central Park to the left and Times Square to your right. You can be in Broadway in 5 mins, Times Square in 5 mins, Central Park in 5 mins and all the other attractions are easily accessed by 10 mins walks. The hotel was so clean and tidy. The room was lovely and freshly decorated. All modern and good sized room. Very quiet and slept really well. You have a coffee shop in the lobby for a morning tea/coffee as you don't have facilities in the room which was the only let down. Cafe over the road for a huge and cheap breakfast. Staff were very welcoming and friendly. You get fresh towels daily and your beds made etc. Fantastic! It's the 3rd time I've stayed and wouldn't stay anywhere else.

I stayed at this hotel for four nights. It was an excellent experience over all. The only issue was with the $1 menu since I was expecting more variety of products. Most of the front desk staff was very supportive, all the bell men were very friendly, the luggage room staff was great, and the concierge guys rocked. I would recommend it to anybody to want to be close to Madison Square Garden, Central park and to the subway access.

Great location, rooms are clean, good sized and the staff very nice. This is the best location for a visit to NY with lots of great restaurants nearby and Central Park is just 2-3 blocks away. We will come back.

Stayed her for three nights with my family. The room was spacious, the beds comfy and the rooms clean. I appreciated that instead of providing tiny tubes of shampoo and body wash each day, they provide regular-sized refillable shampoo, conditioner and body wash. Better for the environment and better for the family - no need to worry about one of the kids using it up. Best of all, the location. Between Central Park and Times Square. Close to Carnegie Hall and the amazing Carnegie Deli... Like half a block away. A walk to the park, to Rockefeller Center or Times Square are all easy and pleasant. Not cheap,. but worth the price.

last minute choice using the app Hotel Tonight and it worked perfectly. I love the location of this hotel, right across the street from the Q line, very near to Central Park, close to Times Square, the room was clean and the beds comfy. Definitely will return.

Just came with my family from New York, wonderful city, really a wonderful experience. However, the expensive hotel we stayed at didn't live up to expectations. I've stayed at several hotels in the city and this is probably the worst. First off:1. The welcoming staff was brusque and not helpful. When asked: "Is there a restaurant in the hotel?" - the answer was a simple: "No". When then asked, "is there breakfast here?" the answer was: "Well, I told you there wasn't a restaurant, so of course there is no breakfast." Later we found out by ourselves that there was indeed a nook in the hotel where several breakfast items were sold. No thanks to the staff.2. The hotel appears to be understaffed. This is for example the first time we were staying in line for leaving the luggage for safekeeping at the day of departure. The guest information desk was empty half of the time.3. The internet is slow and I could only use my iphone (which is pretty good in picking up signals) on one half of the room (near the door). When I moved to the part of the room near the window the signal died. This is not the first hotel we have experienced this with, but it is the first in NYC. We told the staff about this, they said they were going to fix it, they didn't.4. There are probably subtle changes going on in hotels, it appears that the hotels are trying to decrease what they consider to be surplus service - but they don't decrease the surplus room charge, that's for sure. In all the hotel rooms I've been to there have been certain amenities, such as information about the hotel, what's going on in the city, you know, that sort of things. Nothing like that here. 5. The housekeeping people were something else. Although hotel cleanliness was OK, we tend to be hotel guests that like to sleep in, and nothing wrong with that. This is our vacation and we decide when to get up. There were constant "housekeeping" calls all morning in the corridor outside our door. Even though we clearly stated that we did not want to be disturbed we got a phone call twice during our stay, asking: "Do you want housekeeping today?". This was around noon. If we don't want to be disturbed, I think we have earned the rights to be not disturbed, right? That's why we pay those quite a few dollars to stay there.6. For a hotel of a 4 star category, it has to be said that it's quite crappy not to offer real breakfast service except or to be not related to any restaurant nearby.7. There were only two working elevators, which is too little for a hotel of this size. There appeared to be non-working elevators on the other side. This resulted in quite a bit of waiting for the elevators to arrive. Curious thing: Nobody appeared to be going above 7th floor?8. Positive points: It's clean and nice looking. The location is optimal, that's why we chose the hotel. We asked for adjoining rooms, which we got - thank you for that.However, unfortunately I cannot recommend this hotel after our stay.

clean and cozy hotel .. friendly and helpful staff and very well located close to central park and shops .. really want to go back and staying again in this hotel .. city is fantastic and very beautiful. thank you very much

Love this hotel. You'll feel the cool, calm atmosphere the secong you step into the lobby. The rooms are spacious, clean and super comfortable and we love the location... Steps from Central Park and a few short blocks from Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse and from Bloomingdale's flagship store. This hotel offers everything we look for when we travel, short of an in room coffee maker... But recently they've upgraded the t.v. Service in the rooms so there's always hope on the coffee maker.

By no means a 4 star hotel, check in was strange it was if the girl didn't want to be there and was talking to a colleague throughout the process, the lifts are a nightmare, the room was nice, good bathroom and shower, we where on floor 10 it was very noisy, the lounge was nice but no food sold, great location for Central Park and Times Square, personally when I go back to New York I would try somewhere else.

Stayed here for 6 nights. Good location. Room was ok. Problem with safety deposit box, called security twice during stay, still did'nt get fixed properly, had to reset code each time needed to open it. Reception staff friendly. Bar staff not friendly at all, never once saw them smile, never once greeted with a simple hello, what would you like to drink. Bar closes at 11.15pm so after coming back after an evening out don't expect a drink in the bar. We came back one night around 11.15pm as bartender wiping up and clearing glasses. Asked if I could purchase two bottles of water which were in the cabinet behind him to take to the room. All I got from him was "bar closed" and he walked away. Think maybe they need a lesson in hospitality and how to treat customers. It takes nothing to smile and be a bit more hospitable when serving customers!

Good location. Rooms are bit small comparing to other similar properties in New York. But the service is fine and real value for money. Plenty of restaurants around the hotel and just 10 mints walk to time square. I recommend for business travel.

This hotel is an incredible location for walking to many attractions! Nice rooms and bathrooms; very clean. Great room service. There is a resort fee that you have to pay to be able to use the workout facilities. Great price for a very nice hotel and proximity to Central Park and Times Square.

I'd actually give this a three and a half if I could - better than a 3, not quite a 4. Pros:LOCATION! We went all over the city and I'm convinced we picked the best location. It's between Times Square and Central Park - a very easy walk to both, and there are plenty of sub lines that go through that area. Plus, it's close to some great food options and Hells Kitchen. Plus we felt completely safe the entire time. Staff. The people there were great. Everyone was accommodating and friendly. Decent size. We were impressed with how much room we had (two queen beds!) for a Manhattan hotel. We had three adults and two children and we were very comfortable.We got a great deal on parking when booking on their site. Cons:Let me start by noting I'm a bit of a hotel snob. While there was a recent renovation, it's still an old hotel and when you inspect closely, you can tell. The room was a bit dirty for my liking. I think they did a cursory sweep of the room - beds, shower, sink .. the basics were covered. But the walls weren't wiped down - I'm not sure what it was (I shudder to think) but it almost looked as if someone sprayed soda on the walls - it was in the bathroom, behind the toilet paper roll (I refuse to let myself think it was anything but soda), on the bed skirt, there was something on the TV, etc. That was my biggest issue, and for the most part, only issue with the room. And if I wasn't so much of a hotel snob, I probably could have given it a 4 since there were so many other positives. One last thing - and this is no fault of the hotel, but something I should note for families - our room faced apartments across the street. Multiple times daily we could see naked people over there (changing, using the restroom, etc.) Nothing the hotel can do about it, but if you have kids with you, I'd suggest keeping the shade closed, or requesting a room that doesn't face apartments. Would I stay there again? Maybe, if the price was right. And I would recommend it. It's a decent hotel in a great location.

Had a room on the eight floor. The room was very spacious. One could dance in the bathroom. The elevators were most of the time rather busy so it took some waiting. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel so i cannot say anything about that. The concierge was very helpfull in arranging a reservation in a Japanese restaurant. That was very special because it was unknown even for new yorkers. The staff were fast with the check in and out. Very efficient.

My daughter & I went to New York to see several shows as a belated graduation present for her Master's Degree & passing her licensing exams. graduation present. The hotel was within easy walking distance to Times Square, Central Park & most of the Theaters. We didn't use any of the amenities or restaurant so I can't comment on those. There was a great local coffe shop next door that had great quiches, empanadas & pastries. We ate most of our breakfasts there. There were also a couple of stores nearby where we picked up fruit & water. We were able to get a AAA discount & so I felt this hotel was a great value for NYC. Definitely plan on staying here again when I return to NYC. We used the airport shuttle that was on the hotel's website. I wouldn't use them again. Next time we'll take a taxi from the airport. But I feel that's because of the shuttle & not the hotel.

This is my third return to this great hotel.The location is perfect.!!! We love the central park/Times Square area. Lots of restaurants, coffees Metro stations around.Hotel staff is great rooms are big and clean. Many of the rooms got 2 queen beds which is perfect for the four of us .Free Wifi, great coffee shop/ market inside the hotel to take to the room or take away.Great vacation!

The location is perfect, to the left Central Park and to the right Times Square Really was brilliant to have the hotel so close to the hub of touristy NYC The hotel itself looks great as you walk in to the lobby however this luxury is not transferred through the hotel, it's lacking in a quality finish in its hallways and roomsI had been given a room with an adjoining room door and I could hear every single thing from next door, so much so that for the first time in my life I requested a room change as I couldn't sleep..... It was fully booked and I was given ear plugs insteadNever in any hotel have I had to sleep with earplugs in. Worse nights sleep Ever and not great to then go walking around NYC unrested Got a room change the next day but I had to pack up my luggage, put it in their storage and then collect it at the end of the day and take to the new room, all hassle .... A quality hotel would have taken our luggage for us to the new roomNo luggage assistance to the room on check in either and also no compensation given for our dreadful night As for the luggage storage, I had to queue up for 20 mins wasting my time and only just giving me a more negative feeling toward the hotel, one poor guy doing the luggage yet looking over to a reception with 4 people with no customers, I get that they all have their own roles to play however help your fellow colleague out when you can clearly see a line snaking around the market ..... Multiskill your staff Their market which I though was convenient charges $6.25 for a bottle of water ..... That's just robbery and shows a real interest from the hotel to screw over their guests at every opportunity 2 stars for location only

I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in February. The hotel's location is great as it's close to both Central Park and Times Square (and almost everything else is walking distance). Even in the cold winter, we walked everywhere. There aren't too many great restaurants in the vicinity, but everything else is just a short cab ride away. Staff is very kind and helpful, and the hotel lobby is in great shape. Rooms are not bad, pretty big and spacious, and clean. Bathrooms are decently modern and clean. The floor could have been cleaned a bit better, but this is what I expected for New York City. On-site restaurants are terrible - best to go grab even breakfast at a Starbucks or cafe nearby. The "snack bar"/concession store has terrible variety is and wildly overpriced.

We loved this hotel. It was in the perfect location and it was reasonably priced. You are surrounded by excellent restaurants and bars and a very short walk to Central Park. We could see the lights of a Times Square. We will definitely be back.

The hotel has a nice facade and a great lobby that impresses when you walk in. The room looks modern and renovated and the exterior has a nice brick layout. However, some details makes the stay not that great. The room we were given was on 6th floor and with very loud noises coming from fans in the external part. The air conditioning inside the room worked as an old refrigerator that turns on from time to time and was very loud and noisy. We asked for the room service/cleaning to be done once we left at 7am on a day. Once we came back at 5pm, the room was still not cleaned. The hotel has many hidden fees and taxes that adds lots of cost to your final price (like 30 dollars per night for the business center and gym that you have to pay even if not planning to use this facilities). It had no breakfast and only two elevators to serve a huge hotel like this one. For its price, the service provided was not great. The location is undoubtedly great, right by the park, so at the end, that is what pays off to stay here.

Good afternoonMy kids and I stayed six nights In the hotel.The hotel has An excelent situation, and good infrastructure. The rooms are nice but noisy. The staff for us is the problem (except Marisa That was very nice). The rest Of the staff Not nice at all, Not helping you at all. You ask for information as where to pick Up the New-York pass and they send you to An incorrect place as An exemple.They charge a deposit the first day and they don t return it to you until 5 days after you leave the hotel. We don t recommend it. There are a LOT Of hotels nearby provably better.

This was not a 4 star hotel in our book. We were very disappointed. The rooms are poorly lit, the front desk does not promptly respond, the elevators are slow. The concierge seemed limited in knowledge base. There is only a mini fridge available upon request but limited quantities so we could not get one. We stayed three nights and then changed hotels to another 4 star hotel around the corner which exceeded expectations and much better for families plus a lower rate.

I was very excited to be close to the central park. It was in deed very close to it, and to other interesting places. Besides from the locations, the service was very poor. Front desk was rude, not happy to serve you (never ever I saw the slightlest smile). I went to a business Forum and got a special rate for the room. Sadly it didn't come with the 1 usd breakfast. Room service is below the standards, nothing special when you com back, sometimes you just get the bed done, even the trash was still there when I came back. Breakfast service in the hotel are ridiculously expensive. The hotel charges 30 additional usd for the gym and lugagge keeping service, using it or not. It's actually a terrible gym, Most treadmils are useless. Not even one spinning bike. Really sad to have gone though this hotel, the only person who made it bearable was James, one of the managers. I do not recommend this place.

We had a one night stay at this comfortable and well-located hotel. We were near Broadway, food and shopping. What else do you need? Public transit, taxi and driver services were all nearby. My most important accommodation for family traveling is 2 queen beds in the room. They had them...hurrah!

Stopped at this great hotel for 5 nights and couldn't fault the location, on 7th ave about 6 blocks from times square (about 8 min walk) and 2 blocks from central park ( 5 min walk). The hotel was clean and as I was with my friend we asked for 2 double beds which isn't always easy in new york. The room although didn't have a particular great view ( over an office block) was spacious and v quiet, and is probably the most comfiest bed I have ever slept in on any holiday! We didn't eat in the hotel but had complimentary cocktails in the bar, and whilst there was a coffee bar in the hotel we had cheaper breakfast next door or across the road. Be warned though u do get charged 25 dollars per room per night ( this is mandatory! ) for unlimited use of wi fi in rooms and free use of computers and printers in the lobby, having said that we did use it a lot to connect to social media sites and what's app etc! Overall fab hotel!

The hotel is clean and very welcoming, we were always glad to return after a busy day in the heat.Would have liked coffee making facilities or fridge these would have been a plus, but beds very comfortable, very clean. Our room was on the 12th floor on the front, view was good. Great location, central to it all. The man on the luggage room was brilliant very helpful and also the lovely man who help us get a cab back to the airport. They are a credit to park central sorry I didn't get your names.Overall this hotel has a great location and we would stop here again without a doubt.

The location was convenient and well situated. The service was horrendous. I've had better service from a Holiday Inn, than I received here. The front desk was rude upon check-in and checkout. So much so that I felt the need to speak to the manager before departing. Check-in agent was rude, curt and unfriendly. Big surprise, the checkout agent was rude, curt and unfriendly. And forgot to call for the car, which was the whole reason we engaged her in conversation. She asked us how many nights we stayed. We said we checked on Monday. Her response was, "HOW. MANY. NIGHTS?" Apparently she was not able to make the intuitive leap between our check in date and our check out date. The cost of the hotel was reasonable. However, I'm happy to pay for location but not poor service.

My wife and I spent a day in New York and stayed at Park Central Hotel, a hotel we found three years ago. We noticed that Park Central had been freshened up and looked better than the last time we stayed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We liked our room and bathroom. Most of all, we liked the location, near Carnegie Hall, Central Park, Fifth Avenue shopping and close to Times Square. Our room cost a little over $300 with taxes, but this is New York! We will return.

Stayed here in Feb 16 as a party of 3 .location is amazing.when you go out the front door and look right you can see time square,look left and your at Central Park .there is also a subway to the left as well.radio city is straight ahead.the staff are lovely and very helpful.there is a large bar area with comfy seats.in the lobby is a small cafe take away were you can get breakfast if required which is added to your room and paid when you leave.good selection but the staff not very pleasant .our room was very nice with two good sized beds which were amazing to fall into after a busy day.excellent pillows,duvet and mattress.good bathroom and shower all very clean.we had a great stay here and will be returning .

Could not ask for a better location on 7th Ave, easy walking distance to Central Park & Times Square, along with a host of other locations. Yes the lifts are a little slow, now big deal, there are stairs if needed. For those light sleepers would recommend an inward facing room. We initially had a room facing 53rd street which was very noisy, however we were able to change rooms with minimal problem. Plenty of nearby options for reasonable priced breakfast, bar in hotel is OK, not sure why the AC needed to be up so high, jacket was required!We experienced ordinary service from 1 particular reception staff member on multiple days, but overall staff were friendly & attentive, especially in the bar area. Internet speed was good, no fridge in room however you can request. Would happily stay again and recommend to friends & family.

We chose to stay here for our honeymoon. It was a nice hotel but not for our honeymoon, we should've stayed elsewhere. Our hotel in Vegas gave us free champagne, vouchers and upgrade but this hotel did nothing like that. It's a good location right by Central Park, but wouldn't recommend for special trips!

I spent an hour in line checking into the hotel. Apparently the reservation system had a problem and people in front of me had to be rebooked "manually" (whatever that means). At times only one person was checking people in, and the few times that a second person was working with the queue, they had to constantly confer with each other - but neither appeared to be moving quickly or to acknowledge the very long and frustrated line of people.At one point a couple entered the hotel and went to the manager's desk to the side and spoke to the manager. The wife quickly motioned for the husband to join her at the desk. The couple were embraced by the manager and a staff person. I walked over to ask if the manager was checking them in (and effectively allowing them to cut in line). The manager said, "No. I'm just allowing them to check their bags." The manager then escorted the couple to a door to the left of the reception - which must have been a back way to a freight elevator - as the couple never returned after "checking their bags" (which some other guests had to do in order to make dinner reservations). When I asked the manager if he was still "checking those bags" he had the nerve to smile and laugh at me.[Cut and paste of stock manager response to follow from Don Fraser.]

Apart from all the additional hidden fees mentioned in plenty of the reviews here, I could still count the nice sides for the benefit of this hotel's guests; but what they made us go through in our short stay was not like you would expect from any NYC hotel. We had to move to the airport immidiately due to a sudden change in our travel plans and my wife had to wait for a porter for about 40 mins, while I was waiting for her at the airport. Above all, when she phoned the reception desk to ask about the porter, the clerk very easily answered that it has been only minutes that she requested the porter, in a very unfriendly fashion. What a rude way to answer a guest ! Dear hotel manager, people miss their planes because minutes do matter ! My wife asked for help, probably from the floor warden and the porter came upon his request, not upon the receptionist's. This is a clear evidence that whoever was responsible to arrange a porter at the first call did not pay any attention and forgot about it the minute the call ended.Staying here again ? I will definitely change my way and avoid walking past their premises when I'm at 7th Ave next time.

The location was great, very near Central Park, Carnegie Hall and about 10 minutes walk to Times Square. My sister and I had a great stay and found it easy to sightsee from this hotel as a base. The room was a good size and clean with a great shower and wi fi. and coffee maker. We used the diner across the street for breakfast and the hotel bar every evening to finish off our day after our night out. There were plenty of restaurants near here. We used the Trattoria Dell Alla a few doors down, 900, 7th Ave, a bit pricey but worth it, The Irish Pub on 7th Ave and also Benihana Teppanyaki,47W on 56th St. between 6/7 Ave.The staff were helpful, we got totally drenched one day and as the heating is regulated to a comfortable temperature throughout the hotel there was nowhere to dry out our wool coats. Maintence brought us blow heaters which was helpful. I would use this hotel again.

Good location between Central Park and Times Square. Plenty of places nearby to eat at a variety of prices, nice rooms, good Wi-Fi speed. Good, very friendly taxi-service, some of front desk staff friendly, some not... Negatives: Noisy in-room air conditioner, shower curtain smelled.

Wonderfull hotel, Great people service, and Best place, near of Everything places Of Manhattan, if you want a cheap hotel, with all confortables services, Nice bedrooms, you Shoul get stay there. Central Park hotel ir a good option to stay in New York

stayed for 8 nights for family of 3 had a classic room a bit small for price but had very comfortable bed.close to times square was great.if you stay get taxis from hotel they will offer private cars but prices are very high think they doing it for a fee themselves the door men something didnt seem right we were told to go to airport 130 dollars by morning it was 60 dollars.check in is at 4pm we arrived 3.45 and had till wait till 4 this was silly to me after 7hr flight.when anywhere check to see bill hasnt already tip on to it got caught on this ..dont tip if there not nice which in some places they were not why tip for this.new york is amazing but so expensive i would only use credit cards there you swipe not pin number,and be very alert crossing roads its all go ,

First time in NYC, great location but the front desk service sucked! Those ladies need a refresh on customer service! The room was OK, my first night there I had no bath towels, and the shower curtain smelled. The housekeeping lady was very friendly (HINT)

Hotel was in a great location. Room was clean and a great size for NY. However, because we booked with Hotel a Tonight, we were not allowed the $1.00 breakfast.Also, the $30.00 charge for use of the gym etc, which we did not use was rediculous this fee should be applied Only if you use these facilities

I had to book here for one night because my usual hotel was sold out the first night of my trip. I was appalled at their imposed extra fee. I have stayed at Westhouse (which is connected) several times before, and their mandatory fee is because they offer breakfast, wine and appetizers at night, and round the clock coffee upstairs. At Park Central, however, it was called a "facility fee" and covered access to the gym, business center, access to local calls (apparently they think this is 1986 and hotels still charge for local calls....as outdated as cell phone minutes)...and get this: storing luggage day of arrival/departure! It is obvious they are grasping for anything they can think of to make extra money even though these are things that are included at any other hotel, and they do not legally have a right to charge for things that may or may not be used, such as the business workstations. I arrived at nearly 10pm and left in the morning - hardly a need for gym and workstations. Again, charging for day-of luggage storage is simply laughable. What is more shameful about this "facility fee" is the state of their facility. I walked into the room and immediately saw one of the light bulbs on the nightstand lamp was out. When I entered the restroom I was almost made sick to my stomach when I saw the dark yellow stain ring inside the toilet, and when I tried to shower the dispenser fixture was completely broken and nearly collapsed...and the soap was empty. I went to the bathroom counter to get the bar soap and the wrapping had lint hanging off. I could not wait to get out of there!How a hotel anything above a 3 star present a room in this condition to a guest....then have the nerve to charge a bogus "facility fee" for nothing extra on top of it, is obnoxious and shameful. I am in New York 5 times a year and will never be staying here again.

Stopped in for a late drink. Although last call was 11:15 they said the would stay late for us. We are martini people. Of the 4 bars where we had drinks, this is the only one that chilled their glasses. They also had nuts on the bar which doesn't happen often. The drinks were very good. It isn't a true bar experience but for a hotel bar is was a good choice.

We booked a standard room for a Friday night and the check in process was fast and easy. Our room on the 14th floor was very big and spacious, comfortable and clean. The price was fair considering its location (5 minutes walking distance from Times Square) and that hotels in Manhattan are crazy expensive. We'd go back again!

Location is amazing, just 2 blocs from Central Park right near MoMA.Gym is great. Near everthing. Would go back there. Only slight negative is that the rooms are a bit tight for a familly of 4 but it wasn't a big deal since we didn't to NYC to be in the hotel room anyway. The room was clean amd modern and that's what counts. Also they charge 30$/day for the "facility access" which is basically the gym. Would have prefered to have that in the price of the room. Valet parking wad 70$/day which is pretty standard NYC But we noticed a parking right beside the hotel which would have been a bit cheaper.Overall, a great hotel ina fantastic location.

The lobby would make you think this is a fairly modern hotel, but the rooms... not so much. Noisy in-room airconditioner, though unusually you can open the windows. No fridge, no coffeemaker. Comfortable bed. Decent TV. Generally gloomy. Lots of street noise - I was on the fifth floor and was disturbed by people yelling in the street, car horns (it's true - New Yorkers love their horns!), and garbage collection (after I'd gone to bed).As others have noted, the 'resort fee' is a gyp - you'd be hard pressed to get $30 value out of it. I'm glad someone else was paying my bill. And they insist on charging your credit card $50 a night deposit against incidentals - unlike other hotels I've stayed at in the US there's no option to close your account and pay separately for any food and beverage etc.Other positives: Good Wi-Fi speed. Good location between Central Park and Times Square. Plenty of places nearby to eat at a variety of prices.

First time in NYC, great place, went there with my sixteen year old son and wife, plus points are the short walk too broadway shows and times square, recommend the excellent Colour Purple and Chicago, son went to see School of Rock and also enjoyed that,tip don't buy a glass of wine at a show venue, two wines, that will set you back $46, large glass of wine at a recent visit to the Queens theatre in London was £8, try and hold a smile when you pay $46 and then explain to your partner why you need another ten bucks.This isn't a cheap holiday, but I guess most people will know that before they book up, you can grab a huge slice of pizza for a few dollars, but for me eating in a decent place is part of the holiday and there is no shortage of excellent restaurants in this city, wander down a side street and you will find plenty of good places to eat out, The Maple just East of Times Square has great food and a great service.Go to a bar and everyone we met was excellent, good humour and easy to talk to, meet someone in a lift that you have never clapped eyes on before and you will be greeted with a hello, where are from and a, have a nice day, try that in my neck of the woods, I dare you.Now If only the staff at the Park Central were even just a little bit like that, go and ask what the extra $32 per day is on your bill, check your account like I did on the TV in your room, I mean you paid your travel agent up front and thought all I need now is the spending money, you will be wrong, with tax added this will cost you another $238, when my wife went down to ask what the charge was for, she was told for using the amenities, okay, what does that include, asks my partner, the very rude person then puts her hand in front of my wife;s face and says I,M TALKING HERE, if you have checked your final conformation from your travel agent it will be on there, it isn't.It is customary to tip in the USA, not unreasonable, people work hard and a good service deserves a decent tip, but someone at the Park Central couldn't wait and see If we were going to follow this custom, I left our safety box open by mistake before leaving our room for the day, when we returned someone had taken $60 from my son's spending money and $40 from our spending money both in separate envelopes, I would like to thank them on behalf of my family for not tipping all of our money, gee that would have been a bummer.Did we complain, no, we decided to just get on with it and not let the incident ruin our stay, that and the fact that I believe this would have been met with disdain from our grumpy chops at the front desk, oh and the very next day there were four notices along the reception desk explaining the charges, explaining before you book up would be a better practice.Now summing up, would I stay here again, because of the the two incidents I would have to say no, it's a pity, great location, rooms are okay, bar area is modern clean and tidy, one person can put you off, so no we won't be going back to the Park Central, as for New York, great city and great people, you won't be disappointed.

Front desk allocated me a room on 3rd floor. When walking out of the elevator a delicate mixed odor of wet shoes and sweat welcomed me. Once in my room the smell of smoke got added to the plethora of aromas. Front desk was easy with the room change, but had to wait another 20 minutes in line with all the other guests checking in. Room on the 7th floor smelled normal. No complaints there. When I woke up, the bill was nicely delivered under the door, with added taxes (why are advertised rates always without tax?) and a "facilities fee" of 33 dollars (inc tax). WHY? front desk: this is a mandatory fee. Its in your reservation confirmation. No one ever told me there would be an extra 30 dollars added before I made the reservation. And indeed it was in the reservation confirmation email, but that is besides the point. Its a terrible trick to rip your customers from money. They know people compare rates online, and this extra 30 dollars does of course not show up as its POST reservation. These type of tricks make me very sad. Hence: no points for Park Central Hotel.

I stayed at the Park Hyatt for nearly a month and could not have been more impressed with the staff and the accommodations. It has a wonderful mix of international and domestic guests. The location, across from Carnegie Hall and blocks from both Central Park and the Theatre District, was perfect. I loved that the subway was right on the corner and I could easily get anywhere in the city.The Park Central is now my "go to" hotel in New York City.

In NYC for a 4 day vacation with the family. Booked our stay here as it was recommended by a friend. Wow! We upgraded to a room with a view of 7th Ave looking south onto Times Square. Breathtaking view, especially at night. Extremely comfortable beds. Terrific service. Close to Times Square and Central Park so there is much to do. Did not give Park Central 6 "dots" because they only allow 5.

I was here 4 days on a business conference. I had a pretty good sleep in my room, nice amenities, modern decor. What I really like about the hotel is the location, near Central Park, Broadway, and Fifth Avenue shopping. I would recommend this to my friends and colleagues.

The Park Central New York average in just about every way, with pluses and minuses. One word to those shopping on price: The hotel charges a mandatory service/resort/amenities fee of $30/day, as of this writing. Add that in to whatever's quoted you.1) On the plus side: Location. 2) On the minus side: My room on the 7th floor over looked a courtyard with HVAC equipment that was audible night & day -- I got that room after being assigned on backing on the elevators, which create non-constant sound, which is more disturbing -- and the what the front desk called a "business center" was a joke: 3 kiosk computers (you can't sit) and a printer, which I couldn't use from my own laptop, in a heavily trafficked corridor. 3) Average, which means that my expectations were met: Room size, comfort, service, price -- noting that a $30 service fee is applied to whatever rate is quoted you.

After reading previous reviews I was a bit concerned but it was all good a very comfortable place to stay which had everything we needed, the room was of a good size and the bed was very comfortable the only negative would be the noisy air conditioner but we just turned it off when we went to sleep

We stayed here for a week, the hotel is nice and I will let you ready the other reviews but please take care as my family all used the ATM in the hotel reception and my wife and daughter have both had fraudulent activity on their bank accounts as a result.. We used our bank cards at different stores and outlets whilst in and around NY but we all used the same ATM in this hotel and this appears to be the link.. I can't prove the hotel has any involvement but I would advise visitors to use the ATM at their peril

Very conveniently located, with plenty of facilities. People are very nice and helpful. Huge rooms which are also very clean. Perhaps they could have more than one person at concierge as to avoid long queues. Wifi is 'unstable' to say the least. Love the market place where I get my breakfast every morning.

Ideal location near Times Square & the theater district. If you drive into NYC, they had a $10 valet 24 hour parking special & offer luggage storage until 9pm, so after you checkout you have an extra day to spend (we went to Ham4Ham!). Our room was very clean & spacious, & surprisingly quiet as we were facing 7th Ave. The bed and pillows were very comfortable & we had a great night's sleep! We will definitely stay here every time we visit New York City.

Park central is in a great location between Times Square and Central Park, handy for most subway lines, though a ten minute walk down or 2 minute subway ride from nearby subway station to the main Times Square subway, you can connect to anywhere. Hotel is adequate, most hotel rooms are much the same to me, beds are comfortable, but if sightseeing you will not be in your room too much. Tour buses stop close by and some reasonably priced eating places close by, Irish bar towards Central Park is good value. Olive Garden at Tomes Square a rip off with the expected, sizeable gratuity already on the bill. Matilda is a great show and reasonably priced tickets can be bought on the day at the theatre box office. The Schubert theatre is not that big, so even seats at the back have a decent view.

Clean rooms, great location, and friendly staff. I did have an issue where when I booked online, it somehow went through twice. When I got to the hotel, they thought that I had booked two rooms, but I only meant to book once. You can imagine my horror when I saw a charge on my credit card twice (each for 7-day stays.) I was put in contact with Quimby Hightower, a manager of the hotel. He was AMAZING! Super nice, outgoing, and assured me that we'd only be charged once (which we were.) I can't say enough about Mr. Hightower! Because of their friendly staff and great location, I'd highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed at the Park Central for the third time in 2 years recently and the overall facilities and convenient location will keep us coming back. All the front desk staff go out of their way to accommodate any requests you may have. The 57th Street Station entrance is less than 20 meters from the front door giving access to the N,Q&R metro lines and the rest of Manhattan. In terms quality of the accommodations and value for money you cannot beat this hotel.

Stayed for an evening at the Park Central and was extremely happy with everything from the location to the amenities. The room was very spacious and extremely clean. Check in was flawless and valet parking was very easy and prompt. Will definitely stay again when we visit NYC again.

With the room remodeling these are now wonderful rooms ,with modern showers and most comfortable beds Rooms are priced most competitively. Valet Parking was included which added much value.. One of the best buys in NYC

This hotel is in a great location Opposite carniege hall and a few blocks up from time square on 7th easy access to Central Park and 5th and all the sites without being on Times Square .Hotel bar behind reception . The lift can be busy but not a problem for my visit maybe just timed at good times as I had read reviews ! Rooms are a good size for a family just time bathroom usage if u want to get out ! They don't have suites but just get a routine going and you are out all day anyway !! There is a subway 2 minute walk from hotel Eating is expensive nearby so go further afield and ull get more for your money Can't fault hotel and the bar for a drink to put feet up was lovely and wifi good and free within the service charge For skating in the winter use Bryant park as u only pay for skate hire not usage of the rink Originally booked the riu but got moved to this hotel as riu not Completed for my stay and wasn't disappointed Dropped a point as shower could of been a tadge more powerful and had originally booked a suite which this hotel couldn't accommodate but overall very happy

My husband and I love staying here when we visit NYC. We can walk to Sarabeth's for breakfast and then take a walk through Central Park. We've stayed in more luxurious hotels, but honestly, the Park Central is lovely and a great value. Have a drink in the wide-open bar area before going to the theatre. You will love it.

This hotel is amazing!! Some of the reviews on here have been negative which made me anxious about staying here, however! There is no wait for the lifts, there is coffee and tea making facilities if you ask for them, that also goes for the fridge. All the staff are friendly and go out of their way to help you. (A little tip) the lady on the desk can get very cheap Broadway tickets. When we arrived we was straight away given an upgraded room. When we left we was able to place all out belongings in a very secure room which always has an attendant. The wifi has a strong signal and connects very easy. Also the location of this hotel can not be beat!! Turn left 5 min walk to central park. Turn right 10 mins walk to times square, just behind is a 2 mins walk to Broadway and straight ahead is a 15 min walk to 5th Ave. The rooms are very clean and are cleaned daily, if you need more hangers in the wardrobe just ask. All in all one of the best hotels I've stayed in!!

When we got there Saturday evening there was only one person working at the check-in counter and about 10 people in line to check-in. So there was a bit of a wait when we arrived. We had replied to an room upgrade email but they did not have record of that and we had to track down our email. They did have a corner upgrade room available. I'm not sure the upgrade was worth it. The room we stayed in last year 1049 was probably nicer with a bigger bathroom, but this room (1005) had more room for suitcases. It seemed a touch dingy but it was fine. The housekeeping staff is great! They are very helpful and flexible. The location is great with Central Park and Time Square an easy walk away. We went to see School of Rock on Broadway and that was very close and convenient. Overall it was a good stay.

The hotel is okay, but what kind of management allows their doorman to pretend to have "hotel cars" that you can pay to be taken to the airport that are just normal black car drivers that payoff the doormen and charge a higher amount? Management must know this happening. My taxi also had to payoff the doorman for trip to LGA. This is not the way to treat tourists.

Definitely the hotel has a very good location. 10 minutes north of the times square, couple of minutes south of the central park. However there are several 'buts' related with the hotel. 1- the number of elevators are absolutely short. You have to wait for the two elevators that serve for 8 floors.2- no meal is included if you book via booking.com and no water heater or coffee maker in the room.3- the air circulation of the room is somewhat inadequate. you need to turn on A/C all the time.I would definetely not stat there if I come to New York again.

Location is great but overall service was ok. If you must interact with any of the staff please ask for Immanuel! He made my stay pleasant but if it were not for him I don't know if my review would be the same. He was very careful to attempt to meet my needs during my stay and I was very thankful for his hospitality. Outside of service, the rooms are clean and quiet. I had a great night's sleep. There are lots of restaurants and bars around as well as Central Park and shopping. I would stay here again only if Immanuel is working during the stay.

I recently said at Park Central for my anniversary with my partner. I had two problems with my stay. First, when we checked in there was a printed sign that stated a mandatory $30 was added to every stay for use of the fitness center, Apple computers with internet access, and local and long distance calls. This feels very sneaky to me. Why are these costs not added in when you book a room? I think transparency is important and every guest should understand all the fees before they confirm their room. Also, these are arbitrary fees to place on everyone. It should be applied to those customers that use those amenities. Most people have cellphones to make local and long distance calls, and use their cell for the internet.My second problem were their elevators. The elevators are very small and run slowly. Many times it would open on my floor and already be filled. Multiple times I had to wait for the second or third elevator to come by. This seems unacceptable for a hotel with 26 floors and a high volume of guests.That being said, it is centrally located in Midtown and close to Central Park (hence the name). The bed was comfortable, the decor was contemporary, and the front desk staff was friendly.

The location is perfect, right in SoMa and close to transportation and Market Street and Union Square. The rooms had a good view (depending on how high the floor), and were clean and cozy / comfortable.The staff was very responsive and helpful at any time of the day!A great property under SPG/Starwood, and I would stay again for leisure or for business!Note: the staff was very responsive in helping & accommodating with check out and billing issues in a timely manner! Mauricio was able to provide a quick turnaround for my inquiries and resolve my issues!

We booked this hotel 6 months ago for a family vacation to New York City. There was 6 of us. I had requested a room for my 4 teenage kids and an ajoining room for my husband and I. When we got there, the front desk lady was not very nice and had my husband and I on a completely separate floor from the kids. I told them this was not acceptable since I booked 6 months ago. about 25 min later they changed us to side by side rooms. She told me they do not have adjoining rooms at the hotel. When we went to our rooms, our room had an adjoining door to another room that was not our kids! These rooms also faced a dark brick wall that you could not see a thing from and it was on the 18th floor. 45 min later we were moved to adjoining rooms down the hall with a better view. Be careful of high floors! They only have 2 elevators so wait could be long! Our kids room had several problems. The showers have full shampoo and conditioner bottles. The kids room was empty and we had to ask for it to be refilled 2 days in a row. Also, their air conditioning did not work and it was very hot! We had to ask 2 days in a row for that to be fixed. Our room did not have towels the last full day we were there. And lastly, my daughter had bought some clothes in Times Square. The maid somehow took them! We told the front desk and filled out a report. We even gave them a copy of the clothes receipt for $40. We heard nothing back and they were very nonchalant about the whole thing. I am home now and have made 4 calls to the hotel to find out what they are going to do about it. I called the manager on duty and left a message, spoke to customer service and now have put in a call to the General Manager. Not one person has called me back! This has left a very bad taste in my mouth. this is a great location and beds are comfortable but the service is absolutely terrible. I would never recommend this hotel especially if you have kids.

they charge to use the gym , the computers . they do not tell you this just a charge everyone pays no matter if you used these or not . not cool . no restaurant , bathrooms never had toilet paper . they would book your activities and you show up to non booked activities . we spent lots of money traveling around by cab and nothing was booked . what a waste . i will never recommend this hotel to anyone . worst experience . find another place if you know whats best for you

I stay at park central whenever i come to NY cityUsually i come for businessThis time my wife and i came for vacationElisabeth the guest service manger is allways helpful resourceful and very pleasant. I highly recommend the hotel and the personnel Omer

Hotel was in wonderful location, within walking distance to Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, NBC, Times Square, and more. Room was very clean and housekeeping service was great. Check in and check out were a breeze. I highly recommend this hotel.

Firstly the location is great, central park a 5 minute walk, times square 10 minute walk and great selection of small restaurants in 9th ave also short walk away..On check the receptionist looked and screen and said straight away you have to speak to my manager, did not sound good, moved over to the side waited for manager only to be told by the manager that the room we had booked was not available even though this booking had been made 8 months in advance, the reason was that they were checking in a 700 strong Korean group.Instead of the 2 double beds we were given a double and fold down beds for my 16 twins. They did compensate by removing taxes from the room for the week.The first night the fire alarm we had kids running up and down the halls from 11pm and then fire alarm was set off the the same group of Korean kids, after 15 hrs of travel we were less than pleased.The room was clean, the bathroom large and a great shower. Overall the staff were sometimes dismissive of problems, the lifts are slw if you can get one and don't stop at all floors.

This is a nice hotel in a great location, within walking distance to Time Square, Central Park and 5th avenue shopping.I would only offer a few words of warning: Our first room was on the 7th floor and overlooked a brick wall between several adjacent buildings. It was at the bottom of a brick "hole"! It was sunny outside and our room was dark! We did ask to be moved to a street side room but we had to check our bags and were without a room between mid-morning and 4:00pm when the room was ready. when we got to our new room it was a king room and we had come from a room with two full beds. PLEASE learn from our experience and know the type of room/view you are purchasing!....unless you don't mind a dark room with a brick wall view.

More different type of taxes than you could make up, but I understand that's normal for a US hotel. Toilet was blocked for 2 days, at least we had part of one of the taxes (Facilities Tax) credited as compensation $54. Bathroom out of bodywash until we contacted Reception. Private function from 3 pm until 8 pm on one of our 3 days, I'm glad our Facilities Tax was credited as we couldn't use the facilities during that time. The bar only opened at 5 o'clock until 11:30 which is no good for an afternoon beer chill. Probably a good job it wasn't open too long with a G&T at $12!! The Complex Director of Brand Integration & Guest Experience, Quimby T Hightower (unbelievable job title, made up at a brainstorming or "thought shower" meeting assisted by hallucinogenics) emailed us after we checked in to welcome us, a nice automated touch but not seen anything after I complained about the toilet or lack of availability of the facilities in the last 4 days since I sent it. Beds amazing, room good, air con too noisy to use at night, shower a bit feeble. Incredibly clean. $1 breakfast a really nice touch, but paid for a few snacks at $36 once, not again. It's not that we can't afford the $12 G&T or the $36 snacks it just felt abusive, a bit morally unacceptable. I'm probably just old fashioned and should not expect fair pricing in one of the best cities in the world, but accept being "milked" for cash at every opportunity.

The hotel was clean, quiet, and was in a good location. The rates were very good. I will stay there again. Although there were a lot of school groups staying there it still was quiet. The receptionist that checked us in said she was giving us a room with a good view, however we were looking at a roof top. I think she didn't know the hotel that good but that was okay since you are only there to sleep.

Nice hotel in the middle of all activities. We could walk pretty much anywhere. Rooms small but nice . The lobby is always full and there are a large number of people around. There are so many restaurants around so we did not eat here. Plant of cabs and bus tours available.

The room was right for what we needed , to sleep , shower and go - very quiet bar there , nice for one or two and hotel was pristine clean - you need to have a deposit on your card on top of paying fir the room which we were not warned about but we got over this as the staff were generally pleasant

Park Central is a wonderful location, south of Central Park and close to mid Manhattan. Very good for public transport. The prices, considerig the location, pretty reasonable.A few problems: the lift was operated by your room entry card, but this was not explained carefully to new arrivals, often exhausted by their journeys. We went up and down a few times before we worked it out. The rooms were very very clean and the beds super comfortable. The outlook in the budget rooms was darkish, but we were out most of the day, so it didn't matter.The breakfast arrangement seemed to be - buy a packed breakfast in the hotel and eat it where you could, or go out. NYorkers go out, so that's OK if you can get used to it. Lots of nearby diners etc.There are only lifts, so as we coincided with many youth orchestras with their cellloes etc. it was a tight fit or a wait. The youth were also pretty noisy in the night - can cope with that.Would definitely go again, but we needed an instruction sheet about a few things....

We arrived from LaGuardia early. Stood in Line to be told to check our bags into storage. Stood in line to check the bags. It might help to add people during busy periods. If you want to go the bathroom see a bell hop for a pass key to the coed restrooms.The room was one of the refurbished ones. Small bathrooms, cramped hall way. Other than that the room was OK. No small refrigerator, so we used the air conditioner for any left overs we had. If you need phone assistants from your room, good luck, the hotel is very busy. The hotel is well located to get anywhere, is only two blocks from Central Park, and one from Carnage Hall. We did enjoy our stay, just not use to New York ways.

This was our first trip to New York, and we couldn't have picked a nicer hotel. Staff was helpful and location was great! Close enough to Time Square for a walk, and close to Central Park. Asked for a mini fridge and was delivered asap! Recommended!

We have been staying at the Park Central at least once a year since 2003, and it's always our first choice if available. The location and value and service are the things we like best about this hotel, followed closely by the thick walls and quiet rooms !! It is literally less than a ten minute walk to Times Square and the park and Rockefeller Center and Columbus Circle. Centrally located, indeed !!

We visited New York last July, and decided to stay at the Park Central hotel, we weren't disappointed.The hotel is in a great location, close enough to time square without being too close and close to Central Park the other way. We walked pretty much everywhere from our hotel during our holiday. The area felt safe which is important for me when i travel. The staff were lovely, professional and friendly. The hotel has a lovely feel and decor is nice. The air conditioning was very efficient which was very welcome given the hot weather. Although our view was of the internal courtyard it didn't bother us at all, the room was comfortable, and the bathroom adequate.All in all a pleasant stay in a hotel with a brilliant location, we would stay here again and have recommended to friends also.

We stayed at the hotel for a week. The room we were given was not particularly clean and very dark. The carpet was very dusty around the corners and walls of the room. The clock radio and the desk lamp did not work. Took two days to get replaced. Housekeeping did attempt to vacuum the carpet, with little success. The elevators had issues, the screen went out and for six days was not fixed. My daughter also had a room. The toilet was blocked when she checked in, the next day there was an issue with her door lock. Security had to be called several times to let her in.

This hotel has it all: great location (7th Ave near Central Park and with a view of Times Square); excellent customer service (reception, door, room and concierge staff); modern and well decorated rooms.

I normally stay at the Marriotts but a work meeting arranged my stay here with 6 other colleagues. We also had great rooms and were super happy with the property. The Concierge/Customer Service man names Quimby or Quixby, is one the most professional and astute young men I have ever met. What a great guy, and what a great employee to have...if every hotel had a guy like him, you would have a lot of happy guest..

The Hotel has a great location, it has been recently remodeled, the rooms have a perfect size, very clean, nice bed, great TV set, a very good A/C, good bathroom, there are plenty of food options nearby.The staff is typical New Yorker hotel, not so nice , as almost all the hotels I've stayed here, I don't know if its because they have so many guests that they carry, Don't wait for details, I asked by email for a room upgrade, they didn't even reply, I lost my fight and came the day after and I called earlier in the day, asking for mercy about charging me the room, there was no way. But that is the way NYC is!For the rest of the stay a great hotel!

My wife found this hotel for a few days stay in NYC. Very economical by NYC standards and the clincher was the $10 parking fee. The hotel is well located, just north of Times Square. The rooms are excellent and very modern. But we had two issues. (I want to compliment the staff on their efforts to fix the issues - especially Quimby.)While the room was very spacious, the bathroom was quite small.
