Imagine walking in and having to turn to the sink so that you can shut the door. Not easy to fix other than to expand the bathroom a few feet. But the shower curtain is short (an easy fix) - it just comes to the top of the tub and hence gets on the floor.The bigger problem was the air conditioning in Room 1619. It took about 24 hours to fix the problem (though it seem to still be a problem when we left but that is an issue for the next client).Would we come back? Absolutely! But I hope they fix the problems I mentioned.

No breakfast, no taxi reservation, no room service, no service at all. Three days to get my laundry done. 25 minutes for someone to pick up the phone at the reception desk. Only half of the elevators worked, it took me 15 minutes queue to get to my room every time. I expected more for the price I paid.

we arrived at 11:00 and despite we asked in advance and payed for early checkin the staff at the reception informed us that this was not guaranteed and that we should come back at 14:00 to check the availability. Finally we took another room from what we booked as we were in a harry at 14:00 pm. The room was spacious but not so clean as hair from previous hosts were around on the floor especially in the bathroom. Another issue is that when this hotel is fully booked (as it happened when we visited it) there is no space at the lobby not even to stand and there is a lot of noise.

We were in NYC for 4 nights - our very first trip! To be honest we stayed here because a friend of mine sent us a 40% off coupon - and it still cost us a small fortune to stay in mid town Manhattan, but I was prepared for that. I thought the hotel was lovely, the front desk staff was helpful and friendly. No restaurant, but we enjoyed the little marketplace downstairs where Gina was really friendly and helpful. There is a small wait for the elevators, but not more than a few minutes. The only way to access your floor is by using the room key in the elevator, which made me feel quite safe. We had a corner room with two queens, and a nice bathroom with a roomy tub. The beds were comfortable. The hotel is walking distance to Times Square and Central Park - we took a pedi ride in Central Park. We rode the subway for the first time (fast and cheap) - download the app - you won't have to worry about which trains run at night or on the weekends. I could write so much more, but this is supposed to be about the hotel, so I'll stop. Btw, after all of the taxes - which are horrendous - you still pay a resort fee...includes the fitness center and wifi...Oh NY I still love ya.

We were in NYC for a party on the West Side. Got the Park Central package with valet parking. Worked out great. The valet parking team grabbed our luggage and the car, so we could whisk into the line for check-in. Got checked in pretty fast and made our lunch date a few blocks away. Thanks to Jaime and others on the support staff.Walked to and from our event on CPW, got a walk in the park before leaving in the morning. Had the feel of our native city in less than 24 hours.The room was good, too.Getting on the wifi is annoying--bad management, trying to get too much value from the customer.

1. Despite of putting the "don't disturb sign" on the door the cleaning staff was knocking the door and waking us up every morning at 8am and asking us if we are ready to go out or if we need house keeping for that day.2. There was no cleaning or house keeping except tiding up the bed !!!3. Once we put the towels and sheets on the floor and asked them to change them. At night we came to the hotel at midnight and realized they haven't even touched the dirty towels and sheets and just let them stay on the floor.4. There is no mini bar, tea or coffee in the room.5. The keys need to be changed every night. so every night we were going to the room and check the key and 90% we should have came to the recieption to change the key which was super inconvenient.

Every year I go to NYC and stay at this hotel. Very nice and big rooms, and it's near all you need, the subway, 5th Ave. and Central Park is very close to the hotel.The location is the best, and it's a very nice hotel to stay, just to feel at NYC.

Highly recommend the Park Central for the excellent customer services. I had a very unpleasant experience with hotel reservations and the front desk member Emmanuel assisted and arranged hotel reservation arrangements for 06/18/2018 to the West gate hotel. My reservation at the Park Central 06/19-21/2016. Thank you

This is, frankly, a very expensive rooming house. The rooms are fine, although we didn't have an easy chair for the first four days of a six day visit, despite asking several times. The only food is available from a kiosk. No coffee at all from the bar. No hotel information in the rooms. And the lift needs its own set of instructions. It is very central, two blocks from Central Park and two from MOMA. However you have to be very sure that you want to spend a lot of money for this location with all the above drawbacks.

I first stayed at this hotel in 2010. It was been updated and is very nice. The rooms are a good size for New York City. The location is very good, near Central Park and Times Square, but far enough away that you doing get the lights and noise from Times Square. The N, Q, and R subway lines are right below the hotel. One of my issues with the hotel is the size of the elevators. There were only two that served our floor and they were often very crowded. The second is the "resort fee" that many hotels are charging. $30 a night for what? WiFi? Just figure it in to the price of the room and let the customers see what they will actually be paying without having to get out a calculator when planning their trip.

I have stayed at the Park Central hotel on two occasions in the past year. My second trip had my 6 yr old son join us. They have good service and nice rooms. What is best for me is the convenience of the location. It's a few blocks from Time Square, Central Park and the subway can be found a few steps away. Plenty of easy meals in the surrounds.

The hotel is very nice. It is located near to Central Park and Midtown with a subway stop right around the corner so taking a train is easy. The rooms are very comfortable and nicely appointed for the price point. Bed was also very comfortable. The resort fee is a bit high considering the likelihood of using most of the facilities. But otherwise I have no real complaints and was very pleased. Note keep your key cards away from your cell phone or you'll be making the long trek back down to the front desk to have them re-keyed. I was not alone in making that request in my short stay.

I arrived at the hotel and was greeted by courteous staff. My check in was a breeze and included a free upgrade. My room was clean, updated and quiet. The hotel is located one block from Central Park. I would definitely consider the Park Central Hotel again.

Very spacey and clean rooms, perfect location close to times square, broadway, central park, park avenue. Staff was very nice, especially manager Elizabeth who helped us greatly when we had a problem with the room due to noise and she moved us to a quieter and bigger room at no charge!Price was reasonable for NYC and a 4* hotel. You get what you pay and we got an awesome holiday!

The hotel was centrally located, walking distance to the theater district, time square, central park, Rock Center etc. and across from Carnegie Hall. It was clean and the staff were nice and well trained.

The rooms in this hotel have been renovated, which is good. My problem with these rooms is that they are designed in dark grey, making them very dark. To make matters worse, there are no desk lamp or standing lamp, there are only two bed lamps in the room. The safe is in the unlighted closet and you need a flashlight to work the system. We also missed having a full length mirror in the room.

The Park Central Hotel is a perfect hotel for anyone looking to take advantage of all of what Manhattan has to offer. It is in a great location, near Times Square, Broadway Shows, Central Park and the subway. Wonderful restaurant and bars are steps away. The room size is very typical for NYC, but had nice amenities and everything felt very safe. What really made our stay great was the wonderful service - everyone from the staff at the front desk to the guest relations team were terrific. We arrived well before normal check-in with a child who wasn't feeling well and the front desk staff immediately were able to find us a room so our son could sleep in comfort. Everyone seemed to anticipate the needs of the guests.I would highly recommend the Park Central Hotel and will definitely make a return trip!

I was a bit apprehensive reading some negative reviews but I needn't have worried.Great location staff were helpful yes lifts were a bit slow at busy times but this was to be expected we had a free grab and go breakfast which was useful as otherwise the food was slightly overpriced hence the 4v star rating. Staff were really helpful couldn't ask for more overall great experience would defy stay here again

Let's face it, hotels in NYC are quite pricey. I do like to visit NYC at least annually for shows, museums, and other attractions only in New York. This time, we stayed in Park Central Hotel for one night. It was a lovely experience. The staff was helpful. The room was a nice size, comfortable, and CLEAN! One drawback was that there was no restaurant or breakfast available, but there was a little store in the lobby where we bought snacks, breakfast pastries, and coffee and tea.

I stayed for five nights with my two kids last month. After the first night my daughter, who slept in one bed by herself. had some bites up and down her legs. After the second night she had more. We hadn't seen any biting bugs outside and neither my son nor I had any bites. We notified management and they placed us in a different room. No new bites after that. The manager told us they would inspect the bed and let us know what they found the next day. They never did. So before I checked out I asked again. I was told that the testing service wouldn't be in until later in the week but that they would definitely call or email me as soon as they found out the results. Well, it's been about 3+ weeks since my stay and no one has contacted me. I'm pretty sure something hanging out in that bed was biting my daughter after comparing the bites she had to bed bug bites that I see online. At a minimum I would have expected management to honor their commitment to follow up with me. They failed not just once but twice to follow up. An offer to compensate us in some way would have been nice as well. A partial refund or an upgraded room. The 2nd room they put us in was OK, but the bathroom had a strong mildew smell. Needless to say my family and I will be staying someplace else the next time we're in NYC. I can maybe give a NYC hotel a pass once for a bed bug issue, but not following up with me as they promised to nor offering anything to compensate tells me they really don't care. My guess is they rented that same room as is to some other guy.

Having travelled for 12 hours and arriving late, we were greeted by the Receptionist whose first words were 'we don't have the type of rooms you booked' (6 weeks previously). When I said that wasn't what I expected, she said 'we've just had a group booking, are you staying or not?' A great welcome on our first visit to NY.The hotel is clean and in a great location, 5 mins from Times Square and Central Park and right next to a Metro stop.I had booked two rooms and ordered two refrigerators - we only got one - and our wifi (5 devices) were split over the two rooms - and it seems I was penalised for booking two rooms but I did not receive any discount.The Hotel 'Market Place' Shop is overpriced (there is no hotel restaurant) and the shop staff are without customer service skills. Next door to the Hotel is an excellent cafe called Tesserie for reasonably priced, more friendly staff and vastly superior catering.We ordered drinks in the Hotel bar and a small tumbler full of warm white wine, a beer and a mainly ice filled glass of Coke cost nearly $40.The housekeeping staff were excellent however, very friendly and kept our rooms ultra clean and tidy. The porters were great.These rooms weren't cheap and I guess I was just hoping our experience staying here would be a bit nicer really. Would look round for somewhere that offered better value, if we returned to NY.

Good Location to explore the city. A short walk to Times Square and very close to Central Park. Opposite Carniege Hall. Rooms are a reasonable size for NYC. The bathroom is very compact but nicely fitted out. No breakfast facilities in the hotel, it's s grab and go market type set up. Bar is ok though. Staff seem friendly. Lifts are a little small and prone to be busy. I stopped in 848 so street noise was certainly present. Also as a note the air conditioning unit is very very noisy, so needs to be off at night.

This is a lovely hotel with an excellent location and super service. The staff seems to anticipate your every need and desire. Highly recommend this hotel!!! It is super convenient to the theater, Carnegie Hall, shopping, subway stations and Columbus Circle. The rooms actually have space to move around in!

We needed a room with two doubles and this fit the bill. The hotel was recently remodeled and our room was lovely and quiet. We're usually in NY for a show, and I love staying a bit north of the Times Square hub bub. I would absolutely stay here again!

Great location. Incredibly nice staff at all levels. Good cafes, delis, diners and restaurants in every direction. I lost my glasses while checking out. The staff found them and got them back to me and were very courteous and friendly in doing so. I'll stay here again.

I either stay here or the Hilton Midtown when on business, but you tend to get better rates here. The hotel is perfectly situated for visiting my clients in midtown and is very close to the park and also Times Square so even if you are not here on business the hotel is worth a look. There rooms are not large as is the case with most places in central NYC but they are reasonable, the room is clean and the bed comfortable. As with most NYC hotels the traffic noise is a problem so bring some ear plugs! The lifts can get busy at peak times so be prepared for this and factor those extra minutes in if you are in a hurry.The hotel has been recently (last couple of years) renovated and still looks and feels new and fresh. The guys at the front desk are nice and helpful but the doormen are awesome and will go out of their way to help you with directions, calling a cab, your bags or even just wishing you a good day.I'll be back.

We were in town for a concert at Carnegie Hall. This is a great location for getting to Carnegie Hall.We had a room on the 17th floor; it was quiet and modern. We were a little annoyed by the lack of coffee/tea in the room. I think I may have read somewhere that you can request it; annoying for what they charge for the rooms.There is a mandatory $30+tax facilities charge for WiFi, phone, fitness center, etc.. this is the way hotels are increasing their room rates without actually increasing them. I find this to be a very annoying practice as well.There was no evening turn down service or room refresh; at the price and rating (4-stars), they should do this as well.Overall, the facility was quiet and clean; the bathroom amenities were decent; but they just don't do the things they should to be rated 4 stars.

Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, shopping and attractions, this hotel works good for turists. It was my first time in NY, so its location helped a lot. The rooms are very comfortable, spacious, and clean. It has a good internet connection too in all over the places.

Ideal location: Carnegie Hall is across the street on the next corner, Central Park is about 2 blocks away, Broadway and Times Square are within walking distance nearby. The hotel is very nice and the rooms are comfortable. The housekeeping staff is courteous and friendly, especially Ann Marie. I would see her everyday cleaning the 3rd floor rooms and she was always open to a friendly chat. Free wifi in the room was unexpected since their website stated that there was a fee. Three Mac stations were a nice touch for guests to use, first 15 minutes was free. I was able to print bus lists and itineraries easily without being charged.

We recently stayed in New York and we had a great stay. The service at the side desk was exceptional. Emanuel gave us tips on the best places to eat and every one was exactly what he said it would be and delicious. I would highly recommend a stay here and to get the best directions from Emanuel on where to eat.

I stayed at the Park Central Hotel for the second time on business in May. Upon arrival I was given a friendly welcome and checked into a room on the 18th floor. Upon arrival in my room I found it to be quite a bit smaller than the room I was allocated in my previous stay and that it was mainly a long corridor. The room was also over the road which made me concerned it would be noisy. As I was staying for 6 nights I therefore asked if it would be possible to change rooms however due to the hotel being fully booked I was advised this was not possible that night but that I could change the following day. I also received an email from the customer service manager (unrelated to my room change request) welcoming me to the hotel and asking me to contact them should I have any queries. I replied and advised them of my room change request. I received no further communication regarding my request from either the front desk or customer service manager. In the end the room was obviously fine - well furnished, clean and not in fact noisy - as I did not push the point on changing however just disappointing not to have had any follow up.Other than this my stay was absolutely fine. The gym is good and often quiet, wifi is fast (both are included in an additional obligatory $32 daily cost levied on arrival). There is no coffee making machine in the room (which one would normally expect to find in this type of hotel) however Tisserie a lovely cafe next door opens at 6am! There are only 2 elevators which can often mean it takes a while to get to where you are going! Location is the best thing about the hotel as it is right next to the subway and 2 blocks from Central Park. All in all a good stay if a little "non-personal" on the service front. Absolutely fine for a business trip and I plan to use the hotel again.

I had an urgent need to overnight a package, I found Alvin at the luggage desk and he was awesome in helping me - fast, courteous and knowledgeable. I was actually standing at the Concierge desk and he voluntarily offered to help me - top notch.

I took my two 6 year olds to New York in the school holidays and out of all the hotel options available I chose this hotel. For where we wanted to explore the location is perfect - come out of the hotel, turn left and you're a stones throw from Central Park. If you turn right when exiting the hotel, walk 5 minutes and you're in the centre of Times Square! There was also a subway on the corner. We could even easily walk to 5th Avenue for the American Girl Doll shop! We were given a room on the 16th floor - never did I have a problem waiting for an elevator. The room itself was very clean and comfortable. 2 double beds were perfect for us and it had everything we needed. Free wifi in the room was a bonus. Check in was swift and easy. We didn't eat onsite, there are so many restaurants / cafes nearby to satisfy your needs. On our final day the bell boys arranged our transfer back to the airport which was very competitively priced and a nice vehicle.

When in New York I like to eat, see a Broadway show and visit the museums. Having stayed all over town through the years, I tried Park Central and have become a regular. The hotel staff responded to my e-mail promptly long before check-in. When I arrived early it was convenient to work at my laptop in the lobby bar with spacious tables and charging stations. The rooms are large by New York standards. I never had to wait for an elevator and the location was extremely convenient for all of the activities I wanted to do, giving me ample time to change and catch the subway or wait for an uber. It is a little pricey, but the location and amenities make it a value in Manhattan.

I honesty could not believe we would get such good quality in such a good location! especially at such reasonable prices. this was my third visit to New York (taking my 12 year old daughter this time) and i have stayed in the Wellington one time - Opposite the Park Central and i can honestly say the Wellington, is quite a dump (it doesn't look it on the pictures) but it is. however every visit i make now, we will be staying in this beautiful hotel. The check in staff are not the most attentive! however everyone else is. my motto is ignore the miserable ones and enjoy the sights.

Hotel was in a great central location but...the rooms were not clean, the front desk staff were not helpful nor were they friendly. The concierge was helpful - the one highlight of our stay. Lobby was very busy. The recently "renovated" rooms had very cheap fixtures - most were falling off the walls.Next time I am in NYC I will pick a different hotel.

The location of this hotel is great. It is fairly in the middle of both Central Park and Time Square. There is many things going on around the hotel at all times and has many options to eat right outside. The room and bathroom are also fairly big for being a NYC hotel. I had no complaints about the hotel. It was clean, comfortable, and was not far from the main attractions in NYC.

I have never written a review but had such a great experience, I wanted to make sure and get the work out. First off, perfect location. From the hotel entrance you can see Central Park to the left and Time Square to the south. Walking distance to everything in that part of town. Subway across the street that takes you straight to the WTC. A couple blocks to another subway that goes to Yankee Stadium. The staff was outstanding. We got no sleep on our red eye flight and the guy at the front desk was able to get us in a room that morning so we could sleep. Beds were crazy comfortable. Big flat screen TV (we never turned ours on but it looked nice). Great furniture and fixtures. Even the dresser doors were self closing. Bell hops were all really cool and great service. The little cafe/store in the lobby has great snacks (almond croissant was better than a couple bakeries we tried), and the nice woman working there happily gave us great directions a few times. They have their own car service, you still have to pay but much nicer than taking a cab to the airport. Overall, it made our first trip to NYC perfect! Very affordable when compared to other hotels in the area that don't actually seem as nice. Only place we'll stay when we go back.

This was my second time in the Park Central. The location is good, the hotel is OK, although a little run down. However the customer service is absolutely appalling. For those who don't want to read a full review, just bear in mind that you will be treated like dirt by the staff and any complaints you have will be ignored for weeks on end.The rooms we booked were unavailable when we checked in which was the first issue. We were told that if we left our bags at reception in the morning, our bags would be moved into our new rooms before we returned. This did not happen.When we came back our old rooms were gone, but our new rooms were not ready. We were also told by a very rude lady on reception that they would not be moving our bags for us and we would have to come back later and do it ourselves when the rooms were ready. No apology, no smile, nothing. Just a rude attitude. I asked the lady for her name (as I wanted to make a complaint) and she refused to give it to me!I spoke to Guest Services who apologised and organised a room for us. However to my knowledge, nothing was done about the behaviour of the reception staff.On check out, I asked to speak to a manager. I was told that there was nobody on duty (???) but I was given an email address for "B Joseph". I have emailed this person twice in the past 2 months and still had no response.The only way I was able to get anyone to respond was by tweeting them, (nothing like public naming and shaming to get a reply).I was eventually emailed by "Quimby Hightower" who apologised and promised to investigate the issue. Guess what, despite me giving him all of the details I have heard absolutely nothing from anyone at the hotel.I will certainly be back in New York, but I will certainly never endure the despicable service that is offered by the unfriendly staff at the Park Central.

I stayed here for one night on a solo business trip and while the hotel is only a couple blocks from my office, this stay was neither convenient nor comfortable. The hotel looks beautiful from the outside, a fairly glamorous building with doormen waiting to welcome you, but nothing about the inside matches the inviting exterior. At least during my stay, the hotel was insanely crowded with foreign tour groups so the lobby was always packed and it was impossible to get an elevator. I ended up taking the stairs up 8 flights because I just couldn't wait any longer.There are at least a dozen people behind the concierge desk at any point, but they're always talking to one another or staring down at their computer monitor and if your time is at all valuable you'll just have to walk up and interrupt them and deal with the puckered sour look they give you because otherwise you'll stand there all day.The hotel room itself was acceptably clean and spacious (for New York) but drab and thin-walled. They also still have those connecting doors that link your room to the one next door, which I could deal with for one night but not for any longer because I could hear my neighbors pretty clearly.Even the bathroom was a bummer. I love taking a bath in a hotel but the tub wasn't comfortable (awkward angle didn't allow for any recline) and the flickering overhead light made me feel like I was in an asylum. They obviously don't go in for any pampering here, not even the basic stuff like fancy soap or a shower cap!I was happy when my stay concluded and resolved not to return there. There are too many other similarly-priced midtown hotels to waste your time on this generic option with no sense of hospitality.

Our NYC events and meetings were in Midtown, so this hotel was perfectly situated for us. The bonus was how close it was to Central Park and Broadway, so we could play after business was done. Room was spacious, with numerous windows, and the beds were really comfortable. My son used the fitness center, which he said was average, and we used the wifi daily. So I guess the resort fee was justified, sort of. It added another $100+ to our visit, which was high. Staff was great - friendly and accommodating. The bar was closed every time we were at the hotel, which was unfortunate, because it's such a lovely space. Overall, I'd come back and would recommend this hotel to others.

This is the second time we stay at the Park Central. The location can't be beat, close to Central Park, within a block of a subway station, lots of shopping and restaurants close by. Also, walking distance to the Rockefeller, St Patrick's and Times Square. Room is clean, with comfortable beds and good size. Cons: no mini fridge in the room and the "resort fee" is high ($30 per day), although it includes Wifi and some other perks we never really used.

I loved this hotel because of it's location! It is right off Times Square so a little away from the hustle and bustle - but so close to it that it takes you 3 minutes to get to times Square. For a tourist, it's the best located hotel to stay at. The hotel itself is nice, rooms are pretty spacious and the bed is super comfy! Definitely recommend this hotel!

For the huge facility feel they take, they provide nothing. No breakfast no water bottles no coffee no nothing. Even the concierge is never there to help you. Avoid this hotel if you can. This looks grand but thats about it. The elevators can choke you with its tiny size and five inside it feels claustrophobic.They clearly need at least three more to ease the check out check in hours.

We booked this hotel through hotels.com and got a much better deal. General rate is fairly pricy but the location allows for it. GREAT location on 7th ave just blocks from time square! Employees of the hotel were all friendly and helpful and the room size for a 1-king bed room was great for nyc! Felt the "facilities fee" was unnecessary as booking the hotel should include use of the gym, concierge, computer lab, etc. Also the room was a little dirty, but not unbearable. The carpet had some staining and the bed skirt looked to have never been washed; it was pretty nasty. Overall a good stay! P.s. We loved the Christmas cottage store right across the street :)

The room, hotel and proximity to all the things that New York has to offer is certainly why we considered staying at the Park Central, but we kept out reservation because of one Park Central employee in particular, Emanuel. My wife and I flew out and arrived in New York on noon for to attend an event for our client around 4pm, but the hotel had no availabilities until 4pm which would have given us no time to prepare and would have us arriving late to our clients event. I explained our situation to Emanuel and he did everything in his power to get us a room well before our client's event. Cannot thank Emanuel and the Park Central enough!

Beautiful art deco lobby with plenty of couches and a bar and tables with an outlet for your laptop.Nice suite with comfortable king size bed and a modern bathroom.Convenient neighborhood just a half block from Carnegie Deli

Lovely interior but as is common in New York city no coffee or tea making faciltiies, no free parking and ice machine often not working. Close to Times Square but far enough away to be quiet. Opposite Carnegie Hall. Good and fairly reasonable parking in the road by the side of the hotel. Metered parking until midnight and then free until about 6 am.

The hotel is in a fantastic location very near Times Square, Broadway, Central Park and opposite the Carnegie Hall. The hotel and our room were everything we could wish for to use as a base and I would recommend staying there.However, the staff were unfriendly and unhelpful (which is really unusual for USA - and I have been to several destinations now in the states). Plus, there are only 2 lifts to serve rooms for 18 floors and always a long queue to get in them. Also NY is the most expensive city I have been to in the states - I have been to Vegas and it was cheaper.. So take extra money for drinks etc, because May 2016 was very, very hot!

We have just got back from a week at the park central. We've had a fabulous time in NYC and this is a very honest review of the hotel. The Pros.....the location....2 streets from Central Park and you can see time square from the entrance....wow. The beds were so comfortable we all slept really well (take earplugs though it literally is the city that never sleeps) Beds were made and towels changes daily. Wifi was good. Cons...staff....reception staff were not great. Poor service on arrival and check out. Nothing explained in any detail, how to use the lifts, phone, our bill. I went back down to query my bill and was made to feel like I shouldn't. I had been in contact with the hotel via email and FB and they had always been fab, they had promised to make our stay special etc but we were just another number. There was no acknowledgment of any communication. The resort fee is a total rip off but not their fault. The cleanliness of our room was ok but there was rubbish on the floor when we arrived....not a great start. Noise....but not the hotels fault....it's on the road so expect noise. Overall it was a pleasant stay for how often ur in the room it was fine, the only thing that would put me off going back is the poor hospitality or sheer lack of it.

My wife and I stayed at Park Central hotel during a recent weekend stay in NYC. Overall a very nice hotel - it's an old building with some interesting history and you can tell they've tried to modernize a lot of it. Still signs of the buildings age/history here and there, which in my opinion is not a bad thing! Very clean overall with the rooms being a nice size for NYC. We stayed on a higher floor, and there was definitely some street noise - though that's part of the city experience. Elevators fairly small and sometimes a bit of a wait...we took the stairs once and thought they could have been better marked (as we got closer to the ground level it look more like utility areas than actual areas we were "supposed" to be in), but no problems overall. I admit the charging of so many extra "fees" just leaves a bad taste in your mouth - I would rather just have the hotel rate be a bit higher than feel like I'm being charged fees for amenities I'm not using. But overall - I would absolutely stay here again in the future. Great location near Central Park and a short (2 minute) subway ride to Times Square and Broadway areas. Don't hesitate to book your stay at the Park Central hotel!

We have just returned from a week in New York staying at The Park Central Hotel. The hotel its self is in a fantastic location and within walking distance from Times Square, Central Park and other main attractions that New York has to offer. Beautiful grand entrance and reception area and staff were very pleasant. Unfortunately I do have a few niggles, we were a party of 3 myself, husband and 3 year old daughter. When we got to our room we did have a king size bed but nowhere for our daughter to sleep. My husband asked at reception where our daughter was going to sleep and after waiting for about 45 minutes after travelling for nearly 12 hours they eventually delivered a travel cot which was to small really, but that was our only option we were given. Our room was at the front of the hotel on the 8th floor and it was extremely noisy from all the traffic, the rooms at the side and towards the back were very quiet after speaking to someone, but we still managed to sleep. But for anyone who is a light sleeper you may want to make sure that your room is not to the front of the hotel. Our room cleaned to a very high standard every day. For the size of the hotel we were surprised at how small the lifts were,always busy and we would wait for at least 10 to 15 minutes every day, lots of people would just use the stairs but it was a bit harder for us with a buggy. It was an extremely hot week whilst we were there so the AC came in very handy, we would leave this on all day so when we came back our room was lovely and cool. We also had free WiFi which was fab. There is a small place within the hotel to buy pastries, sandwiches, coffees etc. We did not purchase anything from here as we did find everything very expensive, but the food did look very nice. To sum up the hotel is in a great location, staff were pleasant, rooms are clean and adequate, but do not feel they cater for families.

My husband and I stayed here to celebrate my 40th birthday and as soon as we stepped into the lobby we knew we had chosen a fab place to stay. The staff were always helpful, to the point where the concierge service had helped with a couple of points before we had even started our break. The room was spacious and the bed enormous, whilst the bathroom was clean and modern (despite some minor signs of wear and tear). We also thought the hotel was well located being a 15 min walk to Times Square and about the same to Central Park, but our room at least was quiet and undisturbed by the constant noise of the city that literally never sleeps.

We have just returned from a week in New York and we stayed at the Park Central hotel. The location is just perfect, walking distance to Times Sq, Central Park and many more attractions. There are great places to eat on the doorstep and the views from our room were stunning ! I was travelling with a couple of people who had some special requirements, which I emailed across before the trip and they had made sure that everything was in place and more ! As we had a birthday out there they made a fuss and we received complementary drinks. The staff were friendly and happy to help. I have to mention Quimby Hightower, who's cheery nature and exceptional customer service made our stay even better and also Elizabeth Cacovic, who again went out of her way to enhance our stay, they are both an asset to this great hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want to be in heart of it!

The proximity of this hotel to all of the main attractions NY has to offer is fabulous. Times Square is a few blocks, as well as Central Park, or Rockefeller Center, and Carnegie Hall. The room was very good. We were upgraded without even asking. Also, we requested a later checkout time and customer relations was also accommodating to that request.

The Hotel in a very central position for sightseeing. Stop for tour bus one minute away same as subway. Try to master subway for visiting sights . Traffic is a nightmare you can walk faster than a taxi. Room adequate but three of us sharing two queen size beds a bit of problem and only eight coat hangers. Cocktails 15 dollars each and no change given out of 20$. We were given voucher for a snack breakfast of orange juice, croissant or bun and piece of fruit and we went to Starbucks for our coffee, which is next to hotel, took it all back to room and it put us on until lunch. Long queues in restaurant across road from hotel for breakfast. Our room was serviced late in afternoon when we got back, so we only had beds made twice infour nights.

Hotel very well placed for getting around. Ground floor public rooms super BUT bedrooms small tired and room service for cleaning we found very hit and miss.We booked a triple room which we paid extra for and found two queen size beds!!! A very small wardrobe with 8 hangers!! Totally inadequate in all respects. We were informed no rooms had three beds - never pointed out this fact on booking. Our other two companions had the same size room and the same beds. No other room was available. We were informed IF we took another room it would be in the region of $400 per night.Please be aware if you are travelling as a family group. They couldn't have cared less.

The listed price per day turned out to be very different than reality. They charged us a fee to include local calls---really? does anyone do that anymore? The fee included internet at a high rate. OK but it was not an option or discussed at check in. Also included a gym? Who knew? It was also not mentioned at check in. The bar was very nice but closed super early. No last call was mentioned. At $15 for a martini they could have been nicer there. The room was large by NY standards. However the AC unit leaked all over the floor at night. Luckily we did not have anything nearby or it would have been a huge problem. The bed was extremely comfortable.

We hadn't actually booked this hotel but we ended up being really pleased for the change! The hotel we had originally booked ran behind with the building work so this hotel was rearranged for us a few weeks before we travelled. It wasn't as close to Times Square as we had originally booked but as New York is so easy to travel around we didn't mind! It was quite close to Central Park though. The rooms were spacious and very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was equally as comfortable and had a great shower. The hotel has its own small 'cafe' and we had coffees and pastries to take up to our room. In comparison to the Starbucks next door this was quite expensive but it was convenient. The bar service was good and we were able to leave our luggage securely until our flight. The hotel also booked us a taxi with a reputable company which we were exceptionally pleased with after a bad experience from the airport. Staff were friendly and efficient. We would definitely stay here again!

Park central hotel is in a great location, close to central park, Carnegie hall, Broadway, tens of places to eat and I can go on and on about how easy it is to access anything you need.The staff are very friendly and accommodating. We had a red eye flight and got to the hotel early in the morning and to our surprise the person at check in desk said "the room is ready and you don't need to wait until afternoon". That was like a great gift for us. The room was nice and very clean, a little smaller than I expected.Overall I think this is a grat pkace to stay for visiting New York .

Steps away from Times Square is a joke! Mile and a half is more like it. Very close to Central Park. Popular hotel for high school trips. So some noise. Elevators are small. Go up to go down when checking out or wait forever! Room was nice. Bath was nice. Roomy. Room is large for New York. Bar is expensive. 30 fee is a rip off! Pays for Internet, fine, which I usually get but it is under 20 dollars. Pays for local calls- who makes those any more. Pays for gym but no one tells you how to access gym. And pays to store luggage before room is available or if you need to check out and have time before flight. What hotel does not do that?

This amenity fee is to be paid even if you don't use any of the amenities. Things like checking your luggage, fitness center & phone calls. This is clearly stated if you book direct but is not included if you book with a 3 party provider.The hotel is a very good location just a few blocks south of central park. Its a little noisy. There are double pane windows.The decor is very modern and up to date. There is no refrigerator in the room unless you request it

Hotel was clean with comfortable rooms. Staff was welcoming and helpful to our large group full of exuberant teens. One inconvenience was extremely small elevators for such a large building. Also very slow. We took stairs most of the time. We were on 4th floor, so not too bad.A small disappointment was that coffee not readily available. It was not in the rooms. OK. But then downstairs it was "available for purchase" in lobby cafe. Other guests seemed to have room package which included a Continental breakfast from this "to-go" only establishment. So those of us who really needed coffee waited in line. Sunday AM they don't open until 07:30 am. Normally I'd just pop out for a cup. But as a chaperone, I needed to remain in building and available.Great location. Quick stroll to Carnegie Hall. All in all, recommend this hotel.

I stayed in this hotel for 10 nights since the 12th of May. My pijama dress was probably gone with the laundry. I talked to the staff and the manager, wrote a complain, but no one really cares. I am sure that with such a treatment they won't see me again.

NYC was a college graduation trip for our family of three. Upon check in the hotel clerk provided us with an envelope containing a welcome letter and two complimentary drink vouchers. Check in was easy (so was check out via TV ~ a receipt was delivered under the door before check out morning), but no explanation of hotel layout was given, only one elevator was running most of the time, wait periods were about 10 minutes (elevators were small and packed so we had to wait until there was enough room), the room was average size, nothing impressive, no coffee machine, beds were uncomfortable, hard to sleep as it is a very noisy location (construction, non-stop car horn honking, yelling) bathroom had no ventilation system, we had issues with the TV/cable (we could not get a steady picture), blow dryer did not work (blew cold air) and they forgot to clean our room one day. We called, asked for towels that were delivered promptly, but no explanation, apology, compensation or follow up call was given as to the oversight. They do allow for late room service (4pm) for those that are late sleepers. One day, I asked the concierge (smiling female) for their computer and printer location. She directed me to the third floor. The gym is on this floor. The next day I asked a very friendly gentleman at the customer service counter. He pointed behind me...they were on the first floor. The hotel was within walking distance to a lot of locations (Carnegie Hall, Times Square, Central Park, Hell's Kitchen, 5th Avenue, Radio City Music Hall, etc...). We did not spend a lot of time in our room other than sleeping and showering so it all worked out.

So I will just start by saying that we only take one family vacation a year because of vacation days and expenses. This year we chose NYC and decided on Park Central Hotel because it seemed like good rates for the midtown area and very convenient to a lot of the metro transportation stops throughout Manhattan. However, I regret our stay with this company.We came to NYC with one credit card and the balance was $3000 when we arrived in town for our 5 day/4 night get away. The room expense was quoted at $1200 (plus and additional $200 for incidentals). This seemed fair enough until they placed two authorizations for $1400 on our card within minutes of being in NYC. This left us with a grand total of $200 to travel, entertain, and eat in one of the most expensive cities in the nation. Needless to say, we didn't have our best vacation as a family. The Park Central Hotel staff did place a reverse on the authorization but it did not take place in enough time me for us to enjoy NYC. They did however offer us all snacks (sandwiches, chips and a drink) for one meal at their "Central Market." They also offered a cocktail to my wife and I. However, ruining my family's vacation and then offering me chips and dip doesn't quite make it right!! Lesson learned, bring another credit card (in case another dumb hotel makes this decision again in the future). OR, stay at the Wellington or Salisbury hotels...which are both in the same area of midtown and cost the same amount as Park Central. In fact, the Salisbury may even be a better location. DO NOT stay at the Salisbury!!! They offered us NO DISCOUNT off of this stay or any future stay...but a bag of chips was nice.

Perfect location. Room is adequately sized. Everything worked well. Bed was extremely comfortable. Very snarky bellman; Sllightly snarky persaon at registration.Very annoying MANDITORY charge for use of wi-fi and gym, which we didn't want. Seems like a bait and switch sales technique.

Lovely hotel in a great location. Close to Central Park in one direction and Times Square in the other. We walked to and from our Broadway plays in a matter of minutes. We stayed seven days. Housekeeping was inconsistent but usually good. Only one day was a disappointment when we returned to a room that looked as if youngster had done it. Crumbs not vacuumed from the carpet, bed haphazardly made and bathroom fixtures with water marks clearly visible.

I stayed with my family in this well located hotel and took advantage of the parking package. Check-in was easy and thankfully we were allowed in at 1:30PM instead of 3PM. The room is small, there's no coffee machine nor a fridge (which for the US is not the rule). Carpets were not very clean, but sheets and bed were fine. Bathroom is ok, was renovated, however sanitization and cleaning was poor (they have a lot to improve on that). Internet worked perfectly and the TV/cable was excellent. Overall it was fine, price was fair and check-out was easy and without long queues.

The Park Central hotel was beautiful, clean and comfortable. The staff at the front desk and the concierge were polite and helpful. My daughter and I spent a couple of days as typical NYC tourists and it was a perfect location. The room was very nice, and good-sized for New York. We will definitely stay here again the next time we are in town.

I was a little nervous because this hotel was cheaper than most - I was NOT disappointed! Beautiful, clean and centrally located between Times Square and Central Park - Highly recommend this property!!

Lovely Hotel in superb location for visiting the usual tourist sights! Fab view of Times Square from the entrance. If you want the breakfast offer of $1 , make sure you book this online prior to your visit as cannot do when there!! Rooms very comfortable and clean.Would definitely stop here again.

Room was great, service was super, everyone was polite. A great time was had by all and I would totally recommend the hotel. Great Location. Easy access to Metro and great restaurants, Central Park, theaters all nearby. Nalini

We just stayed 6 nights at the Park Central and were thoroughly satisfied with our hotel choice. The location was great. We went to shows in Times Sq. every night -- but it was a relief NOT being in that craziness. This was an easy walk, but felt distanced from the yucky touristy chaos of Times Square. Subways are close, the park is right there, Rockefeller Center also a very easy walk. The room was spacious and comfortable -- the bathroom too. My only minor negatives were fairly weak water pressure in shower, poor light in the room (I kept wanting brighter light), and sometimes it took a while for an elevator to arrive on the 9th floor. A few times I just took the stairs down, not wanting to wait. Otherwise great! Staff was courteous and helpful. Also we got the breakfast package and that was awesome. So convenient. We grabbed coffee or juice, a pastry and fruit every morning before we left and it saved us a trip to Starbuck's.

Very nice room, exceptional service, and a great location. We asked if there was a coffee maker in the room and was told no, but they could bring one up. Which they did quickly with all the supplies needed for the week.Beds were very comfortable and room was quiet.

This hotel was pretty magnificent but the pricing of amenities is what puts it down to a 4 star rating for me.The room me and my family stayed in was clean with a great view down the street so the rooms are fantastic. The housekeeping staff were great also!There's a small kiosk type shop in the lobby which I visited a couple of times a day since there were no kiosks/convenience stores on the street close to the hotel. There were 3 of us buying breakfast one morning because meals weren't included in the package we got and we ended up spending $30 or so on a coffee each and a pastry (croissants or pain au chocolat) so that was a shock but there are loads of places to eat close by and there's a Starbucks next door! All about the location for this place. Fantastic placement near the park and to carnegie Hall which we visited for a show.

The hotel is a good choice, if you don't need a restaurant (a good number of them close to the hotel - it's New York!) or breakfast at all. Avoid the coffee shop in the lobby - ridiculously overpriced and equipped with unfriendly people. The hotel manager is present all the time and is a good example when it comes to aesthetics himself. The lady at the reception with blond, curly hairs needs a workshop when it comes to the words "welcome your guests as good as you can" - a smile costs nothing. She seems to work there, because no other work was available. She dealt not only with us this way. Room was of a goo size, clean. Internet works very well.

I would have found it very difficult to fault this trip until the last day when when our shoes were stolen from our room. very upsetting as these were brand new. We were told our cleaner would be asked and we would be contacted but it has been well over a week and we are yet to hear anything.watch your items if you are staying here !!!

It's noon and I arrive hoping to change prior to the 1:00 meeting. But what line to stand in? There are two, with no signage. My hopes of changing were dashed when I was told there were no rooms available until 4:00. I was told to wait in the long line in order to have my luggage stored. Yes, only 1 employee working the luggage line. There is a nice bar area behind the check in area, however, sigh again, it is not staffed until 5:00 PM. And there are signs stating there is an ADDITIONAL $30 service fee, that will be ADDED to room fee for things such as printing boarding passes, holding luggage, etc. No choice on the extra fee.The lobby bathroom requires a key, despite many other places in Times Square not requiring such.The entire check in / luggage process reflects an attitude of 'you want to stay near Times Square, then suck it up.'The room was nice, as was the bathroom. Soft towels and linens. However I did need to wear earplugs due to the noise from bustling NYC. The walls are adorned with a nice assortment of NYC photos.The management needs to address signage (check in vs baggage check) increase the the size of housekeeping to have rooms ready, and get rid of the tacky $30 mandatory added fee. By all means, have a bar tender starting at noon at the latest. Basically, replace upper management with leaders who value servicing customers.

The location was excellent and the room was fine, a little worn but serviceable and quite large for a New York hotel. I accidentally left behind a small electronic item (easily found, as it was plugged in to the bedside lamp) and emailed the next day to ask if it could be mailed back to me. Did not receive any reply at all.

After a long day of traveling, Emanuel at the reception desk was more than helpful and accommodating. Throughout our stay, the maintenance of the room was clean and refreshing. Close to everything and a very nice hotel!

I have lots of good things to say about our lucky choice of hotels. Since I'm not that familiar with NYC hotels, went through my AmEx account knowing good choices would come up with my criteria. First, the rooms were "roomy" and comfortable and had been updated within the last couple of years. And location, location, location; across the street from Carnegie Hall and it was an easier walk for use to go see The Today Show and head up to Time's Square, lots of great little diners on the block. Only negative was the always irritating "facilities fee," of $32 for one night. I was told it covered such necessities as free phone calls (I have a cell phone,) the business center (I have a laptop.) and no time to even find the workout room. I will definitely stay at the Park Central again, but hopefully that facility fee will include things I don't already have.

The hotel is opposite a very loud bar which plays music until ~1.00am. My room was on the front facing side of the building and even with ear plugs it was so loud I felt I was in the bar itself. I phoned reception at midnight to ask what time it finished, and whether it was worth waiting it out or moving rooms - they refused to pop over the road to ask what time it would stop and told me there were no other rooms to move to. When I got a bit teary because I had to be up in 6 hours they suddenly thought they could find me a room, but instead transferred me on the phone to 4 other people who had no idea what the last was talking about. In the end I gave up and just managed 4.5 hours sleep before having to get up for work. If this was a holiday trip I wouldn't have minded, but never again will I stay for business.

Reception staff; I see in other reviews staff do not receive a good report however I found staff to be helpful when I asked questions. They were not welcoming or overly friendly but they were definitely not rude and not unfriendly. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable.Great location close to many tourist attractions. Within walking distance to the theatres, central park, Carnegie Hall is across the road, Time Square, Rockefeller Centre, Radio City Centre, Fifth Avenue, shopping and lots of eating places, even an old authentic “Brooklyn Diner” was around the corner. The subway is very close by where you can get a train anywhere in Manhattan and it also connects to the Air train to the airport. On arrival to New York get a subway map- easy to navigate city and easy to use transport. If you are coming in from JFK follow the hotel directions for the air-train and subway. I did this with no problem.The hotel was easy to find. Note that if you go out late Downtown a taxi is quite cheap to get back to the hotel if you do not want to take the metro. From the Meatpacking District to hotel a taxi was US$15. I really enjoyed staying at this hotel for comfort and location. I would recommend the hotel and I would definitely stay here again. Price wise, not bad for NYC. The hotel offers express checkout so when leaving you do not have to queue but can drop your key card at reception (if you have no further costs).

This would be one of best hotels we have stayed at, except for the $US25 per night per room resort fee for wi-fi and gym " What a Scam" for a hotel to charge for a resort fee !! considering it's a hotel. We would have gladly paid the extra $25 if included in initial account. The hotel's location is excellent being close to subway, Central Park. Room, bathroom and air conditioner were all excellent

We stayed here at the end of April 2016 for a week. We have stayed at the PC for many years now every spring to get our "Big City"fix. For the last five or six years, we have spent 7 nights to more fully enjoy all the city has to offer and also to see multiple plays. As a bonus, there is a discount for and increased number of nights that suits us just fine. This hotel has nice, good-sized rooms for NYC and the recent renovation has made it even nicer. It is in a tremendous location between Central Park and Times Square. A lot of decent eating spots nearby and a very good area for walking or taking the subway. Although the rooms are nicely appointed, a mini-fridge in the rooms would be a great upgrade. More of the newer properties are adding this amenity. One criticism about the website, where I always make my reservation, is that it did not clearly spell out what the "facilities fee covered this year. Specifically, the website mentioned that internet access was available for an additional fee. But it was not noted to be covered in the $30+ daily facilities fee. I was pleasantly surprised when there was no additional charge for the internet, so apparently it was covered in the FF. I was ready to complain about that issue, but happily did not have to. The internet charge being included in the FF should be clearer, which would also give people less reason to complain about the daily FF. In conclusion, we had a great time for our week in NYC and at the PC Hotel. as we usually do.

We loved the location of this hotel. Walk to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square and great dining options, without the noise of being in the middle of all that. Right across the street from Carnegie Hall! Room and bathroom were spacious by NYC standards, bathroom was sparkling clean (though the room itself was dusty), temperature control was perfect, beds and pillows were incredibly comfortable and city noise was limited even though we were on a low floor. Small drawbacks - elevators are too small and too few for a hotel this size (long waits), many of the towels provided were old/worn but were replaced with nice ones when asked, our door knob lock was loose and we kept the dead bolt on whenever we were in the room, only 3 unisex public restrooms in lobby (again, not enough for a full hotel) and no in-room coffee maker. (Coffee is available for purchase in lobby but again not adequate for large hotel. Two employees running a very busy coffee/pastry bar couldn't keep up with the long lines.) All of these issues were manageable but should be addressed. When you are in NYC briefly, having things run quickly and smoothly is as important as a comfortable bed and nice room. That being said, we enjoyed our stay, price was good and we would return again and recommend this hotel.

Great location. You can see the trees of Central Park from the front door. Had a little snafu with the room type upon check in but it was resolved after speaking with the manager. The hotel is several blocks north of Times Square so is just out of the hustle and bustle which is nice. Very short walk to the park. Rooms were decent size. Only issue is the shower curtain should have been 2 inches longer so it would fall neatly within the tub. Why would you want the shower spray to hit the floor? Would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is between Central Park and Times Square so location is great, Can walk to many touristic places and Broadway is just few blocks away. There´s no cafeteria but many places around to have breakfast or lunch. Rooms are ok, wi-fi is good. Additional to the fare, you have to pay some fees (usd 30-40 per day) directly to the hotel, be prepared.

This was our third time staying at The Park Central, and we were very disappointed this time to fine the restaurant had disappeared, being replaced by an attractive looking, but uncomfortable bar and lounge area at the back of the lobby. There is a small shop selling overpriced take away coffee and snacks. We had hoped to meet our friends and sit in the lounge only to discover it was frequently closed for private functions leaving us to try to find somewhere to sit in the overcrowded lobby. On a positive note our room was good, with free wifi. However our friends were disappointed to find their room had a view of a brick wall and queen beds, despite booking a king, and requesting a view as they were celebration a significant anniversary. The location is of course perfect, but there are plenty of other hotels near by which we will be using next time.

The hotel had a brilliant location , 2 minutes from central park , times square and 5th avenue. The subways were close by , hotel itself is really nicely decorated and kept pretty clean with maids coming in everyday . Unfortunately the hotel did not have a restaurant but did have a small cafe which was extremely expensive . This was no problem though as there was a nice coffee shop next door. The staff were friendly as was the consierge and overall we really enjoyed our stay !

My husband and I just spent two nights in NYC and absolutely loved this hotel. It is in a great location and we could not have been happier. We have found our new favorite hotel in the city. We also loved the breakfast add-on for $1! Keep up the great job!

Booked room to arrive early and check in straight away as we would have travelled and had no sleep for 27hrs and had a window of opportunity to get an hours sleep and then off to a baseball game. Arrived early hours and they cancelled our booking (which I had paid for) and we had to wait 1 1/2hrs to get into a room. Didn't seem to care but happy to charge me for a room I couldn't get into. Then lost two parcels that were delivered, finally got one parcel but still can't locate the other. No one mans the customer service desk so they really don't care once they have you in. Elevators are a nightmare, easier to walk down the 9 flights of stairs then to wait for elevator.I am sure value for money there is a lot better around. Very disappointed as I had previously stayed there and had a good experience but what a difference 2 years make, definitely sub standard accommodation and wouldn't recommend to anyone.

The location of the park central was great for walking in Central Park and getting around town. BUT for $400 a night, you would think that the room would have more than one small bar of soap, one real glass, and would have a mini-refrigerator. It was still cold when we stayed there but I couldn't get any heat without the AC/heating radiator fan making a lot of noise. I finally asked for another blanket which got delivered an hour after I went to bed. The cheesiest thing was that the drinks at the bar were $15 and there were no bar snacks! Amazing. Perhaps the place is having financial difficulties. Or needs more staff.

We stayed at this hotel for business. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to where we needed to be, as well as shopping and dining options. The room was priced fairly for Manhattan, and for $1 extra through Hotels.com we could get a pastry and coffee at the hotel coffee bar.The hotel has no lobby bar, though there is an area behind the reception desk that looks like it was supposed to be a bar. The only food option is the coffee bar in the lobby and it was for morning options and beverages only. It also closes at 8:30pm.My first room was near the ice machine, near the elevator, and my view was a brick wall. (Seems many hotels give you this type of room if you book through a third party website) My room reeked of mold in the bathroom, in the shower, around the shower and molding, around the sink, and on the walls. There was black mold and in some areas there was white mold on the black mold. The hotel offered to clean it, but I asked to move to another room.My second room had a strange layout, with closet separating the two queen beds. It left not much room to walk around and I banged my legs against the sharp edges of the bed frame. (See pic) The bathroom was better than the first room smell-wise, but you could still smell mildew and you could visibly see mold on the wallpaper in the bathroom. (Wallpaper should not be in bathrooms for this reason) (See pics)My second room was located on the other side of the hotel and the elevator wasn't accessible. I had to walk around to the other side to use the one elevator bank. (See pic of elevator with sign) it was inconvenient.Pros-Location. Subway stop at 57th.Cons-poor cleaning of rooms, strange layout that didn't maximize space, no elevator on one side of hotel, no lobby bar and only food option is lobby coffee bar.Unless improvements are made, I won't stay at this hotel again.

We really could not have been happier with our stay. We were in New York for 5 days in early April, and it was our first trip there. The hotel’s location was fantastic, only a few blocks from Central park in one direction and the same distance to Times Square in the other direction, so perfect for exploring the city on foot. We did so much walking around Manhattan and the subway locations nearby were great for getting to the Ground Zero & the Statue of Liberty. The room we had was massive by New York standards, and a lot larger than we were expecting. Our room was clean and very modern, with a huge comfortable bed and a great wifi connection. Although we could occasionally hear people in the corridor, this was not an issue for us and we also had no problems with road noise etc from outside, it was not totally silent but it never would be in central Manhattan! There were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room which was slightly inconvenient but not so much an issue as they have a a coffee shop in the lobby. I am sure if requested we could have got something in the room. There is no hotel restaurant but this was not an issue as you have so many great options on your door step. During our time in New York we walked past a number of hotels which we had previously been considering when looking to book, and we did not see any which met the standards of the Park Central hotel. We would definitely stay again if returning to New York.

It location is the best, really the best, one block from the subway, two blocks from the Central Park, and comfortable walking distance from Times Square, as I have already mentioned, its location is great. The problem is that this hotel is too large, too many rooms, too many floors and very impersonal. They do not have enough staff to help when you have a problem. Three times happened to me that the card to open my room did not work. We arrived very tired, after a long walking day in NY and I have to come back to the front desk, where, despite they had room enough for 5, there was only one person, who also had to work with check in, ckeck out, taxis, luggage, etc. Therefore, every time the card did not work in my door, I have to wait at least 15 minutes more to get a new card. In addition, the hotel, despite being very large, does not have restaurant, only a coffee place at the entrance, which also offered cereal bars, some fruits and a very expensive and low quality coffee. Also, once we were interrpted by the cleaning lady, that dis not ask and just came into the room when were were already in. Resuming, the hotel was ok, but they really had a problem in assisting their passengers. They do not have enough staff at the front desk; they should have different staff for helping people already registered with them. My sensation was " I already have you in, now I do not care about you"

I travelled with my mother and my daughter. We stayed from 25-30th Jan (delayed 2 days getting there because of heavy snow) - The Hotel charged us extra for changing our dates, which was a bit mean as it wasn't our fault. Check in was quick and our room was lovely, in fact we were given a room with 2 large beds and not as we thought, a bed and a sofa bed. Super comfy beds, lovely bed linen and a small bathroom. Reception was a lovely area with a bar and coffee shop. Resort fee is a bit unnecessary as in this day and age WIFI should be available free of charge. New Yorkers are amazing at getting things open again after huge snow storms. Roads and footpaths all clear making it easy to get around. A short walk took you in 1 direction to Central Park and in the other direction to Time Square. Great location. Lots of diners / restaurants in the vicinity. This was out 9th trip to New York and we found eating and drinking out very expensive. A trip to Jersey Gardens is a must for those who love some retail therapy

Great location on 7th Avenue (between 55th and 56th Ave) and therefore, close to Central Park and the all the action that Midtown has to offer. Subway station right on the corner gets you to Downtown, Brooklyn, Queen's in about 30 minutes. The hotel rooms are small but comfortable. Clearly an old hotel that could do with a renovation but more than made up for it with the friendly and helpful staff. Give yourself an extra 5-10 minutes for the lifts (very slow). For those of you who need a gym, they have a very decent one with modern equipment on the 3rd floor.

This is my favourite Hotel in New York, my perfect choice all the time.Location specks itself; seven avenue nd 56st. Central park area. Everything is around the corner and shopping shopping by the major brand. A great fitness centre open 24 hours (NY)! Lovely breakfast at the Central Market and the Historical Society Museum of NY definitely to visit. The top!

Quite simply, this hotel added to our overall holiday experience. The room was a good size, clean and comfortable. The lobby and front desk staff were warm and welcoming, as were the doormen. I cannot fault our stay, which started out as four days and we increased it to nine days in total. Loved the location; easy walking distance to a lot of well-known attractions, and close proximity to all lines on the subway. Last but certainly not least - Central Market, a fantastic grab-and-go cafe with the most delicious coffee and pastries. This will always be our go-to hotel in NY.

Hotel was decorated nicely. I asked for a room with a view since it was our first visit to new York. I got a view of a brick wall. It was probably the worst room in the hotel. Hopefully he got a kick out of that. Service is non existent after 9pm. Nothing is available. We didn't want to leave to get water because it was 0 degrees outside but we had to. Great location though.

I like the rooms & the hotel itself & the mattress was great. However, I could hear every word spoken in the adjoining room and on the 3rd floor the street noise woke me during the night. Black out shades a plus for keeping out light. Quiet neighbors would have improved my stay substantially.

The Park Central Hotel is located within walking distance of Times Square, broadway shows, Carnegie Hall etc. The lobby is pretty and it has a nice lounge/bar. There is a small food shop but it is very expensive & has a limited selection. My sister and I got 2 coffees, a yogurt and a croissant and it was $21. There are only a couple of small elevators for this very large hotel. Also, they neglect to inform guest at check in that they have to use their room key to make the elevator work. I helped many frustrated guests use the elevator. The rooms was clean and comfortable but had no view at all but that didn't matter since we were only there to sleep. Overall, it was a reasonable price and I would stay there again.

Our experience at Park Central was excellent. Location was unbelievable and service superb (especially Angela at the front desk). You can see Times Square from the hotel property, Carnegie Hall is catty corner from the hotel and central park a few blocks, not to mention Broadway so very close!

We booked the Park Central for our first visit to New York City. It is conveniently located to everything, including a subway stop across the street. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially the waitress (can't recall her name) in the lounge who recommended an incredible Italian restaurant close by. The only thing we found strange is that there is no kitchen so you can't order food when hanging in the lounge enjoying drinks.

Hotel was in a good location not far from central park, broadway and a short walk from times square.Room was okay but no view.Staff were good and looked after our bags on check out day until we were ready to move on.

Excellent for Location! It is in the middle of almost all the iconic landmarks of New York-Central Park, Carnegie Hall, 5th Av, Broadway and many more! Rooms were clean and the housekeeping staff were very friendly. Many good restaurants nearby. Made us feel like we've been New Yorkers for a time!

At first I wasn't sure this was that great of a hotel, until I've since stayed in two others. This hotel has those other two "four star" hotels beat. The rooms are surprisingly big and very clean. The location is great, especially for anyone who is visiting for business on 57th Ave or heading to Carnegie Hall. The area is clean and safe and a quick walk down to Times Square or over to Central Park. I would stay again.

I have used this hotel 6 times overThe last 15 years. I choose it for location. This was my worst trip. A/C would not work. Wake up to 75* every morning. They kept saying if bldg air has not been turned on we can't have any air. Finally afterAbout 5 days a maint. Man came in and said relay switch had to be reset. It started working for oneNite. Next nite back hot. When we woke up it was 75 again. That is miserable and for $300-400 perNite unacceptable. No refrig. No coffee pot. But they charged us $27 more per nite for amenities like gym that we don't use. Ask for an extra pillow 3 times before we got it.

This hotel has 2 small elevators to serve over 300 guests.When you get in it is crammed full of humanity. Always!Maybe 8 people.With luggage less.However hotel is clean ,well located and friendly staff who managed to put 3 rooms on same floor for family arriving at different days.

Rooms looked newly refurbished, 2 double beds that were comfortable and clean, bathrooms were a good size and rooms were cleaned well. Good size TV and great internet access. Need to ask for tea and coffee making facilities if you want them. Hotel is in a superb location. We stayed on the 4th floor and overlooked some air con units as the room was set back off the street ~ not a great view. The hotel is in a SUPERB location for just about everything. Staff could be a little more Disney friendly and less New York grumpy !! The downside of this hotel is the RIP OFF $30 plus tax Facilities Fee charged per night. We paid $163.03 for facilities we didn't use. They should either include it in their nightly rate so it's paid for in advance or charge those who actually use it. Really put a negative end to our stay there which was disappointing. Lot of money when we didn't use the gym, computers or the printing facilities ~ it was very irritating to have to pay this amount of money for NOTHING and subsidise others.

We stayed in this hotel between 25 and 30 April 2016. We were a party of 8 and had many items which went 'missing' from the rooms. We believe these were taken by the cleaning staff as they had access to our rooms. Very conveniently, some items were taken on the final morning of our stay, meaning we did not notice until we returned home. Many of the staff were very informative and friendly, particularly 'John', one of the head bar staff. Very disappointed in the theft of our belongings. Will not be back.

What I really loved about this hotel were the simple things 1. Hotel location was perfect. Close enough to time square but far enough away that it wasn’t as busy. Shopping was 2 blocks over. 2. Very easy and quick check in/out service3. Awesome deli!!! Amazing salads and potein shakes4. Great gym! I was there 3 out of 4 days and loved it 5. We were on the 11th floor and it was so so so quiet I got an amazing night sleep6. The bed!!!!!!! I just wanted to take it home All those factors above made it a truly great stay at the hotel! I would seriously recommend this to everyone

Hotel location is superb very close to central park but walking distance to times square.Hotel was clean (with couple of minor issues in bathroom but no major problems) and quiet considering you are on 7th Ave but be aware road noise durng night.Checkin reception and concierge were helpful efficient and polite when required. The bar area is really nice, shame it closes at 11.15. There is a nice cocktail lounge nearby as is Tanner Smiths a nice bar within 50 yards around the corner There is a small shop selling sanwiches etc in the lobby area, nice but a little expensive There are at least 4 delis withjn 50 yards of the hotel, we went to the Park Deki over the road for excellent breakfast and fab coffee and the premier deli next door for great cheesecake late at night, the famous Carneagie Deli is just down from the hotel but there were queues so we gave it a miss.Theroom we were in was 11th floor facìng 7th ave views were ok, decent size and clean bed was very comfortable bathroom adequate good size tv.Overall very good to excellent will come back in future

I stayed at the Park Central for a work conference I was attending at the Javitz in April, and could not have been more pleased. Although I had to wait a bit to get my room key since there was a long line of guests at the front desk, the woman who greeted me and helped me check in to my room was beyond helpful, and had a very welcoming demeanor. The rooms were spacious and very clean, and the manager was accommodating when I had requested to change to a room with two beds (a co worker decided to bunk with me) instead of the one king bedroom I originally booked. Great location, quick access to everything, beautiful sparkling lobby, and easy to get to and from the rooms. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC, and am looking forward to coming back soon.

After trawling through the reviews of various hotels, I picked Park Central based on what I read. Fantastic location, good staff and lovely rooms. The reviews were not wrong.Beds were super comfy, I was also surprised by room size - being central NYC I expected small sizes but was very comfortable for two of us.
