The Market had the most divine chocolate cake which we devoured with cups of tea in our room after a very long day walking around.We didn't have to wait long for the lifts at all but the only slight complaint would be that every time we got to our room our key card failed so then a trip back downstairs to sort out.Of course it is noisy being NYC and that's even on the 10th floor but after reading the reviews, I took some earplugs and that did the trick.All in all a fantastic stay for a special hen do, just mum and daughter. We would stay again and we would also recommend to others.

Stayed here for 4 nights and couldn't be better. As its a city hotel there isn't much to say as you don't really need it that many things so I'll keep it short. ProsLocation, is the main thing. It's just perfect with a nice 10 min walk to Times, and 3 min to Central Park. Perfect for bars/eateries, several literally next door, over the road, round the corner....etc. Try Ray's Pizza for a snack....ACE!Value, we managed to get it at a good price, so it was worth it. But make sure you know they're gonna sting you for Tax, Resort Tax, and any other tax they can think of. ConsWiFi was bad. They tried to get it sorted for us, but took some sorting. Bar prices were expensive (we never used it, but got told by previous visitors)That's it. If the price is right then stop looking, just book this hotel!!!!

My girls and I booked this hotel for our first trip to NYC, it was a brilliant location for all the sights. The room was perfect for three adults, we were not on top of each other. The staff were more than helpful, would recommend this hotel. Drinks from the shop were a little expensive and the atm charged more than street ones.

There isn't a lot to dislike about this hotel. It's located in a good spot - near enough to Carnegie Hall and Times Square, as well as numerous stores and restaurants, yet not too close to be too expensive. The room I had (king bed) was comfortable for the two nights I was there, and very quiet.There is an extra charge (required) for "amenities," which includes internet. Unsure why they do this.There's also a hold on your credit card ($50) for various sundries, but unclear what those might be.Front desk staff was not the most polite when I checked in, but I didn't expect them to be gushing with bon homie either.Overall, a good value.

On the positive side, the hotel is very conveniently located, and the staff is friendly and responsive. The original person (Angela) who checked me in was very kind, as were the Guest and house Services people who helped correct several things. The bed was great.The rooms are small but remodeled. I had trouble with a rancid shower curtain, a faulty tub stopper, the room keys, the time limit on the lobby computers as I tried to find a shuttle, and getting hot water on the final day. The first two were corrected cheerfully on the second try. The hotel is simply not full service. No shower cap was provided, there is no restaurant so no room service; the little cafe there is limited in items and hours; there is no cleaning/pressing service or store for small items. Even motels have this! This hotel was the first ever to refuse me a late check out.

We were very happy with the cleanliness and location of this hotel. Also, I did not mind paying the resort fee, like most hotels in Manhattan. However, $30 a day is a bit much for what you get and you get extremely slow internet; at best 5 MB per second download speeds! Also no fridge in the room and convenient store downstairs was extremely expensive; $6 for bottled water. I will try a new hotel next time...

We travel to New York frequently, but this was our first stay at this hotel. We loved our room because it was very clean, comfortable, and well decorated. The location of the hotel was within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, and Rockefeller Center. There are lots of restaurants nearby, and the price of the room was reasonable. This hotel gets busy, and the elevators can be busy at times.

Very close to everything... subway, Times Square, Central Park, Theaters, good food. Friendly staff, clean room, comfortable beds. It was spacious for New York standards. The valet parking was convenient. Didn't love the sneaky $30 hotel fee. Just build that into the rate if it is not optional and don't stick people with it after just including it on the confirmation. Only 2 elevators, they were modern and fast but 2 is not enough.

We stayed here recently on a last minute trip to NYC. Other friends made reservations at this hotel so we decided we would also. Not knowing what to expect made me a little anxious. I could not have been more pleased when we arrived. It is in an excellent location. Within walking distance of most everything we were looking to do, MOMO, great restaurants, local smaller out of the way eateries, Lincoln Center, Broadway shows...the works! Staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms were pleasant and very clean. The only thing that was slightly irritating is the A/C units were a little noisy for me. Beds were comfortable though as were the sheets. Overall a good experience. I would stay here again.

Check-in and Check-out was smooth and very quick. We upgraded to the corner room, it was a nice size. Keep in mind if you select the corner room that there will be noise from the street at night(loud motors, sirens, etc...). The hotel location is great for whatever you want to do. The staff was helpful and courteous. I would stay here again.

In the past year and a half since my husband and I first stayed here, we've been back three more times and have sent family members who visit the city here as well! This is our go-to hotel in New York City and, while sometimes there's better value to be found at other hotels depending on time of year, Park Central is the one we always check first.The Classic King Room, which we've always stayed in, is huge by NYC standards. The room is well decorated, the bed is very comfortable and, perhaps most importantly, the rooms are quiet which is never a guarantee. Wi-fi is solid too. If you book through the website, the $1 add-on breakfast is a great value as well.The daily resort fee is frustrating and the elevators can get clogged during high traffic times of the day, but that's where the list of cons end. Park Central has a high-class feel with the quality to back it up. Strongly recommend!

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights because our main goal was to stay in a central location so that we can freely roam Manhattan. This hotel delivers on that. However, please read the general reviews posted. The rooms are quite small, oddly furnished, underwhelming, and if you have our luck, terrible views. There is no restaurant on site, but there are many close by. Also, we were told that there was no room service so, if you crave that chocolate cake and glass of wine at 12 am then you must roam outside the hotel. Nevertheless, these are trivial issues because its New York, you're going to be outside most of the times. The main reason we will not be staying at this hotel again is simple - horrible staff! Staff at the front desk were unfriendly and unhelpful. Employees seemed somewhat angry at me for speaking. Therefore, I avoided all contact with hotel staff for the entire stay. On the bright side, there was solid WiFi signal. This is not a 4 star hotel, it is simply a convenient, expensive place to stay.

Changed the key room three times because it was not working.Check in is at 4 PM!! and check out is at Noon. had a late flight and asked for 2 - 3 hours late check out (to 2 - or 3 pm) , they wanted to charge me $75 !!! Smiling face but No Courtesy!!Wanted to leave some bags for storage for a few days, they refused saying it was not possible.And worst of all, on the website they mention complementary internet and local calls free. But then when you check out, they surprise you with an item on the bill called facility fee of $30. When i asked what s it for, was told it is for using internet, free local calls, and luggage storing!!!!!

I spent 2 nights at this hotel, and was extremely impressed with the size and comfort of my room, the hotel amenities, and especially the value. Friends were staying at a different hotel around the corner for $$$ and their room was only a tiny bit larger and nicer. I will definitely stay at Park Central on my next trip to NYC!

Lighting in bathroom and hotel room was poor. Did not know about the MANDATORY $30 per day facility fee. Ask about that before you book. Room was fine, nothing special. Was there for three day business meetings outside the hotel. In summary , not worth $330 a night except for the location.

Hotel is nice and clean but in case you need a fridge or a cup of hot water for tea or coffee with no dairy/soy or food for that matter and you cannot go out, you are in no luck! I could not even get connected to an operator or the front desk because they have the operators in a different time zone or something like this. Many small inconveniences that just added up.

Traveled with 18 in a group.. The service and planning was fantastic.. Very fair on pricing - Actually met a price at a competing hotel to get our business. Perfect location for us to travel to Lincoln Center and Broadway Theatres

Great location that puts you in the middle of manhattan ... what else would you want.good service, good beds ... get the sleep you need after a day in the city for a decent price and good service. Enjoy NY!

We have stayed here three times already . Its centralized located to Broadway Central Park and Time Square . Pricing is good . Employees are nice professional and knowledgeable. It's clean and rooms are not as small as most NYC rooms can be . Would highly recommend.

My best advice, if your a light sleeper stay above the 12th floor. I had a room on the 9th floor and regretted it. The unfortunate part is I asked the front desk about the noise. The noise all night long made for a long day the following day. The bar lounge area is impressive. Fantastic service. Check in was at 4pm. Most of my colleagues did not get a room early. Very convenient location. Rooms are nice, comfortable bed. Pillows are OK, not what I expected for the cost of the room. First hotel I've been in where the elevators are tiny. The check in desk live moved quickly. The concierge line did not move quickly. The hotel is nice, shower is great but for the money it is not as nice as I thought it would be. I would probably try another hotel before I stayed here again.

My roommate from college (1965) and I reunited for a 6 day trip to NYC this spring. We had an excellent experience at the Park Central, the location could not have been better. All staff were terrific to us. Our room was small but clean, the beds were fabulously comfy and our only small complaint was the lack of bathroom ventilation. Whatever we asked for from staff, we received, including a nice little refrigerator for cold drinks. The cleaning crew was friendly and helpful too. Our rate was reasonable and we definitely recommend this hotel.

I was only there for two nights, but really love this hotel. They are well located and the rooms are modern and clean. Rooms are small as per the NY standard, but still comfortable. Staff are helpful and friendly. The view from the room is terrible (staring down a column of rooms with aircon units at the bottom). I just kept the curtains closed. Your out and about during the day anyway. Hopefully one year I will get a room with a better view.

Excellent hotel for Times Square. No restaurant in the hotel but plenty of options close by. Clean modern nicely furnished rooms. Very friendly front desk staff.Concierge service was also helpful storing luggage at no extra charge.Rooms were ready upon arrival early.

My wife and I recently stayed here as I was on business. We had a comfortable stay for 2 nights though I couldn't comment on their other services/amenities since we stayed there mainly to sleep. However the room was pretty good, very clean with the standard amenities. I think the selling point really is the great location, everything's walking distance from Times Square to Central Park.

This hotel stays very busy and there is a facility fee for staying that is a bit pricey. That said, it is worth it for the cleanliness and location! Central park is right around the corner and you are within walking distance to Times Square. The room size is nice and we had a refrigerator on our room. I will definitely be staying here the next time I'm in NYC.

We booked weeks in advance and requested a refidgerator for my medication but on arrival they said they did not have any as they were all used. I cried and explained that if my medication was not refrigerated then I would become very sick. I was upset that the fridges were kept for upper class paying customers who store there alcohol. It was a very disappointing arrival for us and by the end of the night the fridge showed up. Another problem the walls were thin and you could here every single noise from your neighbours. My husband had to approach rude men at 3.00am in the morning to tell them for some respect.

Just came back from an overnight stay at Park Central. The lobby was beautiful, and the rooms were good for what you expect from a NY hotel (just the basics and a small room, but you're not really in the room other than to sleep).We booked directly with the hotel and got a great deal when you pay in advance. What I didn't get was the $30 facility fee. I get that it's to cover all "facility" items like the gym and luggage hold areas, but what I really could have used was a bottle of water in the room as a courtesy. Most hotels offer that but this hotel doesn't. And there are no vending machines, so if the little store in the lobby closes and you're thirsty, you're out of luck. But you better have a lot of cash for that market (a can of coke was $3 and a small bottle of water was $4). We also spent $10 on a small pack of oreos and an ice cream bar. I know the city is expensive, and I'm from the area, but this is ridiculous. Bring some bottles of water with you if you can and some snacks. And if you want a drink from the bar, it doesn't open until 5:00 even on the weekend, which was disappointing since we were looking to get a drink before heading out to an early dinner. I rated it very good because the location cannot be beat and it was very quiet for the area, check in was a breeze (even got in a little before the check in time). We probably won't stay there again because with all the added costs, it wasn't as cheap as I thought it would be. If you do decide to stay here, be prepared to spend a lot of money on snacks and drinks.

Trash cans I lobby overflowing, hair on towels and bedding, hot water in bathroom sink flows in waves of clear and brown and the concierge ... Angry in general and rude! The cafe seems to need a better system, lots of confusion and they have taken notes from the concierge , not the most helpful or nicest to their guest. Only plus, location.

The location is the best.The rooms are wide and very nice.The staff is so kind and try to help you in everything you need.There is also a lovely bar to drink in the evening..Every thing is so close to this hotel.The central park is 3 minutes walking.The times square is 3 minutes walking also.We will come back next time in NY.

Very Good Hotel with excellent location between Times Square and Central Park, across street from Carnegie Hall. Quoted price doesn't include major fees and taxes. The "hotel fee" took the cake-that should definitely have been part of the room rate. Rooms are small but recently remodeled and clean. Bed was average. Lobby is nicely done but doesn't have many places to sit. There is however a very pleasant almost library like room next door with computer carrels and booths at which groups can sit and have coffee. Negatives were price (takes getting used to), street noise, and that the bathtub drain didn't work right.

Conveniently located at 7th Ave and 55th St W, a few easy block to Time Square and Broadway (south) or Central Park (north). Clean, comfortable and a great place to call home while in NYC. Subway entrances close by, and lots of shopping and restaurants in the area. Watch for specials online, or better yet, sign up for emails from the hotel ... we always book through the emails and get amazing prices, including valet parking for $10 a night when we bring our car instead of flying in.

This place is a finding. Clean, roomy and steps away from Central Park and the "hot side" of the 5th Avenue. They don't serve breakfast but in NYC it is not a big deal, the "next doors" are full of options (Starbucks, Dinners, Fresh & Go, Le Pain Quotidien etc). Funny thing is that I've lived at 50th Street with 8th and NEVER notice this hotel before. Amenities from C.O.Bigelow by the way. It is definitely worth EVERY PENNY coz it is "ridiculous" inexpensive if you compare with its pears just blocks a few blocks away.

The best thing of this hotel is its location. It is near Times Square, Central Park, Columbus Circle, Metro Station, MoMA, Rockefeller Center and many places to eat. The room was clean and recently renovated. The bed comfy. The concierge help us in every way we asked for. I definitely would stay again.

This hotel is just plain awful. I came here with my family and first we needed a refrigerator with for my father's medicine they didn't have a refrigerator available until the next day nobody even put in an order for it so I had to call again to put in an order myself. It is very disorganized and there is no proper system worked out nobody is on top of gas requests. Then our toilet clogged about four times throughout our 60 day we called him several times to make a request the engineers took forever to come upstairs and fix the toilets further sometimes they wouldn't even come until I would call a second time then I went downstairs to talk to the manager about this issue no one even offered to have us change rooms in the several times we called about the toilet. When I came down to talk to the guest relations manager Nancy she offered to help me out in the situation and then tore up the paper with the bill on it right in front of my face when I requested for more reimbursement. At the end she didn't even say anything she was silent looked down didn't even look at me and tell me to have a nice stay or anything like that I was the one who had to say thank you and walk away as she looked down and ignored me. This is the worst service I've had in a hotel in a very long time I will not come back to this hotel. The amenities are horrible and the service is even worse.

Amenities are great for business people, free wifi and a place to setup your laptop and do client meetings!! The location is also near to 6th Ave where most banks/clients hang out so you can easily pop over for a meeting.

1 block from central park and I have stayed here once almost every year. They have just refurbished this hotel and made it very nice. It is overall clean and staff is helpful. it is close to central park, I walked to time square within 15 minutes. I walked to Ground Zero in 40 Minutes and it is a lovely walk. Only one thing missing in the Hotel is a Restaurant.

We couldn't have found a better location at an affordable price for what we wanted in New York. Central Park is only 2 or 3 blocks away, Times Square and theatres within easy walking distance, a subway station across the street and a great variety of restaurants all around the hotel. Although the room itself was basic (no bar fridge, no kettle) it was kept exceptionally clean by housekeeping (a big thanks to Marissa). And since we were out most of the day, we really didn't need much more in a room. A small note about the elevators; there was a bit of a line up at times, but nothing to get worked up over. Another thing to keep in mind, we were told that the "one dollar breakfast" had to be arranged at the time of booking your room.Overall, a good experience at the Park Central Hotel.

This hotel is in the ideal location, surrounded by Central Park, Times Square, great restaurants, and many other NY sights withing walking distance. Staff was great. Bartenders were quirky and fun...great lounging area. The only downside I could see is the extremely slow elevators at times.

Excellence and great stay! Close to the Central Park and Times Square. Fifth Avenue is some lovely blocks away. Renewed confortable rooms in a very nice place, near to all the interesting places in Manhattan.

only one front desk staff at 1030pm with a long line of four people waiting. Had to wait 20min just to get a new card key which stops working every time it enters my pocket. Staff rude and unhelpful. Room is dark with no view.

Great location, nice rooms, clean, should be a great place! However, treating people with respect and putting the client first is not a priority. I purchased a package deal with my room and they had no idea about it. They wanted me to prove I bought it, excuse me, you should have that in your computer, take a second and look!! I came back when I had settled down, with proof in hand, this person looked on their computer and said, ya it's right here (I.E. first person could care less), however the package included tickets and all they did was COPY a ticket instead of giving me an actual ticket. Really? Breakfast was in the package. Using the coupon provided proved challenging. The breakfast included choice of hot drink or choice of cold drink. I ordered a large coffee, you can only have a small coffee. Really?! My son wanted milk, no, that coupon only covers orange juice. Really?! I "upgraded" to milk for his sake, over $5 for milk!! Ok, now you have crossed the line from silliness to just pissing me off. I reviewed the hotel via there request, the response I got was "Thanks, we will work to be better". No we screwed up, your right, no offer of discount on return trip to prove we are better than this. Nothing. Says it all. They don't care about you.

Daily 20 minute wait for elevators! Real issue in this hotel!Dirty coffee cups remained 7 days on the bedside table.Very unfriendly reception staff: unacceptable! U'd better avoid the reception team and the elevators in rush hours because this hotel is like a central train station in a big city: stop & go but don't expect anything beyond. I had a great deal (average rate per night around $200 including city tax and the shameful facilities fee you are forced to submit to) but I will definitely not stay again.

No fridge in the hotel. After requesting one, the one I was given did not work. Otherwise, all else was rather good. The elevators also tended to have long lines. The check in and check out experience was good. So was the room. Location of the hotel, makes up for the shortcomings mentioned.

Great location, Central Park to the left and Times Square to the right. Subway close and easy to get around the city and to the airport. Unfortunately there are plenty stairs, New York doesn't cater for disability.. Great italian restaurant left on the hotel side trattoria ... Can't remember the name!!! Friendly staff and brilliant food... Rooms are good, big king size bed and clean. Air con makes a noise and does it own thing!! Would have liked bubble bath. No fridge in room. There is no upgrade the room u book is what u get or pay for upgrade + $40 Tours - a must is the 911 memorial and museum tour. Top of the Rock and Rockefeller centre tour, Staten Island, get on the boat and on the other side head straight back on again. Walking - Central Park, highline, Brooklyn Bridge, Grand Central, Times Square

The hotel was renovated and looks really fancy and classy. Rooms are comfortable, bathroom is spacious, not all the rooms have fridge, for me that is important and I couldn't get one.Hotel is close to many breakfast places, stores and main tourist locations. Subway is just few steps from the hotel. So you are in the best location you could ask for. Maybe you can find too busy, but for typical tourists are perfect.Front desk was not the most polite person, could be more friendly and polite as they ate receiving guests.

We arrived early and were able to store our luggage. We were glad for the computer/printer access for printing boarding passes. The rooms are clean and adequate. The lobby lounge is just beautiful. The location is great and there wasn't any road noise until some morning deliveries. We would return.

We recently visited New York with our 2 year old daughter (who celebrated her 2nd birthday whilst in The Big Apple). Firstly our flight out on Delta, sister company to Virgin. We have flown both Delta and Virgin with our little girl and although I prefer Virgin I couldn't find fault with Delta, professional, friendly helpful staff. On this visit to New York we chose to stay at the Park Central Hotel as we know this location and its proximity to everything we wanted to do on this visit. Due to my daughters jet lag we where regularly seen in the Central Park play areas at 7am. Lol. The hotel was very nice and the staff were more than helpful. We did have to request a fridge in the room to store milk, this request was dealt with promptly and with no time we had a fridge in our room large enough to put the cow in. The only down side to our stay was the mandatory charge for the wifi, but as we was already aware of this charge then we can't complainWe found getting around the city was far easier underground than it was above ground especially with a toddler. As we have visited New York before we had a rough idea of where we wanted to be and of the subway and metro, which were faultless. Overall another great visit to The Big Apple and fantastic memories of my little girl looking out over down town Manhatten from the top of the Empire State Building on her 2nd birthday.

So the hotels a 10 minute stroll from time square one way and 5 min walk to Central Park the other, there is easy access to the subway station nearby. The hotel itself is pretty average, you get the usual New York style hotel room (not much room), we were given a "street view" what this meant was our room view looked out straight on to an office, which meant the curtains stayed closed our whole visit. This was our honeymoon and upon check in was given a voucher for two free drinks in the bar. We go to the gym quite a bit when travelling, this gym unfortunately didn't meet our needs, the weight plates and kettle bells are locked up for some reason, the gym itself has no aircon and had to open windows as got very stuffy inside. There was water and towel facilities however. We knew whilst booking that this hotel had no restaurant, but did offer a breakfast style coffee bar which small food offerings, all of which are overpriced and we just eat outside the hotel. Would I return to park central? Probably not... Would I recommend it? If your looking for location, then sure, however it's New York and you should expect to pay more for not much

Room was little small but if you are in NYC, you shouldn't be in the room much anyway. The service was incredibly helpful and friendly. Perfect location, easy walk to Central Park and Times Square. Close to many subway lines.

We have stayed at the Park Central during our last several trips to NYC. We love the location (close to the theater district, Carnegie Hall, Central Park, Lincoln Center, Carnegie Deli, and the subway). The staff is very gracious and very helpful. The rooms are nice (not 5-star nice) but very pleasant with plenty of space, a great mattress, and good shower, and the hotel has a great bar/lounge and nice little central market (beverages, pastries, sandwiches, snacks). Many good restaurants in the immediate area. We always feel very comfortable here.

Let me put it this way. Location is great, no doubt, the winebar next door is very good and freiendly.The service and friedliness of the Employees, all of them, is very bad.Their credo is, the Hotel is pretty full mostly, why do we have to be friendly.Next please, not Hello how are you.....Would I go back, NO, not because of the location, because of the staff.

The location of the hotel could not be faulted. The room was a good size however the air conditioner made so much noise that we complained and we were provided with a stand alone fan that was even louder than the room's unit. If the weather had been warmer the room would have been appallingly stifling. The safe did not work and the battery required replacement - something that should be added to a quality assessment of the room and its fittings/fixtures. We were placed in the room next to the elevators and stairwell - very noisy at night and early in the morning with guests banging their suitcases down the stairs. We had booked directly with the hotel rather than using a 3rd party site based on reading reviews from such sites thinking that we would receive some preferential treatment bu booking direct - this didn't happen, even though I had specifically mentioned my husband's 50th birthday. Our view was into other rooms and over a very poorly maintained rooftop. There weren't even loan umbrellas for guests, in room coffee making facilities, small refrigerator (friends were staying at Morgans and were provided with many little additions that Park Central did not provide).

Hotel location is excellent. A few minutes utes walk from central park and (in the other direction) from times square. Many places to eat around including some famous delis. Hotel facilities are fine and our room was large and comfortable. Price was around $250 per day for a room without breakfast.

We are currently staying at the Park Central. It is in a great location. Near Times Square and Broadway theaters. Rooms are clean and a decent size for NY. We stayed in a double queen, with two teenaged daughters. It was fine for the one night we were there. If you are not used to NY noise, I would not recommend this hotel. It was built in the 1920's, and although it has a lot of charm, it's construction is antiquated for today's congestion. We heard every noise from outside and best was the jackhammering at 8:00am on a Saturday morning.There are many, many places to eat. We made some reservations prior to our trip, but really didn't need them.Some very minor issues we encountered were:1. We booked a double queen, but they put us in a double full. Had to get that changed 2. Toilet didn't flush in 1st room3. Courtesy personal care item, such as shampoo, body wash and conditioner are in large dispensers in the shower/tub area. Ours were empty or almost empty.

I'm terrified of heights and hate atrium style hotels. So I liked the layout! The rooms were clean and modern. We had some drunken fighting neighbors one night and the hotel was very gracious in addressing our concerns. They have a coffee shop in the lobby and Starbucks on the corner! Perfect location between Central Park and Times Square. My only dislike is that the elevators are small so they seem insufficient for the number of guests.

Stayed in hotel, made reservations directly with Hotel, was never advised of fees for fitness centre , only when I was checking out. They charge you $30.00 fee to everyone staying at this Hotel. You have no choice to pay. Even if you did not initial the information, nor is it explained to you upon checkout. They are making customers pay to use fitness centre.

This hotel is ideally located for a visit to Manhattan. Many key sites such as Carnegie Hall, Central Park, and MOMA are a brief walk away as is are subway stations.The staff is pleasant and accommodating and the room large and airy.There are a few things that prevent awarding full marks:1.) the carpet in the room was dirty2.)the bathroom and the closet was minuscule3.)there were no informational materials in the room4.)there were no glass glasses and soap was not replaced without repeated requests for same, and most relevant:5.)the mattress was not of the level expected in this kind of hotel.Would I stay here again->yes, but would make very specific conditions particularly about the bed.

Had a great time. Price was decent for New York. Room a decent size for New York. Clean room, clean bathrooms. Very nice hotel. Nicely situated can walk to shopping, Times Square, Central Park, Broadway. Hotel staff was super nice. In and out was a breeze, parking was a breeze. Guest relations people were excellent.

I took my family to New York city to see the sites and do general tourist activities. We wanted to stay in the middle of the city so we could walk to Time Square, Central Park, MOMA and many other nearby attractions. This hotel is in the ideal location. The rooms (more later) we stayed in were clean and spacious for a city hotel. I encountered a few issues with our stay. I booked a room with 2 queen beds for me, my wife and 2 children (13 and 18). When we arrived the person at the front desk informed me they did not have any rooms with 2 queen beds left and could only offer us a room with a king bed and a cot. We took the room with the king bed with the promise to transfer to a new room the next day. I am fine with issues in booking and mistakes happen. The person at the front desk was rude with me and offered no sort of compensation (free breakfast, bottle of water) for the mistake. Not even an offer to have a valet move our bags the next day. The second issue is the hotel has a limited number of elevator banks, 2 on each side of the building. On the weekends you can wait 10 or 15 minutes for an elevator. Stairs are an option and we took them a few times (down) from the 8th floor.

My Daughter and Granddaughter enjoyed a long weekend stay at the Park Central In NY. The Location was perfect...every window view was a fun addition to our stay. We were able to walk to almost every place we had on our list to see with a short walk. Also the Uber made even a trip to the Statue of Liberty an easy trip . the Hotel Staff were all very helpful and pleasant. the Hotel room was a good size for sharing a room and the wall divider in between allowed for a little extra Privacy. The morning Coffee and Breakfast area in the Lobby as well as the Lobby and Bar area were a Beautiful addition to our experience ! Would definitely Stay there next time !

I've stayed in 3 hotels in midtown in the last 6 months, and this was my favorite. From the sidewalk in front of the hotel you can see Time Square to the south, Central Park to the north, and Carnegie Hall across the street - if you're there for midtown, the location can't get much better than that! The room was well decorated and clean - a little small, but that's to be expected in New York. One tip- be extra sure you close the window shades when you want privacy - because of the design of the building, we could see right across into other guest's rooms!

The room is small (it is NY) but very clean. The location is great- two blocks from Central Park, right beside subway, and short walk to Theater District/Times Square. Lots of great restaurants in nearby Hell's Kitchen. Definitely get the $1 breakfast add on. We picked up the breakfast and walked to Central Park to eat it. The staff was friendly and helpful. We did not have a problem with slow elevators as other people wrote. I would definitely stay there again. One comment- the water comes out of the tap dangerously hot, use caution.

I bought a Groupon for this hotel and received a great rate. When I checked in I was an offered a free upgrade without requesting one. The room was clean and larger than I expected. The location was excellent within walking distance of most major attractions. At one point when I was leaving the hotel a staff person saw I was confused (about which way to go) and asked if I needed help (without me asking) which I thought was nice. When we were checking out we had our luggage and again a staff person asked if we needed help or needed a cab. Overall it was an extremely positive experience for the whole family.

I stayed at the Park Central for two nights on a business trip in April 2016 and was extremely pleased with the entire experience. I normally stay at a different hotel when in New York but chose the Park Central because of its location. I had stayed at the Park Central once several years ago but from the first moment I entered the lobby I felt like I was in a different hotel.The lobby is very nice and the lobby bar is huge with plenty of places to sit and relax while having conversations in comfortable seating areas. When I opened the door to my room I was amazed at how lovely the refurbished room looked. While I reserved the least expensive room, there was plenty of room for all of my requirements. I had an extremely comfortable king sized bed in my room and a high quality HDTV. The WIFI coverage was great. The room was quiet, and the HVAC was very effective.While small, the bathroom was very nice and had a great shower.The Park Central is perfectly located for someone that likes to walk. I walked to the Lincoln Center, Grand Central Station and walked the Highline to the Whitney Museum of Art and I walked the few blocks to MOMA. I also had an easy walk to my meeting location. I mentioned earlier that I have generally stayed at a different property, but the next time I'm in Midtown I will absolutely return to the Park Central Hotel.

This is a very fine Hotel reservations a must, located near central park, Rockefeller center and the subway so there are many people moving about. Retail stores are near by I did a lot of window shopping during my visit, the room came with high speed wireless access for a extra fee, Refrigerators and coffee makers. I dined at the Redeye Bar & Grill

We chose this hotel because of its location. Carnegie Hall is across the street as is the Carnegie Deli. There are so many close restaurants and Central Park is a short 2 block walk. It is a short taxi ride to Time Square and Broadway.The subway is in the block so you can get anywhere easily . On check in all was well and everyone was most helpful. We had upgraded to a 'premium' room which for NY was most spacious and quiet. Nice view of the apartments and back of the deli. The room seemed musty and unused. It was the shower curtain in the bathroom which was replaced the next day. The bathroom had 2 tiny bars of soap, and sample of body lotion. The other amernies were on the shower wall in pump bottles. Not sure what the reason but it was not possible to get more soap unless there was none in the bath. I have a 'thing ' about plastic glasses and after the first day they were removed and replaced by plastic for the rest of our 10 day stay even when I asked for glass glasses. A nice convenient place to stay. Just bring your own glasses:)

Great Staff housekeeping and maintenance very pleasant, helpful and service-minded! Good room! Only wrinkles: The Internet which I had problems with for abt 2 days. BUT their support service was very good and helped me through it. Reaching the concierge by phone nearly impossible only voice mail and I never got a call back.. But I then went through the front-desk instead. I stay at hotels often and this one is worth the praise.

We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. 5 minutes walk to Central park and 5 minutes to Times Square. The hotel itself is lovely, clean and very professionally run. Check in was slow due to being very busy when we arrived. The receptionists were not friendly or patient but they were efficient- perhaps that's the New York way. The bedroom was lovely with 2 double beds. The bathroom was up to date with a bath and shower and good lighting for doing our make up. Plenty of lovely fluffy towels and face cloths were provided. Our room, 729 overlooked 'the wall' which has been mentioned before. We loved it because it meant we were away from all the NYC traffic noise so we got a good night's sleep in those very comfy beds. It made the room seem dark but there was good lighting so was fine. We asked for coffee and tea making facilities and they were brought to our room within half an hour, free of charge and included loads of coffee, tea, milk, sugar, sweeteners, stirrers and napkins. I went with friends and we all agreed that, if and when we return, we will definitely stay there

My partner and I stayed her for six nights to celebrate my 30th birthday (kindly given a couple of free drinks on arrival by the concierge for this!) and we were both very happy with the hotel.I had read many reviews about the place prior to our visit and had been a bit skeptical, but was happily reassured when we arrived. Check in was quick (we arrived around 8pm), and we had no issues with or long waits for the lifts (room was on the 8th floor). The classic room we had chosen was huge, and the bed was very comfortable! New York City is loud- so don't be surprised if you can hear sirens and traffic outside. This is often the case regardless of what hotel you are in. Toiletries provided were of good quality and the room was spotlessly clean. The hair dryer was excellent too- a big plus for me when european electricals don't work well in the states! Location was ideal. Step outside and you have Central Park 5 minutes to your left and Times Sq 10 minutes to your right. There is also a subway station on the corner and some of the best breakfasts imaginable within a five minute walk too. The only downfall for me were the pillows- big, empty, squashy pillows that give no support, but that seems to be a trend in American hotels! Also, on a few occasions, the housekeeping staff could be heard having very loud conversations in the corridors early in the morning. They were themselves very polite, but it was a bit irritating. However, it was not enough to put me off staying in this hotel, and when I visit NYC again I will definitely look into booking this hotel. Thank you for a very memorable stay :)

We agreed to a certain nightly room rate and at the end of the trip were stuck paying nearly an extra $80/night. Don't believe the advertised room rates. The stick you with $30/night in "facilities" charges which include things like using their printing facilities. We were not made aware of this until we got here. Had we known we would have stayed elsewhere. Completely deceptive practices.

I booked this hotel because of the proximity to sightseeing and the price. Booking online is super easy, choosing the advance purchase non-refundable rate saves a lot of money. I also forgot to add the $1 breakfast, called the hotel and was told I would get a call back. They called me in the morning and were great at adding that to my reservation. This was my first visit to NYC, and had no idea what to expect. I booked a 1 king room and When I arrived I was told that I was "upgraded" to a room with a view but it had 2 queens because there are "no more kings" (but I specifically booked a king)... I had been traveling for over 12 hours already and did not put up a fight. The "view" was of a building next to us... Still I remained positive about the location and kept on. The beds are comfy and clean. My room looked like is had water damage on the floor? Still, I didn't complain. The staff is very nice, the bar/lounge is beautiful, the bartenders are great! Their cocktails are great! The housekeeping is on the ball!! We travel a lot so we appreciate this. The location is unbeatable! You can see Central Park and Times Square when standing outside! You can walk to the Empire State bldg and Rockefeller as well! Over all the experience was great! The $1 breakfast is well worth it! I only give 4/5 because of the fact that I didn't get the room I booked and paid for in advance and the condition of the room. But the staff made up for that!

I loved this hotel! Myself and my friend stayed here in April 2016, having read the reviews I was prepared for an unfriendly and rude check-in, so I couldn't have been more surprised! We were greeted as we walked through the door and directed to the appropriate desk, we arrived around noon and were lucky enough to have a room ready for us. Our room was on the 9th floor - we didn't have too much trouble with the lifts but as there are only two for the 3rd to 9th floors, I understand this could be a nightmare in the busy periods! The room was a great size and we weren't too affected by the noise outside.The only thing that let the hotel down... the shower was terrible! Although, that's the only negative I have!I would definitely recommend and return to the Park Central!

I booked this hotel for a business trip and the location, Redeye Grill and comfortable rooms made this hotel one that I will come back to. The hotel is right across the street from Carnegie Hall and down the street from Central Park and Times Square.

This hotel is excellentExcellent locationIndoor supermarket is greatRooms are large and very cleanClose to restaurants, shops and Times Square Ideal location Close to subwayOpen top bus office nearbyHotel far enough away from the noise and hustle and bustle

Comfortable and big rooms at a hotel which has a great location for being close to Central Park and Times Square. Friendly and helpful staff at all times.If business or leisure, it does not matter at this hotel.

This trip was for my wife's 50th birthday, which I had said I would treat her to a few years ago. I picked the hotel for its location on 7th Avenue, between Central Park and Times Square. My wife isn't a breakfast person, so the fact there's no dining room didn't matter, as there is a small "bakery" in the reception area where you can get a selection of products to start the day if you desire, and loads of "eateries" all around the hotel.No tea/coffee facility in the room which I had checked on prior to going, so we took our own travel kettle etc.

This is truly a four star hotel. From the time I got out the Über to the time I left the experience was awesome. The hotel location is PERFECT, 2-3 blocks from Central Park, 10 minutes from Times Square, near plenty of shopping, near plenty of eateries, near plenty of Walgreens/ CVS if you forgot anything. My family was there for five days, take advantage and request a fridge for water, drinks, etc. it was my wife and I 2nd year anniversary Champign candy and a note was waiting for us in our complementary upgraded room (style/classy) on the hotel staff.

I have just been visiting NY during 1 week and I´m delight with this hotel. The location is fantastic just 5 minutes walking to Times Square and 5th Av. Another thing why I recommend this hotel is because its excellent service. Its customer advisor, Elizabeth Cacovic, did she her best to make our staying unforgettable. Ask for her to get the coolest shops and restaurants in the city. In my back to NY I definitely repeat in this hotel. VictoriaSpain

Located at walking distance from Central Park and Times Square, the 7th avenue is very lively with cafes and pubs nearby. It's also in front of the Carnegie Hall and near the IESE business school. The room was comfortable and well serviced, they change the towels and linen daily.The staff and management is kind and attentive.It has a gym, lounge, etc.The hotel has a no smoking policy, I didn't spot smoking areas.

This ONLY involves my stay most recently, May 2016, which was my fourth time but will certainly be my last. Something's really wrong with this hotel. Maybe it is being sold or closed soon for massive renovation or perhaps it has been abandoned and is being work crewed by inconsiderate former prison wardens. I don't know where to begin so let's start in a room that was filthy with dust, previously used sheets, a bath tub with clots of hair still no the drain, a clock radio that refused to work, no literature on any amenities offered and blocked by cleaning and stocking carts the whole time of my stay and TWO vacuums parked by my room door for the four day stay.The elevator refused to work TWICE. There are banks of elevators that are closed off and the ice machine on my floor NEVER was able to dispense ice.When I complained that I couldn't control the heat or air conditioner a workman came to my room and noted that BOTH were currently turned off since the weather was mild. He suggested I open a window slightly and offered to show me how. When I went to get a cab the doorman pushed me aways saying the cab line was only for guests using the doorman. Let me say this again because it shocks me every time I say it: HE PUSHED ME. When I complained to the front desk they said they were sorry and then immediately turned away.One of the three lights in the room never worked properly. On my final day they just refolded and restocked my used towels. There were no notes in the room to give them permission to conserve and do that. The bed was a King bed with a Queen bottom sheet that never tucked and secured under the mattress. This review might be useless since it is only a matter of time before this over priced hell hole closes down.

I read the reviews and the management responses to people mentioning the hidden fees. They are NOT up front with the $30+ per night "resort fee." I booked using a 3rd party after finding the price to be significantly cheaper than booking direct. I DID check the fine print - all fees and taxes included. Nope! Not the case. I resent this scam and the fact that the hotel charges this to begin with. They justify it by saying it is for luggage storage (additional gratuity expected), the business center, and the workout area. I didn't want or need to use any of these "amenities." Charge a little more if you have to or charge for use of the gym/business center- don't make your guests feel like they have been taken advantage of. With that being said the hotel is very nice. If it weren't for the resort fee I would have rated the Park Central a lot higher. The rooms are spacious and clean but the bathrooms smell moldy (both rooms we had!). That can be easily rectified though as I think the culprit was the shower curtain. Great location- I would stay again if the fees were eliminated. Listen to your guests!

Great location near Central Park, Times Square and many more attractions. The staff were helpful with the exception of the bar staff who were less than helpful. The room was clean. Could have done with kettle in the room to make tea, however when asked the staff gave us a coffee maker.I would definitely stay here again.

My husband booked this hotel because of its location and didn't disappoint. Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, 5th avenue. We had prior requested a fridge due to medical needs, upon entering our room we didn't have one but one arrived within 30 minutes. The lack of no room service wasn't a problem with so many food stores right near us. The front desk staff were sometimes abrupt but still helpful. Would recommend it as a great location hotel

I wish to express how tremendously please I was with Elizabeth, Saleem and Carlene. Excellent service, high level of professionalism and very warmed. The room was very spacious, clean and quite comfortable. Great location and surely one of the best hotel in midtown. Recommend this hotel 100%,

Great location, lovely rooms and very helpful and friendly staff. Only downside, if there was one, is that the bar prices were a bit steep! Best thing is the location of the Hotel is first class, Central Park to your left, Times Square to your right!

Just spent 7 days in this great hotel. Our first time since the remodel and they did a fine job. It's perfectly located, close to Central Park and the Theatre District. We had no problems with check-in and checkout. Room was big... bathroom a bit small, but met our needs. Still a few holdovers from pre-re-model... shower handle fell off... towels were frayed... room keys had to be re-programmed a couple of times... all in all, though, I would give this hotel extremely high marks. Extremely comfortable bed... Beautiful inside and out. (Bar closes at 11:15, even though front desk will tell you midnight)... plenty of other places in NYC to get a late-night drink, however. Stay here. You'll be glad you did.

We stayed at the Park Central Hotel for 4 days. When we first arrived on Thursday night we asked about a room upgrade and staff seemed very moody about it. We didn't get the upgrade. There was no hot water until Friday night and there were only 2 lifts on our side, which were very slow and didn't seem enough to cater for the amount of people. Our room didn't have any complimentary tea/coffee and there was no hotel information provided. The bed was really comfortable and the room was fine for purpose. The hotel is in a really good location near Central Park and Times Square so ideal for sight seeing, but I just felt that for a central hotel it could have been a bit sharper. The hotel looks amazing on the website but not quite the same in reality.

This is a very nice hotel in a great location. This is my second time staying there and I like it because the location is great, close to many things and extremely clean. The biggest problem I see with this hotel is they do not reveal to you that there is a $99.00 charge upon checking out for "resort fees" so to speak. Very disappointing.

Love this hotel. Very accommodating hotel personnel, quick to take care of any needs and I love the location. Close to everything I like about NYC. Away from the madness of Times Square but close enough to walk to the theaters, shopping, Central Park, loads of shopping choices, food choices, you name it, it's within a few blocks.

Spent four nights here and it was the perfect location for our New York adventures. Breakfast was a disappointment (Central Market) but this was the only negative. Rooms and facilities matched the four star rating. It appeared extra effort was made by the room attendants as the rooms were always sparkling.

Great staff! Comfortable room! Beautiful Lounge! Bigger rooms than most city hotels and new, ontmporaey bathroom. Will definitely stay there again. Recommend for anyone visiting NY. May accelerate my next NY trip just to stay at Park Central.

Very nice hotel. We had a room looking out onto Carnegie hall. It was an easy walk to 5th Ave, MOMA, the theaters, and central park. There is a very good little cafe right next to it for breakfast with fresh squeezed OJ.

We stayed there 5 days and absolutely loved our room, the service and the location. You are just far enough away from the Time Square zoo so not to be affected by the massive crowds but you are just a couple blocks away from the heart of it. Don't worry about the small elevator reviews. They are very small but we only had to wait for another elevator to come twice in our 5 day stay. Finally,the service was spectacular, the front desk personal were extremely helpful and accommodating and even the housekeeping staff were friendly and joking with us.

Great location, good for business travel, nicely refurbished rooms and I've got the best rate that I've ever had in NYC for that level of hotel. Didn't use any amenities as I was only there to sleep but was great.

Just back from NY stayed at park central the most comfy beds ever very clean staff lovely i had read a few reviews complaining about wait for elevators we never had this problem we really enjoyed our stay here would have been nice to have had a kettle for a tea in morning but close to lots of cafe shops bars central park 4 minute walk the rock 11 minutes away times square 10 min walk really would book this hotel if i was back in NY thank you park central

Check in is not until 4pm, but check out is not until 12 noon. They were able to get me in a little early. Tip - specifically ask to "pre-register" if you arrive early in the day. You will go on the list for next room available. They will offer to call you when it is ready. Remember: no matter what hotel you visit, it is smart to tip the person at the reception desk (they are able to do more for your hotel experience than any other single person). There is a VERY quick, easy luggage storage room in the main lobby; the staff are very friendly. The "Central Market" is a fast, friendly store in the lobby of the hotel. They have a very good selection of juices, snacks (nuts, snack mixes, etc), yogurts, pastries, coffee and espresso, and some other more substantial offerings. I used this several times - all staff were friendly and helpful. It is expensive, but very convenient. Behind the registration desk is a very large lounge with easy chairs and work surfaces. It looks like it was a ballroom with a very high ceiling, now converted to a lounge during the day and a bar in the evening. There are three computers in the lobby that you may use for free for 15 minute intervals if you need to search for an activity or if you need to print boarding passes. The concierge was also very patient and helpful. The lobby is very beautiful. The rooms are nice - clean, reasonably spacious. The bed is neither too soft nor too hard (I prefer a very hard bed, but was perfectly comfortable on this one). Bed linens are very nice. They provided 4 pillows on the bed, and they varied so that you should find one that is comfortable for you (I may just have been lucky, but I like this feature in a hotel). There is no refrigerator, but there is convenient ice in the hallway. There is a safe in the closet. Bigelow shampoo, conditioner, and body wash were provided. There is a large flat screen TV. Resolution was not great. The selection of movies was great! They have movies that are still in theaters, as well as recent films. They had a "daily special" of 6 or 8 films that were a reduced cost ($6.99). There is a daily "facilities fee" that they add on to your quoted nightly rate; it includes the Wifi. Use their website to book your room. I found out about them thru Jetsetter. However, I had an unexpected trip to NYC and checked the hotel website 2 days ahead of my visit. They noted that they have a matching policy and even though their room rate that night was only $125, they noted that Priceline was offering $120 and that they would match it (Note: I have booked here a number of times over a three month period - the room rates range based upon occupancy rates from a low of $120 to a high of around $300). I was in town to take a class at Alvin Ailey - it is just an 8 minute walk. There is also a Whole Foods that is a 10 minute walk. There is a subway stop beside the hotel. There are also two outside coffee shops immediately beside the hotel: Starbucks and one other. Carnegie Hall is diagonally across the street. Lots happening in the immediate vicinity. I felt safe the entire time.

The Park Central was a wonderful place to stay for my first ever trip to NYC. The employees were all courteous and professional, and helped when needed, and were also 'hands-off' when needed as well, which is a good thing. Very relaxed. Nice room, comfy bed, quiet too. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there, and would go back in a flash.

Firstly the location is excellent for tourists. Central Park is a stones throw away and Times Square just a short 5/10 min walk. There is a subway station right by the entrance and lots of local deli's and diners on hand for breakfast. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times and a free bag check helped for leaving our luggage safe so we could enjoy our last day in NYC. The rooms were very spacious and well maintained. The bed was extremely comfortable, I'd go so far as to say perfect! There was excellent wifi in the rooms and well as an iron and hair dryer for use. I'm only going four stars as a few things let the place down. Firstly the water pressure in the showers. It took me ages to wash shampoo from my hair the pressure was that low. The bathroom set up was way too small. The toilet had clearly been moved as the door was hitting it so now it isn't straight in the room. You have to shimmy In up the side of the loo to close the door behind you. Considering the actual room was so big it surprises me they made the bathroom so small? Finally the lifts! We experienced some huge queues for these. On the 11th floor we one time came out of our room to join a 20man deep line. Every time the lift then did stop on our floor it was already full making us late several times for meeting family in the lobby. These queues were also present when going up, several times we returned to the hotel to be greeted by a 20man (plus luggage) line waiting to go up. Don't get my wrong though overall I think this hotel is great and I'm not one to let the smaller issues spoil my stay. I would definitely recommend to fellow travellers.

What a great Hotel. We've stayed in many in New York. This had the biggest room, by far. Immaculate ! New bathroom. Friendly staff.Perfect location.Valet Parking. Right next door to Starbucks.Who could ask for more?

Stayed in a regular room with king sized bed with husband and daughter. Super tight squeeze in the hallway. There was actual walking/living space on one side of the bed which is pretty rare for regular rooms in NYC. Hotel is in an excellent location. Modern, clean. Great tv options. Good wi fi. The major cons: -The bathroom door scraped by the toilet every time you opened/closed it. As in- full on touching the toilet seat. - So loud!!!! You could hear the plumbing or the a/c all day and night! Great if you love white noise, but not what I had in mind.....

Great location for tourists as it is located approximately 7-10 minutes from Times Square and 5 minutes from Central Park. Right next door is a subway station and close to lots of places to eat. The hotel itself is nice and clean and wifi works well. Had no problems at all with a fast check in and check out. All the staff were friendly and great to deal with. I would definitely have no hesitation staying there again.

Park Central represents a good hotel in a great location. Just a couple of blocks from Central Park and Times Square, you'll also have easy access to bus routes and mass transit to get anywhere in Manhattan. Our rooms were a bit small, but keep in mind the building is older. But the rooms were well-furnished and we had no complaints. The staff were most helpful for any needs we had.

Very clean, very pleasant. The bar is great with many great cocktails on the menu.Staff seemed very friendly however when I asked for two wine glasses to take up to the room all hell seemed to break loose. I did manage to get some after asking 4 different people and a wait about 15 minutes.Other then that I would recommend this hotel. It is in a great location, minutes away from Central Park and Times Square. WiFi seemed OK too.

This hotel is right in midtown close to Central Park, Lincoln Center, Rockefeller Center and Times Square. Great, clean rooms (a little on the small side) and comfortable beds. Staff was friendly and helpful.Nice lounge.

Just outside of our fantastic hotel we can see the wonderful ball drop without standing in the crowd for hours. It's a excellent place to stay for a family holiday because it is placed in a fantastic location. The service of this hotel was really friendly.

We visited the Park Central for a mini-break this week, and it's fair to say we were somewhat underwhelmed. Having travelled extensively in the USA, we have come to expect a certain standard from 4* hotels that just isn't achieved at the Park Central. Whilst it's location is great, we were really shocked by how standoffish and rude the female reception desk staff were. Basic questions seemed like too big an ask for them, and it made us feel reluctant to ask for any tourist advice. Further, the lift system was utterly ridiculous. It's a massive hotel, and returning in the evenings became such a chore, as we would stand waiting for the elevator for ages due to the limited number of lifts available, and the large volume of guests. Even when we got to our floor, we had to do a full circuit of the hotel from the elevator to our room, which seems rather silly when guests generally have luggage and /or shopping bags. Our room looked pleasant enough, but on the first night smelt like wet dog due to damp laundering (I think the towels were the offending items). Whilst the room was relatively clean, the bathroom was small and never felt as clean as we would have liked. There was no mini-bar which was a bit inconvenient, and no hotel information provided. The air con was also hit and miss. The hotel bar was fairly good - the prosecco cocktail is worth a try, as is the red velvet cheesecake from the on-site bakery. The guys on the main door are lovely, and could certainly teach the receptionists a thing or two. Whilst our overall experience was okay, we certainly wouldn't choose to stay at the hotel again.

What a fantastic location this hotel is located on 57th and 7th Street midtown New York. Walking distance to all the sights 10 minutes to time square 15 minutes to Empire state building, Madison Square Garden. The hotel was lovely good size room, cafe in the lobby. Starbucks out front and untold food place's to choose from. Happy Hour in the hotel lobby bar from 5pm to 7pm. Nancy the waiter is fabulous ask her for some tips on where to eat in midtown. Comments below re: elevators & room keys no problems they must have fixed them.

Hi, due to our horrible experience on our first night st the excelsior, me and my daughter needed to change hotels, and as our virgin rep could it place us any where ,I paid extra to stay here for two nights, we did in New York initially till Saturday 9th April. But because of the other hotel issues my backs started to hurt therefore makingHarder to stay the whole time. It's was funny because I would have booked at the park central at first, having stayed here five years ago, but thought the excelsior looked nice, I hadn't realised that the park central had undergone changes,.So first thing Tuesday I went to the park central just to have s a look around, and my daughter liked it, so I spoke to one of the staff who s name was alvin, I explained my predicament and he called his manager. Elvirus. I then went on to book a room for one night at 180 + various taxes, whilst virgin rep where trying to relocate me, and because of my back pain I decided to bring my holiday back to Thursday , leaving earlier.So in the end me and my daughter spent three days in New York, two nights at the park central.We loved the new. Bar area they built, with nice seating and lighting.We booked in to a double twin room on the west side level 10' room 1064. The lift was running fine, two at a time, but there were four. You had to use your room key to activate the lift, for safety reasons, but after a day we had trouble with our key, it wasn't working so locked out of our room and had to track down a housekeeper for help, went to front desk and they promptly changed the key for us.Our beds were just like last time, comfortable , they didn't have duvets on the beds just sheets, but that was ok our air con. And thermostat worked much better, we could Control the heating adjustment easily, the heating didn't blow cold air random like the excelsior did. We kept the heating setting on a comfortable 22 degrees, you still hear the noise of the fan even at low fan setting, but that was ok.Last time ther was a case of bed bugs, so I was bit wary of this, but we see ok,p.I liked the colour of the room and layout. The bathroom was clean, only thing was that the toilet was quite close to the bath, and once you sat down you had to turn around to get toilet paper off the roll, as it was behind you, which wasn't easy with my backache.No fridge or tea making facilities in room either. But the big screen tele was nice,Made came every morning and made the bed etc.I paid 600 dollars for two nights, but did get. 114 dollars deposit back,.I know it's expensive 180 per day plus the extra amenities , various taxes and fees all add up. Other hotels include the various city tax in their price, but this still charges on top. We had a pleasent experience here, with all staff that we spoke too. Thank to ELvirALvin and Soku. For their help in relocating us.If we come here we will stay here again.We like visiting New York, and next time not going to mess around with hotels ,even though this is expensive, I'll stay here.Just one thing, I was told upon pre ordering a black taxi from the hotel that it would be flat charge of. 65 .dollars, for airport drop, plus tip. But when we got to the airport the driver told us it was 83 dollRs. In didn't really query it, because it took us one and half hours to get to JFK because of the traffics.And noticed that our carpet in the room near the edges of the walks was a bit dusty,

Stayed there from Saturday April 2nd to Tuesday April 5th. One of the very few hotels that has a parking package where you can valet your car for 10 dollars a night (no in and out privileges though but shouldn't be a problem for many). Room is very modern and has nice views. I would recommend it for sure as the price is great and location is excellent as it's between central park and times square.

the plus points are the room size and location. the downsides are the staff behind reception (not the doormen who were great). I know New Yorkers like to portray an attitude but in a hotel I expect a bit more than people just grunting at you as you hand over money! The other negative was we had a twin room and realised at 11pm one of the beds only had a sheet and not a duvet! When I went to reception to complain no one took control and I had to wait 30 minutes for someone to bring me a duvet (without a cover!). Because our daughter was in bed I requested it be bought to me in reception but told that couldn't be done so I had to wait in the hallway whilst they tracked down a duvet!? Wouldn't stay again.

First time in New York and chose this hotel mainly for location between Central Park and Times Square. I can't fault it - bedroom was really good size, beautiful bathroom and lots of little extras. We were on 7th floor, served by 2 lifts and never had to wait more than 30 seconds. Our room was at the back so no nice view but also no traffic noise. A bit of noise from the generators outside but it was easy to just tune it out. Some reviews state the opposite of this but it's as if they are about an entirely different hotel. We are already planning our next visit as couldn't fit in everything we wanted to do. Will be rebooking this hotel.

We loved the location & thought our superior room was very spacious and well appointed. The room was kept well during our 1 week stay. The wifi was the best I've had in a hotel.We were only disappointed that the lift service is so poor because only two lifts service each floor, and we often waited more than 5 minutes, and at worst 8 minutes for a lift.We also found the door between adjoining rooms let too much sound in from our neighbors. It was a problem only one night when our neighbors were noisy late at night, otherwise it was just annoying.Overall we would stay there again, because it is a nice hotel, the staff are generally good, and the location outweighs the bad points.

I have been coming to this hotel since the early 90's. We have seen several upgrades and remodeling jobs through the years since and this time it seems like the best renovation was done. It is tastefully redone with a soothing palette and the different hotel spaces seem configured in a way that makes more room and sense. The room we got was nice with ample space for my family of 4. True to the pictures shown here on this site and the hotels' own website. We stayed in a deluxe two queen room. Beds were comfortable and had enough drawer space for us. The bathroom was such an upgrade for what we had experienced in the past. Housekeeping kept it very clean and towels were small but absorbent. I really loved the extra space provided with the shelf under the vanity and the curved curtain rod in the shower, which thankfully has become customary at most hotels. Wish the bathrooms were outfitted with a fan.We did have trouble with the temperature in our room though. After speaking with guest relations, who were trying to accommodate us, we learned there was nothing they could do. Albeit a brand new remodeling job, the a/c remains with the original system where only heater will work when it's cold outside and only the a/c will work when it's hot. Makes sense, except we are used to sleeping in a cold room and so could not get benefit of the a/c. Thankfully we were able to turn off the heater with the thermostat in the room because it kept kicking on. Even without the heater on, the room was incredibly warm and stuffy. We took advantage of the cold weather outside by cracking the window a little open when we were in the room, even while we slept. So we were comfortable in the end. Each night we enjoyed the bar at the hotel which is nicely hidden behind the reception desk. All the bartenders were great. We were given 2 complimentary drinks the first night for the adults, by the person who took care of us at check in /reception, she was friendly and professional. Wish I remembered her name, but she was working 3/17th when we checked in around 10pm. At the suggestion of the hotel, we also dined at the Redeye Grill, who treated us very well and everything we ordered was delicious! The restaurant is at the corner of the hotel, on 56th street.We stopped coming here a few years ago because although we were patient with the remodeling going on through the years, management didn't seem to really address certain concerns that could be helped or seem sympathetic to them. Attempts at the time were not made by different staff members to address one major problem that we had on our last visit with smoking in the room next to us. Simply we had to live with the way things were which agitated our child's asthma. It was not only us but seemed like many guests were unhappy with how different things were handled and how many of the hotel personnel seemed unhappy with their jobs and unfriendly overall. A very big difference now with all of it.So with the remodeling done, we gave it another try and hoped personnel had changed out or changed its ways. We were happy we did a second chance and look forward to our next stay.

I had an absolutely amazing experience at Park Central. We were a family of 4 with a late check in. Everyone from the parking attendant, bell hop, check in/out and rooms were over-the-top. The rooms provide all the essentials you would need, it was extremely clean and the most comfortable bedding/pillows I have ever had in my life and I do a tremendous amount of traveling.I definite recommend Park Central, it is convenient to restaurants, shopping and close walk to the theatre district.I would definitely recommend Park Central for a 5 star experience!

The lady on check in was totally rude and unhelpful after travelling from the UK for more than 14hrs the lady on Check in was really rude and unhelpful - we were given a upgraded room for an extra $57 per night the room was tiny and no way an upgrade total rip off!!! Best thing about this hotel is he location.

Hotel Room Key had to be reset on multiple occasions creating an inconveniences. There were only 2 elevators which created long waits due to the large crowds and multiple floors. No Hot Water on the last day of our stay creating frustration when trying to get a later checkout to see if we could shower before departing. Later checkout was denied. Room Service did not happen until late into the evening on 2 occasions causing us to wait in the lobby while they completed. This is a great location and the rooms and hotel are nice but the inconveniences will prevent me from booking here again.

I just spent 3 nights at this place. Never again. The most unfriendly staff I have found (even for NY standards!). The people that work at the front desk could easily be working as bouncers at any nightclub!No mini bar, no room service... You couldn't use the elevators of the hotel because it was like a summer camp!I travel to NY at least 8 times a year. Never again to this place.

Orginally from New York City, now residing in Florida, the highest compliment I can pay this hotel is that when I go home I have an abundance of offers to stay with family. I opt out & head to my favorite hotel in the City, The Park Central.

Good: the rooms were lovely, drinks were good, reception and guest services were nice, Starbucks is next door, great location for New York, AUX cable with alarm clockBad: room key had to be reset daily, only 2 elevators work for the entire hotel, the phone in all of our rooms didn't work, the floors are very confusing, at the store in the lobby a bottle of water is $6.53!!!! A can of coke is $2.70!!

Amazing staying at the park central hotel! Sister and I had a wonderful time! Everything is very close to the hotel. 5 minutes away from Central Park! 10 minutes away from Times Square..highly recommended if! ....................................

We were very satisfied. Slept on 9th floor. Backview, but not important to us. Bed's were good, bathroom clean, good shower. No street noise. 1$ breakfast gave donut, coffee and fruit. You can eat it in the lounge. 2 blocks from central park and straight view on Times square. We got free wi-fi.

Stayed here with some girlfriends for a 3 day trip. Pros: Near 5th ave, Central Park, and time square. We didn't have a problem walking to any of those locations. Affordable.Big rooms and large mirrors. Very spacious for three ladies with plenty of mirror space. Cons: Slow elevators Unnecessary "resort" fee.

I decided to treat my husband to a weekend in NYC for his birthday. I made reservations at The Park Central and dinner reservations for that night. We stay in NYC often but have never stayed at The Park Central so I checked the reviews first. We went with our 2 children, 9 and 15. I usually try to find rooms that offer space, more on that later. We checked in and went to our room, 608. The room itself was filthy, pics are shown. The window covering is just a plastic shade, ours had a cut through it which was clearly not going to block out any light. The bathroom door did not fit into the door frame and wouldn't stay closed. I called the front desk and they said someone from housekeeping would come up to fix the problems. After waiting a while we called down and said someone would have to fix them while we were out. We came back 2.5 hours later to find that nothing was done. We called the front desk and told them we needed to start getting ready for dinner. An engineer came up, looked at the door first and told us that the doors "don't lock for safety reasons." Then he told us that it was the contractors fault for using the wrong size door and he couldn't fix it. He went to look at the shade while I called the front desk to tell them we weren't going to stay in a room without a bathroom door that closed. My husband asked him to speak to the front desk to tell them the problem and he dashed out of the room. The front desk said that they would called us back but we told them we would be in the lobby with our luggage so they could switch our room because it was now getting getting close to our dinner reservation and we still hadn't showered. The guest relations manager in the lobby said the hotel was full. I insisted they find a different hotel for us to stay in. They said since we booked with Expedia, they had no responsibility-however I paid the hotel directly, so they are responsible.
