I did call Expedia to complain and they offered to try to find us another room in another hotel. (While I was talking to Expedia The Park Central said the engineer would go back and fix the room. My husband went back to the room, no one ever went back, it remained empty.) While Expedia was looking for a hotel the guest relations manager told us that someone canceled their room and we could switch rooms. Because we needed to get ready right now we took the room, how could it be worse? This new room was right across from the elevator and guess what else we found out about the Park Central the windows of the hotel are not soundproof! That's right-you can every little noise outside your window all night long. Every honk, every conversation, every car backfiring-every single noise. Not to mention the elevator dinging and the conversations of the people coming in and out of the elevator all night. Our family got no sleep at all! Here are other things that stink about this hotel: the elevators: tiny and slow-you can easily wait 10 minutes for an elevator. The phone system: to reach the front desk you push zero wait through a whole message of how you have to push another number to reach the front desk. They have no doormen (the doors are automatic) or security in the lobby so people who are not guests feel free to sit in the lobby all over the couches and chairs. Their rooms could not be cheesier: the light bulb in the bathroom was buzzing and blinking with that old timey fluorescent thing. There's no robes, mini bar, fridge, curtains. It's the most very basic of basic hotel rooms, but they charge a mid range fee (plus a $30 facility fee). Here are 3 hotels that are way nicer that we have stayed at that are: roomier, nicer, cleaner, have much better teams and are in the same price range: The Benjamin (this an all suite), The Trump Soho (look for discounts, they are out there) and The Eventi.

The location of this hotel, a few blocks from the south end of Central Park, is excellent. And it certainly was handy for the concert our choir performed at Carnegie Hall, just around the corner. But I have mixed feelings about a hotel that in many ways is otherwise superior. For all its high-tech furnishings, like a desk with multiple electrical outlets on top, it is strangely lacking in a few things - no coffee maker, only one chair for us as a couple, thin windows that let in all the noise that is New York. Plus a nail, or something sharp, sticking out of the carpet at the closet door which was promptly fixed.I had to wear earplugs one night when noises of construction, or what sounded like construction, people shouting, banging, etc. could have made sleep impossible. This at around midnight and later. Earplugs saved the day!The concierge we dealt with seemed to be going through the motions, little enthusiasm, no smiles, nothing. This is a pricey hotel, but it's the little things that matter.

Well upon reading other reviews we pick this hotel, it is close to a lot of things to see and do, and close to our son's apartment and work. Arriving on a Thursday late....7;30 pm our car was stuck in traffic for an hour and a half, the lobby was filled with teenage kids making all kinds of noise and everyone??? told us we would not be anywhere near their rooms....the were right across the hall from us. We spent a lot of money on a suite for some privacy, this was not the case!!! No coffee maker in the room had to go down to their in house cafe to buy ANYTHING and EVERYTHING. Not even a Advil or toothpaste offered anywhere. NO room service, no restaurant on the property and the front desk personal where very unhelpful. We called for additional blankets and waited for an hour and my husband finally had to go down to get them himself and then had to take them off a housekeeping cart he found in a hallway !!! The bar closed at 11:00 pm and did NOT offer any snacks of any kind. Not a happy couple. Will not re-visit this Hotel

We come to Manhattan around 10 times per year and have stayed at quite a few of the four and five stars there. This hotel is our favorite. From check in to check out we are always happy and comfortable. The location is superb, rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff at the front desk don't have that typical snooty attitude we've come to know. Across the street is the Park Cafe where you'll find excellent pancakes and a few feet from the hotel lobby is a Starbucks if you don't have your own small coffee maker (which we do). The down side is no coffee maker in the room but you can ask for a fridge, extra towels or pillows and service for this is the fastest in New York. The internet is awesome and you don't have to keep logging in every time you sleep your device.

If you have never travelled to NYC be prepared for high hotel prices and small rooms. We found this at Park Central. Despite that, this is a very good hotel. First the good: We were greeted by several very friendly front desk people. We also received a warm greeting from our housekeeper! Our room was tastefully decorated in a modern style. This is included the bathroom as well. If you are looking for a great location, this is a great hotel for you. The hotel is very close to: Carnegie Hall, Central Park, Times Square, Rockefellar Plaza, Museum of Modern Art, and much more. The bed was quite comfortable and the shower was adequate. The bad: the room was small and the bathroom was tiny. The sink was so small we couldn't fit our toiletries on it. This might be good or bad, but there was a print of a woman's face over the toilet. Some might find it creepy, others erotic. The TV was a very nice, large Samsung. Sadly, their system was awful. There was no channel guide in the room, or on-screen. There were limited channels, with no info as to what program you were watching. On the other hand, if you come to NYC to watch TV, there's something wrong. There was one weak moment for their staff. I had a question for the one person at the front desk and he wouldn't answer it or speak to the others who were waiting. He said he was off duty and left the front desk unattended. At ll other times the staff here was very attentive. Overall, we had a good stay and I recommend this hotel, especially due to it's excellent location.

I had a large group staying at the Park for several nights in March and was amazed how poorly thew operation is run.On checking in several of our partys rooms were said to be ready - only for our group to find that they havent even been cleaned from the earlier guests.Communication and attitude at the front desk was most of the time terse and irritated.The management just doesnt seem to have a clue what is going on in the hotel in terms of service or managing the day to day operations.Don't bring your business here there are som many more establishments to choose from that actually care about their guests and who actually can run a hotel.

Park Central's location was great. The trip was almost a disaster at check in when the front desk staff - one young lady - a tall Latina never once engaged us. She was dismissive and barely answered any questions. After check-in I went over to the Guest Relations desk to make enquiries that had not been addressed by the impolite young lady. The manager on duty - Mr Beaubrun, made up for all the sins she had committed.He was responsive, pleasant and superbly professional and as a result of this, we pledged to return to the hotel.The room was very comfortable and the beds were a dream to sleep on.

I visited here with my boyfriend for my birthday. I booked it through booking.com which was a very bad move.. The payment for the room was taken out in multiple instalments on the same day which meant I got charged by my bank multiple times for a non Stirling transaction fee! When I spoke to the hotel they said it's not their fault as booking.com to get the best rates had made multiple bookings.. But I was not informed of this and when I spoke to booking.com they said it was not the case. We got here very late after a long days travelling to then be told because it was under multiple bookings, every day I would need to check out and check back in again and authorise a credit card which was absolutely ridiculous! I told them how inconvenient it is (reception gets extremely busy and often has huge queues as well) and eventually they said they'd do it all in one, however, I still had to fill out multiple forms which were exactly the same but for each check in date!! The only issue was constantly being logged off of the wifi and having to sign up again every time. The hotel room was very nice and clean, but it was impossible to get a good nights sleep, noise from both inside and outside the hotel kept me awake every night. I suppose you should expect this being so close to Times Sq, but I was woken up on numerous occasions with people outside holding down their horns in the middle of the night, or other guests deciding to have a 2am extensive chat outside my room. If I were to go to New York again I think I'd stay a bit further out, previously we stayed in TriBeCa and it was a lot more relaxed and I actually got some sleep. Plus there isn't enough lifts so every time we wanted to get up or come down (8th floor) we had to queue.

Great location, just 2 blocks from Central Park, and great for mid-town shopping. Good subway links too. Large clean rooms, however, no fridges or coffee making machines. The AC was very noisy, but without it, the room became a furnace. No restaurant or room service. Just the ridiculously expensive "Central Market" store in the lobby, which never really opened according to the advertised times. The bar was a nice area, with very good staff, but again, over priced. My biggest complaint about the hotel would be the exceptionally awful elevators. It would not be unusual to wait over 10 minutes. The key-cards were also really poor - I must have had about 25 replacements in an 11 night stay.

The Park Central Hotel is in a very convenient location if your plans center around Central Park, 5th Avenue and/or Times Square - it just takes a few minutes to walk to either location. Though this was my first time at the hotel, I could tell the hotel has been newly redecorated. Lobby is open and clean, valet was very responsive and quick, there is a well stocked mini market inside to the left of the lobby. The interior lobby/cocktail space is beautiful with many spots for groups to gather comfortable on the mix of couches, chairs, and booths. The rooms have comfortable beds and crisp white linens and high end Bigalow shampoo/conditioner/lotions. It would be nice to have a more powerful fan in the bathroom and a mini fridge - I usually have a bottle of water I would rather have in a fridge. Busy place and we enjoyed our stay.

Great stay. Nice clean hotel with a fantastic central location. Rooms were nice and beds comfortable. However, the duvet cover has no buttons and so the duvet was easily exposed and this grossed me out, although it was perfectly clean. i think this could be improved. The lady on evening reception could be more helpful, I asked about an issue with our booking and was treated as a hinderance, poor attitude and lack of customer service. All other staff I encountered were friendly and accomodating. I would definitely stay again if visiting NYC.

I had previously stayed at this hotel in October and had nothing but an excellent time and service. This past trip overall was good, but I did run into just a few little snafus. I stayed March 19-26. Booked a 2 queen bed room, through a 3rd party site well back in October. My mother and I arrived at about 5 or 6pm. And when we got to the desk the woman informed us that they "no longer had 2 queen beds available" Only "king size bed" rooms left. I was pretty mad because I specifically book two beds when I travel because I don't like to share beds with people. I have had multiple back surgeries in the past I am more comfortable sleeping alone. I just think it's stupid to force guests to share the same bed and just assume that because I am traveling with my mother we will say yes. Well No. The way I see it is: would they have forced two business professionals to share the same bed too? Doubtful.So we complained and oh magically a room was available... interesting. The front desk woman did not seem pleased. She seemed rather annoyed. I understand (having a friend that works in hospitality) that booking through a 3rd party kind of screws the hotel, but regardless it still gives you business, and it brings repeat guests back. That is why I booked again after my stay back in October. For the inconvenience they provided us with a 2 free drink card. If you're high maintenence, I wouldn't suggest staying here. I'm very low key and low maintenance but my mother isn't. Room service is only at certain hours, the elevators take forever, and the amenities are rather limited. We slept in one morning and called housekeeping when we were leaving for the day so when we got back the room would be clean but when we got back it wasn't. My mom called housekeeping and asked for extra towels and for someone to clean the room they said someone would be up to do that. We received the towels and asked if someone was going to clean the room too and the man said he thinks so. So my mom called back and housekeeping forgot that part of the conversation I guess, so then they came up. Personally I don't care if my room is cleaned every single day, one day without it isn't going to kill you, but my mom is different as I mentioned early. So she complained and we received 2 more free drink tickets. Putting those drink tickets to use in the bar and lounge area, and being a guest for a week, I had the pleasure of meeting and getting to know the bartender Jamaal. He was so kind and wonderful! He made our stay even better! They better keep him around. Overall the stay was good, not as good as my first stay at this hotel but honestly they do what they can, plus you can't beat the location and price. I am sure I will be a repeat guest again at some point, as I travel to NY every so often.

We stayed two nights at this centrally located hotel. It was modern and clean but with a minimum of amenities. We were upgraded to a higher floor room which was quieter at night. There was no coffee maker, refrigerator or microwave in the room. The lighting in the bathroom was extremely poor. We had no trouble with the elevators as others have mentioned. There was a small Starbucks in the lobby open during the day and a bar open in the evening behind the lobby but no where else to eat in the hotel. Fortunately the area has a multitude of bars and restaurants. The service staff seem friendly. Beware of the additional "resort fee" which runs about $27 a day.

Spent two nights at this hotel in early March. This is a very clean and comfortable hotel and the service was very good. Most importantly it is ideally located just a few blocks from both Time Square and Central Park. Everything we wanted to see was within reasonable walking distance. Overall a comfortable and reasonably priced hotel in a great location.

This hotel is really well located and have the nicest staff I've ever met in any hotel in New York City.If you have the chance you should try the restaurant behind the concierge, named Park Kitchen it's a American contemporary food restaurant with really nice food, and oasis in Manhattan.Rooms have plenty of space and bed are the best. Everything looks like new.I'm definitely book my next visit to the city here.

Not only is the an affordable high class establishment, it is so close to almost everything a tourist wants to see. A short walk from Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Times Square/Broadway and Rockefeller Center. I felt proud walking through the doors every time I came back.

Great hotel in best location. Room was very huge for New York. Check in very quick, lady at reception helpfull and pleasant. Nearby a lot of tasty restaurants, starbucks at the corner of the building. Nearest underground station in 10 walking seconds. Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller center, some broadway theaters and lot more in walking distance.

I stayed in the Park Central Hotel during a weekend in March. Staff were courteous and the room was immaculate and roomy, easily and comfortably accommodating myself and my two daughters. The location was ideal for our weekend plans of visiting the Russian Tea Room (spitting distance away from the hotel) and attending a Broadway show (a seven minute walk through bustling, vibrant New York street scenes). We walked to nearly all of our destinations -- Central Park and Times Square are within a stone's throw. When we needed to take public transport, the subway was within a block of the hotel. The room rate was extremely reasonable for such a centrally located hotel. My only (minor) complaint the weekend we visited is the dearth of elevators in the hotel. We did have to wait for a few minutes for most trips up to our room on the 9th floor, and back down to the lobby. All in all, I am so glad I found this hotel; it will be my go-to destination whenever I travel to New York.

Lovely hotel & rooms. However the staff were extremely rude and condescending. A mix up with our bill at the end of our stay left us very upset, staff were unwilling to help for some time. I could not recommend this hotel, purely because of the staff.

i stayed in this hotel for four days .it was very clean they also have free internet wich helped alot the hotels location is great central park on one side and on the other times square .the hotel was close to everything loved it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

My room was quiet and clean and the hotel was in the best location I can imagine. It was a block from Central Park, close to so many restaurants that I would have to come back just to enjoy the amazing food again. Theatres were walking distance away, and so was shopping. 5th Avenue shopping was only 2 blocks away and Times Square was a couple blocks away also. I had the best time of my life, thanks to the concierge and the helpful staff at the hotel. I travel frequently and have stayed at many places, but the Park Central Hotel has been the best overall experience so far....location, location, location!

Having been an assistant manager at a hotel, I understand some of the challenges that go along with running such an establishment. Yet, I have no choice but to share the miserable start to our seven day vacation in New York. Early check-in. Hotels cannot guarantee this and I was given the normal disclaimer after calling to request. We arrived about 10am off our red-eye flight and told the room wasn't ready. This was understandable as it wasn't even checkout. However, here is where we lose any feeling of being valued as a customer. We were instructed to come back at 1pm. Upon doing so, we were updated the rooms weren't quite ready and try again in 30 minutes. This continued for three hours while we wasted the day in the lobby. One room opened up about 4:15, while the other wouldn't be ready until 7-8pm.The uninterested desk clerk indicated multiple schools were checking in and had a contract, so we would have to wait until after. I'm pretty sure my prepaying $4000 entered us in a contract, where my room was to be ready at 4. Again, some empathy or offer to contact us instead of standing around aimlessly could have helped. So now going on 36 hours without sleep, without room, and without any apology from the staff...What to do? We try getting on the Internet to distract from the #&*@ty service. After many unsuccessful attempts, called for help - the Internet is down. Just like my expectations for this hotel. I will update this at the end of my stay in hopes that this hotel makes some effort to rectify the worst possible start to my families spring break. But I am pessimistic and recommend you look into the multitude of other, similar rated hotels right next door.

Travelled to New York and stayed in Park Central Hotel New York is still one of the finest hotels I have stayed in.It is in a perfect location on 7th Avenue for you to get to pretty much anywhere as a tourist, it really is worth paying the extra to stay on 7th avenue. it is just a few blocks south of central park and about 6 blocks or so from the centre of Times Square.Rooms are very well kept, very spacious and have a good selection of TV channels to kick back your feet and watch for a nice relaxing evening before bed. Service is fantastic too. Even booked us a stretch limousine for our ride to the airport after we checked out!

$60 Facilities Fee per Night (Hidden Charge so they can advertise lower prices)I checked out on 3/5/16, I left some clothes I wearing the night before in my room hanging in the closet. I went back to look for them an hour later but the room had been cleaned and there was nothing in the lost and found. So to my determination they were either 1) Sold on e-Bay2) Given to a family member3) Thrown in the trashAll of which are unacceptable. This place is a sham, do not get sucked into it.

Great location but not too clean,I have found a wig on the floor Close to the safe deposit box,took it to reception but no apologies offer at all,it seemed normal to them.Extremely slow lifts,room keys never work.Not good,very average.

This hotel is a great location for your stay in New York City. A few blocks north is Central Park and a few blocks south is Time Square. The rooms are clean & the beds are comfortable. To get a real sense of the city, leave your bedroom window open a bit at night.

Beautiful room...much larger than some of the postage stamps we've stayed in on other occasions. Lots of windows and, no street noise...at all! Super clean room, bathroom good size and a great shower. The lounge area is spacious and comfortable and the little market in the lobby was a great place to grab a coffee and a munch as we headed out. We chose this hotel because of it's proximity to Carnegie Hall (right across the street) where we got to see/hear a dear friend's son play with his high school band. How special was that. As others have mentioned an easy walk to Broadway theatres and there are unlimited restaurant choices in every direction.

The hotel is located just a couple of blocks from Central Park and near Times Square, great spot between both places. Service was top notch and the room was cozy and clean. I'll definitely go back any time I'm visiting NYC. Extra points for the friendliness and service of the staff. My first visit to NYC was enhanced by that. We used taxis all the time, but the subway is pretty close.

The hotel is located a few blocks away from Time Square. Walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller, Time Square, and Broadway. The staff could be a little more friendly. The room was comfortable. The only thing that bothered me about the room was the short shower curtains. Water could easily get onto the floor.

I like the location. Just a block from all the subway lines and a few blocks from Central Park. It's far enough away from Times Square to be away from the havoc. The hotel has a nice lobby. Rooms are average. Typical small NYC rooms. Nothing special. Clean and accommodating. Staff was nice. We are used to more upscale hotels, but it's hard to beat the value here with the kids. I think most travelers will find this a good value.

The Park Central Hotel was perfect for our visit to New York City! The location is convenient to Central Park and Time Square. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are nice and the beds were very comfortable. And the subway access is nearby. We hope to return in the fall!

Midway between Central Park and Times Square, this hotel was perfect for a one night layover. Plenty of hot water, great bed, and the only place I've stayed that has bigger TV sets was San Jose. The staff, WITH THE NOTABLE EXCEPTION OF THE DESK PERSONS, we're quite professional. Set us with a super car service to get back to the airport.

Great location, friendly staff and management, convenient and central to many locations we visited. Room was clean, modern and comfortable. Never had any issues with housekeeping as they always left everything fully replenished.

This was one of few hotels that have two queen beds in a room which we needed with our kids. The location is fantastic. Right between Central Park and Times Square. There is a subway station within metres of the hotel. There are plenty of cafes nearby but they are very expensive. We found a supermarket in the next cross street where we could get meals reasonably. We walked to the Museum of Natural History, the MET, 5th avenue, the ESB and the Rockerfellar Centre. We caught the subway down to the financial district. The hotel is clean and comfortable but the service was a little cold.

Booked via Hotels.com. Received email from the hotel a few days before informing me of mandatory US$40 "facility fee". This was a surprise to me. For an additional $40 I could have found a nicer hotel. The front desk later refused to arrange a morning cab to the airport but instead offered me the hotel car service for a price that exceeded the cost of a cab by about 50%. At the time of writing, I have had three interactions with front desk staff, each one ruder than the other. Terrible attitude. Room is OK.

It was my second time stayed at this hotel because it is dificult to find a hotel roomy and clean and this hotel is perfect if you have kids. Big beds and nice bathroom. The staff was friendly and helpfull. I just recommend to request for room higher floor because the street noise.

Great location between Time Square and Central Park. Less than a 5 minute walk to Time Square. Great pricing. Staff was superb. Rooms were spacious, clean, and updated. Overall a great experience. I would highly recommend this hotel, and we would stay here again.

A nice hotel, room was very clean and adequate for a one night stay over.Carolyn assisted us with check-in. A very pleasant and warm lady, upgraded us to have coffee and pastries for morning breakfast.A great location, near Central Park and Times Square, Theaters etc. Great eateries from a tasty snack to wonderful fine dining.Porters very polite and accommodating.Overall a very nice stay, thank you

Immediately upon my arrival I was treated like VIP. Never had to lift a finger with any of my luggage. The front desk was outstanding; very courteous, professional and most of all accommodating with ease! Get this. Extremely tired, I arrived much earlier than check in and my reserved room wasn't ready (of course), so not to keep me waiting Carolyn (@ the front desk) went straight into action mode, found an available room right away before I passed out (Thanx again Carolyn). And to my surprise it also was an upgrade!! Wait a minute now it didn't stop there. I get to my floor and was warmly greeted by the housekeeping attendant for my room, Marissa (the best by far). She worked hard but effortlessly along with the rest of the team making those 2 weeks too comfortable. And if you are wondering, Park Central Hotel is a Beautifully Tasteful Top Notch Digs nestled in the heart of the city!!! You are looking for this treasure...

My husband, two sons and their wives spent 5 days at the Park Central Hotel, and we all had a great break in NYC. The hotel was very appealing when we first entered the lobby, the service at the front desk was really quick. Our rooms were on the seventh floor, and our room was a great size, we were lucky enough to have a full sized fridge in our room, which was very handy for keeping our water and cold drinks cool.The room was spotless, the beds were very comfy, and we had a great sleep. The bathroom was very well equipped, and we had fresh towel very day.All the staff that we had contact with were friendly and helpful, I would definitely recommend this hotel for your stay in NY.

New York hotels are often miles from anywhere, with tiny rooms barely bigger than the bed. So, it was marvelous to see that the Park Central is brilliantly located opposite the Carnegie Hall, five mins from Central Park and two mins from the subway. The rooms are huge, big beds and big tv, great bathroom.Where it falls down is the lack of amenities for its customer base - it has a shop to buy coffee and snacks, which shuts at 9pm, it has a bar that opens at 5. There's no food provision, and they compensate for this by allowing the guests to do anything - so a lovely bar is spoiled by guests eating take away burgers and pizzas and drinking their own drinks. Very odd indeed. The building has loads of lifts - all bar a few have been blocked off and are out of use - it can take a while to get a lift down from the 10th floor or higher (try grabbing one going up and stay in it!). Another mention to Elizabeth from customer relations who was excellent dealing with the issues another of her colleagues had caused - I guess she's used to it!All in all - if you know what you're getting and how much (including the well publicised if you bother to look facility fee) - it's a great hotel and we'd use it again....

The Park Central is my go-to hotel for business travel. It's close to where my clients are and has all the amenities you need. What makes this experience always spot on is the front desk personnel. They are kind, warm and always helpful. In particular - Carolyn. She is amazing, she doesn't flinch in any situation and always has a smile on her face. Tremendous customer service!!

This is a very beautiful, handicap accessible hotel. The staff did a fabulous job of caring for all of our needs. And they were more than helpful, offering advice on great restaurants in the area, must-see highlights while in NY, etc...Our room was on the 14th floor; it had a view of the middle courtyard, which was nothing to see. The room was not very large but then we only were there to sleep and clean up so it was fine. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom was newly remodeled; very clean also. It was only a few blocks from Central Park so we walked there a few times. You MUST see Central Park when in New York. And walk down to Time Square. You have most likely seen both places on TV but you'll never grasp the excitement and beauty of these points of interest until you visit them in person! And Carnegie Hall is just across the street! Park Central is the hotel to stay at in the area; you'll be treated very special here and the nice thing is, you can sense it is just the nature of the staff to want to care for you in this manner! We plan to return to New York and catch what we didn't have time to see on our first trip. When we do, we will be staying here again!!!

Checked-in on Friday, March 11, 2016 and checked-out Sunday, March 13th (Room #760). The individuals at the service counter were pleasant and answered all of our questions. We purchased our stay through Groupon.com and were pleasantly surprised with the value, especially considering this hotel's location, right in the heart of the theater district and only a short walk from the shops on Columbus Circle, Central Park and Times Square. Our room and the bathroom were very clean, and the bed linens were fresh and clean, which is something very important to us and believe me we checked. We were quite happy with our comfortable and clean accommodations for our stay in NYC.NOTE: The hotel has several amenities available to guests, including a gym and business center. This will automatically tack on to your bill an additional $30 charge per day, which is clearly displayed at the desk when you check-in. Also, valet parking is available for an added charge of $60 per day, with no in and out privileges. As an alternative, you can park in nearby garages for around $40 - $50 per day, but then you'd have to walk to the hotel. WiFi is available, but I didn't get the cost (1st 15-minutes of access is complimentary). We had a small issue with the A/C (couldn't adjust the temperature), but a technician was up to our room in a matter of minutes and fixed the problem quickly. Cleaning staff we encountered were very pleasant also.

The location is very good. We paid to upgrade our suite and it was worth it. By New York standards it was huge. Lobby is a little strange as it is behind the check in desk leaving the entryway very lacking in a space to wait for a cab.

Anyone who books this hotel should beware. They market their rooms dishonestly by using a false low price to lure customers in, and then perform a "bait and switch" by adding on a $30 fee per night. This is a $30 "facilities fee" per room night that cannot be avoided. There is no additional use of the facility beyond your room that you are paying for -- it is actually another charge for your room that is separate from city and state taxes. They do this so they can post a low but entirely unusable price on websites like this one, and then add on the rest of the room rate after you've decided to book. They post a non-comparable price to lure customers in. I'd rather make a fully-informed choice upfront and pay a higher price rather than have a bait and switch performed on me. I travel to NYC weekly for work. They got me once as a first time customer, but they will not have me as a customer again. Tripadvisor should ban and de-list hotels that do not post a comparable price on websites. If every hotel used the shady practices of this hotel, there would be no way to compare prices without reading the fine print of each hotel offer. It would be the end of price comparison sites, and would hurt both customers and Tripadvisor's business.Otherwise, the room was ok. The styling is modern, but the room was a bit dark. The A/C did not work properly, and only one elevator was operational.

Very impressed with the service at Park central hotel. Helpful and kind stuff, especially CAROLYN at front deck, she was welcoming and helpful. The room was a good size and very clean. Great location with a 5 minute walk to Times Square, I would recommend this hotel to everyone, I surly will be going back next year and staying at this hotel.

Really unhelpful staff with an attitude problem, hotel rooms are small, it was clean with a convenient location. No upscale amenities or services. Sorry, I am accustomed to better service. Marriott and Hilton close by offer much more attentive staff and amenities.

Stayed for a few nights in February. Rooms are lovely and spacious, very clean. However the shower curtain only barely reached the top of the bath so having a shower without drowning the floor was impossible.Great location - walk to Times Square and lots of bars and restaurants in the vicinity. Lovely welcome at Reception however not so polite when checking out - and that was to a few people as there was a queue to leave bags so I could hear the conversations.Weren't even interested in what anyone was trying to say - just kept telling them to go to the other desk. No coffee facilities in the room which was a shame - but when they are charging over 5US for a coffee in Reception why would they put them in?? Top tip - go out of the hotel and on the corner to your right there is a deli which serves lovely food and coffee!

Booked this hotel as it was one of the cheaper hotels, but looked nice from the pictures. Read some bad reviews about long queues at check in or the lifts taking ages, both of which are not true! The room that we had was on the 10th floor and was absolutely huge. I have stayed in NYC before and the rooms were 3 times bigger than any other hotel. We emailed before hand asking if we could check in early, and this wasn't a problem despite arriving at 1pm, and they even accommodated us a late check out free of charge. Also, on our last night we celebrated my birthday and the manager kindly gave us 2 drinks on the house, which included cocktails which was great. All in all, a fantastic hotel, great location (2 min walk to central park, 5 mins walk to times sq) and would definitely recommend

Second stay at Park Central and we loved it. Close to everything, this hotel is great for a stay in NYC. Staff were very friendly and accommodating, our room was excellent and cleaned daily. Rooms are quiet given NYC traffic and beds were really comfy. The cafe next door Tisserie is brilliant - excellent brekkie and coffee options. Overall would recommend to anyone and we will return.

At first I wasn't sure about my stay at this hotel. I came with my boyfriend and some friends and I stayed here for one night. The location is amazing, there are so many stores, even organic, restaurants, other hotels even central park just super close by. We were met with an inconvenience during the morning of our checkout but Fred was amazing and made everything better. He was so nice and understanding. He honestly did his best to make us feel welcome and to apologize for the earlier inconvenience. I really recommend this hotel!

Ana smiled and welcomed me with a "Hello" and she asked if I had stayed before and I said yes. She worked hard to find me the perfect room and indeed it was! She secured a refrigerator and coffee pot for the room. They were placed there within 30 minutes. She also gave me 2 complimentary drink tickets She set the standard for a happy NYC 4 day trip. Many many thanks to Ana Pina at the Park Central Hotel.

We stayed here for 4 nights and had a lovely time . The hotel is in a great location over looking Central Park. The hotel offer a happy hour where they serve drinks and nibbles which went down very well . There is a gym it's small but adequate . The rooms are nice enough huge king size beds! We found all of the staff extremely helpful and we would definitely stay again !

Stayed there for 4 nights and was very pleased with the location. Metro station is right outside the hotel. Times Square and Central Park is walking distance. The room was large, spacious and clean. Trip wad quite memorable !!

we had good time in this good located hotel , The staff was friendly, our room was clean and with a good size. The price are reasonable for the service they offer. The breakfast was reach and even in the restaurant the staff was professional and friendly. We enjoyed our stay

After spending two nights at another popular chain hotel with tiny rooms, I checked in to this hotel which was priced lower and was way better and bigger. Have I mentioned how big these rooms are. Rooms are clean with plenty of space for luggage. We ended up getting the king suite that included a living area with a pull out sofa. I would definitely recommend this room to my friends and family. It's also located within walking distance to time square, Central Park and good restaurants. Jett was the best, she made me feel like we were friends ( very polite and courteous) be sure to ask for her when you call or check in.

We booked a 5 night stay for 3 of us back in September at the Park Central Hotel. We got a really good price on the booking and were looking forward to our stay.Having just returned home following our trip, I could not recommend the Park Central Hotel any higher. The room was in immaculate condition and was very smart and well kept. There was all the hotel essentials and all room features were of a high modern standard. The room was kept tidy by the staff every day and they were all friendly and very helpful to our queries. The beds were very comfortable and as quiet as they can be - you are in the city that never sleeps and there is always a siren or horn to be heard somewhere!Location wise the Park Central is in a great location for getting to the main areas of New York - Central Park, Rockefeller Center and Times Square are all a stone's throw away, and the majority of Manhattan and Brooklyn are easily accessible via the subway next to the hotel, or the station two or so blocks away.Overall I could not recommend this hotel highly enough for a stay in NYC, it seems if you book ahead you get the best price. One thing that is worth noting is that you will have an additional fee to pay upon checkout, so make sure you account for this when making your booking to avoid any surprises.

Quite a lovely hotel. Upon entering the hotel, everyone at the desk were very genuinely friendly and made every effort to help me. I appreciated this. It is not always the case at some hotels, even so called luxury ones. The people left a positive impression on me and for this reason, I will return very soon.

The hotel was very well located, the rooms were beautiful and clean.We really enjoyed that the hotel is next to central park.The service was very good, especially elisabeth from guest relation which was very kind to us and helped us with any issue.

Stayed here for two days in March. The checkin was quick, easy and very efficient. I was greeted with a smile and she went totally out of her way to make sure my stay was pleasant. The location is great. I do feel that the lighting in the room is poor. Outside of that I would recommend this hotel.

We stopped here for a nightcap. We ordered a daiquiri and were told they couldn't make one. Really?! We asked another bartender, one with grey hair who knew how. In the end the drinks were fine but any Manhattan bar that doesn't hire competent bartenders doesn't deserve to exist.

We stayed here the first week of March. This hotel is excellent in a great location. 5 mins walk from Central Park and 10 mins walk from Times Square. The beds are exceptionally comfortable. The room was modern and clean. I had two small issues when i arrived which were dealt with immediately and the staff were very helpful.I was on the fifth floor and had no issues with traffic or other hotel customers noise. I also had no issues with the lifts however i was there at a quiet time of year but we never waited more than a minute or two for one to arrive.If i was being picky i would have liked coffee making facilities in the room but i was aware of this before i arrived so brought my own as i like to have a coffee before i go out in the morning, there were numerous places to purchase coffee nearby it is not a major problem. All in all a great hotel and if i return to New York i will stay here again.

Had a short stay in New York for meetings and having been in New York several times this hotel offered great value for money and location.The hotel has a gym facility which was great. A decent choice of up to date equipment.Rooms are modern and presentable. Didn't have any food in the hotel so can't comment on that.Only issue I would say, was the unfriendly nature of the check in staff and the fact that they appeared short staffed at the key check in times. This was added to when there was only 2 people working and 1 of then went on their break or finished for the day and there was still a queue of 4/5 people/couples.Would stay again though

We traveled to nyc from the uk getting to the hotel is relatively easy if you are flying, standard rate from lga airport is $45 and from Kennedy is $65. First impressions of the building is a grand entrance leading into a well designed lobby, the staff at the reception were very polite and handled our room cards and pointed us in the right direction, something to be alert on, you should bring a bank card as they do want a deposit of $50 a night that is refunded at the end, the lifts are very quick and first impression of the room were a big space that was filled by a king sized bed, trust me it's a sight you want to see after walking to the world trade centre memorial and back, the view from our room 1060 was alright you got what was in front of the hotel but hey who wants to experience New York though a window you have to get out there, the tv in the room was massive and had all American channels really good when your getting ready, the bathroom is modern and up to date, there was a bath but it was rather small, the location of the hotel is the best part of it you turn to your left you have Central Park and to your right is time square, there are always taxis outside and they are easy to hail, we didn't eat in the hotel as across the road there was a cafe that sold the most wonderful pancakes with bacon and egg, coming to the end of our time in the hotel we have a slip posted though the door with the extra charges at $108 dollars seeing as though we had been there for 4 nights and Expedia had told us it was going to cost $136 dollars we were quite happy. Overall the hotel is what you make of it, you can always find faults in the places you stay but at the end of the day from my opinion you go to New York to see New York this hotel is just a very posh room with a very comfy bed

Short walk to everything - Times Square, Lincoln Center, and so much more! Great shops, great restaurants all around. Hotel is clean and the staff is fabulous! Their lounge is a great place to hang out and relax with a cocktail before heading out for the evening . We will definitely be back.

What a lovely hotel! Rooms made up and beds changed every day along wit fresh towels. Easy use safe in each room accompanied by huge TV and radio/docking station. Our view was internal drop between buildings but I didn't come for the view out the hotel! Reception always helpful and polite and same for being able to leave bags on the day of check out. Great location , easy to get a taxi. Little breakfast bar is extremely expensive-$23 for 2 oranges juices and a crossiant and Ham crossiant!

This was our 6th time to stay at Park Central in 8 years, the location is great and the hotel is very clean. Rooms are cleaned each morning and I really cannot fault the rooms. We stayed in Park Central back in 2008 & 2010 before the refurbishment and now the hotel is a lot more contemporary. It is in walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue shops, Port Authority, Broadway, close to the subway station and nearby to lots of restaurants at all price points. The negative comments I have which are the facility fee per night which is a bit much, the concierge was quite unhelpful and vague when we enquired about a trip to Woodbury Common and the cost of snacks/ water in the Central Market. However, all the above would still not deter me from booking again. I really would recommend Park Central and we will hopefully be back later in 2016.

We booked the hotel through booking.com and were quoted a price. When we checked out the bill was 30% more than quoted due to taxes. I am aware that this is the case across most of America (tax gets added on after), but when we asked the receptionist, she said that booking.com would have quoted us the full & final price. Clearly they didn't. Great location, friendly bar staff, small rooms. Recommendation: Stay somewhere cheaper or don't book till the day you get there (our friend saved about 75% because she didn't pre-book).

We had a very nice room, modern decor, and spacious. We had a king size bed, which was very comfortable and plush. I did have a friend staying in another room, which had a bathtub. Mine was a smaller, stand-in shower. I would have preferred the bathtub but it was not an issue. The only slight issue in the bathroom was the soap holder in the shower. It was coming off the wall, but I didn't report anything because it wasn't that much of an issue. Overall great experience. The guest service was awesome! I arrived at about 7am, and went to the desk just to inquire if there was any possibility of checking in early (I work in hotels and know this is possible.) The young woman was very helpful, and got me checked in right away.

From start to finish we was looked after. Myself and my now fiancée, was very happy with the service from every department. I requested any help with celebrating our engagement and received a free room upgrade with complimentary drinks! (jaegermeister cocktail & chocolate martini) very good service at the bar. Upgraded room had a lovely view on the 10th floor but I would say being higher would gain you a lot better. Bed was really clean daily, as was the whole room. Great location close by to a subway station, Central Park & Times Square. Overall a fantastic 5 nights for us both and miss the place already!

The title says it all. The front desk help was great as well. When we arrived our room was not ready but the person at the front desk located another room in moments and had us checked in very quickly. The valet parking is also worth the price of the hotel. If you can find a better price, location and service I want to know about it.

This hotel is beautiful it looks like a traditional style hotel from the outside and warm and welcoming on the inside i stayed here for 4 nights for my daughters 18 birthday treat . we had a spacious clean room housekeeping came in every day the location is great you are just a small walk away from Times Square, Central Park & 5 th Avenue.the staff were friendly and welcoming no long queues when waiting to check in or out and no long wait for the lifts that i had read in previous reviews i really cant say a bad word about this hotel. if i ever return to New York i would not stay any were else a beautiful stay from start to finish

This was our first time to New York, we were able to walk from Penn Station to the Park Central with no problem. The hotel is in a great location, so convenient to Times Square, 5th Avenue and Central Park. We arrived at 3pm, and were checked in promptly, we had requested a room on the 3rd floor and that is exactly what we got. It was clean and spacious and had such a lovely comfortable bed! A couple of little negatives would be no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and it would be a good idea to give guests a street map at check in....we were only given one when we asked for directions. Having read several reviews before we went I was concerned about the lifts....I don't know what people were complaining about, they were spacious and fast and at no time did I see a queue for them.

I will definitely stay at Park Central every time I'm in NYC. Just blocks away from Central Park and some of my favorite restaurants. Elevators need upgrading for speed (and they could add a few more), and there's no room service but who needs it when you're inches away from the best in NYC food!? Beautiful hotel, COMFORTABLE BEDS!!, and the ideal location.

I have stayed at the Park Central many many times and would highly recommend but this is the first time I stayed since the renovation! The rooms are totally updated and clean and the lobby beautiful! I would recommend this hotel in a minute.

We stayed at the Park Central (just a few blocks south of Central Park). We stayed on the 10th floor- We arrived early and the staff did everything they could to make sure we could check-in to our room. We yes, we paid the service fees ($50/day)- but it was immediately refunded to our card upon check-out. The room was decent size, (we are used to larger rooms- but my understanding is that for New York- it was pretty large) and it was nicely furnished/decorated. Loved the shower! The bed was a pillow top mattress (pretty comfy)- though I didn't like the pillows. The housekeeping staff were fabulous...so sweet! I will say that the hotel bar is a bit pricey, but you will get that in just about any big city hotel. All-in-all 2 thumps up!

On arrival we needed to ask for a room change the room we were allocated had a dirty bathroom with suspicious stains on the floor. The hallway leading to the room was dark and dingy and to cap it all off we had a 30 minute wait for an elevator.No fridge no electric cattle no water so you’d expect 24 hour room service NO think again this hotel only offers room service between 6am and 11am…yes an allegedly top notch New York hotel offers just 3 hours a day room service.Asked for a bottle of champagne to be delivered to the room and was told that I needed to email there facilities company!Without doubt this is a beautiful iconic building that gets its trade solely from its location. If it weren’t for this then it would either have to step up to the mark or close. The tragedy is is that this amazing building is wasted, it lacks love and a caring competent management team…would I go back no this hotel NO it dampened one of the most precious times in our relationship and charged us £1300 to do so.

The rooms are small for a family with kids but perfect for a couple. The location is excellent. Just between Central Park and the Theaters. There is a coffee shop in the lobby where I got myself some chicken soup one night (tasted very good!) and Tisserrie, an excellent option for breakfast just outside. Service is 5 stars, prompt and smiling. I'll definitely be back!

My stay at the Park Central Hotel in Manhattan New York first of all, the price was to die for, so affordable, yet clean, courteous staff, peaceful, comfortable. Neighborhood is closed to everything from Central Park to Lincoln Center to the tour buses to Broadway shows and great restaurants. It was a marvelous stay, I would definitely visit again and would endorse to my friends.Golda

Loved staying here. The location cannot be beat. Walking distance to upper east side, west side, Lincoln center, theatre district and Central Park. Staff extremely pleasant and helpful. The bar is spacious and you can always find a seat. Rooms are newly renovated and though small everything is new and clean. I would absolutely stay here again. Such a great value for NYC!

Having read mixed reviews about this hotel I was slightly nervous upon arrival! I had heard a lot about unfriendly reception staff and long check ins - I got neither one of these and never did I see long lines!Other reviews have said about the slow lifts, I probably waited about 30 seconds max!! Was not a problem at all.There are reviews mentioning the lack of restaurant at this hotel, but given the location you only need to step outside and you have a huge choice!The only faults I can say are:1) reception staff were not rude however they provided no helpful info on the location, wifi, amenities etc upon arrival. I suppose we could have asked the concierge but would have been nice to have a little info on check in. Also on check out we had no question on whether we enjoyed our stay - just think it would have been nice.2) the housekeeping staff were very friendly, did a wonderful job cleaning the room however in the hallways they seemed to dump their bags of rubbish/ linen in the most inconvenient locations - one being right outside our room door upon arrival! Not a great welcome! Other than that, the room was very modern, spacious and comfy bed. I would stay here again and would recommend it. Just make sure you do a bit of research on the surrounding area before.

I stayed at the Park Central when I was in New York. The room was exceptional and roomy and the bad was extremely comfortable. At my request they gave me an "inside" room which was so quiet that I fell asleep and slept all night without even moving. The inside rooms don't have good views, however. It is in a convenient downtown location, right near Central Park and a few steps from Carnegie Hall. I will definitely go there again.

I stay at this hotel twice a year, each time for 2 weeks. You cannot really top the position, it is just 2 blocks from Central Park, opposite Carnegie Hall, a 10 min walk to Times Square and right next to a subway station. The rooms have been renovated 2 years ago and are big and comfortable. Also the hotel lounge is a place where you want to hang out for a drink. There is a coffee store in the hall for your early morning treat and a well equipped gym on the third floor. The staff is friendly, if you need a coffee machine in your room they will bring it. The hotel applies an obligatory extra fee for the gym and wifi. If you are lucky you can get one of the rooms with a view on Times Square.

I stayed at the Park Central hotel from Monday 22nd - Friday 26th February 2016. I booked my flights and hotel as a package on Expedia and got a very good deal. I contacted the hotel prior to our visit and requested a higher room at a cost of $8 dollars per night. This, I feel, is totally worth it as its a lot quieter and you get better views. I was also advised there would be a $26 facilities fee per night which covered gym use, wifi and calls. This I was not happy about. Not only did I not need or want any of the above as I had World Traveller on my phone, when we arrived it was actually $30 per night which I think is totally ludicrous. I understand that most hotels in NYC have the same fee so this isn't a direct dig at Park Central. I just don't feel it's fair to charge people for something they didn't use. We were told we couldn't check in until 4pm but arrived around 1pm to drop off bags and were able to check in straight away so that's something worth checking. The check in process was quick and easy but we did notice that earlier in the morning and later on in the evening there were very long queues and only one or two members of staff. I had read that there was only one working elevator and it was very slow. There were two and both worked fine so I'm not sure if this was fixed prior to our visit. The hotel was clean and the bed was the single most comfortable bed I have ever stayed in and I believe we stayed in the cheaper room so I'd love to have seen what the higher priced rooms were like! The rooms were attended to daily and there were always fresh towels. They supply shampoo, conditioner and shower gel. There was also an iron, ironing board and hair dryer in the room. Our room was air conditioned but the unit was noisy and didn't go any lower than 18.5 which just made the room warm and stuffy. We mainly slept with the windows open and allowed the cool air to circulate. There is a small shop where you can get coffee and breakfasts etc but we didn't use this as we wanted to explore all of the delicious options outside of the hotel. We had one drink in the bar and it was very excited expensive. A standard price for a disaronno and Coke was around $9 everywhere I went but the hotel charged $18! So we didn't drink there again. The location of the hotel was great. To the right was Times Square and to the left Central Park. It's very close to a couple of Subway stations and there's a Starbucks right next door. There are plenty of food places in the vicinity but I would advise travelling a little further out as the area is very Commerical. The best food we found was on 9th avenue which was close enough to walk to. All in all, the hotel was great and I would definitely recommend it anyone and would certainly stay there again. When we were leaving the hotel recommended we use one of their drivers as opposed to a yellow cab as they run on a meter and at rush hour could rack up quite a charge! It worked out cheaper and the driver was very friendly.

My family and I have stayed many times at the Park Central Hotel. Great location! Walking distance to Central Park, Times SQ and there a subway stop outside the door. The staff is very helpful and the waitstaff in the restaurant remember us, even when we hadn't visited in some time.

Awesome location for most of NYC's activities. Walking distance to Lincoln Center, MOMA, Times Square, Broadway, and of course Central Park. The hotel looks pretty refreshed, and the rooms are nice sized compared to most brrom closets that pass for hotel rooms in NYC. The luggage staff was pleasant and efficient staff. The front desk crew seemed ornery both pre-checking in, checking in and any other time. I would definitely stay here again. Tip- make sure you understand all of NYC's taxes (not the hotel's charges) and understand you will be charged a stiff $30 fee + tax for facility use.

Positives: Location, large and clean rooms, good beds.Negatives: No restaurant.We were originally booked at another hotel so I'm not entirely sure what the price was supposed to be but this hotel was great. Walking distance to so many of the things we wanted to see. The room was clean and quiet and everything held a good standard. I can't really speak much about the staff as we only talked to them when we checked in and out but they were friendly enough then and we came back to a clean room every day so I'd say what we saw of them we were happy with. We generally don't eat at the hotel so lack of restaurant didn't bother us so much, especially with all the restaurants so close by (although walking a few blocks west and south really made a difference price-wise). All in all I'd definitely recommend it.

What can I say here that hasn’t been said by other reviewers?Seemingly, not much.I have stayed here before the revamp, and I must say that it has substantially improved since my last visit. The customer service, however, has not.Shortly after arrival (that’s how poor the prior notice was) I received an email stating that they could not honour my reservation due to maintenance issues with the hotel. As I had just checked in successfully at the front desk, I decided to ignore this strange email and settled into my room. Never heard anything further.However, throughout the course of the day I noticed that hotel staff in the lobby were turning away guests and not honouring reservations due to the “maintenance issue”. What a joke.I felt sorry for these people as we all know how difficult it can be to secure decent accommodation in NY, and it wouldn’t surprise me if they were given the same length of prior notice that I received (i.e. none).In respect of the room, I have some positive comments. The room was small (typical for Manhattan) but comfortable and modern. I had a decent night’s sleep in the bed (mattress soft to medium) and the towels and linens were of high quality.The negatives were as follows:• SO MUCH NOISE. The walls must be paper thin. I am not a light sleeper by any means but I found it incredibly difficult to get decent rest in this hotel between the doors slamming and audible plumbing, and the housekeeping talking right outside my door every morning.• The joke of a breakfast that you can opt to pay for. It’s literally just a muffin and a juice. I threw mine in the bin and went to the deli next door.• Poor customer service. I must have seen about 4 or 5 conversations between management and distressed travelers, and all they could say is “there is nothing we can do, we sent you an email yesterday”. Not good enough.Location is good and the deli a few doors down is superb. I’ve also read management’s comments to some of these reviews and they sound childish. Won’t stay here again out of principal and would rather pay the extra $$ to stay at the Marriott Marquis or equivalent.Park Central, take note – if your aim is to ensure that no one returns to your hotel, you’re doing well. A fine example of how NOT to treat your guests.

My daughter and I stayed here for her Sweet 16th Bday gift. It was her first time to NY and we could not be any happier with the hotel all around. I had put in certain requests and they were all full-filled. It was so heartfelt to walk into our room and see my daughters eyes light up when she saw a sweet arrangement of balloons, chocolate, cheesecake & a thoughtful letter wishing her a happy bday. This hotel stay will always hold a very special spot in our hearts. Forever grateful & can't wait to return ;).

Just had 4 nights away here and loved it! Very warm friendly staff central location and very comfy beds to boot!! New York is a very busy place so after a mad day shopping sight seeing and walking the big apple it's comforting to know your going back to comfort relaxing surroundings

Pros :The rooms are nice so is the location, nice looking, The bad ones: no minibar, not Even water, dark bathrooms, only American plugs. Not helpful at all, when asked if they had adapters we where told you can buy one in the city, our key didn't work for the entire trip. Every time we came home we had to wait for the service guy to unlock them go down to get a new card so that took like 20-30 min... Their answer that they can't do anything about it witch for me is a very wrong answer..... I pay money to stay here and don't have time nor patience to stand and wait to get in the room... 3 day the toilet broke.... The receptionist was just rude and said they will send a service guy up.... The kiosk thing is a joke, overpriced, the food tastes old, coffee is horrible and water cost around 5$ for a small bottle.... Everything can happen. Technical problems can happen but it's how you fix the problem and deal with the costumer that matters. We didn't get any help and just a bad attitude "we can't do anything about this. Would I stay here again? NO!

We just enjoyed another amazing stay at this hotel ! From beginning to end our time here was fabulous. Our room was clean, spacious and well appointed.The guest relations manager (Elizabeth Cacovic) ensured that our stay was 100 % satisfactory! She tended to every detail with professionalism and a personal touch. We enjoyed a drink in the lounge and breakfast items from the market store in the lobby. This hotel's guest relations manager goes above and beyond to ensure everyone has a memorable experience from check-in to check-out. Because of the exceptional experiences this is the only hotel we stay at when visiting NYC. I urge others to do so as well!

Great address and very handily placed midtown to allow for getting about easily by foot, bus or metro- 59th station beneath hotel. Front desk staff sadly disinterested in guests, from initial interaction to the last totally unbelievable. Did not get a hello on many interactions just a "next". I cannot tell you if there is a gym or restaurant or anything nobody talked or guided you. I stay in hotels every week around the globe the worst by far. TV not working needed 5 attempts to get fixed. Bedroom not the cleanest but adequate. As I said a great location but sadly let down by staff.

Very reasonably priced (160 for the night including valet)! Room was beyond clean and comfortable. Only negative is bed sheets were full of fuzzies and had to call to change them. They don't have a restaurant just a small market store downstairs.

Liked it a lot. Stayed 7 nights in the end off february. Good location between Central park and Time square. Big room with nice beds. Not expensive. I would rate it as a four star hotel. Noicy air condition thu so bring earplugs or buy them at any drug store nearby (best earplugs I ever had and bought them for just one dollar). I can warmly recommend this hotel.

Myself and my partner had had a very long flight to the USA to then be slammed with a service charge fee of $350!!The man who was serving us was very rude and was refusing to give us a room unless we paid some form of money. We then asked what the money was for and he e planned what it was for for example using the gym, any room damages etc but did not say the wifi was in with this by the way... We then asked to call out to our travel agency as this was not in with our conformation sheet and we was not aware of this when we booked the holiday but as again because we wasn't putting any money down he said the hotel doesn't take international phone calls but later did we know the money that we was putting down was to cover international phone calls. We don't carry our bank cards on us when we travel away as we take enough money out with us. We was extremely tired, hungry and wasn't into the mood- we let another customer go in front of us and he told them a different story and they didn't have to pay as much as we did as they had card so it was a little bit Cheaper. When we arrived home we went straight to Thomas cook and they are investigating the situation with the hotel. Would never go back to this hotel, staff members are rude and all they want is your money!

After reading some other guests reviews on here I have to say I was slightly concerned about staying here, but from the moment we walked through the entrance my worries disappeared. We arrived at 3.00pm on thursday 18th February expecting queues and not being able to check in till 4pm, well we walked straight up to the desk and checked in and given the key to our room straight away. OK the receptionist wasn't overly friendly but I've worked out new yorkers are more like us Brits than the typical whooping "have a nice day" american and I can cope with that!! Up we went to our classic king room which was a great size, overlooking the court yard on the 14th floor. It was warm and lovely and peaceful, no view but I didnt pay for one. The only reasons for me not giving 5/5 for the score was lack of tea/coffee (we brought a travel kettle) lack of fridge which didnt really bother us and even though the room was clean more detail of cleaning corners and edges of the carpet could of been made apart from that it was fine. We never had to wait for lifts but we were out early everyday. The location of the hotel is excelent, inbetween Times Square and central park with plenty of delis and restaurants around and walking distance to all the main attractions!!! I cannot comment on the little market, bar or lounge as we didnt use them but they looked beautiful like the lobby. Overall I was very happy with my stay as we paid a good rate, the facilities fee is a bit annoying but we knew about it and it still turned out to be a cheap hotel for us. I would 100% stay again

I have high standards for business travel. This was only missing coffee in the room. I very much appreciated the magnified mirror and absorbent towels. Missed having an extra blanket - but the thermostat was in working order and I was able to keep the room warm enough in NYC winter. I don't rely on room service or breakfast at the hotel so I didn't care about "no restaurant". The central market seemed handy. There are just too many other places 2 steps outside any NYC hotel with ample variety and often cheaper prices than any food in a hotel. Many places deliver so a new version of "room service". It will be on my "will return if the price is right" hotels. A word about the bathroom amenities ... shower gel, shampoo, and conditioner were in large dispensers attached to the shower wall. I normally hate these because the quality of product suffers. The quality was good. Cannot comment on conditioner as I bring my own. My only nit here - if you take a bath - they are too high up to reach comfortably. It is a great location - near our office and close enough to walk to Columbus Circle, theatres, Central Park, Times Square - but far enough away to avoid the craziness, congestion,and noise. I found the room dimly lit unless I turned on every lamp. As my window was facing interior "court yard" with other offices/buildings - not a big fan of leaving the blinds open for additional light.

We enjoyed 3 nights at this perfectly placed hotel. Very close to a wide variety of things to do. We did not hear a bit of city noise from our 15th floor room which was very comfortable. Easy access to the Lincoln Center, Carnaghie Hall, Central Park, Times Square, lots of restaurants and the friendly "neighborhood" bar Faces and Names.

Loved staying at this hotel. About half way between Times Square and Central Park. Staff was nice and room was clean and cozy. Hotel does not have a restaurant, but there are lots of options right outside the hotel. The bar and coffee shop inside the hotel are good if you want drinks or snacks. Overall quiet hotel and close to Broadway, Central Park, and shopping.

How can you still in such a competitive market ask for a 30$ fee upon arrival. This just doesn't make sense. That being said, rooms are clean and spacious for nyc. The hotel itself is just on average (details make the difference.. They had no umbrella and it was pouring outside). The personnel at reception was a little bit rude but nothing major. If you are looking for value vs location. This is your spot!

Great stay! Room was great, right in the center of the city. Mr Joseph was the one who was able to get me a room last minute and he was very nice even though there was a rush of people checking in at the front desk. I had a little trouble with the room and Mr. Joseph got someone to come up and fix it within 3 minutes. He also gave me some advice on where to go in the city for dinner and drinks which my girlfriend and I really appreciated. Awesome night! It's refreshing to see someone happy to do more than what his job asks for. Thanks Bud.

Well, at this point I can already say that surely I feel at home in PCH NYC. The people is always so nice, lot of them already know me so far, after many years of coming here.Location, service, restaurant, bar, facilities (which are really something), cleaning, atmosphere. Everything is 5/5.I strongly recommend this hotel; it is worth every cent you pay.

Lovely hotel, lots of space, comfortable clean rooms cleaned everyday. Fantastic location. BUT beware of extra charges from time of booking! Got charged extra $220+ for city tax and resort fees and they also want to hold $50 per day on your credit card. Therefore, I wouldn't stay here again as they aren't upfront about charges

This was our first visit to the hotel and we would definitely return. We somehow got one of the larger rooms that was a welcome surprise. The location is very convenient to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and much more. I would definitely recommend the hotel!

We stayed at the Park Central for a weekend in December and it was perfect for getting to Broadway, Times Square, and Central Park. The hotel rooms are a bit small, but that is to be expected in Manhattan. The room was very clean and appeared well maintained. We would definitely stay here again.The "facility fee" and the cost/value are the two factors that precluded a 5-star review.

No Truth in Their Advertizing!!!! I have been totally deceived by Bookings.com and Park Central Hotel NYC 870 7th Avenue at 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019, USA . If you do business with these folks, what you need to be prepared for is the Moving Shell Game. On each page the price of the room changes, the format of the price changes and at NO TIME WAS I PROVIDED THE ACTUAL PRICE I WAS TO BE CHARGED. Yesterday I went through Booking.com to reserve a room at Park Central Hotel. The website advertised the Lowest Price Guaranteed " at $115. When I put in my date request, the price total for three nights was $540 in large bold letters and that is the price on my receipt in large bold letters. When I check my credit card this morning the total charged is $728.14. For the advertised room of $115.00 plus not included: 14.75 % tax, US$ 3.50 City tax per night, US$ 32.66 service charge per person per night. So now the price is $242.71 per night for the advertised "Lowest Price Guaranteed" $115 room. When I called Bookings.com customer service the agent saw no problem with this and he also contacted the Park Central Hotel who also had no problem with this outrageous price increase from the advertised price. And even better, now I am getting offers from Booking.com to for a reservation price of $110. So much for "Lowest Price Guaranteed" and truth in advertising.

Yes the fee for WiFi is annoying. But our nightly rate was reasonable, so all in it didn't make it too expensive.I have stayed near Penn station and in Hells kitchen, just off Times square before. Definitely preferred this as a location. Not as busy or touristy. There is a Starbucks right next door, so didn't try the shop in the lobby. But it looked nice. I got takeaway bagels from cafe oliver and had breakfast in bed. There are alot of deli cafes a few doors down on 7th ave. We got the nicest velvet cake from cafe premier.Definitely go up 7th ave about a block to 9ten restaurant. Perfect breakfast. Wish we had found it sooner.Decor in the hotel was very smart. Nice room and loved the large tv. Good size for nyc, we had a standard king size room. After alot of walking ...a movie in bed was the most we could manage. Bed was very comfy.Close to Subway station. Short walk to times square. Even closer to central park.Negatives - check in seemed to take ages. Only one person on the desk. Then we had to queue again for the bag drop desk. Why not have all staff on one desk and keep things moving. Elevators were not a problem on the Sunday we arrived. But as the hotel got busier I was starting to notice why so many people complained about it.Would definitely recommend and stay again.

This hotel is clean and spacious. The beds are lovely and the hotel is quiet. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. When I booked I asked for a quiet room and when we got there the room was opposite the lift. I immediately returned to reception and I was found another very quiet room with no fuss. The cleaning staff are excellent and they are really nice. The coffee shop does close at 8.30 pm and there are no hot drink making facilities in the room but I took my own travel kettle so it didn't bother us. Water is cheap to buy at the supermarket or there is always a tap in the bathroom. Glasses and an ice bucket are provided. The only niggle for us is that the staff in the bar are not very efficient and you feel as if you are bothering them if you ask for a drink. Consequently, we visited the bar on the first night and after that went to the Irish pub two blocks away. I would recommend this hotel as it has a great location and is reasonably priced. We booked with booking.com and did not have to pay any extra charges.

This hotel puts a low rate out on booking services. After you arrive they charge a mandatory facilities fee of $30 per person. You cannot avoid the fee. Its a trick they play to look like alone rate. Don't be fooled.

Our stay was totally spoiled by the following:- NO water in the room; at night the food corner in the hotel is closed; no beverage distributors inside.At the same side, the hotel charges a stay deposit of USD 400 - what for??- reseption service is sooo slow- we asked for our car from a garage, waited for 30 min!!!

This place is beautiful. As soon as you step outside there are fast food and sit down restaurants. More importantly you can see Times Square. It's a straight shot 8 minute walk from the hotel entrance. The location is prime, and it's wallet friendly. Be prepared for a $60 valet fee for your car if you drive there. The hotel itself was thoroughly clean. You could smell the cleaning products. The beds were super comfy, and it was quiet! They also have a little cafe in the main lobby. I'll be staying again when I return to New York.

We have amazing time in New York - I would highly recommend the Park Central Hotel New York. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. I room was spacious, clean and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud! Great location as well, Time Square was just two blocks down and the subway was close, however we walked to most attractions.

This is our 2nd stay at the Park Central Hotel. We stayed here for the NYC Marathon in 2013 and I choose it again for this special weekend because of it's great location and sizable rooms. The staff is friendly and accommodating. We were visiting New York from Miami during the coldest weekend in 100 years (I'm not exaggerating). The front desk upgraded our room to a corner room, partially I think because they felt bad that it was such a cold weekend... brrrr! The corner rooms as great and remarkable large compared to other NYC hotels I have stayed in. The ONLY complaint I have about the rooms, and I mean the ONLY complaint, is the shower heads. The water pressure isn't the best and the shower head is one of those rain fall types. Needless to say, I prefer a more high pressured shower head.
