I don't feel like the shampoo/conditioner washes out completely otherwise. Silly complaint, but that really is the only thing. It bothered me during my first stay and again during this stay. During this visit we stayed on the 9th floor. The elevator system is a hassle as there is only one set of elevators for an entire floor. And don't forget your room key or you won't be able to go up in the elevators at all, room key required.I would like to comment specifically about the Guest Services Manager, Elizabeth. She was incredibly helpful and friendly. She remembered from when we checked in that we were visiting for my daughters birthday. She offered suggestions for restaurants, taxi services, and then treated us to breakfast one morning so we could enjoy a quiet walk to Central Park. Did I mention the hotel is only 2 blocks from Central Park. One block from a subway terminal. And still walking distance from Time Square. Enough distance to enjoy the city without being overrun by the hustling/bustling crowd of New York City.Overall, this hotel is in a great location, at a consistently great rate, with great customer service and comfortable rooms. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone who asked.

I was genuinely nervous about staying in this hotel because of the bad reviews on here. However, I am pleased to say it met and at times exceeded my expectations. We upgraded to a higher floor with better views at a cost of 200 dollars. Our room was perfect. Staff were courteous and helpful. No problem with the lifts. Location is the best thing about this hotel. Right beside Central Park but 5-10 mins walk from times square. So many places to eat seconds from the hotel. Subway stop right outside. I'd book again in a heartbeat. Yes it could do with tea and coffee making facilities but Starbucks is attached to the hotel!!!

We booked in for 5 nights, needing 2 double rooms.Likes: position -handy for midtown, staff aren't too 'in your face' with tip enhancing smiles and behaviour! Nancy the bar waitress and happy hour in the bar-quite cheap at 5 dollars a beer(Stella too!), clean, practical rooms, access to Apple Macs in foyers to check out places and print stuff if needed. Handy cafe/ market in foyer if you don't want to go to Starbucks next door. Such COMFY beds and pillows, good heaters in the cold weather too.Dislikes: no coffee/tea facilities-we did ask but never materialised, not enough lifts-being bit fussy now really, and avoid the rooms with adjoining rooms (1032 is one) unless you like hearing everything-yes, everything from the adjoining room-some people might pay for this but not our thing really!! Other room was offered, to be fair, but don't bother unpacking if you get these rooms unless you are friendly...or wish to be friendly, very friendly with the adjoining occupants!!!Last thing ... Wish they 'd put the service charge onto the initial price-it's pointless adding it on at the end-feels like an added expense at the end of the hols.Overall, we would return here.

Wonderful location, large rooms, new bathroom, wonderful beds, clean, great service and worm welcome from all the stuff - especially from Elizabeth Cacovic from the Guest Relations Team that took care of every need with great courtesy. My next visit to NY will definitely be to this hotel!

It is just OK. It is actually a very old building which has been renovated to look modern. The surprise comes with the bill for 30+2$ fee on top of the 15% tax; they call it facilities fee! That will be the first time you hear about this facility (at check out time), and I never heard this in any other hotel (for a room with an usual amenities). It is also surprising that how they can easily get away with this scam.

Great room great service fantastic location , everything we needed for our trip . Our room was cleaned every day , the lifts were fast and no long waits , the staff were friendly and efficient , we will return

We used stay here every January until they introduced a very unwelcome facilities fee of $25 daily which should be optional, not mandatory, and has been a shock for European visitors with the euro weak against the dollar. That said we were offered a cert favourable rate and the facilities fee waived so we returned! The hotel has bee upgraded and the rooms are very comfortable with 6 foot beds and great mattresses. A very good TV in the room with HD added to the experience.If only they would get rid of the add on facilities fee they would have many more contented Europeans visiting!

Recently returned from staying at the Park Central hotel. Great location about 5 min walk to the heart of Times Square.The hotel is modern and contemporary in style. The staff are all friendly and attentive.I booked a King Bed room to share with my mum (cheapest option) but the hotel gave two queen beds when I arrived for no extra cost which was very nice of them.The only negative I have is that the outside noise could be heard at all times, where possible request a room higher up because this might reduce this. I stayed on the 7th floor. The heating system in the room was also noisy.Despite the small niggles, I still had a great time at this hotel and would consider visiting again.

The hotels position on 7th Avenue is ideal for Central Park, Times Square, Broadway and many midtown attractions. The refurbished rooms are comfortable and well equipped although some of the bathroom fitments were loose and needed attention . The front desk staff are delightful and could not be more helpful. For a central New York hotel I thought the value was exceptional.

me and my friend went to new york city for valentines day weekend, and stayed at the park central. it's a nice hotel definitely, and it's a great location too. Close to everything. However, we definitely had some problems. First, ensure you ask for a hotel no where near the elevators because they kept us up all night. The manager offered to give us a different room with a smaller bed, but we declined. She did wave the resort fee which was nice (note this btw! we booked with expedia, and in very fine print it was written that the hotel would charge $27 dollars a night for a resort fee) Secondly, if you request towels make sure to plan to wait at least an hour for them (this happened to us on two different occasions). We called the front desk numerous times during our trip, and to be honest they were less then helpful. Don't try to take a bath either, because the stopper is just there for show. I ended up using a towel to clog the bath. Finally, ensure you're okay with sleeping in a bed with no duvet cover, or fitted sheet.They just put our duvet cover between two flat sheets, and same thing for where the fitted sheet should be. I was totally grossed out because I move a lot during my sleep, and I woke up sleeping on the mattress topper. Like I said before, we called the front desk for so many issues during our trip i just don't think it's worth it. It's definitely a great location, and a nicer hotel but it just missed a lot of marks in my book. Next time I go to new york, ill definitely stay somewhere else.

Park Central is located in an amazing area: inbetween Times Square and Central Park, two blocks away from 5th Ave, and next to a subway station.The cleanliness was really good as well.However, there are some basic amenities missing, which made our stay not that great. We arrived at almost mid-night, checked-in to a not so friendly face in reception, and for starters right there we were told we had to pay for a service fee (which is multiplied by the number of nights we stayed), that we had not been advised off and in years of travelling had never happen to us. But until then everything is fine: we assumed it was a NYC "thing".What was not so confortable was to get to our room and find no mini-bar in a 4 stars hotel. We just wanted water, as we had been travelling for a while and mabe some snack. We called the hotel restaurant to order some room service and it was closed: so far so good, as it was indeed late, although, again, in many hotels we have ordered food around the same time after a long flight. But, it was not great to call the Concierge and hearing a voice message as no one would be there until the morning, and same thing with reception. We ended up having to drink tap water, which doesn't kill you, but personally I don't like; and going to bed hungry.So, it is a nice hotel in an amazing place, but this really through us off.

I didn't read too many reviews before we went but while I was there other people travelling with me told me bits and pieces which I'm glad i didn't know ahead of time as I'd have been looking out for them!The lobby/bar are beautiful, happy hour in the bar is 5-7 and even during peak times it was quiet. It's table service and somehwre I was happy to sit even with a wealth of other bars surrounding us in the city. The lifts were small and crowded so getting to our room took time but that's no bother. The room was very spacious by NY standards, the bathroom not so much but the large sink/mirror area made up for it. The bath we couldn't quite figure out, the pug never seemed to close, someone came to check it for us and said it was fine but the other couple we were with had the same trouble.. maybe it's just us. Shower was great.Bed was INSANELY comfortable and HUGE, in room ammenities were very basic with no info booklets about the hotel or mini bar options however we were there for my birthday and they provided a bottle of bubbly (cheap stuff but that's not the point, is it?) and flowers on arrival as well as a celebratory note. The windows were large and the noise was minimal.Only when I came to video our room for a 'tour' at the end of our trip did I notice the wear and tear others have mentioned in previous reviews. Nothing that made any difference to our stay whatsoever and nothing that would stop me staying again. Little things like the lampshade coming apart and old, wonky set plug sockets, there was a mark on the bathroom wallpaper where something had obviously been cleaned and left a stain but again.. I'm not one of those people to go around photographing dust etc. In New York you need to manage your expectations, rooms are usually very small, not too modern and noisy.. this was large, modern enough and quiet.. for me it was perfect and the location was SO close to Times Square and Central Park.. if you're in to location location location you'll love the Park Central

We stayed in nyc for a week. When choosing the hotel we looked for a while and park central had a very good price and a perfect location. I was a bit worried because of some reviews but my experience there was excelent.The room was clean and quite big, the bed really confortable, the bathroom was very good as well. The staff was really nice to us and helpful.Our room didn't have a view, we saw the inside of the hotel from our window. That was good because it was really quiet, so we didn't hear the loud noises coming from the streets and had no trouble sleeping. The downside was that there wasnt much natural light coming in, but we were never there during the day so it wasnt really a problem. To have privacy we had to close the curtains because we could see the other rooms, but that didnt bother us. The elevators worked just fine (I read in some reviews that they took forever), we didnt have to wait for more than 30 seconds and it was almost never full.The subway was right in the corner, and the hotel was walking distance to a lot of places like 5th av, times square, MoMa, Central Park, Columbus Circus. That made everything so easy for us.I really liked my stay in Park Central, its a good hotel with good price and perfect location.For me the worst thing was the tax that we had to pay for wifi and fitness center, which was 25 dollars per night. I was already aware of that when we booked the hotel so it didnt come as a surprise, but I really think it isnt fair. We didnt even use the fitness center, just the wifi, and in the majority of the hotels that i have been is free. In the end of our stay we had to pay 150 dolars+tax. This should be optional, I would like to have the chance to choose if I would like to pay for the wifi or not (a lot of hotels do that).

The hotel is very close to two subway stations from which you can get directly to all the touristic places on Manhattan. With central park extending just a few meters away on one side and times square already visible from the hotel's entrance, it couldn't be better. Its classic rooms have an optimal size, i.e. you won't need more space, and are clean. The hotel offers all you really need as an accommodation for a trip to New York. Since many decent restaurants are nearby the lack of a restaurant within the hotel itself didn't seem negative to us.

I stayed here for a business trip in May 2015.Overall good hotel: - large rooms, mine had a double and single bed.- the bathroom was very small however, a bit odd in comparison to the bedroom size. It was also not entirely clean, and needed a little tlc.- the room was lacking some of the basics like a kettle and fridge (I stayed for a week for work, so this was a bit of a pain).- my window looked out onto a wall, so not one for great views - but it was quiet, and I spent very little time in the hotel, as I was out exploring the wonderful, city! - the reception is very grand, and they're were some really helpful and friendly staff on reception.- the hotel could have benefitted from a breakfast restaurant; there was a deli, but it was very small and not great in my opinion.- the hotel location is great, so close to time square and Central Park. Also a short walk to my office on Avenue of the Americas!

Loved everything about the hotel. Nice reception with good staff, lovely bar and gorgeous decor. Best thing for me was being so close to Central Park and Times Square. There's a $50 a night security fee witch includes hotel gym, wifi etc witch I think is a little steep but I would stay here again.

Great price, excellent location, nice and clean rooms. Would stay again.Walking distance to Central Park.Eateries up and down the street.Gym access. There are several taxis waiting outside the hotel for customers.Stayed April 2015.

Quality linen and a good selection of pillows - soft and firm. Comfy mattress and padded head board. Great five nights sleep..!!! Room was clean and modern and the majority of the staff are friendly.Only issue's with our stay - the view was disappointingly in our room. The lifts were not adequate for the size of the hotel and the bar did not open till 5pm.

We visited for 7 nights in Feb 2016. Upon our arrival the man at the desk told us that our King size room wasn't available, apologised and put us in a double Queen for the night. He told us our room would be ready tomorrow and as an apology they'd waive the $27 per night service charge for the entire week. This was fantastic news as it gave us extra spending money and the double Queen room was lovely.There were a couple of staff members who maybe needed some training on how to smile with guests, but the majority of staff were super friendly.Pros:LocationBed ComfortFriendly StaffCons:Very slow elevatorsSuper thin toilet paperShower pressure

Went to NY for a long weekend - me and my partner stayed at the Park Cetnral hotel.The staff were great, the hotel was very clean! And the beds are soooo comfortable!! Also the huge flat screen TV was a great great bonus :)The hotel is in a great location, literally 2 blocks from central park and a 10 min walk to Times Square!! I would highly reccomend this hotel and would stay here again!

The hotel was nice and well maintained, but the windows could have better isolation. Being NYC there is a lot of noise coming from the street, specially near Times Square, so the sound isolation should be a big priority, and it was not the case here.A little problem with the booking also. We booked three rooms with a king size bed in each one and we were given two queen sized bed instead in each room.The shampoo and conditioner bottles in the bathroom were empty when we arrived and never re-filled.

Park Central is in easy walking distance to theater, Rock Center, MOMA, and Central Park. The rooms are spacious for NYC and appear to have been renovated fairly recently. The gym has good array of cardio equipment and free weights plus a cable machine which is important to me. (It was too cold to go running in Central Park....but then I'm a weather wimp!)They do charge a "resort fee" of $25/night which you should know when you book. And the bar is nice but pricey.Overall, the is a nice hotel in a great location.

This hotel is brilliant, friendly, helpful staff. The location is brilliant, just up from times square on 7th avenue and about 3 minutes from the nearest tube stop. We had the biggest, most comfortable bed ever. Super clean room. The room key machine wasn't working when we got here so they couldn't make us a key. It wasn't a problem though, they gave us a key to use the lift and then a security guard met us outside our room to let us in. The next morning the machine was fixed so they made us a key no problems, after we showed them photo ID. The security is really good. I would definitely stay here again. Can't fault it.

Now don't get my rating wrong. I would definitely go back to this hotel. The location was absolutely perfect. Just a couple of blocks from Central Park. It was central but far enough away (about 10 blocks) from the craziness of Times Square. The room was quite adequate for my husband and I. The decor was contemporary, the room was clean and comfortable. The only strikes were the elevators. There were 2 in our tower and the weekend we were there one of the elevator kept going down. The line ups for the elevator in the lobby and on our floor was ridiculous and we were only on the 5th floor. The other thing I would suggest is try and get a room on a higher floor. We kept here traffic and sirens in the middle of the night.

I reserved my room for a king size room on booking.com and the price kept increasing by £1 or so, so I emailed booking.com to ask why this is. Booking.com said despite the increase in price, I will be guaranteed to pay the price I initially reserved. When I got to the hotel they said no king size rooms were available. Receptionist was rude and not friendly. Hotel have now tried to take $849 from my account when they should've charged me $500.88 and I have the receipt which shows $590 that they had "charged" me because that was the price I reserved the room for 5 nights. I am EXTREMELY annoyed and irritated because I'm now left out of pocket for the rest of the month when I put my faith in this hotel and thought they'd look after me and do things properly considering it's rated a 4 star hotel. I am VERY DISAPPOINTED because I recommended this hotel to my friends and was even planning on coming back to New York and stay at your hotel but I have changed my mind! I want the money that is owed to me. From other reviews I can see the Managing Director sending out apologies - I'm not interested in the apologies. I just want the money that is owed to me. How do you expect people to trust you and your hotel if you're ripping people off their money??? Hotel is nice and in a great location but I am NOT impressed whatsoever and I am not the type of person that moans about anything but this has left me with no money for the rest of February and I am extremely disappointed in this hotel!! I will not be staying here again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

My girlfriend and myself stayed in this hotel from Feb 1st until Feb 5th. I must say i had nightmares leading up to our check in as i read alot of poor reviews but from the second i stepped into the hotel those fears were put to bed. We were checked in straight away and led in the direction of the lifts. Our room was clean and spacious. New towels and bed were made every day. This hotel was perfect for our needs as we spend most of our time doing the tourist attractions.Pros: Great location, room cleaned every day, quick check in/outCons: 200 dollar deposit not mentioned during check in, took 200 extra and only explained about 50 dollar per night when i rang to reception. Absolutely shocking prices in the bar 16 dollars for a glass of 'paint stripper' wine and a 'pint' and 9 dollars for local beer.

I chose this primarily for its location and good price. I stayed there by myself and wanted to be centrally located near the majority of the attractions I wanted to see. There are a lot of little cafes to eat at right by it. The room was clean and well put together. My view was a brick wall, but it doesn't get much more New York than that.

After purchasing a reservation online we showed up to check in, and were informed at the desk of a $25 per night mandatory "facilities fee." Upon questioning this (because we had already paid online), we were told that we should have checked the fine print. Of course it was there, hidden several bullets down and not at all emphasized. This is very poor business practice and not impressive that they are not upfront with their customers about price. If they don't care enough about their clientele to be upfront with their pricing, it makes one wonder what else they are hiding.

Left a Sephora bag with 100 dollars of make up in the lounge behind check in and have been trying to contact hotel by E Mail and telephone left messages but no reply my daughter is really upset as it was a gift from her dad. This is my only complaint, communication !! The hotel for our 4 day stay was excellent and we upgraded to a high floor corner room 1806 looking towards Time Square. Staff very courteous and room was excellent and well valeted every day would def stay again and hope the hotel contact us.

The hotel location is very convenient, being equidistant to Time Square and Central Park with a subway just round the corner. The staff were very pleasant even allowing us to check in earlier than we expected. The room was on par with any hotel although the bath was on the small side - very clean though.All in all, I would definitely stay again.

Great location close to all attractions and the sub way. Decent sized room but no air con. Staff at bar great as are doorman. Reception pretty hopeless and rude don't look at you and grunt. Best thing is location and the staff at front door. Could do with restaurant but patsy's round the corner more than makes up for it.

Just arrived ! Nightmare traffic from JFK ! Got to be an easier way ! Looking into it ! We were a bit early so left cases with concierge , reception staff couldn't have been nicer ! Our room on 16th floor is wonderful clean , nicely decorated, bath & shower great space windows on 2 sides overlooking 7th Ave ! Surrounded by some big name hotels so location is the best ! Only thing and its not only here but all over is us Brits love our early morning cup of tea / coffee !! Its such a shame the are no facilities or a fridge ! But would highly recommend to anyone visiting New York !!

Trip Advisor Review for Park Central Hotel:Pros: 1) Location is great. 2) Bar service and setting is great but NY prices (no surprise). 3) Room was small but very nice, comfortable & quiet (I requested a room not facing a street to avoid street noise). 4) I traveled alone but felt safe inside and outside of the hotel at all times, even into the evenings while walking home from dinner.Cons: 1) No hotel food - none. They claim in the literature you can order coffee & breakfast danishes, muffins, fruit...from the in-hotel 'Starbucks' type shop but I never received a call back from the front desk to learn how to place the order. The lines in the morning were too long to wait and while the hours state it's open until 8:30 pm it closed early every night I was there. 2) No coffee maker or bottled water in the room. 3) Shower curtain hangs higher than the edge of the tub so water floods that edge of the bathroom unless you position the shower head to face the wall. 3) They forcibly charge a 'hotel fee' of $30ish per night to cover wifi (even if you don't use it) and the gym. My recommendation is the WestHouse hotel located on the same block as Park Central. Rooms are nicer, free drinks and lite fare every evening from 5 to 8pm. Free breakfast offering on 23rd floor every morning, staff excels at providing excellent service and offers to help with everything. In room FREE bottled water. Unfortunately no coffee maker in the room. No restaurant beyond breakfast offering but fantastic local restaurant arrangements for delivery. They do charge a hotel fee also but WELL worth it considering the conveniences that are included.

Let me start off by saying I have stayed here before for 1 night and had no issues. room was spacious and beautiful. So when I booked for the 2nd time and dealt with overbooking, needless to say I was extremely disappointed. I was booked for Tuesday night 2/2, checkout Wednesday 2/3. When I arrived at the hotel they told me they were overbooked and sent me to the Park Lane a few blocks away. My main issue is that I called at 7pm that night, Tuesday 2/2 to ask about the valet package. Long story short, for whatever reason the only way to add the valet package is to cancel your reservation and rebook. They couldn’t just simply add it to my reservation, which is crazy. Anyway, they couldn’t add the package because they were full so they couldn’t cancel my reservation and rebook. Point being, they saw they were full, they saw my reservation, yet didn’t say anything about being OVERbooked!By the time I got there it was 2.30am, which is why I asked about valet earlier that night by the way!! But the timing wasn’t why they were overbooked. They said they had to move many guests this week. So when I questioned the woman at the from desk at 2.30 in the morning astounded that they didn’t have a room for me, she was very rude and all she would say was that she would get me her manager. They ended up giving me $20 for cab fare to the Park Lane and to get to my office in the morning.When I checked out of the Park Lane on Wednesday 2/3, they told me they bill the room to the Park Central and that I would need to get a receipt from them.Later that same day I went to the Park Central to get the receipt. An extremely nice gentleman at Guest Relations, QUIMBY HIGHTOWER, was extremely apologetic, took my email and looked into the situation. Later that night I received an email from him that because the error with my reservation was a hotel error, they took full responsibility and the room to the Park Lane was paid by Park Central, so it was on them!This wont deter me from booking here again, or from going to the Park Lane, but I will definitely be calling ahead next time!

Just stayed in Park Central on 7th avenue room 705 for the last 2wks, had a lovely stay. 2mins from central park and 10min stroll to times Square. Ashley the concierge was brilliant, answered all my questions like it was the first time she had been asked lol, Nancy the hostess in the hotel bar was great, very chatty and friendly and our cleaner was the cuddly mum away from home, did here job cheerfully and well.The hotel spotless clean, very friendly and central. Subway next door that will take you everywhere when you understand the routes (see Ashley lol) rooms were very comfortable and of ample size, towels and flannels changed daily and beds changed regular. Can understand the problems with the lifts that people have mentioned but I stayed when it was quiet so found no problems. All in all I have no complaints what so ever, just one small suggestion. Please change the music.

My spouse and I have stayed at the Park Central many times and have always been pleased. The location is great. Walking distance to MMOA along with full service connection to the subway. A few minute walk to the N/S bus routes from 8th Avenue all the way to Madison. You can travel anywhere in NYC from this location. Carnegie Hall is literally across the street Lincoln Center is a 20 minute walk. The rooms seem to have been recently refurbished and the lobby is new. Look for a special room rate. The downside is that this is a tourist hotel and guests come in waves. The heating system is noises, but turn off the fan. The room will stay warm in the winter.

We were approx. 200 colleagues staying for NRF at this hotel, and never have we experienced such bad service - or lack of service. From checking in, rental service, elevator, postal and check out.I was awakened every morning by the cleaning at 8, I never could figure out why but it was not to clean my room, because thar was not done until 5-6 in the afternoon. And if you are there on holiday, 8 in the morning is quite early..We asked the front desk for help with a rental car, but were told that they didn't help with that, we had to contact the rental company directly instead. We instead went to a colleagues hotel and they booked a car for us.I had a package delivered to the hotel, and even though it was delivered 3 days before it took 4 different people and 3 hours to find it. Even though it was registered in the internal file as received.The only nice person we met at the hotel, was the guy at the luggage check.There were no smiles, no "How are you doing" or "Enjoy your stay" - so we didn't..

We had a lovely stay in the Park Central Hotel. The hotel was very conveniently located for seeing NY, and provided us with a good base for our short trip.I was however very disappointed with their service. The few interactions we had with staff were not satisfactory particularly when we arrived. We had just spent 40 hours travelling (on planes and in airports) from South Africa, and all we wanted was to shower and freshen up but the room we were given had no towels. I called down to order some and my kids got into the shower. 20 min later none had arrived so I called again and was told they were on their way up. By this time my kids are out the shower and shivering. I was forced to use their dirty clothes to dry them, which my wife and I then had to repeat thereafter. 40 min we went downstairs to take a walk to Time Square. The towels had still not been taken up, and I spoke to the reception desk again. The woman from housekeeping apologised but said she had only just been given the instruction and was about to come up with them. This is absolutely not acceptable in my opinion. Rooms should not be issued to new guests unless they have been stocked with new linen and towels. This is as much a fault of housekeeping as it is of the hotel check in staff.

My partner took me to New York last week as a surprise 30th birthday present.The hotel is an amazing location.A couple of minutes walk from Central Park and 10 mins from Times Square, everything is on your doorstop.The hotel has a real cool vibe to it.I would even call it rather trendy. Music as you walk in, lots of different types of people from all nationalities and a real contemporary vibe but still with a touch of glamour.The bar is lovely and big and the breakfast deli inside is great to grab a coffee and sandwich before you catch the sites although there are many delis/cafes around so I would check out others also. Especially the deli on the corner as you walk out to the right, the salmon and cream cheese bagels are delicious!! The hotel gave us a free upgrade to our room which was on the 11th floor and lovely and big also very clean and cleaned every day with fresh towels etc.The bed was huge and very comfortable.You also get a safe free of charge for all your valuables.As well as this our flight was cancelled because of the snow storm so arrived a day later. After telling the staff this the manager allowed us to have another night free of charge which was a lovely touch. As well as this we were given a bottle of champagne in our room a free drink each at the bar and chocolates as this was a special occasion so very kind and lovely touch once again.The outside of the hotel as you walk in is very grand and looks great at night all lit up.It's a great hotel I would recommend it to anyone wanting to come to New York and it's a fantastic price.The noise of course is a little loud in the room at all hours with sirens, cars etc but you are in New York the city that never sleeps so what do you expect!? And It never stopped me sleeping through the night.Great experience couldn't fault it.

Park Central is situated between Times Square & Central Park on 7th - best position of all the nyc hotels we've stayed at. Hotel is contemporary, great bar/sitting area, rooms comfortable & beds are really excellent. Market place/coffee shop carries a good range of supplies - especially good for those who just wants convenience. Staff were friendly & very helpful at all times. Special mention to the Concierge who booked an amazing birthday meal for my daughter at Tavern on the Green

My experience and stay at the Park Central hotel was very disappointing.I had prepaid for a King bed classic room with free wireless internet. When I arrived at the hotel around 8pm, I was informed at the checking desk that the King bed classic room which I had pre-paid for via the Last Minute website was not available till 4pm the following day and only a Queen room was available that night.This is a concern, attending what Last Minute stated as a 4 star hotel and being informed that we would have to check out and check into a new room later in the day is unheard of along with unacceptable attitudes and behaviour. I would therefore waste a portion of my day waiting and returning to the hotel to check back in.Nevertheless as advised by the front desk staff, my girlfriend and I stayed in the Queen room that night and repacked in the morning returning to the front checking desk.We were informed that due to the snow storm that other guests had extended their stay and we would only have the Queen room we checked into at the start available to us. No apologies or offerings apart from the tax fee being removed. when they asked to take a $50 deposit the tax fee was actually fully charged to my card. After raising a compliant this fee has been returned to my credit card. The room was dusty as per the pictures I have taken. There was dust behind the bed and headboard which was exceptionally thick, clearly the room had never been dusted or vacuumed as the carpets and edges had dust and dirt everywhere. I actually found a make-up Q-tip lodged between the carpet and table obviously not one my girlfriend had brought with us.The bathroom had a shaving mirror where the outer and inner rim had dust surrounding. The shower sides had the rust colour residue indicating the bathroom had not been cleaned prior to our arrival. Only towels had been placed in our bathroom each day. Several of the towels received were torn which does not present the image of a four star hotel.Each day we expected a new soap bar replacement along with the replacement of the tissues that had been finished. We received no additional soap bars or tissues. There was one toilet roll and no spare added throughout the duration or the stay.With regards to the front door staff for the hotel, none were not present when our vehicle arrived to assist with our luggage. We noticed this throughout the remainder of the trip that there wasn’t assistance with luggage for the majority of guests.I had asked several questions regarding the locations and attractions to three front door staff that were standing around talking rather than being available to assist. When I asked for directions for an attraction only one said he didn’t known and be best I ask someone else before carrying on their conversation which I found exceptionally rude.I have since contacted Last Minute.com to request compensation for the inconvenience and stress the above matters have caused.

I stayed here with my family at the end of January for 2 weeks. We were made to feel welcomed by all the staff at the hotel and they were all very helpful. The hotel is close to loads of attractions, like Times Square, 5th Avenue shopping, Central Park & The Rockefeller Center which are all in walking distance and there's a subway and a bus stop right by the hotel so it's easy to get to other places too! The room was lovely and upon arrival the the receptionist had told us that they had upgraded our room to a corner room for no extra charge (usually another $90 per night). The room was spacious with a big TV and the bathroom wasn't small or cramped. The house keeping team were always polite and always left our room tidy and clean to high standard every day.The bar staff team always made you feel welcomed into the bar and Nancy (the waitress) always remembered our drinks order, brought them over to the table for us and always made the time to have a chat to us and ask us how our day had gone.What stopped me from rating this a 5 star hotel was that they had put a hold of $250 on my credit card without notifying me for accidentals. It was lucky that I wasn't using that $250 for spending money on my trip. I also feel that the cafe (central market) was over priced but there is a Starbucks next door which is cheaper. Overall I would really recommend this hotel for family's or couples looking to get a way for a while in New York. It's central, it's clean and the staff are polite. I would definitely come back here again.

I am a very frequent traveler to NYC for business and this is my go-to spot. Fantastic location near all public transport and in the heart of midtown (and near the Park). The rooms are spacious, modern and clean and are actually better appointed than some of the "luxury" places that are several times the prices. Staff is very professional. When I first heard the price I was expecting one of the run down, rickety, noisy places that are priced similarly in Time Square - this could not be further from the case. Bright, comfortable, modern rooms, really nice lobby. There is a HUGE bar area to meet clients or friends - I wish they served food, but there is no shortage of great eating options close by. This place is one of the best kept secrets in Manhattan - it is a great hotel and the outstanding value just makes it all the more amazing!

Everything is as described so remember that there is no restaurant, there are no tea and coffee makings in the room, there is a small kiosk in reception that does coffee, soup, snacks, there is a large lounge and nice bar. You will need to go out if you want cooked breakfast. You will be charged an extra £20+ per night for the hotel facilities which are wifi and a gym! The hotel is in a busy location, it is noisy so go for a room that's higher up. We did 14th floor and still got to experience the city that never sleeps!! If you were after an upgrade for the city views then check what you're expecting to see - yes we saw other ordinary buildings so not sure what I was expecting for my extra dollars per night. The thermostat in the room is just for show and the temperature in your room can only be adjusted if you ask at reception! All you can do is turn the fan on which isn't a lot of good if it's cold. No information in the room to tell you about the location or hotel facilities.

Clean hotel in a very convenient location. Reasonably priced during the winter months. Rooms are very cozy and spacious. Within walking distance to Central Park, Broadway, Museum of Modern Art, Times Square. Subway located a block away.

We stayed for 5 nights to celebrate my daughters 18th birthday . Check in was fine we arrived before 12 pm and 1 room was ready so we were able to leave our cases there until after 2 pm when our room became available. This went without a hitch . The rooms were comfortable , clean and adequate however after reading other reviews a kettle coffee / tea making facilities would have been good .The hotel has a takeaway coffee / sandwich shop in the reception which was useful but quite pricey . There are plenty of cafe coffee shops close by though .We had drinks in hotel bar which were resonably priced and we did take advantage of happy hour .The hotel was in an excellent position . Time Square was a 10 minute walk one way and Central Park was a 10 minute walk the other . There were plenty of metro station close by .All in all a fantastic hotel . We found the staff to be helpful and welcoming .We would definitely return .

From the front desk checkin to the front desk departure, this hotel is terrible. The personnel on the desk is not welcoming, friendly, nor helpful. They actually tried to tell me that they would upgrade me from my king room to two doubles. When I asked how that was an upgrade, the gal said it would be a wonderful experience. On checkout, I waited 15 minutes, while 3 people took care of 2 different guests. When one went back over to her terminal she completely ignored me. She kept looking up at me, but never once responded or acknowledged me. There are a lot of upcharges. When I told the gal that I would not be using the fitness or business center, she told me I had to pay for it anyway. It didn't matter. Also, there is an advertisement on their website for a discounted coffee and Danish. When I inquired about that, I was told that I didn't qualify as I had booked my room before the promotion started. All in all, I hated this hotel. I have stayed at many hotels in NYC, but this is the last time I will stay here. STAY AWAY!!

Last time we were in NYC we stayed at The New Yorker. Park Central was WAY better than that hotel. The room was bigger, the bathroom was huge in comparison. We never had to wait longer than a minute for the elevator so I'm not sure why people have complained about that. The lobby was beautiful and so was the room. We didn't have much of a view (which we asked for) but that wasn't a big deal. The beds and pillows were super comfortable as well! There are 2 different coffee shops right beside the hotel as well as a food truck on the corner that sells fabulous coffee for $1!! We loved this hotel and will definitely stay here again on our next trip to New York.

My fiance' and I spent 4 nights at the Park Central. We happened to be there right in the middle of the epic blizzard. No major complaints.....the hotel was clean, the staff were friendly. I had read other reviews regarding the wait times at elevators, didn't have any problems with that at all. We did have problems with the heat not working on 3 different occasions.......and they sent a maintenance person up quickly. The only major complaint was that we had booked a king size room with view and ended up with 2 queens and a view of a brick wall. They told us we could switch the next day but every day we checked and there were no other rooms available. Not a huge deal, we weren't in NYC to spend time in our room anyway. It still would have been nice to get what we paid for. The other minor complaint would be that we booked this hotel through expedia because it had FREE wifi....but....upon check in were told there was a daily resort fee of $26 that includes wifi. That's NOT free wifi. The major advantage to this hotel is that it's perfectly located. Half way between Central Park and Time Square and across the street from Carnegie Hall. We walked everywhere in minutes. A lot of great restaurants in the neighbourhood as well.

I loved my room. The front desk, concierge and guest services staff were extra accommodating. I stayed during the Jonas snow storm and they were able to extend my reservation in a beautiful accessible room by two days. MOST of the housekeepers were very nice, helpful and respectful. I will definitely stay here again. However, one morning, I woke up to a housekeeper walking through the hallway saying "Wake Up" over and over in the hallway. On the previous night, I placed my do not disturb sign on the door handle. However, this same housekeeper knocked while trying to open the door. I had the latch on. I told her that I did not want service. She then says, "Well just let me come in and make sure you have enough towels". I told her no thanks and was a bit shaken that someone would just try to enter the room. On the day that I checked out (long before check out time), she just opened the door and started asking questions. This one housekeeper is not a good reason not to stay there. She just needs training.

Great place in nice area. Only complaints are that they need more elevators, hard to regulate temperature in the room, and no kitchen on site. Starbucks next door. Quiet compared to Times Square area which is too busy. Close to Central Park. Would stay again.

We have just retuned following a seven night stay at The Park Central Hotel. The hotel was welcoming, clean, stylish and staff were very helpful. Having seen reviews, I emailed in advance of our trip requesting a room with a view. The hotel upgraded us (at no extra cost) to a premium room with a partial view of Time Square, we were also given a voucher for two complimentary drinks in the hotel bar- a much appreciated gesture. The room had two very comfortable double beds, we asked for a fridge which was provided at no extra cost. The hotel is an easy walk to Central Park, Time Square, MoMA, several nice bars and restaurants and many other great places to visit. Be aware that there is a service charge to pay at the hotel which covers various things including the wifi. Overall lovely hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Very convenient location close to all amenities including subway station.Room quite spacious for NYC although lift only worked to one side of the hotel. Not the side where I had my room!Why do most NYC ensuite bathrooms as in this hotel have fixed over head showers and low level baths? not ideal....Nice lounge bar and seating area next to reception and very helpful staff, especially considering the wild condition's outside with the snowstorm in NYC.

Our visit to this hotel marked the end of our honeymoon and after a fantastic trip until this point we wished we hadn't booked this hotel as soon as we walked in the door. The key for check in was about 10-15 people long. We waited around 40 minutes to check in, during which time members of staff could be seen doing nothing in the lobby yet no apology or explanation was provided to the ever increasing line. When we eventually reached the front desk we received no apology and were met by a very rude member of staff who didn't even look at us, let alone explain anything about the hotel. We were given one key and told we couldn't have any more. In the lift we found out from another guest (who had been given a key to another guest's room) that the computer system was down. But no explanation of the issues does not make up for poor customer service. Our room was very disappointing. The bath was tiny and the room was very dirty, in particular the floor looked like it had never been vacuumed. We were in a low down room - floor 3 (even though we actually paid for a high floor) and the noise from the air conditioning unit was unbearable. We had internet problems so the next day tried to enquire about this at reception but were met by a very rude member of staff who again did not make eye contact, say hello or any other pleasantries. One morning I went out for coffee and left the do not disturb sign on the door (husband was asleep). I came back 10 minutes later to be met by angry cleaners trying to get in the room - what's the point of a do not disturb sign if you are going to ignore it.On check out we were charged for extras on our room which we never had - such as upgrade to premium rooms etc. We did get this rectified but staff again were very unfriendly during this.Our stay here was the worst hotel stay we have ever had and did spoil the end of an otherwise fantastic stay in America. It really isn't worth saving a few dollars to stay here...just a shame the fantastic location made it so attractive to us.

I've stayed at this hotel several times now and was thrilled I was staying here this past weekend especially due to Jonas. All rooms have been renovated and there is a large and beautiful lounge behind the concierge desk. Unfortunately they no longer have a restaurant however their coffee/snack shop is very nice. There are so many places to eat within a 2 block radius so there certainly was no problem even during this snow storm. It's the perfect location to walk to all Broadway theater's and Central Park is only 2 blocks. Within walking distance to many of the subway lines or grab a taxi anywhere. You can't go wrong staying at this hotel!

Daphne checked us in. We upgraded our room for my husbands birthday. Daphne was helpful and arranged for champagne to b delivered to the room. The room was clean and good size. The bed was very comfortable! My husband put the do not disturb sign on the door so manager elizabeth called me directly to gain access to deliver the champagne instead of just saying the sign was there so i couldnt do it. We were in a great spot to do all we wanted to do and the blizzard added a touch of wonder to our trip. Overall great hotel and service!

I stayed at the park central in August 2015 with my girlfriend and we were blown away with the quality of the rooms and the helpful nature of all the staff at the hotel. We were visiting for my girlfriends birthday and we were upgraded upon arrival which was fantastic and the reception staff were very kind in offering their best regards for her birthday. From the minute we arrived to when we checked out we were made to feel very welcome and nothing was too much to ask of any of the staff.We loved it that much that we have recommended the hotel to many friends and have booked up again to visit the hotel in November this year for thanksgiving! We will be hoping for the same service and hopefully another upgrade upon arrival for another fantastic room and stay in NYC when we arrive in November!

Rooms are descent and big enough. Great bed, and descent bathroom. Shower in the bad, this is for me a little minus. The view was not that interesting, so it surprised me you have to pay more for it, than you expect a nice view for the extra money. Little long waiting at the reception at checking in. But all together a good place, close to a lot of nice stuff. But than again whole NYC is nice stuff :-)

Over all our experience was good, we got caught in the big blizzard and our flight was delayed a few times and it was great that the hotel let us have the same room. They did have minimal housekeeping for those few days, however; it didn't appear that our room was vacuumed nor the bathroom floor swept during our entire stay. There was the same Bobbie pin on the bathroom floor in the same place our entire stay. I'm thinking it may still be there. We stayed 8 nights in total. The thing I was most displeased about was the gym, its not a big gym but it doesn't limit you on your work out, however; the $25 charge for each time you used it was a lot. My monthly gym member ship is only $24 and I have 10 times the equipment to use. I feel the use of the gym shouldn't have an extra fee on top of the room charges.It's in a very central local which is awesome, however; I don't think I'd say there again.

My best friend and I both turned 40 and picked nyc to celebrate. Not only was the location so brilliant, inbetween Time Sq and Central Park, but the hotel was beautiful.We were upgraded too and had a complimentary drink each for our birthdays. The staff were lovely especially customer relations.I would recommend this hotel to anyone and another friend of mine is booking it in October!

The room was spacious and comfortable - most of all it was very clean. I walked to the theatre and walked all over the city with Park Central as my base. Central Park was within walking distance and I just happened to be there as they were setting up for the NYC marathon - what a treat! The staff were very accommodating and kind. I would absolutely stay there again.

Stayed here during the blizzard, Jan 22-24! Clean, comfortable room. Bed was awesome, lots of hot water with great pressure (two very important features). Staff friendly and helpful. Great location. One downside was lack of bright lighting. Room way too dark even with all the lights on. Would be nice if fridge and microwave were standard but overall very happy with this hotel.

Was here for a mix of work/pleasure. We have over 500 people from our company at this hotel and you would never know it from the level of customer service we got. Every request was met with an additional fee or some sort of policy that did not allow for the request. Asked for 2 double beds, extra $54 per night. When was finally able to get the double beds, ended up in a room that was like a coffin. Low floor facing a blocked in courtyard with brick walls leading all the way to the sky and mechanical units below. the bathroom had ZERO space for anything except on top of the toilet. When asked to change rooms since i was staying for 4 nights, was told the policy was no room changes during the day. What???!!! Had to wait until the next day to get moved to another room which was a total hassle for our plans. Then the rooms themselves are junky. Not enough light in each room, the lamps are not bright enough. The closet has NO light and no light in the hallway near it, so you can't even see what is in the closet - I've never experienced anything like it! I had to use the camera light on my mobile phone to see the inside of the closet. The toilet paper holder was of such bad quality, the roll of paper came off every time (this was in both rooms plus others, as I discussed with colleagues). The water pressure was so low you could barely rinse the soap/shampoo off your body. I've been to plenty of NYC hotels that are small and modest. This was by far the worst. Bad rooms, bad staff, bad amenities. Don't waste your time or your money.

We stayed at the Park Central during the NYC snow emergency and the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. This was my second time staying here; we were attending a concert at Carnegie Hall which is right across the street so it made total sense. Please note: this is NOT a high service, mints on the pillow kind of hotel. It IS, however, in a fabulous location, clean, reasonably priced, decent sized rooms and well run. If you need a higher level of service, there are other options including the Westhouse (which Park Central owns) around the corner. We enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to return to the Park Central.

Very nice hotel, just North of Times Square and South of Central Park. View from 17th floor room was breathtaking. Clean, quiet room. Check in was easy, avoided check out by using key drop. Front desk was packed in the morning. Brooklyn Diner around the corner.

The room was nice, the service was good, the people are friendly. But the best place to hang out is the bar/lounge. The service is top notch, the drinks are really good, and it's very chill. There is a huge screen showing pics of NYC, and the furniture is really comfy.

I took my daughters to NYC to celebrate their 25th birthday for three nights and we stayed at the Park Central Hotel. It was recommended by my good friend. It was a great experience. Before reaching there I contacted the hotel to arrange for a surprise birthday for my daughters. I got a quick respond from the relationship manager Elizabeth Cacovic who arranged with me and made my life easy. She had an amazing caring attitude. The girls were impressed with her service and told me how sweet she was.The hotel was nice and rooms were comfortable. I recommend the hotel to anyone who wants to be in the time square and have a good time and enjoy a good hotel. 5 stars for me:)

Don't think we could have chose a better hotel to stay at in the city. The room was perfect with a bit of a view of the streets below, it was cleaned every day. The staff at the hotel were always happy to help during anytime of the day. The wifi was really good to working 100% of the time and wasn't some crappy slow wifi either. Didn't make use of other facilities like the gym but they looked pretty good. They had a bar and snacks bar within the hotel but they were really over priced considering you had places like Starbucks and Irish bars right outside the hotel. In one direction you had The centre of Times Square and in the other the start of Central Park. Will definitely try and stay here again in the future.

My family and I stayed here for the weekend of Christmas and we had a pretty good stay. The room was clean, the staff was very helpful and friendly. There are lots of deli's and restaurants nearby. It's a short walk to Times Square and the heart of the city. The train is within a 1-minute walk from the front door of the hotel which is very convenient in order to get around the city, the hotel is centrally located and having the train a few steps away makes it easy to get anywhere fairly easily.They do charge a $25 facilities fee, so make sure you understand that as you book your stay. The only negative thing I would have to say is that there are only 2 elevators and when it's time to check out it can take you a while to get downstairs.Overall it was a great stay and having to wait a few minutes to get downstairs to check out wasn't too bad as we had planned some extra time into our stay before heading to the airport.

This was my fourth time in this hotel. I always stay here mainly because of its great location. I was there on mid November and noticed it has been renovated since the last time I stayed a few years ago. The did a great job, contemporary but warm at the same time, elegant and unpretentious decor, it fits my taste. If anything I wish the bathrooms were a bit larger but it is New York so it's expected. I went back early January so I prepaid for 10 days since I got a great deal this way. On my 3rd day there I had a call from a family member explaining that my father was in the hospital so I had to rush home the next day. I explained the situation to Angela, who helped me a lot, and assured me she was going to explain the situation to the manager. The manager came over and assured me they will give me a refund for the rest of the stay that I prepaid. Angela helped me with getting a last minute ticket to Europe and the manager even brought me a bottle of water when he noticed how worried I was about my father. They did everything they could to help me. I also want to thank Emanuel Zayas who helped me get a great room this last time when I emailed in advance before my arrival, a high floor room with great view of Times Square and even a mini fridge I asked for in advance. The hotel bar is really nice and the rooms are comfortable and elegant. Times square is only three or fourth blocks away, Broadway, several Starbucks near by and very close to 5th Ave. I highly recommend Park Central. I will certainly go back to this hotel soon, not just because it is a great hotel but because I always feel at home here and the staff is the best.

We have just returned from 5 nights at Park Central. The room we were allocated was very nice, easily a 4 star with brilliant views down to Times Square. The room was cleaned daily and the bed was very comfortable, we were really happy with the room. The bar area is nice but was too expensive for us to have more than one drink there. The Deli shop stocks good food, but again, far too expensive. The staff were fine, we didn't have a problem with anyone as I've read in other reviews, but I wouldn't describe it as great service either. The location is perfect and a real plus for anyone wanting to visit the tourist attractions.We did have a bad experience on our last night but not all down to the hotel. A strong smell of weed came under the door from another room. It got stronger to the point I felt sick and eyes were stinging. No-one answered when we called reception several times. My partner had to get dressed and went down and informed the staff, they said they would send security up. The fumes were awful. I didn't hear anyone come up to check it out but it did stop a while later. Apparently they didn't appear overly concerned. Luckily we didn't have children with us.Overall in my opinion this is an average hotel, given all of the above.

I've never stayed in a New York City hotel before as I'm a native New Yorker. However, I've been to lobbies and a few rooms of some of the better hotels in the city. This hotel was fairly decent. I didn't have any complaints. Pros: in a central location and very close to the subway; decent coffee for purchase in the lobby; can hangout forever in the lounge area until your room is ready; friendliest staff I've experienced almost anywhere; nice size room with good wifi. Cons: No room service (a drag when you don't want to go out); room could use a little repair; no view whatsoever (I felt as if I was staying in a cave as my window faced a brick wall and was above some sort of blocked in alley -- but I did not expect a view in this part of NYC); a huge, eerie picture of a multicolored head hung above the toilet and made me feel as if I were being watched while in the bathroom.

This hotel has just been updated and the rooms are great! Comfy beds and large bath, only issue was air conditioner did not work room was unusually warm for January so it was stuffy, day after arrival I figured out how to open window which helped, maintenance did come when called but with window open didn't need them. Hotel Loy he bar doesn't open till 5pm would have been nice if it opened earlier. I got a good date on Groupon and it was well worth it, hotel location is so convenient to Manhattan sights, hot spots!!

In my last trip to New York City I stayed three nights at this hotel. Even though the hotel has a couple of good things, I would not recommend you to stay at this hotel.First of all, it is really central located, but I would say that is the only thing good about this hotel.The bed is also confortable, but I must say, I had to sleep in a not very clean room, because the wall at the entrance of the room and at the bathroom-furniture were dirty. I reported that immediately and the hotel sent at the next day the cleaning-staff. I think, for the price you pay at this hotel, you should get from the beginning a clean room, don´t you think so?The hotel is really huge, that means, there are a lot of tourists in there, the problem is, for a very big amount of people, there are only two elevators, and if you want to go into your room or out of the hotel, you have to wait at least 5 minutes on the elevator-line.I payed in advance a stay with a "one dollar breakfast package at the central market" and the hotel charged on my credit card 31 Dollar. I saw that in the check out- sheet, that the hotel left at the morning of my departure in my room and I went down to the reception in order to get an explanation. The man at the front desk told me that was a mistake and that they would not charge me anything. THAT WAS A BIG LIE!!! I believed that and went home. Then I realise that the amount was charged in my credit card. I wrote a mail on December 31st and I haven´t received neither an answer nor my refund.Also, you can hear noises from the upper room.The last thing I have to say is that the atmosphere at this hotel is really impersonal, I mean, they treat you really cold, and I didn´t feel that somebody really care.For the price you pay, you would certainly find better options in NY.

Stayed here on my first trip to NYC with my wife and was pleased with our choice. Location was great within easy walking distance of many popular areas such as central park, times square, 5th avenue, broadway, etc. Room was nice with a comfortable bed and nice TV. Fitness center was decent as well. Free wifi was good speed and reliable.Would stay here again for the value, but so many other hotels in NYC I would also be tempted to try something else for comparison.

We stayed at this hotel for a week in January 2016. The location was perfect for what we wanted to do, either in Central Park or Times Square. It is located across the street from Carnegie Hall and there are great restaurants all around, as well as subway access. The hotel staff was helpful and the rooms were kept very clean and tidy. Other than a grumpy bell-man, we didn't encounter a single glitch. We will be back again.

Visually this hotel is lovely and the location is excellent, however the service is poor. It's a 4 star hotel but the bar doesn't open till 5. I was informed I needed to go down to guest services to get a bottle opener, glasses etc. No fridge or basic tea or coffee facilities in the room. Bar staff were not well aquainted with the wines on the menu. All contributed to a disappointing experience on our honeymoon.

Mid range hotel in NYC. Convenient for Central Park and other mid town attractions. All the NYC issues: small room , inadequate elevators , expensive , upbeat bar- it's functional and I am happy to stay here when my company pays. However , it's not endearing, so this has to compete on price before I would book myself. No coffee in room , no iron - hallways a little dreary. Functionally room was clean and modern. No objections , just not memorable .

After a week log stay at the Park Central, I am compelled to write a positive review. First, this hotel is centrally located: just two blocks from Central Park one way and a few more to Times Square. Secondly, our room was a great size, especially for New York standards. Although there is no restaurant within the hotel, there are tons of restaurants within walking distance. The hotel does have a full bar, and cafe that is open early with breakfast items. Although most of the front desk staff was less than helpful, Elizabeth at guest relations goes above and beyond to make your stay comfortable. Prices were very reasonable for such a great location. Great place overall!

What a fantastic hotel one member of staff was absolutely amazing so helpful, genuine and kind CARMELO works outside he was the first person we met and he had such a great manner we knew we could trust him. He has continued to help us with directions, places to shop, eat anything you need ask CARMELO he has made our stay truly an amazing experience we will defentinley be returning to this hotel. Hotel is clean and everything is to top standard, rooms are spotless. This hotel makea you feel like you are at home the people are great. From Leah and Chris in room 1165 xxxxx

My wife booked a room at this hotel through Travelocity and paid in advance for a room with one king sized bed. When we checked in on 1/6/2016, we were told that they were over sold and that no rooms with king beds were available. My wife was looking forward to a birthday stay in NYC and reminded the folks at the front desk that they took Her reservation and Her money for a king, and that was what we wanted. A second representative was called and informed us that they had no rooms available with a king but they would put us in room with 2 queen beds. When we got to the room, there were 2 standard beds. Some romantic stay. The front desk personnel at this hotel were never rude but weren't gracious and weren't truthful. They had a superior attitude and not just with us. A group of women approached the same gentleman who didn't help us and informed him that one of the only two available elevators wasn't working. He told them in the same superior tone that He used with us "be patient it is working". We noticed the elevator doors open on our floor, floor 9, obviously stuck. Overall, the hotel is conveniently located across from Carnegie Hall and close to Times Square, but with so many other better choices close by, we won't be staying here again, and wouldn't recommend it to anyone. The hotel is just OK and with poor service it's a bad combination.

This hotel looks the part but that is where it stops really. The reception staff couldn't be less helpful and couldn't even offer eye contact unless you didn't appear to be going away. Despite paying to upgrade the room on booking the hotel, there was no more then a hair dryer in it. the bathroom needed upgrading or at least the broken plug replaced, and if you are going to stay you will need to take ear plugs because as well as the city you can hear every movement and door from your fellow guests. There was daily room service but they came between 8am and 8.20am every morning and were happy to let themselves in if you didn't get out of bed or the shower quick enough. The hotel, despite its size, also only has two tiny lifts! The hotel is in a good location and the bed was a redeeming feature, but if your staying anything more then a night or at a push weekend I couldn't recommend this hotel. we were there 5 nights and couldn't leave quick enough!

My husband surprised me with an action packed day and an overnight in the City. While he went back and forth on a few choices this hotel seemed to be the best. The Good Location- close to Central Park in better weather this would be a great plus-close, but not too close to Times Square-easy access to subways- if only the E train was running the weekend we went!-since it was on 7th Avenue cab fares didn't add up to too much-walking distance to the theater district- its not easy to get a cab after a show lets out-very close to Carnegie Hall and a couple of decent restaurantsHotel =general-nice lobby-helpful reception- the man at check-in was the nicest! He was friendly, interested in pleasing his customers and easily engaged in conversation- great first impression!-luggage drop was close to the front desk and manned by 2-3 people for good service. We arrived long before check in at 12. We were able to leave our bags and go--this was great!-small shop with wine, drinks, sandwiches , cheeses, snack right in the lobby with a pleasant and helpful lady working the counter. Yes, it was quite expensive....but you pay for the convenience.-elevators- a bit small and little slow for a hotel of this size, but still fineRoomPositive -- sleek, clean and modern with a pretty designbathroom - large with an updated and sleek design -rain showerhead with great pressurehad a small refrigeratorcomfortable bed and pillows with a nice duvetnice and comfortable chairgreat use of space, BUT -NYC hotels have notoriously small rooms. While the design team obviously gave some great thought in making the best possible use of available space, the space between the bed and the dresser, desk, bench was so narrow that we could barely walk by without turning our bodies sideways. This definitely got annoying after awhile and if we had been staying for more than a night or two at the most, it would have driven us totally bonkers! My husband did get a great rate through Priceline, so this may have attributed to the given room choice (although we were staying in an upgraded room). While we we checking out I peeked into two other rooms that were getting cleaned and they were much more spacious.NegativeNothing really stood out here. My only comment is that the concierge ladies should act a bit less snooty. The attitude was subtle, but there nonetheless. It was 'let me listen with a fake smile, give a very quick answer along with the 'eyes' so they will hurry away and let me finish my conversation' I guess this stood out even more because every other hotel employee we had contact with was genuinely nice and helpfulWould I go back again....absolutely! Would I recommend it to family and friends....absolutely -with the tight quarters warning just in case.

My boyfriend and I loved staying at Park Central hotel. We were on the 9th floor with no view the first night, then moved to the 17th floor on the other side of the building for the remainder of our stay. Both rooms were beautiful and clean--modern decor and great bathroom lighting. The beds were glorious as well. I asked for a fan to be delivered to the room because I need to hear the constant buzz to sleep. I'm not sure if this is why I didn't have any problem (like some of the reviews) with hearing street noise or not. I'm a light sleeper but had no issue with noise or trouble sleeping. The location was awesom. Just a short walk South is Times Square, and to the North a couple blocks is Central Park. There are numerous restaurants, bars, shops, and tourist attractions very near by. Elizabeth C. from guest relations went above and beyond to ensure we were comfortable and having a great visit down to the very end of our stay. She even volunteered to give us a late check out since our flight home wasn't until late in the evening. We will definitely stay at Park Central again next time we visit NYC!

Never, I repeat never EVER stay at this hotel. It's rooms are ridiculously tiny, which is not unusual for New York, but the real problem is there is no refrigerator or microwave and THE WALLS ARE PAPER THIN. I had several friends come on this trip that stayed in several rooms and you can here a pen drop in the room down the hall. It's ridiculous, I could hear my friend on the phone with me two rooms away. The staff is TERRIBLE, the cleaning service raided my room and another friends room of jewelry and hidden money. I am disgusted with this hotel, I have never stayed in such an awful place. I had another friend who was on the phone with his girlfriend, let me inform you he is a very nice guy and honestly very quiet, he's kind of shy and very kind. And was not in any way causing a disturbance in my opinion, it was only 11pm in the city that never sleeps and he was waiting on the elevator, and all the sudden a man from the room over came out and jumped on my friend and started beating the heck out of him. Luckily, after calling security the man was pulled off of my friend, but this is another reason that the walls being so thin is an issue. I hate this hotel. And I will never be back.

Stayed here this past weekend. An updated hotel that need some help. Sheets are short and would not stay tucked in also desk chair is broken and would not roll. No restaurant and express cafe is very expensive. $7.62 for a beer. Nice location but probably not come back.

Most of the poor reviews are because of some significant issue that happened that ruined someone's vacation or poor service that was not appreciated by the author. This review is somewhat similar but I believe that there are some upside to this hotel and they deserve that bit of respect.First, this hotel is in the perfect location just outside the hustle and bustle of Time Square and 2 blocks from the south end of Central Park. It is situated where everything is within walking distance and not at the cost of those hotels on Times Square. This is not a high end Four Seasons or Plaza but is a great mid range hotel. It has a classy feel and it is a respected property. The rooms are modern, clean and well laid out and the beds are very comfortable. Check in and check out was efficient and the staff were pleasant.Now the bad, elevators are very slow as some have written about, that has to be taken care of. When we checked into the hotel in the evening our rooms heater did not work. So we reported it to the management and they said they will take care of it. We just got in and wanted to get something to eat so we said ok, we will go out to eat and when we get back we will check with you. So we went out to eat (hotel does not have a dedicated restaurant), took a quick walk around Times Square and then returned. When we returned and talked with the staff we talked to earlier, he advised it was repaired and it was only the filter. We went to the room and it was still cold (January???). So we reported it to the front desk and they said they would send an engineer. He responded 20 minutes later, did some checks and said it was not repairable (funny at 12 midnight that he was not the one who supposedly repaired it earlier). So he said that he will report it to the front desk and they will contact us by phone. Another 30 minutes passed and no call. Whet downstairs and talked with the front desk and she didn't know anything about it. So they said hang out until someone checks the room they will put us in and they will send a bellman up to move us to the new room. He showed up with the key and said he was only delivering the key so he had no idea he was to move our bags. So they got us another room lower floor, 2 queens, no view except a interior brick wall with no natural light, and the hotel machinery just below. We moved in and it was plenty hot as they had the heater at 80 degrees. Funny, we had a reservation for a high floor and a King. We didn't get what we booked and we even informed them we were a late check in. Yes they comp'd the resort fee and even said if we wanted to get a higher floor they would take care of it the next day. So they tried to make it right, we decided it was more of a hassle to try to get the other room as we had only 4 days in the city and a lot to see. I was not appreciative of the fact it was late night/early morning and the lack of urgency and I don't know if I believe what the night manager told me about the repair. But it is what it is, and I did not want to let this ruin our long weekend. My wife would like to add that in both rooms, the lighting in the bathrooms are very poor, light in the mirror, or the spot behind you head, so you see a lot of shadows. Finally, if you are one that gets what you booked and did not have any issues, this hotel is worth trying for the price and it is close to everything in Manhattan.

Really enjoyed our break and bed so comfortable - shower great also. Brilliant location for everything-Camello Concierge was fab. Ray barman lovely also. Just a few small things - lifts - only 2 and often very crowded and slow. Checkout stated as mid-day but our key was deactivated before this time, city tax - just an extra cost added on and whilst cleaning standard excellent our room was not often cleaned before 6pm - awkward if going out again and further showers needed or just wishing to relax after a busy day. If you can put up with those things then all is great.

1st morning: I am an early riser. Need coffee ASAP. None in room or hotel. Must leave hotel to obtain. Otherwise the hotel is clean and location is great. However, was not allowed in lounge area to drink my coffee. Must go to balcony area. Not sure why?

This hotel has a perfect location - very close to Times Square but not too close. Also right next door to a subway stop so traveling the city is super easy. Concierge was very helpful. Room was spacious and clean. I did not like that you had to request a refrigerator, and that it doesn't come with the room automatically. I also liked the decor of the bar/seating area behind the check in desk, but I was confused if the bar was actually open; I often saw a lot of boxes stacked high, so it looked like more of a storage area, that was disappointing. Small cafe in the hotel was nice, but there is no full restaurant in the hotel, which was surprising, but not a problem as there are many places to eat nearby. Great place to stay for New Years Eve! We enjoyed our stay.

Biggest gripe. Arrived from a late flight and no bell boy. With 4 travelling we had plenty of cases. Receptionist , she was very matter of fact. No warm fuzzy feeling for a first trip to NYC! . Did ask if we required assistance but pointless as we had already assisted ourselves. Only 2 small lifts so a wait at peak times. Discovered 2 other lifts on 3rd floor referring to a different hotel down the corridor???Grab and go market in reception.
