Nice room, beds really comfy but big old floor mounted aircon unit and portable fan heater. No coffee machine. Pleased we had a corner premier room on a high floor as traffic noisy. Other than our initial greeting, all other staff very nice and attentive especially when we needed them to check out the guys in the room adjacent who were heavily smoking and up all hours with many coming and going from the room hmmm... Glamorous reception so you expect exceptional quality but quite different once you make your way to the rooms. Huge and beautiful lounge area but under utilised. No restaurant. Told it created too big a loss with outside competition. Stones throw from Central Park and subway close. Walk straight up to Times Square so great locality. . This place could be magnificent given the beautiful features inside and it's locality. May consider again if price is right but prefer being looked after from start to finish. First impressions count for a lot.

My 2 gfs and I visited NYC for the first time Oct 2015 and we stayed at Park Central. The hotel is beautiful, rooms are clean, spacious, and very modern looking. I loved the location, right between Times Square and Central Park. Employees were great and provided excellent customer service. WIll definitely be coming back!

Park Central Hotel was a good, clean, convenient hotel for our family's trip to NY during the Christmas break. The hotel is close to the park, subway, Times Square and easy to get into and out of when you are arriving and leaving the city by car.I would warn guests that their check in and check out procedures aren't the most efficient and at times can have long lines but the rest of the time its a very convenient stay.

Took my daughters and daughter law to NYC for a weekend in December, and the Park Central was "spot on!" We wanted to stay away from Times Square and the Theater District, and the Park Central was a perfect place. Close to Central Park, too, where we went to the Christmas open market on Columbus Circle. They upgraded our room to a larger queen room, which was very spacious and comfortable. Elevators were a bit slow but I think the hotel was at capacity that weekend so that's understandable. There is a small cafe downstairs if you want to grab coffee, soft drinks, muffins, bagels, etc. The concierge and front desk managers were very attentive and helpful, too! We will be back again next Christmas, and I've already recommended the Park Central Hotel to several friends! And, of course, being in NYC at Christmas time is just amazing!

Ok, we visited as a party of 4; older couple and two teens.Two rooms a king and 2 queens. Took a while to check in, but the front desk was really helpful. The rooms are large (for a capital city), newly refurbished and smart, with large flat screen TVs. No tea and coffee facilities in room, which is disappointing for Europeans; yes you can get it in the lobby but not naked...... if you get what i mean!There are other reviews that mention surly staff; yes we noticed this to, but only some not all. But a number of staff made sure you knew a tip was expected; well this is USA and most travellers know this and don't need reminding; not nice.Again, others have mentioned the food (lack of a restaurant) and we heard guests complaining about the breakfast package. There is a food servery at the back of the bar. Overall I rated the hotel very good, in particular because it is nicely appointed and was good value. TOP TIP eat breakfast out. There is a fab bakery "Fluffys" opposite where a good breakfast with coffee is $7 or a big plate with coffee $11, or nearby try the Brooklyn diner (finer diner) maybe for brunch; bit dearer but really nice food in a traditional diner (neons and all!) setting.

Have stayed here a number of times. Location is near Central Park, 5th Ave. and Times Square. They're right on top of the Subway, and it was convenient to get to downtown for business meetings. I recommend booking direct with the hotel as they then know and recognize you for better service. e.g. My flight arrived early - they had a room available and let me check in at 7AM.

We had a great time staying at Park Central. The room are nice and clean and for New York standard big compared to others. We stayed there for 6 nights. The small deli in the lobby is a great alternative to restaurants.

Stayed in this hotel January 7-11th. I'm not one to write a negative review, but me and my partner were a bit disappointed with this hotel. Upon arrival there was around 8/9 people checking in with only one member of staff so we were queueing for awhile. Room was clean and quite modern which was nice. Unfortunately there are only two lifts available and being a hotel with 20+ floors this is quite inconvenient as we often found ourselves waiting awhile for the lift. BE AWARE - there is a mandatory fee of $25 plus tax per night that you stay in this hotel. They claim it is for use of the computers, gym and luggage storage. When we informed the lady we didn't need any of those services she said it is a mandatory fee that we would have already been told about at booking. This had never been mentioned to us previously, and we were told that we had to pay the fee or we couldn't stay. This was a bit disappointing as this is quite a large charge considering non of the services were necessary for us at all. The one thing I would say that is fantastic about this hotel is its location. It is 2 blocks away from Central Park, and a short 5-10 minutes walk from Times Square. It truly is in a fantastic location!! All in all we were slightly disappointed with the hotel, but if you wouldn't mind waiting around awhile and paying the extra charges then I would recommend this hotel simply for its location.

This is an excellent midtown location right on Central Park South. Prices vary by the week, but we got a very good price for a January fun weekend. Can walk to Broadway theaters as well as Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall, MOMA, and shopping on Fifth Avenue. Rooms are very nice and larger than average NY hotel room. Staff is excellent and very friendly. Eat somewhere else to save money. My only complaint is the mandatory "resort fee" that covers wi-fi and a bunch of other stuff we didn't need. That jacks up the reasonable price by about $30 a night (plus tax).

Very well located to many of the places we wanted to visit during our short stay in NY. Convenient to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. Spacious, comfortable rooms. We will stay here again on our next trip, but this time make it longer than one night.

Booked into this hotel for its location, perfect for all the sights and for New Year's Eve. Doesn't have a restaurant, which isn't great and also found most of the staff to be miserable. We did a split booking as went to Washington for three nights and the hotel wouldn't store our luggage while we were away. We were travelling to Washington on the train so didn't want to take big suitcases with us, but we had no choice. Hotel was clean, but only two lifts available to each of the floors which means waiting around for ages at busy times. Also the additional charge of $25 per night + tax is just a rip off. Most people are on holiday and are not going to use the hotel facilities that this charge apparently covers. The only thing that most people are likely to use is wifi, which really wouldn't cost that much per night anywhere. Not sure how the hotel gets away with making the charge mandatory in all honesty.

We stayed at the Park Central in July after a coast to coast trip across the states. This hotel was a great way to end our trip, the room was spacious and the beds comfortable. They included all the amenities you would expect from a hotel and the staff were friendly and approachable. The hotel is centrally located and only a short walk from Times Square and other attractions. We were extremely happy and would definitely stay here again.

I stayed two nights the location is great the center of everything you can walk to everywhere from the hotel. Nice and friendlly staff & clean place to stay with family two. The room was comfortable and big for NY hotel.

We stayed here this week whilst on our honeymoon in NYC. Upon arrival we made our way to check in, we were half an hour early for check but the lady let us up to our room on the 8th floor. When we got to the room we discovered that the heating didn't work and he room was freezing. I went to the front desk and told the staff what was wrong and they said they were sending an engineer up to have a look. Not off to a good start I though. So half an hour passed and no one showed up so I went down again and spoke to a nicer guy Brian. He assured me someone would be up very soon. I also queried that I paid extra for a high floor and he said that anything over floor 6 is a high floor. ( I doubt that ). Anyway he said that the next day we would move to a room on the 17th floor which was great although we had to check out bags into the luggage room the next day and were not allowed to get our new roomUntil 4pm the next day. I thought that was annoying. All in all the hotel was clean and tidy although the customer service from some of the staff could have been better. Would I stay here again. I would need to think about it. Great location though.

We arrived on New Years eve 2015 at 7.30pm and due to road blocks had to walk a few blocks to the hotel. On arrival we were greeted by a very friendly front desk girl and promptly checked in, our room was spacious and very clean. Our stay was for 6 wonderful nights and were very impressed by all aspects of this hotel we felt very comfortable during our stay. The proximity to Central Park, Times Square, the subway etc made this hotel a real winner for us. We would not hesitate to stay there on our next trip to NYC. Thank you Park Central for a very memorable stay.

We visit NYC three or four times each year. Frequently we use time share we own in the Manhattan Club on 7th Avenue. This trip we had no time available at the Club so we tried the Park Central (it is in the same building as the Manhattan Club, but occupies different floors. The quoted price was amazingly low...less than half what we are used to spending at a Fairfield Inn in Brookiyn. We arrived , were greeted promptly, warmly and politely and moved on to our room. Though not spacious, our accommodations were comfortable, spotless, tastefully decorated and looked fresh.Bed, HVAC, Bath, bath amenities and maid service were all top notch. WIFI was fast, free and reliable. The only dowsnside was the lack of in-room coffee and no mini fridge. At $135.00 a night double I can live without either of those.Carnegie Hall is across the street, Lincoln Center 5 blocks away and the theatre district is even closer.We'll be back!\BTW residency at Park Central gets you a discount at the Red Eye Grill. Red Eye is a beautifu;l room, has one of the Best bartenders in Gotham (Shannon) live music at night and an interesting and rewarding menue.

My name is Miriam Magalhaes and my family and relatives have been staying at park central hotel for more than 9 years ... We come every year to celebrate our son's achievements ( last one his graduation from Pace university as an actor )Each time I come ... It gets better... The rooms are super nice, the location is unbeatable !!! Near everywhere you want to see and do in NYC but the reason why I keep staying here is because of its staff, especially Elizabeth who always welcome my family and I with that great smile making us feel at our home in New York City ... Park central has become our home we arrived in NYC spent a couple of days fro Xmas time and then we headed for Vermont for skiing then we came back to park central for more 7 nights full of fun As a platinums member of Tony Robbins group I travel a lot and here I can see everything that I have learned in business being applied by Elizabeth who really knows how to add value to the hotel guests Not only taking care of us but I remember the first time I saw her serving a client ... It is in her DNA to enchant the customer From the entrance to the room everybody is willing to serve and make our stay as wonderful as possible Thank you all thank you Elizabeth

We travelled to New York in December for the first time and we wanted to stay at hotel in a good location for a reasonable rate, all of which Park Central provides. Situated a stone throw away from Central Park, Times Square and 5th Ave this little gem is tucked away in a prime spot to explore the city! The hotel itself is modern with a grand entrance, staff are friendly and personally value for money exceeded my expectations! When you travel to NYC you are spoilt for choice with hotels, some of which are v pricey. If you are looking for a hotel that will place you centrally between tourist attractions at a decent price this hotel is for you! Definitely recommended and look forward to my next visit :)

This was our third stay at the hotel and could tell that it had been recently updated with the lobby looking a lot more modern. The rooms have been updated as well, in particular the bathrooms. Location is the key standout feature. The hotel is centrally located on 7th Avenue within a few minutes walk of Central Park and Times Square. Rockefeller etc are all walking distance as well. Carnegie is across the road. The hotel has a small store (which we didn't try) with lots of eating places nearby. There is a supermarket nearby as well (near Carnegie Hall). We had two adults and two kids in the room (with 2 beds) and found the space adequate. Whilst the bathroom was very modern, it was quite small with very little space. There is no fridge in the room (though each floor has an ice dispenser). Kettles can be requested at no cost. Free wifi was great. The hotel also has a gym on the third floor. Staff at check in was relatively friendly and helpful, but calling them from the room was difficult. I had a question about something but despite continuous ringing, they never answered the phone. On another occasion, I had a request for Housekeeping and though I left s message, they never got back to me. Lifts can be very slow. We ended up taking the stairs a few times though we were on the 7th floor. All in all, we enjoyed our stay despite the small issues noted.

Every Christmas I come to New York to spend time with friends and family Its the most magical time of the year filled with Love and Joy Getting in to the room of park Central Hotel makes me feel that after a long journey I have finally arrived home I would like to thank the hotel and the staff for making my stay pleasant and Joyful!!! Big thanks to Elizabeth Cacovic for assisting me during the stay She makes me welcome and helps me with all my requests thank you again, I wish you beautiful prosperous year aheadSincerely Daniella D

Was in a great spot just a short walk from time square and Central Park, nice helpful staff, cleaner was great help to us. Would defo stay again easy access to the subway one block walk.very clean and tidy

Wonderful hotel: clean, modern, chic. We would definitely recommend!! Not only is the hotel close to Central Park and all the other nearby attractions -- Rockefeller Center, Times Square, It is also surrounded by great amenities subway stations, drug stores, cafes.However, upon check in, and the front desk staff in general, are not very friendly and/or helpful. Unfortunately, there is no true restaurant on site, nor room service.

This best part about this hotel is its location. So close to times square and central park. he rooms are comfortable and clean. It can be a little pricey but you can find good deals out there. Would stay there again if the price is good.

Great hotel, clean and modern! Staff were good to deal with ESP the gentleman organising car service for our parties! Housekeeping was also very prof and rooms were well kept for our stay. The bar area been open during the day for guests to relax in is a major bonus.....

Looks are deceiving. When you enter the lobby you'll think, wow this place looks great! beautiful decor, I'm glad I picked this place...well it stops at the lobby, that's as good as it gets. The common area where can you go to read a book, relax, check email or plug-in and charge your tech was nice and modern, but strewn with empty water bottles, litter, etc. very dirty, not cleaned up in the slightest. Everywhere you look there were wrappers and trash I don't know how the staff could possibly ignore it it was ridiculous.The bar" is pathetic in its lack of stock and limited options with little service, if that's what you want to call it. Then trying get to your room is absolutely ridiculous! there are two, yes two elevators to serve the entire hotel!!! Please imagine how long the line to get into these tiny elevators is. With over 19 floors to service 2 elevators is just unacceptable! At one point in our stay we walked down the stairs from the 15th floor as opposed to waiting for the elevator because it took so long and they were packed every time they stopped. And then let's talk about the rooms. there is no refrigerator, I repeat, no refrigerator, nothing no water no coffee nothing! Although the room had updated decor it was not the cleanest room I've been in. the bathroom had two gigantic windows in the shower that the wind blew through thus the entire bathroom was freezing!!! Then imagine taking a shower in January...brrrrrrr. Not a hotel we'll be staying at ever again nor would I ever recommend it to anyone.

We took a last minute overnight trip. We got a fabulous rate in a lovely hotel. Great location with valet parking, which we also received for a wonderful rate. The hotel itself was quite beautiful in a sleek, deco sort of way. It was clean & well maintained.Now for the downside:Forgot our toothpaste. Requested some. It never showed up.Our room was for 2 people in a King bed. I would expect amenities for 2 people. Only had one drinking glass & one bar of hand soap.No coffee pot.The shower had dispensers for shampoo, conditioner & body wash. The shampoo & body wash were both empty & there was only one bar of hand soap for the sink.There were no blankets. The bed had 2 light sheets on it, but there were no blankets on the bed or in the closet, but the bed & pillows were spectacularly comfy.Let us not forget the fire alarm test at 9 AMWhile none of that was earth shattering, it was mildly annoying. A hotel that pays attention to detail, should pay attention to ALL the details

The staff and service was top notch. The business mgr Liz went above and beyond to make me feel at home and feel so welcomed. The location is great, centrally located to travel across town and two blocks away from Central Park. I was pleased to find out that the rooms and hotel were recently renovated and well maintained. I stayed during January so the room rates were great deal. Wish I could look that $100 per night rate all year long. In summary, it's a nice hotel, that is clean, with courteous staff and located just blocks away from the Theater District and Central Park.

Our 14th year at the Park Central excellent as usual. From the door man, the reception desk, , luggage check, housekeeping and the young lady at the Central Market. Friendly, efficient and always helpful.Our room as always excellent. Door man friendly and quick to ask if you need help or directions. Elevators waiting for us everytime we turned the corner to use it. The only time we waited was one morning when guest were checking out, less than 4 minutes if that. Thank you to Don Fraser and Elizabeth Cacovic for their consideration and the staff of the Park Central.Looking forward to year 15!Carol M. Chadwick

Now, before I booked my reservations, i did my research. I saw a lot of people complaining about elevators being small (which causes minimal load of people and more waiting), staffs being unapproachable, traffic noise, rooms being too hot or too cold and the extra 25dollar resort fee. I also saw a majority of good reviews. Like its the best location, pretty big rooms, fancy, clean and modern. These are what i look for in a hotel. So i took the chance and im glad i did because it exceeded my expectations. The staffs we're approachable, they greeted us when we got there and helped us with our suit case when we left. The room is huge, clean, and modern. It was short distance walk from, time square, radio city, rockeffeler center, central park, etc. there was a lot if food places to eat. I think that a lot of people just expected too much. The $25 fee daily sucks but its for the gym and internet. You get charge whether you use it or not. The internet wast fast, so thats great. Most of the complaints are personal, but unlike me and my husband, we are low maintenance. New York is a great place to be, lots to do out there. So dont waste time being in the hotel. We travel to enjoy the place, and this hotel is good price for what it offers.

This was our first time in the United States and New York city. The Hotel was perfectly located near Times Square and Central park. We booked a room with 2 kingsize beds for 4 persons. The beds were quite small, but since it was winter and cold it did not matter that much! The room was clean, quite stylish and had a nice flatscreen TV. Too bad there wasn't a minibar though. Our bath did not drain well at the beginning, but this was fixed immediately when we made a call to the reception. We didn't really have a view, but what can you expect in a concrete jungle haha. We were outside most of the time. Once we got in our room we slept within 2 hours because we were exhausted every day. I really liked the hotel, but I would go for something cheaper next time. The Hotel itself was quite luxurious but our room did not quite match that, which was probaly our own mistake. I would recommend this hotel to other people, but choose your room type wisely. One thing. The breakfast to go is not a breakfast at all, at least not compared to European standards. We could choose between muffins and donuts and a fruit and drink. That is not considered a healthy breakfast, but a snack. The people who ran the breakfast were kinda moody and sometimes rude. It felt like they were bothered by the fact they had to deal with tourists sometimes. Please respect the people that are new to your concept, as there breakfast are kind of unknown to foreign people. Btw. I really liked the smell of the Hotel. The entrance and lobby had a nice parfume smell. It was something I had never experienced before. I am not sure if this is a common thing in the USA.

A group of 12 of us from Ireland stayed in this hotel for Thanksgiving 2015. Great location right between Times Square and Central Park. Hotel does not provide breakfast, however, there is a small deli in the hotel and lots of deli's/coffee shops close by and you can take them back to the large bar area in the hotel.Staff were very friendly and the rooms were kept spotlessly clean by the friendly cleaning staff. The hotel also offer a great car service to/from the airport. Very reasonable. We will definitely return next year for more shopping/socialising!!

Stayed at the Park Central January 3 for one night. The hotel was clean as was our room. Great location if your looking for Pubs and restaurants. We went to The three Monkeys for a drink which was a fun place. The hotel is right across from Tanner Smith's restaurant, highly recommended if anyone is looking for a good burger and drinks.. My biggest complaint about the hotel would be there wasn't a hair dryer in the room! other then that it was all was good. I would stay at the Park Central again and recommend it.

Everything was great, the service, the food, the rooms, just one detail, the rooms could look better with another color palette, is too dark the color they use, too much grey and dark colors for a room that is big but not so much, I think clear colors would help, also to illuminate them better, I had to use many lights on to have a nice light in the room, like 3 or 4, which in others with 1 or 2 is ok, because of the color. other than this, is ok.

We visited this hotel with our daughter and friends of us with their daughter. On this occassion we went the whole nine yards you could say.Drove to the hotel in a stretched limo and basically did everything you could possible have on your bucket list being in New York. The hotel was overbooked on arrival and we had to stay in another terrible hotel nearby. I even forgot the name but it was no comparison. The hotel arranged taxis (impressive they were and an atraction on themselves). After one night staying somewhere else we were welcomed and got upgraded rooms.We hardly ever had such large rooms in New York (we came to NY before) It was so fantastic that after some maby years I still welcome their newletters every time I see them. The hotel room had a super kingsize bed, large sofa, obviously the minibar and the rooms were facing the street where Carnagie Hall is located down the road. Only a few blocks away from Central Park.With hotels, thus this one as well, their sizes and even their lobbys are so big that your still amazed after a few days.Personel behind hte counter were friendly as ever. The only downside we had is that my friends daughter lost their Ipod supposedly stolen from their room. Through filing a few forms and months later this was compensated. I won't hold this against this hotel as the positive experience we overall had here makes us wish we were still there.

We came here for a week at new years. We requested a room with a view, but got one facing the back and some enormous fans. But the staff fixed this for us in a great way, and gave us a new great room the next day. The staff was great, helpful and friendly. We had a great stay and will return for sure!

Checking in the lady behind the counter was void of emotion or expression. We continually had problems with our room keys/elevator key. Only 2 lifts operating, New Years Eve was a nightmare to get an elevator, waiting up to 3 turns beforeetting in the lift.The housekeeper was lovely, very friendly and always happy. One lady in the hotel shop was lovely also. Next time I'd try somewhere different.Location is the one benefit.

Lets mentioned the good points first: Good Location, Good attitude ( for Duty Managers Only). Rooms are average compare to international standard.Ok, now, the bad points : Bad attitude for most of other staffs especially the house keeping. I booked 2 rooms as I have 3 adult and 2 minors, we travelled from Asia and as expected, we have a lot of bags and stuff. Everyday, my rooms are last to clean, there was two nights, we came back after dinner and rooms are in cleaning process. The house keeping was very unfriendly to my family members until I give more TIP. What kind of service attitude is this? I strongly felt that the staffs in this hotel need a lot of trainings. We are frequent travellers and this hotel has the worst service I ever seen (for an international 4 star standard). Also, the hotel charge a facility fee of USD 25/day/room and with 2 small lifts servicing the entire hotel guests (not to mentioned that there was a day when one of the two lifts actually broke down and I waited more than 20 minutes for the lift...) You must be joking!! Wifi is ok though.In short, with the kind of service I received (except the Duty Manager, He/She were friendly), I will never consider staying in this hotel again regardless of how good the location might be. Very bad experience for me....

If you can get a room here at a good price, it's a decent place to lay your head while you're exploring New York, located right across the street from Carnegie Hall, near Central Park. Clean, nicely-appointed rooms. It's not much more than that. Service is average. Staffing seemed a bit low. There are little details that upscale/luxury hotels excel at that were missing. We stayed a weekend in January and reserved two adjoining rooms but they sold them out from under us when we arrived a couple of hours late. We had our 14-year-old daughter and a friend with us so having them on the other end of the floor wasn't acceptable. They eventually accommodated us, and after going to dinner, we got two adjacent rooms. But no towels in one of them. We called down at around 10:30 after walking around midtown for a bit and were told the hotel was out of clean towels. A second call produced the towels about 45 minutes later. I stopped at the front desk because my daughter forgot her toothbrush. They were willing to help, but would not give me a toothbrush, only send it to the room. I didn't feel like waiting for that so I bought one at a nearby drugstore. The small elevators in the hotel aren't large enough to serve all the guests and there are occasionally lines at busy times. Other than that, the rooms were small, but clean and modern and had most of what we needed including a mini fridge. No in-room coffee, but three options to buy coffee on the same block, including a small cafe in the hotel.

Where to i begin with the park central?I had never been to New York before so i spent weeks and weeks reviewing lots of different hotels. I finally decided on Park Central as it was a combination of a lot of things and not too compromising.Leading up to our arrival, I had been informed from other friends who had recently visited the city, that their hotel was able to arrange airport transport from JFK to the actual hotel so I tried to see if I can have park central arrange this for me.I looked through all of my hotel booking emails and could not find an email address. I then decided to go onto the park central website and submit an enquiry which I didnt get a reply from. It was getting closer and closer to my departure date and i still had nothing sorted so I took to the park central facebook page and left a comment for them to see. After I still did not get an answer, I sent them a private message on facebook. They read the mail but did not reply. Already, I was getting a bad impression about the hotel and I hadnt even left Scotland yet. I kept trying and eventually I got some to reply to which they just sent me a link to a 3rd party car hire company. Now at this point, I could have easily and quickly arranged my own transport but the fact that the hotel was ignoring my requests and messages made me even more determined to get them to reply.After a couple weeks of trying and trying to just get some kind of correspondence going from someone at the hotel. I gave up and set my mind to taking it up with management on arrival. Surly enough, once i arrived at the hotel, i immediately asked to speak to a manager and stated the problems I had been having. The gentleman on reception and the manager on shift were both very nice and even wavered the $100 city tax fee and upgraded me to a better room,The hotel itself is lovely, is perfectly located on 7th avenue for a stroll down to times square or a stroll a couple blocks up to central park. There is a starbucks next door and a subway on the other side of the road which I thought was quite handy.On our last day, British Airways had cancelled our flight and put us onto a much earlier flight so we had to rush back to the hotel and ask to use their telephone to phone BA. The female concierge was very accommodating and let us use her phone and even rearranged our airport transport for getting back to JFK.Now that I have been to nyc already and I know where to go to get transport to the hotels etc, I would probably have a much more enjoyable experience and would probably stay at the park central again providing the price was as good. I would however, advise the hotel to put a system in place to help new travelers to the city get to the hotel in the days and weeks leading up to their trip.

Booked two rooms for one night on Dec 29th, 2015, via Amtrak (GREAT discount if you book via Amtrak.com and choose hotel after booking train tix - only paid $206 per night for each room - 2 double beds per room, 4 ppl per room.)Park Central lives up to its moniker as it is centrally located with easy access to tourist areas - 2 blocks south of Central Park on the West side of 7th Ave - not far from Midtown, Theater District, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State building, etc... Quick access to subway from the hotel. Attractive hotel with decent value. We slept well - the air unit in the room allowed for manual fan control, which provided enough white noise to block out the ubiquitous honking of taxi cabs and never ending screams of emergency vehicles. Comfortable bed with lots of pillows.Molasses-SLOW service at check in. ONE person on desk to service a line several travelers deep. I pre-registered at the hotel the morning of the 29th (around 10:30AM) when I arrived and stored my luggage with the friendly bell hop. When we finally finished up our day of sightseeing and events at 9:30PM, it took 30 minutes to finally get access to my room keys, even though I had pre-registered earlier that morning. REALLY bad experience at front desk overshadowed the other positives.Other than that, the hotel was great and a good deal based on the price I paid.One other note - the hotel charges a mandatory $25 to cover workout fees and amenities that I didn't even use. They inform you of this ridiculous surcharge upon check-in. With NYC taxes added on, you'll pay an additional $27.22 per night per room for the privilege of possibly using a workout facility if you choose to do so.

We stayed here for four nights, from Monday 23rd November to Friday 27th November, in room 1119. My family and I travelled to New York to visit extended family for Thanksgiving.The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. The room was spotless, tidy and well appointed. It was spacious enough for our needs. It was also in a quiet and peaceful location of the hotel.We chose the hotel due to the route of the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, however what was unexpected was the proximity to absolutely everything! It was a 10 minute walk (or thereabouts) to all the attractions we wanted. Central Park, Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, the Empire State Building and other New York landmarks were all in walking distance from the hotel. This is an added bonus when travelling with a three-year-old!We walked most places and took cabs or the subway when we couldn't walk any more.The only two downsides to the hotel is that it didn't have it's own restaurant - but there were many many restaurants and diners within a stones throw - and that we had some children's clothes laundered.My child's laundry cost $83, which we thought was extortionate for the size and quantity of the laundry. That said, my son's underwear did come back beautifully presented in a tissue-lined box! But it still wasn't worth $83 for laundry.If we stayed again we would not have anything laundered and would find a laundromat instead.The additional fees for wifi and the gym did bump up the cost of the hotel stay as well. This can (just about) be forgiven due to the location of the hotel, the helpfulness and friendliness of all the staff who work at the Park Central. My son had great fun playing peek-a-boo with one of the security staff in the lobby while we were waiting for a friend to arrive!My family and I would happily stay here again and we loved the stay. I just wouldn't get anything laundered!

Firstly, the hotel is located perfectly in Manhattan within a short walk to Central Park (hence the hotel name) and close enough to walk to the main midtown attractions.Secondly, the hotel staff were just fantastic. Excellent customer service from the moment we walked through the door to the moment they flagged us a cab to the airport.The room was a great size which can sometimes be a downside to hotels in NYC.The comfort of the room was just right & the bed was very welcoming after a day wandering around the busy Manhattan avenues & alleyways.If you want to wake up in a city that never sleeps, to find you're king of the hill...... You know what I'm trying to say, book a room here.

My husband kids and I took a trip to new York. We saw so much ate alot and walked to much !! But the best thing of all was our hotel so beautiful well takin care of and amazing we didnt think NYC would be this special. The hotel had great views clean bathrooms and the beds are good also. The front desk is very helpful

Our second stay in this hotel the room is wide and comfortable with reasonable housekeeping but the location is what attracts us I have some comments that may help:Increasing and better distribution of the light in the rooms as they are dim Providing a coffee maker in the rooms Putting the safe on a higher self instead of the existing position which is almost on the floorIncrease of the number of elevators which are few compared to the number of rooms In general it is a comfortable hotel

Great location if you have never travelled to NYC before but rooms small, and the daily fee is outrageous! Lifts are terrible with only 2 tiny ones in working order for the size of the hotel and rooms were small with rubbish showers. It's a good location - near to Times Square, Central Park, 5th avenue etc but it could be improved with free wifi, in room coffee maker and better showers!

This is my first day and time in this hotel Im here for the new year eve I payed so much for it to come and enjoy the holiday. They are only very clean and there location, but its kinda old and there is no cafe maker, no refrigerator, no time square view at all in any rooms our room view was someone else room its was creepy and we couldn't sleep because of the light come from the window side and the nose like a trine or carte moving on the top floor they stopped at 4 am and they start again at 7 am . no restaurants in the hotel at all no vending machines.Also, you can hear everything going on in the hall way so clear while your in your room. The hotel is horrible if u a chance DO NOT COME HERE I believe 4 stars is tooo much for this hotel this is some pic at 7 am and there is no sun yet.

Stayed with family for December in NYC! Great location. Out front door you can see Times Square. Close to Central Park and great walking to Rockefeller Center. Rooms spacious and comfortable! Would definitely stay again!!

In NYC, location can make or break the success of a trip. No one wants to spend an hours in transit, wasting valuable vacation time. The Park Central's location is excellent. Two blocks from Central Park, maybe 4 or 5 to Times Square. One street over from Broadway. Surrounded by good restaurants. We traveled with two teenagers on a surprise Christmas trip to see the tree and Christmas decorations. Our room was just fine: spacious, modern, clean. No frills - no fridge, microwave, or coffee maker - but full-sized bottles of shampoo and conditioner were an unexpected plus. The view was weird - but who spends time in their hotel room in NYC? Listen to the other reviews about the elevators. The hotel is old (but nicely remodeled) and only has two elevators. We were on the 4th floor, which made taking the stairs doable. And we did take them regularly, rather than wait 10 minutes for the elevator. Service was just fine: pleasant, welcoming, helpful when needed. A very solid choice for a family vacation where location is paramount.

I have stayed here several years ago. This time brought wife and kids. The location and value of this place is the best in the city. Close enough to Times Square but not too close. You dont want to be..Walk to central park and Great Shopping. I will never stay anywhere else. Book a corner room if possible.

We stayed here the first weekend of December for a Girls' Weekend getaway! The location was perfect for what we wanted to do...broadway shows, museums, shopping, eating! The hotel is beautiful and the room was clean. There were a few minor things that kept me from giving a 5-star review...when we arrived (at 11am) there was a crazy long line and only 2 people working on checking people in/out. I saw in the tripadvisor reviews prior to coming that this is an issue with this hotel. We waited a total of 1.5 hours to check in and check our bags...then another hour at 4pm to get our room key and retrieve our luggage from the holding room. Pretty ridiculous. I had requested a coffee maker for our room when I booked the room and when I checked in...we didn't get one until our 4th call and the staff acted somewhat put out that we wanted one for the room. Lastly, upon checkout I reviewed my bill, which they had added a $30 charge for breakfast, which we didn't have....when I discussed this with the front staff, they immediately took it off. I would stay here again, as the location cannot be beat and it was very clean with comfy new matresses.

Hotel location is good, but crowded and fairly expensive. Not enough elevators to accommodate the guests, had to walk down 15 floors. Lobby bar wasn't accepting credit cards. So not quite as sophisticated as it makes itself out on Web site.

My husband and I stayed here last year for my birthday. This year we took a family trip and my parents, sister and aunt all booked rooms here. We went to check in and my husband and I along with my parents got upgraded to the sister hotel WestHouse which was spectacular. Our rooms weren't ready in WestHouse so my sister and aunt invited us up to their rooms. The rooms were nice, the bathrooms were huge especially for Nyc. We all went to the bar that night for drinks and it's so pretty. The atmosphere was great. The location of the hotel is great and everyone loved it. We left early in the morning and the doorman got us a car instead of catching two taxis since it was six of us. Although I got upgraded and didn't end up staying here my sister and aunt loved their rooms. It's a great hotel. They don't have a restaurant but they have tons of places close by to eat at.

Booked a one night stay for a quick in and out trip to the City. This is a busy, bustling hotel. Lots of people thru the lobby area. Check in wasn't smooth. I waited in line only to find out my room wasn't ready. So I checked my luggage and went out for the day. Upon my return, they switched my room and I ended up with a nice, large room. Full sized couch and chair in the seating area and king size bed. Large for NYC standards. Bathroom was nice. Room felt updated, clean and fresh. I loved the back lobby seating area. Great for meetings. Lots of space and outlets. I spent some time here. Starbucks right next door. Great rate too! Overall I was pleased and I would stay here again.

when i travels, i choose good location.park central hotel, conveniently located in the heart of midtown, is within walking distance of broadway theaters,shopping,and more.also the hotel staff are friendly and attentive afer checking in,we had lunch at that new Mexican restaurant across street from the park hotel

I have stayed at Park Central for business and have enjoyed the beautiful lounge for coffee in morning, or wine in the evening with colleagues. My visit this time was for my daughter's 13th birthday. The location is so wonderful and the restaurants within one or two blocks are great. We were able to park our luggage at the front with ease since we arrived early. Check in and check out were easy. Doormen are very helpful and friendly. The fresh bakery in the lobby is very nice or you can go to Starbucks next door. Enjoy the lounge while you charge your phones, etc. The beds were very comfy, the size of the room is fine for NYC standards and our view toward Times Square was awesome. The unfortunate part was the unpleasant smell that we got as soon as we walked in the room and a window open...on the coldest day so far in NYC. Having been outside all day, we were already freezing. The cleaning service came to freshen up the room, but there still was an unpleasant smell coming from the carpet and/or bathroom...just not clean nor fresh. Also, the typical bar of soap for the bath and shower cap were not provided and very surprisingly, no BATH TOWELS. I called the front desk and they sent some towels along. Just odd that this is happened. I am not giving up, though, there was enough great to our stay and I know the cleanliness of the rooms have been better. These are easy things to fix. (towels, smell, soap, and as others have suggested, open up all 4 of the elevators)

Check inCheck in process is very fast. You should pay 300$ during check-in. Better to make it in cash because hotel will return this money during checking off. If you will pay via credit card money should be returned in 5-7 business days. The amount of money back could be less and really this may take more then a month. The girl on reception pushed us to pay via credit card.RoomThe standard room is quite large. Quite dark. Without kettle. Its really uncomfortable. Bathroom is quite large. The cleaning service was quite good but not very good. There is a safe in the room, an iron and an ironing board. BreakfastThe breakfast isnt included in price of room. You may order the breakfast in hotel restaurant, it will cost about 40$ per person and its quite poor. I advise you to visit restaurant which is situated on the opposite side of the the 7th avenue. The breakfast is very good and it will cost about 15$ per person. The name of the restaurant is "Park Cafe".The rooms with windows on the 7th Avenue are very noisy. Check-outThe check-out process is very short. There is a luggage room in hotel. This room is for free. The restrooms in lobby are closed. If you will need the restroom you shoulda ask workers on the reception desk for a key.

So, there were some issues in room 331. I was going on a trip with my sister and we found this hotel on trip advisor. It said it was 4 stars... LIES! But I will stay positive. So here is how it went down:We check in and go up to the room. I go to see what the hotel has to offer and they sent me on a fun adventure around the room looking for books or menus listing information about the hotel and decided to check the website. I go to call the the front desk and they help me disconnect by giving me a phone that doesn't work. So we leave to get dinner and my sister goes down to the lobby. Some people ahead of her are asking what restaurants are good so she tells the person she would like to know too. The lady sent the people in front of her to a fancy restaurant and the helpful person sent my sister to what she thought was a more "affordable" option, a diner. We ended up going to this other restaurant where we were kindly greeted by a big butt statue as we walked through the door. When we took a shower, the faucet for the bath was falling of and leaking creating a mini water park experience in the bathroom. The curtain was very short and got water on the floor allowing us to have a fun foot slip and slide. Water must have been a hip theme because the sink got water everywhere. They were very Eco-friendly. They conserve soap by only give you a 2"x2" bar. They also conserve energy by having outlets that did not work in the bathroom. They conserve water by having weak water pressure in the shower and the toilet. They once again helped us to disconnect because there were no movie rental options or guide on the tv. The carpet had a unique stiff and rough texture. We had a fabulous view of the utility units and a brick wall. We probably will not go back. The only thing nice about it was the doorman.

Beautiful lobby, comfortable beds,clean room... Arrived in the city early and were able to check luggage before the 4 pm check in. Close to Radio City and Rockefeller Center. Bonus was the 12 pm check out.. only complaint would be the resort fee of 27.00 a night ...over all a great stay.

Just got back from brilliant trip and our hotel made it even better due to its location. It is literally a 5 minute walk from Central Park and Times Square and ideal base for sightseeing. Great choice for short break.

Good sized room, clean, good comfortable bed. Elevator service is poor. Only 2 elevators operational for a large NYC hotel?? Really?? Staff is mediocre at best. First person at check in was rather rude. Very close to Central Park and Times Square area.

Have stayed here a few times due to great location and familiarity. But this visit left a bad taste having to pay a 'resort' fee. A wapping £195! They say it includes wifi and the gym. I tried to find the gym, but couldn't, so it's not easy to find (presuming there is one). The facility they did have (the bar) was closed most of my visit for 'private' events. The wifi in Starbucks in the same building is free.I guess most hotels are doing this in NYC to pretend the prices are lower than they really are. Whichever, not good for customer relations. Be warned.

The corner room was nice with windows on three sides, beds and bathroom fine. Both agreed the rudest people we ran into in our NY visit of 5 days were the concierge and bar wait staff at the hotel, both ladies just flat out NY rude, sarcastic and proud of it. Needs a restaurant and more elevators.

I stayed here with my boyfriend for 4 nights in early December.We checked in (around 3pm) with ease, the staff at reception were friendly and attentive (despite what I'd read on some reviews!). Check-in took around 5 minutes, simple and efficient.We were located on the 10th floor, views aren't the best but its difficult to get a good view in a city full of skyscrapers! It was quite noisy at night (for some reason, New Yorkers really love beeping their car horns at nothing), but it isn't too much of an issue. The room was very clean and well presented. The beds are extremely comfy! The room was a decent size and had most amenities you would expect (bar a coffee/tea maker, luckily there's a small cafe downstairs and a Starbucks right outside).Bathroom was clean, well lit and with a good working shower and lovely big bottles of shampoo/conditioner/body wash which smelled very nice.The only thing I could really complain about was the lifts (elevators), as many have pointed out, being so slow. Only two lifts for that many people? Not great, although it did encourage us to take the stairs and stop being so lazy!The hotel is in a fantastic location, within 5-10 minutes walk of Central Park, Broadway and Times Square and very close to the subway (easy to get around and would also recommend using the Airtrain/Subway to get from JFK ($7.75) if you don't want to spend $50 or so on a Taxi.All in all, great location, very clean, staff are friendly and attentive. It's just little things that prevent this hotel from being spectacular (put a coffee machine in the room, sort the elevator situation out). Overall a positive experience and I would return here again.

Where do I start? Rude service? Lack of customer service? The room? This hotel sucked. Arrival was met with rude check in. Then getting up to our room was a challenge as there are 2 elevators that are about 8 square ft each. We get to a room that has no refrigerator, on in room coffee. The hotel has no complementary coffee either. DO NOT USE THE "COMPLEMENTARY WIFI"... as soon as I signed I was sold to a spammer. In a matter of 10 minutes I had 22 spam emails. The house keeping staff doesn't put away their stuff when they are done either. So at anytime you may round a corner and run into a cart. The carpet stinks from never having been vacuumed. There is insufficient lighting in the rooms and no light at all in the closet. The only reason I give it a 2 is because the location but if I ever visit NYC again, great city btw, I will sacrifice the location for a better place.

This is an amazing hotel in New York City. It has a very posh atmosphere that I highly recommend. I went on a trip to New York City during June 2015 and decided to stay here. The staff was extremely inviting and kind. I would gladly stay here again.

The hotel is in a good location, just a couple of short blocks from Central Park and easy walking distance to many attractions. But, like many others have said, a lackluster staff (not surly but certainly not overly friendly either) and only TWO elevators for twenty some odd floors! The room was small and showed obvious neglect from the cleaning staff (hair on the bathroom floor, dust on edges of counter top, and a small branch from a pine tree in the corner of the room...from the previous occupants X-mas tree?) but it was quiet. You will also be charged $25 a day for the wifi service whether you use it or not. All in all, not a horrible hotel, but definitely NOT a great hotel either.

The positives- we were allowed to check in early (10am). The staff were very friendly.The negatives- OMG the elevators can be like waiting in line at Disney world! You can complain all you want and the friendly staff will say, " I am sorry" but you will wait-maybe a half hour to get down or up to your room. The maids never showed up one day and when I went to call the front desk, the phone wasn't working. At 5: pm went down to the front desk to inform them that we needed room service, the lines were incredible long so I reported it to the concerige who was going to report it to a manager. An hour later no word from anybody. I called from the hallway phone and again reported that we needed our room cleaned, another hour later and still nothing!! It was now 7:30pm and we had no clean towels, we missed our dinner reservations and we were not happy! Finally at 7:45pm someone shows up with clean towels.

Family of 3 (including 4 y.o. one) stayed there from Dec 17 to 20, 2015.ROOM.The room assigned was on the 9th floor, almost the corner room, facing Carnegie Hall (north-east). The room had 2 double beds, TV, phone, hairdryer, safe and complimentary toiletries - body wash, shampoo and conditioner (1 bottle each).Room DID NOT HAVE neither fridge or microwave (which looks like typical for hotels on Manhattan). Cost to get a fridge in the room - $35 USD/ night.- It WAS a quiet room to sleep at night- TV had only local cable stations (incl. 2 cartoon channels, but no international content)- Safe was a standard size one, big enough to accommodate one 15 inch notebook plus cash and passports (17 inch one WON't fit)- There was sufficient number of power jacks (10) to plug in all devices and chargers.- Programmable thermostat was a challenge to operate (honeywell) as we could not get the logic how it works (comes on by itself even if you turn it off) but Heater WAS NOT that loud and provided acceptable room temperature (outside was from 0 C (32 F) at night to 12 C (54 F) during the day) A mandatory daily fee of $25 USD + tax (= $27.14) is applicable that includes:- UNLIMITED local and domestic (within USA) LONG DISTANCE calls , - use if 24 hour Fitness Center (on 3rd floor) and - use of 3 MAC station in the lobby (15 min sessions)HOTELCheck in was a breeze (8.30 PM) - 5 min. We were offered a city map.INTERNET password was assigned - they call it "Complimentary Internet (5 Devices) Usage Plan"Had to sign an APPLICABLE FEES NOTE that mentioned a mandatory daily fee (see above), acceptance to let hotel charge your credit card should any of fees incurred won't be paid at check out (we were told $50/ night, but no numbers were printed on the paper) and OK to let them charge $250 deep cleaning fee (should you smoke in the room).Luggage was delivered to the room faster than we got there!(wish luggage man would explain how that damn thermostat works :-) INTERNET speed was EXCELLENT (fast and stable) all the time - 18 Mbps download, 16 Mbps upload.BREAKFAST is available starting from $10 USD / person in the hotel.There were plenty of places nearby to eat decent food, but a little bit pricey (we were using 2 places - RAY's PIZZA at 831 7th Ave {gorgeous pizza and tasteful home made soup - $6 each} and 24-hr OLIVIERO CAFE at 850 7th Ave). You might consider visiting 24-hr Pharmacy shop @ Broadway x W 57 st (south-west corner) which is a small supermarket (incl. variety of food) Check out was automatic - meaning you don't have to do it in person (just pack yourself and go) Check-out time 12 PM.You will still have an Internet access for about 20 min after 12. The mandatory daily fee bill was put under our room door the night before departure.There was a daytime luggage storage room in the lobby (free) for your convenience.Limo service to LaGuardia Airport is $50 flat, but we took a taxi instead for $40 flat rate (1/2 hr travel).Our credit card was charged EXACTLY as the bill showed (27.14 x # of nights x exchange rate).I will definitely stay there next time i visit Manhattan!

The location is great, with the N,Q and R subway station nearly right out the front door. The hotel itself looks very nice, but once inside things become more obvious. There are only two very small elevators servicing the lower floors. During most of the day, there were always many people in line to go up or down. Any many times, the elevators going down were full before they got to our floor. The HVAC system is very old (someone called it a two pipe system), so temperature for the entire floor is controlled by the hotel not the thermostat in your room. Our room was always a few degrees hotter that we would have liked. The room itself looks very nice and is well maintained, but nearly everything is dark (black) and the lighting isn't the best. If you lay down a black Kindle or pair of glasses, you will have trouble finding it. And I found the lack of sheer drapes annoying. The window only had a black-out shade - either fully open to the office building right across the street or totally closed adding to the lack of light in the room.

This has been the worst part of our NY visit! Experiencing more stays at higher end hotels as well as the occasional stay at low end chain hotels than the average person, I have NEVER had such a negative experience inclusive of lack attention, lack of concern, untidiness, unsightliness...plain incompetence (management, housekeeping, front desk). Boasting the characteristics of glamorous and sophisticated, the hotel's attributes, including its physical structure and the service providers, were polar opposites. During our stay we experienced the unsightly visual of 3-4 housekeeping carts laden with trash & soiled laundry outside our door daily throughout our 5 day stay (not just during "cleaning hours") despite NUMEROUS (3+) requests for attention to the matter. The manager even implied that such aesthetics is normative, which is hardly true, not even at 2 star chains like La Quinta, where (also) requests are typically met on the first attempt versus the 3 required for us to get a coffee pot. The manager seemed oblivious as to why we might not enjoy viewing cleaning carts and verbalized powerlessness (no "control" over housekeeping) to change the situation & belabored us with info regarding the facility's inadequacy to actually store the carts. Ironically, the housekeeping staff with whom I spoke referred me to management. All this complimented our having received no greeting (customary at nicer hotels as this purports to be) - NOT ONE - from any staff member upon our countless entries/exits. The comforters were threadbare and visibly soiled upon our arrival. The walls were adorned with LOW quality "art" and empty hooks. Rooms were poorly insulated: window side of room was actually cold (despite above average exterior temperatures), and urinary functions in room next door were audible. Part of the lounge was closed, & the cocktails were barely average despite a price point equalling superiorly crafted ones at nearby establishments like Serafina. Despite repeated opportunities to rectify problems and improve the business, subpar service and complete ambivalence prevailed.

This is a prime location for Broadway, Central Park, Times Square, Museums and Rockefeller Center. Clean rooms and courteous staff. No restaurant or room service but nice bakery/cafe in lobby. I would return with family or for business in the future.

We stayed here December 15-16, 2015 and had a wonderful stay. I highly recommend this hotel. We took advantage of the valet parking package; arrived in the city at 10:15am, gave valet our keys, placed our luggage in the bellman' closet, and walked the couple of blocks to Central Park to begin our tour. When we returned in the afternoon, we were delighted with our 9th floor room. The room looked and smelled fresh, the bathroom plumbing was sleek and modern, the prints on the wall were unique and attractive, the bed and pillows very comfortable. The ice machine always had ice, the housecleaning team quietly kept the hotel and our room looking fine, the three elevators moved us up and down in timely fashion. The hotel location is terrific for touring, there's a subway stop less than 2 blocks away, a Starbucks and grocery store steps from the front door. I loved the staff and they added to a great NYC visit. I particularly appreciated the assistance of the front desk associate who hails from Israel and the morning valet who was always friendly and helpful. Although I read reviews, I rarely write them but our stay at Park Central was integral to a great NYC visit and I want to thank them.

The hotel is wonderfully located, but one of the noisiest (we had to ask to me moved from 9th floor to 14th floor because the noise outside was awful)! Do not think they have heard of double/triple glazing!The fact a hotel that size does not have a KITCHEN amazed me. We are very well travelled people (all over the world) but when wanting a cup of coffee in the Lounge at 8.30 p.m. at night and to be told they don't do hot drinks or food as the Kitchens had been closed down for quite a while. We could not believe our ears!!! There is a small kiosk in the foyer selling take away coffees and Croissants/Danish pastries and fruit by is not open after 8.30 p.m. We could not believe a hotel of this standing had no kitchen at all. Despite the fact there may be Starbucks and other restaurants very near by, to not be able to have a nice cup of coffee with a liqueur in your hotel in the evening beggars belief.The only thing positive we can say, the beds were wonderfully comfortable.Don't expect a room with a view either. I would only recommend this hotel is you don't want creature comforts.

I am in New York a couple of times a year and, even with the ridiculous $25 "facilities fee" the hotel offers good value by New York standards particularly if you book on the specials. The rooms are a reasonable size and the showers offer good pressure but the star attraction is the location (opposite Carnegie Hall). I will continue to stay here for the foreseeable future.

The positive things:- location- rooms are newly renovated and clean- staff is friendlyDon't expect:- Breakfast or a Restaurant in this hotel. There is only a tiny kiosk- Elevators have been very slow (2 working). Maybe the others have been temporary out of order.- a romantic place :-)We recommend this to every one, who doesn't plan to spend a lot of time in the hotel, but is looking for a perfect located place to sleep in NYC.

The best part of this hotel is its location- close to Broadway, Rockefeller Center, variety of foods, and transportation. The rooms are nice enough but no frills (i.e., no coffee maker in room), but price was good for Manhattan hotel around holidays.

Went on holiday with friends - room was nice and clean. We had a great view of time square out our window. From the first day the staff were helpful - recommended places to go. Within walking distance of main shops and time square so for a girls shopping trip it was perfect. The only problem we had is that we sometimes needed more towels but when we phoned for them they came pretty quick and we always got a courtesy call from reception to check they had arrived and that we didn't need anything else which was a nice touch.We would definately go back again.

You can't get any more "central," than the Park Central when you're in Manhattan. Right on 7th Avenue between 55th and 56th streets, you're only short walks from Times Square to the south, Columbus Circle to the north, only a block from the entrance to Central Park to the north, Carnegie Hall is right across the street and Broadway and the entire theater district is just a block away! While technically not a "luxury," hotel, the staff is first rate in every respect, the concierge will get you whatever you need and in a city not known for its friendliness, the Park Central made this couple feel like part of the family. The room was small but the king-size bed was perfect, and really all we needed, since we were in New York City and part of the romance should be exploring the "city that doesn't sleep," before returning to the room and taking advantage of the luxurious accommodations. For the price point, service and location, the Park Central cannot be beat. I've stayed here on a couple of occasions now and I will definitely return again and again! Take a loved one for a romantic weekend, a couple of days during the week, or a whole week, you won't be sorry.

Great location, clean, comfortable beds. Need light in closet. The elevators were not working very well and my daughter, grand daughter and I had to walk down ten flights of stairs after waiting 15 minutes for the only working elevator. This made us late for our dinner reservation. Upon checking out had to wait ten minutes before we could get an elevator. Talked to the manager and she did the right thing by reducing the bill.

Front desk staff were not friendly, straight out rude and not helpful. When room wasn't ready after taking the red eye and walking around NYC we were not given any options like can we text you or call you when it's ready? When you enter a business for the first time the initial impression/reception is often the one remembered for a long time and will set the tone for the whole visit. Seeing people who look disinterested and don't go the extra mile (the Nordstrom principles) made us feel like why did we pick this place. The coffee stand persons were disinterested and didn't even take the time to look you in the eye. Then you get to the 2 tiniest elevators I have ever seen that were always packed and slow for the amount of people at the hotel. Finally we enter the room which is freezing and turn on the heater and guess what it's broken! Call front desk who sends a guy up with a portable heater and an excuse that they haven't turn the heater on yet even though we're in the middle of December. Then you get to the bathroom that can only fit 1 person, the door hits the toilet when you open it and included a bathtub that was broken. The room windows and doors are so thin that you can hear everything outside, lets the cold in and I could even hear my 8 year old talking to his mom all the way by the elevators. Had to walk up a flight of stairs on 2 days to get ice because the ice machine was broken. Then to top it off everyday we would leave our room at 8 or 9 am to go enjoy New York only to return to our room at 4 pm to find out it either was not cleaned yet or was in the process of being cleaned. Long day of walking to go upstairs, find the person either not at our room yet or still not finished and now back to the tiny elevators to go sit in the lobby until the person finishes which we would give 45 minutes and went back up only to find still not done, again tiny elevator trip downstairs to wait yet again. Finally called the GM to explain the issues and his response was on your next trip please let me know when you're coming in?!?!?!In my business Don, when we inconvienance a client we take care of the client in some sort of way to help alleviate the issues we caused to the client. I comp things all the time when my team screws up but when I take the time to tell the GM what was going on with our stay, his response was see you on your next visit. Don, quick lesson in client satisfaction, even something small like comping your resort fee, giving a late check out (when I told you we were leaving late in the day) or the upgrade fee for a day or 2 which costs you nothing, can go a long way in retaining customers and helping to spread good Customer Satisfaction. It is the little things that show you care that make a stay memorable and insure return visits.Your hotel was sure on the ball when we were returned on our last day at 11:50 to get our bags only to find our keys were shut off due to the 12:00 check out. Again super location but inept, rude staff with poor management coupled with hotel issues make this a place we would not return to. Thanks again Don for all your help!

My boyfriend and I were very happy with our stay at the Park Central. Great location near Times Square, Central Park, Broadway and subway stations. The room was clean and a good size with a working heater and good shower. We were able to check in very early (thank-you!) and found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful from reception to the cleaners and the lovely guys who held our bags and organized a great car to the airport for us. This hotel was the best price for what we were looking for compared to everywhere else and we weren't disappointed. Go for it I say! Happy Travels :)

We came to the Park Central at least one time every year since, maybe, eight years ago. The location is superb, yes. It is not a luxury hotel but it has the elemental services. However, we had a great disappointment. When we arrived to the hotel (past the midnight due our flight from Mexico) the room that I had reserved was not ready. Instead of the Premier Corner room that I reserved (since two months ago!) the receptionist offered us a regular room. That it's not the room that we wanted. What the reservations online system are for? They offered the appropiate habitation for the next day. That situation will means wasted time in our vacation. I am surprised for the lack of seriousness in the Park Central administration. My reservation was confirmed several times by the Hotel by email messages. This failure reveals a very disrespectful attitude from the Hotel. What a shame.

This hotel I have mixed reviews about. The staff are quite unhelpful in general although there was one member of staff who I can not speak highly enough of, his name was Brian and he is the duty manager, he was the most helpful and pro-active manager I have ever met. He had such a lovely personality and couldn't do enough to help us. He certainly knew his job inside and out and we noticed him even being so informative to a new member of staff. I wish I could have said the same for the other reception staff because everything else was 5 star apart from them, they really let the hotel down, at one time when one man was taking our deposit from us he said it was $50 a night so when he took the money I realised it didn't add up right so I let him know that he had taken about $20 too much which isn't a lot at all but his reply was very sharp and short " yeah so I made a mistake adding up, I may of added $20 too much is that a problem you'll get it back alright" For the first time ever I was actually speechless at someone's response, maybe it is a cultural thing but to me that was just plain rude not even to apologise first for his mistake. We had a few other instances like that with staff which got tiring. The rooms were lovely and clean and housekeeping was to such a high standard. The rooms on the inside of the hotel were cramped and dark due to them all facing the three walls of the middle of the hotel considering we paid a lot for a nice room we were unhappy to have got this room but Brian helped up to change rooms luckily because the next room we got faced the street and was lovely and spacious. So the rest of the week that we didn't have to have any contact with the other reception staff the stay we had was lovely.

First of all, if you want to be just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square (yet still in the middle of everything) but still want to be able to walk to most attractions, the Park Central New York is perfect. In addition, it is only a few blocks away from Central Park, truly making it a perfect location. Excellent service, for the most part, however, they did not fix a few issues that we had with our room (that was politely brought to their attention) which kept this review from being one of the best values for the dollar I have ever experienced. We booked way in advance (6 months) and got non-refundable rooms that saved us several hundred dollars. The rooms are well appointed, however, if you are not familiar with room sizes in Manhattan you may be disappointed by how tight they are. These rooms are a very nice size, actually, considering the other hotels that I have stayed in. Fresh upgrades, new renovations give this hotel an upscale Manhattan feel (you want that, don't you!?) and the team of people working here are overall very, very capable. I feel as though this hotel COULD be more if they followed through with the issues of their customers. Located on 7th Ave. all you have to do is walk out of the hotel and turn left (Central Park) or turn right (Times Square) and you are right in the middle of everything. I recommend this hotel and look forward to giving this property one more chance at finding excellence.

I've been staying at the Park Central for years. Then last year they did a substantial remodel. The rooms are comfortable and clean, and the location is really great. But this hotel hardly has the amenities a 4-star would. No coffee-maker in the room. Not even a book of hotel services. And the building is woefully underserved by elevators. Only two lifts on either side of the building and you have to wait forever. But while these are annoyances, the hotel is still comfortable and fine.What's REALLY galling though, is that they have the nerve to charge a mandatory daily $27 "resort fee"! The fee is for (as the accompanying picture to this review shows) "unlimited phone calls" from your room, the fitness center, and use of the iMac computers in the lobby. When was the last time you used the hotel phone? (who doesn't use their own these days?). Didn't use the fitness center. And why would I use the lobby computer? I didn't use any of these "services" and I still had to pay the mandatory fee. Talk about being ripped off. What's next, a mandatory surcharge for the air you breathe? Or a "convenience" charge for the attention of the front desk attendant? This is a nice hotel, but it offers just the basic minimal services. To then be charged for the few amenities it does offer is cheap and non-welcoming. But to be charged for "services" you're not using is an outrageous rip-off. I wonder how many quests would actually even pay for these things if you offered them as premium fee services. Not many, I'm guessing. In the meantime, I suspect charging the fee, while it might generate some short-term revenue, will cost them much over the long term in lost business.

We stayed for three nights in November to wrap up our first family holiday with our 7 month old.Overall, we had a good stay there; the location was perfect for us - easy access to Midtown and Central Park - staff were friendly and helpful in general and the room was lovely and clean. We did find the room a little on the small side but with a baby and having to settle in early each night, we probably spent more time in it than would have done without the little one. We had asked for a cot, which the manager had agreed by email way ahead of our stay, however this did not materialise and as we ended up bringing our own travel cot with us, did not make a fuss. One of our baby's towels was taken with the laundry after our first night - we should have bought coloured towels for him - the staff were not that fussed that this had happened and although we filled out the paperwork, we knew no real effort would be made to find and return it to us. Disappointing.However, as there is no restaurant or room service, it was helpful how close the hotel was to food outlets as we had to eat in our room each night and its location to the MTA and Times Square made walking around Manhattan nice and easy.We did enjoy our stay there and even though there were a few hiccups, we would probably stay there again, due to its location.

Great location and cool vibe in the lobby. But other than that..Had to wait 5-10 minutes for the elevator. There were 2 tiny ones for the entire building, we're often full when arrived at our floor mid way up the building.Didn't have fitted sheets on the bed. They just turned a regular sheet sideways and the bottom half was exposed mattress. Was terribly obnxious.The line to store luggage was 20-30 people long around noon with only one person working. The lobby was very crowded just with people trying to pick up or drop off luggage.Greyhound reps hang around the front door harassing you to buy bus tours whenever you enter or leave. Not a terrible experience...but would never deal with these issues again when there are SO many other hotels to choose from.

Small room but expected. Clean and updated. Jermaine was very helpful and provided great service when there were concerns with our original room. Long, slow line to check bags and slow elevators. Overall a good choice in a great location! I'd go back!

I have had quite an experience of traveling all over the world in various different types of hotels and this has to be the most disappointed I have ever been with a hotel. But let me start with the very small list of Positives: the location is great, a few minutes walk from Times Square! Really you couldn't ask for a better location, with a Starbucks on the corner and the subway right beside it. The beds are comfortable. After having a problem with are room we were moved no problem. Negatives: No restaurant, no way of getting any food unless you want to pay a crazy amount of money for the small "market" down stairs. The lifts are horrendously slow, had to wait 5 minutes very time. BE AWARE of room 303, right next to the gym all you'll hear is weights being dropped at all times of the night, and your paying $25.00 for this gym even if you don't use it!!!! (Although when we addressed the problem we where moved) Unfortunately on are family trip we all ended up getting the flu, but with the strangely high temperatures for this time of year we where told that we would not be able to put the heating on in the room! Seriously, 3 sick people with the flu being told that they can't turn on the heating because it's beyond there control. Service is slow and like being served by characters from the walking dead. No sense of urgency appears to be present in this city at all. Also after asking twice for a new tub of body wash a family of three where left to use one very small bar of soap. I can safely say that I will not be back at this hotel, and I urge others to consider if they are happy with paying s considerable amount of money for nothing.

Lobby & check in area are beautiful and the staff was very friendly!! Room was extremely small, but that was expected! It was nice, needed a few updates and more detailed cleaning in the bathroom. But for the nightly rate, it was a great hotel!

My fiance and I stayed here christmas time last year. We arrived on boxing day (26 Dec 2014) for my 30th birthday trip.The hotel itself is wonderful, fantastic location and beautifully decorated.The hotel had been refurbished during the year and the rooms were lovely and airy and on the large size for New York.
