The rooms were really My fiance particularly liked the massive flat screen tv.The public areas of the hotel are really well decorated and look very luxurious but we didn't spend much time in them as we were either out exploring or fast asleep!The only down side was there were only 2 lifts that were working and at one of the busiest times in New York could prove a little tiresome. Depending on what time of the day/night it is you can get a lift within 2 minutes but at peak times (late pm/early evening) you can wait up to 20 minutes!The location of the hotel is perfect. Right by Times Square (10-15 min walk) and Central Park (5-10 min walk) and has plenty of restaurants and bars around it.Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and when we return to New York i will almost definitely stay at the Park Central again.

I stayed at the Park Central for one night this past weekend (12/12/2015). I met friends at the hotel and we were in town to see La Boheme at the Met. My friends arrived a day earlier and texted me a picture from the lobby where there was close to an hour long line for them to check in. After I checked in and go to my room I discovered discarded shopping bags left by the previous guest in plain view on the bench next to the bed and missed by the cleaning staff. My TV remote was not working and the a/c was inoperative on the hottest day in December on record. Hotel staff (after two calls regarding the a/c) dumped a fan in my room but didn't bother to set it up or turn it on to call the room off before I returned. The wait for the elevators was at least 15-20 minutes each trip and they only have two dedicated elevators on either side of the hotel. The elevators are also quite small. The combination of all these problems made for an extremely unpleasant experience. Guest Services at first promised to give me a 30% rate reduction off my room rate and then attempted to renege on the discount several hours later. I finally spoke with another manager on duty who made good on the discount and also gave me an extra late check out. The line for check out and the line for luggage storage was at least 45 minutes. These concessions were appreciated but did nothing to lessen the impact of the bad overall experience. Clearly this hotel does not have enough elevators to handle a full house nor sufficient staff to provide reasonable check in and luggage service wait times. They need to update their a/c systems and do a better job of monitoring maid services. I will not be back any time soon.

Stayed at Central Park for a business trip to New York. The place is fine and the rooms are spacious for New York and all works. The price is a bit high and also extra cost of wifi and baggage. The concierge service are fast and helpful, but other wise you don't get many smiles or pleasantries out of the staff in general.

This hotel in my opinion was a rip off! When I first entered the hotel there was a line out the door to check in. Once it was my turn to check in, I didn't even get so much as a "sorry for the wait". The room was small, the bathroom was so small you couldn't even turn around in, the shower was open making for a wet bathroom floor after every shower. The room was so hot all the time, we called the front desk asking if there was any way to cool our room down as obviously the thermostat in our room didn't work. They said they would send someone up to check it out, needless to say they said it was fine and working properly but it remained so hot in the room the whole stay it was so uncomfortable. The first morning we were there we went to try and ask the concierge for help and boy did she blow us off. She was so rude and didn't help us at all. Needless to say, we were stuck trying to figure everything out on our own. Nobody we encountered in the hotel was overly friendly, so definitely F for service. The room doesn't even have a coffee maker, I have never stayed at a hotel with no coffee maker! Even cheap Super 8 hotels have a coffee maker. No mini fridge, no microwave, nothing! The only positive I will give this hotel is the location. Other than that I would look elsewhere for a place to stay cause this place is so not worth it! There is no restaurant on site either so you are stuck going off the hotel for every meal. Our view was of a brick building, terrible.

Had a rough time during my 6 night stay. Would not recommend to another business traveler. Tiny bathrooms, no room service. Poor cell signal in the room. Noisy in the rooms facing street. When they changed my room they gave me one with a connecting door! They provided no shower caps despite my asking several times. They sent a kettle but no other accessories. The housekeepers don't clean and one rifled through my bag and stole designer jewelry which in my rush to leave for meetings I forgot to place in safe. The security guy gave me a form to fill but I dont see any follow up. I dont care about the money, just hate the idea of someone stealing from my suitcase from a locked room. Should be easy to track who stole and return my jewelry. I will not return to this hotel.

Rooms larger than normal NYC hotel rooms, recently renovated to quite stylish. Cleaning, porter and valet staff very friendly and helpful but the reception and concierge could do with a bit of customer training :-( Great location, one block from Central Park. They sting you with a $25 daily charge on top of your bill for using free wifi and a bunch of other stuff you don't really need but you pay it to get the wifi - this is not explained at time of booking

We are greeted by a bunch of nice people from the Bell, Valet to the Front Desk. I would recommend this hotel for Mid-Town Vacationers. Perfect Location, clean and affordably. I book my room for a Friday in December, I took advantage of a web blast promotion.

On arrival at Park Central, the outdoor area and lobby are beautiful! Working as a hotel manager myself, the one thing I was disappointed with was customer service - at check in, the staff member on the desk wasn't particularly welcoming and this set the bar for service throughout our 4 night stay (apart from a lovely gentlemen who was working at the luggage room on our check out day). The rooms are nicely decorated, but basic. We stayed on the 16th floor and thankfully didn't really have any issues with the lifts as others have mentioned, although our keys stopped working the day before we were due to check out. Our room was well serviced and replenished with fresh towels when needed (just place them in the bath to have them changed), however, we did find that the shower curtain was around 2 inches too short, which lead to a wet bathroom floor. We did miss not having a tea tray with kettle in the room and a mini fridge - it would have enhanced our stay (we ventured to the nearest Starbucks rather than purchasing from the very expensive shop within the hotel). Although we availed of the internet connection within the room, the extra charge of $25pn was a bit much for all they offer.All in all, a fantastic location - we couldn't have picked a better spot - easy access to so many hotspots and tour bus connections too. There are just a few things I would suggest that management take into consideration including customer service training.

This hotel is in a perfect location! Central park is only a few steps away and times square only a few blocks walk away. The Door man is a star frirndly and always willing to help with directions and if you need a taxi can have one for you in seconds. Also the subway is only a stroll from hotel makinga great location. We had a good saty however i should point out the hotel is more designed to the business traveller andf if you are staying more than a few nights in our experience dont expect a great deal of hosue keepingh we found it a particaular challange getting clean towels and resorted to buying our own i expeected a little more from a four star hotel.

We visited New York as a group of four female friends. We booked a corner 2 x Queen bed room and we were not disappointed. Firstly, the positives, we found the room very clean, nice toiletries, good powerful hairdryer, comfy beds. The bar area was very nice, stylish and comfortable. Great view up 7th Avenue towards Times Square. Great location and staff seemed mostly helpful. We used one of their private cars back to Newark airport which was very comfortable and $90 flat rate. Negatives: As we booked through Expedia, I contacted the hotel to advise that there would be 4 of us and not 2 (the others were flying in from other places. I received confirmation of this. On 2 occasions, I was contacted by the hotel with various confirmations and welcome emails with the reservation saying the booking was for 2 people - which prompted me to check this. When they always confirmed it was for 4. However, on arrival in our room we received towels for 3 people, free drinks vouchers for 2 people and free chocolates (delicious) for 2 people. Although none of this was a huge deal, it would have been nice to have more acknowledgement of the 4 of us. Every day when housekeeping serviced our room they took away the towels again (clean or dirty) and left us 3 sets - which required a a call to housekeeping. They were always prompt and it wasn't a huge deal, just a bit annoying. The hotel bar doesn't open until 5pm, which was a little frustrating as we found we often would have used it at other times of the day had it been open. However the drinks were pleasant and came with lovely table snacks. There is no restaurant, which we knew but found the 'Central Market' coffee shop to be pretty small and very expensive. A tub of nuts, 2 packets of crisps and a packet of M&Ms = $15. As we visited in December, AC wasn't an issue for us (as commented on in other reviews) there was a large under window unit which seemed to heat/cool the room as necessary. Seemed pretty efficient, although a little noisy but no huge complaints. We were on the 18th floor and the room was quite noisy from street buzz. But we just accepted this as the NYC noise and it didn't stop us sleeping etc as we got used to it very quickly. Might be worth requesting a quieter room if you have kids though. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square, 5 minute walk to Central Park, 10-15 mins to 5th Avenue and 2 mins from Ellen's Stardust Diner - which was great fun! Overall, I would stay here again - as it was pretty much what we needed. Just a few comments as above which would have made it even better.

What a wonderful hotel! Right in the centre of it all. I would stay here again on our next visit to New York. What i would say though is you are told you have unlimited calls international and local but this doesnt mean it is paid for in the bill and you will be charged, thankfully i only called home once but would have been cheaper using my mobile. The lift was out of order alot leaving only one able to use which was a nightmare being on the 18th floor, however rooms were clean, fresh towels etc everyday and good service

Let's start with the good...the location is amazing and the room itself was a good size and setup. The beds were very comfortable.For the "ah well...not a big deal"...there could have been a minibar even with just water and or soda. Maybe some overpriced snacks and a few cold expensive beers. We only stayed one night and I think you could have added another $50-60 to our bill with that.For the poor I will try to be polite as I can. The building has no AC, which is understandable. But if your hotel is $500+ a night and has no AC, perhaps that should be mentioned somewhere? Upon mentioning that there may be an issue with the AC (and learning there is none in the building from a young lady who clearly was having a rough day or hates her job) we were told to open our window. We did open the window the entire 4 inches we are allowed, and it didn't help at all. I understand that it is unseasonably warm, but a little kindness and perhaps having an idea when we paid the $500 that we would be sweating all night would have been nice.Upon checkout we mentioned the AC/Heat issue (not because we were asked how our stay was...no one seemed to care) and were blown off all together and were rushed to pay for the room so they could get to other (presumably) more important customers. Other highlights from the room that no one appeared concerned with at the front desk: Long hairs folded into one of our towels (very gross); short hairs all over the sink and tub (moderately gross); a shower curtain that was not long enough to cover the length to the tub and appeared made of cotton, leading us to use most of our towels to wipe up the soaking wet bathroom floor after every shower; and a carpet that had more hair on it than the bathroom.I have stayed at quite a few $500 hotels in New York at different parts of the year and in different areas in the city. This is the first poor review I have left for those or any other hotel. The majority of the errors could have been corrected with kindness and better communication, both were lacking. You will be happy to know that I did not make a scene in the lobby as we checked out. That is not my style. However I will be honest on this survey, to my colleagues, friends, and family, and on any website that would ask my thoughts about your business. We were shocked and actually angry after checkout. The beautiful city of New York helped us get passed that soon after exiting, but it was truly a shame.

The Park Central hotel is at best average compared to the other hotels in the area. It is located near some of the top tour attractions such as Times Square, Broadway, Central Park and Rockefeller Center but for a few dollars more you can get much better service at one of the name brand hotels nearby.There is no restaurant in the Park Central and therefore no room service. There are no coffee makers in the rooms nor refrigerators. Yet the hotel charges a $25 per night resort fee. The ice machine on my floor was broken during my entire stay.I had issues with housekeeping while there. If you are on an 'early' housekeeping floor and there is a do not disturb sign on your door, housekeeping will not come back later in the morning to service your room. I learned this the hard way. After leaving the room around 10 am I removed the do not disturb sign from the door and went about my day assuming that my room would be made up while I was away. I returned at 7pm to shower and freshen up for dinner only to discover that my room had not been touched. I called the hotel operator to see if I could get service, but housekeeping had already left. I asked for some towels to be brought up to my room. It took over an hour and a half to obtain towels. I even offered to get them myself. Needless to say I missed dinner that night.Every morning since then I had to call housekeeping before leaving my room in order to ensure service. I asked to speak to the manager about my experience. The operator told me that the message would be given to the manager. No manager came to speak to me during my remaining four days at the hotel.If I had to do it again, I would pay a little more and stay at one of the national chain hotels in the area. I cannot recommend the Park Central.

It's not often we leave negative feedback but we were ''Really disappointed'' when arrived it took almost half an hour to check-in and considering their were only 2 people in front of us we felt there was no effect to keep the flow moving to avoid any long ques. The hotel lacks not having a restaurant, no mini fridge and unhelpful service. The part that really topped it of for us that made us feel it was worth while leaving negative feedback was the way that we was miss lead on the phone with park central in believing that we were allowed free long distant over sea calls which turns out was not the case and frustratingly we were left to pick up the bill which Bonita hotel staff receptionist refused to help out on, nor offer an apology. In-addition bath room ceiling had obvious patches of mould and painting peeling off. View was nothing spectacular, subway, and some odd shops, if we had the choice again we would select a cheaper hotel which in our view would offer better service and would of saved us some money.

Booked a room with 2 double beds, called to confirm and when we checked in they said they were overbooked and only had a room with one double and a sofa pullout. After 4 nights my back was killing me. The two other guests behind us did not get the rooms they booked either. For 350 a night this was not acceptable. They said they could not compensate me because room was booked through Expedia. They also charge a resort fee on top of everything even if you do not use gym etc. Elevators are small so you have to wait frequently. Room was clean and good location. Desk representative on duty night of 12/4 was not nice and not helpful.

The most important thing about this hotel is its location... if you stay there you will be minutes away from most important attractions in the city; and service from everybody is really kind and formal.As most NYC Hotels within this price range, you will have a comfortable room but don't expect them to be that spacious; though, you will have what you need, it will be clean and you will rest silently in the middle of the city.Once the day begins and traffic builds around the place you will hear some street noises; it does not have a restaurant, but there is a grab and go coffee shop with really good stuff (a little pricey).The only downside, A/C is too loud... luckily, when we visited, it was not needed but I believe that management should do something to get new machines there.

Hotel is in a great location 50yds from the parkRooms are lovely and kept very clean. Staff very helpful. There is a $50 per night holding charge - you get half back at the end of your staySteer clear of the hotel, shop it's mega expensive. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a long weekend

Just back from an amazing stay at Park Central. Location is 5 mins from central park and 10 from Times Square so it was ideal for everything. Loads of places to eat nearby.Rooms really spacious, clean and great comfy beds.The staff are so friendly and helpful at all times. Quimby was wonderful and made us so welcome.Great few days in a great hotel. Thanks!

My husband and I stayed at the Park Central earlier this week. We stayed in a corner room that was spacious and comfortable. The room was clean, and the housekeeping staff was very nice.The only negatives about our stay were (1) the long wait to check in (the desk appeared to be shorthanded), and (2) the long walk to the elevators. Although there was a bank of elevators near our room, guests were asked not to use those elevators. Only 2 of the 4 elevators in the set we were asked to use actually went to the lobby. Still that was a minor inconvenience.Convenient location for theaters, Rockefeller Plaza, and Central Park. Good value!

I've said it before and I'll say it again location means a lot. This hotel was at a great location -- two blocks south of Central Park and about 10 blocks north of Times Square. And a yellow line subway on the corner. Carnigie Hall was on the next corner and Carnegie deli a block away. Awesome. I was also very pleased that they stored our luggage before check-in time. Great service!The room was clean and the king bed soooo comfortable (soft and squishy comfortable). The bathroom fixtures were modern, and I liked that they had full size shampoo, conditioner and body wash attached to the wall.I will complain that the room was always so hot. Even though we put the thermostat at 65F, it always seemed to be about 75F. Fortunately the windows opened and we were able to cool it off to sleep comfortably.No comment on the staff. We only interacted at check in. Not really friendly but efficient, so fine.I would stay here again.

We (2 adults, 2 children) went to NYC for the weekend in November. We stayed at the Park Central. The hotel was bright and friendly. I thought the elevators were small for such a large hotel but that may be my inexperience in hotel living. The room was an upgrade but seemed small. There were two doubles which we requested. Moving around the room was tight. After looking for things the children dropped, I thought the room could have been cleaner regarding the floor. One positive was that it was close to Rockefeller Center and Central Park. The short distance to see things was great. Overall the experience was ok. Again for us, average.

Disappointed in the hotel. Great location close to Times Square but let down badly by housekeeping the worst I have come across constantly leaving us short of towels and not cleaning the room daily. Given 4th floor on side street which was extremely noisy all night and we had a 6 yr old with us. Reception staff on checking in were very abrupt and not at all helpful or welcoming. Sorry to say would not stay here again.

I have stayed at the hotel several times before. As before, the room was very clean and spacious (enough); the staff was helpful and friendly, and the location next to Central Park remains great. I will return to the hotel.

This was my first time in NY and was not sure what the hotel was going to look like. It exceeded my expectations. The staff was great. I was very pleased .From the front desk, bellman, maid service superb.

This time I chose Park Central hotel for my short trip to New York City. Why? Because hotel has gone thru a complete renovation a year ago and I have to say that the rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable and good size. Rooms are missing slippers and robes, but that shows in a cheeper room rate. Actually, I did not miss robe, but slippers. The fitness is ok, open 24/7. Bar area is modern and has its own spirit. There is no restaurant but walking out from the door city is full of restaurants. No breakfast, but the cafe in the lobby opens at 6am. In overall, very nice hotel.

location is the best thing of this hotel. otherwise is really anonymous, too big, understaffed (queuing for check in and check out very long, if you want to pay cash). no real service. the air condition didn't work properly: it has been fixed but didn't work anyway and it is very loud! no minibar in the room, no slippery. on top of that they charges $ 25.-- per day, per room, for services (but most of them you don't use...........)

Having never been to NYC in December, we wanted to stay in a hotel that was convenient for shopping and sightseeing. The best feature about this hotel is its convenient location to do so. Our three night stay found us within walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall! The lights, music and sound of New York in December is beautiful and memorable! The bellhops, check in and staff are pleasant and helpful. Being warned about the small sized rooms in New York, we were pleasantly surprised to find a large king sized bed, 60" flat screen TV and plenty of room to move around. Truth be told, the bathroom is most compact and small, but it did have a 3/4 sized bathtub. The one problem that we did have was the very dim lighting in both the bedroom and the bathroom. Overall the room was modern and clean without any other issues. I felt that the price that we paid for the room was high, then you need to tack on the facilities fee and the high NYC room taxes, this is the most that I have ever paid to stay in a hotel room anywhere! But then again, this is midtown Manhattan!

What a gorgeous Hotel! Excellent speedy service at reception. No issues with the lifts at all. Spacious rooms which were cleaned daily. WIFI service is very fast. Bar area is beautiful if a little pricey. No restaurant inside the hotel but you're in New York...theres hundreds to choose from!! Very close to Central Park and Times Square. We had a bit of a mix up with our room but was compensated by not being charged the facilities fee. Would I recommend Park Central Hotel? Definitely!!! We will be back :)

Just come back from a 4 day stay in New York with my wife, staying at the Park Central Hotel, having read mixed reviews prior to going i was a bit nervous as to what i would find, but, credit to the Hotel our stay was excellent. All the staff were very friendly and accomidating, i had requested a coffee maker which appeared 5 minutes after checking into our room. The room itself was very clean and spacious, the bed was to die for, the Bathroom was clean, in fact athere was nothing bad to say about the room. The lifts had been previously mentioned in other reviews as being slow and crowded, i have to admit thoug we had no issues at all with calling one to go down to the lobby or up to our room, they were never what you would call full and we certainly didnt have to wait for one. All in all i would highly recommend the hotel and we will be planning on staying there again next year.

Decent hotel, comfy rooms, comfy beds, brilliant location. HOWEVER, we paid all our charges pre arrival including the $25 facilities fee. On arrival, we were told we needed a credit card on record for any collateral/use of the hotel bar. My natural assumption was that if we were to use the bar then this would be debited from my account on checkout etc so no issue with this. Lady behind the desk took a copy of our card, little did we know until 4 days later when we tried to pay for some shopping on the card, the hotel had actually taken a $50 per night charge from us on arrival. As we were there for 7 nights, this ammounted to a $350 dollar charge (£236). I was absolutely fuming at the fact we were not told about this charge prior to arrival or on arrival, the lady did not inform us that she would be taking a payment. When i spoke to customer relations they said the money would be put back into account as soon as we checked out as long as we had not racked up any charges! It is now 9 days since we checked out and this money is still nowhere to be seen. We have contacted the hotel via email on numerous occasions via email about this with no response. It is absolutely out of order. So quick to take money out of our account, not so quick to put it back. If youre considering booking this hotel based on their price per night. Dont. The price you see is certainly not the price you will pay.

This hotel is definitely not worth your money. They charge you $25.00 per night for what they call "facilities fee" which gives you the privilege of making local & long distance calls (who the heck doesn't have a cell phone) use of the gym, and use of their computers (wow, they're macs!) All of this is standard for a Hampton Inn for goodness sake! We had the thermostat set to 65 but it felt like a sauna, front desk was of no help. There is no restaurant, the small bake shop with pre-made sandwiches (where are they being made?) closes at 8:30. the concierge desk opens at 8:00a.m and closes at 8:00 p.m. - really? We're talking New York City!!! The towels are about the size of a postage stamp, and the bar of soap they give you is laughable. To say that i was EXTREMELY disappointed would be an understatement. By the way, parking is $60.00 a night. With all of the hotels available in New York City, do yourself a favor and find someplace else than the Park Central to stay at.

I love this hotel - the location is the best and the room was very comfortable. Central Park and nightly street food vendor Halal Guys were only a walk away.The only thing I didn't like was the small bathroom but everything else was wonderful.

Me and my friend had everything prepaid since months before and right at the moment of our arrival, we were told the hotel have had a problem on it's plumbing.. They wanted to transfer us to a horrible hotel next to it for the very same price (which isn't cheap). We didn't accepted of course and asked for a complete refund which took months to be done. I't a beautiful hotel but they were rude to us and didn't try to help us out. I'm never going back.

Second time I've been to New York and stayed here both times. This is an excellent hotel. The location is so close to Times Square and Central Park that it's a great starting point for tourism. The rooms are a very good size - even the basic ones, but they are clean and comfortable too. The lifts aren't that slow either despite the reviews on here.Love New York and love this hotel.

I loved this hotel. From the moment we stepped out of the taxi we were welcomed with great assistance from the hotel staff helping with our bags and the pleasant reception staff at check-in. The entrance to the hotel gives a great first impression and when we saw our room I was more than pleased with our booking. The room was spacious, modern and most importantly the beds amazingly comfortable. Had some of the best nights sleep I've ever had in an hotel. The hotel doesn't come with tea and coffee making facilities or a fridge but these can be requested. I noted this from a previous Trip Advisor post and so sent an email in advance to the hotel requesting this and all the facilities arrived within minutes of us checking in. Great service!The location of the hotel is perfect, a mere 5-10 mins walk to Central Park and Times Square and minutes from the subway.I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Okay, technically there is food, there's a coffee and snack counter in the Lobby, but other than that....nothing. And the restaurants around the hotel need to be researched because some are truly bleh...Friendly staff, decent sized room are pluses, but no HBO or Showtime, just paid movies....there are better options in this price category in Manhattan.

Great location short walk down into times square, hotel lovely clean and warm beds very comfy would definitely recommend hoping to stay here again when I return. Great for sightseeing you can catch the city loop bus just outside where you can take a 2 day tour all around the area,ground zero, brooklyn bridge, statue of liberty and of course the shopping.

Stayed overnight this week to attend a function at Carnegie Hall, which is a block away. The hotel has very good location; lots of sights and sounds within easy walking distance, including Central Park. Checking in was fast and easy.The room we had (1801) was surprisingly large for New York with a nice bathroom. But too few hangers in the closet.Nice bed, too. But the highlight was the pillows. Sheer bliss.It was a quiet room, too.There is a little take out food place in the lobby that's handy, and a nice lounge tucked behind the front counters.Staff was attentive and friendly.What we did not like was the added fee of $27 charged for WiFi, phone calling and use of the gym. I resented that, and reported it to a guest services guy who was very pleasant but unrepentant. I also am not enjoying the slew of follow up emails asking about our stay there. But aside from that, it's was good.

Great place. Clean, In the middle of everything. We walked to almost every place we wanted to see. Loved it! ....and NYC....My home sweet home!!!! I lived in the States for almost 30 years...now in Taormina....I LOVE NY!!!

My family and I recently stayed at Park Central. The location is wonderful - so close to Central Park and so many other NYC Mid-town attractions. The housekeeping staff was always very helpful and cheerful. Also, I booked well in advance and secured a more affordable rate than some of the other NYC properties. My only negative was the front desk staff was not as welcoming as I have seen in other hotels. We checked in late in the evening and they got us checked-in, but they were not over accommodating. We had a nice stay and I would stay there again given the rate and location.

Great location a few blocks away from all the major attractions in New York City.The hotel is great great lobby.they feature a market to pick up the breakfast (because unfortunately no room service). .I had requested a room in a high floor with a view and I booked through Booking.com.When I checked in, to guy at the desk made a face when he saw that I didn't book directly with the hotel..which happens too often...Although Booking represents between 20 and 30% of the total reservations for the hotels..I got a room with a horrible view on the seventh floor when I requested A high floor and a view of the city..The hotel was half empty..The room was nice.Small but everything was there.except that the curtain above the air conditioning was filthy and full of dust and I had a to call them to clean it.. There are tons of hotels like this in the city with rooms at 350$.You must check to see which one makes the better deals..

Since I arrived the attention was excellent, the manager is very attentive always aware spoke Spanish so language was not a problem. When we get to the room had an excellent view of time square, the bed sheets were clean as was the bathroom all perfectly neat.I didn't had the opportunity to taste the food in the hotel because we always ate outside. The concierge explain me how to use the subway, facilitated me maps and helped me get tickets to see the Statue of Liberty.Outside the vallets was bery polite, they helped me get taxis when needed without mentioning that the hotel is really close to many places of interest like the central park, time square, broadway and central station where you can go by walking.

I booked the classic king size bed room a week in advance but when I arrived they said they had "overbooked" and had no more rooms with king size beds available. Instead, they put me and my girlfriend in a room with 2 small queen beds. What's the point of booking a room with 1 king size bed if you're not going to have it available? On top of that, Highgate Holdings charged me $50 a week later for the room, not sure for what? I was told when checking out that I had no charges.Also, I accidentally left my expensive watch by the tv. I have been calling everyday and security & lost and found have not been able to help at all. Probably the worst experience I have had with a hotel.

Without getting into details, we had a problem that the staff was quick to address. They bent over backwards to make sure we were comfortable and happy, and could not have been kinder or more responsive. We greatly appreciate their help, and would gladly stay here again.

Spent three nights at the start of November and could not recommend highly enough. Rooms were of a decent size and bed very comfortable. Didn't eat here so can't comment on the food but the bar was excellent as were the staff. Got checked in very quickly. I saw a lot of people complain about the lifts, they were a little slow but nothing to complain about. The hotel is ideally situated for Times Square (5 minute walk) and Central Park. Could not have asked for more. If you come to New York I'm not sure why you would spend that much time in your hotel anyway

We stayed here for 5 days over Thanksgiving. The security was poor. Only one elevator required a room key to access the floors. The other one was accessible to anyone off the street. I asked the front desk , the night before we left to change the settlement arrangements and they assured me we would be able to express checkout . The next morning the front desk did I not know about the changes and I had to go to the desk to check out .they brought our car around and took it back for some reason so we ended up waiting for over 1/2 hour for the car after it should have been there. For $400 a. night we should have stayed at the Marriott. It would have been cheaper with better service . Lesson learned.

Lovely hotel. Perfect place for us so close to time square and central park. We saw everything we wanted to with jusy a walk away . Hotel is imaculate. Staff are great Bar staff in lounge very friendly. Highly reccomended

We spent the Thanksgiving weekend in the city and were very happy with our decision to stay at the Park Central. Aside from the wonderful location (between Times Square and Central Park) the hotel was very nice. The staff was wonderful (valet, baggage, front desk, room service/maids) and the room was larger than the typical NYC room. It was very clean and the bed was both large and very comfortable. We were very pleased and would certainly recommend the Park Central to our family and friends.

Hotel good for a week in New York.not long wait for lifts as other people commented. Yes only two lifts but we found ok. Hotel near a subway and lots of deli to eat at locally.if you are thinking of going to New York this is a good base

We stayed at the Park central on a last minute trip before Thanksgiving. Just 2 shorts blocks from Central Park, you can't beat the location. We easily walked from the hotel to Columbus Circle, the Central park zoo, and Rockefeller Center. We booked a package deal that included valet for only an additional $10. After reading some reviews, we were not expecting to have a very easy time with the valet but it was painless. There were spots in front of the hotel and a valet attendant outside. We told him we were staying 2 days, took a valet ticket, and he helped us with our bags. We were a little early so we checked in but our room wasn't ready yet and we weren't willing to accept a double bed room (they offered) so we elected to have the hotel hold our bags while we got an early dinner. (Tip: Eat at Angelo's pizza nearby!) Our room had a king bed and was a little small, but for New York and the location, I would not have expected anything better. It was CLEAN and modern. It was also remarkably quiet. We didn't have a view, but you can spend more for an upgrade and get a view of Times Square. The bathroom was also on the small side and my only pet peeve was that they didn't give you personal shampoos and body wash, only wall-mounted dispensers. I know they are locked and can't be removed or tampered with (hopefully), but I would really have preferred my own. But again, for the price and location it seems like such a trivial complaint. I'll bring my own shampoo!Check out was quick and the valet brought our car within 15 minutes, not the hour that some other reviewers have stated. But just to note: parking in New York City is a bear. Seriously. Try to park yourself anywhere. To have a valet at all is fantastic. And if you are staying during a busy time, they may have to move cars to get to yours. Or you may be the 4th car they have to get that morning. Have some patience. Go next door and get a coffee from Starbucks while you wait. I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is modern, clean, and in a great location. Not far from Times Square and Central Park.Only reason I'm not giving it 4/5 stars is because there's a mandatory $25-a-day fee for "unlimited long distance calls (we all have cell phones now) and to use the gym (I've never been charged for that.)" Pretty scammy way to decrease their rates by $25 to appear cheaper than they actually are. I'd consider staying there again, but it left a very sour taste in my mouth.

Couples trip! Recently renovated rooms, so they were super clean. Small but you don't need more! Quite a location! There's a Starbucks right next to the hotel as well as lots of other cafes for breakfast! Pizza places nearby! But really close to 5th av and Times Square. The hotel staff is nice but they don't go over the top... Don't ask for recommendations, they will send you to places that you don't need to visit while in NYC... It is better to Google!

I booked an overnight stay based on the close proximity to Carnegie Hall. Not having any personal reference to guide me, I was pleased with my choice as soon as we entered the lobby. Quick check in and our room was very nice. Modern, upscale bathroom. Very quiet, and a comfortable bed and pillows. Would definitely recommend Park Central as a great place to stay.

Park Central Hotel has a very pleasant, friendly, professional staff! Ana, at front desk, was amazing. She was kind and helpful and listened carefully to each request. Coffee pot and refrigerator was requested and placed in rooms. Express check out and luggage storage were very efficient. Newly decorated rooms were clean, beds were comfortable. Bathroom had plush white towels and large shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. Shower curtain was great. We chose Premier rooms with two queen beds. Rooms cleaned each day by very friendly staff. Elevator can be busy at times. Stairs and service elevator are available. May use room key in elevator slot and then push room number. Lobby area (behind front desk) is newly decorated and relaxing for family gatherings. Starbucks next door. Premier Cafe on corner, plus others. Walked to Central Park, 5th Avenue for shopping, Times Square and more. Doormen helpful. Easy to get a cab. Booking Park Central Hotel for our next family NYC vacation!

Only a few blocks from Time Square and Central Park, this is the perfect location for first time travellers to New York City.The hotel staff are pleasant and polite. Our room was perfectly sized with a huge bed - the room description said among sized bed, but ours was much bigger! (American super sized).

This was a good mid priced choice for a recreational stay. Close to subway and central park as well as restaurants and tourist spots. Staff was friendly and property was decent. Would stay here again. I got a good deal via travel website and was happy with the price per night.

After meeting Elizabeth on our first stay at Park Central a couple years ago, my family and I haven´t been able to stay anywhere else. She always amaze us answering our requests exceeding all expectations and making our stay the best!! By the way the hotel facilities, rooms and locations are excellent. But look for Elizabeth if you need anything.

I will go through each point separately because there are some great things about this hotel, and some not so great.Check in - checking in was quite fast and easy, however the lady at the check in desk was not friendly at all and had a bit of an attitude upfront, but that was the only time we saw her.The room - very impressed, room was spacious, bathroom was lovely with an amazing lit up mirror. Good television with lots of channels, there was a big book about NYC in there which went through things you can do which was interesting. However the rooms can be a little noisy, traffic is a given, that's what we expected being in a big city, but the walls are fairly thin and you can hear the conversations of the people next door. The rooms were comfy, beds were nice and big with good pillows and a very good mattress so sleep quality was good.Location - excellent location, this was the real perk of the hotel. Very close to the subway station and can get to other parts of New York on the R line very easily, including the World Trade Centre which was useful. It is around a ten minute walk from Times Square and therefore has a huge range of great restaurants to eat from, I saw someone mentioned on here they were disappointed no room service was available, but you do not need this when there are so many great eateries right on your door step. It is less than ten minutes to get up to Central Park, in my opinion you are in one of the best places in the whole of Manhattan and therefore I will recommend this hotel to anyone I know going to NYC.The hotel - the hotel itself is nice from what I saw of it, I didn't spend much time in the room or in the hotel as we spent most of our time sightseeing. There is a lovely coffee shop downstairs in the lobby. The bad - what I did not like about this hotel was the resort fees. $25 a DAY for something we did not need. This apparently covers things like wifi and the fitness centre. This made me angry and put a real downer on the trio as we got a bill for $165 at the end of our trip which we received no benefit from. My phone plan allows me to use data abroad free of charge so I did not even use the wifi. I understand some hotels have these fees. In Sarasota we paid $15 a night but with that we were able to use the kayaks, boats, paddle boards, as well as the beautiful swimming pools, pool service, and included shuttles into the town. At Park Central I just felt like the resort fees were daylight robbery and whilst I want to recommend this hotel to friends and family, this is what could hold me back. I am a travel agent and have used this hotel for clients before but this will make a difference in my choice next time. Lastly, there are only two lifts so you end up waiting a long time to get up and down from your rooms. These cannot fit many people in, especially when carrying suitcases, and one of the lifts was out of order during our stay which doubled the problem.

Stayed for 3 nights here.. first night had an adjoining room which I hate. .noisy no privacy. . Changed rooms no problem. . Minor issues in new room.. concierge sue and manager Chloe went above and beyond to make it all good personal and professional. . Great location .. would stay again.. note elevator very small and slow but a very good experience

We (2 adults and 2 kids 10 and 12) spent 4 nights. We have been accomodated in a very noisy room (big a/c units nearby the window), with lot of dust on carpets, leftover dirty socks from prevoius guests, no safety box (just removed from the broken support), no toiletries and only 2 towel sets. Paying more than 200,00 per night. After complaining we have been moved, with a day delay, to a slightly better room (higher floor) but still dirty. Reception service is awful. At least they refunded us with the extra fee that they charge to everyone on top of room rate just for benefiting wi-fi and luggage storage. They leave a long queue waiting both for check in and check out as they only open one desk in peak time. To access to toilet you need to wait for your turn at check in as well.Concierge staff is prepared and helpful trying to balance reception. Also baggage room staff is very nice. Location is pretty good, hall appearance is beautiful and cafe' is also good. Nearby you can find whatever you need for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Booked this hotel having never been to New York before. Overall had a great time but barely spent any time at the hotel.Liked how close the hotel was to the 57th / 7th subway station which using the R line we got to most key landmarks e.g One World Trade Center and Battey Park for Liberty.Starbucks practically next door and open until lateVarious local places to grab a great breakfast just avoid Benash- see separate reviewSlight frustrations that stop this getting full marks;- lifts are small and always seem to be busy/full. Seems like they could do with some more- check in and check out can be slow as not all staff at the desk can perform these functions- quite dusty in some of the corners of the room (924)

Just returned from a 4 night stay. Park Central was a great choice for location but sparse in amenities. No coffee maker, fridge, vending machines at the ice machines, no room service, no information in room about what the facility offered or what attractions were close by.Poor planning at registration desk. Two people were working, six families/couples waiting to check in on a Friday evening, the start of the holiday weekend. Our first night, was so cold because the heater did not work, that I slept with my down jacket AND North Face parka. (Read other reviews, seem to be a common complaint.)Called down the next morning to ask to fix heater, fix desk lamp, and 2 extra blankets. I think they fixed the heater, but was still cold.Blankets didn't get delivered til the LAST night of stay, and the broken desk lamp was left in the room on the floor, still plugged in all 4 nights. The room also had a sour smell like damp laundry, and housekeeping left used glasses with melted ice in the bucket after cleaning the room. I asked for clean glasses and new plastic bag for the ice bucket and got the clean glasses the next day but the used plastic was still in the bucket. On the third day, we got clean glasses and 2 plastic bags for the ice bucket. Kind of odd artwork in the bathroom, a painted face staring at you behind the toilet and the eyes follow you wherever you stand in the small bathroom.Like I said, overall it was a convenient location but for the rating and price, kind of overrated. Got more at 3 star hotels.

I stayed at the Park Central on a recent business visit - I recently moved out of NYC so this was my first stay in a hotel in the area.My stay in the hotel started off with me arriving early and being offered a room, even though I only requested to check my bags. Seemed great until I got to the room and it was OCCUPIED. I went back down to the lobby, after waiting a long time for the elevator (common problem during the stay) to not even get an apology from the gentleman at the front desk, even though I was very polite about the mix-up. I explained I just wanted to check my bags and would wait for a room until later in the day. You would think I would at least receive an apology and something for the inconvenience when I checked back in but nothing AT ALL was even said. I walked in on guests and no one seemed to have a problem with it!The room was adequate and was a nice size, the bathroom was a bit smaller including the shower but it did the trick. The elevator was painstakingly slow the entire trip. There were no waters in the room and the store downstairs charges you for the convenience factor - over $4 for the smallest bottle of evian! I will not be returning, there's better options in the area.

Hi just want to let you all know that this hotel is very very nice , it's got very big rooms with a super queens size bed and big living area . Bathroom lovely just nit a big bath for those liking a nice soke . It's got a lovely coffee shop inside that does little choice of cakes etc and the prices are ok . Please note Do not pay for over charge taxis that cost around 100 dollars plus tax and toll charges . We did the train . You have to walk or get a taxi to 32 street and catch the train at a cost of 13 dollors total . And it takes around 30 minutes max . Normally it's track 1 Also if you are looking at going on the site seeing bus . Please make sure you book the red open top bus . You get a better deal and everyone talks great about them . The cost is around 64 dollors but that is for 3 full days . Also ask them for a grey line discount card . Saves you great money around New York . From food to shopping discount up to 30 % in places . I would say do not buy any ticked from the uk do it in new York. Thank you for reading this and hope you have a great stay Best regards Chris Thompson EastwoodNottingham Date of our stay was the 23rd November.

Arrived on noon Friday hoping to check in early. Desk clerk said if I was willing to take two queens instead of the king I had booked, they had one available. That was a great trade-off for me, and I took it. How nice to get settled early. Room was clean and nicely equipped. Convenient market in the lobby for coffee, snacks, pastries, and drinks. Also, Tisserie coffee shop and Starbucks are literally outside the front entrance. Did not require any other help from staff. Rate was very reasonable for the great location in Midtown. A+.

I was in NYC on a business trip in November 2015 and stayed in Park Central hotel, which is connected to WestHouse hotel as they are part of the same group. Nathan Goodman, director of corporate sales handled my stay and made sure everything was perfect from A to Z. Both hotels are equally great, where WestHouse has more of a boutique feel and Park Central has a bigger reception and lobby area. The hotels share one gym on the 3rd floor which is conveniently open 24/7 and has all the necessary equipment you would need on a business or personal trip. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful. The location couldn't be better - it's just a couple of blocks away from Times Square and many Manhattan attractions. Everything is pretty much within walking distance. Highly recommended for both business and leisure travel.

My husband, 9 year old daughter and I had a wonderful 8 night mid-term school break at the Park Central Hotel in October. We arrived late on a Friday afternoon from Dublin and were checked in immediately. Our room was just as we expected.....huge, clean and well maintained. The bathroom was spotless and well appointed. The bath towels were so soft and fluffy that they couldn't possible fit into our suitcases lol. Housekeeping ladies were exceptional during our stay, as was the guy who washed our windows, and the maintenance man who repaired a minor fault with a power outlet in our room.OK the elevators are a bit on the tardy side, but we quickly learnt to avoid peak times. Park Central Hotel has an ideal location with Central Park, Broadway and Time Square just a very short walk away and the subway is literally 2 minutes walk from the front door. We knew that tea and coffee making facilities were not available in our room so we be brought our own travel kettle and supplies, just for that cuppa in the morning. Diners are located very close to the hotel, for breakfast lunch and dinner......some are better than others.....try them all!!! OK.....so the elevators are a bit on the slow side, it's not the end of the world....neither is the queue to leave your luggage in storage after you check out.....take time to breathe, talk to your family, plan the last day of your stay, but don't give the guy/gal at the luggage counter bad attitude....they are only there to help you on the last day of your stay. They also have candy on the counter ❤️❤️❤️. We will definitely be back.....sooner rather than later.

Several months ago, I booked a pre-paid standard King room at $249 for one night to attend a NY Philharmonic concert.The day before my departure, I received a reminder e-mail. Out of curiosity, I checked the hotel website, and the same room was $180 per night. I called and spoke with a very nice lady in reservations named Erica. She checked with her manager, and they honored the $180 rate that was on the website. They refunded my credit card $59, plus tax. Considering it was a pre-paid reservation, that was a VERY nice gesture on the part of the Park Central Hotel. I will certainly stay here again!

my wife and i booked this hotel.. when we got there they would not let us check in until4pm.we arrived there at 1pm. then at 4pm when we tried to check in the computerswere down, so they had to do everything manually. they knew the computers weredown when I tried to check in at 1pm but did absolutely nothing but turn guests awayuntil 4pm. then there was a line up going outside the hotel and up the block. it tookaprox 3hrs to check in. then the elevators were not working. the internet was notworking. they could not give us electronic keys to get into our rooms. they sent securityup to open the doors any time we had to get back to the room. this was the worst experience I ever had. this hotel should be a minus 5 star.

This hotel was placed in an ideal location just a short walk to Times Square and Central Park, with many eateries, coffee shops and department stores within blocks.Our hotel room was a decent size, clean and comfortable with accommodating hotel staff. The small store located in the lobby was great for quick snacks or needed coffee on your way out. There's also a computer station in the lobby where you can check in on your flights and print tickets. The hop on, hop off bus tour was located nearly outside the hotel doors which made getting around New York super easy.

Hotel was beautiful! The rooms are set up to almost be a two bedroom. The beds are divided by a closet, so lots of seclusion if it's wanted! The Hotel is located just a few blocks from both Times Square as well as Central Park. Truly a great location!! Lots of little eateries near by, with this amazing little coffee shop right next door! Only reason I couldn't give 5 stars was because the entire hotel only has 2 elevators and they are the smallest elevators known to mankind.

I stayed here for 4 nights to do some Christmas shopping.The hotel is in a great location a 5 minute walk to Central Park and a 10 minute walk down into Times Square.On arrival to the hotel we had to wait in a long line to check in, they literally handed us the key and sent us on our way. No conversation and no mention of any extra fees that needed to be paid.The hotels itself is very clean, the room size was good for a New York hotel. The beds were very comfy! We had a room on the 5th floor which was very noisy, with horns and sirens going at all hours! I would advise requesting a room on a high floor. The lifts are really slow, I don't think we actually managed to get In a lift going down we always took the stairs, I think there was only two working and they were always full.On our last day our key stopped working before our 12pm check out so I went down and spoke to one of the ladies in the lobby and she just told me to get in line. So again I had to queue for about 15 minutes to get my key reactivated. They shove your invoice through the door overnight to which we had to pay a $100 facility's fee for the WIFI, this should be optional, or at least include it at time of booking!! The have a luggage service should you have a late flight and need to store your luggage.I have stayed in New York many times and have never had so many issues with reception... Maybe they should consider more staff.

So many issues at this hotel, hard to know where to start. The computer system was not working so we were unable to check in till after 5pm or obtain a key to our room till after 9pm at night. People were lined up in the lobby for long periods of time awaiting manual check-in. We then had to be taken to our room with security as no keys were available. The front desk staff was overwhelmed & not pleasant. Once in our room, we were unable to turn the heat down & the room was smothering. The phone did not work so went to front desk to request assistance with our problem. About an hour later a man came & opened the window stating "there, you now have air conditioning". On a positive note, this newly renovated 1920 hotel was very modern & beds were comfortable, also the location is great for walking to see lots of sights.

So.... We arrived on 11th November by taxi from the airport - no issues. We were surprised just what a great location this hotel is in. You can see Times Square from the street, 5 mins walk - also same to Central Park and Columbus circle. 15 mins to Rocker Fella building - Tiffany, Henri Bendal, 5th Avenue. Carnegie Hall is across the street.Several underground stations steps away from the hotel entrance.Check in was smooth & efficient & we were given a map to the city to help us get around.Our room was 722 - quite a good size for 3 adults - 2 double beds - super comfy & great pillows. Decor modern & simple.It was dark even during the day as it was in a quadrangle just looking onto the other rooms - but, on the plus side this made it nice & quiet at night when the city is very noisy.There was a huge flat screen TV & full length mirror.No fridge or coffee machine, but we asked for a coffee machine & one was sent up straight away.There is a good size wardrobe - again we asked for more hangers - it has a small safe too.The bathroom was well lit & had a huge illuminated mirror - plenty of towels & tissues - bath with overhead shower. All clean.There was shower gel, soap, shampoo & conditioner.The lobby was clean & good decor - 15 mins free computer access with printer too.The lounge areas are lovely - nice bar & seating area.There is no restaurant just a small shop which sells pastries, drinks etc.... We thought it was expensive & there are lots of places to grab breakfast outside the hotel.We left on 16th & after check out the hotel store your luggage until you need it.We booked the hotel car to the airport home - we though it would be expensive but to JFK it was $64. The yellow cab to arrive was $58, and unknown cost to return, so it was handier & very comfy.I would definitely stay here again. Well done Park Central.

My wife and I will come back to the Park Central. The people are friendly and informative. The hotel is close to everything and the subway. You can be down town in five minutes if you take the subway or in 25 minutes if you walk.

Great location. Excelent room decoration, confort and very cleanVery nice staff , very helfull The hotel has the room remodelate, look the same that in the web page pictures The cleaning people was very nice and efficient to keep the room in very nice conditions all the time .Ckerk very efficent and with knolege of they duties I'll stay there for my nect trip for sureTime Square and Central park just block from thereBery beautifull hotelThanks for your services

The check in process was insane, the elevator did network, the bath tub would not stay filled. The whole thing seems run-down. Not worth the good hotel rate because it ruins the New Your trip. Made me late for my business meeting.

Great location. Close to everything but without the noise or the crowd. Our room was big for the New York standard and the bathroom was very clean. Would definitely stay here again as I have stayed before also.

Not the first time here and you don't go back to places you are not satisfied with. Great location and overall hotel experience. If you want a real breakfast I would go outside the hotel and there are numerous places to go within a block. Would have no problem recommending this hotel.

Overall we had a good experience. Upon arrival I was annoyed that no one helped or offered to help us with our bags. I was an adult with my two daughters and we were struggling to get through the doors. Checking in was easy. We didn't ask about concierge to take up our bags but none was offered in any case. We were put in room next to fitness center - the noise was terrible. Every pounding foot on the running machine sent a shudder into our room. It was annoying. Had I been alone I perhaps would have complained but the thought of repacking made me reconsider. The room was a reasonable size. We were three people in a room - there wasn't enough space for our stuff. There was one small closet and eight drawers. No where to put all our luggage / suitcases. We made the most of the cramped conditions but we could have done with some more space. Again, I could have said something but I didn't want to move rooms. We asked them to provide a fridge to the room which they were quick to say yes to, but to actually receive it took a day, four calls, and a visit to the front desk. But it was sorted in the end. Overall, the hotel is in a great location and it is reasonably priced for New York - but these were the things that we found annoying.

My family and I spent one night here. Service was very friendly. We didn't have to wait long to check in. We had a corner room with a great view. The room was clean and comfortable. Great location, short walk to central park, Time Square and Rockefeller Center. Would stay again.

Perfect location - 20 meters from the subway, 5 minutes walking from Columbus circle, 5 minutes in the subway to times square ....The rooms are great, the stuff does the maximum to help you: I arrived at 6 AM and they managed to give me a room. Internet works perfectly. I got very warm service when I left and needed to leave my stuff at the hotel. Price is very good <$200 including all taxes etc. Highly recommended.

First time at the Park Central home. Beautiful hotel and centrally located to everything! The pillows were super awesome & comfortable. The room itself was large and very roomy for a NYC hotel! Times Square and Central Park were not that far. I will definitely stay here again.

Gym: Quality equipment, clean.Common areas: Classy and clean.Rooms: Modern, met my standards.Location: Near perfect.Security: no concerns.Recommend.Areas they could improve on: add a frig, add room service, add a few TVs in the resturant/bar area.

If you like going to hotels, spending around $2000-$3000 and being treated like garbage,then this is the place to go. It does have a nice location but the staff is clueless, they have no idea of how to be hospitable towards guests. They are also ageist and racist, and lack common courtesy. Tiny rooms, dirty, no early or late check in not even for an hour, slow and small elevators, dirty rooms, and an unnecessary hotel access fee that other hotels provide for free!

I do not accept to pay $ 25 per day for facilities not required . Especially if these include unlimited calls in the US , since I'm Italian! I think the rate is already high users' needs even without these contingencies

Perfect location! Had wonderful time in NYC with college roommates. Couldn't have asked for better weather. Staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Room was quiet and beds very comfortable! Would highly recommend park central!

I booked this hotel after waiting a little too long to find a place and was very apprehensive after reading some reviews. I told my son in the taxi from the airport that I hoped it was going to be ok but was a little worried. When we walked in he asked me if I was sure we were in the right place because it was much nicer than he was expecting. Maybe it was the dates of our trip or something but we could not have asked for a better place on our budget. We got checked in quickly, our luggage stored, and off we went. It is really close to so many things that we only took a cab once- walked and rode the subway everywhere. Our room and bath was very, very nice and looked like it had just been redone. The beds were fabulous. The only thing it lacked was a coffee pot but there is a Starbucks right next door. Who cares that they don't have room service -- there are hundreds of places to eat in walking distance. Maybe it was because we were up early and in late but we rarely waited for the elevator. Overall, it was the perfect place for us to stay.

Expensive, long lines to check in, no vending machines, no restaurant, bad elevators, dirty room and I can keep on.First visit to this hotel in Nov 2015 and shall never return. I got in at 3 pm and was not allowed to register because check in was at 4! Came back at 7pm and there was a 60 feet line waiting! By 8 we got the room went up and down again looking for a place to eat something lite, but surprise there's only a bar! Looking for a vending machine? Forget it, there is none. Some beverages or snacks in the room? Forget it, there is nothing! Decided to go to bed, lift the sheets and surprise, was dirty!One of the worst hotels ever been at around the world!

Conference (5 nights) of chocking when in my room from smoking was going on all around me on the six floor (627 to 640) TV had no cord when I came into the double bed room (I wanted a king)! As to the smoke, Manager looked at me as if I am lying about the smoke!!

Hotel is equidistant to Lincoln Center, MoMa and theaters and a good value. However, I would not say here again if there was a better choice, such as the Park Meridien or the Michelangelo, even if it was a bit more. Our room did not have a mini-bar. Although I did not use it, the WiFI is included and very functional.

We stayed here for 7 nights and not a single time were we greeted, welcomed, or even acknowledged. We were helped by Carolyn, who was racist, rude, unprofessional and threw a paper at me. I mentioned this terrible service to manager, Nancy and she didn't even care. I feel like this is a nice hotel based on location but the service is something that will keep me away. I would rather pay more to stay in a different hotel. If you are on the bubble for this hotel or a different hotel, I would suggest picking a hotel different from park central. I usually am not one that cares but I felt completely belittled as a human being.

On our first trip to New York, we decided on the park central hotel! After reading bad reviews close to our arrival I was a little apprehensive. The park central was the perfect hotel for us. Nice size room, clean, comfortable beds. Our only complaint was when we first entered the room there was a horrible musky, damp smell! After the first day that disappeared so we put it down to the fact maybe the room wasn't used in a while. Other than that our stay was fantastic and park central was the best possible location for our first trip! If we come back I would stay again for location alone.

Just returned from 3 days at this hotel. It was extremely busy during our stay and we had to wait for ages each time to access the lift. The rooms are fairly basic but the bed was extremely comfortable. The best thing about the hotel is the location, close to Times Square and Broadway. The worst thing about the hotel is that there is no restaurant or room service. There is a small shop in the foyer but that is it! The staff at the hotel were few and far between. The only interaction was with the reception staff and that was impersonal but I put this down to the fact it was so busy. Would I stay at this hotel again... No, I came away from the hotel dehydrated and in hindsight I would pay a little extra to ensure there was dining facilities after a busy day sightseeing.

We keep coming back to the Park Central because the location is perfect for enjoying the city. The hotel has been renovated recently and there have been big improvements to the lobby and rooms although our room did show some signs of needed maintainence. The bar was closed for a private event when we were there but looks very nice. There is no restaurant in the hotel except for a cafe market. Not really a problem with so many terrific restaurants in walking distance.The hotel management and staff are helpful and friendly for the most part. The rates are also very reasonable for NYC. You really can't go wrong with a stay here whether for business or pleasure.

My wife and I love NYC and love Central Park, shopping, and healthy food. The Park Central was just a couple blocks from Central Park, and Columbus circle where you can find good shopping at store like J Crew, and a Whole Foods, for healthy salad bar and groceries. We were also just a few blocks from 5th Ave, Rockefeller Center, and we even walked to Sunday morning Mass at St. Patricks Cathedral! Inside the hotel, is an amazing modern remodeled lobby, bar, and snack shop. The rooms were also nicely redone! We had an interior room, so didn't have a street view or much sunlight, but I would definitely stay here again!

We spent five nights here in November... the hotel is on 7th Avenue, almost directly across from Carnegie Hall, about three blocks from the south end of Central Park, and close enough to see Times Square, but far enough from the chaos there... close subway access, and within walking distance to shops, restaurants, theaters, etc... very convenient location... The staff was very helpful, and took care of all our requests... we arrived early and checked our bags in their luggage room... when we returned from walking around a bit it was still before check-in time, but Anna at the front desk got us in with little delay... the room overlooked 7th Avenue (12th floor), and you could hear some street noise, but in New York, that's nothing uncommon, and you tune it out easy enough... the room wasn't large, but had nice modern touches, was very comfortable, and very clean... housekeeping did a great job every day... the staff (front desk, concierge, luggage room) were all very courteous and friendly...there is a $25+tax daily amenities fee, which includes your wifi access and other services... we would stay here again...

Keep up the good work. I really enjoyed staying at your Hotel because of the location. Also the staff was very friendly and very helpful. As I mentioned, I will start coming up to NY several times a year and will like to stay at your Hotel

I've stayed here in past but it seems that the hotel's best days are behind it. The bed sheets was disgusting and worn, had plenty of lint balls and looked grayish. There was a shower cap over the smoke detector, the heat doesn't work and bathroom towels was ripped. Iron board smelled like mold. I can go on. This is terrible, I won't be staying here anymore. Left after the first night, too bad my trip was non-refundable.

Nice room fairly large by NYC standards. Excellent location. Great water pressure in the shower. Not happy that the Carnegie Deli has been closed and that the Stage Deli no longer exists. Easy to get everywhere.

The rooms were the size and quality you would expect for the nightly rate in NYC. The appeal is the location - close to Broadway shows, 5th Avenue shopping and Central Park without being in the heart of Time Square madness and noise.

This hotel is in a good location. Bedding & towels changed every day. There was a shop where you could buy breakfast items but you weren't allowed to sit in the bar to consume them. We arrived on September 26th & on Sept 28th my nightwear went missing, presumably with the laundry. I reported it each morning, no interest/concern from personnel on reception & finally on the morning I was departing, the security officer asked me to complete an insurance claim form. He suggested that I was rather silly to have left it in the bed! I left the hotel on Oct 1st & 6 weeks later I have heard nothing from them. I have resorted to putting this on Trip Advisor because I tried to contact them by email but my mail was rejected because my Zip code/postal code does not conform to the format 12.3456.789 or some such. Should people with UK post codes not stay at this hotel?

Well located hotel not more than a block of Carnegie Hall, and within sight of Times Square right down 7th Ave. Reasonably priced for similar properties in the neighborhood, however we had trouble getting the room reserved with tub, and were told in true Manhattan style, "...we have 800 rooms and I can't possibly know which ones have bathtubs!" Hmmm....really? The room was adequate, but had no A/C since the HVAC is one of those central systems where the whole place either has heat or cooling, but not both. We were told to open the window for cool air, and although that made it much more comfortable, it was accompanied by 7th Ave traffic noise, which never quits. After all of the trouble to move to a room with a bathtub, as reserved, the stopper didnt keep water from draining out. Totally unacceptable.The staff here needs a good dose of Ritz Carlton customer service training.

This hotel was beautiful but very dark rooms, no cell service in the rooms etc.  *This hotel only had two working elevators and certain times of the day this was VERYchallenging. People were getting very impatient . the staff at this hotel was not very friendly.

Just returned from 3 nights at Park Central. Lovely hotel in a good location. Close to Central Park, Subway line and Times Square. Newly renovated. Had a little trouble getting the room we reserved, but they did move us to the correct room. No hotel restaurant, and no coffee makers in the rooms, but Starbucks is next door.

Very nice place, and a good value. Hotel is modern and clean and staff is friendly and helpful. The Central Market leaves a bit to be desired, over priced and sandwiches are gross but a good cup of coffee.

Reported temperature problem at 5 PM maintenance never showed up to resolve issue. reported problem again to front desk. Called 2hrs later, problem still not addressed. so much more not enough characters

Hotel great. Booked through lastminute.com so got hotel and flights for ~£525 for 3 nights, but were hit with mandatory surcharge of $25 per night plus tax for gym and local and national phone calls on checking in. Not on really and lastminute.com are not transparent enough about this and their customer service left somewhat to be desired.

Stayed here for 4 nights, first time visit to NYC from UK.Pro'sLovely HotelFriendly StaffRecently refurb room, comfy bed Amazing location for touristsQuiet at nightCons$25 plus tax per night mandatory Facilities Fee, we found out after we booked that this was applicable, not too pleased but was still happy to pay as the hotel & location still looked good for the money & the wifi did come in handy when researching where to go in NYC & when i woke up at 3 in the morning with jet lag & decided to watch Netflix !!What i don't agree with is the policy of adding this to your bill at the end of your stay, if the fee is mandatory then it should be added at point of booking, just feels a little sneaky in how they apply the fee, Integrity should be at the heart of any business !!Overall great hotel & would recommend to anyone visiting NYCThe mandatory Facilities Fee of $25 plus tax per room per night provides guests with the following amenities: - Wireless (WIFI) High Speed Internet Access throughout the hotel's guest rooms and public spaces for up to 5 devices - Unlimited Local and Domestic Long Distance Calls - Unlimited use of the 24-hour state-of-the-art Fitness Center

The service of the hotel is terrible starting with the unfriendly check in person. The maintenance staff took way too long to come fix our issues in the room and this was after several reminder calls. Very tiresome to keep chasing for things to be fixed!

Great Property...Great Location....I have been to New York previously and stayed at more notable properties...this trip was for business and price was a factor....pleasantly surprised... all around great experience...definitely will stay at The Park on my return

This hotel does not have any place to have breakfast, not even restaurant, the rooms are freezing because you have to wait until they think its cold, im payung 320 dollars a day. If you need someone to assist you at the room or need any requirement you have to wait 30 minutes.

Location perfect for enjoying central park activities as well as Times Square and Fifth Avenue Avenue shopping. Rooms are spacious, trendy, and comfortable. Pricing reasonable for this upscale market.

I would recommend Park Central Hotel to friends and family. The location is perfect. It is a short walk to Times Square and Central Park and many other attractions. The rooms are a very clean as well as being a good size with modern decor. The bar and seating area is elegant and I found the staff very friendly to deal with. It is reasonably priced for its location and sized rooms. I would definitely return there again.

I would have liked more lighting in the room and bathroom. It was hard to apply makeup and see the true colors in my clothes.You have great beds and pillows which is very seldom in hotels. Your hotel was in a perfect location.

I stayed in this hotel for the second time. Very nice, perfect location, and lovely quiet rooms. But they add so many taxes and fees that I ended up paying a lot more than any other hotel in the area. Also, very disappointing, the bar and restaurant was not open to hotel guests for 2 days due to private event and we were not even offered any compensation or another solution, that is very poor.Regarding the service, we had one lovely concierge who really helped us and one lovely luggage person. But on our first night we asked advice and questions to the person at reception and she could not be bothered.

We had a great stay and found that the hotel exceeded our expectations. I had indicated I preferred a quiet room on a higher floor; not only did we get this but we were checked in early with no wait.
