The room was recently renovated and well maintained and quite large. Staff were courteous and efficient and the location is great (we had a morning run in Central Park each day). Great value!

Things need to be done im thinking is the last time i make a reservation there and is too bad i used to take more than 20 rooms for me and my students, the location is wonderful but the noise and beds are terrible

overcharged for a corner room which was not any larger elevators and room keys were not working. staff did get around the key encoder by getting security, but still inconvenient. the rooms were smaller not all corner rooms were the same even though they charged us more for them.

Of my 2 day stay there was only 1 of 2 or 3 elevators working. Much wait time to lobby or to room. No coffee available after central market closed early. Would have liked coffee available in room. Otherwise good stay. Thank you

The location and value are good, handy to everything and moderately priced, but that comes with flaws.There is no room service, not much in the way of amenities (no robes or minibars in rooms) and while the lobby is updated, the room decor isn't fresh. And the lighting in the rooms was downright murky and temperature control was not very effective.The room size was average and beds were quite comfy, so on that front I'd go with an Average rating. The reason the overall rating is Poor is service and functionality - there were often lineups at check-in and for elevators, many people complained the room cards worked sporadically and on several occasions staff were less than gracious.But in a city where you can pay a whole lot more for a similar room, if service is not crucial to you at least it's clean and adequate and in a good neighbourhood.

Stayed with my biz partner in a double room and it was spacious for NY. The bathroom is small but well appointed. Beds are very comfy and our room was clean and well laid out. The decor is lovely (although we had a weird giant painted face picture in our bathroom...a little creepy for my taste). If you're a light sleeper, you might ask for a room that doesn't face 7th Ave. It was a little noisy outside. The lobby feels elegant, as does the bar & the seating area is creative. Our conference had cocktail parties there and the appetizers were quite good. The staff was friendly and on top of everything. I'd definitely stay here again.

Love this hotel! The location is great, a short walk to Times Square and in the other directions, you have a bunch of wonderful restaurants! Check in took a long time. They really need to get that fixed. The market was super expensive, so bring your own water bottles, etc. The rooms are really nice and modern. Comfortable bed, beautiful bath. The lower category rooms have horrible views, but you pay for what you get. Housekeeping was very good. The elevators sucked! We waited FOREVER for it. I was able to get a package that included parking and they also will hold your luggage for the day. Sign up online to join their email list.I gave it 5 stars because it's really a great value in the heart of NYC, especially if you get in on one of those packages. Otherwise, i'd rate it a 4. I've been here 4 times and I'll be back again!

Good location, but the hotel doesn't really offer anything else than a place to sleep there is no room service no bottled water in the rooms. Room was not cleaned properly, air conditioning does not work very well. I was disappointed because we stayed here last year but the quality of the hotel seem to have gone down.

Friendly, attentive staff. Very clean room, elevators, and lobby. Can't beat the location, across 7th Ave from Carnegie Hall and steps away from Times Square and Central Park. Located in a very pleasant, safe area of the city

Fantastic location in midtown is only great if everything else delivers - and Park Central does. Great beds, quiet rooms, REALLY nice bath, fast and easy Internet access, and loads of easy access to power for charging gadgets.

I booked this hotel for my boss and her niece while they attended a nearby event. My boss' niece arrived early and waited two hours alone in the hotel lobby because the front desk couldn't give me clear directions on how best to send them what they needed to check her in. I take partial blame for the time but I'm not thrilled with the way I and my boss' niece were treated in this process. On the other hand, the reservation agent Erica was extremely sweet in trying to help expedite the process.

Great lobby... good sized room if u book right one. Location is well situated... good walking around hotel to Park or to Times Square Zoo... ... room can get some better finishing touches... additional hotel fees are ridiculous.. and simply a money grab.... why should they not be in the hotel price? .. silly.

Great location; staff professional; noisy lobby, chaotic atmosphere-mishandled our reservation but offered a discount on facility fees. Rooms typically small; we're former NYC residents and frequent travelers, so pretty picky; OK but would not recommend glowingly.

Rooms have recently been refurbished and are very nice and quite spacious - just like photos. Location 2 blocks from Central Park and right at a subway stop made this a terrific location, really within walking distance to almost everything - museums, galleries, theatre. Lots of restaurants. Would recommend. Mandatory facilities fee of $25 per room/day a bit high.

By Steve, Oct 2015The room could do with more lighting, but was clean & functional. A view would of been nice, window faced a brick wall. However we could not fault it for its location and staff were excellent.

We had good experience, nicely decorated (renewed) rooms, The beds were excellent. The room was quiet. The airco made some noise. The size of the rooms was above expectation. Metro station 57th7th street (N,Q,R lines) is arround the corner with direct line to Time Square, Harold Square/

I was told by the front desk to do it online. rates were too high. called and emailed. went back to front desk. overbooked. then was told there was availability but at a super high rate. Not easy changed hotels.

I was concerned when I read previous reviews of the hotel being bad, but was pleasantly surprised. Lovely entrance, great location top end of 7th Avenue and a stones throw from Central Park. Clean, tidy yes a little 'used' in places where people have bashed their suitcases against walls. Nice big bed and lovely bathroom. Gym was clean and contained all the usual machines and loose weights.

A nice hotel well located. A well stocked cafe stand is on the main floor and reasonably priced full breakfasts can be found across the street.Plenty to do/see/eat in the area. Walked to Times Square, Wicked Theatre, MoMa.Nice room, clean. Big enough, but not large. Not high luxury but definitely not budget.Very comfortable. I would return without a doubt.

First visit to NYC, booked hotel on line. Incredible location, friendly staff, ease of check in/out, clean facilities and excellent housekeeping services, Very satisfied with hotel and helpful staff, would definitely stay here again.

Hotel is well located within walking distance to Central Park, Times Square and the theater district. It was recently refurbished and fairly priced. I give this hotel five stars as being excellent among the upper middle hotels.

Classic New York Hotel with a great location. Unfortunately the service from several of the reception staff left a great del to be desired.Often when we came by to ask a question they were busy talking with their colleagues

Loved this Hotel, perfect location, would definitely come back. Concierge were great, we arrived at 1pm with 4pm check in, they took luggage and off we went for a stroll in Central Park. Likewise when we checked out, flight not until 8pm, so dropped off luggage at 12pm and collected at 5pm which gave us lots more time, luggage free, in NYC

It was a very good located hotel. The interior of the room was beautiful and clean but a little bit used. But cleanliness was very good. If we think of the price, amenity was poor. The staff of Park Kitchen was very nice. I recommend the chocolate cake of the Central Market.But don't buy mineral water because it is very expensive!!!

I stayed here with my friend for our girlfriends birthday celebrations, November 5th-8th was a lovely short stay, just what we needed, perfect location and great rooms. We booked the deal of the day king size room, asked for a high floor and city view room, we were 11th floor with city view and it was just right. Room was spacious and clean had everything we needed for our stay, safe in room was fab also. We had no complaints about the hotel, the lifts were fine - you may wait 2 minutes longer than usual but who's counting? We used the concierge for our luggage on the last day and that was very easy, had some great advice on the subways from the receptionist, he was very helpful. We have both said we will stay again, fabulous first trip to New York, can't wait to return!

Very clean and comfortable room, it is important for me and my family. good location, close to the Central Park and excellent staff. Expensive hotel. I consider this option for my next trip to New York.

Just returned from trip to NY.On the down side we were on floor 3 and inward facing and noise from outside Ac / plant machinery was in the background constantly, but was a low hum. AC in room was very noisey when running. We could only see a bit of the sky as was inward facing and no view apart from other windows.However room was a good size and everything worked . Shower was good. Clean room. Used the left luggage and was busy but ok. Staff ok but no wow moments. Used the in house coffee shop and was ok. Did not use the bar but looked good. Good location for the park and local restaurants. Overall good experience.

Inside room was dark with only bed lamps and one other lamp for lighting.Next time will get room with view to the outside where can see sky and have light. Otherwise wonderful hotel. Location is good for restaurants and theater district as well as shopping.

Room was clean. We were on 5th floor with adjoining room. Could hear everything in room next door. Street noise was not a problem tho. No info in room as to where gym was located, what's near, etc... Would stay again but would requesting no adjoining room.

very well located near subway for easy access to SOHO or downtown, walking distance to time square for getting to broadway easily. Hotel is quiet and nice, simple but well appointed. Needs to replace shower curtains; minor detail that did not impact the overall positive experience.

Beautiful hotel. Few minor complaints: front desk experience could be improved. They had this sort of "path/waiting area" roped off and it you waited in there, no one else did and they just walked up to the desk and the employees served them. Another time, quite the opposite happened. I had been the only one there so I walked up to the desk and there was no staff there. When the staff arrived, she ignored me and called over the guy far away who was standing in the small "path." When I, right under her nose, said I was first, she was totally rude. When I pulled up in front of the hotel after a stressful drive in the city, no one approached my car, although they have valet parking. There was no valet stand and no one in uniform. I even got out and went onto the sidewalk looking for help and couldn't find anyone to approach. This caused me a lot of wasted time driving around the block to see if I could find their garage. Finally, on s second attempt, I saw what appeared to be a valet (all black uniform didn't look like an obvious uniform), I was helped. When I only had large bills and couldn't tip, he was gruff with me. Lighting in room was very bright/harsh and in the bathroom, a flourescent ring around the mirror was not enough to put on makeup. There was only one bar of soap near the sink and I got in the shower excited to use the body wash provided but couldn't get it to come out. So, I had to get out all wet to retrieve the one bar of soap by the sink. Room was modern and generally attractive but you could tell they remodeled an old building kind of on the cheap. Beds were very comfortable though. They honored my request for a high floor and quiet room. It was at the end of a hall but faced a brick wall. No biggie in the city but not optimal. Bottom line, nice remodel on lobby but poor service and just "good" remodel in room. Again, beds very very comfortable and overall great stay. Improve service and lighting and it will be much improved.

Bad experience. Noisy all night. Not enough lighting in the room and a shortage of bathroom amenities.I don't think I want to relive this experience again. Probably wont stay here again. Considering the room rate, I think they can do much better.

We loved our stay at Park Central Hotel. We faced 7th ave and surprisingly the room was quite. Our 5 year old had a wonderful time and we cant wait to come back! great drinks at the lounge as well! This hotel was next to everything. Lots of deli's, shops and time square was only a walk away. Everything we wanted to do was within walking distance. There is also a subway entrance around the corner of the hotel which was convenient for the things we wanted to see downtown. Love this hotel and NYC. Cant wait to come back!

We stayed three nights at this hotel in November 2015. I booked a King Premier room. We arrived at 6p.m., earliest check in was at 4p.m. When we arrived we were informed our room had been over booked and not available and we were given a queen twin room instead. There was no apology that the room I had specifically booked was not available. The staff was smiling but not apologetic or sympathetic to their mix up and that was a theme which continued from all the staff we spoke to at the hotel, they were ignorant and very 'matter of fact' which was rude. In the UK staff are encouraged to be engaging and helpful, not here. The only friendly face was the guys who held onto our luggage while we were changing rooms. I had to e-mail a complaint to get any sort of apology. They did waive the $25 daily service charge for one night but they seemed to think this was enough of an apology to keep me happy. We were given the correct room the following day which again was very clean and modern and more than satisfactory but even though we were on the 14th floor and the windows were double glazed it was very noisy all night long with traffic beeping horns, bins being emptied outside and people talking loudly on the street below. Be aware UK visitors, none of the rooms have tea or coffee making facilities, just water or room service. The location of the hotel is perfect, far enough from Times Square to be away from the hustle and bustle and a five minute walk from Central Park. There is no restaurant so no breakfasts apart from a store which sells coffee and pastries, but it was nice to get out and there are lots pf places to sit down and eat nearby. Will I stay here again? No. The hotel was lovely, clean, tidy and more than acceptable, but the staff did not make us feel welcome or 'special' as a customer. I don't expect a red carpet treatment by any means but just a friendly reception and service with a smile will do.

The Park Central hotel is located close to the Central Park and seems to be recently renovated. It is in a walking distance of Times Square. The room was not big but quite modern decorated. Negative however is the lack of privacy when you have a room in the back (or you face a wall). Also negative is the charge of a facility fee of $25 per day plus tax for facilities that you don't use or want. It is not optional, you have to pay. So it is a way to lower the price mentioned in the hotel sites (therefore create more traffic) but at the end you pay the full price. This kind of 'in pricing' should in my opinion not be made possible. It gives a bad taste to the hotel experience.

One of the face cloths in our bathroom appeared to have faeces on it. When we brought it to the attention of the cleaning staff we no longer received face cloths in our room. The location was great but I would not recommend the hotel.

Room was clean, quiet and staff was cool. A steal for 250 in NYC (This is just nonsense so I use the 100 characters I have left to fill out.) In West Philadelphia bon and raised in the playground where

the location was about the only main reason for going with this hotel, the rest of the stay was very average. I disagree with charging a facility fee to access the gym and internet, I would like that to be my choice, I have my own internet connection I travel with and I did not want the gym, so to charge a mandatory fee for this is not acceptable to me.

Great location. But very average hotel. Needed ear plugs to block out the noise from the street. No coffee/tea maker in the room; while this is NY and the Subway shop opposite is open 24/7, this is a hassle when jet-lagged at 3 AM. Staff were welcoming.

Comfortable hotel. Great location in walking distance of a lot of attractions. Not overly impressed with staff at reception. Safe was broken and looked at by maintenance person who promised to come back next day to fix but didn't.

Every aspect of our stay was above excellent. 5 star quality. Perfect location. great restaurants and shopping nearby. Central Park and Times Square a few blocks from hotel. I am looking forward to booking our stay here again and bringing friends.

After reading some reviews I was terrified but found our entire experience to be positive and without issue. Clean room. Comfortable beds. We were on the 5th floor but no noise issues. Overall a positive experience.

Great hotel everything is closeRecommend Park Central to anyone who will visit NYC!! I will be back and hopefully to stay at Park Central again!We took a private driver from Park Central to Cape Liberty that the hotel arranged for us. We asked the driver if he'd stop at a couple places along the way and he said he would. We stopped at 9/11 Memorial, he stopped on a side street waited for us and we came back and carried on!!!

Very Central position and great hotel. Pity that the hotel doesn't have a restaurant anymore and the bar service was not up to standard of our 2014 stay, but overall a memorable stay. Great rooms and internet service and amenities.

Clean, great location, good size rooms! Friendly and knowledgeable, efficient staff. Good size rooms, comfortable beds. Perfect location, close to everything. Will stay at this hotel again in the future.

I have stayed at park central hotel 3 times last 2 years.I didnt write a review about the hotel because it was very good.This year 2015 I made a reservation for September 4 check in September 11th out and I paid it Jully 2015. which is 2 months before.I arrive to the hotel September 4 th 2015 to check in and they told me that they are very sorry because they have some problem at 50 rooms, that mean I will not have room.I think the reason was because that time NYC was very busy because US open were going on ,so maybe someone else stay at my room.I told them what we going to do now.They offer me to stay at another hotel which is not same level. İt was a bad dream that day I was seing. I can not believe that hotel like a park central did not take care of us the way should be.Very bad costumer service and if you choose this hotel make sure that you have room otherwise you could end up having surprises like we had.

Great location, great lobby to meet clients. Overall the hotel is nice, beds are comfortable as are the pillows. I stayed in room 1725, and the restroom smelled like mildew, and musty, so that was nasty. My coworkers room did not smell, she was in 1726, but her internet did not work in her room.

All hotel staff were extremely helpful, friendly, and courteous. Everyone had "service with a smile" - made it an enjoyable experience. Extremely clean room, and quiet - very comfortable. Would stay again.

Great time at the hotel that was ruined by valet car service to LGA. My boyfriend and I became sick very sick at the hotel. We called to complain and did not receive a call back yet. Call us 8458031969

Great location. Close to Central Park, Subway, Times Square and Bryant Park. Except for a few hiccups, this was a decent stay. The lounge is gorgeous. I would definitely consider staying here again for the location alone.

Very good hotel, excelent location, personal kind.Just the size of the baths are little, very near to times square, good climating control, very close to central park, and many restaurants in the area.

Staff at front desk were not welcoming - gave the impression they were just doing a job and weren't really interested in us. When we asked the concierge for some advice she was not at all helpful and we couldn't believe it when she answered the phone in the middle of our conversation without even saying "excuse me" and that was it - we were dismissed! So rude! Room was reasonably sized but no literature about the hotel or surrounding area to be found in room. Being from the UK we expect tea/coffee making facilities in a hotel of this grade but none to be had in the Park Central. Room was very dimly lit - couldn't see adequately in it at all. Safety deposit box didn't work and we had to phone twice to get it fixed. It was in a cupboard with absolutely no light - had to use torch on mobile phone to see the digits on the box.On checking out we were not even asked how our stay was or if everything had been ok.Definitely won't be back in Park Central!!!!

Good location and great ambianceStaff could be more helpfulAmenities could be enhanced for the priceOverall review goodA bit noisy around because of works around the hotelElevators busy and small for the size of the hotel

We had stayed in this hotel before and really liked it. The service, appearance and location of the hotel suited our needs. Our daughter was running in the Marathon, so now we have even better memories. Would definitely use the hotel again.

Nice location. Walking distance to the park, easy subway access and easily walkable to theater distract and Times Square. Lounge staff a little grouchy - don't put your feet up on the table while relaxing during non-bar hours.

Decent hotel in ideal location but in need of an up lift.Bar area could be more inviting, music would be very welcome.Lifts are a nightmare along with the daily charge for amenities - should be noted on booking sites

Before staying here, consider more accommodating hotels. This hotel had it's air condition service turned-off throughout the entire hotel while the outside temperture was 70+ degrees. The room was not clean as was the bathroom. The bed was quite uncomfortable (lumpy)

Good hotel in a perfect location, Wifi is ok! No breakfast and no fridge in the room what is really a problem once you can´t storage your own food... THe tax of almost 30 dolars just for the internet is also a problem... at least it worked well... in overall it is a good hotel, but not that spetacular..

Rooms were a good size. Beds, pillows and linens were good. Bathroom was large and well appointed. Close to Central Park and so many good restaurants. Walking distance to Broadway, Times Square, Theatres, restaurants, museums, shopping, Carnegie Hall.

Unreliable hotel. Booked months in advance of our trip to New York, only to find out 2 days before arriving that our room was cancelled. Traveling from Hawaii we were excited to be staying at this hotel. I'll never book with them again.

This is a very well situated hotel that worked hard to make our visit a good one. Once quite grand, the whole place has been recently redone to a a solid establishment. It has few frills -- no pool, restaurant, room service, etc. -- but has a helpful and attentive staff and is so close to everything you need that it hardly matters. Rooms were well appointed and comfortable. No complaints.

Will I stay here again? Never. I may be provincial, but I certainly found better value for money at the Hilton Garden Inn in Tribeca and the Hampton Inn at Madison Square Garden, I missed my hot beverage station in the room; I missed proper lighting in the room; I missed friendly staff. Cannot imagine why there was always a significant wait for the elevators....which bordered on miniscule.

I will do if separately on trip advisor. But in short the 25 dollar fee was just being greedy and intimately it affected the quality of my stay. The shower was cheap too, and room was too small. Worst hotel I've stayed at in NYC. Not worthy of 4 star rating

For the family, was a great hotel because the location, and price!! Everyting was fine for us, clean, comfortable, quiet. we can walk to the principal atractions in New York, central park, times square, empire state, rockefeller center, 5th avenue. and is really nearly

Gorgeously remodeled hotel that has added a flair of new with the charm of the original building. A great hotel that was affordable and easily accessible to many NYC attractions. Definitely recommend.

Very good Place and location. Sleep good. Near the most principal attracion. Times square is a few steps. Central park is in the corner. I Will be back in this place the next time I return to NY. Its a good choice.

We could not have Asha's a better experience. We were there for the NYC Marathon & our anniversary and everything was great. Location could not have been better, staff was great, room was quiet. Just stay there already.

Great Location on fringe of hustle & bustle which is a nice escape. Walking distance to everything you want whilst on holiday in New York City. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was larger than I expected for NYC and larger compared to other hotel rooms I've seen in NYC. Room was clean. Only dissapointment was no mini bar fridge which is always handy to be able to keep a few drinks and food in.

Great location and Very Good Option To stay. Close to best areas walking distance to Central Park and Times Square. Very comfortable rooms and good overall services. Next to subway stations.  I would stay there again

The Park Central is located in the thick of Manhattan and, for the quality of the hotel, your money is well spent. It's clean, bright, well maintained and the personnel and friendly and quite helpful. Considering that it's midtown Manhattan, the comfort and quiet sleep I got was truly impressive

Park Central is a great hotel for location and value. Rooms are a bit small, but that is usually not a problem. Very good deli nearby.Staff is friendly, especially Elizabeth in Guest relations. David, New Orleans

This hotel is very centrally located between Central Park and Time Square. The MoMA is just around the corner, lots of restaurant and diners around. It is a good place to stay for the New York Marathon, which finishes in Central Park, as you can walk from the finish line back to the hotel. Unfortunately the bar across at 55th Street plays their music too loud at night. So we had a disco on the 3rd floor... But otherwise it is a good hotel.

This is a great hotel, very convenient location to time square and Central Park, and very nice looking. I wanted very much to give the hotel a higher rating but for me there were two main issues (I'll note that we stayed on NY Marathon weekend which may have contributed)Issues: 1. Room was not as expected. We booked via Hotels.com and had selected a premier room on a higher level with Times Square views. New York is the city of high buildings, and the 10th floor facing a car park and side street wasn't what we had expected. It also appeared to have a much smaller bathroom than most of the other rooms on the floor (poked my nose in when they were being cleaned). This was disappointing. We were told we couldn't move because the hotel was fully booked and we were assured it was a premier room despite it looking identical to a classic room on the photos on the hotel website. We were offered a move if we brought our luggage down to reception the following day but this wasn't convenient and the hotel wouldn't pick the luggage up for us (with a pregnant wife and 3 year old son it was too much hassle to move). 2. There appeared to be a lot of elevators in the building but the bank of 4 elevators on one side only worked for floors 11 and up, and the bank of 4 elevators on the other side were actually only 2 elevators as 2 were for staff only. They also served all floors. So getting to and from the room took 15 minutes most times as the hotel was very busy and there was never space in the elevator (usually had to go up to come down). Probably more of a problem due to how busy it was but again suggested floors 1-10 were the cheaper rooms for the hotel.The were no other real issues. Hotel bed was comfy, rooms were good quality, our bathroom was surprisingly small and the air con is pretty noisy. I would probably try somewhere else next time because of these issues rather than the hotel being poor. If our room had been on a higher floor I think this review would read a lot better.

I've made multiple visits to this hotel. Its location is hard to beat. The N, R ,Q Subway runs underneath and entry an be gained on the same corner. From there one can go almost anywhere in NYC. The room rates are reasonable. The check-in agent went out of her way to find the perfect room. Will book again in the future.

It was refreshing to have a person sincerely interested in our concerns...Ms.ELIZABETH CACOVIC handeled my entire family's needs during our stay at during the NYC marathon weekend.....HOWEVER...I don't appreciate the "gouged" rate you charge for our 2 day 2 room stay...ordinarily the rooms are between $200-$300 per nite.......you charged me over $3,000.00 for 2 nites and 2 rooms....This is not right...how your hotel gets away with this is beyond me....taking advantage of us.

Nice hotel that is conveniently located to Central Park and Times Square. Rooms are clean and adequate, however, no coffee maker or fridge, but can get if ask. Hotel car service not great as they give kick back to hotel. Loved the coffee shop next door, too.

A perfect hotel near Central Park. The only dissapointment during the monday was the bar/lounge. People were lying on couches, eating their own take-away-food, tables were not clean. Am an experienced traveller and apart from this there is nothing much negative to write about the long weekend we stayed there

We were there for the Marathon, Halloween and the World Series. It was a mad house everywhere in the city. The hotel was in a terrific location. Everyone was very helpful. We had a great time. We will be back.

The rooms were nicer than expected, and the staff was very courteous. Location was perfect, and within walking distance to subway access, Central Park, and Times Square. The 12:00 checkout time was a bonus!

Wonderful hotel in a great location just 5 minute walk to Central Park and 10 mins to Times Square.Staff very friendly and rooms clean and well presented. Internet access was excellent and we would definitely stay here again.

Great location but noisy rooms with every car and truck on 7th Avenue able to be heard, all through the night. Front desk staff were mostly indifferent, and at times rude in response to requests for assistance or advice. At the end of the stay an extra facility fee is charged, even if you haven't used the gym or car parking.

It was a bit expensive and the internet did not work. The room was clean and free of outside noise which is a plus for a NYC Hotel. Check in was a bit of a hassle as we had 3 guests and we were charged an additional fee. The 1st guest checking in was given a hard time because she was not the CC holder. I think in this case then the fee should have been wavered.

The hotel was nice, pretty and very well located however it has only two elevators for all the floors so in the morning there is a queue to use the elevator. This can take between 10-15 minutes each time you want to use it. Also there is a mandatory fee of USD 25 per night per room, not included in the reservation fees.

Not a good experience. Impossible to sleep due to noise from outside. Most unhelpful front desk staff I have experienced in USA ever. A hotel that has gone downhill since my first stay here ten years ago.

Nice hotel and there is a subway stop across the street. But at check-out, they claimed they did not have enough space to store my bags! There were about 50 more people waiting as well. It was a mess.

Little things make a difference: they had full-size bottles of shampoo, conditioner, and body wash! For some reason, I found that to be very nice. Large, clean room. Super convenient location, and easy to find.

I knew very little about the hotel before our stay, but was very pleased. Ideal location for exploring New York at around halfway between Times Square and Central Park. A very nice well presented room. Free wi-fi worked perfectly.We didn't need to use the reception/concierge other than for check-in/check-out, but staff were friendly and helpful.Would definitely stay here again.

Great hotel in a great location. Close to my business meetings...as well as Central Park and Times Square. Everyone was very helpful if I had any questions...overall service was great. Must mention that the bed was very comfortable. Elevators a bit slow and small. Would definately stay here again.

great location so close to everywhere you need to be, however felt the staff were very rude ! but then again could that just be the New York attitude ? lots of hotels close by 2 min walk to central park.4/5 mins to time square same to 5th ave

Great place to stay when traveling into New York City! Centrally located, beautiful setting. We would recommend it to anyone looking for a clean and pleasant experience. It is our go-to place when visiting the city.

We have stayed at the Park Central several times due to the fabulous location. Now the hotel (lobby/bar/rooms) have had a major overhaul this will always be our first choice hotel. The newly refurbished rooms are fantastic - and in New York it is rare to get such decent size rooms. We will definitely be returning!

Great hotel, great location. Surprised not to have any dining facilities, but there are excellent diners in the near vicinity. If you like a daily walk in Central Park you couldn't be better placed. The staff couldn't have been nicer.

We were there for the November 1 NYC marathon. Clean and comfortable room. Not worth the ~ $400 that we paid for a high-demand weekend, but @ bargain rage (under $200) - this would be a good value for NYC. Staff were friendly and efficient.

Stay away from this hotel.It is not a real 4 stars hotel. They charge a daily $25 as a hotel fee to offer fitness center and Wifi while these services are complementry in other hotels. Bad check out and luggage services. No AC in the room. No dining services.

hotel is in an ideal location within a five minute walk to times square,central park rockerfella centre and various other establishments. good local eating establishments including Elen stardust closeby would definitely return to new york and stay at this hotel.good facilities and clean hotel with friendly staff.only one thing bad about the hotel is the wifi charge when you attend

Booked here via Thomas Cook and glad we did. My wifes first trip to NYC for her special birthday. Loved every minute. Great big super king size bed, lovely helpfull staff who kept the place amazingly clean and a nice view onto 7th avenue.Would recom and would defo go there again.

Excellent location; beautiful Hotel. Very friendly staff willing to accommodate your needs. Internet working very well. Rooms are very clean but wish rooms are bigger; OK for 1 person. No regrets, will come back.
5 minute walk to time squareMinute walk to central parkVery clean and modernService was superbVery HelpfulTea and coffee in the room would have made it perfectDefinitely would stay again!!!!!!!!

Staff very helpful and polite .. on site food shop way over priced ..shame as we would have used it more .. go around the corner for better ..Rooms very clean and a good standard.Aircon very noisy !! But had a good time

Bedroom and bathroom unclean ,noisy and beds made up poorly each night of stay, reception staff not helpful, great location close to Central Park and time square ,but not great value for what we got ,

Great location but very impersonal. A few issues, hot water was only Luke warm, not enough towels in bathroom for our family of 4. Would have been nice to have had tea and coffee making facilities in the room and a mini fridge. It was nice and clean, staff helpful, but overpriced for what you get. There are plenty more hotels that would have offered the same and been cheaper!

I had stayed here previously and my memory was I had enjoyed it. This hotel is in a good location for seeing mid town, with Central Park a few minutes walk and subway right outside. However nothing else about my experience was good. Over the period of my stay I had conversations with three separate front of house staff and they all forgot about being friendly and helpful. Waiting on the lift on most occasions was a long process, more than ten minutes on one occasion. I booked a Premier King Room and my confirmation indicated free wifi, however I discovered it is free as part of a $25 per night charge for additional services that you might not want or use. The passage below is from the hotel website"Designated on our higher floors, the Premier rooms have windows facing multiple directions allowing for the most light. This category is available in both king and queens beds, making it a great option for the guest that is looking to enhance their Park Central Hotel experience." There are 18 floors and my room was on 9th floor, not what I would call higher level and close enough to street to have sleep disturbed on an ongoing basis. When I inquired about this I was told higher actually meant anywhere from 8th floor upwards. Will most definitely not return to this hotel.

Well appointed rooms and public spaces, wifi that actually works well, and decent prices for a sought-after destination near Colombus Circle, Theater District and Carnegie Hall. If room service and an on-site restaurant is important to you however, neither is available.

One or two small issues (air con has to be oppressively noisy to make any impact, not enough lifts available at times and the upgrade offer strategy needs sone thought), but at the price generally very good, great location and management and staff clearly care about customers. Rooms clean, gymnasium well stocked and great location

The staff was very friendly and helpful, the checkin process was speedy, the room was nice and the bed was really comfy, my only "complain" would be that there was a musty smell in the bathroom that was coming from the shower curtain, but the bathroom was clean and nice. The location is excellent there is a lot of stuff near by, I'll be coming back to this hotel for sure.

I took my 15 year old daughter on a visit to NYC and the hotel stay helped make this a wonderful trip! The rooms were spacious, had a warm comforting ambiance, were clean and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel staff was friendly and attentive. The hotel lobby was charming and I loved the various sitting areas throughout the hotel. Location cannot be beat; 2 blocks to the north is central park and three blocks to the south is Times Square. There are also several subway stations within a block of the hotel. I also liked the coffee shop in the lobby for those that want a quick snack, coffee drink or light breakfast. I look forward to my next stay at the hotel.

By Roy Oct 31 2015 Lacking food facilities, no information given explaining meals and times availability, Each room should have a booklet showing meal times and availability, room service and drinks menu.

Wasted an hour waiting in line to check luggage arriving at noon. Very long line moved extremely slowly. Staff kept disappearing. Management was unsympathetic, unhelpful, and obviously poor and disorganized. This is a photo of the line I waited in and I was in the middle!

This was a once in a lifetime trip to NYC and we were thrilled with the location of the hotel. We were able to walk to so many of the places on our wish list, we were given a room at the front of the hotel so had a fantastic view. Thank you!

A fantastically positioned hotel, which suited our needs perfectly. Situated on 7th Avenue it's close to Time Square but not too close that it's noisy. The park is really nearby and MoMA, Rockafella Centre, Broadway and 5th Avenue shops all 10 minutes away or less. The subway right out side the hotel was brilliant, we where down in Soho in no time. Very helpful and friendly staff.

We really love the location. We have been to the hotel for the last 5 or 6 years.Everyone is very helpful and very nice to the guest. Very convenient when we meet our son who we are visiting. Subway is close.

Great location, nice rooms, very clean.Staff are friendly, happy to help.Bar is nice, best for a quiet drink at the end of the day, not great for a lively night out.Go next door for breakfast, fantastic choice of food and really good coffee!

It's 24hrs since we returned from our family 6 day break in New York, we were privileged enough to stay at the Park Central Hotel, what can I say about the hotel, one word sums it up AMAZING, the location is perfect for Central Park which is a five minute walk, Time Square is a 10 minute walk, the Top of The Rock a 10 minute walk. Don the General Manager has put together a great team, from the check in to the room maid they were all superb, the room was modern and clean with great views along 7th Avenue towards Times Square, we would have no hesitation in staying at Park Central Hotel again

While strategically located, this hotel could use friendlier and warmer front desk staff who did not even smile upon check-in and check out. Their system showed a one night instead of 4-night reservation and while I thought that was resolved, I received a billing after the first night which caused me some worries so I had to go back to front desk to be sure. The new person at the front desk told me he needed to fix that and asked for my card and key card again but then saw a "note" in the system that indicated the person who checked me in had fixed this. I would have appreciated being informed about the separate 1 day and 3 day billing ahead of time.There was also a very rude housekeeping staff who literally knocked impatiently on our door and shoved the hot water / coffee maker to the hands of my daughter and just stomped away. That also took 30 minutes to be accomplished after request. So... there are other hotels in the area and I would rather check the others out next time.

Good location, clean hotel, nice decor, reasonably friendly staff. But long waits for cramped elevator - and beware the mandatory $25 a day "facilities fee" for "free wifi" and use of the gym - even if you didn't use them!

We stayed here for 4 nights, great location for time square and Central Park and right next door to subway and bus stops. Cafe in lobby was expensive, but plenty of choic right outside the hotel for food and coffee. We were upgraded to a queen room which was plenty big enough for 3. We were on the 8th floor and traffic outside was very noisy - New York is definitely a city that doesn't sleep!! Wifi excellent, some comments on elevators, but we only walked the stairs (down) once rather than waiting.

Our room was perfect.The staff was very friendly, housekeeping were very well..Negativ:The central market in the hotel is very expensive..The sightseeings are easy to arrive from this hotel..But it was a very nice stay in this hotel.

Just back from 4 nights stay ,so what can I say,well it is in a great spot for the park and a short walk will take you to Times Square,Rockefeller Centre and only a few stops on the underground to most places. Beds comfortable and rooms not a bad size,staff all friendly and helpful.The one big negative was the noise,we stayed in a room on the eighth floor and because of construction work and a bin lorry that seem to appear at 3.30 in the morning ,it certainly was a city where we never slept. I did complain and unfortunately no other rooms were available for the Wednesday night but we were offered a different room from Thursday,as this was our last night nobody wanted the hassle of moving for the one night, we did I get some ear plugs from the hotel and these helped. Surely if you are renovating a hotel in New York soundproofing would be one of the first requirements. Secondly they charge 27 dollars a night per room for a facilities fee which in our case was wifi, surely this could be built in to the room costs.Thirdly the room we stayed in had a grey carpet which looked like it had never been cleaned.I hate to sound negative because we enjoyed our stay in New York but with a few tweaks it could have been so much better

Have stayed here at least 6 times and have been very satisfied. The lines are minimal and we have been treated courteously by staff every time. Our rooms have been clean and larger than normal for NYC (having stayed in some really small ones). Lots of activity outside the hotel for dining, shows, central park, etc. -- it is all walking distance. Most times the rates are reasonable - if not, we look for discounts or call directly to see what they can do. Would recommend staying here if the price is right - maybe we will see you on our next visit!

A huge thank you to the Park Central for yet another fantastic trip to New York. Spent 5 days there at the end of June, and as ususal the hotel did not let me down. As I have said before in my reviews, you can't beat the location and the ease to get around the city. Had a friend stay with me who has now also become a fan of the hotel. He thought the gym was amazing and very clean. In most hotels the gym is an after thought, here, you even have a view while you work out (the gym has windows) If you are thinking about a trip to the Big Apple, check out this hotel. The rooms are big by NYC standards, and always super clean. Very comfy beds, and big bathrooms make for such a luxury at the end of a long day. The staff are always willing to help out and answer any questions. Requests (such as extra towels, ect) are always delt with quickly. The iron in my room was not heating up, and was replaced with a new one (out of the box!) in less than 20 minutes. Over the years, I have made friends in the city, and they always marvel at how great the hotel is. The higher floors are a personal favourite, they seem to be the quietest. Price wise you will need to look around, as it tends to be different from site to site if booking on-line. In the end, you will be glad you spent the money. There are a million "boutique" hotels in New York, but I have found they never live up to the hype. Enjoy your trip.A

We booked this through Expedia and had never seen/heard of this hotel before. We were a little hesitant but it turned out perfectly. We were on a quick weekend in NYC and the location was couldn't be better as a base to explore the city from. The hotel was clean and modern and the staff were friendly and helpful. I expected a tiny room but it was actually a good size for NYC. I will definitely stay here again!

beautiful place and great location...friendly staff and spacious clean room would certainly stay there again because of the ambiance and the location and the cost was quite reasonable for the location and hotel

Stayed here for one night. It was an beautiful hotel. The service was top notch and the room was big. There is a great little restaurant in the lobby and a great snack shop. the rooms were immaculate and the staff was friendly. Can't wait to stay here again.

I booked this hotel with trepidation after reading some of the reviews but I'm glad I did. We were meeting family who were staying around the corner so I didn't have a choice on location. When we walked up to the counter to check in I told my daughter to beware, that our room was only $250/night so not to expect much. Well, I was wrong. This place was outstanding! Our room had been completely renovated (seventh floor). The new bathroom was sparkling clean and the carpet was clean. The beds were puffy and so comfortable. The AC worked well and did not go on and off all night like some hotels. If you get a room on the interior, it's quiet and dark in the morning. If I need a room in midtown, I would use this hotel again and I've already started telling people about it.

My adult son and I stayed for a couple days while helping my daughter move from Baltimore to NYC. The hotel aura quite restful, rooms small but wonderful, and best of all for those who like to run, from hotel door to the loop around Central Park it's about two minutes. Oh and if you need Starbuck's to get you going in the morning before you run...it is right next door. (Coffee in the lobby shop is pretty good too.) Staff was smiling, helpful, and kind...not snobby.

Visited this hotel as a family and were upgraded to a bigger room ,unfortunately went downhill from there. On plugging in iron on first morning electrics blew in a puff if black smoke (adaptor beside plug shows marking) and could not use phone ,took lift to reception who seemed concerned said they would send maintenence to check it was OK to stay in the room asked if I wanted to change room said I would take their advice ,maintenence guy arrived seemed unconcerned and did not replace iron nor confirm it was safe to stay in the room,no further word from reception on the matter so assumed safe to stay in room ? On last day could not get room key to open door ,they had to get security to open the room for me to confirm my identity with my passport took approx 40mins and felt like a criminal trying to get into my own room. I appreciate the need for security but feel it could have been handled better,glad it was myself who came back to the hotel first rather than one of the children ! The hotel is central and clean but no fridge,tea or coffee facilities or breakfast included for the price of the room which is certainly not cheap! Disappointing .

My husband and I visited New York for the first time and stayed at this hotel. When you first walk in, it looks very fancy! The staff was very friendly. I loved that we could come before check in time and drop off our luggage so we could explore the city! Very close to Times Square and many other attractions. The rooms were pretty big for New York and the bed was very soft. We had a window overlooking the street and we couldn't hear the traffic at all. Overall it was a great stay!

Pros:1) Location is amazing. Times Square is to your right and Park Central is to your left. Other hot spots in New York are all extremely close and mostly within walking distance.2) Hotel staff are extremely friendly and always willing to help. Our cleaning lady was called Marissa and was the most pleasant person in the hotel. Her job was also always well done.Cons:1) No room service, no breakfast. Only food option was is a small indoor market with a limited selection and no seating.2) Business center was mediocre. Internet connectivity was always available for 15 minutes at a time. Also, no chairs were offered and the printer was weak.

This was a great location between Time Square and Central Park. The hotel was clean and the cleaning staff was very friendly. It was worth it to pay in advance for the breakfast, which was a muffin and drink.

Stayed here last December an I've gotta say it was a perfect hotel You walked out an you were right on Times Square and Central Park Hotel staff were very helpful aswell and always pointed you in the right directions for meals out and casual drinks You will love this hotel if you love the hustle and bustle of New York So good we are going back again this December!!

We stayed in this hotel from Tuesday the 18th to Saturday the 22nd of this month and I have to say the hotel was very impressive. It was clean and well maintained with a beautiful modern reception area and bar. The reception staff were really friendly and helpful when we were asking for directions. Some of them even looked up prices of the subway for us and another one drew us a map. The rooms were beautiful, modern, well decorated and spacious. We stayed on the 8th floor and had a good view from there. And the housekeeping kept our room spotless during our stay. The beds were so comfortable as well and the hotel was spotless. Unfortunately we never had a chance to try out the bar but we were so impressed but this hotel that we will definitely be back and try out the bar next time.

The Park Central is a very nice hotel ideally situated on 7th Ave. It's a quick walk to Central Park, a must for me and my children, and Times Square. When we checked in we were greeted by friendly staff at the front desk. We were able to easily store our bags because we were early and our room wasn't ready yet. The room was clean and bright, cleaned early in the mornings, had quite comfortable beds, and plenty of towels. The only thing I can say that needs an update is the wallpaper in the room, which is not a big deal at all. Check out was simple, there were no hidden fees, and my car was in front of the hotel in the 10 minutes as promised. All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. I'll return to the PC again on our next visit to the city.

Room was quite good, some points weren't good though.There is no minibar or fridge in the room. And what's really weird is: If you want to work out in the Hotel Gym beware: There is no barbell. Even though they got everything, weight and rack, there is no barbell to train with. I asked the reception and they said it's for the personal trainers only lol.. srsly?

First time staying there and will make it my go-to hotel in the future. Pros: --Room with two double beds was a good size. The pillows were even good. I travel with my pillow, but in the future when staying there will have that much extra space in my luggage.--Air conditioning worked like a champ in hot, muggy August--I wanted it to blast Arctic air and it did. --Room-to-room noise could have been better, but I'm not sure it was any worse than other places.--Service desk was very nice and helpful.--Location was excellent. Too bad Carnegie Deli right across 55th St. was closed and had been for months due to power (gas) supply issues. Premiere Cafe on the corner, however, was a great place to pick up a quick breakfast and coffee.--The lounge area looked really nice, though I did not use it.--Very close to Times Square, but far enough away to avoid the mayhem.Cons: --Shower curtain liner was barely long enough to fit inside tub. Potential for much leakage onto floor.--Housekeeping was still cleaning rooms at 8 p.m. My last full day there, I just put the "Downtime Needed" card on the door when I returned in the afternoon and kept it there. Not sure if they are understaffed or what. I understand the vacated rooms get first priority, but this seemed excessive.

Hotel is located in great area right next to Central Park and convenient subway stop. Hotel room was very clean and perfect for our stay. Restaurants and tourist attractions are close by. I would stay there again.

I don't know what the gripes are all about, awesome suite, customer service staff there for you when you need them, emails to keep you informed about your stay and charges. Was in contact with multiple customer service agents. Rooms clean, towels aplenty and cleaning staff there when you need them and not there when you don't. Great stay.

Stayed here with a group of girls to celebrate a Bachelorette party in the city. Hotel was incredible, both rooms were beautiful and very comfortable. The staff were all incredibly helpful and friendly. The breakfast from the market downstairs was also a treat, great selection of pastries to choose from. The Park Central is perfectly located in the city close to great food and fun!!

I don't even know where to start.Unfriendly desk staff upon arrival. First morning, housekeeper just barged into our room without knocking, waking us up... Which is unbelievable. Also, housekeeping didn't come cleaning room till after 4 PM, we had no clean towels...The rooms have No fridge, No kettle, No coffee machines and forget Free water bottle or Free Internet. That's their $27 Improvement Fee which quite frankly should be spent on Customer Service. The hotel makes excuses saying guest can request things. How can you request something that other cheaper hotels have... ?Also, the management needs to keep downstairs staff updated about major shops. We were told Schwartz was place to go for toys, my son was close to crying when he found out it close 3 weeks ago. and parking your vehicle will cost you additional $60 a dayThe only positive is, it is Central.I'd never stay here again. This hotel is a prime example of a money making machine that lost completely human touch.

As someone who frequently travels and has stayed in lots of hotels throughout my lifetime, I would rank this hotel stay as one of the worst hotel stays in my lifetime. To start off, we called ahead of our stay to request a hypoallergenic room because of my Mom's severe allergies. When we arrived back to the hotel room after dinner ,on the first night, we were shocked to find that the room contained many pillows that my mom was allergic too. We quickly called housekeeping to remove these pillows and get new one's but we were rudely responded to by the head of housekeeping and the whole ordeal took over 30 minutes. A few night following the incident we returned back to our hotel room late at night to find that the housekeeper had failed to leave us clean towel . We didn't even have one clean towel to share among the four of us. It took over 45 minutes to get this issue resolved and we didn't get to sleep until pass 2 AM. The worst thing about this whole ordeal is that when we complained about the treatment we were told by one manager that these things sometimes happen and that they are not at fault. When we spoke to another manager in the morning she mentioned that she would comp us for our bad experience. But when we went to check out we didn't received any financial compensation and we were told that the manager wouldn't be coming in until 11 that day. Since we had at 11 am flight to catch so we couldn't stay around to complain. Overall this experience put an extremely sour note on our trip and I wished I hadn’t been so frugal and had cough up the extra 45 dollars to stay at my favorite New York hotel the Affinia Manhattan. Since returning home I have had several friends who are planning trip to New York and they have asked me about my experience at the Park Central Hotel. I have been honest and upfront and have encouraged them to stay away at all cost. In the end my stay at the Park Central Hotel was one of the worst experiences in my life and left a sour taste in my mouth. If you have any respect for yourself and your hard earned money I would stay somewhere else. Note my stay was form July 30- Aug 6 2015

A very pleasant hotel and perfectly situated. It's close to Central Park, Times Square, the Plaza Hotel and many more attractions, thereby eliminating the need for a taxi.The rooms are nice, service is good and the staff very friendly.

I had a wonderful stay at the Park Central. Went to NY for one day with my two sons prior to them going to school. Every person I interacted with was cordial, polite and ready to help. My room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. Big tvs in the rooms and my room was of good size in comparison to some other NY hotels I have stayed at. You can't beat the location! A quick walk to shopping on 5th or Madison, the park or Times Square is less than ten minutes away walking. Close to everything for everyone. You can't go wrong with this decision.

We were completely satisfied with our 4 day stay at the Park Central. We drove to NYC and were worried about parking. Not a problem! The parking package included valet parking for $10/day (no in/out privilege but who needs that anyway?) which was fantastic. I selected this hotel mainly for the location, the acceptable prices and the parking package but we were really pleasantly surprised with the room too. Our king room was a good size with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was also a decent size and immaculate, with a wonderful shower, lots of nice fluffy towels and very good bath products. We had a problem with our room keys not working on several occasions but the staff were very courteous and helpful in resolving the problem. I would enthusiastically recommend this hotel and I hope to stay here again on our next visit to wonderful New York.

I arrived at the Hotel after a long flight, excited to start my first day of college tomorrow. When I come to finally check in, the receptionist, in an extremely condescending manner, starts verbally attacking me, a telling me I cant read, interestingly enough Im a English major. I don't know how this Hotel has more than two stars, it seemed as if the moment they denied me the room I prepaid for and wasn't their customer anymore I was like the scum of the earth. They even wouldn't refund my room, and sent me to the hotel across the street. If customer service isn't their first priority, I think they need to rethink their interest in the "hospitality" business. If you're looking for a hotel experience thats accommodating and friendly, this isn't the one.

Most of my traveling is for business, and I stay at Hampton Inns and the like- I don't get a hotel this nice very often. I booked a package trip to NYC with my girlfriend, and ended up with the Park Central being the hotel that fit our dates. It looked fine, and I booked the trip. I started reading some of the reviews and got a little worried. I had one weekend off so far this year and this was it.  OK, so we get there- beautiful place. Got a smile from everyone, were able to check our bags quickly and go see the city before we could get our room. Got back at 3:45, had maybe a 5 minute wait before we got checked in. I asked for a room not so near the elevators, and got changed to a great room on a corner, quiet and very comfortable. I was worried about running out of shampoo and such (courtesy of previous reviews), but large containers were installed in showers and was never an issue. The room was great, TV, etc, no complaints. The desk folks, concierge, guest service people, every one was very accomodating, and the wait time was very brief.. Lots of smiles.  If I have to reach for a downside, I would say I wish there was some type of small refrigerator in the room. Wasn't a huge deal, but would be nice. Our side of the hotel had 2 elevators, and it could be a little slow, but was never frustrating.. We had a fabulous stay, everyone seemed engaged making our visit as good as it could be. The location is unbeatable. I am used to my expectations not being met, and usually just move on and don't complain, but this time they were exceeded. I had a blast. More importantly, so did my girlfriend. When the woman's happy, we're all happy. Thanks!

It might not be the most famous hotel in New York but this hotel, on the 7th Avenue, very close to Central Park, is just perfect if you want a very clean and relaxing hotel.The whole staff was just excellent and helpful. Unfortunately I have only spent few days in this hotel but I will definitely get back. Best one so far of the many I have been in NY

This was my second time at Park Central and, like the first one, everything was great. Location is perfect in between Time Square and Central Park, rooms are clean and quite big for the New York's standards and the new lobby's look is great. I was there with my family and a group of friend and everyone was really pleased with the hotel. On top of this just few steps away there are plenty of locations where you can get your breakfast in the morning for a reasonable price hence you will not regret your choice if you decide to stay there.

Stayed 6 nights at Park Central while visiting New York.Hotel is in great location! Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, Broadway etc.Everything you need is close by, including subway access.Room is small but to be expected in New York. Staff friendly and happy to help with show and game tickets. Market in lobby is expensive but next door there is a French cafe which is great followed by a Starbucks. No mini bar or restaurant facility but also not needed in the heart of the city.Bar area is a nice spot to relax and meet friends.Overall loved this place and would stay here again!

Stayed from August 13 to 16th, 2015. Location: Not to repeat the obvious but this hotel has the best location!! Its a 7 minute walk to time square and a 5 minute walk to central park. Hotel: It appears to have been recently renovated. It has a great lobby to chill out in and rooms were decent. Lobby music was upbeat and matched the vibe of NYC. I used the gym a couple of times at it was pretty good too. Staff: Doormen were the best. My wife got a b-day present from guest relations which was such a nice touch!! Cleaning staff did a great job with towels etc. Bought tour tickets right from the hotel and it was well worth it. Will we go back: In a heartbeat! NYC is really something else and this hotel only added to that experience!!

This is a nice hotel and we felt it was about as good a location as you could have in New York City. We had a family of 6 and booked 2 of the double queen bed corner rooms. The rooms were very big compared to others we have stayed at in the city and they were nice. The beds were comfortable. The $27 daily resort fee is kind of annoying, but we knew about it when we booked. Sometimes you had to wait a few minutes for the elevator, but it was never too bad. Overall it was a fantastic place to stay and we would stay here again.

Recently renovated, this hotel is relaxing and beautifully appointed. The rooms are comfortable, we had an 8th floor corner room, and even though you are right on 7th Avenue, there is no street noise.I was travelling with my sister and we were greeted by a very accommodating doorman who whisked our bags to the counter. We arrived early, 9:30 a.m., but we able to check in (needed to return at 4;00 p.m. for the keys - note this 4:00 p.m. check in was not smooth, only one person, with long lines. The manager came out to personally speak to each of us, but more staff would have been helpful. Another person was added at 4:00.)We did check our bags and went right over to the concierge to play our three day stay. It is worth the extra money to book your tickets, dinner reservations, etc. through these capable individuals. We booked tickets to Wicked, and a dinner reservation, jazz club with dinner, and then reviewed what we could walk to and where we needed a cab. Exceptional. There is a place to purchase bakery goods and drinks in the lobby, a beautifully renovated bar area where you can munch on the goodies from the bakery or order a drink. There are great restaurants nearby, as are the theatres, Times Square, Central Park and so much more. This central location makes it easy for you to get to so much that is accessible either by taxi or walking. We walked through Central Park to the MET and Guggenheim, took a cab back, and the next day walked to Rockefeller Center and Empire State building. As to the extra $25/day fee for wifi and the fitness center, I did know about it, but would have rather it was included in the price.Hidden gem - there is a car service from the hotel that brought my sister and I back to JFK, same price as the cab ride. Worth doing!!!!!

Due to the varied reviews, I was VERY hesitant about our stay at Park Central. However my concerns were quickly put to rest. We planned a girls trip...it was my friend and her two girls (ages 10 &12) along w/myself and my niece (age 11). Our stay at Park Central was AWESOME!!! From the first moment we checked in at the front desk w/Joe (who was fantastic) to the moment we checked out. The hotel staff was ALWAYS friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated!! I read reviews about the elevators being very slow. We never once had a problem. We checked in on a Wednesday and left on a Saturday so we experienced the hotel when it was slow to its peak time. During that duration we never waited for an elevator!!! The location of the hotel was PERFECT!! You step out of the hotel and look to your right and can see Times Square. Look to your left and you can see the trees of Central Park. You can't ask for a better location!! Though most of the main tourists attractions are w/n walking distance occasionally there is a need for a taxi.The guys in the front of the hotel were super about pulling over a taxi for us. We would definitely stay here again, in a heartbeat! PERFECT, PERFECT, PERFECT!!!!!!!!!!

Location.....4 blocks from the park, 7 minute walk to Times Square/Broadway plus a subway stop on the corner!!! Incredibly comfortable bed and pillows...I even called the hotel to find out what they are because I have not slept that well in years! Clean room. Pretty lobby. The door into the bathroom did not open all the way because it hit the toilet, but....we laughed it off. Facility fees, while high, are clearly spelled out ahead of time and since the room rate we paid was reasonable they did not bother me. We got a free breakfast baked good / fruit / beverage which was nice. I will definitely stay here again.

Business Center was closed at times. There are no microwaves on the premises. That is ridiculous! They want you to buy food at their Central Market. Elevators are slow. I did not see a bar to lift the weights in the fitness center. My email was IGNORED. You must give clients access to a microwave. No excuses. Even a motel 6 can provide a microwave. They only contact you after your stay is over. Stay anywhere but here. This is not rare. Poor customer service!!!

This was my second stay here and have no complaints. Great location (esp for walking in beautiful Central Park). Comfortable, clean rooms & close to subways. Park Cafe across the street is great & reasonably priced for breakfast. Have seen complaints about the elevators - although slow at times really were not a big problem for me. NYC hotels are expensive, no getting around that. For relative value the Park Central is the way to go.

Our family travels to NYC often and have stayed at Park Central Hotel, New York many times. We are very pleased with their friendly staff who work very hard to keep such a lovely establishment so clean, safe and professional. Everyone there takes pride in their job and it shows. We will definitely stay there again.

We stayed at the Park Central hotel for four nights - It is in a great location right between Central Park and Times Square - We arrived at the hotel at 9:00am after a long night of travelling from Vancouver, Canada and were greeted by friendly hotel staff - They had us in our room by 2:00pm and I was able to upgrade to a nicer, corner room with views down 7th to the Park - The room was great - beds were very nice - overall the room made for a very comfortable four night stay - And if you enjoy working out the gym is first class and open 24/7 - my wife and I started every day with a great morning workout - I must mention Quimby Hightower, the Director of Guest Experience - also known as "Q" He was awesome and made sure everything was running smoothly - one morning he noticed me at the guest services counter and greeted me by name wanting to confirm that everything was ok with our stay - I was impressed! They really care about their guests - I overheard numerous conversations between hotel staff and guests where the staff members were doing everything possible to be accomodating - Also there is a fantastic deli/sandwich shop just a few doors down that can meet all your breakfast/lunch and dinner needs - and just a couple of blocks down on 9th there are dozens of cafes and restaurants - Overall a great place to stay in NYC

A Recent one night stay at this hotel.Good location,Convenient to theaters and central park.We were a family group,taking 3 rooms on the same floor.Room OK,modern, clean.Two rooms were of acceptable size.The third,where one of my daughters slept with her 2 teenage children was seriously under sized,and poorly lighted,with a really undersized bathroom.Prices are more than the rooms are really worth but due to location and the generally pleasant appearance of the place and the fact that it is New York makes it palatable.Check in is at 4PM Checkout around noon. A few minutes after 8 am comes a knock at the door.A mistake by housekeeping? At our 3 rooms? ( that's the excuse We got at the desk.) The hotel seems to a very large daily turnover of rooms and they are anxious to clean them ASAP.But there's no need to rudely awaken guests.

The room is nice and simple, but the bed + pillows combination at this hotel was something else!!! I don't know why, but I think I never slept so good in any other hotel I've ever been to! The location was great, near the park and close to the mess at Times Square!

Great location and a great place to stay in NYC! Loved the location to everything and the price. It was clean bathroom was average size but nice. The bed was very nice and we both had a wonderful nights sleep.

We spent 10 days at the Park Central to celebrate my husband's birthday. After searching online for the "right" hotel we were very pleased that we chose to stay at this hotel.LOCATION:If there was ONE good reason to book this hotel it would be because of the great location! A short walk from Central Park, a 10-min walk to Times Square, a subway station right next to the hotel and so many shops and restaurants within easy walking distance from the hotel. (Do check out Hell's Kitchen in 9th Avenue!)HOTEL:I have read reviews where people complain about slow lifts, well we were on the 18th floor and we never once had an issue. We did not have to wait long for a lift and the lift moved swiftly. The hotel lobby was lovely, quite a buzz with lots of people milling around. Friendly staff, check-in and out was easy and quick. The new décor is great.ROOM:We booked the Premier King room (1810) - we were happy with the room and the king size bed was the most comfortable bed we have ever slept on!! The bathroom was a tad small but how often were we in the bathroom anyway? The important thing was that it was clean, the water was hot and the white towels were fresh and fluffy. Our white linen was changed every day. Huge flat screen television. The room was airy and light with a nice view from our window onto the surrounding buildings and 7th Avenue below us to the left.I asked the hotel if we could have a small fridge in our room as we were staying for 10 nights, this was such a help. I bought my own little travel kettle, coffee cups & tea bags along with us so I was able to store milk, water, juice, fruit, cheese and muffins in our little bar fridge. The hotel does not have a restaurant (only a little "grab-and-go" in the lobby) but the hotel is surrounded by numerous shops and restaurants. There is a Whole Foods at Columbus Circle but we found a closer food store open 24/7 located in 56th street (2 streets up) between 7th and 6th Avenue called 'Morton Williams Fresh Food Market'. Another favourite was the 'Fresh& Co' on the corner of 7th Ave and 56th Street - the coconut Thai curry chicken salad $6, and the rice pudding $3.50 was my favourite...!!FIRST TIME VISITOR TO NYC TIP:One thing we learnt eating out was that "The price you see is not the price you pay". In restaurants and bars the waitress will add the NY sales tax (I still don't know how much that is?) and a tip usually between 15 - 20%, to the total amount, so be prepared for that when eating out.The $32 weekly subway ticket is worth it if you stay in the hotel for a week or more and plan to travel all over the place.To sum up, we enjoyed staying at the Park Central. We were blessed with amazing hot and humid weather during our stay at the end of July so we spent a lot of time in Central Park.Would I recommend this hotel.... Yes, absolutely!!Susie Bishop, South Africa

Situated in the heart of Manhattan, Park Central is in a great location and makes travelling in the city so easy. True to NY, the hotel is exorbitantly priced. More so since they do not give even basic facilities like tea/coffee machine or a mini fridge in the room. So you can forget about making yourself a hot cuppa as soon as you wake up, or a snack or left over from a large dinner serving. Beds are comfortable though. Dont be surprised to find an amenities charge when you leave the hotel, for amenities that are never used.

We have made the Park Central Hotel our base and refuge on every trip,to NYC and each visit reaffirms the wisdom of that choice. Manager Chloe Finney uses charm, intelligence and ingenuity to handle tense or complex situations and to keep the interface between the Hotel and its guests a comfortable and positive place. The desk, bell, housekeeping and other staff are result oriented, seem to genuinely enjoy their jobs and their interaction with the guests they welcome and assist. The quality of the service, the clean and fresh feeling and decor of the guest rooms and common areas all combine to make a stay at The Park Central Hotel a relaxing and rewarding experience. My wife and I highly recommend the hotel for visitors to NYC for business, vacation or a weekend get away!Jimmy and Catie BrownBrooksville, Florida

Overall, enjoyed the stay and appreciated the upgrade to premium suite with a view of Central Park. The downside was the family across the hall with two rooms and small children were constantly knocking on each other's doors, talking in the hallway, and entering and exiting the room at very late hours (1am). The suite across was so close by you can hear all the chatter and entering and exiting the room which awoken me on more than one occasion forcing me to sternly command they keep the noise down or risk being reported to the front desk. Disappointed the room did not contain a small fridge, no access to concierge service at later hours, as well as no brochure/pamphlet on Hotel amenities and other hotel information. Still my family and I enjoyed staying but will likely book another hotel for the next stay in NYC.

My sister and two of our friends stayed at Park Central Hotel (NYC) for a girls get-a-way and it was the best hotel experience we have every encountered. Check-in was quick and our room was the perfect size, comfortable, decorated beautifully and the shower with all of the extra amenities (large shampoo, conditioner and liquid body soap) was great! We were within 3 blocks of Times Square and the availability of breakfast places is right outside the doors. Starbucks is located right next door, but the crowds in the morning was too much, so the hotel cafe was a great alternative and you get speedy service & great coffee.We also utilized the fitness room which was very convenient and the lounge was very peaceful.

We booked the day before we arrived, and we were happy with the price. After all hotel accommodation is always expensive in New York and our budget was not large.
