We easily walked to the hotel from Penn Station, we were warmly greeted, our room was ready and check in was smooth. Free WIFI included in the room rate. Room was on ninth floor, extremely clean and well presented with everything working. We could not hear noise from neighbouring rooms. Bed was huge and very comfortable. Only downside, window view was into internal courtyard which was not pretty. Easy walk to Central Park, subway station on 57th Street and Times Square. Wide variety of eateries nearby. Bags retained for the day of check out for no additional cost. Room available to change and freshen up etc before flight, or similar.

The lobby is clean and decorated nicely. Some of the wood slabs whined the check in desk need to fixed, but all in all clean and nice. I arrived a couple hours early of check-in and was able to keep my luggage at the hotel while I took dance class and waited for my room.I am very pleased with the room. A King size bed and pillows that are super comfortable.The bathroom is nice but the stopper on the tub did not work properly. So my wonderful bath was cut shorter than I was ready because I refused to keep the faucet running and waste water.I would definitely stay again!

This was our second stay at the Park Central Hotel in Manhattan and overall it was a great experience. The hotel's location is A+. It is just south of central park south and Lincoln Centre and right across the street from Carnegie Hall. There are many restaurants in the area and a Starbucks in the hotel building just outside the front doors! Another great thing about the location is that you are 5 minutes from Times Square but removed enough not to have to deal with the chaotic nature of the "hustle and bustle".The room was clean and the maid service was really good. The staff were very friendly and accommodating and the check-in/check-out was fast and efficient.The only complaint we had was that the elevator service can be slow at times. The hotel has a time share section next to the regular hotel section and the 4 elevators are divided 2/2 between the regular hotel and the time share section. Unfortunately, there are times when you have to wait for an elevator as they are small and are full to capacity on the way down. The best thing is to try and avoid going down to the lobby at check-out time if you're not actually checking out, which is 12 noon. The Wi-Fi access is an extra charge automatically added to your room charge but it was excellent and came in handy. The bed was very comfortable and everything in the room worked well including T.V. and air-conditioning. No problems there.Overall, we loved staying here for a second time and would not hesitate booking for a future trip.

The Park Central hotel is a clean, tourist-oriented hotel. The staff were friendly, efficient, and the bellmen were wonderful. The location is one of its greatest features, halfway between Central Park and Times Square, you really do feel like you're in the heart of NYC. It's not the best hotel for business travelers, but for tourists it's hard to think of a better place....until you get to the ridiculous "facility" fees. $27/night tacked on to your rate for a set of useless amenities. Here's what they say you get for $27/night:-In-room wifi-Local and long-distance phone calls-Complimentary bag storage-Access to fitness centerIn-room wifi is a completely reasonable thing to charge for, although I'll point out that there are plenty of other hotels that do not charge for in-room wifi any longer. Where the fee gets ridiculous is the phone and luggage storage. Find me one person who travels to NYC without a cell phone. It's a useless benefit and it's insulting to customers that you charge them for something that provides literally no value to them. Luggage storage? Most other hotels charge $1/bag. Give me a break. Fitness facilities I get, but for that amount of money you better have the best gym available, which you do not.The GM has made plenty of comments on TripAdvisor reviews saying that "we go to great lengths to make our required facility fee transparent to our guests". Mr. Fraser, because you're transparent about your "facility fee" does not mean it's not insulting to your customers. The cheaply photocopied signs at the check-in desks that basically say "I told you so" in a variety of languages degrade your otherwise beautiful lobby. That you need signage telling your customers that they agreed to the fee means you've had enough unhappy customers to necessitate a sign.If I sent you an invoice for $27/night for the privilege of having me stay at your hotel, you'd refuse to pay, because in your opinion you probably didn't receive $27 worth of value from me staying at your hotel, right? Well guess what, no guest receives $27/night value from your ridiculous fee. When I brought this up to the check-in attendant, she mentioned that everyone else in the area charges fees as well. Guess what? If I liked everyone else's pricing model so much I would've stayed at the other places! Be brave enough to set a standard that other hotels want to meet, instead of determining your pricing model by what you can get away with.Show that you care about your customers by building in the facility fee into your nightly rate. If you charge it to every customer it should not be a separate line-item. And it should DEFINITELY not be taxable, as we are receiving no product.Looking forward to your response, Mr. Fraser.

Once stepping into the lobby there was a very welcoming atmosphere and it had a specific vibe that was unlike all the rest of the other hotels I have stayed at when in New York. I highly recommend it to people who want to stay out of Midtown and want to try something different.

Near Central Park, across front Carnegie Hall, its an easy walk to Time Square, Roc Center or tons of restaurants. We had a huge room (don't worry about windows, the buildings n NY only look at each other) and the bathroom had lots of room with big bottles of shampoo (not the little samples). The help directed us to everywhere, held our luggage on the last day and couldn't be friendlier

We stayed at the Park Central for 5 nights. We walked up to check in and were greeted by a very unfriendly staff member who seemed to displaced by us checking in. She never once greeted us, said hello, how are you? There was NO communication other than NAME. This unfortunately was how all members of the staff greeted us. Through our whole 5 night 6 day stay I can count on one hand how many people who worked for Park Central said hello to us. We also paid for an upgrade higher room and we were given the 5th floor. I brought this to the ladies attention and she rudely stated instead she gave us a bigger room. I was too tired to argue so I left it at that. Upon getting into our room the room was larger for NY standards but stunk like Urine. This stench stayed the whole time we were staying at the hotel. The linens and pillow cases were also not changed. They were was a stain on the pillow case the whole time we were there. Due to these issues we will never stay at this hotel again.

New York City hotels in general are not great unless they are brand new. Most are run-down and ragged inside, with so-so maintenance. Park Central was ok, rooms are fairly large for NYC (with 2 queen beds) and clean, but my room had large mold spots on the ceiling. They also charge a $50 facilities/resort fee, so beware. Doubt I'll stay there again unless other hotels are sold out.

We stayed at Park Central for the 6 days we visited New York whilst attending a family wedding. This is the second time in 18 months we have been to New York but our first time in this hotel. Unfortunately we will definitely be going back to the previous hotel or looking for a new one. Park Central is a beautiful, modern, extremely clean hotel, not far from both main locations for us which were Central Park and Times Square. We had 5 very good nights sleep and room were always immaculate after housekeeping had been. We spent a night in the bar downstairs where we met a lovely gentleman working on bar, who made us feel very welcome. Unfortunately however, our stay here was ruined by a rude and aggressive member of reception staff. Not just on check in but also on the night before the wedding when the groom was meant to be staying here with us. We were not told about the $50 a night per room you had to pay as a deposit so this came to us as a shock. The girl was extremely unhelpful and made out if we didn't have the money or our card were declined as we didn't make our bank aware we were abroad then we would not be able to stay at the hotel. We all understand these girls work long hours, however this is her job and she should be professional and helpful at all times. These situations spoilt our stay here and we would not return.

My stay at Park Central was fantastic! Technically this is probably a four-star hotel, but the service bumped it to five stars, in my opinion. Check-in with Jet at the lobby was smooth and polite. My king-size bed was very comfortable. The room was very clean. The hallways of the main hotel are narrow, no big deal, simply one can tell it's an older building.Lobby was very clean.The lounge behind the check-in area was excellent. John C., the bartender was kind and definitely knew his profession. Nancy, the server, also was professional and friendly.However, bring a wrap or sweater as the lounge is quite cold. Even with 90 degree temps outside it was chilling inside to sit and enjoy a beverage.Location: Excellent! When one steps outside of the hotel, to the right is Times Square approximately 6 -7 blocks, and to the left is Central Park Artisan's Gate about 4 blocks down.Brian, the manager, spent a significant amount of time helping me to find a credit union that would accept an out-of-state ATM card, and/or a check cashing service that would take an out-of-state check.All in all, a wonderful trip! Just be polite, stay calm, and the locals will treat you the same.

On a recent family trip to NYC, we chose the Park Central for it's location and the pictures looked great. We loved the location-walkable to Times Square, 5th Avenue and on the bus tour line. First of all, the check-in line was long and there were only two people working to check people in at 3:00 on Friday afternoon, as well as to answer questions from people already staying at the hotel. The concierge appeared to be on the phone for the entire time we were checking in and was not available to help people, so they had to ask the desk staff. Our room was a corner room with lots of light and a nice neighborhood view, but we wondered if it had been cleaned prior to out arrival. The beds were made, but there were no towels or bathmat. There was also no coffee maker in the room, which was fine, but would have been nice. We called for towels and waited, but none came. We went out for several hours and there were still no towels when we came back. We called again and some were delivered in about an hour, but no bathmat. We had to call again the next day for that. The next day, we went out for the entire day and the room had not been cleaned when we got back around 4:00. Called again to ask about this and were told that housekeeping was still working and would get to us next. We said that were there now and getting ready to go out for dinner, so they said they would come in about 90 minutes. 20 minutes later, in the middle of getting ready, they came but we were not in a position to let them in. When we came back several hours later, they were in the process of cleaning our room-at 9:00 p.m. The next two nights of our stay were fine and the room was cleaned on a more regular hotel schedule, toiletries and towels were replenished. In addition, there was a very long wait for the elevators, especially at check out time. It is also deceiving that our reservation included "free" wifi, but all rooms are charged a $25 fee PER NIGHT for the use of wifi and gym. This was stated when we book our reservation, but the room we chose specifically said free wifi, where others did not, so it was confusing. And apparently you have to pay this whether you use either of these or not. The best part of this hotel is it's location, which is worth some of the hassles we encountered, but there are many other hotels in this neighborhood and we would check out some of these next time instead.

The hotel is located directly next to an N, Q, R subway station which will get you to all of the major sites in no time. It's also located right next to Broadway, Times Sqaure, Carnegie Hall, etc.The rooms were very clean, but did not include a microwave or refrigerator. There is an ice machine in the hall, so if you bring a cooler you can keep things chilled that way, but I do not know how you'd reheat anything. The bathroom was also very nice, with a fairly good size tub. The only other deficiency is the elevator. There is only one pair of elevators that serve a given set of floors (ie floors 3-8) and we would often have to wait 5 minutes or so before we could get the elevator to stop for us.Overall, I would recommend this hotel to first time visitors to the Big Apple. It was easy to find, the door staff was ready to assist us unloading our car and getting into our room, and the valet service was good.

The hotel was decent. Lovely lobby bar behind the front desk but air conditioning was so cold you couldn't sit there comfortably for very long - there was a couple with parkas on the last morning of our stay!

I wanted to do a pedal cab tour. There are multiple options right in front of the Manhattan Apple Store. I talked to a few to find someone who seemed upbeat and personable. Then I negotiated the stated price of $75 per person down to $50. May could have gotten lower, but didn't try.  Our hour tour was fun and informative. Our guide knew his stuff. A couple of other guides even asked him questions.  In nice weather this is a great activity!

Great location, I was pleasantly surprised by the room quality - though small, it was comfortable. The staff were generally very helpful but two in particular were very helpful at the front desk and concierge (Ms Carolyn Smith & Julissa Delacruz respectively).I was very disappointed in the gym though, it was not only small it had limited equipment and some funny arrangement that the large weights bar was not the hotel's and hence was not available unless the external instructors are around (totally unhelpful). An attempt to explain the arrangement just got more and more ridiculous, I think the hotel could invest in a lifting bar seriously. Lastly, there is this additional (compulsory) service charge of $25 per day on arrival that is apparently for access to the gym & wifi. I really don't understand this, either you add this to the actual room rates or allow people to opt out of it, otherwise it gives a false impression of the actual costs per night.Otherwise a comfortable stay and nice staff.

I wanted to stay here because of the history and the reviews we read. We are very familiar with NYC and have stayed in hotels all over the city for the past 25 years. To start off with, it was a Friday afternoon at peak check in time and they only had TWO agents. The check in line was back to the revolving door. I spoke with a lady who asked if she could step in front of us because she had already stood in that line earlier in the day and just wanted to see if a room was now available! Other hotels take your cell number and call you as soon as your room is ready. Once we got our room, we discovered someone had smoked in it. We were told they would send someone up to sanitize the smell. It never happened the entire weekend. Our second day we were gone all day, came back at 6pm and the room had not been cleaned! There was trash on the lobby floor, trash in the room floor halls and the bathrooms have toothpaste splattered all over the wallpaper around the sink area. Also the carpet had u identified wet spots when walking around in bare feet. It is disgusting. See attached picture of bathroom toothpaste. Would never recommend this hotel, will never stay here again!

We took our kids to NY for their first visit in May. We chose the Park Central for it's location and based on website pictures and reviews. The lobby was lovely and smelled great so we thought we were off to a good start. However the room we were put in was directly in front of the elevators. Not exactly quiet for a family if you have to hear every guest arrive on the floor at all hours of the night! They moved us with little problem and we thought we were good to go. The room was small but typical for NY and generally comfortable. However when we arrived back after sightseeing that night our floor was full of smoke...not cigarette smoke...and not just a waft..,think Cheech and Chong movie. We called to complain and were assured it would be addressed. The next morning at 7:30 a.m. the smoke was still filling the hallway and our room. We had to place a towel at the bottom of our door because our kids were getting high watching cartoons!We called the desk again. We invited the manager to come up to our room to see that we were not exaggerating and that whatever was supposed to be done the night before had not been done or was not enough to stop the problem. She was apologetic but the damage was done to our experience. In our pjs we packed up and went to the lobby. The hotel was fully booked so after about a 45 minute wait, we were transferred to a sister hotel. It was a very unfortunate start to our trip and although we appreciated that a transfer was arranged, the experience means we will not stay at the Park Central on our next trips to NY.

We stayed with our 10-year-old in July, had a great experience. Room was large for Manhattan, esp. at the price point. Our room on 11th floor was clean, updated, and quiet. No complaints at all on accommodations. And the location is perfect for Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, and is well-situated relative to many subway lines. Only complaint is the separate non-waivable $25/day "resort" fee to cover fitness center access, wifi, and local phone. That's just stupid--include the fee in the quoted room price if it is required, make it optional for those who want to use fitness center (NEVER charge separately for wifi), or don't charge it. It's a mockery to separate it from room charge but to require it, does nothing but detract from an otherwise great experience.Still, the good very much outweighs the fee annoyance, and we would definitely stay here again.

This hotel was in a good location, close to Times Square but without the crowds and noise. Customer service was good and the rooms were clean and good size for NY. But, you would think with such a big hotel there would be room service which they did not have.

My husband and I recently stayed in this hotel and it was awesome. We really were central to everything. We walked just about everywhere and the subway station was right there as well. The hotel was very luxurious everyone was nice and everything was very clean. The only complaint I had was the little store was super expensive, but that's New York for you. Would highly recommend.

This hotel is very nice with a wonderful, helpful staff. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were sparkling but had a shower only, which was fine but I know some people prefer tubs. The location was great for Central Park and Times Square. There are subway stops nearby. I would definitely stay here again. There is a $25 room automatic room charge for wi-fi and luggage storage-my only complaint.

Unbeatable location, lots of restaurants around the hotel, close to Times Square, and right next to subway station.Good price. It's considerable cheap with a place in this location. Not very quiet at night probably because I was on 5th floor only. Comfy bed and tidy.

Even if the price is a bit high, rooms are nice and well equipped. Staff is professional and efficient. The best about this hotel is its location near Central Park, in front of Carnegie Hall and 10-15 minutes walk from Time Square !

The hotel was great, we received a complementary upgrade as it was our anniversary so we had a higher floor. The room was clean and light, and overall we enjoyed our stay. However we also stayed in another hotel whilst in New York which felt much more personal and we felt much more welcomed by the staff. So perhaps this is something for Park Central to work on.

Great hotel and perfect location - just a few blocks from Central Park and also very near Times Square but far enough away from the chaos of it all. Never used any of the facilities in the hotel as we were in such a good location we wanted to explore for meals etc although the bar was very nice and does great cocktails! Only negative was we couldn't guarantee a late check out until our departure date and when we checked that morning it was not available. We had to Check out at 1pm and our flight was not till 10pm. They did keep our bags secure which was a great help and next time we would just be prepared and book an extra night to ensure we could keep the room. Great location and all you could want from a New York hotel, would definitely stay here again on our next visit and would recommend!

Excellent location in mid town Manhattan. Lovely comfortable room with lounge and double shower bathroom. Slept well and was not disturbed. Internet frustratingly intermittent. No breakfast included, but would recommend the nearby Cafe Europa.

This hotel is in a great location! The people were very friendly, especially Joe & the other doormen & bellmen. Our corner room with 2 queen beds was very nice & the bathroom was great. It was sometimes a problem getting an elevator. There seemed to be only 2 working. My only complaint was that there wasn't one stitch of literature in the room about the hotel, it's facilities & its amenities. I would've liked to see a folder with a "Welcome" as well as info on the gym, extensions to dial for help (ie housekeeping, maintenance, etc ). I tried calling the front desk several times & could never get a live person to answer. That part was a little frustrating however when I did connect with someone they were always very polite & helpful.

Rooms were decent size and the price was fair. Beds were clean and comfortable and the bathroom provided plenty of space. Bar was good downstairs and you walk out the front door to Starbuck's and Carnegie Deli.

We had an excellent room on the fourth floor with a window and two double beds, quite a luxury in NYC! The rooms, hallways and lobby were clean and modern. Loved the parking included rate you can book with the hotel website. Staff was very friendly and helpful with luggage storage, valet services, etc. Rooms were very quiet as well. Easy walking to Times Square, Broadway shows, Radio City and more! We would stay here again.

A good choice for doing business and tourist activities in the city. Great location in the middle of the city. The rooms are decent size; I've stayed here at least 4 times over the past year and services are very consistent. This is not a dream hotel and makes all the magic but you could not go wrong with staying here. If you are sensitive to the noise like I am, ask for a room facing the courtyard (no view, but you will not hear a thing from the street)

I was 7 days in NY for work and I had a great experience. Very good location close to Central Park and subway station. Even a big hotel, the rooms were very quiet, nice modern decoration and staff was very friendly. WIFI was working very good and I will definately come back.

Park Central is a great choice. Room was generously sized for NYC. Our two Queen room had a closet between the beds which was really nice to have since we were a couple with two children. Very clean, good service, comfy beds and great hotel bar. Great location just off Central Park and a few blocks north of Times Square and Broadway theatres. Love the Tisserie next door in the morning. Concierge was great about getting show tickets. Lots of close by subway stops too.

We are a very well traveled family and we certainly know our way around hotels. We rarely complain...usually it all evens out. However NOT in the case of THIS hotel.First surprise. We get get there and there is a $25 upcharge per room per night. We already paid in full via expedia at their listed rate. The fee is not optional. They say it is for wifi and premium fitness room. I've never had a hotel upcharge at check-in. Ever. It's just a money grab. By the easy, the fitness room is certainly nothing special. Second surprise. We went with valet because we needed the use of our vehicle. Now we find out (after the fact) that there is NO in/out privileges and the hotel is charging $60 EACH AND EVERY TIME WE NEEDED OUR CAR. We were never told anything about this cost orr lack of in out until the 3rd use of the car.There are plenty of great places to stay in New York. This is NOT one of them.

Upon checking in the hotel seemed to be ok. It was not what I was expecting for a high priced NYC hotel. Our room was not ready (we were there before the posted check-in time) which I didn't expect it to be ready. I left my bag with the bellman and went on my way. When I returned at 6pm and got into my room I was disappointed to say the least at the tattered condition of the room. The walls had holes in them where there clearly had been screws at some point. The wallpaper in the bathroom was dirty. The bathroom floor had not been cleaned well. The baseboards in the rooms were chipped in many places and well worn in others. The handles on the furniture were falling off. The space between the end of the bed and the desk was so close that I could barley fit between the chair and the bed. I am not a large person either. The beds, however, were very comfortable and the room was in the front of the building and was quiet. This room was mediocre at best. I would not return to this hotel. There are a great many other choices in NYC for the cost of this hotel. The hotel did give us complementary parking once I told them about the condition of our room. Overall, it was fine for 1 night, but I would not choose this hotel again to stay.

This is my 3 rd stay at Park Central and the first hotel I look for when planning a trip to the city. Over the years the hotel has undergone refurbishment, and even the once slow elevators have improved. We had a double room. It was comfortable, but needed better lighting. It was an interior room, so the view was a brick wall, which made the room dark.. The room was clean and the beds were perfect. You have to ask for a refrigerator. We did, and one arrived promptly. We found the staff to be polite and helpful.The best thing? The proximity to the Theatre District without the noise and crowding of Time Square. Hailing a cab is no problem, or one can walk to a subway with ease. The little cafe in the lobby is perfect for coffee and pastries.

I booked this hotel last minute for one night as I had a friend coming to visit and I was staying around the corner in another hotel.The price, considering the incredible location right near Times Square and Central Park, was very reasonable.Staff were extremely friendly, especially Elizabeth in guest relations.Wifi was free, beds were very comfy, bathroom was great. The rooms are quite small, but that's pretty normal for NYC and they are definitely big enough.They have a little coffee shop inside the hotel which is great, and a Starbucks right outside (like every place in NYC!).I would not only stay here again, it will be my first choice!

Park Central is a classy hotel, clean and comfortable, with a great location just a few blocks south of Central Park. Staying there puts you within easy walking distance of the Met Museum of Art, the Museum of Natural History, Moma, and, of course, Central Park. Carnegie Hall is catty-corner from the hotel.Plus there are many nice restaurants in the neighborhood, and Times Square is just a few blocks down there. It's easy. A subway stop is across the street, next to a diner. We enjoyed a room on the 18th floor. In Manhattan, where the street noise never ceases, you want a room on the highest floor possible. Even on the 18th floor you will hear the street -- the constant pizzicato of taxi horns, 4-5 sirens every hour -- but the sounds are somewhat muffled.

Excellent hotel, clean, good service, friendly staff, good WiFi, I stayed for a week and didn´t miss home, believe me! Great location also, everything is in a walking distance. The store at the lobby is not big, but you can have a nice cupcake and coffee.

This was my 3rd time at this hotel. The room is very good, very comfortable and clean.Good beds, sheets and towels. Unfortunatelly there is no refrigerator in the room. the bathroom is OK. Location is perfect, a lot of stores, restaurants and attractions around. The hotel has 2 problems: the internet (horrible) and the elevators, in some hours of the day you have to be very patience...and wait for a long time.

I stayed here with my husband and 11 year old son during the half term break for some sightseeing. We stayed at Park Central for 4 nights as my husband stayed here on business several years ago. However there have been a few changes and a refurbishment since then. We had a slow and slightly curt check in experience but we were not too bothered as we were jetlagged. The lifts are not adequate for such a large hotel as there are only 2 and they are very slow. The room was clean and had sufficient facilities for our needs but we felt it was a little cramped for a long stay for 3 people. The room overlooked the road at the front of the hotel but due to it being set back slightly, it also overlooked a flat roof and we could see into other guests rooms! However, we weren't there much as we had so much to fit into our days that we were only there to get iur heads down! We didn't eat at the hotel only because theres so many places to sample nearby! You are only 10min walk from the park or times square and about 5mins to the local subway station. There are shops and delis all around you and you will have no problems with taxis as they obviously pull up outside constantly! For these reasons, Park Central is perfectly located.

Staff not overly friendly or helpful. Check-in line was super long but there's still no excuse for desk agents not promoting the few activities (wifi, gym) that the hotel has. Bellstaff wasn't much more help. The housekeepers, on the other hand, were very friendly and helpful.Room was well decorated and clean but had a musty smell that just never went away, and was worse in the bathroom. Bed was uncomfortable for me (the sheets wouldn't stay put) but my wife loved it. Bathroom was clean and very nice (love the lighting) but again, the smell was difficult to bear.It's a pretty basic hotel. There's no restaurant, just the lobby shop. Granted it's in NYC and there's at least 12 restaurants within 150ft but it's misleading because a sign right in front of the hotel promotes the restaurant that apparently doesn't exist.I don't particularly like this part of town but if you're a tourist, it's a great spot since it's very close to Times Square, Broadway theaters and 5th Avenue sights and shopping, plus there's a fairly central subway right at the corner.

Traveled 3 nights for a business meeting and took the family with me. Great location, just a couple of blocks away from Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square, etc. They charge an additional 25 USD + taxes per night, but it gives complementary WiFi for 3 days in return. Staff was very kind.

Fabulous hotel with wonderful staff who could not do enough for us! The location is perfect just a 2 minute walk from both Time Square and Central Park. The door man was brilliant and helped us out with anything we wanted. Felt very safe in the area and as it was just two of us (mum and daughter) it was very important.

We stayed here for Xmas/New Year week and found it fantastic. I booked Park Central because of it being so close to Times Square for New Year's Eve. Well how perfect it was! About a 8min walk down to Times Square and about 4min walk up to Central Park also there is a subway station just around the corner. The room was a bit small but I believe they are all pretty much like that in NY. Room was modern and clean and tidy. Check in was a breeze and nothing was a problem and being crazy Xmas week staff were very helpful. Didn't eat there so I am not able to comment on that but there is a small store that stocks basics for you to purchase. There are plenty of Walgreens or CVS stores around for supplies. On NYE I had booked a different room for the night which had a view straight down to Times Square to watch the ball drop, so after spending sometime with thousands of people we could enjoy the warmth and view from our room. We did have to check out of our 1st room but the hotel kept our bags for us and then we spent the day out and come back and we could check into the new room early. Security around the hotel was tight NYE and you had to show your room key when entering the hotel which was comforting to know. I would definitely recommend this hotel for its location and value for money.

To kick off our honeymoon we headed to the Big Apple. Park Central was our hotel our choice, to which we were extremely happy with. Location of the hotel is most definitely it's key selling point. 5 - 10 min in one direction from Time Square and in the other direction, Central Park. We couldn't have chosen a better base for ourselves to explore the craziest of the city. Room was great and up to standards expected, bathroom is probably only criticism of being rather small - but then again anticipated this. Hotel was also extremely easy to get to from JFK with a number of subway stations in close proximity. If your wanting a base to explore the big Apple for a good couple days, Park Central is a ideal!!

Good: Good location. Bad: Noisy: the building is very old so the window is not good at separating the noise. I lived on the 14th floor but I felt like I slept on the street. I end up asking the hotel for ear plug.Amentities: The room is quite small but I think it is reasonable as it is in the most centre area of Manhattan but the room does not come with a fridge and coffee maker. Service: From the very start of our checking, as we stayed at the hotel for four night and we have our own vehicle so I chose the package with the $10 valet parking. the first night we arrive, there is nobody at the front to take the car, as I have to enter into the hotel to find somebody to take our car and no body come to help us with our luggage, the front desk lady have absolute no smile when checked us in. New York really does not need a car so we only took the car once to send my friend back home and this is the only one time that I bring my vehicle out and the process is very troublesome. We have to line up at the front desk to get a stamp on the valet ticket before they call anybody to get our vehicle. they don't have a separate spot for valet parking. After they call, I was told to wait up to 30 minutes to get my vehicle. After around 30 minutes I go outside and I saw my car so I give the ticket to the guy and ask for my car key, then he tell me he don't know about where the car key is, then he ask to ask the front desk, the front desk lady was talking happily with her worker and when I approach her, she ask me what I want? I say I want my car key, she gives me a horrible look and ask me back saying why not ask the people at the outside? I said they told me to come in. Then she left to find somebody and another guy come and told me the guy who have my car key is elsewhere doing something else and we have to wait till he come back. It took us around 45 minutes to get our vehicle and I am glad I only did that once. Deco: the hotel use a very weird sense of decoration in the hotel in my opinion only. Instead of making the hotel feel cozy, they chose to out a scary looking face painting in our washroom. The picture really made me uncomfortable so I called the housekeeper in the morning to take the picture off the wall and they very nicely said they will do it. But at the end of the day, the picture is still there. so I called again and when they come, they told me the picture is locked and only the daytime super intendant have the key. Then I complaint to them saying I called in the morning so it is not my fault if you guys does not have the key to remove the paint. They just told me the paint could not be removed anyway. If so, why not tell me at the beginning? In conclusion, the price of hotel might look decent in the city center of New York and the hotel is supposed to be four star, that's why I chose the hotel. But the truth is, it is not worth the money if you are thinking this is a four star hotel because after I lived at there, I know this is not a four star hotel. And I will not go back again.

Rooms were average, a little worn. Amenities were basic. Staff was very helpful and professional. Subway access was walking distance. Easily accessed Newark by Subway to Hotel Door. Excellent french cafe next door, a must try!!!

We had a corner room on the 8th floor. The mattress was worn out. The pillows were flat. The A/C didnt work well (blew semi cool air) and we complained. They sent a repair guy who gave us attitude and never actually made it any better. So every night was HOT. Terrible for the price. Concierge was below average. The only good thing about the hotel was its location 2 blocks from Central Park, a couple of blocks from Time Square, etc. WIFI was slooow. The bar rarely had a bartender in it. No food. I would not stay there again.

This hotel is located in Midtown right next to Carnegie deli and Carnegie Hall. This is a big plus if you're looking to do anything in midtown. Location is the biggest selling point of this hotel for me. The room was very well decorated and clean-spacious enough by New York standards. The staff was not the most friendly, and there is no available room service or place to eat without leaving the hotel. I ordered grubhub and was told to come downstairs to get it, no one was willing to walk it up, this was unlike any other hotel I've stayed in. Those were the biggest drawbacks I found. There is a little bodega-ish stop downstairs but it closes early and only offers beverages, chips and such. This is not a restaurant. There is, however, a beautiful bar if you're interested in grabbing a drink.

We reserved a corner suite and were given a regular room. The hotel only offered to wave their daily service fee which is half of the amount we paid between the cost of a regular room and he cost of the premium room we reserved. Thumbs way down this far.

This hotel was very nice and exceptionally clean. The staff was very helpful and professional. One of the best parts was its close proximity to several subway stations. My only real complaint is with the lighting in the room. I have never, until this trip, even noticed or considered the lighting in a hotel room. The lighting in this room was particularly bad. The location of the lights made it very hard for my wife to do her makeup and hair and for me to read maps and iron clothes.All in all I would stay here again.

The hotel was clean and within walking distance to Central Park and Time Square. Unfortunately when my husband asked at the front desk if I had checked in, he wasn't greeted warmly. He said it was more of a rude encounter. I doubt we will be staying here again.

The staff was mostly helpful. However, the doorman, David Vargus, was the most courteous,friendly and helpful of all. No matter the rush he always went out of his way. My mother needed extra assistance and he was always gracious to help meet her needs. I was surprised at the lack of restaurants or room service and the small vanity/shower for a 4 star hotel. The concierge were mostly helpful but a couple of them were kind of rude to my mother after making her wait well past the posted return time. It is however a great locaction and the check in/check out was extremely easy and fast. I would again say the best thing about the hotel was the doorman David.

I travel to Manhattan for work every other week, and this is my go-to hotel in the Times Square area. For the area, the rooms are spacious and always clean. The decor in the rooms and bathrooms is modern and updated. The rooms are quiet, a rarity in Manhattan's hotels in this price range. Even better, they have a pretty good gym, unheard of in mid-priced Manhattan hotels. Service is basic, but good. I've never had to wait in line more than a moment to check in or out. My only complaint would be that there aren't really enough elevators for a hotel of this size, and you can spend some time waiting for the elevator. If you're a business traveler, and looking for a quiet, solid hotel with a good comfortable room, not too expensive, I totally recommend this place. I have tried most of the big hotels in the area, and this is definitely my favorite in the price range.After probably a dozen three night stays in this hotel, I am a happy customer.

Had some worries after reading reviews on here but I am very glad I didn't cancel because of these!Easy fast check-in, up to 9th floor room. Much bigger than I had expected and spotlessly clean and modern. We had an external view at the side looking onto an office building and Carnegie Hall. The beds were so comfortable and the shower was amazing too.The hotel even sent up balloons and chocolates for my birthday. We found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful. Nancy in the hotel bar was particularly friendly and remembered us each day when we popped in. The facilities fee was clearly stated when we booked and again directly from the hotel via email after booking and before arrival so I'm not sure how it comes as a surprise to people. Lastly we were very happy with the location and after lots of walks, we were extremely pleased we had chosen the Park Central hotel to stay.I would definitely recommend and if we ever visit New York again, it would be our first choice. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

I have never written a bad review in my life. I am beyond disappointed in this hotel and I will keep this review as short as possible. I booked a room with a King bed (for me, my husband and my infant son) upon I arrival I was given a room with two very small double beds- not a huge deal. I went to the desk and explained I wanted a king bed for us so they said "Were sorry but we have nothing and are overbooked. Come back tomorrow after 3pm and we will see what we can do" Tomorrow came and my husband left for work, I walked around the city. When my husband came back- the hotel took it upon themselves to move everything out of our room without our knowledge. The hotel had moved our belongings as well as given the room to someone else. BIG PROBLEM for a list a reasons!1. Our keys still worked giving us access to our/someone else's room2. I had food for my infant in an ice bowl which was apparently thrown away- Moms out there Im sure you can understand why this is upsetting. 3. My husbands Oliver Peoples Sunglasses, iPad and laptop went missing- the glasses were returned however the other items are still missing 1 month later! I wrote to Nicholas Wilson- the hotel manager 10X now. Same ridiculous responses over and over!!! "Krystie I am out of the office today and will be in contact tomorrow""I have forwarded this to insurance and they be in touch" NOBODY HAS CALLED ME BACK. NOBODY HAS FOUND MY THINGS. THIS HOTEL IS GARBAGE- DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME WHEN THERE ARE 1,000'S OF OTHER PLACES TO STAY.

Great location but no restaurant, no room service and no mini bar. It could be a great hotel !4 star hotel with no food how is that possible !The room are clean. Staff at the entrance, checking is not at all friendly or smily.2nd time in this hotel but i will go somewhere else next time.

My sister and I traveled to NYC this past weekend to catch Micky Dolenz at 54 Below and chose to stay at this great hotel. I must admit, I had some concerns as I read through the other reviews posted. I have to say we did not have EVEN ONE of the experiences others noted.Let me tell you about this hotel. The lobby is gorgeous. We were met by two men who directed us to the front desk where at least three ladies were working diligently with the customers checking in. This was a very busy Friday afternoon, however we had no wait time.We checked in, headed to our room and were met with a huge comfy bed (that we hated to get out of), a large tv, comfy chair all very clean and fresh. The bathroom was spotless and everything was nicely arranged. For those before us who complained the fan did not work in the bath, there are two wall switches. One for the wonderful bright light in the shower/tub area and one for the vanity.We had an inside room, not facing the street, but were never bothered by any noise and never had to wait for an elevator.The internet was the only challenge we had, but we soon discovered it took patience and perseverance to get our Amazon Fire TV Stick working.There is a lovely place for snacks in the lobby and a few steps from the front door are Starbucks, Premier Deli and a Subway Sandwich shop,along with other restaurants.Our completed bill was placed gently under the door for check out, leaving us to only gather our luggage and catch a cab.The maid service did knock gently on our door to check to see if we needed service, however they always announced very prominently "Housekeeping" and were completely polite when we stated we only needed more towels. They couldn't do enough.Over all, this was a wonderful experience and my sister and I are already planning a trip in the Fall. I only hope they have room for us then!

Convenient location just a few blocks from Central Park, 5th Avenue, and Madison Avenue. Easy walk to Times Square. Room was very comfortable but had to have A/C turned to lowest setting and still took some time to get cool. Service is absent particularly bell services. Too long a wait to check bags and pick up bags. Not sure what the $25 facility fee charge is for. Would stay again if it were the best price in the area.

I enjoyed the working lounge and the comfort/quality of the rooms beds and linens. The staff is responsive to your concerns (they had a wifi outage while I visited). You just can't beat the location! I had difficulty with AT&T cell phone coverage inside the hotel--only texting would work. I recommend this property and would stay again.

BEWARE FACILITY FEES! I am giving one star because of several reasons but one being the staff was not helpful and welcoming as I thought they would be. I called the afternoon prior to my check-in about parking and the woman on the phone (wish I asked her name) had misinformed me about how much valet parking was. This was an issue for me because I was arriving around 1 am from the airport (tired) and if I had known earlier valet parking was $60, I would have done my research ahead of time for a better priced parking garage instead of driving around in circles for parking. I explained my frustration with reception about their staff giving out wrong information and their response was that they have guest response services through the phone in Vegas and they must have given out wrong information and apologized.I figured I would just let the parking situation go until I learned that the hotel charges $25 per day for facilities fees(wifi, gym, storage) from my friend who checked in our room before me. The receptionist explained that the charges was listed when I made the reservation on orbitz but of course it was listed on the side very small so I did not see this. All I saw was that we were going to receive free wifi which obviously I learned later that it's not free! I explained that I haven't been to a hotel that doesn't just add that fee to the reservation price or allow the guest to pay it separately if they wanted to use these services. The receptionist explained to me that a lot of hotels around do this now and that was that. Beware of these fees when comparing prices for hotel! Obviously, I did not get the better deal that I thought I did! Also, my friend explained to me because his name was not listed on the reservation that the woman who checked him in was rude to him and gave him a hard time. After I called to have his name out on the reservation, my friend told me that her whole attitude changed towards him. This hotel does have a really good location and the rooms were nice and clean. Location is a couple blocks up from Times Square and couple blocks from Central Park. Subway is also close.

Old hotel, all the carpets look dirty, just 2 elevators working for the hole hotel, small room, clean services cars left at the hallways.. Ice machines didn't work..no security.. We saw a couple from the streets sleeping in the hallway... They charge a mandatory fee at check in for the maintaining... Not good!!

June 5, 2015 Weekend4-star hotel (New York Standard)Got to Hotel around 2:30PM, Check-in within 7 minutes and get free room upgrade on 7th floorRoom is cleaned daily.Very good location for broadway shows, time-square, central park.Subway Station (Yellow lines N-Q-R) is next to the hotel can take you everywhere in Manhattan.Elizabeth Cacovic is wonderful relation manager. She assisted to solve wifi problem in late evening when IT technician was not availableTips: check mobile website on any smart-phone before booking :)

Very good position,three blocks from Central Park and 7 from Times Square,after refurbishment hall is much nicer and rooms have a better furniture.A good hotel at a good price with professional personnel and everybody ready to solve any kind of problems.If you go to NY,try staying there....you won't be disappointed

The location was superb for our needs, walk out the front door of hotel, turn left and you're in Central Park in a few short blocks, turn right and a few more blocks you're heading toward the center of Times Square. We signed up for the onsite Central Market continental breakfast package the hotel offered and with four teens and one tween between my two sisters and myself, it made it simple to keep everyone fed well enough to embark quickly in the a.m.'s to do all the fabulous sightseeing that the city has to offer. Plus decent diners and delis also within steps for ease of quick bites. Hotel was shiny bright and clean, rooms were bigger than expected for downtown Manhattan, we had two Queen-size, not just double-size, beds! Check-in and check-outs were easy-peasy and quick, and the staff very friendly and accommodating. While the view from our 5th floor rooms was anything but utilitarian (think we were looking down onto some kind of heating or air conditioning units) we could still see brownstones above them and it was blessedly quiet for sleeping. A number of previous reviews I read recommended getting a room high above the madding crowd for noise level reductions and with the opposite situation, we couldn't have been more pleased. I mean, yes a view of Central Park or some other famous landmark would certainly have been lovely, but we weren't there to see the view from the rooms, we were there to explore! Would stay here again in a "New York Minute".

Everyone was very friendly and helpful maybe one of my best experiences at any hotel . There package deals are great especially if you need to park a car . The only issue we had was the air conditioning was not functioning as well as we would like it to .

My first experience in a New York City hotel and it was very positive. In addition to being centrally located to key sites, my room was clean, modern, comfortable and well equipped except no refrigerator. All I had to do was request it and refrigerator was sent to my room at no cost. Service overall was impeccable. Housekeeper Marissa was particularly friendly and efficient. Had wifi problem in entire hotel for a short time but it was sorted out. I did miss not having dining in the hotel but there were lots of very nice restaurants nearby (try Rosy O'Gradys for Irish flair). Security was reassuring but not overbearing.

We stopped here 1st July to the 7th July 2015. My partner chose the hotel on the location and reviews.The location is brilliant. 2 mins from Central Park, 5 from the Rockerfella and 7 minutes to Times Square. Despite being in such a good location it never seemed too crowded or busy outside the hotel. There are some good diners, cafes and bars in the local area. There is a CVS nearby where we went to get snacks and beer from for when we were getting ready or at the end of the night.Some reviews we read criticised the check in staff but our check in was excellent. The lady that dealt with us was very helpful and friendly. I regret we didn't get her name as I would have liked to have let management know how impressed we were.Our room was on the 10th floor with a view of the courtyard. Not a good view but we didn't travel all the way to New York to sit in a room and look out of a window so we weren't bothered. The room was quiet, spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff we encountered in the corridors and lobby all seemed very friendly and pleasant.We were really pleased with the hotel and would definitely stop again.Highly recommended, thank you for helping to make our visit to New York so amazing.

We recently stayed at the Park Central in New York City. This is our 3rd time in New York and we absolutely fell in love with this hotel. I always say that a New York Hotel really must have three things, great location, clean, with a great bed. This place met all of those criteria and more. A wonderfully modern room, beautiful bed, great bathroom, and very very clean. The best part was the location, just a couple blocks from Central Park, 10 minute walk from Times Square, just a couple blocks from 5th Ave shopping, Theatre District on the doorstep, and Carnegie Hall across the street...literally. You will not go wrong with this hotel.

First class hotel in a prime location with easy access to shops, restaurants, underground and Times Square is 5 minutes walk. Hotel staff were extremely friendly and accommodating and the hotel is highly modern, with amazingly comfortable beds (which is needed if travelling across different time zones) and free wifi. There is a gymnasium but we didn't have time to use it. The bar area was very well decorated and a popular meeting area.

The room and public areas are clean, and furnished in a sleek modern design with comfortable touches. For my purposes this place was almost perfect. But there are a few details that keep this from being a Very Good or Excellent property.The while the bathroom is a bit cramped, it's great for a solo traveler. Two people trying to get ready would have issues.The elevators are as small as people say there are. I mean, I've been in smaller -- mainly in European hotels -- but it's pretty small and stuffy. More than once I just waited some more for another elevator because 6-8 people filled the elevator.There are two types of people in the world. Those who like tilty desk chairs and those who don't. I don't so it really threw me -- sometimes almost literally. It probably has some sort of locking mechanism somewhere to prevent it from tilting. I couldn't find it.The wifi internet access was very inconsistent, mostly slow, and the signal strength was not always very strong. Hallway noise was pronounced and my room apparently was next to the elevator shafts because I heard a muffled quiet rumble all the time, but it was on the wall opposite the bed so it was tolerable.One thing that I knew about but didn't think I would miss so much is that they do not have a restaurant or room service. The bar is nice, but the space could use at least some tapas. Even the HGI I stayed at in Times Square area a few years ago had room service.

This locations is located in the heart of New York city. It is a soothing relief from the car and human traffic of Manhattan. There are many attractions that are noted on a map that is available at several kiosk locations, depending on where you enter the park from. Do not confuse the kiosks that sell detailed maps with the kiosks that offer free maps that have all the detail you need and are free. The zoo is a main attraction but there are plenty of other attractions. For example, there is a castle, an Alice in Wonderland statue, a playground with rides..... Picture opportunities, there are numerous of. Parking in the area could cost you anywhere from 36 to 55. Look online for parking locations and some of those locations offer coupons. Most locations will provide a 36 USD fee if you park at their location by 11:00 a.m. and you can park there for most of the day. Be careful with parking. Take your time and do your research as there are many gougers out there. Enjoy.

We hadn't been back to the Park Central Hotel for some 15 years and were most pleasantly surprised at the changes that we found. The lobby has been completely and attractively redone, the front desk folks were more than friendly and helpful, and the rooms, while not spacious, are certainly nicely furnished and quiet with very comfortable beds. Would highly recommend taking them up on their offer for a complimentary coffee maker and/or refrigerator, if that works for you; they certainly did for us. And lastly, in the Manhattan world of overpriced everything, the price was reasonable.

Nice hotel. Friendly staff. Nice store in the hotel to buy snacks and quick breakfast items. Rooms are nicely furnished. You have to stay on the top floors to really see any of the city. Our room was not on the street side so it was nice and quiet.

Recently went to NYCWas not certain where to stay Wanted safety and location to avoid taxi costsWe choose your hotel for location even though we really didn't know what to expect and no idea of really our locationWe were pleasantly surprisedLocation was superb food,time square,5th ave,Central Park and Starbucks right next door.Hotel was cleanNoise was to a minimumThe inside view was at first daunting however it was great given you want quiet come nightGreat placeOnly complaint elevators a little slowThat's my only complaint bed was fantastic Simmons beauty rest and the pillows ..out went the lights when your head sunk into thoseDefinitely one of my top choices when we returnFantastic cityMIKE...SHEWAN

We stayed here for a long weekend, and found several things.They have done a very good remodel, and while there is no longer a restaurant lobby, there is a small shop where breakfast and lunch, and snack items are available, all much more rapid than a sit down place.the rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet--- very important in the city that never sleeps.The staff was uniformly pleasant and attentive.It is a great location, across from Carnegie Hall and very close to all the Broadway attractions, not to speak of Central Park area.We did miss a coffee machine in the room.

The hotel is in a great location. It is clean and the staff is wonderful. The only issue we had was poor WIFI but since we were on vacation it did not matter. Emmanuel was kind enough to credit the charges. He's terrific BTW. If you are going to NYC for work and want to stay at Park Central, I recommend you call and make sure the WIFI is working. Other than this, our stay was excellent.

visited for 4th of July holiday and this hotel was PERFECT location!!! just a few blocks from times square yet far enough away to be quiet to sleep (and beds were very comfortable). Also close to subway, central park and bus tour routes. Room was VERY clean!!! Room size was small if comparing to small city or rural resort hotels but great space for the Big Apple!!! overnight parking rate special made the overall price a great value as well. Family trip with two teenage daughters and we all loved this hotel !!!

Great and friendly hotel in the greatest city in the world. Room is very clean and equipped with all what is necessary, the bed was comfortable. Friendly staff with a warm smile. The FREE Breakfast is better than most of the hotels in NYC. We are totally impressed with the amenities, service, location and value of this establishment.

i needed to be up around 60th street at the south end of central park on business. this is what you come to expect of a big name hotel in nyc. big, nice rooms.free internet. friendly staff. gym. yes, there is a facility fee. everywhere i go there is a facility fee now. i was very happy here and would certainly go back. go on overto 8th and 9th avenues for endless restaurant choices. on the 18th floor it wasvery quiet somehow and i slept well. i like this place.

The hotel location was perfect for our needs. We usually stay on the eastside but this was so incredibly convenient! Room was an average size and bathroom was rather small with very little space for placing your personal belongings when getting ready. It did not dampen our experience however since lack of storage was compensated with cleanliness. My main disappointment stemmed from the original booking process: having paid for a prepay option, I was not able to change the reservation after only 5 minutes of having paid in full to revise to the $10.00 rate for overnight parking as advertised on their website. I was not asking to take the prepay away simply revise that option somewhat. I manage room reservations for the # 1 Family Resort in PA and I know that we would have offered some adjustments.

Our room was perfect for us. We slept well, easy to adjust temperature. Noisy AC, but it could be turned off.VERY noisy reception, it was unpleasant to stay there, both because of the noise and the very low temperature.Unstable internet or wifi connection. When I called to ask the Concierge, she claimed that she could not help us. It was also down the next day.It was unstable/not working on 2,5 of 6 days.We also had an incident when we got back late at night, and the door was open to our room after the room was cleaned. Not good.

Conveniently located in the heart of New York.Good service rooms are clean reception is efficient and well organized.Price is on the high side by you are in NY downtown close to many attractions and to all aightseeng buses.

The hotel location is excellent, rooms are a good size, bed is super comfortable. The downside is there are insufficient elevators for the size of the hotel. The tower I stayed in had 4 elevators but only 2 tiny elevators were available to guests which meant long waits to get up and down. Window panes do not keep out street sounds even though I was on the 8th floor and there are no privacy sheers so people from the office block over the street look right into your room. I could hear my neighbours conversations while sitting in my room. here are many things that could be fixed e.g. shower curtains too short to prevent water getting on the floor, broken TV remote, missing soap dish, wall sockets you can't use.

The hotel is really very good and really well located. Rooms as large and updated. HUGE TV (but who needs a tv in NY), extremely clean, well taken care off. Bathroom is very nice, although some fixtures need fixing (nothing major). The place is also abotu location...great location. Two blocks from Central Park, few blocks from Central Square and many other attractions, including the Moma, American Museum of Natural History...and so on. Just across the Carnegie Hall!OK, enough compliments. Watch for two things (or be aware of). 1. They charge and extra of 25 dollars a day in a fee they call "facility use". I don't think that this is fair as they simply don't tell anyone about that. I often travel to the States and this is the first time this happens. 2. The elevators, although brand new and fast, are very small and ONLY 4 for a huge tower with many rooms at each floor. You may have to wait for two or three "trips" before being able to reach your room.But staff is friendly, locations fantastic, price is right! I do recommend.

The stay at Park central has compelled me to leave a review for the hotel.....except the location the hotel has all negatives and weird rules.....1 A compulsory charge of $ 28 per night for gym, wifi access and cloak room whether you use it or not. 2 restrooms at the lobby work with room keys...... Which means the hotel does not have a washroom in lobby invade you have not checked in or you have checked out. Interestingly the elevators don't require key for access3 There is no room service.4 air conditioning was not up to mark. 5 The staff around was too cold. 6 room had a weird shape , it was compartmentalised with a huge 6x6 feet shaft in between the two beds, which means you cannot even talk to the other person. And the TV was placed in front of just one bed. 7 the hotel charges higher rates for higher floors, although it is surrounded by higher buildings around it. When it cannot offer a better view it should not be charging extra, but then it's PARK CENTRAL. Would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

The Park Central provided the perfect home base for ourselves and our two kids (aged 7 and 9). Located just a few blocks south of Central Park and a few blocks north of Times Square and Broadway, we were close to everything we wanted to do (or to transportation to get around). There's a great diner across the street for breakfast, a Starbucks right in the building, and lots of other restaurant choices in the area. Note that there is not a restaurant in the hotel, nor is there room service available. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly, the room was clean and not crowded at all (which is often the case of New York City hotel rooms!), and the beds were super comfortable! Our only complaint was that the shower curtain was too short and water would get on the floor. The hotel lobby and premises were beautiful as well. We were on a lower floor (9th) and the view was still nice from here, but you do have options to upgrade to a higher floor. Only other issue we ran into was waiting way too long (50 minutes) for a bell hop to come and take our bags down when checking out. We finally gave up and managed to take everything down ourselves. It was a very busy time of day to be leaving, though, as we had asked for a late check-out so would have been leaving when many were arriving. Overall, we had a phenomenal experience and will absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Had a great stay at the Park Central. Hotel is very close to Times Square and Central Park. Hotel was clean and the rooms were large enough to accommodate 2 tall teenage boys, my husband and myself. Would definitely stay here again.

Cant really fault the hotel at all. We had two rooms which were spotlessly cleaned everyday. Great bathrooms with toiletries. The boys used the gym a few times. Thought the smell in reception was fresh, nice bar area although prices a bit steep (as expected). Asked for a coffee machine and it was in the room when we arrived and just asked for refills s and when needed. Would stay there again.

Travelled with my wife & baby son of 13 mths to NY for a few days. My wife booked this hotel 2 mths in advance & had well informed the hotel of our little boy. There was a restaurant, menu, pictures etc all advertised so why even ask. Well what she did ask was would there be milk available for us to give him when we got there, even if we were late due to the time of our flight - "but of course", the sign was still on the exterior wall, right side of the entrance automatic door. RESTAURANT, bla, bla bla, no restaurant. In fact as we checked in the check in clerk informed us that the restaurant had been closed over 3 months....so where were we to get water let alone milk, "oh there's a store near by that will have it"... Are you joking???. Not the guys fault & don't shoot the messenger & all that but come on. Right well nothing we could do only get up to our room (which he upgraded us to a higher floor, "better view" of the building next door) & then run to this nearest store for milk.... Look the way I see it, a simple email would have warned us well in advance so we could grab something & even for ourselves. Every parent will always try & look after their baby 1st then themselves but we couldn't do either there. The following day again we had to go to a different local restaurant for breakfast, 7:45a.m not ideal at all. There is a tiny shop selling pre wrapped sandwiches etc there in the lobby, if that's your thing but this is more the style of a hostel, to be honest my description of this to all after is A Glorified Hostel.... In our haste to leave my wife forgot to bring two dress pants, pressed, that we're hanging up in the wardrobe. In fairness she got them back, all be it that that were rolled, like as if you crumbled a paper bag & put into a plastic bag. When the concierge handed them back to her he even apologized to their condition, but what could he do - good bye & never see you again. Will we go back, not a hope, will we ever recommend this place, not a hope, maybe for the Fancy dressed hostel goers but definitely not for those with children or expecting a slice of bread or glass of water. Oh ya, no water available after the shop closes.

I am writing this review as I am sitting in my room!We stopped by New York after traveling to the east coast for a few events. I've read some poor reviews on various sites but decided to stay at Park Central anyways since the price and location were good. Big mistake! We arrived at the hotel past midnight after a day of poor weather and flight cancellation/delays. We had no problem checking in, just had no positive greeting from the front desk personnel. Our friends had dropped off some bags at the luggage storage for our arrival. It took over 10 mins to get our bags and we were not offered to have the bags brought up to our rooms. The bell person also dropped the small luggage and messager bag several times as he was bring them to us. I had my fingers crossed that our room would not have the nasty smell that other reviewers mentioned. Thank goodness that wasn't an issue. However, the bathroom has obviously not been cleaned!Pros:Good locationDecent sized room for NYC hotelReasonably priced roomCons:Not customer service oriented - no greeting from front desk or bell people, no housekeeping serviceFilthy bathrooms - toothpaste stuck on the sink facet (that I personally cleaned because I simply couldn't stand it), mold under sink and in the shower, hair in the shower, blood on shower certain, some toiletries were emptyTiny elevators - will fit about 6 people comfortably and less than 4 people comfortably with luggage

The hotel seemed very nice, we booked a premium room and was a bit disapointed that premium rooms start on 11th floor and that's the floor we end up on. Was hoping for a room on a higher floor. An issue also occured with the room on the 2nd night of our weekend stay. Water started leaking into the room near the window from the floor above. Probably the air conditioner above. We advised the hotel staff when we noticed it at 8pm, and when we got back at 11pm nothing had yet been done around midnight finally we talked with hotel management and we came to a compromise. I was hoping for a higher level of satisfaction since this was our Wedding aniversary.

Having been living in New York on and off for the past 15 years, I must conclude that this stay at the Park Central was a pleasant, and positive experience, in the sense that the room is huge. The room size is at least 500 sq ft, and the location of the hotel was central to Central Park, and most of the theatre related venues that one would like to visit as a tourist, including Carnegie Hall, which is across the street. The hotel when we visited in February 2015 was newly renovated, but the more disappointing aspect of the hotel is the lack of pool, sauna, or anything of that sort. The bar in the lobby was just opening up from the renovations, and therefore, most of the details of the room was new. The downside of staying within this area is the amount of tourists within the building, but considering how many keys the hotel has, the elevator access was very limiting during our stay. The other disappointment was that with this hotel, you can't expect the Starwood treatment, as they did not even have slippers to offer. Generally speaking, if one would like to access Central park and the sorts, including shopping at Time Warner, the location is great; however, if you're more into the downtown scene, that I am generally more inclined to, this location is still just steps away from the subway. Overall Experience: B+ Location: A

I haven't stayed at the Park Central in years and it was very nice to be back. The rooms are spacious, updated and clean. The front desk staff was very helpful and Iove the location. You can't go wrong with the Park Central. Safe travels!

My girlfriend and I get away each spring to NYC to see shows and always stay in Times Square area. This time picked the Park Central based on ability to use American Express points.Check in was firm at 4:00 and they have a place to store your luggage. The reception was fine - nothing incredibly friendly, but adequate. The room itself was clean, quiet enough and the beds were very comfortable. No noise from other guests and no noise could be heard from the street - big plus. This is definitely a hotel that caters to groups of tourists, as there were quite a few groups staying there when we were there. Bottom line - it was a fine hotel for what we needed, but we really prefer a hotel with a little more character/charm.

Stayed at this hotel for our 25th wedding anniversary , it's in the perfect spot for visiting the sites like Empire State and Central Park , we stayed in classic double room which was very nice although we didn't have a view, they had a great coffee shop in the foyer and reasonably priced but don't go in the bar very expensive,all in all a very good hotel

We stayed here one night and then changed hotels. The room smelled very musty, like mildew. The bathroom door opened into the room so it would block access to the toilet. We got the room with two queen beds, but the room felt cramped and dark and dirty because of the smell. The hallways were dimly lit and one of the elevators were not working when we arrived. We will not be returning to the Park Central.

We stayed here for three nights. I would say that it is a great place to stay because of the location, then the price is a bit lower than hotels just a few block closer to Time Square. Our room had two twin beds, these beds were a lot better than other places we stayed on this trip. The room was clean, had all the things we needed. As it was New York there is no view besides from the street but that was fine. We could walk to Time Square but we were still far enough away that the crowd had thinned out when we got to our hotel so it really wasn't noisy. We could also walk to Central Park from here. Easy exes to the Subway and to the hop on hop of buses. Only reason for not giving it a five star is that there is no breakfast included in the price. That may be the New York style but for me that was a disappointment, every day you had to go out to get breakfast ad they didn't even have a place to sit down to order breakfast in the hotel. There is a cafe or so right next door and a breakfast place across from there.

This newly renovated 4 star hotel provides relatively inexpensive, clean and spacious rooms at very competitive price. It is close to all the attractions and there is good wifi in every room. Ask for the Park N Play special (free parking). Or the $1 breakfast special.

Just wonderful people from Carmello outside to Eve who did my room to Q (Mr Quimby) to my favorite Bartender in NY John at the bar in the hotel. Just excellent people and the rooms are wonderful and always reasonable especially compared to the other hotels in the area. L O V E it.

To celebrate our wedding anniversary we chose New York as our destination of choice. We had an early check in as we arrived early and left our luggage and went to explore. The Hotel staff could not have been more helpful and the service was second to none. The rooms are spacious, light and very clean. The rates are fair for the location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who chooses to travel to NY and is looking for a high level of service and accommodation.

Almost any trip to NYC will have its stressors, location and convenience should not be one of them, and Park Central fits the bill. Rooms are smaller but clean. If you want accommodations with a view be sure to specifically request it. Many extras are available for a fee, like Faster WIFI. Honestly, I am in the room to shower and sleep, I really just need soft pillows and a quiet room. So close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Broadway Shows, Carnegie Hall, Central Park, Columbus Circle, The Carnegie Deli, etc. Subway is one block outside front door, ready to take you anywhere. Need a taxi, no problem. Quick Breakfast fix in lobby if needed. I generally walk most places or cab if needed. Plenty of grocery shops, deli's and coffee just outside front door. Staff is helpful and pleasant.

There were a few positives but much more negatives to speak about. I will start with the positives. The hotel is so close to so many wonderful New York City sites, especially Central Park, Columbus Circle and just a host of Restaurants and the Theatre District. I also had a wonderful gentleman who checked me in and he made me feel extremely welcomed. I had a Premier King room which was a decent size with an average side view. Now the negatives.. Waiting for check-in was long and tedious, before I actually was seen by the wonderful gentleman that I just spoke about. It was 4 pm and the line was extremely long because there was just one person checking people in. I'm not sure if there was a malfunction with the computers but there seemed to be at least 5 other people staring and hitting buttons on the computer, but no one was assisting the one gentleman checking everyone in. The next negative was that there were (no exaggeration) at least 200 teenagers, screaming and running in, out and around the hotel lobby. While they were doing this, a staff member from the hotel decided to compete with the noise by yelling and clapping his hands telling the teenagers that they couldn't run in the lobby. The noise level was unnerving and along with the wait for check-in....Yuck!!! I did ask at check-in if I could get a room far away from the screaming 200 teenagers, which was happily granted to me by the wonderful gentleman that I keep referencing. I finally headed up to my room in what are very small elevators. Upon entering the room, there was an unusual and unpleasant smell to it; like mildew. I walked into the bathroom and the smell was disgusting and overwhelming. The shower curtain reeked of mildew and pure sourness. Normally, I would have asked to have a change of room or at least a change in the shower curtain, but I didn't have time to spare because I lost so much of my preparation time waiting to be checked in. I needed to get ready for the evening and not wait to see if another room was available or if someone could come and change the nasty smelling shower curtain.
