Additionally, the chair and ottoman that were in the room were filthy with stains on them. The whole room was just horrible and I made sure to spend as much time out of it as possible. My cell phone, AT & T service did not work in the hotel so I had to keep going outside to make phone calls, receive phone calls and make and receive texts. This was annoying and inconvenient. Lastly, I was awakened by the noise of someone slipping my bill under my door at 2:00 in the morning; really paper shouldn't make that much noise. For what I paid, I would have expected a much better room and experience. I will not stay here again.

Park Central is a lovely hotel, front of house staff very welcoming and helpful. We were put in room 336 which had a hideous view of a brick wall and air conditioning which kept us awake most of the night. We were staying for 6 nights and could not have put up with this room. We spoke to staff who were very helpful and moved us to a much nicer room the following day. Housekeeping in particular do a great job very friendly thorough and accommodating , but tea and coffee facilities in rooms not available although coffee shop in foyer makes a decent coffee. Park Central is in a great position (opposite Carnegie Hall) ideal for Central Park, Times Square, bus service downtown, and shopping at Lincoln Centre.

I had a good stay in the hotel. It's very well located and clean. I'd recommend the hotel to give details about their facilities fee which they charge you in your bill and you don't even know that you have access to their gym or their free wi-fi. Worth to mention that this fee is a surprise during your check out because they don't mention it during the check-in!

Stayed at this hotel on a trip to New York last week, and had a terrible experience so I felt compelled to write a review that summarises The hotel is well located between Central Park and Times Square - perfect for the hordes of tourists that descended every day. At one point there was at least a hundred school kids running through corridors and crowding the few lifts that service the building. I often had to wait for four different lifts to arrive before I could squeeze in. Then, there was the room... A corporate-looking square (although quite spacious for NY) in prison block-colours of grey, grey and... grey. I had to change room after the first bathroom offered a toilet that refused to flush and an empty tissue box, as well as remnants from the previous occupants all over the floor and a television that refused to switch on.The toiletries were pitiful, and bad quality.The bedding was thin and not in the slightest bit comfortable. Upon complaining about these issues as well as the lack of wifi access, I was spoken to quite condescendingly by the manager who still insisted that I had to pay an absurd 'facilities' fee that covers wifi (which should be free), the gym (also should be free) and luggage storage (most DEFINITELY should be free). At an extra $28 per night, this certainly adds to the end bill, especially when you don't use ANY of these so-called 'extra facilities'. I moved room to one that was smaller and equally depressing, but was assured that it was better due to the higher floor. When the view outside your window is the same whether you're on the second or 10th floor, I don't really think it matters? The housekeeping staff obviously don't pay attention to their role, and on one occasion I found two of my items within the bed after being made! On another occasion, I requested housekeeping in the afternoon, and by the time i returned at 7pm, nobody had been to service the room. Upon calling again, I asked them to send someone after 8pm when I would be out of the room, but lo and behold, someone walked in on me whilst I was in a bath towel ten minutes later without even a knock. Mornings promised the beautiful sounds of staff yelling down corridors to one another.The floor staff were usually scowling, nobody offered to help with guests struggling with bags, and unfortunately they still expect a tip and a great review at the end of it. This hotel ruined my stay in NY and I most certainly will not be staying here again or recommending to friends.

It´s perfect for your first time in New York, or your second. I stayed there twice, and it´s a great place for the value. Specially in New York, where the accommodation used to be so expensive and the service is not the best. The Park Central is a great spot, near the best places of Manhattan. And the personal is so helpful. It´s near the trains stations, time square, central park and columbus circle.

Excellent base from which to explore NYC, centrally located an easy stroll from Central Park, Broadway theater district, Times Square, major museums, and 5 subway lines. You can be anywhere in the city within minutes. As you might expect, it bustles; the lobby is usually packed with arriving, departing, and congregating tour groups from all over, and the elevators can be a bit slow. That said, the rooms are quiet, quite well appointed, and comfortable if not luxurious, with excellent beds, good showers, and free wifi. The $2 continental breakfast offer is a steal. Staff is remarkably friendly, from the desk to the maid service.

We have visited the hotel four different times. The first three times we stayed on a good size corner room, although the bath- rooms are small. The last time we stayed in a so called "premium" double that was not only very small, but parted in two by a column. The location,lobby and lounge are very nice. Although the lack of a restaurant makes it very difficult ,especially in the morning.What keeps us coming back is the great and personal treatment we received fromNancy Vatcharasoontorn and Elizabeth Cacovic of the guest relations team. The front desk people should take their example.

The hotel has renovated its rooms over the last few years and they are very comfortable and well appointed. The courtyard rooms may not offer any view, but they are extremely quiet. As for location, this hotel cannot be beaten. It is within easy walking distance of major attractions, restaurants and public transportation.We have been staying here for years and the Park Central keeps getting better.

Great hotel near Central Park and Carnegie Hall, but within walking distance of the theater district. It is a quieter area than around Times Square. Service is amazing at this hotel. We have stayed there 3-4 times and will definitely make reservations at Park Central the next time we are in NYC.

This was the 3rd time I stayed here and I had a very nice relaxing time. Well kept and the staff are so pleasant and helpful. They have Valet service which is great! The food was delicious and the room we had on the 16th floor was Beautiful! Thanks Quimby! You are the Best!

Loved the location!! So easy to navigate to all parts of the city whether on foot or subway. Loved the layout of the room as well, with the wall it gave us a little privacy from the kids. Hotel staff was extremely friendly and were wonderful to the boys (7 & 14). I can't wait to come back and will be staying here again!!

This was our first experience staying in NYC and staying at the Park Central Hotel was perfect for us! The location of the hotel was excellent--just a few blocks to Times Square in one direction and a couple blocks to Central Park in the other. We traveled there as a family because our oldest son was playing with his orchestra at Carnegie Hall which was right across the street from the hotel. Within a short walk from the hotel was Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, and the American Girl store. When we first arrived at the hotel we received assistance with our luggage right away. When checking in at the front desk, the woman was very pleasant and upgraded our room to a King suite with a view of Times Square. Our room was very clean and it was so nice having 2 bathrooms, a small refrigerator and an extra room with a sofa bed for the kids. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning the room while we were out exploring the city for the day. Our room was on the 18th Floor and we did not hear the traffic outside. If we ever return to NYC, we would definitely stay here again.

Last stop New York after travelling around States. I life NY but not in July....it was so busy and bustling that you couldnt move. Found it very difficult to get around with so so many people! Q's everywhere and a lot of waiting around which was such a waste of time. New York is a must but is much more enjoyable in Oct/Nov abs there is always a great buzz before Christmas....fab for shopping. A must do is the tour around Central Park abs afterwards lunch and coffee outside at one of the pavement cafes....lovely

The rooms weren't great. They were dark and really musty and smelled bad. They also bang you for $25 / day for a 'facilities fee' on top of your room rate. I wasn't impressed and will not be going back.

We just spent four days at the Park Central Hotel and had a wonderful experience. From the time we pulled up to the curb until our luggage was loaded for our trip home we found the staff and accommodations delightful. The staff members were helpful and courteous. We brought our granddaughter for her first visit to NYC and our stay at Park Central added to the great experience. The gentleman working in the lounge each night made her a delightful Shirley Temple so she could have a "night cap" with us at the end of a long day. We will definitely stay her again and recommend to our friends who visit NYC. Thanks!

The location is great, but that is all that is great here. The Hotel is very busy, and the services are minimal. Furthermore if you want to benefit from standard services like early checkin or high floor room request, you will be charged for this, without even the guarantee to be satisfied. So in the end, the bill comes up quite rapidly, I paid 500 USD per night, and at that price I could have had a great room in a far better Hotel. definitely not worth the price, unless you cannot find another hotel.

I stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms were a good size by NYC standards, the beds were so comfortable and the rooms were very nice. The bathrooms could be a bit nicer with more amenities.The location was perfect as it was close to the subway and rite in the center midtown. The staff was nice and helpful when needed.Overall good stay but have had better NYC.

Clean, bug free, comfy bed, noise from exhaust fan 14 floors below echoed in our ears all night.Good for the price especially in Manhattan.We are locals and have stayed at some of the best resorts in the world. So its a good value for the dollar.Centrally located near Lincoln Center , central park, theatre district.

We stayed at the Park Central hotel on 7th Avenue, New York from 08/06/2015 till 15/06/2015 and can't fault anything about our stay. The hotel and room were spotless, we had to move rooms because of a problem with the safe, no hesitation from the staff. All the staff, especially Carolyn on the desk, were very helpful from check-in to getting transport to JFK on leaving.

A dream come true for me to cycle around Central Park( and venture onto the roads VERY SAFELY)Various modes of visiting Central Park, walking, cycling, horse drawn carriage or rickshaw/style bicycle Personal highlight... John Lennon's memorial IMAGINEStrawberry Fields with plaque Boost your fitness and WALK that way you can ''get lost/explore ' all the nooks and crannies Central Park has in its beautiful green surrounds.

This hotel was so disappointing. It had good reviews on this site, looked clean, and had a good location. The room was fine--the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was nice. I did not expect the service to be as terrible as it was. We arrived at 1:30am due to the massive delays at JFK due to runway construction and fog. I asked for late checkout (we were flying out the very next day) and was told that I needed to talk to a manager in the morning because it was only free until 1 pm. Otherwise, to have the room until 2 pm, we would have to pay the FULL cost of the room! I had called the hotel in advance and was told that it was on availability--fine, I can handle that, especially on a Wednesday morning. I called a manager in the morning and left a message. No call back. Tried calling the front desk and received the "sorry, we can't help you unless you pay" and "leave another message." Considering that we arrived at the hotel less than 12 hours prior, one would hope that for the money that I paid, I could receive a little consideration (perhaps just a courtesy call back??). So, we checked in our bags at the bag room downstairs for two hours. When I went to check out, the front desk staff was dismissive and made me wait a long time to be helped even though there was no one in line! The person that checked me out tossed my room key off to the side and I had to ask for a receipt. It was as though I needed to feel the privilege of staying at this hotel. The only helpful person was the bellman, who was able to secure a ride to the airport for us without us chasing him down. So, while the location was good, I would rather give my money to a hotel that actually cared for its guests.

This hotel is beautiful, and you can tell from the moment you walk in. Our room size outdid our expectations compared to our other stays in NYC. One plus was the $1 breakfast add on. We weren't expecting much, but we actually enjoyed what we received! The hotel was around a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square. We would recommend!!

We loved the Park Central. It was a very comfortable stay with nice beds, linen and full size shower amenities. The location was spot on and we walked to all of the sights we had planned. The staff was attentive and kind when asking for directions or ideas.Our only small grievences are that the lobby bar was never open and construction was endless accross the street. Minor. Great trip!

Background/Booking/Check-in: A relative and I traveled to New York City for a race event in Central Park. I made our reservation directly through the hotel’s website as it offered the lowest price at the time. (A few weeks after booking a non-refundable rate, Jetsetter offered a significant sale on the hotel, oh well, bad timing!) We arrived after 4 pm on a Friday afternoon and were able to check-in immediately, there was no line, etc.The Hotel: The hotel is located in Midtown West, steps from Central Park and Times Square. Hotel highlights included a beautifully renovated lobby and cocktail lounge. We stayed in a Classic room with two double beds, which was also updated. Room highlights included comfortable beds, a safe and a large flat-screen TV. The bathroom had a rainshower and offered C.O. Bigelow products. Room negatives were that the bed sheets seemed somewhat thin? Also, while the rainshower worked great, the second showerhead was not installed and was actually left on our bathroom counter? (I personally would not put guests in a room until any needed maintenance is complete. However, we did not complain about the second showerhead as it was a minor issue.) Miscellaneous: The hotel charges a mandatory “facilities” fee of $27.21 ($25 plus tax) per night. The fee includes Wi-Fi, use of the fitness center and luggage storage. The hotel did not have a traditional restaurant or room service but offered a “grab-and-go” market. (This was not an issue for us as there are so many great restaurants in New York City.) Our room was fairly quiet but we did hear a little noise at night from our neighbors and other guests in the hallway. We had no issues with the elevators except the morning we checked out, it was quite busy at that time and it took a few tries before we were able to “squeeze” into an elevator, etc.Overall: We had a good stay at this hotel, it was clean and the location was excellent. The price was also reasonable for the area. I would stay here again if attending another event in Central Park.

We had the deluxe kingsize room and it was beautiful, very spacious and clean. Massive television. Nice modern bathroom with powerful shower. We could hear the street noise but it wasnt to much of a problem mainly if loud music from the bar over the road or sirens. I would not say its a hotel you could get views of the city out of your room. Location great!turn left out the hotel and can see central park and 5mins walk right was times square.

Horrible from the moment we checked in until the moment we checked out in the same night! They "re-modeled" their rooms. They half did them. The AC unit in our first room wasn't working, sent up the repairman (which the hotel only has one on a Friday night for over 800 rooms) (discusting-they should appreciate their employees more than that). Went to the front desk, received another room (nothing like the room I had paid for) yet again, AC didn't work. As we were moving from one room to another, we were in the elevator and the bar fell out of the wall and hit my 9 month old grandson in the head. If your going to remodel a hiotel-make sure its properly done. Maintenance is key! We had met our grandparents (from Vegas) who stayed at another hotel close bye, that came to visit. After I made another call to the "Management" to ask for a room that was functional, she proceeded to tell me that we have too many "guests" in our room! Wow! Didn't know we couldn't have visitors. At that point we checked out. They need to re-evaluate their staff and they should make sure when they have rooms that are rented, they everything is funcitionl-especially for the prices they charge! Don't let the "newly remolded" get you to go there. Terrible experience. We have been there many times before it was fine. Haven't been there since they remodeled and I'm glad we haven't! Wouldn't spend another penny in that hotel. All of our family and friends will be known about this horrific experience. They should be ashamed of themselves. Poor hotel, poor management and poor property.

The location of this hotel is amazing! It is located between Central Park and Times Square, and the staff is very accommodating. I did expect more from this hotel and was disappointed that turn down service was not offered. The staff was excellent at following up on guest request but fell short on offering suggestions and directional advice to tourist. The most common response was , "ask the bellman". Additionally, this hotel offered a concierge desk, however it was never staffed during our 5 day visit. The "business center" was confusing and was not compatible to meet our standard adobe needs. Once again, the staff was friendly and accommodating but the core structure lacks the basic accommodations that are expected when paying this rate.

We went on a family vacation with our 2 sons. It was our first trip to Bee York. Very friendly and helpful staff. Very clean hotel. Close to Central Park and subway system. Within walking distance from Times Square and Broadway shows. Very comfortable beds. Bathroom was very nice with high end fixtures. Had charging station for electronics. I would definitely stay again. They also offered transportation to the airport for a flat rate price.

We have stayed at this hotel many times, and we think the hotel is getting better and better. We love the location. Closte to Central Park, Times square, 5th Avenue, and the subway just outside the door. Great bar, say hi to John. Can't wait to get back.

I called 10 times to get a simple email confirmation of my reservation. No one could do it, and it was not in spam or junk mail. I have never had so much trouble getting proof of a reservation made before. The hotel room was comparable to a Holiday Inn, not worth the price!

There is also a mandatory charge of $25 / night for 'use of services' including wifi and the gym. If it is mandatory, why don't they just add it to the room rate like any normal hotel? On the subject of which, it is the only 'hotel' I have ever come across that doesn't have a restaurant or room service facilities. Check in que was half an hour, despite there only being a few people standing in front of us and there being plenty of staff milling around doing apparently nothing. The man in front of us in the que had the audacity to complain and the employee created a massive fuss, shouting at the guest because he had the 'nerve' to complain and then refused to serve him. I have actually never seen anything like it.Location is central, but on a pretty rough looking street - the exterior of the building looks like something from a horror show, although the interior communal areas are quite nicely done. Don't be fooled by the impressive photos on the website - they are extremely flattering. In real life most of the hotel, especially the rooms, are extremely basic. I wouldn't stay here again.

Recently remodeled, spacious rooms for New York, excellent location, and surprisingly cheap rates. Great for families: rent connected rooms for about what you would pay for a single room in one of the other hotels nearby. Just down the street from Central Park, very close to Times Square and steps from the subway.

Just back from a trip to NYC to sing at Carnegie Hall (fantastic). The members of our choir stayed at the Park Central, which was booked on our behalf. It was expensive, we thought, but the central location was great. Rooms sizes were good but there are no extras like coffee facilities in the room. The service was very good - nothing was too much trouble - and the concierge desk helpful. There is no restaurant at the hotel, so no room service, but there is a small outlet where you can buy coffee and some food items. It is VERY expensive and I would recommend going two doors down to Starbucks if you need sustenance. Rooms were clean and well kept, having recently been updated. Bathrooms also clean and fine - low-level back with fixed shower above. Nice toiletries provided. Well placed for Central Park and downtown with regular taxi and bus services, or easy walking distance. Right opposite Carnegie Hall. Rooms on upper levels have better views and are quieter than lower level rooms, and there is a fitness centre, but I didn't visit it. We requested severa things for our room - new shower curtain (the first one didn't reach the top of the bath and the shower flooded the floor), extra coat hangers and also a coffee maker which came with several sachets of coffee - all free, well worth it. Everything was delivered within half an hour. All in all, a good place to stay when visiting New York. There is a bar open in the evenings only - glass of wine $18!

Hotel very convinient, only problem was it hasnt has a restaurant. I wanted to surprise my wife with a nice breakfast and it didnt have a responses. Locations and prices are good. Close to central park and time square

Great location, great internet access, safe and secure. Slightly dated, but clean and comfortable. Be careful of phone charges, some internet booking sites indicate that ALL calls are free, this is not the case.

Nothing amazing, to be sure, but a very good value (we paid $215/night in early June). Rooms clean, good size for NYC, simple decor. Good midtown location. Bar is meh, with no food, but plenty of places nearby. We used the place to sleep and it did not disappoint!

Visited here last year with a friend. Fantastic location, rooms really well kept and clean. Right next to central park and Hooters ;) (which is definitely over rated to be honest).Good value for money and room service in the morning was spot on. Would recommend to anyone looking to stay close to central park and a couple of minutes away from Time Square.

There was nothing about this hotel that conveyed a sense of luxury in anyway. The bed was hard and uncomfortable even though I enjoy a firm mattress. The faux feather pillows are awful and crumple down to nothing under your head. The bed has two sheets with a thin layer of quilt batting in between and no blanket. Which reminded me of a cheap hospital linen set up. I found the bathroom so tiny that there was no where to place toiletries while getting ready for the day and the shower head was an awful choice for a place with such poor water pressure; it was nearly impossible to rinse the shampoo from my hair. I should add that I believe all three bottles in the shower were filled with watered down soap and I believe all were cheap handwash. And the view of the HVAC canyon wasn't a big deal but certainly added nothing to our stay. I have to say it was clean and bug free which I do value, but I have had more comfortable accommodations at 2.5 star properties. There is no restaurant on site and the staff makes no apologies about it or really anything else.

First, I didn't receive the room I paid for. 2nd: The next evening, upon my return from work, my room was changed without my knowledge or consent. I was told that my belongings were moved to the new room. There were not. My bag was missing for another 2 hours. And after receiving my bag, my iPad, apple computer and designer sunglasses were missing. I did receive my sunglasses 3 days later.

This hotel is lovely, we had a massive room with toiletries included. No coffee machine but this is a minor thing when there are so many cafes nearby. I do feel sorry for all the staff as I heard several of them getting grief about the facilities fee they charge for wifi and gym etc. although I do agree this should be included in the full price it's clearly states on all booking and review sites that they charge this so there is no excuse to be rude to the staff about it. I contacted the hotel since and they explained they charge it separately so that if you cancel the room you won't loose this fee too. People on here seem to moan about the lifts being slow, we did not have this issue. Room was clean and well presented. Hotel do charge a holding fee which I found was common in America but doesn't really happen here in the UK. They took it from my prepaid travel money card and when I went to get it refunded they couldn't do it due to the type of card it was . Even thought the first receptionist should have known this is was quickly sorted and they gave me it back in cash. Would return

The Bad:Room not ready upon arrival. I understand the hotel was full the night before. However, when my husband came back around 2PM to ask if the room was ready, we were told 'no'. Upon which he advised that he would wait there until one became available. Magically, one was 'all of the sudden' available. Noise - Not hotel related, but street noise/traffic was absurdly loud throughout the entire night on 7th ave.The Good and Nice Touches:Room Decor and Bed - very nice, and bathroom was nice.Welcome call - it was nice that we received this after check in to ensure all was to our satisfactionItem Delivery - Semi - prompt towel request delivery in about 25 mins.Follow Up - it was very nice to receive a follow up call about 10 mins after towel delivery to ensure we received item and we were happyLocation - Very central, perfect location.Overall, it was average, would've been higher rated if room was ready upon arrival...

Stayed here pre and post renovations. Before renovating it really was a poor quality hotel. Today it is a value for money proposition literally a block or so away from central park. You will find better quality and more boutique style hotels but they will cost a lot more. Room was fine although bathroom was tiny - couldn't fully open the door as it hit the toilet. Some people get upset about this stuff but the room was very nice - had a view to surrounding buildings but none directly in front ie quite private with a decent vista. I was on the 16th floor. Great Irish barman prepared to have a chat to a solo traveller even though the bar is too modern for my taste. For a romantic weekend away - perhaps not. For business travel - if the alternative is the awful Hilton or possibly the Marriott. No comparison.

This hotel is in a great location for anyone who is planning to visit NYC. The room and service was excellent. The breakfast house front to the hotel (the one in the corner) is a very good option to have a traditional american breakfast for a reasonable price.

This hotel is perfect for a summer weekend! it is VERY close to Central Park - 1 block - so the location is great! Lobby is very nice, quick check in process, staff very friendly. Room is pretty big for a NY hotel, beds are comfy! all is very clean, views are also nice!Would definitely return!

Location, location, location. Great room & bathroom. 2 blocks from Central Park. Short walk to Time Square. Great food & service across the street from hotel entrance & Carnegie Hall was the view from our 10th floor room. Would have liked to have had coffee in my room. WiFi service & the fee is a real shame for such an otherwise great hotel. The service for this was $27 (we stayed just 1 night) plus tax added to your bill. I recalled reading negative reviews about the poor wifi service & Before logging on to the service I shut down my iPad & settled with my phone Internet. My daughter (22yo) was not aware of the reviews I found as I planned our trip through Expedia. She did artempt to log on just long enough to find it incredibly slow so she went to her iPhone instead. You will likely enjoy the stay at Park Central. Just stay away from the wifi - it's a waste of your time & money.

Excellent hotel and central to Central Park and Times Square. Shopping in 5th Avenue was only two blocks to the east.Will go back and stay at the Hotel hopefully in the Fall of 2016. Could not fault the Hotel at all with very quiet rooms.

My first trip to NYC to celebrate granddaughter's 16th birthday, also her first trip. My daughter had been before and she was our 'tour guide.' She chose this hotel because of her love for Central Park, and the general location. With three of us women, we booked a corner room, which was very nice and roomy with many windows on two sides. All the staff was very helpful and welcoming. We were on the end of the 10th floor, had the same maid every day and she was awesome. When we were leaving a staff member walked by us and asked if we needed anything. I said we would need a taxi in about a half hour. He arranged for a hotel car to take us to the airport. I loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again - and again. The only disappointment - a very minor one - was there was no restaurant at the hotel and the bar did not open until 5:00.

DO NOT STAY HERE if you need heat in your room on a cold night, coffee in your room in the morning, a small refrigerator, (Even Motel 6 has these basic amenities). And you can forget about room service, quiet from adjoining rooms and hallway, and most of all, getting up or down that elevator in less than than 30 minutes... The "Deluxe" room we were given had VERY tight quarters. (You could hardly get around the bed) Without a doubt THE WORST Hotel experience in my entire life!!! The temperature in our room never rose above 50 degrees in the 4 miserable days and nights we TRIED to sleep there. Crowds of kids making noise all night long and waiting in line to get in the elevator.

Stayed for one night while in Manhattan. Clean room, clean sheets, working iron and clean air con. Nice clean place over all. Price was fair for Manhattan. I was impressed. Slept very well walls soundproofed I think. Will return next time I'm in the area. Recommended to anyone wanting to rest after roving around NYC.

Fantastic hotel. Well located next to the park. Room was very comfy and clean, and the staff were friendly and professional. Very good choice when visiting the city, for both business or personal trip. Will definitely return

The hotel is in a very amazing location, on 7th avenue and at walking distance from Times Square and Central Park. We stayed here for 4 nights and it was a family trip. The hotel is basic in nature, we checked into our room but found that the bathroom door was faulty and would not close, when we escalated to the hotel staff, they told us that it would be fixed the next day and they would change us to another room. The next afternoon, when i approached the front desk about it, they told us that there were no rooms available, but upon insisting and asking them to check, the staff had indeed reserved a room for us and we were shifted to 10th floor. We used the market in the lobby to buy our breakfast and it was pretty expensive and the food was average. The cleaning and housekeeping staff were very good and did a fantastic job but the rooms were a bit noisy in the mornings. I would say the hotel is definitely value for money, but they can improve by adding a couple of amenities such as a kettle in the room or some decent breakfast options. I would stay here again when i come on business but not if i travel with my wife and kid.

Upon arrival a snooty check in clerk refused to honor previously offered upgrade rate for corner room. The hotel has no restaurant or room service and the coffee shop is both over priced and sub par quality. It seems unsafe to walk east from seventh after dark due to a lack of police, darkened areas, construction and undesirable elements.The other guests were noisy and most did not use English as a primary means of communication. The location is nearer other lower quality hotels and has a problem with vagrants who obviously have urinated and defecated on the sidewalks adjoining the hotel. The smell is offensive.The doorman, however, was a great example of superior service and attitude-thanks Carmello!I would not stay here again nor would I recommend staying here.

I stayed here in January 2015 for a 4 days. I had a early flight and my room was ready right away. I had a 1 king bed room and everything was clean and updated. The location is perfect a few blacks from central park and a few blocks from times square. I will stay here again. Also as long as the windows are closed you can't really hear much noise outside. When I was leaving I used the hotels car service to take me to the airport. It was a flat fee of $50 to Laguardia. After I got home I realized that I left my dress shirt in the closet. I emailed the hotel and didn't get a response. I then called the hotel 2 days later and talked to someone and they said they would go look. He then got back on the phone and said that housekeeping didn't find anything. It's a $120 shirt I'm sure they didn't find anything. So don't for get anything you might not get it back!

Great room size and bath for NYC. Most of the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful There were a few at the front desk I found kind of rude. Internet in the room was terrible. Had to go to lobby/bar to get my work done. Hotel was very clean. Quality of linens and room amenities was mediocre.

Loved this hotel. I was on the 18th floor, in the classic 2 double bed room which was clean and spacious. All the amenities you need in the room. The bar area was a very nice space. Strong free wifi. Love the strong floral smell in the lobby. Central Park and Times Square 5 minutes walk away. Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. I would stay here again.

The Park Central was a delight. I spent three nights in New York and could not have asked for a better location, or better service-even when I locked myself out of my room. They were polite and professional at every turn. I have, and will continue to recommend this property. Rooms were very clean surprisingly quiet, and decorative with color scheme and amenities. Loved my stay.Paula Green

Close to Central Park there are a few Hotels of a similar nature - recently renovated and 4 star quality.Last time we stayed at the Warwick, but found their rates were up quite a bit while the Park Central was - for New York on the Memorial Day weekend - much more reasonable (around $300 a night including taxes and so-called resort fee).Our Premier King room was a good size and newly renovated. The lobby was excellent with a small take-out breakfast et al food area and then a nice sitting area if you want to enjoy your breakfast or food brought in from the may nearby choices. Check if the $1 continental breakfast special is available.The so-called Resort fee was, in my view, just a way to hide some of the cost. This is becoming common - but seriously this is not a resort: no pool or spa facilities, just a small work out room with some new equipment (with lot of walking, not needed) and included internet and phone calls. But all I care about is the total daily rate including all fees and taxes and on that basis the Park Central gets a thumbs up.Bottom line - consider this hotel if you are planning a NYC visit. Close to Central Park, Times Square and the Lincoln Centre. Almost across from Carnegie Hall

The room was good, a bit on the small side but it had all the amenities, it was very clean with a comfortable bed and a good size bathroom. The staff at the hotel are very friendly. Location is good with Central Park within a short walk and Times Square not far away either. Plenty of coffee shops and good restaurants nearby. Transport in good supply outside with taxis and subway stations along the street. The lifts are very busy, especially in the mornings and evenings. A number of times I had to wait for long periods while they bounced between floors or because of long queues. Eventually I started to take the stairs (7th floor) because it was quicker.

Great rooms, very clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel does not have a restaurant but the staff were spot on for recommending places to eat. Had great stay and would recommend the Park Central to anyone. Great location. Close to everything.

It is a very good hotel. Down the street of the hotel on one side of the hotel is Times Square and the other side is Central Park. I had an amazing time when I was there because it was my first time there and it was after my high school graduation.

We have recently returned from a week at the Park central NYC and found the hotel to be adequate without being inspiring. Firstly I would like to say a big thank you to Elizabeth who we found to be excellent throughout our stay and nothing appeared too much trouble including a late 4pm complimentary check out. The hotel is ideally located and close to Central Park / time square and easily accessible for the subway. The lobby and bar area were clean and inviting however the same cannot be said of the room. The rooms are small but adequately equipped with shower, bath, TV, wifi and safe however we would have liked tea / coffee making facilities. The cleaning is poor and housekeeping really do just make the bed. The bathroom was full of hair from previous guests and the carpet damp with a distinct musty smell filling the room. Air con was adequate and the room relatively quiet. Some of the staff including concierge were quite abrupt, boarding on unhelpful and I cannot believe a hotel of this size does not offer guests a restaurant or simple things such as the loan of umbrellas. Overall an adequate unremarkable hotel, however if we were to return we would seek alternative accommodation.......10% discount for returning customers or not.

I had been organising this surprise for my husband for a year and although shattered from the flight from the UK were thrilled on arrival at the Hotel and our 11th floor room. Arrived on 13th December and stayed 4 nights (before moving on the grand birthday finale at the Waldorf Astoria). The Hotel was in a perfect location; 2 minutes from Central Park and 2 minutes from Times Square; only had breakfast in house once which was adequate but more for business travellers or those who prefer not to talk! All in all we had a ball and will definitely stay here again.

We booked 6 nights here with our little boy who is 6. A couple of days before we arrived, I received an email asking if I wanted to upgrade our room to 2 beds for $40 per night (which is what I thought I had booked anyway). So I emailed the Hotel to remind them there were 3 of us and may struggle with 1 bed so she upgraded us to a 2 bed room free. When we checked in, we thankfully had been given a 2 bed room which was large, airy and clean. I found the staff at the desk to be a little abrupt that could be mistaken for being rude, however there would always be a friendly message on my phone afterwards asking if the service was ok so I put it down to just the way it is and I am sure it is not meant the way it is taken. The hotel is 10 minutes away from Central Park and Times Square and there is a subway round the corner so it is in a fantastic location. There are lots of shops and food outlets close by so it is handy for everything. I would recommend this hotel although it can be pricey and would stay here again.

Park Central is a nice hotel located in a very strategic location but there were some aspects that would probably keep me from staying there again. The main drawback was the lack of light anywhere in the room. A lot of times a hotel will try to reduce energy exposure (and expenses) by lowering wattage in the room, asking you to reuse towels, etc but at least give you decent light in the bathroom. My daughter and I had to literally use our phone lights to look for clothes in the dresser drawers, apply makeup in the bathroom, etc. It was laughable after awhile.The air conditioner was set to the lowest setting but was tolerable at best. Our second night our sheets and pillows actually felt damp from the humidity in the room.While the staff was very nice and efficient and housekeeping was very friendly, I don't think I would put myself through this experience again.

This hotel is great. Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, and Patsy's Restaurant is right around the corner (which I highly recommend). The atmosphere of the hotel is great. The lobby is beautiful, and the bar and lounge is very pretty. Our room was just what we needed and it was very clean. The bathroom was great, the lighting on the mirror was amazing. The shower was incredible and the tub was a decent size. Overall the room totally kept us comfortable and my Girlfriend and I loved it. The gentleman at the front desk, Emanuel, was a great help. We had a bit of a mix up with our room but he got right down to it and solved the problem in a professional manner. The way he went about the situation was how every worker should, informative and kind. He made our stay that much better. I totally recommend this hotel. Great prices, great area, and a great experience.

Just an overnight stay...but absolutely no complaints. The room was spacious, staff was pleasant enough, and it was CLEAN. We were going to a performance at Carnegie Hall, so the location could not be beat.

I don't like to go negative on a hotel, especially when I loved staying at this one in the past, but I cannot recommend Park Central to anyone else for these three reasons.First, every room had chairs that do not rock back and forth. Instead, they rock diagonal from the front left to the back right. I checked another room and the chair did the same thing. I then went to another floor and the chair did the exact same thing. Either the person who put them together put every single hotel room chair together wrong or they purchased them from a horrible vendor. This was painfully annoying.Second, I booked this hotel through Hotwire, but when I arrived, they told me that I would have a MANDATORY extra $25 a night fee for WIFI and the fitness room. If fees would be mandatory, they should be included in the Hotwire price and not have someone be given a surprise fee when I arrived.Third, NO late checkout. I asked for late checkout (maybe one hour), but was told that they do not offer late checkout. Now, this is not a requirement, but it's nice when hotels will give this. When it is not given, I think that TripAdvisor readers should know that they will not get late checkout at this hotel.Staying at this hotel was not a disaster, but for the three reasons listed above (especially the horrible defective chairs in every room), I cannot recommend this hotel. Very sad, because I stayed here 16 years ago and loved it. I was so excited to come back, but left disappointed.

We love staying at the Park Central every time we are in New York. The location in midtown next to Central Park is perfect for us. The contemporary rooms are well lit, spotless and well appointed. This time we had a gorgeous view of the Times Square ball in a corner room with three large windows.

The Hotel was refurbished 2-3 years ago the decor modern,and the room which was a superior ,so not he best,was more than adequate.the lifts were a problem ,lucky i was on the 6th floor walking down not a problem.The thing in New York now is the RESORT TAX.You get quoted free internet,but its not this charge pays for it whether you use it or not .It covers phone calls and the business centre and wi fi and internet.Free is no longer free.The charade differs in all hotels.my charge was 100 us for 4 daysso beware of hidden charges booking sites don't tell youThe hotel though i would recommend

Spent one night at the Park Central New York in a Classic King room. We were impressed with how friendly the bellman and front desk lady were. The room was very clean, comfortable and a good size for NYC hotel room. The lobby is beautiful and a great place to have a drink. I definitely would stay at the Park Central New York again.

First visit here was very positive overall. The room was a good size for New York, very clean, and the staff helpful and enthusiastic almost without exception (one reception desk person). The location is excellent - spitting distance from Central Park, which is important for a walker and runner like me; decent to good eating and drinking nearby and convenient for sightseeing, theaters etc.The worst thing about the hotel is the slowness of the elevators, which is such a common theme in other reviews that the management really needs to at least comment on it and, better still, do something about it. The other major negative for me was the street noise, but I realize the hotel has no real control over that.The good far outweighs the bad, though and I would come back here.

A $100 million upgrade has made this venerable hotel a beautiful, chic, and comfortable place to stay for business or pleasure. I especially enjoyed the jazz trio in the attractive lounge. All of the hotel staff went out of their way to make my feel special.

If u like unfriendly/unhelpful staff you found your place. The room noisy coz the walls and windows are paper thin. So u end up hearing street noise, and your neighbors conversations. I don't recommend this hotel.

I stayed here for a week. The rooms were clean and surprisingly large. The staff were always pleasant and helpful. Two minor negatives to be aware of: There is no onsite restaurant - so no room service and the street noise is loud until around 10 pm. However: There is a shop in the lobby for coffee and snacks - akin to a Starbucks. There is a lounge with an awesome jazz group playing each evening. There are a slew of restaurants within walking distance...along with other attractions like MOMA. It took me about 10 minutes to walk to it. Overall, I liked the hotel and would stay there again.

Shared a large room with two friends and had a cheap upgrade! The hotel is busy and bustling which doesn't bode well when there are only 2 lifts servicing the enitre place! Very busy queues indeed :( Rooms are large, and cleaned thoroughly every day by very lovely staff - much nicer than check in ladies who seem to just want to put you in a queue even when you're asking a question!! I can't fault the rooms - we only changed and slept in them so they were perfect for our every day needs. They were quiet too, despite being near the front entrance.The hotel bar isn't open during the day and shuts promplty by 12 everyevening but that's ok as there are many, many good bars just around the corner. In fact, everything is just around this hotel so the location is just great. It's a short walk to pretty much everything and if you need a cab the very helpful men outside will get one - we ordered one the morning of departure; an SUV to JFK which was much cheaper than the 'flat rate' yellow cabs.There's the 'resort fee', 'local tax' and various other types of tax on the bill that I didn't really get, but do check this as it does bump up the overall bill!I would recommend this hotel as it's modern, large, busy, clean, well priced, and best of all VERY CLOSE to everything! We really enjoyed our stay.

Great stuff first: - Fantastic location if you want to be by the Park and in a quieter spot than the madness that is midtown.- Friendly staff and decent facilities (from what I could tell, I was just there for a couple of nights on a business trip).- My first room was one of the largest NYC rooms I've ever had - and not just for NYC either - it was legitimately roomy.- "Room" rate was reasonable for the location, time of year, general quality of accommodations. Be warned - the room rate is $25 higher than advertised due to the "Facilities Fee", which "includes" wifi, use of the fitness center, and phone calls from the room (the second and third of which seem absurd - I've NEVER been charged to use a fitness center - and who the hell still uses a hotel phone to make calls?!) They don't hide the fee or anything - but the justification is lame and the room rate is deceiving since this is not an optional add on.As for my experience specifically - it was pretty mixed - and this is what gets it a three: After checking in I went to my room to find two things I wasn't thrilled with. First, there was a used razor blade (from a men's razor") in plain sight on the carpet (see photo). Not something that would have/should have been easily missed while cleaning. Whatever - I could overlook that. Second, one of the bedside lamps was not only without a shade, but had been seriously damaged (see photo). The lamps were glass and this one was half missing with sharp and jagged parts remaining. If I hadn't noticed it (not sure how that would have happened) and rolled over in the dark to turn on the light, it was definitely in a condition to slice a digit off. Anyway, I called the front desk and asked them to change the lamp out while I went to dinner. Came back - no change. Called again and they sent up the housekeeping manager - who seemed to be (justifiably) appalled. I asked if they could just switch my room and they did - to a very nice two-room suite. So - that was a plus. Even still, the new room had a lamp issue (weird theme) inasmuch as one of the outlets had a cord prong still sticking out of it (see photo). And the sofa in the living room had a gross stain (see photo - doesn't quite do it justice). I'm pretty forgiving - and didn't bother griping about these things - but it just seems like a lack of attention to detail in the housekeeping/maintenance dept. I travel 100+ days a year and - overall - this is a totally decent place. What would have made it better, would have been if I didn't have to make the calls/ask for changes in the first place.

Upgraded hotel with good public spaces and decent sized rooms. Good amenities. Didn't try restaurant, but lobby service is effectively self-service from a fairly well-stocked small 'market'. A good idea and probably saves money, but $6.53 for a bottle of water was ridiculous. Other things like coffee were much more reasonable.Comfortable, standard, slightly more stylish than some equivalent hotels, but totally anonymous! Fine for a business trip though expensive. The area has little going for it but local shops/restaurants/bars will fill any blanks.

OK so the good: the location is fantastic, the rooms are large by NYC standards and the whole place is spotless. Staff very pleasant. The only niggle I had was that the water pressure wasn't great as it took about half an hour to fill a bath from the trickle that came out of the tap. And the water isn't actually hot enough either. One last thing. I would not recommend that you use the hotel driver to take you to the airport. We were quoted by the hotel a fixed fee of $75 to JFK for two of us (each going to a different terminal) but the driver demanded $89 when he dropped us off. Stick to getting a yellow cab instead.

I booked and paid for a Premier King room 9 weeks in advance. The website description "designated on our higher floors with windows facing multiple directions allowing for the most light, making it a great option for the guest that is looking to enhance their Park Central Hotel Experience" On arrival we were told that the room we booked was not available, after asking how this could be be the receptionist told us she had found a room that we booked. The room we received was on the 9th floor of the 26 floors available definitely not one of the "Higher Floors" with a single window over looking offices. Sheryl the night audit manager advised she couldn't comment on the on-line descriptors and she would leave it with the GM Don Fraser to look into the following day. Hopefully they will honour their word and maintain a reputable status.

I've stayed at many other NY hotels before, and I have to say that I am completely dissapointed with the Park Central Hotel. The location is very good, and so far the staff has been nice, BUT... the rooms are small, there is no phone signal in my room, and what I dislike the most are the bed sheets. The duve is too thin and the sheets are not crispy at all, they seem old. I was really looking forward to my stay here and to sleep at a great hotel bed, but this hotel is nothing like the big hotel chains.. The Lobby may seem nice and splendid but once you get to your room its another story...

My 11-year-old son and I stayed at the Park Central for a last-minute Spring Break getaway. We arrived behind busloads of young performers at Carnegie Hall, but the cheerful staff whisked us to the reception desk, and we were up to our room in minutes. We loved the smart modern furnishings and artwork, but the layout of our Classic Double was the best I've ever seen in a hotel -- and certainly the best for parents traveling with kids. The closet divided our shared room into two separate spaces with independent lighting.And, yes, we loved being able to walk to Central Park and MoMA, Rockefeller Center and Times Square.

We recently stayed here for the first time and really enjoyed the hotel. The location is terrific; great to be a runner and so close to the Central Park. The rooms are comfortable and the service is great. Will stay here again.

Stayed one night while on business. Rooms are fairly big by Manhattan standards. It was also clean. Close to Carnegie Hall and Central Park. E, Q, N, R subway stops are close by. One elevator seemed to be out of order all the time which caused long lines and delays. They advertize free wi-fi but charge a $25 facility fee plus tax wich is a bit much.

Lots of room, great bath tub (nice size, contours well), polite staff. Wonderful location (much closer to the Park than it looks on a map--convenient walk to MoMA). There was no coffee maker in the room, but hotel supplied one free of charge when asked. Only negatives: The walls are REMARKABLY thin (could hear word for word people's conversation in next room) and they tacked on some kind of resort fee which was COMPLETELY unsubstantiated (normally with a resort fee you get bottled water or, well, *something*). My advice? Just raise your room rate to include the fee so you look less nickle and dimey. But the rooms were HUGE for New York, place was clean, overall enjoyable stay.

My daughter and I stayed at the Park Central in February for a doctor's appointment I had in Manhattan. On that visit, our check in was not the best experience. We specifically asked for a room NOT near an elevator on a high floor. We were given a room directly across from the elevators on the 8th floor. We returned to check in and after some challenging discussion, were given a quieter room. The room was spacious and we were not bothered by street noise. However there were three rooms next to us that were occupied by a big group of young people partying loudly until 2:30 am. At check out we spoke to an assistant general manager, and were provided with a comp room for our sleepless night, on our next visit. My daughter and I again came into NY for a doctor's appointment May 15, and this visit was wonderful. At check in we were graciously assisted by Adrianna, who saw that we got a lovely and quiet room. We had a restful night in a comfortable double queen corner room and got up refreshed and ready to enjoy the city the next day. The managements response to our first unpleasant experience more than made up for it, and we will look forward to staying at the Park Central again. The location is certainly Central to all the stops we wanted to make in the city. Thank you again Nathalie Uy and Adrianna.

We recently traveled to NYC for some fun and a Yankees game. Park Central was conveniently located to subway stations and within walking distance of both Times Square and Cental Park. Staff was friendly and personable.

Location! This hotel is incredibly well situated. There is another directly across the street as well, though it didn't look quite as nice. Having visited New York several times, I know what you typically get for your money. Most hotels are older and remodeled to give it a fresh feeling. The lobby is nice, the fragrance pumped in is equally nice. Non-smoking hotel, however, there was a guest on my floor that continued to smoke despite the fine fee. Hotel security did an excellent job at remedying that situation. ProsLOCATION! Central Park is a mere 4 minutes, the zoo maybe 10 minutes, Empire State Building, about 15 minutes, Broadway theaters 4 minutes, Times Square 7 minutes. LOVE.SPACE! NYC hotel rooms are often not much more than closets that manage to have a bed squeezed into them. A very spacious room at a very affordable price.SERVICE - Excellent. Helpful and friendly. I needed a cab, they got me a cab. After making a number of attempts on my own, this definitely ranked as a point.BEDS - extremely comfy, great pillow selection and bedding, though I could have used an extra blanket, the comforter is relatively lightweight.WINDOWS - they open, fresh air instead of recycled is always preferred. QUIET - need I say more?CONSROOM SERVICE - they don't have it. For me, this doesn't matter, it's NYC, I want to go out and dine, but I realize for some this is less than desirable.FRIDGE - No fridges in the room, that I actually would really like, as well as a minibar. For me this is a definite negative.WINDOWS - yes, they open, but the windows all face other rooms if you're on the inside of the U. So don't come parading out of the bathroom in your birthday suit so that you surprise the people across the way. Yeah, I may have done that.BATHROOM - though quite large, the water pressure in the shower was a slow drizzle that made you feel like you couldn't quite rinse the soap out of your hair, no matter the setting on the shower head. The sink, there is no counter space, there is no shelf...I should put my make up and toiletries where exactly? Big ol' bathroom, no shelf??? Ummm...Other than that, despite the issues I had, I'd stay again.

This hotel is beautiful. We were here two years ago and it was under construction but no problem for us. Rooms are beautiful and the staff are very helpful. We especially want to give kudos to Carmelo the doorman.....he's the best. Fabulous personality, more than willing to help you, works his behind off, great suggestions as to what to watch for and where to eat. We love him, one of the reasons we came back. Housekeepers were excellent and rooms were clean. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to any of my friends and colleagues. Good job on the renovations!

Rooms were clean, stylish and exceedingly comfortable. Staff were lovely and very welcoming. They were very willing to help and assist with any queries in relation to the area. Only critique is the lack of tea/coffee facilities inside the actual room and it was very expensive to buy coffee in the hotel. Would highly recommend tough!

We recently stayed at Park Central in NYC. We were pleased with the location, cleanliness of the whole hotel, and size of the room. The staff were pleasant and accommodating, providing early check-in. There is a nice large lobby to relax in and our room was clean and quiet. Divided layout of the room is ideal for added privacy for families or shared business accommodation. Door-to-door car service can be arranged to and from the airport by the hotel. The location of the hotel is ideal - within walking distance just north of Times Square and just south of Central Park. There was a great diner (The Wellington) across the street for breakfast at a reasonable price that had fast and friendly service. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to travelers looking to stay somewhere comfortable and centrally located to the sites in Manhattan, NYC.

Excellent location just 2 blocks from Central Park. Carnegie Hall just across the street. Hotel is spotlessly clean following a complete refurb in 2012. Well appointed roooms and super friendlyand helpful staff. Bar has just been added which was not there for our visit.

Based on my own experience this is a great hotel in an even better location right between Central Park and Time Square. Simple to check-in, staff was polite and helpful. Allowed me to check-in early. Room and bathroom clean and nicely decorated. Many breakfast places around. I will stay here again.

We stayed at the underwhelming Park Central for three nights. While the renovations are nice and the rooms quite comfortable, the staff service is where this hotel is lacking. The older, grey-haired gentleman who checked us in seemed bothered to be there, and didn't explain a single thing about the hotel... We were left to figure it out on our own. Plenty of staff in and around the lobby yet not a single one greeted us during our stay. We certainly didn't expect to be carried to our rooms, but a simple "hello" would have been nice and is generally the norm in any hotel. Beware of the $27 per day resort fee - which includes the "free wifi" (as well as fitness centre access, U.S. calling, luggage storage, and a few other things that come standard in most hotels).Housekeeping service wasn't great. Beds seemed haphazardly made, small amenities like soap and ice bag weren't replaced during our stay. Beds are very comfortable though - some of the best sleep I have ever had in a hotel.You will receive an email after check-in asking you to email them with any issues - don't bother. Based on my experience and reading other reviews, you won't receive a response.All in all, very unimpressed by the service at the Park Central. While the location is ideal, I will definitely stay elsewhere during my next stay.

Nice looking hotel - staff are busy; thus, not very warm and welcoming - bar/lounge area is modern and quite attractive - if you're on a budget, your guest room will probably have a "view" of concrete walls and not much else - rooms are decorated ok and are on the small size - I wouldn't plan to stay in your room a lot. Now the best part - LOCATION! Perfect (which is why I would probably stay there for a third time) and that's the only reason. If it weren't for the location, I would forget it and look elsewhere.............

I liked this hotel for the value and location. It's clean and spacious for NY. Just had to call for soap. And we wanted to stay an extra night. Better plan on it next time/ they book up fast- could stay here a third night- had to leave bit the front desk was very accommodating to help us find another place. Next time, see them early the day before, not in the late afternoon like we did.

I stayed in this property for business and would return again. Although it is not part of the rewards programs of both Hilton and Starwood (both of which I am a member), I decided to stay here due to its proximity to my office which is adjacent to Times Square and the reasonable nightly rate offered. I found the check in process to be quick and the room was recently renovated, modern and very clean. Even though the building is historic, I found the room to be spacious and well designed for business or for pleasure (which is a factor when considering boutique properties in the area). The location (56th St & 7th Ave) is very convenient to Times Square, Central Park and Hell's Kitchen and I never had a problem getting a cab to access other parts of Manhattan.

A great location if you want to be close to beautiful Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, Carneige Hall and much more. All within walking distances.The hotel itself was nice. I don't know what they spray or use in their lobby area, but it always smelled wonderful fresh each time you walk into the lobby. Our room was ok... It was really CLEAN, the bed was comfortable, the view from our window was awful. Sometimes that's what you get, but when you're in NYC...who stays in the room anyway???? We had problems with our toilet and they came to fix it, but it was a temporary fix. It didn't flush well, but other than that..it was a nice place for the convenience and location. We got the standard room/king size. Oh...for a 24+ floors, they're elevators were awful small, but fast moving.

We've stayed at the hotel before and always find it clean and reliable. Unfortunately no room service, other wise very good and a great location with walking distance to great sites including Central Park. Will stay there again.

It's not only central to Times Square and all the Great Restaurants, it has very comfortable rooms. And it has coffee and croissants for sale in the foyer in the morning. It also adjoins another hotel, in case you run out of ice.

Just back from first visit to USA. Staff were helpful and friendly. Accommodation was very good. Stayed there for a week and there were several good places for breakfast within 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Also handy for joining an open topped bus tour close by. Fifteen minutes walk to Times Square and theatre district.

This was my first time staying at The Park Central Hotel. Had a very spacious and well appointed room on the 17th floor. Large bathroom, very modern sink. Lots of storage space, nice closet. Modern Dresser with soft closing doors. Nice bathroom fixtures. Gorgeous lobby, friendly staff. Would return in a heartbeat!! Excellent location just 3 or 4 blocks south of Central Park, and walking distance to Times Square and the Theater District. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED HOTEL!!

Great hotel, great location, closed to Central Park, modern, warm, nice staff, same as showed in pictures! Except there is no water to drink in the room, no mini bar.Tres Bon emplacement, moderne, personnel tres agreable! dommage il n'y a pas de mini bar et d'eau dans les chambres!!!

This is a beautiful property with comfortable beds and nicely appointed rooms. The location is perfect - just steps away from central park. There are a few minor corrections required, including the need for new towels and pillows - both are beyond their expected life span.There is one larger issue which made us unhappy with our stay. Within a lot of text on our confirmation email there was a line about a $25 per day facilities fee, which I simply did not notice. Upon check in we discovered that the fee is mandatory, and therefore it seems it should be within the room rate, rather than charged separately. This approach in fact makes the rate appear lower than it is. I did complain to the check in agent, the front desk manager, and the guest services manager, so feel comfortable reporting the same here.

Hotel is great, centrally located within walking distance of many attractions. Subway entrance is just steps away. We booked a King bed and they didn't have it when we checked in, they gave us a Queen room but did not charge us the $27/day hotel fee. Wifi is not charged. Little and convenient food market on site. Only complaint is that the room smelled weird (like someone smoked and they cleaned it), but given that we spent most of the day exploring the city it didn't bother us that much. Overall I will recommend for anyone traveling on a budget.

Park Central is ideally placed in Manhattan, on 7th avenue within walking distance of Times square, central park, Broadway, 5th avenue and Hells kitchen. The rooms are spacious and clean, reception is efficient and helpful but can get busy. Nice bar and lounge area.Beware the $25 per day facilities fee (wifi, gym, US phone calls are included in this). Also you can upgrade to a high floor and/or a view, if you don't chances are you will have a view of the other 3 sides of the hotel (it seems to be built around a hollow square) and some fans on the 'courtyard' roof. Considering how little time we spent in the hotel when we weren't asleep this wasnt a major problem.In summary a very enjoyable stay in a good, well run hotel in a fantastic location. Overall I would recommend this hotel to friends and family

Nice hotel in great location. Ok price and decent room. Only complaint is the bar. Was told at check in was open until midnight but on first night was told at 11:15 last call. 2nd night at 11:20 told bar is closed. Bar employees rude. Received email from hotel asking that I email them with any complaints. I did but no response. Won't be staying here again.

Great location near central park and the subway. My wife and I spent three days here and had a blast. The only complaint I have is the parking fee but that's everywhere in New York City. We visited central park and took the subway every night to Times square.

I usually don't write any reviews on any websites since I usually don't have any bad experience with hotels. But this one was different. Though other staffs were very friendly and kind, the man at the front desk with gray hair was exception. It started at the very beginning of our stay, when we were checking in. As soon as I started to talk, with very annoyed face and cut into my talking and then said, "Look into eyes when you are talking to people." At that moment, I was almost too shocked to even ask if I heard him right. Was I there to learn how to speak or check in? It was extremely rude gesture and I must say I was very disturbed as well. He didn't stop there. When I came down to front desk on my third day of my stay to do the check in again, since I made two different reservations under different names, he completely ruined my day. When I explained my situation, he asked in what name the reservation is under. I told him that it's under my name and even spelled it out for him, since many people find it very hard to spell it correctly. Did I mention he looked very annoyed as soon as I started to talk to him? Anyway, when I told him my name several times, he said he couldn't find it. So I told him few other names that my reservation my be under, and while I was doing so, he looked very disturbed and said it would be better if I just write it down for him. Excuse me, but I wasn't even finish speaking out those names. After handing the paper to him, he said he still couldn't find it. Then he asked for confirmation mail and while I was searching for it in my inbox, he was talking to a woman in front desk and I almost freaked out when he said f-word. I didn't catch him clearly, but the word is hard to miss by nature. As far as I can remember,he was saying that he didn't know what the f is happening and he got this. I didn't even want to ask if he was referring to me. It took my quite a while to find a confirmation email, and while I was doing so, he asked if it was under the name that I've spelled it out for him from the beginning. I said yes, and while I was still looking at the phone, weaving through heaps of emails for confirmation email, he said, "Are you listening?". I looked up at him and I still can't erase that disgusted look on his face from my head. I answered him several times when he asked my name over and over again, and I still don't know why he thought I wasn't listening. Maybe he wasn't listening to what I've been telling him, since obviously he even missed what I spelled it out for him from the beginning. So, when he asked if I was listening, I said yes, and I even told him that he name he just called is the same one that I've told him at the very beginning. At last, he finally said he was sorry for the confusion. I would have understood him if it was late at night, after dealing with tons of tourists. But it was early in the morning. I can hardly believe I was treated like this at hotel, at front desk in specific, where they greet their customers. It was the worst service I ever had in any other place, possible in my life. I understand if he doesn't want to hear anything from non-native speakers, but if he does, he shouldn't be standing there treating customers with such attitude. I was trying to send email to the hotel directly, but I couldn't find their email so I'm writing here, since they specifically mentioned that they wanted me to share my experience here with others. Well, this is my experience I had in the hotel. I would put up with their tiny room where you can hear everything from construction noises to people walking down the hall. But I won't put up with being treated as if I had begged to stay here while I paid over $200 per night to stay here. I wanted to leave this review after I leave, but I just had to let it out. I couldn't stop thinking about it for whole day and it just ruined my day from the moment I walked out of the lobby. I must say I am curious how he treats guests who don't speak English at all. I bet he would just ignore them with disgusted face. My little piece of advice would be like this: if you're not fluent English speaker, just avoid the place. You might find it hard to believe in NYC where tourists flocks in from every places on glove, but this hotel's front desk won't make you feel welcomed if you are not.

Park Central Hotel was a superb choice. All new sheek and trendy not stuffy. Staff was gracious. Location ideal. Fits well with my mantra "Four Seasons or better". I highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

We really enjoyed our 2 night Sunday/Monday stay in the very large hotel which is literally convenient to everything. We never even took a taxi, walking to the Metropolitan Museum(a bit far), Times Square and other attractions.Room was very clean and decorated in a very modern style.Even though the hotel is huge, never really a wait for an elevator.Hint would be to book Friday, Saturday and Sunday for more reasonable pricing.NYC hotels have gotten very outrageous in their pricing. We found a Groupon for this hotel and also had to pay a $ 25/night facility charge in addition.

Beautiful Hotel and so central to our visit to Manhattan. Everyone was so accommodating and polite during our stay. Our room was perfect and the beds were amazing. The only minor shortcoming was the closet sized elevator that made some weird noises while riding it; glad it made each trip safely.

We booked this hotel for its good rates and we wanted two Queen beds. They were small queen beds but better than doubles! The hotel was nice and clean, good location for midtown. Walk to Central Park, Times Square, 5th Ave shops, Rockefeller, Radio city etc. The only downside was the small room, I know NY hotels have tiny rooms but with the Deluxe Queen I expected a little more wiggle room. No view at this hotel. Pretty good proximity to subway lines. It was great and fit our needs, will probably explore somewhere else next time.

We spend a great week at Park Central. The location, right next to Central Park and a walking distance from Times Square is ideal. The staff made every effort to make our stay pleasant. We were unhappy with our initial room (I am very sensitive to noise) and Elizabeth, the client relation manager not only moved us to a higher floor but continues to follow up with us every day to make sure we were happy with every aspect of the hotel. She was truly incredible!

We ask in the front desk to move from the hotel for a personal situation after check in our. We explain the situation asking for a penalty and the manager told us that was imposible to return us our money If we move... Incredible bad !!!

Hotel location is only a couple steps away from N/R Subway, close to Central Park, easy walk to theaters and restaurants and many other attractions. Possibly as good a location as one could ask for when visiting NYC. The rooms are modern and clean, as is the entire hotel. The price is reasonable considering how pricey most rooms are in NYC. The added taxes are significant but that's not the fault of the hotel. Some members of the staff stood out as exceptionally good while others less so. The doorman who hails cabs is terrific. Just the sort of personality one would like as a tourist needing a little help with transportation. The front desk at check-in and check-out times was understaffed with less than cordial people. They were no nicer even at off-peak times. The woman who fills the spot as concierge leaves a lot to be desired, too. She seems to go through the motions of doing the least she can get by with. I realize the Park Central isn't the Waldorf and you get what you pay for, but the concierge should be more accessible and friendly. If I managed the hotel she'd be looking for a job elsewhere. Then there is the problem with elevators. Although there are banks of 4, seems like only one runs at a time. On the lower floors one does better to use the stairs than wait for an elevator coming from the higher floors and by now so crowded that one needs to wait for the next car to show up only to see the same scene of people packed like sardines. It isn't just an issue on one day when there might have been a problem, it was like that all week. Despite the drawbacks which are really minor irritations rather than show stoppers, I will stay at Park Central again on my next visit to NYC.

This hotel is located in upper Manhattan, between times sq and central park. The hotel went through a refit 2 years ago and is looking fresh & new. The rooms are modern with bath and shower, plenty of drawer space and hanging space. There is an iron and board in the cupboard, which is nice for refreshing cloths before you go out. My only criticisms of the room is the lag of space between bed and drawer unit (end of the bed wall), this is just wide enough for 1 person to walk through meaning a few times if there is 2 of you moving about getting ready one of you ends up walking backwards or jumping over the bed, not Ideal. The other moan is the air conditioning unit is old and noisy, and didn't seem to cool the room down enough.Check in was easy enough, and check out was automatic if you weren't querying the bill, which is popped under your door the morning of your departure. ours was fine and we just dropped the key card in the box, simple. The concierge checked out bags on the last day due to a late flight so we could do out and even arrange a black car for travel to JFK, which was only $5 more than a taxi and far more comfortable.The small in reception carries a nice supply of bakery, fruit and drinks and is open early until 10pm, the staff were friendly, and prices weren't over priced. The hotel had free wifi for all guests which was fast enough for facetiming the kids in the UK.The reservations team and I must mention Annette were lovely to deal with. They ran a deal for 4 nights or more giving 40% discount.
