I asked if they could do that deal for 3 nights as our flights had already been booked, and they happily agreed, booked it all in and i had free cancellation until 24hrs before with no deposit. This to me show good customer care without demanding deposits etc, which is great since we were coming from the UK and get charged for foreign transactions.In all you shouldn't be disappointed with this hotel, the staff and venue is perfect for couple/business, etc There is a Gym, but we didn't use it.I would like to express our gratitude to the hotel for the card, balloons and chocolates that they put in our room to celebrate our honeymoon. It's the little things like this that put smiles on your faces.

rooms were okay, but too noisy because of unisolated windows. seemed like the midtown traffic driving through our room. central park is just a few minutes away, also times square. expected a bit more for the price, staff was at least helpful, but would not stay there for a 2nd time. 3,5 / 5

I read the reviews AFTER I stayed there for four days. I found them interesting...and all valid.One cannot dispute the location. Excellent. But there are MANY options with the same excellent location, so that should NOT be a factor when selecting this hotel. So then what do we, as travelers look for? There were mentions of bad views, but that is up to you topaz for upgraded views which I did. I had a Premier Room with windows overlooking , well, the city across the street. But thats fine. Like other reviewers stated- no mini bar or fridge, which I find confounding. No food/room service. That is such a no brainer these days. No coffee bar in the room-even the "lower end" hotels have these, Park Central does not. The room was pleasant enough and the bathroom was fine. The baggage storage is a plus. BTW - the starbucks next door mentioned in a earlier review-- gone. The day after we arrived! Crazy.A previous reviewer talked about only two elevators and the long wait for them. They were RIGHT. So weird.But here was my problem. When I booked, I made a special request for NO FEATHER pillows/bedding due to my partners allergies.Then when I checked in at 4pm, I reiterated the request, just to be sure.After being out for the evening, I returned to the hotel at 11pm.....they still had not changed the pillows. I called, they said they would take care of it. We were so tired, but had to wait.midnight---no pillows. I call again. I explained the history and the situation. The fellow on the other end was VERY apologetic and was going to get it done right away.12:30 am---now, this is putting a cramp on my love life for the evening. So I'm pissed now. I decide to head downstairs to the desk. I open my door, and there in the hallway was a maid with three pillows on the floor of the hallway. She picked one up at a time and kind of "banged" it then put on a pillow case. OMG---really? on the dirty carpet/floor? She then asks if three are enough. I suggest to her next time, don't put them on the floor. She apologizes. I'm thinking, oh no-my toothbrush will be going right in the toilet tomorrow.Anyway- I had received an email that afternoon from the director of guest engagement, in which he stated that if I "FACED ANY OBSTACLES during my stay" that i should contact him or his staff.so-----I email him the next day and explain the events of the night before. And how I had planned ahead, and even reminded the staff about this simple no feather request.TWO DAYS LATER-after hunting him down he finally responded. He apologized, and gave us 50. credit towards our facilities fee.So , there you go. Oh one more thing....the room rate had dropped 75/night the day before we were to check in. But of course I took a non refundable reservation to get what I believed was their lowest rate. That was annoying. I have to remember to get a low price guarantee hotel room next time. The staff was all in all pleasant otherwise.BTW-I love NYC!!!

This was a pleasure trip and we stay in a bad service hotel. A lady did not matter that we said that the HVAC was not working and the room was so hot that we had to open the windows. We paid for a premier room and they gave us a lower rate and did not give us the money back.Intercontinental hotel at Times Square is the best one!!!

Location is great, rooms are nice but there is not enough illumination (just few lamps) and no coffee maker!!!.I would like to commend Quimby at the front desk who helped us out with all the questions we had and was extremely courteous and nice.Again, thanks quimby for the great and friendly work. We were able to check in at our arrival (noon) and helped us with the bags and transportation to the LaGuardia airport ($50.00).Summary, Best Location and Quimby, worst price, bad illumination and no coffeemaker.

Cannot believe this place is four starred hotel..Check-in service was very slow and front desk staff appeared not customer service-oriented; he was very unfriendly. Also, I had two huge baggages so I told that staff I needed a bell service. Then I went to my room and waited for 30 minutes and nothing happened. I called the concierge and no one answered. So I went down and brought baggages by myself. When I was at the lobby to get my baggages, there were so many bell guys seemed to be available. I just think that staff guy who checked me in forgot how to treat customers. I am never coming back to this hotel and I would never recommend this hotel.

This hotel is in a great location with access to all of the attractions and restaurants of mid-town. Central Park is just a few steps away as is Times Square. Our stay during April was marked by missteps one after the other. From a surly check-in to arriving in the room and finding an empty, unplugged refrigerator sitting in the middle of the entryway, it seemed almost nothing goes right at this place.The room was small and faced an ugly courtyard the only saving grace of which is that one is spared the city noises. The room was dark and dimly lit (the latter now becoming a requirement for hotels to define themselves as 'trendy') which is NOT good for older guests. The bathroom was clean and adequate but tiny.Maid service was barely adequate and one out of the 4 days of our stay the room was not made up until we had to request it at 5PM. Interestingly, the maid-service cart lived permanently in the guest corridor! This is something I've never ever seen before.Finally, to top it all there were only two elevators leading to unusually long wait times pretty much throughout the day. Many guests were choosing to get on the elevator if there was a spot to squeeze in even if it wasn't going their direction.

Stayed here for one night on business, and thoroughly enjoyed. Sizable room, by Manhattan standards, all updated and modern. Well situated, across the street from an excellent diner, next to great coffee shop. Lobby is very comfortable, with good space for working; nicely set up with tables that have plugs for laptops. Great service. Exercise room was decent; small but well equipped with the basics. All around, terrific choice; will come back if I can get a good price again.

My wife and I just stayed at the Park Central for our 28th Wedding Anniversary and had an awesome time! All I did was email the hotel prior to our stay and received an email back from the hotel guest relation manager saying she would accommodate us by extending an upgrade for us. Needless to say that upon arrival (which was an easy check-in), we found that not only were we upgraded, but, that the room we were upgraded to was a beautiful junior suite with a view of most of Manhattan and times square. There was also a small box of Godiva chocolates with two Fiji water bottles and a card from management wishing us a Happy Anniversary! I don't know of many hotels that would offer these kinds of accommodations especially on a first time visit. Overall, the entire hotel staff was very friendly, the place was immaculate clean and we will certainly stay here again in the near future if our plans call for us to spend the night in NYC! Highly recommend this place.

Aside from the great location, after 5 nights, I can't help but be disappointed. The air conditioning required 2 visits from maintenance when all they had to do was change the filter. I was told by the front desk, that when the outside air cools, the air conditioning only blows fresh air. The smoke alarm would go off intermittently and when guest services was notified, I was told it was the dust collection in the room. Towels are old and thin and require more than one to dry off. The bar is minimal and there is no where on the property for breakfast. I would've hoped for more from such a prestigious hotel.Howard

I enjoyed the location of this hotel, but I was not the greatest fan of the hotel. There were no perks: no mini fridge, no coffee maker, no spa, etc. To put it bluntly our room was terrible. We had to keep our blinds closed because we could see directly into the room(s) next to us. What a drag keeping the windows closed the entire stay.

The location is terrific. Check-in using our hotels.com reservation went smoothly. Our room was clean; the mattresses were very comfortable; pillows were mediocre and we would have appreciated more than one choice of firmness. Free wi-fi but few other amenities; drawers were empty – no notepad or pen. We would have appreciated better reading light. We did not have a City view but our inner room (4th floor) was very quiet. Staff was uniformly pleasant except for one man at check-in. We appreciated the drop-luggage service which we used both before check-in and after check-out, allowing us to wander the City without our luggage. The lines and wait time for drop-luggage seemed excessive.

Grant it, the hotel was undergoing renovations, however, no room services, no spa, no anything. Room services poor, customer service only average. The one good thing was its location. Walking distance to so much, you don't need a cab. However, I do not recommend this one.

This hotel is not like the pictures...the room was very small and crammed and stuffy .the AC did not work while we were there! And we were there for 3 nights! The phone did not work at all no lights and neither did the TV . A maintenance guy was sent up he came in messed around with the phone and got a light to come on...when we tried calling reception though there was no response, so either they were not picking up or it was still not working, we tried on a couple of occasions then gave up! The maintenance got the TV to work.. But it was just advertising. The attitude of the staff I spoke with about these issues was basically you have paid up so that was it! I would return to Hilton Midtown where we stayed in December,!

We enjoyed how close this hotel was to restaurants, Central Park and mass transit. The whole hotel has been renovated. Everything except for the elevators that need some serious updating. The hotel staff was very helpful. Unfortunately, housekeeping knocked on the door multiple times each morning. We were on vacation so this was not wonderful but we were not woken up. We would definitely stay here again. The linens were lovely and I would suggest staying on a higher floor due to the fact that the elevators get so full that the lower levels are not picked up easily during high times.

This property is walking distance to so many great locations- Carnegie Hall, Central Park, 5th Avenue, Broadway, Times Square, Rockerfeller Center. It's is a quiet location with easy access to La Guardia. Excellent service, clean rooms. Bonus- Starbucks is steps away.

Really great place to stay. Location is perfect for sight seeing. Only issue is bed changing been here 5 days and still no bed change. Rooms are a good size for a couple free wifi is a bonus and you can use up to 5 devices. TV is basic but you don't see much as it New York so much to do and see outside. Literally 5 mins from Times Square and Central ParkWould give full marks but for the bed issue, just give reception a call to get it organised Still a great place to stay

This Hotel has a very impressive lobby. The location is perfect and so is the room decor. I was on a higher floor and the city view was perfect. I enjoyed a great night sleep and the mattress was firm and comfortable.

My daughter and I enjoyed our stay here. We arrived a couple hours early and were able to check our bags in, a few minutes later I went back up to the front desk to ask a question and at that point we met Ms.Shpresa. She was super Awesome, she upgraded us to a room so we wouldn't have to wait and the room was actually bigger than what we had booked. She was so helpful and super nice. We loved the hotel. It's beautiful, modern and clean. Time Square and Radio Music City hall are walking distance just minutes away. Location is great, our room was super clean and the cleaning staff was great and friendly as well. Our room was cleaned daily. Just perfect! I have no complaints. I will definitely stay here again and I will recommend this hotel for sure!!

The rooms are a good size and the location great. Apart from that it's ok and nothing special. Don't expect any special service and long queues at check in, and don't lose your room key - trying to get another one is painful especially as they want ID to issue another one when you have left your ID in your room. Awful

We had a wonderful stay at Park Central. The location is perfect for our family. We enjoyed how central the location was as well as the closeness of the subway. The best part of this hotel were the queen size beds. The room size was also on the larger side, compared to other hotels in NYC that we had stayed. The staff were always very helpful. They work very hard to keep it clean. The lobby also has a wonderful smell when you walk in. We got a breakfast deal for $1/day. Not a full breakfast but enough to get us all moving in the morning. The concierge was very helpful with finding great places to eat. The gym was very nice and more than just a converted hotel room. It had a great view.  I will definitely stay here again.

large and crowded you wait on line for the elevators,the rooms are nice we have a side room that is a big room,the location is great,a lot of restourants in the streets,5 min walking to time sq,ok hotel but next time i will look for a much more

I enjoyed my three night stay here in the early Spring of 2015. The hotel is closely located to Times Square and Central Park. You're nearby Carnegie Hall - go to a show there - you won't regret it. The lobby was clean, the bar/lounge is located directly behind the check in/out counters - so you get an energy rush when you're joining the hotel for a stay no matter how long. The rooms were comfortable with nice clean bathrooms. I'd recommend staying here to friends and would return for the right price (note I booked via Hotel Tonight app).

Took the family to NYC for a family wedding. Stayed 3 nights, and had a great experience. Staff was friendly and helpful; the rooms were clean and roomier than the average NYC hotel. The restaurant in the hotel offered delicious food (although a little on the pricey side-expected in New York) What was great about this particular hotel was the location...walking distance to Central Park, Broadway and Time Square. Will certainly go back.

Staff was not friendly and walls are VERY thin! Bathrooms very small. Lock away you shopping! My daughters shopping was stolen. Hard earned pocket money in a weak currency. We brought this under the attention of management, but the problem was not solved! Overheard similar problems in the corridor. The location is great but so are many other hotels!

For the most part this hotel is quite good. Friendly helpful staff, comfortable beds and great shower. My only issue was that the shower curtain was too short and you really had to be careful that the water didn't get all over the floor. I pretty much flooded the bathroom because I didn't know this when I took my first shower. Small issue. Just pointing it out in case the hotel is looking to purchase new shower curtains. Oh and the lobby really smells of cologne all the time. It's kinda overpowering. I think it's the hotel shooting out the scent. At first I thought it was just a guest wearing too much cologne but then we realized the hotel was doing it.

Park Central has a great central location for our needs in New York City. The staff does not necessarily go out of their way, but they do what is necessary. There are always cars and taxis waiting outside because the bell staff makes sure of this. This is very convenient when traveling around New York. I like the hotel's proximity to Time Square, 5th Avenue, and the subway.

I stay here often due to the proximity to Central Park. The rooms are new and renovated. The hotel is large with many tourists because it's also close (walking distance) to Broadway and 5th Ave. Service is good. Rooms are large by NY standards.

My friend and I have stayed at the Park Central many times over the last two years.We love the central location.easily accessible to the theaters as well as to Lincoln Center.We keep returning because the rooms are spacious and clean .The beds are comfortable and the staff is friendly and accommodating.Many times upon arrival we are greeted by Elizabeth.She is welcoming, professional and accomodating.She is an asset and reflects well on the hotel.We are planning to return soon.For us the hotel is a home away from home.

This is our second time here, it's a perfectly located hotel. Everything you need to visit in NYC is at walking distance. Carnegie Hall just across the street, the fifth avenue, the Central Park, Apple store, Times SquareRooms are not fancy, but they fulfil its purpose totally. Service was perfect, very friendly people at the reception. The Bar is a bit expensive, but its a nice place to have a couple of drinks at night.Wifi was extremely fast.

I stayed in this hotel for two nights, from May 6- 8, 2015 with my daughter. It was in a perfect location, but not a particularly nice hotel. Would not stay here again. The carpet didn't feel clean, there was practically no space to hang towels, and the room had two beds, clearly for two people. The picture window had inside hand prints on it, which indicated that it hadn't been cleaned from a long time. Some of the plumbing and door trim was put on crooked. Housekeeping was okay; concierge responded quickly to a complaint, and any employees whom we came in touch with were pleasant. However, all in all, it felt like a three star hotel in a 4.5 star location.

I staryed in Park Central in Jan-15 as part of a group. We had received room rates for our group of 35+ travelling. They day before we travlled Park Central cancelled our rooms! They then said we could still stay, but in the same rooms AT A HIGHER ROOM RATE!! We had no option but to travel and deal with this on arrival. On arrival room rates were doubled. Our cards were swiped to "HOLD" the rooms. We were told that room rates could be sorted during the week. No room rates were sorted at all!! They simply refused to honour the previous rates that we had email confirmations of! At check out I was advised that my bill was settled! I was confused and asked why. The check-out staff were cheeky and made fun of me that I didn't know how my bill was already settled. They said you paid for it at check in - this was not what happened!!! They obviously realised their fault and reversed the charge to my credit card, so I could lpay in cash with USD. Now, they owe me money due to changes in currency rates! They will not reply to emails. They will not admit responsibility. There's nothing I can do re non-honouring of room rates as you can't change the past, but I am livid that they lied to me at check in, charged my card, denied they'd done it, then finally admitted they did and refunded me, but refunded me less than I had paid! DO NOT STAY AT THE PARK CENTRAL, the rooms may be "OK" but the staff are definately not OK. Happy to help? No they weren't.

Deluxe rooms (if a bit smaller than expected) feature comfortable queen beds and huge LCD TV. In the morning, it gets really hard to get the elevator to go down to the lobby (waited for more than 10 minutes once). Wi-Fi was really fast (10+ megabits per second per device, if I remember correctly) and reliable, even if limited to 5 devices per room.The location of this hotel is the best thing about it. If you like to experience the town on foot, it hardly gets better than this.The staff is very pleasant and genuinely interested in your needs and issues. The receptionist (Elizabeth was her name, I think) went truly out of her way to help my friend with an issue, and the entire staff was, for New York standards, really pleasant and helpful all of the time.

Don't be fooled by the good location. This is not a 4 star hotel. The front desk is understaffed and it gets very busy meaning long waiting times. The lobby is well presented but elsewhere the decor is average. There was no shower gel in the room. There is a very noisy extractor fan in the airshaft affecting all inward facing rooms, this WILL affect your sleeping. And they will rip you off and charge you a $25 facilities few per night for use of wi-fi and gym whether you use it or not. Take my advice, avoid!

The hotel is conveniently situated between Central park and Time Square. Broadway is within a stone's throw of the hotel. The underground system is on the doorstep. Most attractions are within easy walking distances. There are many restaurants around the hotel (variable quality but none bad). The hotel staff are polite and helpful. The lobby is clean and spacious. The rooms are functional, the beds are enormous and very comfortable. Very little noise pollution penetrates the rooms. Unfortunately there are no tea making facilities in the room. WiFi in the lobby is very good and the signal is reduced in the rooms. This merely may reflect that may aging mobile phone is ancient. I am not convinced by the facility charge but this was made very clear at the time of booking. Generally our stay was a pleasure and good value.

I truly enjoyed this hotel. The staff was amazing and the location was superb. My only critiques would be to include a couple waters and a refrigerator in the rooms to make the stay better. WIFI should be free.

After coming from another hotel around the corner that was half the price, we were a little disappointed. The room was massive which was great, but the walls were very thin so could hear our neighbours talking and watching TV. The shampoo/conditioner/body wash was bolted down and there was no body wash our entire stay despite me asking to have it refilled at reception twice. Not a big deal but I don't like having to ask for things like that. No minibar or fridge so couldn't keep cold water through the hot weather either. Location was great.

I stayed at the Park Central Hotel on a recent business trip, and was very pleased. Check in was smooth, and the lobby was really nice. The hotel is very conveniently located near Central Park and a short walk to/from Times Square. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance, but I have a few favorites such as Carmines and John's Pizza located near 44th Street and Broadway in the theatre district. My room was nicely appointed, and very clean. Shower was hot and water pressure was good. Don't pay for internet, the access code is PCVIP2014. I would stay here again. Traffic noise can be a problem on lower floors, but you can set the AC system fan to run all the time and use ear plugs to help.

room was nicely appointed and new showers in a good sized bathroom. Comfortable and good bed. The location is excellent. Great eats and sights within walking distance. Go for a bike ride in Central Park. The only drawbacks I have is the lack of complimentary conveniences. Like coffee in am, or coffee in room. And no vending machines on floors. Just ice.

My daughter (14), mother and I stayed at Park Central for our first Mother-Daugther vacation to NYC. Hotel lobby was beautiful and inviting, and the room was very nice and accomodating The location was the best of all- 1 block from Central Park and just a 10 minute stroll to Time Square,Broadway,Shopping and awesome restaurants. We certainly felt like we were in the heart of the city--My daughter enjoyed us going to nearby diners latenight for dessert and we certainly felt safe.The Staff was amazing too, extremely nice and helpful! I would definitely recommend this property and look forward to visiting again soon!

Beautifully redone property in a great location. Just spent one week there in a 9th floor room overlooking 55th St and heard nothing from inside or outside the hotel. Loved the high ceilings, comfortable space and modern décor, especially taupey-grey colors. Art selection was very attractive too and the lighted picture was a nice touch. Reno must have included plumbing because the whole bathroom functioned extremely well and shone.However, as nice as this hotel is, service is not its strong suit. Although there are quite a few uniformed men at the door and in the lobby, not once was the door opened or held for me, luggage or not. Yesterday I stood under the hotel canopy for a full ten minutes while waiting for a shuttle pickup before one of the two men there asked why I was there. The outside window displays a sign offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner but no such thing was happening there this week and the beautiful bar lounge was pretty much deserted most evenings. The "Central Market" is tiny with very limited offerings and hours. If you want coffee or a snack after 10pm you will have to go out on the street. No vending machines or in-room coffee pots. The tap water is probably hot enough to make instant coffee or brew a cup of tea but you'd have to plan that in advance. When the market is open, expect to pay $3+ for coffee and $5+ for a can of Bud Lite. Except for the WiFi and safe, I don't know what the daily $27.21 "resort fee" bought me but this is NY after all.Housekeepers are friendly but their work is spotty. I don't need service every day and often refuse it but when it happens I expect changed pillowcases to be removed and the ice bucket to be emptied. Nonetheless, I enjoyed my stay at Park Central and would definitely return and recommend it. I've stayed in many West-side NYC hotels over the years and this one is now a favorite.

This hotel was great it was located near the theatres, Central Park, Time Square and 5th Avenue. The rooms were clean and the hotel was beautiful. The staff was very pleasant and most of all the price was much more reasonable then any other hotel in the area and just as good. We would recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again when returning to New York City.

I made a reservation through my points from my American Express Platinum card and the attention that I received was not the same, that if I had paid directly to the hotel . I got a room with defects and bad location very noise, close to the elevador.Definitely, in the future, I will not repeat this hotel

Park Central is in the perfect location...just blocks away from Central Park, Broadway, Rockefeller Center and Carnegie Hall. There are many excellent restaurants in the area.The hotel is fine. They have recently updated all the rooms with new showers, bedding,etc. The bathrooms are very small but adequate for showering, etc. Internet was painfully slow. Bed was comfortable. Lobby bar was convenient.

Our Mother/Daughter weekend was enhanced by our perfect room with plenty of space for four grown ladies and a large bath (by NYC standards)...and after a day of walking and dinners out we slept like queens on the perfect beds and the sounds of the city were drowned out by the fan we controlled next to the window-blissful nights of sleep!!!

My wife and I stayed there for 4 nights. Room was nice and a good size with a great bathroom. Only 5 minutes walk from Central Park and 10 minutes walk from Times Square. Lots of eating places in the immediate area although these were expensive. Take a stroll to 9th and 10th avenue for better options.

Such a beautiful room, wonderful location! A little on the pricey side but the room is worth it. My only complaint with the room itself is that no matter how many lights/lamps we turned on the room was always very very dark. Everytime we tried to use the wifi it asked for a email address, upon entering our email address the website told us it wasn't valid. We tried multiple times and with multiple email addresses but to no avail. So we could never use the WIFI though our entire stay. Beware they have a "facilities charge" on check out...when converting to AU dollars it was a hefty amount considering we already paid top dollar for our room, and the wifi (which is considered a "facility" never worked for us) When we questioned this surprise charge on checkout the reception attendant looked us up and down and said "well you could have used the gym" this goes without saying but...that kind of comment is deplorable. We did complain to the manager, he said he would speak with her as "that comment in no way reflects the kind of service that Park Central strives to provide" Still, that hurtful comment is now etched in my experience of New York and the Park Central. This was our first trip to New York and I'm so disappointed that even though Park Central is a beautiful hotel in a great location I would never stay there again.

I just stayed at the Park Central NYC solo last week for 5 days and it was great! Park Central is well located (and well maintained) so that you are not on top of "too loud" Broadway/Central Park/Shopping but in short safe walking distance to your 7th Avenue/56th Street home at the Park Central Hotel/NY. Subway N/R is at the end of the block for your adventure travel!

Very close to Central Park and within walking distance to many places. Hotel was remodeled not long ago and is very nicely decorated. The beds were delicious. We did not get maid service so we reused towels which were kind of damp. We liked the little market in the lobby where you could buy snacks.

We stayed at Park Central for a Bachelor and Bachelorette Party. We're from New Jersey so we weren't looking for anything super nice, just somewhere we can sleep so we didn't have to drive home that night. We were very surprised at how nice the rooms were! Everything was clean and modern. We had a great experience with the hotel and staff.

We really enjoyed staying at Park Central. It's a terrific location and the rooms are quiet, comfortable and nicely done. We would definitely stay here again. We were in walking distance of Broadway shows, Central Park, Union Station, Metropolitan Museum of Art and Carnegie Hall was across the street. Great restaurants were located near the hotel too. The hotel itself does not provide breakfast, but they had a little shop in the lobby where you could buy coffee, juice, water, muffins, etc. that was convenient. We always opted for a quick breakfast at a deli nearby.

Easy walk to Carnegie Hall, subway, bus stop, and restaurants Molyvos, Asian Fusion, Carnegie Deli, Europa Cafe, Russian Tea Room. Fifth Ave also nearby.I like its updated, glass, minimalist decor to old fashioned, historic decor.

Great place to stay in the city. The hotel has been refurbished and looks modern and fresh. Unfortunately the bathroom wasn't as clean as it should have been with toothpaste stuck on the wallpaper. Overall it's a thumbs up

I lived in NY for 61 years before moving to NJ. Came in for the auto show Tuesday night play & Wednesday matinee. This hotel was located perfectly for all three, plus great nearby restaurants. I was also treated very well by everyone.

Hotel was very clean. Everyone was extremely nice. Perfect location and well priced. Only negative was the elevator service. Elevators where tiny and slow. Ended waiting 15 minutes for an elevator and when it opened it was full. Ended up taking stairs.

The hotel is pretty antique but it was completely renewed recently. I stayed here some years ago and the thing resembled a bus central station at that time.The lobby is very big , so they divided it in different spaces making it more attractive.It is nicely decorated with some touchs of sofistication.It is located in the heart of everything, no more than one block from Carnegie Hall, Carnegie Deli, 57th Street.Three or four more short blocks you are in Central Park or Times Square.The check in process was speedy, maybe because we got there at 4PM. There was a bell boy at the door to take care of the luggage.In the lobby there is a small cafeteria offering some choices in light food and beverages.We stayed at an upgraded room, reasonably big.The corridors have a pristine painting and carpetry, absolutely new.The room is very clean, as well as the bed linen.I believe that this hotel is reasonably priced for what it offers and that it´s location is superb for tourists in NY.In the room I felt some negative aspects: it can be noisy even on the 18th floor where we stayed; the window blind definitely does not block the daylight so get ready to wake up early ; they don´t have a minibar o fridge in the room and, the worst - and not understandable in a newly designed place - the shower curtain is just too short to the designed place so every bath will soak the bathroom to the soul !If you cannot find a nice to place to dine you must visist the food court in the basement of the Plaza Hotel - very chic and full of different food options.

We stayed at the Park Central for three nights. It has recently been renovated, with the public areas and rooms nicely decorated. Our room was considerably larger than many hotel rooms in NYC, and very comfortable and clean. The hotel is right across from Carnegie Hall, an easy two-block walk from the MOMA, and within easy distance of Central Park and many many nice restaurants. Apparently the room rates vary based on demand in the city, but we found the rates relatively reasonable during our stay (though variable even among the three nights we were there).

Apart from the bar staff, all other staff members were quite snooty. Furthermore, cleaners took a pair of shoes, gloves and hat the one time I didn't put awayThe hotel itself is charming, the rooms are comfortable and has the perfect location. I would definitely stay again because of its proximity to Central Park, Times Square and the metropolitan opera at Lincoln center. If you can cope with a little rudeness...recommended

Unless I'm performing at Carnegie Hall and need to get on stage quickly, I don't need to pay extra for the location. To be fair, the hotel is conveniently located, the room is clean and good sized, the TV is huge, the staff is courteous, but somewhat slow. There aren't enough elevators and there are few amenities, except for plenty of power outlets. There is no in-room coffee, the toilet paper is the cheap institutional type. Worst of all, the sound insulation is horrible, both between rooms and from the street noise. There was night time construction and a crying baby next door when I stayed and I was hardly able to sleep. For $100 less, I can get a room at a Hilton Garden Inn or Hampton Inn a few blocks away and get the same blandness but more amenities, and probably a better night's sleep.

Stayed two nights. Excellent location, of course. Good beds, excellent bathroom--bigger than most in NY and well appointed--made a big difference to people who are spoiled. Clean, good towels. Nice dresser with ample drawers. Good wifi.Two negatives: (1) the "resort fee" is bush league. Yes, you can just add it to the price when comparing. But it says bad things about management. (2) No Golf Channel (a small range of channels overall). Again, says something not good about management.Noisy music in the lobby, but there seems to be noisy music everywhere these days.

I am a New Yorker born and bred. Isince we were celebrating our 25th anniversary we decided to make a night of it and stay in a hotel in Manhattan. We were seeing a Broadway show, so I wanted a convenient location that would be walking distance. After doing extensive research we decided the Park Central would fit the bill in terms of location and affordability. I read some of the negative reviews so I was a bit skeptical, but I always take those reviews with a grain of salt. I booked through a third party website and it was made very clear that there was a $25 facilities fee. Whether or not I agree with the fee is irrelevant. It was made quite clear so I am not sure why other reviewers complained that they were unaware of it until they checked in. We arrived around 5:30 pm. The check in process was quick and the desk clerk friendly. She knew it was our anniversary and she "upgraded" us to a premium room. Not exactly sure what the difference was between our reserved room and the premium room but that was nice of her nonetheless. Our room was small compared to other hotels we have stayed in, but it was clean and modern. Although I have stayed in many, many hotels since I live in NYC I hadn't stayed in one in Manhattan for over 13 years. I am not sure if it is just the Park Central or Manhattan hotels in general, but there were not many amenities in the room at all. Since we were only staying one night it was not a big deal to me, but if we were staying longer a coffee maker and refrigerator in the room are nice to have. The bathroom was modern and very clean, however there were no amenities there as well. The shower did have the dispenser for body wash, shampoo and conditioner but the body wash was empty. There was one small bar of soap on the counter and a small lotion but that was it. We had a king size bed and it was very comfortable. I know other reviewers complained about the street noise and yes, you will hears cars, busses, sirens etc. but hey it is Manhattan after all so that didn't bother me as I hear that at home as well. Overall the hotel was very clean and served its purpose. You can't beat the location and the price for Manhattan.

Loved this hotel - it was ideally located within 5 minutes walk of Times Square. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable and well stocked with toiletries. Unfortunately there is no restaurant but as the hotel is central then there is plenty to eat close by. there is a small 'shop' for purchasing breakfast items, drinks, snacks etc which you can charge to your room. Would recommend the CitySightseeing Bus which can be accessed close by - although it is quite pricey it is the best way to get an overall view of the city.

We had a wonderful time. Park Central is so convenient to Carnegie Hall. It was clean and well appointed. It was also in walking distance to MOMA, Central Park, Rockerfeller Center, and many other well known sites. A variety of restaurants were also in the area.

I was impressed by the staff, the location and the cleanliness of this hotel. I stayed for 5 nights while traveling for business and did not have one negative experience. The staff was helpful with every request and very friendly. This is located in a great area of Manhattan. Great hotel for business or recreation travel.

As everyone has stated this hotel is really close to Times Square, Central Park, across the road from Carnegie Hall etc. so we had easy access to everything. The city tour busses ran just outside the hotel, there was a little deli next door where we got great coffee, sandwiches and cakes from. The room was nice but bit small. It was clean and had a great view onto the busy New York street below. I loved this place and the staff were very attentive too. Will definitely stay here again when I return to New York

I read a number of negative review and was somewhat nervous about going.I shouldn't have been. As noted the lobby was wonderful, but also the staff and the rooms, which were marvelous. Large, well furnished, very clean and as nice as I could hope for.I asked for extra towels and not only got them quickly and also got a message from guest services making sure I got them and was happy.Couldn't have asked for a nicer place in a better location. I will be back.Steve

Great location for first time NYC family visit. Close to walk to park, times square, top of the rock... clean/friendly. Not the cheapest hotel, but you get what you pay for. Rooms were very clean and entire atmosphere great!

We had a great weekend stay (24-26 April 2015) and were not disappointed. The location can't be beat. The neighborhood is great and it is easy to access other parts of the city. We had a good view of Carnegie Hall even though we didn't have a deluxe room. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were all friendly and helpful. The only negative is the line for the elevators is problematic, but many hotels have this problem. If people didn't bring ENORMOUS suitcases for a short stay then we could fit more people into the lift! The facilities fee covers wi-fi and allows for free luggage storage so I thought it was reasonable even if you don't use the health club. Finally, we got a great deal that included $10 per day valet parking- an amazing benefit. All in all, I felt it was a great deal and am pleased with our choice. Will definitely stay here again.

Stayed here for 5 nights so got to know it pretty well. After reading some of the reviews we did come prepared with a small travel kettle and some coffee. However I do think in this day and age these things really are a basic human need and really in a hotel of the stature it promotes really should provide a mini fridge too. Although much of what others have written is true we did not really experience much delays on the lifts, reception was good, lounge area we only used when waiting to leave but it was most comfortable. I think the lack of a restaurant is really bad though, when you are out sight seeing all day it would be really nice to come back and have room service or a nice coffee late in the evening at the bar or have a meal in the hotel instead of having to trudge the streets for something suitable rather than just burger bars. There are eateries around but they are fast food or coffee and muffins. Our room was like a UK premier inn good size with 2 queen beds with a view over the front door from 16th floor which was about as good as it gets here. The room was quiet all night and the beds were really comfy. The room was fairly clean but could have done with a bit more dusting. I think the house keepers have a lot to do in a day and have to rush some of the bits. We came back about 4 pm one afternoon and our room had not yet been touched and had to phone to get clean towels and the housekeeping lady then came and did our room after I asked her to as she was in the corridor. The in room movies was a good selection although had to phone to get it to work - also the bath plug didn't work had to phone for that to be fixed. All of which was done and reception did phone on all occasions to ensure I was happy. It is well placed for everything to see and central park is lovely. All in all we did our research and came prepared it would just be nice if kettle and fridge was supplied and an onsite restaurant would make this hotel great. Wifi was excellent and had no problems with it at all. I would use this hotel again.

The lobby is always a mess. The front desk is not helpful and there are always long lines. The rooms don't have good views.Traffic in the elevators is frustrating.The RESORT FEE(!!!) is sort of a scam. If you do stay for any reason make sure to enjoy central park as much as you can!

This is a well sized room that is clean. It's priced like a 2-star hotel but could be a 3-4 star. I came in on a red eye and they let me check in at 7:00 AM. Very grateful they went above and beyond. 5 minute walk to time square and 3 minutes to Central Park.

This is NOT 4 star hotel!!! It may have recently been refurbished but don't let the fresh look and swanky lobby fool you!!!The negatives;there are only two lifts and they are very slow so it takes ages to get to and from the room.Our room was dirty the bath had hair and grime in it and there was a dried up dirty flannel under the sink. The shower curtain barely fits over the bath edge, the shower is very slow to drain, you can't take the shower head of the wall. There are no coffee/tea making facilities in the room. Came in last night from a the cold. Just wanted a hot drink to warm up. Went to bar asked for a coffee, and the waitress was polite but said she was unable to serve hot drinks. There is a market place to get snacks and hot drinks but it closes at ten.Tried tonight to get a hot drink from market place at 9.30pm there was a guy there but he told us he was shut. Again no place to get a hot drink!!! Not a four star service.We have an internal room on 6th floor it is very very noisy. The air con unit outside is humming all night and is very intrusive!!Logging into the "free" WiFi took ages and wasn't simple, had to spend ages on phone to desk to get sorted.Hotel charge extra for services.... including free WiFi and fitness centre. Whether you use them or not, It just feels l like a rip off. Include it in the room rate fine,but adding it as a non optional extra just feels like a con. The positives;Location is good but so is every other hotel in Manhattan.Rooms are ok sized.Asked for / extra blanket and received them quickly.Staff are ok, some better than others but didn't really feel like they cared at all.This hotel would be fine as a value three star but as a relatively pricy four star I just feel completely ripped off!!! Not happy.

Great hotel. This was my first trip ever to NYC and was very happy this is where we stayed :) modern comfortable rooms, great service and the location was ideal. I was on a lower floor (level 2) but I didn't find it noisy at all. I also didn't find the lifts slow as some other reviews have mentioned. The location meant we could come back to the room in the middle of the day for a recharge as we had 2 children that needed to catch their breath whilst site seeing. My only negative is I would have liked a mini fridge in the room as it meant it was hard to buy a bottle of wine and then continually get ice for the ice bucket to keep it cold.Overall though, I would definitely stay again. Thanks for making my introduction to NYC so great!

Stayed for business this past week. Lobby is beautiful as is location which is just two short blocks from Central Park. Was disappointed that upon arrival a king bed was not available even though confirmed through reservation. Room was nice but small - typical for midtown hotels. Bathroom was problematic. Shower curtain too short for shower and water was going all over floor. Dispenser for soap/shampoo/conditioner worked poorly and water pressure in shower was terrible. Disappointing.....

As usual the Park Central did not let me down! Had a fantastic stay this past weekend (April 16-20 2014) and could not be happier. I have stayed here many times over the years, weather for business or pleasure, and I will continue to do so. First, there is the location. You could not ask for a better spot in the city. Close to everything you need/want on a trip to NYC. All in walking distance. Second, cleanliness. The rooms (and the hotel itself) are very VERY clean, with big comfortable rooms and fantastic beds! Always a great sleep after a long day out in the city. The bathrooms are also very large, super clean and have perfect lighting. Part of enjoying any trip is knowing you are in a clean, safe and relaxing environment. Third, there is the staff. Really one of the nicest group of people you could ever meet. Always a smile, an offer to help, or a solution to a problem (that rarely comes up) I have friends who live in NYC who ask if they can stay with me to just to enjoy the room and the atmosphere at the hotel. The lobby smells like a garden-they should bottle it, and even though it's a busy hotel, it never seems "frantic" or disorderly. I have come to think of this hotel as my "home away from home"! I have stayed at other hotels before I found the Park Central and always felt let down. Check it out if you are planning a trip to the "Big Apple"-you won't regret your decision. Have fun!!

This hotel's location is really amazing - two blocks from Central Park, across the street from Carnegie Hall, and a short walk from Broadway. The rooms are pretty new and although you won't find a lot of the things that you might be used to from staying at chain hotels - such as bathrobe, slippers, fridge and coffee maker - you will be happy with the cleanliness and size of the rooms. The gym is also pretty good, they have a few of everything (treadmill, cross trainer etc) and anything you will need to work out such as earphones, water, wet towels etc. I will definitely consider staying here again the next time I visit NYC.

Booked via a 3rd party discount site and was really only concerned with price, location, and cleanliness. I'm happy to report that the Park Central not only met but far exceeded my expectations. First off, the location is ideal - walking distance to most everything we wanted to see. For those sights requiring transport, the subway was just steps away. The hotel smells divine - very welcoming coming off of the street. Front desk staff was pleasant and accommodating. We arrived on a red eye and although our room wasn't quite ready, they checked our bags, offered us directions/map. I had anticipated this and we spent a few hours having breakfast and visiting a museum before returning to the hotel around 2pm, where they handed us our keys. Bellman service was speedy when we went to retrieve our bags. We were on the 6th floor, facing an interior courtyard overlooking the HVAC. Not an ideal view, but we didn't care and enjoyed having no street noise. Room wasn't huge but was more generously sized than most NYC rooms. Bathroom was small but, again not outside of the range of normal. We had 2 doubles (2 adults, 1 child) and there was plenty of room.The resort fee was clearly explained to us upon arrival (and was referenced when we booked), so we had no issue with the charge. Wifi was easy to connect (we had 4 devices connected) and was speedy enough to even allow my daughter to stream Netflix without issue.No coffee maker in the room but there are about 5 coffee shops within steps of the hotel. Not a big deal to run out and grab something. There was a cafe/quick serve place in the lobby - we picked up water there but didn't try any food. Didn't try the bar either.Upon checkout, the bellman got us a car to JFK immediately, despite it pouring rain.I would most definitely stay here again.

I just spent a great week there with my family.The hotel has an excellent location and can walk basically to the main places like Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, MoMA, 5th Avenue, Broadway theaters and many good restaurants and museums.The personal is great, specially Elizabeth Cacovic, their guest relations manager. Who always was looking to make our visit as comfortable and seamless as possible.She gave us a very good recommendations to have a dinner just a few steps from the hotel.And shared us an excellent tips to do in the city during our stay and for our futures visits.Definitely I will back again and will contact her to make my trip more enjoyable

What a nice hotel with friendly staff, spacious clean rooms and ample lounge and bar area. I booked this hotel based on the close proximity to Carnegie Hall due to traveling with an elderly family member. Although I had requested an early check in, none of our rooms were ready mid-afternoon so we had to check luggage and forgo changing and freshening up after our long day of traveling. Despite this, our stay was great and we would look for this property in the future.

After reading reviews and our initial impression of the lobby, we were a little wary of the hotel. It IS in a great location, but so are a lot of hotels in the city. We liked our room. A lot. The décor was relatively modern, but not too modern and although I wouldn’t call it a “luxury” hotel, it was a “very nice” hotel. We were pleased to find that our room (which was probably a handicap accessible room) was large with a comfortable bed and lots of spare space. The room had 2 huge windows where the folks across the way could obviously see in (since we could see them). So if this bothers you, you might want to ask for a room that faces the street. The bathroom was also a good size with a lot of (what appeared to be handicap) bars on the wall. We didn’t mind them. The one knock on the room was that it didn’t have a separate shower and tub and yes, I realize that most of the rooms in NYC are built this way.Other than house cleaning who knocked on our door at least twice each morning, the staff all seemed reasonably happy and helpful. And as my husband pointed out as we were leaving that had we put the “Privacy Please” sign out, we would have saved the poor woman a little aggravation. (Sorry about that.) The only place we ate at in the hotel was to grab quick breakfasts in the morning at the little store in the lobby which had delicious pastries and coffee. In addition to Carnegie Deli being right next door, there were lots of restaurants in easy walking distance so that is what we did in the evening.The location is very good to great if your purpose for being in the city is to attend shows. Times Square, Broadway and Radio City Hall were all about a 10 minute walk. There were also a few subway stations very close with the closest being less than a block away.Overall, we enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again.

I usually look for hotel deals for under $250 per night when going to NYC. This time I decided to spend a little bit more. For the price I think it was worth it. The hotel is well located, walking distance to central park and time square(if you are into that). Subway entrance right on the corner(N,Q,R lines). Staff was friendly the few times we encountered them. The room was a really good size, compared to all the other hotels that we stayed in the past. I actually had room to walk around in the room. Our room was on the 14th floor, didn't really hear any street noise. I would stay here again. The room came with wifi. Not sure if that was included in our bill, i forget.. Either way.. Good enough for me.

Park Central is a nice hotel, fully renewed with excellent location. Close to the heart of Manhattan is a smart choice, a place you will find comfort and quality, not expensive luxury. Hotel charges a fee that is not optional for services, including the wifi internet access that works really well. Just ensure you are aware that this will be added to your room fee.

The location of this hotel is great. Close to Central Park and Times Square, with a subway stop just outside the door. The beds were comfortable, and the room size more than adequate. However. We always waited for front desk help--no matter what time of day. There are no coffee makers in the rooms, although they will give you one, if they have them available, if you ask. WiFi was unbelievably difficult to log on to and when we called with our problem were given a tech support number to call that took forever to answer and resolve the issue. There is a nice bar/lounge area behind the front desk, but they do not serve any food. Not even peanuts. The small coffee shop/food stand in the lobby is only open 6:30 - 22:30, so if you are having a late night drink there's no food to go with it. Conversely, if you are an early riser and have not requested a coffee maker you have to exit the hotel to get a cup of coffee (not fun when the weather is inclement). The rooms were clean, but for the price I have stayed at other midtown hotels that had better amenities.

Four of us stayed at Park Central for a weekend girls' trip. The staff is polite and helpful, the lobby is nice and inviting and the location is great! The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were quiet and clean. We will definitely choose Park Central for our next NYC trip.

This is a lovely venue in a very busy area between Times Sq and Columbus Circle. It's a good place to be if you're a tourist, not so good for peaceful, quiet streets, but I knew that when I booked. My 4th floor room was larger than any at a boutique hotel, with a window that looked out on other buildings. Nice decor, comfy beds, large bathroom. The staff was most agreeable. Checkout time is noon, an hour later than most. Surprisingly, no on site restaurant, but many comfy chairs for lounging in behind the main desk. There are so many places to eat nearby that it's not a big deal. My only quibble is that I was charged $25.00 for "incidentals" - wifi and I don't know what else. This seems to be an unfortunate trend that hotels have picked up from the airlines - soon there will be machines that measure O2 used so you can be charged for eevry breath you take. I booked through Venere and I can't remember if I was informed about this fee when I made my booking. I'll be on the lookout for it from now on.

This was my second of three weekends I booked at Park Central and just like my first everything was great. The hotel is clean and the service is beyond good and the location is perfect for what we like to do when in the city. My few little complaints. I don't like the $25 charge for the gym and wi-fi. Check-in sometimes gets backed up and is slow. Both times when I checked in there appeared to be a problem with one guest because they were at the desk the whole time slowing things down. Finally the bar they close at 11:30 on weekends, they should extend to midnight. Each night I was there they were sending guests home. By the way, last call is 11:15.Another gem of a deal is the $10 parking option, that saves me $100 for the weekend. This is my new go to place when we head into the city. See you in June

Really I've never stayed in a better smelling hotel. Very clean, good and safe location right across the street from Carnegie Hall where my son was performing. Quick and easy check in even tho their credit card machine was down. Room was nice sized, very upscale modern decorating. Great pillows! A bit noisy on the street side, but it's New York City after all! The concierge easily assisted me in getting a shuttle to the airport. The hostess in the lounge was very friendly and helped me arrange several tables together for our party of seven. Expensive drinks but yummy. I'd stay here again, definitely!

I traveled from CA to NYC on the redeye, with a request for early checkin. When I arrived at the Hotel there ween't any rooms available for early checkin. I was told I could check back every hour or so to see if anything was ready. I asked if I could get a text message once the room was ready, so I didn't have to keep coming back, stand in line and checkin. The receptionist indicated they do not do that and coming back or trying to call was my only option. I wasted most of my day walking back and forth checking to see if my room was ready. Once I checked in, there is no room service, no restaurant and no blow drier in my room=( I was sick the next day and couldn't get anything for over 24hrs. I would never think a Hotel this expensive would have ZERO accommodations and a terrible checkin process. No text alerts???

we got moved her from another hotel because of expedia and we glad we were.. this is very well located to central park and 10 mins to the center of times square.. we loved the hotel .. and the lobby was gorgeous..especially the bar area... although we never had a drink as we had no menu or idea of prices. the room was lovely and nearly on the end of the building to get a road view to times square but was one away... fairly noisy with the outside traffic (constant bibbing) and nice sized room. There is resort fees - we did not get a daily morning paper or anything other then wifi - BUT the wifi was fantastic and had no issues once we connected so was happy with that! the main issue we had was a small but annoying one - there was no ice cube machine working on our level and you cant access any other levels unless you go by elevator which was annoying .. so we could not use the ice machines - Staff were ok - polite - apart from the bag hold - they were not very helpful and were rude on both occasions we used them. we enjoyed the location - and the beds were nice .. would we stay here again - possibly...

Excellent location and very kind staff.Close to Central Park, Museum of Modern Art, Apple Store, Carnegie Hall, Broadway, Columbus Circle, subway stations.The room was very well cleaned.I do recommend this hotel.

Quimby Hightower took great care of us. He is a wonderful, personable Director of Guest Experience. He and his staff helped us find our way and get situated for the night. My daughter and her friends were delighted to have such a positive person greet us. His welcoming spirit set the tone for our visit and his smile lit up the hotel lobby. My daughter's two friends were in NYC for the first time, and Quimby was their first impression for the hotel and NYC. Quimby set the tone for a great experience for all of us.

Perfectly located right across the street from the world famous Carnegie hall and right next door to the even more famous Carnegie Deli. Only 1 block away from Central park..what more could you ask for.The rooms, even though only just revamped were still (in my opinion) just ever so slightly dated. The main bar and service though were superb. As this was just a short weekend trip for my daughter 16th the concierge service was superb in helping me find a bakery open on the day of her birthday (Sunday) that would deliver a cake.Not the best hotel in the city but from far the worst for the rate.

Park Central hotel is excellent, it's locate at the centre of the world for a decent price, Room are super clean and modern Next time I'll be in NYC, we will book this hotel again for sureClose to main attraction, and of course Central Park I really recommend it, enjoy

Park Central was highly recommended to us by friends. It is situated in a great location. Times Square, Central Park, 30 Rock all very near. Even Carnegie Deli is just a block away. Rooms were nice. Didn't have any coffee machines, but Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, and other cafes were really nearby. Staff was all nice. I especially remember Muhammad who helped us with our luggage. He was extremely friendly and helpful!Thank you!

Park Central is one of the very few hotels that carry on a business practice that is borderline deceptive. The advertised rate of the hotel doesn't include facilities fee thus making it appears cheaper than other comparable hotels. When do price comparison, be a smart shopper and add at least $25 to the Park Central advertised rate to make a fair comparison to other hotels. The hotel is actually very nice. The front desks are sufficiently pleasant. The lobby smells great and the rooms are nice and modern. Two evaluators can be slow and too full to get in during morning and evening rush. Great midtown location. Without the deplorable hidden fee practice, I would have rated this hotel higher. Let's keep complaining until they stop this practice and just advertise the real rate like other hotels.

Stayed at the Park Central hotel for 6 nights with my daughter we were in room 743 which was a twin bedded room on the 7th floor. We booked through Jetsetter and got a very good rate. Our room was very clean and were given clean towels every day. One check in reception gave us a code for internet access which was free of charge. You can also use the computers in the lobby to check your e-mail etc at no additional cost. The staff were very helpful . We had breakfast to go each morning from a restaurant across from the hotel which was very good valueWe wanted to extend our stay and asked reception if we could have the same rate as we were paying she said no and gave us a silly price I asked her for a better rate and was told it would be cheeper to book via booking.com for an extra 2 nights I explained to her to avoid the OTA she told me she was not allowed We both stayed the extra nights at The Wellington Hotel across the road from the Park Central who gave us the reduced rate. I would stay again at the Park central due to its location and very nice bedrooms shame about the last 2 nights

I spend 50% of my time traveling around the world. First time I feel like an invisible guest at a hotel. No reactivity to any customer ask... I had issues with the TV in my room and at the the water fountain at the gym (no glasses available) and it took ages until anybody was sent. Had to call several times to remind them.

The staff were welcoming and helpful. The room was nice and tidy! The location was perfect. It was just a short walk to times square and a short walk to central park. We loved park central and would definitely book again!

Fantastic mid town location, lots of great restaurants nearby and close to both Times Square and Central Park.Rooms were very spacious for NYC, we travelled as two friends sharing a twin share room and had more than enough space for the two suitcases etc.Bathroom is a decent size, however the addition of the towel rail inside the shower is a bit odd and rather inconvenient. Good amount of bench space for make up. Staff provided us with a map and check in and check out were very easy and quick. There is a nice café next door and a Starbucks two doors down for easy breakfast. We had a cocktail at the bar which was also very nice. Would stay again.

We chose this hotel due to it's location and the other reviews we had seen.The location was great, just up the road from Times Square. Unfortunately the staff and the facilities were a real let down.We are a family of 5, young kids who wanted their own room. We requested joining rooms when booking, and at check in I asked for this again. The snooty guy at the desk said this is what he was giving us and handed us the keys.When we got to the rooms, they were 4 doors apart.The snooty bloke was extremely unhelpful, he confirmed that joining rooms were available, but since we had used the rooms, he couldn't change us. The air-conditioning doesn't work if it's not hot enough outside, even if the rooms are too hot to breathe in, there are no coffee or tea facilities in the rooms, the hotel doesn't even have a pool, but charges a resort fee.Overall the staff are unfriendly and not helpful, the hotel claims 4 star, but is only 3 at best.

Upon checking in I was given a room that was already occupied. Granted I came in 8pm so it wasn't nornal check in hours but that's still very disappointing for a midtown hotel. The rooms are very modern, beautiful actually. shower is well designed. Room temperature well controlled. The smell of the hallway was terrible tho.

I spent one night at this hotel because my family from Switzerland came to visit me in New York.Park Central is located in the center of Manhattan, 10 minutes away from Times Square by foot.You have the N, Q and R lines right across the hotel, which is very convenient.Starbucks is next to it in case you like coffee. You're close to Central Park as well.The room was roomy, nice bathroom, it was very clean and the heater was on point, had to turn it on all the time because it was pretty cold, so I guess it isn't well insulated. The bed was extremely comfy, big enough for 2 people (we had 2 beds).The lobby is well designed. Unfortunately I can't tell you anything about the bar because I didn't have a drink there.Staff was friendly.When my family left the hotel, a member of the staff proposed them to take the hotel's car to drive them to the airport and said $65 all included, that wasn't true. It came out to $75 (without tips). Overall, I had a pleasant night.

The rooms, which have clearly been renovated within the past 5 years or so, are comfortable. The bathrooms are quite stylish. However, certain amenities I would associate with a 4-start hotel are lacking: no dining room or café (though there are two coffeeshops in the same building -- outside entrance in each case), no fridge in the room, not even a single bottle of water provided. The wifi (which was included in the price of my room) has very good signal strength.

It is a wonderful hotel best location close to the central park and close to time square everything close by and 5th and 7th are just around the the next bend.There are some amazing places to eat like the deli down the street towards downtown.The service here are super.

Very close to at least two subway lines, to the Central Park, and to the most famous stores at 5th Ave. Also close to the trendy restaurant Carnegie Deli. That is the best advantage of the hotel. The bedroom is comfortable, clean, but the amenities, like shampoo and soap, could be much better. There is no breakfast, but if you pay US$ 1 extra per person/night in advance, you can take a croissant with something to drink in a cafe in the lobby. I didn't try, but looked ok.

Very nice hotel. Front desk staff not very attentive but the doormen were great as well as the bartender john c. Bar doesn't serve food and there's no restaurant on premises. Just a little coffee/ pastry shop.No fridges or microwaves in the rooms.

Park Central was a perfect hotel option for my husband and I during our first visit to New York. It is centrally located just blocks away from Central Park and Times Square, and very easily accessible by subway. Since we were so close to everything, we found that we walked to most of our destinations during our trip.Our room was very comfortable throughout our stay. When we first checked in, we were given a pretty tight room with a not to pleasant view of an ugly brick building; however, we contacted front desk to request a room change and they were able to move us to a much better room the next morning with a perfect view of Carnegie Hall. While the rooms are not the most luxurious, they are definitely comfortable enough for a few days, and the price that you pay definitely has good value. This hotel was quite affordable compared to other four star hotels in the area.I really don't have anything negative to say about this hotel and would definitely stay here again during my next visit to New York.

Plus pointsGreat location, so close to Times Square/Central Park/ Tour buses and subway stations. Fantastic modern room with huge comfy bed and lovely bathroom. Brilliant tv and friendly service with staff who are quick to sort any issues. Cleanliness is great as is facilities.Minus PointsOn a family holiday with my parents and both booked the same grade of room but theirs is twice the size of ours. Room sometimes not made up until early evening.Overall these are very slight niggles that I am sure the hotel would resolve if we raised them. We are pleased with our booking.

We were happy as a family to have stayed here overnight.The staff were quite pleasant and helpful. The updated and modern look helped in making our stay very comfortable.The place is accessible to train station/subways trains that are can take you to east west.We enjoyed the touristy areas and also more upscale locations in upper west and eastside.We also were able to visit downtown and the village during our stay.Will definitely recommend

We spent nine nights at the Park Central. We chose the hotel because we received a promotional offer for an average daily room rate of $275 including taxes (and the insidious facility fee of about $27/day). For central Manhattan this is a decent deal, especially given the quality of the room and location. The hotel is a short walk to Central Park, Carnegie Hall, MOMA, Times Square and many other attractions as well as convenient for all subway lines. The room has been renovated, is spacious and comfortable. Many have written about problems with service but we were generally satisfied. That said, the desk staff was surprisingly unfriendly and the lobby is frequently jam-packed with tour groups.

I love Tripadvisor, so I would like to relate my recent experience with the Park Central Hotel in New York City. I was there for 2 nights over Easter Weekend with my Daughters. I paid up for the Corner room with 2 Queen Beds. Supposedly their larger of the standard hotel rooms. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable. The furniture was modern and sparse. As a whole the room wasn't very large. Rooms as a whole in NY aren't very large. The Bathroom was very skinny. In fact when you open the door you have to be careful. It will hit the Toilet. They put door stops on the hinges. It got the Job done. There were 3 of us and 3 towels. I got the impression keeping cost down in general was a theme in the Hotel. I didn't request more. I am sure they would have provided them. Overall pretty clean and somewhat remodeled. They did a nice job on the lobby. The worst part of the hotel is the elevators. I stayed no the 17th floor. There were only 2 elevators. They are small and always packed. I had to send my family down 1 at a time with our luggage. I let 2 go by full and it took 3 more before the 3 of us made it down with our bags. Unfortunately the elevator issue was there every time we used it. Up or down. The very best part of this hotel is its location. 56th and 7th. Broadway, Central Park, shopping..You name it and you are close. You aren't paying the price of the big boys (not cheap, but not expensive). We averaged 400 a night. Be aware they will tack on a 25 dollar insult charge or facilities charge per night. I would rather see that in the price of the room. Overall, I would probably stay there again, because of the location. I give it 3 star rating. If the deal with the Elevator issues, I would give more. Location, location and location.

My husband and I spent 4 nights here on our 1st trip to NYC. The classic room was spacey and reasonably priced. It was in a great location within walking distance to almost anything you could need. Our only complaint was the $28 per night charge for a "resort fee" which is for Internet and phone calls neither of which we used. Also, we were woken up twice after long nights out. The first day was a voice over a loud intercom alerting for fire alarm tests at 9:30am. The next was a knock from housekeeping even though our DND sign was in the door also around 9am. Our room was 1424 and they meant to go to 1425!! Other than that it was very comfortable. Do not get snacks & drinks from the cafe...go to any of the 5-10 places on the block outside of the hotel. We paid $11 for a bottle of water and a coke at the cafe! If in NYC again we would consider staying here but would look at comparable options before booking.

Made the reservation for what has become an annual visit to the city during the Easter holiday for my sons' piano recital at Carnegie hall. We arrived 6 hours earlier than check in and the front desk staff was very helpful getting us a room to check in early. The room was a reasonable size for NY standards and very clean. Modern decor and obviously newly renovated. A very well equipped fitness center and a pretty bar area for gathering with friends are an added bonus. No complaints, overall a good stay close to Carnegie Hall at a reasonable price!

The price and location were great. Close a couple different subway stations. Walking distNce to Carnegie hall, Rockefeller, radio city, time square, and Central Park. We had a double room with two double beds. The room was great. It had a bi closet between the two beds that Allowed for some privacy. The downsides would be that the thermostat did not work. It never got cooler than 72 in our room. The temperature was not awful, but the room got stuffy and stale. Also, the elevators were very small and very very slow. Due to the size, they were often full and you would have to wait quite a while for another one. The $1 breakfast was with it. All in all, if the thermostat was working I would stay there again.

We booked this hotel because of a great deal I found online. It's what you'd expect for the rate, that's for sure. The lobby is very modern looking with a tall bar behind the front desk and a small deli near the elevators. The staff was nice, nothing out of the ordinary, and weren't a problem the entire trip. The room itself was average, our room had two poorly made queen sized beds overlooking Grand Central. The decor consisted of NYC skyline photos and other flimsy commodities. Pros of the room would be the giant tv, nice view and large(r) beds. The cons would have to be the bathrooms, which were tiny and unpleasant, and the unbelievably loud A/C. Besides these speed bumps there is one thing the Park Central has that is hard to find for the money... location. The Park Central is located only 3 "short blocks" from Times Square and has a metro station 20 meters from the entrance. So, all in all the Park Centrals cheap rates don't give you anything other than standard but cash out on location.

Very close to a metro station, Central Park and all major attractions and museums.Stayed just for one night.The double room was modern and well maintained but relatively small, with the two beds taking most of the place. The beds were very comfortable and big enough to accommodate two people each.Good quality of bedlinen. Small modern -renovated- bathroom, but in a very good condition and very clean.The only negative thing was that the room was looking inside and the noise coming from the machines installed on the ground floor was annoying, even on the 10th floor.Valet parking for 10$ a day was a great value!

Massive. Clean.zoo ok for kids park interesting could wander and did for hours kids liked all different parks inside only downside was finding toilets! stayed West side visited few times nice but budy sanctuary in the city

This is the second time we've stayed in 3 months and we came back mainly because the staff is so great. From the warm welcome from the bellman Carmelo as we pulled up to valet park, to the hellos we received from the front desk and cleaning staff, they made us feel right at home. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, and we love the shampoo, conditioner and body wash that is attached to the shower wall. And you just can't beat the locale. We like that it's near everything but not too busy or congested on the streets in front of it. Great time all around!!

Everyone was rude at some point. Every time i went to Someone to tell them that ive been waitig for about an hour for my luggage they ended up answering poorly and rude. And it's been just the first day. Super busy hotel but they're not trained to treat with people or at least that's been my experience. I would have known this so I could have booked a different hotel. Stayed here just because it was the only one available close by.

The hotel was nice and hotel staff was accessible. Just beware of the hidden fees. They charge $25 plus tax for every night you stay there. That is a blatant scam. They should add it to the overall price. It is a sneaky move that they do to think that you are paying less for a hotel that costs you way more. I had to pay from my own pocket because my work didn't recognize the extra charge. Thank you very much...

This hotel is comfortable, clean and beautiful and you can't beat the location! Three blocks from Central Park and walking distance to Times Square.
