An easy subway ride down to the High Line, Greenwich Village, SoHo etc. I went as a group so I really can't comment on the service or prices but I enjoyed my stay in this hotel.However...a couple suggestions for hotel management:- the rooms are very dark (I couldn't even distinguish my clothes from my friend's clothes in the closet and I got a headache if I tried to read anything in the room. The other people in our group all said the same thing. You definitely need to add more light.- way too much fragrance in the lobby (some people are allergic to these scents and having it constantly pumping into the lobby is unnecessary if not offensive)- there is no towel rack in the bathroom; also, get with the rest of the world and do not replace towels every day. Put up a towel rack so that your guests can help you save some water- you really need to improve the elevator situation; a couple times we waited in line for three elevators to go up until we could get on one. These changes will make this a fantastic hotel.

The hotel was nice. The lobby and bar were impressive. The room was "ok", I'd say just above average. Look out for the hidden "resort" fee's. I stayed at this hotel for one and only used it to shower and sleep. I did not spend any time in the hotel so that "resort" fee was money down the drain. I would stay here again. Just know that you will be paying more than you think.

My partner and I stopped here for our first visit to New York and were so happy with our decision. The main reason we picked the hotel was because of location and it didn't disappoint - a 5/10 minute walk from Time Square and a 3/5 minute walk from Central Park made it absolutely perfect. When we arrived we were blown away by the reception area and the bar area which we happily drank in a couple of times rather than heading out. The room was a fantastic size and came with the most comfortable beds (as well as having the advantage of being King size for extra room!) The staff were brilliant and very helpful, all in all we couldn't have asked for more from our stay and we will definitely use again if we return to New York

Beautiful hotel..clean rooms...staff was very helpful. Great location...right in the heart of everything. Times Square to the right and central park to the left..Carnegie Hall across the street...I didn't give excellent score because of the noise factor. But that is not the hotels fault. Will defiantly be back!!

We chose this hotel as it was exactly where we need. On arrival we were upgraded to 2 double rooms. We came out of the hotel and if we went left we went to Central Park, right was down to Times to Square. The rooms and beds comfortable, just what you need after a full day on the go. The rooms could perhaps do with a little freshening up, we weren't in there for any length of time, it was just a base to sleep and shower. The bar was good with reasonable prices for drinks and what you would expect to pay in New York. We didn't use the restaurant so can't comment. The staff were helpful and friendly, I would definitely stay here again.

Great hotel. Centrally located. Rooms were spotlessly cleaned. Maritza did a great job! Sadly we only had two days to explore the city, but the staff was great. Will definitely return - the bar is also a great place to watch sports!

I keep returning as the hotel is great - i like the modern refurbished rooms. In particular the bar team - John and Nancy - are fantastic and very welcoming. It is just a shame the bar doesn't offer food.Here are some tips:1. There is no restaurant. Dont expect bar food or a warm breakfast. There is a shop that sells pastries and drinks. But there are so many places nearby it wasn't an issue for me.2. The hotel charges a mandatory $25 service fee on top of thr room rate for internet per day. 3. You can often get a cheaper rate if you book on a cell phone - I found it to be $50/night cheaper at one time. If you almost book and then cancel, you may get an email the next day with a 10% discount code. 4. If you use their "fixed rate" airport taxi service make sure you agree the rate with the driver not the concierge. I found the concierge offers a fixed price $50) which it turns out is about $20 less than what the driver asks for.Despite a few flaws I really like this hotel and will be back.

The room had an odd odor, musty kind of smell. The room was small. If you are doing one night and by yourself, it is a good place. If you are taking your family to see NYC and spend a few days, well, pick another hotel. As mentioned with other reviewers the $25 fee they charge seems to be a bit of a scam. I almost didn't get the room because of this but they still were cheaper then other hotels. The front desk staff were very friendly.

Nicely decorated, smart hotel. Very close to central park, Broadway and nice restaurants. Staff are very nice and helpful. Bathroom could have been cleaner, found an old hair tie on shelf and marks on tiles. Bedding could have been more luxurious, it was rather thin considering the outside temperature!

This is the 3rd time I have been to this hotel within a year, the reason for this is, the room's comfort the hotel location, the employees just like the first 2 time all very friendly and happy to help.I have already recommended this hotel to another two friends that have also already booked!But what I would really like to point out is the outstanding work of Mrs.Cacovic. Very friendly, helpful and also very professional even in hard situations . Why? before I left Germany, I had to ordered some things and she made it possible for the items to be therefore the start of my stay, even with the problems that occurred with the sending were professionally organized by her. again very professional and helpful always with a smile.The hotel is lucky to have an employee like her.Ralf.

First, the pros: everyone was friendly and when we needed the drain in our bathtub fixed, the engineer was quick and obliging. The concierge and desk personnel were also helpful and courteous. A Mr. Quinby was very helpful in straightening out a problem we had with housekeeping (more on this below). Finally, the location was excellent.The cons (and the reasons why, on balance, I doubt we’ll stay here again): A minor irritant was the lack of a coffee maker and microwave. I’ve stayed at number of hotels, both cheap and expensive. The Park Central was the first that did not provide a small coffee maker and microwave for the convenience of guests. There was also no refrigerator. These three items would have gone a long way to making our stay more convenient and, considering the rate the Park Central charges, patrons have every right to expect them.A greater nuisance, however, were the problems with housekeeping. On the second day of our stay, the person cleaning the room threw out our daughter’s retainer. It will be expensive to replace. On two evenings, we came home exhausted after miles of walking the museums and streets of Manhattan to a room that had not been given even a superficial sprucing-up: garbage pails were unemptied, beds unmade, and the same damp towels and face cloths were in a pile where we had left them for the attendant. The first time it happened, it took housekeeping two hours to send someone to do the job, which they did only after Mr. Quinby took the matter in his own hands. By the time the woman arrived, however, my exasperated wife had already made the beds: we settled for new towels and plastic cups. To his credit, Mr. Quinby reduced our facility fee by about half in compensation. When the same thing happened the following day, housekeeping sent someone to clean the room within ten minutes after my call. It is worth noting that in neither case had I left the “Do not disturb” sign on the door: there was no reason why the room should not have been cleaned.My theory is that the hotel does not have enough people on their housecleaning staff. As a result, they are overstretched and if they can’t get to a room on their schedule (on one day, a woman looked in our room at 9:00 am to see if we had vacated) then they may not get to it at all. Whatever the reason, however, the hotel needs to address this basic expectation of its patrons.

Had one day stay.. Excellent location in Manhattan and within 200 mtrs of times square and central park.. What else could I have asked... Snowfall added more joy.. Just get swayed away in the streets of new York.. No words to say.. Hotel had nice room. N great staff..

Ooooooooooh, this is rich. So, Park Central already charges a junk "Facilities Fee" of $25/night, supposedly for the luxuries of local & long distance phone, wifi, and gym. So I get my bill for 2 nights, and it shows $50 Facilities Fee, PLUS another $2.20 for "Local Phone!"After calling the front desk and being placed on hold for 5 minutes, I was informed "sorry about that, we'll remove it. You must have called Canada or something." (I did not call Canada.)I asked to speak to the General Manager. "I'm sorry, I'm not allowed to connect you to that person."It's bad enough to pay $25 junk fees. But I'm not sure my blood pressure can handle ALSO having to waste time while I'm checking out in the morning to track someone down, wait on hold, and have a $2.20 fee removed from my bill.Can you FEEL the FRUSTRATION.

Excellent location close to all the main NYC attractions. Clean rooms, friendly helpful staff. The two lifts got pretty busy at times with queues forming, but overall I reckon it was good value for this part of town. I would return.

We stayed 3 nights here using an Amazon Local deal that brought the price down to about $150 a night. Not only was it a bargain, but we were able to walk everywhere we went. We saw a wonderful play at City Center which was right across the street. Paul Taylor company at Lincoln Center was only a few blocks walk as was the Radio City Spring show. MOMA was only 2 or 3 blocks away and our last night, we attended the Signature Theatre which was around the corner from Port Authority where we caught a bus home. The room was large with 2 queen sized beds. Both the front desk staff and the Concierge were extremely helpful.

This hotel is packed with school spring break trips. While the lobby area is very nice, the rooms are average and nothing special. You can find a much nicer hotel for the same price that is not filled with 100s of school kids and few chaperones. I am travelling with my teenage daughter and friend, so I am not anti-child, just anti hotels that are designed for large groups of unsupervised teenagers.

Pros:-Perfect location to NYC attractions-Modern, spacious rooms-Affordable-Nice Lobby and Bar area-Complimentary baggage checkCons:-No fan in bathroom-Long wait to check in (30 minutes, they only had one person working)-Overwhelming perfume scent in lobby-$50/ night fee on top of room rateOverall, I would stay here again for that price. Only blocks to Times Square and Central Park.

I booked this hotel for a quick short stay to visit a friend in NYC. As predicted, I got to the hotel at 12:45 and they did not have any rooms ready, fine, but the reception I got was close to none, and I felt I was not welcomed at all by the young lady at the front desk. No big deal, but being in the industry for over 10 years, I was surprised, since they are rated 4 star+ ( basic courtesy should be included here).Once I arrived late at night after a long day, I requested for my room key to a front desk staff again, not one hello, or a " enjoy your stay". When I got to the room I was surprised by a strange smell, coming from the bathroom, I went to check to find out there was a urine stain in the shower curtain, yes, urine stain - meaning they used products to "clean"but did not wash the curtain before the next guest went in...I was exhausted, so I was dreading calling the desk to inform them about this. But I then made up my mind to call them because I was trying to use the Internet wifi and it wouldn't work.I called the operator, and after being on hold 3 times by the front desk I said please, I would like to speak to a manager, I then got through to a front desk person who said lines like: I'm sorry but we have no rooms available for you to change to at this moment" and there must be something wrong with your cell phone ( about the wifi) "nobody else is having issues with the wifi".After all the nonsense from the front desk, and being tired, I literally gave up. One hour later ( 23:30) I get a call from a lady called Elizabeth, she was kind enough to say that, they indeed have a room I could change to, and was surprisingly helpful, but too late, I was exhausted, upset and really just wanted to wake up and leave the next day.The next morning as I dropped the key, I was greeted by a Guest relations personnel, and as I left she asked if I had enjoyed my stay, and I briefly told her what happened, again, she didn't show that much concern, and convinced me to write this review.There are many other hotels in similar category that deserve my stay.

My partner and I have just returned from our 4th stay at the Park Central from Australia and once again can not give enough compliments. From the breezy check in process which saw us up in our room within 5 mins of arrival at the hotel (and the lovely clerk who offered us a complimentary city map) to the efficient housekeeping staff who always did an outstanding job whilst we we were out playing in the city and the staff at Central Market who always greeted us with smiles.The room was once again immaculately clean on check in and fitted with all amenities in great working order.I wasn't sure what to expect this trip after reading some of the more recent reviews however there were no hidden charges and fee's on my booking (possibly because I read the terms and conditions when booking directly through the hotel and was fully aware of the facilities fee which I was more than happy to pay for rather than the old $14 per day Internet service and my partner enjoyed the complimentary use of the fitness center), I never once encountered a rude or unhelpful staff member and again can safely say that the Park Central feels more like a home to me when I visit New York each time I stay there.Looking forward to my next trip back and can not recommend this hotel enough.

This storied hotel has a notorious past, which initially attracted us. Arnold Rothstein, the gambler who fixed the 1919 World Series, was killed here in 1928, and mob boss Albert Anastasia was gunned down here in 1957. Things have become quieter since then, and no trace of the hotel's violent past is evident. We had a tastefully decorated but small room with good-quality plumbing and fixtures, plenty of towels, comfortable bed and very helpful staff from the curb to the cleaning staff. Convenient to Broadway shows, good restaurants of all sorts, Carnegie Hall and the gateway to Central Park.But the view from our 7th floor room over looking the HVAC system was of perpetual night. No matter the time of day, the sunlight never peeked over the rim of the top of this huge hotel into the canyon below. The view from our window looked at two other walls of the hotel canyon with similar guest windows looking back at us through the gloom; the third wall was the blank side of the building next door. We had to keep the heavy shade on our window drawn to preserve our privacy, which only added to the darkness.The constant hum of the HVAC system at the bottom of the canyon added to our feeling of being under siege in our room. We immediately upon entering should have asked for a different room, but by the time we registered our displeasure, it was too late to vacate for the first night, and we didn't come to New York to spend time in a hotel room anyway.Also, be sure to note the fees and taxes that will be added to what you think is the room rate. Two examples: $25/night plus a tax for "facilities charge" for non-sleeping parts of the hotel (the exercise area, business room, etc.), and another fee for the privilege for being in the same section of town with the Javits convention center.

My husband and I travel to NYC 6-8 times a year and have stayed at many hotels. This one was one of the few that was not only a GREAT DEAL but also a great hotel in all aspects. HUGE ROOM especially for NYC, comfortable beds, clean clean clean ... bathroom had a huge tub which is always a plus and the location couldn't be beat ... near TImes Square, the subway, Central Park, Rockefeller ... we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and will return in May.

My friends and I stayed at Park Central Hotel from 3/6/15 - 3/8/15 and the experience is not what I would have expected. Granted, the location was great and the price was decent but staff (except the cleaning people) were not. The bellhop guys weren't even friendly. We requested a fridge and after asking for a third time, they finally brought us one. It was filthy! Thought the room was small, it was still nice. The beds were comfy and the hotel itself was clean. The reason for my 2 stars. We had an incident that the staff did not handle well at all. There was a man that woke us up out of our sleep by banding on the wall repeatedly for about 15 mins. At first, I thought it was hotel maintenance. After awhile, I finally got up to see what the noise was. When I opened the door, I saw our neighbor leaving his room. I asked if he knew where the noise was coming from and he replied "It was me. I was waking you guys up because you woke me up." I was so confused. We had left the room the previous night (Saturday) by 10:00pm. Even if he did think my friend and I were getting dressed loudly, a knock on the door would've solved that issue. The look in his eyes were scary. He could've been capable of anything. Any-who, we complained to the front desk twice about the deranged man next door and they did nothing. They did not offer any solutions to the issue what so ever. In my opinion, it is always about the service and we did not feel like the hotel cared at all about us as guests. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Although this hotel was nothing spectacular, it was very centrally located and a perfect place to stay if you only have a few days in NYC. The staff was helpful with our needs and the rooms were comfortable.

When you exit the front lobby ... you look left and see Central Park ... look right and you see Time Square. Carnegie Deli ... a NYC landmark is right next door. I will frequent this hotel time and time again.

Although I stayed at the Park Central NYC almost a year ago, I had to submit a review. I stayed at the hotel with my sister for her extended birthday weekend. The hotel is aptly named as it is walking distance from the MoMA; minutes away from Broadway, Central Park and Times Square; and centrally located to non-chain restaurants and subways. All positives since my sister was having her first NYC/Manhattan experience. Regrettably, that was the start and end of our seemingly pleasurable experience at the hotel. We booked our room on a third party website and asked for a room on the higher floors upon arrival. We were initially given a classic king room on the 4th floor which was beyond sub-par for a hotel that has such great reviews. The room was dark, with only one window which "boasted views" of the rooftop ventilation systems of the neighbouring buildings and the rooms surrounding us. The bathroom was TINY for a king room - the bathroom door was haphazardly positioned - when open, it was within an inch of the of the front of the toilet. My sister and I are average height and if either of us sat on the toilet and someone opened the door, we would be just shy of a knee injury! To top things off, we were constantly disturbed by noisy occupants in the adjacent rooms (they seemed to be a travelling high school sports team who had little to no adult supervision). We immediately reported our dissatisfaction; however there were no more rooms available given our late arrival. The following day we were upgraded to a premier room on the 7th floor. The concierge was amenable and empathetic to our complaints. He advised that certain rooms were off limits since we pre-paid through a third party, but he was accommodating in light of the situation. The room had 2 windows with city views of the local shops and one with Times Square in the near distance. Our bathroom was significantly bigger, which thankfully had an unrestricted entrance that wouldn't result in injury and/or awkward maneuvers. We opted for 2 queen beds instead of a single king which offered more space. Despite these improvements, we were again disappointed. Our AC/heat was temperamental to say the least! When set to heat, it blew cold air and vice versa. We called to complain and a serviceman came up promptly. He was very polite and apologetic for the issue. After fidgeting with a few of the controls, he mentioned it "should" work but couldn't be certain since he had a number of calls with the same issue (not impressive since this was a newly renovated hotel at the time). We thanked him for his help, set the room at about 24C and went out for dinner and a show on Broadway. Upon our return, the room was frigid! We reported the issue to front desk; however, much to our chagrin, nothing could be done due to the late hour! We were forced to sleep in multiple layers of clothing and bury ourselves in the linens. Our only consolation were the duvets - which are more hygienic, warm and cozy than comforters or blankets.Another let down was the lack of free wi-fi. Although the hotel was equipped with a few iPads, it was insufficient for hotel's capacity. I would return to Park Central to give it another shot, as our experience may have been tainted because we booked through a third party (although one would expect the same standard of service regardless of where or how it was booked). The rooms are clean, hotel is good value for money (despite the $25/night/room wi-fi surcharge) and its centrally located to numerous landmarks and amenities. I would book directly through the hotel if its prices are comparable to its competitors and request a room on the 7th floor or higher.

This hotel is located conveniently from Central Park which is to the North of 7th av. and times square which is located down to the South. The hotel is very modern and gives off a contemporary feel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I stayed in a classic room which is quite large for the basic room. The bed was great and super comfortable. The television in the room was of good quality even if one or two of the channels did not have great signal. I found the lighting in the room not to be adequate as there were only a series of lamps on bedside table's and one in the corner of the room. There was plenty of storage space for clothes. The bathroom was also of good size and the whole room gave off a luxury feel. The range of amenities given by the hotel in the bathroom was also good.The only complaint I had was on one night I believe they have staff posted out in the hallways with radios. I had a feeling that a member of staff which was posted directly outside of my room had left their radio on at full volume and left their post, and subsequently was trying to be contacted. This disturbed woke me up and disturbed my sleep.

I know that's a weird thing to say, but they really do seem to pride themselves on having a good smelling lobby and bathroom supplies. My family and I stayed there for four nights and had a good experience. The beds were comfy and the rooms were large for NYC. The only thing that was a bit frustrating was our rooms weren't ready until after 4 p.m. and each time we went to the lobby there was a wait for the front desk. Also, they don't tell you that your keys should not be kept anywhere near your credit cards or cell phone or they will stop working (Good luck! I got 4 keys during that time). The lobby is pretty, the views are nice and if you want to be near Central Park, this hotel may be right for you.

Stayed with my 2 girls for spring break. Was here for 12 days. I'd stay here again! Fantastic location- steps away from the subway, Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping, Times Square, great restaurants. Clean, comfortable, professional hotel photos true to how the hotel actually looks.

We booked 3 nights in this hotel for the first part of our stay in NewYork. And compared to our next hotel we prefered by far this hotel (similar price and quality hotel). The location is good, and we enjoyed the 10min walk to Time Square. There is a tube station on the corner of the hotel which was very practical.The hotel is clean, you can notice is when you first wall in the hall. Very busy but staff is very kind and reliable.Rooms are very clean, with a nice lightening. There is a modern feel in this hotel which I rather prefer. Matresses are very good and the bathroom is good and feels new.The view from our room was okay. We weren't at the highest floor but were high enough to feel above most street buildings. You really feel in new york with all the buildings surrounding you!!We never got to eat at the restaurant for breakfast nor lunch so I can't share that experience.

Driving was a mistake on my part. This hotel is in the core of the city...definitely take the train then Uber. Everyone was very helpful and friendly for the duration of our stay, but the amenities need work. There are 2 elevators TOTAL for guests- we had to wait in line several times to get up and down. The AC in our room wasn't working right and we were overheating despite the thermostat being set at 65 degrees. The the hand-held on the phone did not work...neither did any of the speed dial buttons. We used speaker and dialed 0 when we needed assistance. The bathroom is poorly lit and no room service available.

Read a lot of reviews about slow elevators and unhelpful staff at check in, well they must have stayed somewhere else as this hotel was excellent from start to finish. Perfect location, clean and welcoming, never waited more than a minute for lifts and the staff friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend and stay again

We visited Park Central in February 2015 when the real feel temperature outside was -20. I visited with my wife and two young teenage children. We chose Park Central due to its great location: 3 blocks south of Central Park and 8 blocks north of Times Square, plus the fact that this hotel had queen sized double beds was a great selling point!We paid the extra premium and booked a Premier Queen Double online and were reliably informed that these rooms were on higher floors, larger than the Deluxe rooms and double aspect, so they were bright and airy. When we checked in, the female receptionist stated that a Deluxe room had been set aside. When I questioned this room, the receptionist's description quickly changed to a Premier room, Hmm. We were taken up to our room and on arrival it was plain to see that what we had been assigned was not a Premier room. After a 02:00 am start and a 9 hour flight, wouldn't it be nice to get what you asked for?we trudged downstairs and spoke with Vito. "V-I-T-O" said a defensive and somewhat sarcastic male receptionist. Being Italian myself, I think I could have worked that spelling out for myself.Having explained to V-I-T-O that I booked and paid for a Premier room, I expected such and were eventually given the correct room on the 18th floor.It was a shame to start the hotel experience like this but hey, that's life I guess?My only criticisms of this hotel is that there is no heating in the bathroom. No warm air heater, no heated towel rail, nothing. Which means when it's -20 outside, it's like walking into a walk-in freezer first thing in the morning! The room although light and airy during the day, is really poorly illuminated at night. There is a serious lack of storage space for clothes and suitcases considering it can take a family of four and the warm air central heating in the bedroom is noisy and gives either all or nothing. There does not seem to be any middle ground where you actually feel at a comfortable temperature. The room came with 3 bath towels, there was four of us so we asked for a fourth. The following day, we went down to 2 bath towels!When I asked another receptionist about the internet charge, I was informed that I would have to pay a package fee of $27 that included suitcase storage and gym fees. As I needed neither I didn't bother but if you log into the hotel's WiFi, you'll get all the access you'll need for a few dollars there and then. I also found that when I gratefully left our 7 bags with the hotel's suitcase storage facility whilst we waited for our limo to the airport on the last day, I was told there was no charge for the service!The lobby restrooms downstairs are unisex but then on a plus side the doorman outside is a lovely chap who was chatty and a real pleasure to exchange pleasantries with.I'm sure the Park Central Hotel would be much better in the Spring / Summer seasons. as stated, it's in a fab location, the rooms were clean, they all had a large flat-screen TV which was great watching the local NY News channel and the house keeping staff were very efficient (apart from the towels).If asked "Would I stay here again?" No. Not because it was bad, purely because there is so much choice out there.

I had given up on ever finding a decent place with an affordable price in NYC. Then I found Park Central. First, it couldn't be in a more convenient location, 55th & 7th, near most major subway lines and close to Central Park and Times Square, without the madness of Times Square. I had booked a king room but when they realized my daughter was with me, upgraded me to a huge room with two queens. Very clean, very comfortable. One caution…they add a daily fee that isn't included which, although they tell you ahead of time will be there to cover "free" internet and baggage storage, etc, means it has to be added to your bill as an extra when you check out. Don't know why they don't just include it in your rate…would be more transparent and easier check-out. That said, I would still definitely stay again.

Incredible location, very helpful customer service staff, great rooms - will keep coming back. I was lucky enough to check in with Elisabeth from guest services. She was incredibly helpful and accommodating and went out of her way to make sure it went well for me. Maybe she saw that I was due to stay for 12 nights, but that's fine! In fact, she ended up allowing me to look at three different rooms and choose which one I wanted. This made all the difference to my stay. Whenever I needed anything, guest services were incredible - from a coffee maker, to a vase for flowers, through to checking out a drafty window - things arrived within 15 minutes. The room I got was wonderful - 18th floor and very spacious indeed. A special shout out to the fabulous maids of the Park Central, who always make my trip a pleasure and are incredibly friendly (whilst getting on very efficiently with all they have to do!) Two downsides - like others, if I ever had to go to the front desk to ask a question, staff there were bordering on the rude. On one occasion, I was told I was standing in "the wrong place" in order to ask a question of the staff (there was a cordoned off little area, where you had to queue) but I didn't bother standing there, as there was no one else around! I found this sort of treatment bizarre in the extreme!Secondly, the wi-fi was erratic. Given I was staying for business, I might not be able to make it a fourth trip simply on this basis, which is such a shame.

The Park Central Hotel was a very good deal , very clean and modern rooms with very comfortable double beds. We've been explained very well all hotel policies, and unlike other hotels in NY the deal was always very nice and attentive.

The block money out of your credit card without telling you. They charge an extra "facilities" fee that they don't tell you about before booking. I'm sure there's more I don't know about that will appear on my credit card soon!! Horrible because they know tourists need the place to stay the night so they feel they can abuse us with their extra, unrelated charges and get away with it.

I got a room at the third floor and we can hear the street noise all night. The sirens from the police car, ambulance and fire truck can be heard almost every hour.Be careful if you get a good deal on the room price. They will put you on a bad room.The hotel is on a great location.Room furniture are nice. But you have to pay expensive parking ($45/day off site) and extra facility fee ($25/day).

The Park Central Hotel was an excellent choice for us. It was within walking distance to Central Park and Time Square. It was quiet and enough away from the craziness of time square. The staff was so helpful. Our house cleaner was amazing (Marassa). She asked us daily if everything was okay. Our room was spacious and my husband enjoyed the workout facility. The little snack shop is Perfect for a quick muffin and the coffee was wonderful there. Park Central will be our go to hotel in New York City!

We had a wonderful 6 nights at the Park Central. The hotel is very well located, 1-2 blocks from transportation, clean, comfortable and friendly staff. It is also within walking distance to many places for eating, the theater, etc. The only thing that I would have liked was a second chair in the room for comfort, but then again, we didn't spend a lot of time in the room. We would definitely stay here again.

This is my second trip to Park Central hotel. We chose this hotel because it is on the half marathon route. First of all, let me say that the staff are very welcoming, the rooms very well appointed and extremely clean. I love coming to this hotel also because of its centralized location. Walking distance to both Central Park and Times Square. The surrounding area has a host of amazing Restaurants, including Carnegie Deli, Trattoria Del Arte, and the diner across the street . Starbucks is right next door! On the negative side, they closed the restaurant but put in a small market for snacks instead. I enjoyed coming down for breakfast. Secondly, they have many fees and taxes, as all NYC hotels do. But they charged me a $100 "facility fee" - which they did tell me about when I checked in- and I'm still not sure what facility usage they were talking about! Seems extravagant for something I didn't ask for or use! Otherwise lovely accomodations.

Park Central is a great hotel in an even better location. It was just a 10 min walk to times square. The hotel was roomy, comfortable beds, nice flat screen tv and a nice spacious bathroom. The girl at the front desk was friendly.

Our family spent some time here in December and we were very pleased with Park Central. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms were super clean and comfortable. We were actually upgraded to a corner room on a higher floor with no additional charge. We recommend Park Central and will definitely check in again. While NY is noted as the city that never sleeps... a room on a higher floor takes care of that.

My wife and I spent last weekend in NY, and stayed at this great hotel! Really clean rooms, very well located, great service from the hotel staff! Definitely, if we go back to NY, we know where to stay!

Stayed with the family in two rooms weekend of March 7th. Found on discount web site and was a bit apprehensive as it is a "mature" property, but in fact had a very good experience. Felt quite safe. Property is well located at Broadway and 56th - close enough to Midtown amenities but outside the jammed area of Times Square. Everything functioning and room was updated. Great TV. Very decent place. My only quibble is that the "resort fee" of $25 per day was not mentioned until after the final price was quotes and booking confirmed with credit card. Even with that was just over $200 per night for upgraded-size two queen room. (Beware $60 per night valet though.) Not bad at all for NYC and would definitely stay again.

I booked this hotel through Amazon local. I had never been to New York before and the price was decent enough that I wasn't worried about it if I hated it while I was there. I made the reservation of a king sized bed for 2 on February 6. I even made sure to call the reservation line on that hotel to confirm that my order was correct. We showed up on Friday night ready to check in, the front desk informed me that the room I had booked was unavailable and they were putting us in a 2 queen bed room. If we did not like our room we could call down the next day and be put in the room that we originally booked. It was late at night and I was tired from our 3 hour drive down, so I agreed that we would call down the next morning to switch rooms. We called the front desk the next morning and was transferred to 4 different people before we were finally told that no king rooms were available. I specifically said so even though I booked a king room weeks in advance you are telling me that the room I paid for is not available? She replied with yes that is correct. Never once was there an apology or an explanation as to why what I paid for wasn't available. All that aside New York is a beautiful place and there are many many many activities to fill your time with while you are there. There is also a ton of different hotels to stay in so if you are looking for somewhere to stay where you get what you paid for and where the employees are nice I would pick a different hotel.Check-in: Friday, February 27, 201516:00Check-out: Sunday, March 1, 201512:00

Just arrived home from a 4 night stay at this hotel ideally located equal distance from Times Square and Central Park. All hotel staff were friendly and helpful very busy hotel people always around. Rooms are really lovely we had a standard room and was brilliant hair dryer provided along with usual toiletries. Would fully recommend a stay at the hotel for anyone visiting.

We had a quick stay at this beautiful hotel and weren't disappointed. It was very convenient to Central Park & MOMA, 2 of our stops. Beds were super comfy and check-in/check-out was easy. We were out and about in the city most of the time but truly appreciated the comfort of our room - we would stay here again!

beautiful hotel! My daughters and I absolutely loved it! The staff is very friendly with the exception of the front desk. I went to the front desk on 3 different occasions and 3 different people were not friendly. I did not let it ruin our stay! Excellent hotel in every other aspect. With so many tourists coming in the front desk are the first impression.

We didn't do any research before hand and then reading the reviews after making our booking we became a little concerned. But we stuck with our choice and I am so glad we did. What a stunning hotel. From the moment we arrived and walked through the doors everyone was so friendly. They couldn't do enough for us. We arrived early but hadn't taken the early check in option.. So we left out bags at the luggage storage and began exploring this glorious city. When we came back at the time specified they had our room ready and we checked in. OMG the room was lush, so fresh smelling and clean, we literally fell on the beds and could've gone to sleep right there and then as they were so comfy. We stayed for an entire week and we were not disappointed, rooms were cleaned every day and received fresh towels everyday. We asked for coffee making machine as it was not in the room and it was delivered straight to out door within 15 mins along with all supplies. Anything we wanted they provided. All in all a fantastic hotel with awesome staff and its in a fantastic location for everything especially as the subway was just around the corner which made access to everthing easier. Also, as for the "hidden fees" that people keep mentioning, perhaps they should Check website/booking agent sites properly as I knew from the very beginning that there was a resort fee to pay. Also we never had a problem with waiting times for the lifts as I see people keep mentioning they wait ages for them (rubbish), the longest time we waited was at most 2 minutes..When I return I will be staying here again as I can't fault anything about this hotel.

This hotel has an amazingly nice sized room for NY. The bed was comfortable, too, which is always a plus after a long day. It is updated and looks amazing! The staff, especially Carmello, were exceptionally helpful. The only drawback of this hotel is its lack of a restaurant on the property. However, the location is fantastic! You are very close to Central Park and Times Square.

It was an amazing experience with great services and excellent location. The front desk employees always available and ready to help us for any needs. I really do recommend this hotel because Fabulous location, extremely comfortable beds and pillows, beautiful bathrooms, clean, friendly, have stayed here before and would definitely return

Overall this was a good hotel for the price that we got on trip Advisor. Great location/subway rt around the corner too. However, the elevator sometimes did not work (this happened 2 times during our 4 nite stay). Luckily we were on the fourth floor. Our AC did not cool. Even though the outside temp was in the 50's it made it a bit stuffy in the room. Maintenance did respond rt away, but all they did was open the windows. Housekeeping did not do a very good job--never changed our sheets/only made the bed our entire stay; forgot to pick up our dirty towels one day; did not restock toilet paper another day. We were also disappointed that they had recently discontinued their restaurant service. This hotel has a fantastic lobby/bar that used to have full food/bar service but not anymore--only the bar. Hoping they will get enough customer feedback & bring the restaurant back b/c it was really good last yr! (They do have a small food market for breakfast items that was great). Hotel was very clean; great concierge, doormen, front desk staff.

It is a nice hotel, very well located, but it had been a while since I see such rude front desk employees.When I got an email from the hotel before my check-in offering help, I was really pleased but unfortunately, I was really wrong. When faced with 2 challenges (see below) the front desk employees, instead of working with me to solve them, went really rude and sarcastic, attacking me. No need to go into detail, but basically:- Make sure they don't charge you a $25 "Service fee" if you were not aware of it. I had prepaid my room and nowhere in the reservation it said I would have to paid that, but then I did- Be careful with needing something during the night as if their "runner" forgets her walkie-talkie, they are going to keep telling you "5 minutes" but nobody is actually doing anything (I had to wait from 12am to 1.20am for a toothbrush!).

Centrally located on 7th Ave. and 56th Street, the Park Central was the perfect choice for our mid-week getaway for Spring Break. Great deal on the room and flight via Orbitz made this even better. Only a few blocks from Letterman, Central Park, Broadway/Times Square ... it had just about everything. The king room was generous by NYC standards but even on the 16th floor the traffic, sirens, sounds of the city were disconcerting for this mountain boy. But we knew what we were getting in to.Only complaint was that the bar didn't serve food. It's a small complaint because of the roughly 3,000 deli's within walking distance. There's also the Central Market next to Carnegie Hall just across the street, so that's where we spent most of our time stocking up the fridge (upon request).We would suggest taking the airport shuttle (1 hour ride for $23 rather than the two-hour subway ride with multiple changes).

Fabulous location, extremely comfortable beds and pillows, beautiful bathrooms, clean, friendly, have stayed here before and would definitely return. Easy access to N,Q and R trains, very centrally located. Steps from Central Park, Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Starbucks attached to hotel, but unlimited options for quick breakfasts right outside. Carnegie Deli one block south.I've read other reviews saying unfriendly service but I have not had that experience and I've stayed there twice. Very friendly in my opinion.

From the time we walked in, the bell attendant to the front desk to everybody around was all smiles and all helpful. I wish I stayed my entire trip in this hotel. I had to make a last minute reservation as my hotel near by could not extend my stay. The staff promptly helped me in early check-in by 1:00 PM without any hassle or extra charge like the other hotel chains do. I had a 4 month old who was being a little cranky during my check-in and the staff around was quick to entertain him. I booked a room with two double beds and they upgraded me to two queen beds. The rooms are clean, the bathroom fixtures are excellent. The hotel is upgraded and is with latest infrastructure. Right outside the hotel you have the wonderful times square view. Walking distance to all key landmarks like central park, times square, rockefeller, 5th avenue shops etc. All in all a wonderful experience. Next time in NYC, i am staying at Park central.

Stayed here on February break with my husband and kids. My husband dropped us off outside hotel and a bellman said he would be right there to help with bags but never came back out. When we got into the lobby, there was a big line, at least ten people ahead of us. A very pleasant young man offered to get us coffee or tea while we waited, which I accepted. It might have been more beneficial if he helped check people in. Two receptionist on duty for four o'clock check in. By the time I got to check in, twenty minutes later, the line was all the way to the door. It was a very cold day out so it was quite chilly every time the door opened. I asked the receptionist why the big wait and she said the hotel wouldn't pay staff to come in even though they were full to capacity. Now that's what you call service. I had called and requested to be in a quiet room, away from elevators and ice machine and reiterated this upon check in. She said, of course, you reserved a premier room. We went up to our floor came out of the elevator and literally walked out of the elevator and there were our two rooms in front of us, right outside the elevator doors. The elevators were not even in a separate hallway. I immediately called down and, of course, reception was too busy to answer the phone so my call was sent all over the place, I finally spoke to a manager who apologized but they were full to capacity and she could not do anything for me. I was quite upset that after booking two rooms we could not be granted a simple request she then offered to waive the facilities fee which I accepted. However, next morning it was still on the bill. Obviously this hotel has a huge communication problem and non existent management. So we are off to a bad start. Our room was quite nice, good size and nice décor, my husband called it "shades of grey" because it was that grey and white décor but very pleasant and clean. The boys had a double room and it was a nice size also. The lounge was very nice, quite big and plenty of areas to sit and relax, also had a bar in the evening. My favorite thing about the hotel was the location, it was walking distance to central park, Columbus circle, Times square, lots of restaurants nearby. We didn't park at the hotel because 24 hour parking was $60 but if we were not back exactly within the 24 hours they charged you for another day. we parked around the block at Quik park and it was the same price and if you were not back they just charged you hourly. We got a good deal on the hotel so I was happy with the hotel, but the staff could definitely communicate a little better and lines for check in is just a bad first impression but they don't seem to care. Facilities fee is such a joke, for what? What facilities, a gym, so now I am paying $25 for internet and a gym, ridiculous. Last time I paid a facilities fee was at the Biltmore in Arizona but they certainly had facilities to offer. There are plenty of deals to be had in the city without paying these add-on fees. Nice hotel but could be managed a lot better.

My wife won a stay at this Hotel in a silent auction fund raiser in the Florida Keys where we live. Having both lived all our lives in New York until retirement we thought it would be a great Birthday celebration for my wife.We were happily surprised by the Hotel. It went beyond our expectations . We spent 4 wonderful days there. The location was super ,close to restaurants ,Central Park and Broadway. We were very comfortable in our room it was clean ,modern and plenty of room. Really can't think of anything we lacked during our stay.

Park central hotel is a fab hotel! Was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room, the huge bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was large and with bath and shower options which you don't see very much. The rooms were seen to by the maids everyday so always spotless, the hotel corridors and lobby also spotless. The subway was right round the corner and the park was a two block walk away so location was also perfect. The only negative I would have is that they only had two elevators on each side of the hotel and at busy times you could be waiting for 10 minutes for one. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay here again!

Great location but hotel has no dining area and carpet could have done with a major clean. Guests trekked to Starbucks next door Hotel was rather tired looking. No complaints about the bed which was very comfortable. Wouldn't go back.

Many thanks to Guest Relations as they did their best to feel us like at home against the really hard weather conditions(snow storm). Also they took care for us top to toe with every needs in and out the hotel. As long as they exist I would never consider to try any other Hotel in Manhattan. It is like a second home for me and my family.

We were apprehensive to say the least about staying at this hotel as a result of reading TripAdvisor reviews. We were expecting rude, obnoxious service and a stinky lobby. Actually, we liked the scent of the lobby and enjoyed sitting in the newly renovated space near the bar. It was comfortable and attractive. The check in line was very long, because only two receptionists were working (as three other staff members hung out by guest services). Would it be too much to add another receptionist?We loved our room, which was spacious and nicely renovated. I wish that the in room information book was up-to-date, because while it claimed the gym was closed, I found out upon checkout that it actually was operational. Definitely ask for a nice view- we looked out onto Times Square, but I hear other rooms have a brick wall. Service was really mixed. Some staff members excelled, including two front desk women who went above and beyond the call of duty. The barman was also friendly. That being said, doormen were obnoxious and the maids stared at us like what are you doing here, rather than say hello or respond to ours. We also had to deal with an unpleasant man at Guest Services. So this area could definitely use some work. Also, for all of the renovations that the hotel has done, it doesn't seem on par with other four stars we have stayed at (although this could also be due to the service)! It feels more like a large three star hotel trying to act luxurious, but offering no services and nickle and diming the guests ($25 daily fee on top of the room fee? For what?!) For this reason we wouldn't return to the Park Central.

For our first visit to New York we made an excellent choice. Not knowing New York at all and how things work we found the help and guidance from the concierge desk Julissa very friendly and a relief that the hotel gives this service. Got a booking via TripAdvisor for a very good discount, which fitted our budget. When we arrived, the hope of the hotel being a perfect location to all the sites we wanted to visit was perfect. Walking distance to Broadway Theaters and Time Square, while the subway train station was at the corner of the hotel. The reception is beautiful and easy to book in. Early arrival allowed our bags to be stored for us in the hotel until the room was ready. Tired and excited as we were we went for a stroll in Central Park until the room was ready. Our room on the 14th floor had a window looking onto 7th Avenue. It was quiet and the bathroom was small but a comfortable bed for the weary bodies. The hotel and room was clean with a friendly atmosphere. I will come back. Suggestion: maybe a self help coffee station in the room would have been very nice.

I had a business trip that I had to make on short notice, and booked the Park Central Hotel for a pair of nights via Orbitz. It was a reasonable rate. The lobby is spacious and spotless. The room had an excellently comfortable bed. The bed was very clean. The desk staff and bellhops were very friendly and willing to accommodate questions for navigating in the city.There is a snack bar that has choices from candy, chips, fruit, refrigerated simple sandwiches, coffee, tea, and cold beverages of various kinds. There is a very spacious two-level bar/lounge where people can have meetings and drinks or just relax.The only bad part is that the hotel does not have food service of any kind (aside from the snack bar mentioned above); there is no room service. But there is a concierge service-- there is a chance he/she might be gone after 9 p.m., however.Because of location, there are various landmarks in the immediate vicinity of Midtown Manhattan, like Carnegie Hall, Central Park, the Theater District/Broadway, and more.

The Park Central was a terrific value--the bed was comfortable and I slept well, the wireless internet was complimentary, and the concierge's aid in using the computers provided off the lobby as a business center was much appreciated. The staff has a good attitude. Yes, the room was tight and the first time the room cardkey didn't work, and yes, they could use a few more staff on the front desk at times. But it's an excellent value and when you're hungry, it's hard to beat the Cqrnegie Deli three doors down on the next block.

I have stayed at. Park Central from time to time because of the wonderful location, but today I checked in because my flight home was canceled twice. I am old and don't see well because of an eye disease, so I REALLY needed some assistance. Everyone was so helpful, and particularly Ana at the front desk just could not have been nicer or more patient with my situation. My room is spacious, spotless and was even ready an hour before the regular check in time. I won't forget this! The next time I travel to NYC, I will book here because it is my first choice, not just because of the convenience.

nicely located midtown west hotel has been recently refurbished to include glossy entrance and nice bar/lounge area. The refurb is only skin deep and has papered over a tired hotel (with metal doors to all rooms for example). There is not any catering at the hotel but loads of delis / restaurants etc nearby. When I was there one or two of the lifts were out of action and the staff were not well trained. On the plus side, even their advertised rates are cheap for decent rooms in NYC and if you call at short notice you can sometimes get really great rates. So if you are looking for a hotel just to sleep in ( nice beds) but not as a destination in itself, this might suit you - esp if you and not your company are paying!

Hotel was in perfect location. 5 mins to theatre district, restraurants & bars!!! Hotel itself is beautiful, rooms alit dated, but service from the desk, parking, & other employees was wonderful. Only thing is, in my opinion, the lounge bar didn't open til 4pm, thought Mabey it shld b opened alit earlier, for some lunch or drinks, specially that r room wasn't ready, & we waited there from 1:00. Other than that, it was a fabulous stay!!

My boyfriend and I had a wonderful experience the Park Central hotel. Everything was perfect, from the friendly and welcoming staff to the beautiful room and stunning facilities. Every time we walked into the lobby we would comment on the wonderful flowery smell and how is just the small things that make a huge diference. The hotel is on a prime location close to most landmarks, museums and restaurants. It has been recently renovated so everything is new and modern looking but still very luxurious. It is very clean and quiet hotel. We loved our stay there and we will definitely come back to the Park Central Hotel on our next visit. Totally recommend it!!!

We booked this Hotel through booking.com. This was our first time in New York and the hotel was very convenient to Times Square and central park. very clean. although it was very cold our room was extremely hot!

The Park Central Hotel has added a ridiculous 'daily resort fee' in the mode of Vegas hotels. Over $27 for use of the so-called 'state of the art' fitness center, luggage storage, wifi, and 'limited' phone calls. Of course, everyone has his/her own opinion on what makes something 'state of the art', but this fitness center doesn't fall under that category. $27 to hold my bags? Seriously? $27 for wifi? No thanks-don't need it. $27 for phone calls? I have my own phone, thanks. These amenities used to be free, and they still should be. The hotel is nice enough, but in my campaign against these fees, I wouldn't stay again until the the fees are removed.

The guest room was spacious and modern, with all amenities. And, you can't beat the location right across from Carnegie Hall and blocks from Rockefeller Center. It was a perfect perch for our quick trips into the city! Highly recommend!

Arrived at this hotel at 7.30pm, we were made to feel very welcome by the reception staff, quickly got our keys to our room which was on floor 9, the room was spacious with a massive king size bed and huge tv. The room was very clean and cleaned daily with clean towels etc.. the maid was lovely and very friendly. We had a view of the beautiful lit up high rise buildings outside and could see a bit of Central Park! The bed was extremely comfortable, there were sirens and noise outside but this is New York, i slept well. The bar area is stunning but let down with over priced drinks, my wine being $20 for one glass with a tip so only went in there once. No restaurant but coffee/sandwiches and pastries in the hotel lobby. Next door is starbucks. Short walk to Central Park and Times Square which was amazing. It snowed during our stay and Central Park looked beautiful. I would recommend The Rockafella, the views are amazing. There are lots of bus tours which i would also recommend. We stayed 5 nights and didnt want to come home. New Yorkers were so friendly and couldnt do enough or us. New York is very Clean and we had the most wonderful time. Will definitely come back to this hotel! Also fast wifi.

I used to live for a year at the W Downtown- never again. I always had major problems there even paying 3 times more than I payed in this hotel. The Park Central it's beautiful, Cheap, and the people who work here are simply the best! (All the opposite of the W). It's also near of everything! The rooms are warm and comfortable! They are also quite large! I arrived at the hotel for the first time 5 days ago, and they couldn't find my reservation, even like this, they gave me a double room, and charged me only 100 dollars for extras, saying that they would wait until the next day for the confirmation of reservation I made by Expedia, even thou I was paying for a single much smaller room. Then 2 days ago when my reservation ended, I fell really sick and couldn't even move from the bed, I wanted to extend the reservation a few more days, but haven't the strength to take the phone to give credit card info, or go downstairs to make the payment by cash... They called me several times in the room, but I was too sick to talk, so they finally sent the security to my room the next morning, after I unhooked the phone in the room. When they realized I was really sick, they did everything to help me, they took the cash with me in the room to make the reservation for me, which is totally against their policy, they offered to call my family, hospital, anbulance and gave me all the assistance I could need, the girl from the front Desk and the security guy even bought me soup, fruits and Gatorade, and brought me to the room 10 minutes later- they are true angels! Never seen such a good treatment in a hotel in my life, specially in a cold city like New York. I'm glad I was staying here and not somewhere else in such hard personal situation. I totally recommend this place!

Service staff training and staffing are very positive since the renovation. We were greeted with a smile by the bellman. The front desk person that checked us in had very positive restaurant suggestions. Rooms were very clean and well maintained.Overall, location across the street from Carnegie Hall was goodRecommend for a weekend getaway

We stayed over using a copoun. We arrived at noon expecting to check out bags, they had a room ready for they let us check in ! The room was large and comfortable. They have a happening bar area with arm chairs and computer ports. We plan to stay again

I have previously stayed in this hotel before the renovation & had such an amazing holiday that i decided to come back and stay in the newly renovated Park Central & i was not disappointed. Beautifully renovated & my room was big for a NYC hotel. I was on the 17th floor with beautiful views of the city. Perfect location and close to times sq, central park & a subway to take you where ever you need to go. No wait for lifts as some other people have experienced.. Overall another amazing stay at Park Central & i hope to be back same time next year!

I love older New York City Hotels, especially when they get a redesign! An unexpected weather travel delay, found us getting routed to NYC for a night. We love Molyvos Restaurant across the street, so the location was perfect, with Central Park, Times Square beckoning in either direction.From the moment we entered, every staff member was kind and accomodating. We got a decent rate for Midtown, and our King room was clean, comfortable and stylish...the bath was nicely redone. The extra service fee that justifies wifi, fitness room, and blah blah blah wasn't bad, but any hotel in the world should be scolded for even mentioning it... Hoteliers in the world's better properties need to understand that the pubic expects these things....it reminds me of when I was a kid, and hotels would advertise "free TV, phone and AC" ..isnt it time to reaize that fees justified for wifi are just making people crazy..We will be back.

Been twice to this Hotel, & will be staying there again in March 2015. We can't wait.Centrally located in the heart of NY & walking distance to Times Square, the theatre & shopping.This will definitely not be our last time in NY & definitely not our last time at The Park Central Hotel. We love the ambience & it really makes me feel like I am in NY. that feeling.

This was not my first time staying at the Park Central Hotel, but it was the nicest. They recently renovated and the place is GORGEOUS! The staff is friendly & helpful. The location is right in the heart of Manhattan close to Times Square & Central Park!

My girlfriend and i stayed here 5 nights in februari 2015. Hotel is Very good. Nice rooms, perfect location. Few minutes walk to central park and times square. Its a expensive location (5 dollar water in deli, 6,50 in hotel!), so bring youre own. Staff could get better. Ar 16.00 check in, there was a big line and only one employee. According to manager because of unions, and breaks!? We asked if we could have the breakfast as advertised on site, but they did not understand what there deal was. 25 dollar ex tax is added per day you stay here. No explanation what we get for this money. Overall, Very good hotel, bad staff/ management. World stay here next time for location and room.

We stayed in the Park Central Hotel for six nights from 17th to 23rd of January. The hotel is perfectly situated on 7th Avenue and when you walk out of the hotel you can see Central Park to your left and Time Square to your right.Check in was very quick and easy and the staff were very friendly. Our room was situated on the 18th and top floor of the hotel. We worried that with so many rooms and being on the top floor that we would have to wait an age for the lifts, but it is a very quick system.Our room was a very generous size with a large comfortable bed, and all the usual amenities. There was only one armchair in the room, but there was space to have a proper sofa or two chairs at least. The air conditioning system was very good and we could change the temperature in the room pretty quickly. The bathroom was a good size and we had plenty of towels and toiletries. Overall we were happy with the room, but better use could have been made with the space.Unfortunately, there is no restaurant for breakfast, but there is a shop on the ground floor which is well stocked with all your needs for a nice breakfast or lunch. If you need anything after about 10 pm there is a supermarket very close by, as the hotel has no facility to give you water after this time.The bar closes at 11 pm. We found this very strange as hotel bars in Europe would all stay open until after midnight. The drinks prices are ridiculous and the cocktail menu is limited, overpriced and badly made. Would recommend staying clear of the bar.Overall, this is a well located, reasonably priced hotel, with friendly staff and nice rooms. The bar is to be avoided though.

This is a well located and inexpensive hotel, with spacious rooms. There is no restaurant however and I wish there was at least a coffee maker in the room. There are many places to eat nearby however. Staff was pleasant. Nice fitness center. Will stay there again.

I stated at the Park Central a few weeks ago. The location is simply awesome. You are two blocks away from Central Park, 5 blocks away from the Apple Store :), you are at walking distance from Times Square, and you have a subway station round the corner. The service and the cleanliness were very good, though I must confess, that since no breakfast is served, I was waiting for a "more friendly" coffee machine service in my room (I requested to have one). It seemed they were counting the number of coffee bags they left the first day, and it seemed I was not getting any more than "I deserved", even though the weather outside was freezing! Anyway, there's a Starbucks right next to it! The rest was excellent. I would go there again!

My son loves to stay in "The Big City" sometimes. I booked this room for Feb 15th. This was a clean, quiet, pretty and comfortable hotel. We got a great rate through Groupon and enjoyed every minute. The concierge desk was very helpful in directing us to a nearby restaurant as it was freezing out and we did not want to walk far.We were close to Times Square and because of the cold weather we did take a cab, but it was close to walk in better weather. We would definitely return.

We decided to stay in the city after seeing Bradley Cooper in The Elephant Man (that was 5 stars!) This hotel has a convenient location just close enough to Times Square and the Theater district. The hotel is in good condition and well-maintained. My complaint was that the rooms are SO HOT with no way to get the heat down. The thermostat was at its lowest setting and the room was still really hot which even with the cold outside was unbearable, we were uncomfortably warm. Wireless was great and included. The hotel had a convenience stand in the lobby for water and snacks. The bar was not great but at least they had one! It was a great value and I would stay again!

Sad but true... I travel to NYC two or three times a month and I was in hopes of finding my go to hotel... but not so much here. From the second we checked in to the time we left, the employees of The Park Central need to go to a course on customer service. They also charge a $25.00 a day resort fee that we knew nothing about until we checked out. We questioned Angela about it and she rattled off what it was for. I told her it would have been nice to have known about the few things is was good for during our stay instead of as we were leaving. I asked her for a copy of the 'resort amenities' and she said I would have to wait for her manager to come from downstairs to bring it to me. I asked her how long that would be and she said she didn't know. And the coffee/deli bar is so overpriced... No way will I be back!!!

We booked on Expedia few days before our trip. We were happy with the price consideration the great location of the hotel. But we forgot to consider the extra charge of $27/day for free Wi-Fi in the room. But still cheap for a 4 stars hotel...We checked in on Friday around 8pm and waited in line for over 15 minutes. Could be good to have more than 1 person at the front desk on a Friday evening.We booked a room with a King bed, but when we checked...no more room with a king bed! Great! We complained with the girl at the front desk for few minutes and then her manager gave us a room with a King bed. Not sure to understand how few minutes earlier the hotel has no more king bed rooms and now there is one available. The room was ok - but nothing compared to the W hotel or Intercontinental (i.e. 4 stars hotel) in Time Squares where we stayed few months earlier. The room had paper walls, we woke up many times in the night due to noisy people.Overall, I consider Park Central to be a 3 Stars hotel (I travel around 30 nights/year). If you want a great location for a good price it's a nice hotel. But don't have high expectations because you will be disappointed.

Thought we got this hotel at a great rate until we noticed the extra $27 a day they charge as a "resort fee" for having a gym and wifi.Daylight robbery.Wifi is a necessity in this day and age, more so than a TV for anyone under 50. So this should not be considered a luxury you have to pay extra for. Hello? It's not 2002.Plus how does having a gym make a hotel a holiday resort exactly???Disgusting!

There is an old saying that "One 'Aw, s**t' erases 1,000 attaboys." Such a moment ruined our stay at the Park Central this weekend. It was spacious, modern, well-appointed room, in a great location and at a reasonable price. So far, so good.The problem was with the valet parking at the hotel. As we were finishing packing this morning I called down to the front desk and asked to have the car pulled around, and I was told it would be 20 minutes.Twenty minutes came and went. So did 30, 40 & 50. Finally, after an hour standing outside in sub-freezing weather our car was delivered. There was only the most perfunctory of apologies, with a statement that they were "backed up."I don't object to paying New York prices for things, provided they are accompanied by great service. In this regard, the Park Central failed miserably.

Where do I start. . Everything you need is on the corner the subway a deli,diners, statbucks, Carnegie Hall. You can see Times Square to your right and Central park to your left. I was traveling alone for my first NY trip and it went perfect the hotel smells amazing the staff is nice and the gym and Internet fee was worth it. The gym is awesome they have complimentary earphones and the Internet was fast. At the end of your visit they have car service waiting outside instead of a taxi which is nicer and cheaper I had an amazing time. Thank you and I'll be back next year with a friend.

The hotel is in the middle of Manhattan and many attractions are within walking distance.Don't expect to find the regular hotel amenities in this hotel because there are none.I was charged a $27.00/per day 'Resort' fee for just getting 'free wi-fi in my room. And garageparking was $60/day.If you just need a clean sleeping bed in Manhattan,this hotel will do. Room Price is ok comparewith similar hotels in the area

When we checked in and went to our room, we found that it was still dirty from the previous guests. I called the office and reached "Ashley" (come to find out, she was not even in the lobby, she was in Las Vegas answering phones!) Anyway, she told me someone would get back to me within an hour. Not acceptable. So after waiting 30 minutes in the dirty room, she called back to let me know a manager was waiting to talk to me in the lobby. By her tone, I felt like I was about to get scolded. Ashley was rude and uncaring. Well, I did meet with the manager, Elizabeth. She saved the day and the stay. We were immediately provided with a clean room with apologies. She was gracious, accommodating, personable, professional. Accidents happen and I really believe the room situation was simply an oversight. Ashley needs customer service training and Elizabeth needs a raise. She is a great front-of-the-house representative for the establishment. This is the 2nd time we have stayed there and will do so again.

The hotel is beautifully decorated throughout, rooms are a great size and the beds are amazing...huge and the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on. The location was great, we didn't have a view but we were hardly in the room so we didn't care. There was no noise and black out blinds so you could sleep as long as you wanted. Location was great literally 5 mins from Central Park & 10mins to the centre of Times Square. The only slight disappointment was the fact that there was no restaurant, but there are so many places to eat close by we weren't too fussed.I'd definitely go back and would recommend this to family and friends

Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Had such a fantastic visit, large spacious room with huge comfortable bed. Staff were very friendly and went above and beyond to facilitate our needs. Will definitely be staying here from now on all visits to NYC

Stayed here for 5 days in December with the family who had all travelled over for my mums 50th birthday!This hotel is in a great location and is walking distance to pretty much everywhere! We walked to Radio City Hall, The Natural History Museum, 5th Avenue and most importantly Ellens Stardust Diner (a must if you’ve never been!)The hotel itself was very nice and modern and our room was surprisingly spacious by NYC standards and was cleaned every day! The bed was the biggest and most comfortable I think I’ve ever had in a hotel, if I wasn’t in NYC and wanting to see the sights I could have stayed in it for the duration of my holiday!We never ate here but we had a few drinks in the bar which were nice, although my husband about fell over when he got a $30 bill for a nip of whiskey! There are some lovely delis around and we found we visited them in the mornings for a coffee and a bagel before we made our way into the city!The only downside was that it was a little bit noisy with traffic and goings on outside, one night a fight erupted outside our window which kept us a wake for some time (this was nothing to do with the hotel or its guests).

II have been to NYC about 6 times in the past 6 years and stayed at various places (Palace, Essex House, Empire). For a number of reasons we chose the Park Central. The price was reasonable, the location 'excellent' and it rated higher than many other places of similar price. We thought we would give it a go. Location is great - in one sense. 56 and 7th is very convenient to central park, broadway and shopping. Problem is it is a very busy and thus prone to be very noisy. We stayed in an upgraded room, but opted not to pay another 28 to 40 dollars to be higher up which may have been a mistake. Two nights we were up till 3 or so because of the noise outside, in the morning, the hallways were often noisy so we got woken early. We always travel with ear plugs. am a light sleeper, my wife is not. We both had challenges. Management was sympathetic but could not move us. The rooms are nice, clean, nothing fancy, beds are very comfortable. Staff is quite pleasant. They are a big enough hotel that they get a moderate number of groups/conferences which is not always great since they can't handle large volumes well - ie long lines at elevator or check in. One thing in price is the resort fee - covers gym and the internet, is about another 20 or so dollars a day. The gym is ok, I would say average. Overall the hotel is fine and reasonably priced but it is noisy. We stayed at the Empire in the past which gets a significantly lower rating on trip advisor but is far quieter, in our experience. If you stay and are a light sleeper you have been warned. Remember a good nights sleep is worth a lot.

The hotel was nice and inviting and a perfect location to everthing. The receptionist was very friendly and accomodating. The Room was clean and comfortable, I love the comfort of the bed and the shower !The Bellman in the lobby was friendly and gave us good direction.We will definitly be backCheers

We chose this hotel because of its location and a special rate offered by a hotel booking website. So, other than the pictures and descriptions provided in the site, we had no knowledge of the hotel or how it would be. Well, we were so pleased with our stay that we will certainly be back. The hotel is extremely attractive and fresh-feeling and its staff was welcoming from check-in to check-out. Our room was very clean and updated. By NYC standards, it was also relatively spacious. The location is wonderful, providing short walks to the theatre district, Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping, etc. It was a lovely stay at a great price.

This hotel is very well presented and is very clean, the bedrooms are immaculate. The hotels location is perfectly situated on the main road right in the middle of Times Square and Central Park.The staff on reception are very friendly and helpful when approached. The only criticism would be is that to find any information you need to approach staff members there are no helpful information packs or handy tips

I stayed here for business for two days during winter storm Juno. My supervisor booked the room for us so that we wouldn't have to commute during the storm. Overall, it's a nice hotel. It's clean, it smells great as soon as you enter the lobby. The room was small but perfect for just sleeping, which is what we mostly did. The bathroom was spacious and had nice amenities.My favorite part of the room was the bed. It was super comfortable and cozy. I wanted to take it home with me!

Great location and very well appointed room. Really love all the power outlets. Where it fell short, literally, was the shower curtain, that didn't reach the tub unless you removed the rings in the middle. Then there was the toilet paper holder that kept coming apart. And finally, a late night false fire alarm followed by a morning false fire alarm. Again, it is nice hotel in a very good location, pretty close to as good as you are going to get in NYC for the price.

We were really excited for our stay at the Park Central - it was our 7 year old son's first trip to New York and the trip was his birthday gift. We had a Groupon and the rate was fantastic and we were very pleased with the location, the lobby (which smells fantastic) and the room. We expected it to be small, but it was very modern and nice.
