It was also very warm on one of the coldest nights in history! But we had a horrible night of sleep, possibly due to our room's location. We were near a freight elevator, so that might have had something to do with it, but it sounded like a large cart was rolling around on a tile floor somewhere near us all night long. I'm not sure if we were near a laundry facility or maintenance was going on, but it was awful. Add to that the sounds of neighbors in the halls and a fire alarm going off around midnight, and we did not get the rest we needed after a long day of travel and touring the city. We can forgive small issues, but after the sounds of something rolling that probably didn't come from a guest room, I don't think we'll be back. It's a shame because we really did love everything else about the hotel. But for an overnight room in a busy city, the only thing that really matters is sleeping, isn't it?

On Friday night Valentines weekend I waited on line for 45 minutes since they only had one person to check in guests. There is no restaurant; therefore no room service. I requested no down feather pillows (allergy), but they still left half of them as down feathered. Had to request a refrigerator for my King Bed Classic room (which they did provide); just strange that there's no fridge in the room. Read the fine print on the surcharges because even though I got a good deal on hotels.com for 2 nites, the room still cost me almost $1000.

I booked to stay at this hotel through booking.com, after booking I received a confirmation email,then all of a sudden and cancellation email,then a confirm confirmation email, completely confused. Somehow they booked the wrong dates for what I had wanted, when I phoned from the UK which one can appreciate is a pricey phonecall, I got passed from one person to the next as nobody could help me and then I got told I must take it up with booking.com even though you would like to think that someone may have been able to help at the hotel directly. All they had to do was change the dates? You wouldn't think that would be too hard for a hotel to do! They have now also taken payment which included taxes and may I add a $25 per night fee to use their WiFi which I obviously won't be there to use?! Don't understand this at all. If they can't sort out a simple problem like this, then what is their customer service desk there for? Also their staff in the in house reservations section were even more incompetent and extremely rude trying to fob me off to ring booking.com rather than sorting the problem out on their end. Definitely would not recommend this hotel, unhelpful and incompetent in every way and im sure there are plenty of other hotels to stay in rather than face this hassle. Particularly not a day before you leave.I have now booked elsewhere. thankfully.

Four Star hotel?!?! I think not!!!During my stay, I experienced 2 false fire alarms and terrible service.The 2 false fire alarms happened at 11pm and at 8.30 am and that was a perfect way to jolt you out of your bed. The first one was understandable because it was a false alarm and the second one was unacceptable as it was "testing" its system.Aside from the fire alarm, I had also called the service desk to see if they could help me fill up my bath tub as I wanted to take a bath and the drain would not close. I waited for almost 2 hours for someone to attend to our request. This was unacceptable as the service desk specifically said that someone would be attending to us within 10 mins.Furthermore, the check in desk at the hotel was terribly so and the receptionist was not the friendlist person. They did not smile nor welcome us to the hotel during check in and couldn't be bothered asking us about how the stay was at the hotel. I understand that they did their job but, for a supposed 4 star hotel, this was unacceptable. I've had way better service at a motel 6.On the bright side, the bed's were comfortable.... but that was the only positive I could fine. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone regardless of its location.

The hotel looks good on their website but when you are arriving, there is a mandatory fee of 25 dollars per room per day that no one is aware of if you have booked the room with a third party.The director of front office assured me it is becoming common practise within New York hotels which is after verification is not true. (Challenge me on this!) This mandatory fee covers internet access, domestic calls, luggage storage and fitness center access. Once you are checked in you are trapped. Domestic calls will not interest nationals with their mobiles, and foreigners will have little interest calling within the USA. Access to the fitness center is not the main interest of the people visiting new york, and the luggage storage will have interest for only a few of the customers and only on the last day of their stay.. This will make the most expensive internet access of all new york hotels! As the room is concerned nothing extraordinary, the hotel has been renovated recently but within the room nothing which will make this hotel a proud member of the four star category. No tea or coffee facilities, no armchair, the most basic plastic tooth glass which will remind you of Super 8 motels (and I am not talking of a minibar!!).The standard room is very dark with a store enables you to see the courtyard (see photos). Well a new carpet and a nice bedhead are not enough to make this tourist hotel a place to stay in New york. As I am concerned I will definitely avoid this hotel for my next trip in the City and stay away of the best scam in the Big Apple

We visited this hotel at the start of February 2015. We arrived & had a quick check in with a lovely girl on the desk. We got to our room on the 17th floor ( I don't know why everyone complains about the lifts they were great) and it was a clean & tidy room with a city view. The room was spacious and had everything we needed including a safe. The king size bed was great especially when your on your feet all day. The smell in the lobby is warm & welcoming along with the staff. We checked out hassle free and great facilities to store luggage. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Times Square if your looking to stay away from the hustle & bustle of NYC. A great hotel and a must to stay in.

My sister and I stayed at Park Central after being recommended by a friend. We booked 9 months in advance and were able to get a great price. We were very happy with our stay here, the hotel is in an excellent location. 5 minutes from Times Square, you can actually see it as soon as you walk out of the hotel. Close to Central Park and the subway. The art and decor was beautiful as was the entire hotel. The rooms were quite small but I have been warned that nothing is spacious in New York and it wasn't too cramped. Housekeeping were very friendly and made our experience very comfortable. The only issue was the lack of breakfast options or a restaurant for dinner or anything. Overall, a very pleasant experience. I would recommend this hotel to any first time travellers to New York that want the tourist experience. Next time we may stay somewhere in Chelsea just to get a different experience.

The best thing about this hotel is the location. Aside from that it's sadly average. It feels more like an accommodation and less of an experience than other hotels I've enjoyed in NYC. It's very generic with little in the way if originality. A couple of problems...no soap in the room and a faulty key card. It's just a large impersonal hotel that will due if all you want is a place to rest your head...however that was problematic as well as the walls are terribly thin and you can hear your neighbor. I was in room 832 and there was no phone service. I had to go into the elevator Lobby to make calls. Won't be back.

This hotel was a pleasant surprise. Fully renewed, is close to Times Square and Central Park and is well served by Metro stations. The hotel staff was kind and the room was clean, but, for us, the big diferencial was the availability of rooms that accommodate 4 people, which made it more affordable than renting two rooms for our family (father, mother and two daughters).
user_location: Sao Jose Do Rio Preto, SP

review_body: The Bathroom has mold all over the shower and the faucet as well. The ceiling has stains that I believe that comes from the water, but they don't pay attention to repair. . This hotel was recently renovated. . I paid for an upgrade (room -corner) , but basically is the same as a regular room...

First time in NY, found hotel on the Internet. Great location easy to walk to Times Sq, 5th Ave, or Central Park. Staff interaction good, Room excellent, refurb'd, clean and spacious.Only downside was a film crew taking over the lobby on the day of departure on 2nd Feb 2015.

Lovely Hotel entrance and location, Very disappointed with housekeeping as didn't seem to get the fact that we were 4 adults staying in our room and the only supplied 2 or 3 towels and 2 drinking glasses everyday and we had to call them everyday. They would bring us plastic cups as extra cups. Didn't get the room requested and did the booking 6 months prior to our visit. Coffee machine didn't work and on the second day returned back to our room and the door was left open by someone and presumed it was housekeeping. Overall a very unhappy stay was had by us all after this hotel was recommended by our son and his girlfriend who had stayed there in August the same year.

As everyone has already said, this hotel is in a great NY location. And, the room was comfortable and very nicely renovated. However, we were put in a room behind the elevators and it sounded like an airplane was taking off every time someone used the elevator. Next there is construction all night long on 56th Street, and the windows are not even close to drowning out any sound. Finally, the walls are so thin, we could hear the people next door like they were in our bathroom. And yes, the $25 service fee is just an extra charge for nothing - internet should be free to begin with - and why should we be charged for the gym if we do not use it? We used a promotion from Amazon so we had a very good rate, but we would never go back there - so I guess the promotion is just to fill rooms and they do not really care if we ever return.

This hotel was fantastic. I came across this hotel via booking.com and picked up a great deal. This was my second trip back to NYC but it was my boyfriends first time. The hotel was in a perfect location only a couple of blocks to central park and a very short walk into time square and many other attractions NYC has to offer.We stayed of the 12th floor which was perfect and the room was spot on not too small and really clean :) the whole hotel was brilliant very modern with a warm feel to it. The staff were fantastic- check in was no problem at all very quick and welcoming, the doormen were brilliant but the one person who really stood out to us was John who worked in the hotel bar, he was so welcoming/helpful- giving us tips on where to eat/drink ect we could have a he made us feel right at home, like we had knowen him for years :) even before we were due to leave he came over to wish us well.All in all this is a fantastic hotel and would recommend it to anyone who is travelling to NYC. We will be back and shall bring our friends with us.We look forward to seeing you again Park Central :))

Location is super, really close to the opera, ballet and symphony, at Lincoln Center!!Great coffee shop next-door to the hotel.Rooms are ok, hairdryers are filled with lint. Might be a fire hazard,but just plain gross.The hotel charges a ridiculous users fee. For that money, they should be able to have regular, small individual bottles of shampoo, conditioner, etc. Instead, they provide oversized communal bottles, which give off a teeny tiny drop of liquid. Very annoying.Mini bar would be nice, or the ability to buy the snacks and alcohol that are very much on view in the closed and locked up hotel market. No room service available.No coffee maker in the room. Get with it hotel managers: people don't want to go to your in-hotel coffee shop to Buy morning coffee/tea. This is normally a courtesy provided by the hotel. What is it that the users fee actually provides?Don't get your expectations up for this hotel, but stay here for the location.

I live about an hour from NYC & found an Amazon local deal for this hotel the same wknd I had matinee tix to The Lion King. Hotel was great, large room, perfect location. We walked everywhere. To the theater, Times Square, church at St. Patrick's Cathedral. Easy access to subway, if you want that and many, many restaurants and delis close by.

My husband likes to stay in Midtown West on our weekends and we had walked past the Park Central several times and it is near a few of our favorite restaurants so we thought we would give it a try.Stafff is friendly and for the most part helpful (the concierge being the only exception to this- but we might have hit her at a bad time since she had just dealt with some very rude people in front of us). The person running the market place was also not very friendly- ignoring me at first, seemed upset when I didn't want much, only giving me a partially filled coffee and then after paying an exorbitant price for coffee and water, I left no tip, which she commented on.Valet parking is $60 per night (a little steep), no in/out privileges if you need your car.The rooms are a decent size for NYC, spotlessly clean, well set up. Comfortable bed, a very nice bathroom- however the shower curtain was too short and the floor becomes wet during a shower. Very quiet- very little street noise, no hallway noise. No mini-bar, no coffee machine which forces you either downstairs to the market (pricey and rude) or out onto the street in search of your morning coffee. Wifi is free and works well.Location is great, just few steps to some very good restaurants, delis, Carnegie Hall, Central Park, 5th and 6th Avenue, lots of taxi traffic. Subway stations within a block. We got a very good deal on the room, but it is also not exactly peak season.We will certainly consider staying here again, especially at the price we booked.

Arrived on 30th Jan 15 at 10:00 am The reception at the hotel was unhelpful, abrubt and acting like she did not Care however manger was very good .the room was giving to us had a cockroach,which I am allergic to,and they changed our room right away.but after all they gave us a room with the wall view....more caring would be good

We were a family of 4 visiting NYC for Christmas 2014, great location between Central Park and Times Square. No noise and easy access to subway. Rooms good size for NY but no fridge or tea/coffee facilities. Great Deli's nearby for everything from Breakfast to late night dinners.

My daughter & I had a 5 night stay there, from the end of January to the 4th Feb. The hotel is well situated with easy access to Times Square, Central Park & 5th Avenue. The room were clean & tidy, the beds were so comfortable..there was a bit if a draft from the window but our air con worked well.They did bring us up a kettle so we could make tea which was much appreciated. I would only want to stay there again if we return to NYC, as it was so perfect.

We took the advice of other travellers and requested a high floor and away from the elevator. The receptionist was very accommodating and gave us an inside room on the 16th Floor. The room was adequate in size and clean, comfortable and quiet. American rooms rarely have tea and coffee making facilities and this was no exception. The hotel offers a "Grab and Go" breakfast facility in the lobby but I would advise against this. It represents very poor value and the tea and coffee felt short when it came to quality. There are numerous bars and cafés within feet of the hotel where you can purchase breakfast.

The Park Central is an ideal hotel; clean, efficient and friendly. The front desk is well staffed, the customer service expedient, professional and friendly. The Park Central is the only hotel I will ever stay in while in NYC. Thank you to; Emanuel at Front desk, Quimby, the manager, who were kind and took extra time to advise us. Carmelo the doorman is a dream and an incredible resource for guests and hotel! Thank you to an awesome crew!

I recently enjoyed another great stay at the Park Central Hotel. This hotel is in a great location. The subway is literally steps away and it's convenient to Central Park, great restaurants and Times Square. Special thanks to Elizabeth Cacovic! She attended to every detail (as always!) and provided exceptional customer service. My room was spacious, clean and well appointed. She asked daily if everything was to my liking and if there was anything else I needed that would make my stay more comfortable. She is always welcoming and professional with a person touch. I have been staying at The Park Central Hotel exclusively while in NYC for over 6 years now due to this excellent customer service and attention she gives.

This was my second stay at the Park Central. I first stayed in 2010 and I loved it then which is why I returned. The hotel has recently been refurbished and is almost unrecognisable from my first stay, apart from the outside. Receptionist staff could have been friendlier upon check in and at first informed me that they had no booking under my name. Luckily I had printed my booking confirmation and they were able to find the booking. My first name and surname had been switched on the booking which I was informed happened from time to time. We were on the 3rd floor on the east side of the building. We had hoped to be higher up and have a better view but that's the luck of the draw. Our room was spacious, in particular the bathroom. Everything was beautifully maintained and very clean. We were a little disappointed that there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room but we had everything else we needed. The main negative about our room was the windows. Single glazed aluminium frames meant the room was very loud but also extremely cold. The heating in the room only seemed to blow out cold air. However the bed was the comfiest bed I have ever slept in anywhere. I really wanted to bring the bed home with me! So whilst the room was chilly the beds kept us nice and warm. The restaurant is now closed but this doesn't surprise me as there are so many restaurants and coffee shops nearby I would imagine the hotel found it hard to compete. There is a small coffee house type area in the restaurant which sells drinks and snacks although this closes around 10pm I think and they had run out of English breakfast tea bags when we wanted to buy a drink on our final day. The walls must be quite thin as we could literally hear everything in the room next door but I think we had an extremely noisy family staying next to us. The hotel arranged transport for our journey back to JFK who provided excellent service for good value. The concierge desk were very helpful during our stay. I notice from the reviews a lot of people complaining about the facilities fee. These complaints are unjust. The facilities fee was made clear to me during the booking and isn't bad value considering we had unlimited wifi for up to 5 devices and we were able to store our baggage at the hotel after checking out on our final day. There was also a gym available to use included in the facilities fee but we didn't use it. The location of this hotel is perfect. Very close to Central Park (less than a 5 minute walk), close to Times Square, 5th avenue, and there is a subway station right outside the station. I would definitely stay here again. This hotel certainly offers value for money.

I stayed here during a New York snowstorm. The room was large with a nice view of the snowy streets below. Close to everything including Carnegie Hall and Carnegie Deli. The staff was helpful and very courteous. The only down side was my room had very little heat. I did not notify the desk till the next day since I was comfortable enough and didn't want a plumber banging around. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was well equipped and large. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Stayed at the park central for 4 nights. The check inn was quick and easy but receptionist very unhelpful and unfriendly they need to learn customer skills however the door men where extremely friendly and welcoming. Rooms are large and very clean. Would stay here again. But please teach your receptionist social skills.

Our stay at Park Central was perfect in every way. The location was great; the accommodations and décor very impressive. The staff, however, made the stay extra special. Every staff member we encountered greeted us with a smile and ensured we knew we were like family. Special thanks to Quimby Hightower and others whom allowed us to enjoy the filming of "A Person of Interest" in the hotel's lobby and were especially warm and welcoming. We WILL be back.

Hotel was very well kept, excellent service by the front desk, bell hops, and valets. The rooms were exactly what we needed. Only complaint is regarding the bar. We got back around 10:30 PM one night and wanted to get a drink, but didn't want to leave the hotel again. The front desk informed us that the bar was open until 12 AM, so after we had freshened up in our respective rooms, we returned downstairs to find the bar closing at 11:05. When we asked the bartender if we could get a drink, he informed us that the bar usually shut down at 11:30 because business is apparently slow. Despite our obvious interest at getting a few drinks, the bartender continued to shut down the bar.

During check-in the associate called over 2 other associates & together they all hurdled up and whispered about my credit card and ID. After I asked what the problem was they then tell me the problem was me using a company credit card because it had the company name instead of my name on the card. It's hard for me to believe that any hotel in year 2015 has never seen a company card before...... problem being no one ever thought to simply say maim do you have another form of ID or another credit card. Which I had no problem providing once I was told what all the criminal treatment was about. Customers don't know your payment preferences or policies until you tell them. Instead of causing a scene in the lobby and making a big deal the 1st associate should have asked for an alternate form of payment & avoided the whole situation and ordeal. Then it feels like -12 degrees outside in NYC & I get to the room and the bed doesn't have adequate linen. No quilt. No comforter. No goose down. No blanket. Nothing except 3-4 sheets doubled together. And the heat in the room would only go so high. So I had to use my coat as coverage in a hotel that I paid my hard earned money for.

Thank you to The Park Central Hotel and especially Elizabeth for making our weekend stay incredible! I had strong reservations about booking a hotel room in NYC with two young children, fearing that we would be an inconvenience to other guests and be cooped up in the room. My husband and I actually felt like we had a romantic weekend getaway - even with the kiddos - and the location was fantastic.The staff members were attentive, gracious and made sure that we had everything needed for a comfortable stay. Elizabeth followed up with me both during and after our visit. This kind of personalized customer service far exceeded my expectations. My husband and I live in northern NJ and frequently visit the city. Thanks to this great experience, I will not think twice about staying in town at The Park Central when planning a family trip to the theater or a museum. I hope other guests have the opportunity to experience the fabulous customer service and beautiful accommodations at The Park Central Hotel.

I would like to thank the hotel management for their excellent service, high level of hygiene and its good staff especially Mr. Saleem at the reception. Certainly I will stay there again and again.Nadia Al Laham

Two friends and I stayed at Park Central for one week January 2015. Hotel location is ideal for shopping, theatre, opera, symphony. Lots of great dining in immediate area, everything from delis to fine dining.I have stayed here previously and was impressed with the renovations since my last stay. Highly recommended.

The hotel itself is nothing spectacular. Nice, very clean and with a modern attitude.The rooms are quite small but comfortable nonetheless. The real perk in staying here is how near it is from fifth avenue and all the places you will want to visit when in nyc.

I was just n NYC for the weekend (and got out before the big storm) and, because they had an incredible special rate, we stayed at the hotel . Here's my update:The hotel rooms are still quite amenity-less; no complimentary shower cap or coffee-maker. They do provide two little bottles of body lotion and in the shower a body wash, shampoo and conditioner and yes, there is a hair dryer. There is also no restaurant in the hotel though, why would you eat in an expensive hotel restaurant when there are so many restaurants in the area?One of the issues I had with the hotel was that they had a sparse, cold lobby area. they have resolved that by turning the former restaurant into a lovely lobby/bar area with plenty of comfortable seats and couches as well as a beautiful bar that opens just in time for happy hour at 5. (So, as I said, I can live without their restaurant.) It would be nice if they served an interesting bowl of nuts (cashews, almonds, etc) instead of the sweet and cheddar popcorn but hey, I didn't go their to eat anyway!They also have a new convenience spot called Central Market where you can get coffee, water and all sorts of delicious looking pastries (we didn't try any because they looked so fattening). It was a little odd that it was closed on Sunday because they person who runs it was out that day. (How can they not have other staff to cover it.) Never-the-less, there are plenty of places in the area to have breakfast for under $10 a piece. (So if you are upset by the lack of coffee-maker in the room, you will have to go out but there is the Central Market downstairs, a Starbucks next door, delis and diners everywhere close enough so you won't faint from lack of caffeine!)One thing I would suggest you do before you even bring your suitcase to your room is to check out the room. While the rooms are very pretty, we got a Classic King that literally had less than a foot between the bed and the dresser/TV stand. So we had to sidle past the bed every time we wanted to get from one side of the room to the other and my boyfriend kept banging his foot en route to the bathroom. (Had we not schlepped our luggage up and felt exhausted from the travel, we may have asked for another room.)Another improvement was the elevator situation. The last time I stayed there the elevators were slow and the waits long. This time the waits were short and the elevators were very efficient in climbing the floors.All in all, there were definitely improvements that overshadow the lack of coffee-maker in the room. And, by the way, I believe you can request one (but I am not entirely sure about that.) For location and price, I will stay there again and just get up in the morning, get dressed and go to one of the local restaurants for coffee and breakfast!

We booked a last minute reservation at the Park Central this past weekend. Not only was the staff very accommodating but our room on the 18th floor was superb! The room was large enough for 3 and very clean/modern. Even though we were directly across from the elevator we heard no noise what so ever. This is the place to stay in the heart of NYC!

been there for a four days holiday and I've been fully satisfied. our king size room was clean tidy and really nice. bed and pillows are ok, clean and nice bathroom but a bit noisy conditioning system. sure I'll keep in mind for the next trip!!

We stayed at Park Central this past weekend and found it to be a wonderful hotel that is centrally located in mid-town for all your sight-seeing activities. The hotel was very clean and recently remodeled featuring a very comfy bed, large size TV, and a modern and spacious bathroom. Excellant staff that was very attentive.Only knock we had was that the lobby café is supposed to open Sunday at 6:30 AM but failed to open before we left to go home at 8:00 AM. Since the room does not have a coffee pot I was forced to walk a block just to get our morning cup of java. UGH!!We will definitely return and stay again on our next trip to the Big Apple (and hopefully the café will open as scheduled.)

First of all, the room was good and big enough for our family of four adults. The toilet was clean and hygienically maintained with hot and cold water. The Lobby was good, though a bit stuffy and lack of sitting space for the visiting guests. Check in to the hotel was easy and so the check out. But the best of all was its location and close proximity to main tourist attraction The Times Square with shopping malls and night clubs. The sore point was internet not being free and every time you need to access the internet, you have to travel down to the lobby or the coffee shop. All in all, a place worth visiting again.

Walking into the lobby, we knew we made the right decision. Clean, elegant and inviting, this hotel did not disappoint. Staff was friendly and attentive. Check in process was smooth, and special requests were accommodated without hesitation. Rooms were exactly as shown in online photos. The rooms were very clean, bathrooms as well. Beds were comfortable, linens were crisp & fresh. I would (and already have) recommended this hotel to others. Cheers!

Loved my room at park central. You can walk to central park, fifth avenue and times square. Staff is friendly and the rooms are larger than most nyc rooms. The linens were very nice! We had no wait at the elevators. One thing i didnt like was the extra auto charge for the internet and gym. I think internet should be free and you should not advertise a rate and then be surprised with a 25.00 daily fee

Stayed here for one night on a Saturday due to the low winter rates. Location is the best near everything from Central Park to Times Square.. Having taking the ferry over from NJ, we used their bus to get within a block of the hotel and the same for the return.We arrived early at 1pm, but were told, "the guaranteed check in time is 4pm". Not sure if that is something they just quote robotically to everyone on a Saturday, or if our room was not ready since there was no mention of our room not being ready which is the usual hotel protocol IMO. Since we were out an about, we didn't go to our room until about 6pm. The room is beautiful (King Classic), nicely decorated, high ceilings and perfectly clean. This room type has no view which made for a very quiet night's sleep (and a dark room since were were surrounded by brick buildings.)The bathroom was a huge disappointment. Though decorated nicely, the door did not open fully as it completely hit the toilet. I'm a 5'6", size 6 person and had to walk in sideways to get in, then shut the door to get to the toilet or tub. The single sink was in an alcove between two walls in the bathroom and I would hit my elbows on the 2 walls when doing my hair. If we were staying more than one night, I certainly would have raised this as an issue to the hotel, but just thought I'd share with my fellow TA'ers instead.We had a few drinks at the bar. Not the best time I've ever had at a hotel bar. Bartenders were again very robotic, not social and measured every single think they poured from wine to liquor. Thought that was "cold" service for the high prices ($16/glass house wine). You do get "free" popcorn with your drinks that was very good (cheese and caramel coated).I can't say service was bad, but I did find it very impersonal - like every employee hated their job and was tolerating me. As a born and raised NYer I get what our reputation is, but the hospitality industry does not have the right to be less than personable/friendly/outgoing/etc.Enjoy your stay and consider an upgraded room if you want a little more "elbow room" than a King Classic.

As there is none!Grumpy Personal at Check Inn, We asked for an alteration to our booking, we might aswell have been talking to the wall with the response "Computer says No"!!Slow elevators and only two in operation for such a large hotel is ridiculous, No room service but not too much of a problem, there are plenty of Deli's in the area for great food at reasonable prices.No tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Room was nice enough but I definitely won't be back and Don't recommend it for anyone else

Me and my boyfriend stayed here for ten nights as our winter holiday trip to New York. It was the most amazing holiday we've ever had. The hotel was always clean, the staff were attentive and anything we needed we got. The hotel was in a great location and easily accessible. I would definitely stay here again.

The location is brilliant. The rooms are a decent size, the beds are really comfortable, and it was very quiet for NY! Obviously a constant stream of tourists and parties mean that customer relations are fairly basic, and the lack of a restaurant was a bit of a surprise but hey! we wanted to eat out anyway. The lifts/elevators are very fast once they have arrived. If you want a very clean and comfortable room in easy reach of Times Square, Carnegie Hall, Central Park and the Lincoln Centre, which has the subway 30 yards from the door, then this is a great choice.

We were here for one of my milestone birthdays to see a show at the Broadway Theatre. It was close to many restaurants and shopping and only minutes from Times Square. Many theatres are close as well. Very lovely lobby and trendy restaurant. We enjoyed our stay here. But of note, not sure if we could have reserved a mini fridge for our room and was sort of caught off guard when we brought leftovers from an area restaurant. May have to ask for coffee maker as well. Since our stay was only for a day and a half we did not call to ask. There is a busy café across the street and right next door for the coffee lovers was a Starbucks!

I spent 6 nights at the Park Central Hotel just before Christmas. The hotel room was very nice, well decorated and clean. I have seen complaints about the elevators, but I did not have to wait for longer than 5 minutes. I did not eat or drink in the hotel so cannot comment on this.The location was ideal for my first time in New York, 5 minute walk to Central Park one way and a 5 minute walk to times Square the other, also only a short walk to all the fifth avenue shopping. So much to do and so many places to eat and drink within a 5 minute walk. There is a subway station right outside the hotel door aswell so you can be anywhere in Manhattan within 20 minutes.By the end of my stay I had really had enough of it being mad busy outside the hotel being so close to Times Square. If I do go back to New York I will probably stay in a different area next time, but I am glad I chose this for my first visit. If you ware planning on doing all the touristy things and want to be in the middle of the madness I would definitely recommend staying here!There is a resort fee to pay, around $27 a night I think, I have seen some people complaining about this, but it is made clear on the hotels website so was not a shock to me! Also the café directly across from the hotel front door does a great breakfast!

My wife and I returned to New York, this was our 4th trip here and our second stay at the Park Central. We both love New York and we feel it is the most exciting city in the USA. There is always something going on in Times Square and always a lot of people at anytime of the day or night. We took in a Billy Joel Concert at Madison Square and it was the high light of our trip as he is one of our favorite entertainers. We walked from our hotel which on 7th Ave and 55 st to Madison Square Garden for the concert ( this is close to 2 miles each way and there thousands of people out after the concert in Times Square. We also saw so many other attractions that we kept busy everyday. It was cold but with all the people around it was not too bad. New York is truly the City that never Sleeps.

I attended trade shows in NYC from Jan 17-20.Again I stayed at the Park Central Hotel.Room was great. Pillows so soft you don't to leave the bed. Service great as usual. Elizabeth, the guest services manager created us upon our arrival. She is most accomodating .Coffee bar makes great cappuccino.Had problem with bathroom and was resolved within minutes. Great service.Bar area is great. Too bad restaurant closed. The bar could be opened longer. It closes at 11.Been staying here for years and will continue to do so.Vince

This hotel is close to Times Square, so great for someone who wants to be close to that action. The hotel feels a bit shabby and sad. Bar was deserted, restaurant was closing permanently while we were there. Rooms are large for NYC, but toiletries were not refilled in our room. Elevators were slow and always full.

The hotel has an excellent location as others have mentioned. It looks like after renovation the previous Park Central Hotel was divided into two hotels (Park Central and the more luxurious WestHouse). Not sure how it was divided, probably the top floors are now WestHouse and the bottom floors are Park Central; this adds to the elevator confusion for those in Park Central. Staff is always nice, and the room we were in was clean and large enough. Good choice especially if you get a price discount or a coupon.

Was there on the weekend of January 17 & 18, 2015. I was with a school group and we had to place our luggage in a holding area until our buses came later in the day. One piece of our luggage was lost. No offer to reimburse us for the lost garment bag and it's contents. Not even an apology. This happened under their watch.

My husband and i stayed at the hotel in late December for 13 nights. The hotel has been renovated and is perfect for our stay. The location only a couple of blocks to Central Park and a few blocks to Times Square. Housekeeping kept the room neat and tidy. Upon arriving at front desk to check in after a 25 hour flight we were told the hotel was overbooked and not given the room we booked 6 months prior. We were given the correct room the day after but found this not a good start to our holiday. The other downfall was that the bar closed at 11.00pm when advertised as closing at midnight. We would like to praise the efforts of Elizabeth Cacovic, the guest relations manager for her efforts in rectifying this situation. We would stay there again and would recommend it to others.

This trip was my 4th stay at the Park Central hotel and it never disappoints, only ever seems to get better. Located up by 59th and Columbus Circle - which is far enough out from the madness of Times Square to be a little quieter (in a New York context!) yet still only a 15 min walk back into that same madness. Transport links are good nearby thanks to the proximity of Columbus Circle and 7th Avenue, plus the open top tour buses leave from stops about 10 min walk away. Getting around is therefore a breeze. Nearby attractions such as Carniege Hall and of course Central Park itself make the location even better.From the outside this hotel is pure NYC. It's gothic and grand and everything you'd imagine from a hotel in a movie. Inside it's wonderful - appointed as if the art deco era never left in a very grand style. Customer service is excellent, whether it's front desk, concierge, the bar staff, or the cleaners. Everyone on the team is keen to talk, help and make your visit that little bit better.We had a room on the 5th floor on the side nearest Central Park, facing inwards to the court, which does mean the room was a little darker than perhaps it should have been but minimised the noise from the road outside. The room is plenty large for New York - 2 double beds, a more than adequate wardrobe, a desk, seat, big TV and a great bathroom, with a 'stubby' bath that doubles as the shower, with some great artwork round the walls. The provided toiletries are above average qualty being provided by CC Bigelow which is just down the road from the hotel.All in all how can I recommend this hotel? It's clean, friendly, comfortable, high quality and everything you need to come back to and base from for a week in New York. I almost don't want to tell anyone about it because it'll become too popular and prices will go up. Yes it's also a bargain for the service you receive. Visiting New York? Check in to Park Central.

Stayed with my mom and son, had two rooms. They are small but functional and clean with modern furnishings. Hotel bar is beautiful as is lobby. No restaurant at this hotel but hello, you are in NYC , plenty of restaurants around. Hotel should fix the elevators that aren't working.

My wife and I stayed at the Park Central Hotel for New Year's Eve 2015. We booked this hotel due it being close to Times Sq and Central Park and being good value for money. I'm sure most New York hotel rooms are small in size but we were able to move around the room quite easily with plenty of space. Overall the hotel was very comfortable indeedMy wife had emailed the hotel in advance to let them know we were coming for my birthday and the hotel had replied to say that they would try to organise a treat. Even during such a busy time for the hotel, on arrival we were provided a small upgrade with a complimentary champagne bottle. We could not have asked for more our New Years and my birthday.

Location of hotel is near Times Square and Central Park and on the other site of th street you find Carnegie. They have some workplaces in the lobby with power, so you can work after check-out. In my room no safe was present and couldn't be fixed. (!?) The other advise is to have a bar tender in the bar to serve the 20-30 people in the lobby. Rooms are spacious and clean. The 'power of the shower' can be improved...

I booked this hotel as a Groupon Getaway, and was very pleased with this choice overall. The 7th Ave location was perfect for my needs: even on a bitterly cold night I was able to walk to and from the Neil Simon Theatre. Desk staff are cordial and helpful. When I arrived about 45 minutes before check-in time, the desk clerk made a room switch to my advantage to let me check in early. It was a quiet room at the end of a hallway facing the inner courtyard. The décor of the room (indeed the whole hotel) was sleek and sophisticated. NYC hotel rooms can be notoriously cramped, but this was surprisingly spacious, with a roomy closet. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. Pump bottles fixed to the shower wall dispensed lavender-scented body wash, shampoo, conditioner. I would have welcomed a disposable shower cap, fluffier bath towels, and a ventilation fan in the bathroom. And why is there no clock radio in the room? Would it have disrupted the feng shui? It was annoying to have to reach for my phone and open it whenever I needed to check the time. Form should never preclude function in a hotel room.In stark contrast to this minimalism, the bathroom art was visually jarring: a gigantic, vivid, big-red-lipped head of a woman stared out over the top of the toilet. Bad choice. The non-optional $25/day facilities fee on top of the room charge includes luggage check and storage until 9 pm (handy when checkout is 11 am and you’ve got an evening departure), free calls to anywhere in the US on your room phone, use of the fitness center, and use of a computer terminal in the lobby for things like searches, directions, and airline information. The grab-and-go snack shop in the lobby is handy, and the items I had were all fresh and very good. The restaurant always looked empty or even closed. But for a sit-down breakfast, there are plenty of choices: a couple of delis less than a block away, a diner across the street, and a patisserie down the street, for starters. The reasonably comfortable open lounge area includes tables/outlets for laptops.

Hands Down!! The best place to stay in New York Manhattan! 5 min walk to central park 15 min walk to Time Square. Clean, beautiful and immaculate rooms and décor! What else can you ask for!I bought two nights of stay for this hotel through a third party as a present for my parents who were visiting USA for the first time. As much as I was happy for them I was also very nervous. I didn’t want them to come back home with any bad memories! I did a lot of research with my hotel booking and this one kept coming back on my short list (although it was a slight bit over my budget). Once I booked the accommodation I couldn’t wait for my parents to get there.Obviously it wasn’t as easy as I expected. My parents experienced some flight delays due to which they arrived a day later than the actual check in date. Now according to the policy I couldn’t make any changes to the booking I had made neither could I get a refund for the one night stay that my parents were missing. It took me a bit of time to get to the right people who had the authority to do that but once I reached them my problem was resolved in a matter of hours. Not only did I get a refund for my one night stay, my parents were also given an upgrade to a premier king!I would like to thank Don and Tom for their help and support and making this a memorable experience for my parents. I must admit my parents were very sad with the fact that they only stayed one night at the hotel and wished that they had stayed longer!Thanks again to the team at Park Central. I highly recommend this hotel.

I stayed here for 4 ou 5 times but this last one I realized that the hotel suffered a great refurbish. Everything looks new, rooms and bathroom. The unique thing that I missed inside the room was a refrigerator and complimentary coffee machine, very commom in US' hotels.

I went there the first weekend after the Christmas tree lighting. Great location and interior with a very helpful starr. Hotel was perfectly in between Times Square and Central Park and very close to Carnegie Hall and deli! Walks are about 5 minutes to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central park. Newly renovated rooms. Bathrooms were a bit small but manageable.

We stayed at the Park Central during the holidays, a very busy, crowded time in NYC. This was our first stay at this hotel, and we enjoyed it immensely. The location is perfect! You can walk to Times Square or Central Park easily, and just a few short blocks away from 5th Avenue and great museums. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms were clean and efficient. We loved the bar and often had pre-dinner drinks there or snacks in the restaurant. The only problem we experienced was with the elevators. They are small and there were only two for our floors, resulting in wait times during peak hours. Other than that, it was a great experience and we would stay there again.

We spent 3 nights in early January at this hotel and enjoyed our stay very much. The staff was super friendly and helpful--we got upgraded to a better room and were able to check in at lunch time. The weather was forecast to be a little icy at checkout, so the staff arranged for a car to take us to the airport for a great price so we wouldn't have to gamble with a cab. My only complaint is that there is not a restaurant in the hotel, just a little pricey snack bar, but with all the other choices around, it wasn't a deal breaker at all. I would return in a New York minute to this hotel!

I searched long and hard for the perfect hotel for my family and I to stay at in NYC. The Park Central was the perfect choice for so many reasons, here are a few: can't beat the location (close to everything, Central Park, shopping, subways, Times Square, next door to Carnegie Deli, etc.), clean all around, room was spacious (for New York standards), modern look, beds were very comfy (and we are picky in this department) and enough room for 2 (queen beds vs. most hotels have full sized), great views from the corner rooms, coffee/snack shop was convenient, restaurant had great food (but I think they are now closed for renovations), all staff friendly, we didn't have any problems. Overall it was a great hotel and we were very comfortable in the room!! I loved the great aromatherapy in the lobby which was nice to smell after getting off the busy city streets. It was as if you walked into a spa. I would definitely stay here again!!!! We can't wait to return!

i was surprised of the size of the premium room. We had two double beds and there was two adults and two children aged 7 and 5. We could actually relax in the room in front of the massive TV in the evenings. So,e nights we got pizza from Rays pizza in our room. It took 5 mins there and back. Loads and loads of dinners outside the hotel which was perfect for breakfast choices. We tried a different place every morning for the 6 nights we were there. Really easy to get to Rockefeller and Times Square Central Park. The location was superb as it was away from the hassle and bustle of Times Square but just there really. Starbucks on the corner. We used the bar one evening and the service was outstanding And personal. This hotel is a no brainier if you want location, price and good size rooms in NYC. Would stay there again. Kids loved it and we often walked back to relax in the afternoon if children were tired. Only downside was noise from the room. Could hear people next door and dump trucks at night. He hotel could do with investing in sound proof windows. I mentioned this to the management and they couldn't really do much. Overall a happy experience. We accepted and got use to the noise as we are in NYC. Hidden gem of a hotel in NYC.

I've stayed at this hotel four or five times now. It is in a brilliant location, has great facilities and the staff are very polite, efficient and helpful. I will definitely be staying there next time I visit New York!.

Elizabeth at the front desk was fantastic.The room ,gym,staff friendliness was greatDon FRASER,the GM,has put together a winning team.Always a pleasure to be a guest.I always recommend my friends to stay here.Everything is always A plusPeter Pollak

I visit New York, during the holidays, to get my fix of "cold weather." I live in California and we don't get much of a winter, so New York becomes my Holiday Destination! I always stay at PARK CENTRAL. I am within walking distance of the beautiful windows on 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center and my favorite place, Central Park! The staff is really friendly and attentive. I had a corner room on the 18th floor with 2 nice views of the city. The king bed was so comfy. The lobby was beautifully decorated for the holidays. I always enjoy my stay with PARK CENTRAL. I highly recommend you give it a try!

I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is in an excellent location, just a walking distance from Central Park,Times Square, and Brodway. The downside to the hotel is that there's no room service and also a $20 a night facilities fee for using wifi and gym. Overall a good hotel and would definitely stay again.

Stayed her from the 10th to the 15th of December 2014 together with my mother for a mother-daughter weekend. Well the location was great - close to Central Park for a morning stroll, close to Times Square, Broadway, Fifth Avenue and the subway. As well many great places to have breakfast and grab a coffee to go.Didn't eat or drink anything at the hotel so can't say anything about the service or quality in this area. The reception staff were not very engaging, service-minded and some were on verge of being rude. They couldn't help with the simplest things like mailing postcards, providing stamps to either international or national post and when we were informed they didn't sell stamps they seemed bothered by having to tell us where we could get them - this sounds really unimportant but this was after several other incidents so we were just over the mediocre service at this hotel. New toilet paper rolls took approx. 18-22 hours to receive even though we reminded them 2-3 times, they didn't have adapters in the reception to lend but luckily there was one person in the staff at the hotel that went over and beyond - Quimby I think his name was he is the the head of guest relations he lent me his private adapter for our entire stay. He put all the other staff to shame with their poor service standard - if the rest of the staff were like him the hotel would be a lot better.The elevators were the worst - floor 10-20 or 22 shared TWO elevators and for about 18-24 hours there was only ONE elevator working. Waiting 20-45 minutes for the elevator is NOT OK! Absolutely terrible!The hotel looks really nice, modern and renovated but it was just on the surface... Things were half broken in the lobby bathrooms, paint coming off in places, the holder in the shower was also half broken. The hotels surface is beautiful but once you look beyond with more critical eyes you find that it's quite worn and battered...Would possibly return for the same price we paid but not a penny more and that is for two simple reasons the location and that when travelling on city vacations I spend very little time in the hotel room and hotel - just sleeping, showering and changing clothes.

Location is fine if you're a first time visitor or are in NYC to meet business partners ... It's neither good nor bad ... Just okay ... I just spent one night so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt ... BUT charging $25 facility fee + $2.22 facility fee tax even when facilities are not used???

first off we have stayed many times at the park central we have always had a pleasant stay.we arrived a little early and while at the front desk we said we were here to celebrate the holidays and my wife had just had her birthday.they gave us a nice room with a great view.it made our stay even better.the main floor has been newly renovated,the look is nice and comfortable.i found all the staff were friendly and helpful,i remember the person at the luggage holding department named mohammad he was right there to take care of our bags while we were out for a while the last day in the city.i'll be back.

Front desk was as bland as bland can be. Just plain didn't listen to my comments or needs. The manager on duty at 11pm was ridiculously flippant about the fact that computers don't print boarding passes for JetBlue even though it's a huge carrier in the area. His comment - "what are you donna do?" and then walked away. Walked in/out of the hotel 12 times at least over 2 days and there was a doorman 1 time. Bellman couldn't be bothered to give eye contact. Housekeeper left the window open....open when it's 10 degrees outside. There's a leak in the pipes you can hear in the bathroom. "yes, we know, we are working on it". Yah, right. The only saving grace? A ridiculously comfortable bed. Crazy good.

Great and friendly customer service at a NYC hotel on a Sat night over the holidays is a rarity. Though I was told by the hotels' central booking that I could check-in early, I was informed upon arrival that I would have to wait a minimum of an additional four hours. After a slight wait, the onsite manager Elizabeth not only gave me the professional courtesy of immediately checking me in, but gave me a room upgrade and a couple complimentary drink tickets at the hotel bar to boot. It also happened to be my birthday, so thank you Elizabeth and Park Central Hotel (which looks great after the recent renovations).

Stayed at Park Central Hotel from New Years Day for week. Had to change rooms ( we had 2 rooms) they were opposite the lifts , not a good idea with people coming and going through the night. We then were given 2 rooms on 17 th floor, room 1702. On first viewing looked good. The plug in sink wouldn't stay down so we had to support it with a small container. Then when you emptied sink it leaked on the shelf underneath. Did mention to cleaner but it never got sorted. The surround of the carpet were very dusty, even found a lid under the chair after we had been there for nearly a week., very dusty beside cabinets on carpets. Don't think the carpet has seen a Hoover for a while. Also no tea / coffee making facilities in room, so you had to go down each morning to get a coffee, which opened 6...30 am closed at 10 pm. So if you wanted a cuppa out of those hours you would have to go out of hotel. The bedding I must say was clean and bed very comfortable. It is very central to Times Square. I think management should check rooms as cleaners are not doing a very good job. Also our window was broken so traffic noise could be heard . Leg kept falling off chair. Heating had a mind of its own.

This is by far the worst hotel I have stayed in. I have no idea who gives the good reviews. They are either fake or they have never been to a hotel before. The staff are unfriendly and during check in nothing was explained. We had booked a Premier King room (which is supposed to be on "high" floors) so were disappointed when we were told the room was on 10th floor. When we asked about this we were told anything over 8 (out of 24 floors) is classed as high.There are only 2 VERY small lifts so expect long waits. When we got to the room we found it to be tiny and dark as there are no lights on the ceiling and only one bedside lamp. The bathroom was the smallest it could possibly be and hardly had any essentials in. There was no mini bar, tea/coffee making facilities, restaurant or room service. How they have managed to get a 4 star rating is beyond me. As the phone was not working had to go back to reception to complain about this. They said they had no kettles but they would provide a coffee maker, which we never saw. They also gave us a chitty for complimentary breakfast (which they actually charged us for) but as there was no restaurant the breakfast comprised of a pastry and coffee in a disposable cup. The walls were paper thin. The housekeeping trolleys were kept in the corridors so constantly looked messy. During checkout we were presented with a bill including compulsory charges ($20+tax per person per night) which is practically for WiFi. At the prices they charge they are the world's most expensive hostel as I would definitely not call them a hotel. After leaving there we went to Boston where we stayed in Holiday Inn which was much nicer at less than half the price. That says it all really.

Stayed at the Park Central for a girls weekend. Nice hotel, centrally located. Rooms are decent size for NYC. Two queen beds so four girls could share the room. Bathroom is small. Didn't eat at the restaurant on site. It also offers a small coffee shop inside.

This is my second time staying at the Park Central. I had stayed there years ago with some girlfriends for a weekend getaway and loved the location as well as the staff (we relied entirely on the conceirge back then to plan our weekend!) When my parents, my own family and I decided to visit New York for a few days, I immediately suggested the Park Central... The hotel has been refurbed since my first visit and the lobby is lovely. The rooms are much nicer too... We had a good time generally until the last night. My husband, daughter and I left the room with just our key cards and when we tried to get back into the room, we were denied access. I left my husband and my 6-year old by the room and went down to reception to sort this situation out. I did not have ID and knew it was perfectly logical that a member of staff would need to verify that I was, in fact, the guest registered to the room but the member of reception staff was so rude and unpleasant, she managed to make me so angry! She said that she would call security and they would meet us at our room. After 15 minutes of waiting, I used the public phone on our floor and the operator tried his very best to help me. He could not get security and he could not locate a manager to help. At this point, my husband went down to try and get some help. In the meantime, after being on the line with me for a long time, the operator managed to locate someone in security who was on his way to me. My husband found out that the woman who had been so atrocious to me had sent security to the wrong room. The security man was more-than-pleasant, verified my identity and said that we did not need to go down to reception again and that he would arrange new key cards to be delivered. The man who brought them was also more-than-pleasant and apologized for the lady at reception's attitude. In fact, everyone was so nice after that, I gave this hotel more than 1 star! The only other negative, in our experience was the facilities charge. It is weird that it is not included in our rate - we have travelled all around the world and have never been charged additional for the use of the facitilities (except wifi and parking, if we specifically requested them ). I feel kind of cheated! I don't recall being informed of this charge when I booked our rooms... I probably would have booked at one of our party's other choices, if I had been informed, purely on a principal basis!

My title says it all - Great Location! The hotel is central to everything I want to do in the city. The rooms are adequate and the staff usually friendly. My only real complaint is their "Facilities Fee". I stay here often and last year they instituted - in their words - a required facilities fee. This fee is $25.00 per night and allows me to use their wifi, telephone, luggage storage, and fitness center for "free". I have explained to them that I NEVER use these services. I am disappointed that a very nice property uses tactics like this to add to their bottom-line.

Very nice hotel! Breakfast is not offered, although we can find many coffee shops around in the area, which makes your stay in the hotel very convenient. The size of the bedroom is okay, although bathroom is too small. I do recommend the hotel.

I stayed at Park Central in Nov 2014. Very nice hotel for a reasonable price. Clean and good size rooms, not huge but comfortable. I gave 3 stars only because I left a good pocket knife in my room and called after checking out to see if they found it. I got the run around over the phone and they basically told me that I was out of luck. I actually happened to be in NY again Jan 2015 and paid them a visit in person to see if I can find my knife (worth $100.00). I was told that they didn't find it. I can't 100% blame them for not finding it (could have been the next guest). It's fair to say that it was in plain view on the table, so it was probably a staff member.

This was our first time in New York so I was unsure where to book. I was very pleased with our choice, it was close to Times Square and Central Park. The hotel was very clean and when I asked for tea/coffee making facilities they went out of their way to get me a coffee machine and find some tea bags. It's quite close to Hells Kitchen too, we had our best meal of our trip in a small Indian restaurant there. Unfortunately I can't remember its name but oh my word it was good and very reasonably priced. Could not fault this hotel in any way and would highly recommend. Sleep quality was low due to noise outside, this is nothing to do with the hotel we were on 16th floor but the bin lorries and police sirens which were incredibly loud kept us awake most of the night.

We stayed here for 6 nights checkin was really quick there were enough people at reception. I think the girl who checked us in was Carolyn she was really nice! The room however was not very nice there was mould everywhere and even my leather shoes were covered by mould. The service staff at the restaurant was really nice as well however the food was terrible. The hotel is located just between the central park and time square, the price was alright. So all in all I think it's a good hotel to stay over a few nights but don't expect too much...

We stayed at Park Central Hotel for four nights - and were very happy with it. The location in Midtown was a key for us and it proved to be a good choice. Its on 7th Avenue and an easy stroll to the wonderful Central Park. The weather was great during our stay and we spent a lot of time in the Park strolling and biking (we rented bikes a few blocks away from the hotel).Park Central is surrounded by great eateries and delis including Carnegie Deli (queues for this were unbelievable so we tried a few others nearby - and weren't disappointed). Lots of good quality local stores for groceries, takeaways and wine and beer.Carnegie Hall is just up the road and it's an easy stroll down 7th to Times Square, but just far enough away from all of its noise, action and madness. From the Hotel we also walked easily to Broadway to see Kinky Boots, breakfast at Juniors both on West 45th Street, Rockefeller Center and lots of other things. We also used the hop on hop off buses and there is a stop just outside the Hotel. All in all the location in NY was superb for us.Park Central is a good quality, 4 star hotel, Our room was well appointed and the bed was very comfy. The hotel has a good restaurant (and nice lounge for cocktails, drinks and nibbles as well) and a small coffee and cake shop.The staff were exceedingly helpful and friendly.This hotel and location get a big tick from us - we will be back at some stage.

Most amazing views of time square from the windows!! Amazing value for money...perfect location!! Beautiful interior and bedrooms, massive comfy, clean bedrooms. Loved our stay here! Staff weren't the friendliest of people. We could escape the mayhem up in our room as it totally masked the noise of the city that never sleeps. Would definitely stay here again.

My second time at Park Central and another great visit. Nice room. We found the bed very comfortable! Good location with access to Central Park, shopping and a small walk to theatre district. Helpful staff from the desk, concierge, bell and porters. .

We stayed here for one night, we checked into the hotel quite late and was very tired after a day of travelling,Check in was real easy and went to our room, Room was real nice and was very quite from the street noise.Bed was comfy and bathroom was nice, the only criticism was there wasn’t anything to drink no bottled water and anything, there was an ice bucket with glasses but nothing to pour into the glasses, apart from tap water which isn’t the best.wifi in the room was fab and really quick. The hotel itself is really busy checking out was long so we just handed back our room key and put our bags in the baggage room there was a little que but wasn’t bad. All in all a good hotel, great location too…the Irish bar across the road is fab… The only thing is the $25 they charge you to use the facilities but once at the hotel you will see why they charge you, facilities includes wifi and use of the baggage room. To be honest this should be built into the room charge even if the room charge was a little more it would still be worth it..

Lovely HotelVery centralisedVery helpful staffCleanLovely Bar areaDouble Queen Room - The beds are slightly smaller than double beds so fitting four men on a boys holiday in that room was a little tight but we hardly spent any time in the hotel so it wasn't a big problem. Lifts/Elevators - I think there is a problem with the elevators in the hotel. I know it was a busy period being NYE but only one elevator was working. Some days we had to wait 10-15 minutes for the elevator to get to floor 17. Then it would stop on ever floor going down. So if you are in a rush its probably quicker to take the stairs (as many people were doing). All in all a very friendly hotel suited for family's, friends, groups (big or small) and couples. When you need to print out your boarding passes for your flight home the hotel has free WIFI to log into your flight and it also has printers to print out the boarding passes (reception)- VERY HELPFUL

1st time in NYC, it was a great spot. Close to Central Park, and only 10-15min walk to time square. We walked everywhere, from the hotel to Times Square to Madison garden for the NBL and through Park Central. The hotel is very nice, big lobby and service is excellent. Wifi was a little slow. Our room: a premier king room on the 15th floor was nice, Good size and clean. The internal walls are a little thin.. Can here people in the hall, but extenal walls are think and could not here the street noise. Overall we loved our stay. Quite pricey but everywhere in NYC is expensive.

Stayed with my wife for 1 night while visiting family and we both wished we had booked the room longer. Two room suite with 2 bathrooms could have comfortably accommodated four adults since the living room area had a pull out couch. We had a wonderful view of Time Square and the surrounding city. Simple and elegant features, as well as attentive service, rivaled any other luxery accommodations we've visited throughout the world. We would definitely stay here again!

Gorgeous hotel, newly renovated. Modern rooms equipped with all you need for relaxation and luxury. Staff absolutely amazing. From Jessica at the front desk to Noel the bellman to Isaac the other bellman. Breakfast was delicious in the restaurant on the main level.I ABSOLUTELY recommend this hotel, close to theater and views of Times Square right outside front door!

One important thing to consider when visiting NY is that you will be spending a lot of your time out of the hotel, therefore certain hotel luxurious aren't really needed. This is not to say this hotel is average - it was just ideal when factoring in price and location. The rooms are clean with all the necessary amenities (great shower!) and the staff were polite and friendly. The most impressive thing and the most important thing for us was location. The hotel is walking distance to a lot of the attractions (Times square, Central park and a couple blocks from 5th ave.) The subway is literally 2-3 minutes walk, meaning most locations are not out of reach.Overall in my opinion the hotel has everything you need when visiting NY and with a competitive price. it really was ideal, would definitely recommend.

Have stayed here a few years ago and then gave it a miss. However, I stayed there last night and I was very impressed with the improvements. The public areas have been greatly improved, the whole place is much lighter and airy. The rooms are modern and very comfortable, it was really good that the Park Central was back and on my list for places to stay and recommend to friends. If I had one issue, the edge of the carpets on the room was dusty as was the skirting boards. I do t have a dust allergy, but someone just might! Overall, would stay there again, they looked after me very well indeed and the front desk manager, Quemby? Was a delight.

Park Central was absolutely gorgeous and in a great location. My room had a view of Central Park and I was able to walk everywhere I wanted to go. Our room was a lot bigger than I thought. It was very spacious and modern. Our heat never came on in our room but I never called the front desk to bother with it. My husband and I got to the room early expecting to just drop off our bags but we were allowed to check in early which was great. The front desk was spectacular and it was a great stay. I will defiantly stay here again for the service and location. The bathroom was a great size. Something had wasted on the door and just needed to be wiped down, but it was clean and very spacious. I've stayed in NYC before and the rooms were tiny and the bathroom the size of a closet and that was not the case here. The restaurant looked very fabulous but I never got a chance to dine there. This was my husbands first time in NYC and the hotel and its location was just an added bonus on him having a great trip!

This is a nice hotel at a very competitive price given the great location. Room was somewhat small, but nice, clean and with all the amenities. Staff was friendly and efficient. We will recommend to others and happily stay here again.

First time staying at Park Central. Overall its very good. Best location for getting around Manhattan. Staff was friendly and helpful. They were happy to accommodate our needs. Rooms were modern and clean, great shower. View of "inner courtyard" is not anything to view. Rooms were very quiet. Elevators overall were OK but they seem small for the size of the hotel. I would stay there again, but would not order drinks from their downstairs bar, they were too expensive in my opinion..

I traveled to NYC with a group of 9 women the week before Thanksgiving. We were thrilled with our stay at Park Central. The location was excellent, within walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, 5th Ave and more. I made the reservations for the stay and throughout the process, everyone I dealt with could not have been nicer nor more helpful. On a subsequent call to confirm arrangements before the visit, they even informed me of better rates which saved us nearly $500!! Upon arrival, we asked for a double room as opposed to the one king room we had and they gladly made the swap for the same price. The rooms were stylish, clean and comfortable with 2 queen size beds rather than the usual full beds found in NYC hotels. We stayed 3 to a room and we made out just fine with plenty of room. At check out, Elizabeth and Angela at the front desk, went out of their way to accommodate our payment preferences. Something they didn't have to do but did and it ended our trip on a high note!! Thank you Park Central for treating us like special guests!! We highly recommend you to all NYC visitors!!

We had two rooms for a family of five. Hotel was OK. Location is great for a vacation trip. Service was friendly. Only negative thing was loud heating/ air-conditioning unit fan. Rooms we renowned lately.

it was an excellent time very pleasant and stress free. i recomended at any time very satisfactory experience. It was closed to excellent shopping and near the most famous landmarks in NY. the rooms were so clean and the beds very comfortable. all the hotel employees were very nice and helpfull
user_location: New York, New York, United States

review_body: Friends from Toulouse France were visiting NYC during the Holiday Season. I knew no French and they spoke little to no English. While speaking with Corinne at the Concierge desk I explained the language barrier. Immediately she gave me a warm smile and told me she speaks French fluently. Corinne saved the day and went beyond her duties as a Concierge Representative to an interpreter. She made my friends extremely comfortable navigating in the city, and put my heart at ease. Corinne expressed the willingness to help my friends and to circle back to check on them for the remaining of their stay. I felt like I left them in good hands. Corinne is a valuable asset to the Park Central staff, and is truly a professional in her profession.
user_location: New York, New York, United States

review_body: The hotel is perfectly located close to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre and Central Park. Walked to most attractions and plenty of nearby restaurants, theatres and cafes. Rooms are very small and bathrooms are tiny. But they are clean and overall very good value for what it is.

This was my first time at the hotel after the conclusion of its renovation. And I must say it was a "good" renovation. The common areas looked great and the room felt new. Add the perfect location and the friendliness of the staff and I will most definitely return to this hotel next time I go to New York.

I booked 2 double beds rooms for my family. At arrival I was told by a non friendly front desk staff that our rooms were very far appart , not even in the same tower.I complained the day after but it has been cumbersome to fix the problem. The first alternative was a dirty room with several fixtures missing(safe, lamp, chair, painting in the wall) the bathroom was tiny with the door almost touching the toilets!I complained about the room and was changed again by a nice guest desk person , they did the change without discussion, good job which changed my early bad perception.. Beware at booking, ask for the largest bathroom possible( same price!...)VERY loud air conditioning/ heating which can be switched off. The rooms could be more thoroughly cleaned (1 old hair elastic lying forever on the carpet(not mine and still there at time of writing ) one old pin found on the desk ( not ours)Tiny bath towels , cheap amenities in bathroom , no shower caps, tiny low bath tub but renovated rooms.Expensive for the service and surface of the room.( this is New York)No real concierge service.

As reviewer "Annejarret47" said on 12/19/14 the rooms are "much too warm" and cannot be properly adjusted. I set my thermostat as low as it would go (65 degrees) yet all night the actual temp stayed at 76 degrees. The manager replied to Annejarret47 saying that the team of engineers would be looking into her reported problem. Well what happened Mr. Manager? I sweated all night and remained awake. Inexcusable considering management is fully aware of the problem. I thought they are committed to quality improvement? Or was that simply lip service and saving face to sound good in the comments section?I have over 200 reviews on Tripadvisor and most are positive. But because I didn't sleep last night I plan to check out today if temperature is not resolved this morning. If I can't get a nights sleep I give 2 stars despite all the frills. While the location is prime, lobby and bar are very beautiful, and bed was comfy I still would not stay even one more night free. In addition to the hot room the heating and cooling unit is loud, there are no over head lights in room, too few outlets (as other reviewers have reported this month). On a positive note, if the warm 76 degree temp is fine with you the location is prime with N, Q, R trains right there literally, as is Carnegie Hall, Carnegie Deli, Starbucks, Central Park is just a few blocks. Staff were generally professional. If they resolve my heating I'll write a secondI review to be completely fair.

Wonderful, fully renovated hotel in a great location between Theater District & Central Park.Very prompt courteous service, rooms very clean & contemporary decor. Vibrant public space (with bar & light fare) for meeting friends or just hanging out.Good price for NYC.

We'll be honest...we booked the hotel because the rate was so good and the hotel is located in midtown, right where we wanted to be. We had stayed here years ago, and while we didn't remember having any problems then, it didn't stand out in our memory as an outstanding stay. Well, this time was different. The hotel is much nicer than I expected (recent reno?) and the staff was warm and welcoming. Our room was a good size and attractive and clean. Angela, who checked us in, was very helpful and was able to get us into our room early-at noon! We will definitely be back! P.S. Love the smell in the lobby!

Check in was fabulous and expedited. I was excited that I was awarded my upgrade request... When I arrived in the room though I was very irritated that the extra money I spent for a high floor was facing a brick wall. Who would pay extra for that?? I should have gotten a discount!
