I didn't request any services. There was a lot of dust in the room, which made sense when the head housekeeper was arguing with another housekeeper at about 9am loudly in the hallways.. While another gentleman was vacuuming. At 9am. This was extremely irritating. We left right after, there was no sleeping in that morning! Luckily it has a great location. It was a block from the Carnigie Deli, so we beat the crowd to a great breakfast!

I was surprised to meet a resort fee of about $25 when I checked in. When I asked the manger what the fee was she said to me that it was on their website etc; and on expedia. I explained to her that I didn't see the fee until after I had received the booking confirmation. She (Denise) further explained that the fee was for:1. Internet2. Use of the gym3. Local calls4. Storage fees for your bags kept till 9pmI laughed. I said to her these are facilities that are included in the room rate in other hotels especially if the room rate is $200 or more. And that I had never heard of a resort fee being charged for a hotel in New York. Hotels with resort facilities like a pool, tennis court, golf course etc but not for a New York City hotel. I then went on to explain to her that I wouldn't be using these facilities. I had a cell phone which I used for local calls; we were checking out at 11am and would not have time to use the gym or use the storage facilities. As for Wi-fi that was usually complimentary or guests had the option to pay for it. She refused to budge -- stating that the fee was mandatory regardless of whether guests used the facilities or not. Unfortunately we could not cancel our booking as it was made through expedia. But the whole check in process just left me with a very bitter after taste.Sad way to end our holidays after a very pleasant time at the Westin Grand Central. I think the hotel spent a lot of money with the renovations and are looking for a way to recoup their expenses and as such came up with this fraudulent resort fee. Good luck to them. If you are happy with paying for services you don't use then this hotel will be an option for you. However if you are not, I do not recommend this is a hotel option in New York. We had also booked the hotel because they advertised a " modern" bath-tub. Sadly the bath-tub was tiny and would only accommodate children or little people.

A very nice hotel. Stayed there since it was in walking distance to the theatre that was showing The River starring Hugh Jackman. Even though it was raining coming back to the Park Central was very enjoyable. We had diner and drinks before retiring for the evening. A great sleep.

We traveled here for a quick Christmas getaway. The location was perfect. Nice short walk to Central Park, FAO Schwartz, and Rockefeller Center. We also used the concierge to help set up a tour. ( the timing of the concierge was not the best, could have been better. Was out to lunch both times we went to the desk and no one assisted us while she was gone, we had to wait.) Other than that this is the perfect hotel for family.

This hotel located in a great location with a subway station ( N, Q, R trains ) right beside the hotel. The hotel is only a few blocks from Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, and Central Park. Carnegie Hall is right across the street. Queen beds were very comfortable.

Stayed four nights at the Park Central from 19/12 to 23/12. The hotel is located in midtown in one of the best possible areas, between Central Park and Times Square (slightly closer to the park). Times Square is 5 mins walk away and the Rockerfeller is 6/7 mins away. 59th street Subway is right below the hotel and there are lovely Deli's nearby, I recommend Fluffy's opposite, cheap but great quality.The rooms are lovely and quite spacious for a NY hotel, flat screen t.vs and a HUGE bed that we got lost in. We had a "Times Square" room view and we could just see the top of some of the advertising boards. We were given a room on the 14th floor but we could still hear cabs/police cars through the night, this was not that much of an issue as we were tired and had no issues sleeping.I would love to stay here again for longer and make use of their bar and restaurant. Check out was painless and took all of 30 seconds and they sorted out a cab ride for me back to JFK.

I needed a centrally located hotel for one night and the Park Central fitted the bill. The hotel was renovated recently and my room was a decent size and nicely appointed. Check in was efficient and friendly. The room was impeccably clean, the bed comfortable. By New York standards, the price was reasonable. A slight irritation was when I asked the concierge desk if I could delay check out from midday to 1.00 pm, so as to repackage my last minute shopping before heading to the airport. A kindly lady said, yes, no problem but she was overheard by a "helpful" supervisor who said that there would be no difficulty with a late checkout but I would have to pay half a day's charge. Thanks, but no thanks!

Spent a couple of nites here on a business trip and got a great rate through the party we were visiting ($159/nite) though it looks less good when the $25/nite "facilities fee' is added. This hotel is beautifully decorated. The rooms are large though the design could be improved to add space to the very small bathrooms. The room has a very small desk area that makes working difficult. Not enough outlets and a strange lamp that can only be turned off by unplugging.The hotel has a trendy feel to it and there is a very nice restaurant and bar in the lobby with a very large TV showing NYC scenes. The bar also has two tables with outlets set up to work on a laptop. Nice feature. Breakfast in the restaurant was just OK. The bar itself has a good selection but beware if you like beer, the bars tap lines were very obviously not kept clean and were contaminated giving the beer a funky off flavor. Hopefully they will fix this. A significant downside of this hotel in my opinion is the thumping bass music that is played just outside the lobby doors (think Virgin America check in desks). They are trying to create a trendy feel but to me it came across as annoying.

I am actually fine with this hotel, except for one thing. I got the reservation off the discount web-site, Hotels Tonight. I paid around $200, plus an additional facilities fee at the hotel. So this is a bargain for Manhattan, and it is very conveniently located close to Columbus Circle.This place is huge. It occupies an entire city block, and the rooms are on both sides of a corridor, around a central courtyard. I was in a room on the 7th floor. I have a feeling that this is the floor where they put their budget travelers, because there was a big party going on down the hall and it reeked of marijuana in the morning.I was in a room with a window looking out on the inside courtyard. Because the hotel goes many, many stories above the 7th floor, it is very dark at this level - and this is the weird thing. The rooms are very dark, and they only have one of the REALLY heavy window shades that block out all of the light. There is no light weight privacy drape that allows light through. So if you open the heavy shade in order to get a little light, then you can see right into the rooms across the courtyard. In the morning I had to work in my room, and to get light I opened the shade. I could see right into the rooms at my level and below me - I counted 13 beds I was looking at, including some fellow walking around in his underwear. So take you pick - live in a cave, or be a peeping Tom!Otherwise the place is a good value for Manhattan. The beds are comfortable, the room is small but adequate, and the staff is very helpful. I would stay here again, but I would ask for an external room, rather than on the interior courtyard!

Wonderful hotel. Stayed here previously and was great but the update in the decor is brilliant. Everything looks wow, loved the rooms, bathroom was fab and the reception and bar area amazing. Great location, close to a lot of the attractions and right next to central park.

Elizabeth helped us like she was our personal assistant. I would recommend this hotel to my best friends and closest business associates!!! Everything was clean and efficient and the gym is open 24 hours which is great for my schedule!!

Only hotel we stay during our visit of NYC. Great location, professional approach, cozy environment, much more beautifull after renovation, comfortable bedding, amazing city view available on higher floor. I would like to say thank you to front desk staff, specialy to Elizabeth Cacovic for helpfulness, knowledge and friendliness during our stay in PC hotel. Thank you Elizabeth.

We have stayed at this hotel three times now, the last being about 8 years ago and we were delighted to see the improvements that have been made to the hotel specifically the foyer, lounge and bar area. The standard bedrooms are absolutely fine and offer everything you need for a short stay, nicely and thoughtfully decorated. The addition of a small coffee shop/food market in the lobby is extremely useful and welcome after a day sight-seeing.One minor grumble is that it was difficult to adjust the thermostat in the bedroom to a satisfactory temperature, much too warm most of the time.All the staff we came into contact with were lovely and very friendly - with the exception of one high-handed lady on reception when we arrived.The location, just south of Central Park, couldn't better for exploring the City.

I had a wonderful stay. the hotel was truly amazing, clean, newly decorated, the shower was particularly good. The maid service was excellent, front desk were most helpful altogether a terrific experience. I will definitely return

This hotel was a pleasant surprise, since it was one of the less expensive hotels I had viewed online. It was extremely clean and everything looked new. The room was spacious, with comfortable bedding and a huge TV. My $16.00 breakfast entrée was excellent, and deserved an A+ for presentation. The location is central for shopping and the museums, and I would definitely stay here again.

Through the years I've stayed at more than a dozen New York hotels from the West Village to Harlem. I'm always checking out hotels based on amenities, room size, location, ambience and a host of other factors. Park Central ranks near the top for me in New York. The room and bathroom size are among some of the best for regular rooms in New York. They are comfortable, relatively spacious and well-equipped. My main knock on the hotel is something many hotels seem afflicted with; the lighting is inadequate. At Park Central that's magnified in interior rooms that don't receive a ton of natural sunlight anyway. Some pendant or overheard lighting would help tremendously. My other complaint is that housekeeping carts, at least on the floor where I stayed, are left out in the open, albeit covered. I realize this is probably both a convenience and space issue, but it can be a bit disconcerting. It seemed like a possible plot for an episode of "The Twilight Zone" where creatures of the night would emerge from the carts in the wee hours. Yes, that's silly, but so is having the carts lined up everywhere. That aside, I would stay here again and again. The staff was friendly. The public spaces are beautiful. The location is convenient to the subway, Carnegie Hall, Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Plaza and more. It's definitely worth putting on your list.

Let's start this off by saying this hotel exceeded my expectations from a typical centrally located New York hotel. The rooms were spacious (no bath though) and the decor was modern and had a great air about it. The first impression you get when you walk in is a feel of luxury for what I perceived to be a fair price. I'm sure if you paid more you could have had a room with a better view than the view of a wall and some ducting that we got but it doesn't matter as generally if you are a visitor to New York, your room is a base and nothing more.I can't really fault the hotel its self however it does get marked down for a couple of essential things. Number 1 is the service charge which I did not pick up on at the time of booking. I think this is totally uncalled for as Wifi is generally free in most hotels I have ever visited and if you let's face it most of us won't be using the gym as New York is tiring enough without being made to pay for facilities you won't use. I would have happily paid a higher basic rate which includes a proportion of this fee for the wifi but begrudge paying for things which everywhere else includes in their price. As a side note my booking voucher said I only had to pay $100 but it was actually $108.90, this is only minor but it's the principal.Number 2 was when I was asked if I required transport to the airport we happily agreed and we were told it was a fee of $65. Which was fine albeit we already knew the flat rate to JFK is $52 in a yellow cab but presumed this would be because of the pre-booking. Now the car turned up late (over 20 mins) to pick us up and because of traffic which we had to detour through a toll road to make it on time adding an additional $7.50 to the fee (after being told by the concierge specifically to pay no more than $65). Taking into account a $10 tip on top what should have cost us $62 ended up costing over $80 which after being stung with the service charge left a sour taste in the mouth after what was a great stay.Don't be put off by the negative points above as this is a great hotel but there is room for improvement by not making customers feel like they are being exploited at the end.

Good sized rooms and reasonable prices (for Manhattan). I have stayed several times. Can't beat the location, about halfway between Central Park and Times Square, right on 7th Street - both a few blocks away. Great for tourists or those seeing a show! I stayed for business but would come back for fun. My only complaint is the hotel restaurant closes at 10 PM, which is too early. But there are plenty of food options open late nearby, including the Carnegie Deli right next door and a Starbucks in the same building.

Location great - 7th and 55th. Rooms small but clean. Bathrooms decent size for NY. Front desk staff is outnumbered by guests - both checking in/out and for general things like rekeying room key. Need more or a better organized system. Most desk staff pleasant but did encounter a lady at checkin who was very snippy. Lounge - food ok, overpriced, service terrible. I was shocked at how poor the service was - both evening in the bar and for breakfast. They are slow, not proactive, provide least amount of effort they can get away with, and generally have no knowledge of their menu or cocktail recipes. Go to Starbucks, the deli across the street, or any of the nearby bars/restaurants rather than suffer thru this experience.Market place - good options except they only offer regular coffee. Not a big deal as Starbucks is next door. Snacks and drinks ( including wine) a nice option if don't want to leave hotel. If you have time, stock up at a Duane Read to save $.

Stayed at the Park Central for 2 nights. Loved the beds and the bathroom was spacious!Great location to Broadway ... a very easy walk to our play, and Central park is a short walk!Staff is very helpful! The director of guest experience, Quimby, is one of the reasons this hotelis welcoming! He treated us to a complimentary drink and was more than happy to help with anyissues we may have had. We will be back!

I have stayed at the Park Central continually for the past 6 years when I travel to NY for business. The people are wonderful and very helpful and the rooms are great !! The renovations they did are amazing and the rooms are wonderful and spacious!!

Best hotel I have ever stayed at, honestly. I was born and raised in NY so I thought I saw it all, but I was so shocked at the level of friendliness, warmth, and professionalism by the staff that I caught myself thinking I was dreaming. Best location period, everything is within walking distance, times square, central park, Rockefeller center to see the tree, radio city, Broadway, and shopping, some of the best locations to eat including landmarks like Lindy's and Ray's pizza, all the way to Ruth Chris and celebrity filled spots for fine dining. This is the PLACE to go for romance or Christmas, the rooms are beautiful, the beds feel like clouds and the bathrooms are stunning and modern. They do incredible things with the space to give you a modern look but it is still warm and cozy. Love it, already booked next year for our 1 year anniversary. The manager Elizabeth was probably one of most amazing people ever, if she is who the hotel wants to represent them to their guests, they hit the jackpot. I hope she is there when I go back next year to thank her again for the amazing honeymoon. Thank you again!! Anthony

The stay at Park Central this time was unfortunately not a pleasant experience. We have stayed there two times before this stay without any complains in particular. This is my first negative review and normally I don’t want to spend time on documenting negative experiences, but in this case I would have a bad conscious if I didn’t.I have attempted to sum it up below.1. Price: The WORST is that the PRICE you see when BOOKING the room is INCORRECT. The price announced via hotels.com and their website doesn’t include the mandatory “resort fee” which will cost you an additionally 21$ per night. This is in my mind fraud and I think the only reason Park Central does this is to look less expensive when booking. It is written on hotels.com at the very bottom of the page and in a section which you need to expand to read. If the fee is mandatory, it should be included in the room price. I don’t thing is fair to demand a collective fee for services that not every guest needs. Bottom line, the price you see when booking a room should NOT be excluded mandatory fees. 2. Amenities? Forget about coffee maker, minibar or clean glasses. 3. Service: The housekeeping was sloppy; we found hair in the bathtub and waste next to the bin from the previous guest. Drinking glasses were not replaced with clean ones by housekeeping. In 6 nights they succeeded once!! Calling the front desk to get new glasses sometimes work, but only when you actually manage to get through to the front desk. Asking for new glasses at the front desk works...again only sometimes. If you want clean glasses do both or buy plastic cups in case they should become unavailable. 4. Noise: When two rooms are separated by a door you can hear everything being said and done in the other room. Some people might like that…we don’t. The elevator is very noisy. It can be heard from inside the room 5 rooms down the hall. Luckily there are only 2 elevators so the noise is reduced, but you have wait a while if you want to use them.5. Personnel: The people working the front desk and the bell boy was very sweet and kind and seemed truly understanding of our frustrations regarding the mandatory resort fee (I guess they hear that a lot?). The doorman however could be substituted by a cardboard figure. Despite arriving with 4 suitcases (two persons and with additional hand luggage) we didn't receive any help at all, but nor was he busy.This was however our last stay EVER at Park Central hotel. Mainly due to the additional mandatory resort fee as I see as a way to trick people, and I don’t reward people I regard as frauds. For the “adjusted” total price I believe that you can find a hotel with much higher standard and good location for the same price.And “dear” Park Central manager please don't bother replying to this review as I practically don't care!

We stayed here for an overnight & selected the hotel based on its location. Overall, we were pleased, The room was a reasonable size, bed comfortable, however, the walls are thin & we could hear the people talking in the next room. The lobby / bar areas are spacious & check in / check out were fast & efficient.

Returned to NYC for annual mother daughter trip and stayed at the Park Central. Last-minute weather problems gave us some travel headaches but the hotel was lovely and accommodating. Hotel is very clean and well taken care of. Elevators were a bit slow, so I'd recommend a low floor. On-site resto/bar has a GREAT burger!Location is incredible - 2 blocks south of Central Park - can't beat it!I believe the hotel offers a door to door taxi shuttle to the airports so worth looking into.I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to NYC.

My sister and a friend were in NYC last week, and we were sooooo disappointed in this hotel!! I should have believed the reviews on Tripadvisor, but I chose it because it was across from Carnegie Hall and 2 blocks from Central Park! We paid $600 per night and felt that we were taken advantage of. The elevators were down more than they were up and running. The room was a dark hole, and we had to ask for another lamp (no overhead lighting). The bathroom was well-appointed, but so small that only one person could be in there at a time! The sheets were frayed and spotted, and the towels were so thin they didn't absorb after a shower. The bar/back lobby area was run down, and the carpet was dirty...I know because when I moved a chair to be closer to my friends there were crumbs and pennies under the chair legs!! I could understand if this was an economy property, but $600 a night??? There are so many other hotels in the area...I'm so sorry I chose this one. I could go on and on...!

My girlfriend and I stayed over a weekend about 10 days before Christmas. Lets start with the pros. The location is ideal, close to the park, walking distance to Time Square and the main road outside is definitely less busy than New York is famous for. The lobby does smell lovely, my girlfriend was adamant she had the same perfume! The room was unexpectedly quiet and the bed very comfortable. Unfortunately thats all the positive things that spring to mind. For over 400 dollars a night I expected more than just a room. We didnt even have a directory of hotel services in our room so Im not even sure what the hotel had to offer. I did request this and despite being told one would be sent up, it never materialised. Room 921 seems to be a wifi black spot as none of our devices could pick it up in our room. The charge for this was refunded however and I appreciate that. Although I think this should be complimentary given the room prices. I booked the premier room as these were said to be on 'higher floors'. I would like to know what the Hotel considers as 'higher floors'? We were on floor 9 of 21 I think, so I don't really see how less than half way up can be considered higher floors.In summary this is a nice hotel, but I just didnt feel we got what we paid for. I know New York hotel rooms are expensive in general especially over the christmas period, but you still expect more than just a room. Even smiling staff can be enough to make it worth the money but I didnt real feel much warmth during our stay.I'm putting this one down to a bad room in a good hotel but unfortunately thats enough to put me off staying again given the choice NYC has to offer.

My son and I went for our annual trip to NYC for Christmastime. This year was above and beyond spectacular. The staff was extremely accommodating and made us feel at home, especially Elizabeth. She was with my son and I every step of the way and made us feel like she was there specifically for us. It wouldn't have been the same without here. Emmanuel was also very attentive and kind with us at check in and out. I was so pleased and appreciative of their time and kindness :)

The hotel is very good, staff is very friendly and eager to help (a lady by the name Angie and especially a gentleman named Saleem which was extremely friendly and helpful in previous visits). The location is unbeatable - across the street from Carnegie-hall, 3 min walking from central park, 5-10 min walking from Time square and Broadway. Highly recommended.

Was there for meeting and business in November, for a whole week. I had some personal issues with my first room and they had all the patience in solving each little issue for me. Rooms were large (not so common in NYC), clean and quiet. Excellent location, near many train lines. My special thanks to Elizabeth and Carol who were always kind and made me feel like home during my stay. Would definitely go back.

We stayed for 6 nights at the park central. Room was on the 4th floor. The room was large and clean, beds very comfortable and bathroom very high standard. The location of the hotel is excellant minutes frm times square and central park. Subway across the road and lots of Deli's handy for a quick bite to eat. We thought staying on the fourth floor would be noisy and it was although it was from emergency services sirens and I think it would have been the same whatever floor you stayed on. Only complaint is there is only two elevators which was a nuisance particularly if you had luggage to get up or down, otherwise we usually walked. I would recommend this Hotel and will stay here in the future

Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Check in was very quick, we got there quite late so no queues.The rooms were spacious, had two double beds, lots of storage to put clothes in so we could actually unpack the suitcase. The location was great, Times Square, Central Park and Hell's Kitchen weren't far to walk.Guest services were very helpful, very knowledgeable and offered to sort tickets for us.The only down side about this hotel was the price of drinks in the bar and no free wifi in the rooms. Would definitely stay here again though.

This hotel is fantastic value for money. It's comfortable, modern and has everything you need. Bed was very comfortable and accommodated our honeymoon activities well. The only negative I had for this hotel was the WIFI - it was pretty much useless, and considering they charge you a hefty facilities fee, it should be a lot better. would recommend it to others - just don't rely on wifi, or go next door to the café for their free wifi.

I have been here a few times and I really enjoy the food and the ambiance. Love the fact that the dining area is very spacious & modern but it still feels comfortable and private at the same time. This time around we were a group of 8 people. The food was excellent! We shared the tuns tacos and chicken wings ( a must try - these are amazing !! ) , afterwards we had steak which was one of the best I had in a while. Perfectly cooked.The waitstaff is very attentive and pleasant.

This our third visit to Park Central and we enjoyed it just as much as before.John, the bartender is not only a great bartender but a true gentlemen.This is not always the case when two females are traveling together.Due to the no'easter our fligtht was cancelled,but guest services was ableto get us another room,at a reduced rate(didn't even have to ask)!! This will continue to be our goto hotel!!

It is the second time I stay at the hotel. As the first time, I consider the hotel very good: relatively spacious, quiet rooms; clean. Above all, it is very close to Central Park (and the businesses). I would stay at the hotel again.

Service is excellent, rooms are specious and clean but location is the best for us. We come to NYC every year for the Opera and this hotel is in walking distance to Lincoln Center, shopping, restaurants. Also next door is wonderful Coffee Shop Tisserie, great coffee and pastries.Will be back.

This hotel is in a great location, and the rooms are perfect. Corinne the Concierge was absolutely wonderful and helped up tremendously with booking events and sending us in the right direction. She was also incredibly sweet. The hotel needs to have more than 2 working elevators and could improve upon their Wi-Fi service in the rooms.

This is our second time staying at this hotel. They did a beautiful remodel since our last stay. Perfect location to Cntl Park, Times Sq, Columbus Circle, Broadwy, and Subway. Concierge people were wonderful

I stayed here years ago and was not that impressed. With my recent stay in a girls shopping trip we heard it wasRecently renovated and decided to give it a try. We were very pleased. Nice and modern with a nice bar. Clean and decent sized rooms (for NYC). About an 8 minute $20 cab ride from penn station.

Stayed at Park Central a few times and absolutely love it there. Rooms are spacious, clean, hotel couldn't be in a better location walking distance to Times Square and broadway. The room's are big with everything you will need. Ellen on the front desk is GREAT and always willing to help however she can as are the other members of staff! Hoping to return very soon :)

This Hotel is perfectly situated to visit the City. Within 5 Minutes you can reach the next subway stations and get to the Central Park. By foot it takes approx. 10 Minutes to get to Times Square. Very safe and clean area. The lobby is big but there is a penetrate perfume smell in the entire first floor. The escalators are to small and you have to wait a long time to get in. The rooms are quite big and cozy. The rooms are all noisy but that's something you have to accept if you're looking for a hotel in the city. I can recommend this hotel because of the excellent location.

The Park Central hotel is strategically located in midtown Manhattan close to Times Square and a few minutes from other attractions. The hotel is clean and fresh. It has a European flair with its decor. Positives include:1. Friendly staff who are helpful and knowledge about the city. 2. A great workout facility with a variety of equipment in a well lit open area. 3. A small snack shop with healthy food options. 4. Excellent meeting facilities 5. Excellent wifi- good connectivity and available throughput the hotel. Are there negatives?No, not really. Food prices are high but that is true through NYC. The rooms are small - again real estate dictates this in NYC. I was there during a NorEaster and traffic was challenging. Yet they got me a town car to the airport within ten minutes. Amazing!

My wife and I just spent a Dec. 5 and 6 at the Park Central, a hotel we have stayed in many times pre and post renovation. For certain this our "go to" hotel what with location, value and exceptional service. This last trip presented a problem for me that I didn't think the hotel would care to get directly involved with. However I sent an email and got a response within 2 hours of with information that I much need and it did solve my problem! This place feels more like home each time we visit New York.Ed and Pam

Just returned from 2 night weekend stay. Excellent location. Very large hotel. Nicely updated room, their basic. 2 queen beds. Just 2 of us. Would be very crowded for more. Very clean and comfortable. Excellent temp control, tho noisey. No mini-bar/fridge. Had iron, safe, good space for suitcases. Not very good were: no room service, very minimal lobby canteen, no "gift shop", no in-room coffee, long waits for very small elevators, adequate pretty bar, but inadequate restaurant. There were several very close cheap choices for meals. Would definitely stay again. Easy walk to Times Square and Central Park; subway very close. Safe walkable area.

Just returned from spending a long weekend in NYC, staying at this hotel. Was quite disappointed overall especially given the price. Definitely didn't feel like a 4 star...Location was great, rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable...Very small rooms - we had a Premier corner room with two queen beds... quite tight for 2 people. Bathroom was very small as well... would have expected double sinks at least. Bathroom towels were of low quality, amenities were empty and never replaced during our stay. Elevators are a joke! long line ups to get an elevator, then waiting for one that you could actually squeeze onto. And the most disappointing of our experience was the extreme rudeness of the doorman on Saturday evening (around 5 pm). My friend approached him asking if there was a line up to get a taxi... he snapped at her and said "whatya think I'm doing? I see you, I see you". We were in no way rude to him. When the cab arrived, we didn't feel he deserved a tip, to which he banged h's hand on the passenger window of the cab, and yelled out very sarcastically "yeah, thanks ladies, thanks very much". Unfortunately, I won't stay here again. Too much money for little value.

We were delighted to have stayed at The Park Central Hotel.We were there from Dec. 4 to 7.Centrally located with Metro stop right around corner of hotel.Clean excellent remodeled rooms with very fast WIFI. Nice new 50 inch TVs as well.Great mattresses and pillows.The bar is spectacular and open till midnight. The coffee shop is open early and closes late. great cappucinos and crispy croissants.Last but not least, there was Elizabeth Cacovic, the guest relations manager. She made us feel most welcome. Answered all our questions and showed us around the amenities.Vito and the rest of the front desk employees were great and super polite.Have stayed there for years and will continue to do so in futureHappy Holidays !!!Vince

As always, the Park Central Hotel was wonderful for my recent stay to see NYC with all the Christmas decorations in the store windows. The staff is always exceptional, especially Elizabeth with Guest Relations who could not have been more helpful and pleasant at all times. Carmello and Ivan were great help getting cabs and assisting me and my family with everything we asked of them. I love walking across the street to Carnegie Hall and walking to Bergdorf Goodman and Central Park. Couldn't be better!! My favorite hotel to stay in when I visit NYC.

We had a great time during our recent visit to NYC during Thanksgiving holiday. The hotel is conveniently located in Mid-Town near everything (Central Park, Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Museums, etc.). There are many subway stops and tour bus stops in front of the hotel. Our Premium room was very large (for NYC), very clean, and modern. The hotel's elevator was a bit small and there are not enough of them therefore there is a little wait for the elevator many times. I traveled with a 5 years old and felt very safe. The food seems a little pricey so we opted to eat at the deli just south of the hotel and the food there was amazing and reasonably priced. Great location- we look forward to staying here again!

We visited this hotel in mid May. Fantastic location! Just over a block to Central Park, a great little coffee shop right beside the hotel for breakfast, subway station access is right out the door, and a short walk to Time Square and everywhere else in Midtown. The rooms are VERY spacious and clean and bright! One of our best meals we had was right in the hotel restaurant. We were on the 4th floor directly across from the elevator, yet never heard any noise, very quiet which was great. However, paying for wi-fi daily was a tad expensive. I think management should consider having this as an inclusion.

We stayed in the hotel from the 30th november til 07th december. I work also in hotels,since 12 years ago,so think that my opinion is very objective and professional when I say that the hotel is one of the best choice someone can take to visit New York:close to Central Park,to 6th and 5th Avenue,to Times Square,many places to have dinner/lunch/shoping/Subway entrances, etc... A special mention to Shpreda at the reception desk (she's wonderful working, attention to guest, helpful and kind and polite), and to David Vargas (the best bellman in the whole hotel, who was ALWAYS taking care of us, our transfer back to the airport,which is cheaper if you book through the hotel directly as with a company, and the rest of the needs we have had during our stay there). Just maybe should mention 2 small details (as client and as hotel worker,and an experienced traveller...): the bathroom comparing with the size of the room (and for 2 people) is too small for that categorie of hotel. Could not be making up at the same time 2 women, and while one of us were in the wc, no one could be also in the bathroom as there was no space enough. The other point to mention is just a small detail: the housekeeper did not fold our pijamas any time during the whole stay. I don't know if is not a habit in USA, but all I've been travelling all over the world, and never happens to me... in spite of those 2 things, our stay was incredible, amazing, and 100% sure, if any time we come back to New York, our hotel will be Central Park Hotel!! Congratulations to all the staff!! Best regards and greetings from Spain, Angeles and Sam

A superb hotel in Manhattan! Loved the beds and the lounge. Liked the fact that I could buy a cup of coffee and a muffin and sit in the relaxing lunge. No noice whatsoever! I'd like to be back someday.

We had the good fortune to find Corinne at the Concierge desk at this fine hotel! I lead a team of highly motivated customer service professionals in my job and Corinne`s attitude, interest in making our trip successful and exceptional service was a breath of fresh air!!Corrine went out of her way to make a soggy, rainy day a great experience. She listened, made good suggestions, secured tickets for a show, had them delivered to another hotel close to the theatre to save us time, called a restaurant and made reservations and spoke to the owner to ensure we were treated right.When I travel, I rely on the concierge for good suggestions outside what I can read myself in a tourist book and Corinne provided a superior experience. Because of my job, I have a high bar on judging service and she far exceeded expectations.Thanks so much Corinne!

Park Central was perfect for our NYC visit. Location, location, location...Within walking distance to Carnegie Hall, Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Broadway Shows, Central Parking and shopping. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The facilities and room are clean. Newly renovated. Concierge services are excellent. This is now our choice when visiting NYC.Highly recommended.

Mixed feelings about Park Central. The location is superb, well situated in midtown and with the central park close enough for a morning run. The entrance and the reception is ok, polite and friendly.I already read online that there is a facility fee, but you are still surprised when you have to agree to purchase a package at a fee of 25 USD a night. This package includes nothing really useful (domestic calls, baggage storage (who is going to store his baggage every day at the baggage storage if you have a room for a week???)), except the use of wifi. Best part of the offer is you can hookup up to five different devices (for free...) to the wifi. Which comes in handy if you are travelling with 3 phones and two laptops. Not really.The room however is nice. I was told they were redone this year and they are as you expect from a standard hotel: not that big, but large enough for business travelers. Bathroom amenities are nice and the iron equipment in the room is convenient. Huge television with crystal clear image and nothing to complain about. Room is also very clean.Water temperature of the shower could be better. It is hot enough to shower, but not warm enough to take a bath. All in all a good business hotel, and even with the 25 usd included not that expensive given the quality of the room and the location. Breakfast is expensive and the buffet is small, I used it twice but wouldn't recommend it at all. Actually the only thing that would get me considering another hotel was the smell in the lobby. If they could get rid of this cheap toilet refresher scent that is attacking you when you enter the lobby: that would be great!

Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights on a business trip this November and liked it, almost.Good: Great location, strictly "good" room as per NY standardBad: Service, food choiceI started with a shocking experience. Reached NY after a looong flight from Bangkok, it was past 10 pm I think. I went straight to my given room, and ooh la la , somebody was already occupying the room. Fortunately nobody was there in the room, but you can imagine my horror. Hurriedly I came back to reception and lady there told me that I was given a room which was not "cleared" properly. I was in no mood to argue with her as I was much tired, and accepted a room with two beds, instead of one. This clearly was hassle as NY hotel rooms are anyway a match box and here you have two beds to occupy whatever space was available.I did not find service to be very good, but then in NY hardly you expect any. There was very limited choice in breakfast, and almost nothing for a strict vegetarian. Hotel has a small shop within the premises, they serve coffee / drinks etc, but don't serve any hot food (no heating / microwave - surprisingly).Location is great. You have good food choices nearby. Almost daily I went to Starbucks next door for breakfast and few veg (including one Indian) restaurant nearby for dinner. Hotel is very close to Central Park and Times Square. I made a point to walk to Time Square during evenings, however late it was. At least twice I went there after mid night, atmosphere is so charged that you feel refreshed again!I may stay here again, just for location!

I am a frequent traveler, and when I come to New York City, Park Central Is always my first priority. its great location on 7th ave and 55 str allows me to be in the center of Manhattan.Close to Times Square, Central Park, Museums and many great restaurants I also chose this hotel because the staff members of the hotel always make me feels welcome and help me with all my needs.Special Thanks to Elizabeth Cacovic - GUEST RELATION MANAGERShe always make me feel at home I look forward to be a guest of the hotel this upcoming ChristmasIts my favorite time of the year and I am glad to spend it at Park Central

I was quite surprised by my stay at the Park Central. Compared to other mid town hotels, the rate was quite fair, or so I thought after booking on Orbitz. The lobby is lively and the rooms are well appointed. I certainly preferred my room vs similarly rated and priced hotels like the Moderne (avoid). But at checkout, I was hit with a 26 dollar a day fee that was not disclosed at checkout. If you are a regular user of consolidator websites, the fare you see when you book your hotel should be the final fare. There should not be an incremental facility charge for wifi and fitness center (which is underwhelming). In 2014, the hotel should either disclose the amount owed by building that in to the fare or eat the charge. No one charges for Wifi these days and unless you are in Vegas, no one charges for gym usage these days. It was a very disappointing end to what had turned out to be a very surprisingly good stay. If you do decide to book this hotel, please make sure you confirm the rate beforehand.

I travel to NYC often and have stayed at many hotels to a certain extent you expect NYC attitude anywhere, but here the total lack of any effort to give customer service is amazing. First we paid for an upgraded room when check in they did not give it or have it then were hesitant to adjust the rate. Also another example we asked the front desk to charge some snacks to the room right when they were closing the market area, while the person was still on site. They said check with the front desk, front desk said they would call a manager and be right up to help us, 10 min later still no one shows up, we finally leave and go outside. This on top of general ruddness all the time during the stay above ordinary attitude, we just won't stay here ever again you should not either.

Our stay here was more than exceptional! EVERY person that I met that works at this hotel during my stay, was extremely friendly and helpful! The food is great; the rooms are great; and the location is great! I have lived in NY and visit about 6-8 times per year. This is the friendliest staffed hotel I've ever encountered. Thank you to all and Quimby H.!

This hotel is located on 7th Ave, in the midst of it all, but without the premium of the 5th Ave. location. It was an excellent venue for getting to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade - one block to 6th, going downhill, you could not miss it even if you were arriving after the start. We were also in the same building with Starbucks and steps away from a dozen great restaurants, from the famed Carnegie Deli to Rosie O'Grady's. Traveling as a family of 4, with older kids, the room and bed sizes were key to making a 5 day stay in NYC bearable, and Park Central did not disappoint. This hotel has done an outstanding job at accurately describing their room categories on the website and all was a s described. The location was superb, the beds were true queens and kings (not fulls and doubles), the accommodations were very nice and the rooms were very clean, however that's about it. The head line sums it up: no mini-bar, no shower-caps or any extras, no room services, difficult time getting the front desk to pick up a call. With one exception, service at this place taken down to the minimum. The exception is the lounge/restaurant at Park Central. If you feel like treating your company to a special evening, venture out to the lounge/restaurant and ask for Nancy. This lady might as well own the place: she truly has a knack for making people feel comfortable and pampered. She reminded me of an iconic Italian mother-in-law you'd see in movies or an upscale bed and breakfast owner. She truly cares about her job and the people she serves! Someone give this lady a promotion or, better yet, put her in charge of hotel's hospitality/customer relations!

New York City is one of my favorite destinations. The location of the Park Central is fabulous. Easy to all my faves; theater, Central Park, Columbus Circle, Time Warner Center, Carnegie Hall (right across the street) and they have finished a very nice re-model, refurbishment. The rooms and bathrooms are great and great looking. They have wonderful staff who are always helpful and accommodating. They now have a little/bar eatery right behind the lobby check in counter. Drinks are rather expensive and a very skimpy pour......Happy exuberant door men, friendly and helpful maid service. Great place to stay and rates are pretty good for NY City. I will continue to return to this gem of a hotel in the "Big Apple" I recommend highly.

The hotel is situated in the perfect area! 5 minute walk from almost everything! It's great for first time NYC visitors because it's so central! The rooms are lovely, clean, the beds are extra comfortable! Except I didn't get any sleep because we were put next to the elevator and other guests were very loud as early as 6am. I will admit it's very expensive for what it is as they only provide you with a place to sleep, there's no mini bar, or place to keep your water cold, and no room service offered either. The service over all is average, depending on who you came into contact with, but I found most of the staff to be judgemental and unhelpful excluding a small number of nice people. Although the bar is a lovely place to relax at any time of the day! The resturant has potential, it could be a nice well know place to eat if they Inclued a wider range of meals on their menu. My first trip here was great last year no problems what so ever. This year has been a horrible experience, my lack of sleep added to anxiety I already have, the staffs behaviour and reactions to certain situations stressed me out far too much, and they ran my bank cards without my permission numerous times and in doing so the bank put a 24 hour block on all my funds. I feel unsafe for a number of hours as the hotel manager locked us out of our room (myself and a child) and faced the possibility of having no where to sleep in New York for a night. Consequently I left this hotel in order to enjoy the remaining days of my trip, I'm currently staying on the upper west side and haven't had any issues here. Over all the park central hotel is fabulous (especially if you get a room away from the elevator) , the location is great, it's the service that's poor, and it's all not worth the price they charge.

Nov 2014. I do like this Hotel even if it is a little pricey. It is way nicer than some other places we've stayed. Our room was directly across from the elevator, but surprisingly, it was very quiet. I was pleasantly surprised. We had 2 adults and 2 kids and were able to get an upgrade to two queens (For an additional $40). We used the free bag check twice so we didn't have to tote our bags before and after check-in (Just tipped the guy per bag). Very convenient.

I visited this hotel at the end of November 2014, I had previously visited prior to upgrade and although reception, restaurant / bar area has changed and looked great, the rooms were not up to scratch, dirty marks on floors, stained bed sheet. Bathroom was great, but hairdryer didn't work. Air vent was very noisy. Location is excellent from Central Park and Times Square. Receptionist was rather short with me on check in. Not sure I'd re-book for my next visit to NY.

We chose the Park Central because it was one of he only hotels on the area that had rooms with two Queen beds and with 3 adults, that's what we wanted. We were there for 4 nights over Thanksgiving weekend. Check in was quick and courteous and we were given a very nice room on the 14 th floor. The room was large by New York standards, quiet, and comfortable, the bath separated with the sink area open to the room. I would have liked to have had a tub, but the shower did have both an overhead and hand held head.The location was easy walking to Central Park, shopping, Times Square, Grand Central Station, The Modern, Carnegie Hall, and many other attractions.

I have been coming to the Park Central for years. It is in a perfect location close to Central Park, the theatre district, Columbus circle, plenty of places to eat within a block or two and the subway is also very close so you can get anywhere quickly. I have always experienced excellent service from both the front desk, valet and the conceirge staff

Stayed here for one night, very close to work for me and my husband. When we got there the guy at the desk (didn't bother taking his name cause it was only one night) but he said no rooms were available for a king bed meanwhile that is what I booked and every website had that available so we ended up in a room with two queen beds so whatever that fine but for the price I paid he should have been a little more negotiable. The TV in the room is amazing very updated such a clear picture and that is a major thing for me when I am staying somewhere. Room was clean decent size bathroom was fine. Overall nice hotel, very close to many of the major attractions in New York for the tourists who come here. Check out was a peace of cake.

Good value, great location, walk to Central Park and fifth ave for great shopping. Quick eats within the block. Broadway shows within 10 min walk. The rooms were nothing fancy but were clean. Cafe Europa, a block over, does excellent brunch.

The hotel is great, good location, landmarks as Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, Mancy's are nearby. the staff is very welcoming and impeccable cleanliness. I will definitely recommend this hotel.

My family and I stayed at the Park Central Hotel for our Thanksgiving weekend trip to NYC. Upon our arrival, the staff was quick to get us checked in. We also drove in, and the valet staff was quick to help us unload and valet park out vehicle. The entire hotel is clean, and attractive. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful, and also made checkout a breeze, and our rental car was ready for us by the valet within 10 minutes of our checkout. The lobby is even scented. Our Premier Room featured double queen beds, and was meticulously clean. The rooms were recently remodeled, and our room featured a huge Samsung flatscreen HDTV, cordless telephone, and a clock radio with iPod dock. The beds were comfortable and allowed us to sleep well the 2 nights we were there. Everyone knows that visitors to NYC find it hard to hail an NYC cab, but the valet staff was more than willing to help, and was able to quickly help us hail a cab to take us where we wanted to go around NYC (even though we rented a car to drive to NYC, we didn't actually drive the car in NYC and either walked or took a taxi everywhere we went).The only downsides that I can think of are that, for the price you pay per night to stay here, the hotel had no vending machines (a call to the front desk confirmed this), and the small pastry shop inside the hotel sells drinks, though it was $8.00 for two sodas. This is by far the most expensive hotel I've ever stayed in, and all of the less-expensive hotels had vending machines, even on the floor I stayed on. Also, even though wifi is provided free of charge, it was extremely slow to connect my Mac to, and I ended up relying on my smartphone's mobile hotspot feature for my entire stay. But that's probably because several large groups were staying at the hotel, and were probably all logged onto wifi at the same exact time (the hotel allows for up to a total of five devices to be connected per room for free). Other than that, I would definitely come back to the Park Central for another stay in NYC! (:
Great location for the park and shops. Lots of local cafes and deli's.Rooms clean and modern, large comfy beds. Nicely refurbished rooms, corridors and lobby.Good value. We will be back in the future

The recent renovations have made the Park Central a perfect hotel -- everything one could want while traveling - comfort and friendly personnel, a good restaurant and a nice lobby to have a glass of wine in the evening. Mr. Salim at the front desk is a pleasure to work with and I also found the concierge most helpful.Across the street on 7th Avenue is a great Greek restaurant, Molyvos, which I consider a delightful find! Everything I had there was delicious and I can't wait to return.

We stayed for 3 nights 11/20 - 11/23. The check-in went smoothly. Arrived before the 4:00 pm check-in time & our room was ready. We had agreed to upgrade to a Primer Corner Two Queen room if available for an additional $45.00 per night when we made our reservation online. The Park Central was able to provide the upgrade...it was well worth the additional $45.00 as the room was larger & had a great reading chair & more windows to few the city. We had requested a small refrigerator for our room prior to our stay & it was brought to our room with 15 minutes. Great service by everyone at the hotel. Front desk staff were wonderful! Rooms were very clean & housekeeping staff were top notch. No complaints or problems during our stay. Great location...easy to get anywhere. Wonderful restaurants close by the hotel. Also, used the Carmel limo service for ground transportation from airport to hotel & back to airport. Wonderful car service without the hassles. Highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel has been recently remodeled and the rooms and common areas are quite nice. The bathroom was a bit small, and I had great difficulty taking a shower without flooding it. I stay there at least twice a year when I have meetings in Manhattan. The bar and restaurant are very pricey even by New York standards for average food at best. Fear not there are excellent restaurants within a short walk from the front entrance.

My daughter and I stayed for 6 nights (24-30th November). This was my third visit to Park Central. It is close to 5th Avenue, Colombus Circle, Madison Avenue, Carnegie Hall, Russian Tea Rooms, Carnegie Delicatessen and Times Square. This hotel has been refurbished to a very high standard, and I will certainly be booking my next visit very shortly. The staff are very helpful and accommodating especially Carol Smith and Elizabeth Cacovic. I have stayed at other hotels, but always end up coming back to Park Central. Beatrice

The Park Central is a great hotel in a great location. You are within walking distance to Times Square and there are multiple subway stations nearby to take you anywhere else. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and it was perfect for a family of 4 because of the queen size bedrooms. I would recommend upgrading to the premier queen room if you have a family of 3 or 4 because it gives you a little more room. The only negative was the service in the restaurant, they were not very attentive to the guests that weren't at the bar, we had to ask 3 separate times for more water, as well as our bill. I would not recommend eating in the hotel there are many restaurant options very close by.

We have now been coming to this hotel 2 or 3 times a year for over 10 years now, and plan to keep coming. Early on we met the nicest young woman working there, Elizabeth Cacovic in Guest Relations. We always looked for her to say Hi & just visit. She couldn't have been nicer & always went out of her way to make sure everything was fine. Time went on & now she is the head of Guest Services! And we sure know why !! She is a huge reason we keep coming back.I actually asked others that work under her how they liked her & got such positive feed back. In addition we love the big clean rooms, all the people that work there (we have had drinks, b'fast & dinner there - all more than satisfactory. I usually talk to the women that clean our room- always friendly & do a great job too. friendly & do a great job

The hotel staff was good to very good overall. The resturant staff was very rude except for the lone female waitress. It's not really much of a resturant to begin with. It's almost as if there is a lobby bar with food. With a resturant or diner in any direction you would think that the staff would be over accommodating. Not the case, it's almost as if they are doing you a favor. After meeting the resturant manager it's clearly a leadership problem. The hotel manager stepped up and when needed and ensured my group of seven was satisfied. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to Time Square, Central Park, and Rockafella Center. I would recommend staying as high up as you can to maybe avoid some of the noise, but it's still NYC people are always moving. The bathroom had a missing picture from the wall, made it feel cheap. Overall the rooms are nice and everything worked. Check in was smooth as well as check out, I would stay again. Just would avoid the attempt at a resturant.

We have just returned from a 5 night stay (22-28th nov). This was our first visit to NYC and would definitely recommend the hotel to our friends and family. The hotel's location is perfect! Close to central park and a 10 minute walk to times square. All the staff that we encountered were always very welcoming. The only reason we haven't given the hotel a 5* rating is because of the extortionate bill we received in respect of a 10 minute internation phone call that we made from our room (£120 ($180)). Ridiculous! Thankfully the management forgave the charge however I could not help thinking that they were "trying it on". It was very disappointing that we left the hotel with such a bad feeling after a fantastic stay.

I stayed at this hotel while on a NYC trip! It was amazing!! Clean hotel, friendly staff, a place to hold your bags until your room is ready or until you leave. It's a great location! I block from Central Park, 1 street from Broadway, and a few blocks from Times Square! The price was alio very reasonable.

Couldn't fault the hotel for its location, service, style and friendliness of the staff. Our only small problem was the AC unit in the room which struggled. But apart from that they're great rooms in a modern decor. All the staff will help with any queries or point you in the right direction. Would highly recommend and being a few mins walk from Times Square is very handy.

New York City is a wonderful place; but it can be a bit overwhelming. My wife and I just returned from a vacation that included NYC and a stay at Park Central Hotel. The hotel is fabulous. But, the best part is it's staff. Special kudos to Jamie B. and Saleem. These folks were extremely helpful and went beyond the "call of duty." Their patience and professionalism helped make our stay in the "Big Apple" smooth and most enjoyable. Thank you Jamie and Saleem. We look forward to seeing you again in 2015!

I was very pleased to return to the PC. The work done from the lobby to the rooms was all very nice..The new rest/bar area was also beautifully done. I was treated very nicely by all staff that I encountered.I have stayed at this hotel about 100 times over the past 10 yrs and I look forward to going back..

I booked this hotel for the Macy's Day Parade - and it was a perfect location. Our 10th floor double-queen bed room was a decent size (for NYC) with a huge TV. It was quiet in the evening. Thanksgiving morning, we were able to easily walk over to 6th Ave to claim an early spot along the parade route and then make it back to the hotel (with may others) to check out before noon once the parade passed us.It was frustrating to pay the $25 facilities fee since we were not using most of them, but we did need to keep our luggage after check-out (which I guess would not be complementary otherwise).Overall, a great experience!

The newly renovated Park Central hotel came as a pleasant surprise after having stayed in pigeon holes for rooms in Manhattan. The rooms here are really large compared to Manhattan standards and can accommodate 2 people and loads of shopping easily! Nice, big king sized bed, a huge flat screen tv and a comfortably sized bathroom. However, the location is the best aspect of this hotel. 2 minutes away from central park and a 10 minute walk to times square or the shopping on 5th ave. The metro stations are located on the same block too. There are lots of lovely cafes and restaurants in the area. And it's quite lively even late in the night. The only negative during my stay, the windows weren't sound proof. So a police or ambulance siren can easily wake you up at night. asking for a room on the higher floors might help.

I've stayed at Park Central Hotel a few times and really love it. It's become my favorite place to stay in New York City. Usually affordable. All of the recent upgrades and renovations were very well done. They made some wonderful investments in all aspects of the hotel and its operation. I also really appreciated Elizabeth's (guest relations manager) recent special attention and excellent, personal service. And Marisa (housekeeping) on the 10th floor takes great pride in her work and was always very friendly. Overall, an excellent stay. I highly recommend staying here because of Park Central Hotel's excellent staff, location, affordability and recent renovations.

Very clean friendly hotel, recently renovated. perfect location for doing all the touristy things but not too close to make it noisy at night. Would highly recommend cannot fault, if i would have one criticism it would be that the shop downstairs was very overpriced but thats a very minor thing!

Great stay from start to finish. Myself and a friend stayed here for 4 nights and had a great stay. From the concierge on arrival, to the staff at the luggage room at check out, the stay was faultless. Room was more than suitable for the 2 of us. Bed was very comfortable and spacious, great to relax after a day of shopping and sightseeing. Bathroom was nice and spacious. Don't understand previous comments regarding the lifts/elevators, we waited no more than 10 secs on any occasion - on the 11th floor, we used this daily. Perfect location to Times Sq, Central Park, 5th Ave etc. Wouldn't hesitate in staying here again and would certainly recommend to people to say here

I am staying and my room is nice. Not spacious but has a nice view. That said, we booked two rooms together through hotel club.com and this has always guaranteed we were very close together. My husband is 70 and has had cancer this year (2014) and his dream has always been to watch the parade in person so when we booked, it said it was on the parade route and we paid up front for the rooms. They changed the route so it isn't on the route. I had called and asked if we could get a refrigerator in at least one room and they said they had a limited amount of them and would try to get one for us in at least one room. We are scheduled to stay through Saturday, which is four days, a pretty good stay. When we arrived, my family, which needed to be close to us, were not only not close, they are on a different floor. There is no refrigerator, they acted as though they didn't know the rooms were together, and really didn't seem to care when I addressed the situation. Basically, she just said no when I asked if they had a room closer to ours and she walked away. The room directly across from ours was being cleaned and was empty when we got there. I called on at least four occasions and every time made sure they knew we were together. On top of this, we decided, because of husband, to keep the car with us, in case we needed it and our Honda odyssey is considered oversized and is $70.00 a day to park. He will have 40 radiation treatments in Dec. & Jan. so NOTHING can ruin this week for us but make sure if you want family rooms together, you don't book here. This was, among being nice, most important to us.

I booked a two-night stay here through the hotel tonight app. In addition, the hotel levies a mandatory USD 25 facilities charge for calls, WiFi and a number of other items. I had a spacious, comfortable room with two queenside beds that featured great views. The hotel is very centrally located and easily allows walking to most of Midtown's attractions. Beyond being generally comfortable, the experience was nothing out of the ordinary but seamless and very pleasant. So exactly what I was looking for.

The most outstanding feature of this Midtown Manhattan Hotel is its location. "Central to everything" as they advertise. It is a few steps away from the Central Park and just across the street from Carnegie Hall. Columbus Circle and the Lincoln Center are at a short walking distance, as well asTimes Square. We have stayed at the hotel several times before. At this time we found it fully renovated, including staff attitude towards guests. They are much friendlier now than they used to be. Rooms are spacious and linen is spotless. A serious setback, though, is a "Facilities Fee" of about US$20+tax per day they charge you without previous warning. When asked about it, a kind telephone operator informs you that this is a fee charged to every guest to account for the usage of WiFi, the gym and the luggage store.

From photos or outside it really looks nice - but staff wasn't nice, room was average - nothing special. Breakfast was great - lot of things to choose. Location is great - the hotel is near the Central park or Times Square
user_location: Prague, Hlavni Mesto Praha, Czech Republic

review_body: I booked through Hotel tonight and they hit us with an additional charge of $27 which is crazy. I stayed 3 nights and I really was impressed. It was close to everything. Broadway theater was 5 minutes away and timeshare was 12 minutes walking. Only problem I had was the heat not working but Elizabeth the manager made sure it was dealt with. I'm looking forward to staying here again. The breakfast is by far the best I had in any hotel.

We stayed at the Park Central on November 22, 2014. PROS: The room was nice. The staff was very nice and helpful at check-in. CONS: Room not well maintained. There was dust over all furniture and it appeared that carpet had not been vacuumed.There was hair on the floor in the bathroom. Around the bathtub there was no grout at the bottom of the tile, and as water hit the wall, mildew, slime, hair, etc. ran out into the bathtub. Tried several rounds of throwing water to wash out but debris kept flowing out. Had wanted to take a bath, but would not sit in tub. Put towel on floor of bathtub and showered. Had problems with computer in business center when printing our airline boarding passes. Computer kept locking up and had to start over twice. The pastries in the deli were stale.

We stayed here for a night at the theater. Nicely appointed, modern in flavor and very good service. Room was adequate with all the usual amenities. Facility could have had an additional designated elevator for so many rooms.

The general manager and the entire stay are outstanding..great rate,location,gym,rooms,decor,comfort,and locationHave stayed at waldorf towers for years and the park central was just as enjoyableWell done!!!!!!!!Peter

I booked using the HotelsTonight app. I wasn't expecting to pay an additional $27 "facility" fee. I've used HotelsTonight app for two other hotels and never had to pay an extra fee. Great location but they only gave two towels, two was clothes and no bathrobe. Also, didn't have water bottles or any food for purchase in the room. View was terrible. Apparently, the fire alarm went off at 9:15am. I didn't hear it but I did hear the very loud announcement from the speaker in the room at 9:15am that the "fire alarm is being investigated and they will provide more details momentarily." Then, at 9:30am, another loud announcement was made that it was a false alarm. At 10am, I had just fallen back to sleep and the housekeeper started knocking at the door. The worst part is that the elevator was so slow and they only had two elevators for floors 1-8. So you must take into account that there will be a 10 minute wait for the elevator. The elevator only fits 4 people. I would not stay there again.

Nice and neat hotel in middle of everything. Staff were great and rooms were in good shape. Only thing we missed was breakfast that suits children too. Little shop in lobby was great and door men were very helpfull everytime you need something.

+great location 5-10 mins walk to Central Park, time square, 5 Ave shopping and many other places of interest+clean updated room with lots of towel- needs vending machines on floors or fridges in rooms - bedding is weird the just use 3 flat sheets two on either side of duvet and one to cover bed equals a big tangle of bedding in the morning+ good computer for quick search with 15 minute time limitAll in all great hotel if your short on cash considering the other hotels nearby cost nearly double

I spent 2 nights in the hotel. It was nicer that I thought and reception was great. Very efficient and friendly. Two things that did not work for me - no towels the morning of the second night AFTER I got out of the shower. And just ok service in the restaurant. Dirty wine glass. Rushed to clear my plate. I travel a lot - and may or may not stay there again.

I go to NYC for business and try to stay at different hotels in different areas of the city. On my last trip I stayed at this hotel. The location was great! In easy walking distance to many attractions. Lots of food places around. Service was fine, hotel was fine, room was fine. Nothing amazing but every was nice and I had no complaints. I would recommend to anyone wanting to stay in the area.

We are a family of five and booked two rooms . Location was perfect and we arrived early at 10am and they were nice to offer us rooms on the 5th floor right away. The two rooms are really dated and the infrastructure is really worn out. I suspect some floors are renovated so guests enjoy better rooms. In one room , there is only one light by the bedside and we have to ask them to bring in extra lighting, then we found the bathtub does not drain well and they have some one come in and remove a big clog of hair from the shower drain before it works well. In another room, the air conditioning is so noisy and the safe has no electric supply and does no work, so they come in again and fix everything. Finally we got to sleep for a while and we got awakened by a fire alarm that went on for ten minutes before an overhead announcement informing us that it was a false alarm and told the guests to stay in their rooms. Overall it gives me an impression that the floor we are staying in is outdated and had old infrastructure and above all there seems to be no quality assurance program whereby everything is checked before they deliever the rooms to the guests and they just fix everything as the complaints come in. There is also the facility fee that they claim will cover local calls and wifi and it is mandatory that we cannot delcine , as we have our own phones and do not wish to pay extra after paying $400 per room per night. Overall, it feels that the hotel is trying to maximize revenue in every other way and put non suspecting guests in rooms that have not been renovated if possible. So, I will not return to this hotel the next visit and will look for some hotels that will offer renovated rooms.

Got a good deal for a 5 night stay during October and my wife and myself were more than happy with the service and facilities at the Park Central. We have stayed in New York a number of times previously and the Park Central would certainly be high up amongst our choice for future trips. The room size was very impressive for New York (and we have stayed in some that more resemble a cupboard than a room). The location was ideally central for us, being close to Central Park, Times Square, and most of the other attractions - an ideal location for all of our needs. The staff were most helpful and we would have no hesitation in strongly recommending the Park Central.

We stayed here for 3 nights on a New York re-visit, picking the hotel due to its location as we have stayed in the area before.Check-in was easy and efficient, our room wasn't ready but we were asked if we wanted to wait or be upgraded, so we opted for the free upgrade to a 15th floor room with two queen beds and a view of high buildings and roofs, which is typical for New York.The room had everything we needed except coffee making facilities, which we expected to find as most New York hotels provide these. But coffee is available in the lobby and next door and next door but one and over the road, etc...The location is great - midway between Central Park and Times Square, with diners and restaurants within yards of the hotel. Opposite is the Wellington hotel, which has a diner called Park Cafe - we ate here twice and a really good diner experience it was.We didn't use the hotel lounge or bar, but did use their coffee and pastry shop, which had a good choice and reasonable prices, but the Tisserie coffee shop next door provided better coffee and pastries, plus some very good rolls.The hotel charges a "Facilities fee" of about $20 per night. This provides room internet, late baggage storage up to 9pm, express checkout and no doubt other things that we didn't use - the fee seemed compulsory so worth knowing - in fact with taxes and this fee our room bill went up by $140 for the three nights.We liked the hotel, its location and the staff - we used the Concierge to bookm Hop on Hop off bus tickets and received lots of good advice while doing so.We would happily go back to this hotel.

This is a great location walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, 5th Ave, Lincoln Center, Time Warner shops, across from Carneige Hall.The rooms are nicely appointed and extremely clean. Friendly and most importantly, helpful staff! Yes, the know the city well and were extremely helpful in giving directions to specific venues.

For the high price of a room only booking, you would expect a better service. You have to queue for everything - check-in, to leave bags, for drinks at the bar etc. There is also a mandatory charge for wifi, gym etc which you HAVE to pay. You also cant take any drinks up to your room from the bar unless in a plastic cup which I found a real pain especially after ordering champagne. The shower is also not the best, one morning it was stone cold. The hotel itself is beautiful but there are so many flaws I wouldn't go back again. The highlights are its a brilliant location - 5 minute walk to Times Square or Central Park and the beds were comfy.

we really enjoyed our staying....we got a room upgrade so we had amazing views of the city, the room was spacious and we had 2 really comfy beds.The location was perfect for walking everywhere....the hotel has been recently renovated so all looked very nice....the staff has always been very friendly...

Very good hotel, rooms refurbished, reasonably priced. The hotel is located in Times Square area, Broadway shows as well as a large variety of restaurants are on walking distance. A must see museum, the MOMA is a few blocks away.A Subway station is also round the corner.Ideal for tourists, surely no disappointment if someone chooses this hotel on his next visit to NY.

Stayed in the Park Central for my wife's 50th Birthday. Hotel was clean and very modern but very busy. We had a room on the 14th floor but didn't have a view but weren't overly concerned about it.Disappointed to have to pay $100 for hotel wifi given that wifi is generally free in most places. Also when we booked we weren't told that breakfast wasn't included. Again not a real concern as we ate out every day anyway!Special thanks to the guy who came to fix our room safe late at night!Room was clean and the beds were out of this world! - Just what you need after a hard day of shopping!Overall I would stay there again as the location was perfect for our trip.

Excellent location for those who want almost everything in walking distance (well almost).Comfortable and rennovatedHad a good deal for 7 nights otherwise it would have been out of budgetArrived with a Hertz car and returned it just 1 block away.Breakfast is more then double the price of everything outside.Good service

There certainly are more expensive hotels in midtown, and depending on your own definition there are "nicer" ones, but Park Central is tough to beat for NYC period, and REALLY hard to argue against for mid-towners looking for value at a reasonable price. Park Central is literally steps from south end of central park, St Pats, Ed Sullivan, Carnegie. A few more blocks toward downtown and either east or west and you have the library, Empire State, Rockefeller, etc. I've stayed here several times in the past couple of years and have made it my "go to" simply because of the value for the location. I've read the reviews and have experienced none of the complaints others have noted with the exception of the view from the room. I last stayed on the 20th floor and looked out at a brick wall. So what. You're in NYC folks - get the heck out of your room and live a little...

Room was fine, but the heater never stopped humming all night. Shower was too small. They also charge a Resort Fee for phone, gym and other stuff that I didn't use and it's not an option. I didn't initial to accept it at check in, but they charge anyway which I expected. It's the principle equating to an add-on or hidden fee. Just amend the room rate vs. having this kind of add-on charge. A stick in the eye.

the hotel has larger rooms than average in NY at good prices and newly renovated.so overall good value for money. Next to Central Park and Times Square and 5th avenue, good for tourists.Guest Relations Manager, Elizabeth Cacovic, was just oustanding in helping in all needs.
