A couple of hundred yards from Central Park, ten minutes' walk to the Broadway theatres, the location suited us perfectly. The hotel looks like it has been recently refurbished and everything was spick and span. The room was very comfortable and larger than we expected. We were there for a week and asked to be moved from our 10th floor room looking into the courtyard because of the noise from the aircon units outside. Elizabeth Cacovic of guest relations could not have been more helpful and moved us to a room on the 17th Floor facing the street. It's right that there is sometimes a bit of a wait for the lifts (max two minutes in our experience) but otherwise the experience was first-class. This will definitely be our first choice for future visits to NY.

Have read many reviews re Park Central Hotel, not all of them favourable,this is not one of them.From the moment we arrived and I forgot the hand luggage left in the Airport transfer bus,which was found and returned within 30 nerve racking minutes,but thanks to Concierge Ramon everything was sorted without fuss.I had also read that the lifts were a nightmare, well sorry but all the time we were there we never had to wait more than 20-30 secs before a lift arrived.Room on the 14th floor, although no view,was lovely and quiet just the steady drone of the A/C fans which went off during the night anyway.What use is a view when you are asleep.I believe the rooms could provide Drink making facilities/or a Mini-bar but that said I suppose the Coffee shop/bar in the Hotel was there for that purpose.So I would certainly recommend the Park Central to anyone going to N.Y. Location could not be better and as far as I could see the Staff were polite, efficient and as helpful as possible Thankyou Park Central for a wonderful stay.Ken & Carol Skilling Room 1427 Nov10th-15th. Merry Christmas to you all

The Low-Rise floors are only accessible by 2 small elevators (5 people max with no luggage). At rush hour in the morning or evening you could wait 10-15+ mins (no joke) for an elevator. There is no refrigerator in the room. The hotel wanted approx $35 per person for breakfast and God only knows what they wanted for an evening meal and not a person in the restaurants. Lobby staff, Concierge and Doormen were very helpful. I would recommend the Sheraton a few streets down or the NY Hilton (a block and a bit away) which has been renovated. At $400/night with no breakfast, i would pass on this Hotel. I honestly could not recommend this Hotel.

Flew in from the UK to celebrate my sister-in-laws 50th Birthday, we arrived at Park Central at 12:30am - no one else in reception apart from 2 receptionists - I handed over our passports & confirmation, no welcome, no eye contact - she handed over our room keys & pointed to the elevators & said we don't do room service!! that was our 'Welcome to New York' We booked a double room with 2 double beds - the room was a nice size the bathroom was tiny!! Both very clean - we were on the 4th floor where you heard the constant drone from the generators - we got used to it. The 1st morning we went to reception and asked for a street map, the guy took one from the back desk & slid it over the desk, no conversation never showed us where we were or what direction to head in!! I have never experienced such unhelpfulness from any hotel I have ever stayed in. As for the extras & taxes our bill was nearly £200 more than we were originally quoted. We thoroughly enjoyed New York but not the Park Central Hotel.

The first time I stay in the park central hotel was in 2011. Since this visit, I haven't been in any other hotel in new York city . the main reason for my staying in this hotel is the hospitality of two nice ladies in this hotel .they are ms .Angela and ms .Elizabeth.although the hotel is very good looking and good location,but as a human being ,we need to see some kindness and hospitality.especially when we came with 14 hours flight.so,i would like to thank Angela ans Elizabeth more time for their kindness and hospitality.

This hotel is located really well. Near to central park, times square and 5th avenue, this is all on walking disctance. The rooms are pretty big for new york. Sometimes there is a lot of noise in the streets also during the night but not every night. The interior design is very nice and comfortable.

We had a very nice stay at Park Central. The room was super clean, the bed was comfortable, we could hear minimal noise from the street but this is NYC and is to be expected. We were very pleased with our stay.

I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights recently, meeting 2 friends for fun-filled reunion. With it's ideal location and great service, this hotel fit our needs perfectly. Just across the street from Carnegie Hall on the corner of 55th and 7th Ave, it is an ideal location for museums, Broadway shows, and just a few blocks from Central Park. It is atop the 57th Street subway stop which connects several lines so you can easily get from one end of the city to another easily. (download the Hopstop app for easy navigating.) The hotel has recently been renovated and is beautiful. I liked that it is not huge, but feels more intimate. No long lines at check in, and the service was very personable and responsive to my needs. The Park Kitchen restaurant has a varied menu at breakfast including a buffet but the options for dinner lean more to a bar menu with a few special entree options each evening. Having said that, it's a very comfortable place for cocktails or post theater drinks, with lots of seating areas, and also options for single guests who want to relax or work--there are charging stations where you can use your personal devices while in the lounge. For quicker refueling, there is the Central Market which has a good selection of bakery goods, sandwiches, specialty coffees, etc. Rooms are modern and luxurious. My premium king was spacious and quiet. I loved this hotel and will be happy to return. One minor concern was that better task lighting is needed. In the area where you place your suitcase, there isn't any illumination.

Hotel very pleasant. The cost was reasonable. However, located two blocks from six different subway lines and only an easy walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park makes the hotel Ideal.

The property is well located and was nicely refurbished about two years ago. I've been staying there for a few days every two months or so. Unfortunately, all aspects of the property - service, housekeeping, basic facilities have been on the decline. For each of my last visits they have had only one bank of elevators operational - leading to long delays to get from or to one's room. Housekeeping is very poor - with the staff barging in despite a DBD sign. They were miffed that I had overslept & disturbed their routine. Articles left behind are never returned. I thought I had a room rate that included breakfast - only to be directed to a little kiosk in the lobby that was handing out muffins and coffee. After about 10 visits in he past two years, I have decided not to return. There are other Hotels that make more of an effort.

If this is the hotel that Priceline gets you, or it's a cheaper stay, that's fine. There's nothing particularly wrong with this hotel. I will note a disturbingly strong scent when you enter the hotel. I think it's meant to be sweet, but it's more like a cloud of disinfectant covering the entryway. Reception staff was not particularly friendly, nor rude. The room itself was quite far from the elevator, but otherwise fine. The bedroom part was relatively large by NYC standards, but the bathroom door could only open halfway before hitting the toilet bowl. The gym was small and had decent equipment. All told, none of the above says avoid at all costs, but there maybe nicer places to stay, at a similar location with similar cost.

Stayed here a few nights in a row and for the most part it was quite good. Staff were very friendly, rooms a good size, bed was comfortable, nice bathroom, only problem we were on the 7th floor and it was quite loud from the traffic outside. Also the curtains did not block out all the light so was reasonably bright every morning. Overall I would recommend and stay again, if they improved those things it would be ideal.

My sister and I just stayed at this hotel and loved it. The location is excellent, the room is nice and it gives us privacy as the queen beds are divided by the closet, and every time we needed anything the staff was very friendly. The bell boy got as a car to take to the airport that was clean and safe and got us there cheaper than a taxi driver! Thanks Noel!

We had a long stay here, about 15 days. The hotel is pretty decent, but it was only a place to hang our coats and sleep. Summary:Hotel: Fairly clean and well-maintained. Elevators were irritatingly slow and old - at times we had to wait easily 5 - 8 minutes (and while carrying luggage, made it impossible). We never ate at the hotel, quite expensive when there's plenty of other food options around in Midtown.Rooms: We had the refurbished rooms, very clean and modern. Don't expect complimentary bottled water or welcome drinks etc; it is a NYC hotel anyway. Bath was modern and clean, well maintained as well. However soap / shampoo dispensers were plugged to the wall. Makes it feel a bit tacky.Sleep quality: Decent, can be noisy even at the 5th floor (it is NYC anyway). Pillows a bit too soft but otherwise bed kept us sufficiently knocked out.Location: Good for Midtown; two blocks from Central Park, right opposite Carnegie Hall, in between two sets of subway lines. If you're looking to stay close to Broadway and all the shows then it's the right place. Otherwise far from East / West Village and the financial centres. Close to MOMA, and a good 20 minute walk to the Met. Good if you're a bit older, but not great if you're looking for a supremely good time. Service: Bellboys were superb; we made friends with these chaps. Front desk was efficient, no complaints. If you're looking to book taxis or airport transfers ask the bellboys first - they'll save you a few dollars (concierge is outsourced and charge a hidden service fee?). One horrible experience was when I accidentally left my sunglasses next to the computers by the lobby. Called the hotel 3 minutes after I left (was in a cab) to ask somebody to pop by and hold it for me - but the 'Hotel Guest Relations Officer' couldn't be bothered to walk over or get hold of front desk to get it. Insisted that somebody will turn it over to security. Obviously, it was lost forever.

The Park Central is always the hotel I stay at when visiting NYC. This hotel is in the best location for working in Midtown, not to mention, you are in a great location near main visited spots such as Time Square, Central Park, Rockefeller & Radio City. The Park Central is also near several of the Theaters, so it can be very accommodating for booking shows and plays.This hotel is an incredibly clean...and for a NY hotel, the size of the rooms are great! You will be pleased to have a large room and not to be staying in a tin can. The employees have always been very friendly and helpful. I have to give praise to Elizabeth Cacovic the guest manager at the hotel for always making my stay extra special!! If you visit, I hope you get a chance to work with her!They have also recently remodeled their dining area, lobby and gym. For traveler who like a hotel with great amenities and accommodations, this is the place to stay! Enjoy!Becca

I stayed here for four nights as part of a mom and daughters get-away. The hotel is clean, service at registration and in the lobby bar is friendly and efficient, and the location is close to Times Square, the Theater District, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, and the Metro. I will definitely stay here the next visit to NYC.

This hotel gives you the New York City vibe without the crazy NYC hotel price! Rooms are decent size. Bed was very comfortable. Staff allowed us a 2 hour early check in (thank you!), the hotel location is perfect for midtown. Seeing something at Carnegie Hall, stay at Park Central! It is right across the street. You have many deli choices in the City, Carnegie Deli is top notch and real close to Park Central. There will be a line for lunch. The service we got at Park Central from the front desk, to doorman to bartender to housecleaning all very pleasant. Couple of improvements. Water in bath tub backed up while in shower, handle for toilet paper broke (room 1145 hint hint). Bar closes at Midnight on a Friday night! Just wrong for NYC! I would stay there again.

No security at night. Scary. We at hotel bar and guys off the street walked in and harassed us, causing fight with my husband. So scary no security around ? Funny same night but earlier in bathroom lobby a man walked in to use bathroom off street and he was a pimp lol not kidding. They need serious help getting this hotel safe. Anyone can walk in and find there way to a room????

great location near Central Park, Times Square, and just steps from metro station. Room was clean and 2- queen beds deluxe room was fine size to accommodate 3 adults. Checkin/out was easy - no lines/waiting. This was my second stay at this hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed four nights. The Park Central is a great location...easy walking distance to Times Square. You can see the bright lights to your right in the distance when you step out onto the sidewalk. (It's nice not to get hit with immediate hustle and bustle.) It's a 10 to 15 minute walk to most Broadway shows. To your left as you leave the hotel it's a few blocks to Central Park. The rooms are a nice size and very clean. Beds very comfortable. Lots of pillows. No coffee in the room. Had to pay a $20/$25 flat fee per night for wifi (fee included use of gym, etc.). There can be a wait by the elevators. (To avoid the frustration of people "butting" in line, I prefer the hotels where you select your floor and the elevator is assigned to you.) The ice machine didn't work on our floor during our entire stay. (Not complaining just stating the fact...got some exercise walking down two floors to get ice.) Didn't experience the personal touch from the staff that others mentioned. We came and went without hardly a smile from anyone on the staff. Not a big deal to me but some might like a bit friendlier feel. (We didn't have too many questions so that limited our interaction.) Subway (N/Q/R) close. (Walk to the Central Park station to get more variety of lines) Would highly recommend the Café Europa - it's on the corner just a few blocks to the left as you leave the hotel. Great service, great breakfast choices. Our taxi driver said this was the hotel the Beatles stayed in during their first US trip. Could be?

We went to NY in a family, our kids are 10 and 11. We had a nice stay at Park Central, first of all, the rooms have a decent size, we usually have the size problem in NY hotels... hotel is clean and staff is very friendly, is perfectly located too. Only a few things to improve like there is no refrigerator in the rooms and there are no bathroom amenities either.

Blown away by the recent stay here. I'm glad I researched this hotel through Tripadvisor. The room is warm, cozy and the hotel is very inviting. I love the atmosphere of the hotel and their vibrant smell. Good job to the front desk agents, the food, the security and most importantly the concierge. I only stayed for 1 night which I regret leaving but the best part was when the concierge arranged champagne to be delivered to me as a surprise! Check inI love it! Fast and easy the check in process was. As the anxiety builds up, i was immediately greeted. I think the reason why the process was so fast and convenient is because the front desk asks you all kinds of questions. Questions leading all the way to parking, so I didn't even have to ask a thing, and before i knew it I had my room key!The RoomI love it! It was clean and cozy. That's all I ask for, something that looks and feels luxurious. Amenities there fully stocked, bed really clean (their was no bed hair trust me I checked) and the bathroom was clean as well.Park KitchenI love it! Food was really good here, I ate the Park Kitchen Steak and it was amazing and not bad in pricing to compared to other steakhouses in New York. Their Dinner is open until 10pm and they even have a cocktail menu.ConciergeI love it! I was able to be helped by Julissa with a few questions about dinner reservations (which lead me to eat The Park Kitchen Steak) and later found out that she surprised me with champagne to my room. I LOVE CHAMPAGNE!Check outI hated it! Yes, I said it, I hated to check out and leave this wonderful hotel. I really wished I stayed an extra day or 2 or 5, but in reality this is place is the perfect place to stay when your in the city.It goes to show you that their is hotels out there that you can have your 5 stars worth of service. Just make sure that Tripadvisor leads you to the right path in picking the iconic hotel!

I've stayed at the hotel a few times for business the past few years. I always enjoyed my stay and made it my NY hotel. The rooms are nice, the location is great and the staff are very friendly. I usually look for Salim who is especially nice and helpful. Wouldn't stay anywhere else since I discovered Park Central.

This was my 2nd stay at Park Central in 2 months, and I found the service much improved (my first trip had coincided with a UN summit so the hotel had been extremely busy, perhaps too much so for them to adequately cope).Whilst I have some minor gripes, such as no robes or water ever being left in the room, bar closing at 11.30pm and meal prices being somewhat high, the staff provide an excellent level of service (special mention to Elizabeth Cacovic of guest relations). The hotel is located excellently, rooms are of a high standard and very comfortable, and additional services such as laundry etc are to a very good standard. A wonderful base for a business or holiday visit to New York.

We stayed as a family of 5 in the hotel (not my first time at Park Central but first time with my family) the room was really nice and clean as usual. We were checked in by Salim at the front desk who was very nice and helpful! We even looked for him the next morning and he gave us some great tips if what to do in the city. I would recommend the hotel to anyone traveling to New York. Erez Zemach

I have just returned from a 6 day stay in New York and my husband, 19 month old daughter and I stayed at the Park Central Hotel. All in all its a great hotel. It's in a great location, and has obviously just been refurbished to generally a high standard.Bad Points; food and drink in the hotel is expensive. A bottle of water and a cup of milk coming in at just under $10 I thought was pretty steep.The bathrooms are pretty small and haven't quite had the same amount of attention as the rest of the hotel. There are only 2 lifts serving each side of the building - not ideal at peak times. No room service or even a fridge in the room. This was pretty disappointing for me.The good points;Staff generally are very friendly and will do anything they can to help.Staying at the park central isn't going to break the bank. I would say it's a 4 star hotel with 3 star prices. The hotel has a great atmosphere. The main room is pretty big compared to other hotels in New York (just a shame about the bathroom)Close enough to times square yet far enough away so that you're not kept awake all night. All in all a great trip and would definitely consider staying at this hotel again and will certainly be recommending to friends and family.

in recent years my wife & I visit NYC at an average of twice annually - & have turned Park Central New York to be our home away from home every single time.Besides being located in the heart of town - between Central Park & Times Square - near central lines of transport - the PC is a warm & welcoming establishment focused on quality guest services: from front-house management thru the accommodations - their cleanliness & comfort.Front desk (reception) personnel, the hotel's "showcase" , are all efficient & pleasant. I wish to commend in particular Mr. Saleem Raj Yichye for his exceptional professionalism: constantly ready to comply with guests' requests (annoying as they may be...) & to find the right solutions with a friendly smile.Needless to add that we'll continue to see in PC our base for future NY experiences.Prof. David Alexander

We travelled to New York in October in a party of 6, with two children. Our hotel was changed at the last minute by our travel agent - a situation out of our control. We didn't know what to expect anyway having not stayed in NY before so were glad to see a nice hotel front and just a block from Times Square where we were originally supposed to be staying. The location of the hotel was great for everything we wanted to do.I agree with other reviewers, the hotel staff are ok but not much in the way of a welcome. We did however manage to get interconnecting rooms so this was a great bonus for us.The bell boys however need to be challenged about their service, trying to book in and keep an eye on your bags and tip someone just doesn't work, and when you tut and flounce off in a huff you are never going to get anything in the way of a tip.The room was nice, we were on the 3rd floor. The beds comfy and tv huge! No mirror in the bedroom near a plug so that was a problem but there was a hairdryer in the room so it wasn't a massive issue. The noise from the street was bad, there were bins emptied and skips delivered and emptied all at 4 in the morning, but hey this is the city that never sleeps.. probably better if you are higher up.The bar in the hotel we used twice before we went out at night, very pricey but one night we had a lovely waitress Nancy and she was very attentive. It's a really nice place to relax.The wifi cost is a total rip off , along with the facilities as yo never really get a chance to use anything when you are in NY for a few days surely! We didn't really have much choice but to pay this after our hotel being changed so if you don't want to pay $20 a day you need to shop around.All in all a pleasant stay - the hotel certainly was no problem - just a pity the staff weren't friendlier on arrival.

The hotel is well located and has a good price the service is not that goodI was expecting more but I will use it again when in New York I didn't use the restaurant but it seems ok same goes for the barIn the room the only problem was that you aren't able to open the windows

Travelled with my mum hoping to do some sightseeing and shopping. This hotel was great, because of the location it was close to everything we needed. Unfortunately the first impressions of a hotel are really important - when we got off our flight and arrived at New York there was no bell man to help us with our bags and we were left to do it ourselves, then the manager of the hotel didn't welcome us she sent us to another of the reception staff instead. The reception staff were okay but they could have been more helpful and friendly. Our room was very nice (because we upgraded to get a better view) we were in the 10th floor and had three windows looking out to 7th avenue. One small thing was there was only one mirror and that was in the bathroom - it would have been great to have one in the room as well. Our beds were also very comfortable!A big negative point was the key cards. Apparently the key cards are easily effected by magnets around them so about 4/5 times while we were there they wouldn't work in our door. This was pretty frustrating, especially on the first night when we were tired and just wanted to go to bed. This meant we had to go down to reception and change them - or call the security man who was nice but not very fast at getting to us.We had wifi included in our room and it wasn't great - it was pretty slow at peak times and only really worked in the bar and restaurant.Okay positives...the bar and restaurant was very friendly as were the staff there. We had a very good burger and fries there one evening and it was nice and quiet.The concierge was also very helpful when we had to change our dinner plans on the last night because of rain and he had many suggestions.Honestly we did not spend a lot of time in the hotel - it was just a shame that they weren't more friendly while we were there. On the night with lots of rain, there was a very long line to get taxi, including us and other that couldn't speak English. The bell man hailing the taxis broke his umbrella and left but didn't come back leaving us all pretty stranded. In the end we walked but it would have been nice to have more staff around to help or even tell us that there would not be any free taxi's (which is what the concierge told us when we went inside to ask).All in all our trip was not ruined by the hotel but it would have been such a great addition to our holiday if we had had a nice welcome and more staff smiling around the hotel (oh and the cleaners were all very friendly - especially compared to the reception staff)It would have to be a really great hotel to make us come back again, so I'm pretty sure we will not come back here but I guess I could recommend it to a friend in the future if they don't mind the less personal aspect of it.

We arrived at the hotel after a 10 hour flight, 1 hour security check and baggage wait and another hour and a half of driving in the evening traffic on Van Vyck Expressway. At the hotel door a burly guy grabbed our luggage and said " We will handle these, sir". At the lobby there were three clerks busy working at their computers, not one bothered to look up and perform our check in, they merely pointed to the next clerk, who did the same. At my third try I managed to catch the attention of these majesties and finally checked in. We were told the luggage would be brought to our room and I had the feeling we would be shot if we tried to carry them ourselves. So half an hour later we were still sitting on our beds, tired and sleepy and cold (more about this below) waiting for our luggage to arrive, anxious to unpack and turn in. After my wife urged me for the tenth time, I finally collected enough courage to go down to the lobby to check what was happening with our bags. Sure enough, they were sitting cozily on a luggage cart, untouched but fortunately not stolen. So I decided to steal our own baggage, trying to hide behind other customers so that I am not observed from the reception counters. Nobody noticed.While waiting for our luggage I had tried to get some heat in the room but all the air conditioning unit was able to do was to blow out cold air. Now remember this is NYC at the end of October, 50 F with a cold drizzle. When I got back to the room with our bags I again tried to coax some heat out of the unit, with no avail. All I got was a cold draft. So I called reception who was very helpful for a change and told me she was sending up somebody immediately to check the unit. One hour and three calls later there was a timid knock on the door. Opening the door revealed a maintenance person who very embarrasedly told me that the room unit was perfectly OK, it was just that hotel management had decided to turn off the central heating but it would be turned on at midnight if the weather got any colder. Now, coming from a warm climate and spending close to 500 bucks a night for this sort of treatment, I found it a bit odd that the hotel management saw it fit to decide on my behalf whether I needed heat or not. Anyway, this guy made a very gracious suggestion and said if we wanted more blankets we could always call reception. Well I was under the impression that if I paid this kind of money I sort of had the privilige to call reception any time I wished but I let it go. At least this guy had the honesty to tell me the truth that the reception people would not.So that night we froze under our measly blankets and toward sunrise sure enough we got a warm trickle out of the screaming AC unit. That day although we were out for business I kept the unit blowing at max heat and full blow, preparing for a cold night. Surprisingly that night heating (perhaps I should say warming) was on and I said to myself, OK, maybe this was a one time case. How wrong I was!! The next day and night we were again left freezing. I wish me and my wife were preparing for an Arctic cross country on foot because this was certainly a fine training ground.When we finally checked out I was told of the "Facilities Fee" for 20 dollars plus tax which was conveniently left out of the check in briefing. However I was so glad to get out of this miserable establishment that I would have paid even more out of gratitude.The long and short of it is, the location is great and this is the only good thing about this hotel. Do not be fooled by the fancy ads and posters telling you how beautifully the hotel has been renovated because the interiors were the most tasteless decoration I have ever seen anywhere. The room obviously hates you and wants to kick you out once you have paid your 500 bucks and the "facility fee".My advice: select any of the 4-5 star hotels in the area. None of them can be worse.

Great location, poor accommodations. Our upgraded executive room was small with little to no privacy. We endured a sleepless night of 85 degrees since the thermostat did not seem to regulate the heat. The service charge of $30 is for no service. Two drinks cost us $50 at Harry's Bar. The quality of our stay (one night) was almost as good as night at a Holiday Inn.I would rather pitch a tent in Central Park than stay at this dive again.

excellent locationnice rooms  cleanthe trap is you ARE CHARGED for the WIFI even if you don't need itONE MUST KNOW nextdoor at Starbuck Cafe WIFI FREEand nearly everywhere in New Yorkyou ARE CHARGED FOR THE SPA YOU DON'T NEED AND ASK FORTHEY CHARGE FOR THE STORAGE ROOM though you MUST LEAVE AT MIDDAYnext stay we will go for instance to the SETON where the wifi is really freeWe won't come and stay there any longernot far you have for example the SETON just renovated and the WIFI is really freeattention au piege de vous faire facturer la wifi que vous ne demandez pasau starbuck cafe mitoyen WIFI GRATUITE on vous facture le spa mm si vous nm'en voulez pasla garde de vos bagages alors que vous devez quitter la chambre a midi !!!!!a lk'hotel

We were in NYC to celebrate a girls a weekend and the location was amazing but service in the restaurant/bar was atrocious. We tried to have dinner there one night and no one came to take our order after waiting for over 15 minutes and so we left then we decided to go and have a drink one night and same thing happened - awful! We were also supposed to receive hospitality drinks every night and we didn't get those either. Wifi was also incredibly spotty in the room. The location was great though which was great for what we needed.

Watch out! This and several other hotels are now adding an extra tax for services you don't use! I paid for my reservation by credit card in advance. When I checked out there was an extra charge of 40-some dollars for services I did not need, want or use! The front desk said it was in the print. Isn't everything? I could have crossed the street to the Wellington Hotel and been as comfortable for two days for over $100 less! Has NY City checked on the new tax? Who is receiving it? Park central said several of the hotels are now charging this tax. Needs to be stopped!G. Jordan for M. Delhaise

Very high service level, particulary from the investor relation desk (Mrs.Elizabeth), very efficient to address specific needs (travelling for business). The rooms are confortable and the hotel has been recenlty renewed.

Great Grand HotelClose to all the great restaurants, theatres, Time Square and Central ParkWhat more could you ask for ????Priced very well for NYCI have stayed here for business and pleasure.....vacationAs they say in the classics, when you're on a good thing, stick to it!!

Location is amazing. Broadway, Times Square, 5th Ave., and of course Central Park in walking distance. Service in the breakfast restaurant/bar was outstanding. Spot on referrals to restaurants and transportation in the area. Rooms well appointed. Could use one additional mirror and plugs for singles traveling together in rooms. Again, location is perfect. Would stay here again...

I've stayed in 3 hotels in NY and this Hotel places top in all three. I've stayed in many hotels throughout the world and this hotel remains top. First thoughts are very spacious reception, speedy staff at check in, they are staff walking about who are more than happy to help, concierge best about, hotel shop extremely affordable (shocked as they are usually expensive) bar and restaurant area were well laid out and spacious. The hotel rooms are spacious, beds comfortable and get pillows. Bathrooms are big and spacious.We didn't have a fridge in our room or a kettle... But upon request these were delivered straight away. Fridge was a large and spacious great for chilling food and drinks. There are giant ice fridges on each floor of the hotel which are great. Cleaners/ Room maids kept the rooms cleaned perfectly, beds fixed prefectly and provide a great service of fresh towels and sheeting. I can't say anything better about this hotel... Other than I could live there 24/7... I hate hotels but this one was like a home from home. I'd rate it a 5* hotel and have already told family and friends about it. I will be back :)

We enjoyed staying in that room. Yes, it was small, no refrigerator nor coffee maker, but, hey if you are in New York first time as I was, then you shouldn't spend much time in a hotel anyway :)Great location, clean, updated, quiet room, great bed, good sleep.Close to everything. Was absolutely great to step outside and be right in a middle of New York life.If you haven't seen Phantom of the Opera, it's a must! That Broadway show was breathtaking!New Yorkers are very proud of their street food - you have to try that! It IS oh so good! I am not a big fan of street food, but if you are in NY, you got to try it! It is absolutely safe and really, really good!If you are taking any city bus tours, don't believe that they are just 4 hours! They would be without traffic, but New York without traffic??? hahaha :) So plan to spend about 6 hours, bring bottle of water and enjoy! We went to Uptown and didn't have time to go to Downtown, next time. The tour was awesome! So much to see, we have learned a lot, had a great time!Lots of good places to eat, generous portions. if you can't finish your meal, don't leave it in a restaurant. Ask for a box to-go, there are lots of homeless people on a street, they are very grateful for your leftover What else can I add about New York? It's a spectacular city, in constant motion, lots of people on a street walking fast, the only slow walkers with confused faces are tourists lol, lots of cars, traffic, honking cars, catching a taxi on a street, high fashion next to a cheap outfit, lights, monitors, displays... AMAZING! I am in love :)

Great central location, unfriendly & impersonal service except for the resturant staff who were always friendly. Phones to the concierge, restaurant and other services seldom answered. Refills for bathroom supplie sporadic, bed linen change infrequent. Overpriced for what it is.

A Very good localization , confortable rooms and good Wi fi !This hotel is close to Central Park, where you can find lots of museums.Restaurants and shops are easy to find and the prices are good!It's a big hotel and sometimes the employees are not so close...

Asked for a quiet room - did not get it.Room was cold and heat was not working. Asked them to get it fixed. An hour and a half later, it was still not working. Apparently it takes awhile for the building heat to kick in. So, they brought in a space heater. Oh, and you have to pay a mandatory $25/day for the internet and free long-distance calls. I guess the hotel industry will now be like the airline one. Shame.

Great location by the very beautiful Central Park & convenient to subway lines & Times Square. It's big, you may have a hike to your room & the rooms - like most in NYC - are small, but they're fine & clean. Did not use any amenities but staff was courteous & helpful when I needed clarification on directions. Other reviews mentioned the slowness of the elevators. I was on the 9th fl and they weren't as bad as I expected. I recommend breakfast at the coffee shop in the Hotel Wellington directly across the street. Quite the hustle & bustle (think Sat Night Live Pepsi, Pepsi, Pepsi), reasonable prices and good food.

The best thing about the hotel is the location! Just a few mins from central park and Times Square and some great delis and cafes nearby for breakfast. The lobby is lovely and the check in staff were friendly and efficient. Our room was spacious, clean and exactly what we needed. The bed was so big and comfy and we had a nice big flat screen TV. Our view was of the street below, was a little bit noisy but then that's NYC. We ate in the restaurant one night, the menu was limited but the food and service were great.The facilities fee of 2o dollars a night plus tax is a bit annoying but it wouldn't stop me staying here again as the perks out way the cons.

Just stayed at Park Central hotel for a 4 day stay in New York. The hotel is in a perfect location, mere blocks from Central Park to the north and Broadway and Times Square to the south. It was easy to get to on the underground from JFK, and we found it easy to get about all the city from the 3 nearby underground stops! The rooms were well equipped and were fitted to a higher standard, the bathroom was slightly small but this was not a problem for such a short stay. The bar was nice (but pricey) for a evening drink, and the on site coffee shop ideal to grab a quick snack- although there is an abundance of eateries around the hotel so isn't really needed (we highly recommend Fluffy's across the road!) Had no problems with waiting for lifts and stored luggage as some reviews mentioned on here, overall would definitely stay here again!

Because of the number of tourists and large parties, you may not think of this hotel as a place to stay for business, yet I have chosen this hotel for years. Well, except for when they were undergoing renovations when it was a horrible mess. It's all finished and very nice. The restaurant is very good and great for meeting clients for breakfast or just a meeting. There are terrific restaurants across the street that are suitable for business dinners. Yup, the place is very busy but inside the room the noise level is fine. It's centrally located with entertainment options within walking distance. And, the price is usually very reasonable for NYC. Desk help service seems to be much improved. Caveats: Very busy with lots of tourists and teenagers. Unless you are on a high floor, it is noisy but this is NYC. All hotel rooms in the City are noisy with screeching sirens, car honks and construction. The rooms may seem small to out-of-towners but they are large by NYC standards.

This is a perfect mid-town choice. A very short walk to Centeral Park, MOMA, Columbus Circle, Broadway, amazing resturants and so much more. GREAT LOCATION for lots of dicovery but not in the middle of the madness of Time Square ( we got to see it from our room!) . Nice bar and resturant ,very comfortable beds,spacious rooms modern on the inside-old school New York on the outside with friendly helpful staff. I Highly recommend it for a NYC visit.

Travelled from the UK for 5 nights at this hotel. First impressions were good, really nice looking hotel with really nice staff. We stayed in a double king bedroom which was a perfect size for us. We absolutely loved the decor and I wouldn't say the room was small either, about the same size as what you would expect from a Premier Inn in the UK. Bathroom was nice, huge flat screen TV and huge bed!! The only downside I can think of is the noise from the elevator shaft, but a set of earplugs sorted that problem. We will hopefully visit NYC again soon and will be checking in here again without a doubt.

Took the red eye to NYC. Landed at 9 am, hotel allowed check in and I was so thankful. Allowed for a nap before hitting the concrete jungle. Close to everything. Walked through Central Park every AM. Stopped at Tisserie right outside for a quiche and the best coffee. The bar was nice to sit and have a drink at. Room was large, and very clean (heard sirens all night but thats NY I guess). Held our bags and scheduled a town car for departure. I would easily stay here again. The price and experience matched perfectly. The staff was so friendly! I didnt expect that in NYC.

We arrived at 11.30 in the night having flown from Heathrow and the receptionist was very helpful. We had read that fridges could be provided if asked for, which we did because we needed to keep medication in it. It was brought to the room within 10 minutes of settling in. The rooms are freshly decorated in modern greys and blacks. We knew that there would be a resort charge for services that we would not use but the total room rate was still comparable with similar hotels in convenient positions. The fees include the internet which was problematic. We could access a weak intermittent signal if we sat on the floor behind the door of our room. Reception confirmed that there is a problem which seems ludicrous in the middle of New York for something that you have no option but to pay for in a resort fee.

I was very unhappy with this hotel yes it's centrally located yes it was clean and the bedding was good but there was no room serviceAnd the rooms were small in addition to that we had to go all the way down to the main floor across the lobby up the elevators pick up our eyes go back down to the main floor across the lobby and back up to 7 to keep our eyes in a bucket there were no refrigerators either we had to fully dress or drink there was a little store downstairs but it wasn't open 24 hours so we literally had to walk blocks we wanted to get something off hours I would never stay there again never

This was my first stay at the Park Central Hotel but it won’t be my last.My guest and I chose it for the convenient location: just far enough away from Time Square and Midtown congestion to feel unburdened by tourist crowds but right around the corner from several of my appointments, very near several Subway stations, and only a five-minute walk to Central Park.This is a very attractive property—they recently invested $70 million in a renovation—with food and beverage that is unusually good for hotels without named restaurants attached to them. My room was very nice as well and the rate very reasonable, but the hallmark of the Park Central’s great value is in their extraordinary service.Every member of this team—from the beginning of the stay until the end—was courteous, warm, and professional; and unlike so many hotels in the area, each of them appear to really enjoy what they do. Salim (sp?) at the Front Desk Nick was particularly gracious and attentive and we were impressed by the excellent service of Nick at the front door, Jordan in baggage check, and several members of the hotel bar.I was especially grateful for Guest Relations Manager Elizabeth C., who worked with Salim to resolve a minor issue with our originally assigned room right away and who checked in with me personally throughout our stay, offering her assistance several times, to ensure my guest's and my expectations were being met. Both he and I remarked several times that our expectations weren’t merely being met, they often were exceeded. We were initially booked for only one night at the Park Central. Because of this experience and the attentive service, we extended it to four.Great value here.

The best bits .... location is perfect. It is great for central park and times square plus close to main shopping streets. Subway easy to use and this hotel is close to key/main lines that we needed. Room (deluxe corner room - we paid $100 more) very good & beds/pillows all very comfortable. When we did eat in the restaurant/bar area - the food was good and staff very friendly. The not so good - when we arrived (a little tired & jet lagged) the welcome was okay but certainly not warm or friendly. Noting explained to us or made easy (a little off putting) but then again we were tired. No one helped with our bags, even the cab driver tried to get someone to help but no luck (we arrived around 8.30 p.m. so maybe concierge busy). The restaurant was closed for a private party and no room service available so had to go out to find some food (okay but not ideal). Then we went to our room and the key cards did not work (10th floor). This happened 3 days in a row and the hotel receptionists just kept saying keep away from your phone (which we did & had been doing from the start) ! Did not really apologise just blamed it on us. The room was clean but the corridors and lifts appeared a bit shabby (the lift had hand marks all over it) again a little off putting. No heating in the room - apparently it was too early for the hotel to put their heating on - so we were a little cold for a few nights. It was quite expensive - and watch out for all the taxes they add on to your bill (for New York State, New York City and then a New York occupancy tax - again for both the state and the city.I booked the hotel through expedia.com and they sort of allowed for some taxes but it did not really add up when we came to pay. Quoted $2,359 for 5 nights but then the total came to $2671 (and please note the rate of tax changes every day !) All very confusing but I am sure it helps keep New York state & city both nice and wealthy. Lastly, the noise (and you can't really get away from the noise in NY) - try to get a room high up e.g from the 10th as the sounds from the road can be heard at all times (although the double glazing was pretty good) but being higher will help ( and the noise will be less bothersome) Take ear plugs if a very light sleeper.

The hotel is very busy and caters primarily to tourists. Room was average and small but clean. There is limited dining option in the hotel which is fine given there are plenty of choices around the hotel. Location is great as it is close to Times Square, Central Park and Columbus Circle. Service is average. Once they check you in you are on your own (other than house keeping), there was no one offered any help for luggages, no doorman to help with cab and no concierge manning the desk. In conclusion, this hotel provides basic accommodation in a nice location other than this don't expect any thing more.

Last march i stayes here and i even gave an excellent review of this hotel, dont get me wrong, the accomodations are good, but the way that the front desk work is awful, 2 of the ladies look so mad and are rude with the client, dont know with the others but to me, they should know that they dont own the hotel and arent doing to me any favor, first they told that my room will be ready at 13:00 so i went to spent time so i came back so wet cause its raining and with a bad attitude they told me that they never said that, that they guaranted thw room at 16:00. I am not even start my atay here and i am having a bad bad tine.... Probably im nor going tocone back.

1. $50 per person per day "resort fee" for nothing. WiFi and health club should be complimentary to begin with.2. 2 towels. Are you kidding me?3. Shampoo and conditioner on the wall are difficult to dispense and low quality.4. No other amenities in bath other than lotion.5. No vanity mirror.6. A/C is noisy and non-adjustable.7. Three kids were running all over the hotel in socks all day unsupervised.8. Internet service was weak.For $500 a night, there has to be a hotel with nice facilities AND a great location.

We stayed at Park Central for 6 nights. All staff were very helpful & friendly. Upon arrival we asked that our room be changed because we had a wheel chair. This change was made promptly. If you have a motorized chair or scooter, you may encounter some accessibility challenges because of the ledge entering the bathroom and the very small elevators. The room was quiet and bed comfortable. The location was exceptional. Two short blocks to Central Park, numerous good restaurants and deli's close by (we recommend Carnegies Deli for breakfast or lunch and Trattoria Del Arte for dinner). The staff assisted with hailing taxi's and there are 3 computers in the lobby to print out your boarding pass. Coffee was not provided in the room but could be purchased in the lobby in a small take-out café that also had wonderful fresh baked goods, snacks and beer/wine. Several subways close by and walking distance to Times Square, the Theater district, 5th Avenue shopping, etc.

Perfect location, gorgeous hotel, a very nice aroma always in the lobbyI would recommend this for a good location however I found the staff (except cleaners ) to be like robots with no emotions and it was like they are all programmed to say what they say and cut in over u if u ask a question and just pass u on to the next personThe bathroom door hits off the toilet, there is just very basic toiletries Overall it's perfect for location but I expected the staff to be a little politer than they were, it certainly put us on a downer if we needed anything or advice so in the end we just asked the cleaners everything

It’s our third time traveling to New York City. Upon arrival, we checked in at the “Park Hotel Central” on 7th Avenue. Immediately we felt that this hotel was the perfect place to be. All the personnel accomplished our desires. We had an issue regarding our room: We booked a 2-bed room, since our son, studying medicine in New York City, astonished us, we had to move to a 3-bed room. To solve this issue, I started to talk to the “angel” of our hotel. A young and encouraged women helped us out right away without any delays and we found our divine room with a sight directly on the 7th avenue and the skyline of this breathtaking city. After everything was clarified, we found out that this kind and supportive person was the “guest relation manager” of the Park Central Hotel. Her name is Elizabeth Cacovic, she is not only working professionally, but helpful and has a positive spirit with exorbitant humanity. Thank you for this beautiful time in New York City and the support by Elizabeth Cacovic, we’ll definitely come back.

Summary: Expensive sweater went missing from the room; spotty internet; dirty linens in the halls; understaffed room personnel; unresponsive management; cleaning staff seemed to not have lists of room occupancies and communication with management,,were loud; technical difficulties to use amenities (internet, phone, desk lamp); managements constant reply: well, you could have called us about it. The management seemed to think it was up to me to point out these shortcomings and then get behind getting them fixed rather then having them attended to in general, without complaint. Calling and getting assistance was a let me transfer you bonanza.All that at $ 500 per night supposedly including the 5 night $ 40 discount?Me thinks not.

We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights on October 14, 15 and 16, 2014. Our stay at the Park Central Hotel in NYC was, overall, a very good experience. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is within walking distance of Time Square, Lincoln Centre and Central Park (south). We also walked from the hotel to Bloomingdales and Barneys. Lots of restaurants, stores etc. right outside the hotel door on 7th Avenue and there is a Starbucks right in the hotel with access from the street which was AMAZING for morning coffee!! This hotel is also right across the street from Carnegie Hall.When we arrived in NYC by train (Penn Station) the weather was beautiful (75 degrees and sunny). We walked from Penn Station (around 34th street) up to our hotel with our wheel-able luggage. This took approximately 20 minutes. We did the same on the return to Penn Station after the trip. Good saving on taxis!We had a room with a King size bed. The hotel has recently been renovated and the renovations are quite nice. The hotel room was smaller in actuality than what the picture on the hotel's website depicts (trick photography?) although the space was large enough to move around in and there was ample room for luggage storage, etc. The window in the room faces an inner "courtyard" of the hotel and many rooms face this inner courtyard. Therefore, you have to keep the blind drawn on your window or you are completely visible to all other rooms within this courtyard (as they are to you as well!!). That being said, our "inner" room was probably much quieter than a room facing 7th Avenue and we weren't too concerned about a view from the window as we spent little time in the room. Wide screen T.V. was great, bed comfortable and all amenities in the room were good except we prefer wrapped plastic cups to real glassware, which was provided, as you are never quite sure how or when these glasses are washed/handled. The only real complaint was that the water pressure on the shower was really not great, although it was adequate enough to take a shower. There were no complimentary shampoos/conditioners but rather dispenser bottles that were "locked" to the shower wall (why would anyone really want to steal these items?). You had to pump many times to get enough shampoo out of the bottle, but once again, the end result was adequate for our purposes.The hotel charges a Facility Fee of $20 per night for luggage storage upon departure and WiFi as well as "private changing facilities" in the lobby. We didn't take advantage of any of these things so this was an additional cost that the hotel does not waive even if you don't use the services.Check in and out was really fast and efficient. Check in is not until 4:00 p.m. but we did check in as soon as we arrived at approximately 2:00 p.m. and it was really straightforward and professional. We did an express check-out wherein you simply drop your room keys into a drop box as long as you have no outstanding charges on your room account.Overall, we would definitely stay here again simply because the location is really fantastic. We didn't take any taxis and walked to most places we wanted to see in the downtown or mid-town areas. You would have to take a taxi to Greenwich Village or the East Village, Soho, etc. if you wanted to visit these places, though we are saving these jaunts for our next trip!A good hotel with a fantastic location. A bit pricy (but this is NYC) and we saved money on taxis because of the fantastic location!!

We stayed for seven nights and were totally pleased with our experience! The room was quiet, clean nicely appointed. The room service was prompt. The tv worked. The beds were comfortable. No problem with waiting for the elevator even though we were on the eighteenth floor. We would definitely stay here again. The location was perfect. The front desk staff were all helpful and pleasant.

We stay in this area of NYC 3-4 times/yr, and love the location. CNN/Columbus Circle; Central Park, Times Square; Broadway; Carnegie Hall; Hells Kitchen Restaurants; Lincoln Center; and more. I stayed at the old Park Central in the late 1990's - it was available, had good rates, but was very ummm.... used. It needed the recent facelift. They did a great job with the rooms and the lobby. The rooms are ok size for NYC (you're not gonna spend much time in the room are ya?). The new bath room was great (modern shower, no tub in our room) Nice fixtures, lighted mirror. Giant 48" TV (couldn't sit far enough back :-). There are many ways to get into PC, so depending on how you book it, you may pay extra fees that may not be disclosed by the booking agent. The bar is pretty, and comfortable for chatting...including a balcony away from the hustle & bustle. The lobby does get very very busy during changeover, and the elevators are ridiculously slow. ELEVATOR TIP (if you're up and want to go down, press the UP button and take it up, if you're low down you'll never catch a down that's not already full).

I often stay in this hotel when I am in Manhattan. However I had the optimal satisfaction and recently prior to a trip to Africa. Miss Elizabeth Cacovic who was at the front desk gave me excellent customer services that exceeded my expectation and previous experiences of staying in the hotel. Her attitude, human relations and professionalism are beyond compare. I could have extended my stay for a few more days had it not been for my scheduled flight overseas. Nevertheless, I enjoyed my time at Park Central and I got my $$$ worth! Deep thanks Miss Elizabeth Cacovic for your outstanding service to your guests!!!Dr. Linus Nangwele

we stayed at Park Central in beginning of October, chose the hotel as it was newly renovated. However, obviously their staff wasn't "renovated". The housekeeping staff would talk to each other constantly since 8 am with each other- the doors of the hotel rooms are not really sound proof- so i woke up daily due to the housekeeping chatting outside my door. isn't it common sense and common training staff are not supposed to talk loudly?? also , there are no slippers at the hotel. its an amenity that will probably cost the hotel 50cents per pair (at most), but an amenity their customers will appreciate. FIRST hotel i've ever been to who DOESN'T have slippers for their guests. Lastly -- I forgot new iphone 6 cases in the room, contacted the guest relations manager, she said they haven't found anything and referred me to their security director to fill out a form - who hasn't contacted me for the past 3 days. so basically -- the hotel staff stole my iphone cases (the staff were supposed to have put it in lost and found) , and don't take any responsbility for it. OH, and they don't clean very well - there were hairs in the bathtub. that would be the first and LAST time we will stay at this hotel. never referring it to my friends. NEVER.

Stayed for 6 nights in October 2014. Excellent hotel in terms of its location, good rooms - very clean and comfortable.Excellent service from all staff; in the coffee shop, front desk, luggage room and John in the bar.Especially important to note the best service we have received from Elizabeth. Elizabeth was courteous and gave excellent service.

I choose Park Central Hotel every time I am in NYC. It can be pricey but to me the price is well worth it for the convenient location. The hotel has recently been through a complete remodel and looks fantastic. It is situated above the NQR subway line and has a Starbucks next door. It is also only a couple of short blocks from Central Park. There are countless restaurants within walking distance and also lots of shopping. They do charge a $20 per night resort fee (not optimal) but that includes wifi, use of the fitness center, etc. All in all, I feel like this hotel can't be beat!

During our last trip we stayed at PARK CENTAL New York. Excellent hotel in terms of its location, good rooms - very clean and comfortable. Especially important to note the best service we have received from the staff especially the Manager Elizabeth. Elizabeth was courteous and gave excellent service - thanks to Elizabeth we always go back and recommend this hotel to all our friends.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Park Central after spending 2 nights in a 'trendy' botique hotel. Park Central lacks the 'trendy' and hip attitude and ambiance, but it is a more than comfortable hotel at a great value (we got a great deal on Expedia). The rooms are spacious, clean and comfy; bathrooms are modern and clean and fresh. We were more than comfortable in the hotel. We really enjoyed the location, walking distance to Central Park, Time Square, etc. I would choose this hotel again based on location, value and comfort.

The positive things about this hotel are that the restaurant is very good, the staff are very nice.Our room was too dark so they did send up another lamp. I also requested a small refrigerator because they DID NOT have room service. The bathroom was rather small and no siting area other than at the table where the TV and drawers are. What upset me was that the night before we left i saw 2 bugs crawl behind the headboard. In the morning i asked to speak to the manager and told her. She asked why i didn't call housekeeping and i told her we returned to our room very late. She never apologized and offered no words of comfort. I will not stay there again.

4 of us stayed in two rooms for 3 days last week. It is a lovely hotel, very clean and modern and nicely situated to explore New York.The Hotel badly lets itself down by charging $20 a day plus tax for Wifi, telephone calls etc. As visitors from England we used none of these services but they are mandatory whether you use them or not so we paid $130 for nothing.Guest should be given the option whether they require these services when they book in so for this reason we would not stay in this hotel again.

Too expensive for what it offers! The hotel is organized and managed with the main purpose to save money and staff....The result is that you get the minimum but you pay the high price (ex. no breakfast included, no free WI FI, no newspapers, no coffee machine in the room unless you ask for (twice), no hair dryer unless you ask, no fitness room, 2 elevators only....and you end up waiting, and waiting for everything

1) a/c is verrrry loud and is not working for heating which is a problem in the beginning of october.2) constant line to enter elevator (only 2 exist per 8 floors). Jams with suitcases, or strollers, or people espesially in breakfast ours. Had to use stairs couple of times, after long waiting.3) hotel is not children friendly – you cannot retract shower handle – it is fixed, so if you need to wash a small child you have to go to shower together with a child – nice. Also see point 2 – we had to wait for free elevator for 10-15 mins sometimes to enter with stroller – it is unacceptable4) no kettles in the hotel - it was funny to see lady with a coffee machine in front of the door saying it is the only machine for the hotel – try to boil water in it. It havent worked of course.5) rooms are ascetic with no minibar and not enough light. Still you will be charged a security deposit. WiFi is not stable and free version is slower than my 3G phone. Loud machinery is working 24/7 on the roof of groundfloor (some a/c blocks or whatever). General condition of the rooms and corridors is not fresh, no hygiene kits in bathrooms, max 3 stars rating for the hotel.

The hotel has gone through a complete refurbishment of the rooms and lobby which has made a complete change to a more pleasant stay. Location is perfect, two blocks from central park, Columbus circle and the subway entrance is round the corner (lines N,Q,R). for both business or pleasure is a great choice, and I try to book me in every time I go to NY.

TL;DR: Hotel was mostly fine, except for an unhelpful front desk attendant that resulted in a pair of lost/stolen sunglasses and one very dissatisfied customer. The room: Brother and I got a larger room on the 5th floor, with two double beds and a renovated bathroom. The room itself was fine (some street noise but wasn't an issue). The windows DO open but we generally kept them closed to keep out the city's dust and noise. Although the wifi is very fast, it's "free" in that there's a compulsory charge that comes with the room. So if you're paying for internet, might as well use it! Our room was located quite a distance from the elevators so it was a bit of a walk, but walking wasn't an issue for us (it might be if you're with older folks or with someone who's got a bad leg). My parents had a room closer to the elevators and they had no complaints about the room. Two things that really bothered us about this place: 1. The keys. It is ridiculous that we had to change our keys a total of FIVE times for the two rooms. Imagine going back to your room after a long, tiring day and not having your door open because your key's messed up. And then making the trek back downstairs to change the keys, only to have the same thing happen the next day. This happened to both rooms, multiple times. They kept malfunctioning until the hotel eventually reprogrammed the machinery for my parents' door because none of the keys would work. What a pain. 2. Customer relations can be deplorable. My brother realised he left his sunglasses in a monogrammed leather case by the computer terminals when we got into the car, about 5 minutes later. We called front desk, asked them if they could just do a quick sweep of the computers and hold onto the sunglasses until we got back - we'd stay on hold and would really appreciate it. Front desk said that if security brought anything to lost and found, they'd let us know. Not that they would take a brisk 30 second walk around the lobby or go and ask someone to take a look real quick, but that if something came in at the end of the day, they'd let us know. We asked the attendant to just see if they were there and she wouldn't. It wasn't a busy morning and it wouldn't have taken her more than 30 seconds to walk over, grab them, and save us a tremendous amount of grief. The time she spent on the phone with us telling us she wouldn’t go and look right away was longer than what it would’ve taken her to walk around. We asked front desk if anything came in three times over the next few days– obviously nothing did. This incident was enough to turn my brother off this place completely and I doubt he’d recommend it to anyone. The hotel itself was fine, but Park Central could definitely work on their customer service if it’s the difference between a returning customer and a dissatisfied one. The hotel: - Other than the front desk incident, service was fine. Bellmen and reception were (mostly) helpful yet always ready with a smile. Housekeeping accommodated us when we took a little longer to get ready in the mornings (jetlag) but otherwise were great; we always came back to a clean and tidy room. - The hotel's airfresheners were a touch too strong. - There's a Mac computer terminal with free printing, which was handy for printing all our tour passes and boarding passes. There is a 15 minute time limit, but that's generally enough time to google where you're going for dinner and to check into flights. - We didn't eat or drink in the hotel, nor did we use the gym so can't comment.

No grumbles apart from the $20 dollars a day tax charge.Would defiantly recommend "Fluffys Diner" for eating. It's on the next block on the opposite side of 7th Avenue if you turn right out of the hotel.

I spent the week on business and the hotel was in the perfect location for my clients. It is also close to Time Square and Central Park for some much needed R&R. The Manager on duty Elizabeth Cacovic was great, she resolved an issue for me without fuss or complaint and for that I would like to thank her again in print.The hotel itself is well laid out, the rooms and public areas are clean. The bar and restaurant had nicely prepared food but was on the pricey side and the coffee shop/snack bar was a welcome sight as I rushed off to my morning meetings.

We stayed in New York City for two nights on our way to Illinois. We enjoyed this hotel especially its location. It is in the centre of Manhattan, a few blocks away from all the important attractions of the city. At one stage we walked from the hotel to Times Square and up to Central Park. It was as easy as a walk in the park. The hotel itself is good. It is not neccessarily value for money at that price but it is among the cheapest in its class. Again, in the context of New York City, you get to redefine the concept of value for money! There are no views in the hotel. We in fact preferred keeping our curtains closed because the outside of our room was a gloomy wall. The rooms are small but good enough. The strongest point of the rooms are an extremely comfortable bed and a large flat TV set with HD chanels, international news channels and a cinema type sound! I do not remember a hotel TV as good as this one.

Am half way thru a 7 night stay, on the 16th floor in a standard room so will give you a live update. This is also my first visit to NY.Bathroom very small, the door only just closes with the positioning of the toilet. main part of the room quite nice however is a bit worn out. There is no mini bar or even fridge in the room however available on request...... Um ok... There's a cafe style shop in lobby that charges like a wounded bull with pod style coffee. Go next door or down to Starbucks, hotdog vendors for water and soft drinks.Hotel mentions a laundry however it's a service where they send it out. There is two coin op laundries around the corner so I wouldn't bother. Main bar/restaurant sells itself as a proper restaurant as per a normal 4-5 star hotel but is really just a booze den... That happens to a serve tapas/mezze plate style food. Went there on the 1st night and asked to see a dinner menu, was given a cocktail list and a snack bar list. Website lists a full Style menu, am not the type of person that chases someone for something that should be standard fare so I just had a few drinks and a cheese plate which in fairness was very good as were the drinks. No room service either. TV channels are very limited to local free to air. Lobby is quite nice however does get very busy with guests checking in. Perfect location to the park, upper west and east side and a few minutes to Times Square and associated attractions. If you are used to the Australian/Asian 5star hotels like I am then stick to the chains... Hilton Marriott ect... Jokingly I am expecting a knock on the door and be whisked away to the real hotel and a bit of service for the money I paid but I don't think its going to happen... The general vibe is "you want a room there it is" I just came back from 5 nights at the JW Marriott in Hanoi so perhaps my standards are a little skewed.Not the hotels fault but there is a screaming newborn baby next door. Who brings a new born to a Hotel in New York?? They still use the old interconnecting rooms with the doors.Overall ok but never again. Nothing horrible or shocking to report just no wow factor.

another trip to NYC and as always we stay at Park Central Hotel (this is our 4th stay) the renovations are all complete and everything looks nice. we never had a bad experience with this hotel. Dennis the bellman is very helpful and pleasant. the concierge staff is the best. being close to the subway is a plus and everything is just a walk .

First time that I have stayed in a NYC hotel after living my whole life here but we had friends in from the mid-west and spent time playing tourist with them. First off, the location is great and the general cleanliness is fine. The main problem is their front end. After waiting on line to check in, we were told, not unexpectedly, that the room was not ready. There were only 2 people behind the desk. We did the normal pre check in including credit cards, id etc. we then went to the luggage storeroom where there was one person checking a long line of customers luggage. Came back later in the day, waited on line again, showed id and credit card and eventually got my key. One of my friends, after being given his keys and two other cards, inquired as to what they were for, and was told, by the only clerk on duty, to read it himself. Needless to say, on the last day, the line to check luggage was 30-40 people long as there was only one bellman on duty on a Sunday at 9:30am. the service, aside from a waitress in the lounge named Nancy who was wonderful, is completely lacking.

Been there for 10 days, and ok, but not more then that. Reception is bad. I came with a request regarding sequrity on flights on thursday(10 oct, 10am)and wanted to get in touch with Air Canada, and got nothing but arrogant answer "she had better things to do than standing on the phone".Which I never asked he to do.The hotel rooms are worn down, but the cleaning is ok.The bar: Great Girl called Nancy working there - makes you feel at home. Sorry Nancy, the fact that you are there, will not make us come back.The Christensens

I am a seasoned business traveller and I must way I hit rock bottom at the Park Central. I checked in for 1 nite and let me succinctly highlight the lowlights:1. I was with a group of 4 colleagues; two had suffered thru the humiliation of them not having a room and denying the reservation when they had written confirmations of the reservation from the hotel itself; 2. We had 2 boxes of materials forwarded to them for delivery to us...they confirmed receipt and thereafter admitted that they through out the boxes; 3. My room: 3 burned out light bulbs, a mouse...one live one dead, no towels; 4. 75 mins. to check in; 5. 35 mins to check our back as our room was not ready notwithstanding that we came back at 5 pm when it was promised for 4 pm; 6. 3x took me over 15 mins for an elevator.Well done Park Central...DO NOT GIVE THEM A 2ND CHANCE!

Was recommended byy Amex platinum card. Well I had requested if possible early check in when I made reservation. When I arrived at noon time the front desk clerk told me I should have booked the room the night before and of course paid 430 ...Because that's what she recommended to do. Waited in line for 30 minutes to check my bag in as there were no rooms available. Surprise. Thanks but no thanks. Small clean noisy and not worth the money

Just discovered this hotel and was really impressed. Beautiful hotel, spacious rooms and so easy to get around to great parts of NYC. I was surprised by how large the rooms were. Bathroom was clean and functional and had great lighting! The lobby bar was the perfect place to meet friends, and John quickly became our favorite bartender. I will definitely stay here again soon.

We stayed at the Park Central in NYC this past Saturday and were very happy with the quality of the accommodations, on site restaurant, location, and pleasant staff. Very conveniently located to theatre district and what a great room rate! Plenty of staff at front desk so no lines on check in or out. Great food at hotel restaurant/bar/lounge area.Great music playing. Had a lobster roll sandwich which was amazing and plenty of room to spread out in comfort or re-charge your laptop/phone. Updated in grey motif very trendy and clean. Valet very friendly and attentive from the moment we pull up. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and look forward to next visit at the Park Central.

I have now stayed at this hotel 4 times and each experience has been beyond expectations. As a seasoned business and leisure traveler, I find this hotel to be clean, nice friendly staff, good ambience, and a great location to Central park and surrounding mid town highlights. I will definitely stay there again on my next NYC visit.

Over the last 12 months, I have spent in excess $10,000 US dollars in a total of three different stays at Park Central Hotel for business and vacations. In the interim, on my second stay I had another stay in another hotel within Times Square, that one, despite being more expensive, offers smaller rooms and less professionalism than Park Central Hotel.I have been treated like a real valued customer by Park Central Hotel personnel and I would like to express my profound gratitude to Elizabeth Cacovic for the high standard dedication to her work and professionalism. I think she is one the best asset of this establishment. I also would like to congratulate Marie Paul in charge de security in the hotel. She have been very helpful to me on several occasions. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. However, I truly believe that for the price paid, the hotel must immediately suppress their policy of charging for the internet. It makes no business sense to charge $20 for internet while for a cup of tea or coffee you get wi-fi for free at the Tisserie and Starbucks Coffee next door. THIS MUST CHANGE.

We were just completely underwhelmed from the minute we got there. We were there a couple of hours early (with a 1 year old baby). The front desk really wasnt interested in assisting us into a room quicker. Just told us to come back at the pre-determined time. Not even an effort to accomodate. We get it, its busy, but a half decent attempt would have been nice.The hotel itself, other than the spot on central location, is not really great. Maybe its the same at all similar hotels in NYC. You are paying top dollar and not really getting anything near the quality. We upgraded to a bigger room - well that was about the size of a small room anywhere else. Noisy has heck, no sound being blocked from the street.The elevators were the tiniest I have ever been on. Families with babies, take a small stroller. Pretty much no room if you are in for anyone else.

We stayed in Park Central for 7 nights.I cannot recommend this hotel enough. The location is just perfect. You are walking distance from all the big attractions - Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, 5th Avenue, Central Park to name just a few. You are also very close to Hell's Kitchen which has the best range of restaurants in the city.The staff were friendly and very helpful, from the desk staff to the concierge. Room service was completed daily to a very high standard.The room was an adequate size and suited our needs perfectly. The bed was huge and not the usual 2 twin beds pushed together but a proper king size. It may have been the comfiest bed I've ever slept in! The TV had a great range of channels and the other room facilities were good. One great thing I must mention is plug sockets on the bedside table lampshade. So often in a hotel, the plug point is nowhere near you bed and it's a real pain to charge your phone and have it close to you. Here at Park Central you won't have this problem. The air-conditioning worked fine and wasn't too noisy. We were on floor 16 and had no noise from outside so always got a great night sleep.The on-site coffee shop was a nice touch also. A varied range of snacks and pastries and really lovely coffee for a decent price.When booking be aware of the extra fee of $20 dollars a day. This is pretty standard in US hotels, but it's usually in the fine print. For this fee you have the use of unlimited wi-fi (which is an absolute life saver) as well as use of the gym and a safe in the room. There are also 3 PCs on site to use which is free for up to 15 minutes plus a free to use printer which came in very handy for printing off our boarding passes.I would 100% stay here again on my next trip and would highly recommend it to anybody.

Great experience on our first visit to NYC. Couldnt fault hotel at all. Everyone of the staff were kind and courteous and always willing to help. Perfectly clean hotel and cleaners in room always left it spotless. The location was also perfect. The hotel is located about 5 mins walk either side of central park and times square which was perfect. We were also delighted to be helped by concierge in getting tickets for aladdin which was just new out. All in all we both had great experience and would be glad to return. Many thanks
