I stayed here for a week-the location was perfect and considering it's NY, the prices were reasonable especially compared to other hotels in the area.I booked through Booking.com and got a decent rate so will consider doing that again

I had stayed at this hotel a few times now and every time my stay has been wonderful. The location is great. I can easily walk to Times Square and Central Park and many other great locations. The management at this hotel is incredible, any concerns you have they give you the best attention and they are very involved with the guests , which is hard to find these days. Quimby Hightower, one of the manager, was amazing !. Thank you Quimby for making my stay awesome !Omar Palacios

We were 8 Canadian women left stranded without a place to stay when we were shafted by an apartment rental site (FYI - NEVER book through "Unlocked Spaces"!!!!). To make a long story short - The staff at Park Central went ABOVE AND BEYOND the call of duty to find us rooms and make our stay in New York enjoyable. The bonus was - it was such a great location! Short walk to Central Park and Times Square. We walked to all of our shows. And super comfortable beds and clean rooms!! We found everyone, from the front desk staff to cleaning and maintenance to the manager, to be friendly and helpful. I will recommend this place to all my friends travelling to New York, and hope to be back again!!

We spent a weekend in NYC and went back to our old standby Park Central.As the name implies it is central to pretty much everything. The have given the entire hotel a face lift. When you walk in the aroma of flowers is delightful. Beautiful. The bar has comfortable couches and intimate seating. There is a big nine screen display the runs a loop of the great things to see in New York. Our room was the typical classic king-comfy clean sheets and soft bed.Although the room was remodeled, the wallpaper was coming off the walls by the air conditioning. We never had a problem had a problem in the past until this trip. The problem this time was the missing TV remote. The TV won't run without it. There are no on/off buttons anywhere.How did housekeeping miss that when they turned the room? I called for a remote. Thirty minutes later a gentleman knocked on my door and handed me a remote with his apologies then left. The remote did not work. I immediately called the front desk again. They told me they would send someone up but couldn't say when...I let them know we were heading out for the night. Four hours later then I returned, the remote still did not work. The front desk did not say if anyone came while we were gone but 15 minutes later the same gentleman showed up. He tried to remote, no go, wiggled some wires and said the remote was defective. Another 20 minutes, and finally a remote that worked. It was after midnight by the time we settled in. I was highly aggrivated because housekeeping dropped the ball when turning the room and why did I need to call late into the evening for a silly remote. It bothers me to write poorly about the hotel because I have always had such a wonderful experience. BUT.....prior to checking out the housekeeper was in the hallway talking on her cell phone. When I checked out,low and behold she was still there chatting away. That does not pose well to me after the issues I had. For 900 bucks for two nights, everything should be perfect. Sorry PC but your staff really dropped the ball.

This is my second visit and I always feel welcomed, The hotel is spotless, the rooms are updated and the location is perfect for me. Close to the theater district, great little delis and all I wanted to experience in NYC. The rooms are a little small but I expected that. It is pricey but figured I saved a good deal on taxi fares. I was on the 9th floor and the road noise was no bother.

Arrived from UK at 5.00pm to be told that they had no record of booking made in Feb. From then on it was up to me to sort it out. They took no interest and we were treated like we were trying to get a free stay. They didnt even want to let me call UK to try and sort it. Eventually they said they would "allow" us to stay 1 night until we sorted but were adamant that they were full and didnt have rooms for our 6 night stay. Next morning I got same resistance to calling UK but finally made a call and then, miraculously, all was suddenly OK. No apology or even admission of error and when asked how they managed it when they were "full" last night, they couldn't answer. The only exception was a Mr Quimby who actually took an interest in helping us. Perhaps he should train the rest of the front desk!Rooms were pretty small and bathrooms were tiny. Constant noise from below. A very poor example of New York hospitality. I suppose because the UN General Assembly was on that week, they knew they could full the rooms without us visitors annoying them! An awful experience for what was supposed to be a special birthday treat for my wife. Totally spoiled the whole stay.

The three hour tour was a delight for the palate, entertaining and very informative. We could have visited the area dozens of times and never have known the neighborhood as we did in such a short time. The food was delicious, the employees of the various establishments were very gracious and our tour guide, Robin, was a delight.

It's fine for $300 a night, but not $500. Extravagant lobby - but on check in, after being charged an extra $40 for an "upgrade" and $20 for wifi and amenities, they put me in the darkest, dankest room I've ever seen in this city. Bathtubs, advertised on booking site, are tiny and shallow. Freshly painted and carpeted, sure - but squashed, cramped, dark, filthy windows and no light. There are brighter rooms at the Holiday Inn. No one answered any of the phones, so I had to go downstairs and have a strop. Fine. Waited for a new room. Same teeny bathtub. Amenities- such as shampoo- bolted to a wall. Ice machine busted. Elevators near room out of order requiring a stomp of half a block back and forth. (I'm disabled.) No extra glasses, no newspapers, nothing. Linens not fresh. Temperature in room ridiculous - there is an ancient air conditioner that freezes you to death if you dare turn it on. Asked for a paper. Was told I'd have to pay for it. Fine - but it hasn't shown up. Just all a bit... cheap at these prices. Then discovered they were literally short-sheeting my bed. As in, a foot and a half of bare mattress at the end. Complained to manager, and they remade the bed - with the same sheets. Half a foot of bare mattress still at the end of the bed. But no one answers the phones, so I had to trek again to the lobby - in my pjs - to a manager who just nodded sympathetically and droned on about it being a bad week at the UN. (sorry, do they pay more than the other customers?) Then another manager was sent to verify the problem. Had to awkwardly stand there while a maid redid it properly. (Tipped her, of course, this isn't her fault.)I'm Canadian. I'm very bad at that sort of thing. For the same money, you can stay a few stops away on the subway at a much better hotel, one that doesn't dump its money on the vacant and abandoned lobby bar. Avoid. (this is my 10th trip to NYC. this is by far my worst hotel experience.)

We were a group of 8 that had a series of unfortunate events that left us without accomodations. The staff at Park Central went above and beyond to help us. The beds were comfortable and the rooms and hotel was clean. The house keeping staff were excellent. They were very courteous and helpful when approached. The location was excellent as stated by other reviews. I would definitely stay again.

Fantastic location. Everyone encountered was kind and efficient. We had a wonderful stay and look forward to staying again. Would recommend Park Central Hotel to anyone. We stayed on 10th floor as Taxi's honk in the middle of the night, and that worked pretty well to reduce traffic noise. Deli's next to hotel are awesome for great food!

The hotel ambiance was quiet and personnel helpful, specially the Concierge and front desk, whose recommendations were always above expectancy. Provided orientation as to best options to get to the places, and dining locations in the neighborhood, too.The room was comfortable and the location, excellent! Close to theater district, Central Park, museums, metro stations, etc. The price is reasonable for what you get! Easily recommendable.

Take it from me .... I am in NYC almost once or twice a month and have always stayed at the Park Central hotel. Staff is friendly and courteous, hotel is spotless, rooms may be small to some people but I am assuming these people have never stayed in NYC. I love this place...the hotel and location cant be beat.

The valet lied to me told me it cost $58 to park my SUV, and I was like okay only $6 more then the parking lot across the street, and it was like 11 PM when I arrive at the hotel, I was exhausted and just wanted to sleep. Next day I checked out the front desk said it was $70, and $12 isn't much but I hate being lied too. The front desk wouldn't even do anything about it. Just bad customer services and horrible valet attendants.The hotel, is okay, nothing special. The elevators took forever because there were only 2 elevators going up and down from the 10 floor and the 18 floor, and there are a lot of hotel rooms.

I just got back from NYC for the first time. My experience in The Park Central was really cool!. It is a renewed hotel with the perfect location: south central park, the theater district, Time square, the 5th avenue, looong etc. Obviously if you enjoy to walk, this is perfect... Or if you dont, then you use the metro, bus or cabs for not so much money because distances are shorter than what might think. Be prepared for small showers and the extra 20 usd fees per day... But it was worthy.If you are buying cruises, tickets to broadway, etc., you can print them for free in the lobby ;)The bar and the food are good too :)We just loved it.

I must say that this was, by far, the best hotel experience I've ever had considering cost x benefits. Great deal!!! This hotel is clean, neat, with great staff and a delicious breakfast. It is not a five star hotel, but has the fairest cost. Plus, the location is absolutely perfect. A few blocks from Central Park, a few blocks from Times Square.... You can visit almost the whole island walking, and if you'd prefer, you have the subway really close. Just perfect!!!

This is more of a business hotel where feeling comfortable is less important. The staff were a little chilly and the decor is spartan. If you pay 450$ for a room (without breakfast - that would be another 35$ per person) and had booked this with "internet included" then you don't expect having to sign up for an extra "package" of $20 per day for internet, luggage storage, use of gym and the telephone. That is just a rip-off.

Great location right across the street from Carnegie Hall and steps away from Central Park. Bus and train transportation are located just steps outside the hotel, this is great!!!!!!!!The staff was most accommodation and professional. We especially enjoyed the "Wine Hour" Wednesday evening, how welcomed Quimby Hightower made us feel. Our room was excellent, and I will recommend this hotel to family and friends.

This hotel is perfectly located on 7th ave and 55th st, with a subway stop right on the corner that can get you to the theater district in 2 stops. Right next door is a Starbucks for coffee addicts and on several corners are deli to get breakfast including The famous Carnegie Deli. You can walk to blocks east and you're on Fifth Ave shopping and 4 blocks north and you're at Central Park. Can't beat that. The hotel was recently done over and the common areas are very nice. My room had a king bed, which was very comfortable. The bathroom was small but nicely updated. One of the major negatives is an outdated elevator system. There's only one bank, the elevators are very small inside and are often crowded, so you need to wait for the next one. If you have to be somewhere, allow some extra time. The hotel seems to attract some large groups of foreign tourists, which can make check ins challenging.

I was hunting for many hotels before I booked Park Central in NYC. I'm a member of HH and SPG chains and normally book or Hilton chain or Sheraton chain. This hotel is not a member of any of them. However, it was very pleasant stay and we have had a positive experience. Park Central is a big hotel just across from Carnegie Building. Hotel is within walking distance to Central Park, Columbus Circle, Times Squares and Fifth Ave. Also, there are Subway station "7 Ave @ 57". We were using mostly 42 St. Times Square or 50 th Street - goes strait to South Ferry and Soho/Tribeca and so on. Around the hotel you can find a number of good restaurants, grocery stores, wine stores, pharmacy and whatever you may need as visitor in NY. We have arrived late and were given "upgraded room" for free ( it is a common practice actually), and it was a great surprise. Room was very spacious and had a good size and comfortable beds. Everything was very clean and we left a compliments for housekeeper Marisa who is signing while working. Lust laughing. They have a great bar. I recommend "Whisky Manhattan". We didn't use their restaurant, nothing I can say. Also, hotel has a small kind of coffee shop with pastries and all kind of morning food you might need. They serve "Nespresso" and they actually don't know what it is in details. I'm using Nespresso for many years and know exactly how it is supposed to be. But that's me. There is Starbucks, right on right corner of the hotel, outside. But I recommend to have croissants from this hotel cafe. They don't bake them, but the product they buy - is a good product. Very fresh and delicious, not like frozen commercial items in Starbucks.In general - Park Central is a very good, solid hotel and I would recommend it to everyone and, will consider it as a "place to stay" next visit in NYC> Forgot to mentioned WI Fi. It is kind of free, but you pay your service fees with your bill and it is not free. But it is the best Wi FI I have ever had in hotels. Works great and no problem for the laptop or iPhone. Additional thanks for that.

Its a average hotel showing sign of age and inadequately maintained "lower quarters". They have two different sections, floor 1-9, rooms are old and each room has its own issues. i know since the room i moved into had three power breakdowns in 12 hours i.e. No power in the room!! No response from desk for 45 minutes until i went down and shouted in front of other guests to shame them and they scrambled and send someone who flipped a switch. I was frustrated since i have a 3 year old trying to sleep at 12 AM and power went out for third time. Apparently, one of the wall power unit does it if you plug anything. The so called engineer could not figure it out and i did. Service was so so and its reasonably clean. The other side of the coin is they have newly renovated rooms which are better so role the dice and hope you don't get the servant quarters. The Mafia i refer to is Parking and Hotel Mafia. I think these guys need to learn from Las Vegas otherwise this NY mafia model is not sustainable and this great Tourism place will end up like Detroit. Great location close to Time square and central park and the amazing Halal Carts with delicious hot dogs and rice over chicken/lamb for the spice friendly people and amazing shops at square and 5th and the MET museum and the Zoos and and .... yeah the sub-standard hotel.

I had a great stay here. Good gym, friendly staff, close to Central Park, time square, theaters it really is a perfect location for tourists wanting to fit a lot in. Also the hotel manager Elizabeth Cacovic was outstanding. It's hard to find someone in the hospitality that is more than happy to help and ensure your stay is great, and also knows exactly how to get things done fast. She really does care for the guests. I'll be back because of service like this. Thanks Trent.

Had an excellent time. Room was large, attractive and clean, although we had to request an extra chair as there was only seating for one person. The staff we encountered we professional, helpful and in the case of Quimby Hightower, most accommodating, helppful and entertaining. Had difficulty on two occasions when the cleaning staff forgot to replace the two drinking glasses in our room - quickly provided by room service. Only disappointment was the grab and go breakfast which we found too dominated by pastries where something more substantial like a ham & cheese croissant would have been more appropriate. Took a couple of days to get the housekeeper to leave the AC off. Lobby area too cold, so didn't use restaurant.

The Park Central is located right across the street from Carnegie Hall and is steps from Central Park and Times Square. Clean and quiet, it was convenient for my quick business trip to the Columbus Circle area.Two issues that moved my rating scale from Very Good to Average: I stayed two nights but the maid service never showed, and it was not clear to me until it showed up on my bill that the $22 per night for WiFi and other hotel amenities is not a choice but an automatic add-on.Other than those minor annoyances, my stay was fine.

I found this hotel through Kayak, double checked it through Trip Advisor, and was completely satisfied with it. The lobby is clean and efficient, the rooms are surprisingly large for NYC, and the first-floor bar has just enough cool factor to be a great respite after a long day in the city. Within walking distance to Times Square, but just far enough away to stay out of the hubbub. Also walking distance to the south end of Central Park and Rockefeller Center. Easy access to CitiBike stations throughout the neighborhood.

Conveniently located few minutes walk from central park. The facility is pretty new, rooms are large compared to most New York City hotels and prices are very reasonable. Rooms are fully featured with ironing capabilities, iPhone charges, alarm clocks, radio etc. The lobby is constantly busy but it is well staffed. Stay was great.

This is our first stay at Park Central Hotel. We will be back! The check-in staff are friendly, efficient and welcoming. We are still in our room and it's size is generous for a New York hotel. The bathroom is an equally nice size with good water pressure in shower and plenty of countertop space which is important for women and their toiletries! Drawbacks: if you have a scent allergy or sensitivity, the hotel's public spaces (particularly the lobby) are filled with an air freshener. You can taste it in your mouth and it gave me a headache in the few minutes we stood there. I do not generally have a sensitivity so this will help you understand how overpowering the scent is. The cleaning staff is incredibly noisy. A maid is cleaning the room next door and conducting a conversation with the man vacuuming the hallway. In order to be heard, both parties are hollering. Definite positives: a short walk to the Theatre district, equally short walk to Central Park and the best part of all, half a block to the famous Carnegie Deli. Carnegie's matzo ball soup is perfect on a cold New York day or if you are ever feeling a bit under the weather. All in all, I would not hesitate to stay at Park Central again and will be recommending it to others. The rooms are decorated with a clean, modern look that does not tip into a cold, minimalist feel. No coffee pot in the room but plenty of fabulous New York coffee to be found out the front door.

When in NYC this is the place to stay. It's located a couple of blocks from Central Park, The Time Warner Center and the subway it's right at the corner. Times Square it's a few mins walking or 1 stop on the train. The rooms are huge for NYC standards, with storage closet, spacious bathroom, updated fixtures and even a desk. The beds are very comfortable and you can rest well, away from all the chaos outside. The staff is very attentive and always happy to help. We have stayed here 3 times already and will continue to do so every time we visit NYC.

I found the receptionist on arrival to be rude and condescending, however on return a few hours later the new staff were most helpful. Our room was great ,the view of the airconditioning and brick walls was depressing though. Only a few blocks up from times square and one away from central park , so a fab position. priced at over $500.00 for one night during the week was unwarranted.

It was a a great location, breakfast very good for the price which is charged, near all theathers, staff very helpful, but they charge three dollars for each package that is delivered at the hotel and five dollars for each bag for storage.

Good location - just a few blocks north of Times Square. The rooms are well-maintained and reasonably spacious, though no tea/coffee facilities and no mini-bar. Staff were generally helpful, though they did help themselves to a gratuity when putting the breakfast on my room bill - my fault for forgetting to leave a tip I guess. The buffet breakfast itself was average - no cereal (just porridge or oatmeal as they call it), and it was fairly expensive. I didn't eat in the restaurant after that - it looked to be empty most nights anyway.All in all, nothing to complain about, but I just found it to be a bit of a large, characterless hotel.

Couldn't find a better location, everything within walking distance. Best rates in the city, especially for longer stays. The bar could use some better beers, but that's the only complaint. The all new bar area is very sleek and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Concierge service was also very good getting show information.

If you want great location, nice people, service and NEW rooms, this is the place to come to. After the renewal it is our place to come to when we get to the big apple.It also has a very cool bar and it is right beside broadway theaters, restaurants and of course Central Park.We have already booked our next stay here in a couple of months :)

This was actually our third visit to this hotel. We don't think we would stay anywhere else when we visit New York City. We stayed at a Premier King and the room is just beautiful and huge specially for NY standards where hotel rooms tend to be very tiny. The staff is great and very attentive. The hotel is centrally located and for the size of the hotel and activity in the area it is relatively quiet. Stay on the side overlooking Times Square :)

Park Central is great location for tourists in Manhattan. It is central and walkable to many of the Big Apple attractions. This is our second stay at the hotel and with the renovations in the last year we really enjoyed our stay again.The room size was good, the bathroom was a bit small but it is an older hotel design. The beds were so comfortable after a long day of walking and exploring.I agree it would be nice to have a coffee machine and small bar fridge to have a cool drink as you relax in your room,but the idea in New York is to explore and get you out into the fun!

Net is I wouldn't stay here again. We booked on booking.com and were immediately bombarded with email to upgrade our double standard to a queen standard, which we finally did. Wasn't worth it at all. First when we checked in, the tub wasn't clean and had hair in it. There was a hole (literally) in the base board. There is no place to hang a towel (the rack INSIDE the shower makes no sense). The shower curtain (yes, $500 a night and you get a shower curtain) is too short for the tub, so water went everywhere. The second night we never even received a bath mat. There is no makeup mirror and when I asked for one from the front desk, the agent said no one has ever asked for one before and he didn't know what that was (seriously?). Also the a/c needed calibration (and is quite loud). So I documented all of this the first night and gave this list to the front desk. Never got a response that they even acknowledged the list. Yes, it's in a great location but next time I'll book the Parker Meridian down the street like I normally do. Live and learn.

I had a chance to live in Park Central, New York for a week in first half of August. This was after a week at Hotel Willard in Washington, immediately before that. This makes the comparison between two hotels natural.The biggest plus point of Park Central hotel is its location. As it is on 7th Avenue, it is so close to the biggest attractions in the city. Walk hundred meters to your left and you are in Central Park, the best place in the city. Go about half a kilometer to your right and you are at Times Square. Can one believe these two fabulous places being so close to it..Not only that, I along with my friends could walk to Grand Central Railway station, Empire State building, United Nations building, 5th Avenue, Rockfeller Cener and all other locations, including Broadway. One could never imagine one can be so close to all most attractive locations in city like New York.Due to its locational advantage, I could visit Central Park, almost daily, any time I wanted, in the morning, afternoon, late evening, It was just a pleasant thing.Regarding food and service the hotel is good. It had excellent Indian breakfast for us as we were a group of 80 persons staying there and I appreciate the efforts made by them to make us feel at home, in this regard.The hotel lacked a bit in courtesy and being helpful in a few small things.

Excellent position for this clean and comfortable hotel. Room was a good size with a very comfy bed, although could have done with a coffee machine and the elevators are a little slow. The bar area is very nice with good music.

This hotel was very nice and in an excellent location. Staff was very nice and helpful. The price was great for NYC and for such a prime location. I rated the room average because it was a bit small as was the bathroom but it was clean and nicely decorated with comfortable bedding so for the one night we stayed it was fine. I was pleased overall and would stay here again when visiting NYC.

My daughter and I stayed here Labor Day weekend. Overall we had a great experience. The room was lovely and large for NY. Very clean. The beds were comfortable. I am reluctant to give it 5 stars for a couple of reasons. We booked our accommodations using "miles" through a credit card reward program. We were unaware of a 20.00 per day "resort" fee that was additional until after we had booked the trip. Since this was an airfare/hotel combo there was no way to cancel the hotel. Since the "cost" of the hotel portion was using a fair number of points I really did not understand the additional charge. Why not just state this charge up front in the cost of the daily room charge. Is there a tax reason for doing this? When I mentioned this at check-in she did "upgrade" us to 2 queen beds from a king bed, which in our case was an upgrade. However if I had been traveling with my fiancee that really would not have been a solution. She stated that it covered internet service, use of the gym, etc. I have to say that I am surprised that the more expensive hotels are the ones still charging for use of WIFI. I can go to most Holiday Inns, Hampton Inns and get free WIFI. A few minor other issues. When I requested more body wash because the one was nearly empty in our room they sent up several, as if to be a bit sarcastic about request. When I informed them the toilet paper holder was broken they sent more toilet paper, but did not fix the holder. And one last thing, I would not recommend paying cash at the small cafe/gift/sundry shop in the lobby. I bought a coffee and give her 20.00 for a 2.65 coffee whereupon she gave me change back for a 10.00. I said I gave her a 20, and she said no I didn't. Because she did not keep the bill out (as a good cashier should) there really was no way to dispute except to wait for the drawer count at the end of the shift by which time she could pocket the extra 10 anyway. I informed the front desk, but no one did anything. The best way to combat this type of thing is to pay by credit card. Other than those minor things we found the hotel very nice. Centrally located to Times Square and Central Park. New York is a great walking town. Taxis are easy access and there is a flat rate to JFK.

From my first stay at the Park Central Hotel about seven years ago until this past month, the hotel has gone through many positive changes and renovations. Great service, warm hospitality, comfortable rooms and a great location makes the Park Central a great place to stay while visiting Manhattan. Sherri from LA

When Visiting New York, I wanted a hotel that not only is in a great location (few blocks south of Central Park and few blocks north of Time Square), but also a place I could come back to and simply relax after exploring the city that never sleeps. Park Central Hotel was that place... From their modern appeal to their fun atmospheric lounge. The room I had was quite from the hustle and bustle of New Yorkers and had the most comfortable beds a hotel could offer. The staff was brilliant, accommodating and greeted you with a smile and "hello" every time. I would highly recommend this hotel and would absolutely stay there again.

My family was in town for my mothers 70th birthday and we stayed at the Park Central for 4 nights. First, the location is unbeatable if you want to be near areas such as Times Square and Central Park, but just far enough away so that you don't feel crazed from all the activity. The hotel lobby is beautiful and our check in was very efficient. The room was a double and for New York standards, was quite large. If you've ever stayed in some of the New York City boutique hotels, you'll know what I mean by small! Thankfully, these rooms were spacious with great views of the city skyline. While we only dined in the restaurant one time, it was quite good. And the coffee bar in the lobby was very convenient for our morning coffee and pastries. The hotel exceeded our expectations and we would definitely stay there again.

We booked on Hotel Tonight app. The hotel was located a couple blocks south of Central Park and north of Times Square. The room was nicely decorated. The TV was huge and seemed like it was high definition. The bath products were great. I had not issues with the hotel. The bed was comfortable. Only problem was no view, the the rest made up for it. Would definitely stay again.

The location is central and calm. BUT THE SERVICE IS BAD. I sent an email with three question beforehand. They didn't reply for a week. I resent it and they finally answer to ONLY one question without saying'Mr. or Ms.' Then we went there and they clean the room but they didn't change our sheets for 4 nights and we've never asked for that. Moreover, THE PRICE IF THE HOTEL TAXI WAS CRAZY. The staff at a luggage store said it cost 55 USD include everything such as tip to JFK. And it COST 82USD with tip. According to the driver 55USD is only when you pay by CASH and if you re paying by credit card, that's 82. Why he didn't explain well though most ppl pay those huge account by credit card. THIS HOTEL CAN CHEAT ON YOU.

The hotel was clean and always smelled great when you walked in the front door. Small double but I guess that's the norm. Air wasn't working but engineering came up and fixed it right away. The location was great! Only a few blocks from Central Park and you could see Times Square from the front of the hotel. Loved it.

Wish there were 1/2 scores as I would rate this 3.5. Loved the location, employees very friendly, room was clean but was quite worn out looking due to paint chipping off baseboards and bathroom shelves. What was disappointing were the "extra" touches that make you feel pampered and special. No water glasses to use when brushing your teeth, no individual shampoos/conditioners/body wash, no coffee pot, no small refrigerator, although we were brought one quickly when requested for prescription meds that needed to be at a cool temp. The very first day when we notified someone of the ice machine on our floor not working we would told it would be fixed shortly and to try the next floor. 2 floors later, those ice machines were not working!!! Everyday for 6 days we could not find a working ice machine!! Some elevators were out of service. I would stay again for a night or two, not for a long term visit.

Great location, very clean, and the service was excellent all around. We were only in town for one night, but wish I had booked for longer. Front desk staff were very accommodating and extremely pleasant. We will definitely be back. Thanks for an enjoyable weekend.

To start off we had to go inside the facility to get a valet, it took around 10 minutes to get one.Long lines to get checked in with lots of staff lurking around.The rooms were pretty small for the price, and the carpets are disgusting, look at the corners they don't do a good job for what they charge for the rooms.No coffee makers or a mini fridge in the rooms.To be at NY and having the non-stop high speed pace going they don't even have a check out on the tv to speed things out, you most have to get in line AGAIN to check out and get your car.I'm going back in November but, definitely I will find a better place to stay.

The Park Central Hotel is in an excellent location, a 5 minute walk to Central Park, across the street from Carnegie Hall, a 10 minute walk to TImes Square and Broadway Theatres. It is close to many sights and restaurants, but enough removed from the main hustle and bustle of the Times Square area. The room we stayed in had virtually no view (walls in every direction), a very small shower, and no in room coffee maker or fridge. As we were in New York City, all we needed the room for was sleeping and in this respect it was very comfortable and quiet. I would recommend the Park Central Hotel primarily for its location, relative affordability and if your needs are the same as ours.

Emailed a question to hotel in advance ( could not get answer from Adam in reservations) and got a prompt and helpful email reply from Mr. Quimby. Upon arrival, first thing I noticed was not only a lovely but the best smelling lobby in all my travels. Tea tree and ginger? Jett was friendly and professional and Dennis helped with our bags politely and efficiently. A little service issue in lounge bar but Winston from restaurant helped us straight away. This location is amazing- Central Park, Carnagie Hall, Times Square and Carnagie Deli all very closeby. Rooms very comfortable. We stayed 4 nights. 3 in a deluxe double queen and 1 in a deluxe king. Clean, good AC and bathroom. This hotel has noticeable maintenance upkeep issues which probably would not be noticeable except everything else is so nice, the crooked door/wall fixtures stand out in contrast. Slow elevators. Lobby restrooms had line the 2 times I tried to use it- a little disconcerting that I waited behind the Gray Line bus guy who was hawking out front on the sidewalk and the UPS guy as they weren't paying guests but when you've got to go.... Very good food in restaurant although terrific eateries surround this hotel. No room service and no complementary hotel transportation ( it is NYC though.) the staff and location make this a first- rate place to stay.

So to start the room was nice and clean. The location is wonderful. This hotel would get a 5 star review for me but for two large issues.The two big complaints I have are that the listing said a queen sized bed and gave me a full and that there was a fee that was mandatory which while it gave me internet access was not advertised clearly. I will explain the bed more first. The queen bed they offer is actually a full size bed in reality. I asked them to see the double and sure enough it was smaller but it was a large twin. Apparently I was the first person this year to notice and complain. They handled it gracefully but ultimately I felt like I was living in a strange world where we both agreed the bed was smaller than advertised but nothing could or would ever be admitted to that effect. If you stay here get the queen-particularly if you have a family with you.The second complaint I had was the mandatory, undisclosed fee. The fee should really get posted to the booking sites because it really can't be avoided. I would have still stayed here but I felt like I was deceived which is the frustrating part. The Internet access was nice and we made good use of it in the end but I would have preferred to know about it ahead of time.Most of this could be fixed by just correcting the data on the sites the hotel can be booked on.

The hotel is located on 7th avenue near times square and central park. Basically right next to Carnegie hall as well. There are plenty of bus stops and subway stations right outside so getting around is not an issue at all.I enjoyed the modern style of the rooms and bathroom. The beds were comfortable and I enjoyed the look of the lobby as well as breakfast/dining area. Very sleek and elegant. The staff is friendly as well so no complaints.

Lovely hotel , easy checking and checkout , clean rooms , great central location to walk to Central Park and time square or get on a train , close to all shops and restaurants . The only thing I wasn't happy with is I would have loved to be able to make a cup of tea or coffee in the room .

This hotel doesn't have any advantages despite its location and even the neighborhood is too noisy that you can't sleep at night. The staff literally treat you like animals. Breakfast is a total rip off. The rooms are small and dirty. Avoid this hotel if you can!!!

Very nice hotel, location excellent both for shopping, Central Park and Times Square.No coffee facilities in room, I was put on the wait list for a coffee machine, but after 4 days I still didn't get one. Staff helpful and apologetic re the coffee machine

I have traveled quite a bit around the world and never experiences hospitality as wonderful as what i received at Park Central, NY. From the moment I arrived I was greeted by a wonderfully energetic and engaged Guest Engagement Director, named Quimby. I could tell he truly cared about the guest experience and wanted to ensure everyone felt at home. His personality and demeanor was infectious and resonated through the entire staff. I know myself, after a long day of draining meeting, his attitude lifted my spirits immediately! And on top of all that the atmosphere was beautiful and the rooms were perfectly maintained and very clean. kudos to the staff and I will definitely be back!

got a great deal to stay here on priceline saying it was their top tier hotel. at the time the hotel was undergoing renovations. check-in was so slow. they put us in an unrenovated floor. I immediately called priceline and said we'll stay somewhere else. the hotel called and upgraded our room to a renovated floor (same room type). this was better but the experience wasnt great.

Despite being charged $20 /day facility fees, in-room WiFi was extremely unstable and signal poor. Our devices were unable to connect in several instances and most of the time, we had to be in common areas such as the hotel lobby and floor lobby to access the internet. We had raised the issue with front desk but no remedy was offered. (NB. we were misled by the ad in Expedia that the hotel provide free wi-fi and was only advised of the mandatory facility fees after booking was made) When we first entered the room, only one of the beds was made, the other had its pillows stacked on the made bed, the iron was missing and coffee-maker was not provided. The shower was installed incorrectly. Hot water came out when the tap said cold, and cold when the tap said hot. There was always long line for the elevator. On the day of our departure, it had taken us ~ 20 minutes to be able to get into the elevators with our luggages.

We stayed at the Park Central hotel with our family of 4 including 2 kids, 16 and 14. Although the rooms were small we requested 2 queen beds and slept comfortably. The room was clean and well decorated. Park Central is a well priced 4+ star hotel centrally located and definitely worth consideration. The only negatives, the elevators are slow and there seems to always be a line, and the gym equipment is lacking somewhat.

We stayed here in august and think it is way over priced. The hotel is small but it feels like a train station. Packed with people and lines to use the single set of elevators. Bell staff is lazy and took a while to come get our stuff. The guy stood next to me waiting for a tip as if i owe him somthing. On our way out it took 30 minutes to get our stuff down and we had to pay taxi extra. The room is small but clean. Very over priced. If you are about to get such shittu service you better off pay less

This is an old NY landmark hotel that has changed hands a number of times and has been recently renovated. I found the staff pleasant and efficient, but the elevators leave a lot to be desired. At certain times there were long lines both in the lobby and on the room floors. Also noted the same at the front desk as there weren't sufficient staff to handle check ins. I was very pleased with my deluxe king room which was very clean and well appointed, and had a very comfortable bed.

My husband and I were very excited to stay at the Park Central for our anniversary weekend, and chose it for its proximity to Carnegie Hall, where we were planning to see a concert. Unfortunately, Park Central disappointed in almost every possible way. We arrived in New York around 5 pm on a Saturday, and it was over an HOUR wait in line to check in. (This is no exaggeration. People were buying sandwiches from the cafe next door and eating them in the line for checkout so they wouldn't miss their theater tickets.)Turns out that they had overbooked that weekend, and given our reservation to someone else. Instead of the upgraded non-smoking KIng room we had confirmed, we had to take a smoking room with one full-size bed. We were told this was all they had left. I asked if there would be a price adjustment to reflect the change, and they said no. The front desk manager did offer us a choice between free drink vouchers or complimentary breakfasts for the duration of our stay. We opted for the breakfasts--which would have been a reasonable compensation, except that when we got to the room and looked at the vouchers we had been given, they were all for drinks. (And these so-called free drink vouchers? In order to get the "free" drinks, you were required to purchase an entree in the hotel restaurant.)This high-rise hotel only had two elevators--so there was a line and a minimum 20 minute wait EVERY time we went in and out. Not only was the bed tiny, but the room itself was miniscule. The lamp on the left side of the bed was broken, and the desk lamp didn't work. So--smelly, tiny, and only one working lamp. No coffee maker, only one towel, and no ice in the ice machine on our floor (on any of the three nights we stayed.) All this from a "luxury" hotel. Oh, and they charge you an additional fee on top of your room rate to cover wifi and other amenities. And no, the additional fee is not optional.We waited for a couple of hours for the line at checkout to clear out, then stopped by the front desk again to try to resolve the we-were-promised-breakfast-vouchers-but-didn't-get-them problem, as well as to voice our concern again over the substandard room for which we were being charged upgraded rates. The desk clerk apologized for the vouchers, but only gave us one day's worth of breakfast vouchers instead of the three we were promised. She said that the manager would have to authorize the rest, but he wasn't available and we would have to come back. As it was close to midnight already, we said we'd come back the next morning.We asked again the next day, and again was told he wasn't available. We also asked if we could switch to better rooms, and the desk clerk said that this would be possible later, but that we would have to come back and clear it with the front desk manager. (We went out for the day, and when we got back in the late afternoon, there was another mile-long line at the front desk for check in. The same process repeated the next day. We never did get to speak to the manager.)After we got back from our trip, I wrote to the hotel management to tell them about all this and ask again for a partial refund on the room rate. After TWO WEEKS, I got a response thanking me for "pointing out the ways they could improve their service" and to try to regain our good opinion, Park Central offered me a "special reduced rate of 30% off their regular prices" for my next stay. Except I had also been getting spam from Park Central offering a 30% discount for online booking. Wow, Park Central--how great to offer your existing online discount as recompense for a job badly done!!Yes, the location is great--they are directly across the street from Carnegie Hall, and only a few blocks from Central Park in one direction and Times Square in the other...but there are other hotels in the immediate vicinity that actually know how to deliver a nice stay. Do yourselves a favor and go to one of these instead.

The location of the hotel is really great, but unfortunately that's the only thing that's great about this place. Check-in takes a long time. The room is noisy and small, the view is terrible and the water pressure reminds me of hotels in third-world countries. The room doesn't have a fridge or a coffee maker. The food at the bar is overpriced.

My wife, three kids and I stayed for a week in August 2014. Great location on 7th Avenue, the staff are friendly and the rooms are clean. We had one problem though with the A/C in our room which did not work on most days. Although maintenance came and got the A/C running again at least 4 times it stopped working within a few hours which was most inconvenient when arriving back at the hotel at 10pm at night to find the A/C down again. This problem made most of our nights not very comfortable as we had to sleep with the windows open.

Hotel was in a great location for sight seeing and Uptown Manhattan shopping Hotel upgraded our room due to our anniversary which was a very pleasant surprise ! We found the staff very helpful and hotel in general very nice. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Great ! Great ! Great !

We stayed there 2 nights in May and the location is excellent. They don't have room service which was kind of surprising but in the US it seems that room service has become a luxury that only the very rich can afford although it is a necessity when someone has an accident or becomes sick during their stay. Anyway they do have a good minimarket for food were you can buy the breakfast and take it to your room. As one of us had an accident and could not walk they immediatly gave us a late check-out. The decor is very modern and a little too impersonal.

We started and ended our 3week travel at this hotel. Very well located with easy access to all the mayor tourist areas in Manhatten. Hotel gets very busy, thus sometimes a bit of a wait at the lifts and check in. Friendly helpful staff. Rooms are small but adequate. The food at the bar is delicious and well priced. For a short break to NY I will recommend this hotel!!

Since you probably read all the reviews I want to address some of the concerns that were raised. First our customer service was above average. We arrived at 10PM and the front desk receptionist was pleasant and helpful. During our stay some family members stopped by for a glass of wine. The room had only 2 glasses so I called for 2 more and they arrived within 10 minutes. A few minutes later Housekeeping called to make sure we got the glasses. Second, the room was standard size, perhaps about a foot narrower than most US standard rooms. It was up-to-date with a large flat screen HD TV and modern bathroom amenities. Our king-size room looked out on to 55th Street. Third, while there were several housekeeping carts in the hall, they were covered and not in the way. Fourth, we prepaid our hotel room as part of the Manhattan Club promotion and were not charged any extra fees. Finally, we were on the 8th floor which is serviced by 2 small elevators (which service floors 3-9). At certain rush times, you might need to wait for a second or third elevator to arrive (or take the up elevator to insure space going down), but if you allow a few extra minutes, you will not be late.

I highly recommend staying at the Park Central hotel! Tastefully appointed and spacious rooms! I travel at least once a month to NYC and have stayed at numerous hotels. This is truly a solid 4-star hotel with 5-star service. It is very unusual to find a hotel in NYC that is well priced and centrally located. This hotel is in the perfect location. Only a few blocks from Times Square and Central Park and literally a block away from the subway. Very easy access to all midtown attractions without all the noise and chaos of staying in the middle of Times Square. The room I stayed in was very clean and spacious (a rare find in NYC). I never expected the hotel to look like the websites pictures but it is identical. If anything, the pictures don't do the hotel justice. What truly stood out was the friendliness and hospitality of the entire staff! I must say the guest relations manager, Elizabeth Cacovic was beyond helpful! She was extremely welcoming and made my stay! I have stayed in some of NY's top hotels and have never been as well received as I was at the Park Central hotel. I will stay at this hotel from now on without a doubt! A clean, spacious, centrally located and well-priced hotel in NYC!

Booked on the mobile site for a king room for two adults and a child. When we asked for the roll away bed they told us we hadn't ordered it ... and that it was our fault for not entering the child's age. The site hadn't asked for it (we checked again by doing a dummy booking - nope, it doesn't ask). Anyway, they then had no king rooms, but they did find us a queen accessible room and ordered a roll away ... so fair enough they sorted the problem. Nice enough room, for a good price, but we had expected a king.But the roll away didn't come. We had to ask for it three times before it actually arrived, and that involved queuing for ages at the front desk since they didn't have nearly enough staff ... Long queues for the lifts too. Clearly not enough lifts for a hotel that size. Long queues for the left luggage. Long queues to hand the keys in despite express checkout. (Why not have a key bin if you have express checkout?)Bonus: car service to JFK, slightly cheaper than a taxi and much nicer.Watch out for that facility fee though - given it's compulsory I don't know why it's not in the base room price ...All that said, a good hotel in a good location in New York, at a decent price. Would stay again, but be better prepared for delays.

I've stayed here many times. Great for runners as you're 2 blocks from Central Park and pretty close to Nike World as well as NY Runners at Columbus circle. On this visit I came early due to flight changes. They were gracious enough to provide me a room early in the morning. Service was excellent.

Location is great, access to everything. Bell men are great and full of information. Front desk girls really do not want to be there, at least the bell men gave a good first impression as the ladies at check in did not. Rooms have min. amenities, when staying with more than 2 people you must ask for additional towels and cups. Mini fridges are offered free of charge if you request upon check in. Housekeeping keep the rooms clean. There is a little place in lobby for snacks. Downfall is that the rooms are extremely small. We expected small, but you can't even swirl around in the desk chair due to hitting the bed. Also, be careful of the view you have as looking at the wall is very closterfobic. The tv is too big for the size of room. There is no air conditioning in the hallways or elevator. Also, elevator is VERY small, max 8 people can fit, and there are only 2. There are many deli's close by for good food, Central Park, broadway, time square, and subway. If size of room doesn't matter, and believe me it is SMALL, then the location of this hotel is good. Also, rooms are not noise proof, can hear all hallway noise. We had no road noise as we were against a wall, don't them fool you, they call it a court yard. It is not, there is nothing green below. Other issue was that our toilet paper was not replenished when house keeping came in the morning. I called to request more in the evening as by this time of course with 4 people in the room for 2 days, it is out. When none arrived 30 min later I called again, and was asked if I could wait another 15 min...for toilet paper. By this time the kids want to sleep, so I had to schedule my ' delivery' for morning. So as of now, we have still not received any. Hoping the Kleenex will due for now. Overall for a 4 star hotel, I was disappointed. You should not have to request sufficient amenities from a 4 star hotel, and rooms should have room to move. I would rate it as 3 star max.

My colleague and I were very well received by Ms. Elizabeth Cacovic, Guest Relations Manager, when we checked in at the hotel. She was very welcoming, helpful, informative and provided the attention to make us feel we were special guests. She accommodated our room requests, checked several times to make sure the rooms were to our satisfaction and was always ready to do more. During our 2 day stay, she used our names when addressing us, recognized us even when we were just walking through the lobby and made us feel special. I am grateful to Ms. Cacovic for her welcome and special attention, which made our hotel experience exceptional.

I use this hotel for business often and pre pay everything. Was surprised this morning to get a final bill for $44....a mandatory "facility fee" whether you use anything or not....Seriously, just bundle it into the price if I have to pay it anyway....The Facilities Fee of $20 plus tax per room per night provides guests with the following amenities:• Wireless (WIFI) High Speed Internet Access through the hotel's guest rooms and public spaces for up to 5 devices• Unlimited Local and Domestic Long Distance calls • Luggage storage upon arrival and/or departure up until 9:00 PM.• Unlimited use of the 24-hour state-of-the-art Fitness Center• An alcoholic (house wine or signature cocktail) or non-alcoholic with the purchase of an entrée Cheapskates...it's just a way to add money to my bill..

What a wonderful place, so central to the shops, central oars and the underground. Helpful staff and very clean and spacious room. Starbucks is just next door and so near to 5th avenue. Beautiful entrance.

I stayed at this hotel with my husband and parents who were experiencing NYC for the first time. We really enjoyed Park Central. The lobby is spacious and elegant. We found the staff at the front desk to be efficient and helpful. There is a little market with coffee, tea and snacks available which is quite convenient. Valet parking was easy. The room was clean and big for New York with large comfy beds. The bathroom had lots of moving around space. There is an easy to use safe in the room. We were on the fifteenth floor and there was no street noise at all. My husband enjoyed the modern workout room.The housekeeping staff were very friendly. The hotel is located very close to Central Park which made it nice in the evening to go for a stroll in the park and then head back to the hotel. The subway stops are just a few steps from the hotel. There are lots of cafés and delis just out the front door. My one minor complaint is the wait for the elevators in the morning. They were fine the rest of the day. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who likes to be in the middle of the action and then retreat to their room for a comfortable rest.

It was a girlfriend weekend in NYC so we stayed 4 in the room.We booked a room with 2 queens and were hoping to get a cot because the website says cots are available upon request. However we were informed at check in time that a room with 2 queens cannot accommodate a cot. We asked for a room with 2 doubles instead and we were told that it does not accommodate a cot either. After insisting, the receptionist called housekeeping, who said that they will bring up a cot. The cot fit awkwardly in the room but it fit without being a fire hazard. Apparently cots are only meant for rooms with one king bed, which is not mentioned anywhere on the website. Through this whole process the receptionist was very rude. The room was small, there was nothing spectacular about it, but it was clean. Otherwise the walls are thin, the elevators are very small, there is no refrigerator in the room, and the iron had something caked on it so I couldn't use it. There is also an extra 20$ a day, facilities fee, that they charge and for it you get free Wi-Fi and luggage storage before check in and after check-out. I guess the only good thing is the location as it is very close to Central Park, Times Square and Broadway. Because we were 4 it didn't come out terribly expensive, but if I were to go as a couple I think I will prefer to stay further away and just take the metro.

Hotel is pretty nice looking and the rooms are pretty clean, but can´t say the same about the staff. People at the front desk aren´t really friendly, and they don´t seem to be very happy to be there. I booked a king room, and when I got there, the lady told me they didn´t have any king rooms available, and offered me a double queen room. I said I didn´t want a double queen room, so the lady went to the back, and came back in about five minutes, telling me she found a king room. (WTH??) after that, she was pretty rude. Besides the check-in, everything went pretty smooth. the pictures DO fool you, so be careful with which room you book. Location is excellent!!! Cleaning people are nice.

The photos online don't do this hotel justice... Very nice curb appeal, nice lobby, waited 10 minutes to check in, only one person on duty (arrived at 8:45). Actual check in took less than 10 minutes.. I had prepaid my stay.. Credit card required, agent stated they put a $50. Authorization on card. $20 per night fee.. For gym, wifi. Etc... Got to my room and was wowed by the clean, fresh smelling and tasteful decoration.. Very, very nice...

When choosing this hotel, you're choosing it for the location, which is awesome. It's about 2 blocks from Central Park and is also walking distance to the Theatre District. Both of these were important to me for the purposes of this trip. The hotel is nice enough, but not super upscale. For instance, no room service (my fault; I should have checked), tiny rooms and bathrooms (typical NYC and not super important), but when I called for more towels and pillows, I was told they'd arrive and they never did. Also, in the daylight the next morning, we noticed stains on the sheets. Ew! The lobby cafe was nice and a good place to get coffee, etc... on the run. They also store bags after check out so that we didnt' need to carry them around. It was fine, especially for the price, which was affordable in NYC. I may stay there again someday.

I begin by saying I knew I was not staying in a five star hotel. The walls were thin, the elevator small and the overall room lacking a bit.... no refrigerator. The rest was exactly what I needed. On this visit I wanted to jog central park.... and couldn't ask to be closer. The lobby bar was a great place to start the evening and Melvin the lead tender was awesome. He had my wife mesmerized by stories and city information for an hour or so. All the staff was as helpful as you could ask. The location, besides the park, was great as well. My kids could see time square from the front door. My wife and I walked to Hell's kitchen for cocktails and several subway stations were close by. I would certainly recommend it to those who are not expecting the Ritz and need something close to the action..... BTW even though we were on the seventh floor me and my boys used the stairs often because the elevator was REALLY small.

We selected the Park Central because they assured us os a room large enough to accommodate a rollaway for our son, and they weren't kidding. The room -- obviously designed for a guest with a disability, from the roll-in shower -- was vast by NYC standards, and reasonable. A few issues that could be addressed -- inadequate lighting, no refrigerator, roll-away not made up until we requested housekeeping to do so -- but overall, a comfortable stay in a good location, near theaters, Central Park, key subway lines. Be sure to check for AAA/AARP discounts (an idea raised by the booking desk, thanks!).

We like this hotel because of its location and reasonable price (for NYC standards). The front desk staff is always super helpful and attentive. Only issue for me has been the longish time it takes to check in - they always say they're short-staffed, but it happened to me several times in the last 6 months.

I stay exclusively at the Park Central when in NYC (5-10 nights per year) and have other reviews on Trip Advisor but wanted to single out this trip to praise the efficient desk staff. I was arriving in NYC after a grueling 17 hour flight - at 7 am! I notified the hotel in advance asking for an early check in if at all possible - knowing the Park Central is very busy and this is often challenging. I was hoping maybe they could get me in mid-day. When I arrived I was greeted by Vitto who had a room immediately ready for me. What a gift! I was able to have a great rest and enjoy an evening out with friends before beginning my business trip. As always, the room was well equipped, comfortable and the location ideal. Thanks!

This hotel was in the best location it was very near central park and times square. The hotel decor was very modern and suited it very well. The staff were also very nice. However the elevator that we were told to take was very slow at times especially during the busy hours where there were long queues of people waiting. It seemed as if only one elevator was working out of the eight that were on our floor. The room that we stayed in was very nice it was decorated very well and the bathroom was very nice. Overall it was a very good stay.

Get to the point Hotel close to Time square , clean and great service I was welcomed immediately and checked in quickly The lobby is clean and the staff is friendly Tons of restaurants and Bars ooh wait a minute , it is in the middle of everythingwill stay there again

This Hotel is great for a quick getaway with the girls! My friend and I took our teenage daughters, they loved the modern decor! The location was perfect for sighseeing and shopping. The room was a bit small - but that is the room that we paid for :) it was clean - and modern - with newer decor. Concierge was VERY accomodating! We recomend this hotel for your stay.

We chose the hotel because of its great location and that is certainly the case. It's a big hotel, relatively recently refurbished, and is very busy. Unfortunately it doesn't have the staff or the resources to deal with the number of guests. There are frequent lines for the elevators (and you are often forced to wait for the second or third elevator to stop as they are so full). Check in is at 4 but we could not check in until later because the room wasn't ready. The check in staff were abrupt, bordering on rude. You get the feeling that the hotel management are trying to squeeze the last ounce of profit out of the place with the minimum investment in people needed to run the place or in resources. Rooms are pretty small, even by NYC standards. Ultimately disappointing and not recommended.

well i was not home alone, great hotel with great rooms .great everything, excellent service,great linen, nice view, very convenient to time square and the business district, they do not try to cut corners

Couldn't have asked for a better experience in the Big Apple. Location was perfect, easy access to subways, and walking distance to Central Park, Times Square and great shopping. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Rooms were clean and comfortable.Can't wait to come back in 6 months and do the NY Experience again!

Comfortable and extremely well positioned in midtown manhattan. Very good quality/price ratio. The rooms are confortable, clean and very cozy, giving a feeling of warmth and relaxation. Close to Times Square, the Broadway, Central Park and many other NY attractions.

First I want to thank Nancy V., the Manager at the front desk, who was very kind and quickly solved a minor issue with our accomodations request. She does a wonderful job, and her attentiveness and friendly smile makes all the difference when you arrive after a very long flight, exhausted, frazzled and with three cranky kids!The hotel lobby was very luminous, modern, and very clean. I suppose it was high tourist season because there was always a lot of people and the front desk was quite busy, but the staff was still very helpful at all times.The room was very nice, the beds very comfortable, the bathroom looked updated and spotless. There was one minor thing that made the experience not so perfect: our room on the fourth floor was right above a huge air conditioner unit that made quite a noise, which I noticed most at night. I suppose in higher rooms that wouldn´t be such an issue. We didn´t use the restaurant, but the coffee shop was nice to have right there at the lobby.The 20 dollar daily fee was something I didn´t make a big deal of, since we did use the fitness facility, which was great. The location is awesome, especially for tourists. Overall, a great experience.

Excellent location near Times Square but also away from all the hassle and bushel- right near Central Park and awesome service. The best kid friendly hotel we had fun.We will always book park central.

This was the first time my husband and I visited NY. We did not know which neighbourhood we are gonna fall in love with. So we thought the location of this hotel would be central. Of course this hotel is very close to Central Park and other attractions in midtown. But after exploring more in Manhattan, we realized we would have preferred to have our hotel more south. So if you want to be in that part of the city, this location is very good.Since we stayed for 9 nights, they upgraded our room. Bed was super comfortable and it felt new and fresh. There was not that much space in the room for opening our luggages. And also a small closet. We felt the room was a little dark. No good lighting.Breakfat was not included and we did not have any food at hotel's restaurant. We read other's review about the elevator and how busy it can get. But it was not a huge problem.Our room had a window to the street. And it could get noisy.

As a last minute hotel this was super expensive but a lost passport and a search at 1100pm on a Sunday night forced me to stay here.I wouldn't pay this for a room usually but had no choice.......That said despite the expense, it was a very nice hotel, the staff were super helpful (the young lady on reception on the night in question was great) the room was comfortable, dark and the air conditioning wasn't super noisy. It's location in NYC is a good one too.If staying on purpose and booking in advance I'd say this was a great choice to explore NYC from.

This hotel has a great location. It's walking distance to the subway station, Central Park, dining areas and broadway shows . You can just throw your things in your room and start your New York adventure. Rooms were average in size and clean. Good service.

We stayed here for 4 nights in July and we found the Hotel to be centrally located , two Minutes walk to central park and 10 Minute stroll to Time Square , The Hotel is bright ,airy and modern very clean, there is a good coffee shop in the Foyer which is very handy, especially after a long day sightseeing, and the staff are pleasantCheck into the park central was a bit slow but the staff were good and friendly beware of the $20 per night surcharge which I mentioned to the staff that I had seen mentioned on TripAdvisor , they said it covered * wifi ( free in most hotels or at least you have the option of paying for it if you need it )*Local free calls ( having traveled from Ireland there were not many local calls I needed to make in New York ).*ability to store your luggage on departure day ( every Hotel in the Universe offers this for free)We also paid $30 extra per night for a room with a view , it seemed that the regular price quoted was for a room looking out onto a brick wall , so be careful when choosing a room .having said that , Park central is a nice hotel , friendly staff , the concierge was particularly helpful it is clean modern and the rooms are spacious , clean and bright but it's main benefit is the brilliant location Enjoy

I've stayed at numerous hotels in Manhattan, and this is by far the largest room yet. Was under remodel at the time, but the room was nice, front desk was terrific, and location perfect. Have since returned twice - and is quickly becoming my 'go to' NYC hotel. Clean, convenient and good value.

The hotel is in a good location for exploring Manhattan, close toCentral Park and other attractions. The rooms were comfortable andclean. The other facilities like the bar and gym were of a highstandard. The staff were helpful and polite.As a family of five, we had booked two rooms for our stay. However, onour arrival we found that one of the rooms had been cancelled. Thehotel blamed booking.com and booking.com blamed the hotel. The hotelwas full, but the staff managed to find us two adjacent rooms aswe had originally requested.Despite this initial problem we enjoyed our stay and would recommendthe hotel.

My friends decided to stay at this hotel, thus it would not have been my first choice. However, it was pretty good. The room itself was great, I stayed in a King size ro and it seemed much larger than my friends two doubles room. Room had an easy to use safe and a window that saw a bit of Central Park! I couldn't hear the street and was only on the third floor. I was most impressed by the fast wifi that was free- that hardly ever happens anymore with huge hotels! The one con was the service. The front desk was friendly enough but the concierges were obviously overwhelmed and not super friendly. I was expecting better for a 4 star hotel. The hotel was full of tourists and wouldn't want to stay there if I was there for business.

The room was really nice, very modern and comfortable,but not so big. We had a double bed room with view to the side street wich is a little bit quieter than the avenue. The room didn´t have a small fridge or coffee machine, but we asked for it and the brought us one with no cost.The lobby of the hotel was very cold because of the air conditioning system but it was really nice and modern. The location is excellent, it is really close to the central park and 5 minutes walking to Times Sq. We found many clothes behind a drawer that were left by another guest, which means they don´t clean the drawers very often. The staff was helpful.

My sister and I recently stayed at the Park Central (five nights, six days). We chose the hotel because it was one of the few we could find that looked good and offered two beds in the room. (We are sisters, not a couple!) Starting with the not so ugly, when we first arrived we were impressed by the ultra modern decor of the lobby though it is not one where you can hang out. It only had a few benches and no other seating which makes the lobby pretty unwelcoming. (The entire hotel had been recently redone.) Check-in was easy and we went to our room. Then, the bad began. There are only two small elevators handling an entire wing of the hotel so waits are long and the rides seem to take forever. Upon entering the room, my sister, who is a little "smell" sensitive noticed a disturbing odor (which I did not sense). She also noticed a lot of dirt and dustballs where the carpet met the floorboards and chipped paint below the window. We had been promised a great view with an upgrade but I don't consider the rooftop of buildings with giant AC units to be a great view. (Happily you can close the drapes!) And, you know how most hotels give you an array of small bottles of lotion, shampoo, conditioner, shower cap, etc? Not the Park Central. There was one tiny bottle of lotion and one bar of soap. (To be fair, there are three large "community" bottles of product int he shower.) On top of all that, our AC was a little sluggish. We spoke to management and they offered us a change of rooms the next day. We decided against the change because the new room was on 17, we were on 9 and thought the elevator situation would be even worse on a higher floor. Unfortunately, housekeeping did not do our room because they thought we were moving (miscommunication.)! So after our first day in the city, we returned to a room in the same condition as when we left that morning. There was one more housekeeping issue when my bed was made with a sheet that had black stains on it. Now the good...the staff was very accommodating. They got the AC fixed, gave us more toiletries, resolved the housekeeping issues and gave us a break on our bill to compensate for the issues. And, by the way, the restaurant is very good but if you don't want to eat there (breakfast is a little hotel pricey), there are plenty of neighborhood delis. There is one other thing, if you are visiting NY to see shows, there is NO better location. So, despite my 3 star review, will I stay there again? Absolutely!

Unfortunately not what I had hoped for or expected. Booked a double bed room for family and was given options to upgrade on the website for a larger queen deluxe room which I opted for at an extra $75.00 per night. If this was the larger room, I would hate to see what the standard room size is because it was in my opinion tiny. There was pretty much no room for our luggage. It was very tight and minimal standard. The elevators were a disaster. I saw four elevators but for the whole stay only one or two worked making for extremely long lines and long wait times coming and going. We ended up waiting for the elevator going up to our 12th floor room and taking the stairs coming back down. This was very frustrating.The air conditioning I would have to say is a bad system. It is very loud and blows cold air so cannot set for an all night comfort level. If you leave your window open as an alternative for fresh air, the police and ambulance sirens are relentless all night long. Needless to say, no one slept well at all.The location however was fine. Close to the park and 5th Ave shopping if this is what you are coming for. It is also located right next to the subway line which is great but the subway was closed at this location for maintenance during our stay. Normally we stay in mid-town but we stayed here for a less busy and noisy location. I would not stay here again. I noticed what appears to be a large Sheraton two blocks away that I assume would have better / larger rooms and (my guess) would be a better experience.

Standard hotel, international style, clean busy and anonomous. But foe my purpose, buiseness, very good. Good room, cleaned daily, with nice window facing time sq. Wifi is really bad, and service from front desk is hopeless in this regard. Very much NY attitude. Location outstanding, and genuine NY city feeling right on the doorstep. Prices fluctuated enormeously during my 5 day stay from 200 to 600$ A night for the same room

Between Times Square and Central Park, so walking distance to Broadway, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller etc too. We used the open topped tourist buses to get around when we weren't walking.Central but surprisingly quiet. Rooms clean and comfortable. Staff very helpful. Would definitely stay again.

The location of this hotel was excellent . Near to the park and everything you could want or need. The entrance is nice and spacious and the reception staff were helpful and friendly. The room was a good size ( for NY) but the bathroom was toy size. HOWEVER we found dust balls behind the furniture and a pair of dirty tights, a dirty sock and undies under the beds VERY UNIMPRESSED....

The room was clean but very small.The bigger problem with the Park Central was the consistent bad service we received from the staff. We arrived at 1.30am and waited at least 15 minutes before a member of staff checked us in. The staff were not welcoming, friendly or apologetic about our wait. Before we arrived at the hotel I had contacted them asking if they could recommend anywhere locally I could order a birthday cake for my sister, I received no response. The hotel then failed to notify me when the cake I arranged to be delivered had arrived. If it hadn't been for an email from UPS I believe this would have been lost by the luggage room who couldn't find the parcel when I arrived with my email notification. I had planned to nip down to the front desk to collect this surprise cake for my sister, and was sent to three different people before someone eventually helped me, this took over 25 minutes and as a result ruined my surprise. The same day, we used the concierge desk to book an excursion with equally poor service. The man who served us was extremely rude, not only did he answer the telephone while he was selling us tickets, he also picked up the phone and made calls to other guests about their dry cleaning. This may not have been so unacceptable if the man was capable of multi-tasking, however, he stopped serving us while he did these other tasks meaning we waited longer than necessary. On our final day we also asked the concierge if it was possible to book a taxi for our return journey to JFK. We were quoted $93 for a private taxi which was expensive considering yellow cabs advertise flat fares of $50. The concierge's response to this was that the $50 didn't include tolls or gratuity and that yellow cabs were unreliable. We therefore booked two private cars as advised. Later that day when we were leaving the doorman advised that if we'd booked a taxi through the hotel it would have only cost $60. We were confused by this because as far as we were concerned we'd booked through the hotel's concierge, it was only at this point we were told the concierge desk was not part of the hotel team. This is not communicated by the hotel staff at all and there are no signs. We felt totally ripped off. To make matters worse, our second car was 30 minutes later which was extremely stressful. The concierge also advised gratuity was included with our payment, which it was not and we weren't taken on any toll roads! Overall the hotel is extremely expensive for small rooms and although the location is good, the Park Central is let down by their unfriendly and inefficient team. This was our first trip to New York and we were extremely disappointed with this hotel. I would not recommend.

A friend recommended Park Central hotel and we were not disappointed. We booked the hotel through their registration desk well in advance and asked for a discount if we paid for our rooms in advance.
