They agreed. We stayed in a room with two queen beds and were surprised (but delighted) to find there was a wall between the two beds...almost like a two bedroom suite. My friend and I do not go to sleep at the same time, so we were able to have privacy. The location of Park Central is perfect. It is a few blocks from Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue shopping, and Rockefeller Center. There is an entrance to the subway right outside the doors and three great deli's directly across the street. Carnegie Deli is right next to the hotel. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Spent 3 days in nyc..2 nights at the park central. Perfect location..away from the craziness and close enough to walk through central park, to the high line, grab a tour bus or cab, walk to theatres and restaurants. Room clean and comfortable. Lobby inviting. All staff members so friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend.

I was fortunate to have stayed in this hotel back in February for 3 nights with a friend of mine on a business trip. I travel to New York at least 5 times a year and have stayed at some beautiful hotels. This hotel has to be at the top of my list and I will be going back in October to take my partner as a suprise for our joint 30th Birthday and 1 year wedding anniversary. We are going to stay at Park Central Hotel for 8 nights and then we will be travelling over the next month to stay at other beautiful hotels around America. This will be our first stop as New York is our favourite place and this is the hotel I want to be at for our anniversary. I booked a Classic King Room so i hope that will be special enough - im not sure what kind of room I stayed in before but it was beautiful and very spacious so I hope this time will be the same. The service was exceptional and the location was perfect! Looking forward to coming back in October!!

Park Central is a good option for those that don't want to or can not spend a lot of money with more comfortable or luxurious hotels. It's well-located. However, the rooms and mainly its bathrooms need urgent refurbishment! The gym center is really good! Cost-benefit hotel! Don't expect too much! It's fair for what is paid! Enjoy NY!

This hotel has been remodeled and it is gorgeous! The rooms are very comfy and large for NYC. The bathroom was also beautiful. It was the only hotel in the area (that I could find) where you could book a room with 2 beds! The bar is great and very trendy, modern. The bartenders were all very nice. The bar food also looked very good. There was a couple who ordered burgers next to us and said they were gonna eat them again the next time. But the best part of the hotel is the location! It is a block from central park, a few blocks from Rockefeller Center and times square. I would definitely stay here again!

Perfect location - very close to Times Sq and Central Park. Rooms were big, clean, and quiet (despite the hotel size, and its location in Manhattan). We can definitaly recommend this hotel, and we will love to come back.

The biggest selling point for the hotel is definitely its location. It's a short walk to Times Square and most Broadway theaters, and an even shorter one to Central Park. If you want to go somewhere a little farther, there is a subway station conveniently located on the corner of the hotel. The room was new, clean and bigger than expected. The staff was helpful, quickly solving a problem we had with the safe upon arival - we did have to work a little harder to get soap two days later, but it wasn't a big deal. The amenities, which cost $20/day but are included in the reservation, give you free wi-fi at great speed, three computers on the lobby with a printer and a gym (which I didn't use), among other things. I'd definitely go back in the future. The only thing I would fault are the fact the the room is a little dark (there are no lights in the ceiling just two bedside lamps and a third one in the corner - I kind of expected this, though, as another reviewer had previously mentioned it) and the pillows could be a little bigger, particularly because we had a king bed.

I stayed with two of my children for an entire week at the hotel. It was a great success. The location, as the name suggests, is very close to Central Park, but also to MoMa and Times Square. Rooms are very good for a small family. The accommodation is modern, recently refurbished and clean. We stayed on the 12th floor on the 7th Avenue side, but slightly back from the street. Noise levels were therefore mild. One point of attention is the airco. We should have addressed this earlier, but we didn't. The lobby's temperature is very agreeable, probably 65F. The corridors were higher, some 70F. The lowest we could get our room's down to is 75F, too warm and humid really. The 24 hour gym is well equipped. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel very much. Staff were wonderful, location as you can expect superb, we plan to come back.

What a gem of a hotel! Beautifully decorated, wonderfully maintained, clean FRESH beyond words! When you enter from the heat of the city streets you are taken in by the spa like oasis with a refreshing scent that fills the air surrounding the lobby and crisp air conditioning that is so welcoming in NYC in July!It is one of the few hotels you will find in NYC that has two queen beds in their rooms.(Most only offer doubles) The rooms are well appointed, not the biggest but having the bigger beds definitely makes up for that. Everything was clean and modern and very comfortable.The location is fantastic in that it is just blocks to Central Park, and Times Square. We valet parked our SUV with the hotel and walked everywhere.The hotel staff was friendly and helpful in every way. Definitely give this hotel a try! You won't be disappointed.

My husband and I decided to stay at the Park Central for a little time away from home in New Orleans. When you first walk in, the lobby is open and welcoming. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The staff we spoke with were very professional and resourceful, meeting our needs and expectations. The hotel is beautiful and in a great location. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to visit. I highly recommend it and would definitely stay here again.

Had to make last minute changes to my New York travel itinerary and found Park Central. I was pleasantly surprised and have no regrets choosing this hotel. The location was perfect, not too far from Times Square (and not too close that it gets crowded!) and is just a few blocks down from Central Park. Very close to a lot of attractions and easy to get around with the subway close by (57th St-7Av/7Av). The hotel is clean and the fresh smell that awaits you in the lobby is always a welcome after a long day of walking in the city. The rooms are big enough by New York City standard and the amenities were all in good working condition. Checking in was fast and easy and so was check out. A big Thank You to Juan Varela for a sorting everything out. The only complaint would be that the elevators sometimes would take forever to call at your floor. Friendly staff, and great environment. Would definitely come back.

Went to celebrate my anniversary with my wife and 18 month old daughter to New York. Once we got to the hotel we thought to our selfs what a great place and great location. Close to everything. Staff was very friendly and treated our family with the up most respect. After the second night we notice that things weren't so great. The pipes under the bathroom sink leaked which caused my daughter to slip and fall. While taking a shower the over flow cap fell from the shower. My wife called manager and stated all the problem and said maintence was on the way, after 30 mins we called maintence our selfs and they came to fix problem. It seemed like the management working that night was not to eager to help. I must say the rest of our stay was good but that left a sour note in my book. I probably won't be staying there again. Not all was bad though, hotel is in a great location to Time Square and Central Park.

I'm a recurrent visitor of the Park Central hotel for two reasons: 1) Elizabeth Cacovic, the manager the recepetion and 2) the incredible location. Elizabeth is the most attentive and welcoming person you could ever meet. She's extremely accomodating, and does her best to assure you a great stay so if you ever have a problem definitely ask for her. The location of the hotel is also amazing, you have Central Park two blocks away, Hells kitchen with all its restaurants 5/6 blocks away, 5th avenue, Lincoln Center etc... seriously best location without the crowded touristy feel of Times Square (even if its a 5min walk away).

I ended up stuck in NY due to weather a couple weeks ago and stumbled upon the Park Central Hotel on the "Hotel Tonight" app. This was a really great hotel. Just South of Central Park and about a block from the Carnegie Deli. The rooms were kind of small but very clean and comfortable. I would stay here again if given the chance.

I am a frequent business and vacation traveler. I am on the road at least 25 weeks of the year. This hotel is not one I would recommend. The front desk staff is not helpful and borders on being rude with the exception of Charmain. This hotel does not have enough elevators and each trip to the lobby can be a twenty minute adventure. Each trip back to your room the same. The staff gets frustrated with the service elevators and uses the guest elevators as well. Twice I had the staff tell me how this hotel is owned by a person that is not interested in how it is run and they have to use the guest elevators to do their job. The rooms are nice but the maids do not have a place for their carts so they are left in the hallways at night. In the morning since they have no place to go they stand in the hallway and talk, loudly as they get ready for their day. All in all it was an unpleasant experience. They make a big deal about renovating this hotel and the physical facility is fine (very average for the price) but the rest of the experience make it a poor choice of hotels.

First time at the hotel, first impression was great, friendly staff, clean stylish in all areas of the hotel. Room was very tidy, I was able to control the room temperature easily and it was quiet.The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to many attractions and food options.

We booked this hotel because it was reasonably priced and in a great location, just a few blocks from Central Park. It was fabulous - comfortable quiet and spacious. We went for an early walk each day through Central Park, which was absolutely beautiful. Lots of cafés and restaurants nearby, and not too far from Times Square. We loved it.

It is located downtown and is walking distance to all the main locations in downtown New York. Also felt very safe there with the hotel being very clean and fairly quite depending on where your room is situated. Staff is excellent and made my vacation there perfect. Plenty of restaurants, cafes, bakeries, coffee shops located again all within walking distance. I also couldn't believe the price for this place! extremely reasonable. All the other hotels comparable to the park Central in location and quality of stay were at least $200-$300 more per night.

The Hotel is at 56th and 7th Ave. Many fairly inexpensive places nearby for breakfast. The hotel is undergoing modernization. You could smell the newness of the carpet. Check in and out was quick and efficient. Car delivered from the parking lot promptly.

- Great location. It is on the 7th Avenue and only 2 or 3 blocks away from the central park, fifth avenue, and Time Square.- The rooms do not meet the standard of what you are paying ($200-300 per night). - Poor amenities. I don't expect a four star hotel to have poor amenities like park central. No fridge, no slippers, and they do not provide you individual packed shampoo, body wash and conditioner. I really don't understand. It is not that expensive.- Uncleared/Unstated $21 dollars+ Tax per day of facility fees. Seriously?! who charge that? It was not mentioned in the site where i booked the hotel and the staff at park central DID NOT mention that to me when i checked in. I FEEL I WAS BEING ROBBED when I see the check out bill. - Free WIFI?! THAT IS SO A LIE. They do provide wifi for all the guest rooms. However, it is not FREE as they stated. It is included in your FACILITY FEES. And yes you have to pay $21 dollars per night for the wifi maybe you don't use.Good luck. Don't stay here unless you want to be robbed.

My colleagues and I stayed here for the AHR convention in January 2014. The rooms are a good size for a NYC hotel, decor modern/updated, and the bed was very comfortable. Hotel is in a great location (the shuttle picked us up right out front) and there are many breakfast places within a block in addition to Halal Guys right down the street. Be careful when changing and walking around your hotel room, as the windows are facing the other side of the hotel. My only complaint was that my white dress shirt went missing in my hotel room. Maybe it was my own fault as I hung it on a door knob on top of a towel. I'm 99.9% sure the maid accidentally took it with the linens/towels. However, after informing the front desk (day 3 of my 7 night stay) and following up after my stay, they were not able to track it down, nor did they offer any kind of refund.

After staying at the Park Central for nearly 25 years on and off, I must say this recent stay has really put me off for all future stays. Upon completion of the recent remodel, they use only half of the previous elevators available. You need to Expect long waits for tiny fully packed elevators. After receiving a coffee pot, housekeeping was extremely rude telling me they don't offer free coffee.....strange. The first night I dropped one of my meds next to the bed, when I reached down to retrieve it, there was a similar, but different pill obviously left over from a previous guest. And, the shower had questionable brown spots in the tub. If you stay at the Park Central, lower your expectations and don't look too close.

Below is the email I, Sent direct to the hotels customer service email and got no reply I wanted to pass on some concerns I had with my recent stay in NYC. I am very loyal Kimpton customer and stay with them every time I am in NYC (10 -12 a year) for business. In this case I had my family with me and Kimpton only had King beds available for the past weekend. When I first arrived at the hotel approx 6:30 pm on Friday there was no valet available and when I asked the front desk their answer was "just stand outside and look for the men dressed in black", not let me get them for you. After checking in we realized the phone did not work. It was not fixed until Saturday evening, despite being reported several times...911 was my biggest concern if it was ever need for anything the phone wouldn't work. Also, there was a red/pink stain on the sheets in our bed...we called down (on my cell) and instead of offering to come up and fix they stated "we clean all our sheets to the best of our ability and if there is a stain it has been cleaned and disinfected". We left the sheet under the window the first night and slept without it...to our surprise it was placed back on the bed the next day despite my complaint. The next morning I had forgotten my shaver and my wife walked down (no phone) to the front desk and they told her to walk down to the pharmacy 2 blocks....again not the hotels fault I forgot my razor, but customer service. The concierge did redeem the poor service, by getting me a shaving kit after I called down (on my cell) they sent one up. My wife went to the front desk and not concierge, but the answer should not be different from person to person over a common request.Parking was $60 or 65 I cant remember and I accept it is NYC and that is the going rate. The part I was disappointed in was the first time we use the room phone was to call for parking as we were leaving at 9:15 am Sunday. It rang and rang, but never connected to valet...I called the front desk and was met with rudeness over why I calling them and they transferred me...again it rang without answer, I walked down to get the valet myself and the gentlemen out front was very apologetic when I told him what happened, he knew exactly which FDSR had helped me and said "she has an attitude every day" she is the same lady that checked me out.As someone who travels a lot and works 100% in hospitality industry I don't like to complain, but the consistency in which your FD lacks in customer service is a trend. Very disappointed in the level of service and although I didn't yell and scream over the problems, I was clear on my disappointed and the FDSR did nothing but tap her nails as I talked...No I don't ask for discounts or credits, but I do think feedback should be heard and this case I had a lot in 48 hours. My Kimpton loyalty is something that will remain after my visit to your hotelRyan CollinsRoom 320 - Friday through Sunday

Just a few blocks north of Times Sq, the location of this hotel can't be beaten. The staff were always so helpful when we had any questions, the hotel was clean and the rooms of good size, especially considering some others I have stayed in in NY. Really it's all you need from an NYC hotel and I will be back.

Ok I'm going to get the couple of negatives out of the way first.1. Reception staff on arrival miserable & impatient 2. The lifts are a little slow at times & when busy you can wait 5-10 mins with your luggage!Ok now for the pros,1. Location - perfect! 5 mins from Times Square & 3 mins from Central Park2. We stayed on 10th floor in Premier King Room & it was clean, spacious enough & more than enough for our needs3. When leaving the guy at the desk & the valets were happy, helpful & very positive which was a great end to the visitI would definitely recommend a visit here. Great place!

I've been in this hotel in June, 2014 with my mother (70 years old) and my two boys (7 and 9 years old). It was perfect. The rooms were large and comfortable. The TV was new and big with many options of channels. I arrived very early in the morning but my room would be available at noon. The attendant gave me the option to choose a smaller room and in a lower floor but that would be available immediately. I prefered to deliver my luggage in the luggage room to go out and visit the city and come back later to check in the bigger room.The only complain is regarding a "facilities fee" (free wi-fi, use of luggage room, welcome drink(?) and gym room) that is mandatory. If this fee is mandatory why isn't it included in the room price? They told me if you book by internet it is already included. But if you book through a travel agent, it would depends if the agent repass this tax to the hotel. I think that they should make a better work regarding communication with agents. Because if you are a customer and you paid everything in advance to a travel agent in order to arrive to the hotel expecting to have nothing else to worry about, this is a bad surprise. And you can not afford not to pay this fee once it is "obligatory" (about 20 dolars per day).The location was very good. Close to good restaurants, including options for children: Europa Cafe, Serafina, Benihana, Trattoria D'el Art, etc. And close to many attractions (ex: Central Park) and good shopping options.I recommend this hotel for who doesn't matter to pay a little more but to stay with comfort and well located. And also for families.

We just got back from a fabulous weekend at the Park Central. We found this beautifully remodeled contemporary hotel to be a perfect location for everywhere we were going. We came to visit our daughter in union square and were just a block from the subway station to get us there in minutes, we loved taking walks through the park in the mornings after going to the gym and we were only a couple blocks from Central Park. We were also minutes from Times Square, fifth avenue shopping and Columbus circle. We found the room to be well appointed, well lit, roomy and very clean. We were greeted by smiling staff everywhere and they couldn't have been more helpful and kind. This has become our go to home away from home in NY.

My husband and I stayed for 5 nights and it was a very nice hotel. We did not eat or drink there as it was far too expensive. We bought a bottle of wine on the first night and it cost $55 (it was one of the cheapest!). We went to the La Parisenne which is between Park Central and Central Park. Very nice breakfasts there and very reasonable prices!

I booked this online and chose to pay everything upfront with Expedia, only to get billed a 20.00 per day facility fee. It's basically a gouge but as long as you are aware you won't be surprised.Ok so on to the hotel, I found the hotel pleasant and clean, those are some of the most important things to me. The location is close to Times Square and also close to Central Park. The room was small but clean and the bathroom was pretty good.The only issue is with the elevators. The hotel shares its elevators with the Manhattan Club and you only have two allotted to your floors, so the waits can be long and the elevators can be crowded.The rooms with the inner view to the courtyard are pretty dismal, but once again this is New York and views cost a lot. I left the shades down all the time.

I stayed at the Park Central Hotel last night with my wife and 7 year old daughter after naming my own price on Priceline.com. My bid was accepted by Park Central with Priceline and when I checked in last night at 9pm, the front desk representative asked me for a credit card for incidentals. Okay, no problem. I gave him my credit card and that was it. My wife, daughter and I went up to our room room and went to sleep as we had an early morning flight home the next morning. The next morning when I woke up, there was a bill under my door for $20 plus tax ($21.78 total) for a "Facilities Fee". This was never mentioned to me when I checked in, so I went down to inquire about it with the front desk representative. He said it was a "mandatory hotel fee" and he couldn't do anything about it. I asked to speak with a manager and was introduced to Tony C. Tony C. could not have cared less about me. I asked why I was not told about it when I checked in and he said it is because Priceline.com should have told me about it. I mentioned that I was not aware of the charge and he pulled out a binder that was already sitting on the front desk counter that had screenshots from Priceline, Hotwire and other online booking sites showing the super small fine print that "Facilities fees may be extra". Clearly people complain about this all the time which is why he had the pre-printed pages in the binder on the front desk. When I asked "what is included in the Facilities Fee", he indicated that it included items such as free internet, free luggage storage, free local calls, etc. Why was this not disclosed to me when I checked in that I was going to have to pay a mandatory $21.78 per night change and for that I get the above mentioned amenities? BECAUSE THEY DO NOT WANT YOU TO KNOW THAT YOU ARE BEING CHARGED A BOGUS $20+/NIGHT FEE. They try to hide it from you. I never used the internet, made any local charges or stored my bags. Most hotels give you the option to purchase internet per night and who uses hotel phones for local calls anymore? Everyone has a cell phone.This hotel is deceiving and unethical and has HORRIBLE customer service. I asked to have the change removed as I was not made aware of it or the amenities I got for it and therefore did not take advantage of it and the front desk manager, Tony C, could have cared less. Basically told me tough luck.I will NEVER stay at this hotel again and urge you to carefully consider staying here. If you do, be aware that your hotel cost is $21.78 more per night than you thought.

Stayed in January 2014 on business.Service was second to none at all times, hotel staff could not do enough to please in this newly refurbished hotel. The location is great, easy walking/ cab distance from just about anywhere and anything, given the choice of similarly priced hotels in the area I would definitely return here again. Beds were comfy; rooms had great facilities & climate control. I only ate breakfast at the hotel once but it was very enjoyable although overpriced - what can you expect in NYC. Wifi is not provided free of charge.

While the hotel was expensive, its location near Central Park and Times Square is incredible. Highly recommended for people wanting to get the typical touristy experience in Times Square. However, if you've already been to Times Square there are probably cheaper places you could get in other areas.

At the time we went it was just getting renovated and it looked fantastic they're was lots of building work happening around us but could see it was emerging into a 5 star hotel. This hotel is in a great location around the corner from the museums and central park itself. The rooms were very tidy and everything was decorated nice.

Excellent location, close to everything and a couple blocks from Central Park. The dining room served a very lovely brunch and we had a very attentive waiter, an excellent welcome and excellent service overall . We were very happy with our stay!

It has been three years in a row that I stayed at Park Central after staying at different hotels in the same area, and without any doubt the next stay will be there as well. In my opinion ideally located near Central Park you will find very nice, comfortable rooms in a hotel with friendly staff at a very reasonable rate.Everything nearby, great to have your morning run in Central Park, good advice and help from the staff... Excellent!

The hotel is in a great location between central park and times square. The hotel was clean, but the staff was not too friendly. Overall it was a good hotel and it was perfect for site seeing in New York for the first time.

Stayed 5 nights at Park Central, NYC. Room was small but, clean and fresh. Our room was boxed in - window view was of a brick wall, and more hotel rooms on both sides, but this made for a very very quiet room. :) Room did not have microwave, fridge, or coffee in room, that is probably typical of a New York hotel.Location was fantastic. Within walking distance to Central Park, 5th Ave/Park Ave, Rock Center, Times Square, Theater District, Hells Kitchen, more! We put on the miles, but enjoyed being able to get around so easily on foot. Subway/Train located just across the street. Lot's of restaurant options nearby. McGees (Maclarens pub from How I Met Your Mother), just a block away - big hit for my daughter.

We couldn't have picked a better location for our New York stay. 5 minutes walk north to Central Park and 10 minutes south to Times Square. The Hotel is very comfortable, has a coffee shop in the foyer, polite and courteous reception staff. The elevator was a problem, slow and when we stayed only one was working, which meant a bit of a wait.Our room was wonderful. Plenty of space (especially for New York hotels) and our bed was very comfortable. Tastefully decorated. We certainly would stay here again.

We ' re staying for the fifth time in a row at a park central hotel ny and unfortunately we're going back to Brazil tomorrow. The hotel underwent a major reform getting very beautiful and modern.Its location is excellent , clean and spacious rooms .Special thanks to Elizabeth Cacovic for your attention and hospitality .We will return soon!!!!!

I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel.The location was excellent, several blocks from Rockeffeler Center, walking distance to central park,(plaza hotel fountain),two block from 5th ave and high end shops, St. Patricks Cathedral directly across the street and close to Radio City Music Hall, but hotel is in a quiet location. The rooms were bright and large with marble bathrooms and very comfortable beds. The service was superb and I really felt great during my entire stay.Special Thanks to Elizabeth Cacovic assisting me upon my stay and providing me with all my needs.I would LOVE to have the opportunity to come back again and stay at this beautiful hotel!

This is a nice Hotel with great comfort in its rooms but the highlight would have to be its location, it´s just 6 blocks away from Times Square, 1 block away from Broadway St, 2 Blocks away from 5th avenue (the area with the best stores), You have 2 metro stations 1 min walking.Definitely its a best value.

Beautiful newly renovated hotel with spacious rooms & in a great location. Two blocks away from Central Park & a short walk to Time Square. Elizabeth the Guest Relations Manager was so lovely & so helpful in catering to our needs. She made our stay there very special. Have stayed there before & will definitely stay there again. Can definitely recommend this hotel.

I told my grandchildren the summer they turned 12 I would take them anywhere in the world. My third grandchild to turn 12 is a baseball fan and he choose a baseball journey. In addition his mother was turning 40 this year, so we pulled out all the stops. My husband choose Park Central because of the location. He specifically choose a a corner room with windows on two sides for our daughter, grandson and son-in-law so that they would have a view of Time Square.Of course this room cost extra. What a mistake that was. Where to begin? We did not have dial tones on the phone in either of the two rooms we rented. We were able to make phone calls out. The air conditioning in the corner room would go to 65 and then click off. The room was hot and muggy and smelled of mold. The bathroom fixtures were coming off and there was mold behind each of the fixtures. My daughter had to stuff a wash rag down the bathtub drain to hold in the bath water (the plug did not work), Air conditioning in the hall way outside our room also was not working.One of the two elevators was not operable while we were there and there was often 12-15 people with all their luggage in line to get on the elevator. It took forever.We understand that things happen and machinery breaks down. What was most frustrating about this hotel was the lack of response that we received when we contacted them. They stationed a young employee in the lobby who dutifully wrote down the long list of complaints. No response. We then wrote two emails and did not receive a response from either of them. No word at all from customer service.The only good thing I have to say is that the linen was good. Avoid this place folks. They have a lot to learn about customer service.

Spent 7 nights at Park Central; very nice room and excellent service from beginning to end. Rooms were spacious and quiet though right in the heart of midtown Manhattan. Service was excellent, particularly the housekeeping staff who quickly and thoroughly changed sheets and cleaned up after each of my two eight year old twins vomited several times on back to back days. Didn't eat there (a little pricy), but there is an excellent coffee shop next door and several good restaurants within a couple of blocks. Carnegie Hall was across the street, Central Park two blocks away, and a subway station at the end of the block. Would go back again; Recommend it.

This is the perfect location to base yourself in NY to tick off lots of tourist things. The room was very spacious for NY. The bathroom was nice and clean and came with a hair dryer. Bed was comfortable and air conditioning was not too loud. Staff were very friendly, they recommend places to eat and things to do. If you are in NY for over a week, I would recommend staying here, but then maybe somewhere else like Soho just to experience another vibe.

Great location!!! In between Central Park and Times Square! It just felt like we were a couple of steps away from Times Square. I don't even know what view we had, but we didn't care as we spent very minimal time in the room. Service was great & they were helpful. Rooms were very clean & spacious enough for 3 people. Elevator statement was great. Just press your floor number & it caters to the number of people in it. No complaints and I was quite pleased! Booked our room through the hotel website itself and got it at discounted price. Of course we planned and mapped out our trip before hand so the transit and traveling was quite good! I would definitely go back here for sure.

Another hotel with a priceline price, and low expectations. And again, I was wrong. Yes the hotel is huge, and it is a favourite with tourists. Yes the location is really touristy, nothing like the East Village. Although being two blocks from Central Park is not bad at all.But the king room, was by a mile, the best one I have ever stayed in NY (and a top 5 anywhere). The room is brand new, huge, larger than a lot of NY flats. It has a sleeping area (very good mattress), a separate siting are with a huge TV, a small entrance hall with closet and a very large bathroom. Not all rooms are as big as this one. I have no idea if I was lucky, or if this is what most king rooms look like. As a tip, mine was 1157.It was really a pleasure to go back to the room after a day of work or running in the park, sit in the sofa, and watch a World Cup match. It did not feel like a cramped hotel at all. It felt like home.

There seems to be a lot of good reviews about this hotel but I didn't care for it at all...here's why: the rooms themselves were ok...modern furnishings but could really use a good cleaning. All around the edges of the carpets were full of dust. I mean could housekeeping vacuum a little better with a smaller vacuum connector? It's just plain lazy to see that the carpet areas against the walls are dusty...gives you a sense that the rooms are just not that clean. The entire hotel which has 26 or 28 floors (I forget) has all but 2 elevators in which one of them was not working some of the time I was there.The lobby bathrooms near the bar were filthy and disgusting. I have never seen a lobby bathroom that gross...especially for a 4 star hotel.Lastly...please don't go to the bar...when my colleagues and I went there for a drink one of the nights...we all sat there and felt itchy. Perhaps not bed bugs but certainly a lot of dust mites. At first I thought it was just me being paranoid but then I started seeing my coworkers also scratching all over, it confirmed it...the place is just really really dirty. New York is not a clean city...but hotels really need to hire and train their staff to upkeep and make guests feel comfortable away from home. I will not stay here again and will be telling my firm not to send anyone to this hotel again.

Any person traveling to New York whether for business or leisure should stay at Park Central, the location couldn't possibly be better. I loved every aspect of my stay, the room was spacious and very modern and as for hotel staff they were extremely accommodating and friendly (in particular Elizabeth Cacovic). I just want to say a MASSIVE thank you and I cannot wait to come back to the hotel again!!

We stayed four nights as a couple with teenage children in a second room. Despite what we had read previously Reception check in went smoothly and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We did not like our first room as it overlooked a central courtyard that was full of air-conditioning units so we asked to move. I think it was Laura who handled our query and had us moved to a higher floor with a better outlook within about 10 minutes. Room decoration is very nice, modern and clean. Couple of little things like no loo brush or loo extractor. Our first night was a bit of a challenge as our air conditioning unit was so noisy and we had been up for 25 hours straight and wanted to get to sleep. We called down about 5 times and eventually a maintenance guy turned up. There was no hotel information guide in our room, if there had been we would not have had to make as many calls during our stay as the information would have been to hand. (in fact there was a book in my sons room) The air conditioning problem was just that the fan was up too high and was fixed very quickly, we could have done that yourself with an info book. One big tip is take a flashlight with you. It is impossible to see the safe deposit box numbers in the dark wardrobe, especially as the box is turned to the side. We had to keep moving the room light into the wardrobe. In my son's room they had a wall in wardrobe and their safe was in pitch blackness at the back so impossible to use. If you want a bath leave yourself plenty of time as it takes about 20 minutes to fill so we stuck with the showers. Lots of hot water though at any time.There are no shower hats provided just the shampoo, body lotion and body wash. Plus soap. The rail in the wardrobe is in danger of collapsing as there is no centre support, I called to warn them a couple of times. When the maintenance man came about our aircon on the first night he said the wardrobe doors had come off of the runners and said they were a bad design. We had not noticed. The TV is huge in the room and we had good wifi connection on the 9th floor but my son on the 6th could not connect. There are only 2 lifts. We were lucky and only had a couple of times with a long wait but at times on the ground floor we could see big queues with suitcases waiting for lifts. Also on the ground floor the reception lacks seats. In total only 4 benches so had to stand for quite a long time when we were checking out and waiting for our car. Plenty of room to put some more comfortable seating. As mentioned in other posts there is no fridge or kettle facilities in the room. The downstairs grab and go shop is great, nice coffee, lots of choice of pastries and snacks. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as we had read it was expensive and instead went to the restaurant across the road everyday. This hotel is surrounded by restaurants, lovely steakhouse next door and an Italian which had nice food but awful service. On our last day one of the children was very sick and so we asked to stay on in the room until our car came at 3.30 They charge half a night rate for the 3.5 hours. The porters/bell men could do with better customer skills. In the 5 days we were there they never once said good morning or engaged us when we passed them, but perhaps that's New York. Locations wise this hotel is great. 5 minutes to walk to Central Park, 10 minutes walk to Times Square and 42nd Street. Dozens of restaurants and close to theatres. Overall we had a lovely time here. The beds were amazing

The hotel is nice and well located. The only thing you should be aware is the concierge. They sold me a bus ticket to an outlet that the departure was 2 blocks from the hotel (ok!) but when i came back they left me 10 blocks away! I was with my two little kids and a bunch of shopping bags walking in a crowded street! When I complained all they said is that they don't take responsability from the concierge because it's a rented space. I am waiting for reimboursment for the inconvenient at least! And other thing, when you wait for the bus at the outlet, go 30 min earlier because the line is big and if the bus get full you will have to wait for an hour more! I would have rented a car if I knew all this!

Read a lot of reviews before booking our stay and was very pleased with our week long visit. Everyone kept saying how great the location was in all the reviews, but more folks should chime in about the nice rooms, great staff, and lovely lounge. Found some conflicting info/pictures online from before the substantial renovation in 2013 and I have to say they did a fantastic job. The Premiere King room was a good size, very clean, and the bed/linen was lovely. Make sure you chat with Nancy in the Lounge and get some restaurant tips from the very helpful manager Chloe. Go for dinner just one block towards the park at Trattoria Dell'Arte and have a great pizza and 2for1 happy hour wine at Pazza Notte just one block over on 6th AV.

I and a friend reserved a two bed room. The room had the most bizarre configuration of a closet in the middle of the room that extended between the beds. We could not talk to each other while on our beds and only one of us could view the TV, which was on one side of the room. This configuration is nowhere on their website. The room was upgraded the second and third. A also asked twice of a blanket to replace the comforter, which was not done. Otherwise the hotel was fine, good location and clean.

My husband & I took my mum here for her first ever visit to NYC & she loved it. All of the staff members we met (with one exception) from front desk, to housekeeping to the bar were very friendly and helpful. The location is great, about equidistant from Times Square and Central Park so it's easy to get around and see the sights during the day, and get to the theatre, great restaurants and bars at night. The rooms were spacious and clean and all of the common areas were spotless.

Such a great spot. Newly renovated hotel. Really close to Central park & walking distance to Times Square. Great for subway, a few stations very close by. Really enjoyed our stay. Excellent staff & very nice bar area. Would avoid the 'central market' in the lobby, but otherwise an excellent choice fir NYC.

We stay in this hotel 3 nights. The location of the hotel is superb. It is walking distance from Times Squares, Central Park and 5th. Ave. The lobbby is impresive,however, the elevators are very small. The waiting time to take elevators could be from 10 to 15 minutes. The rooms are cleaned but are small. The average night for my staying was $333..too expensive. In taxes and fees we paid more than $120 includig $60 resort fee. We will evaluate other options in our next trip to NYC

We stayed in the hotel for 14 days - from June 11 - June 25 (2 rooms). The location of the hotel was great - very accessible - Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, etc. The rooms were very comfortable and the house keeping service made sure that rooms are cleaned everyday. The Guest Manager, Elizabeth Cacovic is ever attentive to the needs of the guests making sure that they are happy and satisfied. They have a nice Lobby with a fresh scent at all times. When we go back to New York, we will definitely choose to stay here again.Tina G.

Read recent reviews regarding this property and I can say, my visit was superb! Angela got us a "room with a view" on the 18th floor; the food and service was outstanding. The bonus is the hotel is conveniently located (most within walking distance) to every little thing! We recommend The Irish Pub, Tavern on The Green, and Bar Americain. But, if you don't want to leave the hotel, the food there is excellent!

We stayed here June 8th-11th to celebrate my birthday with our first trip to NYC. This hotel was a score!! I used Priceline to get a fantastic deal on this hotel and it was everything I hoped it would be, though I would hesitate to call it a 4-star hotel, as advertised. The lobby is gorgeous, and I know it sounds silly but it smelled so good, especially after walking in from 7th Ave on a hot summer's day!First, the positive: LOCATION!! Located a 5 minute walk to Central Park, an 8 minute walk to Times Square, with a subway stop that goes the length of the city down to Battery Park directly next door, I literally could not have asked for a better location. Oh, and the Carnegie Deli is about a 30 second walk away on the next block. Our room was quiet and clean, air conditioning worked beautifully, and the beds were probably some of the most comfortable hotel mattresses we've had the pleasure of sleeping on. The bathroom was big and bright. DH in particular was a huge fan of the rain shower head.Now for the negative: I was aware of it from the other reviews (thank you TA!), but the extra $20/day mandatory fee for wifi use and luggage holding is ridiculous. I have never before stayed at a hotel that had a mandatory wifi charge. Normally, if there's a usage fee, you request the password at check-in and pay from there. Oh, you also get a free drink, but only if you order a meal at their restaurant (we opted to explore NYC's other meal options). I wasn't told about the fee at check in, and I didn't bother arguing about it when they slipped our bill with it under my door at check-out. But be warned, there is a hidden fee. We tried to watch TV one night, but dish service was unavailable at that time. There are no coffee makers in the room, and there are only three TINY elevators servicing floors 1-9. Not sure about the rest of the floors as we were on the 9th. I would definitely stay here again, but I feel rack rate is a bit high for what this hotel offers. All in all, though, it was a wonderful stay in the perfect location!

This was a very enjoyable stay in a very comfortable hotelWe would not have any hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyoneYou are also very close to Broadway, Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping, Times Square, Carnegie Hall but at the same time it is relatively peaceful.

Totally enjoyed my stay. Asked for a view and got one. Only snag is it was written on the site that there's airport shuttle but didn't see one, was told in the hotel you'd have to call ahead and pay for that service separately. This should be rectified on their site. Otherwise, everything was fabulous.

Its a long awaited review, we stayed sometime last year ..while they were undergoing renovation, I'm sure its done by now..great hotel, great location..very close to Central Park, and walking distance to times square

I had an amazing stay at Park Central and most definitely will be returning. Not only was the hotel very welcoming and had an amazing vibe, the staff were also extremely helpful and went out of their way to assist you with anything you needed. I can easily say that this was the best hotel I have ever stayed in and had the most comfortable nights sleep. Customer service was excellent, have already recommended the hotel to friends who will be travelling to New York soon. The location is great, you can go out at any time and feel safe. One day I had a very minor issue, and spoke to a lady called Elizabeth Cacovic, she was so helpful, understanding, warm, lovely and AMAZING at her job; the issue was quickly resolved, and on top I received complimentary breakfast as an outcome. I have never come across someone who is so willing and happy to help someone and make the most of their stay. Park Central are lucky and blessed to have such great staff delivering such high standard customer service. I already miss the hotel and cannot wait to revisit in October, until next time Park Central.

This hotel was below par in my opinion. It was during the Christmas season and we were in an upper floor room with no view and it was was way too hot. The sliver of a window didn't help the stuffiness. The location was handy for a first time visit and the attractions - Times Square, Broadway, etc.

just returned home to scotland after a week staying here... the hotel itself is brilliant....the beds are sooo comfortable the room we had was soo modern... the only negitive points i would make are nnot enough elevators for people...also no fridges in the rooms to keep ur bottled water cold. would stay here again in a heartbeat.

We stayed at Park Central Hotel during current June and we really enjoyed it. It is a lovely hotel located in the heart of Manhattan at 2 blocks from central park and at 5mns to times square.We were with our baby and we appreciated the professionalism and care of the staff, very friendly and available.We believe money we paid worth it for a family. We recommand this hotel to everyone who wanna go to NYC to visit the main spots.

This hotel is well worth the money I paid. It is in a good location - just south of central park and opposite Carnegie hall. Times Sq is 5 mins walk away, it's close to Broadway and Top of the Rock. We were a family of 4 staying end of May to June 2014. The hotel is pleasant and very tidy. The reception is spacious and pleasant smelling. There can be a bit queue at checkin - but we never experienced this. There are 3 Apple Macs + printer in reception for guest use connected to the internet. The room is modern and tidied daily. No drinks bar - but plenty of sockets and other standard hotel features.Cant understand the people who criticised this hotel - it is a good hotel for Manhattan for its price bracket. People this is Manhattan!! if your going to spend your days in the hotel in Manhattan you've wasted your holiday. I see hotels as a place to rest and sleep - and this hotel was very good for that.

I never thought I would enjoy this hotel very much. New York is an expensive city buy of course what would you expect but expensive hotels too. Yet they managed to make every penny worth it. From the cleanliness , ambiance and staff- kudos.

The website revealed a lovely hotel in mid-Manhattan that allowed my son and I to walk to all the tourist spots we had wanted to visit. Friendly and helpful staff, a great restaurant, and beautiful room rounded out the experience.

I had actually good expectations before staying in this Hotel. I watched the website and I really expected something small and design, with all the characteristic of this type of structures. I was disappointed. The service is nothing, compared to the rate I had to pay. The room was small, old-fashioned equipped. Only the TV was good. The wifi was acceptable. The bathroom absolutely too small. The A/C system also very old-fashioned, noisy and not so performant. The only WOW is connected to the position: very good if somebody would come here to go outside and just walk the Big Apple. It wasn't my case. I don't think I will stay there again.

The hotel, despite the millions spent on renovations, is average. The carpet in our room was dated, the fixtures in need of repair, and the wall paper was peeling. On the positive side, the bed was very nice....I slept very well. The windows open and the fresh spring breeze was wonderful. The noise level was ok and the distance to the metro was great (across the street)!!! The staff was wonderful and was fun---they truly made the hotel! The products in the hotel were nice despite the hotel being very "cheap" on giving them out. Overall.....and average hotel.

The Park Central Hotel is very nice and I would absolutely stay there again. The location is perfect, the staff was excellent and friendly and the hotel is clean. My only complaint is the bathroom is too small and has bad lighting.

The problem by "overselling" your hotel is that people get easily disappointed on arrival. As many other reviews I was expecting to be wooed, and I was not. Check-in is very slow, and always a long line of people waiting. Also the first thing that will hit you upon entering the hotel is a strong sense of perfume. I'm not allergic to perfume, but even I found it to irritate me. I can't imagine how it must be for those who are allergic.Room was on the 17th floor, and no street noise considering its New York. However, the crying baby in the room next door I could hear every morning. Ugh! Annoying! Bathroom is quite small, and very bad airconditioned, it seems the damp after the shower didn't go away and was still there in the afternoon when we returned after seeing the city. Great location for first time visitors are we were, but I think next time I would prefer to be more downtown.

Tremendous location and friendly staff but the rooms are absolutely pedestrian. The highlight of the room was the bathroom. The rooms are very small with no basic amenities other than a safe. Even the ATM was inoperable all five nights of our stay. In comparison to other 4 star hotels we have stayed in the last year (Liaison - Washington, DC; Omni Parker House - Boston) this was highly disappointing. We were offered a 37% discount on a future stay which would have been the appropriate pricing for this average hotel. Unless location is your only consideration, I cannot recommend this hotel.

The location is so convenient, hotel is recently renovated and serves the purpose. Rooms are sufficient in size considering it is NYC, but do not expect even a small fridge of coffee. Personnel is unfriendly (who cares) but it is somewhat disappointing that they try to sell you attractions or car rides with a great degree of insistence.

When i've made the reservation for 5 nights at Park Central Hotel in NY I was very happy! The hotel isn't cheap, the price was very high. But t seemed to worth it. The photos of the hotel and its rooms are amazing!!But when we've arrived, the hotel was just good, not amazing. The location is fantastic, could not be better! But with that the noises from the street were very very loud!The room is good, the bathroom was small, but the bed is one of the best I've ever slept in.If there is any special offer for the hotel, it is good. If you have to pay full price, as i've done, think a little bit more.

The location is great and the rooms of reasonable size, our room on the 12th floor was quiet and comfortable, but the bathroom was cramped (the door wouldn't open fully because the lavatory pan was in the way!).There's no room service and no tea or coffee facilities in the rooms, a coffee shop provides drinks, pastries fruit and so on, but you have to fetch it yourself. We Brits looking forward to an early morning cuppa were disappointed!There's a nice bar area and the restaurant serves a very limited (and pricey) menu - think up market pub grub not fine dining. The buffet breakfast is $35 each.I thought the $20 a day facilities charge was over the top - OK it includes the Gym which I didn't use but otherwise it amounts to a charge for the WiFi and a $15 drinks voucher.If you plan to stay for more than a night or two you might prefer a bigger bathroom and a different mix of facilities.

Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of June, weather was perfect. Reception was quick and very friendly, as very tired, arrived late after travelling from England.,and we were on the 3rd floor 315,and had no problems with lifts, or traffic noise, and the room was always a good temperature. Very modern room, and bathroom. with a great view out to the side street. The beds were so comfortable, could not get out of bed, with crisp cotton sheets,. The TV was huge, great for a late News catch up. The hotel was very quiet too, no noise from any other guests. had a lovely snack/bakery drinks shop too.and a lovely bar area, also quiet. One of the nicest hotels I have stayed in, Had no complaints at all. Would definitely stay here again..

We stayed here on a quick work trip to New York. Booked on hotwire it was quite a good value. There was nothing fancy about it, but it totally served our needs.We spent no time in the hotel except to sleep and the beds were good, the shower was fine and the room was clean. The location was excellent for us. There is a Starbucksa few doors down and lots of places to grab a bite on the way to work.I would stay there again on a business trip.

This hotel was in the perfect location. Just between Times Square and Central Park. It was a quick walk from everything and great restaurants. They redid the rooms and they were spacious for a NYC room. Would def. go back!

We stayed for 11 nights at Park Central last month and it was an excellent choice. Huge comfortable bed, and the pillows were so comfortable we were in bed early, and late getting up!.Friendly staff, especially Georgina the lady who made our room every day, she was so friendly and helpful, and kept our room well aired, clean & tidy.So well situated, we had a great time there, and would definitely return to this Hotel if ever back in New York.Good value, the restaurant was very good for dinner, although we did find the restaurant breakfasts rather expensive, so we used the "Central Market" counter in the foyer for our cups of tea and blueberry Danish every day.

After a long day, either for fun at the museums, shopping or for work the Park Central will give you the rest and comfort you need to be back again on the streets. The hot ale was renovated about 4 years ago, giving it a minimalist cosmo look that gives you a nice place to have your base while in NYC. Elevators are a little bit slow, but you will be in a perfect safe location to explore the big apple, either by foot or public transportation, nearby the theatre district as well as most important museums.

This hotel has an excellent location, close to almost everything in Manhattan. It has been recently renovated, which improved its public areas and rooms. The only problem we had were the elevators: only two for all floors. Depending on the time of day, going to or from the room required some pacience. Let's just hope it is only temporary...

We stayed for 5 nights with my parents during a city break to NYC. We found check in to be pleasant and easy with really helpful staff. The room was basic but clean with a comfy bed and clean fresh linen and towels. We don't mind walking anywhere and we found the hotel to be in a really good location. There is a subway station close by and within walking distance to some of NYC most famous attractions. NYC is an expensive city and the hotel prices are inflated compared to other cites of the world but in relation to other NYC hotels we found it to be good value for its location. Overall a nice stay and one i would recommend.

I recommend this hotel. I have no complaints about it. Just remember if you want a refrigerator or a coffee pot in your room these must be reserved too. But, there is coffee in lobby for sale. You are only a few blocks walk to Central Park. Taxi cabs are in front of the hotel. Staff is attentive and courteous. We asked for early check in on our arrival day and we could have had it but we chose to wait for two rooms next to each other. If you prefer adjoining rooms, remember they are only located on certain lower floors.

I stayed at this hotel only one night on a business trip. The room was clean. The bed was comfortable. Check in and check out was easy and the front desk staff was friendly. The location is good and there is plenty of cuisine to choose from nearby. We did have a bad experience with one of the doormen that had a very bad attitude and was not appreciated. If not for that terrible moment, I would have give the hotel 5 stars.

Hotel newly renovated! rooms are comfortable and modern! perfect location between times square and central park! subway just accross the street!The only thing I am complaining about is the cleaning who is done in less than 10 minutes where they only change towels and do the bed, I let you imagine the dust occupying the room! but when I called the housekeeping manager YESENIA, she was very helpful and came right away to check our room, after showing her all the dust, she sent right away a cleaning lady "MARIE PAUL" who did an outstanding job cleaning the room at 09.00 PM, she spent one hour going through all the dust. MARIE PAUL was very friendly, highly professional and did a meticulous job cleaning the room.All in all, this hotel is a very nice address in NYC, your remarks and comments are valued and you get a good service, I highly recommend it.

The good: location is awesome. 2 minutes to Central Park, 5 minutes to NBC, 10 minutes to Times Square!Hotel lobby, rooms, etc. are beautiful. The service is awful. Staff are not engaged and simple requests like towels and a bottle opener were too much for them.Cafe staff downstairs need proper training in customer service to serve gourmet food products. Excellent bell staff and house driver to airport were exceptions

I stayed in the hotel on a Saturday night. The price was really good; the room was quite roomy for a New York hotel, clean, and up to date. Its very close location to Central Park is also very attractive. While the slow elevators were wanting, overall, the hotel was very good.

My partner and I were traveling to New York for a few days and decided to try booking through Hotwire. Lucky us, we landed on the Park Central hotel. Completed renovated, the Park Central is midget and close to the subway, broadway, Time Square and Central Park. I would definitely recommended it but do shop some of the travel sites like Hotwire and Priceline. The best price we could get on regular sites fir the same hotel was 340$ a night. By using Hotwire we paid 200$. It's worth it.

First time staying at Park Central. The location was great, but the customer service was horrible. Asked for a bottle opener, extra towels, recommendation on airport transfer, and all were too much trouble. Room cleaning was poor, lobby bathrooms were very dirty, bar staff were rude.

This hotel has recently be refubished, and was one of the reasons that my fiance booked it as a surprise for our honeymoon. Entrance is clean and pleasant looking, as is the room. But the bathrooms are so small there is no where to put anything, I ended up having to close the toilet seat, putting a towel on it, to open my make up bag to apply my make up. The room could do with a dressing table area with a mirrow, even if you put a mirrow over the desk area it would have helped.There is no tea or coffee making facilities, although i asked if it was possible for some to be sent up, as advertised on there web page. I was informed they didnt do tea, only coffee and would see about getting one sent to the room, it never appeared. The bath towels (laughable) were the same size or slightly bigger than a hand towel, and thread bare. Overall its a shame as the location is pretty nigh perfect, 2 blocks from central park and a short walk to Time Square. The refurbishment is completed to a good standard, and the faults could be easily rectified. This would have increased the score dramatically.

We booked the Park Central on recommendation for a holiday to celebrate our wedding anniversary and a 21st birthday. A fantastic hotel in a great location close to all attractions. The hotel is very well appointed and the rooms are extremely comfortable. We didnt have a room with a view which was a bit dissapointing but nevertheless, it didnt spoil our stay in the least. The housekeeping staff were all very friendly and the rooms were maintained in a spotless condition with towels and bed linen changed every day. One negative was the speed of check in and check out at the front desk. It seemed to take ages, but at the end of the day it is what it is, the staff have a job to do and they do it well with the utmost of courtesy at all times.We would definitely stay here again and would certainly recommend it

I went to NY for 3 Nights for a Conference at The Plaza , so I stayed at Park Central a few blocks away. First of all Tony at reservation was the best , awesome . I have stayed a few years ago and was pleaseantly surpeised to see the rennovations. The new bar was beatiful with firendly bartender , the restaruant was nice as well . I ha the bes burger in town as well as great breakfast . Although the buffet I did not tried . The room was small but well accomodate with a huge LED TV it looks like it was 55 to 60" awwesome. I was surprise to see the was no radio in the room . The batheroom was really nice and love the brigthness and lights.In general this newly renovated property was great , friendly and super well located .

I came to NYC for a work event a few weeks ago and several members of our staff stayed at the Park Central. Everyone complimented the location and the comfortable beds. Some rooms came with a view (mine, unfortunately was on the air shaft side of the building which involves a lot of bricks and looking into other people's hotel rooms) but, I was hardly there so I didn't mind pulling the shades when I was.The restaurant in the lobby is lovely and was a nice place for a business lunch. The location is top notch, one block from central park and quite close to times square (but also far enough away to avoid that mess if you want to!). It was quiet and comfortable and very clean with nice bedding.There's a $20 fee per day that they tack on to your rate for your wireless internet access and this also includes gym access and some sort of free drink that I never took advantage of. But that's fairly normal. All in all I recommend this spot if you're looking for a good value by NYC standards.

Went to New York with 2 girl friends and wanted a well priced hotel in a central location. We chose Park Central. The hotel has been all Redon and our room had two queen beds with plenty of room for the 3 of us. Only draw back the room had NO dresser so no drawers to store our clothes. You will need to live out of your suit case. Plus you could not read in your bed since there was only one lamp between the two beds. The bar was very nice and good place to stop on the way out for the evening. Good price, good bed

Close to Central Park, 5th Ave, Times Square & Broadway. Rooms are slightly small (my son and I stayed in two doubles and were perfectly comfortable), but who cares when you'll spend very little time in them.Check in took quite a while which was a surprise considering the professional look and attention to quality in other parts of the hotel. Not sure of the process is slower or there was a lack of staff numbers, but the check in line moved very slowly.other than that, a highly recommended place to stay and catch all of the best of NYC.

My family and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, the service is excellent, everytime you need help an assistant is ready to attend you.The rooms are newly remodeled and that's cool because it looks nice and elegant.Also the food is delicious.I recommend this hotel because is so near of the most popular places to visit in NY.We also are thankful with the receptionist Jessica, she help us every time we need help, she gave us maps and recommend us many places that we could visit.

We enjoyed our stay with at this hotel in our Summer Holidays. The location & friendliness of everyone in the hotel was super - we would definitely stay with you again.The hotel room need tea/coffee making facilities in room.

Stayed for 4 nights over Memorial Day weekend and got a discounted rate through their Facebook site. I was worried about bed bugs in NYC, but the rooms are newly remodeled with new mattresses and covers, so no issues. The rooms are well insulated - you can't hear plumbing noises or tvs from other rooms. However, sound does come quite clearly through the hallway door. There is no radio, docking station, or coffee maker. BUT there are plenty of outlets that you can have several electronic devices charging, even bedside so you can use your phone as an alarm/radio. All staff are very friendly, even the maids in the hallway! Park Central is very close to theaters, Central Park, subway, and hop on/hop off bus stops. I had a single king room, and there is no place to lounge and put your feet up except on the bed. It's amazing how dirty you can get touring and going through Central Park and the bedspreads are white, so a sponge bath was needed before relaxing. The concierge will help you tickets and a ride to the airport.

This is a beautiful, historic hotel with incredible decor and architecture. The staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and elegant and we felt we had stepped into a historical world with all the comforts of the modern day

My boyfriend booked 4 nights for us here as a surprise for my 30th Birthday. As first timers to New York, the location was brilliant. Two minutes walk from Time Square, 5th Avenue & Central Park. Nearest subway is 1 minute walk from the front of the hotel.We stayed in a Premier King on the 9th floor. Our room was awesome, spacious, clean, modern furnishings, really contemporary. Although I didn't think the hotel would matter to me (I was in the big apple for the first time!!) it was great to come back every evening to a beautiful, clean & comfortable room. Our super king bed was THE most comfortable bed we've both ever slept in at 5'10 & 6,4 it's important we have a big spacious bed! Our room was cleaned, & given fresh towels & bed linen every day. Free wifi throughout all areas in the hotel including our room was an added bonus for looking up maps/restaurants/directions last minute.There's lots of reviews on here with complaints about the lifts (elevators!)- we didn't have ANY problems. Never having to wait more than 10-30 seconds, this was not an issue whatsoever. Staff all friendly, helpful & welcoming. We used the free luggage store both on our arrival & departure, & had wine & snacks at the bar too. Late check out of 12 allowed us to fit in some last minute shopping & a final visit to Central Park before returning to our room to pack & leave for home. Thank You Park Central- we would definitely stay here again & recommend to friends.

My wife and I went to NY City on business, but were able to combine this with pleasure at the Park Central, a wonderful old hotel with a vast space for just sitting in the lounge under chandeliers that look like solar systems, ordering a drink, or just plugging in your laptop and doing business. No need to book a room if all you want is some surcease from the bustle of 7th Avenue.Our first room was a disappointment, having an A/C unit that leaked and wet the carpeting. But we were immediately given a better room with visual access to the City that never sleeps. We reserved lunch for ourselves and our friends, and we were given a quiet table and allowed to stay as long as we wished over coffee and dessert. Total for four great lunches: only $163, sans gratuity.The Concierge took time to explain what's to be seen and done in the City, providing maps and instructions to landmarks. If you're in need of a cab, just call the doorman and he'll hail you a Yellow Cab. Yellow Cab fare to (or from) JFK is a flat $58, and it's worth it. We took cabs to the theater, as well. The cabs are metered and the drivers are good. The Concierge can also get you Broadway tickets, but if you want to be adventuresome, stroll up Seventh Avenue and find the half-price ticket booths. You'll have to stand in line, but you'll be among friends from all over the world. Not wanting to stand in line, we bought tickets for "Jersey Boys" (not to be missed) from a street hustler, bargaining him down from $75 per ticket to $62.50--and getting great seats.New York City is not inexpensive. I paid $4.75 for a small glass of orange juice at a great restaurant across the street from the Park Central. But you can also walk a couple of blocks from the hotel and get New York pizza for 99 cents a slice, as we did after "Jersey Boys," taking our snack up to the room to eat while watching the Miami Heat win its basketball game.You can stay at the Carlyle for about twice the price as the Park Central. I've been to both and I believe that the latter gives you more bang for the buck.

Why don't hotels have coffeemakers in the rooms any longer? I suppose the answer is that they'd prefer that you buy a cup in the overpriced kiosk in the lobby. The Park Central has "some" coffeemakers that can be requested, but they apparently didn't have one for us.Anyway--the location just south of Central Park is excellent. Walking distance to Broadway, Radio City Music Hall (for our daughter's graduation ceremony from NYU!), to the Empire State Building, etc. The room was very clean, and well maintained for the two nights we were there. I thought it was spacious for a hotel room in NYC, and the beds were comfortable, with a great pillow assortment.Complaints? Well, the aforementioned lack of coffeemaker, and the water pressure in the shower was low.I used Priceline Express so I really can't comment on the value. We were there for a gorgeous spring weekend, and some of the rates I saw online for other hotels were appalling. The valet parking was $58 per night.On the whole, I would definitely recommend the Park Central.

From the moment you arrive, the fresh sent truly welcomes you to this gorgeous hotel. You can definitely tell the hotel has received a major face lift. From the decor, to the close proximity to Times Square and the service we were offered by it's employees I rate this a 4.5 out of 5. The only reason I knocked a half star was due to the wait time for the elevators for floors 1-9. I believe the hotel was at maximum occupancy for a local concert so the wait time was long at times. Elevators for floors 10 + were much smoother. Our room was clean, modern and very comfy. You don't hear a peep at night and that's saying something, since you're sleeping in "the city". All around a great hotel stay!!!!!

Very contemporary hotel with friendly staff. Spacious bar/lounge area with a nice design. Convenient "market" near the front desk which had snacks, sandwiches, breakfast items, and beverages to-go. The room was very clean; beds provided a very comfortable nights sleep. The bathroom was stocked with some lovely smelling shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and lotion. The location was just what we needed..walking distance to Times Square and one end of Central Park. Only downside was the view from the rear of hotel, but not a deal breaker.

My wife and I were pleasantly surprised at the very fine room that we enjoyed at the Park Central in NYC. We had no complaints of any kind, unlike some recent reviewers. The elevators did not cause any wait time as some reported, and we found the location to be perfect, convenient to both Central Park and Times Square as well and Fifth and Sixth Avenue sites. The hotel charges a Services Fee of approximately $21 daily which is not optional and we did not really use any of the services except for WiFi. Management should rethink this charge and find a way to have only "one drive out price" and remove the extra fee.

My wife and I had to spend one night in New York City before our flight from JFK. We should have slept at the airport. Our room was booked through a budget provider, yes, but the Park Central management should be ashamed to put a “guest” in such uncomfortable surroundings. My wife and I had to “take turns” moving between closet, bed and bathroom – that is literally how small the room was. There was not even space for a chair. The window looked onto the airshaft – dark, ugly and foreboding. We did convey our displeasure to the hotel. Their response was to tell us the square footage of our room.

This review is a little late, however my boyfriend and I spent 5 nights at the Park Central in NYC from 1-6 March 2014. The hotel is nice, its clean and tidy with modern furnishings. The room was very small, but that's fairly typical in NYC. It's very close to Time Square and within walking distance to most things.The staff are unfriendly and that was pretty much what let the whole thing down for me. We wouldn't stay there again just for that reason, there are plenty of other hotels in NY to choose from. However if you want a clean, reasonably priced hotel within walking distance to everything it's fine.

We have just returned from 4 nights at the Park Central. Great value for money in a great location. Hotel was clean and modern with great customer service - especially Elizabeth Cacovic. The rooms were a great size. We highly recommend

Two friends and I stayed at the Park Central in May 2014. This was not our first trip to Manhattan, but it was the first time we booked at this hotel. As is normal in NYC, the hotel room was small, but it was clean and kept that way throughout our 4 night stay. We had the towels replaced every day, the room was cleaned and made up every day and that means that our fun and enjoyment of the city wasn't impacted by a lousy hotel experience, so we were very happy with the room. The only complaint we had was the noise from the street. The first night we were there we actually thought there was a window open. There wasn't. To be fair, we were on the 4th floor, but we've stayed on lower floors in another hotel in Manhattan and never experienced this level of noise before. We could even hear the horses hooves on the pavement. That said, we were exhausted enough at the end of the day that the noise didn't impact our sleep, but if you are a light sleeper, maybe request a room higher up, or a room not facing the Avenue. The hotel has been recently refurbished and this shows. The carpets are new and the window treatments and wall coverings are new. The beds were comfortable, and there was no shortage of pillows, if that's important to you.Oh, one other minor complaint. The elevators were SMALL. Luckily this did not seem an issue, as in we didn't have to wait too long for one, but there was once (and only once) when we had to wait because there were too many people for the elevator that arrived. Over all, though, I'd recommend this hotel to friends and family. We did not try the bar or the restaurant.

Found this hotel on my Hotel Tonight app and got a kickass deal. Given the price I was quite pleasantly surprised at how large the room was. Staff was friendly, the room was clean, and the location is excellent, but the best part was the size of the room. Most NYC hotel rooms I've experienced are tiny, so this was a nice change. Highly recommended.

Stayed here for a couple of nights last month. Loved the room. Clean and didn't look as small as the usual NY rooms. An extra $20 charge per day as a compulsory Facilities Fee was a big let down. Perfectly located close to Central Park and Times Square.

We now always choose to stay at The Park Central when in NYC. The location is perfect - cafes on every corner; fabulous Italian restaurants around the corner on W57th; Central Park 5 mins walk; Times Square's dazzling neons just down the road; subway 1 crossroad away; we even caught the "E" line to JFK - $8.75 pp- so easy and direct - 7th ave and W53rd st. Decor and room size make you feel so relaxed and indulged. Beds and bedding are superb. Unquestionable cleanliness. Have stayed at other Manhattan accom but this is the one I highly recommend.

Very friendly staff , awesome service, Elizabeth CacovicWas really helpful ... She rushed my check in process and I was able to check in around 11 am instead of 4 pm .. She is a great person with high level of customer service .. I highly recommend this place and recommend Elizabeth CacovicIn case of any problem or any special requests

In the peak season when all of New york was booked, Mr.Tony , gave us the room we wanted and excellent service . After the renovation the hotel really looks good. Best location , near Times square and a great place to be. My luggage was also taken care of , while i had the whole day in my hand. Whenever in US would only stay in this hotel . One of the best hotel in NYC.

This hotel is just a few blocks from Time Square and Central Park on 7th Avenue so you can walk just about everywhere you want to go in Mid-town Manhattan. We had no problems checking in or out and the room was very clean. There is no mini-bar, refrigerator or coffee maker in the room but there is a Starbucks right downstairs. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.

We stayed here for 3 nights mid-May - and found the hotel to be very clean and spacious. We had 4 adults staying in a room with 2 double beds and had enough room for all of us.The lobby area was very well presented, check in was easy and quick. We never had any issues with the lifts unlike what others have mentioned.
