Rooms were clean and cleaned daily with new towels.Location was brilliant, look out to the left and see Central Park, look out to the right and see Times Square.The only thing we weren't as happy with was the bar prices, which we found to be much higher than expected.Overall, we felt this was good value for money, and wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

This was a really great location as it was close enough to Time Square you could walk but not so close you felt crowded. The rooms were spacious and clean and the staff friendly.We booked a broadway show via the concierge and only found out after we paid an additional $30 PER PERSON to use a broker. This was not told to us and we only found out after the fact when we saw our tickets. They tried to say it was on the agreement we signed even though it was not (believe me I checked) so I would not suggest using them to book a show.We also got a $65 "Facility Fee" for things like Wifi (which we didn't use), and other random things we didn't ask for and had to pay for. The TV was pay only which was annoying (considering we paid $65 for a fee we didn't know anything about)I'd also stay away from the hotel restaurant - insanely overpriced and with plenty of low cost options right next door, it's not worth it to eat there.

First of all I have never been to new york before so I cant compare to other hotels here . We paid an average of $350 per night. The room was not large but did not seem small. It looks like it has been recently updated and is contemporary looking. The location is excellent. The bed is very comfortable. The ventilation is very good- no stuffiness or musty smells. The flip side is that it seems that the air conditioning/ventilation unit runs all the time which is a bit annoying. Aside from that the room is very quiet- no street noise. The room is on the 6th floor and is at the back and faces into the interior courtyard. Despite having a large window facing the courtyard the room is quite dark- although a bit annoying it has meant it is easy to sleep in. We have been here for 3 days but will be staying 4 days. So far the elevators have not been a problem. The is a mandatory exextra daily fee for wifi and such wifi coverage is very good. Although everything seems new, cleanliness could be improved considering thr cost and thst it is supposed to be a 4 star hotel. Wejust used some lysol wipes to go over some surface. The front desk is not overly wsrm or welcoming but there were no problems on check in. Hopefully there will not be problems with check out. Overall this hotel seems a bit pricey but in line with what we saw from other hotels in the area. So far we don't regret staying here.

I have stayed at many hotels in NYC over the years for weekend getaways now that I live in Westchester and this is absolutely the best in location and service. The staff was so courteous and helpful. I will go back every time!

This is our second stay at the Park Central Hotel and the re modernisation of the hotel and bedrooms is of the highest order. The rooms are bright and airy and everything is fresh and new. Location could not be better with Central Park, 5th Avenue and Broadway all just a short walk away.Door men very helpful and Angela and Vito gave us a great welcome at check- in.

When I made the reservation, I requested the quietest room available. I always do this because I am a very light sleeper. When we checked in, the staff were friendly and efficient. We were impressed by our room's chic style and size; by New York standards, it was a roomy room. The bed was incredibly comfortable. I will say that the lamps in the room, while very impressive in styling, didn't exactly make the room bright, so if that's what you look for, bright lighting, you won't be able to acheive it. But I did love the lamps and plan to buy a couple of the same style for my home. The elevators were fast enough for us, unlike other reviewers' experience. The wheels fell off our experience at 11:30 that night. After a long day of traveling we were tucked in and dozing when the guests next door returned to their room. Even over my white noise maker and my ohropax earplugs, I could hear every word the woman was saying to her husband, Eugene. They went on and on and on, until I, despairing of their settling down anytime soon, called the front desk. I requested that they come up and quiet the folks down. But 20 minutes later, "Eugene" this and "Eugene" that. Just as loud as before, but with the television on now. It was then 12:30am and my fantasy of getting up early to energetically explore the City was fading. I called down again, and the front desk phone rang and rang and rang. I hung up, called again. Rang and rang again. It was about 1am at this point. I dressed in something slightly presentable and dragged myself downstairs to the front desk, where I found a big guy in a Hotel uniform. He asked if he could help me and I replied that he could come with me and get these folks to shut up. He came up and was able to get them to quiet down, and about 1:30am I finally got to sleep. I know the City never sleeps, but sometimes visitors want to. Also, do hotel housekeepers even vacuum rooms anymore? I washed and styled my hair one morning and returned to find those same hairs on the black and grey carpet in the same place they had fallen that morning. They stayed there through the next day when in disappointment I picked them up. My test over, I concluded that hotels no longer vacuum. tl;dr Nice rooms, comfy beds, friendly staff, mediocre housekeeping, paper thin walls.

Location is wonderful. Central to the wonders of NYC. Close to theaters and beautiful Central Park. Staff are exceptional; friendly, polite and most helpful. Would definitely stay again and have recommended this to friends who plan to visit NYC

We were pleasantly surprised by our stay last month. We were in town for four days on business and the hotel was all we needed for such a visit. Good walking to Central Park, 5th Avenue, and Fashion District, where we were working. We plan to visit again as people were pleasant, efficient and the price was just right. The Carnegie Deli is next door -- and yes, they deliver late night! Delish.

Very convenient location to Central Park, theaters, restaurants and public transportation anywhere. The rooms are fine, beds comfortable. The elevators are very slow. It's not a bad choice for a moderate, predictable room in NYC.

Great location and beautiful rooms. Did not eat in restrurant but use the the store/coffee facilities and they were delicious and nice to had in hotel! Door men were Very helpful in arranging car service to airport which the driver can also do arrivals if arranged two days ahead. Only disappointment was concierge. Several times given wrong information about subway. Like some lines are closed due to construction from flooding during Sandi storm! They should know this info since it has been under construction for a year. Love the hotel and going back soon! Family and friends were recommended and staying at Park Central end of month and in June.

This hotel is absolutely perfectly situated for easy access to all of NYC. It is within walking distance of Central Park, Columbus Circle, MoMA, Theater District, Linclon Center, and subway stations with all possible lines that can get you anywhere in any borough. The hotel has been newly renovated. Rooms are comfortable, bathrooms OK (although shower water never hot, just tepid). No information about NYC in the room, so come prepared with own information about sights, transportation, etc. Lobby and restaurant beautiful and welcoming, clean, quiet. However, restaurant has very limited and unappealing dinner menu, and bar menu does not have prices for many common beverages on it, making it easy for guest to be confused about bill. We were overcharged for a common cocktail, had to contest the bill. Not pleasant. The restaurant/bar space is beautiful and comfortable enough that it would be worthwhile for hotel to improve the menu and make prices transparent. Would stay away from it unless that happens.

We stayed here 10 days and the location is great! Your right in the center on the street that one way leads to Central Park and the other leads to Times Square. All within walking distance. The staff were super friendly and the hotel was clean. They came every morning to clean and change towels and the hotel was well served.

The best thing about this hotel is its position two blocks from Central Park and in easy walking distance to Times Square and the theatre district. So it is quiet but close to everything. It is also next to a subway station. We were in room 701 which was large but very dark - in fact the only light came from two bedside lamps and a desk lamp. Why no ceiling lights ? The compulsory daily Resort Fee included great wifi and the king bed was very comfortable. On the minus side water pressure from the shower was very poor and there were only 2 small elevators to cover a block of 10 floors.

The hotel was great in terms of location - close walk to Central Park, literally steps from the subway line, and a quick stroll away from Times Square with easy access to entertainment and food all around. Room was decent, although a small fridge would be nice to store leftover food or juices. Everything was clean, and the room was tidy and organized everyday by the time we returned late afternoon. Overall, everything was great. Check out was a quick process though the wait for the elevator was ridiculously long when it was close to check out time. But experience was very positive and will definitely consider staying again.

I was recently a guest on the Rachael Ray Show and they booked me at this great hotel. It was a wonderful place to spend the night. It is only two short blocks to Central Park and four to Times Square. The rooms are clean and bright. The bathroom is one of the best I have ever had in a hotel! The staff was attentive and very friendly. The doorman was awesome! The rooms are small but very standard for New York. I will definitely stay there again!

Not sure how long ago this property was updated (it needed it), it's now really nice. Location is great (between theaters and central park) staff are extremely friendly and when I stayed in May, the price was great.My parents stay every year at the Manhattan Club (a timeshare connected to the Park Central). I've avoided the park central based on past walks through the lobby. Not anymore! Perhaps because my expectations were so low, this property was able to exceed them, but I think it's more than that. The staff (everyone) were extremely friendly (another problem in my opinion regarding typical NYC service staff who just don't care). Management is doing a really good job here. We'll be back.

My husband (fiance at the time) took me to NY for our 5th year anniversary. When we got to the hotel I thought it was very nice..not too far from time square at a decent price. They had construction going on in the lobby at the time but it was still a pretty lobby area. We were able to drop off our bags since our room was not ready and the line was pretty long to check in but it seemed that they were doing their best to move it along. The room was nice, a bit bigger than the average tiny room in NY. The longest part was that my fiance had gone down stairs to get a wine opener and it took about 15 minutes to receive, he waited forever at the desk while someone went to search for one. Also, we checked out of our room and left our bags to be stored while we went to go get breakfast and it took about 15 minutes to get those out as well...no big deal but it just wasn't realy quick service there. I would stay there again if the price is right because the location was great.

As we were visiting friends in New York, I chose the Park Central because it was only a 10 minute walk from their apartment and a five minute walk to Central Park. MOMA, The Met, The Frick Collection all within easy walking range through the Park. Times Square five minutes away. We had booked a Premier King room on a high floor (for light and noise proofing) and the room itself was perfectly fine. Newly decorated and everything working - so far - though carpets a bit grubby. Also, a good size for NY, with extremely comfortable bed. The room was serviced very well every day. No coffee/tea making facilities though and to 'pop' out for coffee when on the 18th floor, with dreadfully slow lifts, not good. Also, no mini bar, so you don't want to forget to take your water up with you - or, with the above-mentioned lift problems - you could lose the will to live!!The bad bits. SERVICE - or complete lack of it, coupled with rudeness and generally surly behaviour. As a first time visitor to NYC, I was completely taken aback!When we arrived, after a long flight on Saturday 3rd May at 6.45pm (Park Central - so you can check who was on Reception!), with our Booking Confirmation from Booking.com, we were told they had NO room. As seasoned travellers we were having none of that - so eventually were told there were no KING rooms. On further pressing and production of our paperwork, we were extremely grudgingly given a key to a room on the 5th Floor. We had specifically booked a high floor - in NY, 5th is definitely not high. With yet more persuasion (after the aforementioned long flight), we finally got a room on the 18th Floor. Very hard work, worst check-in ever, rudest staff I have ever come across - highly recommend a staff training course.Further rudeness in the bar area and general unhelpfulness throughout our stay. It seemed the hotel was chronically understaffed and the staff are NOT HAPPY! For 2 days there was remedial work on the airconditioning system.Our room keys stopped working halfway through the week and we were asked to produce identification (which was in our room, obviously) and then undergo extensive questioning to verify our identity. To get into our own room! No apology though for their shabby service.The lifts are a disaster...only two to service 18 floors. Slow and crowded. Had better experiences in Vietnam and Cambodia.Although this hotel has a newly glitzed Reception area, hairdryers (poor - either very, very slow or blows your head off) and ironing boards in the room this is BY NO MEANS A FOUR STAR HOTEL.Since the only thing to recommend this hotel is the location, I would look in this area but avoid this hotel.

i got this hotel as a recomendation from a friend that used to live in NYC. and that was a good advice.it is hard to find a decent hotel in NYC for a reasonable price, this is one of them. location was excellent, walking distance from times square, broadway, 5th avenue and central park. hotel lobby was cool and trendy. the hotel has a starbucks attached to it and a subway station underneeth it. i had a car with me and parked in one of the public garages in the next block. i actully got a coupon with me and that helped a lot with the garage price. the people who worked in the garage were rude, but i was told that is normal.defenitly recomend this hotel

This hotel is fine, it is clean, rooms made up early, easily walkable to Times Square, centrally located, etc. I only have one problem: Upon check out I find a charge of $20 per night plus tax called a "facilities fee". This surprise entails the availability for your use and pleasure (whether used or not) :, phone service, gym usage, Wi-Fi, internet connection and maybe a few other odds and ends normally included in the price of a room. Even though I did not have a car, I'm surprised I was not charged for parking. I didn't use the gym, phones, or internet, no matter....the charge is there. Apparently included in the room rate is running water, electricity, cable TV and the use of an elevator. This is a terrible business decision to charge separate and apart from the room rate without regard for usage.. Just increase the room rate and you create good will and save your poor desk clerks a lot of grief from irate customers.

Great location good serviice and Manager Lisa Cacovic she made it all possible.It is good to see a smiling face when you first come in and when you stay there and when you are leaving thanks again and see you soonAdnan kefeli

I always stay at the Park Central Hotel for the wonderful, helpful and warm staff and the convenient location to Carnegie Hall, Central Park, Times Square, and Bergdorf Goodman!!!Good price, large rooms, safe hotel. I don't travel to NYC often but when I do I always return to the Park Central Hotel.

Even though it's NYC I was expecting a little more for the money. On arrival there was no one to help us with the bags and my wife and I carried our bags upstairs. Same problem at checkout. There is not enough lighting in the room with only two small lamps and the bathroom lighting. For our side of the hotel there were only two elevators and at peak hours, it was difficult getting on the elevator. The room was ample enough and the bed was very comfortable.

Even though they say it's stated on the Hotwire sight (it certainly wasn't obvious, included in the posted rate...or re-stated at check-in) that there is this additional $20 per night "Amenities Fee", which they say covers Wifi, phone charges, use of the gym and office facilities. You will find this out by having the additional charge bill slipped under your door the day you check-out. When I went down to the desk other guests were there compaining about this as well. This rip-off should at least be explained/re-stated again at check-in and guests should be told there will be this additional per day charge whether these "amenities" are used or not. The not-very-nice Front Desk Manager expalined this was the same type of charge you would incurr at a resort "where it is known as a 'Resort Fee', sir". Scam is more like it. Make sure when booking here you know about this additional charge.

Got the deal through Groupon, the place was busy and under renovations. Staff were pleasant and friendly under trying circumstances. Close to Central Park, where my kids loved following the fireflies *(we don't have them in Toronto). The hotel is close to the

What a let down.I spend 60 to 90 nights a year in hotels all around the world, and this has been a most disappointing experience.I booked a King Suite as part of a surprise to my wife for her birthday. I booked a week or two ahead of the stay. It seemed perfect as we were attending a Carnegie Hall show that night.Location is good, close to the theaters, central park, and several subway lines - although it's a very touristic area.I soon discovered this wasn't the high-end hotel I was expecting; only a regular, average hotel.And that they overbook the place.I was told upon check-in that the room I booked, and for which I received written confirmation, wasn't available. As in, it was never available, it was sold out when I made the booking, I was told; but no one ever picked a phone to let me know what was going on and to offer me an alternative. That is fairly shocking to me as a business owner, and a hint of managerial issues / lack of care for customers (i.e "let people come in, and when they have no other choice, we'll let them know there's a problem so they don't cancel their reservation")They re-booked me in a smaller room with two smaller beds, and handed me a coupon for breakfast and a drink at the bar.None of the person I spoke with, including a manager, really tried to answer my questions; they avoided them with generic answers. They kept interrupting me when I was trying to speak - probably the most frustrating and disrespectful part. I should have just left at this point, but unfortunately the context didn't allow me to - as they hoped.The hotel was relatively clean (although I did see food scraps in the elevators and corridors on a few occasions)There aren't enough elevators (only two elevators for floors 3-9), so they're constantly packed and you have to wait a while before you can go up / down.The room I was re-booked in was on the 8th floor, so we struggled to get good sleep due to the noise outside; apart from that, it was decent and clean.There is no room service, but there is a bar / restaurant downstairs. The bar was OK, serving good cocktails and local brews. Breakfast buffet was OK too (I wouldn't spend $35 on it though, knowing you can have great brunches minutes from the hotel).When we checked out, no one even asked how things went - another sign of a hotel that doesn't care too much about what customers think.I sent feedback but didn't get a response.So, while the place itself isn't terrible, my experience and the way it was handled certainly were, and I think the place is overpriced for what it has to offer.I won't stay here again for sure, and I'll have better hotels to recommend for any friends or relatives visiting the city.

In NYC for some business meetings. Booked this via an OTA by chance as was looking for the most sensibly priced hotel in relation to where most of my business meetings would be. It seemed reasonable at the time for the 3 nights.Nice expansive lobby, great location, you can see Central Park up the road, rooms are large by any standard with a comfy King bed. Its an older hotel that has been fairly extensively renovated. For the price I paid found it a little odd that there was no availability of drinking water, no mini-fridge, etc within the room. The grab and go in the lobby opens a bit late in the morning and closes really quite early so coming back after a full day of meetings to buy a bottle of mineral water didn't work.Great breakfast options around the corner for a coffee and a pastry.One thing I found very strange was the extra $20 levy per night which gets added to your bill

my family and I were booked and prepaid for 2 rooms for 5 days. flight from vegas was cancelled and as such we arrived at the hotel at midnight. we arrived with luggage and a tired 7 year old in tow only to be told that our rooms were given away! what?!?!?! supposedly a big group had their flight cancelled and had kids and thus were given our rooms. wait, it gets better..."don't worry, we have two rooms for you..in new jersey..." again, what - we find out later on it was their sister hotel??? no rooms in new York supposedly as the night manager stated with confidence. we made a total of three calls and found two rooms five blocks away which was supposed to be paid by them. we get to the other hotel and the manager says "this letter is not even signed nor has the letterhead of park central". after thirty minutes of trying to get in touch with the night manager (who "wasn't at her desk" - 130 in the morning????). we paid for the rooms and sent a letter stating exactly what happened to the GM. he NEVER replied. but thanks to booking.com, we got our refund (yes, we refused to go back to the hotel and booked at the intercontinental). lesson learned - hotel chains are better for those that are untried and untested. the staff were too self-serving and not accommodating at all (with the exception of the bellman - good guy) and this policy of giving away PREPAID rooms is just outright ridiculous.

i had a great deal on Booking. otherwise i think this hotel is really expensive. BUT it's worth your money to. like the guy at the front desk told me when i asked if i had a good view from my room. 'it's not the view, but the location' and he was right. close to central park. close to times square. everything you want to have when you spending some time in a big city. you can use the subway but it's really easy to walk to a lot of tourist attractions!Subway (sandwich) across the street for breakfast. but it's nyc when you walk 10 min you have 50 options to do breakfast.

Excellent location and a good dining room are positives for this hotel, but I question whether a hotel which does not offer room service can really qualify for a 4 star/diamond rating. Rooms are adequate with regard to fittings but the room we occupied was on the small size. And no coffee making facilities in the room! It’s a pity that porters/doormen/security don’t go out of their way to open doors for guests; at least you would feel welcome. Often experienced longish waits for elevator. So maybe other hotels in the area would be better option.

This hotel is very reasonably priced for New York. It's clean and well maintained. It can be somewhat busy when it's hosting tour groups. The lobby bar is very good and comfortable. The rooms are spacious but could use another chair. the elevator service is divided by zone and they really need more elevators to serve the Floor 3 to 9 zone. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The concierge is great and can get tickets to just about anything. There are lots of restaurants in the area.

I spent 8 night in this hotel and I can say that there isn't a better place to stay if you want visit The city. All The subways lines have a stop around here, so it' s very easy to get everywhere. Moreover you are 3 blocks far from central park and 5th avenue. The rooms are quite big and clean, the bed is very comfortable. There are just 2 things that I have to say : 1 there is no mini bar in the room and I don' understand Why. 2 the wifi fee is not included in the room cost, but they Will charge it in any case.

My brother and I made a last minute trip from AZ to the City, and decided to book this hotel last minute. While all the amenities were nice, the customer service provided was fantastic! Upon check out we stored our bags with the concierge so we could wander around and not have to lug our bags. When we came back to the hotel we stumbled upon a Loooooooooong line of guests waiting to pick up their bags. Not expecting that this was going to be the case and we were going to be late trying to get to the airport and our ride was waiting for us, Elizabeth stepped in and saved our day, and quickly retrieved our bags so that we could get on our way. She was very polite and helpful, and because of her I will make this my first choice when I visit again!Thanks Elizabeth for all your help!

I stayed at Park Central in April 2012 and had such a great experience that I returned in April 2013. I was amazed at the stylish refurbished room which I got for a great rate. The location is unmatchable and the service excellent. It is April once again and I yearn to return to this wonderful NYC hotel but unfortunately it is not possible this year.

The company had booked us into this hotel and we were a little alarmed by all the poor reviews plus on their website it said you had to pay for in-room wifi. So with that in mind we split our stay in NYC with the second week at another reputable hotel that offered free wifi and it's Tripadvisor reviews were much more kind. Having stayed a week at the Park Central and a week at the other - we kinda wished we'd spent the two weeks at Park Central. Since it's highly publicised refurbishment - the room we stayed in on the 9th floor was actually really nice and annoyingly the wifi was free! D'oh!Pros - location. It's within easy walking distance of Central Park, the theatres, the subways, a fabulous coffee shop next door called Tisserie and a sensational Brooklyn Diner around the corner for breakfasts. The rooms are very nicely done and the mattress in our room was very new. We had glimpses of Carnegie Hall from the room which was nice. The toiletries from a local alchemy store were super cool and appreciated. Cons - small things but they all add up. Yes the checkin service was efficient but lacked soul as did the general staff peppered throughout the lobby area. So much so we didn't feel terribly welcome to even visit the lobby bar. The rooms are NYC small - that means a room and plenty of wall knocking. The TV size matched this. For a king size bed the TV also needed to be size graded up. In the bathroom - and yes I know its all the rage at the moment - but the lights built into the frame of the mirror were way too bright and provided strange alien-like halos in your eyes. Very disconcerting. Last but not least - there wasn't a single trip in the two lifts were one was not malfunctioning. This is over a week. Engineers hop on it I say!Recommended: Yes. But only if you get a really really competitive rate.

This could be a great hotel if they'd pay attention to the small things that guests expect from a full service hotel. Until then, it's a mediocre experience.I had to stand out in the rain in my dress clothes and try to hail a cab for 20 minutes because thee was nobody out front to help me get a cab-- sorry, but that is inexcusable in this town. Hire some help. No room service! Food menu at bar was very strange (or maybe just not to my taste-- very heavy food.) Limited restaurant hours. Fitness center was nice, but very hot. And, only 1 small working elevator for so many rooms! What's up with that? No hot water in shower one morning. Bed was comfy, room was clean and larger than is typical for Manhattan. Great hi def television. And like I said, nice fitness center. So, there were some good things, and I guess the negatives I posted above are why this place has rates better than others nearby. It seems like if they'd make an effort to fix the little things, this could be a great hotel.

While on business, I was staying at a place near NY Presbyterian and though it was close to the hospital. ...It was awful. I looked on line for a deal and ended up at the Park Central. Quite pleasantly, I found the rooms clean ( small, but it is New York). Comfy beds and a great environment. ..Happy I made the move.

we can say we have our "home " in NY. Why?- incredible location 2 blocks from Central Park. N, R, Q metro line at hotel doors!- free super high speed wifi- great bedding and shower experience- state of the art gym- causal coffee place at the lobby- super efficient guest service The reservations team is very helpful, specially TOny. Enjoy!

This has to be one of the most impersonal hotel experiences I have had, and it has nothing to do with the hotel being in NYC. I agree completely wit another review that says it seems the hotel runs itself and management is 'whatever'. Upon arrival the staff was courteous but hurried and impersonal. There were 2 people only tending to a lne of people waiting, and we did not arrive at a busy moment, since I saw longer lines on other days. There were more personell spots but there were empty, which was recurrent even when the lines were full with big groups arriving.The rooms were clean and the location central, yes, but that is about all this hotel has going for it. That and an obsessive aromatherapy going on upon entrance to refreshen your senses everytime you come in from the street. Period.Cleaning staff met during the morning hours looked one over as a nuisance, instead of any sign of sympathy for paying the room (not cheap necessarily), which pays their wages. The room was provided for with 1 soap and 1 handlotion, and the lotion ran out after the second day, yet the staff did not replace with another at all. The towels were one day only re-hung, as opposed to having clean ones put in. There was no welcome anything (literature, flyer, hotel ammenities, description, city information, anything at all) on the room we stayed in. Very impersonal. My daughter got sick and I went to the front desk to see if there were any thermometers available, and was instructed to go to Duane Read two blocks down. For a parent travelling this means either exposing the child again to the cold weather which is ailing them or leaving the kid alone in the room. There was NO hint of empathy or any help offered at all when I mentioned this to the man at the front desk, which tops again on the we dont care impersonal attitude throughout the whole stay.This was further acentuated when I went to check out and there was a big line of people checking in. I approached the front desk with my bill in hand and asked a woman if I could ask her something when she had a second, since she was tending to a check in. She rebutted with a 'Cant you see I am with someone' to which I told her I was checking out. She called another woman who was tending to the long line of group check in, who in a very rude manner asked what was it that I wanted. I explained I was cheking out and wanted to make sure all was ok and had a doubt about a 'Facilities Charge' included. She explained that was a standard charge for facilities, gym, wifi and general facilities.This charge was NEVER explained or specified at check in. My rate had free WIFI, but alas!, it was not free at all, I was being charged for it at the end. When I explained this to her she made a quick math and said "Well since you stayed 5 days that's about $20 something a day". At this point I gave up, since there was no purpose in having any more talk with this woman and just wanted to leave the hotel.This morning I received a standard marketing email survey on how my stay was, and part of what I am posting here is my reply to them. What irony that they have all their marketing set up really well, but the real experience itself falls quite short of it all. Lack of management, sympathy, empathy and just basci common sense so customers like it, reccommend it, and return, none of which I will be doing.

The description sounds good but the hotel really isn't up to the mark. Rooms may have been recently refurbished but maintenance isn't great...carpets look grubby already and corners are dirty and not vacuumed. Bathroom was clean though and so was the bedlinen. Amenities are nonexistent. No fridge or minibar, but they did bring one, as well as a coffee maker, when I requested them.The phone has a button for room service which I pressed many times without connecting and then when I called Guest Response I was told the hotel doesn't even have Room Service! Elevators are small and on the 9th floor where i was, there's a long wait. Service across the board is terrible- except for the maintenance person who brought the refrigerator who was very polite. When I entered an open elevator at lobby level and pressed the button for my floor several times it refused to register. On bringing this to the attention of the lobby manager I was told "you've got to press the button"- as if their guests don't know that! Finally he conceded he would need to call the engineer!Wi-Fi, which is one of the amenities I paid extra for, is sketchy and very often goes off and comes back, on its own and without warning......and in fact went off twice while writing this review!Location is good- just off Central Park South, a couple of blocks from Columbus Circle, but that's about the only positive thing one can say about this hotel. I would not stay here again.

Park Central is located conveniently near Time Square, great shopping, and subways. The room was clean and the hotel itself is nice. However, it's as if no one works there and the hotel is a machine that runs itself. Housekeeping and the doormen were very nice, but everyone else was clueless. We put in a request online for a refrigerator at least 4 days before our arrival. We even called to confirm the request. We arrived at the hotel early in the morning, before 10 AM, and were assured that we'd have the refrigerator in our room by the time we returned in the evening from our full day's excursions. When we returned... no refrigerator. My husband called to request that one be brought up. They said they would bring one up shortly. It never arrived. Not once did anyone mention that they did not have a refrigerator available. To the contrary, we were constantly assured that we would receive one, yet we never did. Our room was warm for the entire 5 day, 4 night stay even though our air conditioning unit was set to auto and 65°. What's so strange is that the temperature outside was 45° to 60° the entire duration of our trip. Yet the room was very warm. Lastly, as I pulled out some tissue from the tissue box in the bathroom, a medium-sized black bug came out with it. It was alive and crawling. I have a videotape to prove it. We had a very busy itinerary, and rather than compromise our plans by moving to possibly an even warmer room, we chose to bear the warmth and throw away spoiled food. We mentioned all of these things to a hotel manager the night before our departure. She viewed the video of the bug, asked me to email it to her, and listened about the refrigerator and warm room. However, she showed little concern or desire to redeem the hotel's reputation. We certainly aren't needy, but I know about good customer service. If it were my hotel, and guests were paying over $400 a night, I would've shown good faith by at least offering a free breakfast as an apology for all the money lost in spoiled food. We, however, did find a solution by giving away several days worth of food to the homeless once we truly realized we were not going to get a refrigerator. Management really needs to step it tremendously because they solely are ruining what could be a great hotel. And I know how management loves to write redeeming rebuttals on this website, however, if they truly cared, it's something that should have been done face-to-face when I told them about the issues we were having.

Recently I stayed at this place while attending a work conference for New York State. At check-in my colleague mentioned that the special New York State tax form was faxed to the office in advance, to speed along the check out process later. The desk clerk said he couldn't fine it, and would we talk to him later. So, we had our secretary re-fax the same form, and this time it was received. No problems right? Wrong. The replacement clerk for one of us said, "No problem!", and was quite cheerful. The other clerk was definitely rude, and said she would have to talk to a manager since we were using our own credit cards for payment. She doubted our word that NYS doesn't give out corporate credit cards (as if), and insisted on photocopying our ID, business cards, basically wanting our first born. And then, since we left over the weekend, conveniently the business manager would have to handle to matter on Monday. Charmaine Warren said she would contact us with further information about our refund ($153 each) and she still has not done so. Not only is this illegal, but their attitudes were astonishingly rude. Will never stay there again, and will tell all my campus colleagues to avoid the place too.

Exellent staff, very, very friendly and competent and the location is also quite good, just a few minutes from Columbus Circle, Central Park and not far from Times Square or Rockefeller. Lots of coffee and food nearby, for example the surprisingly good Szechuan Gourmet on 56th, just around the corner and over Broadway, maybe 5 mins from PC.The Rooms are ok, a little short on table space and the double beds are as we all know by now not really double, but rather one-and-a-half. The bathroom's nice, though initially not completely clean (also not really bad, just a few minor things), but a nice lady named Marie Paul made it sparkle.The one thing that's quite bad in the Park Central are the lifts, they're not for the impatient. There are 8 elevator shafts on the plan, each with a capacity of 8-10, but only two serve a group of floors like 3 to 9 which results in frequent waiting and long queues at check-in time (hint: don't check-in at 4pm if possible, wait until ~6pm).I was already planning to try another hotel next time as there are so many in this price range south of Central Park, but then I read on the invoice that they offer a hefty rebate on my next stay, more than enough to offset the only negative point, so I'll probably be back :)

The Park Central is a really nice hotel located across the street from Carnegie Hall. The remodel seems to be completed. There are plenty of delis and restaurants nearby to make dining choices easy. Not too far from TS and the theatre district bur far enough away from the noise. My only complaint is the same as others who have stayed at the PC and that is the lack of elevators to accommodate the number of guests. There was always a tremendous wait for them regardless of which direction you were headed. My advice to have an enjoyable stay at the Park Central would be to request a low floor and take the stairs.

We stayed Apr.19-23/2014. The hotel was quite booked (because it is close to Central Park and Carnegie Hall it is always busy) and there was ALWAYS a long lineup for the elevators! In desperation we climbed 9 flights instead of the interminable wait, not a happy project after walking for hours in New York. There are not enough elevators to service this hotel, AND the elevators are small. Everyone was complaining. Even if this hotel were half the price I will NEVER stay here again.

Location is good, near Central Park and the theater district. It seems overpriced, however. The staff is distant and not very friendly, except for the bellman who got us transportation to the airport. It was a private car for the same price as a taxi, and was more comfortable. The walls are thin. Even on the 9th floor, the street noise was quite audible. One night the people in the next room had a noisy party until quite late. Restaurant and bar quite expensive. One night we had a drink in the bar. The price for 2 drinks, a shot of bourbon and a glass of wine was $42 including a tip! I realize that New York is expensive, but this is ridiculous! The housekeeping carts are stored in the hall, which I find very tacky.

I was in NYC with a group, singing at Carnegie Hall, which is right across the street! That's why they chose the hotel, because it is totally undistinguished otherwise. Rooms are reasonably comfy, wi the typical tiny bathroom. But the elevators are not up to the task of moving large groups of folks. One was broken throughout our five day visit, and there were two times when NONE of the elevators worked. I hiked up to the 4th floor several times rather than wait. Once I picked up the phone and called the front desk,and was directed to a service elevator, the only working one in the building...staff were doing their best, and again, the rooms themselves weren't bad, but the adventure of access was not fun!

Woke at 8:40 to hammering and drilling into my wall. A request at check-in for a quiet room away from elevators resulted in a room that shares a wall with the maintenance elevator room. Got fed up and went over to give the guy a piece of my mind. I said it wasn't even 9. He said it basically was, but he didn't mind waiting "a few seconds" if it made me happy. It was 8:55 but the work started at 8:45. Security apologized, guy should have waited till 9 to work on routine pipe work. ROUTINE PIPE WORK AT 8:45! This can't wait? He doesn't have a list of things to do that don't require drilling into a guest's wall first thing in the morning? Other than that; interior king room has no street view, "cleaning" lady only changed the towels and made the bed, and mattress is so worn in the middle it's like sleeping in a bowl.

The hotel has a great location just a few blocks from Times Square, has a subway station in the corner and 3 blocks to the Central Park, everybody is very nice and helpfull, has many good restaurants near and some rooms has Times Square views

I paid $1400 for 3 nights. 2 nights was $480 something each night. Not a bad hotel, but definitely over priced for what they have to offer. Location was great. You can see Central Park to the left and Time Square to the right. I didn't mind the price, however it's definitely not a 4 star hotel.

My family and I have stayed for the third time at Park Central and as usual we had a wonderful experience thanks to Elizabeth. The hotel was recently renovated and we could see great improvements. I would defenitelly recommend it.

This hotel had a near perfect location for sightseeing. The room was good and the bed was big and comfortable. Unfortunately the safe could not be unlocked by us on two successive days, so we had to request security. The wait was about half an hour each time and needed phone calls to speed things up. Lost faith in safe so did not use for last day. Also, long wait at reception on arrival and air conditioning machines outside were a constant annoyance through the night.

We stayed here in December 2013, the hotel was fantastic value, with staff assisting us with any request. The room was a good size, with two queen beds (very comfy) and spotless. Housekeeping was efficient and the room was left sparkling every day. There can be a bit of a wait for lifts, but it was an extremely busy time of year. The gym is also very well equipped. Suggest booking room on a higher floor overlooking 7th Avenue. For the price we paid in Manhatten, over Christmas, it was fantastic value. They have a coffee shop downstairs and let's face it, it's New York, you can buy anything, anywhere, anytime! Loads of great coffee shops and shops nearby. Only negative is the price of wifi, they should think about including this in the room price.

Had a great stay at the park central hotel. The hotel itself is very modern and in a fantastic location. We were charged an extra $20 for internet that we didn't intend to use but didn't care because the front desk was so accommodating! We showed up at the hotel at noon when guest were still checking out, not only did they give us a clean room but they were able to handle our late request for two beds instead of one.The room was clean and again, modern. The beds were comfortable and the hotel room was a comfortable size for our family of four. We checked out at 8 am and the hotel held our luggage all day for us with no fee.We lucked out getting this hotel on priceline and would definitely stay here again.

This is a good 4-star hotel located just blocks away from Central Park in the Midtown area. I won this one on Priceline for $184/night (a bit high, due to the NY Auto Show driving prices up). Upon walking in the first thing I noticed was the fresh scent that was in the air, then the well groomed common areas leading to the registration desk. The clerk there was friendly and upgraded me to a Premier room, which later turned out to be a worthless description. There was NOTHING premier about this room, even though the agent indicated that the room was slightly larger. The room was nicely decorated with modern touches and had everything you'd expect. The room however had several issues that I noticed...there was NO coffee pot, no refrigerator, and the restroom door does not open completely. It hits the toilette at a 45-degree. You have to open the door, walk yourself into a corner next to the toilet then close the door to access the toilet or the shower! I cannot believe that an architect thought this was appropriate. If you are disabled or handicapped in any way, this is a serious ADA concern. Every time I went into the restroom I got upset about this again. Park Central FIX THIS!!!! (Room 1140)Otherwise, the room itself was ok. The hotel is steps from Carnegie Hall and some good eateries.

While the Park Central may have undergone a refurbishing that upgraded the dreary lobby and dirty rooms (we've stayed there before and decided to give it another chance only because of the remodelling and the fact that they did have rooms with two queen beds, something unfortunately hard to find in midtown), it is still beholden to allowing teen age tour groups to take the place over. We had the misfortune to be an individual family in the midst of "tour group hell" that meant fighting our way through tour groups taking over the lobby distributing dinner and waiting often over 15 minutes simply to get on the elevators (which are under-capacity even for normal use) when groups descended en-masse going to and from their rooms and then being forced to stuff ourselves into elevators if we had any hope of getting to and from our room, and in one case literally having an open plated Pastrami sandwich almost stuffed down my jacket. Combined with rooms that did have a makeover so that they were at least serviceable, but nothing to write home about given we were still paying over $430 a night including a mandatory "facilities fee" (read "WiFi charge") of $20 per night for marginally functioning WiFi service. You can do MUCH BETTER in NYC without trying very hard.

It is a nice hotel. Had a good breakfeast and the accomodations were good, including the bed that was very good. It was an old building but nothing to complain about it. The rooms could be a little bit bigger (we were staying in 3, and it was a little bit difficault to accomodate us three).

It is an excellent hotel in Manhattan.Nice rooms, excellent location (7th avenue at 2 blocks from Central Park), kind front office persons.All facilities and rooms were recently renewed.I definitely recommend it.

This hotel has nice rooms and a very good location. The service in the reception was very bad. The lifts take forever to get up to the floor you are on. There is no coffee machine in room, no machine to buy drinks in the hallway, so you need to go downstairs to get anything. There is no roomservice either.They charge you a facility fee of 21 USD per night. This is probably for the "free internet".All in all not worth paying 400 USD for pr night as I had to do.

This hotel has nice rooms. The location is good. There it ends. Reception staff was totally not up to standard. A total mess with 20 people waiting in the reception area and one person working there. Another time I came down there was noone there in line but I was still asked to go between the ropes and wait. Two seconds later I was called to the counter.,The lift takes forever to come. Expect waiting 5 minutes for a lift. There is no coffee in room, so to get a Nespresso you have to go to a small shop in reception and buy it. I had a prepaid room but they charge a facility charge of 21USD for internet and stuff even if you dont use it. This you wont know about before you leave.

Besides cleanliness, what I really consider important is the location. That's why I usually stay at the Park Central. I've stayed there more than six times and I intend to stay there again the next time I go to New York.

This newly renovated hotel was a real find. It is across from Carnegie Hall, near the theater district, 2 blocks from Central Park and close to Lincoln Center. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The Bar/Lounge area is great.

The hotel is centrally located to Central Park, Time Square and all the important shopping areas in the city thus is very good for people who enjoys walking around like me. The room is very comfortable and clean. The only thing which annoyed me was there are many hidden charges which are not known until the time you check out, like this USD 20 per day/person service fee for services which I never used during my stay. The other issue is all those taxes; city, state and other what not taxes which can add up quite a bit to the total hotel bill. Making international call can be extremly expensive. I almost had a heart attack when I saw the bill. It costs more than USD 50 to USD 70 for a 2 or 3 minute call at the most. Better ask the receptionist where one can buy a call card from the news stand. Otherwise, had a very pleasant stay at the hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful when you need something from them.

I would highly recommend Park Central to any traveler. The staff was extremely personal and helpful in every way possible. The location is close to lots of major attractions and the food was top shelf.

I visit New York a couple times a year and tend to stay away from Midtown cause of all the tourist chaos, this time, I found a good deal at Park Central and decided to give it a shot. I'm glad I did. Service was great, the room was clean and spacious, and the location was ideal for what I wanted to experience. When I stay in New York, I like to move around the city and Park Central is real close to most of the major subway lines that run through Manhattan. It's only a couple blocks from Central Park and it was close to some place I wanted to eat at - Ma Peche and Betony.As I understand it, Park Central has recently undergone some renovations and updating. One morning there was a problem with the elevators and had to use the service elevators, but the issue was resolved by afternoon. There was no refrigerator or clock/radio in the room - which is a bit different. While it wasn't much of an issue while I was there, it didn't seem that the heat/ac was working in my room. If the weather was colder, it might have become an issue.In the end, I've added Park Central to the top of my list of places to stay when I visit New York.

Great value for money when I stayed in February 2014, with great location for midtown. Very helpful staff and lovely breakfast. They were very accommodating when I nearly got snowed in. Very spacious room to, for New York.

Our overall experience was very good. Recently renovated, comfortable beds, good sized rooms for the price and kind attention from personnel. The only issue is that they charge you a US$21 "mandatory" fee per day for Internet (which we did not use) and other hotel services such as luggage storage. I think that they should just add that amount to the room rate as you cannot request waiver for this service fee. We would have appreciated that they would have told us this from the beginning.

Park Central is on 7th avenue at 56th making it an incredibly convenient location for all things midtown. This includes Central Park, Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Columbus Circle, Rockefeller Center, and all the shopping and sites that come with this area. It's also very convenient to the subway to head downtown and cabs are plentiful for whisking you back to the airport or other parts of the city. It's a big hotel popular with large tour groups. The lobby is huge and has a couple of different gathering locations. Check in was quick and the staff was very friendly. I asked for and received a high floor room. The corner king non-smoking was large by NY standards. Two big windows let in lots of light. A large credenza with drawers and ample desk space along with a large bench, a chair and ottoman , and two large side tables make up the furniture in the bedroom and there is still plenty of floor space left over. A large double closet had plenty of hangers, a luggage rack, extra pillow, and the usual amenities (iron, etc.) The bathroom is also large with ample counter space, great hot water, and a big shower. The hotel looks recently updated in a mid-century modern meets urban style. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Stylish without being particularly unique. This could be one of many hotels in this area as it isn't particularly clever in its design, but the location is what sets it apart. I have stayed in the nearby Parker Meredien and would rate this hotel equal in size, amenities, and comfort. However, this hotel is about $100 less per night than the Parker. If you don't mind big hotels and are looking for convenience and value in midtown, this is a great option.

This was our first time in new york and this hotel is an excellent location for central park Times square fifth ave shopping and easy access to tour buses. We stayed for a week and had a great experience staff were friendly helpful and we had no problems getting g the lift we were on 17th floor. We read a lot of not good reviews but we could not say that that was our experience .Susan and Godfrey

Location between Central Park and Times Square excellent.Hotel OK but just a bit over-priced for what it is. This is not too much of an issue as you are not going to be in the room for too long when in New York - there is just so much to do out there!Our issue was with the reception and bar staff (exception being one receptionist who was excellent). They appear to base their service on their perceived potential to gain tips. Rich looking older people and business types, they are all over. Turn up at reception in jeans and a polo shirt (because you have been walking around New York all day and are returning to the room to freshen up and change in to smarter clothes for your evening meal) and they give the impression you are not really their sort of people.In the words of Pretty Woman "Big mistake.....Huge!" as I am a fairly generous tipper. The hotel lost out as we did not want to eat where we were not made feel welcome.

a good hotel for those who are fond of new york midtown. the hotel is nothing special, the rooms are neither large nor small, clean and equipped with everything you need. what we love is location - close to the central park, times square and boutiques. we stayed at this this hotel three times and consider it to be a good choice

An excellent hotel within a stone's throw of Carnegie Hall. There are many tourist groups of all ages which is not a problem except for elevator use. When a group leaves or returns en masse, the waiting for an elevator can be significant. Using the stairs became a necessity at times. The woman who attended our room, Monique, was very friendly and responsive to our requests. The hotel staff is very attentive which is no small accomplishment given the number of guests. Security came immediately when I entered the wrong code for the lock box. In all, very satisfactory!

The location could not be better, if you want to stay in mid Manhattan, near Carnegie Hall, Central Park, Fifth Avenue, Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle and Time Square. All these attractions are within walking distance. There are many restaurants and shops around. The place is well kept and clean.We slept very well, the mattresses are comfortable.Toiletries are also excellent, from a nearby shop.The staff is friendly and helpful, they do not press you and they try to accomodate your needs.I highly recommend this hotel.

I find it hard to believe that the other reviewers and I stayed at the same hotel. We stayed two nights in a classic king room #655. If this hotel had recent renovations they are already tired looking. The room was so small and the furniture so oversized that it was uncomfortable to be two people in the same space. When you open the dresser drawers they hit the end of the bed so unpacking was awkward. No desk chair because it wouldn't fit it there was one. Clearly the designer needed to be told that one size does not fit all when it comes to hotel rooms. This was our second room - the first had a desk chair but no other chair to sit in. The first room also had a broken toilet seat and a broken bathtub drain - there were parts sitting in the tub. The only place to read a newspaper or do some work was by sitting on the bed. Apparently only two elevators serve the entire wing of the hotel where we were staying. We had to wait in a line to take an elevator to our room when returning in the evening. This hotel seems popular with large groups of tourists - particularly students. While the location is great, the lobby bar quite nice, the staff friendly and the room relatively quiet on the 6th floor above street level , the rooms we saw were abysmal. Even at a discounted rate, I would not stay here again.

We attended Vision expo in March, the renovation of the hotel is great.the rooms are very nice and the service was very good. For sure we are going to stay again in this hotel in our next visit to New York

The experience we have had in New York was like living a very pleasant dream that you dont want to wake up from. Staying at the hotel just made that experience that much more exciting,fun and dream like. The hotel staff is amazing friendly helpful and exceeds your hotel expectations. The hotel is situated in midtown therefore if you choose to have a relaxing walk in Central Park or exciting night in the town you are a 10 min walk in each direction. Access to a train station is a 1 min walk from the entrance. Your room is exactly what one needs after a day out in New York. Interior design is relaxing and comfortable, it is always clean and gives you a feeling of a home. Thanks to all the Park Central staff our stay is unforgetable and they will be seing more of us.

This was my 15th visit with a group to NYC, and our 7th stay at Park Central. A lot has changed since we were last here! Many updates to the lobby and rooms. The beds were SO comfortable. My entire group was on the same floor, which made it easy to keep up with everyone. We had great success with the subway, which is literally right around the corner.WONDERFUL time! We will be coming back!!

I attend a vision conference in the city every year and I always love to stay at the Park Central! The beautiful new renovations are beautiful and I always feel so at home there. The service was impeccable from the moment I entered the hotel. The room was beautiful! A must try the next time you visit New York City. I love being so close to Central Park!

We probably stay there again! Great location, friendly and helpful staff, comfortable room and big for a hotel room in NYC. My rate isn't excellent just because they offer a small store inside that was always closed, an because of the amenities, a hotel like this could use better amenities

I would stay here all the time if I got the rate I did!! Made it affordable...unfortunately, like all the other hotels, it can be $300+ more the next time you look! Very convenient location and amenities!! Just wish they had a coffee pot in the room or room service...instead, I went to the lobby to get it..not a horrible complaint but I need my coffee without having to brush my teeth first and look pretty!! ;)

Location is perfect for all upper midtown manhattan activities. Always felt safe going out alone, even at 3am. Subway right next to hotel will take you right downtown for ground zero/statue of liberty tours. Rooms were good size, esp for NYC, and at a very comparable rate. Staff were very attentive and accommodating, always willing to help. Would absolutely stay here again.

Park Central was just that, central to everything and anything one would want to do in NYC! Carnegie Hall, Radio City Music Hall, The Diamond District, The Rock, Time Warner Center, Tratorria Arte, the Park, etc...and that is all within walking distance. Not to mention all the transits of cabs, cars, subway stations proximally to the hotel.

Judging by location and friendliness, this was probably my best NYC hotel experience. I accompanied my daughter on a job interview, and the hotel was amazing. Quiet rooms, comfortable beds, and friendly and helpful staff plus a great location. See Jaybebee's comments and I agree with them.

It's a great location across the street from Carnegie Hall, two blocks south of Central Park, close to Rockefeller Center, and just north of Times Square. The staff are very helpful and friendly, and it's a very clean hotel with decent size rooms for Manhattan. The lobby and restaurant/bar area are very nice (restaurant food is OK).

We chose to stay again at Park Central due to its location. We knew that the hotel had been renovated since our last stay and we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived in our bedroom. Cool calm décor and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was bijou but clean and the shower was good. Yes the reception was very busy with people milling around each time we passed by but this didn't affect us when we needed assistance;we were dealt with promptly. The staff were professional and courteous rather than friendly. Being British I would have loved a kettle in the room for tea rather than just a coffee maker, and I was disappointed to find the small coffee shop was closed when we arrived but did take advantage of it the following morning and enjoyed a drink to go! I would recommend the hotel, it is ideally situated for shopping and theatres.

Perfect Location to the Subways for businessExcellent Room (like the inside corner with the desk looking out the window as I worked.Service ExcellentNever used the food restaurants or service.Front Desk helped me split my bill into different components for personal vs. business expense.

The location of this hotel is great, Central Park is right there, couple blocks to Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue, subway, etc. The hotel its self is just ok. Lobby looks nice, and so do the common spaces, rooms, and bathrooms. What it lacks is cleanness and attention to detail like bedding, which is quite sloppy for 4star hotel. It might not seem like a big deal, but when the sheets don't fit the bed and common bedding that is reused is exposed to be used, I get iffy..Also the carpet and the room itself although nice in appearance , is not very clean. As others mentioned no fridge, coffee, and room service, which is little odd for 4star. Overall, it is an ok hotel to stay in.

I spent one night for the Macys parade (probably not the best date) hotel was incredibly crowded, I waited in line with my mom on a wheel chair in order to do check in, rude staff, room was far from the elevator, wheelchair hardly fit through the corridors, while in the room there was a fire alarm, I got really scared because of my mom situation... finally it was a false alarm.There where another elevators but where apparently on maintenance, so the only 4 available where incredibly slow, it took like 10 minutes to wait for it.For 600 usd a night, I had to take my bags to my room, no breakfast, no wifi, and difficult accessibly room. Definitely not my best option in NY. I expected more.Room was nice, thought there was a hair in the bathroom.

We had a great stay at this hotel. We booked and checked in at 10h00 normally check in time was 16h00 but the front desk was able to check us into a room. Great hotel great service totally saved our trip to New York City.

Spent the weekend with my husband and we had such an enjoyable stay! The hotel is clean, comfortable, and relaxing. It has all of the modern amenities anyone could possible need. It's right on 7th avenue, but you wouldn't know it inside the hotel, all was very quiet. The location is perfect...close to Central Park, Times Square, Theatre District, 5th Avenue shopping, and the Rock to name a few. The room was spacious, the bed was so cozy (amazing pillows!), and the bathroom was very clean. Everyone that works there was incredibly friendly and nice. It's definitely our hotel of choice when we go back!

Spent a weekend here with some girlfriends who were visiting NYC and could not have been happier! We had two great corner rooms on the 18th floor, one which looked out at Times Square, and even though we were right on 7th Avenue, all was quiet. The rooms were great, too; modern in design with comfy beds and a great shower (just could've used a little more light).I didn't interact with the staff too much, but they seemed to be attentive and friendly. Friends enjoyed coffee from the shop downstairs. I think as long as you're aware of the facilities fee ahead of time, and know that there isn't room service, you'll be just fine here! The location was perfect, and we couldn't have asked for a better weekend.

I have been a regular bar lounge guest of your hotel for several months now. My co-workers and I have always enjoyed the relaxing, atmosphere and the wonderful service that we received. However, about a week or two ago we had a very disheartening and disappointing experience. One of your servers, I believed she was of Hispanic descend, treated us disrespectfully and rudely.Her entire demeanor was inappropriate and certainly not up to what the park central hotel requires of their employees. I know you would want to be made aware of this because if this is a constant occurrence on her part it may keep good customers away. We certainly appreciate the manager, Peter apologizing for her behavior and taking care of our check.

Stayed as part of deal with taking part in Manhattan Club timeshare presentation. Newly renovated room was very clean. Beds were very comfortable. Convenient location being close to Broadway/Times Square. Only complaint was that maid came in at 9am when checkout isn't until noon.

Park Central Hotel always exceeds my expectations and is my go to hotel when staying in the city. From the time I walked through the doors I was treated as though I was their most valued customer. Elizabeth, the desk manager ensured that my room was up to par and everything I needed was in order. In addition to Elizabeth, the concierge, valet staff, and cleaning staff were all very friendly and accommodating. Staying in the city you can quickly compromise the cost with roominess and class. However, Park Central has the perfect balance between value and price, room size and comfort, classy decorations with up to date high tech aminieties. Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, Subway lines, and the best possible dining experience(s) awaits you within a few strides of the hotel. Park Central Hotel will always be my choice of accommodations when visiting the city.

While the hotel is nice, dishonest practices can't be tolerated. At check-in you are told for the first time about the "facilities fee", which wasn't in the price you were seeing when choosing this hotel. I asked what facilities I was getting for this fee and the person at the desk said room phone and the one free drink coupon (which required buying a meal!!). When I asked him how many calls he thought I'd be making from the room phone in the year 2014 he just smiled. AVOID.

Just finished a weekend in the renovated Park Central Hotel and was very impressed. The room and bath were very clean, well decorated and furnished--even down to a toilet seat that did not slam down. The TV was large and HD--although the remote did need a new battery. Liked the new dinning room also. The staff was very cheerful and helpful, the food was good.

We visited New York last week with my family and found the Park Central through a recommendation from a friend. The location could not have been more perfect. Close to everything we wanted to see and do. The hotel is within an easy walk of CentrL Park, 5th Avenue shopping, Times Square, Theatre District and of course great restaurants. We coined the staff at the hotel extremely helpful and very personable. The new shop in the lobby has a great fast breakfast if you are on the run. The rooms were a nice size and beds were very comfortable. The thermostat in our room was not working properly so it was a little warm but ok. Everything else about the room was great to include housekeeping. I will stay at the Park Central on my next trip and recommend it to all my friends.

Good value for NYC considering we booked the room last minute, very near subway, central park and nearby neighborhood establishments to dine and drink. My only complaint would be the facilities fee that they tack on. Especially since the kitchen wasn't even open while we were there. Not sure what the fee was for to be honest, I guess to help supplement the construction?

Ok call me crazy but for a "high end nyc hotel" there is zero room service at all???? No coffee in the room or anything. But yet on the phone there is a button to call for room service. I don't get what I paid for. Definitely won't stay here again. Learned the hard way. Don't be fooled by the slick lobby. Waste of cash.

I booked and prepaid for my hotel room at Park Central. Upon checking out, I noticed that I was being charged a $60 "facilities fee" on top of what I had already paid. I asked the front desk and they told me to check the fine print on my confirmation -- I pulled out my computer, checked the fine print, and lo and behold, no indication of a "facilities fee." I called and left a message with the manager and sales manager, but they are not returning my calls. AVOID.

Park Central is a good hotel to stay. It is situated nearby Time Square and Central Park. If you want to go out for a run it is 2 minutes walk to the entrance of Central Park. The staff is helpful and friendly. The rooms are just renovated with good amenities. The beds are good what is very important for us. The bathroom is also good, with a good shower. The television is a flatscreen with a big size. What we miss is a little fridge in the room. The AC was not working well. We asked for assistent from the maintenance staff. In a few minutes the friendly man came and told us that he couldn't fix it. He gave us the advise to open the windows for fresh air. For us that was a good solution. The only thing was that the fans of the kitchen were very loudly. After all we had a good stay in this hotel and we can and will recommend it to other people.

You can't really go wrong with this hotel in terms of location. We had a toddler with us and we walked everywhere without having to use the subway which is conveniently located at the corner of the hotel block. The hotel and rooms are nicely decorated and updated. We had a king bedroom but was still quite a squeeze for our family of three. It was comfortable.A few things that made our stay average instead of great...elevators were slow (only two to use for the while hotel). Customer service was not really existent. We waited a long time at check-in because there were only two people working at reception. (It doesn't help with a screaming toddler when you have to wait just so they can tell you the room isn't ready.) Checking out was the same, only two people working when there is a line of seven or eight guests trying to check out at the same time. At check-in we were automatically charged a service usage fee (for storing luggage, internet use etc...). I wasn't aware of this when we booked.Overall, we were satisfied with the location. I would probably stay here again if we got a good deal.

This hotel is in a good location, very near Central Park. Convenient especially if you have business in Midtown Manhattan. For the area, I suppose the price of the rooms is relatively reasonable. My room was small but clean and quiet. However, I found the amenities to be lacking; I particularly was disappointed by the lack of coffee in the room and the lack of room service. I did not enjoy standing in line in the lobby to pay for coffee first thing in the morning. The bakery next door, Tisserie, has some nice pastries and efficient service, but, still, I prefer more immediate access to coffee. (Evidently, you can order coffee service for your room, but this was not well-advertised and I didn't notice it until day before I checked out ... not sure if there is a fee for this, but wouldn't be surprised). Free breakfast? Forget about it. The restaurant / bar is nice, but pricey (of course). Also disappointed in toiletries (soap, shampoo, etc.) provided in bathroom (they were in dispensers bolted to the wall). I was woken up (twice!) by maid staff seeking to make up my room long before noon on the morning I checked out. I felt like I would have had better amenities and a cheaper room at a Holiday Inn.

This was quite a find, and at the price I paid in March 2014, excellent value.The rooms were surprisingly large for New York, with a comfortable bed and large bathroom, and the whole ambience was professional and efficient - and friendly. The location is great - very near the Park, and walking distance from prety much anywhere you'd want to be north of 42nd Street. Some nice local bars nearby, as well as upscale locations a short taxi ride away.

Restaurant is overpriced for breakfast. Requested mini fridge and it took two days to bring it to the room even though upon check in we were told it would be brought right up. Room was clean and comfortable. Location is great. My go to hotel in NY for both business and vacation.

Great place; great location _ 6 blocks to Times Square, 4 blocks to Central Park; most places are walkable - and if not, the subway is right at the corner of the hotel. Staff friendly and knowledgeable. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Lots of variety in the area. Double room good size - larger than most NYC doubles (if you can find one) and able to hold a family of 2 teens, 2 adults. Would not hesitate to come back.

We spent one night at Park Central. Very clean. Very nice. Our room had two queens, very large room for room in NYC. Bed was comfy. Bar area was very nice. It's in a perfect location. Many nice restaurants nearby. I would definitely go back again

The Park Central hotel is beautiful, spacious and clean. It is close to Central Park and Times Square. The rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated. The attendants are warm and helpful with guests. I already stayed in this hotel twice and have always been well attended. I recommend this hotel in New York.

I was extremely unhappy with the "customer service" we were provided when we first entered the hotel. I do not normally complain; however, I think that a few things should be addressed that were issues. The front desk receptionist are just a few of the first people who greet your customers as they walk into the hotel. We were visiting on a work trip and NONE of us felt very welcomed by your front desk at all. We anticipated being greeted with a smile; however, on this trip we were greeted with attitude. I believe if your staff doesn't like to help people, then maybe they should not be in customer service. Since your staff does not have name tags, I could not tell you who your staff member was who was rude to us. She was a younger Latino women possibly in her late 20's early 30's with dark brown hair and a tint of red. Let me explain to you our situation. We were on a work trip and reserved 4 hotel rooms for the staff. We were not assisted in the right manner as we all felt as if we were bothering your employee. We had an issue with checking in because we did not have our corporate card with us that our boss wanted us to use to pay for the room. We did not know that we had to have that card present during check in. Your employee faxed our corporate office assistant some paperwork to fill out in order for our hotels to be paid for. She left before our faxes even went through and didn't tell us she was leaving. We had been waiting for the paperwork to come through. We finally were checked in after about an hour wait. My co-workers and I were given our keys and we proceeded to our room. We tried to use the cards and they did not work. I had my co-worker wait outside of the room while I ran downstairs to ask the front desk why they didn't work. They reactivated the cards and I went back up to the room. We used the cards and finally they worked....HOWEVER....to our surprise we entered a room that was OCCUPIED already! HOW DOES THAT HAPPEN???We went back down to the front desk and again went to your rude employee who just said "Sorry"....and gave us another room. If we were dishonest people we could have stolen all of the items that were left in array in that room...but we are NOT those kind of people. I would have been very angry if I were those patrons that had someone walk into their room without even knowing!!! What a horror it would have also been for us and the other patron if we had walked into that room and they were there. That would be extremely scary! I am very disappointed in the customer service that was provided, and was very upset with the hotel mix up of room. I will not recommend your hotel for our next stay. Your hotel is beautiful....but your employee made the whole check in experience ugly.

Hotel staff is exceptional. They were extremely attentive to any and all needs. I was overly impressed by the amount of communication I received when a question was asked before my stay, during my stay and again after my stay. Love this place!
