This hotel was a great price in a great location within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park and Rockefeller Plaza.The hotel service and workers were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely look to book here again and recommend it.

I've stayed here many times and have always received great treatment and value. It is near the park, the subway, Times Square, tremendous shopping, Broadway, and any kind of dining you like, in addition to the MOMA, and Columbus Circle.

I just returned from a two night business stay. I was very pleased with the whole experience in general. I felt the staff was accommodating, the room clean and well appointed. I was impressed by the renovations and felt that the hotel had a very upscale feel. I ate in the hotel bar my first night and enjoyed the bar menu, though it was a tad expensive. Overall a very nice stay and no complaints.

Awesome location as it's only a 5 minute walk from Times Square. The staff were helpful and professional. The rooms are smallish, but updated and clean. Your view will likely be an inner courtyard of bricks but we were hardly in our room much anyways. Our only complaint was the walls seemed thin. We booked on hotwire and were very pleased with what we got for what we paid!

Hotel is AWESOME, now that elevator situation is fixed and remodeling has been done. I love the shower ~ has all necessities on the wall (shampoo, etc.) less waste. ALSO perfect location to 54 Below to see the MOST AWESOME, TALENTED, CHARISMATIC Jarrod Spector [A MUST SEE SHOW] (or catch him in Beautiful). Convenient to Penn Station, most delicious Rosie O'Grady and Central Park. I will return, often as I can.

My wife and I (and our 7 year old son) just returned from 5 nights at Park Central. Our stay was excellent. As we were in town to display our line of jewelry (our line is called Vania & David) at a trunk show at Henri Bendel on luxurious Fifth Avenue, the location was perfect! Everything about the hotel was great - the beds were extremely comfortable - the rooms were clean - the cleaning staff were warm and friendly - the front desk was pleasant - the food was tasty, etc., etc. Prior to arriving, I had the good fortune and pleasure to communicate with Elizabeth in guest relations. She went over and above the call of duty to ensure that our stay was superb! Not only was the location just 2 avenues away from the trunk show, we were just a few blocks away from the park and very close to Times Square. On Monday we walked over to Central Park with our son and had a blast climbing rocks and playing! It was a bit cold, but, being from Buffalo, toughness trumped! We then walked down towards Times Square and went into the M & Ms store and Toys R us - the little dude was in seventh heaven! Everything was so close... Well, I give Park Central a wholehearted thumbs up! This was our first time there and it won't be our last. Thanks, Park Central. Sincerely, David Vania & David

We've stayed at this hotel many times, but this was our first visit since the hotel has been renovated. Check-in took too long because they only had 1 person at the reception desk even though the line was long. We noticed that they continued to staff the front desk with only 1 or 2 people throughout the weekend regardless of how many people were waiting. Waiting for elevators has always been a problem here and this time was no exception. We've taken "up" elevators because the wait can be so long for a "down." The room was adequate in size, especially for NYC standards. On our second night, we realized that the maid short-sheeted the bed with the bottom sheet. The bottom 2 feet of the bed had no sheet. We ended up re-making the bed ourselves. Otherwise, the location of this hotel is great: convenient to Time Square, Central Park, and 5th Avenue.

I shared my room with a friend here, it was really good. We have two queens bed separated by a closet in the middle. It was very good because we had some privacy and got a very good price. The hotel been renovated and in a very good style, the bedroom was always clean and good shears. Perfect for a business trip

Spent a long weekend at the Park Central while visiting my son and daughter who live on the Upper East side and West Village respectively. Perfect location for getting around the city. Walking distance to so many places including the theater district, Bloomies, Carnegie Hall, Carnegie Deli (three doors down) and most importantly, the subway. The rooms were comfortable and well laid out with a desk area for laptop use and plenty of drawers for storage while still leaving enough room to move around. Unusual for a New York hotel. Loved the sleek modern decor, especially the fabulous desk lamp. Wish I could remember the brand so that I could buy one. All in all, a great stay with competent staff and comfortable accommodations.

I was involved in a musical group singing at Carnegie Hall. Proximity of the hotel to Carnegie Hall was perfect. In addition, it was easy walking distance to Lincoln Center, Central Park, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Broadway Theatres, Rockefeller Center, and many restaurants. I found the service staff to be most helpful, from desk personnel and concierge to the room maid. The food in the restaurant was well prepared and tasty.and the wait staff was outstanding, although the menu was a little limited. I would stay here again.

We were fortunate to have been selected to participate in the 2014 Carnegie Choral Festival. The good part is the Park Central Hotel is just 1/2 a block away. The hotel does boast a renovation, and it can boast this. We arrived early, and had to request to room changes. The first because it was on an outside room and very noisy, the second smelled of cigarette smoke. We finally had a smoke free and quiet room. I'm not sure why hotels feel that they need to have duvet's that are Sooooo hot that you cannot sleep. Also, I hated the dispenser soap and shampoo. Awful. Also, one of the elevators was broken. Worst of all, Bridget at the hotel desk was so rude to one of our other singers, that I would NOT recommend this hotel to a large group. So rude. In addition, we tried to purchase a glass of wine to take to our room, and the bloody bartender send "no", end of story. I would't recommend this hotel at all.

The staff and accommodations of the Park Central Hotel were excellent. I brought in a group of 24 students for a concert across the street at Carnegie Hall and they went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed for an easy and no-hassle stay. Highly recommended.

Modern Hotel, clean and perfect location, step away from the subway.I was nicely surprised by the decoration and high tech inside the hotel and the room.The room was very clean, quiet and good size for New York City.I would definitively recommend this hotel.

First Class Hotel in the perfect location, easy walk to everything! Central Park, Times Square, Columbus Circle. Was there on business but got to do a bit of exploring because everything was so close!Concierge was excellent, all staff were friendly and very accommodating. Can't wait to go back!

Park Plaza is an excellent option for staying in New York City, perfect balance between value and price, rooms are comfortable, clean and decoration is so nice, all hotel facilities are modern and hotel is just few blocks from Times Square and Central Park... All hotel staff is nice and helpful...

We have stayed at the Park Central for years and always enjoyed the great location and very reasonable prices (when specials are offered). Since our last stay about two years ago the hotel has completed renovations throughout and the rooms, always comfortable and roomy, are even better. The lighting in the bathrooms remains somewhat dim, but that is typical everywhere as hotels are determined to cut down on utility costs.The location could not be better. Within easy walking distance of MOMA and the theater district and near several subway lines. We have stayed here ten or twelve times over the years, testimony enough to the value and quality.

New York's Park Cenral hotel has been around for a long time and has recently been upgraded with a major makeover all of which was very nicely done. While the physical side is now far above what it was, guests are going to notice the atmosphere as soon as entering. It's the tip-off to the fact that the PC has an amazing group of peope who actually understand what it means to be in the hospitality industry. The GM is actually visible and personable and clearly keeps his fingerprint on operations. Courteous front-desk staff is supplemented by a superb group of customer relations people who keep things moving and offer to help in whatever capacity is required -- a very welcome departure from those properties that let you stand and languish. Bell Desk is absoutely top notch -- great guys who are always smiling and eager to help with whatever you need. New restaurant is chic, convenient and relaxing. PC is a great value.

Just stayed here for the first time last weekend. Excellent experience. From the time I walked through the doors until we picked up out bags at bag storage - we could not find anything wrong with this hotel.The staff friendly. The concierge excellent (two excellent choices for dinner). The rooms were clean, comfortable, and best of all - great price.The best part of this hotel by far - is the location - walk to anywhere, to see anything. Right on the metro line.....you want Broadway - you got it.Would stay here again in a minute!

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in Feb 2014 with our 1 year old son. We booked a Accessible room as it was a good deal and thought it may be spacious for our just crawling son to play around in.ARRIVAL/CHECK-IN:*We got to the hotel- our little baby was very unsettled and crying after a 8 hour plane journey, amongst this and checking in we forgot to tip the gentleman who loaded our suitcases, he walked past us is utter disappointment and shaking his head mumbling something unpleasant.BEDROOM:*The room was very nice and spacious. We had requested at least a few weeks in advance a Baby cot and fridge for the room, this was confirmed via email by the hotel, despite this nothing was set-up for our arrival.*When it came to sleeping in the room, the noise from the elevators was horrendous and continued through the night with loud bangs and other noises. We reported this to the reception they were aware of this noise and casually said this it because you are near the elevators!FOOD:*One morning I went to the small shop in reception/lobby and bought some breakfast, I bought 2 cookies, however requested 2 from the bottom of the pile as they looked a little dry on the top. The lady serving me was annoyed at this request and in my opinion got my coffee order wrong 3 times deliberately! she even served me a white coffee as a Latte thinking I would not notice!We checked out and continued our holiday to then realise we had forgotten a big "Virgin Atlantic" plastic buggy bag full of luggage cords and luggage labels at the hotel, however there was nothing left behind in the hotel. We realised/assume that this must have been discarded by the cleaner as it was not in our room. I contacted the hotel to be told this:Hello, "We appreciate your patience while our Recovery Team searched along with our lost and found department investigated your claim of the lost item. Unfortunately, we do not have the items in question. We have made a note and if anything turns up, we will reach out to you."I sent them " email stating this item was NOT lost and found, but it was discarded from our room! to then receive this reply after much chasing: "We have reached a resolve here at Park Central. The Housekeeper was questioned and did not recall discarding any item which did not appear to be refuse. Again, we do not have the items in question. We have made a note and if anything turns up, we will reach out to you."As you can see there is no apology in relation to our property being discarded and a very rude response in my opinion reply.This hotel is a very nice hotel, however there are certain aspects that let it down.

Stayed at Park Central for 7 nights during this last month, had a lovely stay, New York now a favorite city!! Hotel was very modern, clean and nicely decorated. Found the hotel staff to be helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel was a great surprise, 10 minute walk from Time Square and less than 5 minute walk from Central Park. The city sightseeing bus also stops just outside the hotel which was perfect. Must mention the final bill on leaving the hotel; lots of hidden charges for fitness suite (was NOT aware there was a fitness suite) and wifi etc. Small extra charges are always to be expected - however the price that was advertised and we believed we were paying, was nowhere near what the final bill came to.Nice hotel but beware of the fees added on!

If you are staying here on business BEWARE! Cell service comes and goes in rooms and in lobby. I lost many calls. Had four bars then none. I was on an important conference call as organizer. . I dropped four important people, including a major client. Disaster. When I asked about the cell service issue the front desk acknowledged the issue. Sad because staff is wonderful. Rooms big and clean.

On arrival we had to wait in a long line for 20mins to check in. Only one member of staff on the desk and in no obvious hurry to speed the process up. Eventually got to the desk where we were informed (with a shrug and bad attitude) that despite booking King Rooms the hotel can't actually guarantee the room you book so we all got downgraded to queen size beds instead. The staff were totally Unapologetic and actually fairly rude and unhelpful during our stay. On check out a $20 service fee was added onto the bill. When asked what this was for I was told 'it's for use of the gym and for the complimentary wifi and local calls'. I did not use the gym, nor in fact the wifi or local calls but irrespective of this, don't advertise the wifi as complimentary if you're forced to pay $20 for the privilege on checkout. Good location but in a city with so much choice of hotels I can categorically say I will never book this one again!

We were very happy with the location of this hotel, and the rooms were clean, large for Manhattan, with modern decor, newly updated. We were annoyed however upon check out that there is a fee for $21...in fact everyone in line checking out had the same concern-what was this facility fee? The lady explained it's like a resort fee...for using things like wifi of the pool. We were hardly in our room, and did not use the pool, so I would have rather opted out of paying a wifi charge if I needed it then be told it's free when in fact it is not. Not to mention it was not a resort....it's a hotel.

I stayed at the Park Central last weekend for one night. LOVED the hotel's decor - it had a nice ambiance, modern. The room was a decent size, comfortable, clean. The hotel is in a great location! I'd definitely recommend staying at the Park Central.

I had seen this hotel prior to its renovation and the improvements that were made are phenomenal. The lobby and dining area serve as both a lounge for those who wish to work or those who wish to dine. Both are blended nicely to create an open place that isn't stuffy. The guestrooms can compete with most any other hotel in NYC. The hotel is centrally located to many nice restaurants and attractions. I look forward to staying at this hotel again in the near future.

Loved staying here. Location is just near Central Park, Broadway, 5'th Avenue, Lincoln Centre, MOMA and the subway. First night had an issue with noise outside our room, so requested a change. First alternative room offered was not satisfactory, but Charmaine Warren at the Front Desk was just superb, professional, charming and caring and immediately found another that was perfect (and totally quiet). No room service, but no problem, loads of coffee shops and restaurants in the area. Would definitely stay here again. Thank you Charmaine for making our stay really memorable.

The hotel was great and within easy distance of all the sights. The staff were very professional and helpful. The rooms were very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable which have me a great nights sleep. The only downsides to this hotel are that there is no free wifi but Starbucks is on the corner so you can access it there and there is quiet a wait for lifts during the mornings when everyone else is also going out but overall had a great stay here and would stay again.

As we are known to do from time-to-time, my hubby and I checked our Hotel Tonight app and booked this hotel for a same-day stay. We arrived a bit early and the front desk was accommodating in getting us a room before check-in. Our fairly large room was clearly recently renovated and had a clean yet comfortable modern style.The staff were all pleasant and ready to help, not that we needed much. Everything in the room was in good working order, had plenty of charging outlets, and had a comfortable bed. The only room issue was that the shower wall-mounted bottles of shampoo, body wash, etc. included an empty bottle of conditioner. Small issues: the elevators are very small and have an odd system where you press the floor you want on a screen by the elevator bank and it assigns you one of two elevators. The problem is that sometimes an empty elevator opens that you weren't assigned and you have to get in and wait for it to start moving before you're allowed to select your floor. Also, as of March 1, 2014 the hotel charges a $20 + tax facility fee per day that allows you to access the "free" wifi, luggage storage, unlimited local and domestic long distance calls, health club, and a free drink if you buy an entree in their restaurant. Bottom line is this place is super clean, recently updated, has comfortable rooms, and is close to Carnegie Hall, Columbus Circle, and great restaurants.

The only reason I hesitate to write this review is that I don't want this place to get any more popular, it is our home in New York. The hotel is located just South of Central Park, close to great restaurants, museums, almost anyplace we want to go in Manhattan. The staff is friendly and responsive, the rooms are clean and very comfortable, it is easy to book rooms online. We have found great pricing deals, especially in the off-season. We haven't tried the concierge services, Mello the doorman is wonderfully helpful and attentive. We have no complaints, the hotel has made coming to New York easier. The hotel isn't cheap, but given it's location it is far less expensive than other hotels we have tried. I love the atmosphere of the place, it is full of European tourists, we love the different clothes and accents in the elevator and lobby. Nice new coffee and muffin stand down in the lobby also. No complaints, we have found it a great place to stay.

Been here 3(!) times in the past 5 years, and it just gets betterIt really seems like they're putting efforts into improving their downsides, though only fewLocation is great - 56th street, 3 blocks from the southern entrance to Central ParkMetro station literally next to the hotel doorstep..Nice coffee shop to kick-start your morningWalking distance from everythingFar enough from Times-Square, yet, short walk down the avenueGreat restaurants nearbySpacious roomsLove it!!I'm putting them at first priority every time I'm in NYC, and the last time was a real bargainHighly recommended for couples or business layovers

Always had a great location, but after major remodel it is now one of the best hotel values in NYC. Tastefully redone, nice bar and restaurant, really gets my vote. Will definitely be my new favorite hotel in New York.

The hotel itself looks very nice: the beds were very comfortable and it is in a convenient location that was close to Times Square. I do not believe that it over priced and do not recommend staying there at this time. There was only ONE functional elevator and the lines backed up very quickly. This lead to needing to take the stairs up and down to my floor. We even had to carry our own bags up many flights of stairs! This was unacceptable for the price of the rooms.Additionally, the bathroom was unusually small and had poor lighting.

We have stayed at the Park Central on several occasions for our periodic trips to New York to catch some Broadway shows. The great location, coupled with the professional, courteous and helpful staff make this the place we always come back to. The renovation was ovedue and has added to the enjoyment of this great hotel. Highly recommend...

My wife has stayed here on business, and we were able to grab a fantastic rate for a quiet weekend in New York. The hotel handled our separate check-ins easily, and the staff was gracious. Valet service was fairly quick, but I wish the pre-paid parking option was more clearly offered (although that may be a Booking.com issue, not a Park Central issue). My one complaint is that the hotel seems to be a popular choice for school groups, and the small, slow elevators seemed to struggle with the demand.

We stayed at the hotel this past Saturday night for one night as we were meeting friends and celebrating St. patties Day a little early. The hotel was grand, the staff were fantastic and the rooms were gorgeous. Unfortunately, we weren't there that long other than the one night but the people we came in contact with were "top notch"Nice job Park Central. We will be back.

My fiance and I stayed for a quick getaway this past Saturday night. Very nice hotel, great location, well appointed rooms and fast check in. Staff was very accommodating and friendly. We both also really liked the bath and shower products. Would definetly stay again and recommend highly.

Hotel location is great; the hotel is renovated recently rooms are fine and room size is decent (for Manhattan). Expect very few services. Concierge service is very poor no currency exchange no booking for the NYC attraction personnel seems quite disappointed to do their job. Quite expensive, don't get fooled by the offers: at checkout you'll find an additional resort fee of 65 usd.

I'm not sure who's reviewing this hotel, my guess is the rich business men who they simply fall over themselves to help! I had business & also family trip- 1. No room service after a horrible journey arrived at 9:30pm to be told no food service & restaurant closed no chef! Also no food for a baby at all no veg or even an attempt to help out!2. No free anything- at checkout they charge you for wifi,gym,use of anything you don't use anyway! 3. Not baby friendly at all4. No fridge/mini bar (we have a diabetic & charged to use the fridge for the meds & baby milk)5. No in room coffee machine6. Levels 1-5 is for low paying clients - so if you get a great deal, be prepared to get what you paid for. 6. Concierge was never there- I'm sure I paid for that too7. Front desk attitude adjustment although there was a lovely lady there once- who's name I couldn't pronounce from Armenia I think. Lovely girl.8. Asked for 1 spare toothbrush was told where the nearest cvs was at 11pm with a baby!! 9. Location is great if your prepared to walk. It was my mums first time in NY so wanted to upgrade to a 4* there are FAR better 3.5 stars out there than this place far far better with FREE internet FREE drink in arrival and ROOM service!!10. I hated this place and I travel quite a bit!! NEVER AGAIN!!!! This hotel is just a big look at me shell of a disappointment!! This is my first time reviewing a hotel because I wish I'd read the poor reviews! I think staff must be doing the good reviews because it was terrible!

Amazing renovation makes this hotel a new favorite. 2 blocks to central park, a block to the subway, opposite carnegie hall, 5 mins stroll to times square and a starbucks next door. The rooms looked new and were spotless. The heating worked wonderfully which was needed in the frigid temperatures, and the bathroom was really spacious. I was on the 15th floor in a corner room which had great views and was surprisingly quiet for such a central location. What really stood out was the service. The concierge helped us every day, giving us good breakfast and dinner suggestions, organizing tables for us and multiple time changes with zero fuss. The northern Italian place the Susan recommended called Azalea was a standout. Delicious pasta and the best dirty martinis. She also helped us plan our days, advising when she thought key attractions and areas would be less busy and giving us good travel tips.The large lobby bar was beautifully decorated and warmly lit. It felt like an upscale lounge bar and had waitress service. It became our go-to meeting place every night for pre-dinner drinks.. We also had a quick lunch there on departure day and the food was good (I had the fish and chips which was generously portioned and felt very fresh).There is a small cafe for to-go items that was open in the morning through to mid afternoon. It was a nice to have but there is a starbucks right next door for those loyalists.A stylish choice with a cool elevator experience. We'll be back in the summer.

Was there for a friend's bachelor party and had a good experience. I guess there was a symphony performance and the lobby was crowded on few days but the receptionist was friendly and the location was perfect. Had a good time overall.

Superb modern hotel in excellent location ! Remarkably quiet room . All the staff could not have been more helpful. Rooms minimalist in a very positive way. New York is not a place where you have time to spend in your hotel. But the room was so quiet , large and beautiful that it was actually pleasant to stay in the room longer that we normally would . The bakery in the lobby area had great coffee , the gym was beautiful and we were so glad we valet our car ! Emanuel at check in was amazing and the door man who helped us with our car , luggage and to grab a taxi to go to Metropolitan was also a gentleman . We will highly recommend this hotel and we're looking forward to come back and stay with you again during the Summer !

Just when you thought customer service was a thing of the past, along comes Park Central and their fantastic staff. Everyone from the valet to the front desk staff was wonderful. Kudos to Carolyn and Elizabeth Cacovic for going above and beyond. Many thanks.....

I ordered four nights at the hotel, and specifically asked for a room in a high floor with a view to times square. When i arrived today none of my requests has been answered. When i tried to mention my requests the girl in the lobby said its not possible since its a different price. Well, as far as i could see all prices were the same and differed only by the room size. I will not come back to this hotel.

Booked another hotel in Time Square and wasn't happy. Went up to the Park Central and made a enquiry and the gentleman was helpful and said its cheaper to book online .Booked online and arrived at the hotel the rooms are newly renovated and bedding comfortable. The bonus of this hotel is that it's in Time Square and central walking distance to most things.If i travel to New York again will be staying at Park Central again.

I would like to start off by saying how impressed I am with Saleem’s high positive energy, great vibes and fantastic customer care. I am really appreciated to Saleem for displaying such great customer service and customer care. Thank you for the fantastic hospitality and quality experience and I would like to say thank you to Saleem for being so welcoming from the moment I walked into the lobby. I would like to point out also that I was really impressed with the newly renovated Lobby as it is very fancy and really looked graceful. The hotel itself is a very fancy hotel, very upscale and I was impressed with the scenery within the hotel, the nice carpets, the doors and the room was very elegant. The room was very clean and I felt very relaxed and comfortable within the room environment. I was also impressed with the FREE high speed internet which was very convenient. The Park Central is located in a very nice spot within NYC as it is in the middle of all the major attractions including a 5 minute walk from Times Square. For all travellers the Park Central hotel is highly recommended because of the awesome customer care, fantastic renovated lobby and room and perfect location. Thank you once again for demonstrating a great customer service and customer care; I was really overwhelmed with the quality of customer focus from Saleem.

Exceptional staff! Elizabeth Cacovic, especially , privided us with a high level of professionalism and welcomed us as though we were family. I travel every week to NYC and I will absolutely be staying at Park Central most frequently. My new home away from home.I will be highly recommending this hotel to all my business associate here in Toronto.Arq. Elias F. ManceboCEO of BuiltRite Technologies Inc. Canada

My partner and I booked into the Park Central sight unseen and at the last minute during a hectic business trip during the polar vortex of 2014. We found it to be a wonderful oasis in the storm. The hotel staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean clean clean and tastefully decorated in the new modern minimalist style. The beds were snowy white, comfortable and not too soft. The shower had great pressure and the towels were soft and fluffy. Everything was immaculate. We each had views of Carnegie Hall and Central Park. Our business was in midtown so it was perfectly situated. We could have stayed tucked in to this wonderful nest for weeks. I'd change some of the art on the walls. The bathroom print was a strange choice but its a small complaint in an otherwise perfect stay.

Just spent two nights here and enjoyed our stay immensely. My husband and I were there to attend a business related event which was held at the nearby hilton. Only a five minute walk to our event. The moment we set foot in the hotel our experience was perfect. The doorman, bellhop, and front desk people were all very professional and could not have been any more helpful or friendly. Our two queen room was beautifully designed and very clean. For a New York hotel we found the bathroom and room itself to be a very nice size and had a great samsung tv in it. We loved spending time in the huge lounge bar with comfortable seating , great cocktails and delicious tuna tacos.. They even gave us the recipe to make them at home. We will make this our go to place in New York from now on. Loved it.

We stayed at The park central 3 nights. The room was ok and the service was spotty. The location is excellent and generally the coat is reasonable for the area. We had one porter move our bags 100 feet and hover over them belligerently until he got a tip and another who was absolutely charming with the kids and very helpful in getting our bags to the room. The elevators were very unreliable all weekend and would not close or not allow buttons to be pushed which was a bit nerve wracking. But mostly what was frustrating was that after paying for my rooms from hotels.com we got hit unexpectedly with a 65 dollar tax and "facilities fee" when we left. We were not told about this and we didn't use any of the facilities (save a couple hours of internet). I have never had a hotel do this and I think it is dishonest gouging.

We will use Park Central to stay on our next visit to NY. The room and beds are great.We got an upgrade from superior room with no charge. The hotel is very central. And you are in walking distance to many things you must see or do in

This was the forth time that I stayed in Park Central hotel and, unfortunately, I was not happy as the last times. My mother have been coughing, for seven days, and I do not know what there is in the room that it is not good for allergic people. And in the end, I felt threatened by the hotel staff. They had only order a taxi for me. But there is a mafia between black cars driver's and the hotel staff. I do not have obligation to get black cars, and I do not take this kind of car because: a) do not know if they have a driver's license, b) do not know if they charge me at the end of the path they told me they would charge at the beginning, c) do not know the names of them, d) do not know if the NY municipality controls the services rendered by him, and many other things, ie, do not know if they are subject to all rules which are subjected yellow taxis. It seems that Park central hotel are not giving importance to safety of its guests, this to me is very serious. In my country, the street is public place and can not be transformed into private business as Park Central hotel are doing, since in front of the hotel there were stopped at least 6 black cars .The black cars prevented the yellow taxis stop to pick up passengers. This threatens the safety of tourists and I do not know in USA, but, in Brazil, my country, it is also illegal!!

This hotel is just every you expect from a classic New York Hotel, from wonderful, comfortable and clean rooms, to a professional and friendly staff. At breakfast, the waiter in the restaurant actually remembered my husband and me from a visit in the past! Perfect location -- everything you need near by and close to many attractions. We'll be back for sure. A special thanks to Ashley Eevardi who spent an extra moment to ask if I needed any assistance when I was waiting for my husband to speak to the front desk. We got into a very friendly conversation about Broadway shows and good restaurants to visit. Just a delightful young lady -- certainly a great asset to this hotel.

we have just spent seven nights at the park central, 7 adults occupying 4 rooms. the refurbishment is a great improvement. the check in staff were friendly and efficient changing our rooms so that we were all on the same floor. the rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable, the maids came in every day. we encountered no problems with the elevators. although there are no facilities in the rooms for making drinks there is a coffee bar in reception and starbucks is only next door. the location is great. all in all we had a wonderful time. I can find nothing negative about the hotel and would certainly stay again and recommend it to others.

We had a wonderful stay 4 night stay at this hotel. It's central location made it an easy walk to many places, times square,broadway, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. The concierge, Louis, could not have been more helpful or friendly, and we were sorry he was not at the desk for the rest of our stay. The disappointing view from our room was the only part of our experience that could have been improved, as we looked out onto a courtyard and other rooms. The bar and lobby area are very big and comfortable as well. Computers are available for guests to use. We would stay here again.

Stayed in NY to see some shows and the Park Central is the perfect place to stay, It is right up the street from tkts and within walking distance to most shows. It was bitterly cold while we were there so it was a luxury to be able to walk back to our hotel when we needed to warm up(or get a drink). We stayed at the Park last year during the remodel. It is finished this year and just lovely. The lobby, bar and rooms are first class. The rooms are larger than most NYC hotels which is a real plus, you don't feel like you are sleeping in a closet. The beds are great, large flat screen TV and spacious well lit bathroom. We enjoyed our stay and for the money could not be beat!

We had a wonderful stay there, the hotel is perfectly located, clean and very comfortable!The staff was friendly and very good service. Angela was very helpful at our arrival. We hope to be back soon!

Excellent staff, friendly and great service. We couldn't get the heat to work, one phone call and four minutes later it was getting nice and warm. Great location, a stone throw from Central Park.Next time we'll be back here for sure.

Check in staff with an attitude, no hold luggage service, disgustingly dirty carpet in the bedroom, no minibar nor any drinking water in the room and no room service. I cannot believe this is still acceptable in a city like NY and will never stay here again. In fact, I only stayed one night and moved out the next morning.

Stayed here at the last minute and was pleasantly surprised. I stay in NYC monthly work work but being sole employed cost is a factor. i've stayed in many of the 3-4 star hotels in the area and would easily recommend Park Central among the best. I hadn't stayed pre-renovations but the rooms are quite nice now. As a final note, I stayed on the 20th floor and the noise from outside was still quite loud, this doesn't bother me but could be a factor to others.

nice hotel. excellent location especially for those who enjoy the hustle and bustle of Manhattan. Room was nice, very comfortable king sized bed. air con didnt work though so the room was quite stuffy. really nice bar..although it closed pretty early (about 11.15pm I think). Hotel was quite expensive already so I was quite frustrated when the charged for wifi on top of that. All in all in was still an enjoyable stay

as i told myself .. i stayed at park central hotel .. its always my best hotel .. me and my family enjoyed a lot .. we felt home .. the new renovation is so great .. the staff is excellent and friendly .. the room is so clean and comfort .. i definitely recommend this hotel for Manhattan visitors .. the best quite location .. all places we need is just a grab of hand .. underground at the hotel corner .. central park is just 4 blocks away .. times square is 5 mints walk .. nothing is better than this location .. plus .. the price is great .. since many years i never change the park central hotel when i visit Manhattan .. when i compare it with other hotels , park central hotel always the winner .. i rate it 10 of 10 ... thanks for everyone works in park central hotel ... special thanks to Carmillo the door man .. he is a great person .. so friendly .. will let you smile all the time and will help you much more than what you expect ...

I spend more than 100 nights in hotel rooms per year. I loved the location and the service I received whilst there. Even when they were tremendously busy, they took the time to resolve internet connectivity issues I was having. I'd definitely stay here again.

Stayed at park central for 5 nights, brilliant hotel all staff were friendly and couldn't do enough for u. Rooms were lovely big enough for what u need them for and cleaned to a brilliant standard. Location is great just by Central Park and a 5-10 minute walk to Times Square so was nice and quiet to sleep at night! we had a late flight on our last day so asked to have a late check out as it is normally 12pm and because it was our first time to New York and the park central a lovely lady called Elisabeth let us have our room until 4.30 free of charge which was a lovely end to a perfect stay!

Stayed at the Park Central again this year Feb 13-19th and I must say the renovations to the hotel are a huge improvement! rooms are nicely decorated and the bedding is comfortable. Nice bar area and reception area. still additional charge for Wi-fi which is ridiculous even Laquinta offers free wi-fi! Elevators a little slow but, overall good value for the ideal location.

Check in was slow. Friday afternoon and only one person at reservations. Bur all else fine, clean, couldn't beat location. Lovely bar/coffee area, great coffee shop right next door. Couldn't believe the bar closed at 11:30. What???? This is the city that never sleeps, but good Irish bars DOWN the block, and we love the Colleseum on 58th. Great value and we will definitely stay there again.

I have stayed at the Park Central Hotel numerous times, and have never had a negative experience there. The staff are extremely friendly, helpful, and accommodating. The hotel itself is beautiful, and the rooms are modern and clean. It is conveniently located in midtown Manhattan, A ten minute walk from Times Square, and about three blocks from Central Park. Also, if you are lucky, you may even get a room with a Times Square view! The hotel is located right beside the 57th Street subway stop, which has lines N, Q, R, and W. Many other lines are in a short walking distance as well. Carnegie Hall is DIRECTLY across the street and the hotel is right beside the famous Carnegie deli! Overall, it is the perfect hotel for a vacation to NYC, for newcomers, as well as Manhattan veterans! I always fly into Newark and take the Airtrain from Terminal B (Where porter airline always fly’s into) to Terminal C where I get on the New Jersey transit, which takes us directly to Penn Station in NYC (about 25 minutes). The total cost of the Airtrain and New Jersey Transit is approximately $6.00. From Penn Station I usually opt for a Taxi to my hotel instead of the Subway simply due to my desire to not lug my suitcase around on the busy subway any longer. I always fly into Newark because it is significantly cheaper than flying into JFK or LaGuardia (At least from Toronto), although flying into those two would eliminate the extra steps getting into the city. The decision is up to you!I hope this review was helpful!

The best of hotel I have ever stayed in. Everything was flawless from the amazing attentive staff to the very convenient location. The room was spacious and modern, and everything felt premium, from the floors to the sheets all of it was amazing. There is a lounging area with a bar where you may sit and relax. The halls are amazing as well over all my favorite hotel to stay in the city that never sleeps. A must for any tourists and locals alike. Cheers great job.

good hotel...good service...centrally locatedvery spacious....friendly...walking distance from every location...good stay...neat and clean...nicely furnished....would recommend this hotel to all those who are travelling to NY.

Loved our weekend in New York. We love the hotel, bar, restaurant and location. The staff are really there to please, which is refreshing today. Can't wait to return, not just because we LOVE NEW YORK, but because we have a clean, upscale home away from home.

Upon arriving at the hotel there were plenty of bell hop available to help with luggage and a problematic cab ride. The lady at the concierge desk was friendly and helpful in making change for the cab drives that refused to reset or work his equipment to take cc's. After paying him and checking in the frond desk lady comped my wireless after having heard of my problems and a short exchange on how beautiful the remodel of the lobby and restaurant is. The new color theme is grey's, natural and whites. Very elegant. the elevators are a bit confusing upon first use but one never ceases to learn, so when you find the screen and press you floor n the elevator will announce itself. Once up on my floor there is a fresh feeling and coolness of the grey's very inviting. the rooms are nicely done. clean and well equipped. Had a street view, so got plenty of light. So far another great experience at this hotel. I got a great rate booking online but not directly through the hotel. The only difference as far as I can tell is they no longer offer room service.

Traveling with my teenage daughter to look at colleges we stayed at this hotel. We had stayed here before the renovation and had not been back until now. We were super impressed with the new rooms and lobby. Everything was designed well with plenty of space. The beds were super comfortable and we had a great view of 7th ave which was wonderful as my daughter saw her first snow fall! We will definitely be back here on our next trip to New York City.

Took a punt when booking this hotel, had a mixture of reviews but at the price I got thought it was worth a shot and wow, it certainly exceeded my expectations.Being on one of the rooms near the top of this hotel allowed me to feel like I was in the heart of New York, surrounded by buildings of all different heights, apartment blocks with their rooftop gardens but thanks to decent windows, the noise of the traffic below wasn't disturbing at all.Overall I would say this is a nice hotel and the fact you can find deals on the usual sites makes this one to not pass on, even just for a weekend.

So.... my third time here but my first since it was refurbished. I wasn't disappointed.The "double double" rooms are excellent value and work well for a 2+2 family when the kids are small. The normal double rooms are also more than adequate and worth the extra money.The restaurant is good and of average to high price, the hotel offers breakfast discounts if you book them in advance and I would recommend that if you intend to eat there each morning. On that note, the breakfast buffet selection is limited and not really inspiring and you have to ask for milk and juice.When I arrived the check in was seamless but the room I was allocated was still dirty even though it had been "serviced". The hotel swiftly moved me to another room so no damage done but I didn't get an apology which would have been good customer service.The bar is good and the staff knowledgeable but the waitress/waiter service is slow so my advice is to sit at the bar. The cocktails are expensive..$20 for a Manhattan ?? Really ??Final note: $14 a day for WiFi ????? come on.. which century are they in?? Guys, it needs to be free!

Mostly of time I go to NY I always try to stay at Park Central Hotel and this is more or less 4 times a year. The location is very good near by everything, the rooms is very good and always clean and the services are all good.What else I need from the hotel to have a nice stay in NY? Just keeping stay at Park Central Hotel and enjoyed the New York city.

Went on our honeymoon. Stayed in a queens room on the 18th floor. The hotel was very modern and stylish. The location was near perfect and staff were helpful when needed. I would recommend to anyone and would seriously consider staying here again.

It has been a while since my wife & I had stayed in Manhattan, but we hope to go back to the Park Central soon. We stayed in a King Single room (1710) and it was clean, modern, and equipped with everything we needed. Plenty of room for two, and my wife loved the bed & pillows (very plush!) A nice bonus was the view; a peek-a-boo look down 7th Ave. to Times Square. (I'm willing to bet rooms 1709-1706 has slightly better views, but couldn't check.) The rate was about what we'd pay for a chain hotel in any upstate burg, with a few caveats. Wifi costs $14 per device per day. And anyone used to chain hotel free breakfasts will be disappointed. Nothing free in NYC. We did not dine in the hotel, but heard the food was good. In this neighborhood though, you have so many choices. Everything from Starbucks to the Carnegie Deli just steps from the door. Speaking of location, I can't imagine a better spot to be in Manhattan. Just 2 blocks from Central Park. Carnegie Hall across the street. We walked to dinner every night, and even walked to the theater and back. Being from the sticks as we are, we had no trouble getting around & felt right at home.

The hotel has recently been updated and although people staying during the renovation had problems with the elevators, it seems that the hotel has corrected those issues...one set of 2 elevators serves floors 1-9 and the other set serves floors 10+. The room was really comfortable. We had a Standard King and had lots of room. Actually really enjoyed the space and updated room. Loved the shower and great towels. The bed was perfect! Plenty closet space and although the hotel seemed full and there were people in the hall at all hours, you couldn't hear a thing once you were in your room. The staff was always pleasant and helpful and never failed to offer a "good morning" or "good evening."The location of the hotel is great. It is across the street from Carnegie Hall and just a few blocks from Times Square, Central Park, Columbus Circle, The Lincoln Center and the Met, Rockefeller Center and more.I would stay here again any time. Big thumbs up to the management and staff for making us feel like we were your only guests.

The room (Single King) was the biggest I had seen in NYC in a while. The property is clean and neat, although not luxurious by any means. Staff were gracious and helpful. The bed was very comfortable!

The Park Central was finishing renovations when we stayed there the weekend of 2/7. The public areas were complete, and the restaurant and bar were bustling. One side of our floor was still under repair, although no distraction to the guests. The halls were freshly painted, the decent-sized rooms newly decorated and furnished, and the bathroom surfaces were all new and clean. Our daughter's top school performance groups were playing at Carnegie Hall, and to be right across the street was lovely, especially in the cold and ice. We'd gotten a last-minute deal and were thrilled. The price on the hotel door was three times what we paid, and for $25 more we nearly stayed a couple of blocks over in a clean and pleasant place, although clearly not as luxe. In NYC all you need is a place to sleep and refresh in clean and secure comfort before you go back out the front door to enjoy the city. If you can get this place at a deal, though, do it in a heartbeat.

I brought a group of music students here from February 14 to February 17. They had a performance at Carnegie Hall. I was uniformly impressed with the level of service from the concierge (Susan), to the housekeepers, bellmen, and all of the other employees. Everyone was smiling and genuinely seemed to want to be helpful. The only place I received "so-so" service was in the lounge. I waited with two friends at least 15 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us. It wasn't busy, and there were two hostesses at a stand in the back of the room who were engaged in a personal conversation the entire time. But we finally ordered our bottle of wine and had a pleasant time, The room was nice enough, somewhat modern (if a little cheap-looking), and it is already suffering from the effects of high turnover (scuffed walls, etc.). I had a room overlooking 7th Avenue, so the view was nice, especially when it decided to snow on our second day. The only real problem was the elevators. When they renovated, why couldn't they have invested a bit more in expanding them? For a hotel with over 25 floors, there are only TWO teeny-weeny little elevators, with a maximum capacity of six or seven people. Imagine hundreds of people attempting to check in or out (with luggage), or simply to go anywhere. It was a nightmare. Thankfully, we were on the 6th floor, so in desperation, we usually took the stairs. Not too bad going down, but it was quite a hike UP. But hotel guests shouldn't have to use stairs. There is another bank of elevators on the other side of each hallway, but conveniently "off limits" to hotel guests. Simply disgraceful. Also, the lobby-level "market" had very limited hours. I think it is only open in the mornings, but always seemed to be closed whenever I walked by. There are no vending facilities in the hotel, so in order to get anything - a beverage, a snack, etc. - we had to bundle up and venture out into the 15-degree weather. Granted there are lots of places very close to the property, including a Starbucks (always packed) and another coffee establishment. But the management needs to rethink their limited market hours. They are losing a LOT of revenue in Food & Beverage.But again, the real issue is the elevators. Even with the terrific location of the hotel, I would probably not stay here again because of them. If you MUST, stay here, request a low floor. Also request a room that faces the front of the hotel. My friends in the interior rooms could not get any cell phone service. Oh, and I did get lucky with the internet. The front desk gave me a free "VIP" code, so I didn't need to pay for it.

So many hotels in NYC to choose from and so many locations that it gets confusingLearned about Park Central through Tripadvisor and very glad we did!Park Central has a great location, cleanliness, great comfort and nice staff.

As you see my overall ratings above compared to the rest of the items listed vary greatly. Let's talk about the good stuff. Great hotel, great service staff, great rooms, some of the front desk people were very helpful, no complaints! But, some certainly need some serious attitude-adjusting in regard to taking care of the clients. Upon arrival, there was an issue with my credit card for my 4 night stay. After much ado, they were able to get payment for one evening. I assured them I would look into the matter and report back the next day with payment from that card, or other payment source. Upon checking with the front desk the second day, I was told by a front desk person (Cheree) that everything was OK and that my stay would be uninterrupted with future issues of this matter. In the mean time, I was checking to see what the issues were with my credit card. A quick call to the card service to let them know I was in NYC assured that I would have no future card issues at the hotel. So, I have two positive steps taken. Wanting to cover all my bases, I checked my on-line statement, only to find that the hotel had put a hold on my card in the amount of nearly $3000 for a 4 night stay that cost just over a thousand dollars. My room was nice, but if I'm being charged nearly $3000...gonna' need a SERIOUS upgrade! Bringing this to the front desk's attention, (again, Cheree was very helpful) she told me should would contact their finance department and see why such a large amount had been held. ( I realize that hotels will hold a few extra dollars for incidental issues. Ok, I admit, I dropped and broke one of the water glasses in the room...so BILL ME!) Again, I was assured that everything was all right. Well, it was until returning to my room on Sunday night/Monday morning. My key would not open my room. Heading back down to the front desk for another key card, I was told they hotel was experiencing key card issues, apologized and sent me on my way with a new card. It, too, was found to not work. Making a second trip back to the front desk, I was told that there was an issue with my credit card. (I'm sure there was...they had initially put a hold on $2800 on the card!) The night manager said there was nothing he could/would do until proper payment was received. For the next two hours I was left to sit in the front lobby until some of my other friends returned from their night out. In what was a very awkward and embarrassing moment, I had to ask one of them to "cover my charges" so I could get back in my room. After 3 hours, I was allowed to go back to my room...after their daily reports were printed and the computers would allow them to make me a new key card. Have since received a credit card statement showing nearly $1500 available credit on the card. Yet, checking the card on-line TODAY, the hotel is still holding nearly $400 in funds against the card. So, my advice, it's a great place to stay, but have a credit card that has 5 to10 thousand dollars of available credit, as the hotel will be "holding" a big chunk of it. Not impressed. Really ruined my time in the city, as I was performing at Carnegie Hall.

I really liked the Park Central hotel. Rooms were a nice size. However the 2 ladies at the checkin were very cold and indifferent. I do not understand why management would put their nastiest employees on the Front Desk. I was surprised the room lacked a coffee maker. Nowadays, even the 1 star hotel would provide coffee. No free internet. I would have been satisfied if the one day price was for all devices. But you would have to pay a fee for each wireless device. Anyway. Outside of that...the hotel was nice and very beautiful. Love the gym too. I rated the hotel as 'average' because of the lack of basic amenities that are standard for 1-2 star hotels now.

We started recommending the hotel to our friends via Facebook before we even left. The location is outstanding - across from Carnegie Hall and with the subway (N/R) at the corner. The decor is gorgeous, the beds were extremely comfortable and the room was spacious for New York. Our only issue was very loud neighbors (not the fault of the hotel), who quieted down immediately when we knocked on their door. The Guest Relations Manager, Ms. Cacovic was very friendly and helpful. We were waiting for our ride for some time in the lobby and I observed her checking up on guests, making sure everyone was being helped and taken care of. The young man at the bag-check even refused a tip with a smile! This was a 4-night business trip that we spontaneously extended by one night a) because the hotel was so wonderful and b) the hotel extended a very favorable rate even though it was a Saturday night.

I stayed here during one of the winter snow/ice storms. Prices in February are reasonable. They went out of their way to extend my stay, clear the snow, and help me any way they could. It's clean, no frills, basic, safe, and comfortable. The water tastes really good. So, bring your own water bottle and refill it. This hotel is near excellent restaurants: Molyvo's (expensive), as well as value Chai and Georgio's. It's within family walking distance to Times Square and MOMA. You need a taxi to go to the Met or the Natural History Museums. Negatives are lighting and internet. The light in the room wasn't bright enough for me to see to pack. There is no light in the closet. Bring a led light. You pay $15 a night for wifi (I didn't buy this). There are 3 computers and a printer in the lobby. It's good for searching for addresses. I had trouble getting and printing a boarding pass, and so did many others. I would stay here again. It's just a room, but the staff is outstanding. It's New York; you just use the room for storage and sleeping. It has location, location, location.

We stayed at the hotel during the Super Bowl. Rooms were clean & nicely appointed. Staff was willing to help. It's across the street from Carnegie Hall and easy to walk places. We did not eat in the restaurant there but the bar area was busy most evenings.

Second visit to the Park Central, even better the second time. In between Times Square and Central Park....an ideal location for getting to all the sites New York City offers. Service was excellent and nothing was too much for the staff.....loved it!!!

Location is good and staff did a good job - particularly the concierge. The room was clean, but very small - about the size of a cruise-ship economy cabin. The furnishings were quality. What I found annoying is the lack of normal amenities that I find customary elsewhere. There was no coffee in the room (nor complimentary in the lobby); you had to get up early to get a newspaper from the desk and the most irritating of all..... a $14/night charge for WiFi (I used my cellphone's hotspot instead). The lighting was somewhat dim.The local fire station must be close by, because sirens were common and very loud throughout the night - even on the 10th floor.Check-out is supposed to be at noon, but when we returned from a shopping trip at 11:25 AM to check out, our card keys had already been neutralized, and it took 20 minutes to get a security person to let us in to collect our luggage. Fortunately, we'd allowed enough time, so we didn't miss our flight. I guess that is just New York (crowded, noisy and very expensive). Pay more; get less.

Don't ignore the bad reviews. I thought it was a bunch of grumpy old farts who complained, but now here I am, doing my first review ever so people don't stay at this hotel.If I reviewed the hotel within 2 hours of checking in, it would have gotten 5 stars. Over the course of a two day stay, my impression has definitely worsened.If you want to take a nap during the day or get a good night's rest, forget it. It's not because of the outside noise--rather, hotel staff stomps through at all hours of the day and night. The walls are so thin you can hear entire conversations. I just want to sleep, not hear about laundry statuses. Also, on my first night, the someone from the hotel banged on some poor girl's door for a really long time at 5:40 in the morning. That woke me up plus her until she asks them to stop. Why can't they use a phone like normal people?The front desk staff was not very accommodating at all. I had to extend my stay due to the snowstorm and they were unhelpful. Instead, I booked another hotel and the experience has been many times better. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. Be prepared to give up your firstborn to pay for internet charges. Will not stay here again if there is any choice in the matter.

Newly renovated. So clean and modern. I had an early flight to NY. Arrived at 6am. Worried that I wouldn't have a room until check-in time (4pm), I emailed Park Central and they told me they did early check-in if there were rooms available. I booked a Classic King but at 8am, they only had Two Double rooms available. I didn't care, I LOVED that I could have checked in early and shower after a long flight. It worked out well, the room was interior facing (no views) but as a result I found it very quiet. I was able to sleep in comfortably every night (the shades are amazing as well). Location: PERFECT. Walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. The Yellow line (Subway) is literally around the corner. Starbucks, Halal Guys (amazing, but go easy on the hot sauce), Carnegie Deli, etc. I will highly recommend and definitely return.

Good location with walking distance to everything. Rooms are very small, but pretty nice. When you check in they put a hold on your card. As most of the hotels do. I am still struggling with getting my money back from the hotel. It's been 3 weeks now since I checked out. They don't reply to emails or return your phone calls. Apparently I'm not the first, and probably not the last!

I chose this particular location because I had to work about a block away on a Monday morning. The hotel looks nice inside and out. The rooms were clean, nice and the bed was so cozy I didn't want to get out. There wasn't too much street noise from my window, and I was only on the 5th floor. Maybe it is because it was snowing, maybe not. The bar is pretty and the bartender was excellent. I could not believe I only paid $120 to stay a block away from Central Park!

I really enjoyed my stay here! The staff was so impressive! Every person i encountered that works here was not only extremely helpful but also very sweet! The location perfect, being right next to time square, and your close to the train so it is easy to get anywhere else in New York as well. I lived my stay here and i wouldn't stay anywhere else!

I go every year and I feel very confortable. This year it has been recycled and it is all new. People very friendly trying to solve all our problems! The location is excellent very near Times Square. Central Park, shopping area etc. Good prices and a very nice place to have breakfast or relax next to the lobby

This hotel was a great surprise,we had an amazing vacation. With excellent location,nearly everything you need.Spacious room with confortable bedAnd have a very good gym room, i worked out every dayOf course,i'll stay there again.

My boyfriend and I planned a long weekend to NYC. We caught the train from DC and stayed at the Park Central hotel. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready, so we had them secure our luggage and proceeded to hit the city streets. When we returned several hours later (at the required check in time) our room still wasn't ready. I was prepared to grumble, but they managed to find a room so we could check in. The hotel lobby keeps a lot of traffic. It's not very big, so any "group" that gathers tends to take up all the space. The agent working the front desk (well I can only speak for the one that helped us) was not very friendly. Now that I think about it - she never did smile. The elevators are very small and very slow, but once you get to your room - it's very nice. The decor is very chic and the room, very clean. We didn't eat or use any of the services, so I can't comment on them. The location to Times Square is several blocks, but it's a straight shot. There are lots of places to eat within walking distance. Taxis are readily available if you need to go further. Would I stay again, probably so - but I'd also opt for trying some place new.

What an amazing experience! We travel to NYC about once every two months and generally book through Hotwire. Obviously we don't know where we are going to wind up. Well the Park Central is an amazing hotel. The staff is very friendly and Elizabeth, at Guest Relations is amazing. She not only accommodated our needs but also made our experience as though we were Home. We found our Home in NYC at The Park Central and we owe it all to Elizabeth, the most friendly and genuine hotelier EVER. The hotel is very chic, clean and in a great location. We look forward to staying there our next trip to NYC.

The Park Central is centrally located for everything you can think of to do in NY. Great location for dining, shopping, tourist attractions, basically everything you can think of to do while in NY. The hotel itself is very up to date and the staff is very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay there any time we would travel to NY.

The Park Central Hotel is an ideal location and base for any New York trip, be it for business or leisure. A nice and even stylish hotel!Of course all is to some extent matter of taste and personal experience and many review have are available. Our stay however was great!The rooms are certainly nice, but a bit loud at night at lower floors. The elevators can be a bottleneck though, and the lobby should have more seating options as folks flood the floor to get interent access; which in rooms is at (quite) a charge.Anyway, we want to focus on the staff and support: which is great in general.Some of them we experienced as very helpful and kind and consider them assets of the Park Central: Jessie (customer service): incredible!Elisabeth (concierge): AAAFred + the guy with the bold head (reception/concierge): AAAJon (outside/doorman): got us cabs etc ... really cooland many more(this review was published here on behalf of my wife and her friend who did their 50th birthday trip to NYC and stayed here)

Loved my room at Park Central.Carolyn checked me in and she was the best part of my time at the hotel. She was extremely pleasant and helpful.My next stay will be at be at park central when I come back to the city.

The Park Central is 2 blocks from Central Park. and a block from the Carnegie Deli. It is also just a few blocks from many of the theaters and tremendous restaurants. The hotel completed a huge renovation so it is very new. The rooms are spotless and the entire staff very helpful.This was our 4th stay at the PCH and will not be our last.

The best thing about this hotel is its location, very convenient if you want to be near times Square. It is really close to Central park and metro connections are really good.What lets it dow is their staff, which lacks of hospitality values for such a kind of hotel. They do not treat your requests or problems as you would expect. It is not worth anymore the value for the money that you pay.Some rooms smell of cigarretes and the air conditioning system is really noisy.

We stayed here for 11 days in January and found the hotel to be excellent. the rooms were spotless, cleaned every day (even on the day when there was a snowstorm and the hotel warned they may not be able to clean). the staff were effecient, friendly and unintrusive.The hotel was happy to provide us with a mini fridge which made a difference for a longer stay. I have not seen the hotel before the refurbishment but it really looks good. We never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for an elevator as they have a new computer-controlled screen in the lobby.The cleaning staff were very good and did a great job every day, I don't often leave a tip behind for chambermaids but these were so efficient and thorough this time i did.Very impressed and would stay again.

I am a first time guest at this hotel. I visit NYC on business twice a year and because of the Super Bowl rates of my regular hotel I registered here instead. It was a total, wonderful surprise and experience. I read where the rooms had been refurbished and they surely have been. The staff was great. The doorman was exceptional trying to get cabs in a snowstorm and being so gracious about it all. I highly recommend this hotel and fully expect to be there again in six months. Location is great too!

The room was clean, comfortable, and pretty. Great location with friendly staff. I did not notice a gift shop, though. Especially grateful for the courteous bellman and knowledgeable hotel limo driver that took us to LGA.

I spent seven nights here. A very reasonably priced hotel in a fantastic location. Easy walk to Broadway shows, Times Square, Central Park, museums, and good food. Conveniently located near a subway stop. A safe area to walk around at night. I would stay here again.

I stayed at the hotel while I was looking for a place to stay (as i was moving to New York). I found the rooms to be very spacious and comfortable. The location is incredible: Great restaurants, subway stations, minutes away from times square and central park. I found the staff to be very polite and helpful. Especially Elizabeth Cacovic, she is the Guest relations manager in Park Central. We had to keep extending our stay, so sometimes it was difficult to check out and check back in everyday while we waited for the reservation to go through. However, Elizabeth was very helpful and patient every time we faced a problem and made our stay very enjoyable. It felt like home!

I've stayed here many times, the last time when it was undergoing renovation. The results are outstanding! The new lobby is much larger and welcoming for short business meetings / drinks. Also, I came in on an early flight and they were kind enough to check me at 7AM - Thank You.

If you haven't seen this newly opened, totally renovated bar and lounge, stop by soon. The decor is very nice. The ambience is great and the service and drink selection is top notch. The menu is still limited; however, they're very new.

Park central really is central. Its resonably priced and very comfortable. Strangley though, the male staff were very friendly and the female staff were really uptight and almost mean. On several occasions I was ignored while they spoke about personal issues and up coming holidays. Something I have never found in any Hotel in my many years of travelling. (very strange)Overall it was a great place to stay and have drinks before bed after sight-seeing all day.The bed was so comfortable and luxious, and I would stay here again.

For being completely renovated I sure saw a lot of problems in their details... the Bathroom was modern but the finishing was terrible with molded grout and when we turned on the shower there were leaks coming from the shower head that made a big mess on the ground outside that we didnt know was leaking until after our first shower. The location was good, close to central park and Times square. We got a really good deal on the property because we listened to the timeshare presentation next door. I dont know that I would pay regular prices to stay here again. I dont like that the really expensive places always charge for wi-fi.. what is up with that??? you can stay in a motel 6 and have the same quality sleep and they have free food and wi-fi. The windows are really drafty too. We stayed up on the 12th floor and had to keep the blinds down to help with the cold air getting in.Overall I would stay again... if I could get a cheap price...

My wife and I have been staying at Park Central for many years now. the new remodel is fabulous....very well done. We have had only positive experiences at Park Central....For convenience the location is great....

Fantastic location, friendly staff and great service. Rooms look even better after recent renovation. Special thanks to manager Elizabeth Cacovic for going out of her way to make sure we had a perfect return experience after a less then stellar previous stay (no fault of the hotel, there was a disturbance due to other guests whom staff dealt with in a timely fashion).

From the moment I walked into the hotel I was greeted with smiles and amazing personalized service. Nancy V and her team made sure that my colleagues and I had a room that suited our expectations. The beds were VERY comfortable, the rooms are clean, the gym is quiet and has good equipment. My flight was delayed on my departure date, but the Park Central Hotel was able to accommodate me to stay a little bit later than usual. I was very pleased with my stay and will return. Apart from the rooms, gym and service, the Park Kitchen food is a little pricey but tasty ($18 for a salad!), and I could hear the vacuum one morning at 8AM but fell back asleep with my earplugs.

I have to say, before visiting I checked the website and saw a very rundown hotel in desperate need of a renovation. I figured it's why it was so cheap. When i arrived, however, I was greeted by a COMPLETELY RENOVATED hotel! I was stunned! You could still smell the new wood and materials. It's completely modern - dark woods, brushed steel, glass. The staff was very friendly and helpful with restaurant suggestions in the area. The room was also very spacious for a New York hotel. The beds were very comfortable and plush. The location is also EXCELLENT! It's right across from Carnegie Hall, subway stop and Starbucks right outside, and a couple blocks from Central park. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

What a pleasant surprise to see the upgrades made at the Park Central. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms were large with nice decorations, etc. I have always enjoyed staying at the Park Central and look forward to returning soon. Nancy was one of the most amazing hotel staffers I have ever encountered throughout my 25 years for constant travel. However, I was surprised and very disappointed that free wifi wasn't available, which is standard at the majority of hotels I frequent.

I returned home a few days ago from another great stay at The Park Central! Congratulations on a beautifully renovated hotel ! I am already wanting to return.  I arrived at the hotel to be greeted by guest relations manager, Elizabeth Cacovic. My stay was absolutely wonderful as she saw that every single detail was perfect. What a wonderful representation of this hotel to have someone like Elizabeth that truly cares about the guest! She says that she wants to make sure that every guest is 100% satisfied with their stay and she ensures that happens.The location of this hotel is convenient to everything.The subway(N-R-Q) is literally steps away. It is close to Central Park and many other attractions. Since our last stay here the rooms have been 100% renovated as has the hotel restaurant (Park Kitchen) and the bar & Lounge area. It is clean, comfortable & affordable.   It was a pleasure to return to this hotel and see all the wonderful changes and find that Elizabeth is still there attending to every detail as always. She is truly a great first and last impression of this establishment and the main reason we continue to return. Congratulations to the Park Central hotel for all the improvements and for having such a professional and helpful guest relations manager!

I have been traveling for business and pleasure for 40 years. I have visited some of the greatest hotels across the globe. One person stands out among those in management whom I have had the pleasure of dealing with. Elizabeth at the Park Central in Manhattan is by far the best client relations manager I have ever met. I would recommend Elizabeth above all others. She is in tune with her clients' needs, sympathetic, flexible, and responsive. She is the greatest asset the Park Central has. I look forward to seeing Elizabeth at the Park Central again real soon.Sandy Krolick, Ph.D.Chief Specialist Altai State Pedagogical Academy

I just came home a few days ago from a short ten day stay at the park central hotel. I get all the complaints about the hotel and I felt them as well. The elevators were a nightmare and I don't get paying for wifi when you can get it for free right next door at the tisserie or even at Starbucks. However the concierge was extremely helpful and the beds could not be more comfortable, so I take the bad and the good together. I would stay there again. And look for Winston in the breakfast room. He is the best.

The location is what makes this hotel great and convenient!! You are steps away from a 57th Street subway station (N, Q, R), a block from Central Park, 4 Blocks to Broadway, a few blocks to Radio City and Rockefeller Center, etc!It`s unacceptable for a hotel like this (4 stars) not to have free Wi Fi, not even in the lobby! You just have 3 Ipads with internet connection, that aren't enough for the amount of guests that the hotel can accommodate. You have a Starbucks next to the hotel, but I went to Tisserie or Premier Deli Café, just a few steps from the front door of the hotel, both of them were great and had free wi fi!The hotel is nice, recently renovated. The rooms are ok, and in general the service from the hotel staff is good, especially the bell service guys, and the brunette concierge (I can’t remember her name) that was extremely helpful with a problem we had with the airline and our luggage, she was really nice with us the whole trip with everything we needed! We had some issues as we arrived to the front desk were the old lady with curly blond hair that was supposed to assist us, wasn’t helpful at all; She said she didn’t speak Spanish, but we heard her communicate with other member of the hotel staff in Spanish; She also wanted us to pay in advanced, to which we refused, and she told us we couldn't get our room until we paid (it was early anyways, so we said we will wait), she had a really bad attitude and really rude, looks like she really hates her job, and the truth is she doesn't fit in that position. Later when we return in order to get our room, a man help us in the front desk, he was helpful, he told us we had to pay when we check out (as in almost every other hotel!, except from the ones you pay in advance) As the days went by we got to talk to another guests in the hotel, two of them had similar problems with the same lady.

Our experience with the Park Central was great! We chose for the location, close to west side hospital. Our room had been recently updated, was immaculately clean & well appointed. The bed was quite comfortable & the bath clean. For a city hotel, the room was an adequate size and very quiet. The elevator system was our only complaint.....waited more than 10 minutes each time that we wanted to go back to our room......this needs to be improved greatly. Out of towners should be prepared for NYC prices such as $35 breakfast buffet, but that certainly is not mandatory. There are plenty of coffee shops & delis within sight of the front door.
