I feel like I am with my family and I really enjoy my visit to the such nice and perfect hotel ,special thank for the great person Elizabith you are more than great person and thank you for being so helpful with us and I promise to stay in this hotel every time I visit NYC

After being informed that this was where we were staying by the person making the arrangements, this intrepid traveler did her homework and expected to find a bit of a train wreck based on the negative reviews. Be assured that if there were problems in the part, management has indeed addressed them. Modern, chic, and cozy. The beds were very comfy, room was very clean, elevators run efficiently. Only criticisms: whoever designed the bathroom did not account for the bathroom door to clear the toilet. Door only opens part way into the bathroom. Also: restaurant staff are inefficient, walking back and forth, accomplishing very little. In spite of this, food came out hot and was delicious!

Not sure why (at the time if writing this review) this hotel has only a 3.5 star rating on TripAdvisor. I have been traveling to NYC on business on and off for the last couple if years and I like trying out different hotels based on availability and pricing. This week I stayed here and had a lovely experience. Granted, I only spent around 8 hours total at the property, so I may not have had the full experience.I checked in a little late since I came straight here after some travel. The check in process, even at 11pm, was smooth and efficient. There was a line and only one person at the front desk but quickly a manager came and helped remedy that situation. The room was decently sized for NYC and nicely updated. I didn't turn on the TV but it looked like a nice sized flat screen.The bathroom is a little on the smaller size but I have seems smaller in NYC. The fitness center / gym is truly the best part of this property. Plenty of cardio machines (all looked very new) and lots of space. This is something very rare for a hotel in the city. Normally it's a closet with 1-2 treadmills and maybe one bench. This place had several cardio machines, 3 benches, and lots of room for yoga mats. The fitness center alone makes this place a new spot for me to stay when I am in NYC.I didn't need the wifi so the fact that they charged didn't bother me but that would be the only amenity I think this hotel needs to become a very highly rated spot on this site.All in all a great hotel.

First time staying here and will definitely make it a regular stop if the prices are right. Here on business for two days, very attractive prices (sub $200 all in) considering the prices at surrounding hotels. Rooms are renovated and good size for NYC. All amenities are there. Lobby bar is inviting and a great place to hang out. Do try the pastries in the lobby cafe: they are from Amy's Bread and the chocolate croissant is the best I've had this side of the Atlantic. Staff is spectacular: extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating.I always have people asking me for recommendations of places to stay in NY. This will be one of them.

Clean, quiet, convivial people staying there which made lounge a lively place. But a few quirks they should remedy: internet is $14 a day, not even free in lobby. So guests go next door to the Tisserie cafe (nice frittata for breakfast) or Starbuck's (ugh chain coffor the free wifi. Hotel loses business with this policy.Also bathrooms lack fans (does building code allow this? Not where I live) and shower curtains barely graze the top of the tub. Otherwise, good stay, great location, right at subway stop. Cleanliness really stands out. Seems to be a favorite of European guests.

Having read recent reviews about lift and lobby was bit worried but everything was great. Check in excellent and room really clean and size ok. Staff at reception very helpful. Would have rated it excellent but for the charge for wifi although you can use business centre if it is not busy. Stayed here 2 years ago and standards have been maintained. Location could not be better as close to Times Square and Central Park and Metro. Tip, if you want coffee machine or fridge in your room just ask at reception

We had a large group of about 100 people in our party stay here recently. We found the front desk staff kind of unfriendly in particular one girl that was rude everytime we had to deal with her. When a request was made to borrow a corkscrew to open a bottle in our room as well as some wine glasses this was not given. We had to go out to try and find some to buy. Another time I asked to buy a bottle of water and was told they had no bottled water in the hotel. The restaurant is very expensive so I would recommend going to one of the delis out of the hotel.The Premier Deli and the Carnegie Deli are just out of the building and less that 1/2 a block from the front door. Subway is also across the street and it is open 24 hours. The hotel was having a lot of trouble with the elevators. We waited sometimes 10-15 minutes for elevators. They are set up strangely with one bank of elevators on one side of the hotel and the other on the opposite side. One bank of 2 elevators goes to only some of the floors and the other bank goes to some other floors. weird set up. There are not enough elevators for the amount of rooms in the hotel. There is also a large discrepancy in the sizes of rooms and bathrooms. Our room was very small as well as our bathroom but one of the other guests in our party had a large room. We both paid the same price. Didn't seem quite fair. The hotel is in a really excellent location. Easy to get to Carnegie Hall and within walking distance to Times Square. I would likely choose somewhere else when we return.

Spent a few days at PCNY as I do every year as minimum.In the past PCNY was a good place with a very good location and a "desinterested" serviceNow everything has changed. Rooms are splendid and furniture and space is more than confortable.This year have experienced a problem with a delivered package which was not found when I arrived. in the storage room.I need to highlight the outstanding job performed by Mrs. ELIZABETHCACOVIC, the guest relations manager. She was kind, servicing, pushing, responsive and most of all she was always showing up inmediately at any given call from me in order to find a solution to my problem. I have spent 5 days in the PCNY this ocassion, and every single day I found her with an answer that could provide me a hint so as to work out my problem. The last day, when I was leaving my box with the jacket inside landed in my hands with a smile from Elizabeth. WELL DONE !!!!!!!!Also I want to mention Mrs. RUTH PINO which helped me out very kindly in a couple of opportunities.In summary.excellent hotel and excellent people.thanks a lot and i will come back (as soon as possible...)

It was very nice, rooms up to date, etc. Their new lounge/bar in the lobby is great. Forget about obtaining any food there after 10pm. Location is good .Parking right around the corner.The elevators are slow.

The hotel has been remodeled since we were last there and it is really well done. The rooms are a little smaller but still fine. It was cold out but the room was very comfortable--staff responsive and very helpful Check in/ check out very easy. Location is great. Mattress and bedding were fine the bathrooms immaculate Only one complaint: there is a charge for the internet and I think that there should be none but even if someone thinks that a charge is ok I would suggest that this charge is too much. Most places where we stay have free internet.That being said -we will go there again and we recommend it to our friends. But they should get rid of the internet charge

I stay in the Park Central every year, since 2007. The hotel has done excelent renovation, except in the comfort of the rooms. The heating system is very old, and the hotel should have changed it for a new one. It is very noisy. We could not sleep well because of the noise.I hope they do something to repair it.

I stay for two nights with my wife and two kids and the attention was very good. Everything was clean, the room was pretty nice and the service to the room was fast. I didn't like the breakfast but downstairs they have a Starbucks which is perfect for me. 110% recommended for everyone even if you have kids. Near for Central Park and FAO Swartz

We stayed at Park Central for a long weekend. Our two rooms were ready and waiting for us, and check-in was fast and friendly. Both king and two-double rooms were large, recently renovated, and clean. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful.We stayed on the 10th floor and could still hear noise from the street, even with windows closed. Higher floor rooms may be quiter.The location of the hotel is hard to beat. It is very convenient to most Manhattan landmarks. The only concern is the cost of parking in this area. The hotel offers valet parking and there are many rather expensive garages nearby.Overall, it was a very nice experience and we are looking forward to staying at Park Central during our next visit to NYC.

Last year before redo hotel was tired looking but still great to stay at location and employees very accommodating. This year after remodel beautiful lobby, nice location of new quick stop food bar. The rooms beautiful and very comfortable. The location has always been a perfect central location to go to any site. The housekeeping staff very cheerful and room was done very fast every day. We were there when it was -15 wind chill and the door man on the day shift was always cheerful and helpful even standing in that frigid weather. Will be returning next year for our yearly visit to NYC and be staying at the Park Central again. Also, a thank you to Ms.Buurman for making our stay even better.

Great location. Quiet room. Completely renovated bath. Far enough from Times Square that you can see the lights down Seventh Ave but not in the middle of all the commotion.Room rate made it very attractive - here on business but would return with family because of the location to central park. p.s. always appreciate a great hair dryer.

Aside from the heavy deodorizer scent in the lobby and dim lighting, the Hotel is in good shape and the rooms are a decent size for New York City standards.The hotel offer plenty of amenities and valet parking.I would certainly stay here again. Prices between Christmas and New Years were around $425. which were in line with other compatible hotels in the area.

We decided to go into the city for the night and booked a room at the Park Central. It was a great location; very convenient. We parked in Jersey City, took the Path Train to 33rd Street and then hopped on the uptown subway to 57th. The room was clean with duvets rather than bedspreads. I find that to be much cleaner since the duvet covers are washed and pressed for each use. The bathroom was small but very nicely laid out with a sleek, modern look. We went out the next morning and they held our suitcase in their downstairs storage room so that we could pick it up later. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

The hotel was very modern and the rooms were great. I had a very good last minute deal via a booking website which made the hotel cheap. The location of the hotel is perfect. The only thing was that the breakfast is crazy expensive. But you can of course choose not to have breakfast in the hotel. Would recommend staying here.

Park Central has great location with room rates that seem like a bargain. The staff at the Front Desk and F&B were professional and more than eager to address our needs. Our room was clean comfortable and had a great view. I had several visits to staff about our meeting arrangements and Elizabeth at the Front Desk insured things went smooth.

Nice rooms, lovely furnished, great service ;) Hotels with lot of strengthens.....Just the elevators are to slow!!!! Location is great, just a few steps from the Time Square ;) Has been our secand time in this Hotel !!!

The Park Central is our home away from home. We come here every month. The staff is very friendly and accommodating and we especially adore Elizabeth Cacovic. She is the Guest Relations Manager. Elizabeth has always been very helpful to us by making sure all of our comfort and needs are met. The location of the Park Central could not be better. All means of transportation are nearby, trains and buses. It is an easy walk to Times Square and Lincoln Center and a few blocks from Central Park, MOMA and Fifth Avenue shopping. We love it here, especially since they renovated. They did a spectacular job, everything is shiny and new…..got rid of the shabby everything.
